Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: umj22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Riu Palace Mexico on March 20th, 2012, it was wonderful. We have stayed at several 5-star all-inclusive hotels in Mexico and throughout the Caribbean, this resort has topped them all! The lobby, bars and lounge: -All beautiful, this is just a beautiful hotel. A very grand and beautifully decorated lobby and lobby-bar. You just want to hang-out there all evening, it feels so elegant!! The Food: -Buffet: had everything you could imagine, but pretty comparable to all other buffets we have seen in other 5-star resorts, but it was great. -Restaurants: Japanese- I live in Vancouver Canada, where we have some amazing Japanese food, so I wasn't sure how this was going to compare....I was quite impressed, the starter rolls were just so-so, but the rest of the meal was fabulous, I especially LOVED the tempura ice-cream, it is a must!! Brazilian- delicious, well -cooked meat, nothing too special, but really well-done. Steak-house - We LOVED the sea-food starter, extremely well-done, I got the 'Sea and Land', it was fabulous Krystal- This was my favourite restaurant, fine dining, a really wonderful meal, the sea-bass was amazing. Service: This is what made this hotel so amazing, I have never seen such amazing service. The waiting staff, the maids, to the front desk workers, to the entertainment staff had so much energy!! I never got the feeling that you had to tip to get good service, the waiters were literally running to get our drinks, they were amazing. The room: We had a junior suit on the 3rd floor facing the outside of the hotel (which actually meant we were looking at the hotel next door, but there was lots of trees which created privacy). This room was very quiet, but next time, I would request a lower room facing the court-yard, I just think we would have used our balcony more if we had something to look at from our window. But if you are looking for quiet and private, our room was perfect. The room was extremely clean and was kept clean all week (this goes back to the amazing service). The bathroom was basic, but very sufficient. The room itself was huge, huge bed and sitting area, lots of room for two people. The mini-bar was great, it had vodka, rum, tequila and whisky. Fridge was fully stocked with water, pop and beer. The person who fills the fridges only comes by in the mornings, and if your 'do not disturb' sign is out, they may miss you. But if you phone down to the front desks and let them know you were missed, they will come up to fill it immediately (they will even phone up to double check you are happy- again, amazing service). The pool: -At first I wasn't sure about the pool, it seemed small and I wondered if we would go down to the Riu Palace Playa del Carmen (a 10 minute walk down the beach) to use their pool, but I ended up really liking the pool, it is bigger than it initially seems. If you want a quieter space, just sit on the opposite side of the pool bar (you will still get lots of drinks because the service is so good, they are constantly coming around asking if you want another drink). The pool-bar side was lots of fun....had music, volleyball, water aerobics.....really fun. The pool loungers were really comfortable, but bring a little extra towel or a t-shirt or something to put on the bottom of the lounger where your towel doesn't cover because the cushion gets really hot from the sun. The beach: -Beautiful sand and clear blue water. There were lots of palm trees if you want to find some shade, but can pull the loungers out to get full sun. Again, amazing drink service on the beach. -The water does not have snorkelling right off the beach, which I found a bit disappointing. There were also a few days that the wind was really strong, which made for pretty big waves, so you had to work to cool off, but most days it was fairly calm. The Spa: -we each got a message at the beach, it was amazing!! The hotel clearly hires professionals, it was great! The entertainment: -My husband and I are not the biggest 'joiner' so we didn't do any of the schedule entertainment throughout the day...but we noticed there was always lots going on the the entertainment staff were extremely friendly. There was always volleyball, water aerobics, spanish lessons, yoga and so on going on. -The evening entertainment I was very pleasantly surprised with. The other resorts we have been at, the evening entertainment is usually super cheesy. But this resort clearly spend a bit of money to hire some professionals. There is always a band or musician in the court yard before the main show. The main shows usually consisted of different dance acts (ie. Brazilian, traditional Mexican) and they were all amazingly talented!! I was really surprised. The surrounding area: -The hotel is in a gated community called Playacar. There were about 10 resorts and many condos, townhouses and houses in the gated community. About a 5 minute walk down the street is a starbucks and an outdoor shopping area where you can get souvenirs. You felt extremely safe walking around the area. It is about a 20 minute walk into Playa del Carmen, 17 of those minutes are walking through the gated community. The busy tourist area of Playa del Carmen is literally 2 blocks outside the gated community, very convenient. If you don't want to walk in, there are lots of taxis. My husband and I wanted a relaxing trip where we didn't have to worry about anything and we got it. We had no problems at all with this resort, we had an amazing time!!

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace Mexico Very Relaxing! Some helpful hints...”
Reviews.Author: willow6868
Reviews.Content: Great property. WEllmanicured grounds. Very nice pools and beach area. Lots of alternatives for food and activities. Be careful to watch out for a few practices at the resort: 1. Tips upon check-in are useless. We came in on a company trip with five couples and tipped the front desk guy $50 to get us some rooms close to the pools/beach. He said no problem. OUr rooms were not ready when we arrived but when we got our keys, the rooms were the furthest possible from the pools/beach and our patio faced a concrete wall (they called it "garden view"). After a whole lot of arguing they moved a couple of us closer to the pool but we still had the disappointing "garden/concrete wall view". 2. We asked for golf recommendations. They kept trying to sell us on this course that was 20 minute cab ride away (instead of the beautiful Playacar Golf Club within walking distance). He said he needed a cash deposit to hold the tee time. Then he changed the amount of the cash deposit needed when we started to object. We said no chance and decided to book Playacar...no cash deposit...no credit card needed! Seemed like the "cash deposit" would have been his commission if he got us to go to the far away course. 3. Food was excellent in our opinion. Many choices. Very hot and fresh. No problems getting the reservations for the nicer themed restaurants. The buffet was great. Wine served at each meal (or whatever you wanted). Champagne at breakfast! Very good! 4. Lots of free activities. Pool demo of scuba for free, Snorkel, Windsurf, Catamaran, etc all right on the huge, clean beach. Some topless sunbathers scattered throughout. 5. Free Wi-Fi in lobby (90 minutes per stay). Shopping within walking distance. Be careful, and know the exchange rates as they sometimes try to confuse you with dollars to pesos conversion. OUr first RIU experience. All other RIUs were right there. In my opinion, you could book any one of them and resort hop during your stay. No need to stay at the most expensive resort. They were all gorgeous in their own way.

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: DCH2000
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place! Had a great time thanks to the very efficent staff. You could not ask for more. Food was very good and the resort was absolutely beautiful. Well kept and maintained. Thanks Fermin, Assistant Director,for his oversight and friendliness. Soceer will forever be called Football! Truly an unforgettable experience. This was our first RIU but won't be our last. The Palace is first class. The staff are really that good! Did do the Extreme Tulum experience and is very safe and worth the money. The buffets were almost better than the ala carts.You will not be disapointed with the Palace MEXICO!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: traveler2002oct
Reviews.Content: We went here for a Girls trip, everyone had a blast, service was good and the food was also very good...we went first weekend in March so there werent any/many children there at all, it was really nice, the grounds were kept well.. it would have been nice to have a few more dinner choices each night.... Some premium liquor would have been nice location was great as well, a few minutes from Playa de Carmen which is a great city

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Holiday”
Reviews.Author: robert33
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks holiday at RPM, had a fantastic time. When we arrived we were very impressed by the main lobby - it's huge & very grand. All staff were very polite & were all very helpful. The room was very large, dark wood, plenty of hanging space, very large bed. Minibar with optics stocked up on a daily basis. Bathroom had bath, shower, toilet & bidet. Main buffet restaurant was good, a very large choice. You would have to be extremely fussy to not find anything you like to eat. We tried the speciality restaurants & found El Patio (Steak House) to be the best. Krystals (Fusions) was not very good at all, we had the lamb chops & they were so tough you could not cut them at all. The atmosphere in the restaurants was excellent thou. The waiters were always on hand filling your glasses with wine, champagne etc. The beach was wonderful, very large & lots of sunbeds. It did get extremely busy when we were there & we do prefer it to be a little quieter. My husband used the Scuba Caribe Dive Club on site which was excellent. He did a 10 day dive package & we went on a diving & snorkelling trip to Cozumel which was very good. We visited a couple of the nearby Riu Hotels for a drink, but the RPM appeared to be the best. We had a trip out by taxi to a nearby restaurant called Alux which was brilliant. It is a Cenote, very unique & well worth a trip. There were a couple of things that drew our attention & they were the bottom sheet on the bed - it did not fit & there was a large gap on one side with the plastic sheeting underneath showing - very uncomfortable. Then a very large group of teenagers arrived & were extremely rude & noisy. They were falling about drunk. I know they were on holiday & everybody is enjoying themselves, but it went a bit to far & was not appropriate for a 5 star Hotel. You do not expect this behaviour. I think the Management did try & sort them out, but it still spoiled 3 days of our well earned holiday. Also their parents were apparently with them, but obviously had no control over them & didnt mind them being so drunk they couldn't walk at 10 am in the morning!! Other than that we had a fantastic holiday & would recommend this Hotel as the staff are excellent, beach lovely & it is in a very nice locality.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: CanUSGals
Reviews.Content: (March 16, 2012) Just got back from a one-week vacation at the Riu Palace Mexico with a group of friends. This is a lovely all-inclusive resort. The weather was perfect, the pool is lovely, the beach is great. The resort is a nice size and caters to a vacationers looking for a quieter holiday. Anyone wanting dancing and late-night party time could spend time at the Riu Tiquilla across the street. We enjoyed our meals - and the a la carte restaurants (small venues with 2 dinner seatings, requiring reservations). Breakfasts start with my favorite Mamosa's - and a good selection of anything you could ask for. Lunch again offered everything you could want, from BBQ to salad buffet to wings. The dinner buffet was nice - although some of the meats (lamb and beef) were tough. The chefs do a great job of chicken, rice and pasta dishes and there was a good variety of speciality and ethnic cuisines. All meal venues were beautifully decorated, offering inside and outside dining. One of the venues is close to the beach and the pool, making it convenient for anyone enjoying these areas. Staff were excellent. The rooms are spacious - best if you can get one overlooking the courtyard. The only complaint about the room - and one shared by our fellow travellers - the beds were hard, needing an upgrade of softer pillows and sheets as well. The room was nicely cleaned and bar fridge replenished daily. There is a great staff/guest ratio - we never waited for anything - good service from the bar staff - never had a problem getting pool or beach chairs. The one major complaint we had, as well as other guests we spoke to - and from what we understand this was unusual blip of bad judgement for this resort - we had 2 days of "March Break" teenage drunken drama at the pool bar - annoying and ridiculous behavior - the so called "parent" chaperones who watched and did nothing - especially when bar staff were yelled at - should be ashamed. However, the hotel staff was quick to deter the group with other activities keeping the spoiled self-indulgent brats away from the mainstream vacationers. Staff members were friendly and hard working - thanks to Nando, Mateo, Ernesto and others - helping make our holiday more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “My first experience at the Riu”
Reviews.Author: Gembe
Reviews.Content: Our first vacation with friends was three years ago with a recommendation from a working collegue we arrived at the Riu Palace in Mexico. Our first impression was WOW! I have never been at Riu before and believe you me - we were spoiled from the moment we arrived until the day we left. At the time the beach was under construction - but we were able to use the other Riu next door beach until ours was restored. But the resort was beautiful, the food was amazing and i must say ever since i have been hooked on the Riu. Playa de Carmen was also amazing and i promised myself i will return in a couple of years for a much longer stay

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: BrownEyes22
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at the end of February, and this resort was just what we needed. I had been reading reviews before we booked, so I suppose I already knew the 'bad' points. (two beds pushed together, very firm mattresses, musty smell). But The good points out weight the bad points ten fold! The bad: Yes there are two queen beds pushed together, yes they are not very comfortable. The Good: The staff is beyond exceptional! Always a smile and 'hola' no matter if it was the grounds keepers or the bar keep. The Animation team goes out of their way to make everyone feel welcome. Aieda, Cindy, Freddy, DiDi from Japan, the 'VOLLEYBALL' guy (I am sorry I don't remember his name) and all the others, they were exceptional. There seemed to be enough activities to get involved in if we wanted to partake. The room was spacious, We were on the second floor facing the fountains, Great view! I did not notice a musty smell as others have complained about. We did take a few candles and an air freshener, but didn't need them. But I will keep them in the luggage, just in case. The food was incredible. The breakfast and lunch buffet gave you more than enough to choose from. I suggest going to the lunch buffet near the lobby, it seemed to have a nicer selection for lunch than the one on the beach had. We did go to the Steakhouse, the Krystal Fusion, and the Japanese restaurant, the steakhouse was just OK, the other 2 were great. The Japanese restaurant served a lot of food, maybe it was all the rice on the sushi, whatever it was, I couldn't finish my meal, but it was good! We went to Krystal three times, I would have gone more, but we did want to try the buffet for dinner too. Needless to say Krystal fusion was my favorite. The buffet was good also, so much variety, and always fresh. Defiantly not the 'average' dry meat, old casserole buffet. And the desserts.. mmm. The ice cream was SO good! The pool/ beach area is perfect, yes the rooms are a bit of a walk to the beach, but it is so beautifully landscaped, we didn't care. It was a nice walk. With the exception of Sunday, we always had plenty of chairs to pick from either at the pool or the beach. We enjoy the shade, and there was always an umbrella available by the pool, but the bases are HEAVY. So I had the guys move it as the sun moved through the sky. The Beach is pristine! They rake the sand daily, so by the time the sun is up, the seaweed is gone. The staff here really does everything they can to make your stay great. The beach is also walkable in both directions, if you head north you will be in town in about 35 minutes. nice walk. They are planning a reno of this place later this year, so I was worried that the place would just be old and run down, but it is not. It is old, there are signs of age, but it is so well kept that you really have to look to see some of the age. Location: is great! We were close enough to check out the other Riu properties, and close enough to go into town without a hassle. Playacar is a gated community, with plenty of sidewalks for strolling. Very nice area! Overall, this place rocked my socks off :) I would go back today if we could afford it. But next year will come soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia-Metin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 week at the Riu Palace Mexico and it was great!!! Everything you can expect they will make it come true! We also had a a'la-carte diner at the steakhouse, and i didn't liked that to much, but the buffet was so great!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico the first week of March 2012 with 5 other couples. Was leary to book here because there were some negative reviews. Whoever wrote those must have been very picky. Food was typical Mexican all-inclusive food(not fantastic but very good). Loved the beach here. Always someone bringing drinks around. Pool bar was fun. There is a shopping plaza about 3 minutes walk that is a great place for picking up souvenirs. The staff is all great-helps make the trip! This hotel is closing from Aug through Dec for remodeling which will even make it better.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TRIP!”
Reviews.Author: woodsmokesandy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 night stay RPM and it was fabulous. My only complaint is the smell, I expect a musty smell but even after unpacking at home my suitcase and purse and everything we had with us has a horrible smell, not sure what they could do about that but it is a great resort with something for everyone, even picky people like me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Lillycat
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in the Riu Palace Mexico in February 2012. The difference with other Riu’s in Negril or the Dominican Republic is that you are not confined in your hotel. The surroundings are very nice for walking and very secure, even in the evening. There is a plaza with some shops in front of the Riu Playacar, just a few minutes walking from the Palace Mexico. Many people are always walking and jogging on the road along the hotels, you will never feel in danger. You can walk to the center of Playa del Carmen but we choose to take a taxi (70 pesos or 7 $, so the price is far better in pesos) because otherwise you might be tired already when arriving in town. There are lots of shops and restaurants downtown; you can easily spend a few hours strolling there. Also along the beach, it is possible to walk endlessly on both sides of the hotel. We often went to the Riu Yucatan just next door. They have a garden that is more like a forest, where you can see monkeys in the trees. The food in Palace Mexico was good and varied. The magnificent lobby has many sofas to sip a good cocktail. We had a seafront room (1045), but be aware that you cannot see the sea because of the very dense palm trees. The beach is nice with no rocks, so you do not need sea shoes. The beach is incredibly large so be prepared to do some walking before you reach the water. The water had already a good temperature but there are always waves so forget the snorkeling in front of the hotel. From the beach you can see the ferries connecting Playa del Carmen and Cozumel. We took the Ultramar ferry. The price was 312 pesos for an adult return ticket. It was a large catamaran (up to 500 passengers) with a nice band playing live music. When you buy your ticket, you will receive a leaflet with the timetable, which is not always up to date. Only consider the timetable printed on your ticket, which is the correct one! Over all a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico - wedding trip ruined by rude security guard”
Reviews.Author: wendy J
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the place ( smelly lobby though! ) until our last day. Went to Mexico to attend our daughters wedding further up the coast. Thoroughly enjoyed the hotel although we only ate there twice in ten days as we went out to eat & meet up with daughter and future Mexican husband. On our last day we didn't have time to go into town to meet them so arranged to meet on the beach outside the hotel. I have to stay in the shade as a MS sufferer so daughter had to come and find us but did not encroach on land owned by Riu. Within minutes a very rude and loud security guard demanded that they leave or more security would arrive. Would not listen to what we had to say. Was very embarassing and ruined the end of the holiday. At no time did they pass the signs saying 'guests only' and had no food or drink from the hotel. NOT HAPPY!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Samantha P
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico and had an absolutely fantastic holiday. Our room was on the second floor overlooking the fountain which was great. We ate at all of the speciality restaurants and really enjoyed them all however, I do think the Japanese and the Fusion are the best ones, we also ate in the buffet where the food was great we ate later so there was music playing whilst eating outside which was really nice to listen to. The staff are just amazing they work so hard to make your holiday and they certainly do that you never have to wait for a drink whilst sitting at the bar they even top them up without you having to ask!!!. They are refurbishing the rooms at the end of August and room 1 has already been refurbished so we went to have a look at it and it looked fantastic done in black and white but looked really great. Please don't take notice of the negative reviews if you are thinking of booking some people just like to moan!!! We had a truly fantastic time and can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “4.5 Stars - The good (90%), the bad (8%) and the ugly (2%)”
Reviews.Author: gocougsNorthBend
Reviews.Content: We visited the Riu for a week over mid-winter school break with our 8 & 10 year olds. Overall, very enjoyable vacation - very nice employees, facilities are nice (albeit a bit dated), great beach, and the food was for the most part really good. Please tip - we brought 100 - $1 bills - they don't make a lot and many don't. The Good *beautiful beach, good waves for boogey boarding, and palm trees in the sand so you had your choice of sun or shade. We found that we could always find a lounger at any time so no need to get there early. Our kids loved playing in waves and digging in the sand. *The lobby bar was great. Very relaxing, enjoyed banana martinis and the kids could get virgin cocktails. Super service *Courtyard seating - a great place for after dinner cocktails, listen to music, and we met a lot of great people. They bring the drinks quickly. They do have Don Julio here (but not at pool) *Pool bar (Ernesto was great)- occassionally busy but they keep them coming. We will bring large mugs next time - drinks are weak but you ask them to top it off with coconut rum or tequilla. They had volleyball games going & the pool was plenty big. The deep ends were a bit deep for our 8 year old but he was fine with 3 foot section near bar. Kids enjoyed the kiddie cocktails. Poolbar is in the shade late afternoon which is a nice break from son. *Restaurants - Japanese was very good and our kids liked it which is saying something. Brazilian had some nice skewers. Fusion had a couple interesting options like pumpkin scallop soup which we liked. Steak house - we loved the bake alaska (see more under the bad section). Buffet - a ton of choices, you can pour yourself a mamosa/blood mary and choices of omelletes, occassional good sea food (giant shrimp, crab, sushi,) extensive fruit selections, etc. We didn't get bored. *Room - loved the sitting area, cigar on the balcony (small balcony), and towel decorations (swan was great) . More on room under ok/bad. We were fortunate to have 2nd floor toward the pool so nice view of courtyard and quieter. *Hotel - fountains are very beautiful - nice facility. *Staff - 99% were super friendly. We kept running into a maitrede who rememembered our kids and joked with them. *not related to hotel, but check Edventure Tours if you want a great day outing of Tulum/Coba, zip lines, cenotes, and swimming with the turtles. Highly recommend. The O.K. *workout room was basic, served its purpose. *mini bar - liquor dispensors were full and fridge replenished but without proper mixers, you really wouldn't drink the vodka or tequilla. Tip - bring mug, fill it up from your dispenser, and then take to beach to make your drinks stronger. *Steakhouse - meat was so so. Not sure if beef is just bad in Mexico, edible but nothing exciting. Almost "bad" but saved by the baked alaska. *lunch at restaurants near pool - didn't ever change options. Fun to build your own taquitos or other stuff to a point but got repititious. Italian didn't have much of interest except when kids wanted pizza. *evening shows. After a few cocktails, the lip synched reenactment of movies hits was kind of funny, with no cocktails, you may not be so impressed. You can tell they really try hard to put on fun shows but you just can't have too high of expectations. The Bad *some Europeans just shouldn't be wearing speedos or going topless on the beach *beach bar - nice location, but I was watching them "wave" the bottle over the top of the blender without putting much in. Order a straight shot to go with your margarita and dump it in to make it a drink. *Kids club - tiny and not suited for those over 5-6. Fortunately, my kids (8 and 10) finally made friends with other kids on beach to hang out with during evening shows and swimming. They did enjoy the beach activities like soccer which was open to all ages. There is not much for kids 7+ at this resort. The evening kids shows were totally hokey but my kids went anyway and kind of had fun (and gave us a chance to sit outside, have a relaxing cocktail, and socialize). *men should be able to wear long shorts in the restaurants at night. The Ugly *beds with plastic under sheets and hard pillows are hot and not super comfortable. I would prefer to be more than 6 inches from my kids in the next bed. *our toilet didn't flush completely ever. We had to resort to multiple flushes. *small balcony. I could enjoy my cigar and brandy but it was a tight fit. Overall, we had a great time and would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon,”
Reviews.Author: RustyBamf
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spent 2 fabulous weeks at the Riu Palace Mexico for our Honeymoon back in January and we had the best time ever! After a pleasant transfer from the airport we were greeted at the hotel with a warm welcome and a cold cocktail and allocated a room on the first floor facing the Riu hotel next door. The room was lovely, plenty of space and an absolutely massive bed! Others have mentioned that the bed was hard but it was perfectly fine for us and we never noticed any join where the 2 normal beds had been put together to form one. We did mention to reception that it was out honeymoon and that our travel agent had advised to ask about the free fruit basket for honeymooners and were told that they would sort something out for us, later that day they called us over as we were passing and told us that they had upgraded our room! we were now in a similar room but with an inward facing balcony overlooking the internal grounds and fountains, even though we were perfectly happy with the original room, having that view really did make quite an improvement to our stay! The hotel is kept spotlessly clean, one morning when still suffering from jet lag I popped to the bar to get coffees at about 6 am and I counted 15 staff members cleaning and polishing just in the 50 yards from the reception area to the bar! The food was excellent! The buffet for breakfast in particular was magnificent, My wife was particularly enamoured with the Omelette station whereas I always found myself in a battle to resist visiting the waffle and pancake area after picking up my bacon and scrambled eggs. With chocolate milk and champagne (hey, we were on honeymoon!) to wash it down we were like pigs in muck! As with all the staff we encountered, the guys at breakfast were great, really friendly and accommodating and able to find us a table in the outside area even when the hotel was apparently at capacity during our second week. We didn’t visit the buffet much for evening meals, preferring to use the speciality restaurants most nights, we never had any problem getting a table for these for either the early or late sitting. With the jet lag we tended to go for the late sitting first week (giving time for a nap!) and then the late sitting the second week. We visited Fusion 3 times, this was our favourite and managed to have at least 1 different course each time, The Japanese we visited twice which again lovely. The Brazilian & Steakhouse we visited once each, not ideal for my vegetarian wife but she managed to find something nice to eat as she does eat fish. The other nights we ate at the buffet or in PDC as we had a couple of days/nights on the town. We did visit the other Rius apart from Lupita during our stay and although they all seemed lovely we came away feeling Glad that we chose the one we did as it just seemed to have everything exactly as we wanted it. I used the Sports bar at the Tequila a couple of mornings to catch the Manchester united games but as it was only a 5 minute walk from door to door I didn’t mind the Riu Palace not having a sports bar at all. We loved loved loved the Cubana bar, trying all the different cocktails and martinis. We liked that it was quite elegant and made us feel like getting dressed up before our meals rather than going casual, not that you would be made to feel uncomfortable if you did but it just made it feel all that more special and exclusive for us. We are beachy people and spent most days there rather than at the pool, the beach area is fantastic whether you want shade or full exposure to the sunshine you can always grab a bed and pretty much pick your spot. You can either walk up to the beach bar if you fancy a drink or wait for one of the guys to come round with their tray of ready made cocktails. We tended to stop off at the pool on our way back to the room for a few drinks at the swim up bar or sat around the pool, the sun doesn’t seem to reach much of the pool area in the late afternoon, but we had usually had enough of it for the day by then anyway. Now to the hotel’s main asset and best feature, Its wonderful staff! They really could not be faulted, always friendly and eager to help, we have never experienced that level of service before. Coming from England I am usually quite daunted by the etiquette of when and how much to tip when in countries where it is the norm, especially when doing it face to face when you are not paying a bill after a meal. I think we muddled through even though we never felt like the staff were looking for a tip, or were annoyed if you didn’t. We would normally give 50 pesos at meals and 20 pesos to the drinks guys but not every time, Don’t worry too much as you soon get an idea of how to approach it and a feel for when & how much to tip. The resort of Playa Del Carmen is definitely worth a visit, its about 30 mins walk or 70 pesos in a taxi, there are some lovely bars and places to eat, worth going for a few drinks in the day or night if you like that sort of thing. Also I would recommend Coco Bongos if you like a bit of a party night out and I would definitely recommend the VIP as you get drinks to your table and a better view and its good to have seats at is a pretty long show. A tip if you are coming from the UK maybe leave it until the 2nd week so that the Jet lag has worn off as the show starts at 11 and goes on till 2 (we got home about 4.30am) so you will need plenty of energy! We also caught the bus to Cancun one day and had a day there, it was really cheap getting the bus and we also used the 2 Rius there for a swim and drinks as they are close to Hard Rock and the other bars that are open in the day. Just don’t miss the last bus home(about 9pm I think) as we almost did!! Also Xel Ha is a great place to visit for the day with drinks and food included and great snorkelling around the massive lagoon, it is great that you can wander wherever you like around the lagoon (within reason) and get in and out at lots of different points. You really feel as though are exploring the area rather than in park and doing lots of queuing. Anyway thanks for Reading and thanks to the Riu Palace Hotel and their staff for an amazing, unforgettable Honeymoon!!

Reviews.Title: “One of my best vacations”
Reviews.Author: Faba007
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the first time at this resort in December 2011 and can't say enough about the excellent food, staff and service. My husband and I were quite impressed. The only issue we had was during check in. When we got our key, it was for someone else's room because they gave our room to someone else -- not the best situation as when we opened the door to the room, luckily it had the additional lock in place otherwise we would have ended up walking in on the sleeping occupants. This was quickly resolved and we had no issues after that. I heard that the hotel will be closing for renovations in July 2012 until December 2012 so that should resolve any issues of it being a dated place. RIU entertainment staff were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Best part is the beach”
Reviews.Author: kcos422
Reviews.Content: Just returned from vacation with girlfriends. ROOMS- The rooms are adequate. The beds are not comfortable. We had a nice balcony but there are no ocean views. We had a junior suite- so it was 2 full beds and a couch. We had a problem with our shower and a problem with our patio door (it needs to be shut for the air to go on). Within the first 24 hours- we had to make 3 maintenence calls. The manager Adrian, said he would try to do something for us. I said- well we would like massages. He said he would see if possible and get back to me. Never heard a word from him again. I saw him when we were leaving and he made some kind of excuse. FOOD- We really liked the main buffet. There is something for everyone. If you want to be healthy- it can be done. Otherwise you can eat warm donuts and desserts everyday. We went to the Japanese restaurant- I thought it was quite good. The fusion restaurant I didn't care for at all. BEACH- The beach here is great. It's very nice and there are plenty of palm trees if you want shade. The only thing is there are no umbrellas available. Also the drinks they serve you are very watered down. Stick with beer or soda in a can. Soda out of the spout tasted like syrup. SERVICE- With the exception of the front desk manager, the service was very good. The staff was quite pleasant and efficient. The town is only a $7 taxi ride away. Some decent shops- nothing too exciting. Some cute restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: rizan22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my Mom in Aug. 2011 (just getting around to writing review) excellent hotel. I have stayed at Riu's in the past but never a Palace and was worth the extra dollars, though I did get a smoking deal at the time! From the moment we checked in the front desk was more than accommodating in getting us a room near the beach area, though we initially had a room near the lobby. All the staff more than eager to please. The grounds very nicely kept, the room like past Riu's very comfortable and nice having the sitting area. The a'la carte restaurants were just ok, to be honest I thought the buffet was much better than the restaurants and I ate at all of them. The buffet, lots to choose from and food was really very good - I usually dont like buffets. The beach....well what can I say about the beach other than perfect! I'm not a pool person but, seemed there was lots of activity always going on out there. But, the beach really was perfect and never did I have a problem finding a lounge (neither did my Mom who stayed at the pool area. I also like that there was bar service at the beach area, didn't always have to get up for a drink. Seems that one of the best kept secrets is the hammock area between the pool and beach area. I used the hammocks quite a bit and never was there more than 1 or 2 people out there. It was a great place to hide out (under a tree) from the rain and do some reading. I really enjoyed my stay at the Palace and would probably have a hard time not staying at another Palace resort the service and food (buffet) really are a notch above. Also another reason, hardly any kids (sorry I preferred not being around their screaming and such) So why 4 stars not 5? The reason would be due to the a'la carte restaurants, they really were a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Health issues due to mold/mildew”
Reviews.Author: Verna G
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful and staff maintains and keeps it very clean. Issue is the strong mold/mildew smell prevalent in the lobby, lobby bar, theater area. Rooms musty as air conditioner not adequate. Leaves clothing, suitcases, and all items smelling of mildew. Too much work when returning from vacation to wash and scrub and try to disinfect all items. Hated the idea of two double beds pushed together to make a "king size" bed. Won't return because of this. This is NOT romantic. I found the food good but repetitive over an 8 day stay. Loved the Japanese restaurant. All of the hotel staff are very pleasant and helpful. But...the bed situation and the moldy/mildew smell will stop us from returning. Bad way to end a vacation with an asthma attack (allergy to mold).

Reviews.Title: “"Great Time"”
Reviews.Author: Nick053
Reviews.Content: We were at the Riu Palace Mexico for five days in late January and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the resort! The hotel is located about 45 minutes from Cancun airport, so the transfer to the hotel is not bad at just under an hour. The resort is well maintained and kept very clean from the rooms to the lobby to the grounds. They have a selection of about four to five a la carte restaurants and a large buffet which is pretty typical for most Riu Palace resorts. The food and service were very good, although not excellent. The beach area is very large and even has a bar located on it. During the time we were there, there was no need to grab towels early and save seats at either the pool of the beach, as we were always able to find them. Although we did have a nice time at the resort there were a few things that we did notice that were working against it. First, the resort appears to have been built in the early 90s and is really in need of a makeover to bring it up to the same standards as most other RIU Palace resorts. The pool area was very dated (a little grimy) and does not have any access for those that are either disabled, or older and need assistance getting into the pool. In other words there are no ladders, or stairs (like we see in newer pools) for those needing assistance. The rooms, although very clean, were also a bit dated. Finally, the other surprising thing was that there were no ocean view/front rooms at the resort. The resort is set quite a distance from the beach area and based on the setup of the hotel, there is are no views from the rooms, other than the garden. We were told that the resort will be closed during the summer months and major areas will be renovated. So, if you are looking to make a trip down to Playa and want the true RIU Palace experience, maybe consider the RIU Palace Riveria Maya which is just down the street and newer, until this one is redone in August. However, if you are looking for a pretty good resort at a good rate, stick with the RIU Palace Mexico. Overall for the discounted rates available for this hotel at this time, I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NALucas
Reviews.Content: My wife chose this hotel from a wide list of hotel in Play Del Carmen, and when we get there both of us were surprised in many aspects. I must say that we had high expectations about Riu Palace Mexico, and all of them were highly fulfilled. Its a beautiful place, good beach, good food, good service, good restaurants, good spa and the best of all the entertainment crew... they manage to give good mood and fun and we were never bored. For sure i will return. Thank you Riu, for a marvelous vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect mix of beach and city”
Reviews.Author: AlanBGypsy
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've vacationed at this resort. The location is excellent if you are looking for a mix of all-inclusive beach vacation and a bit of city fun in Playa del Carmen. The place is immaculately clean and the food is above average compared to other 5 star resorts. The rooms and some common areas need to be refreshed and it seems as if they are renovating room by room. It is only a 30 minute walk through the gated Playacar community to the centre of Playa del Carmen with great restaurants and night life. It's only a 30 minute walk along the beach to the public beaches in Playa del Carmen which are great for people watching. I will definitely return and would recommend this resort to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wall to wall sunshine!”
Reviews.Author: Iona007
Reviews.Content: There's very little to add to previous reviews but I think it's important to mention that whilst we were worried by the weather forecasts before we went, forecasting rain and storms, we didn't see one drop of rain just lots of sunshine.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Riu”
Reviews.Author: tytx
Reviews.Content: Visited first week in February 2012. Only one day of rain (staff switched gears to find things to do!). We have visited Rie Palace in Costa Rica, and one in Cancun. This is very best beach! Lovely Palms, ots of chairs fro beach and pools.Exceptional staff and food. Took eco tour and into city twice. No concerns for security. Only two elevators and they go through service areas at the gorund level where food service and beach are located. So, if knees are a prroblem a ground level room would be best! 1st floor is lobby level and will require stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Riu once again! Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: hastres
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico in May 2011 for my wife's 30th birthday. We consider ourselves 'seasoned' Riu guests.. this is the 3rd different property we have visited in the past three years, all in Mexico. As we expected, the property is clean and in great condition, the food and entertainment is fun, and the staff is very very friendly! Our only minor gripe would be the check-in process... we arrived around 12pm the day of check-in and were greeted by the front-desk staff. They informed us that our rooms would not be available until 3pm. No worries, the restaurant, beach, pool and all other facailties were open and ready to be used. We were told our bags would be brought to our rooms when they were ready. Well come to our surprise 4 hours later, the bags were still in the lobby and it seems like they were completely forgotten. No worries though, it's vacation right! Anyone who has visited a Riu Palace property will knows what to expect and can be reassured about the quality of the food and staff. Everyone goes out of their way to make you comfortable... awesome! We visited the Spa during our trip for a massage... Yes services seem pricey, but $20-30 for mani or peti and up is about normal for any resort. Once again the staff was very gracious and did a great job. Last but certainly not least is the beach. This Riu is situated on a very large piece of property and no kidding the beach is HUGE! The water is probably at least 200 yards from the edge of the resort which is awesome. The sand is clean and the water is crystal clear and warm. The resort provides plenty of lounge chairs and there is a large group of palm trees between the pool and the sand that provides lots of shade. The resort was fairly full when we were there and we did not have much trouble at all finding a shady spot (this can't always be said about other resorts we've been to in the past). There are bartenders continually circulating amongst the lounge chairs with drinks of all sorts (water, mojitos, pina colladas, and more)! To conclude, we had a great vacation and eagerly look forward to our next trip to a Riu. As the tag-line says... "I want, I want to go to Riu.. I want, I want to go to Riu!"

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Courteous, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: T0TE
Reviews.Content: Lovely accommodations and friendly staff that could not do enough to please. Nice selection of food on the buffet and at the restaurants. Great beach access and the on-site pool was quite nice. There was different entertainment each evening and lots of activities. Musty odor in the rooms due to the heat & humidity and expect to pay extra for in-room WIFI (although it's free if you use your laptop in the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “returned on february 18th, 2012 from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdwayne
Reviews.Content: we had booked in November for a one week stay at the RIU Yucatan for Feb. 11-18th. on arrival we found out the Yucatan had over booked and that we could/would be moved to the RIU Palace Mexico. we didn't really have an option so we were moved. all worked out just fine with the exception that one of the couples had paid for a suite at the Yucatan costing them more money than we paid. when the move was made they pretty much ended up with the same room we had. our room was on the bottom floor, we would have preferred either second or third floor but again apparently that wasn't an option. they were placed to the inside court area so they had a better view than we ended up with. our view was of the walking trail between the two properties used by the guest's of the RIU Tequila. we pretty much had constant traffic in front of our patio. this wasn't a big problem for us but we had booked the Yucatan mainly for the jungle atmosphere. the pool area at the Palace was just ok and the beach was very nice with plenty of lounge chairs and didn't seem to matter what time you got to the beach, there always seemed to be a selection of loungers due to having a Palace wrist band and the other RIU guest with the exception of the Palace Riviera guest's could only use. food at the Palace Mexico was very good with plenty of selection, not sure how anyone could really complain, maybe too picky would be my first thought. the specialty restuarants were very good, we managed to go to all of them during our one week stay. the plus side of the Palace wristband access was being able to go to ALL the other RIU's. we visited all of them except the Lupita. the Yucatan seemed to have more of a party type crowd in the pool area and we really had an enjoyable day when we visited there. the Riviera Maya had a very nice pool area, we enjoyed a day there also. to finish up i would say our trip was very good with a couple of little bumps that were easily over looked as the staff in all of the resorts were VERY accomodating and always seem to have a smile for you with a friendly "hola". thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful winter break”
Reviews.Author: jasmine078
Reviews.Content: A party of ten of us stayed at the RIU PALACE MEXICO in January , we went over to renew our wedding vows. The majority of the guests are American and Canadian. The hotel is lovely,ok , it's dated but that wasn't a problem, even for a fussy person like me, and its due to be refurbished later this year. The grounds are beautiful and make you feel so relaxed. We didn't try the pool, just went to the beach, (it did tend to cloud over about 2-4pm maybe it's just the time of year) and it was a little warmer by the pool when the sun went in. , you could always get a drink on the beach they used to bring a selection around through out the day. Spa: You can get a massage on the beach, expensive, but worth it. I went to the hairdressers in the Spa and I came out with what I wanted perfect even with the language barrier, that never happens at home ! ! We tried the Japanese, Krystel and the Steak house restaurants, all nice inside but the food and the service were not as good as the buffet, that's just a personal point of view. Rooms kept clean and tidy by the room boy's, the bar staff always quick to serve with a smile. Entertainment: good, not brilliant but the staff work so hard, and you can always go over the road to the Tequila for a dance. The staff at this hotel are a real credit to it,from the catering staff,bar staff,waiters, room boys.. they all made our stay so good. The only let down , are the Reception Staff,(it would depend who was on duty) they weren't interested or helpful. We did have a medical emergency one night,the man on reception was so slow to react and unhelpful that if we didn't have a nurse and a paramedic with our party who eventually got the lady to hospital I don't know what would have happened! Trips: We went on the bar crawl, it cost for two people £90 UK pounds, you go to two bars and get watered down drinks then much later on in the evening to Coco Bongos,the 20year olds in our party liked it, but we thought it was a total Rip Off. If you want to do any trips dolphin,catamaran etc come out of the hotel, turn right walk a few yards down the road, you will see some shops and kiosks you can book the Same trips at the kiosks for much less. Finally, we renewed our wedding vows on the beach, Marco the Wedding co-ordinator made our day so special it was everything we wanted and more, the hotel staff also went that extra mile to make our day perfect.' If anyone would like information on weddings please e.mail me.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE RIU PALACE MEXICO!”
Reviews.Author: Sherry M
Reviews.Content: Been to RIU Palace Mexico 2 times now. Both times were excellent! Great service, friendly staff, felt spoiled and catered too! The only down side is the beds and pillows could use up grading to something softer and more comfortable. The pillows in the rooms are hard, but you can request softer ones. The softer ones were better, but need replacing as they were getting lumpy. That would be our only complaint. Everything is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Was giving Riu hotels a second chance ...”
Reviews.Author: Bettybooptwo
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Riu Jalisco in Puerto Vallerta several years ago and did not have a very good experience as far as the food - in the next years we always stayed at the Iberostar's and was extremely happly with their resorts.. We decided to give the Riu chain another chance this year and stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico .... we loved it The food- was great so good I came home weighing a lot more than when I left - We ate at the Specialty restaurants - Steak and La Bodega - Our steaks were great and they give you so much food - it is impossible to eat it all -- The La Bodega is a lot of different meats ... chicken, steak, sausage, turkey.... Most of the time we ate dinner in the Don Julian - and found the variety overwhelming - a word to the men though bring a pair of long pants to wear at dinner even if you are eating in the buffet... LONG pants are required - they do enforce as we saw several gentlemen turned away because they had dress shorts on - the El Patio and La Traviata are 2 restaurants on the beach and serve lunch daily - good salad bar and one has Italian food and the other is more mexican and american .. We did go over to the Riu Yucatan next door for lunch one day --- don"t waste your time - it was horrible The Room - We stayed in the rooms on bottom floor behind the Don Julian restaurant- rooms 83-94 - Okay these rooms never see sunshine so they are damp ... when we go back again we are requesting rooms on the 2nd or 3rd floor... so we get some air circulating and some light ... The rooms were fine always clean and refrig stocked but just never dryed out. The hotel is closing down Aug 1st for a renovation of the rooms and if you go to room 001 you can see what the new rooms will look like ... quite interesting - anyway just a tip to let you know ask for upper level room The Beach - Big and Long - have a beach bar so don't have to walk too far and a couple of days thay had a young man that came around with trays of drinks all different kinds - their cups are small - maybe 6oz - so bring a larger container to put several drinks in the bathrooms are up in the 2 beach restaurants ... Pool bar they have an upper and lower bar - together - swimup bar is on the lower and walk up bar on top - bathrooms are next to the pool bar .... if you don't get down to the pool by 9 forget about getting a chair... never had a problem at the beach lots of seating ....they have towel cards - the towel place only opens at 8 so we always exchanged our towels at 5 so we would have fresh towels in the morning as we were early risers... The Animation entertainers were excellent - Aida was the best - always coming around and talking to us -- play bingo and bocci ball -- that's about all we did but they have at lot of other things to do .... The lobby bar - great drinks - Hiram and his crew always kept our glasses full Would we go to this Riu agan - definitely the only downside to our trip was when we checked in - it was a short gentleman- commented that we were early -- heh funjet dropped us off at 11am and ... the gentleman told us our room would not be ready til 3pm and this is how he said it - It's 11 that's 11 to 12 to 1 to 2 to 3pm - 4 hours come back then -- he was really rude... we got our rooms at 3:15pm I wish I would have got his name ......

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ny_mt_girl
Reviews.Content: January 2012. Stayed at the RIU Palace Mexico. An all inclusive in Playa Del Carmen. We also had the RIU, Yucatan, Tequila, & Palace close by to be able to use as well, Except for dinner. Be sure to get a room overlooking the fountains, Pretty views but be closer to the pool as every night some entertainment would go on till 11:00 PM so if you want quiet stay closer to the pool. No ocean view as the building is a distance from it for hurricane protection. The room was very clean but the couch was so old it was sagging to much to sit on. We enjoyed our balcony & a comfy bed that had a topper on it. Be sure to get one. The room also had a bar & fridge with micers & plenty of water to use for drinking or brushing your teeth to making coffee. My husband likes Scotch so we asked them to switch a bottle & they just left a full sealead bottle of J&B in the room. Plenty of hot water for showers. The lobby/ lobby bar always had inscents burning. A bit overpowering for me but mus be used to help with the musty smell. The buffet was always plentful, fresh & something for everyone.Out of the specialty restaurants that you would make reservations for The Brazilian Steakhouse was the best. Fusion was awful & we were 10 minutes late and we were scolded like children and almost turned away. They would have done us a favor as the buffet was better. I am a wine drinker & use to be in the business. The wine is swill.. Just awful. That was a huge disapointment. I would have been happy to purchase a better wine but not available. All inclusive means plenty of drinking But be sure to ask for the rum in your pina colada or else you may not notice any.. We brought plenty of US single dollars for tipping & they sure remembered you & took care of you. We were about a week early for the warmer beach/pool weather but still enjoyed our stay. Overall I would go back, find a liquor store for my wine or buy it at the airport duty free & bring it with me. for less than $10.00 US. You can take a cab "Downtown" get away from the inital drop off and walk further away into the nicer section withthe better shops & restaurants. The shop people are constantly barking at you to go into their shops it is annoying. Across the street from the hotel entrance and just a few yards away is a small shopping area. It is clean & safe & a starbucks is there if you feel the need. Playa Del Carmen is a great location. We liked the securtity felt good. The beach is large & pretty w/ plenty of chairs. I will try a RIU property again. The staff was Wonderful, except tfor the one guy at Fusion. Everyone was friendly. You get your moneys worth. Maybe we will go back after the renovations. I would go again as we really enjoyed our trip. Avoid room service for food.. this was surprisingly bad.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit & I was worried........”
Reviews.Author: dmfalle
Reviews.Content: We arrived Feb 3 thru the 9th, with a group of 60 for our 2nd visit to the Riu Palace Mexico after being there last year. We usually go to different resorts so I was worried that I would be "let down" by going to the same place twice but that didn't happen! As before, we found the resort in excellent shape even though it is planning on a complete reno this spring. Heard many comments "why?". I asked the receptionist about the plans & he said, the rooms will completely be re-done, the alacartes will be changed & upgraded, a 24 sports bar will be added and the pool will be re-done. Am sure there are other upgrades planned along with those. The beach is the same - long, wide, sandy, sunny, shady and the water a crystal blue. Service was exceptional as before. Rooms were clean, orderly & very function-able. There was some construction going on which resulted in some room changes. A few hair dryers were ""weak" but unless someone tells them - how are they to know? And what a weak complaint! lol We had reservations at 3 of the ala-cartes. Personally, we enjoyed the Steakhouse the most. As Nebraskans, we think we know "beef" & we can say our steaks were very tender & tasty. Plus they present a sea-food platter as an h'orderve with clams, crab leg cuts, etc.... Salmon was also on the menu. Service was exceptional. The Krystal restaurant was our least favorite. I had the Sea Bass which was wonderful but it is a very light fish so was glad my hubby had the filet & shared it with me. Their h'orderves are very unusual but all was fun. Again, can't ask for better service. The Brazilian Restaurant was truly a different experience with all the different meats. From ribs, beef, chicken etc... you are ready to bust! It all is prepared on rotisseries & shaved off at your table. Our Olympus Travel representative arranged for our group to take the 8:30 seating so it was a treat to be able to dine together our last night. Again, the service was unsurpassed. The buffet is the best - I don't care what anyone says! If you can't find anything good to eat at that for either breakfast or dinner, something is wrong! Service is excellent. Contrary to another review - plenty of fresh fruit is available!! Yes, they do have wine and/or beer or non-alcohol drinks or any other cocktail anyone wants. Service & smiles are the norm. The beach restaurant was also very good for lunch but how can we eat soo much! The carrot cake was so good, we were tempted to take the whole cake to our table. lol This year was the first to find a shortage of beach loungers but it happened just one day after a couple days of over-cast skies & showers so everyone hit the beach. We found beach service only one day out of the 7 but we figured out that if the pool isn't busy, it gives them a chance to serve the beach. Lots of volleyball was played in the pool by our group. A friendly game between the Germans & USA! Both teams had their own cheerleaders and both sides knew it was "in fun". Actually, most of us are all Germans by ancestory! Free water sports are available. They punch your arm band & then you have usage rights for a 1/2 hour or hour depending on how busy they are. I was disappointed in the live band in the plaza. It just wasn't as good in my opinion as last year. But, evening rain showers put a damper on the plaza's activities. I was also a bit disappointed on the Superbowl game reception. Last year, they held it in the theatre. This year, the time frame did not interfere with the evening theatre hours but they held it in a conference room & of course, the tallest, biggest guy was sitting in the front row, blocking the view for us "shorties". Oh well, wasn't really a big Superbowl fan this year! Overall, nightly entertainment was lacking but the other Riu's are available for other options. Two nights, they had guest interactive games. The Las Vegas night was a good show. Overall, we just can't find much to complain about. The Riu Palace Mexico is well run, a resort with lots of class, exceptional food & service, the best beach & nice functional rooms. Just as it was last year!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SLCparrothead
Reviews.Content: I have often wondered how the reviews for the same place can vary so much. In this case, there are two resorts that are called Riu Palace in Playa Del Carmen on the Riviera Maya. One is called the Riu Palace-Mexico. The one next door is called the Riu Palace-Riviera Maya. We stayed at the Riu Palace-Mexico in Playa Del Carmen. It was excellent. The rooms were large and comfortable. The service was very good. The staff bent over backwards to please. The grounds were clean and well kept. The food was not great, but was good. If you stay here, you can go to any of the other Riu resorts in the area. We did not. However I think that this resort was newer than the Riviera Maya. That may be the reason for the various opinions. It is only a short cab ride from downtown Playa Del Carmen. This in a gated community and there is security everywhere. Very safe.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful all inclusive”
Reviews.Author: josiePlymouth
Reviews.Content: just returned from the riu palace mexico in playa del carmen...what a wonderful hotel...we have been there before, so we knew what to expect...and we were not disappointed....the food was a little off....not the same as two years ago....but service, the people, and the beach are still excellent. we heard that the resort will be completely done over the end of this year. however,.the room was in excellent condition. the weather pretty much held up however it did rain a little every day or at night...we travelled with 11 people and they upgraded us and we were all together. jet blue did an excellent job with the price &, transfers. we had a great timeand will go back again

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: KyT27
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Riu Palace Mexico after our 7 day stay. This is the 2nd resort we’ve visited in the Riviera Maya in the last year. Overall it was a good hotel, great beach and great service. First impressions were great but as the week went on the little things added up. Here’s what I thought, -Friendly staff and excellent service, all the other reviews about the great service and friendly staff were right – they were accommodating, quick, and always pleasant -Beautiful Beach – the beach is large with palm trees so you can get both sun and shade, they also have hammocks in the palm trees for a siesta. Usually you had to get down before 10 am to get a beach chair, most ppl throw towels down early to reserve and come back later. The beach is one of the best features of the resort. -Rooms – rooms are large with a sunken living room, mini bar and a balcony, only complaints were the hair dryer – didn’t work, we asked for a new one and they had someone up and switched it for another one within 20 mins, but even the newer one didn’t work very well, I would recommend to bring your own. Also, there were ants in our room anytime food or drinks were out. We keep things clean and never left food out but even a pop bottle that had its cap completely closed tight still brought them all over the bottle and table within 20 mins. They even were after water. If we wanted a drink we had to put it back in the fridge if we didn’t drink the whole thing immediately. Our room was on the 3rd floor(top floor) and was facing the Riu Yucatan. The path was right below our balcony for the golf carts and ppl walking to go back and forth to the beach from the other Riu resorts across the street. The carts are gas powered and start running around 8 am. We live in the city so the noise didn’t bother us but it was fairly loud so light sleepers might not enjoy that. FYI – there are no rooms in the hotel that have any ocean or beach view. -Pool – it’s narrow and small. The area for the fountains is larger than the pool, but with how nice the beach is we preferred to be out there anyway. -Facilities are clean and well maintained (even though a bit dated), some tiles move in the hallway when you walk on them but this should be fixed once the renovations are done at the end of the year. -Location – the RPM is in a secure community of 11 resorts, golfcourse, and condos, etc – you can feel safe for a 30 min walk to Playa Del Carmen or to the shops across the street, etc. Only a 10 min drive from Xplor/Xcaret parks and 45 mins from airport. I really liked the area, everything was close by and lots to do. -Food- it was decent but I’ve had better. I have celiac disease which is basically a food allergy to gluten and the options here were very limited. In Mexico I’m used to corn tortillas in food instead of wheat but at this resort it seemed they used more flour tortillas for most things. For the options I did have the food was okay but a lot of things were undercooked I found-particularly red meats. Chicken was good but the other meats were fatty and undercooked to my liking but to each their own. Had I not been restricted in my options I think I would have been more satisfied with the buffet but overall we both agreed that the Barcelo was better. -Specialty Restaurants –we only tried the steakhouse on the last night we were there. Everywhere it tells you that you need to book the specialty restaurants for the same day between 830-1030 am, the only issue we had with that was that we came out of the buffet from breakfast at 8 am thinking we had a half hr to kill before we would go book the steakhouse for the 630 pm sitting and we noticed a small line was there starting to book the restaurants. We went over and sure enough they started at 8 and by the time we got to book(5 mins later) all the spots had been filled for the 630 pm sitting, only 830 pm was left. Why would you state everywhere that you book between 830-1030 and even tell us that at check in but then allow ppl to start booking at 8am? I don’t get it. The steakhouse was actually just the outside patio snack bar that we eat at midday, nothing fancy, no a/c, sand still on the floor and despite being supposedly an upscale hotel most ppl at the tables were wearing jeans, running shoes and a t-shirt. Felt over dressed in my dress clothes. The staff was awesome as they were the whole trip. My wife had the chicken and that was good, I ordered the rib eye and it was probably the toughest steak I’ve ever ate – if you go to the steak house, do not order the steak which seems odd to be saying. They served fries with dinner and they were good with the seasoning but we only got like a tablespoon sized serving of mashed potatoes. The staff was good enough that I would say you should try a specialty restaurant but definitely order the chicken or try another one of the restaurants b/c the steak is something you shouldn’t bother trying. We had a great time, the beach and the service were the strongest traits, everything else seemed minor but for the money we paid I think there are better resorts out there. I’m sure most things would be solved after the renovations but I preferred the Barcelo over the Riu.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Kate S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Palace Mexico at the end of March 2010. I travel a couple times a year and this is still 1 of my favourite hotels and places. The hotel itself is gorgeous and very luxurious. The buffet is the best buffet ever with a variety of delicious food and different themes every night. We also had room service which was much better than some all inclusive but not comparable to the amazing buffet. The club was at RIU Tequila which was right across the street (a very short walk) and because we stayed at a palace we were able to go to any of the 5 RIU's to swim, drink, or eat lunch. The club was mainly a younger crowd. The Palace Mexico had entertainment in the evening and then around 10 it started to get a little quiet. Playa del Carmen is a 5 minute cab ride...and that is where you can have lots of fun at night. There are many excellent clubs with wonderful entertainment. there are also many stores, markets, restaurants and bars. The town is something that needs to be visited during the day and at night. From there you can also take a short boat ride to Cozumel, which is also very beautiful. Within walking distance of the hotel there is a small outdoor mall. There you can get beautiful jewellery, snacks, clothes, souvenirs, ect. There is also a bank there. My only warning is not to buy jewellery from the hotel market that they have in the evening because you can get it 10 times cheaper at the outdoor mall or in Playa del Carmen. Tours There are many tours offered from the hotel. We went on explore which was a day trip that included: zip-lining, swimming in caves, taking a raft through the caves and lunch. It was worth it. We also went on the catamaran tour. It included snorkelling at a coral reef, lunch, beers and cocktails, and free time in the water. This was a relaxing and fun trip where you can meet people. however the coral reef was not nearly as pretty as the one in cuba. On our last day we rented a boat from the hotel and went fishing. It was our group of 5 plus 2 of the workers. we went for a ride on the boat while the fishing stuff was hooked up (I am not a fisher so I am unaware of terms) then asked them to take us snorkelling and that was much funner than the tour snorkelling. We had beers (bring some extra though), took pictures on and off the boat and we got to drive the boat which was very fun and wild. There Staff were amazing. Service was excellent! Food was delicious! There is so much to do in Playa del Carmen that we only slept a few hours each night. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone because you have the option to play at any of the other 4 RIU's within walking distance. we spend one day hotel hopping and meeting people and using the other RIU's pools. If it is within your budget I recommend staying at either the Palace Mexico or the Palace Riviera May because you then have the option to visit all of the RIU's

Reviews.Title: “riu palace mexico”
Reviews.Author: shannon w
Reviews.Content: We just returned today fro Riu Palace Mexico. We had a wonderful time. Service was great, the facility was very clean. We only experienced one problem and that was with the room we stayed in, room 2161. The room's air conditioner did not work. We complained about the issue, but it was never resolved. The room was always about 10-15 degrees warmer than the hallway or even the main lobby. Everyone else in our group stated that their rooms were actually cold. When you looked out the window to the back deck, it looked straight out onto concrete roof that was painted orange. No view what so ever.That was very disappointing. So, if you go, request not to have that room. But other than that, we had a great time. The room was very nice except for the air and view. Food was excellent and again, service was exceptional. Looking forward to going back next year. Can't wait to see what renovations are going to be made. The grounds are beautiful. Nice area and we felt very safe. We walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Adios but not Goodbye will be back next year!( 7th Jan 2012 2 weeks)”
Reviews.Author: BarbedWirePreston
Reviews.Content: First experience of an all inclusive . Absolutely loved it. Enhanced by the fact that the hotel is one of 5/6 other Rius in Playacar. Staying at a Palace Riu means you can use any of the other Rius facilities day and night . Have lunch in any of the hotels and drinks of course. You are asked to have your breakfast and evening meal at your own hotel.( Some of the other Rius cannot use the Palace hotels) The flexibilty of being able to wander around a resort really enhanced our holiday. Perfectly save to wander around during the day or evening. Playa del Carmen is a 35min walk through the Playacar resort or a 40 min gentle stroll up the beach. Plenty of taxis (90 pesos £4 approx from the far end of 5th Avenue). Had already upgraded to a suite and had emailed the hotel in advance to request a 1st floor or above room with an unobstructed view.we had room 1058 traditionally furnished .Clean well presented bathroom lounge area and bedroom with a walk in wardrobe and a spacious balcony with a really lovely view over the fountains. Four optics in room with various premium liquors and a fridge full of beer .soda and water all replenished on a daily basis.(husband prefers a darker beer left a not in the fridge asking for cerveza negra/amber returned that evening to find a fridge full of dark beer GREAT!!) We would definitely upgrade to a suite and request an upper floor room (loved the space we had). Absolutely no problem in making bookings for the speciality restaurants always room expecially for the 2nd sitting.We enjoyed the Steak restaurant probably best. We also ventued out to dine in Playa del Carmen our recomendations would be evening meal at Ajua Maya ( excellent mexican cuisine with flare and theatrics at your table with a really good house band ) Lunch at Carboncitos and coffee and all things chocolate at Ah Cacao.We understand that the hotel is going to be reavmped sometime this year it will be interesting to go and back and see whats been done. A special thankyou to Mayli our Room maid. Polo the pastry chef in Don Julian Restaurant and Addy the always smiling waitress who seemed to be serving everywhere we where. Thank you also to house keeping who decorated our room for my birthday and the lovely cake that was presented to me with singing waiters in the Krystal restaurant .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Tillymint90
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review as I thought the below review was very untrue. Yes you could get beer and wine at the evening buffet...it's a lie to say you could only get this at lunch. There were about 8 different fresh juices at breakfast which were made infront of you with a blender...and also the buffet food was some of the best that I've had in an all inclusive hotel. I do think you must of had your eyes closed! And desserts we're not the best in the world... But they certainly were edible. They Even make fresh Crepes for you at the evening buffet. Service was excellent, staff work so so hard! Also the grounds are kept beautiful, not enough credit it given to the grounds staff. Overall a lovely stay... Don't be put of by the bad reviews... Clearly people have nothing better to do but moan!

Reviews.Title: “Five times a charm”
Reviews.Author: birchstick
Reviews.Content: As this was our fifth time visiting the palace, they must be doing something right. As some reviewers seem to speak of the negatives I will begin my review the same First, there was a picture in our room that was hanging crooked. Then there was a weed in one of the hedges that did'nt get picked for 2 days. Once the container of warm milk for morning coffee was'nt quite full. Then at one of the restaurants there was a fork that was on the wrong side. I could go on and on but I'll stop there. Plain and simply it's the staff that keeps us coming back. The front desk staff is very fast and efficient. Anything they can do for you they do. The housekeeping staff are always around and always have a smile and an Hola! for you. The grounds crew is amazing. The clippin' and trimmin' and sweepin' never seem to stop. Every day the hundreds of beach chairs end up all over the place. In the morning everything is back in perfect line ready to go. They even have this beach zamboni thing that cleans and grooms the sand. The staff at the restaurants are friendly and professional. If you want something they don't have, they go find it for you. The activity crew are buzzing around the place from morning to night and are always up to get everyone involved. The evening enterainment is great with different shows and dancers who really work there butts off. The staff at the buffet are all so friendly and fast. Our morning guy Abraham knew what you needed before you did and had it there pronto. Juan Santoyo runs his area with great pride and is second to none. As this resort is about 15 years old it is about time for and is scheduled for a reno this summer. If any of the RIU brass comes across this, here are a couple of suggestions if you haven't already got them on your list. 1. Pleeeeeeeease get rid of the Canadian Mist as your house rye. As you have thousands of Canadians as your guests, I can tell you that no one drinks this garbage. Canadian Club is almost as bad. 2. Move the room safes up to eye level. Us old guys can't bend and stoop as well as we once could and having them on the floor is a real pain. If you raised them up you could build shelves under them which would give the ladies somewhere to put all the shoes they bring. 3. Bring in whatever heavy equipment you need to annilate the pool. You have plenty of room to make it like the big brother palace down the street. Put the swim up bar facing the beach where it gets sun past 10 am. 4. This is the important one. As the headbords never need to be moved, please screw them to the wall. Jamming a pillow in between the headbord and the wall wastes precious energy that is required elsewhere. Looking forward to checking out the Palace once you're done

Reviews.Title: “travel agent review”
Reviews.Author: ANNMILLSTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico, and was very impressed with the resort. Cleanliness of facility is top notch, from early morning , cleaning tiles to turn down in the evening.Buffets are the best you will find with cooked to order omletes and fruit juices that are amazing, to salmon and great wines... Try to get a top floor superior room, as this will face the courtyard, not the back of the resort. it is worth a few more $$. Service was attentive and friendly.
