Since Europeans stay for at least two weeks, they seem to cater to those with little amenities like warm milk for their tea.Entertainment was good and changed every evening. Authentic crafts and items were available one evening for sale..Beach is one of the best, and my husband and I truly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “great time!”
Reviews.Author: esk70
Reviews.Content: Some reviews can put you off this property but we had nothing but great things to say.Yes its getting a bit old but how cares,it was spottless!The staff are amazing,from the grounds crew to the service staff...top rate.Abraham at breakfast was the best.The entertainment always had something for you.A little something for everyone as far as food.The only problem we had was the smoking,we wished there was no smoking while we ate.Other than that it was great

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: FREQTRAVELRCanada
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and mother and father -in-law and I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico the second week of January 2012. We had a wonderful stay and there is not one bad thing that I would say about the resort. As per some of the comments by other guests , yes it could use some refurbishing at the pool area and some of the trim in the rooms is looking a litte tired. It didn't bother me at all and have stayed at newer Riu Palace's and this one did live up to my expectations. The food and service was just sensational. I cannot remember enjoying a buffet as much as this one. In fact after one A La Carte dinner we elected to have our remaining meals at the buffet. I would not recommend the Krystal A La Carte. Besides the Steak, the other meals were dissappointing. Our one and a half year old had a great time during the day in the sand and really enjoyed the children's entertainment in the evening. There were not a lot of kids at the resort, but the ones that were there had a lot of fun. The entertainment was fairly good as well.

Reviews.Title: “great winter sun location”
Reviews.Author: Geoff07
Reviews.Content: It,s pretty much all been said in previous reviews although I must say what people find to moan about is beyond belief. This place pretty much ticks all the boxes for most people. I would mention that our North American friends frequent this hotel in considerable numbers and as this is their backyard, so to speak, they are confident here and their confidence (and volume) grows with each mudslide, dirty monkey, tequila sunrise and whatever other ridiculous cocktail they can get down their throats.However the noisiest seem to congregate around the pool bar and the pool volleyball so leaving the beach and other areas relatively peaceful. Mexico is famous for it,s silver with many shops selling all kinds of silver jewellery but the diamonds of Mexico are surely it,s people who have such sunny dispositions and are industrious and so welcoming. They provided us with the best service we have had anywhere in the world. If you choose to holiday here, which I recommend you do, then please be kind to them and remember that in comparison to us they are not paid very much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Outi66
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in this hotel, getting back home just couple of days ago. Our travel agency person sold this to us as only real 5 star hotel she has ever stayed in. I do not know where she has been before but I have to say that to me this one did not come up as 5 stars. First impression of the place was very promising but then we started to notice the small little details that separates the real 5 start places from this one. I try to be now as impartial as I can and list some details that may help others to have more realistic expecatations of the place. Rooms: Nice and spacious. They look clean but soon you will notice that for example the floor is not really properly cleaned. When you walk there barefoot after the shower your feet will be soon black. Our room was facing sister hotel Riu Yukatan and first we thought it must be quiet location but soon realized that the golf cart taking people from main road to beach starts to operate at 8 am and goes on all day. The noise is so horrible it will wake you up. I wonder why they don't have electric ones.... Chairs at the balcony are very nice. And air condition is also smart, it will turn off automatically if you leave balcony door open. Mini bar: Fridge is stocked with sodas and beer but no wine available. Could be ordered through room service, I believe. I it would be nice to have mini bottles in room too. Embarrassing to this hotel was that they had fake Smirnoff vodka in Sminrnoff bottle. In my understanding that is kind of illeagle in most of the world. When we mentioned this in reception and requested the real stuff they tried to look suprised and said they could not understand what has happened. But still they changed the bottles also in the rooms of our group even though they had not complained, yet. So obviously the have the fake stuff in there hoping people will not notice the difference. Every night we had to call for refill of the minibar and it took several calls. First we call and ask for certain items, then we call again after an half an hour. Then someone appears at the door asking what we need (we had said that already on the phone). Then we call again after half an hour and soon someone comes with the refill. Then after about 2 hours reception calls and asks if the refill has happened, 3,5 hours after our first call!!!! I would not call this first class service. And seriously, this happened every night. Reception: Lady who checked us in was very very nice and effective. She said she is Hungarian but cannot remeber her name. But unfortunately she was the only one appearing that way. Others did not know anything about Playa del Carmen or did not want to help. They had dirty uniforms which I think is real embarrasment for any hotel, let alone 5 stars. Once we asked from reception if it is normal that cleaners empty all the coins from ashtrays in the rooms. This happened in first day, my husband placed on my advice all his change to ashtray and when we returned to room it was all gone. In the end it was suppose to be tip to house hold but we did not realize they will take it first day. Anyhow, we asked if this is common practice and we just were stupid foreigners who do not understand the local habits. Clerk from reception said that that probably is whats has happened, cleaning person must have thought it is meant for him. But anyhow he promised to check this. He never returned to topic. Well, we did consider this when we left our final tip. Pool: you have to have a card to get a towel (1 pce) for you from the pool. In my experience in 5 star hotel you do not need any cards, you can get as many towels as you want and leave them anywhere. Here they tell you very clearly what you will be charged if you do not return the card of the towel while checking out. First morning there were not any towels available around 8:45 am. And you cannot return your towel after 6 pm. There isn't any other access to pool but horrible staircases, I mean those metallic ones with couple of steps. You cannot really walk into the pool. The water was very very cold. Restaurants: For first couple of nights the dinner buffet is ok. The salad / cold appetizers table is really nice but same every day. Warm food was not so good. Mostly dried up or cold. But some nice exception to that were found most of the time. White wine they give you as default is something very cheap and not nice but if you ask you will get better one. But again, in 5 start hotel do you need to ask for nice wine? Lunch buffet was good, at least for lunch I would not require anything else. Breakfast was the best part of the day. The selection is huge! A la carte restaurants were very average. In my country I can find better ones from midprice places. Crystal was quite good, steak house had good steaks, Brazilian one was real dissappointment. Japanese one we did not try. Way of reserving the table is horrifying. Imagine waking up and running to table reservation at 8:30 am in 5 star hotel, no thank you! But luckily that is not the real life. We were able to reserve tables to each restaurant later in the afternoon. They were not full at all. Shows: I heard people complementing them at breakfast table and I wondered why, to me the were really boring. The latin music band on our first night was good, otherwise everything was so amateur. Beach: The beach is wonderfull. Best part of this hotel. So clean and nice. But again, some small detail: the drinks from the bar at the beach does not really have practically any alcohol in them. Of course some people may say that you are not meant to get drunk there. But I rather have my drink as I order it and then drink water in between. Into 0,5 litres of thermomug they will put about 1-1,5 cl of alcohol, practically nothing. When you mention this they will add one drop more. This applies especially the guy who is in charge of the place. Once when I got a drink made by another guy it had normal amount of alcohol. Service at beach works, you will get those water down drinks directly to the beach. That is nice if you are happy with juices and watered beer. Personnel: Everyone except the guy at the beach bar are really service oriented and nice. Summa summarum: Place is really nice if you expect 3-4 stars. Even though I give a lots of critic here we did enjoy our stay. And if the price was right we might stay there again, assuming we would go to same location another time. But since the place claims to be the 5 start I feel obliged to tell you the truth of these little details that takes stars away from this place. Just have right expecations and you will enjoy it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Food!”
Reviews.Author: PandPIndiana
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 visited this Riu property and we were not disappointed. While the resort is supposed to be closing down in August 2012 for a complete redo of rooms and other areas, it didn't hinder our good time. The food at this resort was some of the best we have had at an AI. The buffet breakfast had made to order omelets and make your own bloody Marys. There is a musty odor in the lobby area but we soon got used to it. The rooms are spacious and clean. Some tiles are in need of replacement throughout the resort and there are some gently used areas, but overall, if they are totally redoing this resort, 2013 should find this a 5 star location. Staff was pleasant and attentive. Drinks on the beach and easy walk to two buffets for lunch from your beach chair.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility!!”
Reviews.Author: JRB1959
Reviews.Content: I must say my wife and I were delighted with our recent stay at this resort! Everything from the pool and beach areas to the restaurants was great! All of our meals were very tasty and well prepared. We would not hesitate to return to this resort are try our some of the other Riu resorts!

Reviews.Title: “Not really 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Wendy N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Christmas and New Year and was quite disappointed. The noise around the pool and the shouting for volleyball and bingo to name a few, we thought we had arrived at a 3 star hotel. It wouldn't have been so bad if the children had stayed in the pools reserved for them for they don't. The food on Christmas Eve was lovely but it went downhill from there on. After complaining about the corked wine on numerous occasions and getting nowhere we complained to the people on the front desk. We were then subjected to a very rude restaurant manager who said we should have told him! which we already had done. Also having to queue in the morning from 8O'Clock to get a ticket to go into the speciality restaurants in my opinion is not 5 star. If you are too late you just don't get to go in them. The shows were good in the evening, but after they finish at 10.30 there is absolutely nothing to do. By the end of the 2 weeks we were very bored. We did go into Playa del Carmen to eat on numerous occasions, the food was very good but expensive. This hotel is okay if you are looking for a reasonable priced all inclusive hotel but if you are expecting 5 star treatment look elsewhere. The spa and hairdressers need badly updating a few up to date magazines in the hairdressers might help the ones which are there must be 2 years old at least. The families there seemed to be having fun which I think is more suited to them not couples.

Reviews.Title: “the best resort at customer cultivation!!”
Reviews.Author: funtimes85
Reviews.Content: i stayed at riu palace mexico in playa end of october 2011 long over due for review. my room request was made and fulfilled through email. check in was fast and friendly. the room was perfect except the love seat. very clean, room service was great and they have evening turn down service as well. we received a letter everyday to thank us and if their was anything we needed as well as calls to the room if we were ok. the pottery gift was a nice touch as well as it sits on our coffee table at home. customer service here is great in every level and every worker is happy to work at this resort. the buffet has a lot of choices something for every one. we made our reservation for dinner thru email as well for fusion witch was romantic. beach one of the best in the world if you know the area. beach bbq was good as well as the drink service we like to bring our own insulated mugs. not one bug in the room and the bed at riu is softer the the one at home. every one here is so friendly from the doorman to the management i can see why this resort has repeat customers. the lounge bar was good sit chill listen to the piano man david. outside courtyard is nice to have a few drinks view the entertainment. stocked fridge and liquor dispensers `are a nice touch. i enjoyed the crepe's maid to order add some ice cream and syrup i was happy. i would suggest the red wine from chile they have some of the best vinyards. you can't go wrong booking this resort unless you are miserable to begin with. happy go lucky people this is the place for you have a great time we shore did!! review from funtimes85

Reviews.Title: “RIU Comes Through Again”
Reviews.Author: mdgtravelWI
Reviews.Content: This is our 6th trip to a RIU resort throughout Mexico and the Caribbean and this was just as good as our other trips. Owning a travel agency has allowed me to visit many different resorts and the RIU's are ranked among my favorites. We traveled with 10 people, 4 rooms and we were placed together in rooms 0108 - 0112 as requested at check in. Our rooms faced the resort next door and had a view of the workers from that resort but we didn't spend much time in the room and the view doesn't really make or break a vacation for me so it was fine. All rooms have 2 beds in them. You can pull them apart or push them together to make 1 king or 2 separate beds. My only complaint with the rooms is that the beds and pillows are extremely hard for my liking but we were so tired that even if we were sleeping on concrete, we would have slept like a rock. The resort itself is beautiful and the beach no longer has the large "sand whales" and is breath taking. The restaurants were all wonderful and we never went away hungry from any of them. The drink service at the pool was wonderful and there were usually chairs to be found until around 10am. The only disappointment with the pools were that there are no stairs leading into any pool and they are not very large. One person in our party is disabled and they were only able to enter the pool 1 time during our 7 nights due to the difficulty of entering and exiting without stairs. It is also quite a long walk over the beach to the ocean for anyone with a disability. Our only other disappointment was that there was no chicken man at this resort. Previously, at a RIU in Jamaica, there was a gentleman grilling chicken everyday on the beach at noon for lunch and we were told this took place at all of the RIU resorts but RIU Mexico had never heard of this before. Again, this didn't break the vacation as we never went hungry. There is no disco on site but across the street at a sister resort. Just a bit of an inconvenience. There are not a lot of activities going on around the pool so it is very relaxing. The resort is welcoming and friendly. All staff that we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful and never rude or inconsiderate. I would recommend this resort to anyone that is looking to relax and have a great time. Thank you RIU for the great memories.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days at the resort. Very nice place geared toward adults, but with families there as well. More of a european feel to it. Employees were very helpful. There was a show every night and we were able to try different type meals every night also. We spent one rainy day visiting the other Riu resorts. We enjoyed this one the best. Many daytime actvities on the resort you could do as well, but we most enjoyed just sitting on the beach, 100 yards from our room. If you're looking for R&R, this is a good, affordable place for it!

Reviews.Title: “A great trip”
Reviews.Author: blackdoghill
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our 7-day trip to the Riu with a group of 20 family and friends. Very nice facilities. Check-in and check-out very smooth. Rooms might benefit from some updating, but with all the activities, we didn't really spend that much time in the room. From the front desk to the beach crew, staff very helpful and friendly. For an all-inclusive, the food was very good. Lots of choices at the buffet - including some interesting cheeses - and the other restaurants were very nice. All were very well run. Bars had some nice drink choices - hooray for not serving Corona! Lots of people running around, but never felt crowded or rushed. Enjoyed talking to people from Europe and South America. Shows were so-so, but eh, these filled the time before moving on to other things. Tennis courts were in good shape and well lit for playing after dark. Food in the Sports Bar was weak, but who goes to there to eat? (The correct answer seemed to be: drunks.) Nice to be able to explore the other Riu properties in the area. Also enjoyed the walk into Playa del Carmen. A great experience for all of us.

Reviews.Title: “RIU - Jan 10-17”
Reviews.Author: GoRavens4243
Reviews.Content: Overall this resort is very nice. We read reviews that trashed this place and I would totally disagree with them. The food was very good, the service was very good, the beach was awesome and the location is fantastic! Food - always so much to pick from at the buffet. The Krystal was excellent and we never had a problem making a reservation at the special restaurants. Rooms - were clean but they never seemed to mop / clean the floor. This was my biggest issue. The floors were filthy. We actually wore socks that would be black from the nasty floors. Beach - never had a problem getting a chair and we went at different times during the day. Pool - was noisy on the bar side but there is another half that was quite. My only other "complaint" would be that they need to either change out the walking tiles that lead from the pool to the main building or at least coat them with something gritty. After it would rain or just even slightly mist, the tiles would become like a sheet of ice. We slid several times and actually saw people fall. Older people or the handicap would really have a tough time with this. We resorted to walking in the grass to avoid falling. Overall, I liked this resort and would stay here again. They staff is not overly friendly but are very accommodating. It was a very safe location with a short walk to shopping.

Reviews.Title: “great trip once again!”
Reviews.Author: travelgs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexcio from Jan4-11. We have stayed here before in 2004 and once again we loved it! We went from Wed. to Wed. When we arrived we were met at check-in and given a cold drink. Check-in was very quick. Our room was not quite ready so they asked us to come back in 15 minutes. We changed into our bathing suits and went to check things out. It was just as we remembered, beautiful! A little while later we went to our room and it was ready, even had a towel animal holding a flower, hanging from the bedpost. Nice touch. The first day we left a note with $5.00 in the fridge, asking for lots of beer. Every day they made sure there were at least 10 beers. The room overlooked the court yard, right above the theatre. It is sort of loud but they quit at 11:00. The rooms are a little outdated but it was spotless. The person who cleaned our room did a great job, always leaving lots of towels and soap. Breakfast was great, omelette made to order, lots of bacon and mimosas. Our waiter at breakfast and the lunch buffet was Francisco. He is a good guy, hard worker. After breakfast we went to the theater to make reservations for the steakhouse. We did not have to wait in line at all. We made a 6:30 reservation for that night. It was very good. They serve a platter of seafood as an appetizer. The service was excellent. The rest of the time we went to the buffet at 8:30 for dinner. I must give mention to Rafael in the dining room. He always made a point of stopping at our table to ask how we were. Good food, great service from our dinner waiter, German. Homemade soup every day, big salad bar, we even had turkey one night. The beach is awesome, very big, lots of room and lots of chairs. We did not use the pool but it looked very nice. The resort is in a great location, close to Playa Del Carmen and Fifth Ave. We walked into town one day and one night. Did some shopping and sight seeing and then took a taxi back. It was only $7.00. Overall I would say this is still a beautiful resort and the service was excellent. The staff were all friendly and cheerful (except maybe Omar at the beach bar who sometimes seemed a little cranky). I would definitely stay here again. I can't wait to return and see what changes are made when they close for renovations in the fall of 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveler105
Reviews.Content: This is overall a very nice resort and we booked it for a reasonable price for a trip in early January 2012. I would recommend it and had an overall positive impression, but I probably wouldn't return. I'll explain why. On the positive side, the food was very good for an all-inclusive. I've been to about 7 different all-inclusives in Riviera Maya, and this one had some of the best overall food quality. The Brazilian, Japanese, and Steak House restaurants were all very good. The breakfast buffet was great - ask for "espresso" if you want stronger coffee (the regular coffee is weak). The grounds are beautiful with the fountains, palm trees, architecture of the buildings, etc. Our room was quite big with two full beds pushed together to form one huge bed that was bigger than a king. The mattress was comfortable. There's a separate seating area with a couch and TV. Our bathroom was big with a tub/shower and separate toilet area. Our fridge was always stocked with bottled water, beer, and soda. You have your own bottles of liquor on the wall which is really cool! The shows at night were actually very good and the dancers in the "Las Vegas" show were excellent. The "Mayan History" show was also very high quality. There was a band that would play in an open courtyard every night before the formal show at 9:45 pm. The staff and service was very good. There was free basic internet service near the front desk. We were within walking distance to downtown Playa del Carmen - it was about a 25 minute walk, or maybe 2-3 miles. There's also a little shopping area right across the street from the resort. The ocean at the beach has crystal blue water which is beautiful, no rocks, and very little seaweed. Now for the negatives - I found the pool area to be quite small for the size of this resort. It was very loud at the pool all day and there were no "quiet" areas like I've found at other resorts. The working crew at the pool try to make it fun but it was loud and obnoxious every day, like a spring break party (at the pool). The beach is very nice, but the chairs were always full very early. I found the resort's beach area to be quite small compared to other resorts I've been to. On the first day of our trip, we were not able to get chairs on the beach until after 3:00 in the afternoon. So for the rest of our trip, my husband would go down and save beach chairs with towels and shoes at 9:00 in the morning. Because everyone was packed so tightly on the beach, we were also very close to smokers, loud talkers, and other annoying people (topless) on the beach each day. I also found the drinks to be very weak, and a few times I had a pina colada that tasted like coconut water. Oh, and the maids start cleaning really early. There were mornings that we heard tons of noise as early as 7:00 in the morning. Another morning a worker was using a very loud drill in the hallway outside our room, and it was quite early. I would suggest bringing earplugs if you're a light sleeper. Don't get me wrong - it's a very nice resort and I feel positive about it overall. I suppose I've been spoiled because I like the resorts in Playa that are really, really big. I've stayed at the Valentin Imperial Maya, Moon Palace, and the Iberostar complex and they are huge - almost like a small city. I really prefer that because I don't feel confined. But if you don't mind a smaller resort with a really packed pool and beach area, then you will like it here. Oh last thing - I highly recommend tipping the staff at meals. We always gave $1-3 dollars per meal, depending on how much work the server had to do and how attentive they were. The people who work at these resorts make so little and they work so hard!

Reviews.Title: “100% luxury !”
Reviews.Author: Andrea S
Reviews.Content: I will keep this short and sweet, went to this hotel last year and it was the best I have every been to. Booked again for April this year and can't wait. We have stayed in a few different hotels in Mexico but not anymore the Riu palace is the one for us. We could not fault anything at this hotel from the reception staff on arrival, the rooms, the maids the waiters everyone treated you like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Andy P
Reviews.Content: 2nd two week holiday at this hotel. If you are wanting a quite hotel, then this is for you. Just a (safe) 20 minute walk into Playa Del Carmen if you fancy a change of scenery. Food and service are both fantastic. My only criticism would be the size of your balcony. I would go back there every year but sadly the missus likes a change.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Time at this resort will be back”
Reviews.Author: Nic080880
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time to this resort and will be going back again. I love this resort its a smaller resort. The staff are great they go above and beyond!!! Food was great always good selctions. We are hoping to get married next yr and are thinking we may pick the palace mexico.

Reviews.Title: “OK for couples, not so much for kids”
Reviews.Author: Casey_Brooklyn
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at Riu Palace Las Americas in Cancun and this year decided to check sister property in Rivera Maya. The stay this time was just OK. Here are the highs and lows of our stay. Highs -Room service is exceptional, all the way to the call 1 hours after check in to make sure that everything in the room is OK -Free Wi-Fi in the lobby -Non-motorized sports - you sign the waiver once at the start of your vacation, your plastic bracelet will get punched and you can rent equipment for the rest of your stay just by showing your bracelet and stating room number. Which is great, since my son didn't have to drag me over every time he wanted to get body board. -New Years buffet - DELISH - lobster grilled to perfection, every food we tried was yummy -Plenty of beach chairs at both pools and beach -Hammocks! and plenty of them -Cindy and Dideron for entertainment -Casino nights - that was a lot of fun and I haven't seen it at other resorts -Umbrella in each room -Safe that can fit laptop -Acess to other Riu properties including restaurants. Note that this is only if you stay at "Palace" hotels. So while I could get food at Riu Yucatan next door, noone from Riu Yucatan could eat at Palace. Lows -Key to the room is real key, not a key card. At checkout we were issued only 1 key and had to ask for 2nd. -Kids club/entertainment was not suitable for kids over 6 years. While my 8.5 yo son was able to participate in non-kids activities, collecting award certificates became problematic as those were handed out at 9.45 pm, when my son was asleep. -We arrived before 3 pm check-in. While we were checked in promptly, we were told to come back to get our room key after 3 pm. In other hotels, we would get key right away, but couldn't access the room earlier. -King size bed is really two beds moved together. Not fun if you are the one sleeping in the middle -I had a chance to walk around Riu Yucatan located next door. Even though Riu Yucatan considered lower class then Palace, the facilities at Yucatan was much more modern with better layout -Beverage Service (again comparing to what I saw at Riu Yucatan) - at Palace Mexico your options are either get drink of your choice at the bar, sit down at the beach restaurant or get one from the waiter walking around on the beach with limited selection of drinks. At Yucatan, you have all of the above mentioned choices, but there is also a self-serve area in one of the poolside restaurants, where you can get soft drinks, juices, beer, wine, tea and various coffee drinks without any wait. I found myself making a lot of trips to Yucatan for coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: nurse64pw
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful property! The food was great! From the buffets to the world class restaurants, amazing culinary treats. My only suggestion here would be 'more guacamole'. :) It was always freshly made, but as soon as it hit the buffet, it would be gone in about ten minutes. The service is outstanding. If by chance you needed anything, it would be at your door in a short time. The staff was always very attentive and friendly. We shall miss Ernesto, a wonderful bartender! The hotel and the grounds immaculate. What a feast for the eyes, and during the holidays it was impecably decorated...I felt like I was in Paris. However, there is always room for improvement, and mine would be the beds! There is some kind of plastic mattress cover which makes noise as you move and holds too much heat. Also the pillows were flat, nonfeather military issue...but thankfully after a full day of activities, we all slept well. The airconditioner worked wonderfully, we were on the top floor. Surprising too was the fact that the pool bar closed at 6pm. This made for a crowded piano bar at times, but in retrospect I am glad, because the noise level from the pool area was greatly diminished at nightfall. We were in the last building, nearest the pool, our walk to the main hotel was very pleasant, and romantic at night with the fountains and lights. All in all, a very good time, we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ThomasLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at the Palace Riviera Maya but just wanted a change,having read reviews on the Palace Mexico we decided to try and were not disappointed.It was more peaceful than the RPRM with a lovely beach area,the pool area was not as good as the RPRM still very nice though. The service really is very good all through the hotel and doesn't require tips as in other hotels we have stayed in,although if you decide to reward the tips are always great fully received and well deserved. The food in the restaurants is of a very high standard with a Mexican twist.I would agree with other reviewers re the slight hassle in having to make the reservation but this was only really noticeable when the hotel was busy.We enjoyed the Brazillian and Japenese,Krystals was okay and certainly worth trying. The cleanliness was exception and our maid did a great job of cleaning the room every day.We did receive an upgrade after I enquirerd how much it would cost to move,when asked why I just said the room we had overlooked the kitchen roof.The room in question was on the 2nd floor just over the entertainment area,if you went on the balcony there was a slight smell of cooking and a great view of a palm tree.I would add it wasn't a major problem but the way Riccardo handled it was in our view going above and beyond it made our holiday that much more enjoyable. I really cannot fault the whole hotel and yes as some reviewers have said if you look very hard you can find fault with some aspects of the appearance I certainly wouldn't call it tired though. This was our 6th visit to Mexico and 3rd to we would definitely return and would recommend try this hotel. If you would like any info please do not hesitate to ask

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: torontotwo_13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks at the beginning of December 2011. We found the hotel to be beautiful, well maintained, the rooms to be large and quiet. The beds were comfortable and room layout similiar to other Riu Palace hotels. The courtyard style to the hotel creates a nice feel to the grounds. The stand-outs at this hotel are really the staff: helpful, friendly and polite. The beach is a great a long white stretch great for long walks ( and you can walk to town along the water) , the water depth graduates slowly - so good for children and there is a very large palm tree shaded area for people who prefer to stay out the sun. The main negative for this hotel is that the pool is poorly designed. The food was excellent with a good variety . The hotel is a quiet one, middle age - and older clientel generally.We also went to the other (newer) palace down the street - it has a grander feel, a pool that is laid out better and what you'd expect at a higher end resort and a younger crowd . Walking to Playa del Carmen is about 30 mins. Playacar is a very safe feeling area with tourists walking the main street amongst the hotels and the residential area. We definately think that the Mayan Riveria is a great vacation area - with lots to do, and safe. This palace is a great safe, restfull resort.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Jackie B
Reviews.Content: From a Travel Consultant's perspective - Stayed from 28Nov -7nights. Arrival check in at 3pm smooth & efficient. Staffed by at least 6 persons. English spoken by all and very helpful front desk staff during entire stay. Room- garden view, booked and received. Hotel was at full occupancy no upgrades available. The superior courtyard view rooms are the same but with a much nicer view. Some jr. Suites have balconies which are high concrete so if sitting out on the balcony you're viewing the wall. If you enjoy sitting on the balcony upgrade to courtyard or suite. Beds are two doubles or king, step down to small sitting area which has a sofa. Did not use room service due to the view from the balcony. Older furniture, wc with separate toilet/bidet. Cleanliness - I've inspected 100's of hotels and this hotel receives the top award. Even the wc by the pool.beach were always spotless and dry. Restaurants - buffet excellent with a large variety to please any palet. No problems in getting a table for any of the meals. Dishes are replenished continusly so 5 out of 5. Service by waiters excellent and friendly. Coffee pots left on table at breakfast time..congratulations to the restaurant manager! A-la-carte: reservations required only same day and start at 8am. Lime -up does move fairly quickly. Steakhouse- 1 out of 5. Steaks tough,service poor as the restaurant is understaffed. 6 tables at one sitting. Didn't try the other a la carte as generally speaking I'm not a fan of the riu palaces a la carte restaurants, buffet meals are much better quality. For the record I do prefer a la carte, therefore if this is your preference I'd suggest another hotel. Entertainment-typical all inclusive calibre - not much to write about, dance numbers..I've seen better but I've seen worse id say 3 out of 5 Beach- excellent in all ways 5 out of 5. Plenty of beach lounge chairs no need to save, always plenty available. Nice to sit under palm trees or palapas, your choice. Pool- relatively small for this size resort but ok. Not a grand pool area but with a swim up bar and plenty of games. Bar service decent. The loungers immediately around the pool are saved but there's always space. Long beach for walking, Playa del Carmen is 35min leisure walk. Family- this is not a family resort for small children. Although there's a children's area not many children unless it's school break time. I'd suggest another resort. Gym-small indoors older machines Overall - I would say a 4 out of 5 ..management receives hi marks, hotel was freshly reprinted, rooms need an upgrade. I would return again for overall quality. As you are able to visit the other rip hotels,the Riu Yucatan is next door, Tequila across the street which has the disco, Playacar 2 hotels over and the newer Riu Palace Riviera Maya is 10min walk. The staff and service at the Riu Palace Mexico was much better. There's more palms then at Riviera maya but the building/rooms were nicer at the riviera maya. Weddings- did not witness any,which is unusual as destination weddings are extremely popular. There's a small chapel off of the lobby for very small weddings. For beach weddings I would only consider one location, but you wouldn't be able to see the water.

Reviews.Title: “Return trip”
Reviews.Author: Lancashirelass301
Reviews.Content: After 6 years we had decided to return to the Riu Palace Mexico. We were not disappointed. The last time we visited our holiday was interuppted by Hurricane Wilma - not a good experience. We were celebrating our 35th Wedding Anniversary so had decided to return to Mexico, as we love it so much there. The hotel staff made us very welcome and our room was the same standard as we had experienced before - excellent, although my husband had emailed before hand and asked for a room overlooking the patio rather than the fountains. Our room did indeed overlook the patio and was directly over the night entertainment area. This did not spoil our holiday really but I personally would have loved to have been further down overlooking the fountains. Having stayed at this hotel on two previous occasions, I personally did find it a little jaded this time. We did find out that the hotel is due to close in Autumn 2012 for 3 months for renovations. It is ready - the rooms need upgrading, the corridors are a little tatty and the pool area is definately in need of an upgrade. But none of this spoilt our holiday in the least. The staff are still just as friendly as ever, the food just as good and the beer/cocktails are still excellent, though having said that we did find that there was slightly less choice at the bars and the staffing levels were at times minimal. Would I go again? Perhaps, not sure at this stage, although I would be intrigued as to the renovations! Overall, we enjoyed our trip and perhaps we will return again at some point in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico Christmas/NYE Family Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbie85614
Reviews.Content: Still in PDC withdrawl... what a fantastic 2 week family vacation at RPM!! I've stayed with Riu before, but not at a Palace. In the future I will only stay at a Riu Palace!! This trip was with my 2 teens & myself. I requested (and got) an extra bed in our room - I was a little concerned that it was going to be an uncomfortable rollaway - NOT! In fact, I slept <well> on this "extra" bed. Tho not an Adults Only resort, there were very few children at the resort - most were well behaved tweens/teens with their families - small children (mostly) were also well behaved. Quite a few larger extended family groups (Christmas vacation) RPM does have a limited kids program - probably amped up for the holidays. I would go to another resort if you have kids (so they have other kids to play with). WOW - the other reviews apparently didn't go to the same resort we went to!! I found front desk staff to be quite pleasant & helpful. Our room 2134 was fantastic! Top floor - Overlooking fountains & even could see Caribbean over palm trees (there are no beach front rooms at RPM). AC only works when sliding glass door is closed. It's going to take some decent running & swimming to remove what I added from dining at RPM!!! We ate at all the ala cartes (some a couple times) and Don Julio buffet for bfast & dinner plus the pool buffet El Patio (& some other name) for lunch. Yes, a little slow in the morning capaccino delivery. I just get up early in the AM, so no problems making ala carte reservations - even with a full resort. Animation staff - Cindy, Aida, Freddy & Dedi were very lots of fun to play with - BINGO @4 was on the calendar for everyday (almost) - they ask you to participate if you want - all seem to truely enjoy guests & making things fun! I felt they really went out of their way to make sure people were having fun. Pool bartender Mundo **EXCELLENT SERVICE** with a friendly smile! Thank you! Wait staff around pool always ready to offer another drink. Drink service on beach limited to what was on the tray - I'd rather get up & order my own drink - plus get a LITTLE exercise!) Evening show at RPM was lame - we walked across the street to Riu Tequila which IMHO had a better show. Went into PDC several times - to CoCo BONGO & NYE - plus some daytime shopping. Never had a problem finding a chair around the pool or at the beach - sometimes we had to "pull" it to our desired location - very little "towel game" here. Ironically we also went to Riu Palace Riviera Maya where the pool "towel game" was in full play!! I did like the RPRM pool/beach set up a little better. Parasailed, jet skiied & did snorkeling excursion with Scuba Caribe (the water sports guys "associated" with Riu) - they are friendly and helpful in making suggestions that might work best with your group. Snorkeling was especially fun - followed sea turtle for awhile! My daughter painted ceramics & the guy at the booth tricked it out & sealed it overnight - nice touch! Also went to Coba wity Yucatreks - they are a great outside excursion company - book directly on line. Fun one day off property trip. An environmental beef - do you really need to serve a straw with every drink?? I thought that was a little wasteful. Riu staff did a great job keeping beach cleaned up, straightened up chairs every night.. raking sea weed... These guys work really hard! Resort is scheduled for some kind of rennovation this fall - hmmmm - well the couch in our room was well used, curtains a bit dated - but certainly fine with me. Yes, it would be nice if there were "walk in" steps to the pool (instead of the ladder). SAFETY SUGGESTION!!! The tile on the walkways, steps, etc are slippery!! Be careful!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money at a RIU”
Reviews.Author: RandyM8484
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to RIU Palace Mexico in December of 2011. Our experience was HORRIBLE! The staff was rude, the food was subpar and to top it off we had a hotel staff member burst into our room in the middle of the night claiming he was security. We transferred hotels the next day. We both feared for our safety here and could not believe how horribly managed the place was. The mini bar was not stocked, the king bed was two double beds pushed together made seperately, the tv didn't work, the air conditioning didn't work and the beach was a PUBLIC beach, not private. We were offered coke and weed within 10 minutes of being there. The RIU Palace Mexico is a COMPLETE disaster. Whatever you do, DO NOT stay here! Spend the extra money to go to a better resort. The RIU is unsafe, dirty, horrible customer service and a terrible experience. The hotel manager Katy Black was SUPER RUDE. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: 1JCLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked with Thomas Cook which proved to be a mistake as they apparently have a connection with Iberostar hotels and therefore as this is the Riu chain we had the worst rooms in the hotel. Thomson customers have the fountain facing rooms, so check before you travel. Travelling as a group with teenagers and an elderly mother we requested ground floor rooms close together. Our request was not passed on to the hotel by the Thomas Cook Nat West travel service and therefore we ended up on the 3rd floor with no lift access. At check in when we requested ground floor rooms the desk staff were far from helpful and one young lady was positively rude, smirking and showing a complete lack of concern at our circumstances. Worst ever check in experience! Tired from the long journey we finally accepted one ground floor room with one large bed, which was not exactly ideal for my mother, daughter and niece to share. Unfortunately the poor attitude of the staff was not restricted to the checkin desk. On the second day we were on the beach when the heavens opened and the only shelter was the beach restaurant. As they were not open for lunch they would not even allow anyone to enter the restaurant and sit down at the tables, making everyone huddle in a small area which was lashed with rain. After about 15 minutes we could return to the beach only for the heavens to open again 30 minutes later and this time even though it was 5 mins before opening the restaurant staff would still not allow us in. We experienced service issues in the beach restaurant, not only in obtaining drinks, but when 9 of us wanted to sit at a table they would only push together two tables and cram us around with the table legs in the way. Not exactly the treatment I would expect from a hotel of this standard. The only place in the hotel where you could get a decent coffee was the Lobby bar and unbelievably they had a shortage on tea spoons. We also had an incident with a waiter in this bar when we changed our mind and added some additional drinks, he rolled his eyes in annoyance. If you wanted a coffee at breakfast without sugar the waiters took 15 mins to produce half a cup as they had a problem with the cappuccino machine. Again always a shortage of teaspoons in this restaurant. The grounds are lovely and the rooms are huge but the view from our room was terrible, just some bushes and part of the neighbouring hotel buildings. The beach is beautiful and you can walk all the way to Playa del Carmen. The entertainment team were terrible. The family joined in a game of volleyball and my daughter was reduced to tears by one of the entertainment team shouting. No one explained the rules and following this experience no one in our group would attempt to join any further activities. As you walked along the beach all the other hotels had activities on the beach, with games and dancing etc., but at this hotel the option was volleyball, stretching or horseshoes. A once a week beach party lasted for exactly 45 minutes so get there quick or it will be gone and you are left with just the BBQ. The evening shows were poor and we ventured to the neighbouring Riu hotels for an atmosphere in the evening or into Playa del Carmen We went to Xel Ha for the day which was brilliant and also had a couple of evenings at Co Co Bongo which was excellent fun. We booked a trip with our Thomas Cook rep to Coba which she confirmed would leave at 8am and take 50 minutes to get there. It was brought forward to 7.20am and took over 2 hours to get there, which was totally unacceptable. Who wants to spend 4 hours on a coach! This trip was totally mis sold by the Thomas Cook rep, so beware. The water sports center on the beach was so unprofessional. We booked a snorkelling trip and they did not have enough masks. The equipement was very poor and not ready when we arrived and their main concern was gettting you to sign the Waiver. The boat was so noisey you had a severe headache before you got to the reef, but we did see a turtle which was fantastic. My advice would be to book one of the other hotels and if you choose one of the other Riu hotels stick with Thomson. The weather was great though!

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: jfkinoz
Reviews.Content: Here are some quick thoughts on our trip taken Dec 23 thru Dec 30th for a family of 5 (boys 18, 15, 13): * Overall...the experience was good b/c the weather was great. The resort did not feel cramped and the mix was definitely towards an older crowd (with families mixed in here and there). Other Riu's catered more to the younger crowds and were very busy...with more energy. * Food...plenty of choices. No awards though. Brekky buffet is probably the best. Dinner reservations are made between 8-10:30AM...but get there early as dinner at the better restaurants go quickly. Gentlemen must wear pants. In fact, this is a very well dressed set of guests. You can go more casual of course, but you can also feel free to step it up. * Service is inconsistent. Sometimes it was spot on. Other times, it was wanting. Other Riu's have soda dispensing stations so as to not have to rely on service members. This made everything slower than it could have been...especially in the more casual atmospheres. * Rooms are traditional, but tired in decor. Rooms were cleaned well with a turn-down service at night. JR Suites face out to adjacent hotel properties. Suites facing into courtyard would be very preferable as you can then enjoy people watching as the day winds down. * Room temperature was good. Mini-bar was well stocked with water, sodas, beer, and had access to liquor. * Bathrooms were decent size...needed more light. Tub shower...with mold...disappointing. Separate toilet with bidet. No fan. * No room or pool/beach internet access. Must go to lobby for access. * Grounds are beautiful and well maintained. The most impressive aspect of the resort. * Pool was good but not very big. Pool bar...water volleyball. Jacuzzi was without heat...just bubbles. Get to the pool early to get the best location...we got there at 7:30 to secure our spot. * You cannot see the beach/ocean from the pool or the hotel. The beach was good and clean. Lots of activities. * Location is 25-30 minute walk from Playa's 5th Avenue...or $7 cab ride. * Connect with an onsite travel reservationist quickly so as to book regional activities. My recommendation is Olympus and ask for Elizabeth. She gave us a straight advice on a number of activities by asking very good questions about what we wanted to accomplish as a family. I had high expectations which were not lived up to relative to value for money. With that said, we had a good trip and you could have done far worse. Not...we had friends stay at the Riu Maya Riviera. They had a very similar experience. In looking at the two, the Maya is a bit closer to town, a bit more updated in decor, bigger, and better facilities. It is also a bit more crowded, the food wasn't as good, and the service is was wanting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but security was lacking”
Reviews.Author: Debbie S
Reviews.Content: The week started off beautifully - the weather was perfect, beach was lovely, staff was accomodating, food was good - lots of choices for vegetarians. However, my nephew's iphone was stolen on day 3 (from a lounge chair next to the pool - stupidly left in the open) BUT my husband's Blackberry was stolen from our LOCKED ROOM on day 6. The hotel was very unresponsive and didn't even bother investigating our room until 18 hours after the fact.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Holiday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: gnat824
Reviews.Content: I went to this resort solo the week before Christmas and had a great time. The grounds and rooms are beautiful, the staff extremely attentive and the beach was all that I expected. I very much enjoyed the food and drinks, all pretty high quality. This was my first trip to an all inclusive so I really didn't know what to expected. Make sure you check out Krystal! The location is Playacar was also great. I loved that it was a gated resort community (with homes and condos in addition to large hotels) so I had no qualms about going out for a run or just exploring. You can also take a long walk down the beach to get to Playa del Carmen (or just take a cab but I thought the beach was a nicer route....) Not an ideal place for a solo traveler, though, as everyone was there with SOs or families. Also, my room was overlooking the central courtyard and over the main lounge, so there was entertainment going on every night. I was fine with being right in the heart of the action and they're good at cutting it off at 11 PM each night, but if you want to go to bed early, make sure you ask for a location that's a little farther out on each of the wings. The pool area also felt a bit smaller than some of the other resorts, but I preferred the beach anyway. Overall, I had a great, relaxing week, which is exactly what I was going for. I would definitely recommend this particular RUI and I briefly visited the Palace Riviera Maya (stunning lobby!) and the RUI Tequilla (right across the street), which both seemed pretty nice. All five Playacar RUIs are pretty close together and it really expands your options if you take advantage of the others. Would definitely recommend and there's a very good chance I'll be back to one of the Playacar RUIs in the future (although I might try something different to mix it up, not because I didn't love the Palace Mexico!).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and resort !”
Reviews.Author: Crozzer
Reviews.Content: “Riu Palace” Those two little words that tell me how much you love me ! An excellent choice of hotel for your stay in Playa del Carmen. Exceptionally clean and smart hotel with very friendly staff who went out of their way to serve you and make you feel special during your stay. This hotel will not disappoint, it is great. The rooms are large and comfortable with big firm beds, air con, optics and fridge and coffee machine, with free safe deposit box, steam iron & board, extra blankets and pillows, flat screen TV and sofa area. The sofa was a bit tired, however, and had seen better days. Tiled floors and well stocked bathroom with hairdryer & a good shower over the bath. Why do the Americans keep going on about lights in the shower ? Don’t they realise that leccy and water don’t mix ? It’s not rocket science is it and it’s not that dim – my advice - do things by touch and feel ! Towels are plentiful and replaced daily if required. Friendly and unobtrusive maid service with sheets changed frequently over our 2 week stay and nice towel art touches to welcome you back to your room. Reception team are very friendly and helpful and make a big thing of contacting all guests at the start of the holiday – notes and information delivered to your room on a frequent basis introducing themselves and letting you know what services they provide. Senior management all very visible and interactive with guests and introduced themselves personally during our stay which is a nice touch. Being Riu Class members doesn’t seem to bring much in the way of benefits even when you are approaching Diamond Class but the points will all add up for future stays. All inclusive at the Palace allows you to use all 5 Riu hotels in the resort for drinks, meals & facilities (except your evening meal) and even further a field in Cancun where we went exploring one day and popped in to the Riu Palace Las Americas for our lunch ! Meals at the Riu Palace Mexico are amazing, the choice in the buffet restaurant is huge – the first week you will try everything – by the second week you will be back to just tea and toast for breakfast as you will be stuffed. Just watch, however, as everything comes with added sugar in it, even pure fruit juices; and coffee lovers will do well to ask the waiters for “espresso” coffee from the machine rather than the stuff that is served from the flasks. They also like their salt in their food so no need to add more – taste first ! Food in the buffet was great – Beef Wellington, Duck, Prawns, Beef, Turkey, salads, cheese, pizza, pasta, choice is amazing and the ice cream is lovely too ! The themed speciality restaurants were all great quality and all well worth trying as they all provided excellent dining experiences – look out for Speedy Gonzales in the Brazillian and even if you don’t fancy Japanese do try it as it will surprise you in a good way ! Don’t understand the comments about problems with booking as this was by far the easiest and best resort for doing this, never a queue and always got what we wanted apart from one night in the Krystal but we were put top of the list for the following evening which was great service. Drinks improve as the day lengthens….the pool & beach bars serve good quality drinks but the alcohol content is minimal – which is probably just as well – the quality improves in the lobby bar and in the speciality restaurants during the evening and the service is superb – we didn’t even have to ask, Danny would remember our favourite tipples and ensure they were delivered to our table as soon as we appeared. The pool area is well maintained and clean – the pool itself was exceptionally clean and there were always plenty of loungers and parasols free. The grounds are immaculate although the tiles were very slippery when wet so care is needed when walking around the grounds after a shower of rain. This hotel has a European flavour to it – calm, quieter, relaxed, less noise and bustle with mainly European guests – its sister hotel the Riu Palace Riviera Maya – just ten minutes down the road, has a livelier edge to it. Bigger pool scene, more going on, animation, more American and Canadian orientated. As you can use all the Riu hotels you can take your pick and swap and change scenes as you feel like it, one of the great advantages of staying in the Riu chain at this resort. Hotel facilities are fine – decent gym (a bit small but ok) and spa with mix of cardio and weights and the staff are really helpful and accommodating of your needs. Free wi-fi access in the lobby and bar area for all your Pods & Pads which will easily fit in the safe while you’re not using them. Beach area is clean and tidy – nice relaxing hammock area, plenty of sun and shade to suit all tastes and water sport activities a plenty, lifeguards on duty and clearly marked flag system for safety. Top tips and advice from Crozzer: You can use American Dollars or Mexican Pesos throughout Mexico – with 20 Pesos to the British Pound – I would probably just opt for using the Peso as you seemed to be able to negotiate a slightly better deal when using the Mexican currency. There is an exit tax of £40 payable at the airport on departure or you can pay in Dollars or Pesos – put it in your passport at the beginning of the holiday ! Excursions and trips can be booked locally without any problems – haggle down the prices and get yourself a good deal – the Chichen Itza trip is a very long day but we did it for about £45 each which was good value. Coba is also worthwhile as you can still climb the pyramids there and get above the jungle canopy. If there are 4 or more of you the cheapest way of getting out and about is to hire a taxi for the day. Do visit a few Cenotes as they are fascinating for a swim and a welcome way to freshen up from the heat of the day. Over the road from the hotel there are shops and kiosks – even a Starbucks - where you can arrange your local tours – go and find Victor and haggle him down to around 40 to 50 pounds per trip per person per day. On departure they are strict on luggage weight limited to only 20KG so plan ahead if you want to buy things but they didn’t seem too bothered about weighing hand luggage so it wasn’t too much bother. Tipping is very much down to the individual and tends to be a culture thing – the Americans tip, the Europeans not as much – its not demanded or expected but appreciated when you do. Tip when the service you receive goes beyond your expectations. I wasn’t particularly bothered by Mozzies – only 2 bites in 2 weeks so no problems there even in the jungle ! It is rather humid though so I found some medicated talc very handy to keep my bits that rub from getting chapped and sore ! Shopping is good but don’t expect very cheap prices, they are not daft, but the quality of most things appears OK – lovely jewellery, silver wear and semi precious stones, good quality cotton shirts and leather boots, Mexican blankets and everyone wears a hat ! The resort is very safe and there is no problem walking into Playa del Carmen – about 3km from the hotel takes 25 minutes at a leisurely stroll – take a walk down 5th Avenue for all your shopping needs, souvenirs, cigars, silver wear, hats, sports wear, designer shops etc and enjoy. To sum up – a superb holiday and a lovely hotel – ranks right up there with the best of the Riu Palace hotels for comfort and service. Remember “Riu Palace” those two little words that tell me how much you love me…….see you in the Algarve in April…cheers Crozz !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Christmas escape.....”
Reviews.Author: bonnielass29
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one of the best holidays ever.....the Riu Palace Mexico has it all - great service, great food, and the best beach ever! I would highly recommend this resort - even the specialty restaurants that we ate in were amazing - we ate at Krystal, the Japanese restaurant and the South American - all were great. My new favourite drink is the caipirina! Immaculate room topped everything off. Even Starbucks is only 200m away, if you need a good strong coffee to get you going. Walked the beach to Playa del Carmen every day - 60 minutes round trip. Thanks Riu Palace!

Reviews.Title: “A breathe of fresh air”
Reviews.Author: crazycirce
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico for 5 days over Christmas and it was a wonderful experience. The rooms are clean, comfortable and roomy (I recommend 1129, second level faces the pool, close as you can get to beach). Mini bar in room features Bacardi, Smirnoff, Cuervo, some kind of brandy as well as Dos Equis for beer and a selection of pop and water restocked daily. The maid always seemed to know when we went to breakfast since our room was always clean by the time we returned. The staff is extremely friendly and hospitable always ready to help with a smile. They remember your face and typical drink after a few days. Upon arrival they give you a nice glass of punch while they check you in. I thoroughly enjoyed both the buffets, so much so that I only made reservations for one a la carte (normally I try to eat at as many as I can). Food was hot, had a good variety, plus theme nights. A good variety of liquor and non alcoholic options. The chocolate martini is to die for. The entertainment staff were a bit pushy, but given that I'm around their age I think they "bugged" me a bit more than others. That being said, they were very friendly especially Cindy and Diderot (who is the only blackjack dealer I've ever seen to hit on 18 at casino night). Great with kids, and hard working. I didn't watch many of the shows at night, but I did enjoy the music before and after from the band. I usually went over to the Riu Tequila across the street. If you stay here, you have access to ALL the Riu resorts in the area, including Cancun. Which is nice to be able to explore. I would definitely return here, and keep in mind they are closing for reno's and upgrades in August. Overall, GREAT EXPERIENCE!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Christmas Vacation”
Reviews.Author: SoccermomTN
Reviews.Content: We have stayed Riu resorts for the past 10 years and once again we were not dissapointed. Booked our trip thru Vacation Express and everything from the flight to check in was outstanding. The rooms were clean and the food was great. I think my children ate the entire vacation. We were in Playa Del Carmen during Christmas and the entire staff made us feel like we were at home. The evening shows were great. Our children thoroughly enjoyed the Mayan spectacular. Plan to stay again at Riu and thank you for making our Christmas holiday special!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Calgary-visitor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort for 6 nights beginning Nov.26, 2011. The Riu Palace Mexico is in Playacar and about 30-40 minute walk to the town of Playa del Carmen. The resort has beautifully maintained landscaping with fountains in the central courtyard. Our junior suite was very large with the TV and sofa down one step from the bed. Large closet space with mini bar and in-room safe. The one thing that we found very uncomfortable was the sofa - it was very low and we stacked pillows from the bed to sit on while we watched TV. The bathroom was also large with the toilet and bidet in a separate room with a sliding door. The bathtub area was very dark but otherwise a lovely bathroom. The resort is on an excellent beach. A thick row of trees separates the main buildings from the beach so there were many choices to lounge in the shade if you wanted out of the direct sun. We never had a problem getting beach chairs either around the pool or on the beach. We did go to water aerobics one day - the pool was on the "cool" side but we got used it after jumping around for a few minutes. I did not like that the pool has no wide steps gradually leading into the pool. Only access was by the vertical ladders which could pose a problem for mobility challenged people or children. I liked that the towel shack by the pool also had a small free library as I had already read the books I brought before arriving at this resort. We ate at 4 a la carte restaurants - Japanese, Fusion, Steakhouse and Brazilian. We had a very good meal at all 4 restaurants. We could only book the a la carte restaurants on the day we wanted the reservation. This was a bit inconvenient since we had to make sure we were there at 800am promptly when reservations opened. If we went at 830am most of the restaurants were already full for the early sitting (630pm). One piece of literature we received said that the reservations opened at 830am not 800am so it took a couple of days before we wised up. We walked into Playa del Carmen 2 times and also took the ferry to Cozumel from there once. This resort was very lovely and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: audiogalNewYork
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this hotel. The staff is great, the beach is lovely with both shady and sunny areas, the rooms are comfortable, and the food is OK. None of these types of all inclusive hotels have really good food. Once you accept that you can always have a satisfactory meal with lots of salad options, good simply grilled chicken or fish and very tasty ice cream ( the best dessert though cheesecake and carrot cake were pretty good too). There is plenty of alcohol. The sparkling wine from Spain is actually quite decent; I cannot comment on the other wine. I liked the Banana Martini too!! The specialty restaurants are nice for a change of pace, but beware the food is lousy. The rooms are very comfy. My one complaint is that the shower is dark. The tub is nice, but it is difficult to get in and out of if you are short. I always needed to grab onto the wall to get in or out. The maid service keeps the rooms spotless. I left a 2 dollar tip each day. I gave a 1 dollar tip at the bar for a round of drinks. Additionally I left the waiters at the buffet one dollar per person at meals. I have been to Playa del Carmen many times and since I am not interested in shopping I did not go on this trip. One block from the hotel there is a shopping Plaza that sells the basic tourist trinkets. There is also a car rental, Starbucks, pharmacy etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Resort - Great time!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugNH
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Riu Palace Mexico after enjoying our visits to the Riu Palace in Cancun a couple times. We've also stayed at the Riu Palace in the Bahamas (nice too). We booked thru Riu.com and got a great price including non-stop with Jet Blue and transfers. Arriving after about a 45 min.ride to this gated community, check in was a snap, received a refreshing drink and were told to come back at 2 when the room would be ready. We had lunch and walked around and by 2 were unpacked in our room. The room was the standard "suite" with 2 queen beds together. Firm but not as hard as we had feared. Sleeping was never a problem and we are spoiled with a great mattress at home. We had a 2nd floor with walled balcony (no real view but nice tree tops). Very clean rooms. Yes, a bit dated but lovely just the same. The grounds are awesome and the beach and pool had plenty of shade or sun, and getting a chair was never a problem. Food was above average for an all-inclusive. Like many have said, if you can't find something you like, something's wrong with you! I'm longing for a huge plate of fresh papaya I had each morning. Omelets made to order, smoothies, anything. The sausage etc. were not great so we learned to skip those calories. For dinner and lunch they would have a great selction of salad makings, pasta stations, etc. and plenty of choices for anything from tacos to soups (excellent tortilla soup!) . We tried the specialty restaurants and they were good and a nice change. Don't expect 5 star. Service was above average every where, from the swim up bar to the restaurants. They work hard so if you can, throw them a tip. We would tip at least a dollar with every drink, a few for lunch or dinners, at the specialty restaurants $10 or so. Tip - the coffee is fairly weak, so order a double expresso - after a couple days we would be served this automatically at breakfast - nice!. And when you want to drink, ask for their "best tequila" or your preferred vodka - while they don't have every top brand, they have a pretty good selection and will pour you whatever you want. It was fun to try the water aerobcs, volley ball and target practice - good way to meet people and you'll work off at least half a drink. Maybe. The evening entertainment we found better than we have seen in other resorts. They have a nice variety and it's so pretty sitting out under the stars with the resort all lit up, music playing, a drink in hand. The weather was nice - 82 during the day, 72 at night. Cannot beat that. It rained a bit while we were in Playa del Camen so we ducked into a place for lunch and by the time we were done so was the rain. Playa is fun and a short cab ride away, or you can walk the beach. We would recommend this resort for relaxation or to be as social as you want or any where in between. The Riu Palace Las Americas in Cancun is also very nice but the beach there does not compare.

Reviews.Title: “RPM worn out”
Reviews.Author: Wise2u
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Dec 9th- Dec 17th, it was our second trip to the RPM (the first was 2009). Many of the reviews before me are spot on with the details of the property. If this is your first trip to RPM you will likely be pleased, if you are a repeat guest you will be disappointed. The hotel is worn and will have a renovation next fall, I hope they do it right, and will look foward to reviews after their Dec 1st reopening. We liked the place well enough the first time to book it again (we stay very few places more than once or twice). We got an awesome price of $184 per night for the room, just a few bucks more than what they wanted for the Riu Yucatan next door. My wife's sister and husband were staying in a courtyard view room and we requested a room near them. They set us up in a room across the hall, it took them a few hours to get it clean, and when we first got in it the doors were open and the floor was slightly wet, sticky in places and slick as ice in others. It felt like the ac wasnt working so I asked for another room. The room they showed me was what I think we actually paid for....it was a smaller room with no step down to the couch area, had a chipped tub, and some non working lights. So there are more room types than courtyard or garden view. We were told these were our only two rooms available, that the hotel was full, and no new rooms were available untill the next day. (Personally I think many mexican AI hotels lie about available rooms, hoping you will take the crappy room they have clean and be too lazy to change rooms later.) We waited a couple of hours and the ac finally dried the floors and caught up enough to cool the room to a temperature we could sleep in. We had a view of the fence and backside of the hotel next door, so we kept the drapes closed most of the time. We had a leak from the ceiling because of the AC one night, which was promptly fixed. We also had a few bugs drawn to the water leak, which i stomped. Didnt see any afterwards. The couch in our room felt like elephants had used it as a trampoline....totally worn out, it felt like you were sitting 6 inches off the floor and was hard to get up from it after you sank in its worn out springs and cushions. The bed (2 pushed together to make a king) was comfortable enough, even though it was probably worn out too. Most Riu beds start out hard as rocks, the elephants must have softened it up for us. The tv was a small flat screen 32"?..but it did have HDMI jacks that allowed me to plug in my tablet and watch some concerts i recorded from youtube, instead of 3 stooges in spanish which translated surprisingly well. LOL We didnt care too much about the room, because we were only there to sleep, shower and change. As long as it has a good bed, AC, working TV and bathroom we are happy. We used my in-laws patio a couple of times for the view of the fountains, which was nice but not worth the extra $$$ in my opinion. Unless you get an extended period of rain you never sit in the room that long anyway. The whole hotel was looking as old as the majority of it's guests. so many tiles in the hallways were chipped or repaired they need to replace more than half of them. The tile walkways near the fountains get slick as ice when wet, this does not go well with the elderly clientelle, they need some tile with texture. The pools need to be drained and cleaned/ regrouted. They need plastic tables on the beach to keep drinks out of the sand. The other palace had plenty, as well as some pads for the beach chairs, RPM only had pads on the pool chairs. This trip beach service was plentiful, unless there was a wedding, I think they use the extra waiters to help for events because there was no beach service whenever a wedding was set up. Our last trip there there was plenty of pool service and practically no beach service. This time it was reversed. Now to my biggest gripe, the food and drink. I know it is a subjective subject and I am no foodie with 5star expectations. I am just comparing what we got this time to what we got on our previous stay. Last time they had Grey Goose vodka at the RPM and Absolute at the other Riu's...this time Absolute at the palace and Smirnoff at the others...this must have happened over a year ago because the menus had changed. The menus at all the Riu's still showed Havana Club Rums (a couple of kinds) even though none of their resorts have had this brand for a couple of months....Get new menus before you get rid of the brand!!...it just reminded me of what I was missing. (Havana Club was my favorite last stay) Last time they also had Classic 12 (aged canadian club) under the bar. It too was gone. The lobby bar had an annoying system of 1 guy taking your order, the bartender making it, and a random waiter/waitress delivering it to you....it made it hard to know who to tip and sometimes caused long delays in getting a drink....sometimes it was easier to go to the bar and get it yourself. The staff were all very good and mostly friendly, we saw many of the same faces from two years ago. It was one of the few things that had not changed for the worse. Free wifi in the lobby was a nice addition but was down for a couple of days, during which time we were told to go to the tequilla and use theirs...I think they should have made it available through the pay for use guy who always had a signal (for a price) Riu could have compensated him for thier slack....or they could have offered us the option of using our Riu class points to pay the guy, like we had to do last stay. Riu Class points= worthless. The food.....The buffet is still the best choice for variety, but had less choices than the last stay. Last time the theme nights were bigger and used the area by the main entrance as a cooking station for whatever food was featured. Last time we had a few upscale choices, beef wellington for example...this stay we had 1 memorable night with giant prawns and lots of seafood choices, I don't think it was coincidence that this was the dinner they handed out the satisfaction surveys afterwards. The next day they had the leftover shrimp and it was about the same choices. The food is better than the other Riu's and I think that is the main reason you pay more for the Palace....I'm just not sure it is worth the premium anymore. The buffet has about 3/4 the choices it did 2 years ago......They still have some of the best ice cream, the butter pecan tastes almost homemade. The entertainment was ok, but the music was geared to the 60+ crowd If you like Lawrence Welk and Benny Goodman this is your place...other than the piano guy in the lobby bar there was hardly any house music to be heard in the bars or near the pool. It might annoy the staff to listen to the same recorded Muzak, but even Mexican radio would have been better than the stuffy silence that was common. It felt like you should whisper in the lobby bar because it was most always quiet. We went across to Riu Tequilla a few times to listen to music and party after the RPM shut down for the night (usually around 11pm) There are no TV's in the public areas at RPM, we had to go to the sports bar at Tequilla to watch a football game, they also have a fridge there with sandwiches and snacks that you can take back to the room...The only option for after hours food at the RPM is room service, and the choices are fewer than they used to be. I wouldnt be surprised if they run across the road to tequilla and get your sandwich from the fridge in the sports bar...the other palace has a similar sports bar on property and has more amenities than the RPM. The landscaping was well maintained and looked as good as last time, the beach was nicer than last time since the "beach whales" are gone, there was hardly any seaweed this time, whereas last time they had crews raking and burying huge amounts of it. They had paint crews working on the outside of the buildings, but they were just looking busy. 1 guy scraping some of the loose stuff that was peeling everywhere and 10 guys painting. When they do the renovation they need 10 guys scraping or sandblasting all the loose stuff off first, then the paint job will last more than a few months.
