Bottom line is the service and staff are the best reason to stay at the RPM. The food and drink quality is being cut year after year. The furniture and buildings need the upcoming renovation. The manager said she has a wish list, but has no idea of what the Riu people in Spain have planned for the RPM. I hope they spend the money and make the effort to bring this place back to top of the line "palace" standards....otherwise it will show that Riu is not interested in competing with luxury brand resorts, and will remain a mid level AI chain with slightly better "palace" properties......unless the palaces are much better than the other Riu's there is no reason to pay the extra money. Might as well step up to Iberostar, Sandal's, Breezes, or the original mexican "palaces" (ie sunpalace, moonpalace, ect. ect.) These are my gripes and one of the reasons we dont stay at the same place twice (because properties usually get worse over time) Please don't let this review keep you from trying the RPM (expecially after the 12/12 reopening) It is a very nice property for the area, and if your a first time guest I would say you won't regret the choice....other reviews before me highlight the properties good points, and all in all we enjoyed our second stay there. That said, given the choice, until the renovation is over, I would stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya down the road...it is a newer and better laid out Palace. Oh, one last thing, we tried the little strip mall across from Riu Playacar and found it a wonderful change from the high pressure sales found on 5th ave. It is an easy walk from either palace. They have tons of stores and not a single shop owner pressured us or bothered us while we looked. It was like night and day from the sales people in town. I might have paid a little more, because I didn't bargain as long as I should have, but I didnt mind because of the lack of pressure from the shopkeepers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but did not meet expectations”
Reviews.Author: foghesino
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day stay at the Riu Palace Mexico 24-hour all-inclusive resort. I was there attending a wedding. As always, I decided to learn more about the property, ammenities and recommendations from other Trip Advisor reviewers. I found most of their comments spot on, and yet, I expected better food, newer accommodations and an overall "amazing" experience. Food was subpar and the room, although nicely cleaned and looked-after by staff, felt a bit "old" (for example, the layout of having a sunken living room is interesting, but not very handicap accessable or safe, if walking still wet from the pool/beach). Furnitute all around the hotel was not comfortable either (one exception was the courtyard chairs). Staff, specially those in the the entertainment and drinks division were extra nice and helpful. Some of the kitchen staff (serving in different sections of the buffets) were not (they simply seemed as if they hated it being there). Although I do not expect to have WiFi or internet everywhere (that makes it a great excuse to enjoy your time there more) the Riu Palace Hotel only has WiFi availble in the lobby area (and it was down for most of the time I was there). They have a couple of laptops available for a resonable price (40 pesos/hour I believe) but doesn't that defeat the purpose of an "all-inclusive"? Food at the speciality retaurants (e.g. steakhouse, japanese, etc.) was the worse: Overcoooked, poor presentation, bad quality, overpretentious. I would recommend the main buffet area (Don Julian) since at least you will find yourself with more choices. As a guest at Riu Palace Mexico, you have access to the other 4 properties near by (also called Riu) and their buffets (don't bother...the food selection is the same, but in less variety). As for the drinks at Riu Palace Mexico: My hats off to them. They have lots of selection (many high brands) and you can ask them to pour you as much or as little as you want (almost to the point of making your own drinks!). The only catch in regards to drinks (but it happens in other all-inclusives) is the size of the cup. If this truly bothers you, just bring your own drinking cup, they will happily serve you the same drinks in it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: coconutbeach24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico with a group of friends the week before Christmas. We had a great time, pretty much laid by the pool and on the beach. I recommend making dinner reservations for the themed restaurants, in my opinion the best food had was at those places, especially enjoyed the Japanese place (Miyagi). Mini bar in rooms are a nice perk, complete with 4 full bottles of liquor in the dispenser. Plenty of food options on the buffets, can't imagine anyone going hungry, and I'm a picky eater. I didn't think the food quality was stellar, but knowing how much we paid...we couldn't have eaten this well anywhere else for the price. Wide fruity drink selection, but not many beer options. Overall lots of liquor options, hard to imagine anyone going thirsty. Rooms were very clean, king size bed was huge, it looked like the size of 2 fulls or queens put together. The Riu palace Mexico is located in a gated community called "Playacar", there is no indication from the outside sign that Riu palace was inside, so I was confused at first as we passed private condos. Turns out there are 6 Riu properties located in this gated community and you have privileges at all of them with your Riu Mexico wristband. This was nice as there was a sports bar and discoteque at the Riu across the street from us. Resort clientele was a mix of families and older couples, some younger couples as well (age 20-40). Not a party atmosphere which is perfect for relaxation. Fitness center was fine, basic but served its purpose. Best Day Travel was the shuttle service we used, they were great to work with, hassle free and felt safe. Be careful at the airport for airport personnel imposters that try to lure you into using their service instead, Best Day's workers are in uniform and hold the Best Day logo sign. We booked our entire package through Bookit.com and Best Day is the shuttle service they must partner with.

Reviews.Title: “Great Palace, Wonderful Hospitality, Fabulous Service.”
Reviews.Author: svaldez5
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived the staff made us feel very welcome. They offered us two drinks while we were checking in. The front desk staff explained us really well all the services and the amenities we can find in this resort. We were so glad we booked this resort because with the bracelet you received you can go to any of the other five Riu Hotels in the area. Moreover, you can eat in these places breakfast and lunch or have snacks and use their facilities. The other hotel that can do this is the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We were so comfortable in our place that we just loved to be there. They have six restaurants. Four of these are specialty restaurants namely, Krystal, Miyagi (Japanese), La Bodega, and El Patio (Steak House). You have to make a reservation between 8:00 AM and 10:30 AM to go in the evening either at 6:30 PM or 8:30 PM. The other two restaurants are Don Julian where you can have breakfast, lunch and dinner and every day in the evening is a different cuisine; the other is La Traviata where you can eat snacks or lunch. El Patio also offers lunch. The food was good, with variety and plenty to eat. They also have five bars. The one by the pool (El Kiosko) you can seat while you swim. They have one by the beach (Bar La Playa) and the servers are constantly walking by the beach offering you all sort of drinks. This place is indeed all inclusive. One week for us was not enough, we were regretting why we did not book the place for at least ten days. Every evening at 8:00 PM they have a show for the kids with prizes, dances and songs. This is followed at 9:45 PM with quality shows for adults in the theater or in the courtyard. They offer a great SPA to do workout, massages, sauna and two whirlpools one hot and the other lukewarm. They also have another whirlpool by the main pool. They have free wi-fi in the lobby area or you can rent a computer to use the internet. The beach is beautiful and spacious where you can rent a jet ski or do some parasailing. They also have hammocks among the palm trees and they do a cook out once a week by the beach. Our room was comfortable and really clean. In fact they come several times during the day to do touch ups or some decorations with the towels or they may throw some petals to decorate. All these little things made us feel that the staff indeed cared for us. They also offer room service at no extra cost in case you may get hungry during the night. You find groups of people from many different countries, especially Germany, Canada, USA, and some other countries in Europe and South America. The great thing about this Palace is that everybody is welcome, and they value you as a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, except the room we had was not”
Reviews.Author: DFWTom
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake, this Riu is one of the best resorts we have ever stayed at. Wish we could have been there longer than the 8 days that we were. The food at the specialty restaurants, as well as at both of the buffets were the best we've ever had in Mexico. Heck, we even had a good steak a couple of times while there which was a first for us in Mexico. A wide variety of seafood that was top notch. Good brands of liquors, well made drinks, and always outstanding service with a smile. Always. Entertainment in the evenings were much better than we had ever experienced too. Even compared to some of the other Riu Palaces we have stayed at, this resort scores higher in our book on everything except the room. More on that later. They do require a dress code for men during the evening meal, even at the buffet. No sleeveless shirts or shorts. In many ways we appreciated this and didn't mind dressing up a little before leaving our room for the evenings. If guest didn't pack trousers, they have some that could be borrowed, so fellows bring some. This dress code is only for the evening meal, but shoes/sandals must be worn at any meal, even at the buffet by the beach. Yes, there was some topless women sunbathing in the lounge chairs off of the pool area. I did not see any at the edge of the pool or in the pool - and I was looking for it. The amount of topless sun bathers on the beach was about average for what we have experienced in Mexico in the past. Decor: Hey, its one of their Palace properties so you know it is decked out. Lots of marble and rich wood work throughout. Giant Christmas tree in the lobby. Besides the normal gift stores and desk in the main building, there is also a small Chapel in one corner of the lobby. Elevators on each end of the large lobby are handy to take luggage either up to the top floor, or down to the ground floor. The lobby bar is on the way the way to the double curved stairs leading down to the main Plaza. This lobby bar has a very pleasing 2-3 hours of piano music 5 nights a week. It was a real treat to watch the pianist's facial expressions and body language thanking the applause after each tune. We took advantage of the brand liquors available here for a quiet drink or two each evening before going down to dinner. The lobby bar is open from 10:AM to 7:AM. Why they bother to close for 3 hours is a mystery, but it makes for a good place to get drinks and good coffee during the night. There is a spiral stair leading to an open balcony on one side of the bar, but was closed off every time I was there. Coming down the double curved stairs you come to the main plaza dominated by a huge fountain. Here you will find the main buffet on one side and the theater (with it's own bar) on the other. The Brazillian, Fusion, and Japanese specialty restaurants are here on the ground floor of the main building. On the other side of the plaza is a raised stage area that had some form of live music, always different, each night right before and right after the nightly theater show. This plaza is also the area they had set up for Casino night and Mexican Market night. On Casino night they give you chips that can be used at several different types of gaming tables, then used to bid on items at the end of the evening. Market night is various vendors setting up tables and booths of over priced tourist stuff that you will also see in town, but without the verbal abuse from the vendors on 5th Ave. In the evenings drink service at the tables in the plaza is very fast. I do have to say though that I preferred the vodka tonic mix and the scotch straights from the lobby bar. This area is the gathering place for guest after dark, but usually gets pretty quiet after the dancing and live band is done playing. One night a little after 11:PM we heard a commotion on the other side of the large fountain and turned just in time to see a young man being thrown fully clothed into the water, with 40+ cooks crowded together in their chef's jackets and tall hats laughing and singing to him. We asked the waiter what was happening and he said it a Mexican tradition for the guy's birthday. I had no ideal they had so many people helping to prepare the evening meals. Grounds: Manicured, very visually appealing layout of the 100m long, center court-yard and walks along the fountains. Lit up at night, full of fountains, statues, and pools connecting them. I wasn't surprised at the number of people taking pictures and videos. Little harmless critters wondering around. Full of flowers, trees and bushes, many of them in bloom. Looking down on this from the double curved stairs of the main building is a site worth seeing. These fountains were not working the first two days of our stay. Bummer. The tile on these walkways can become very slick when wet as my wife's bottom found out after just the briefest of showers. Pool: Between the beach area and the fountains, the double sided pool provides a comfortable area to lounge and enjoy a drink from it's bar. Good drink service here too. Water was a little cool when you first got in, but not too bad. You either had to jump in from the side, or climb down a ladder as there were no steps leading into the pool. Both sides (one quiet and the other containing the swim up bar and volley ball area) are shallow and curved. Nice looking flower/plant mosaic incorporated into the bottom with small tiles. Both sides are fed fresh water from fountains on each side. The swim up bar also has water falling into the pool from giant clams overhead. Many of the day time activities take place here. In the towel shack building, there is also a small, free library. To one side is the Kids Club building and the Gym/Spa, on the other is the beach restaurant that serves a good noon buffet and pulls double duty as the specialty Steak House restaurant in the evenings. Actually, it is split up as two restaurants each with their own buffet, but since everyone goes from one to the other it is all the same place to me. Gym/Spa: Air conditioned with modern exercise equipment. Normal spa services provided at additional cost. Two large Jacuzzi tubs on the porch, one warm, the other nice and hot. Small his and hers sauna that they will have brought up to temp if you will give them advance notice of your wish to use them. Hot tubs can be used by both sexes at the same time, but saunas are strickly his and hers. Beach: Before you get to the beach, you walk through a large area of palm trees with loungers and hammocks. The beach bar is located in the middle of this area and there is almost always a waiter wondering around with a large tray of assorted drinks asking guest if they would like one. How much lazier can you get than to have a fresh drink brought to you before you even ask for one? One day during our stay they had a beach party at noon in this area with a live band, dancing, and a limited buffet with food cooked on the spot from a charcoal grill. To one side of this area is the dive shack that provide the normal water activities. There is also a hut on the edge of the tree line if you want a beach massage (at an additional cost). There are no shortage of loungers between the tree line and the shore, but I am unsure if drink service is provided here since, as with every beach in Mexico, it is a public area accessible by anyone. Very good swimming area with good sand under foot throughout. There is only a slight dip from the breaking waves as you wade out into the water. This beach area is raked cleaned every night and is a true joy to experience. Food: Very good buffet with a different theme each evening. A few times they had a kid come out of the kitchen wearing an apron with his guitar so that he a several of the waiters could sing happy birthday to someone. It was only later that we found out how they celebrate the kitchen help's birthdays. Main buffet offered a wide selection at all meals. The specialty restaurants were OK for a more formal dining experience, but felt the food (except the beef) was just as good at the buffet. At the Steak House, half of my sirloin was very good, half was over cooked. Every other steak I've had in Mexico was over cooked. On the evening we ate at the Steak House, there was a very pleasant sole sax playing in the other half of the building. This may have been for a wedding, but it was very pleasant. The Brazilian was OK, but nothing special. The Fusion (Krystal) was superb and well worth making a reservation at. Enjoyed an excellent steak one night and their lamb there on another night. We did not try the Japanese restaurant. Of the 8 all inclusives we have been at in Mexico, this one by far had the best food. Rooms: All rooms to my knowledge are accessed from interior corridors which provide additional security. Doors are locked with a key instead of an electric card that is more common these days. A lanyard is attached to the key if you want to wear it around your neck. Most rooms do not get a wi-fi signal, though I believe that the ones close to the main building can. Unlike some of the other Riu Palace resorts, the halls have no carpet and are tiled throughout. This helps cut down on wet carpet that can smell musty but makes for more noise outside of the room. There was an ice machine just around the corner from our room. Rooms face both ways - towards the central courtyard, or out towards neighboring resorts (the Viva Wynham Maya on the north wing, and the Riu Yucatan on the south wing). A few rooms face towards the pool and the palm trees at the end of each wing. Due to the large stand of palm trees between the pool and the beach, only a few of the rooms on the top floor will give you even a partial view of the ocean. All rooms have a balcony or patio. Some of the balcony's half walls are solid meaning you have to stand up to see down on the fountains or the ground. We liked the layout of the rooms for most part - on the ground floor facing the fountains. A separate door and hallway divided the bedroom and sitting area from the bathroom. Yes the shower is a bit dim with the curtain pulled across the opening but not to the point that it bothered us. Must say that we found it unusual to hear other people (via vents) talking and using their plumbing while in our bathroom. Even the bathroom had nice tile and wood work with corner molding on the ceilings. The step down sitting area has a dresser with a lamp and LCD TV on one side, a small, uncomfortable couch and table on the other side. We would have preferred a chair or two and some kind of light on the sitting side of the room. Our patio had two plastic chairs and a small table. There were plenty of hangers in the closet next to the bed. An electronic safe is located on the floor of the closet. Next to the closet was the bar, with it's 4 750ml bottles of spirits and the fridge with DosXX, water, cans of soft drinks, tonic and soda water. A counter area here contains the coffee maker, fixins and glasses. Supplies were restocked daily. Bed: Our bed consisted of two full size beds, each with their own bedding pushed together. We usually prefer a king-sized bed, but found we like this set up too. What we didn't like is how the mattresses were worn from people sitting on the edge. I slept fine on mine, but my wife's left her sore in the mornings when she got up. The pillows we had were totally worn out - flat and with no bounce left in them. We used 3 pillows each and it was like sleeping on folded up clothing. We could clearly hear people walking around in the room and corridor above our room. I am of the opinion that this room was an exception to the rule. However, it is what we experienced and as such is the sole reason for giving this resort 4 stars instead of 5. Other services: I enjoyed taking the hobby craft out a few times. 2 good tennis courts on the north side of the main building. There are 4 other Riu resorts that you can visit within a short distance of this one. A small shopping center is located a few minutes down the street. Bicycles can be rented at one of the other resorts. 24 hour sports bars with a number of T.V.s are located at the Tequila and at the other Palace. In short, this is a beautiful, elegant resort in paradise with some of the best food and entertainment that we have ever experienced. A number of guest we talked to from Europe, Canada, and the US return here time after time. It was the 10th trip to this resort for 2 couples we talked to that were from Holland - and they were staying for 4 weeks this time. However, the room noise we experienced, and the poor sleeping bed and pillows provided is unacceptable in this class of resort. Based on our experience I can not recommend room #0131 at this time, but I sure would recommend the resort for everything else. Keep in mind that in 2012 this Riu will be closed for several months as it under goes a major refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Wonderful Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Liverpoolaa
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my Husband from (28th Nov-12 Dec) The majority of staff were a credit to the Riu chain of hotels, Before we went my Husband emailed Reception & requested a top floor room, he also mentioned in the email that I would be celebrating my Birthday on the 5th of December. On arrival we were greeted with a cold drink and allocated room 2018 on the top floor, this was set back from the court yard. The room was lovely very spacious and the bed was massive. The view from the balcony wasn't up to much it overlooked another hotel with a walkway to the beach between the two hotels. (this didn't bother us as we weren't in the room a lot through out the day) The room was kept imaculate by the house keeper Jorge, as was the rest of the hotel by other hotel staff members. The landscaping of the court yard & grounds was really lovely & the beach was the best we had ever been to. We spent the morning of my Birthday both having a Swedish Massage on the beach (which I can highly reccomend!) Later on in the day we returned to our room to find that the house keeping staff had decorated our room with baloons streamers & confetti for my Birthday. They had even made me a Birthday cake out of towels which was left on our bed. We didn't try the speciality restaraunts as they were booked in two sittings, the first sittings we thought was a bit too early & the later sittings too late! The main restaurant was buffet & it was called the Don Julion you can have breakfast, dinner & your evening meal there. There is lot's of variety! The only negatives we had were that some times certain foods were luke warm, & on occasions the table cloths in the Don Julion were left stained, after other guests had used them. Then some members of staff would lay out clean crockery & cutlery on these tables! Riu Palace Management hand out forms on certain nights of the week for feed back on their Hotel, so I am sure any negatives will be turned into positives by Riu. All in all a lovely hotel which we would love to return to!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Palace”
Reviews.Author: NanuBucks
Reviews.Content: First impressions as we arrived WOW and it just got better. Room very comfortable and kept beautifully clean throughout our stay. The choice of food was mind boggling and the standard could not be faulted. The staff were extremely efficient and very friendly and willing to go the extra mile. Location absolutely fabulous. This is our 6th stay in a Riu hotel (in various locations) and we have enjoyed all of them but this hotel definitely rates as the best.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, good food, and awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at RIU Palace Mexico for 4 nights (Dec 8th-Dec 12th), and had a great experience. We were celebrating our 1st anniversary and were looking for a perfect place on the beach to the relax, and this RIU is just that!! When we arrived to the hotel we were greeted by the front desk with welcome drinks and a free room upgrade! The rooms were nice, and the bed was HUGE! We had a nice view of the courtyard, which I enjoyed. The food and service was great. Our favorite restaurant was the Japanese and then Fusion. Wasn’t a huge fan of the Steakhouse; it wasn’t terrible (just not as nice as the other specialty restaurants). The grounds of the hotel were clean, and the landscaping in the courtyard was very impressive. We both enjoyed the location of the hotel, and felt very safe. My favorite part was the location on the beach. It was only a 20 minute walk to the downtown area where you could take the ferry to Cozumel. The only negative comments we had, were the entertainment in the evening was pretty cheesy and we wish they had some nicer house wines. Overall, the RIU Palace Mexico is a great location for a winter getaway. We can’t wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Chuckreis
Reviews.Content: Spent December 3rd to December 8th at the resort with my wife and had a great time. The room was always clean and many days had flowers petals on the bed. The fridge was filled daily with beer and Pepsi. Showers were fine, with great water pressure and plenty of hot water. I also really liked the "massage" soap bars. Food at the resort was good. We ate at the Steak House on the first night and the Surf and Turf was great while my wife's steak was not so great. The rest of the time we ate at the buffet and always managed to find something to eat. While it sounds crazy the pizza is really good with some of the best crust I have ever had. Sure it is not "real" pizza but it is very good. Drinks were always good no matter which bar you went to. Service was for the most part excellent. Some hit or miss personnel at the front desk but almost everyone else was always nice and helpful. The grounds, beach and condition of the resort were not bad. It shows some age but overall I was impressed. The beach was clean, the sidewalks always swept, no trash and everything looked nice. The pool was not great, but we are not "get in the water" type people. For lounging it was great but if you like to float or swim it would probably be a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico--compared with Secrets Maroma”
Reviews.Author: DJNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed there Nov 29-Dec 6, and agree with almost all of the positive reviews, so won't repeat them. Especially noteworthy are the expansive beach, many lounges, great buffets, and beautiful grounds. We still consider Secrets Maroma the best in the area, so let's compare the Palace with it. First, overall appearance goes to the Riu. It has very attractive buildings and beautifully manicured grounds, whereas the first impression of Secrets is fort-like. Pools--goes to Secrets. We're not pool people but noticed at the RIU few people were actually in the pool. They lounged around but, perhaps, the water was too cool. We rarely saw anyone in a pool (except a few at the pool bar). The Riu pools could have been in any inland hotel--they were removed from the beach and far from the beachfront. Secrets' pools were more conducive and more occupied, even equipped with rafts. The pools looked out at the beach and sea in a beautiful setting. Plus, Secrets had a poolside snack area, grilling up burgers, steaks, and other goodies. Also, Secrets offers wandering food carts brewing up fajitas, tacos, and the like. Both resorts have restaurants near the pools--Riu has two buffets and Secrets a table service steak grill. Beaches--Two very different beaches. Secrets' beach is smaller, more intimate, and more closely integrated with the resort. The water was clearer, the sand was fine, and there were ample lounges and palapas. Bar service was frequent. The Riu beach is amazing in its expansiveness--you walk through the sand for about a block or so to the waterfront, where you are confronted with a vast array of lounges and several rows of palm trees--no palapas. The beach and palms are very impressive and beautiful, but the beach abuts that of the Riu next door, which adds another 500 roomsful of people competing for space and lounges. We always found a lounge near a tree (for some shade), but people coming down around 11 had trouble. We found, and may others commented on, how cloudy the water was, not at all like we've found over the past 15 years in the area--maybe it was the weather, which was sunny, but had a couple of days of wind and rough water. Rooms--both resorts kept the rooms spotlessly clean, but Secrets offers a much more luxurious setting--with four-poster bed, jacuzzi tub, and elaborate detail. Riu rooms are older and suffer from a few problems--poor lighting, especially in the bathroom; a tv set in fixed position that couldn't be rotated toward the bed; few amenities; and having two beds pushed together instead of a king-size. The refrigerator was well stocked and the Riu does have a wall bar of bottles of rum, tequila, brandy and vodka--nice idea! Overall the Riu room was quite nice, but lacked a WOW factor. Front desk--easily goes to Riu. We arrived early and the receptionist--Ildiko--at Riu was very helpful, showing us 4 rooms from which to choose and setting us up in one better than we expected. Front desk at Secrets was professional but not pleasant. Restaurants--you've already read reviews of the food. The specialty restaurants at Secrets offered higher quality food and you do not have to reserve in advance (a plus!). At Riu, one must arrange reservations each morning for that evening-for 6:30 or 8:30 only. Worth noting is the main buffet at Riu, which was almost always very good but especially on Monday night's Asian theme--where they had large woks filled with lobster tails, stone crab claws, roast duck, and lots of other goodies--not to be missed! We ate more meals in the Riu buffet than usual because it gave us better control of our time--and the food was so good. Overall, both resorts are very nice and we had a great time in both. Secrets is adults only and will cost you more and you can decide if it is worth it--you won;t go wrong at the Riu, either!

Reviews.Title: “Once Again Beautful & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: garyash
Reviews.Content: My wife & I celebrated our 27th wedding anniversary over Thanksgiving week.This was our second time staying at the Riu Palace Mexico. Both times the level of service throught out resort was outstanding. From the bartenders and wait staff to the houskeeping crew, the level of profesionalism was top notch. Upon out arrival we recieved our welcome drink and was told our room was not ready. At 3 p.m we returned and then we were escorted to our room. To our suprise, and even though the resort was at full capacity, we were up-graded for free to a courtyard mini-suite. The room was well appointed and very clean. The mini bar was stocked with an array of sodas, beer and bottled water. The liquor dispensor carried 4 different types of liquor, mostly top shelf. The resort and grounds are kept in an immaculate condition. The grounds crew works very hard and it shows. We have tried all the specialty resturants and the steak house is the best followed by the Asian resturant. The buffet is amazing. There are so many choices and the ones we tried were very tasty. The pool is very nice with a swim up bar and wait service around the pool area. But the best part is the beach. Tons of beach chairs, white sand and azure waters, a perfect recipe for relaxation. We spent all of our day time kicking back and enjoying the beach and ocean. On a side note, if you stay at one of the palace resorts in Playacar you can use all of the Riu resorts in the complex. On Thanksgiving day we went to the Riu Palace Riveria Maya to watch the Green Bay Packers beat the Detroit Lions in the sports bar. I wish I could remember the bartenders name but she made killer mojitos and her service with a smile made the afternoon all the more enjoyable. The Riu Palace Mexico is a beautiful resort, with good food and drink and occupying an awsome stretch of beach. A perfect recipe for a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All inclusive Resort”
Reviews.Author: PatricioT-Argentina
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife for 9 days from Nov 26th to Dec 4th, 2011 and we were amazed on the excellent service received. All the staff were in extreme friendly and helpful, specially the front desk employees. Food was very good in all restaurants, with many different choices everyday and good quality in every meal. The room was pretty big and always neat and tidy. The only issue we had is some candies and coins stolen from our room (?). I would suggest not leaving any important thing at the room out of the safety box just in case (Not that candies are important, but very displeassed with this issue). Anyways, I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “The place to go!”
Reviews.Author: travelobsessed03
Reviews.Content: I went on this trip with a friend from work as a prize won from work. It was recommended to us by a travel agent and we are so glad we listened to him! This is not my first all inclusive, but it was certainly the best one. Besides the property being so immaculate at all times, even though it is on the older side, the staff was incredible. You never sat down at a table without someone coming and making sure you were all set for drinks, your water glass was never under half full and they even opened your soda bottle and poured it for you! All with giant smiles on their faces. The food was your general buffet mix, but they had theme nights to switch things up - always so much to choose from. I think the best part of the trip (besides the sunshine and beach, of course) was the entertainment staff. There are activities almost every hour during the day, and many to choose from. Then, at night, there is a live band and dancing with that same staff which is followed by a show in the theater (i.e. Mamma Mia, Grease, Michael Jackson and others!). The staff, mostly Cindy, Fredy and Carlos made each day a blast! By the end I was just as sad to leave the people as the beach. For entertainment after 11pm (which pretty much ended at the RPM) you could go across the street to Riu Tequila where they have a club and the bars are always full until late (definitely a younger crowd over there). The resort is in a gated community and we always felt safe walking around there. You can also go into Playa Del Carmen - we went to the CocoBongo one night and Mandala another - they are both great, but you cannot miss out on the CocoBongo! If you want to go, ask some of the entertainment staff about getting there - they know what to do and they will help you have the best experience possible! One thing that I wish I knew before packing was how the amount of nicer (not formal, just dressy) clothes I should have brought. Also, it was "winter" and got a little nippy during some evenings (a brisk 68* F), so I recommend light dressy sweaters for the ladies. I can't say enough good things about the Resort, the staff and the whole area - if you're less of the party type, but still like the option to be - definitely stay at Riu Palace Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulouse!!”
Reviews.Author: dooneyWolverhampton
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two blissfull weeks at this wonderfull hotel, we were treated like royalty for the whole of our stay, i cant find a negative thing to say ,we did notice the slight musty smell that others have mentioned its not offensive and you really dont notice it after a day or so,the food was of a very high standard and,the restaurant staff were very attentive,the rooms are very spacious and spotless the whole hotel is imaculate, the entertainment was very good,the beach is beautifull, we walked to playa del carmen several times it takes about twenty minuets at a steady pace,we went on the jungle tour trip it was fantastic we had a private car and driver included for the day, he picked us up at 8 oclock and took us to Cancun to the venue we got to drive our own speed boat through the mangroves then on to the sea we then went snorkeling on the reef it was breathtaking, our driver collected us wen we got back and droppped us off at the Cancun palace for lunch(you get to eat at all the Riu hotels when you stay at the palace hotels) he took us around cancun later and to downtown cancun to the local market, that was an eye opener its not touristy just the local people!! we will certainly be going back to the hotel sometime, I believe they are closing for three months next year to renovate(August-October) If your thinking of booking dont let the negative comments put you off, i'm a really fussy person with a cleanliness obsession and like I said it was perfect....any questions please ask and ill answer them as best i can

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: mrserenity
Reviews.Content: Best hotel we have stayed in. Not one thing I can find to complain about. Return trip is coming soon.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: MaddyL
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico almost 10 years ago (when it was still called simply the Riu Palace). It was a great experience then and it is still a great experience. The quality of guest service is superlative - and that includes all the staff - front desk, housekeeping, Grounds, wait staff, bartenders, Animation team. All terrific. The property has been maintained extremely well - though the suites need some freshening (a complete rejuvenation is apparently coming in Summer 2012) the whole experience is still fantastic. The beaches are well maintained - lots of sun and shade depending on your preference. The buffet offers something for everyone. The bars still offer several premium brands - and the wait staff are eager to please. We tried 2 of the restaurants - the steakhouse and the fusion (Cristal). They were pleasant and the staff was most accomodating. Two suggestions - the food in the fusion restaurant was heavily salted - both the fish and the filet. Please ask the chef to put down the salt shaker. A good piece of fish or beef does not require heavy salting. Also, it would be nice to see a slightly better calibre of wine offered. I don't expect vintage but the table wines are not very good and there are better inexpensive wines out there to be offered. We stuck to the cava which is definitely quaffable. But these are minor issues at best. This is a lovely resort and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection again!”
Reviews.Author: MicheleL56
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our annual Thanksgiving trip to PDC. We again spent 6 nights at the Palace and another 5 at a resort in Akumal. I can't say enough good things about the staff at the Riu Palace Mexico...they are always so helpful and friendly. A special shoutout to Abraham at the beach restaurant and Katie Black the assistant manager....they went above and beyond to make our trip wonderful. Go, relax (remember you are in a different county) and have the time of your life!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort good location”
Reviews.Author: Linda P
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 12 vacationing in Nov 2011. The lobby was stunning. We were taken care of immediately however our rooms were not ready til 3:30 the earliest. They did their best to group us in same area. Also we were able to book our specialty restaurants for the week in advance.The rooms were nice ( I heard they are completely remodeling in the spring) except for the very hard beds. I requested a bed topper which was only 1" thick but it did help.All the specialty restaurants we good except the Brazilian. Everyone in our group complained about most of the meats. The beef was like shoe leather! The only other complaint from our group besides the quality of meat(at the buffet also) was the liquor. We have a few drinkers that drink top shelf whiskeys and they weren't available. Also the wines weren't to good. My husband is a picky red wine drinker. He knew this in advance so he packed a few bottles of his favorite wine.When he ran out mid week he went into town looking for a good Napa wine. We'll he found it at a $98 dollar per bottle price. He pays $22 in the States.As far as the staff, they were wonderful. The entertainment crew was fun and knew our group well by day 2, since we all participated. The shows were all enjoyable. The beach was perfect. The pool was nice, but stroll down to Riu Palace Riveria Maya to take a splash in there infinity pool or enjoy a drink in there swim up booths & bar. The location was great close to Playa Del Carmen where we did some shopping. Also recommend taking the ferry over to Cozumel.Ask the taxi driver to take you to Chankanaab beach you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great beach, good times ...”
Reviews.Author: Eric M
Reviews.Content: Overall, we had a great time and I would definitely consider going back to the RPM. If you're trying to figure out if this is right for you vs. other all inclusive resorts along the Riviera Maya, or if you want details or have specific questions, read on ... RESTAURANTS: All of the food was very good. Plenty of variety for breakfast and lunch on the buffets, with hot foods cooked to order as well. For breakfast Don Julian provides a vast variety of food. La Traviata has a more limited selection, but it is the breakfast option from 10:30 to noon, and was appreciated on the day we wanted to sleep in a bit later. For dinner we tried all of the options. A friend arrived a day earlier than we did and made a reservation for all of us at Krystal, the fusion cuisine restaurant, for the first night. It was excellent, with a some very unique (ecclectic?) and tasty dishes. The portions are appropriately sized--after a starter, first course, second course, and dessert, you'll be plenty full. Next we tried Miyagi, the Japanese restaurant. It was fine, but compared to all of the other dining options, it ranked last on our list. The sushi was more of the California-ized variety, and some of the dishes or accents didn't seem authentic Japanese. La Bodega provides a real nice array of grilled meats served tableside, and also has some interesting things on the salad and desert bar that you won't find elsewhere. This is located in a single room back in a corner and lacks windows. El Patio is a nice open air change of setting, near, but not right on, the beach. The service was very good as was the food. Finally, the buffet at Don Julian. It was always good with a large array. On Carribean night they had large crab claws, grilled lobster ... Another night included Beef Wellington, among many other dishes. I never counted, but I would guess they had twenty or so entrees each evening, along with plenty of sides, a huge cold bar ... We never tried the room service. The menu seemed limited and we just didn't have the desire or need. Ranking the restaurants, first would come Krystal. We liked it so much we went back for my wife's birthday on our last day at the resort. After that, El Patio probably edges out La Bodega. The Don Julian buffet overall is at the same level, but probably comes out higher on its best nights, lower on others. Finally, Miyagi comes in last. If I were at the resort for a full week again, I might go to Miyagi again, or I might skip it. ROOMS: I picked the RPM over several other options because all the rooms are junior suites (or bigger), with a small sitting area with a loveseat. If I'm going to stay somewhere for an extended period of time, I appreciate having a comfortable place to sit instead of having to read, write, etc. in bed. The RPM delivered in this regard. From the many pictures, you can see the decor is a bit ? Dated? Gaudy? No, not quite gaudy, but not as refined or stylish as some resorts. On the other hand, this is in the hotel that looks something like a Mexican palace, and is named as such. You're vacationing in Mexico, so go with it. That was my attitude with respect to the decor. Before arriving, looking at the pictures of the lobby, etc. I thought the place might be quite ostentatious. After seeing it in person, I would say it is just ostentatious. The Riu Palace Riviera Maya might still qualify as quite ostentatious. Now the bad ... Our first room wreaked of cigarette smoke. Housekeeping provided an air purifier, but after dinner the room still smelled. The front desk provided us a different room, which smelled much better. The next morning, however, I awoke to a strange sound, which turned out to be water dripping from the ceiling onto the arm of the couch in the sitting area. I moved the couch and put a towel down on the floor. Later I put down more towels, and housekeeping changed them as well. Hurricane Rina had just passed by, and I really didn't want to change rooms again. That night I asked the front desk if they could mop up the floor and clean up the water, which they did, and the room remained dry for the remainder of the trip. Water dripping from the ceiling sounds pretty bad, and it was a bit disturbing at first; but given the hurricane/tropical storm/tropical depression that had just drenched the place, I'm willing to cut the resort some slack. I'd still go back to the RPM. Some people have said the beds are too hard. I thought the bed was fine. (Others that have stayed at multiple resorts point out that all beds in Mexico seem to be on the high end of firm.) Our room was made up with the two double beds joined together as one giant bed. I never noticed the gap in the middle, so whatever cover they put on top worked well. BEACH: I had seen some Mayan Riviera beach pictures in which there were large errosion control mounds in the water, and I think they show up in some of the Google satellite images. And I was concerned that Hurricane Rina might take the beach away, as previous hurricanes had done. But my worries went away when we walked out to the playa. No mounds, no real garbage (some cups and straws from resorts guests, cleaned up at the end of the day), lots of nice sand and surf. It was a wonderful place to relax, and in the first week of November, there were plenty of empty chairs in the sun, in the partial shade, and in the total shade of the palm trees. In fact, this is one thing I particularly like about the RPM. At some of the other resorts, the hotel abuts right up to the beach. At the RPM, the hotel is set back a little bit. You might not think about this, but from a boat on the water, it is quite obvious. The result is that there is a nice buffer between the beach and the hotel, and more lounging options. All the resorts have chairs on the beach. The RPM also has rows of chairs in the palm trees, which get more dense closer to the resort. There is also an area with hammocks strung up between the trees. I enjoyed reading a book and falling asleep in one of the hammocks one afternoon. Given the hotel setback from the beach, you do have to walk and extra minute and half to get to the water compared to many of the other resorts, but I think this is a positive tradeoff. Also, one day they were grilling food close to the beach, and every day there were plenty of waiters delivering tropical beverages down to the water's edge. The beach is excellent. If I had to nitpick, the waiters could have a few more glasses of water instead of their other beverages, and the chairs could be a little easier to get into the flat position, but I'm really struggling here to find something negative about the beach. SCUBA: Scuba Caribe is an adequate dive operation, and was ideal for our needs. My wife and I did our classroom and pool dives stateside, so all we needed to complete our open water certification was four open water dives. We arranged to do this with Scuba Caribe, and were open water certified in two days. There are plenty of scuba operations in town, and some will save you $5 or $10 per dive, but by the time you take a cab and account for the convenience factor, you might as well stay at the resort dive operation. It was very easy to get up, have breakfast, go back to our room, put on our wetsuits, and walk down to the shop and gear up for the boat. Between the morning and afternoon, we easily enjoyed lunch and spent some time on the beach. That said, diving around PDC is nothing like diving Cozumel, and just getting on and off the boat at the beach is a bit of an adventure. There is no pier to walk down and hop on the boat. Instead, you gear up with everything except your tank and fins by the beach. The boat pulls up and a line is run from the boat to the shore. You then hand your fins to one of the dive shop helpers and walk and then swim/pull the line to the boat. Climb onto the boat, take off your BCD, then hook it up to the tank ... Getting back into the boat after a dive is done with your tank on. There are a few people around to help if you struggle with this, but you are more or less on your own. The return back to the resort after the dive is a bit like the departure. With gear on except tank, and fins in hand, jump off the boat and swim back to the beach. This is not a "full service" dive operator. One of our friends who is accustomed to a higher dive service level likened getting on to the boat to the evacuation of Dunkirk, and getting off to the storming of the beach at Normandy. Okay, it wasn't that bad, but you get the idea. For our four dives, we went to Jadines twice, Moxche, and Barracuda. Of those three, Barracuda was the best and most interesting. Perhaps some of the early morning deeper dives are better. If you want to dive Cozumel or the cenotes, you can arrange this with Scuba Caribe, but you won't be diving with the same people that operate the dives out of the resort. Given this, we arranged our later dives on our own. We dove off of Cozumel with www.divewithchristina.com. Cozumel has incredible diving, and divewithchristina.com is a more full service oriented dive operator. For one example of this, when you finish the dive, you take off your BCD and tank in the water, and they haul it up to the boat for you. We dove the Dos Ojos cenote with tankha.com. Tank-Ha is a bit more like Scuba Caribe in terms of level of service, but seemed to operate in the same manner as the other operators at Dos Ojos. SPECIAL OCCASIONS: We went to the RPM to celebrate my wife's birthday. I saw pictures on Trip Advisor of decorated rooms and told the front desk about my wife's birthday so they could decorate our room. They did decorate the room with flowers one day, but in fact it was two days before her birthday. A minor slip there I think, or maybe I wasn't totally clear? Also, they tried to deliver a plate of fruits and a birthday wish to the wrong room, where our friends were staying. We also made a reservation at the Krystal restaurant for her birthday. They did an outstanding job for the occasion. The table was decorated, a surprisingly delicious cake decorated, and mariachis sang. That made for a very nice celebratory evening. Good job and thanks to them!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negatives!”
Reviews.Author: Yve124
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a two week holiday at the RPM and we were more than happy with nearly everything! We have stayed in many hotels all over the world and I can be quite discerning. But I just don't understand the negative reviews that this hotel sometimes receives. If it is not to your liking then I suggest you pay even more for your holiday or do not go "all inclusive"!! The staff work very hard and there was continuous cleaning everywhere. The hotel and grounds were immaculate! Our room was nice and we had a view of the fountains. We would like to make a particular mention to Eliel in the Buffet restaurant who was always friendly, hard-working and made sure our glasses were filled. The staff in the Lobby and entertainment areas were particulary efficient too. The general service was excellent! We liked the sophisticated edge to the hotel. I agree with another review that the RPRM is a little more rowdy! The good thing about this hotel is that you can visit all the other Rius in the area. The food in general is pretty good. We always found something to eat and as my partner is quite a fussy eater the negative reviews are not to be believed. We had a lovely meal in the steakhouse and the flambe Baked Alaska was to die for!! Yes, we didn't find all the staff to be overly friendly but then not everybody is friendly by nature. But nobody was ever rude! If I have to be picky then the three things I would gripe about is that some of the waiters in the buffet restaurant are not very quick to get drinks for you. Another criticism was the miming at the entertainment shows. Surely some of the cast can sing? It would be more natural and entertaining if some of the songs were sung by the Riu staff themselves. The dancing is very good and we particularly enjoyed the Mexican show. The third thing is having to book the speciality restaurants early morning on the actual day that you want to go. If you are on a trip then you can't book! My daughter is at a Riu hotel in the Dominican Republic at the moment and they get three days to book these restaurants! Anyway RPM, thank you for a lovely holiday. We hope to come again. And to anyone reading this review - Go and ENJOY! It's a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Janine-Dion
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon at the Riu Palace Mexico. We had an awesome trip! This resort is beautiful and has everything you could want - beautiful beach, great food, amazing service. The hotel is very clean, the grounds are immaculate and the staff are so friendly. We even found several surprises in our room that were sent to acknowledge our honeymoon! We tried the Steakhouse and Krystal specialty restaurants; they were wonderful. The buffet was very good as well. For lunch we always went to the La Traviata beach restaurant where we would visit our new friend Abraham. We did check out the other Riu's in the area (go see the monkeys next door at the Yucatan!) but were definitely glad we chose the RPM, although the Riu Palace Riviera Maya is quite spectacular as well. It's a bit newer and grander, with a nicer pool and ocean view. However we still preferred the beach area at the RPM. It is very large and has a great beach bar. All in all, this is a fantastic resort. The service is what makes this place really stand out. If you want anything, just ask and you will get it. If you get a chance to stay here, do it, you won't be disappointed. We had a wonderful vacation and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: saparis
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a vacation for 9 days at the Riu Palace Mexico. The hotel is gorgeous and very clean, staff are extremely hospitable. The service at this hotel exceeded my expectations and well beyond. Staff are very friendly. Beach was beautiful, we had stayed down the road 2 years ago and the beach at the time was totally gone due to hurricanes that year but they have done a marvelous job bringing their white sandy beaches back! Food was great, even the Buffet restaurant always had great choices. Definitely will be returning to this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Week”
Reviews.Author: CDLVancouver
Reviews.Content: We and another couple stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico the week of Nov 5-12. We had chosen the RPM after having visited the resort 6 months prior while staying just down the beach at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We decided to stay at the RPM this time because it was closer to the other Riu’s, I liked the feel of the resort and the pool and beach area seemed just a bit better than the RPRM. Two weeks prior to arrival I emailed the resort requesting some room locations (close to the beach, upper floor, and to be close to our friends). Upon arrival we were informed of a nice upgrade to room 1053, and our friends were right beside us in 1054! Nice! We had also requested an ala carte reservation for that night and we were scheduled for the early sitting at the Brazillian Rodizio that evening. So here is our impression of the resort: Rooms The rooms were nice and fresh and conveniently located in the middle of the building closest to the beach. No water view, but the fountain/courtyard view was very nice. Room 1053 is actually on the second, or middle floor, and is located pretty much in the middle of that building. If we were to stay here again we’d again request this room. The room was cleaned nicely each day early afternoon, and the mini bar was restocked daily. Rooms are spacious enough with the little sitting area with LCD tv,a large balcony for early morning breakfasts, and a large enough bathroom. The shower is fantastic! If you like high water pressure in your shower, youll enjoy these. Get in, grab a hold, and turn it on. Also liked that they had installed those anti door slamming devices. Grounds/Facilities The grounds are nicely maintained and the fountains in the courtyard are very nice. The lobby area and inside lounges are also very nice. I heard that the piano lounge is open till 7 am but I could never fully test that out. Lots of top shelf drinks available but sadly they recently stopped stocking Havana Club :( We checked out the RIu Yucatan and the Riu Tequila and they were both nice. While visiting the Yucatan we found a group of about 10 howler monkeys in the trees (cool!) and while hanging out at the large pool at the Tequila we enjoyed all the Coati’s. We could easily access the free wifi in the lobby lounge, and could occasionally get it in the courtyard as well…reception was better the closer you were to the lobby. Evenings in the Courtyard The courtyard in the evenings is centre of activity on the resort in the evenings. It is perfectly sized so that everyone can be seated and enjoy the evening. Bands, theme nights, market nights, and generally just an enjoyable atmosphere can be found in the courtyard. Staff in the courtyard are without a doubt top-notch and deliver the best service. Activity pretty much ends at midnight, so a couple times we would head over to the club or the sports bar at the Riu Tequila, just across the street. Nice and convenient. Beach/Pool Being in Playacar, which had its beach restored last year, the beach is wonderful. We enjoyed that there are no palapas but rather palm trees to provide shade. There is plenty of space and loungers and finding a lounger at 10 am was no problem….but it did get busy by 11:30 or so. But loungers could still be had quite easily. Drink service was quite frequent…they come around with a large tray of various mixed blender type drinks and you pick and choose. I actually liked that approach as I tried many different drinks that I probably would not have otherwise tried before. We made the “sunrise” a staple on our walk down to the beach…try it youll like it. Beach bar opened at 10! Food This was the only thing that was disappointing. I think that I was just unlucky with my entrees at the ala cartes as everyone else in our group enjoyed their meals. It was nice to have bottle service at the ala cartes…go for the Chilean cab sauv its quite good. Steakhouse: The “filet” was actually a fast fry steak folded to make it appear thick like a filet. Overly salted as well. Not good at all. Krystal: The filet was weird…it was an actual filet but was like eating gristle…but when I looked at the steak each time it did not look like gristle. Weird. The ravioli appetizers were to die for though. Japanese: The tempura was very bad and it was a stretch to call it such, and any actual sushi involved under cooked almost crunchy rice. Least favourite as nothing appealed to me, except for the deep fried ice cream which was quite good. Brazilian: The only ala carte that I enjoyed. The cream of asparagus soup was most tasty! We had some very good meats served…but then when meat is served on a stick its always good! ;) Don Julio Buffet: There was always a wide selection of tasty food at the buffet and we all enjoyed the buffet…particularly enjoyed the beef wellington one night. In hindsight we should have done the buffets every night. For breakfast the offerings are vast and we particularly enjoyed the huge selection of smoothies available. Beach Buffet for Lunch: It filled the void but nothing spectacular. The two days they had the beach bbq we enjoyed burgers and grilled chicken. Too bad they didn’t have it every day as it was a nice convenient and tasty lunch. Also, there was a band playing during lunch on those bbq days and we really enjoyed the music. They should have that every day and have it on for longer too! Overall We all really enjoyed the RPM. The service was the best Ive experienced, the rooms were quite nice and well appointed and cleaned spotlessly, the beach area was fantastic, the pool was pretty good, all the staff were fantastic with an extra nod to the staff in the courtyard (Hiram and his crew!), and the proximity to town and the other Riu’s was great. Would we return to the RPM? You bet!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent first trip to Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew S
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to any part of Mexico and we couldn't have picked a better resort! Food and people were excellent. Check out a lot of our pictures at this link. http://razzi.me/albums/4912-mexico-riviera-maya

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful experience here”
Reviews.Author: oceanlover59
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico 11/12-11/19 2011. I had always wanted to try a RIU property. We've stayed at some of the other chains before and been quite happy. The service here is top notch they anticipate your next need even before you do!! I chose this because of the beach and was not disappointed, it is beautiful. The food was very good, no complaints. We ate at the buffet every night but one. The place is spotless I have never seen a place cleaned daily as thoroughly as they do. The staff there is wonderful. The only complaints I would have would be the beds they are not comfortable and they should invest in new ones. Also,you have a key to open your door instead of a card key and you kind of have to play around with it. Minor things in my opinion, go and have a great time. We would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Palace !!”
Reviews.Author: dallas-cheryl
Reviews.Content: This is our 8th all inclusive in 4 years........and this was the BEST resort we have stayed at by far!!! The Riu chain is just a step above to begin with but when you go to a Palace it is exactly what they say, a Palace. Everything from the grounds, to the food and especially the service. The Area: First time to the Mayan, but have stayed at Cancun before....very close to the same. Lots to do, lots of excursions. Maybe the only slight downfall is it is more commercialized then say Cuba or Dominican. It just depends what you want. We like both....the exclusiveness and quietness of Cuba (where we have stayed), but appreciate all there is to do and see in the Cancun/Mayan area. We did Xel-Ha....excellent!! Not sure if I like it better then Xplor but they are 2 different kinds of parks. Xel-ha there is more to see and is more of an relaxing sight seeing park with different activities. Xplor is geared towards adventure. Both are excellent and well worth their money! Also did the Coba Ruins tour. Very good as well. Lots of interesting things there about the Mayan culture. It was just an excellent trip with excellent friends!! Can't wait for the next one!

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful trip, an amazing wedding”
Reviews.Author: namenotavailable
Reviews.Content: I'd like to start by saying that I had read a lot of reviews on here, and spoke with several people who had been married (or been to weddings) at this hotel. That made me feel much better about my decision to wed here. first - arrival was good - very fast. the front desk staff were outstanding. automatic room upgrade was nice. rooms were nice, big and the service was great. room service menu was limited (only sandwiches, not too fabulous) but boy was it ever prompt. bar fridge was ALWAYS filled and if empty, one call had someone up within minutes! unreal. also - always had phone calls checking to make sure that we were happy and everything was ok. always a plus:) grounds - ok the grounds here are absolutely stunning, the main reason I picked this hotel. will upload pics when I have some. but my wedding shots, ok all shots, were fabulous. pool - well the pool is a little odd. very unlike the Riu chain. But the front desk told me this hotel is closing late Aug 2012 for 3 months for an update/reno. I have a strong feeling the pool will be redone. otherwise it was still lovely, nice swim up bar, just no steps leading in, only a ladder. there is a shallower and deeper area though, and there is also a quiet side (no swim up bar). beach - ok this was OUTSTANDING. need I say more? food - I (like many others in my group) found the food to be quite delicious. The buffet had something to please everyone (both main and beach lunch buffets). Tried a few a la cartes, the Krystal was nice, beach El Patio (had wedding dinner here) was beyond delicious, and the Japanese was ok. Didn't hit the Brazilian, but heard it wasn't all that great. alcohol - 24 hour bar was fabulous. again a little different than the other Riu's. the lobby bar is 24 hours (usually pretty dead) and there is no sports bar at this complex. because it's a pay for 1 pay at all deal though, if necessary you could always hit up another Riu or just call room service. note - they won't deliver to the lobby bar. yes... I tried. lol. wedding - a few days before my wedding I walked over to the other Riu Palace (10 mins away) for my wedding meeting. this was a breeze. back at the hotel you get a bill, which you easily pay at the front desk in your lobby. day of the wedding, flowers arrived in my room 1 hr before the ceremony for everyone, the gazebo was set up (GORGEOUS) and the wedding was flawless. the ceremony was in english (bonus!) and it was just wonderful. Then dinner at El Patio, which was also decorated and can I say the cake was DELICIOUS! and I'm not a big cake eater. vanilla with strawberry filling, sooooo fresh. amazing really! also my flowers were beyond gorgeous. it was all exactly what I wanted. and there was sooooo much champagne! (if anyone has any questions, please feel free to email me) So I will definitely return and recommend this hotel to any bride, or anyone for that matter. A wonderful vacation, an amazing wedding spent in paradise with the most attentive and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “The most FANTASTIC Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 5 days there, and we enjoyed every second. From the moment we walked in to the second we left, the service was wonderful, the food was plentiful and delicious, the grounds were well maintained and everything ran smoothly. We will be visiting again soon! You will not be disappointed if you stay here..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service......amazing resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Loonychick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIu Palace Mexico from November 12-19th 2011. When we arrived at the resort we were welcomed with a delicious drink while we were checking in...which went smoothly. We received our room key and towel cards and were told exactly where our rooms were. (We were a group of four). We had rooms 1097 and 1103 which were on the same level as the lobby just past where the outdoor courtyard is (they were both facing the back of the resort towards Cancun, but the nice thing was it was quiet with no one being able to see into your room). Location was perfect for us. I will say too that there is a musty smell in the lobby as others have said, so I was expecting it, but honestly that smell was limited to the lobby area and you did tend to get used to it. Definately didn't ruin the vacation by any means. We were welcomed with a cute towel animal and flowers on our bed...usually every day we got something new. It was always cool to see what they would leave for us each day. The room was immaculate and a great size. We are used to a king size bed at home but my husband joked that he had to text me to see if I was up in the morning. This bed is huge, and although being pretty firm...we both slept well. No complaints there at all. The grounds are kept immaculate as well. I would get up every morning around 6:30 to take pictures and there were alot of staff out and about cleaning and literally scrubbing the walkways, railings etc. The beach is absolutely stunning! It is huge and the vast amount of palm trees was really nice. We took advantage of the hammocks one day and had a siesta on the beach...who wouldn't enjoy that? The service is bar none, the best service we have ever received at any all inclusive we have ever gone to. They wouldn't even let our coasters get wet without coming around and changing them for us. They would come and ask if we wanted another drink if we were only 1/3 done...so you're glass is literally never empty. And I am a sucker for a nice tropical drink in the proper glass and they did not dissappoint in the lobby bar. Always with a piece of fruit in it too. Just a personal preference but I enjoyed it. Everyone there from the cleaning staff, to the groundskeepers, to the waiters and waitresses to the people at the front desk and the front door were always smiling and extremely friendly. And I have read some comments from people that the staff are always looking for tips. I found the opposite to be true. We tend to tip for every round of drinks because, lets face it they all work so hard there so that WE can have a great time. We found that sometimes we would try to give some waiters a tip and they would almost run off like they didn't want the tip. We certainly never felt like it was expected but with the amazing service that we received how could you not tip? Everyone was always saying Hola and have a nice day. I was amazed at how many staff members speak extremely good english at this resort...but I also enjoyed trying to speak spanish. Also wanted to mention that we didn't find the pool was cold as some have stated. We were actually quite happy with the temperature. On the beach it was a nice touch when the waiters would come by with a tray of assorted drinks and ask if you would like to try one. Once again service was amazing. We didn't even pull out our insulated drink cups the whole time we were there because our drinks were replenished so quickly. I honestly cannot say a bad word about this resort. The food was fantastic...and as I have said in previous reviews...I am a very picky eater. And for those who say they couldn't find something to eat here or if they got bored of the food, I can't imagine the feasts you must enjoy at home! There was literally something for everyone. We went to the Brazillian (La Bodega) Ala Carte and it was fantastic. The service again was incredible and we had a lot of fun with the waiters that night. We also went to the Steak Ala Carte and it was equally delicious and they certainly like to keep the champagne flowing. The bonus for me was to be able to check out all the other RIU resorts. I got up every morning and walked by myself to these resorts. Being in a gated community like Playacar, I felt extremely safe doing this. There was always people on the beach or on the cobblestone roads outside the resorts. For those considering the other RIU Palace (Riviera Maya): We did walk there on our way into Playa Del Carmen and enjoyed their breakfast buffet one morning (their bacon was better than ours haha) but other than that it was pretty much the same as the RPM. We also walked there via the beach one day (15 minute walk) and spent the afternoon in the Infinity pool, which we did enjoy. Their pool is also nicer than the one at our resort. The nice thing was, we could visit these resorts and then go back to our resort which was definately quieter, especially at night. I thought we had the best of both worlds. For those considering the RIU Palace Mexico...do not listen to the negative reviews as stated by other people. If you can find anything seriously wrong with this resort than you are looking too hard. Enjoy the experience and kick back and have a great vacation. You will not be dissappointed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average... nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: MexicoLuvinHillbilly
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August and was a little disappointed in several areas of this resort. Room: The rooms wase nice and clean, but dated. This resort is starting to show its age and they need to touch it up a bit. Shower was nice and large though. No water issues or plumping either. Food and bars: Food was average at best and we actually had better food at the Tuquila and the Playacar. The food certainly did not feel like any upgrade to the 2 prior mentioned. Service was spotted at best too. Some days were great, and some days it totally sucked. Pool bar was barely acceptable for service and the pool cafe service was horrible. The main buffet at night was good for breakfast and dinner. Abraham was wonderful! He was what everyone should be like. Pool and beach: Beach was large and shaded, but we are not beach people. Now the pool...... small cramped and not much activities going on. The design is a total flop. Bar service sucked and lack of communication with two diff. bartenders. Not much personality either, unlike the Maya Riviera Palace. Also, tons of kids and families. Saw many reviews that said mainly couples. B.S., kids galore! Ruined our privacy and they felt like they were on top of us all the time. Actually the other palace kicks this palace's butt. We spent more time at the other palace than the mexico palace. Don't quite get these reviews here, but no way in heck this place touches the Maya Riviera Palace. All in all I would not waste my money on this palace that looks the part, but does not feel the part. I regret not picking the Maya Riviera or simply saving my money and picking the Tuquila for a lot less and better time. Note: not many Americans here. You might feel out of place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sedonico
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the Riu Palace Mexico (11/9 to 11/16). I was with a group of 15 people ranging in ages from 30 to 67, and everyone in the group was happy with the hotel. The best part of the hotel is how beautiful the grounds are. I loved walking around the fountains in the courtyard, and the palm tree filled beach was very pretty. The food was good- I always found something that I liked to eat. However, the buffets can get repetitive, so definitely take advantage of the specialty restaurants. The rooms are a good size, and feel very comfortable and clean. The shower had great water pressure and plenty of hot water. I only saw a few of the shows, but the ones I saw I enjoyed a lot. A couple areas of improvement are the front desk and room service. Sometimes the front desk was extremely efficient and helpful, and at other times they were not at all helpful and I ended up being frustrated. It very much seemed to depend on who was working at the front desk. Room service was a huge disappointment. I was excited that room service was included in this resort, but the food was no where near as good as the food available at the buffets or restaurants. But overall, I really loved this hotel, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it, or to return there for another vacation.

Reviews.Title: “"Fantastic staff, handy location"”
Reviews.Author: Dewclaw34
Reviews.Content: Our stay was 7th to 21st November 2011. We were aparty of six, three couples aged 45 to 55. Having been to Mexico before, plus Cuba and Dominican Republic in similar 5 star all inclusive resorts, we are well qualified to comment on the Riu Palace. The Hotel is well presented inside and out. The maintenance staff are continually cleaning, repainting and maintaining the decor inside and out. Other reviewers have referred to a "mildew" smell which was present in the rooms but was not unpleasant, just something that you got used to. We only had one technical complaint when the air con temporarily went on the blink, which was quickly put right. To be fair the evening temperatures at the time of our visit meant the air con was not really required, the ceiling fan was adequate. We were surprised to find spirit optics in the room as well as the usual minibar. There were five spirits; Brandy, Vodka, Tequila and Bacardi. I presume they would swap these out if you're tipple was not included. The minibar contained bottled beer, cans of mixers, bottled water in large and small sizes. The rooms have a 22inch Sony Bravia flat screen TV. This was strangely glued in position for viewing from the seating area rather than from bed!! The pool will not suit length swimming types as it is small and shallow (1.4m max) The staff that serve the pool area are attentive and efficient, the plastic glasses though do not give the beer a good taste, but understandable foe H&S reasons. The bingo at 4pm was painful, if you win you are subjected to public humiliation by way of having to do a "sexy dance" Fine if you are hammered, not good if you aren't! The beach has a shady palm tree area and a full sun bit for the tanning freaks. At the time of our visit getting a bed was no problem if you were up and about before 10am. Reservation by towel at silly o'clock was not the norm as in some hotels. The a la carte restaurants were all good, bookings can only be made on the day you want to eat. Only one of the restaurants allows shorts - Le Patio Steakhouse. This policy includes the buffet restaurant which is unusual in my experience and caused me problems not packing enough long pants. To be fair you are made aware of this at every opportunity and it is rigidly enforced. This rule is the cause of much heartache on my holidays, women can walk in with cut off jeans, sports shorts etc teenagers can walk in with baseball caps on - but I can't get in with dress shorts on!!! crazy. The Cubano bar in the lobby is lavishly decorated but is a bit austere and lacks atmosphere, guest pianists, flautists and violinists ply their trade if that is what you enjoy. During the frequent downpours on our visit, there was not enough undercover areas to sit and drink. This leads to people in wet swimwear using seating used by guests in evening wear and could be one of the reasons for the "mildew" effect.
