Playa Del Carmen is a 140 MXP taxi ride away if you get stir crazy. You can walk it in about 20 mins. A Corona in Playa Del Carmen is about 40 MXP. Don't believe the Travel Agent hype about US Dollars not being accepted anymore, the dollar is still king and most shops and bars still post USD prices. The best thing about the hotel is it's staff. They are polite, efficient and seem genuinely aware that they rely on our trade for their livelyhood. Your drinks are topped up sharpish without any need to go looking. The food was amazing and at least as good as the Bahia Principe chain. Entertainment was not my scene but seemed to please the majority. Once you have seen one Michael Jackson impersonator and a Grease musical - you've seen them all! The gold "Palace" bracelet gets you into all the other Riu hotels for drinks, but their Red bracelets doesn't get them into yours - a bit of one upmanship if you have an ego.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time! Ignore the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: lolapops
Reviews.Content: We returned from our Honeymoon in Mexico on Sunday and we had an amazing time in this hotel. We arrived on the wednesday and check in was quick and to the point, a welcome drink was given which was delicious! Staff on check in desk very courteous and answered all our questions. The room we had was large and spacious - 2 queen size beds pushed together, a sitting area, bathroom and a large balcony. All very clean too, and the mini bar was a welcome addition. Our balcony overlooked the main courtyard area which was nice, and it was lovely to sit up there at night and listen to the band after the entertainment. The beach at the hotel is amazing! It was very clean, and plenty of shade provided by the trees. A waiter also came round with trays of various drinks so you didn't even need to get up off your sunbed, which was really nice! The sea is quite clear once you swam out a bit. The pool was not as big as I expected - this was a bit of a down point for us, and we quite like swimming around - it's set up in a odd way, it's kidney shaped, but cuts off in the middle and there is no slope to get it, just steps. One side where the pool bar is located it quite shallow and the other half is deeper for swimming. Again, plenty of sunbeds and waiter service. Food - the food was amazing! We did eat in all the restuarants apart from the Japanese. The fusion was 'unusual'. Starters were not very nice, but the main course and desert were quite good. The steakhouse and brazillian were very nice. Buffet was good, plenty to choose from, but did become a bit repetetive after 10 days. There could have bit a little more choice, but what was provided was plentiful and of a good quality. Same goes for the drinks - if you wanted branded spirits you have to ask for them or they give you the cheap stuff. The entertainment at night was quite good - some of the shows were a little bit naff but some were fab! The Mayan show at night was really good. One night there was a marichaci band and dancing which was really good. Every night before it started there was a band or a singer on, which we enjoyed. Casino night was quite a laugh and and the same for the games they did on mexican night. Staff were pleasant and courteous, and went out of their way to help you. To walk into 5th avenue from the Hotel takes about 20 minutes, and is a pleasant walk. We booked all our trips there, and they were half the price of what the tour operator was charging so we were pleasantly suprised! There is a little shopping centre over the road, but it is a little more expensive than 5th avenue - don't bother going in the silver shop, I saw a necklace I like, but they wanted £400 for it, whcih I thought was a little expensive. Coba and Tulum are worth a visit, we really enjoyed this, and also swimming with the Dolphins was amazing! All in all, we had an amazing time - ignore the bad reviews!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good, a little bad”
Reviews.Author: Alicia N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the 12 nov to the 19th. Our first impression was that the hotel is beautiful. It looks just like the pictures. We got there at around 1 and check in wasn't till 3. They had us leave our luggage in the lobby, where everyone had acess. That worried me a litile because anyone could have claimed our bag was theirs, but in the end nothing was missing when we came back. Check in at 3 was quick and easy, but when we got to our room the maid was still cleaning it...she didn' speak english so it was uncomfortable trying to explain to her to just let us drop off our bags and she could finish...not sure if it was done before she left....oh well. The room was nice. It was big, with the 2 beds pushed together. There is a mildew smell, but you get used to it pretty quickly. Fully stocked bar was refilled every time they cleaned the room. We did have a urine smell on one side of our bed that never went away...it was gross. I think someone actaully urinated on the edge of the bed...which would be a smell that was hard to get out...we were again too uncomfortable to complain. This would be unique to just our room though, as it was definately only one particular area in the room that smelled that way. Hint, if you run the air conditioner while you are gone it will help with the smell and the humidity. It was way more comfortable in the room when we figured that out. The urine smell made one of the two beds pretty much un useable, so between that and the noise, sleep was not easy. (2 adults on one full size bed) I am sure we could have requested a room change, but we don't like to complain. I suggest if this is something that could ruin your vacation, make sure you request a change. Our room was 103...on the basement floor. We had a lot of foot traffice going by our room in the middle of the night...they were drunk and loud. But that isn't the hotel's fault. We were near a popular stair case, so maybe try getting a room that is farther away from all the atcivies and major walk ways. The beach was amazing! Very beautiful! It was not easy getting a drink while you were on it...too many people to serve i guess. but there is a bar on the way where you can get one to bring with you. There were people who had insulated mugs/cups that they would just have filled. That was a good idea. Pool was nice too. No complaints, and swim up bar was pretty cool. Buffet food was lacking. Lots of fried food. We preferred the breakfast. You could always find something you could eat...but i just expected a 4 star hotel to have more quality food. The soft serve ice cream (or frozen yogurt?) machine at the lunch buffets near the beach were the best dessert they had...everything else tasted funny. Though the oreo cheescake did actually taste like good cheesecake. We had a few meals at mexican restaurants outside the hotel and wished they had that same quality at the hotel. The dinner restaurants were awesome! It is worth the reservations process. If you want a early time at a particualr restaurant, you want to get to the counter before 9. If you are not picky, you can go later and get something. We favored the brazillian fusion...lots of good meat. The french was new for us, but very good (krystal). The steak at the seak house was good quality, though I ordered medium and got well done while my husband ordered the same and his was cooked correctly. It seemed to me that the steak house was more focused on sea food, so if you like sea food, you will ike this. We only did one night of the actual hotel entertainment. Casino and then Mr Riu contest were very fun! Casino is free and you use your winings for an auction of prizes later. Mr. riu was hilarious! Over all a very nice hotel. Staff was very nice and helpful. They make them wear full on suits while they are running around trying to get everyone drinks...they work really hard and deserve tips. They were fun and really wanted to help you...did not feel at all like they were annoyed with any of our requests. We are not too into getting drunk, but you definately can here, just order strong drinks and hang out. They will make it however you like. So, rooms could be better do to smells and the double bed thing. Buffet food is not amazing, but lots of choices, you will not starve. Everything else was abive my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service with the most perfect beach!”
Reviews.Author: Saria213
Reviews.Content: Just got back 2 days ago from our week-long stay at the Riu Palace Mexico, and boy do I wish I was still there! We had one of the best weeks of our lives! Let's start with the basics: we are a young couple, 26 and 28, who are very laid back but kind of finicky about food. I am in the service industry, and we both know what we're looking for when it comes to quality of service. We're also well-travelled for being a young couple, and I'm a stickler for a place with good reviews. That being said, I did my research for a good week or two before deciding on this resort. In general, the reviews stated that it was a gorgeous, well-kept resort with decent food, great service, and a gorgeous beach. Here's our personal take... We booked with Apple Vacations which was very easy and offered a great deal. It was also nice to be able to put down a deposit to hold the reservation and pay the rest within about a month. Apple offers round trip transfers from the airport and I will say to anyone staying in the Playacar complex (the complex of resorts the RPM is located in) DO NOT pay for the "Riu Shuttle" they offer. They group their shuttles based on location when you're waiting outside the airport, so you're most likely ending up on a shuttle that is going solely to the Playacar complex anyway. Our shuttle had us, a group of 2 couples staying at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya (which we visited and I'll comment on later) who stated they paid extra for a direct transfer (so they were dropped off first), and 2 women who were going to the Sandos Playacar. The shuttle only took about 40 minutes or so, we dropped the group of 4 at the RPRM and were at the RPM about 3 minutes later. Upon arrival we were greeted at the door by Manuel, with whom we became fast friends. He is wonderful, helpful, extremely friendly and kind. He always got us a taxi when needed and high-fived us every time we saw him. Check-in was a breeze, very fast, welcome drinks were given to us, and they explained the whole deal with the resort: towel cards for your beach/pool towels, key to the room, gold Palace wristband (which is surprisingly not uncomfortable, I hardly noticed it was there!). The bellhops were summoned to get our luggage, and the 2 men just glanced up and then continued their conversation. We didn't mind, as we only had 2 rolling suitcases, so we found our way to our room (although I'm sure some people would have been rightfully peeved at this). We were in room 1129, a basic junior suite on the same floor as the lobby, which is the 2nd floor. I had emailed prior to arrival asking for a 2nd or 3rd floor room, so obviously they were able to accommodate. The rooms are spacious and very clean. Some state that they seem dated, but we just found them as having festive Mexican ambience. Our balcony overlooked the pool area as our room was the second to last in the building. We quite liked the location, as it was a nice view as well as convenient coming back from the beach or pool. The mini bar was stocked with soda, Dos XX, and water, and was always restocked every day or so. We were big on bringing those bottles of Pepsi with us in the afternoon! There are also liquor dispensers above the mini fridge, Smirnoff vodka, Bacardi silver rum, brandy, and Jose Cuervo of course. Surprisingly, we never used them, although that's probably because we spent very little time in our room. The bathrooms have a bidet and a toilet, a tub/shower that doesn't have a light (we showered with the curtain open to remedy this), a hair dryer, the usuals. The bed is 2 full beds pulled together and they are quite firm, however neither was a problem for us. They can provide you with a mattress pad if you'd prefer. After seeing our room and walking around the resort, we were amazed at how gorgeous it is. The resort is having renovations done next year, August through November I believe, and we were both saying how if the resort looks this nice now it must look absolutely amazing once they're done! It is by far the cleanest resort I've seen, they are constantly working on upkeep and tidiness. The beach is absolutely stunning. The water is bright blue and clear when you're in it, although it was quite "rough", for lack of a better term, for the first 2 or 3 days of our trip, so the waves kicked up a lot of sand and seaweed that remained throughout the week. The water temperature is perfect, not too warm or cold. We made sure to go in every day. The sand is beautiful, white and always clean. We usually didn't have a problem finding beach chairs, however during the end of our stay the hotel must have been at capacity because we were finding it harder and harder to get chairs later in the afternoon. While swimming we left our cellphones and camera at our chairs and never had any problems with anything disappearing. Included is the use of snorkel equipment, boogie boards, catamarans, etc. We used the snorkel masks several times, but didn't see much since the water was quite active like I mentioned before. The water activity workers will come around to try to sell you on excursions, a polite no will usually do the trick. The pool is nice but chilly! We only went in twice, once for the pool bar and once just to swim. If you jump in after getting hot while laying in the sun it's nice and refreshing but still a little chilly. The service overall was fantastic. Tips are not required but appreciated. We actually saw very little tipping while there. The bartenders will get to know you and will remember what you're drinking. We had great service at the beach bar, pool bar, lobby bar, you name it. Hiran was our favorite! He is amazing, one of the hardest workers I've ever seen. Quite frequently we saw him in his suit walking along the beach with the drink waiter, a bottle of liquor in hand adding more to people's drinks! He is truly amazing! Beach service is spotty, especially on certain days, but we didn't mind having to get up to get a drink. The drinks themselves were good. Small cups and sometimes weak, but you can always ask for it to be stronger! And if you bring a larger cup they'll gladly fill it for you. If you like bananas (which I LOVE) try the Dirty Monkey! It was my favorite. I also liked the piña coladas and the Bananamama. The food, overall, was alright. We only did one ala carte, Rodizio, the Brazilian restaurant, and we would not reccommend it. Most of the meats were not very good, and having been to some amazing Brazilian steakhouses it's quite a letdown. We did not have a problem getting a reservation though, and the line was never long. The buffets were good, individual foods are hit or miss of course. Our favorite was Don Julian, the main buffet. Very large, lots of choices. Breakfast was great. Smoothie station, make your own mimosas, omelettes, eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, waffles, French toast, potatoes, muffins, bread, the works! My favorite meal of the day by far. The dinner at this buffet had theme nights (Mexican, Asian, Italian, etc.) but still always had something for everyone. Great salad bar, great fresh fruit (if you spot some Proscuitto out try some with the melon!), great bread, crepe station for dessert, it was very nice. The service at Don Julian is great as well. They're quick to refill your drinks and clear your plates as you finish. For lunch we tried the buffets at La Traviata and El Patio (which becomes the steakhouse ala carte a dinner) and they were alright. Nothing special but still adequate. The entertainment staff is a lot of fun. My boyfriend played beach volleyball every day, twice on most days, we played bingo at the pool bar and both won (I won a visor, bandana, and a huge shot of tequila haha, he won a bottle of tequila and a huge shot of Southern Comfort), and we also went to Casino Night, which was quite fun. All play money of course, but they give you chips and you can play either black jack or roulette. Since we're young the entertainment staff really took a liking to us and tried to get us to come out to town with them on numerous occasions but we were just too beat from the sun and activities of the day. If you get the chance, go with them! They're a load of fun and super nice! They really try hard to get people involved. We ventured across the street to the Riu Tequila on our first or second night to check out the sports bar. It's quite large and has some video games and such, but it was empty so we didn't stay long. They do show some NFL games for anyone needing a football fix, and I was told they were showing a boxing match that many people asked for. On our last afternoon we went down to check out the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. This resort is newer than the RPM. The lobby is, like the RPM, gorgeous, and contains a nice little jewelry shop. The hotel itself is set up quite similar to the RPM, and when we exited the doors into the courtyard I got dejavu. Their buffet is also to the left, theater to the right, gazebo in the center, fountains in the center with palm trees lining both sides. I will say that the RPRM's pool is AWESOME. It blows the RPMs pool out of the water haha. Larger and just more gorgeous. Lounge "chairs" in the water? Check! It also seemed warmer. The beach looked slightly smaller and not as nice, just my opinion. I think next time we would still stay at the RPM but visit the RM for a swim! Unless the renovations come through and build a similar pool, which would be fantastic! We also ventured onto 5th Avenue about 6 times or so. We stopped at Pez Vela (I think that's what it's called), a bar that has swings (swings!) at the bar top. Their chef salad was amazing! Great piña colada too. For those Americans like my boyfriend who are craving American beer, they have it here! We came often so he could get his fill of Bud Light. We also ate at La Parrilla, a restaurant on 5th. It was very good, his steak was flavorful and perfectly cooked, and I got these skirt steak and chorizo kabobs that were fantastic. So good we came back again for the same thing! Regarding being haggled and bothered on 5th Ave, yes we were, and quite frequently. The store owners are constantly trying to get you into their shops, we were offered marijuana every time we were there and even offered cocaine once. We found the best thing to do is just ignore them and avoid eye contact! I pretend like I don't speak English or Spanish! ;) Overall, the RPM was worth every penny. It's clean, has a great friendly staff, and has the most gorgeous beach I have ever seen so far! Even though the food wasn't amazing we were not deterred. You're in paradise, nothing should spoil your mood with the quality of service you'll be receiving and the gorgeous sights you'll be feasting your eyes on! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant holiday again”
Reviews.Author: michael p
Reviews.Content: Miguel+Kate Aberdeen UK If you are looking for a place to relax totally and be waited on hand and foot the RPM is just such a place.We stayed for two weeks this October,a party of four,ages from15 to 87 and all thoroughly enjoyed it. My wife and I stayed here two years ago as a special treat for our fortieth wedding anniversary. We liked it so much that we had to return,and we intend to come back next year all being well. If you want to relax at the pool or on the beach you will enjoy the tranquil setting. If you like to be active the entertainment staff will provide plenty of fun and games in a very friendly spirit to pass the day. They are very hard working as are all the hotel staff and continue entertaining till around 10 PM. The evening shows in the theatre are a bit samey,but there again it's not Las Vegas although they are very enjoyable especially the Mexican culture shows. We see in some other reviews complaints about the food.We found plenty of variety and always well cooked,for example beef steaks arrived exactly as ordered,no language problems. Omelettes made with all the trimmings in around 30 seconds. For a day out my favorite excursion is on the FAT CAT catamaran from Puerto Adventura. Party boat trip with plenty of drinks and a packed lunch with a snorkel swim in a shallow area with a coral reef where we saw a turtle,stingray and barracuda etc. swimming just below us. Back to the hotel,this is not a Club hotel and if you are looking to party-party all day and night you might find this hotel too quiet for you. If you like peaceful polite refinement without being stuffy this is the place. Any faults that cropped up were dealt with by reception very quickly e.g.on arrival the air conditioning in our room was noisy,my wife who has very good hearing thought that sleep would be impossible,I phoned the desk and went for dinner.When we returned it had been fixed to perfection with absolutely no inconvenience. One little drawback,the atmosphere when we were there was very humid and although there are clothes drying facilities on the balcony our smalls were still damp after days hanging out and never dried completly.the other option was the laundry open monday to friday. We really loved being at this hotel and can hardly wait to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: ltritz
Reviews.Content: Travel dates 11/5 – 11/12. We arrived at the Cancun airport early in the morning, briefly waited for our transportation and arrived at the RIU Mexico Palace around 10:00 a.m. Our bags were taken by a very friendly staff member with a big smile who took us to the front desk. The lobby was quite impressive and clean. We were told by the man at the front desk that our room would not be ready until 3:00 p.m. He informed us that we would have room #52. After reading prior reviews, I asked if we could have the 2nd or 3rd floor. He didn’t seem too happy but said he would see what he could do. We were directed to a changing room where we could change clothes and begin to enjoy the amenities. We were not greeting with a ‘welcome drink’ as some other guests described in their reviews. I actually thought the man at the front desk was cold and impersonal. After hanging out at the beach we decided to check back in at the front desk around 1:00 p.m. and at the slight chance our room would be ready. We were then told that ‘we were one of the lucky ones’ and that our room was ready. We were taken to room #1143 on the 2nd floor. We were given two keys, so I’m not sure why other reviews mentioned they only got one. The room is average, but clean. Toiletries were supplied, stocked mini bar (Vodka, Run, Tequila, Scotch, water, soda and beer). The bed was 2 doubles pushed together but it wasn’t an issue. There was a balcony, but unfortunately we had a high wall and if you were sitting in the chairs, you could not see over it and enjoy the courtyard view. Towels were always provided as well as the restocking of the mini bar. We always left a couple dollars for house keeping, since they always did a good job. A couple of ‘towel animals’ were left for us which was a nice little surprise. We did not experience a nightly turn down service. It is a little noisy. The folks upstairs got up between 6:00 a.m. and 6:30 a.m. everyday and it sounded like they were tap dancing and rolling marbles on the floor. We were actually told by a visiting travel agent that we were on the ‘renovated side’, which if facing the beach, is on the left. To be honest I wouldn’t have wanted to stay on the ‘un-renovated side’. Beach is beautiful and clean. Clear turquoise water, small waves not enough to knock you down. Plenty of chairs and palm trees, you don’t have to be there at 8:00 a.m. to get a spot. The pool was ice cold. Chairs around the pool seem to go quickly. Not sure why since hardly anyone was in the water. We are beach people, so we didn’t spend much time at the pool. There is a bar for the pool and one for the beach. They also come around and serve drinks to you at both. The playmakers would come around and announce what was going on, so you had the option to join in or not. The same time every day, was the same activity. There was volleyball, bocce ball, darts, dancing, bingo, water aerobics and rifle shooting. There is an activity listing at the desk/both where the towels are given out. We noticed that on Thursday’s, there is a kitchen tour. This was pretty interesting to see the ‘behind the scene’s’. You are given 2 towel cards (per couple) for 2 towels. If you want more, sorry. But they always had fresh towels available for exchange. The fitness center is small a couple treadmills, elliptical, bikes, stair climber and some weights. Some days it was crowded and others I was the only one in there. We tried getting a kayak one afternoon, but it was an hour wait. It didn’t seem like they had too many water sports equipment available. I must say that the service was very good. Everyone (with the exception of the guy checking us in) was very professional starting at the top all the way down to the landscapers. Everyone seemed to be happy to be there and willing to help with whatever you needed. Everywhere you looked someone was cleaning something. A huge difference from some of the other islands I have been to. Yamir was very helpful with the restaurants reservations, along with restaurant service itself. Evening activities were pretty low key. It was pretty good for us, since we hang at the beach all day and are pretty tired by midnight anyway. Just would be nice for a little more interaction in the evening. We only watched Grease as far as the shows go. We listened to one band where they got the guests involved with balloons, which was fun. I must say the most fun evening was Mexican Day (Wednesday). They had different types and shots of tequila. We walked to Playa del Carmen which took about 20 minutes on a safe paved sidewalk. Town was pretty cool, which had lots of shops and restaurants. Some locals even had their pet iguana, monkey and lion cub (yes lion) available for photo opportunities. For breakfast and lunch we went to the buffet which was pretty good. Pretty much the same food, every day, except for a couple different sides. Dinner buffet seemed to be much better that the other 4 specialty restaurants (which surprised me!). Don’t get me wrong, they were good but not exceptional. For those restaurants you had to make reservations – for that day only, starting at 8:30 a.m. You had to choose between a 6:30 or 8:30 seating. If you don’t get there early, you won’t get a choice, if you even get to go at all. Personally I didn’t especially care for this type of set up. We did go across the street to the RIU which had a sports bar to watch football on Sunday. It didn’t get very busy, but there were a few fans in there to make it fun. We also checked out the lobby and had a drink at the RIU Playacar (very small and unimpressive) and Riu Riviera Maya. This one had a much larger and more impressive lobby. It seemed to have a younger crowd (30-55) than the Mexico Palace. The Mexico Palace either had very young (20’s) or very mature (50’s +). All in all I could not really complain about anything. But at the same time nothing made me say “WOW”, except for the service. Not sure I’d go back since there are so many other resorts to explore, but I’d possibly refer this to an older couple.

Reviews.Title: “The Service is What Makes This Place Stand Out”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSlim
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to the Riu Palace Mexico. Last year, we went in early July. The weather was just about unbearably hot and humid every day. This year, we went in early November. The weather was PERFECT. Mid-80's and sunny to partly cloudy every day and the ocean temperature was warmer than I was expecting. I must say that there is some truth to the negative comments posted here. There is a musty smell in the lobby that only seemed to be noticable on our first day...but it's there. The rooms on the ground floor seem to smell a lot more musty that the rooms on the upper floors. We were on an upper floor this year. The resort looks lovely in the pictures, but parts of it looks a bit dated and worn when you look up close. We heard that this hotel is closing for some renovations next year. With those caveats, the bottom line with this place is that the service is absolutely outstanding. Everyone is friendly including the front desk, the waiters/waitresses, the housekeeping staff, the groundskeeping staff.....everyone. You're not going to wait more that a minute or two after even thinking about another drink, etc. without someone asking to help you. I made sure that I tipped everyone early in the week....but the service didn't vary whether you tipped or not. It was all outstanding. Men actually do have to wear long pants to dinner...they are serious about that one. The food is really good. I didn't even bother with the theme restaurant reservations this year. All reservations are either at 6:30 PM or 8:45 PM. 6:30 is a little too early for us, and 8:45 is a little too late. One of the waiters actually remembered us from last year. That was nice. One thing I didn't know from last year is that you can rent bicycles from the front of the Riu Tequilla across the street. It was $5 US per bike for a half-day rental. You can ride a few laps around Playacar and work up an appetite for the buffet at night. All in all....great place. We walked up to the Riu Palace Riveria Maya, and while it did look a bit more spiffy, it seemed overcrowded and noisey. I can't imagine that the service could be any better than the Riu Palace Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe that this resort is anything but amazing”
Reviews.Author: bennuk85
Reviews.Content: I'm on trip advisor, reading reviews for a hotel I'm going to in a few weeks time, and while most reviews are glistening, there are a few that are worrying me. I decided to see what everyone says about this hotel, seen as I've experienced it for myself and loved it, so I can gage it well... and yet I'm surprised to see some of the reviews here are not great either... I'll keep it short, but I went to this hotel, spent two weeks there and had the most amazing time ever, the hotel more than lived up to expectations and is still (in my opinion) the best hotel I've ever been to (The Krystal restaurent probably did this for me, as did the fact we had a junior suite). I've travelled a lot, been in some amazing hotels, and cruised on Cunards Queen Mary 2 (ok so the hotel isn't as good as that, but I'm trying to paint a picture of where my views are coming from). I would recommend this hotel time and time again. So don't believe some of the ten bob millionaires reviewing on here. You get more than what you pay for here, and if you really don't think its a 5* experience for the price, then you really need to jump back to reality and realise that you couldn't afford the standard your expecting... ANYONE WHO IS GOING, HAVE A FANTASTIC HOLIDAY, BECAUSE I GARAUNTEE YOU WILL! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: By the beach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. The grounds were beautiful and well-maintained, and the layout of the resort flowed nicely. We especially liked the outside courtyard concept and it was nice sitting at one of the many tables listening to entertainment in the evenings. The hotel lobby and all but one outside restaurant are air conditioned so if you are visiting in the summer this is a major plus. The food was okay and the four a-la-carte restaurants offered two seatings: 6:30 and 8:45. We had no problem making a reservation each day. The wait staff at the restaurants worked together to take orders and each course was served in tandem, which takes away the personal touch and service. In addition, the appetizers are pre-determined and served to your table. You only had a choice of your entree as well as dessert , which needed to be ordered with your entree. We were never offered coffee with dessert. This system is no fault of the staff, as they had to get everyone served and out to get ready for the next seating. We were expecting a little more in this area because of the "palace" name, as we stayed at a competing "palace" resort a few years ago the food and service was a cut above other all-inclusive hotels. All in all, the hotel is in a great location and you can take long walks on the beach or visit any of the other four Riu properties which are a short walk away. On a personal note, we probably will not return to another Riu property because we have had more personalized service in the restaurants at other all-inclusives and their system for dinner appears to be the norm for all Riu hotels, as we have stayed at two others.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington Court House, Ohio, United States
Reviews.Title: “11/1/11 - 11/11/11 stay at Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Linda W
Reviews.Content: I do not want to expound on the negatives that you have read; some of them are correct - there is no light in the shower, there is only one elevator, the resort is older, the lobby area does smell a bit musty. BUT who spends a lot of time indoors or in the lobby when there is a wonderful beach and so many other things to do? We arrived in torrential rain on the tail end of Hurricane Rina. We were met at the front desk by smiles and apologies for the rain (like it was their fault!). Karola assisted us with the check in process and happily arranged the exact room location we requested. Our bags were at our room waiting for us when we arrived there and the room looks exactly like all the pictures you have seen. Immaculate! I spilled a bottle of water on the floor on the second day and utilized one of the resorts white towels to mop it up - not a spec of dirt on the towel! The staff worked tirelessly to keep up with the water that accumulated on the stairwells (open air windows) and also on the walkways. The resort is very large and a good deal of walking is required, but it is all maintained beautifully. Our 2nd day and still some rain - but it began to clear up and we spent a little time on the beach. I must say I was disappointed with the rough water as I had thought the water was calm, but I attributed the waves to the recent storm. I was right, by the end of the week the waves had calmed tremendously and the water was very refreshing. The beach is HUGE but there are always many many lounge chairs to select from. I must say, I was also a little disappointed in the beach - lots of vendors (not pushy but asking you to purchase things many times during the day). I also thought the beach could have been kept cleaner. But it is still fantastic and you can enjoy as much sun or shade as you want thanks to the beautiful palm trees. There are hobie cats, kayaks, and boogie boards for use at no charge or you can choose parasailing or jet skis for use at a fee (I do not believe these are managed by the Riu staff). Once the rain subsided the staff returned to their normal duties of cleaning and maintaining the property. I never once saw any staff member just standing; they are moving and cleaning constantly. One day I saw someone with a brush cleaning the outside of the cement flower pots. They are constantly sweeping the sand, cleaning the fountain, trimming the shrubs, trimming the stupendous palm trees, mowing, dusting, painting, mopping......it is truly amazing. Thanks to Manuel our room was spotless each and every day with fresh towels 2X a day due to the evening turn down service. I requested specific drinks in our mini fridge and was accomodated immediately and thru out the remainder of our stay. The food at all the buffets is displayed beautifully and there is a huge selection. It is not 5 star and it is not prepared the way I am accustomed to in the States, but I could always find something to eat; actually too much to eat and I am an extremely picky eater! We ate at all the speciality restaurants and the Steakhouse was my favorite (ate there twice). Juan Luis was our waiter at Krystal and he was great - and also very entertaining. All the wait staff is the BEST - Miguel took wonderful care of us each and every morning at breakfast. And the staff preparing the omelets/eggs were great. Always smiling and happy to prepare your food any way you asked. Most of the wait staff work 12 - 14 hours a day; the person who waits on you at Don Julian for breakfast will probably wait on you at the beach buffet for lunch. Lydie takes your speciality restaurant reservations from 8:30 to 10:30 each morning and will be working at the dinner buffet at night until it closes at 10:30 PM! She is truly a jewel! Each and every staff person I saw during the day greeted me with a smile and a friendly greeting each and every time I saw them. There is a wide variety of alcohol to select from - many top shelf liquors and the bar staff will fix whatever you want however you want. The terrace is a marvelous way to end your evening - drinks while enjoying the bands provided or shopping with the vendors (prices very comparable to the shops in the Playacar and cheaper than in Playa Del Carmen). The shows are entertaining and you can enjoy them from inside the theater or you can continue to sit on the terrace with a beautiful breeze. I could go on and on with praises for this resort, but I'm sure by now you realize that I loved it here. Yes, it is older and yes there are a few issues but it is not in the USA and things are done a bit differently in every country I have ever visited. If you want things the same way you are accustomed to in the US, you are travelling to the wrong places. I felt I was treated better at this resort than at any hotel or restaurant chain I have ever visited in the US. I love the Riu chains and have stayed at many - I was truly not disappointed at the Riu Palace Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “My review was for Palace Mexico, not Palace Riveria Maya”
Reviews.Author: mlcampbellokie
Reviews.Content: Our previous written review was for the Riu Palace Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ali M
Reviews.Content: Returned from the Riu Palace on 2nd October. We had a totally awesome time, the hotel, staff, food, service, rooms, bars were all excellent. We could not fault any part of the hotel. Nothing was too much trouble. The staff in the buffet restaurant were excellent especially German who used to save a table for us in the evenings and he would decorate it with flowers!! I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel and would go back tomorrow if the funds allowed! Awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “This place just gets better each time.....”
Reviews.Author: GeorgieBillie
Reviews.Content: I always read the negative reviews and smile. How anyone could find anything to complain about at RPM amazes me and I can be as objective as anyone. We have just returned from 2 weeks from 17th October - 1st November. This was our 3rd trip to this hotel - 6th time in Mexico. We keep returning because the hotel maintains its consistently high standard. From the moment we stepped off the bus and were greeted by the doorman to "welcome home". Its not just us that keep returning either - we have met a few friends over the years. This time there were 6 couples that we knew from previous visits. We also recognised 3 other couples over the 2 weeks and reading the reviews so many people write that its a return trip. Reception were wonderful and welcoming as we had a cool drink whilst being allocated our room. We had a lovely room at the end of one of the blocks. A huge bed - which was 2 doubles pushed together but they never moved so we had no issues at all and slept fantastically. The beds were so comfortable. The rooms are lovely. Nice and simple with a large bathroom, tiled floor throughout, bedroom area with plenty of hanging space (and hangers) and then a seating area with tv. The balcony is great and has 2 large chairs to enjoy the caribbean air (with a bacardi and coke from the optics / fridge). We dont use much of the supplied drinks - purely because we dont spend a huge time in the room and when we do it tends to be water we drink. The fridge has beer, water, coke, orange, lemonade, tonic, club soda - everything! I have always noticed that if you tend to drink diet coke then this is what is replaced with additional stock to ensure you have plenty! Nice thoughtful touch. The staff at the hotel throughout work constantly to ensure it is spotless. There is a smell throughout but then its the caribbean and the air conditioning is on constantly. To be honest its not something we notice until we get home and open our case - but the clothes are going in the wash and its really not anything awful. Again - you are not at home - expect something a little different that is all! We tend to mainly eat in the buffet as the food is delicious with so much choice that this suits us. We can eat then as and when we are ready. We did eat at the steakhouse and that was lovely and nice to have the special service for 1 evening. There is so much choice in the buffet which is where we ate breakfast and evening meal. The fresh omelettes are so nice that I had this, fruit and yoghurt each day. The choices varied from 10 cereal options, pastries, toast, pancakes, waffles, eggs a multitude of ways, sausage, bacon, salad, ham, cheese. In the evening a huge salad bar with all salad types, pastas, sushi, cold meats and fish, cheese, fruit. The hot area with varying choices of meat and vegetable, pasta and fish. And always some form of speciality whether mexican wraps made fresh and to your choice or roast joints, whole fish or pasta stations. There would always be pizza and chips too if that was more suited. The dessert area also has a huge array of choices but my favourite was the fresh crepes with flambe fruit. We chose to eat lunch in the pool restaurant and again we never had any issues on choosing something delicious to eat. The waiting staff are amazing and go out of their way to make your stay all the more special. Joel looked after us at breakfast and remembered us from last year (and that we loved the hazelnut cappucinos), Abraham was so helpful with information if we asked and made sure we had water waiting at our table at lunch and German in the evening who set our table with flowers each evening. The bar staff are just the same and if you tend to order similar drinks they will remember each evening. We love the cocktails and there is more than enough alcohol in these. If you want more just ask - nothing is too much trouble. If you want a branded drink ask for it - if you ask for vodka and coke you will understandably get the local brand. The beach area has plenty of sun loungers and lots of palm trees which provide shade of varying degrees if you need. The sea can be rough at times but its great for body boarding on these days (borrow boards, cannoes, snorkels from the beach team). If you want to book a trip id recommend doing from the beach team. Have to say they seem to know if its not your thing and never hassle us - we are happy just to relax and they seem to pick up on this straight away but its good to know who to ask if we did. Weve stayed in Cancun a couple of times but prefer Playacar. We enjoy walking into town in the evening and having a beer in one of the bars or just a walk round the shops. The people there do pester you to have a look inside which is a shame as im sure they would get more business if they didnt. The shopping area has grown incredibly since our first visit in 2006 and has some good shops, bars and restaurants. You can also catch the ferry to Cozumel from here. While we were there we did have Hurrican Rina threaten. The staff were amazing and must have been at work all night to prepare. Everything was boarded and fastened down and sandbags placed along the walkways to try to keep the water at bay. We were given packed lunches for our rooms as the storm was expected at lunch time. It downgraded to a tropical storm and didnt hit till that evening but that was no problem and it was good to know that the hotel was prepared. We just cannot fault this hotel and cant wait to return in 2012. Thanks for another great holiday RPM

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Firstnan
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days at Riu palace Mexico rreturned Oct. 30. Hotel is lovely, staff is great, food is wonderful, beach is expansive. We were there when hurricane Rina threatened. Staff was amazing with preparations. Cannot praise them enough. Always felt safe and well cared for. We were in rooms on first floor behind main dining 80-90 numbers - not too nice, very smelly, no air circulation, view only of side of Wyndham next door. Avoid these if you can. Fortunately we do not spend much time in room, but were confined there for a short time anticipating storm. Riu is smaller than we are used to as we have stayed at Grand Palladium, Grand Sirenis, Iberostar, Fiesta Americana Condesa, but close to playa del Carmen which we enjoyed

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to to return”
Reviews.Author: art1139
Reviews.Content: My wife andA I arrived Oct 21 and departed Oct 30. We had a great ground floor room toward the front (room 0148) near the restaurants and night life facing the beautiful court yard. We were scheduled to leave on the 27th but due to hurricane Rina our flight was canceled and we had to extend our stay for three days. This was not a problem until the assistant manager told us we had to move to a lower class Riu hotel down the street. After a good part of the day this was a finally resolved and we were allowed to stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. Other than the hurricane and assistant manager in no particular order, we highly recommend the Riu Mexico and the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We normally visit one of the Riu Palace hotels about four to five times a year. All the other staff are great and I do tell them that it's because of them that we continue to return. All the good reviews are accurate no need to hear over again, but I will add that if you plan to visit in the next fees weeks you will probably find the pool water getting to cold to enjoy. The ocean was still maintaining comfortable temperature of about 79-82 degrees. The nights will be more comfortable with light jacket or sweater. If you need anything in the Dinning rooms ask for Giovanni the head captain, we is the best. If you like the late night conversation try the lobby bar at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Theirs Islas the best bar tender in town, tell him the Baby Boomer sent you. Also at the Maya is the 24 hour sports bar where you usually find the same late night die hards. Personality wise the mexico is a little more laid back with more Europeans where the riviera Maya is more up beat and more U.S. Either way the staff will make you feel at home. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: MarcPurnal
Reviews.Content: We had to change our plans while travelling through Mexico and booked this place. We were not familiar with the RIU chain so we didn't know what to expect exactly. But it was a very good decision. This must have been one of the best places we ever stayed in. Food was great, room was good, staff was real friendly. If you find a negative in a place like this, you're just too spoiled...

Reviews.Title: “Just got home....”
Reviews.Author: jessleigh
Reviews.Content: Was at the RPM from 10/19-10/29. Have been traveling to Mexico for yearly vacations for 10 years, and this was our 8th time in Riviera Maya area. Have always stayed at different all-inclusive resorts and this was our first time at the RPM. Check-in: Painless. Desk staff was very friendly and gave us a great room. Not a fan of having actual keys, not key cards, as they can charge you if you lose it. We never did, but another guest came for an additional key since they lost theirs and they were told they would have to make them another one, at a $15 or $20 charge. The desk staff was very thorough in explaining where everything was, how the reservations for dinner worked, etc. This doesn't always happen at resorts and you have to spend a couple of days figuring everything out, so I appreciated the explanation. Room: We had a second-floor room on the courtyard/fountain side, close to the pool - 1052 and 1053. Great rooms and views at this location. The rooms are a little dated compared to some resorts we have stayed at, but they weren't that bad. Yes...two full beds moved together to make a larger bed, which was annoying. No light in the shower. Great tv with a variety of channels, many US channels, which was great since we were there during Hurricane/Tropical Storm Rina. Housekeeping: Great. Always prompt and well-done. Mini-bar was always well-stocked, and when I requested additional items to make sure we would have plenty when the storm hit, they gave me everything I requested on my note. Food: Restaurants - Steak House was our favorite, but I wasn't too impressed with Japanese and Krystal. They were okay, but I didn't love them. We did not get a chance to eat at the Brazilian restaurant. We ate at the buffet more on this trip than any other, and it was great. Towards the end of the 10 days, I was a little "over" the food, but that was not a reflection on what they offered....we were just a little "full!" We only ordered room service for wine and coffee, but the menu was not very impressive. Always nice to have the option, though. Breakfast and lunch buffets were great. Pool: I'm a big "pool person," and this one was not one of the best I have been to. We spent most of our time on the side near the pool bar. It was great having drink service to our chairs, and those servers worked very hard. The pool itself needs some work....a little dated and in need of repainting, patching, etc. I also like when they play music in the pool area and I think they only had one playlist that they used every day....current music for aqua aerobics, then traditional Mexican music for the rest of the day. By the last day, we knew all of the songs by heart :-) Beach: The beach was great. Plenty of chairs and room for everyone. Quite a few feet of the beach was eroded away after Rina hit. Waiters would bring large trays of an array of drinks down to the beach, and that was a great service. The beach bar was not very impressive. Very small and short-staffed, so you had to wait a while for service. Since it seemed that most guests chose the beach over the pool at this resort, I think they need to re-think their bar service. There would be 4-7 people working the pool bar, and 1-3 working the beach bar. Activities: Pretty basic. The activity team was really nice and did a great job, but this resort was a little light in this department compared to other resorts we have been to. Cindy was our favorite....always took the time to talk to us. Evening Activities/Shows: I'm usually not a big show person, but we ended up seeing most of them due to the layout of this hotel, and where we ended up after dinner. They were very similar to other resorts and we enjoyed them. They played some games in the courtyard some nights before the shows, and those were fun. Casino Night was especially popular. Tropical Storm Rina: In the early stages of this storm, I was a little frustrated with the communication, or lack of, by the hotel to the guests as to what was happening. It got a little confusing and chaotic, as some people heard some things, but others heard something different. We actually had a desk employee tell us that we would be put on a bus and sent to a local school until the storm passed! I think there might have been a slight language barrier during that conversation, but needless to say, that was a little concerning. We checked with the desk the following morning and were told that was not going to happen, based on what the current strength of the storm was projected to be. In the end, I can see that the hotel was just making sure they had all of their "ducks in a row" before issuing any formal statements, and at that point, the hurricane was downgraded to a tropical storm. When there was more clarity as to the severity of the storm, I feel the hotel did a great job in making sure we were safe and comfortable. We had to go to our rooms at 12:30 on Thursday and we were sent with a bag lunch....not a great lunch, but we all could easily afford to miss a meal after 7 days of all-inclusive :-) The storm ended up hitting at around 7pm, and at that point, we were at dinner at the buffet. There was thunder, lightning, and rain, but the hotel set up casino games in the lobby, opened the buffet for dinner, and held the show in the theater. All was fine...a little wet, but fine. Overall, it was a great trip and we were happy with the resort. I would possibly go back, if the price was right. I liked the smaller size compared to some of the mega-resorts we have stayed at in the past. It is nice to have the option of utilizing the other sister resorts if we get bored with ours, but we never really did. I only gave the resort 4 stars because I have stayed at the Royal Playa del Carmen, and I don't think this one is equal to where I would rate the Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: guest79963
Reviews.Content: The best hotel i have ever been in. The hotel looks even better than in the pictures, the staff go above and beyond with their service even the chamber maids all say hola everytime you pass by. The staff selling trips down at the beach don't push any sales on you for the first time a salemen knows what no is and they just chat to you. So Glad We picked this Hotel to get married in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and food!”
Reviews.Author: koolchic101
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a week. It was our first time at this resort. They have excellent service and the food is fantastic. Awesome drinks, the beach and the pool. It exceeded my expectations. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Week”
Reviews.Author: algoma
Reviews.Content: One more week at the RIU Palace Mexico our 6th. time there. Met some of the same people we met last year from the U.K. and the U.S. so had a lot of bar time because of 4 days of rain,so did cross the street to the RIU Tequila sports bar for a lot of football and baseball game time.. We did get a room up grade for once in the court yard,it was nice to get a different view. The hotel was about 85% full this year,but everything fas Great. The Buffet restruant is still our favoite more to pick from.. It seemes like the hotel keeps eliminating bar stools at the lobby bar the show lounge and upper pool bar to save on drinks. being from Wis.we allways met more people at the bars. Other wise everything is the same, but a few of are favoite employees have moved over to the RIU palace Riviera Maya, so had to go over there a few times to see them, they had plenty of bar stools over there..Any way will be back again when we see the deal $$$$ its worth it..

Reviews.Title: “Simply: amazing”
Reviews.Author: Diego_Z
Reviews.Content: Everything is amazing at this hotel: the beach, the food, service. The theater has also shows for kids. Nothing to add, just go because you won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST ALL INCLUSIVE”
Reviews.Author: cicoli
Reviews.Content: After 31 yrs of traveling to Cancun & Riviera Maya area this hotel tops them all. From Front desk, rooms, room service, bars & servers,resturants waiters & Managers......You just can't beat it. Because if you do have a problem it will be fixed fast..I do not know how anyone can complain about the food being the same every nite because you can eat something differant just from the salad bars alone, Main courses also.Differant theme every nite. Shows were very good. You must remember that it isn't Vegas & your not paying $100. for each seat. Not to mention Francesca - Directora, Asst. Kate Black,

Reviews.Title: “This has to one of the Best”
Reviews.Author: flyingchefmanchester
Reviews.Content: I often stay with the Riu Hotels around the group and can only say this was the best the staff were faultless and I dont often mention a staff member as they all work so hard but the one that stood out was ILDIKO from the front desk, my room for a single travler was spacious and very clean, the buffet was very good somthing for anyone, WELL DONE RIU PALACE MEXICO

Reviews.Title: “Magic Mexico”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: I just want to say what a fantastic hotel and holiday. The staff couldn't do enough for us. From Adrian on the front desk or Giovvanie and Edward in the main restaurant. I would also like to say that the rooms were kept immaculate even when we got the tail end of a hurricane they never stopped.The food was wonderful and plenty to choose from. And for trips we walked down to the small shops and saw Leo who sorted uot some wonderful trips.Will be back to swim with the Whale Sharks

Reviews.Title: “The time of my life!”
Reviews.Author: Jess50207
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 day from feb 2 2011 - feb 6 2011. I went with my boyfriend at the time and about 60 people from his work. The first night we were there he asked me to marry him right next to the fountain in the main courtyard. That pretty much set up for the best trip of my life. The drinks were the usual at resorts like this, kinda weak. However the property was perfectly maintained and the beach was the nicest I have ever been to. The beach alone is a reason to go back and I most definitely will!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico, Sept 2011”
Reviews.Author: m236971
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. The check-in was a breeze; all of the staff were pleasant and worked hard to assure we were happy. Our favorite was Yamir that led that staff at the Krystal Fusion restaurant; he was awesome. The food was excellent in buffets as well. The beach was perfect; no rocks, white sand and had a gradual slope. The gold-colored wrist bands we received at check-in provide us exchange privileges with the Riu's on each side Riu Yucatan & Riu Playacar, across the street Riu Tequila and up the street Riu Palace Riviera Maya. It was fun to swim in their pools and drink from their swim-up bars. The entertainment was livelier at the other Riu's, but that suited us fine because our room was quiet. Since the 1980’s, my girlfriend visited about 8 other resorts in the Cancun and Rivera Maya area and believes that our stay at the Riu Palace Mexico was the best. I proposed to my girlfirend on the bridge over the courtyard fountain, making it our special place forever.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed but more places to see”
Reviews.Author: 71poppy2011
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 2weeks, 30thsept to14th oct with my husband, unfortunately not the best holiday due to the weather and illness, however nothing to do with the hotel ,firstly the room we were given was very spacious and immaculately cleaned, flowers and animals made daily we had a 2nd floor room facing the fountains and swimming pool definately worth paying the extra for this. beach kept clean, plenty of sunbeds,nice touch the waiters bring you a selection of drinks down on to the beach, hammocks amongst the palm trees to protect you from the sun unfortunately we didnt get to see much sun, on the downside the current in the water can be quite strong at times and quite a steep incline to get into the water restaurants the food in the main buffet was excellent, choice was fantastic everyones needs catered for, the waiters are very attentive never had to wait for a table we prefferred to sit outside only downside a lot of people smoke as their is no smoking ban there, only went to the steakhouse as we enjoyed the variety on offer in the main restaurant. bar lobby bar,again excellent service, hiran looked after us never had an empty glass ,all spirits are well known brands a good choice of cocktails,piano player excellent as was the guy who played the flute. overall enjoyed the holiday,no complaints about the hotel, weather wasnt the best dont think i would return, to many other places to visit thats the only reason

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars All The way”
Reviews.Author: JerVic
Reviews.Content: We Just returned from a 7 night stay at the Riu Palace Mexico in honor of our 20th wedding anniversery. The service and the food quality were the best we have ever had anywhere. The bed was very firm but we like it that way. Everything everywhere was always spotless. Nobody expected tips but we always tip for excellant service. The Steak House and Crystal sit down Resteraunts were both excellant as well. I don't know why anyone would write a bad review about this Hotel. Thank you Very much for our wonerful stay. Jerry & Vicki

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Terrible: Didn't even stay the FIRST night!!!”
Reviews.Author: ncoutroulis
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and our 4 yr old son were supposed to have spent 8 "wonderful nights" at this hotel that so many have raved about and said things like, "the most amazing place ever!" Well, This is NOT that place. Not by a long shot! The quick story: We checked in, and checked out 3 hrs later and into RIU Riveria Maya. A much better property. (Read my review on that as well) The hotel itself, on first appearance, is ok—grand and maybe a little impressive—depending on your taste. However, it is old, smelly, musty, and leaky! We arrived in the middle of a 3 day downpour, and the lobby, as well as the hallways, were leaky and smelled of mildew and VERY heavy chemical cleaning products. We were given a key to our room, a basement level "Jr Suite", which faced a "garden" area. It had a small outside area, but that was probably the best part. The room smelled so bad (of mold/must/and the heavy chemical cleaners), that we couldn't stay in it. The room was also DATED!!! The comforter was OLD, the drapes were OLD, everything about this room was OLD and depressing. We asked the desk to see another room, and we did, but it was equally terrible for the same reasons. We ventured to RIU Riveria Maya, about a 10 min walk towards town, and looked at a room there. Much better (still not amazing, but at least no smell and slightly more updated). I ran back to the other RIU, checked out, and happily paid the additional money for the RIU Riveria Maya. ******* Do yourself a favor and do some serious research before booking here. You will be sorely disappointed otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Unfair reviews”
Reviews.Author: mothergoose17
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Riu Palce 11 times now, 9 times during September, once in December and once in February. If, as the last few reviews keep implying, this hotel is dissapointing then we would not be repeat visitors. Our last visit was September this year, there was a party of 40 of us, all from England, in Mexico to attend a beach wedding at this resort. We have seen numerous weddings over the last 11 years and can honestly say that this was probably the largest group of people together that we have seen. The wedding was amazing, the beach, the reception and the steak house for our meal were outstanding, and the staff were absolutely fantastic. Our party consisted of ages 2 to 82, all of whom agreed that the Riu Palace is a very special place, most of whom WILL return again. The staff at this hotel are among the best in the world, we have so many that we now count as our friends, in fact we now refer to our holidays as "visiting friends". I know that not everyone has the same views as us but, please, take the negative reviews with a pinch of salt and go and see for yourselves, you will not be dissapointed. Yes, some parts of the hotel are in need of refurbishment, but look above all of that, see the people there, speak to them, get to know them, they are the people who will make your dreams come true.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but too smelly for me”
Reviews.Author: pmsimp01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico for 5 nights from Oct 14-19 2011. The hotel itself is very beautiful, and the warm, tropical environment provided a magnificent backdrop. The beach area – with all the palm trees, hammocks, and chairs – looked like something out of a movie set. We were unfortunate enough to be there for 5 days of heavy rain, so I didn’t get to experience the clear, blue waters that I’ve heard so much about (or the sun for that matter). The tropical depression that hung around all week made the surf dark brown with all the sand being churned up from the waves (which also happened to be much too rough for my comfort zone.) Our room was spacious enough and I loved the detailed work put into the tile and woodwork, especially in the bathroom. The small fridge was nicely stocked with sodas, beer and plenty of water. The TV worked great and there were many channels to choose from. The air conditioning in the room also worked perfectly (as long as you knew what temperature you wanted in Celsius.) There were three things that I did not particular like about the hotel, the most notable being the smell. Our room smelled of mold so bad that it gave me a headache within 5 minutes and kept me awake at night. It is the worst smelling hotel room I’ve ever been in; it reminded me of an old dirt cellar or the old canvas tent we had stored out in our shed when I was a kid. The same smell was in parts of the main restaurant and a few other places as well. I must say that I was fascinated by the fact that some guests obviously could not smell this, because there was no way I could have eaten in that wing of the restaurant. I got to where I couldn’t even walk through the back entrance to the restaurant because it was too overpowering and would give me an instant headache. The second thing is that we were made a little uneasy by all the knocks on the door from room service bringing us water or such that we never requested. I could see a mistake once or twice, but this happened too many times for it to be a coincidence. I got the impression they were looking for rooms where no one was in. The final thing that did not go well for us was that my husband got food poisoning on the second night we were there. We ate at Krystals and he had ordered the sea bass (which we’ve since learned that you should not eat anyway) and it was so salty that he could only get down two or three bites before he was pretty sure something wasn’t quite right with it. Less than two hours after dinner his illness began. Today is day 7 and he is still sick and can’t eat anything without being near a bathroom. He has an appointment Monday with our doctor. (We did not drink any tap water and only ate at the resort restaurants.) And for what it’s worth, the rain seeped into our living area all week and we had to keep towels on the floor. This was a problem throughout the resort due to all the rain. If you go I would request a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor. On a final note – you must try the Selvatica tour (ziplining & 4 wheeling) – it is a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Not Safe do not travel here!”
Reviews.Author: jennifer h
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Barcelo Maya Palace and upon arrival at The Riu Palace Mexico I was disspointed from the beginning. Barcelo Hands down is so much better. Everything is newer the pool is amazing and there is plenty of entertainment for people of all ages. Here is my brake down of the horrible experience I had at Riu Palace Mexico Rooms were old and out dated. There is no light in the shower/tub. Beds are hard but we were aware of this before we got there and requested a mattress topper which they did not do until we complained The Buffet was pretty good. The specialty restaurants you had to make reservations for every morning for the night of. The steak one was pretty good. The Japanese was terrible. The brazilian was good and we could not get into the Krystal one which was very dissapointing since that is the only one I wanted to go to. The pool was horrible I have seen better pools at peoples houses. So dissapointed The beach was one of the best I have seen in Mexico. The bartenders were mean and rude. The night before we left My husband and I were walking from our room on the third floor to the lobby bar and found a man laying across the hallway as we got closer we saw broken glass and then realized there was glass sticking out of his head.I thought the man was dead and am still not convince other wise. I was crying hystericly and my husband began banging on doors trying to get someone to call the front desk. A couple finally answered their door and did not understand any english but we were able to get them to help us anyway. Management came running and my husband took me back to our room because I was serrioully traumatized. The next day we went to management to ask what had happened and they acted like they didnt know what we were talking about. After being persistant about it we were then taken to a room and told the man was okay but that we were the only suspects and that they werent going to press charges because there wasnt enough evidence. I was like you have got to be kidding me. Once again I was in tears on my vacation. My husband told me to let it go because we are in Mexico and they could pretty much do what ever they wanted to. I own a restaurant in the states and every person I have talked to has told me do not go to mexico it is unsafe and my response has always been that once you are on the resort you are perfectly safe. I do not feel this way about Riu Palace Mexico and will NEVER return there! I may never return to Mexico again because of it. Most Horrible Experience of My LIFE!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at RIU!!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyinchicago
Reviews.Content: Nightmare Vacation! I am not sure what all the glowing reviews are for, perhaps, there was a special hyponitizing tonic being served on the property that made people believe this place was some sort of paradise, when it was quite the opposite. When we arrived on October 15th @ 12:15, in pouring torrential rain, we were welcomed into an overcrowded, leaking lobby with a mildew smell and no seating available.The furniture seats were so old that the couches had huge dents & were sunken in. Upon attempting to check in, we asked if the desk clerk could just check to see if any rooms were avail. for early check in, however, we were immediately dismissed as she kept pointing to a sign that said 3 o clock! How rude, we just wanted to check as we were in soaking clothes & very uncomfortable. The fact that she would not even check the system to see if there was a room, is what was infuriatiing. So we were left to stand in a smelly lobby, with ugly plastic buckets to catch water from the leaking celiing & no seating available. We finally went downstairs in the meantime to kill some time and try to have a meal. We were again in an overcrowded waiting area, waiting for the mediocre buffet to open. Why only 1 eating place open for lunch? When we finally checked in nearly 3 hours later, we were given a key--a key? in 2011? not a key card, to a room that was downstairs in the lower level. The room door opened and we were welcomed with a strong mildew smell, 2 beds pushed together? This is their idea of a double room? To beds pushed together as if it were one king bed? We wanted 2 separate beds. The beds has ugly faded blue, then bed spreads--not comforters--thin bed spreads. After sleeping, we missed the dinner buffet & ordered 'room service'. Uh, nice menu? Mostly cold items--turkey sandwich, a salad, etc. The food arrived with no trays or food covers, the turkey sandwich was inedible with spongy, stale like bread, dry turkey, and no cheese, as they told me on the phone that they had no cheese, only cheesecake?? The next morning, when sitting in bed looking up, I see the air vent in the upper right of the ceiling has mold growing around it! Disgusting! The bed spread has slipped off & when I picked it up, I noticed a huge brown stain on the lower left side of the box spring. Travelers biggest fear, a dirty mattress. We still tried to see if Day 2 was in better, but no! I almost slipped in the hallway because of the water seaping from the ceiling, we went out for a bit and came back @3:15. We went to our room to find our clothes were wet because of the leaking ceiling in the room. We tried to see if we could get food as we were hungry, however, the buffet was closed & were told it would not be open until 6:30. No hot food was available unless, as they told us, we could walk out all the way to the back of the property in the pouring rain if we wanted hot food, or wait the 3 hours for the buffet downstairs to open--the other two restaurants were closed as well. The property should have planned for the inclement weather and had extended hours at the buffet or one of the other properties. Between rude manager, the mildew smell, mold in the room, wet clothes, plastic buckets all over the property to catch rain from the ceiling, poor access to hot food, we decided to move to a new property (at an additional charge) to salvage the last 3 days of our vacation. We will NEVER return to any RIU property--ever. We also will inform others to stay away. This was not a 4 star experience or worth the $1100 we paid!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: diehammer
Reviews.Content: When you first arrive you get a fruit cocktail the rooms are very good and the food is excellent, there are 4 restaurants which have to be booked in the morning but its well worth it. The hotel gives access to all of the other RIU hotels in the complex. Food is excellent & fridge is restocked every day with beeer, soft drinks & water

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico Was Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ed m
Reviews.Content: We enjoying searching for and reading the bad reviews of this property. Comedy!! Riu Palace was awesome. The property was breathtakingly beautiful. The service was impeccable. My wife cried when it was time to leave. But here are some tips to keep in mind if you are are ultra-picky: * Playacar is hot and humid. This isn't the hotel's fault. If you don't like hot humid weather, you won't like it here. * The tap water in this part of the world is generally not safe for people whose metabolisms aren't accustomed to it. Drink bottled water or enjoy the copious beverages at one of the many bars or from your generously stocked in-room minibar. Never give the tap water to a baby! * There are many desperately poor people in this part of the world. Occassionally, one of them will be tempted by your wealth. Management would prefer that you use the in-room safe than to deal with complaints that arise from your carelessness. * If your vacation plans center around 5 star dining, try New York or Paris or Florence. If you can't find something you like at the Riu's buffet, you have a problem. It might taste a little different from what you're used to, but remember that you're not in Kansas anymore. The variety and quantity of food was staggering. It made me feel a little guilty. How spoiled are we? * Semitropical environments (and all environments except maybe Antarctica) have insects. They weren't at all bothersome. Quite the contrary. But you might see one occassionally. I think I recall from biology class that insects serve a useful role in nature. It would be disastrous to try to eradicate all of them. This hotel was fabulous. If you don't like it here, you have some kind of special need and you should have planned better. We loved every minute of our stay and we can't wait to save up and treat ourselves to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Cathyjam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Tequila Hotel the first week,which was not great so moved across the road after having a look round the palace one day.Food and service was exceptional, its right on the beach too.It was just what you want from a relaxing holiday.Its the only time we have said we would go back for another holiday to the same place. We went sept/oct 2010.

Reviews.Title: “overall great time”
Reviews.Author: meatlovers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the RIU Palace Mexico and had a great time. The hotel offered a positive experience with food, drink, beach and hotel rooms. This is the 7th RIU we have stayed at in Mexico and Jamacia and ranks up there with the best. Beach was smooth and easy to swim in with very little waves and a sandy beach. The only thing I would ask for is some steps in the swimming pools instead of ladders - makes things difficult. Will, and are, going again. I stayed Oct. 5 - 12, 2011.

Reviews.Title: “All-inclusive done perfectly”
Reviews.Author: FussyCritic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at RPM for four nights starting October 8. The weather and the resort were perfect. We booked private transfers from USA Transfer, which was much better (and only barely more expensive) than the shared shuttles we've used in the past. They were excellent. What makes RPM different is the huge expanse of property between the resort and the beach. You can't really see the water from the rooms (at least where we were), but the palm-shaded beach had hundreds of lounge chairs and hammocks, which spread guests over a larger area and eliminated any sense of crowding even though the resort was nearly full. It felt more like a tropical resort than a hotel plopped directly on a denuded beach. There are five Riu properties in the area, and guests at one can use all the facilities at any of the others, including bars and restaurants (except dinner, where you eat at your own resort). RPM is a really pretty property, somewhat the standard Riu layout, but in an Old Mexico theme with wrought iron, stone, and mint green colors. Grounds are immaculately maintained. It's truly all-inclusive -- they didn't even ask for a credit card swipe at check-in. Most of the guests were from the UK and Germany, with few children. No obnoxious drunks that we saw, always a risk at all-inclusives that proudly advertise in-room liquor dispensers and unlimited bar service. Playacar is a secured area with guarded gates at all entrances. Quite safe, I'd say. There's a small plaza across the street with a few souvenir places and it's about a 30-minute walk to Fifth Avenue on quiet, residential sidewalks (or a fixed price $7 cab ride). Other reviews covered the obvious features, so I'll add a few. The patio of our room was huge and quite nice, with two lounge chairs -- totally private, with full walls. We weren't on the courtyard side, but that was a plus in our book - we were looking out onto palms and lawn and it was quiet. The room was nice and cool and the pushed-together bed was enormous. The only negatives were the tiny pillows and lack of bathrobes. Towel animals were fun. I watched the maid clean our room one day and it was more thorough than I would have imagined, with full dusting and mopping even though we'd barely touched the room -- she must have worked 30 minutes in there. Fun surprises: the noon beach party was cool with a live band, barbeque, drinks in coconuts, and dance lessons. The piano player evenings in the lobby bar was outstanding. Unlike our two previous all-inclusive visits, there were no timeshare pitches. Buffets were of amazing variety and excellent quality (favorites: the cheese buffet, the roast beef, ceviche,and the always-available Mexican food items).
