Fruit and vegetables were, as usual in Mexico, of very high quality -- I started every morning with a sandwich of tasty tomatoes and bacon on homemade bread, cinnamon rolls, and a chocolate croissant or homemade doughnut. The dinner buffet featured ice sculpture and carved vegetables, easily the equal of the midnight buffets that cruise ships once offered. Breakfasts also featured make your own mimosas, freshly made smoothies, and Kahlua coffee. Most folks took the chance to eat outside at the buffet, and service there was equally excellent to that inside. We enjoyed the Miyagi and Fusion specialty restaurants, very well themed and intimate (only 40 or so seats). Service there was perfect and the food was quite nice. The best feature of this resort is the staff. They were exceedingly friendly, smiling, and efficient -- I've never seen hotel employees work so hard and diligently, but always with a smile. Even their smartly tailored uniforms were immaculate at all times. RPM has plenty of bar staff even at poolside and at the beach, so it's exceedingly easy to get a drink just about anywhere on the property. All-inclusive or not, I like to tip a dollar every round or two of drinks, a couple of dollars at dinner, and $5-10 at the specialty restaurants - it's entirely optional, but seemed to be much appreciated. Entertainment staff were fun, especially at the beach party. We only went to one show and it was pretty bad, so we left quickly -- unskilled lip-syncing and dancing to a recording of Mamma Mia! was not at all entertaining, although the show room was nice and bar service was excellent there as well. Looking back, what gave this resort an almost cruise-like feel were the shared events: casino night on the patio, the band, the shows, the beach party, and the mingling at the bars. You could simply hole away on the beach or in your room in private if you wanted, but there was a nice feeling of camaraderie that we haven't had at other all-inclusives. I could go on, but the bottom line is that we had a wonderful time, better than at Live Aqua or Royal Playa del Carmen, with the big differentiators being the friendly and efficient employees, the excellent food, and the scheduled events. That points to outstanding management - hiring and motivating the right people, quality control, and guest relations. Being part of a large organization like Riu may make that possible. Everybody has their own opinions and some of the negative ones posted here gave me cause for concern, but I have nothing at all negative to say about Riu Palace Mexico. I think they do a magnificent job and I would recommend it to others without hesitation. I'm certain guests will leave feeling as we did -- relaxed, pampered, and satisfied with excellent value received.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Meet Expectations for a Palace”
Reviews.Author: Chris K
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico on 10/11 and agree with most of what ds521 said in their own review. Last year we stayed at the Iberostar Quetzal down the street and absolutely loved our stay however were looking to "upgrade" a bit this year by staying at the Riu Palace Mexico. Unfortunately we didn't feel like there was a single part of this resort that was really upgraded over the Iberostar Quetzal besides maybe some higher end boozs (though quetzal had this available at many of there bars and the bartenders only used it at the Riu if you asked for it). Food: One the things that I was most looking forward to on this stay was an upgrade in the food which many reviewers talked about at the Palace Mexico. We were however very disappointed in what we found. Breakfast was decent offering all the basics (eggs, bacon, some pasteries, etc.) though nothing was executed incredibly well. The French toast was dry, the eggs were hit or miss, and there breads/pasteries were nothing special. The cereal was also stale which was disappointing. The one nice thing was an extensive juice/smothie bar which we enjoyed. Lunch was probably one of the most disappointing meals of the day. At both restaurants/eating areas they had mostly fried foods or the typical grilled meat strips or hamburgers with the same prepackaged desserts which you saw at every meal. Even things as basic as the nacho cheese were kind of chunky and unappealing. For dinner we ate at three of the specialty restaurants (Japanese, Fusion/Krystal, and the stakehouse) as well as the buffet. The buffet was nothing special and I actually think the dinner buffet at the Iberostar down the street was much more elaborate and well done. We enjoyed our dinner at the fusion restaurant, thought the japanese was OK, and were very dissappointed int eh steakhouse. The baked Alaska they have there is cool but the actual meat is very mediocre. Also what killed me was that the "Fine potato chips with parmigiana and herbs" that they served with it were just fries from the lunch buffet with some parsley sprinkled over them. All of this was just really sad since I big reason we choose this resort over going back to Quetzal was because of the food and overall I would say the food at Quetzal was actually superior. The room service was also pretty sad with only a few pre-made options that you wouldn't want to order anyway. Beach: The beach is gorgeous, though you should be able to find this at most of the resorts in the Playacar area. There were plenty of Palm trees which were nice. Grounds: Very clean and well kept which was nice. I just don't think I liked the Palace feel as much as I expected versus the jungle feel of say a Riu Tequila or the Iberostars. Entertainment: As everyone mentioned, it was pretty bad, especially compared to what we got at the Iberostar. Basically one man acts with some other staff members dancing around. The one exception to this is that they did have a casino night one evening which was really fun though it closed down rather abruptly. Staff: Everyone was very nice and helpful, no complaints. However, we didn't think there was anything which was superior to the Iberostar quetzal either. Pool: Awful. Whoever planned out this pool should not be an architect. First off its (there is only one) in a weird flower shape so you never get the feeling of being in a large resort pool which we didn;t like and is not conducive to groups. Also there was no view of anything from the pool besides the sides of the resort which was disappointing. We actually walked down the the RPRM everytime we wanted to spend some time in a pool since they have a beautiful large pool and an infinity pool which overlooks the beach. This combined with the food were probably our two biggest let downs. Rooms: Once again we were a little disappointed here. The rooms were fine though there was nothing that shouted "palace" about them. Pretty normal and comparable to our rooms at the Iberostar quetzal except these had a little lowered seating area. The one thing that was much worse about these rooms was the bathrooms. The shower/bath was incredibly narrow and didn't have a light in it! Last year we loved our large glass door shower at Quetazal which felt very luxurious. This shower felt like it belonged in a motel 8. Our room was also not cleaned one day which was pretty annoying and unexpected for a Palace. Overall, if you have never been to an all-inclusive resort before, you'll probably enjoy yourself here. We however were very disappointed due to our expectations and what we feel we could have got with similar money at an Iberostar resort. We didn't feel like there was much that made this place very special or desirable for future visits. If I were to stay at a Riu again in Playa it would be the RPRM since there pool is infinitely better (though the food is just as disappointing) and it just seemed much livelier. Overall the resort just seemed a bit dated and average for what is suppose to be the Flagship line of Riu resorts.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Tiggs26
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from another fabulous holiday in this amazing hotel I have been here about 7/8 times The staff are so friendly and helpful and cannot do enough for you. There are so many that I can't name them all however Katy Black, Manager, deserves a mention. She makes every holiday I have spent here go so smoothly and is always on hand to answer queries or help. The rooms, no matter where located are all excellent, some have views of the fountains or the pool which obviously adds to the view if you like to sit out on the balcony. The pool is exceptionally clean and lovely and warm. They clean the rails and showers every day, the down side being that there is sometimes odd bits of rubbish or glasses left out from the day before, but people staying here could help that situation as there are bins every where. The area itself is clean though The food is excellent and there is ample to chose from. You could have a completely different meal every night if you wanted, and I stayed for 3 weeks!! The speciality restaurants are also excellent although the Brazilian is not my personal choice. The shows are typical hotel shows but you can really enjoy them if get into the spirit. There was some different entertainment this year and we had a casino night. They gave you chips and then what you won was turned into a cheque and you could bid at an "auction" for prizes.....great fun. Your drinks are kept topped up all the time often without asking and they remember what you "normally" drink. The shopping is close by too at the plaza, or you can get a taxi for $7 to 5th Avenue. Most of the entertainment staff were new this year but they worked extremely hard and were really friendly. A couple of comments I woud make are that:- - they need additional steps into the pool that are not quite so steep - They need to make the signs more prominent in the quiet pool that state no airbeds or balls as these rules were ignored - Men are supposed to wear long trousers in all restaurants but they were being let in with shorts even in the speciality restaurants, unfair on those men that made the effort NONE of this affected our holiday and was not a problem to us Can't wait to go back again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to our expectations...”
Reviews.Author: ds521
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one week stay at this resort and we hope that this review will be as helpful as other reviews have been to us. We flew into the Cancun airport without any problems via Continental, and it took about an hour to clear immigration, etc. We booked Cancun Express and prepaid our private transfer for $94 for the roundtrip for my husband and me. I recommend this company – they are very reliable and reasonable, and you can’t beat the price for a private transfer – no stopping along the way to deliver others to their hotels first…. We stayed at the Riu Tequila in 2010 so we were somewhat familiar with the Riu Palace Mexico since it’s across the street. The Palace Mexico is much more lavish than the Tequila – the lobby is very ornate with its beautiful chandeliers, wrought iron arches and detailing, etc. The staff at the front desk was very nice – our room wasn’t ready at 1:30 so we went down and had lunch. At 2:30 our room was ready and we were given a 2nd floor room that faced the pool area. I had emailed a request prior to arrival for a 2nd or 3rd floor room and they honored that request. We also mentioned that we would be celebrating my husband's birthday as well as our anniversary while there, but neither event was acknowledged at any time throughout the week. We also asked for 2 room keys and that wasn’t a problem. The room was very nice, air-conditioner worked well, and it was a good sized room with a lower level living area. As others have stated, the bed is a bit hard but we didn’t have a problem sleeping. As some have reported, the room is a bit dated – especially the bedding looked worn. Upon arrival, the room had rose petals on the bed in the shape of a heart, and there were 3 towel animals also. There was one other day that a towel animal was made and placed in our bathroom. That was the extent of the towel animals and rose petals. I know some people have said this was a daily occurrence in their experiences but that wasn’t the case with us. There was 1 day when the room wasn’t cleaned at all. It wasn’t a big deal for us though – since there are just the two of us, we just needed a couple extra towels and wash clothes. As nice as it was to have a furnished balcony that was close to the pool, it wasn’t functional for us. The balcony wall was so high that you could not sit out there and see anything but the sky – literally not even the tree tops could be seen when sitting on that balcony. Not all balconies were like this at the Palace Mexico so if you enjoy sitting on the balcony like we do, you might want to make this clear when reserving your room. It was a negative for us – we didn’t enjoy the balcony at all on this trip. The grounds at this resort are gorgeous and meticulously maintained – you won’t find a cleaner hotel, that’s for sure, and to be sure, it does look palatial. The staff are very friendly and helpful – no matter if you tip or don’t tip. One of the main complaints I have with the Riu Palace Mexico though is that everything is so far from the ocean. To walk to the water’s edge from the main hotel area is no less than the length of 3 (three) football fields. I have to agree with some who have complained about the amount of walking that’s required when you stay at this resort – it can be a problem for anyone with joint problems or for the elderly. We really didn’t enjoy the pool there at all – it’s beautiful but you cannot see or hear the ocean when you’re at the pool. As a matter of fact, unless you’re sitting beyond the tree line of the beach, you won’t be able to hear waves. This is not a resort that structures many activities around the beach. They do have beach volleyball, etc. but if you’re like us and enjoy beach activities both day and night – you might want to look at other resorts. We’ve stayed at resorts that have Mexican Fiestas, Big Screen Movie Nights and Football Game nights, Fire Shows, etc., etc. on the beach at night – this resort has absolutely nothing on the beach in the way of entertainment and except for volleyball, has little else during the day. On the subject of the pool, it’s very weird – the only way to get in or out of that beautiful pool is by ladder. There is no zero entry – no steps with handrails. They gave no thought to small children or anyone who has any disability or who is older, and these ladders don’t extend to the bottom of the pool – you really have to hoist yourself up to reach that first step when you’re trying to get out. I’ve never seen anything like this in any public pool and especially not in a resort pool. We disliked the beach/pool setup so much that we walked even further each day to the Riu Yucatan next door so that we could use their seating around the pool that actually overlooked the ocean. This was fine – the pools are great there and the view of the turquoise Caribbean and Cozumel are perfect - but we paid for the bar service at the Palace. Unfortunately, the less expensive Yucatan has no bar service poolside, you have to go and wait in line to get a drink. It also was inconvenient at lunch time because we had to trek back over to the Palace – the lunch at the Yucatan was very mediocre at best, and if you eat too late, it consists of an odd assortment of unidentifiable mush. We found the food at the breakfast, lunch, and dinner buffet at the Palace to be just ok. They did have shrimp a couple of nights and that was good, the beef was tough most often, the salmon very dry, the desserts very repetitive and gelatinous. They seem to offer menu items geared more to the European tastes rather than to the Americans, and maybe it’s because they seem to have more Europeans than Americans staying there. We actually liked the food at the specialty restaurants better – the steakhouse/El Patio was probably our favorite. The Krystal was good and the Brazilian was pretty good too. We didn’t try the Asian restaurant though so we can’t comment on that. We found the entertainment at the Palace to be really disappointing. I know others have said the same thing but we’re not big partiers and are pretty easily entertained, but we were just plain bored at this place. We went across the street to the Tequila and they at least had enjoyable entertainment that included audience participation. We were both very surprised by the amount of smokers on this trip. There weren’t many Americans who stayed at this resort – most visitors being from the UK, Germany, etc. but it was shocking to see how many of them smoke like it was still 1955 when we were still clueless about the dangers of smoking. It’s so rare in the US to be exposed to cigarette smoke nowadays – with so many laws that protect the non-smokers, it was really hard for us to deal with all that toxic smoke. We won’t be staying at this resort again. The staff is very good and very friendly but I think the management needs to rethink what many people look for when planning a beach vacation. The fountains and décor are beautiful but we can get that in NYC. It’s about the beach, the food, the entertainment……there are so many great resorts in that area that offer a complete beach vacation experience and there’s no reason to settle for less. Midway into the week we found ourselves - for the first time on any vacation - considering moving to one of those resorts to finish out the trip. This is not to say, by any means, that this is a bad place – it’s not. But it just falls short in areas that are important to us when we’re looking for a great beach vacation. Hopefully, this review will help you get a better idea of what the resort is like. These are our opinions and based on the viewer ratings – some people out there likes this resort to be sure. As long as you understand what it does and does not offer, you’ll hopefully be less likely to be in for any disappointments. Have a great time – wherever you do stay. The people, culture and that beautiful turquoise sea make for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “riu experience and the rest of my vacation”
Reviews.Author: jennifer9898
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace Mexico- Positives- The food was excellence, I would recommend you stay here just on the food alone. -never had a bad or even average meal - Favorite dining Krystal, try the salmon, lava chocolate cake was totally worth the extra time on the treadmill - The breakfast at Don Julian's with the fruit shakes are great! The staff- - kind and hardworking - always cleaning and so busy making the grounds and rooms nice - the staff was always smiling and giving us a friendly "Hola!" Beach- Amazing! I took pictures and they do not do the place justice. You must just go and see it for yourself. The sound of the ocean, the waves, the staff coming by with the tray of drinks..., soft powder like sand, beautiful Clean- The place was so clean! The rooms were a little outdated but cleaned twice daily. There was no musty smell, no bugs, we did have a little lizard find his way into the room. But it is Mexico! There was a door in the hallway between the bathroom and the bedroom. This is a nice feature b/c it allows bathroom privacy and blocks out hallway, music noise from the outside. I would recommend a third floor room. The floors are tile (which I like) but people walking upstairs is very loud. We switched rooms after night one to a third floor. The beds were firm. Only Negative- The gym smelled horrible. You will need to walk to the Yucatan which is next door. Their equipment is a little old but ok. Still much much better that the Palace Mexico. The rest of the trip... Ground transportation from the airport to Playa del Carmen. When coming from the airport take the ADO bus.They are huge-brand new Mercedes buses. There is a bus coming to and from the airport to Playa about every 45 minutes. The bus is about $10/person each way. Also the ADO bus goes to Cancun every 15 minutes for about $3.50 each way. We took the ADO bus to Tulum for a day trip. It was about $5 each way and $5 entry fee into Tulum. We bought a round trip ticket with the return ticket open. This means you can take whatever time you want on the return. The bus does have assigned seats. Check your ticket for assigned seats. Ask to sit near the front, so you can see the movie they show. Plus you get a better view. FYI- when in Tulum, we asked one of the vendors the price of a cold coconut, he told us the price and then proceeded to cut open the coconut, when all we did was ask about the price. The price was too high and we started to leave. He called the police saying we had ordered the coconut, we were stealing. Moral of the story- beware of the cold coconut vendors and their $3 little scam. I was a little scared, with him calling the police and the unfairness of the whole situation. I am not one to ruffle feathers or cause a scene which is why I walked away with the tyrant following me. I tried to not let it ruin my day, but it is hard to forget. PS the police never came. Fifth ave- Overrated and the street vendors are a bit much The one pearl I did find was at Yaxche with Filo as our waiter. Be sure to ask for Filo! The cuisine is authentic Mayan food-which I have never had but now love. The place feels like you are eating in a candle lit, romantic tree house. Be sure to ask for a table upstairs. For about $50 we had appetizers, drinks and each a lovely dinner. My partner had pork with candied onions and corn torillas. Fantastic! I hope this has been helpful, please forgive any typos. Hope you enjoy your trips, say hello to Filo for me! Sincerely, Jennifer Flight attendant

Reviews.Title: “Thorough review the only one you need to read”
Reviews.Author: Stlchiropractor
Reviews.Content: Overview of the area. The Riu palace Mexico is in the Yucatan peninsula. Riviera Maya is an of the Yucatan Peninsula south of Cancun and it is similar to “the Midwest” in the states = Rivera Maya is just an area. This resort is just outside of the City of Playa Del Carmen, in a gated community called Playacar. All traffic is stopped at the gates to make sure that they actually have business there to get in. The Riu Palace Mexico is one of six total Riu resorts that you will have access to. The Riu Palace Riveria Maya, Riu Tequilla, Riu Yucatan, Riu Playacar, and Riu Lupita. Please see below for more info. My perspective- We have stayed at 5 all inclusives in Mexico and one in the Dominican. This was by far the best. We are a couple in our early 30’s and travelled with another couple for this one. We stayed 5 nights and travelled out of St. Louis on a 2 ½ hour charter flight and paid 549.00 before taxes for the five nights, so we feel this hotel was a steal. Check in- The palaces are the only two that have an air conditioned lobby which is much appreciated. The lobby was very nice. We were greeted with a drink, and they overviewed the property-gave us info on what restaurants were open at what times, where the bars were, spa, etc. I had sent an email to palace.mexico@riu.com prior to arriving to make reservations at a restaurant and request an upgrade. Adrian who answered the email greeted us and took care of the requests. Rooms- The rooms are spacious. They are cleaned twice a day which is great. Mostly people go to the beach, come back, then leave for dinner. They clean up any sand that you may have brought back while you are out in the evening. The bathroom is nothing special, but it does have a bidet. We did not find the bed hard. Make sure to request one mattress pad and one comforter to cover both beds if they do not provide this for you already. The AC was cold as was the fridge. There is a master switch at the front, so if you hit this you turn off the fridge so it won't be cold. The room had a walk out patio, (3rd floor) and a seating area with a flat screen TV. We had no problem with the safe. The liquor dispenser in the room is cool, but we did not use it much. No bad smells or must was noted. There is only one elevator and this is not a huge resort, but it has three stories. We were on the top and took the steps quite a bit. If this is a problem request ground floor. Pool- This area was nice. There is a swim up bar, and it did not smell bad. The pool at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya was much nicer however. Service was good and there were plenty of chairs. Beach- This area was by far the best we have ever seen on a trip. If you are a beach person you will love it. Clear blue water and white sand. It is also very big and wide with shade if you need it and plenty of chairs. When we went the water was ridiculously calm and warm, it was like being in a gigantic bathtub. Fish would swim right up to the shore, if you waded in you could see them before you got knee deep. There is free snorkeling and kayak rental which we took advantage of. There are also other free non motorized sports. Grounds/Service- Immaculate and well manicured. There is a really neat walkway between the Riu Yucatan and The Riu Palace Mexico that gives you a tropical view. The service also was great. Top notch, just ask and they will accommodate. The twice a day cleaning and turn down service was a nice touch. Food- We went to all of the restaurants, and buffets. The on the beach food was the least best. The beach restaurant had cook to order pasta, but could get redundant. The food was always hot. If not I am sure they would heat it up for you. The main buffet was also good with cook to order stations, fresh juice, and liquor/wine/beer. For the other restaurants men need pants and you need reservations that can be made in the morning supposedly at 830-1030, but just ask if you are leaving early on an excursion and they will accommodate you. There are only two seating times 6:30 and 8:45. I never had a problem with making reservations, Yamir was great. Remember that you can get more than one entrée or appetizer or dessert if you desire. Krystal-gourmet-we liked the best. The shrimp ravioli is very good and the chocolate cake-lava cake was great. I had the sea bass which was cooked perfectly and the lamb. It was very good. Bodega is the Brazilian. They brought out about 8 different meats on skewers and fed you until you said stop. The steakhouse is the beach restaurant during the day and was good also. Steaks were cooked as ordered. The Japanese was just ok. I like sushi, and they don’t really have sushi. They do have smoked salmon here and at the buffet which was great. The room service was not very good. If you were very drunk and very hungry it was edible. I will say the same for the “food” at the sports bars at the different resorts. Entertainment- This was adequate. It is what you make of it. The night shows were okay. There was always something going on from during dinner time. The day activities were fun also. We got to shot rifles which was fun. Sister properties- Riu Tequilla is directly across the street. This one seemed to be the Riu Drunk European-because there were always fall down drunk Europeans there when we visited. It does have the disco, and sports bar but, they aren’t really anything special. If you want night life go to Coco Bongo or 5th street. The Riu Yucatan is right next door. It has a far superior gym and some shops in the front worth checking out. There is a walkway that the people at the Riu Tequilla use to get to the beach between the Yucatan and the palace that is worth checking out. The Riu-playacar, this one is a little farther about 3 or so minutes walk. It had live music and a cool entertainment area, but the crowd here was much older- it could be nicknamed the Riu Hospice from what we saw. The Riu Palace Rivera Maya was very nice as well. It is past the Riu Playacar another 3 or so minutes. We got great service there, the sports bar was better than the Tequilla and pool was awesome. The Riu Lupita is small and a little further but there is a shuttle there that you can take back or into town which is a plus. It is past the Riu Yucatan. Excursions- First you need to get to town. You can get a taxi for as low as 4 USD. We did Tulum via collective but taxied back for 28 USD-make sure to haggle them. Tulum was nice and the collectivo was cheap but you get what you pay for. I would do this on your own vs. with a tour. The entrance price is 5 usd. Our favorite excursion was the Party Hopper. This is a must do. You ferry on your own to Cozumel. This is about a 45 minute boat ride on a nice sized vessel with live music. It costs 13 USD one way per person and leaves on the hour and the times vary. Once in Cozumel the party hop meets a location that will be told to you after you reserve it-check out the website. You go to four different bars on the non commercialized side of Cozumel and it is a blast. You get a free shot at each and this was the highlight of our trip. Misc- 5th street was worth checking out. There is a little shopping area closer with a starbucks right across the street that was worth checking out as well. If you are on the fence about this hotel, don’t be. It is fantastic. Make sure to check out all the sister properties. The liquor was not watered down, and you can always get more. Tell them what you like and they will make you a drink. I would bring insulated cups. The weather in late Sept was great. An early morning shower, and a few clouds, but high 80's and sunny over 95% of the time. Feel free to email teddcphd@aol with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Cant go wrong by choosing RP Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Mikie-10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week beginning 9-26-11. We have been coming to Mexico for over ten years and this place ranks right up to the top. It has excellent food although we liked the buffet more so than the specific restaurants. It has one of the best beaches we have ever been to. The service is outstanding. It is located in an area called Playacar that is basically a residential /hotel area that is gated. There are several RIU's in the area and if you stay here you can go to them all; which we did. If you like to dance go over to the Riu Tequila right across the street and go to the disco. It starts at around 11:00 pm. If you like the rainforest go over to the Riu Yucatan and check out the rainforest areas they have there. They have a path you can walk through. If you are quite and walk slowly you might see a monkey.The RP Riviera Maya was this hotels twin, very similar, maybe a bit newer. The only negative was the pool; it is time for some updating and maintenance and we didn't like the way it was laid out. Other than that this is a wonderful place for a holiday. Feel free to contact me with questions

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for the price-very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Lkytrvlr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Riu Palace Mexico September 27-October 1, 2011. This was our second time to PDC, last time in 2008 we stayed at the Royal Playa Del Carmen, which was wonderful, so that is what I have to compare the RPM to. We are in our late 20's, and this was a vacation to escape the demands of having a 1 year old--we needed relaxation and quiet! We arrived late (8pm) on Tuesday night. Check in was fast, and we were offered a welcome cocktail that was delicious. Our room was on the lower level below the lobby. I was initially disappointed in the room-it seemed dark and a little musty, but maybe that was because it was already dark out when we go there. It was spotless though-very clean-and stayed that way. The bed was a little firm, but we preferred it that way. The two beds pushed together actually make for a bed larger than a king which was nice! The maid staff did a great job cleaning and overall the room was pretty good. The beach was beautiful!! I usually prefer the pool to teh beach, but not here. It really was breathtaking. The water was blue and clear, and the beach area was actually pretty expansive. In this regard, RPM beat RPDC. We never had a problem finding a place to sit. The only thing lacking was bar service. There was a bar nearby you could go to for drinks (part of the hotel), but we were used to wait service and the RIU didn't offer this-would have been nice, but not a HUGE deal. Pool was nice, but not my favorite part. It could get kind of loud there mid day, but again, we didn't usually have trouble finding a spot. The entertainment was lacking, but we didn't mind all that much becuase we just wanted to relax and not do much anyways. Food: The buffet was decent for a large all inclusive hotel. Again, I felt the RDPC excelled in this area, so my standards were high. The breakfast was good-my husbands favorite part-as they had an omlette station and alot of variety. We enjoyed the a la carte restaurants for dinner. We tried Krystal (twice) and the pumpkin soup was so good as was the chocolate lava cake. We also tried the Japanese restaurant which was very good as well. Didn't get to the others. We did not do any excursions or even go to town, but we did walk the playacar area a little. There is a starbucks down the street and a little market, as well as many other RIU's to expore if you want. Next time we will likely stay somewhere on par more with RPDC, but for the price, this hotel was right on track.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: co_native29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a week stay at the Riu Palace. This was my second time to the area (previously stayed at Valentin Imperial) and my husbands first time. Overall it was a very nice hotel with very little to complain about. Rooms: The rooms are nice, spacious enough for 2 people with a little sitting area and a patio. As mentioned before, the beds are hard and not very comfortable. They are stocked with liquor, water and sodas. Food: I can't imagine anyone being unsatisfied with the food, there was something for everyone. Breakfast they had any type of breakfast you could imagine eating, even salads. Lunch was better in Don Julio with the other 2 lunch buffets just okay. Dinner we only ate at the buffets which were good with different theme nights. My one complaint is you had to make reservations to the sit down restaurants. I like the freedom of going when I want and this detered me from going. The one time I made a reservation I missed it. Pool/Beach: The beach was amazing, crystal clear water and very calm. We spend most of our time here. The pool was dissapointing. It was small and a big part of it was too shallow. Also when you go to the swim up bar there was this awful stench like someone threw up. The RIU chain seems very nice and I would most likely return here. The upside of this resort compared to the Valentin is the beach, much nicer. Pool is much nicer at the Valentin along with other things.

Reviews.Title: “Marcel & Diane Canada”
Reviews.Author: Marcel596
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the resort and i am more than satified.The food was excellent so were the drinks the place was spotless.I would like to thank all the staff and emloyes for the service and politeness,will visit again

Reviews.Title: “Review from March”
Reviews.Author: Franfromthepoconos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Mexico for 12 days this past March. Sorry for not entering this sooner-I thought I had written a review but found that I hadn't. This was our 7th stay at a RIU, but our first stay at this one. As always, my main gripe about the RIUs (and it's obviously not a huge one or we wouldn't have been to them 7 times!) is needing to make reservations for the al a carte evening dining. Other resorts of the same caliber as the RIUs manage not to need them, I just don't understand why the RIUs don't try it. Because of the need for reservations, we ate most of our meals, after trying each of the restaurants except the Brazilian, at the buffet. RIU's buffets, in my opinion, and especially this one, are second to none. The chocolate fountain with fruit for dipping was wonderful. The theme nights were always great. And, there was always a Mexican section to satisfy my love of Mexican food. The beach-as at every RIU we've been to except the one in Montego Bay-was great, with palm trees in abundance. The ocean water was lovely as well. However, on the days it was windy, it got a little rough. The swim-up pool area was fun. However, it was difficult to get out of as there were no stairs with a bar to hold on to. This would not be a problem for most, but I was only a few months post hip-replacement surgery. I informed the staff ahead of time about my surgery, and thery conveniently placed us on the first floor. The rom was beautiful and had no musty odor at all. Overall, it was a lovely vacation and I'm sure that we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 6-Night Stay at RIU Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: jhchan02
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at RIU Palace Mexico in PDC and returned 9/29/2011. I want to make this review as helpful as possible and don't want to write a novel. Things to keep in mind though: we traveled during off-peak hurricane season. There weren't crowds like there would probably be during spring break. Info & Tips: 1. Hotel Location - located in a gated community with many other hotels (including other RIUs where you can use their facilities) and residences, it felt safe walking around at all hours of the night. There was also a little "mall" near the hotel where you can get souvenirs and plan excursions. Also, for $6-7 taxi ride, you can venture down to Fifth Avenue and peruse the stores, bars, entertainment, etc. 2. Hotel Staff - very accommodating and happy to help. Our first day we had an issue with our safe. The front desk came immediately and fixed it. Also please tip the staff. I saw a lot of people order trays and trays of drinks and not tip. Though this is an all-inclusive, the staff really bend over backwards to get you everything you need 3. Beach - amazingly calm, clear, blue water. Never an issue looking for a beach chair. Again, this was off-peak season and this may be an issue for those traveling during the spring. Take advantage of the kayaks, catamarans, and snorkel gear (all included). We took some bread from lunch, grabbed our snorkel gear, and got to see and feed so many fish. They would just swarm around you...it was fantastic. 4. Pool - there were two pools (quiet and activity). I have to say the entertainment staff was really really bad. There really was no entertainment during the day except for bingo maybe. But that wasn't a big deal at all since we did our own thing and didn't remain seated by the pool for extended periods of time. It was just sad to see them try and fail. On two of the days we were there, they had parties on the beach with burgers, nachos, salad, etc. That was a nice attempt. As for chairs by the pool, we woke early the first morning to save seats, but realized it wasn't necessary (at least during our off-peak travel time). There was always something available and if there wasn't, you could always find something on the beach. 5. Food and Drinks - Breakfast was our favorite meal of the day. The fresh juices, the eggs made to order, etc. were great. I wouldn't say the food was all fantastic, but generally the food surpassed our expectations for an all-inclusive. We took advantage of the room service on one of the nights. It came within 15 minutes of ordering, which is unheard of in many other places. We didn't try all the specialty restaurants, but the two we did try (the steakhouse and Krystal (some fusion cuisine)) were pretty good. The service is a bit slow though, but nothing outrageous. DRINKS - it really depended on who made the drinks, but for the most part they were strong enough. They use cheap liquor though unless you make a specific request for Absolut, Bacardi, Smirnoff, etc. We tipped each time we ordered (whether poolside or at the bar) so service was always very prompt and we never had an empty glass. Also, we brought a thermos for our drinks because the cups they use by the pool are TINY and the drinks get warm very quickly. This was key and I credit other reviewers who gave us this idea. 6. Rooms - Generally spacious, but try to get a room facing the fountains. Also the BEDS...ugh the beds were terrible. They were the worst beds I've ever had to sleep on. You have to lay on this mattress cover type thing that's plastic and makes funny noises every move you make. As suggested by other reviewers, I emailed the hotel a week before arrival for a mattress topper and a room facing the fountains. Neither request was taken into consideration. Further, this hotel uses actual keys for your room, not keycards. And to top that off, your actual key has your room number etched into it. For worst case scenario purposes, I may as well have drawn a map to my room for a potential thief. This is the first hotel I've ever stayed in that still uses actual keys. Really? Overall we had a fantastic stay at RIU Palace Mexico. The upkeep to the hotel was great. The grounds were beautiful. The staff was fantastic. We would definitely return. On our visits to the surrounding RIUs in the gated community (with the exception of RIU Palace Riviera Maya since we didn't visit it), we definitely felt like our hotel was well superior to the others. The others felt a bit more crowded, a bit more festive, but I liked our hotel with fewer people and nicer grounds. I recommend this hotel and would definitely return. And for those who are hesitant about traveling during hurricane season, it's really a crapshoot. I was nervous and bought travel insurance. It only rained on two of the mornings we were there. After breakfast, it had cleared up and the rest of the days were sunny.

Reviews.Title: “Excelente!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shellshock18
Reviews.Content: LOVED this place!!! From the moment that we checked in!! The service was over the top!!! The grounds are beautiful and immaculate!!! Could not have asked for a better vacation. I cannot say enough about the service!!! They really work hard to keep your stay stress-free. I do have to give some thanks to: Raul, Danny, Gabriel, Amtonio, Nando, Elena, Paty, Neftali, Cocinero, Jose, Hiram, Mateo, Danny, Wendy, Santoyo, and Adela!!!! I know that I missed a few, but what a great team!!! If there is anything you need, just ask and they will try their best to accommodate you. Tips were appreciated but never expected. You received superior service either way!!! They all seemed to love their jobs. The food was good and the drinks were plenty!! The beach was beautiful white sand and the sea was crystal clear blue water. Never had a problem obtaining chairs at the beach or pool areas. The resort is in a great location. You can be in the town of Playa del Carmen within a 5 min cab ride or about a 30 min walk. You have the use of the sister Riu Resorts all within walking distance. Met a lot of great people. Cannot wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Nando71
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at Riu palace. The food was good and drinks were very good some places made the drinks better than others fo us best made was at night at the lounge.My wife was enjoying bbbc bacardi,baileys,banana,coconut and dirty monkeys was good also. The pool was awesome and beach was very nice. Our room a jacuzzi suite was huge with walk in closet private balcony and stairs from outside that take u to a private jacuzzi which we had specatular view of the beach.The rooms have a liqour dispenser with baccardi,tequila,brandy and vodka. The location was safe to walk around and about 20 to 30 minutes walk from 5th ave which has many shops and places where u can get massages at good price we loved sabai spa overall i plan to stay at Riu Palace again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Holiday”
Reviews.Author: john m
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a two week stay at the Palace Mexico, and as other people have said the hotel is fantastic. Everything from the food, cocktails and the service the staff gave was faultless. The only fault on our holiday was that someone decided to help themself to approx. 5000 pesos from our safe 2 days after we arrived. The hotel seem to think they are not responsible for this and Katy, the assistant manager gave us the brush off after we told her we were disgusted the hotel weren't going to do anything. Even after she took an electronic reading from the safe to show what times it had been opened. It had been opened at 1130am on the Wednesday, and we hadn't been there since 8 that morning and have 4 witnesses to prove that, but Katy didn't want to accept that. So if you are staying here be aware that your belongings aren't safe in the safe.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: linda b
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico on 24/09/2011.I was travelling in a party of 6 . This is a fantastic hotel,everything about it was brilliant.It is immaculately clean.The staff are more than willing to be of assistance,and are always willing to go that extra mile.If you are unhappy with this hotel......im sorry,but you must have a problem !!!! If I had to moan about something,it would be that you are only issued one key per room..On mentioning thisto the rep,on our departure day....he said that if we had asked,it would have been possible for an extra key....so please ask,if this causes inconvenience for you. Food is more than amazing,and is excellent quality,as was the drinks. On several occasions,a waiter was serving drinks on the beach ( both alcholic and non-alcholic) I would certainly return to this hotel....it was a very high standard

Reviews.Title: “brilliant time”
Reviews.Author: anneptr
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 week holiday and couldnt fault anything.The staff are great and cant do enough for you The service is amazing..Our room was regularly decorated with towel animals,and the beds and sink decorated with flowers and petals.everywhere was kept spotless.The cleaning of this place never stops.Tried out all the restaurants and the food was good in all of them.Was there for independence day,the hotel put on lots of fun games and lots of tequila tasting! On our third day into our holiday we had a phone call from the front desk asking if everything was ok with our room which i thought was a nice touch.Visited all the other rius except the lupita.They were all ok but im glad i chose this one.Saw the monkeys playing in the trees at the yucatan and the raccoon type animals at the tequila.People have said that the beds are too hard but i didnt have a problem with them.The beach is great,there was always plenty of free loungers.Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Randles18
Reviews.Content: First time to an 'all inclusive' hotel the whole experience was just amazing. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: hufty79
Reviews.Content: visited Riu Palace Mexico in Playacar in September 2011. I haven't got a bad word to say about this hotel the staff were fantastic everyone of them,the entire hotel and pool areas are immaculate and the food wonderful. Fantastic hotel friendly staff and wonderful beach all made for a fantastic time and would definitely recommend this hotel. Only saw about 6 children all 14 days so this isn't a hotel if you have kids who like to meet other kids but its good for couples who want a quiet relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Again, another wonderful visit and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: buminj
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 2nd stay at the RPM. We had yet another wonderful visit. Room was not ready upon arrival but we arrived at noon and expected this. One of the staff from the front desk came and let us know that it was ready. I had requested at least 2nd or 3rd floor and this was honored and we had the 2 full beds pulled together with the pad and it was just great. You could not tell it was 2 beds with this. I know everyone says the bed it hard but it was just right for us. Had left note the first day for extra water and Pepsi light and from then on had all we needed. Our housekeeping staff was wonderful. It was cleaned close to the first thing every morning and we had towel art and flowers arranged. Evening turn down service was also good. Always had plenty of towels and face clothes. Housekeeping staff do not get enough praise for the work they do. They are excellent at meeting your needs and getting their work done. Only issue we noted one day was that the pool around the pool bar area did not seem as clean as the other pool. May have been because of more people being in that area. Music at night was great. Do enjoy this part of the resort. We did not do any of the a la cartes but felt we had plenty to eat at the buffet each day and lot of variety. Would not have done this different. did not seem that people were having any problems making reservations. Too many wonderful staff to name. We spent most of the time at the lobby and were taken very good care of by them. Elena, Hiram, Emmel just to name a few. I am not sure I have spelled the names correct. also want to thank Jaquin, one of the managers in the buffet area that we spoke with frequently. Very nice young man. Congrats on your upcoming wedding. Front desk staff were very helpful when we had any questions. Never had any issues at all during our visit. Like that the safe is digital, would be nice if no longer had the key for the door but can live with that. Also like the way they have done the doors so there is not the loud slam when people close their doors. We felt welcome from the moment that we arrived until we left. Were asked when we would be coming back. Would highly recommend this resort to anyone and plan on returning again soon. Thanks again to all the staff who made our stay so enjoyable. Look forward to another visit soon

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: voyagemom
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Hurricane Irene - our family of 5 was able to extend our stay in PDC by three days. We started out with 8 days at the Riu Tequila which we thought was just fantastic with a value that could not be beat. However, when we realized we could have 3 more days in paradise we decided to see how life was with a "gold" bracelet...Thanks to TA - we had met up with another family with teens earlier in the week who had previously stayed at the Tequila who gently informed us that they had no regrets making the "upgrade". The only thing that was equal between both hotels was the extraordinary staff and service which is unparalleled anywhere I have traveld in the world. So with packed bags at 9 am - we simply crossed the street and checked in. We did not expect to have a room right away and to our surprise 1 of our 2 rooms was ready. We made our reservations for Krystal and hit the beach. As it is really the same beach as the other Rius - there was no big difference there. However, as soon as we hit the pool we starting seeing a difference. There were no rowdy sports at the pool as at the Tequila. Thought my guys who fully partook in games would be missing that fun. Instead, there was a warm welcome from other TA family as well as all the other kids at the pool. While there were much fewer kids (and people in general it seemed), it was easier to interact with those who were there. Both my boys (14 & 9) made a bunch of friends that they saw throughout the 3 days. As the Tequila is so spread out with so many kids - my guys did not regroup with the same kids ever. RPM felt more like a country club where everyone knew everyone than an AI. I know that the RPM is quite big - but it never felt crowded like the Tequila or the Yucatan. The only thing missing was the Sportsbar which is fun in the evening for pool for boys and worth visiting. We did not like the Sportsbar at RPMR - very boring when we went. We all noted a difference between drinks (kids & adults) between the Tequila and RPM. They had much better choices at RPM which were more fruit based. The kids and I all enjoyed the fruit punch. And later in the day the Coco Rossa was fabulous. You could have Cava morning, noon and night if you wanted. I'll get to the wine at dinner later. There was a huge difference between the accommodations that we noted right away. While we had no view outside of palm trees - we thoroughly preferred the RPM. Standard rooms felt like suites. Balconies are huge! Bathrooms were large. And the woodwork was beautifully done in the room. Towels were white (as opposed to brown). And it felt like the room was constantly being spruced up. Turn down service is something I could get used to. The kids enjoyed room service for breakfast while us parents indulged in mimosas and the extensive breakfast buffet. Loved every minute of dining out on the patio in the morning. Best breakfast in the world - IMHO! As everything seem smaller and more manageable at the RPM - as a family we split up for lunch. The boys (Dad included) preferred lunch at the beach: fiesta or beach restaurant. My daughter & I preferred to dine on linen with a glass of wine at lunch. Loved that we could all do what we wanted allowing special time for everyone. The biggest surprise of all was that the kids (as well as the adults as well as the Maitre D) loved the "gourmet" a la carte restaurant Krystal so much we did it 2 nights in a row. I might also add everyone had clean plates (both nights). The quality of the food and service literally blew us away. Felt like we were dining in a top restaurant in NYC. Fantastic. At our first dinner, a German man was celebrating his birthday and it was so much fun when literally the whole room joined in singing. I think the overwhelming good will of everyone there inspired the man to then serve his cake to every table with an introduction and thanks for sharing with him such a happy day. I felt that this really reflected the ambiance at the RPM. While it may be a big international AI - it feels more like a very intimate club where everyone takes time to relax, indulge in the good things in life, enjoy each other and be open to meeting new people (staff & guests). It is such a beautiful setting which inspires such a wonderful experience on so many levels. Obviously, we are planning on returning. The sooner the better!

Reviews.Title: “Just returned for a second trip to Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: NAP1981
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Riu Palace was seven years ago and the second time was just as wonderful! The two most important factors for me are beach and cleanliness - so that is why I give this hotel five stars. The staff is beyond friendly and I always felt welcome. They go above and beyond for everything - service and entertainment. The grounds are meticulous and gorgeous. I can't comment on the pool area since I never went. The beach is great - lots of chairs and gorgeous water!!!!!! I was in heaven!!!! I really liked the Krystal and Miyagi restaurants. The buffet was OK but I wasn't raving about it like the restaurants. The rooms are very clean although their decor is outdated. We didn't spend much time in there though. What really sucked was the two full size beds pushed together. And the beds were very hard. I highly recommend this place - and I definitely plan on returning!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time....ignore the nit pickers!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jess-lou
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay at the Riu Palace Mexico for two weeks (25th Aug - 9th Sep) and i cannot think of one thing which i would complain about or anything that we would change! For people who think this is a holiday for older people or families with children, then I should say that I am 21 and my boyfriend 24 so age really is important there is so much to do! When we landed the coach was there waiting which was air conditioned and there were plenty of seats (which was nice as it was boiling outside), as promised we were the 2nd drop off along with only 2 other couples - pictures of the hotel dont do the building justice it is amazing (we both felt very excited when we pulled up as the 5* rating was obvious compaired to the hotel we had just dropped other people off at). Check in was fast and we were told lost of information about the hotel and all the other Riu Hotels on the complex (all of which Riu Palace guests can use with just a flash of your gold wrist band) we recived a complementary fruit cocktail and were directed to our room, whilst a porter brought our bags. There is so much i could write about this amazing hotel but here are just the main points I think would be helpful: * TIP!!!! The staff are lovely all the time and will so anything for you but honestly a small tip here and there to the more attentive staff and you will notice a significant difference. We tipped a man who brings drinks on the beach (only 20 pesos) and we never had an empty glass he even brought down some Absolute Vodka to top up my cocktails! *German in the buffet resteraunt truly made every tea time meal amazing, we tipped him and from then on he had a table with flowers and champagne flutes waiting for us! *Trips, we did Chichen Itza and Coba although they seem similar in the thompson trip guide, if you enjoy history then its well worth doing them both! Anyway hope this is helpful if you need anymore info or have any questions then dont hesitate to ask.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slacky-11
Reviews.Content: just returned from Riu Palace Mexico, rooms spacious, staff wonderful nothing was to much trouble, I would go back in a tick, thanks for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and worry free vacation!”
Reviews.Author: baci0124
Reviews.Content: A perfect vacation from the moment we arrived. Food, service and rooms were fantastic. The beach was so beautiful and there were plenty of chairs. Breakfast was the best meal of the day! But that's not to say dinner wasn't delicious each night.

Reviews.Title: “perfect vacation in a perfect place”
Reviews.Author: traveler1075
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about our stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. The rooms are spacious and clean. Yes it is two beds pushed together but the bedding was across both of them and did not present a problem to either of us. The buffet is probably the best we have seen and the wait staff is fabulous at all three meals. We fell in love with Abraham and would have taken him home with us if he would have gone!!!!!! The specialty restaurants that we ate at were very good. We skipped the Japanese and did not care for the Brazilian but that was just our own tastes---everyone else thought they were fine. The beach is the best! The water is crystal clear and shallow enough you can walk a long way out. The palm trees are numerous and the staff was busy keeping it clean. We walked the beach several times to the north and the south and it was always a pleasant experience. The entertainment team seemed to work hard all day. We enjoyed the piano bar and the nightly ensemble groups in the gazebo, but did not go to the shows afterward. We would certainly go back there any time.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Pretty good Value for the price”
Reviews.Author: _CAA_75
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Riu Palace Mexico. Room was spacious, we enjoyed the patio with some local critters to look at too (not sure what they were, overgrown squirrel looking thing, minus the tail). It seemed the maids constantly were cleaning and making our beds and bringing us clean towels. Counted three times per day. Every day we had a new towel-animal waiting for us too. Bed was kinda hard, disappointed about the two twin beds pushed together to make a "king" bed. There was a weird plastic cover over the mattress though, which was awkward. The room was so humid that my entire suitcase that I had laid flat on the floor for two days was covered in green, fuzzy mold.. Gross! All our clothes wreak like mold too. Lobby bar really made the best drinks, but we felt the food overall really should be alot better for a hotel of this class. The specialty restaurants really weren't that special. The sushi at Miyagi tasted like it had come pre-packaged and my salmon had a funky bi-taste. Brazilian was bland and needed seasonings. Ended up going to the buffet instead, the pasta station was really good. One morning there was a roach on thecounter by the bagel station, which we pointed out to the attendant. For some reason, the coffee was not very good there which was strange. Beach is fantastic, preferred over the pool as there was no breeze. It never felt crowded. The first few days there were plenty of drink service but the last two days we had to get our own.... Not sure what happened there (?). Massage huts were nice too. Bought some trips through the travel agent at the hotel to Chichen-itza, came to find out the wal-mart in town sells the same trip for a lot less ($69). Its worth it going to town to book the excursions etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Palace standards but still fine”
Reviews.Author: kfpd404
Reviews.Content: My husband & I along with another couple just got back from a 4-day stay at Riu Palace Mexico. Check in was quick and easy. We arrived around 3 so our room was ready. My husband had emailed the hotel prior to our arrival to see if we could make dinner reservations at the specialty restaurants. We’d like to give a BIG THANK YOU to Katy Black, Assistant Manager. She was so kind in making us reservations for 2 out of 3 of the nights we were staying. We had no problem making reservations for our last night there. We had the pleasure of eating at El Patio (Steakhouse), Krystal (Fushion) & Miyagi (Japanese). The food at all 3 of the restaurants was excellent. No complains from any one in our group. The breakfast buffet was just ok. My husband & I found that the service during breakfast was lacking quite a bit. We’ve been to several other Riu Palaces & service has always been over the top. This one seemed very short staffed & lacked motivation. We noticed also around the pool the service was also sub-par. Dirty glasses lined the edge of the pool & in varies locations. Just not up to Palace standards in our opinion. The beach was quite crowded but you could always find a chair. The beach vendors do stop & ask if you would like to purchase something but once you told them no they moved along. This beach has lots of shade so anyone looking to get out of the sun wouldn’t have a problem finding a spot. On our last night there after dinner we walked over to the Sports Bar in Riu Tequila to see if we could catch the college football game. We asked the bartender if she could find the game, which she was able to & turned it on so we could watch. Again our only complaint with this resort was the lack of wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!”
Reviews.Author: UK Traveller S
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from this hotel and have to say it was magnificent. We have stayed in other 'nice' hotels, but this was by-far the best. Beautifully kept, great staff, lovely food, fab rooms and the beach is unreal. I have to admit, I initially had doubts about this hotel (after booking it by mistake- I meant to book the Las Americas) so watched TripAdvisor like a hawk to see what I had let myself in for. Thankfully, it was a blessing in disguise and it was an amazing hotel in a great location. There is no mistake- the Riu Palace Mexico truly is a palace! We also went to nosey round the other Riu's on the same street and they cannot compete with the Palace. Go there, you won't regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: NormanWhiteside
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights. Loved (almost) everything about it. Room was excellent and spacious, nice pool, bars were all well-stocked and restaurants served some excellent food. Ignore reports complaining that all-inclusive hotels palm you off with cheap brand drinks or watered down beer. This hotel did not scrimp on anything. Staff could not do enough for us, constantly bringing fresh drinks to us by the pool and even on the beautiful beach. Evening waiting staff were excellent, efficient and friendly without being overbearing, too. Waiters at dinner were sometimes a little patchy if ordering drinks they weren't used to serving (let's face it, only the English ask for Gin and Tonic with dinner!), but other than that, service was faultless. Location is great, too. If I had to find fault, it was this...There's so many water-sports activities on the beach that so could sometimes smell the diesel or 2-stroke from the jet-skis and speed boats. That really is my only criticism. I'm not the sort of person to go to the same place over and over again, but if I were to go to Mexico again, I'd have no hesitation in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Was the Palace Palacial?”
Reviews.Author: rantam
Reviews.Content: Wednesday to Saturday was outstanding however, Sunday to Tuesday the service dropped off and the food was not as good. Ala cartes were o.k. but the night we went to the Japanese we liked the sushi the most the rest was o.k. That night there was sushi on the buffet. With the service being much slower at the ala cartes and the food to our family was not better then the buffet, after our 2nd ala carte the gourmet, we were done with the time constraints and just enjoyed the buffet for the rest of the time. If you do book them, I recommend Sunday to Tuesday as the buffet quality seemed less on these days. To us the worst night at the buffet was the Italian, it seemed about the only difference was a lasagna. Buffet a few notable foods for us were the carpaccio, beef wellington, sushi, onion soup with croutons, chocolate covered strawberries, very large cold crab claws one night only, unpeeled cold shrimp was good, they did have it one night peeled and cooked. I like red wines and was fortunate enough to have Giovanny at the buffet let me taste the selections, I enjoyed the diavlolo cab and there was a shiraz but not sure if it was diavolo. The wines weren't what I would drink here at home but they were o.k. Room Service was O.K. You could order a light breakfast if you put it out the night before, finally found the sheet to order it on in the drawer. We had to catch an early shuttle but room service breakfast and main buffet were not available until 7 a.m. Of course all the other items were available 24 hours. We ended up walking across the street to the Riu Tequila sports bar as it has sandwiches and fruit to go. Drinks were good of course the lobby had the best. I enjoyed the Ernest Hemingway, Mango Margarita, Espresso Martini just to mention a few. It seemed when we first arrived it was all top shelf toward the end I found they were putting cheap coffee liquor in my white Russians, I thought we just had a bad bartender but when I saw him make it I noticed he was not using Kahlua for the most part they did. I found that strange again it started on Sunday. Beach was beautiful, water was clear however, due to a slight incline I found it hard to walk down the beach with just my feet in the water. It was like one leg was shorter then the other. It was swimable and nice though. Pool was pretty, loved the flowers on the bottom. I didn't like the fact that they only had ladders to get into and out of the pool with. It would have been hard for and elderly person and sometimes we take my mom-in-law. Animation team was O.K. not as wild as the Yucatan next door but we enjoyed it being a bit quieter and knew what to expect from previous reviews. We weren't there to party so it worked for us. Special things. They had a beach party twice, it was dancing on the beach and decorations around noon. One day they had Paella another day it was just burgers and hot dogs. They also had special drinks near the beach bar, coconuts with or without alcohol and fresh blended fruit one day which is my favorite. In the plaza they had some flaming shots and I believe special Mexican coffees one night but my favorite again were the fresh fruit daiquiri's they had kiwi, peach, strawberry, mango etc. Rooms were O.K. We looked out to trees (not palm trees), it was nice to have a private balcony though. We had 2123 and 2122 it was quiet on the top floor and exited near the pool. Email request received pretty prompt response. I had inquired about what types of shoes were required for men and the reply was any. I had send an email mentioning we were return visitors having been to the Riu Tequila previously but got nothing special. My request for a specific area they were unable to fill. I had also requested one room be a king bed the other two separate beds with mattress pads, none of that was done. We enjoyed the resort too much to even bother trying to rectify these small issues. Palace Mexico to Palace Riviera Maya, we walked down a few times to enjoy the infinity pool but I hated the headless statue as you entered from the pool into the lobby!!! Having a sports bar there was a plus. I'm sure if the price were the same I would have a tough time choosing between the two. I also much preferred the larger fountains at the Palace Mexico. So was it Palacial for us?? Not by my definition but it was a step up in service from our previous resorts and it would be hard to go back down, :).

Reviews.Title: “The staff are wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: steve r
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were upgraded straight away due to an e-mail I sent them, saying it was our anniversary. Couldn't do enough for us. The Hotel is really well kept, and the staff are lovely. All of them have that little bit extra time to give you. Nothing is too much trouble. We tipped in dollars and pesos. The Buffet, be it breakfast, lunch or dinner is outstanding. The specialist restaurants are all really nice, and top notch. The best is the Steakhouse. The one we didn't rave about was the Brazilian, but I'm being picky!! Must do trips are Tulum and Coco Bongo! DO COCO BONGO! It's a great night. The entertainment in the hotel is really good. The pool is great. Split into two halves. You choose where you sit! Get down early with towels unfortunately. 8am should get you anywhere. The beach is fantastic. Well it is the Carribean!! Sunrise was lovely, sat on a bed with a coffee from restaurant To Go! All in all a lovely, relaxing, special hotel. From gardeners, through waiter/waitresses, to reception, everyone has a smile. They are a credit to the company, and I have thanked them. If you see a bad review, just ignore it. This hotel is first class! Other Riu Hotels are not as good, but to be fair, that doesn't make them bad. Just go to the best!! You will enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL AND LOCATION.”
Reviews.Author: 500DAVE500
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best. The location is right on the beach, the food always excellent and it is very clean. The staff are more than willing to help and it really is total relaxation when you arrive at this hotel. It is one of the best we have stayed in. We were there on honeymoon in August 2011. There are a wide variety of trips to do while in mexico and I would definately recommend COBA (Pyramids) and the Mayan Village visit in the jungle. All the trips are priced in American Dollars so it is worth taking dollars and Mexican Pesos. The people are friendly and you could even leave your bag or camera on the beach without the fear of it being stolen. it just doesnt happen there. Remember when you arrive in Mexico that if you are tipping the porters at Cancun Airport, a $1 note is sufficient and they are quite happy with that. If you book into this hotel you have the right to use every other Ruiu Hotel around the area, about 5 in total. the Mexico Palace and The Mayo are definately the best with the others more suitable for children. Dont listen to anyone who moans about this hotel, there is nothing to moan about other than the humidity can sometimes be quite high but all in all this is the hotel if you want a good holiday in MEXICO. It is also very safe to venture out in the evenings with no problems whatsoever. FIVE STAR.

Reviews.Title: “This place is wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Beverly B
Reviews.Content: We had never been to a Riu resort before and I am glad we tried it this time. From the moment we arrived at the property the service was outstanding and the place was fantastic. The access to the ocean and to the pools was easy and both places were terrific. There is a buffet three times a day and the variety is wonderful for an all inclusive. There are five restaurants on the property. We did not try all of them but the Bodega which is hosted by Raul is OUTSTANDING. The food in The Bodega is top notch and Raul and his team never stop running to make this a fantastic experience. The Krystal restaurant is also a excellent restaurant run by Yamir and his team. The entertainment team has some really good people on it and they tried to include the guests in daily activities. I am very very fussy about cleanliness and I had no complaints. the rooms were cleaned daily and everything in the resort was lovely and clean. The nightly entertainment could use a little work, but generally it was okay. My teenage children had never been to an all inclusive and they were thrilled to be there and enjoyed all aspects of the resort. We are looking forward to going back again and perhaps trying another Riu resort as well. This place is TERRIFIC

Reviews.Title: “The most fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayellHerts
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the hotel my family and I entered the enormous reception and looked around not sure exactly where the actual desk was. We were greeted by a receptionist waving her arms above her head with a huge smile on her face saying "Hola, welcome - over here". After such a fantastic welcome this hotel did not disappoint in any way. The rooms are huge, the hotel is spotless (they are always cleaning it) the food is good and the staff are the most amazing we have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Christine T
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from Riu Palace Mexico in Playa Del Carmen, the first words when we arrived after being VERY tired was, "welcome home." I can't begin to tell how how amazing the service was from every single facet of this place. The beaches were unbelievable, pools were great, every single housekeeper said hello, flowers and different little "gifts" left on the bed every night. Even balloons in my son's room. From Raul the maitre d, to Tony in the open air veranda, were absolutely top notch. There is a little gift / amenties shop across the street. Beaches are clean with palm trees, clean water, great activities for all members of the family...thank you Riu for making my father's 70th birthday celebration one we will cherish forever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another success!”
Reviews.Author: thumper1031
Reviews.Content: We would not stay anyplace else but a Riu Palace. This was our first time at tha Riu Palace Mexico and we where not disappointed. Everything was first class. We never had a problem getting into the restaurants and the food was outstanding. The buffet was always good. We walked into Playa a couple of times and enjoyed the night life. Staying at the Palace allowed us to visit and eat at the three hotels across the street. not as nice as the Palace but ok to stop in. On our way to the Playa we stopped at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya and wanted to come back here this year. We will be there in November. Any questions please feel free to write.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at its best”
Reviews.Author: 1eyeguy
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6 night 7 day stay at the "RIU Palace Mexico" in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico. Located about an hour from Cancun Airport, the RIU Palace Mexico is one lovely place to stay at. The hotel entrance looks like the front of a palace some where in Europe. As you enter the resorts lobby you are entranced by the beauty of the marble, flowers and fixtures. The staff at the front desk was on top of their game. We were wisked to our suite (which the front desk staff upgraded up to) that over looked beautiful gardens and fountains on the center area of the resort in under 5 minutes. The suite was very attractive, clean and up to date. There was a bedroom, sitting area and a large outdoor balcony. The bathroom was done in marble with a separate toilet area. For our stay the rooms air conditioner was great. We found the room to be very quite during the day and night. The resort area has three swimming pools, one with a swim up bar. Around the pool area there is volleyball, fitness in the pool, bingo games and rifle target shooting. The beach area was spectacular. The sand a clean light beige with several hundred sunning chairs located either in the sun or within the hundreds of palm trees for shading. Watch out for the coconuts falling from the trees.The ocean in this area is a clear, clean and a beautiful light blue. Scuba divers love the area for coral and fish viewing. There is available on the beach a massage area. The ocean was smooth with hardly a wave. During the day food is served and drinks offered on a continued bases. Did I fail to mention that the resort is all inclusive? All the food and drink one could desire 24 hours a day. The RIU has 7 restaurants to dine in. Your choice. Steak, lobsters, shrimps etc. Each night the buffet features different region of food, Italian, Mexican and European. We found the food to rate an 8 out of 10 for dinner. Breakfast is all you could ask for. In your room is a minibar loaded with drinks. All part of the package. Each night there is a show put on, mostly dancing and some singing. I rated these shows at a 7. Nothing like the one's you see on cruise ships. The weather for all seven days was sun, sun and more sun. A wonderful tan was gotten by all of us. The hotel is a 5 minute, $7 dollar taxi ride to town. I was very surprised how nice their shopping area was. Very clean, modern and friendly locals. Its a must to visit the area known as "5th Avenue" in the evening. To end I found the entire staff to be attentive, helpful and as asset to the resort. Would we return? Yes, yes and yes.

Reviews.Title: “It's the people who make the trip”
Reviews.Author: GregT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just booked another trip to Playa and chose the RPM. We stayed last year for my birthday and the people there couldn't have been better. I keep wanting to try other hotels, but my wife really likes the consistency of the RIUs. She made a connection with the bartenderess (is that a word?) in the lobby bar and gave her a whole lot of school supplies (paper, notebooks, etc.) that could be passed around. Location, food, etc are good. But the people are amazing! Towel art, rose petals on our dining table (even though we left before they could sing happy birthday), etc. This is our 7th or 8th time to a RIU in the last 5 years or so. Granted, we tip well, but only because we want to - yes WANT TO!. This year we are bringing some blood pressure cups, school supplies, and other needed items. We'll drop them off at the hotel or Carboncito's(love it there) or on our way to El Fogon. Our only regret is we can't see the water from our room. We stayed at the IB Quetzel a bit ago ant they gave us a partial ocean view room Really nice, but our guests chose a room farther away so it didn't mean as much. You will love this place if you like good liquor, well prepared food, beautiful grounds, great beach, and people who have a heart. R. Gregory

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Bulent A
