Reviews.Content: Just pack your bathing suit and flip flops, that's all you need. We enjoyed the Mexican Riviera so much that we are thinking going back at least once a year. Prices were so low, we had a really great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Paulbrann
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 14 days in August. The weather was spot on with only one shower which cleared up quickly. First impression of the hotel was excellent. Efficient service on entry and a welcoming atmosphere. Rooms are very clean with a large bed. Mini-bar restocked daily. Speedy room service although the room service menu could offer more variety. The room are always cleaned to a high standard. The hotel ground are immaculately maintained. The service staff are impressively proactive and comparatively more professional than the staff at the Maya Palace down the road. This was a pleasant surprise. The pool is functional and ha a friendly feel. The service seems faster in the Palace Mexico. I put this down to staff to guest ratios. The pool service at the Riu Mexico is very friendly. The beach is just behind the pool area. It is beautiful! Especially from 8-11 when it is not as hot. I used some of the free watersports facilities and the motorised stuff. All very safe and professional. The food is spot on. We tried all the restaurants on offer and enjoyed them all for different reasons. Service with meals is superb. Your wine glass is never allowed to be empty. The lobby bar supplies you with the best drinks in my opinion. Overall, great hotel, nice staff and cracker location. It's nice to be able to utilise all facilities nearby. It mixes it up abit. Oh ya, the entertainment team were great. We thought we would leave the hotel most nights to go out but we were impressed with some of the acts on. Thanks to all that made it such an enjoyable holiday. X

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel, great service and fantastic food.”
Reviews.Author: leapealea
Reviews.Content: We visited the Riu Palace Mexico in August. There were 4 of us: My parents, my partner and myself. We all thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The food and the restaurants were fantastic except for the Japanese and La Bodega. Even in these restaurants, the service was amazing and high quality ingredients were used; they just weren't to our taste. The buffet restaurant was the best all-inclusive restaurant I have eaten at (a really huge choice, hot and fresh) and the Steakhouse (El Patio) and Krystal were also really lovely. Booking was never, ever a problem for us. Room service is limited but it is included in the price and they will deliver it 24 hours a day. The drinks were also really good. Branded spirits, proper glasses (all inclusive hotels that I have stayed before have insisted on plastics anywhere other than in the restaurant), lovely cocktails and brilliant service. The lobby bar was particularly good - you were served extremely quickly and it was air conditioned. Drinks in rooms were also great - 4 spirit optics and a full fridge every day. You can also use all the bars in the other Riu hotels in the resort (there are 5 Riu hotels here altogether). The hotel itself was spotlessly clean and extremely well maintained even if the sunbeds on the beach could have been smartened up a bit. The beach was great and always enough beds to go around. There were a lot of cigarette ends but it's not the hotel that I blame for that although perhaps they could invest in some ashtrays. Giovany, who cleaned both of our suites, made sure that we always returned to immaculate rooms. Like many Caribbean hotels, there can be a damp smell but this was not overpowering. Every single member of staff, from the door men, the maids, waiters, bar staff, chefs reception staff and supervisors made you feel welcome and relaxed. Raul, Saul, Miguel, Hiram, Jorge and Paty were fantastic. It was wonderful! Please ignore bad reviews - my family have travelled a lot and we will all complain if something is not right. We all agreed that it was one of the best hotels for quality and service that we'd ever stayed in. We would love to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “The best service we have ever had anywhere in the world...”
Reviews.Author: Manic_organic
Reviews.Content: A group of 4 of us (2 couples) booked a 2 week all-inclusive at the Riu Palace Mexico (RPM) Playacar following extensive research on the area and hotel amenities - we were not disappointed!! Arrival: Arrived at the RPM exhausted following a 10 hour (advertised as 8 hour) Thomas Cook (TC) charter flight from Manchester, which at best can only be described as 'no frills'. The main meal was served just 2 hours into the flight and only a light snack of a scone later on. The main movie did not work and one of the toilets was broken, resulting in long queues. You also have to pay for all additional drinks and food - I have never before experienced this on a long-haul flight. This all made for a very long and tedious journey and we were relieved to finally arrive in Cancun. Exiting the airport was slow through customs, but straightforward, and our TC rep was waiting for us just outside the airport doors. Transfer by coach was fine and took about 1.5 hours, however, our coach was only half full so this could potentially take a lot longer and you can do it much faster in a taxi for only around US $50, which we will definitely consider for future trips. Playacar is a gated community of hotels and condominiums just outside of Playa del Carmen. Although it felt a bit like we were staying in Disney World, it is beautiful and meticulously well-kept and significantly quieter and pleasanter all-round than Cancun's glitzy hotel zone. Upon arrival in Playacar, we were greeted at the RPM by warm and friendly reception staff. The gorgeous lobby, in the trademark Riu Palace style, is modern but invokes an old colonial feel. After a short check-in procedure, we were handed some refreshing fruit cocktails and were given detailed information about the hotel and its facilities before a porter took our bags to our room. Your room key is on a string to hang round your neck, which is handier then you'd think given how much you are in and out of the pool, beach etc. - much less difficult to lose than room cards. We met the TC rep on the 2nd day of the trip, who was helpful and informative about the various activities and excursions on offer. The excursion prices quoted were very high e.g. the rep quoted a price for a whale sharks excursion which was US $75 per person more then we eventually paid through another operator and a staggering US $100 more pp than someone else on the same trip with us paid when booked through another company again. You all end up on the same trip anyway, so be sure to shop around. Room: The room was great! We had emailed the hotel in advance to inform them we were celebrating our anniversary and they had upgraded us to a junior suite with a large balcony on the 2nd floor overlooking the gorgeous courtyard with its fountains and 'chic' outdoor drinks area where people gather for the evening's entertainment. Without the upgrade, you can potentially end up facing the hotel next door! The staff had put balloons in the room and later added a gift and a note congratulating us, which was very thoughtful. We had a large balcony with sun-loungers and high walls for privacy and inside there was a two-seater sofa, coffee table and flatscreen TV (with a good range of Spanish and English language channels including ESPN and MTV) in a separate seating area. The bed was in fact two double beds pushed together giving the appearance of being absolutely huge. The bedding comprised light sheets, but there were blankets and spare pillows in the cupboard if needed. Fresh bedding was provided daily and there was always a fun 'twist' to the way the bed had been made, sometimes with the addition of flowers and rose petals. The air conditioning was adequately powerful, but not freezing. The bathroom was a good size with a separate room for the toilet, a large sink area for toiletries, a bath and shower and small hairdryer. The mini-bar was restocked daily and additional water can be ordered through the 24 hour room service. The lobby bar is also open till 7am so you are pretty much always able to get a drink if you want one from somewhere in the hotel. There is an iron and ironing board in the room, as well as an easy to use safe and filter coffee machine. Ice is available from machines at the end of the hallways on the 1st and ground floors and there is an ice bucket to fill below the optics dispensing branded vodka, tequila, brandy and rum, which are checked daily and restocked as required. The curtains are thick enough to adequately block out the light. The room was kept spotlessly clean by the staff who were always friendly, courteous and quick with their work. They also left new towel art every couple of days, which was all really amazing (we loved it so much we went to the lessons to learn how to make it). They also tidied up our toiletries in the bathroom, which we always appreciated, and would happily wait if you were not yet out of your room when they came to clean. We were really happy with our room and the only thing that could have improved it would be having wireless internet access, as this is currently only available in the lobby and (intermittently depending on traffic) the courtyard area, although it is free at least. Pool: The pool area was big and relatively quiet during the day (lovely) so there were plenty of sun-loungers nicely spaced apart. The pool itself could probably do with an upgrade soon, but was cleaned daily and a nice warm temperature. There was a volleyball net area, a pool bar, some in-pool seating at the sides near the bar and a separate pool away from the bar. There was also a toddler's pool near the children's club area. Unfortunately, this appeared to be seldom used and the majority of the children were near the pool bar area. The splashing and ball throwing was slightly annoying at times, but we can't blame the kids whose parents were clearly not bothered, at the pool bar, or otherwise elsewhere. At no time was the pool overrun with kids, however, I wondered if using the other lesser-used pool as a dedicated children's pool might be a good idea to keep the pool bar area splash-free. The pool bar itself was excellent and served all the drinks and cocktails you can get elsewhere in the hotel. We highly enjoyed the Mojitos and Miami Vice cocktails. There were unfortunately no bar snacks (other than peanuts) which would have been a nice addition. There is a nacho dispenser near the toilets in the pool bar area, but these did not look hugely appetising (the chips are nice, the cheese is not, being artificial 'squeezy cheese'). There is food available throughout the rest of the hotel on a 24 hour basis though, so you will not go hungry (see food section below). Beach: The beach area is huge so although it is busy, it is really pleasant in the 'garden area' and there is often a nice breeze which helps with the heat of the day. Sun-loungers and hammocks rest between the palm trees which provide great shade and there were occasional beach BBQs and dance parties to keep you entertained. There is a massage hut, a beach volleyball court and a water-sports hut where you are borrow snorkels, canoes, small sail boats and boogie boards for up to one hour at a time. They also offer jet skiing, diving, parasailing etc. for an additional price. If you are planning to do any snorkelling in the wider Yucatan area, we recommend bringing your own gear to save on equipment hire at cenotes and other snorkelling sites. The sea in front of the hotel was very clean and a beautiful turquoise colour, but was unfortunately highly congested with motor sports traffic (seemingly largely from the hotel next door) including jet skis, parasailing boats and speed boats which made it very noisy and choppy. There was also a frequent stench of diesel fuel - not a very pleasant atmosphere for relaxing in the sea unfortunately. We did enjoy some early morning dips before it got too busy and some moonlit strolls and if you walk along the beach up past Playa del Carmen there are some nicer, quieter spots. You are free to walk the entire length of the beach under Mexican law and there is lots of security patrolling the various beaches in front of hotels so it is all very safe at night in the strip leading up to Playa del Carmen. Recreation & Entertainment: The Animation team were excellent. In particular, Omar was an absolute star and made sure we had a fun-filled stay. Dianne, Carlos and Freddie were also great fun and all very professional. The team organise activities during the day including towel art lessons, spanish lessons, salsa lessons, volleyball, aqua aerobics, beach BBQs and table tennis competitions. There is also a Kid's club during the day which appeared to be very well attended. For the adults, the Animation team can also escort you on nights out to local clubs, including Coco Bongo and the Pink Elephant, at no extra cost, and will ensure that you get a good spot and great service in the club. The evening entertainment at the hotel is also really good. There are nightly shows for the children (Aladdin was great), followed by professional dance shows which are all on the stage adjacent to the courtyard. The shows have various themes on a 2-week rotation (our favourites were Movie Night, Grease and Michael Jackson). In between shows, there are live bands on the courtyard bandstand. There are also themed games nights, such as the casino and Mexican games night. There are musicians in the bar and lobby areas and a whole host of random extras like fashion shows around the pool and 'pop up' markets on different nights of the week - you don't even have to leave the hotel to do your souvenir shopping (although you will pay a higher price). Other recreational activities on offer include a tennis court (it was way too hot to play when we went), a spa facility comprising a small but adequate gym (2 treadmills, 2 bikes, 2 cross trainers and a step machine, free weights, incline bench, squat bar and cable machine for lat pulldowns etc.), massage and spa treatments, a sauna and hot and cold jacuzzi. There is also another jacuzzi tucked away in the corner of the courtyard gardens near the pool. Like the pool, the jacuzzis have seen better days, but are still nice. The spa looks lovely and smelled gorgeous. We didn't have any treatments but these seemed to be standard at around US $120 for their top massage treatment.  In short, you will not be bored at this hotel...! Food: There is an abundance of food on offer including the main buffet restaurant and 4 à la carte restaurants. Breakfast was our favourite meal of the day. Margherita's freshly made omelettes are the stuff of legends and she was an absolute delight each morning. As testimony to this, there was always an orderly queue patiently waiting for one of her quickly prepared omelettes with fillings of your choice. Hot and cold food is served buffet-style including, eggs, meats, breads, salads, muffins, fruit, cereals etc etc. Lunch was buffet-style again with all of the above plus pizza, burgers, grilled meats, pastas etc and the buffet dinner was the same again with additional themed meats, desserts and other dishes. The quality of the food was very good-to-excellent the majority of the time and there was a wide variety to choose from everyday. We particularly enjoyed the extensive salad bar and the guacamole, salsa and cerviche are to die for. Wine, beers and soft drinks are served across all meals. Between us, our group tried all of the à la carte restaurants. You book these on the day, in the morning from 8.30am near the courtyard and stage area, but get there early as most of the slots have gone by 9am. Our favourite restaurant was Krystal, (which has a fusion menu), because of the great service, food and atmosphere, but also largely because the steak house and Rodizio restaurants were not air conditioned which made for a very sweaty dining experience. Both the Miyagi (Japanese) and Krystal restaurants were small, air-conditioned and offered a nice change from the buffet dining. Room Service was really handy after a night out and generally very quick at all times of the day, but the limited menu choice was a bit disappointing. Please add French fries to the menu - easy to make and perfect post-clubbing food! The coffee was pretty terrible everywhere so bring your own cafetière, instant sachets and a kettle, or filters and coffee to use in the machine in the room if you are an addict. The espressos are ok and Starbucks is not far otherwise! The bars were plentiful, efficient and served a great selection of drinks and cocktails. You can get take-out espressos in disposable cups at the main lobby bar. At all bars and meals you can request specific wines I'd you find one you like (we loved the White Zinfandel rosé and the Chilean Cabernet red). Service: The service we received was truly outstanding and made this trip really stand out from anywhere else we have stayed. Our group has travelled extensively throughout the world and we all agreed that we have never before experienced a more friendly, helpful and professional service anywhere else in the world. Nothing was too much to ask and you felt pampered and cared-for every step of the way. Service was always with a smile and staff were attentive, pleasant and chatty, but not imposing.The etiquette in the restaurant and hotel generally was outstanding, but without any uncomfortable pretence. It was all of the little touches that really stood out, for example, staff come round in the evenings to check if you need fresh towels, they provide a poolside drinks service (remembering your round each time) and, most memorably, always greet you with a cheery and sincere "hola!". From the maids and porters, to the chefs, waiters and the front of house workers, the staff at this hotel work tirelessly to ensure that you have an amazing holiday and I have never before experienced a more friendly and professional service anywhere in the world. The staff in our hotel were also head and shoulders above those we encountered in other Rius and should be highly commended for their amazing work. Wildlife: There is some interesting wildlife at the hotel including sereque (best seen at around 6-7am or 6-7pm), some interesting looking lizards and pelicans flying by the beach. There are also a vast number of black birds with long beaks which I can only presume are the Mexican equivalent to pigeons in the UK. They are quite noisy and make some interesting calls, but they were quite entertaining and don't harass you or leave a mess (other than occasional sugar packets scattered about the bushes which they pinch from the outdoor breakfast tables). You can also see sereque and howler monkeys at the Riu Yucatan next door. Mosquitos and red ants are everywhere in this part of Mexico. I was savaged on the first night here and had to spend days treating painful and itchy bites. The mosquito repellant wrist bands do nothing. Buy the hardcore Deet products and possibly a plug for your bedroom at night. You will definitely need insect spray if you do any excursions to the jungle as you will be bitten to pieces. There is not much to see snorkelling off the beach and you can't go out very far due to the motor sports traffic. You might see the occasional fish go past and small crabs scuttling past further down the beach at nighttime. Location: The hotel is about 2.5km from the security barrier that leads out to Playa del Carmen. This is quite a hot walk, either on the road through Playacar, or on the beach, but taxis are cheap and you can also rent bikes from the Riu Tequila (across the road from the RPM). Playacar, although very artificial, is a beautiful place and a good base to explore the region from. Excursions can be pricy, so we found it more economical to rent a car and drive ourselves to the various towns and archaeological sites at our own leisure. You can park securely at the hotel for free and can also park at other Rius. Playa del Carmen was generally a lot more touristy and ranged from areas full of rowdy bars and street hawkers to quieter areas with nice cafés and boutique hotels. Much of the town beyond Avenue Constituyentes is where the locals live and seemed to be quite poor. This part of town is generally not for tourists, although the beaches up here are supposedly much quieter and nicer so worth a drive up if you have a car. The general Yucatan area all appeared to be very safe and we happily roamed about on foot, bike and car during our stay. Shopping: The hotel has a small shop selling sundries like batteries, disposable cameras, cigarettes, chocolate etc. and assorted beach wear, but is generally more expensive than shops outside of the hotel. Playacar has a small shopping precinct just across the road from the RP with a Starbucks, Avis car hire (incidentally the cheapest and best deal we found in and around Playa del Carmen), a drugstore/corner-shop and various souvenir shops. There is also a stand here for booking excursions and it is definitely worth shopping around and haggling for a better price for these because, as aforementioned, there can be up to US $100 difference in prices for the same experience when booked through different operators. There is an Oxo express supermarket in the Riu Yucatan next door to the RP and another Oxo further up the road from here and a pharmacy in the RP Riviera Maya. We found that the best place to buy souvenirs was in the Chichen Itza hacienda. The sheer number of sellers here serves to drive down prices, particularly late in the day when there are real bargains to be had (this is also the best time to visit if you can, as it is quieter and cooler). The items on sale here seemed to also be of better quality than those we found in town. Other Rius: The golden wrist bands of the RP are your golden ticket to go to any other Riu hotel for breakfast, lunch, drinks and access to the pool and beach facilities... or just for a nosey like us! We visited the Riu Yucatan, Riu Tequila and RP Riviera Maya in Playacar and the RP Las Americas in Cancun. These visits confirmed our view that we had chosen the best hotel in the Riu chain in this area and we were always pleased to 'come home' each time we visited another Riu. The RP Riviera Maya had a newer and nicer pool area and slightly more lively atmosphere in the pool, but a smaller and much less grand courtyard; the hotels are otherwise identical but the RP Riviera Maya was slightly more expensive when we booked. The Yucatan and Tequila were clearly lower classed hotels within the chain and definitely had a less luxurious feel, although they are possibly livelier if you are after that sort of vacation. The disco in the Tequila, La Piñata, serves all the Riu hotels in Playacar, but was small and disappointing. Save your time and energy for Coco Bongo instead. There is also a sports bar at the Tequila but as most of the football is on the ESPN in the RPMs rooms anyway, again I wouldn't waste your time visiting. Departure: Check out is at (a very respectable) 12pm and was very quick and straightforward. We had to wait around in the lobby for a couple of hours for out transfer so we had lunch and then drinks at the lobby bar while we waited. You can get small bottles of water from reception and there are toilets and showers in the lobby which you can use. The doorman will look after your luggage so you can go off and use the pool etc. while you wait. TC transfer to Cancun was fine as were the airport security procedures. The VIP lounge is not worth a visit – no food other than bar snacks and no vegetarian food. We went to Bubba Gump's restaurant instead where you can use free wifi. The flight back was shorter (9 hours) but equally as dreadful as the flight out. Two passengers in the seats in front of me started an argument over reclining seats (thankfully diffused by the stewardess before it really kicked off), it was noisy, smelly and the food dreadful. I slept as much as possible and was relieved to get home! I will definitely look into travelling with a more reputable airline in future. Flights aside, we all had a fantastic time at the RPM and would definitely recommend it for a luxury holiday in a fabulous location, with the best service you will ever experience. Recommended for: We would especially recommend the RP Mexico for couples, families, older travellers and anyone looking for a lovely, chilled, and hassle-free holiday. It is probably not a good venue for a party crowd (stag, hen dos etc.) as the hotel tends to go quiet after the evening entertainment finishes around midnight - try the Yucatan or the Tequila instead!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, great food and even better service”
Reviews.Author: lw12
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a nine day trip. Our rooms were not ready by time we arrived (it was before 3PM) but the front desk did give us our bracelets and welcome drink and let us use the hotel until they were. By time we were done with lunch our rooms were ready. We had balloons to look like flowers in our room and towel elephants on the bed. The fridge was completely stocked and the room was clean. The bell man made sure the AC worked before leaving the room and made sure everything was to our liking. There is service everywhere. They will bring you your drinks at the shows, at the beach, by the pool and in the lobby. Every night there was live music and a good show. If you wanted more excitement all you have to do is cross the street and go to the disco. Or if you want to catch up on a ball game. The Riu complex has two sports bars, one at Riu Tequilla and one at Riu Palace Playcar. The one great thing about staying at a palace is that all the hotels are included except for the dinner. The food was amazing. The buffets were great and a large variety. We were stuffed full at every meal. Reservations were not hard to come by. You do have to make sure you get to the reservationalist in the theater area sometime in the 8AM hour. Only small tidbit I would offer American travellers. Come prepared with some smaller bills or have some US dollars converted to pesos. You can use US at the gift shop and the shops accross the street, but they only give you change in US. The hotel front desk will not convert US dollars or give change for US dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Made my wedding perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Carmen T
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I travel, a lot! I have stayed in various different hotels/resort. This is, by far, the best resort I have been to. Many of the other reviews are misleading. The food was fantastic (there were so many different themes and restaurants to choose from), the service absolutely incredible (it seemed as though every staff member was there to make my stay perfect) , the views and rooms were immaculate (very clean and well stocked) , and my wedding was such a relaxing and exciting day (yes, I said relaxing)! The hotel handled all of the wedding planning, I made every decision through emails and then a final meeting upon our arrival to finalize the plans we had made. All of my friends and family were jealous of how carefree and relaxed I was throughout the planning! There are a few things to let future travellers know: 1. RIU hotels does not accept USD, only pesos or Visa and MC. 2. The hallways to the rooms are mostly open to the environment, don't expect cool hallways. However, the rooms are kept cool unless you have the front door or patio/balcony doors open. My A/C went out in my room (on my wedding day) and was fixed within one hour of calling the front desk, they were fabulous! 3. Men must take pants in order to have dinner at any of the restaurants, even the buffet. Be prepared! My husband and I are already planning a return trip back! The resort itself was immaculate and breath-taking, the staff made our stay so comfortable and welcoming. I couldn't have asked for a better wedding or vacation. It was absolutely perfect. I would without a doubt recommend this resort to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Resort”
Reviews.Author: Amy V
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler, both for work and for pleasure. I have stayed at a number of 5 star resorts as well as numerous all-inclusive resorts. This is the best all-inclusive I have been to. This was a family vacation (2 adults and 2 children, ages 9 and 15). We all loved this place! It was a great perk to be able to go to all of the other Riu resorts and use their amenities as well. There are 4 other Riu resorts within very easy walking distance (3 of them are within a 2 minute walk; the other is less than 10 minutes). Having visited all of the Riu's, I was glad we had chosen the Riu Palace Mexico, as I really thought it was the nicest one all around. The Riu Palace Playacar would have been a close second (they are almost identically built). Within walking distance is Playacar Plaza (less than a 5 minute walk). Loved this place because it has a Starbucks (which became a daily hotspot for us since we didn't care too much for the coffee at the resort). The Plaza also has a number of tourist shops and places where you can buy tickets for various excursions (I recommend you buy them at the Plaza rather than in the hotel lobby. We compared prices and it was a good bit cheaper at the Plaza). We purchased tickets for Delphinus (swimming with the dolphins), which I HIGHLY recommend. Also within walking distance of the hotel is downtown Playa del Carmen and 5th Avenue shopping. It takes 30 minutes to walk there and it was a very safe and beautiful walk. We even saw a number of young women out walking by themselves in the evening. We walked to 5th Avenue but then took a cab back to the resort afterwards since we were all a bit tired (it was $7 US for the cab ride back). This hotel is spotlessly clean...and I mean every part of it. They have an army of people who seem to be working around the clock to keep everything in perfect condition. The grounds are impeccable. The room was very nice (and again, VERY clean). Probably one of my only complaints is that the beds, the linens, and the pillows aren't very comfortable. The food really sets this place apart from the others. Even the buffet was incredible. And unlike many of the other resorts that have open air buffets, this one is situated inside a beautiful dining facility. The wait staff was fantastic. We sat in German's section every night (I highly recommend you find his section--he's wonderful!). We had no problem getting reservations for any of the specialty restaurants. We forgot to make a reservation one day and were able to walk up at the time of dinner and still be seated. They have a smoothie bar as part of the breakfast buffet every day. We all got hooked on the banana smoothies! The evening entertainment was mediocre. We would generally go for the first 30 minutes or so and then leave. Note that there is no teens club and the children's center really seemed to be geared towards much younger kids (my 9 year old didn't go there at all). The pool is nice, if a little plain. The pools at some of the other Riu resorts were a bit larger and seemed to have more activities (basetball hoops, soccer nets, larger volleyball nets, etc.). Unfortunately the pool water was so warm most days that we couldn't stand to get in it (but I think this would likely be the case at all the resorts given the hot, hot temps every day). We never had any issue finding chairs by the pool, even when we'd get there late morning. You never had to go in search of a drink. There was always a wait staff person close by checking to see if you wanted anything. The resort is situated on what I believe (and what some of the locals confirmed) to be the best beach in the area. It is has very soft sand and crystal clear blue water. There are a lot of water sports available right in front of the resort. We did parasailing. Shop around a bit for prices. The first place quoted $60 per person. By asking around, we were able to find it for $45 per person. I also have to share that we mistakenly left our in-room safe wide open one day when we left the room. We figure we had a couple thousand dollars worth of items in the safe (4 cell phones, an iPod, an iPad, jewelry, money, passports, etc.). On our bed, we received a notice that the resort security had been notified by the maid that the safe was open. Security locked the safe for us and sat down with us when we returned to go over all of the contents of the safe. Not one thing was missing. I give the resort top marks for their safety/security practices. I did a lot of "homework" before picking this resort. If you're doing the same, trust me, look no further. You won't be disappointed with this resort. It is absolutely top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: klhrn
Reviews.Content: This resort exceeded our expectations. I read the mixed reviews on trip advisor, after having been there ourselves I can say it was the right choice. The resort was very clean, the grounds were immaculate! The beach was wide and beautiful with lots of chairs, we never had any difficulty getting one any time of the day. There were lots of mature palm trees on the beach so there was plenty of shade if you wanted it. The beach is sandy all the way in the water which gives the ocean that beautiful blue color. The water was clear. We were a little leery of traveling to Mexico, I had concerns about the people, food, water, safety etc..but decided to try an all inclusive resort. Wow were we surprised, the service was excellent, the people that worked at the resort were all very friendly and went out of their way to help you. Most were bilingual, some spoke 3 languages. Some of the reviews spoke of poor food, we were amazed at the selection and choices we had. We only ate at the buffets, but each night had a different theme, Italian, seafood, Asian, Mexician etc. We never had a problem finding something delicious to eat. There were activities throughout the day at the resort, you could be as active as you wanted or just chill & relax, which is what we did. The rooms were large with a sitting area & fridge, which was restocked each morning. We had plenty of drinks and bottled water. If you needed anything all you had to do was ask. The only complaint I had was the beds were a little hard. Everything was very well maintained, I did not see any bugs or critters, but we were on the 3rd floor, you have to remember the halls are open to the outside, no windows or glass so a critter can easily make it's way into the hall. The rooms are air conditioned, which felt good after a day at the beach. Other reviewers talked about how hard the employees worked and boy are they right. They did not expect tips but were very grateful for any that came their way. The drinks are plentiful, we brought our own insulated mugs and they were happy to fill them with whatever we requested and we took these to the beach. Another tip for the gentleman: you must wear long pants to dinner, even the buffet. We did not know this ahead of time, fortunately my husband brought 1 pair of pants and wore them over & over. Also bring your sunblock it is expensive around $20 a bottle, on the other hand, you can get about any type of medicine you want at the pharmacy without a prescription. Keep in mind this beach also allows topless sunbathing and the European women sunbathe this way. We will definitely return to the Riu Palace. The Palace seem to be the higher end resort compared to some of the other Riu Hotels. This resort was a nice mix of families, young & older couples as well as many Europeans. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have been to”
Reviews.Author: Clive001
Reviews.Content: Not long back and just had to write a report. I have been to a few Riu hotels, also a few 5 star hotels in mexico and the caribbean and this rates as the best hotel I have been to. Food is awsome, the buffet never failed to dazzle me, although I always end up eating to much. The specialised restuarants are just as good, it is good just to go there and get a break from filling yourself to much. Pool was nice and clean, great swim up bar with the staff ready to make whatever drink you want. Pool is also a good size when you take into the fact it is split in two. The entertaining staff are constantly busy, however, they dont hassle if you cannot be bothered to do any of the various activities. Rooms are spotless, comfortable and freshly made every day and turned down at night. Staff so friendly and helpfull always with a smile :) I do not understand people who have complained about this hotel. I could not find anything wrong. The only only complaint I have, and its nothing to do with the hotel, just a daft London female of which the hotel could do nothing about. Some middle aged woman who obviously had to much to drink must of bought one of the beach wear dresses from the models that show off their goods every couple of days and proceeded to try and model it round the pool the same as the models did. It was very embarrassing , she must of been drunk, she had been showing of her expensive rolex all day prior to this, thats if it was real. Sorry to end on a sour note, but at least if you go to the hotel, this lady wil be gone and the hotel with all its luxury is all yours.

Reviews.Title: “We had an amazing time.... ignore the complainers!”
Reviews.Author: sstreets
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, my husband and I had a fantastic time. We are in our late 20's and travelled with another couple. We were welcomed with a delicious cocktail and given great rooms upon request (rooms 2063 and 2064.. both highly recommended). Ya so we were given one key on a string.. really, who cares? I don't let minute things like that bother me. I also didn't mind the heat. Isn't the HEAT something you go on vacation for? Our rooms were lovely and clean yet had a slight dampness that was gone by the second day. The view from our room was great! Could watch the nightly entertainment from our balcony while having a drink from the well-stocked mini-bar. It was re-filled every day with 3 1-litre bottles of water. Our maid was great, we always came back to lots of towels and turn-down service at night. The food at the buffet was excellent and well varied. Something different every night. We went to 2 a la cartes, Krystal and the Steakhouse.. Krystal was good (great salmon and pumpkin soup!) and the Steakhouse was just ok.. the dessert was the best part (flaming Baked Alaska). Our group preferred the buffet, also because we didn't like to be on a schedule (a la carte reservation times are only at 6:45 and 8:00pm). Not one of us got sick from the food, and my husband is super susceptible to illness (had to go to emergency as soon as we got off the plane from the DR a few years ago). The drinks were great. I highly recommend the Caribbean Orange and the Banana Mama for the beach (with MUCHO alcohol, if that's your thing.. they will give it to you! No complaints of weak drinks here.. you just need to ask for it!!) and I really liked the white wine (specifically "Diavolo" brand) at dinner and while watching the shows. The beach was large and beautiful. Tons of chairs. No palapas, but we prefer palm tree shade to palapas any day, makes the beach seem so much more natural and pretty. The water was an amazing turquoise colour and warm. Some days it was real seaweed-y, but just get over the initial entry to the water (where all the seaweed collects) and the water was beautiful and clear. We only went to the pool once to see what it was like. We aren't pool people. It was really warm.. kind of gross warm. Could only imagine what kind of "things" were floating around in there. I chose not to think about it while I was in the water. Had a couple drinks (which were great by the way, a mojito and a Coco Rosa), got out of there and headed back to the beach. The staff couldn't do enough to help you here. The drink service was great, no matter where you were. So many guys walking around on the beach with trays of drinks (felt sorry for them because of the heat) and someone was over to your table every 5-10 minutes to ask if you want something during the evening on the patio. The buffet service was a little hit and miss during dinner, but meh, I certainly wasn't in a rush. We went to Chichen Itza while we were there. If you go, prepare for the hottest day of all time. Make sure you have a hat!!! And lots of water!! You will sweat buckets just standing still in the shade. Worthwhile experience though! The Mayan show on Sunday in the courtyard was EXCELLENT. Those guys look and sound like they truly enjoy what they do! Fantastic music, dancing and costumes!! Overall, the Riu Palace Mexico is a hotel that you just can't go wrong for with the price we paid. I had done so much research on hotels beforehand and I'm so glad that we chose this one. I had a very memorable experience and would definitely go back when we return to the Mayan. Be happy, have fun and relax! "I really want, I want to go to Riu!!"

Reviews.Title: “No worth the money or time”
Reviews.Author: Bcolon
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I have traveled to Cancun over a dozen times and stayed in various hotels. I have stayed in different value resorts in cancun, riviera Maya, puerto aventuras and puerto modelo. I can stay this is by far the worst resort I have been to. I had a feeling it was going to be bad when we entered the lobby, all of the staff were sweating thru their uniforms including the receptionist. The lobby was closed in with no air conditioning, the young lady was complaining to us about the heat. Upon checking in our reservation, which was paid in advance could not be found. After about 30-40 minutes and us filling out a complete form we finally receive one key for our room. Yes I said one key, so if you decide to go somewhere in the resort without your significant other your screwed. When we got to the room, about a 20 minute walk outside in the heat,we noticed something impartant was missing AIR CONDITIONING!!!!. It was worst inside the room than out in the hall, I was only thinking "what the heck did I get myself into?". We checked the thermostat to see if maybe it was set to high, but no deal it was set to it's lowest. Great. We decided to got to one of the great resturants which where on the hotels website, but unfortunately they are all closed by 3pm and don't open until 6:45p. The only other alternative is by the beach outside in the nice sweltering weather. Hey when your hungry you go anywhere. We ate and I was sick for three days in my hot room. The pool is small the beach is crowed with hairy Europeans in speedo's and the best part of the trip was the ride back home. One good thing came out of all of this I lost 17 pounds. The bad part about the weight loss,I paid $5000 to lose it

Reviews.Title: “Improvements needed to take this hotel back to its previous standard”
Reviews.Author: julo063
Reviews.Content: I really like this Riu and decided to revisit. The pool service is excellent, the rooms clean and well maintained. Plenty of chairs etc outside and a pleasant although limited lunchtime menu. Animation team really great fun and hard working. So why write this review? The Don Julian is less well managed than ever... reserved tables for the waiter and manager working this section involving tips and tables standing empty for thier preferred guests. Have not got a problem with tipping however not to have a table although empty table is available is not a great recommendation for this hotel. So walk past this cattle market station, don't tip and find space further back, relax and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back soon”
Reviews.Author: danddnorthdakota
Reviews.Content: First of all remember this is another country you are in. 5 star doesn't mean slippers and robes here. What you will get is 24hr room service and the staff trying the best they can to make you happy. Remember they do not always understand you, but there isnt anyone you walk by that doesn't say hello ,good morning, and have a nice day, Most of the time in 3 different languages. They try hard to make you welcome. Some work for $8 a day. They tell you tips are included, yes they are. Some get $17.00 tip at the end of the week, Crazy...but not one of them do you see complain. We even tipped the maintenance man a little, his expression was priceless . So I would say the.... Staff.......awesome and try there best to get us what we need. hotel....awesome Mexican feel. room filled with pop , water, beer and hard liquor. beds are harder than what us Americans are used to, but this is there country. clean towels, bed was turned down after supper , no complaints. As far as smell...well smells like you live by the ocean. pool......no complaints, swim up bar great. beach ... wonderful , move your chair to a corner if you want to be alone. food.......ok it is blah...BUT ASK THEM to spice it up or look for the small dishes of spices and sauces. They are trying to make alot of different nationalities happy. The sweets are not as sweet as us fat Americans are used to. They are good and we do not need all the sugar. I like spicey food so I add some different sauces to my food and it was all great! Breakfast..........eggs....any way you want them, cereals, toast, many diff kinds of breads and rolls. bacon, beans, and a full salad bar along with a juice bar. Many choices Lunch...pizza, hamburgers, hotdogs, full salad bar, sweets and many other dishes or ask the cooks to make you something with shrimp and clams....but remember the do not understand you that well , so be nice and do your best to tell them. It doesnt hurt to learn a few Spanish words either. Dinner....A little of everything, Tor ask to have something made. They really do try to make our stay a good one, I just wish tourist weren't so rude. Just ask if you need anything and ask nicely .

Reviews.Title: “Goin' in 5 days, August 13-17, for my 3rd time!”
Reviews.Author: adamsry1
Reviews.Content: I think I was 17 the first time I went to Mexico, and my little brother was 15. I ended up finding ways to drink occasionally, but Riu employees would never really budge...Years later, I've been of drinking age for quite some time. I'll be staying in the Riu Palace Mexico because I thought it was the nicest of all of the "clustered hotels" scattered about the strip of road. At night, I always remembered not to buy the junk they try to sell in the courtyard at rediculous prices! I've never had any problems going into the downtown area of Playa and getting what I want...I was never "loud" or "flashy." I was calm, nice, and it seemed to work out. Rather than rushing through sales, I took my time and talked with people. The Riu Tequila has a dance club that opens at night and it's always amazing! Of course...everyone is wasted! The club is packed, the DJs spinnin awesome world music, and there's people from every nation of the world around you! WHAT A GREAT PLACE TO MEET PEOPLE! I always preferred staying in the Palace, rather than the Tequila, however, because I had the freedom to visit all the other Riu hotels and experience their hotel's ammenities, while it DIDN'T work the other way around. They couldn't necessarily leave their hotel and dine or use "our stuff." =) GREAT VACATION, jet skiing guys, etc etc on the beach right there, bars outside in the water or above, cute girls....I love it, and I'm goin' this week! =D

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SoccerMom010
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful relaxing vacation. The Hotel was beautiful, staff was wonderful and the food was delicious. My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico with our two children, 17 and 20. They played volleyball at the pool for hours, while my husband and I relaxed with drink on the poolside. I recommend this hotel and will come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “BEST EVER RIU”
Reviews.Author: sallypinner
Reviews.Content: Even though Cancun Airport, ON ARRIVAL, was the most inefficient airport that we have ever landed at - it took 2 hours to get through customs - once we arrived at the Riu Palace Mexico - all was forgotten. We are a frequent stayer at this group of hotels - but this one was 5-star plus. The staff just fall over to please you. It was excellent - wonderful choice of food throughout the 14 day stay that we were lucky to have. The hotel leads down to the amazing Caribbean sea and white sand - and there are so many chair beds on the beach - and round the pool - there was never a problem in getting a chair - especially on the beach under the palm trees for protection from the sun. We loved it - and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: baduy99
Reviews.Content: We were totally impressed with the great beach, warm water and excellent service at Riu Palace Mexico. Food at buffet restaurant sometimes great, sometimes only good but you will not be hungry with plenty of food selection. Excellent food and service at Krystal, was able to get reservation with about two minutes wait in line. Drinks at lobby bar were very good but at the theater watered down. Plenty of chairs, lounges at the beach and beach was cleared of seaweed every morning. We would definitely come back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fantastic staff and service”
Reviews.Author: billystephen09
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the riu palace mexico and have to say we definately made the right choice for our first trip to mexico. After so much thought before selecting we were certainly not dissappointed. The hotel is situated in a beautiful area and within easy reach of 5th avenue in playa . The staff were fantastic and very efficient but at the same time extremely friendly and always had a smile which added that personal touch to the service. The hotel,rooms and grounds were kept spotless at all times. We could not find any fault with this hotel and would deffinately return.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Cool_Hand812
Reviews.Content: My recent experience at this all-inclusive hotel was beyond positive. First of all, let me tell you that I was being very cautious about the various hotels and the large number of complaints about hotels here on TripAdvisor. I can definitely tell you that we made the right choice in taking the time and picking the right hotel. You CAN'T go wrong with RIU Palace Mexico. From our arrival with Hotel beds at the airport we had no problems. When we arrived at the airport, we were unable to get a room, since we arrived at 10am and check-in wasn't until 3pm. The staff was wonderful in helping us enjoy the hotels amenities even though we had not received a room yet. They directed us to the restroom facilities at the lobby and the showers they have for those who don't have a room yet. All of that helped us to change and be ready to eat. While the food was made for general consumption, it was tasty and varied. The service staff was wonderful and I'd like to point out that Frida, the hostess, was wonderful in her assistance whenever we needed it and the meal services provided by Valerio and Saul were awesome. The entire staff are a definite 10 in our book. One lackluster event was when we went to "El Patio" steakhouse. The steak was very greasy and full of fat; half the steak was fat and the salad was unappetizing. The bright spot was the Myagi restaurant where the food was marvelous. The room was very clean and, again the staff was fantastic. I cannot say anything bad about our stay. It was all positive. The beach was awesome!! Please keep in mind that the "undesirables" were definitely not there. Everyone was respectful to each other and the trip was more enjoyable that way. The pool was constantly cleaned and so were the facilities around the pool. The evening's entertainment was great!! Diana, from entertainment, kept us on the beat and we really enjoyed the atmosphere. Nando and Mariely kept the drinks coming with a smile and good recommendations. Overall, this hotel rocks and we can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not know how people can say this is terrible!!”
Reviews.Author: normalreviewer
Reviews.Content: Ok I think of myself as pretty normal, average even! So if you are too this review is for you. After booking RPM, me and the husband looked up the reviews on trip advisor.Some brilliant,others terrible.So here's my review. 1.People complained about uncomfy beds with plastic on! Ours was about 7 foot wide(seriously) and as comfortable as my good quality bed at home. No plastic on incase we have an accident either. 2.Insects and cockroaches in room- while we never experienced this, it is hardly the fault of the hotel is it if a cockroach wanders in your room. 3.Beach towels only changed once a day-surely more than that is just un necessary. 4.Pools close at 6? Never left pool areas until after that and still loads of people in and around pool. 5.No problems making reservations in the restaurants,or lengthly queues.Literally a 2 minute job. 6.Theft.. Now to me, anyone stupid enough to leave out watches,iPod,phones,money etc is just asking for trouble.There is a safe, use it! I wouldn't leave anything lying around in any hotel room at home or abroad no matter what star it is! 7.Limited amount of water bottles in rooms-never had a problem with this either, I drink at least 2 litres a day & if we were getting low I just kindly asked one of the room maids to top my fridge up(as you would) Overall smashing hotel, lovely food (and I am VERY funny with food abroad) lots of choice, drinks equally spot on, always served good strong measures of Smirnoff/ plied you with never ending wine/champagne if you so wished! Lots of sports to take part in in the daytime, gym well enough equipped for your holiday, staff cannot help you enough & do not sniff round for tips. I suppose the down sides ARE- It does stink in the lobby reception. Not the most inviting entrance smell, but you hardly sit in reception all holiday! The evening entertainment is pretty crap but isn't it always.They do try hard though. The rooms are a little old fashioned, but equipped with everything I needed. Oh and if I wanted to take cake/fruit from the restaurant for later no one every stopped me(I only did it on odd occasion, not like I wanted to take a whole cake every sitting) I think there are some seriously odd people who call this hotel terrible. Most probably the same ones who clicked their fingers, said"rum and coke "& then ignored the waiter when he returned with the drink. You know, normal people who have manners & give and take a little will enjoy this hotel. To add also we had torrential storms for 3 days out of 7 and I still enjoyed it!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: BelfastLadydee
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a two weeks break in the Riu Palace Mexico, Playa del Carmen, this hotel is absolutely beautiful and I have to say the staff are excellent. You could'nt ask for better service and always with a smile. One big thing that we noticed was the staff were unexpecting of tips. Please tip the staff as they don't get payed very well and they work so hard. We left this hotel feeling we made friends with some members of the staff, one person in particular I would like to thank is Omar from the entertainment team, he is such good crack and very good at getting people involved in the daily activities. You couldn't be bored at this hotel - all watersports are included expect motorised watersport, we went kayaking, did body boarding and you could do scuba, windsailing, catamaran and these are only the beach activities. The beach is beautiful. At the pool area there is something to suit both male and female, both young and old. We personally took part in the aqua aerobics, salsa dancing and water volleyball, my husband did riffle shooting, horse shoes and volleyball. The buffet restaurant was excellent, once a week you could do a kitchen tour and you can see how clean the staff keep it. We actually choose this hotel because of the reviews about the food and we where not disappointed. The specialty resaturants are also excellent, especially Kystral, yum now i feel hungry... Rooms are excellent but the view from the balcony was not great. Weather wise we had a few wet days at the start of the holiday, on the third day there was a crazy thunder storm but after that the weather was hot hot hot - we would definately go back at this time of year. 5th Avenue is about a 30min walk, we walk in and out a few times and we didnt have any problems, very safe but i would still advice not to walk alone. All in all we highly recommend this hotel and well definatly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, genuinely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: katiethewitch
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived we were blown away by the service and friendly attitude of the staff. Our room was immaculate with the biggest bed I have ever seen. The restaurants were great we especially liked the Brazillian themed restaurant. The beaches are beautiful with crystal clear waters and plenty to do. Elena in the lobby bar and Elmer and Fransisco In the buffet restaurant we great. Anyone who finds something to complain about here is overly critical and needs to travel in Europe where attitudes to tourists really are appalling the Mexicans should run training schemes for European Hoteliers.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome- What a Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JGINTERNATIONAL
Reviews.Content: First if you want to get away from hustle and busle of Cancun "This is the place for you". My wife and I have been visiting Mexico for the last ten years and by far this is the best place yet! Beach was terrific,clean with no rocky areas. Food was better than expected ,very good selection. A great value for you money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip beautiful resort and grounds!”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug5602
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the RIU Palace Mexico, the resort and grounds were beautiful. The staff went way beyond anything we could have expected. We were constantly asked if we needed another drink or if they could be of any assistance. The employee's work very hard and are always seen cleaning and manicuring the property. The food was good and we had no problem making reservations at any of the "Ala carte" restaurants. The beach was absolutely gorgeous, crystal clear light blue water with just enough waves to make it fun. We would recommend this resort to anyone who wanted to relax and have some fun, if you are looking for nightlife they have a sister RIU accross the street with nightclubs which was included, though we did not take that route. The evening entertainment at the our resort was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: SupaTeacher911
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all that we expected. The service was awesome, the food, especially the Japanese Rest. was GREAT! We ate there twice and each time it was wonderful. Also the buffet offered a very good variety of foods. We had no problems making reservations at any one of the speciality restaurants. We chose the 6:45 sitting...a good choice this gave us time to relax afterwards in the courtyard and enjoy the nightly music and the shows. Other than that not much nightlife. The staff were very accommodating and pleasant. I was amazed by how happy the staff was. In fact I asked one of the head waiters in the courtyard why she was so happy, she said, "I just Love my job" this means a lot to a visitor. Some tips: If you are American make sure you get some local currency prior to your visit. We had trouble changing American dollars at the hotel. Also do not carry large denomination bills, keep it to $20's The rooms were very nice however there was a musty smell from the humidity, daily we would open the sliding glass doors to let some fresh air in -- it did the trick. We spent most of the time near the pool, just loved it. The beach--we spent a little time on the beach, it was beautiful and we had no problem getting beach chairs, there are hundreds of them and if you can't find one near the water then just move it from under the palm trees. While we were there we had a lot of rain. So be prepared for that. Also visited the famous 5th Avenue. It was something to see but hesitated to return because we were hounded by people selling timeshare, excursions, and especially hounded by locals trying to sell their wares. One man was very creative at trying to sell us goods from his mothers store he jumped out at us identifying himself as our waiter at the hotel, we had not even been to dinner yet! Anyway it was a very relaxing vacation, met some wonderful people there as well. A shout out to Rochelle and Roger from the UK. Hope you had a safe flight home and are easing back into life. Congratulations again on your marriage.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Paradise”
Reviews.Author: COYNE79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for our honeymoon in April 2009 and I can honestly say that this was one of the best places I have ever been! The food is great, the drinks are great, the staff are excellent! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED You must also go to Coco Bongo as this was a gret night out!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: maggiembinghamton
Reviews.Content: Stayed from June 30th 2011 to July 8th 2011. This place is the bomb.The beach-wonderful. The food-wonderful-Specialty restaurants-amazing.The rooms great spotlessly clean. The staff most accommodating-will do anything for you. I have traveled extensively and we were treated like royalty and honestly I cannot fault this resort. I am usually quite critical and can find fault-but this was the best of the best. If you read any bad reviews of Riu Palace Mexico dont believe it. This is our fifth time to Mexico and it was outatanding. I count the days until 2011 when I can go back. Do not hesitate to book here. You may want to pay a couple of hundred dollars less but pay the extra and go here. It is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab holiday”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowNessie
Reviews.Content: S tayed two weeks and had the best holiday of our lives staff were great and very friendly food was excellent and had a good variety of dishes . Celebrated my 60th birthday on my second week and staff went out of there way to make it special for me .The hotel its self was really gorgeous and would like to say we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was still there.”
Reviews.Author: Icemaiden_10
Reviews.Content: We have visited this hotel before so obviously we like it or we wouldn't return. Overall the hotel is beautiful with immaculate grounds. It's on the older side so the rooms could do with a bit of an update...especially the bathroom. However everywhere is spotlessly clean and rooms have everything you need including a flat screen TV (that we did not switch on during the entire three weeks of our stay.) For the last two years we have stayed in room 2128 which is in a great location overlooking one of the pools. Food - is very good for an AI - not 5* but you would be hard pressed to not find anything to suit your palette. This year we only ate in the buffet but there are several themed restaurants if you prefer a change from the buffet. Again, I would say that these are good but not exceptional....but it is nice to be waited on sometimes. Pools/beach - The beach is gorgeous with blindingly white sand and water the most beautiful turquoise colour you will ever see. Lots of sunbeds and some hammocks as well as plenty of palm trees for shade. Two pools...one of which has a swim up bar and tends to be busier and noisier than the second pool. We prefer the quieter pool but it horses for courses so you do have a choice. No trouble getting beds or shades in either area whilst we were there. There is waiter service by the pools and the staff frequently come onto the beach as well with a selection of drinks if you don't feel like getting up and going to the beach bar. Entertainment - the animation team have a selection of things going on during the day (rifle shooting, boules, ping pong, water aerobics, dancing lessons, spanish lessons etc) but they do not bother you if you say no. The entertainment at night is pretty low key, music by the bandstand and shows a bit later on in the theatre....not great, but you can pass the time quite happily as long as you are not expecting 'las vegas' type quality. Drinks - I read in quite a few reviews about drinks being watered down. I'm not a big drinker so I can't say I've noticed that myself....but they taste good to me and if you want more alcohol you just need to ask for it and they are happy to oblige. Staff/service - ah well this is where the hotel really excels as far as I'm concerned. Efficient and friendly from the top to the bottom and they really do want you to have a good time. The same excellent service (whether you tip or not) for everyone. I hope the Riu directors appreciate the calibre of their staff ...they are what make us come back year after year. We have been lucky enough to have visited some beautiful places over the last few years but the RPM is really special to us and I can highly recommend it if you are looking for a relaxing, elegant, pampered holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous holiday in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Realisticlady
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks of being thoroughly spoiled here! The suites are spacious, clean and cool, the room cleaning is faultless. Everyday we had balloons, flowers, towel animals. The minibar was restocked daily. The beds were comfortable. The communal areas were always clean and gardens well tended. Pool and beach both beautiful and really peaceful. Food was really good - it's never going to be Michelin star standard catering on the scale they do, but it was excellent. The choice was varied and if you asked for anything additional, it was never any trouble. Speciality restaurants varied - Krystal and Miyagi are very good but the steakhouse and brazilian restaurant were disappointing, not as good as the buffet. Drinks are replenished before you have to ask, plates cleared swiftly and always with a smile and a few words for you. The resort is quiet in the evening but it's only a 30m minute walk into Play del Carmen for something a little livelier! Shows are typically a little naff but enough cocktails and you'll think it's good. We loved this hotel and have found it difficult to adjust to not having someone do everything for us on our return! The only bit of feedback I would give is that the turn down service is too early - we were still getting ready for dinner when they came to do it - but that is really picky! You also get to use all the other Riu hotels - we used the other Palace pool for a day, just for a change. Loved it here, would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: clariza4
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and like to visit different resorts every year. This year my family and I stayed at the RIU Palace Mexico. Overall a very nice hotel and I would recommend to clients. It is more of a mediterannean style hotel. The resort is very well maintained and kept up. The Pools are great and the staff was fabulous. What I enjoyed is that we could walk out of the hotel and walk over to the plaza or the other RIU's right next to it. It is also only a five minute cab ride to 5 avenida. The beach is fantastic. There are so many beach chairs and so many palm trees on the way there. The food is like every hotel. Nothing more or less. I personally liked this hotel better than the RIU Palace Riviera Maya. The kids club is very small and the kids pool is also very small but the kids enjoyed the nightly shows at 8pm.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Bycroft
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in June for 2 weeks and I can only describe it a wonderful experience. Everything about this hotel is pure class from the moment you walk in to the amazing reception until you leave. Rooms and facilities were top quality and cannot fault at all. Everything was modern and the room was spotless and remained so every day. Our cleaning lady was brilliant. The fridge was topped up every day with drinks Food was varied and we were always able to find lots to choose from. Our favourite meal was always breakfast because of the various fresh fruits and the lovely selection of cooked food. The buffet in the evening was superb and could not fault at all. Staff were brilliant everywhere and always smiling and happy and the service in the buffet was really excellent. The bar staff were very efficient and always served you very speedily and with good quality drinks. Reception were very efficient and very pleasant. The beach and sea was lovely with no shortage of sunbeds during our stay. We only used the pool once as we are "beach people" but it was very nice too and again no problem with sunbeds. The grounds were immaculate and beautifully kept. We even spotted one guy each day who seemed to do nothing but polish all the ornamental lamp posts I cannot praise this hotel enough and I send our thanks and congratulations to Riu on owning and maintaining such a wonderful hotel. I really could not praise this hotel high enough and the only thing I could find "wrong" was a tiny weed I saw on the path near the pool !!! Absolutely superb. I cannot see how anyone who stays at this amazing hotel could not have an enjoyable break. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to everyone just make sure you dont book all the rooms because I will hopefully need one next year.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon location”
Reviews.Author: Jan V
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived till the moment we left we were treated like kings. We had the honeymoon suite, which was pretty big and had an upper level with a jacuzzi on it. The view on the private pool and beach was amazing. The room service menu was rather small though. Not alot of choice. The service was amongst the best I've ever had. Everyone was super friendly. The buffets and specialty restaurants were really good. The hotel is situated in PlayaCar, a zone with 24h security around it. At 100m of our hotel there was a small commercial center - and a starbucks - and at 2km (30min walk or $7 taxi ride) you have the town center of Playa Del Carmen. There's a nice selection of excursion available, both to relax or to do some adventurous stuff. We went to Paradise Island, did a quad tour in the jungle, visited Chicen Itza & Tulum, ... The only regret we have is that the excursion to go snorkeling with whale sharks got cancelled because of bad weather at sea.

Reviews.Title: “equal parts: mediocre, bland and poor quality”
Reviews.Author: mistafairy
Reviews.Content: I am basing my rating on the overall experience which was so bad I asked our travel agency to switch our hotel- something I have never done. it started out with the worst the sparkling I have ever tasted as a greeting at front desk, next they gave me an actual metal key on a grimy looking lanyard - I thought it was dated but it was a sign of things to come, the room definately showed its age it was old, with a weird layout and shabby furniture. they gave us two beds when we had asked for one. the bathroom was dark, there was no light around the bathtub. the toiletries were cheap, and as far as I am concerned any resort that claims to be 5 stars should not have a shower gel/shampoo dispenser in the shower. the food: oh my god don't get me started, the food was awful, all of it, it did not matter where you went. it amazed me that with so many items it was very difficult for me to piece together a meal that I can enjoy. at breakfast even the egg station egg was so oily. be prepared to go daily and waste some time every morning to make reservations because as I was rudely informed they only take them daily. the brazillian restaurant la bodega they had literally a salad making area for their salad bar nothing but lettuce, old looking tomatos, cucumbers, some other also old looking veggies and some dressing, the meat sucked, they even screwed up the pineapple. the french restaurant krystal was a little better but i still ended up trading food with my boyfriend because I am a picky eater and my food was not that appetizing. Cleanliness: well we had a cockroach infront of our hotel room that stayed there for most of the day- we took a picture of it, enough said. service: was so hit and miss, there are some really attentive people especially at the bars, but 50% of the others are clueless. the grounds are ok, pool was alright, the beach was fine too. 9:00 am saturday it took us less than 18 hours to figure out we wont like it there, asked to be moved, our agency said absoloutely we will email riu customer service to confirm if there is a cancellation fee and move you , don't worry they check their emails regulary 11:00 am saturday well 2 hours later with no response from riu they called us back to tell us so we took matters into our own hands spoke to front desk had them call riu customer service and we even gave them our agency's email address 1:00 p.m. assurance by front desk not to worry 2:00 p.m.oops riu customer service left without sending the email - guess what we had to stay until monday. obviously not impressed, at that point really anything was just a waste of time. when we got back home we emailed Riu Customer service about our experience.... waited a week, nothing not even a confirmation that they recieved an email. I have travelled all over the world and really one of the worst experiences I have ever had. thumbs down to the Riu

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Helsbels55
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two weeks at this hotel, all I will say is that if you are thinking of going then think no more, it was way above our expectations. The staff were over the top, we never wanted for anything. The food was fantastic, and the service was second to none, for two weeks I felt like royalty, the staff could not do enou gh to help, always smiling, I would go back every year. We went with two of our friends, and me and my friend were drinking champagne for breakfast everyday. When your on the beach the bar staff come down to the beach at regular intervls with a tray full of cocktails and beer and water if you want it. Tony who was a waiter there was so nice, and so was jonny, they always looked after us, and if you think y our cocktails are a bit weak, just tell them, but be careful cos then they can be quite potent lol. My fAvourite drink was carrabean orange, with rum, yummy . The area is very safe. And you can go into town, no hassle. I will end this revue now only to say it was the best holiday we have had, any questions feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time There and Equally as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: wiggy101
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at the Riu Palace and i can not speak highly enough about the place. The service is amazing, the staff can not do enough for you. I love how they look after you from the moment you arrive to the moment you leave. The rooms are cleaned daily from top to bottom, with the mini bar also refreshed. If the optics in the room are not to you liking just ask the bar manager and they will happily change them for you. The rooms are also a great size. I can confirm that i will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous! We are planning our return trip”
Reviews.Author: GF13
Reviews.Content: We arrived on June 19 and stayed 5 days. It was an amazing vacation! The hotel grounds are immaculate and the customer service is superior. We were greeted with a fresh tropical -non-alcoholic, drink at check in. ROOMS: The rooms were perfect, we had rooms closest to the pool. We had a double bed and there was a pull out couch. The beds were not as hard as some people mentioned in other reviews. The pillows were on the flat side, but I doubled up and had no problems. The AC in our room worked perfectly, in fact, I had to raise the temperature and turn off the ceiling fan because we were cold at night. The rooms are a bit dated, but nothing was broken or worn out. There is a flat screen TV that is bolted to the dresser. It would have been nice if the TV was on a stand that could swivel, but no biggie. The pull out mattress was old and uncomfortable. once completely pulled out, the bed wasn't flat, it was on an incline. So, we decided to take out the mattress and put it on the floor. That is where our daughter slept. We asked for extra linens and at turn down service both our beds and the mattress were readied for us. The rooms were cleaned thoroughly, furniture is pulled away from walls and floors were spotless. We didn't have any issues with noise. POOL: The pool is smaller than other resorts we've been to, but since we were traveling with a 5 and 6 year old, it was perfect for them. We spent a lot of time at the swim up bar and the girls liked ordering Shirley Temples. The water was warm and the pool was clean. ACTIVITIES: There was plenty to do at the resort. We participated in water aerobics, volley ball, bingo, and towel art. The evening entertainment was fun. There was a Michael Jackson show, a tropical show, the circus, and Mexican night (with a live mariachi band -this was our favorite). There was also live jazz and latin music. KIDS: The Riu Animacion team was fabulous. There weren't many kids at the resort, but this only ensured the girls were taken care of fabulously! There is a small kids pool, mostly for toddlers I would say, but since the main pool was not deep, that is were the girls spent most of their time. Behind the kiddie pool is the mini club which opened from 10:30 to 1:30 and again from 3 to 5pm. The girls spent time coloring and making crafts. The team then took them to the pool to play games and even took them to lunch! At night, there is a mini disco at 8pm and the team put together themed shows for the kids. The girls loved it! They always rushed through dinner to make sure they didn't miss the mini disco. The grounds were completely safe that we felt comfortable letting them run to the Lounge were the mini-disco took place. BEACH: The beach grounds were immaculate. There were plenty of chairs and could always find a nice spot to sun bathe. Our 5 year old did notice the topless women, but wasn't shocked. She thought it was a good idea to make sure women got an even tan! Bar tenders were attentive and brought drinks to us and the girls. We took a long walk along the beach and the beach at the resort is one of the biggest and best kept in the area, including other RIU resorts. FOOD: The buffet was great. There were plenty of options to choose from, although towards the end it does get repetitive. The specialty restaurants were great. We eat at the Japanese and Steakhouse and were able to get 6:45 reservations. There are only two sittings, but my husband made sure to get up early to get the earlier sitting. The only thing I wish the resort had, were snacks - like chips, peanuts, and the like, especially at the bars. Drinks abound, but it would be nice to have some chips and salsa as you drink your margarita and enjoy the evening shows. OTHER: I liked the free wi-fi access at the lobby.
