We didn't experience any missing items from our room and always used the safe for our valuables. This was definitely an awesome stay and we can't wait to go back! Do not pay much attention to negative reviews. This resort is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: chris01761
Reviews.Content: it was our first time in a riu palace and was very pleased ,it was every thing we dreamed off,the hotel ,grounds and all the staff were great,food was great in all the restaurant but our favourite was krystals,the beach was out off this world,if you get a chance and there is a full moon go on the beach around 10pm it was great,only thing we would not go again in june as it was to hot for us at night as the humidity was 100% the whole time, but we will be back,

Reviews.Title: “First Time at a Riu nicer than expected.”
Reviews.Author: douboy386
Reviews.Content: Went June 4-9 with a group of girlfriends. Stayed 3 in a room which wasn't crowded at all. Asked for a pull out bed in advance and it was in the room upon check-in. Rooms and public areas very clean. Beds were extremely comfortable. Front lobby very ornate - not tropical as you would expect - but still lovely. Pros - food in buffet. Very varied selection each meal as there were many different nationalities and tastebuds. Wine was good and bottle left on table without having to ask. Food in speciality restaurants was wonderful. However if you don't get downstairs to make a reservation by 9:00 a.m. you are out of luck. We ate in 3 of the specialty restaurants and each time there were some empty tables. What a shame for those who wanted to eat there and were too late. Beach was probably the prettiest I've ever seen. No rocks, beautiful white sand, and crystal clear water. Stayed by the beach the whole time. Went into the pool once for water aerobics. Pool area looked nice but small. Service with a smile - everyone working there was so friendly and accommodating. Nice people who deserved the few extra dollars they received. Spa - Had a wonderful swedish massage. With the $25 credit we had, the massage was very affordable. Wanted to go back the next day but the sun came out and the beach won. Cons- Towel card - found this very obnoxious the first few days, got used to it after than. You are allowed one towel and one towel only. You get a plastic card upon checkin that you are warned not to lose. This is your ticket each day to get a towel. Annoying? Yes. Can you live with it? Yes. Beach drink service - I read here that there was beach drink service. Not so much. I have no problem getting up and walking the 50 feet to the beach bar but have never stayed anywhere that didn't have beach bar service. Also, drinks at the beach bar was very very watered down. Only the one bar inside the lobby which got very crowded in the evening, especially on rainy nights. All in all I had a great time, the price was right and I would probably go back for that beach if for no other reason.

Reviews.Title: “worth every dime”
Reviews.Author: pinda91
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace was by far the nicest , most relaxing , beautiful resort for us to date. we have travelled for the past seven years with two other couples . Prior to the Riu Palace I would have to say that the Iberostar - mexico was the nicest. The Riu Palace is exactly that, beautiful grounds, great staff, beach, food,rooms. I will say one thing. if you get a room with a wall on your balcony you may wish to switch to a room with a view , unless you dont care about sitting out on your balcony which we did. there is live entertainment in the gazebo every night, usually a band or single talented singer so it was nice to sit out and listen on the balcony. They do stop the live music for an hour to some very loud annoying guy do the typical just married and kids stuff but all in all you can just shut your door. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The beach is beautiful and if you wanted to you could walk on the boardwalk all the way to Playa Del Carman. The hard working staff keep the beach clean, there is a bbq on the beach and they actually come around and serve drinks . The palace grounds are immaculate and the garden view from the rooms with the fountains and greenery are georgeous. The food is excellent, buffet has everything and the smokers eat outside so nobody smokes indoors if that bothers you, I must say we werent too keen on the all day excursions, it is just too long and it is hard to be away from such a beautiful resort . 1/2 day would be great. Xel-ha has everything, snorkling, swimming with dolphins, food and some shopping. anyway, you get what you pay for at the Palace..we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The best food, ever!”
Reviews.Author: Julieta314
Reviews.Content: The ugly: optional topless, not pretty! The bad: garbage (cigaret buds, cups, broken sea shells) on the beach The good: service but can use monthly training on etiquette The best: FOOD! Each and every restaurant was amazing! Prior to this trip, I hated seafood. Now I love it!! I also tried a variety of yummy foods!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service, lovely grounds and pool and great food”
Reviews.Author: becstrat
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Riu palace, and we would especially like to commend the extremely attentive staff across all areas of the hotel. It was my birthday and our honeymoon during our trip, and the hotel made sure we were looked after. In fact, we did not even mention it was my birthday but I was still given two 'surprises' to celebrate. armondo in the bar plaza was excellent, and many others. I am surprised by the negative reviews, we had an excellent time! The value for money was astounding. Drinks at the bar pool could have been stronger!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: cogmog
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical when my husband booked this trip. Wasn't sure how much i would like it. Boy was i surprised. PLEASANTLY.Hotel was extremely nice. very clean,modern,well maintained,beautiful landscaping. The staff was so friendly,welcoming, and happy to be around. The beach area was my absolute favorite. Lots and lots of palm trees to get out of the sun, which was a must this time of year. Next, the two most other important issues...food and drinks. Lots of choices for food. Buffet or 4 other restaurants to choose from.Crystal was our favorite. The Japanese and the Steak House were just soso. Did not try the Brazilian. One day we had a cookout on the beach--nice. And as for the drinks!!!all you want of any kind. Our first time at an All inclusive and would HIGHLY recommend it. The entertainment staff is alway busy during the day doing games and other events, but they are not pushy in trying to make you do anything. OMAR was our favorite. At night, there was entertainment and music out on the plaza area. All in all we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: ken_montgomery
Reviews.Content: Our whole stay at the resort was awesome...there were a few glitches but overall the stay was great...the staff is excellent...Santos at the pool bar is great. ...the young lady with dinner reservations was great...everybody at the front desk was great. ...my only dislike is the long pants policy...I'm not one for long pants on vacation, but at the special restaurants it's a must or they won't let you in. I got sent bact to my room twice because my clothes wasnt acceptable.....And why can't they put wifi in the rooms, not the lobby only....other than that it was great....!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic cant wait for next year”
Reviews.Author: leicesterlee
Reviews.Content: could not fault this place, my 1st time here. Already booked for next year, from reception to Nando in the pool bar to Max at the scuba centre, amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Left us wanting more!!!”
Reviews.Author: derbywenz
Reviews.Content: Several of my long time friends are turning 50 this year. We had planned 5 trips to commemorate the occasion. The second trip was to be tropical- a Caribbean vacation with the wives/girlfriends. We did an extensive amount of research narrowing the search to Playacar, St Johns and Dominican. In the end Playacar won because of the price and excursions available. None of the group was disappointed. The RIU Palace Mexico exceeded our expectations. It is wonderful! Greeted at check-in with a tropical drink. Rooms were great, food was great. Our only complaint other than we had to leave after a week was the pillows were a little flat and my club sandwich from room service was not that great. That seems like such a small things, but really that was the only negative.We read several poor reviews- those people are crazy. No musty odor. Food in the buffet was wonderful. Staff was extremely friendly. We wakled the beach in both directions this resort has the BEST BEACH! When walking the beach do not forget to stop in at other RIU properties and fill up your drink- all are reciprocal with the Palace. Here are a few tips: Bring an insulated mug-drinks are served in small plastic cups Ask for a room close to the pool, away from the plaza. We ate at two the the restraunts Crystal and Steak place-both good, but the buffet was also good. Save all of you shopping for 5th Ave in Playa del Carmen - better selection and much better prices. Shopping at Playcar and on excursions is expensive. When shopping barter, do not be afraid to walk away. We had several vendor chased us down after we left to offer better prices. A initial price of 65 us became 20 us by walking away. The swimming pool at the RIU Yucatan is a nicer pool. Thake your mug and spend some time there. We went to Xcarat, private snorkeling for 12 and Chitzen Itza. All were booked at the RIU after we got there. All were good trips for a good price although not cheaper than online. It was nice to have a person if there had been a problem. You will be approached by people wanting to sell you stuff, if you are not interested just say "no grasis" and they go away. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa112266
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 nights at the Riu Palace Mexico and really loved it. The staff was so great...very impressed with them. The rooms were clean and spacious. We were on the first floor with a view of the pools & hot tub. They did tend to be on the humid side specially withe the day & a half of rain we had (which did not damper our fun). I do think they need to either add a light to the shower area or put in clear shower curtains. I do agree with some others about hearing sounds in the other rooms but with the fan going that helped. The fan in our room did seem to have only 2 settings...high and super high..so would have been nice to have a lower setting. We used the safe for all valuables and never had a problem with anything getting stolen. Also, one time we left the room and forgot to close the safe but came back to everything still in there. The food was good. We ate at the buffet for every meal. The one night we did plan to make a reservation there was a couple weddings so we weren't able to reserve at the place we wanted and decided to stick with the buffet. We did a couple days of excursions and with the rain we were only able to enjoy one day at the beach & one day by the pool and we enjoyed both. We would for sure go back to this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome fantastic Big up all the staff”
Reviews.Author: Simonanddeb
Reviews.Content: Nothing is too much for them doorman hails taxi for you during day. Entertainment staff good would recommend using spa there waiter service on beach fantastic attention to fine detail is brilliant. Only thing I will point out is men have to wear long trousers to eat in restaurants in evening no dress shorts allowed if this is the case why can the women wear hot pants they should be made to dress smartly too

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: Simonanddeb
Reviews.Content: Nothing is too much for them doorman hails taxi for you during day. Entertainment staff good would recommend using spa there waiter service on beach fantastic attention to fine detail is brilliant. Only thing I will point out is men have to wear long trousers to eat in restaurants in evening no dress shorts allowed if this is the case why can the women wear hot pants they should be made to dress smartly too

Reviews.Title: “It's a great hotel but for one thing”
Reviews.Author: Sport67
Reviews.Content: Hotel and 99 percent of the staff are excellent could not fault anything service was superb , bar staff great , beach area great water sports good so your wondering why 99 percent and not 100 percent , because there was a lot of thieving going on in the hotel rooms we new of three people who had a phone watch and American couple had 200 dollars taken from his wallet , these are only ones we new of but were told to watch our safes as two people had things taken out of them the hotel did not want to no according to these people who had things stolen so be aware of this and make sure you look after your valuables , it is a great hotel and you will love it but be aware

Reviews.Title: “VACATION AT THE RIU RESORTS”
Reviews.Author: BS2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay exclusivley at RIU RESORTS. Wonderful people, wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!! Absolutely loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: beachboy1151
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been married 5 years and we had always wanted to go to a nice beach resort so we did a lot of research before picking our destination. We definitely made the right choice...WOW... and loved it from the moment of checking in as they gave us an upgrade to a suite without even asking!! Everyone here is FRIENDLY!! This place is gorgeous!! Checking in was a breeze taking maybe 10-15 min. I really cannot think of one negative thing to say about Riu Palace Mexico! Simply fabulous! Our room was huge and beautiful! Gorgeous view of the courtyard! We had a large balcony. Everything was so clean and pristine...they work hard to keep everything looking perfect! The food was awesome! We mostly ate at the buffets except one night at the steakhouse which was very good... and no complaints! The beach was beautiful white sand and no rocks! Plenty of loungers for everyone! We spent all of our time on the beautiful palm tree lined beach...not once in the pool which was very nice but we went there for the beach not a pool :o) The ocean water was clean, no seaweed, and a beautiful turquoise blue! It was quiet, no loud partying going on! The service was amazing! We did not tell them it was my wife's birthday and they decorated our room that day...a real surprise for both of us!! We would take our laptop to the beautiful main building lobby area in the evening and check our e-mails/Facebook...very nice areas to lounge and enjoy virgin pina coladas, and free wi-fi which worked great! I could go on and on and on... but you get the picture. We started planning our return to Riu Palace Mexico before we left and can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely honeymoon venue!”
Reviews.Author: fmrsl
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon here in April/May. Beautiful setting, 5* hotel in every way. The food was excellent and service was always with a genuine smile. We realised towards the end that if we gave a tip to the manager of the San Julian dining room we would get the better wine and have the bottle left on the table! The "champagne" was delicious and light to drink. We personally, found the weather a bit too hot but took to sailing at the hottest times or went and lay in the hammocks in the shade. If you like Spanish, i recommend the lessons with Diderot at 12 pm, another chance to sit in the shade with a cooling drink. There is also a tour of the kitchen which is interesting to do. There is entertainment every evening starting at 9.45. If you play the casino game and win some chips put them together when you cash them in and you will then have more to bid for one of the prizes! Room service was exceptional, every day the rooms were cleaned to a high standard and pretty little towel animals left on the bed. One thing that is worth noting is that with the air con on all/most of the time, the room can get rather musty and the clothes feel damp so we learned when in our room to have the doors open and the air con off for a while every day to keep the air smelling fresh. There are many trips out available, its worth talking to more than one of the reps to find out the best deals. We also recommend having a massage on the beach, late afternoon is a good time for this. The only downside we found was that the walls are rather thin so if you have noisy neighbours you will know! Most of all - enjoy! Would we go back? Yes but at a slightly cooler time of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Hot of the press from a great holiday”
Reviews.Author: UkHammers
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great holiday at the Riu Palace Mexico. Have to say feel very relaxed. Overall Hotel – Great hotel and lovely grounds, visited all the near Riu hotels and we thought this one was bar far the best looking. Not quite sure the hotel is a true 5 Star as have stay in better. We had a room round the back, which was fine for us. Pool/Beach – Lots of sun beds to choose from, we preferred the pool area but beach always looked good. Room – room was good, but think it could do with some updating, our fan was noisy at times and sometimes woke up hot other times woke up cold. Massive beds. The only thing I would say is the water smelt like they recycled it from the pool, but I may be wrong. We had no problems with things going missing, but I did make sure we left things locked up in the safe at all times and didn’t leave items lying around on the side, in our 10 day stay we heard of no other problems. Only hint is the coffee machine is slighty strange and no tea making, so might be worth taking a kettle. Food – main buffet restaurant plenty of choose but sometimes at dinner things didn’t quite go together, ok if you like a bit of a miss match. Found the beach restaurant slightly better for lunch. Also never had any problems booking any of the 4 below restaurants. La Bodega – was ok nothing special El Patio – was ok nothing special have been to much better steak houses so don’t get your hopes up Fusion – was lovely nice meal Miyagi – was our favourite and eat there twice Drinks – Yes agree that they were probably watered down, but hay after a bottle or 2 of wine in the restaurants was never a problem, mini bar stocked up daily and loved the fact their was bar staff walking around all day, so I never had to move. Majority of staff where very friendly. Activities – Plenty going on and reps never over hassled you. Evening entertaining was dreadful more like butlins but have to say here was much better than Tequila which was differently butlins aboard! We also had a photo session with Calypso who where great and didn’t feel pressured into buying any of the photo’s Playa Del Carmen – good 30min + walk if you walk by the beach but it is a nice one, be warned that as you go past every shop they do ask you to come in and look at there stock. There is a little shopping mall 5 minutes from hotel which was ok and had a starbucks. Would I go back? Yes one day Would I recommend you go? YES! Overall had a great holiday Things that would improve it: • Not watering down drinks • Updating rooms • Slightly better matched food in the buffet restaurant • Some food slightly less salty • Bath robes in the room • Free Internet access across the hotel and not just in Reception • Tea making facility in room • Better entertainment at night i.e. better shows

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip until the hotel staff robbed us...”
Reviews.Author: rappiesisfat
Reviews.Content: We stayed between May 24th and May 31st. We were impressed by the lovely grounds and excellent food at the buffet. On our second day there we were greeted by a woman asking us if we spoke english. She was hysterical, claiming that all her electronics and money had been stolen out of her room (with no signs of breaking and entering). She eventually got into a cab and went to the police...we never heard what happened to her. On our last night, my boyfriend and I took out our cell phones from the safe to charge them for our ride home. We left our room for an hour and when we returned we found that both our blackberry's, sunglasses, camera and his watch were gone. Our "do not disturb" sign was still on the door and the lock was intact. So, someone with access to our room came in and took our belongings. The hotel staff informed us that they were doing "an investigation", but we knew that our stuff was never going to be found. We are in the process of trying to recover some of the losses from Riu customer service...who knows how that will pan out. So, if you are going to be staying at this hotel, I urge you to keep everything, at all times, hidden away and keep your do not disturb sign on the door so no one can scope the place out while refilling your room with minibar items or towels while you are gone. We had planned on coming back to stay here in 6 months time, but this incident placed a giant black cloud on ever travelling back...

Reviews.Title: “couldnt find the RIU Palace where our North American friends stay”
Reviews.Author: doozan
Reviews.Content: We got back from our stay at the RIU Palace Mexico and my partner said that if anyone wrote a negative review about it then she would feel the need to redress the balance. So here we are, having just read a 1 star review. There is no way that this hotel deserves such a score. All staff were attentive and the service was some of the best we've experienced. The hotel is clean, secure, well appointed and fully deserves its rating. The only criticism was noisy air con in the room on the maximum setting and thats it. I could write about the food etc but its already been written and its all good - just go.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Playa Del Carmen.. RIU was ok...”
Reviews.Author: jeepgirl824
Reviews.Content: Now.. I know you're all reading this to help you decide where to stay in PDC. I did the same thing. You really can't even go by the reviews because there is such a vast array of people vacationing here. I am an average, no-frills-but-like-nice-things person.. and a slight perfectionist. If you're very froo froo, travel frequently and require nice things, you might not be satisfied. If you are more honky-tonk (you know if you are :D ) and you don't travel much, you will love it more than life. I am right down the middle, so I really enjoyed it. 1. The beach: It's beautiful and clean.. tons of palm trees, tons of chairs, nice breeze.. definitely one of the best I've seen. Downsides are, jetski noise and exhaust.. chairs are abundant, but TOO packed together.. Also, it's a topless beach! So if you've got them, flaunt them! If you are going with children/kids and you mind them seeing boobies, you might feel uncomfortable. You can also see Cozumel far away.. Cool. 2. The pool: Water was warm, and it seemed small/narrow. We didn't have trouble finding a chair, so that was nice. Swim up bar was sort of "icky".. weird smells. the grounds are well kept, the palms are healthy and beautiful. 3: Food: We ate at Krystal, it was very good. Steakhouse was not, nor was the service. Buffet is good, lots to pick from. Anything and everything.. and the staff is fabulous! Coffee is strong.. it was too strong for me to drink. And I drink Starbucks!! 4: Drinks: Weak, weak, weak. Ask for a shot on the side of whatever you want in it. Beer is Dos Equis. Not bad. Cubano bar serves the weakest drinks. 5: Rooms: They are ok. I stayed at the RIU Aruba which was nice. This room was ok, needed updating..but who cares. We did have a few broken things.. iron, ironing board, light, lamp and toilet. Sounds like a lot, but we called and they came to fix things within 5 minutes. Rooms were clean, and cleaned promptly. Housekeeping staff left flowers too.. 6: Entertainment: Um, not very entertaining. Cuban dancer were great, the variety/Beatles show was terrible! hahahaa... Mr. RIU show was funny.. 7: Service: VERY good. All very humble, genuine and attentive people. If you want to go for relaxation and eating.. you will love it. It seemed to be a slow week. Not very crowded at all.. only a few children too. Overall I had a great time and would go back, but might try RIU Riviera Maya down the road a bit. It's newer. Also, a room booking tip. Ask for Courtyard view (Jr Suite Superior) on the second floor "at the end". It faces the inside, so you won't see other hotels or brick walls.. and the end is furthest from the restaurants and theater so the noise will be less. It's a hike of a walk to get back to your room, but worth it if you want quiet to sleep!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a WONDERFUL stay!”
Reviews.Author: NadiDanJones
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand why someone would give this hotel a bad or mediocre review. We just came back from a trip to the Riviera Maya. Third time in Cancun Area and 2nd time with the Riu. First time with the Palace status and WE LOVED IT! The hotel is in the Playacar complex, a private community in Playa del Carmen. We rented a car to get there but a taxi will charge between 50 and 70 bucks to take you there. The hotel's grounds were so beautiful, "mighty pretty" my husband kept saying. We never got tired of looking and walking around the super clean and well kept grounds. We love the patio area at night and hangin gout mingling with people and drinking. We were very impressed with the service. The staff was wonderful. Our fave bartenders were Tony, Luis, Angel, Dany, and I am sorry but I am blanking out on names now! they were great. If you asked a drink double or super FUERTE! they would do it. You turn around and someone was always taking care of your orders no matter where you were. Staff at breakfast, lunch and dinner service was equally wonderful. We were very happy with the food. The buffet has great variety and I was in heaven when I saw beef wellington in the gala night! it is my favorite dish! The specialty restaurants were also really good! The steak house was superb. We did not have time to try Bodega though. The Japanese restaurant was our least favorite. It is blah. Food is good but we are in CA so we have great sushi and Japanese food here, that one still needs to grow. We enjoy Krystal too! The entertainment team was SO COOL! Thank you to Omar, Aida, Christian, Carlos y Diana for making it soooooooo fun for us. The guys dance with you at night and are so much fun with their games and dance lessons. Room service was also great. We loved it. Love the tostadas at any time of the day! Great also was having the bar int he room and all the alcohol there!!!!!!!!!! as well as water and sodas. If you need something extra, you just pick up the phone! The rooms were beautiful too! great layout with a separate level for the seating area and loved the bathroom with a bide! There was WIFI in certain areas of the hotel for free: lobby always and some areas in the patio. Another wonderful thing was just the service of the hotel in general. IT IS GREAT! starting at the door and ending in the beach, their scuba center, and the cleaning ladies! They decorated the room beautifully for my husband's birthday and he was so happily surprised! we made sure to give extra tips to every body. Oh, my hubby was also kind of sick one day and the cheff at the buffet was super accommodating and made him a chicken soup from scratch! and on the next day, they all asked how he was doing! Of course, cannot forget the beach! It was gorgeous! We loved the hamacs and the natural shade provided by tons of palm trees. The beach bar was also awesome! the water is beautiful and there are waiters on there too. We love the attention of the staff at the beach from the scuba team! they were great too! We were very very sad to leave the hotel and come back home! we also met wonderful people there and we will go back in a heart bit!

Reviews.Title: “DECEIVING REVIEWS! BE WARNED!”
Reviews.Author: tiffanytx
Reviews.Content: I wish someone had warned me before I picked this place for our honeymoon. The hotel itself is very pretty, but has possibly the WORST rooms I've ever stayed in, not exaggerating, and they moved us twice. I have NEVER slept on a harder mattress in my life. (Imagine the fake beds in a dept. store.) The rooms couldn't have been more humid either. The all-inclusive meals are terrible as well. I think it's the first time I lost weight on a vacation. You have been WARNED! I seriously don't understand all the good reviews...

Reviews.Title: “Top location highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Cooperle206
Reviews.Content: Maybe with have been lucky but we cannot find fault attention to detail is second to none waiter service is exemplary our only complaint is the discrimination at the evening dinner restaurant men cannot wear even smart shorts and have to wear long trousers which is uncomfortable in the heat where as women were going in there with hot pants how is this ruling fair they really need to change this then it would be perfect

Reviews.Title: “well recommended for a wedding party”
Reviews.Author: ijamsville
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding party and reception at the Riu Palace Mexico in May 2011. Our group was 16 people (13 adults and 3 kids). We stayed 6 nights. Booking for the group directly through Riu groups and events was easy- no issues and very responsive. The wedding reception and other group events we booked went flawlessly. There was a full staff to accommodate the group for our reservation at the private restaurants. Service was excellent; never had to ask for drinks or clear dishes- very proactive and attentive. All of the adults enjoyed the food: appetizers, main course were all excellent. The hotel is beautiful with granite throughout the lobby. Excellent doorman and we were always greeted well. The grounds were beautiful and very well maintained. You have to love the tons of palm trees down to the beach. There were plenty of chairs available in the sun and shade. The rooms were great and spacious. My two complaints about my experience (specifically for a wedding party) was (1) there was a billing mistake on Riu’s part, which was minor. I asked for a corrected bill from the Riu group coordinator and offered to pay in cash that day (again very minor $’s). I did not receive the bill but got a bit of a nasty note stating our events were going to be cancelled if I don’t pay the bill. Not the type of note you want the day before the wedding and I already paid the group contract in full prior to arrival. Overall, the Riu group coordinator could have handled the billing issue better since it was their mistake. And (2) the day of the wedding our photographer showed up at the hotel and the front desk called our room and stated that it will cost $800USD to allow an “outside vendor” on the property. We hired an independent photographer that is not associated with the hotel. Riu, like other hotels, want their cut since we did not use their expensive photographer who is associated with the hotel. I would assume this issue would arise at any all-inclusive hotel when using an outside vendor. One tip: We ordered flowers from a local shop in town two days before the wedding. We brought in pictures of what we wanted and picked the flowers at the shop. The flowers were beautiful and delivered to the hotel on time. Total cost was $60USD for all roses and included two bouquets (bridal and bridesmaid), three boutonnieres, and delivery charge. The hotel was charging $125USD for one bridal bouquet alone. Overall, great hotel, staff, service, and food. I would definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Cornerlot_10
Reviews.Content: Pros...Great service. Great Beach. Pool area is nice but a little small, but not overcrowded as most seem to prefer the beach. Food was very good. Room was very nice. Lobby/bar is air-conditioned. Cons... The king is bed is two full beds pushed together. One bed was really bad, so we slept on the other (it was marginal at best). Rooms get a little warm at night. Drinks are very weak, (but easy to overcome as I asked for a shot of tequila and a margarita, then poured the shot in the margarita). Much older crowd (we are in early and mid 30's) and the resort aligns with the demographic (but this makes for a relaxing stay). Very pleased overall. Would go back. Would reccomend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Come for the Beach & Sun, Stay for the Service”
Reviews.Author: JoshR85
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 7 day trip to Riu Palace Mexico and am fully pleased with our stay. My family and I traveled - my parents both ages 52, myself (26) and my younger brother (20) decided that it's been too cold of a winter in Toronto and I had been away at school for too long. We booked our trip through one of the last minute travel companies in Toronto, which even though it was still a Sunquest trip worked out ~$50-75 cheaper than if we had booked with Sunquest directly. The package from Sunquest included flight (WestJet), hotel transfer and the all-inclusive hotel. We had no problems going through the terminal and meeting our Sunquest agent who got us to the hotel promptly. Keep in mind that the hotel is an hour away from the airport in Cancun - use the restroom before you leave the airport. Upon arrival at the Riu we were immediately greeted by the doorman, who took care of our bags and ushered us in to the front desk. Great staff! I had emailed ahead to confirm our booking, request rooms close together and to tell them we were down for my birthday. The guy at the desk clearly had read the email, wished me happy birthday and had drinks ready for us as we were checking in - real smooth. The room wasn't ready when we arrived, so he took our bags and showed us where to get lunch. We had a pretty standard room, great view of ...the security fence. Didn't matter much, we were only in the rooms to cool off after being at the beach or to sleep. The beds were comfy, pillows starched (but still soft) and the TVs were new Sony Bravias which had their fair share of English - German and Spanish programs. With regards to the "musty" smell that previous posters have reported. It's there when you walk into the hotel, but you become accustomed to it within 10-15 minutes. It's not present in the rooms and I venture the hotel recognizes it, when we got to our room there was this neat little box that looked like a heavy duty air freshener - it apparently worked because our room smelled fine. No nasty encounters with any bugs to thankfully report. Food - The food is excellent. There is nice variety at the Don Julien buffet restaurant. Breakfast is pretty standard fare - waffles, toast, pancakes, fruit, cereal, cold cuts, cheeses, eggs, sausage, bacon, hashbrowns, there's a whole lot more but you get the idea. I'm going to highlight two big breakfast favourites - the donuts! I know, seems crazy, but they're little round things of sugary greatness that are not too sweet but so satisfying. Also, the omelette senoritas are top notch - they were a favourite with my parents and by the end of the week they had their omelette orders memorized. Also our server Francisco whose tables we always sat at during Breakfast knew that my mom and brother drink coffee, my dad drinks tea and I try something from the smoothie station. He would even ask where the rest of the family was if only one of us showed up in the morning and I can think of one morning where my brother went down early and Francisco got a table ready for all of us. Lunch- there's a couple of beach BBQs during the week which are nice. We mostly dined by beach at the patio restaurants - one is Italian themed with pastas and pizza, the other is pretty standard American hot dogs, hamburgers, salad, etc. Again, tasty food; ketchup is a little runny (a small thing to knock them on). Favourites at lunch was the soft serve ice cream machine ...particularly watching my dad struggle to make a proper spiral cone. Dinner - we dined at all 4 of the sit down restaurants. Before we left I had read people complaining about the early time to get reservations, I was thinking that meant waking up at 6am and trudging down to the restaurant. Turns out they let you make reservations from 8am - 10am - which really isn't THAT early. The only day we didnt get a reservation we wanted was when there were 3 weddings happening on the grounds. The steakhouse is probably the best of the 4 restaurants - the meat is nice and tender and was cooked exactly the way each of us asked (and we all asked for a different way). The food was good, music and ambience really nice. Big shout out to our server Ana who even went and found out who was singing and what song when my dad asked her. Next best restaurants is a tie between -the Brazilian restaurant and Krystal Gourmet/Fusion restaurant. The food was alright , certainly tasty and the decor of both places matched the theme. Brazilian was lots of different meats. Krystal was pretty good food -- get the ravioli starter if you go - my dad was the only one smart enough to do so. No complaints with the meals at either. Last restaurant - Miyagi sushi - now I'm biased because I love sushi, so I probably had an unreasonable expectation for them to meet. The actual sushi was tasty. The tempura - was, well, not tempura. Just stuff that was fried in a different batter. Whatever else there was that was served wasn't memorable, or that great. I think I probably got sick from something I ate at Miyagi so I'm really not that big of a fan...this was the ONLY bad food encounter on the trip. I'm a Dr. so came ready expecting the worst sickness ever -- fortunately we never had any serious problems with the food. Beach & Grounds- The beach is nice; they work really hard to keep everything super clean. I'm usually awake early and the grounds-crew was out early cleaning everywhere up early in the morning. Lawns and hedges were well trimmed, beach was even raked. By the end of the day, the beach looked like a disaster zone - there are a lot of filthy tourists out there - and yet by the next morning, the beach was pristine again. I brought pool shoes because I had read that the beach was rocky -- never used them. The sand gets warm by the afternoon, but on the well traversed areas, they'll pour water on the sand to cool it off. The water is clear and the swimming area varies from pretty calm to a few nice rolling waves - great if you want to relax OR boogie board. There's a good number of hammocks which were comfy, well shaded and great to fall asleep in. Never struggled to get a beach chair in the shade- including securing 4 together for the whole family. Activities - This is where RIU really shines; hands down they have a great location to work with but what takes them from being a 4.5 star to a 5 star hotel is the incredible service. I want to highlight their entire entertainment staff who made our vacation memorable. By the end of our stay, pretty much all of their entertainment folks knew our names. They have a great entertainment program - rifle shooting, bocci ball, darts, volleyball, water aerobics, ping pong. First off, Omar is awesome - he's out there dancing around and full of energy - I'm going to venture he's my mom's favourite since she went to everyone of his dance classes and water aerobics. Next, Diderot is the man - he and my brother played countless games of volleyball and Diderot got my (sometimes) reclusive father out playing ping pong a few afternoons which is NOT an easy task. Aida is new but seamlessly has integrated into the staff, really catching and building off of Omar's energy. Cris and the other evening show announcer (whose name I forget- sorry!) are both hilarious on stage, easily going between languages so that the whole audience can participate. Everyone else on the entertainment staff is great, they may be the best kept secret at the resort and definitely go out of their way to make guests feel welcome. I know in the evenings, they'll even accompany guests to the various nightclubs around ensuring they go out and get back safely - definitely above and beyond. The evening shows were always fun to watch. Obviously its not your Broadway-esque performances but they made for a fun evening. The servers in the theatre are really prompt with bringing drinks, it almost seems like they're paid per drink served because your glass never gets empty. It's a nice touch that they give away a prize and certificate to the winners of the various activities from the day - I won a nice haul of RIU trinkets thanks to my bocci ball success. We went on one excursion while there to Chichen Itza, really because it's a recognizable landmark. It's a couple hours away and was an ok trip. We got to jump into the cenote out there which was fun and refreshing. There were a bunch of other excursions out there that the various travel reps would have willingly setup, but we were pretty content to relax around the resort. In summary, this was an excellent vacation. It's a difficult and daring task to plan a vacation in my family because EVERYTHING has to go right and the slightest error will result in endless taunting and torment from the rest of the family. As the lead planner on this one, I read tripadvisor endlessly before deciding. I'm thankfully happy to say that there were no complaints from anyone during our trip. We all had a great time and would willingly go back again.

Reviews.Title: “RIU - You're the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: ILGrammy60
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I just returned from the RIU Palace Mexico. Our stay was magnificient. The weather was 85 - 88 degrees, sunny with pleasant ocean breeze. Everything was PERFECT. Our garden view room balcony on the second floor 2010 overlooked heart shaped bushes and a beautiful sculpture. The food was delicious at all of the restaurants. We were able to make reservations each morning when we went for breakfast at the restaurant of our choice for the seating of our choice. There are two seatings: 6:45 & 8:45PM. Our favorite was the Krystal. I enjoyed the Sea Bass, Pumpkin soup and chocolate cake. Atmosphere, service, presentation and taste were flawless. The pools are beautiful and clean. There is a huge mosaic tile rose at the bottom of one of the pools. Pool servers bring soda, water or alcohol right to your lounge chair. The beach is golden sand and clear water. No rocks like Cancun. Palm trees provided plenty of shade, a combination of sun and shade. There plenty of lounge chairs at the pools and on the beach so no need to rush down in the morning to reserve a place. Hubby and I went to Play del Carmen to go to church and visited the 5th Avenue market. We also went to the little shopping plaza across the street from the hotel. We were content to spend the rest of our time on the property enjoying the resort and our room. The bulding and grounds are more beautiful and luxurious that the pictures portray. We did our homework before we went and found the hotel to far exceed our expectations in every way. We talked with at least four couples who were return guests. One couple came from Germany and spent 2 weeks last year. They liked it so much they are back for four weeks this year. Another couple from England came back after about five years. Europeans outnumbered Americans but everyone was friendly and most spoke fluent English. This is not an adults only but there were very few children. There is a dinner dress code for men. Men are required to wear long pants, jeans are ok, collard shirt and shoes or dress sandals. We went to the buffet our first night there and my husband was politely asked to change into pants for dinner. We would not recommend this hotel for families traveling with children or for young adults who are intested in heavy drinking and partying. We would recommend this for 40+ year olds who want a luxurious, relaxing, quiet, getaway with gourmet food and outstanding service. This is our 5th RIU stay but our 1st "Palace" stay. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: NaughtyJack
Reviews.Content: Visited from May 11-18. Weather was perfect. Staff was excellent. Drinks only so so. Not top shelf liquor unless you ask for it. House band at The Plaza most evenings plays mostly Latin....Salsa, Merengue, Cumbia. Shows were worth seeing. $7 cab ride to Playa Del Carmen. Buffet had plenty to choose from. Steaks at the Steakhouse and Krystal were very good. No problem making reservations at the specialty restaurants. Rooms need a little updating but A/C was very good. No problem with getting chairs poolside(sleep in, no need to play the towel game). Very hot during the day at the pool. Try the beach. Much more comfortable and a terrific view. Not many Americans anywhere in Playa. Mostly European. Younger ,more energetic crowd at The Riu Tequila across the street. If you enjoy Salsa dancing make sure to visit The Bodequita Del Medio in Playa at 5th Avenue & 34th St. North. Great Cuban Salsa band every evening. Also try Tropical Night at The Pink Elephant on Sunday nights for Salsa. All in all a very good resort for middle aged folks looking for well behaved fun seeking crowd. No loud drunken jerks here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome- highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: ASugarman
Reviews.Content: The RIU Palace is really beautiful- great beach, very nice lobby with crystal chandeliers, elaborate and well-manicured grounds, etc. Great romantic getaway- the crowd is almost entirely couples and groups of couples. The rooms are large- essentially suites- all with a balcony. The breakfast/lunch/dinner buffet food is really really good and the Krystal fusion restaurant is excellent. Every staff member was very friendly and attentive. I would highly recommend this place! I would just say to avoid the Steakhouse restaurant- the food and ambiance are both sub-par. Also, the front desk guest services can be lacking, e.g. when we asked for a wake-up call and assistance with a broken door that never came.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Grounds, nice room, food mediocre”
Reviews.Author: imacitygirl
Reviews.Content: I originally posted this to the wrong hotel, I stayed at the RUI Mexico, not the Riviera Maya. Here is the repost and some additions. The hotel is beautiful, the grounds were very well maintained and our room was lovely. I enjoyed my trip tremendously...BUT...(sorry Riu but I have to do this) I also had 3 roach sightings...one near the food preparation area near the buffet, one in my room and a third in the lobby. I have to say that I was a little bummed out about this and had a hard time sleeping at night. I'm just glad it was on the 6th night of our 7 night trip and not earlier on because that would have ruined the entire trip for me. Get some exterminators out RUI....it's kind of a buzz kill and can ruin vacations for people!!! I also noticed that musty smell I've heard others complain about and have a suitcase full of clothing and other items that reak of it. Not really sure what can be done about this and it's not a huge deal, but it is a little annoyance that would be best taken care of. Thirdly, the food was just ok...mediocre at best. I was really looking forward to Mexican night in the hopes of having some authentic mexican food, but I was hugely disappointed. However, I always found something to eat, but mostly stuck with the make your own pasta and salads. Not what I was hoping for, but it did just fine!!!!!! Because I paid up front for a package that I feel includes all meals and drinks, not being able to have a variety of foods and having to stick with certain things that I eat back home all the time, I feel I was a little ripped off in this area, but again, just mentioning for the sake of giving a fair review that others can benefit from and base thier decision on when making thier own travel plans in the future. Lastly, the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything going on in the hallway and above you. Unfortunately for me and my spouse, we had a very noisy guest above us. We heard every step (in heels) that person took and it lasted for a good hour, sometimes longer, in the mornings when still ready to wake up and again in the evenings when trying to got to sleep...way past midnight! It's not like we expected peace and quiet at 8:00 PM. On the to the praises. The staff is courteous and always willing to accomodate! We had no problems at this hotel. The maids did a great job, sometimes leaving flower petals in our bathroom and making sure our room was spotless!!! We always had clean towels, fresh linens. I will visit again soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back again and again”
Reviews.Author: jess0611
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Mexico. We would definitely recommend the Riu Palace Mexico opposed to any of the other neighbouring Riu Hotels. The other Palace hotel in the complex was exactly the same layout but on a larger scale, it had a sports bar and jewellery shop but I dont feel this is worth the extra costs as the hotels mirror each other apart from this. Food was great although we had a bad experience in the El Patio. Would go back every year to this hotel, you are allowed to visit all the surrounding Riu hotels as staying in a palace. I had spa treatments whilst staying here and the service was second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly overwhelming!”
Reviews.Author: NOTPICKY59
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful! The hotel lobby is lavish, the service is over the top, the location is paradise, and the atmosphere is right for every type of traveler. There are non-stop activities during the days, plentiful nighttime events, and they cater to everyone - from families with all-aged children, to solo traveler, couples, etc. My room air conditioner never seemed to work properly, but I wasn't in there most of the time anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Celebrated our 50th Birthdays here with 5 high school friends”
Reviews.Author: Fabulousat50
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. The meals were excellent and the sit down dinners were marvelous. Service was great. Absolutely no complaints about anything. I would stay there again anytime. Even though this is mostly a couple's resort, we found plenty to do as a group of five female friends celebrating our 50th birthday

Reviews.Title: “A great stay with only a couple issues”
Reviews.Author: tompammc5
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Riu resorts in Cancun & Playa Del Carmen 6 yrs in a row. We travelled with our 2 yr old and a 5 yr old grandsons and their parents. As usual the palace resorts were clean, great food, and the employees so kind. We have a RIU card and have always been able to change rooms if we weren't happy. We paid and extra $100.00 for a courtyard view when we booked, but our children did not. THey were given a room with a cement wall on the balcony that was horrible. THey would not change their room unless they paid $120.00 extra per NIGHT. I even offered my RIU points and the front desk wouldn't budge. I thought this was a bit of a rip off. Also one of our grandsons has cerebral palsey and we checked to make sure they had an elevator. THey do in the lobby, but not in the back of the resort by the beach. So a point off for not being very handicap accessible. Otherwise a great trip. Next time would stay in Cancun because of oceanview rooms & closer to the beach with the kids. But we felt very safe here. We used Cancun transfers once again from the airport and they were promt as usual, only $120 r/t for all of us and provided booster and car seats. Took the kids to Xcaret which is only 15 min away. Professional photographers at the resort were awesome and the beach was great even tho my son got bit by a jellyfish.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: JN1222
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Mexico with my mother. She has been maybe 20 times, but never to Playa Del Carmen. The RIU Palace Mexico was amazing. I can't express how friendly and helpful the staff was. I speak almost no Spanish and had no problems communicating. The food and drinks were wonderful. The facilities were always clean. We stayed for a week and relaxed daily by the pool or on the beach. The beach does tend to get crowded, but we never really had an issue with finding two lounge chairs next to each other. I would say it was mostly couples and families, but I did see younger people staying in groups as well. There is a bit of a lack of nightlife, but downtown Playa Del Carmen is a 5 minute/8 dollar cab ride away with lots of fun bars and insane shopping. I fell in love with Mexico at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “riu palace mexico”
Reviews.Author: shikha123
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 6nights at riu palace mexico playa del carmen food was ok we tried 2 restaurants krystal (food was good) AND MIYAGI ( bad food) and el patio and la triviata lunch is usually buffet for dinner time el patio turns into brazilian food restaurant bad part pool closes at 8pm no lights on beach at night best part rooms r spacious and big but air conditioner stops working for sometime at night which makes the room hot bar in the lobby is good but others ones ok

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: theoldone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spacious and well appointed. The rooms were nothing special but were kept clean and in good order. The consumables were repaced regularly, including the mini bar. You even have your own set of optics! Disappointed in the balcony which didn't have railings, just a four foot wall, so when we sat on the chairs that is all we could see! The food was exceptional with every taste catered for. Food dishes were replenished regularly. There are 4 restaurants on site as well as the main buffet style. The food and service in these were very good and the fine dining restaurent has to be visited at least once! The hotel pool is quite small and the swim up bar is in the area where they play water volley ball and keep fit - not ideal. The beach however is so beautiful that we spent little time at the pool. The sea is warm and the sand fine....quite big waves but they just added to the fun. Beach drinks service was excellent but sporadic. All sorts of water sports are available at additional charge. Evening entertainment was not invasive if you just wanted to drink and chat. We visited Chichen Itza and it was a well organised trip but a long day and incredible hot.

Reviews.Title: “Still great”
Reviews.Author: bluewater365
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel at least 2 times before and have been to mexico (stayed at all-inclusive resorts) probably 10 times. Although this Riu isn't brand new anymore, it is still a beautiful property with great service. The food is very good (the buffet always has something on it). The beach in Riveria Maya is wonderful. We've consistently had a great time at the Riu and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great vacation”
Reviews.Author: drakul20us
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in Playacar (a private community), about an hour south of Cancun. Very secure location, with every vehicle coming and going being checked by security. Just south of Playa del Carmen which has shops and restaurants and night life any party goer could ask for. The hotel itself is in very good aesthetic shape, with friendly staff and excellent grounds. The food is very very good. The specialty restaurants are all great, except the fusion, that one was not that good. We happened to be there on holy week, when all of Mexico goes on vacation. It was a bit crowded but not overbearing. Every night, the hotel put on a different dance show, and every night they had a few dancers spend some time prancing around with the kids. The pool is somewhat small, with no easy entry/exit ramps. The liquor was not top shelf but was sufficient. The beach is excellent, with plenty of shade for those that want to stay out of the sun. One piece of advise, do not buy anything that anyone is trying to sell to you. be it an obsedian turtle, or a silver necklace, or a wooden mayan mask. Chances are, the price is hiked up three times the worth, and it is poorly made. They will all swear that whatever they're selling is made by their own hand, it isn't. Pros : excellent service, food, grounds, beach, security, entertainment, quite pool Cons : long walk to the pool, especially to the beach, it can get a bit noisy at night if your room is facing the central plaza

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Gmartin15
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Palace was wonderful with exceptional service. The food was for the most part was superior quality, with the exception being the Mexican portion of the buffet which left everything to be desired. One would think that would be the best of the buffet, but you would be sadly mistaken. The specialty restaurants were exceptional in their food, with the steakhouse winning hands down. The room was very nice, though the beds were the firmest we have ever experienced -- we had to have the mattress changed out it was so hard. Think billard table hard -- really. The staff was excellent in keeping the room up with fresh towels & beverages daily with surprises as well making it an adventure to see what was in store for us every evening. It was however a bit irritating to have to wait for our room to be ready. Check-in is at 3:00 pm and we arrived about 2:45 pm and were told our room wouldn't be ready unitl 3:30. Went back at 3:45 and were told would be 45 more minutes. Ended up being only 15 more and only after told manager how long we had been waiting and original time frame. Be prepared to be firm, but nice and it will go a long way toward resolving the situations. Overall, would go back and take the kids as well.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort and pool, difficult access”
Reviews.Author: beachmom707
Reviews.Content: Entire resort was immaculate inside and out. WE stayed in a junior suite was had a balcony with a terrible view and a lot of noise! The room did not have adequate electrical outlets and was in need of a vanity with mirror in the room. The only mirror was in the bathroom. Tub/shower was very difficult to get in and out. I had bruises and so did others in my party of 15. Everyone complained about this. The pool was beautiful and not very crowded. The towel policy was ridiculous however and there were no restrooms close to the pool. If you have issues climbing stairs, this is NOT the place for you. Long walk from our room to the pool and the beach and lots of stairs to climb to get back to the room. Food was adequate at the buffets. Very tastefully presented but not so tasty. There were plenty of choices however, so you could taste until you found what you liked. Reservations in the restaurants were "full" so were were forced to eat the the buffet the entire time except for 1 night. Interesting though that you could see inside the restaurant and there were plenty of empty tables. The one night we ate at Agave, (travel agent made the reservation 3 months in advance) the food was not that great nor plentiful. NOt a good selection of desserts either. Room service menu VERY LIMITED. Our group managed to have a good time but this resort was definately lacking in the entertainment area. Not a party like atmosphere at all. We were even shushed by another guest for laughing in our rooms at night! Great beach and pool area where you could get sun and shade. Plenty of lounge chairs but hard to get a group of them together even if you went out when the towel shack opened! Favorite thing was the pool and the lounges.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & everything so clean”
Reviews.Author: emailWendy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, beach location within a gated resort so you feel very safe. Can use the facilities of the other RIU hotels but they are not as nice as the Palace so why bother. Asian restuarant excellent and you can have a bottle of champagne with your meal, not very keen on the Brazilan though to much meat! Service everywhere is excellent. We had a 16 year old and not many teenagers or young children around. Probably better if you have 2 children rather than a bored one like us, took him a while to make friends although lots of events to join in, ours wouldn't. They can go across to the Tequila Sports Bar, no problem as it's a gated resort.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: figuritaboy
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Riu Palace Mexico and all I can say is I want to go back to Riu!!! I spent ten splendid days from April 10th to April 20th. I was celebrating my 20th wedding anniversary with my lovely wife. I was well greated by Ricky at the front desk Who assigned me a great courtyard room, an upgrade from what I previosly booked. From there on everything just got better and better. From dinner at the buffet with great variety of quality food closely monitored by great Chef Neftaliand His crew. Waiters were very attentive and courteous. Breakfast at the buffet was just too much to ask for, plenty of fresh fruit, juices, tasty sides and the egg lady made great omelets. Dinner a la carte was great too. The Brazilian restaurant was okay. The steak house restaurant had great meat and seafood entrees. The Japanese restaurant was great too, good sushi, tempura the tamarind shrimp main dish and fried ice cream for dessert. And finally the best for last, Krystal Restaurant with fusion food, extraordinay, the shrimp ravioli entrees were great with a very delicate exquisite white sauce, the main dish had a nice steak with mushroom mouse sauce to die for and for dessert a passion fruit and coconut mouse. The shows were good, I missed most of the first part because I always had supper at 8:45 p.m. and by the time I would be finished eating well the shows were almost over. I ate three nights at the buffet and gladly one of those nights happened to be the Gala night theme, which had lobster on the grill, shrimp, steaks etc. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone Who is looking for quality per price service, food and installations. As a Riu Palace guest I could visit all the sister Riu hotels but not one was as nice or had the quality of service of the Riu Palce Mexico, not even the Riu Palace Mexico. A great acknowledgment to Manolo, Yamir, Raul, Francisco, Neftali and the magement of guest relations making the hotel run so smoothly. Future travelers I hope You enjoy Your future stay at Riu Palace Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “BEST VACATION EVER!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DD1989
Reviews.Content: We travelled with a group of 21, 10 adults and 11 children (one 16 year old; four 14 year olds; two twelve year olds; three 10 year olds and an 8 year old). Most of us are already planning our return trip next year. I truly cannot say anything negative about the Riu Palace Mexico. Everything exceeded my expectations, and that is hard to do. We travelled from 3/27 to 4/2. The weather was great!!!!! The service great!!!!! The food was the best I have eaten at an all inclusive resort!!!!! The beach was huge and the pool area was big enough. We rarely had a problem securing lounge chairs at the pool or the beach. There were plenty of activities for the kids (snorkeling, boogie boards, volleyball). They even had a towel folding class for the little kids who got to keep the animal they made. They offer parasailing and jet-sking right on the beach! We did both and loved it. My husband also took an introductory SCUBA lesson and went on an ocean dive!!!! I LOVED laying on a lounge on the beach and having a waiter bring me a drink......TOTAL RELAXATION!!!!! You never need to walk too far to get a drink either. As for the four restaurants, they were all good, but our favorite was Fusion, followed by the steakhouse, then the Japanese and finally the Brazilian steakhouse. Getting up early to make the reservation for these places is a bit inconvenient, but well worth it. We were lucky that a different family volunteered to make the reservations each day. The buffet is EXCELLENT!!!! Great variety and quality. The rooms do smelly musty, but after a while you don't even think about it. In that regard, be prepared to wash ALL clothing when you return as the musty smell follows you home. We have two children (10 and 14). The beds are small, so we asked for a cot. One daughter slept on the cot and the other slept on the couch. We were not in the room too much so it didn't matter!!!! There was nightly entertainment in the beautiful courtyard, as well as the theater. We walked into Playa del Carmen one day!!!!! About 25 minutes, but worth it to get a feel for the town. The rooms were always clean. Of course some items were moved around, but how can you clean without moving anything? RECOMMENDATIONS: Bring larger plastic cups for the pool/beach area. The cups they provide are small so require more refills. Bring some type of stomach medicine. Immodium worked for me. You can also go to the pharmacy across the street and buy Cipro. My husband was worried about traveling to Mexico, but even he felt perfectly safe!!!! We did an excursion to Xel-Ha. Well worth the money!!! I LOVED THIS PLACE!!!!!!! BTW, we booked through FunJet. Would recommend them to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Third time at Riu Palace and its still great!”
Reviews.Author: Ottawagal62
Reviews.Content: A friend and I have just returned from another trip to the Riu Palace Mexico. This was our annual "gals" trip, with the main goal of relaxing, catching some sun and just generally taking it easy. Last year I introduced my friend to the Riu Palace and she liked it so much that she suggested we go back - no quarrel from me, especially as I was able to obtain a very good price for our package, after a bit of internet research. My advice - never pay the brochure price, especially if you are coming from the U.S or Canada - you can always find discounted rates. I obtained a good deal from beachdestinations.com, which included a direct flight from Ottawa to Cancun on Westjet, so I was very pleased. Anyway, on to the review. We travelled April 12-19th, and the weather was spectacular - 30 degrees celsius or so every day, and not a drop of rain. When we arrived I requested an upgrade, (from the standard room to a courtyard view - not a big deal) and the hotel accomodated us. Food in the buffet was very good, and we ate there every night. The food tastes so incredibly fresh, especially the salads and appetizers. I noticed that in comparison to my first trip to the resort several years ago, the dessert choices have increased, and were even more tasty than before. Service was good, with the exception of one day, when we had to flag down the waiter to get refills, etc. Some of the staff recognized us from our previous trip, and welcomed us "back home" Again, the beach was lovely, but had a bit of a drop off - not really a problem, just more of an observation. The beach is very wide, and although it does not have palapas, it does have dozens of palm trees, so finding shade was not an issue. I noticed as well that beach chairs seemed available throughout the day, which is unusual (for any resort) amongst my 20 + resort vacation experiences. Pool chairs seem to go more quickly. One thing that I especially like about the Riu Palace is the large courtyard filled with tables, which is a great venue for relaxing with a drink and listening to a live band. We would leave the restaurant after dinner, grab a table, and enjoy the music. Service was very good, and we never had an empty glass. As the resort is located within the gated community of Playacar, there was never any sense of a lack of safety, people could walk around at night without much concern. I have been in Playa del Carmen many times, so we went out into the town only once, and again its the same thing - many people about, shops and restaurants open late, and never a sense of discomfort or concern. A taxi from the hotel into town costs 70 pesos, or just under 7 dollars. Finding taxis to return to the hotel is never a problem, as there are taxi stands at almost every corner of 5th avenue. As a repeat visitor to the Riu Palace Mexico I was very pleased with my stay, and I would not hesitate to return, especially if the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort...Outstanding Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: ksappton
Reviews.Content: My college aged daughter and I spent 5 nights at the RIU Palace Mexico for spring break the end of March. My husband and I have traveled to the Playa del Carmen area numerous times and stayed in several different AI resorts (ie, Barcelo, Iberostar, other RIU properties) and this resort by far exceeded my expectations. In fact, soon after returning home we booked 10 nights over Thanksgiving! The service was outstanding from the minute we arrived. I couldn't find something to complain about if I had tried. The staff pays so much attention to detail that they even remember what your favorite drinks are! No matter where you are in the resort they make you feel as if you are the only person at the resort. We never had to wait in line for anything except making reservations for the ala carte restaurants. By the way we ate at all 4 (if you are an early riser it is easy to get a reservation) and all were excellent. Our favorites were the Brazilian and the Fusion. The rooms are spacious and yes a bit musty but your in Mexico! Our housekeeping services were good and most days our room was cleaned early. We went to all the RIU properties except the Playacar. All very nice but the service at the RIU Palace Mexico was by far the best. The RIU Palace Riviera Maya is almost identical although newer. The pool is beautiful but we didn't think the beach area was as nice. We didn't spend much time there as there was a large crowd of very obnoxious high school students and their equally obnoxious parents who had taken over the pool. We did not have any issues like this at our resort but I guess that can be the luck of the draw during spring break. This resort could probably use a bit of a face lift in a few areas but I will take outstanding service over brand new any time!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: galeadk
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at the riu palace from March 31st through April 6th. I went with my boyfriend and another couple. We were very happy with the service, the grounds and the beach was beautiful. The resort is very well maintained! We enjoyed our stay thoroughly and overall we were very pleased with the resort. We had a few insignificant issues: the electricty went off a few times during the week but it was during the night. It came back on eventually. One day there was no hot water but we made due after all it was in the high 80s and a cool shower felt good anyway. Otherwise the rooms were comfortable and clean and the service was good. The food was delicious except we ate at the steak house one night and it was not as good as we expected. We did eat late and that could have something to do with it. The Japanese Rest. was good. The other nights we ate at the buffet. The food was delicious and the variety of foods was amazing. They really do a nice job there. We would definetey go back to this resort. It was well worth the money and we were comfortable and very delighted that we enjoyed it so much. This was our first all inclusive. We were always greeted with smiles and a big Hola from all the employees. They seemed genuine and couldn't do enough to make us comfortable and happy. The shows in the evening (we watched two) were very entertaining and well done. The resort is geared for couples and families. It is not a spring break sorta place which was appealing to us. I think this resort is a solid 4 to 4 1/2.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Wedding, Fantastic Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Henton13
Reviews.Content: Well where do i start, iv just come back to miserable england after two amazing weeks of pure luxory in Riu Palace Mexico, First off dont listen to any bad reviews you have seen on this hotel im a well travelled person and i have never stayed in such an amazing place. it really is a palace. stayed at las americas in cancun last year and this beats it hands down, Straight away from the moment we left our coach the service was brill. got a room upgrade due to our wedding which had a great view also like a fool i left my £500 new camera on the coach but as soon as i reported it the bell boy jumped on his bike (after failing to catch up with it by running) and caught up with the coach and saved my holiday from ruin. this is just one example of how brill the staff are, we never had an empty glass, always had a spotless room and they never fail to say hola:). the grounds are amazing, spotless. The food is to die for, different choices at the buffet every night but they still keep the essentials, my favorate resturant was the brazillian the meat just melts in your mouth we ate there for our wedding meal and again the staff we faultless. Easy to sum up the beach AMAZING!! The pool is ok, nice a quiet compared to the yucatan/tequila hotels next door, but my favorite pool was the tequila as its surrounded by jungle/tropical gardens and had a good atmosphere. Our wedding day was perfect it was so easy and stress free our wedding planner was real friendly and took care of everything, after the ceromony a waiter brought our party of 10 drinks while we had our photo taken and then we went to the cocktail/champaign reception where the waited on us hand and foot. playacar as a resort is amazing its a private community and the streets are spotless there is a small shopping centre 2mins up the road and playa del carmen 5 mins taxi ride up the road or 20mins walk along the beach. this is just a gorgeous hotel so clean and tidy i would strongly recommend it to anyone. before i go anyone who is travelling from england in april/may this year, the weather is beautiful dont listen to weather reports before you go they are wrong it gave for rain the first few days of our trip all loads of internet sites and it was gorgeous mid 30's for 2 weeks. any questions please contact me.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Char12340
Reviews.Content: Probably the prettiest beach we have ever seen. Check in was smooth, rooms clean and well appointed, however, you won't find bathrobes or slippers if you're looking for them. Dinner was formal attire ( long pants for men so pack more than one pair) and the dinner hour started with courtyard "cocktail specials" each day around 6. Food was average to good, but I'm not a big fan of buffets, so the specialty restaurants each day were right up my alley! Staff was friendly, polite and accommodating. We had a great time. There are other Rius within walking distance if you want more night life. There is a shopping plaza within walking distance so you really don't have to banter with the sales hype in Playa del Carmen if you don't want to.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tat22450
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an awesome week at the Riu Palace Mexico. My daughter and I normally cruise every year, but tried an All-Inclusive for a change and it sure changed our minds about our next trip. The grounds, facilities, service, staff, food were all excellente!! Whatever we wanted or needed, we were accommodated. Our room was great, love the patio area!! The workout facility does need to be updated and enlarged, way to small for the number of guests. We made some new friends and have plans to meet up with them again next year! The only thing I would do in the future is research the excusions more thoroughly, we had some issues, but it was not the hotel that made the mistakes. I picked up a few tips reading Tripadvisor reviews before the trip which were very helpful!! #1 Tip......bring tumblers/insulted mugs to get larger drinks at the pool bar, plus they stay cold longer!! #2 - Bring Immodium and if you get the Mexican flu (my daughter did!) go to the pharmacy and buy Rantidine (Zantac) for the stomach pains, tip from the very helpful Front Desk. Looking forward to seeing everyone again at the Riu Palace Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, small pools, musty smell”
Reviews.Author: Lynnie27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from April 2nd to April 8th. The resort was beautiful and kept immaculate. The interior decor of the lobby was gorgeous with crystal chandeliers, marble floors, and old paintings depicting an era from when the Spainards came to Mexico. You can see the Spainish influence in much of the decor with scalloped wrought iron lights and railings all over the grounds. This was actually a smaller resort in comparison to some places we have stayed at but it was easy to get around the grounds and I enjoyed it more because it felt more comfortable. We got a great deal, 50% off the rates, for booking early but I wouldn't have paid the full price. I don't think it would have been worth it because my husband and I don't drink and eat a lot so basically we paid to stay for the location. We were upgraded from a junior suite to a full suite for free. The room was beautiful and spacious. I found the beds very comfortable. The only thing that bothered me was the smell of mustiness. When we got home I had to wash all of my clothes, even the clean ones, and air out the suitcases. Our refrigerater was stocked every day and if we wanted something more we just asked. Our room was a short distance to the beach. The beach was beautiful, clean, no seaweed, and the sand was nice. There were many palm trees to sit under if you don't like scorching in the sun all day. I am very fair skinned and burn easily. No beach service for drinks or snacks, you have to get your own. The beers and drinks were provided in smaller plastic cups. I did see some people bring their own cups and had the bartender fill them. Good idea if you don't want to keep getting up to get something to drink. No music on the beach. The area is very quiet and relaxing. The pools are small and getting older looking. They could use some updating with fresh paint and things. There are activities scheduled daily but we chose not to participate. For those of you who have children, I am not sure if there is a playground area, I didn't seen any swings. The entertainment was decent for a resort. They had different types of shows every night and also had a piano player in the lobby by one of the bars. There are four restaurants that you have to make reservations for every morning. When I am on vacation I don't like being on a time schedule so I ate only at the buffet. My husband ate at the Brazilian grill one night and said the food was ok. The buffets offer a large selection of different types of food and also fresh fruits and salad bar. The food was good but you have to remember they are buffets at a resort and your not going to get the same quality as you would going out to some of the restaurants in downtown Playa. Lastly, I would say the service was very good. If there is anything you need or want just ask for it, the staff will accomodate you the best that they can. I would definitely go back and stay here and recommend this resort to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am perplexed by the bad reviews. This hotel is 5 star all the way. The staff is so friendly and helpful. The food is great. The beach is fantastic, as is the pool area. Our room was fantastic, and was always kept clean. The front desk staff even organized a birthday party for my wife complete with champagne and a cake.
