Don't hesitate to stay here...it's a fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the feeling!”
Reviews.Author: jone
Reviews.Content: First I want to comment about some of those very bad reviews of this hotel: 1. Stolen stuff: There is FREE safety box in the room. You can use that! But we never felt like the cleaner or anyone was after our things. But then again, we did use the safety box. 2. This is NOT a hotel for children or kids. Some think it's a plus, some might find it a negative thing. It's more like hotel for more gown up people who enjoy finer thing s of life ;) 3. The towels were always clean (sometimes maybe with a stain or two, but always clean). And the bed linens were dry and clean (at least during our 3weeks stay). 4. The pool was small, when compared to the ocean!! But the pool was huge enough to get a good swim around it. And if you want to use bigger pool, you can use all the other pools in all the Riu resorts. Some of our highest points of this hotel: -The service was excellent! So friendly and helping. -Lovely clean grounds. -The beach was gorgeous (we saw the beach first time at 2007 when it was very narrow with the sand bags and we loved it then too). -Lovely buffet, somedays the selection was ok, other days it was excellent! But everyday we did get loads to eat. -The over all feeling of this hotel was just so amazing! Well, you just have to feel it yourself :) -The gym room was nice + handy, next to the swimming pool. Maybe a bit small, but still adequate for our use (sometimes a bit hot/steamy if the A/C wasn't on) Bad: Well, only thing I can think of was the vegetarian food at the buffets. It would be better if the vegetarian dishes had their own section (now they were among the meat dishes + some other hotel guests used the meat takers to the vegetarian dishes). But even thou I had to skip some vegetarian dishes due to the meat takers in them, there was still plenty to select :) And we will return and even bring our friends with us!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Holiday”
Reviews.Author: ladyinredk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riu Palace Mexico for 2 weeks at the beginning of March 2011 and we loved it. The concept of 24h all inclusive it is, in European standards, like an ultra all inclusive. In here you have drinks and food included all day and all night long. The minibar and room service is also free :D. Only the spa and the laundry service is payable. The only bad thing about this hotel it is the fact that it doesn't have wi-fi in the rooms or on the beach, not even payable. It only has a free wifi area in the hotel's lobby, where you can also pay for Internet if you didn't bring your own computer. Service was very, very good, cleanliness as well. The hotel is well maintained with nice grass areas and lovely clean fountains. At 8:30 each night there is live music (not very good singers, but nice for the atmosphere). Shows at night were also good, with lots of dances, and they had a different show each night for 2 weeks. Food is more than you can eat, and we also had sea food specialties, champagne and special nights st the main restaurant (Asian, Mexican). You have access to all the Riu in the area, where you can also eat in the morning and at lunch. We visited all of them, and we also liked Riu Palace Riviera Maya, which is a bit bigger and with the same layout. The beach is huge, with crystal clear water and white fine sand. We also had great waves in the windy days. One day we had a fiesta on the beach with salsa music played live and special food. Otherwise all days are really quiet on the beach and relaxing. It is fantastic to read a good book under a palm tree's shade. The pool is kind of small, and it doesn't have a special entrance for disabled people, but there are plenty of loge chairs at the pool, and at the beach also. You can also use the pool at Riu Yucatan very close and really huge. Rooms are big with 2 huge beds put together and a nice sitting area. We also had an umbrella in the room for rainy afternoons. They do nice towel arrangements, and put balloons and fruits in the room if you are celebrating something. In the bathroom you have a bidee next to the the toilet in separate area. A light in the shower would have been nice. Playa del Carmen is 5 minutes away in a taxi (70 pesos or 7$). It is nice for shopping, very colorful and with nice cafe places. We visited Xcaret, for which we took a taxi for 20 minutes and 14$. We then bought our tickets at the door for 69$ or 99$(plus). It is much cheaper than booking this trip through an agency (they charge you 30$ per person only for transport). I would recommend to do the Tulum trip with a taxi as well, especially if you have already been on an organized trip to Chichen Itza (which is worfy) and you had already listened to the Maya history lesson. It is much faster and cheaper. To sum up I would definitely return to Riu Palace Mexico. I really enjoyed my stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve its rating”
Reviews.Author: MMM068
Reviews.Content: This is an all-inclusive hotel. If you are below 50, this might not be a good choice as most people are with families or older crowd. About service: Every time they cleaned our room, all our things were moved around the room, even drawers were checked. We had to look for stuff after each “cleaning”. Bed sheets were wet all the time. It is humid in this palce, but at least fresh sheets should be dry! Some freshly changed towels were not clean! On the last day, right before our departure, our room was “tidied up” and iPod and Camera were stolen. We did not have hot water for two evenings. I understand that sometimes there are issues and things get broken. But we tried to reach out reception by phone several times to find out what is going on. No answer! And that was unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: “ask arnold said 'I'll be back"”
Reviews.Author: wopinuk
Reviews.Content: Great all inclusive. Beach, pool, rooms, entertainment is what you expect from top end resort. RIU complex nicely laid out so you can actually walk to each one and check them out and use their services. Staff was friendly and helpful. Big shoutouts to Alex at front desk, Giovanni at the restaurants and Tony at the bars. Extra attention: daughter had too much sun one day and had to go back to room during dinner. wife took daughter back to room while daddy and son finished dinner. daddy made a plate at the buffet restaurant for mommy/daughter. giovanni had room service deliver it from restaurant to the room - that's superior service my friends

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but watch the male staff!”
Reviews.Author: kimfromcanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace as we always choose the Riu. We like the layout and the service is always good. However our last visit took a really bad turn. One evening we were enjoying ourselves at the Lobby Bar and one of the bartenders from the pool bar decided to join us. We (me and my fiance) had met him earlier in the day. He was very friendly however he started to become a little annoying. He reached out and grabbed my breast....i was totally embarassed. My friends told him it was time to leave. We reported this to the hotel management who questioned me like i was some kind of bad person. Fortunately we had witnesses sitting with us during the questioning. The manager wasnt understanding at all. It really made me feel ackward and i didnt enjoy the rest of my stay. Please be careful with the bar staff, as my experience was not very pleasant. I still feel disgusted with what happened. Its hard to beleive this happened, we will never return to another Riu!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: pat80
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to Mexico (1st time at the royal Playa Del Carmen which was great and 2nd at the riu) and would highly recommend the riu Mexico to anyone wanting a high standard hotel. I have stayed at many hotels but the service at the Riu was the best by far.Nothing was ever too much trouble and the staff always smiling. Never a problem finding a sun bed at any time of the day, even though the hotel looked quite busy. Loads of food choice, although, we tried to book on a few occasions the a'la carte resturants and were always told the early sitting at 6.30pm was full and some times the second sitting at 8.45pm. But the food in the main resturant was very good and each night they did a different theme so wasn't really a problem. The hotel surroundings is beautiful and the resort of playacar is very pretty. We did get a taxi to Playa Del Carmen a few times for shopping and the taxi was only 70pesos each way (approx £3). Go to this hotel, you will love it

Reviews.Title: “Nice RIU, as always”
Reviews.Author: williamtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RIU Palace Mexico the first week in March. This is our 5th RIU stay and we were not disappointed or suprised. Food was good, beach set-up was perfect with the palm trees and service was excellent. As others have said, rooms do show some signs of age, but are super clean. The crowd was very low key. One complaint, it is hard to get a margarita that wont burn a hole through your stomach with all the sour mix. I kept ordering tequilla, orange liquor and lime juice while at the tables in the concourse area and I would get these floresent green sour mix margaritas.... Best to go to the theater bar before dinner when the bartender has time to make a real mexican margarita. I would definitely pay choose the Palace over the other local RIU hotels... it is worth the $200 per week.

Reviews.Title: “Hardworking Staff!”
Reviews.Author: vacagirl79
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a nice property, but the thing that stuck out the most for me was the staff! They were constantly cleaning. The grounds were immaculate at all times and they were constantly scrubbing or mopping the hallways. The staff in the restaurants was equally hard working, I was very impressed. The food was good but not great. I have stayed at other equal level resorts in Mexico where the food was better. I wish the buffet had more Mexican food. The pork dishes were very good but everything else was just good. Usually, these places have three or four specialty dishes that are really good, I didn't find that here. I wish they had some way to get people who are leaving for tours early in the morning better food, they say their room service is 24 hours but you can only get very limited food for breakfast, we got fruit, coffee, juice and what they call bread which was really muffins and danish. It would have been great if they could get us some toast, simple eggs or even ham and cheese if you want a European breakfast. I was disappointed with my ability to get food before my tours. They leave so early, breakfast wasn't open yet. The food in the a la carte restaurants was extremely good but it can be tough to get a reservation. Tip: to guarantee yourself a spot, you have to be down in the theatre area no later than 8 am to get a number. You then have to wait half an hour when they actually start taking reservations at 8:30 am. It takes about 30 seconds per person so, if you’re number 20, expect to be in line another 10 minutes after 8:30 to actually get your reservation and if you walk away, you lose your turn. I have to admit, waiting 40 minutes for dinner reservations was a little bit annoying but I’m not sure how else they could do it in a fair way. We had organized tours that left before 8:30 three of the mornings we were there so, we couldn’t get a reservation on those days which stunk because we only made it to three of the four restaurants even though we were there eight nights. The bar area with free Wi-Fi was great, you could sit, have a drink and check your email. Our tour operators were communicating with us via email so, this was a great perk. Bring your itouch or ipad and it's really convenient. Our room was very nice, it was spacious and the bed was a little hard for me but still OK. The better pillows were in the closet. It is kind of a loud place, we were on the third floor but pretty close to the lobby and were constantly hearing things crashing, I have no idea what was falling all the time but there was constant noise, even at 3 am. You may want to take a set of ear plugs with you if you’re a light sleeper. The beach was awesome, I never used the pool, I’m not a pool person but I love the ocean! I loved the palm trees that lined the beach, my husband likes the sun and I like the shade and we never had to fight over a palapa because the palm trees provided plenty of shade. The palm trees also make the beach more interesting, I thought it was beautiful. We also utilized the dive shop/activity shop on the beach. We took a refresher lesson on how to use the catamaran and then took it out ourselves after that and had a blast. As we were sailing, we even saw dolphins! We also took a trip with them to Cozumel for snorkeling which was fun, we saw a ton of stuff. I’m an avid diver and I saw the biggest ray I have ever seen snorkeling in 25 feet of water. They also have snorkeling trips that stay in the Playa area and boogie boards. The front desk staff was extremely helpful on numerous occasions, they speak English very well and it was great to have them as a resource. You can book tours right in the lobby of the hotel if you want and even rent a car right there. We rented a car to drive to Akumal and to the Jungle Place which was very convenient, you do have to be careful, the police are more likely to pull you over because the tourists have different license plates so we are easy to spot. The driving was easy, we didn’t have any problems. It was just like driving at home, potholes and all. We also went to Chichen Itza and Ek Balam which was a long trip but I was really interested to see the ruins. Ek Balam was way more interesting than I thought, they have preserved stucco that is fascinating. The shows were good, kind of the usual sort of show that you would expect in a resort, nothing great but certainly entertaining. The style of the resort is super Spanish, if you’re not into that sort of thing, you won’t like the style. I liked it because I love Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful !!!!”
Reviews.Author: neenee62868
Reviews.Content: We stayed March 17-21, with another couple and our 21 yr old daughter & her friend. This resort was perfect from the moment we arrived until the time we left. The lobby is absolutely beautiful and spacious with large chandeliers, dark wood, and red velvet seating areas. Wi-Fi is only in the lobby area so we spent each evening there contacting our son back home and did not have trouble finding seating or privacy with all the other parents doing the same. We had three rooms reserved and two of the three were ready and the other took longer than they had originally told us, however we just changed clothes and all went to the beach to wait. We were there to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday and I had emailed the hotel before we left about possibly having something small in her room to surprise her. Boy, were we surprised the entire room was decorated and it made her day. The rooms were spacious, and bathrooms large however wish our bathtub had been larger, just a standard size tub. Air conditioning was cool (we have stayed in other hotels where it was not). Balconies were nice and private. I have seen some reviews the beds are hard, they are hard if you are used to a pillow top mattress but not dated in anyway, we found them comfortable. The pool area was nice and the beach was beautiful. We have stayed in Playa before and the other resort had the big sand whales, nothing like that at the RIU. I recommend the massage by the beach, very relaxing. Food was best we have had at any other all inclusive, the buffets have many different options for everyone. We had the Brazilian and the Japanese dinners while were there and found the food to be excellent as well. The shows each night were entertaining and as other reviews have said get a seat early. Our daughter and her friend were in the front row for Beatles night, and were pulled up on stage and after the initial embarrasment they had a great time. This is not a party resort, with your wristband you can visit the other RIU's in Playa for that type of atmosphere. This would be more adult and family type atmosphere, not to say it isn't fun it just isn't the sloppy drunk obnoxious type resort. Very classy. Spent one evening shopping in Playa and felt safe the entire night, got lots of bargains be prepared to deal and walk away when they don't agree to your price. Took ferry to Cozumel one day and had a great time at the Nachi Cocum Beach Resort (another great day and worth the money take the $35 snorkeling tour you will not be disappointed.) - ferry is rough so if you get seasick take the Dramamine before you go. They had a singer on the boat to try and keep your mind off the rocking and I normally don't have a problem but I had a few moments myself. One other note - we found the majority of the staff spoke English or at least limited English and could accomodate your wishes. Would we visit again? Absolutely!! We are already planning another trip with more couples and families next time.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable location, service and weather”
Reviews.Author: angela9209
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace Mexico was nearly overwhelming. This was our first real vacation anywhere and we definitely started at the top! First, the location: Playacar is a fabulous little gated pocket of luxury. Hand-paved streets with a couple of trees growing out of the middle in a spot or two, residential homes that shouted hefty price tags, a new condo complex all bright and shiny, and then high-end resort after high-end resort. Drivers coming into the community had to stop at a gate and hand over their drivers' license in exchange for a pass. I don't think it gets much safer than this area! The beach, the sand, the water, the trees and landscaping, everything was just gorgeous. Secondly, the service: Perfecto. Even starting back at O'Hare with the AeroMexico airline. Unfailingly polite, quick to smile, patient with the language gaps, attentive, pleasantly chatty. There were a couple of staff members at the hotel that just blew us away- Luis, our favorite by far, who we asked how the scheduling was done (11 hour days chopped into 2 shifts) and seemed to be everywhere we were. Mariely, (just call me Marley), whom we only saw briefly at the theater bar but was so much fun to talk to. The doorman, who gave us each fist-bumps and then blew them up the few times we crossed paths in the lobby. The scuba guys were so amazing, too. Fernando taught us scuba diving in the pool and the one who set up our snorkeling excursion to Maroma Paradise ($220 for the four of us) was so interesting to talk to. Apparently, there are quite a few families in the area who still speak Mayan in their homes, learn English for their jobs, and then pick up Spanish as their THIRD language to use on the streets. And of course, the weather: it was surreal. Coming from Chicago, (it snowed a bit while we were gone), it was as if we won the weather lotto. Mid-80s, breezy, partly cloudy, two brief and refreshing rainstorms (both occurred while we were in our room) and when the sun went down, mid-60s. I saw almost NO BUGS although I did manage to get one mosquito bite. Although, do not mess around with this sun. The Mexican Caribbean sun is NO JOKE. My children and I are already pretty tan even in the dead of winter (Korean blood) but my 10-yr-old daughter starting showing symptoms of sun poisoning the last day around 4:00am (headache, nausea, dizziness, fever, hives) which we had to deal with the entire day of travelling back home (cool shower, Ibuprofen, Benedryl, aloe vera with lidocaine, lots of water and 7-up). She had no visible sunburn. And we went through 3 bottles of Neutrogena SPF 70 between the four of us in 5 days. Also, had wide-brimmed sun hats for me and her, and used loungers under the trees. So, be careful! A couple of things I wish I would've known: bring more cash than you think you'll need. There's only one ATM in Playacar and it dispenses pesos. There is a Señor Frog's down the beach heading into town (5th Ave) that has an ATM that dispenses US dollars. (It's a 20-25 minute walk from Riu Palace Mexico, saving you a $7 cab ride). Speaking of 5th Ave, you can't walk more than 3 feet without being accosted by someone selling something. Wear earphones, dark glasses and a big hat! We only lasted 4 blocks before we turned around, fed up with the harrassment. But Señor Frog's was a groovy place to hang out before we walked back. Bring your own towel from the resort to Maroma Paradise snorkeling! No one told us we needed our own, and to rent them is $5 each. Also, the snack and sodas they tell you is included is served in a restaurant by a waiter. We only brought the reef conservation tax money ($2 each) and tipped the boat crew the last $2 we had on us. I felt really cheap getting up and walking away without tipping the server. Everyone wants a tip. Not the hotel staff! They appreciate the little extras, but they do not expect a thing and are always extremely gracious and grateful. But the shuttle/bus drivers, the boat crews, the porters at the airport, everyone outside the hotel will pretty much tell you they work for tips soooo....(insert foot tapping here). At check-in to go home, we had nothing left and the guy who walked us all the way into the line was pretty irked when we told him we were broke. If anyone wants to take your picture, or asks your name, or wants to put a sombrero on you and sing to you, they want at least $10 dollars in exchange for whatever little gimmicky trinket or souvenir they slap your picture/name on. Which goes back to bring more cash than you'll think you'll need!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing hotel, such a shame to leave such paradise!”
Reviews.Author: CPrates
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the palace was fantastic! We were able to see all the other Riu hotels in Playa del Carmen during our stay( Tequila, Playacar, Yucatan),and none of them came close to the elegance and outstanding service that we received at the Palace. The beach was very clean, and the pools were very well maintained. The only thing that could have been improved was the mattresses on the beds, which were quite hard, and the coffee which could have been better. But compared to everything else, these were quite minor imperfections. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anybody who is willing to spend a little more on their trip for an absolutely unforgettable vacation. Five stars for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel... would definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: lorirogers
Reviews.Content: My husband are I are in our 30's. We traveled with his parents and their kids, 11 & 16. The hotel had things for everyone of all ages. Upon entering the hotel, the decor is elegant and classic. The beautiful chandaliers, dark hard wood, and paintings stand out. We enjoyed the rooms. We were located on the ground level with a patio over looking the fountains. The beds however were not very comfortable. They had 2 full size beds pushed togther to make a large king, made it difficult to sleep near eachother. The sitting area, patio, and mini bar area were all nice! The pool area was a bit out dated, but large. They have a swim up patio that is covered in shade, so it was hard to sit there if the day wasn't hot. I would have liked to be in the sun. We were able to find chairs each morning both at the pool and the beach. the short walk down to the beach was filled with white sand and palm trees, and scattered inbetween were a hammocks swinging. the Staff was incredible. Everyone was so nice and accomodating. I loved how the cocktail servers came both around the pool and to the beach. Service with a smile! I enjoyed everyone we met. The food was wonderful, minus the french infused restaurant. (It just wasnt our style...we did hear that others loved it.) The buffet breakfast was incredible, everything you could think of and more. and the quality was fantastic. The lunch buffets that we ate at were by the beach, again great food and wonderful service. For dinner you had the option of eating at the buffet or one of the 4 specialty restuarants. (French infused, brazilian, steakhouse, & japonese) We loved the Japonese restuarant! You had to make a reservation each morning around 8am to get into either a 6:30 or 8:45 seating. I wished we would have been able to make our reservations for the entire stay instead of each day. After dinner their was a show each night starting at 9:45pm. The dancers were fabulous! I was very impressed with their abilities, the different themes, and the costumes. So fun to watch. However, we ate at at 8:45 a couple nights, which meant we didn't get great seats and came in late. Overall, a great hotel! I had never been to an all inclusive and this was a great first experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Now doubt about it”
Reviews.Author: Daveann11
Reviews.Content: I will make this as short as possible. This place was spectacular. The service,grounds,beach, pool and restaurants were top notch. Restaurants: The best food we have ever had at an all inclusive...we ate in Playa one night and preferred the RIU food at the buffet. Anyone saying food gets repetitive is because they kept eating the same things. A lot of variety for everyone. Steakhouse: Very good, this was the only one we tried. Too worn out by the end of the day. (Be sure to be there at or before 8 am to get a number first; then return by 8:30 am to make your reservation for the specialty restaurants). Ordered room service twice, limited menu but nice to eat in and not have to get all dolled up for an hour. Drinks: Premium liquor but the wine was not good. Pools: Very nice and clean...pretty quiet though. We spent time at the Yucatan to liven up our day a few days and were glad to come home to the relaxing nights at the Palace. Service around the pool at the palace none at the Yucatan. Rooms: Spacious and clean. Balcony had a cement wall but very private. We were in rooms 1045 and 1046. Perfect location!!! Next to pool, short walk to beach and right next door to the Yucatan. We had a nice mattress pad on our HUGE bed and slept like babies. To sum it up: If you are looking for a crazy all inclusive party palace this place is NOT for you, but you have the Yucatan/Tequilla/Playacar/Lupita options. I can say that I would most certainly return for all that we had enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all-inclusive hotel”
Reviews.Author: ripejack
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 11 night stay and shall certainly return. The suites, food, staff, facilities, landscaping, bars and entertainment (day and evening) are all fantastic and great value. The restaurants offer an excellent variety and we thoroughly enjoyed the Brazilian restaurant. On arrival after an 11 hour flight, we were offered a suite which didn't have a great outlook but we were switched to a suite overlooking the landscaped gardens without any fuss at all. Shop around for your excursions to the Mayan attractions - Chichenitza etc - as your tour operator may not offer the best excursions for you. We opted for a minibus tour to Chichenitza - it was a long day but well worth the effort, despite the extreme heat, and we were thankful not to be cramped in a coach. The all-inclusive is all you can manage and far more - the optics and beers in the suites are plentiful but if I would have one small gripe, I would suggest that the Hotel stocked one of the better known brands of beer (on tap and bottled) because despite the heat and the very relaxing atmosphere, we didn't really like what was on offer. It's strange really, with Sol and Corona amongst my favourite bottled beers, and brand names on the majority of the spirits - and if there is only one beer on offer, it needs to be something that appeals! Despite this, I would have no hesitation in recommending the Riu Palace Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “So Worth It!!!”
Reviews.Author: journeytojourney
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 12, and every single person thoroughly enjoyed our stay! Personally, I definitely felt as if the value I received was worth double what I paid! The staff is SO accomodating, the resort is absolutely beautiful, and the beach is perfection. I can't stop raving! I think my favorite aspect of our trip is that I felt like we had the beach all to ourselves. Because it's not a massive resort, there is always plenty of room on the beach. We always found our friends, and there was plenty of room to play beach games. And definitely bring your own big mug as the plastic cups they give you for beach drinking are absolutely tiny. Secondly, I loved the specialty restaurants! Krystal was my favorite, but Miyagi and the Steakhouse were also huge fan favorites of our group. The food is cooked to perfection! Finally, what I liked most about this hotel is that it's not full of Spring Breakers. Only one bar is open late, so you won't have rowdy crowds running through the hallways at odd hours. However, if you do want a nightlife, you can simply walk across the street to Tequila. As a Palace patron, you have access to all 6 other Riu hotels, but they cannot come to your hotel. I can't say a single negative thing about our stay (8 days). You are definitely getting more than you're paying...and I highly recommend bringing singles for tipping. The service is wonderful without it, but a little additional does go a long way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, happy guests!”
Reviews.Author: DoggieFamily
Reviews.Content: We were there March 9 - 15, 2011. This hotel is wonderful and the service was fantastic. The rooms are huge and very comfortable. I am witing this review to note just a couple things as all the reviewers have covered most everything. My husband and I are fairly active, and although there is water aerobics, volleyball, sailing and kayaking available, plus you can purchase snorkel and SCUBA trips, the general population of very friendly and happy guests that come here are mostly in it for the laying in the sun and drinking and smoking. That is all fine and good and it appears the guests were loving their vacations!! But there are no "no smoking" zones so if you are a non-smoker, just be prepared for the overwhelming number of people that are smoking there, especially at night in the courtyard where everyone hangs out for after dinner cocktails and the nightly show. Not the end of the world or anything, but I just wanted people to be aware that this is much more of a leisurely vacation spot - which is exactly what a lot of people want! We were at Club Med Cancun last year and found that to be a much more active population of guests, and smoking was restricted to certain areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation at RIU Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: truttchy4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 night vacation at the RIU Palace Mexico and we were 100% pleased. This was our second trip to the Riviera Maya, Playa del carmen area. Last year we stayed at the RIU Playacar and had such a wonderful experience, that we wanted to try another RIU in the area. The resort and grounds are absolutely as beautiful in person as it looked on line! The hotel staff were nothing but gracious, personable & very, very friendly. Our rooms were wonderful, the maid staff did a superb job always leaving us a very cleanly room. I believe they even changed the sheets each day! The food was as wonderful as last years was, always something different to choose from on the buffets. We ate at the SteakHouse, Kristal and Brazilian restaurants. The steaks at the Steakhouse & Kristal were absolutely fantastic. We live in Wisconsin and have some of the best steaks in our restaurants in the USA and these were just as delicious and prepared exactly to our order! Cudos to all of the chefs at the resort. We were not overly impressed with the food at the Brazilian restaurant... the wait staff was top notch... but most of the food was very tough to chew... a little over cooked is my guess! But maybe we just hit it on a bad night. Our only surprise was the first night for dinner we went down to the Buffet Restaurant for dinner and our husbands had on shorts and a nice shirt and they had to go back to the rooms and change into long pants. We were rather surprised at this since last year at the Playacar they could were shorts. I guess we missed that point on the website. It wasn't a big deal... but we don't really think that this was necessary for that restaurant. The guys had only brought one pair of dress pants along- thinking they'd only need them for 2-3 dinners at the "reservation restaurants". But with this being our only "surprise"... we are not complaining about it in the least!! A shout out to Jonathon at the swimup bar & Elile our breakfast waiter... you were both so much fun and amazing workers... good luck to you both in your futures! If you are considering staying at the RIU Palace Mexico don't hesitate to do so... it was a little more subdude atmosphere compared to the Tequilla... we went there several nights for drinks at the Sports Bar - which was over-run with highschool & college spring breakers.... who were over the top annoying! We saw very little of this at the Palace. We cann't wait to return again in a few vacations! The Truttschels from Wisconsin !

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoandWill
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Palace. It was cheaper than the Riu Palace Riveriera Maya because it is due a refurb but you do get the same 5* service as the Maya and I thought the rooms and public areas are still really nice. Infact I would like to complement the hotel on it's service as all the staff were excellent. A special thank you needs to go to lady that worked the Lobby Bar in an evening as she was really attentative and professional. You get a good choice of known brands of spirits etc. We went across to some of the Riu Club hotels some nights and you could tell a difference in the quality of spirits compared to the good brands that the Palace served. However do try the disco at the Riu Yucatan as it really is a good laugh. The pool was ok, quiet, but we liked that. The beach however was excellent and you could always get a bed and move it into the sun or shade as required at any time of the day. I have to say the beach is beautiful and you can walk either way for quite a distance. Watch out for the lizards on the rocks if you walk in the direction away from Playa Del Carmen. They make a really good photo opportunity. We went into Playa several times for nights out and found it really safe. Some of the bars on the side streets away from 5th Avenue have more of a Mexican vibe and you can have a drink with the locals. I never tired of the food, they have theme nights and try to keep it interesting. We went in the speciality restaurants twice. The Steak House was not to my liking but I loved the Japenese restaurant. Don't be afraid to go there if you don't like seafood as they have chicken and beef dishes. I think the only gripe I would have with the hotel is with the dress code on an evening for gentleman. They have a policy of not letting men wear 3/4 trousers / shorts. However they let people in with base ball caps. something a lot of bars / restaurants in the UK ban. And some of the women wore near on beach shorts for dinner. Apart from that some of the guests brought in their "Bubba Cups" that they had used all day at the pool bar and continued to drink from them through out dinner!! I agree with the previous reviewer, some of the guests used these cups for their drinks through out the day and got drunk early on at the pool bar. But that was ok as it left the nice Lobby Bar to everyone else who wanted a nice sociable drink in the evening. Do not be worried about the bad reviews, it is a very good hotel. We requested and got a room on the top floor. So if you are worried about security, request one of these rooms as no one can climb up to your balcony. Also, if you suffer mosquito bites, as I do, put your "do not disturb" sign on the door as you go out to dinner so you do not get the evening turnover service. (They leave your door open as they are doing this, creating an opportunity for the mosquitos to get in your room.)

Reviews.Title: “2nd Year back to the Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: hwy.
Reviews.Content: I personally cannot say enough about this place, we absolutely love it here. The staff goes above and beyond to make your vacation the best possible. Your always greeted with a friendly smile and "Hola". They are hard workers and want you to enjoy your stay. As always, the grounds are well kept, from trimming the bushes & lawn to scrubbing the floors in the middle of the night so they are clean in the morning. The beach area is great, always plenty of chairs. At this point, we will stay at any RIU because we love the atmosphere and friendliness of the staff. Thank you again Palace Mexico, for a wonderful vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Anybody finding things wrong with this Hotel need to "get a life"!”
Reviews.Author: Barty2
Reviews.Content: Just back from 2 week stay at RIU Palace Mexico , Playacar , Playa Del Carmen - do not confuse it with others! Great Holiday. Hotel fantastic - staff , all exceptional friendliness and service. Great selection of food. Used Fusion and Steakhouse speciality restaurants - these were really nice - better than some we have tried elsewhere. General Tips. Dont worry about rising early to get beds on beach - theres loads anytime. Hpwever pool can get towelled out by @ 09.00. Ignore loud Americans !! Some tend to drink all day and at pool bar, eat dinner early and crash out -dont see many at night. Entertainment fairly low key but try Riu Tequila ( also has disco). Prebook or take private taxi from Airport as transfer can be slow ( over 2 hours) Its @ one hour and 80 dollars one way in taxi. Playacar golf club. - beware if you take twlight tee times ( 120 dollars) as bar and food closed after 6.00 pm. You may get paired up with two others if there are just two of you. You will be charged for premier clubs even if you order regular at time of booking! Did not like their attitude so only played once -nice course . Coco Bongos - a must to go to even if you are 40/50 like us - great show but pay extra for VIP ticket its worth it ( 100 dollars). Exceptionally well run organisation and show. Playa Del Carmen -its more than 25 minute walk or only £ 2.50 cab fare. Cabs always outside hotel. Very safe to walk around. nice restaurants. Sports Bar literally over road in Riu Tequilla -shows Premeirship/Euro games -Spanish commentary. Open 24hrs. Uk 1pm games on at 7.00 am in Mexico. finally -Go and Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Love the Area”
Reviews.Author: marnieWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Went with a good girlfriend. We were treated wonderfully. I have stayed at multiple RIU porperties (6 different times) love the cleanliness of the resort. Lots of friendly smiles and great service. Had a GI issue from something for 2 days, nothing a little immodium could cure. Loved the walks to Playa D. Took some backroads through quaint little neighborhoods. Overall a great resort, a little lacking in nightlife. Food selection is excellent, dont expect 5 star food. Most days too tired to stay up past 11 anyways!!!! The beach is just breathtaking. Bring your laptop! Dont hesitate, book now.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Fun, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JLW55
Reviews.Content: From the reception in a palatial lobby, to the design and maintenance of the grounds, unfailing friendliness (not the too familiar sort) and helpfulness of the staff, we were impressed. One does not expect either service or food to be above average at an all inclusive resort. This was a surprising exception to that expectation. There are four "gourmet" restaurants on site plus a large central buffet style restuaruant and then 2 addtional restuaruants down by the beach. Our favorite of the four restaurants that require reservations was the Japanese (Miagi or something close to that). We were also impressed by the buffet restuaruant. Most buffets are sort of awful arrangements of overcooked food on institutional looking steam tables. This is as far from that stereotype as it could be. The beach is great. The resort has planted palm trees (30 or 40 feet tall) thickly at a distance form the shorline, and then more thinly as one approaches the waterline. So, you can choose to snooze in the chaise lounges in complete shade, filtered sunlight or for 75 yards or so next to the water, complete sun. Sand is fine and light yellow, water was comfortable (75 F ?) for February and incredibly blue/green, sun was great. The waiters and bartenders also make an effort and succeed in learning your name and remembering your drink. Pools with swim up bars are fun and lots of people used them. In the evenings, there are shows every night in the theatre. A little hoky, but still fun. Our "junior suite" was great, tile floor, patio, living room/area, bed room and nice bath. Booze dispensor consisting of 4 different bottles of liquor, plus a refrigerator with soda, water and beer. We played tennis every day (2 hard courts), beached, scuba dived, and shopped in Playa. We will be going back for more. One negative comment is that wireless is not complimentary in the rooms. It is available without charge in the lobby and courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Own Cup”
Reviews.Author: ctammy
Reviews.Content: If you are planning on staying at any of the All-Inclusive RIU Resorts in the Playa Car area and plan to take advantage of the unlimited drinks bring your own cups! When we arrived on site, I strangely wondered why so many of the guest were walking around with their own thermal cups…until I got to the bar and ordered a drink. The drinks are served in 4oz plastic cups, so unless you are looking for some great exercise going back and forth to the bar or hope to have one of the waiters at your beck in call, you may want to consider taking this advise. Oh and don’t plan on buying one when you get there…we looked all over and couldn’t find one. Aside from that our stay at the RIU Palace Mexico was a 3 out of 5. As always the staff is very accommodating. I have to say, we have been many places and the servicer you receive in Mexico is immeasurable to other regions. The beach – Wonderful! Beautiful waters and white sand as far as the eye can see! The pool – So, So. On the small side. Get there early to claim your chair! They did have a swim up bar which was nice but be prepared to hear the same music CD over and over. I think I have had my fill of ABBA after about the 5th go around. The activities – If bingo or water aerobics are your thing then this is the place for you. I think they could have done a little bit more in this area. I have been to resorts where they staff is always around trying to get the guests involved in a game of volleyball or some kind of activity, not so much here. The room – If you like hard beds then you are in for a treat! I myself prefer something a bit softer then the plastic brick to lay my head on at night. Now, I have to say we did make mention of this to one of the staff members and again very accommodating….they brought a mattress pad to our room and placed it on the beds. Oh yeah, if you are expecting a king size bed plan for 2 double beds pushed together – just beware of the crack. The rooms are equipped with a mini bar and a fridge which is restocked daily with bottled water, beer and soda. The food – I have yet to really find an All-Inclusive that I walked away thinking the food was wonderful and this was no exception. The breakfast and lunch buffets are great! Enough food to feed a small country. Dinner on the other hand, let’s say a 2 out of 5. With that said, we were only able to eat dinner in one the designated dinner restaurants 2 of the 6 nights we were there. Here’s the thing, you have to make reservations daily. They have 2 dinner seating’s, 6:30 and 8:45. In the morning (specified time period – I think it was 8:00 – 10:00) you have to go grab a number and wait to be called to choose your dining experience for the evening. Now, plan on hanging out a bit as both days I think we were number 60 in line and once your number is called it’s a crap shoot as to what will still be available. Both times we only had the option for the 8:45 seating, which for us was fine. The food – nothing to write home about. Oh and make sure you dress for dinner, no shorts or tank tops allowed. For me I’m not sure of the logic behind this, because when I’m on vacation and the last thing I want to do is put paints on. The location – Great location!!!! It’s a $5.00 cab ride down to 5th Ave. Fun area for shopping, drinking or just people watching. If you are planning on doing any scuba diving you can also catch the ferry over to Cozumel there. On a side note – if using the ferry, buy a 1 way ticket. There are 2 ferry carriers and if you buy a round trip ticket you will be subject to that carries departure times. All of the RIU resorts are located in an area called Playa Car, which is a cute, gated, self contained area of hotels and residential/vacation rental properties and shopping. Resort Sharing – All of the other resorts are within walking distance and you can use their facilities with the exception of dinner. Other RIU – We went to all of them to check them out. We stayed at the RIU Palace Mexico not to be confused with the RUI Palace Riviera Maya. They are very similar in looks and set up, but I have the say the Riviera Maya looked a bit newer and nicer but not worth a huge cost difference. Evening Entertainment – I think the Palace Mexico is a little slower paced then some of the sister properties, so if you are looking for nightlife you may want to consider one of the other properties. All in all we loved our vacation and would consider staying again but would also research the other available options in the Playa Car region.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: buckley96
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time and would go back to any of the Riu's in this area. Staff is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good, but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: SeniorGoose
Reviews.Content: All of the staff were very friendly and accomodating. The food was of the typical all inclusive variety. The property was beautiful and in a great location from Playa Del Carmen. Pitfalls ... Called for new towels for the room and never received them. Way too many palm trees around the pool area created a problem to get good seating by the pool. Was horrified one morning to observe a worker kill a stray cat with a machete. :( Lack of the some of the more popular premium rums i.e. Bacardi Select

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!! Great beaches, friendly staff, clean hotel, good food & drinks!!”
Reviews.Author: luvmy3guys
Reviews.Content: We visited Playa Del Carmen from Feb 11-18 and it was more than we thought it would be. We loved it!! We got through the airport/customs and immigration at the airport in probably an hour. Our shuttle service, Lomas Travel was incredible. We found the rep right away because of the teal shirt and white pants. He took our bags and got us right over to our shuttle and was incredibly polite and helpful. The drive from Cancun to Playa was about 45 minutes, but we met some nice people that rode in our shuttle with us, so it made the time pass.....oh, not to mention the Corona's we drank. :-) Checking in was a breeze. We got our key and they helped us up to our room. Room was very, very clean and I even made it a point to look around in cracks and crevices just to see with my own eyes. I even felt comfortable laying on the comforter on the bed and I get grossed out about those at hotels. Every day at different parts of the day they were always cleaning...scrubbing floors, painting the railing outside on the courtyard, cutting the grass, trimming bushes....everything was immaculate. Yes, there is a musty smell, but that's EVERYWHERE in Mexico, it's not just this hotel. If you can't stand it then Mexico isn't for you. The hotel was huge, courtyard beautiful, beaches very well cared for and gorgeous. Food was great too. Buffets were awesome with a wide variety to choose from. You will never go hungry here. The only angst was the lack of "snacky" type food. They had chips/cheese dip at the pool bar, but I agree, the cheese was kind of gross. My husband and I would recommend taking snacks to the room with you....chips, crackers...something like that for in between meal times. Making reservations at the restaurants was not difficult at all, so I totally disagree with the reviews saying it is. We were generally up around 7:30 everyday, so we'd take our time, shower, throw on our suits/cover ups and head down to breakfast. One day we had to wait about 10 minutes to get reservations, but we got them in the sushi res. where we requested and actually ate there twice that week. We also ate at El Patio and never had any issues getting reservations. It's not a mad dash to get down there, but if you wait til 10:30 then no, you probably won't get your reservation, but it doesn't hurt to ask. I can't say enough good about some of the staff. We absolutely loved Santoya and Raul at the hotel and Carlos from Lomas Travel. But, all in all, everyone was very polite and extremely helpful. They actually seem like they enjoy what they're doing!! We also met some great couples that we partied with one night. Lots of people escaping the cold winter. Weather was awesome.....80-85 and sunny every day. It rained one day, all day, so we improvised and went to 5th Ave (downtown) all day. We had a great time!! Totally safe....no problems with people or the taxi's or anything. Of course we loved the drinks at the hotel because you can get anything you want....beer, margs, martinis, dacquiris....you name it. There were 2 weddings while we were there....one was under the gazebo in the courtyard because of the rain and the other was on the beach.......BEAUTIFUL to watch and be part of. We did two excursions. One was a catamarane that took us to a beach where we at steak/lobster on the beach in the evening. It was incredible and romantic. The other was jet skis/snorkeling. The tour guide was awesome and we rode the jet skis what seemed forever, so you got your money's worth. We snorkeled in two different places. Loved it! The only issue we had was getting a sick stomach the second to last day we were there and I think it's because of the water.....not sure. We did not drink the tap water, but we brushed our teeth with it, they mix it in drinks and probably rinse their lettuce, veggies and fruit with it. However, we are not positive on that. Other than that, the trip was incredible, we plan on going back again and staying at RIU Palace Mexico. Oh, one other thing....we were considerign taking our boys.....9 and 13, but this hotel is more for adults, not much to do for kids, so I wouldn't recommend kids go. Our boys would have been bored if we wouldn't have done excursions and that can get pricey. My husband and I would totally recommend this resort to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort with outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: dmfalle
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Riu Palace Mexico on Feb 2 thru the 8, 2011with 5 other couples. The transfer to the resort from the Cancun airport took about an hour but we had a very informational driver and found interesting things to see or discuss along the way. Just relax - the time will pass. Check-in went smoothly. We were scheduled to receive a "run of the house" room but I had emailed the resort a week prior to arriving to ask if we could use our 500 Riu points for an upgrade & asked again upon arrival. They granted us an upgrade being placed on the main level w/ a garden view right across from the large fountains. Our Junior Suite was very nice. I have seen mentioned that the furniture looks a little worn but not in our room. The beds are pushed together but that makes for one huge bed and we didn't mind at all. Please note there is a sticker on the bathroom mirror not to drink the water in your room as is the case in many Mexican resorts. No problem - the room is stocked each day w/ plenty of bottled water in both large & small bottles. On another note - have a problem w/ a short supply of towels etc... - just call housekeeping and the towels will arrive in as long as it took them to come to your room. The biggest asset is the beach! It is wonderful compared to others we have visited. You can walk as far as the eye can see and the water is very play-full. The lounge area is very large w/ plenty of lounge chairs. One little draw-back, there are no tables in the lounge area but were told to just bring the small white tables down from the pool areas. I think they take them back up at night to keep them from blowing away. The pools were a little smaller than the other Riu's we have visited being the Riu Vallarta, in PV & the Riu Montego Bay in Jamaica but were very nice & adequate. We spend very little time @ the pools because the beach was perfect. The food in the buffet - what can we say - it was plentiful, a large variety, nicely presented & way too yummy! Your choices are endless. I have read that it gets tiresome but pick something different each day or stick w/ your stand-bys, can't go wrong. One note, if you have a large group at the evening buffet - there are large tables in the back of the buffet and they will gladly move or combine tables. We only ate at one specialty restaurant but ate there twice. It was the steak house and the best was the Baked Alaska! Ordered it both evenings. Being from Nebraska - we can't judge the beef because no - one can beat our own Nebraska beef on the grill. It was good though. The other entrees were served family style and were very tasty. Concerning making reservations for the specialty restaurant - we have early risers so it was not a problem and we have experienced different methods of making reservations and none are perfect or totally convenient for everyone. We had visited a resort prior that had the option to make reservations 3 days in advance. What we found in that case was the first 3 days - they were totally booked so with that example we gladly accept the method at the Riu's. The service - we have been to 25 different 4 star resorts in as many years. The service was a step-up from any others we have visited. They will do anything to please you. No others words but excellent! The drinks were typical Mexican or tropical varieties but they will give you what ever you desire. They offer wine at each meal. We drank alot of "dirty monkeys & mud slides" but often opted for plain ole whiskey & water etc.... Again, service is outstanding - they are back to serve you again before you know it. As far as noise level generated by entertainment. Yes, you may hear it until 11pm but who goes to bed before then anyway and if you shut your doors - you will receive a quiet sleep. The entertainment was typical Mexican resort variety. We were there for the SuperBowl and felt very pampered to watch it in the open terrace area outside of the big projection screen theatre when we would have been bundled in blankets at home. Would I recommend this particular resort? YES! In fact, we are planning a business trip next winter and are seriously thinking about scheduling this resort again. That has never happened in 25 years.

Reviews.Title: “Good as Always”
Reviews.Author: swami
Reviews.Content: Resort still offers great service. If fact when we check in they stated they would have better rooms for us the next day if we would switch which we did. Food is wonderful in the ala cartes. They resort is starting to show it age but they are doing painting eveyday to fix it up. Easy to find a chiar on the beach. They walked around eveyday at the beach giving away drinks both with and without booze. Still quiet at night but only a 25 to 30 minute walk into Playa. Resort is cleaned eveyday inculding the beach.

Reviews.Title: “The Best All Inclusive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RangerFarnborough
Reviews.Content: In my view the this was the best all inclusive hotel I have experienced including Sandals, which was terrible. The service was excellent all round and the bar service, which included international drinks, was exceptional. There was a bar delivery service on the wonderful beach most days. We had a standard room which was very clean and spacious and was fully equipped including a mini bar, again with international drinks, at no extra cost. The food was excellent including the buffet and there were four other theme restaurants with al la carte service. There was entertainment every night supplemented by a grandstand band both professional. The only minor downside was that the provision of hot water in the room was sometimes inconsistent

Reviews.Title: “Very good resort with good food that my kids even loved!”
Reviews.Author: Morgans4
Reviews.Content: To start off, we arrived later at night so check in was a breeze. We were in our rooms within 10 minutes of arriving. Sleeping arrangements with a family are odd. There are two small double beds pushed together. It was impossible for all four of us to sleep in them so one of my children had to sleep on the small, non-pull out sofa. The rooms were musty smelling but this is to be expected with most Caribbean rooms. Our safe worked and we kept everything in there. We also kept our patio door locked as we were on the main level. Don't take any chances with your valuables. Be smart. Our room cleaning service was great and our rooms were very clean and turned down every night. There are two large pools. They are kept very cold but this is nice for a refreshing dip when you are sweating your butt off!!! One pool is quite deep so it didn't work well for us with the kids. We had to use the part of the pool that is right in front of the swim up bar. This is the best height for my kids (6 & 7). The kids pool is a bit of a joke. It's a super tiny wading pool. Good for toddlers, I guess, but I never saw anyone in it... ever! The kids club is small but my kids loved it. They played ping pong in the shade and loved the people working there. It was good for them to get into the shade and have a change of pace every once and a while. I felt very comfortable leaving them there. Now the food. I really enjoyed the food and we are very PICKY resort food eaters. We will not go to Cuba or the DR because of the food. If you love sushi, the Japanese restaurant is amazing!!!! We went back twice. The Steak House was quite good too. They do not have kid options at the restaurants (like chicken fingers and fries) so most people with children ate at the buffet. My kids are flexible eaters so we did fine. Making reservations is very annoying!!! You've got to be there early every day to make your reservation for that night and it's a bit of a mad dash to try and get a good number if you want a 6:30 reservation. It's a very small resort and everything is walking distance. I prefer small resorts. I do not like waiting for busses and trains to take me to dinner. The size was lovely but that also means that you will hear everything that happens at night at the main stage. The air conditioning will drown out the noise though. I was happy for the AC as my kids were in bed when the music started up. The service was wonderful! I was very pleased with the people who knew my kids and always patted them on the head. The kids loved it. And the servers always remembered our drink orders. A $5 at the beginning of the day will help you with that!!! My Spa experience "to start" off was terrible. I had to wait for 15 minutes only to find out that they couldn't find my massage therapist. Then this man who was sweeping the floors said he would massage me. I didn't even believe that he was a massage therapist so I rebooked for the next day. They next day I also waited a long while and when I finally got my massage it was only 40 minutes even though I paid for 50. Here is the good part. They gave me a free massage the next day and it was lovely. She even threw in an extra 10 minutes. They were very apologetic and I went away pleased. Down Town is only a $5 taxi cab drive. Well worth it! We enjoyed our day trip there. And the kids loved watching me barter. Do not be afraid to ask for a lower price. Overall, we enjoyed this resort. There were good and bad but mainly good!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing spot with many amenities and very friendly staff equals good vacation”
Reviews.Author: 19adventurer68
Reviews.Content: if you want to party, Cancun is an hour north. If you want the party options, but with excellent service, beautiful beaches, relaxing atmosphere, and a great deal for the price, then travel to the Riu palace in playacar. It appears the average traveler to playacar is older crowd and not younger newlyweds or folks with children, who would probably have more options in Cancun. Despite this, the resort and area have many fun options, but with the tranquil atmosphere for unwinding on a vacation (that's some of the point, right!?) the resort is a bit older and musty, but impecibly clean. someone was always cleaning or shining something....so becareful on those tile floors! the food was delicious and every staff member we met was friendly. it was a great trip for the price. If i wanted to visit the same place again, sure i would go back. However, now i know that if i pick a Riu hotel, i could likely get the same quality, just at another location to explore. It's quite a hike from the airport, so be prepared. the beaches are beautiful, rooms very nice and it is the perfect "this is a vacation" hotel in mexico - no highrise here! the sleep quality =2....just have more free alcoholic drinks, the beds are HARD.

Reviews.Title: “Totally enjoyed everything ... BRAVO !!!”
Reviews.Author: latenighterpete
Reviews.Content: Check in was swift and easy ... We had asked for a comfortable bed, room with a good view of the beach, (we love the ocean), and a second floor room ... 5 star for them all ... The beach view was a tough request as the hotel itself is separated from the beach by a series of pools and a huge palm tree grove, but we had a lovely view and it was quiet and peaceful ... When I asked my wife what she wanted for her birthday, she replied, "a big wide beach" .... HUGE !!!! ... and beautiful ... Must be 400 feet wide at certain parts, and we were able to walk about 45 minutes (and more) in either direction .... The food was outstanding, both in the a la carte restaurants, to the fabulous buffets ...(you must book into these specialty restaurants early in the morning - 8:30am.) They had theme nights, and served up so many choices, too numerous to mention ... All the guests seemed to get into NEUTRAL, and totally enjoyed the nightly entertainment ..... A next door RIU had wilder parties and younger vacationers to entertain, but we, 60+, were more than happy to spend some quiet time at this place .... (There are 5 RIU's within 10 minutes of each other). Service was fantastic, friendly and never without a cheerful smile or "OLAH" ... AND, while we were out for my wife's birthday dinner, the staff went into our room and surprised us with dozens of balloons, flowers, and all of the 'towel characters' (animals), you could think of ... A totally enjoyable stay, with "SPECIAL" thanks to Aaron from the front desk... 'Thank you so much' for making a SPECIAL birthday vacation, the BEST we could imagine ... No wonder this is such a popular place to stay ... We did see families and children, (not many and all well behaved), and feel this place did a great job to please everyone .... We sure felt special !!!! Very good job Aaron and company .... We look forward to our next RIU stay .... BRAVO !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but be careful of the water!”
Reviews.Author: CBGolfers
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace Mexico in Playa del Carmen was a great place to stay and relax away some of the winter blues. We only tried two speciality restaurant, the Krystal (Fusion Gourmet) and the Steak House. I had the steak and my wife had the Sea Bass at the Krystal. Both meals were very good. The Steak House was also very good. The main restaurant was a buffet all week. They had many similar selections all week and had a speciality meal each night. It was okay, but nothing to write home about. The beach was ourstanding. Plenty of area to relax in the sun, or if you prefer, you could relax in the shade of the palm trees. We had to drag the lounge chairs to our location each day. They had a small beach bar, but you had to walk halfway back to the hotel to get to it. They could have put it a little closer to the beach. The pool was good. Plenty of room, but it was difficult to find a chair in the afternoon. This was the second Riu we stayed at (Montego Bay, Jamaica). It seemed like the other Riu had more planned activities for guests than this one. We even checked out the Riu Yucatan next door and it seemed like they had more things going on there. If you have small children, try another Riu. Not much to do there for kids. All-in-all, it was a pretty good stay. When people say don't drink the water in Mexico, they mean it!!! I didn't drink the water, but brushing my teeth and rinseing my mouth with it caused me to visit the restroom most of the day on a Saturday. They provide plenty of bottled water, so take advantage of that.

Reviews.Title: “This trip was amazing and everything I was hoping for!”
Reviews.Author: Rachl21
Reviews.Content: I went to Playa Del Carmen, Mexico for 5 days and 4 nights with two of my friends. The hotel was absolutely gorgeous and everything we were hoping for. The pool was beautiful and looked over the beach. Some days we went to the pool and other days we went to the beach. It was the best of both worlds. There were over 5 restaurants within the hotel so we were able to make a reservation for every night and since the hotel is all-inclusive we could eat and drink as much as we wantJennifer Toren helped us plan this vacation in a matter of a week. I told her a few details - that I'm looking for a vacation place to travel that has warm weather, a beautiful hotel, safe night life, and a fun environment/culture and she pulled everything together very quickly. I would definitely go back to Playa Del Carmen and stay at the RIU hotel. I will probably never plan a vacation without contacting Jennifer Toren again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Super Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Oliv0137
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our star at the Riu Palace Mexico. We arrived and were upgraded to a two story jacuzzi suite even though we weren't on our honeymoon - what a great surprise! Check-in took maybe ten minutes and everything we needed was explained to us at this time. Our room was super clean, as were the grounds and everything else. The bed was the biggest king we'd ever slept in. The hallways are open so the only places that are air conditioned are the room, lobby and restaurants. We had a "damp" smell in our room but it only seemed to appear when we'd be gone all day and returned. I always wore shoes in the room because the floors always seemed to feel wet but we had the same experience in Cozumel as well. The food was pretty good for an all-inclusive. We ate at Krystal (fusion) and it was decent but nothing over-the-top. The other restaurant we ate at was Miyagi which was also decent - our waiter brought us extra sushi without us even asking. I was surprised by the small size of these restaurants. We ended up in the high 30's in the reservation line and had no problem getting into the restaurants we wanted (the 6:30 times were full but we wanted the 8:45 anyways). The buffet had a large selection for dinner and breakfast. We ate lunch by the beach at the buffet there - it was OK. We got tired of the food the last couple days. I ate lots of pineapple instead of the other junk food but ended up with an upset stomach. There was just so much fresh fruit I couldn't seem to stop myself... We loved the beach and had no trouble finding a good spot under the palm trees. We'd usually move to the pool area after lunch and again, no problems finding a good spot. At the beach, trays of drinks were brought around and there was waiter service at the pool. We did go to the Riviera Maya Palace one afternoon - the pool is nicer there but it was really crowded. It was partly cloudy a few days and rained a few times throughout the trip but we were never really bored. The piano lounge in the lobby was great and the drinks seemed to be the best there. The beach bar drinks seemed to be pretty weak and so did the alcohol in the rooms. One last note - the only place for wi-fi is in the lobby/courtyard or there were laptops you could pay to use. The only real complaints we had were the slippery walkways (inside and out) when they were wet and the dinner reservation system. Overall, we had a relaxing trip and would recommend this resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good not perfect but I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: natnats
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a week at the Riu Palace Mexico. Had a good holiday (although the weather was decidedly iffy for Feb) and we would definitely return to the hotel. Lobby: The lobby is a formal area, and for me lacked any atmosphere. The bell boy service was excellent and speedy both on arrival and departure from the hotel. The reception staff were distinctly average and not particularly friendly. The lobby is a vast area with a large decorative stone staircase at each end leading to the rooms. There's also a shop (extortionate!) and a lovely little chapel. There's also a lobby bar that wasn't particularly well used. The lobby tended to be heavily used by people with laptops taking advantage of the free wifi service. Bedrooms: Our bedroom was located at the beach end of the hotel which suited us perfectly. We were on the top floor and overlooked some trees and the tennis courts of the Riu Yucatan. It was a quiet location and had the sun most of the day. Being picky, the balcony was very small in comparison to most and it was only just about big enough to seat two. The room itself was very spacious and despite lots of reviews stating rooms were tired, for me the condition was very good. The mini bar was well stocked and the optics had premium brands including Smirnoff, Jose Cuervo and Bacardi. A coffee maker was provided with two mugs and coffee but no spoons, sugar or milk!!! The wardrobe was massive with tons of hangers. The bathroom was also spacious with lots of towels, and shampoo/conditioner, shower gel and body lotion all provided and replenished every day. When we arrived, the air con wasn't working but this was immediately fixed as soon as we mentioned it. One thing we couldn't fault all holiday was the cleanliness. The room was absolutely spotless all week as was the rest of the hotel. Pool: There is one small pool area (split into two) with loungers and a pool bar. We spent most of our time at the beach but used to stop at the pool bar for a drink on the way back to the room. The side of the pool with the bar is quite lively, the other side is much quieter so something for everyone. There seemed to be loungers available most of the time. Beach: The beach is lovely and again the loungers were plentiful. We used to head to the beach at about 9 am and often found we were one of the first. The beach does get busy but never felt crammed unlike some of the other hotels nearby. One thing to note is that the only shade was under the palm trees at the back of the beach. There's a beach bar and also lounger service (a selection of drinks brought around) which was great. The water sports were also good. Food: Breakfast for me in the main restaurant was the best of all the meals. Lunch was ok although we found that both beach restaurants (next door to each other) had different things so we ended up going back and forth between the two to get what we wanted. The main restaurant in the evening had a good selection of foods for all tastes. We tried two of the speciality restaurants – the steakhouse and Krystal. Both were nice but Krystal was the better by far – we went twice! I should also mention the fact that there's free room service available. Entertainment: This was very low key which suited us. Most nights there was the house band followed by a dance show. The local Mayan show being the one to watch. We had drinks most nights out in the courtyard and there were stalls to browse several nights too. This is a quiet low key hotel, so if you are looking for lively entertainment then just pop across the road to the Tequila. I travelled with my Mum and the Riu Palace Mexico suited us perfectly. I'd highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a low key week in a very nice and civilised hotel. If you are looking for somewhere with lots of young people, entertainment, late nights and parties then I highly recommend the Riu Tequila across the road. Feel free to email me if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Gyurcika
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our 9 month old son, the staff was extremely kind with him and also we had a nice time. The food was very good, although the speciality restaurants were not up to our expectations after the first days at the buffet. The flagship, Krystal, might be inspired by Michelin-star cooks, but it is not close to a star. The pool area is nicer at the other Palace, RIU Palace Riviera Maya. I would maybe still recommend this hotel, as Riviera Maya seemed bit too posh for my taste. I highly recommend to upgrade to courtyard view room.

Reviews.Title: “Bad reviews are whacky”
Reviews.Author: turk3651
Reviews.Content: If your looking for your place,this is it.More bang for your buck,and all you could want for warm weather vacation.Service excellent,food better than recent years and the all inclusive is just that-----you cant spend even if you want to--------and for the night lovers,across the street at clubhotel--great,jammed outdoor bar and club that opens at 11p-cant wait for next January

Reviews.Title: “Real Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: VeryHappy_11
Reviews.Content: I love this Hotel!!! Food was GREAT, GREAT. Rooms were SO CLEAN!!! Front Desk was so friendly and helpful. If I have a negative to say, it was the cleaning staff was not as friendly as they have been in the past. There was a stickie spill on the floor, in the hall, that was not cleaned up for a day, which was kind of bad. Went in a cast, which I would NOT do again, my bad, but the staff was not helpful at all, with a wheel chair, or in any other way. Not sure I should expect anything from the staff? but there was no consideration either. I finally found out myself, where the elevator was, so I could use it instead of the stairs with no rails. But all in all, I love this place!!!!! It was my third time, and I totally LOVE this hotel, and would go back in a heart beat!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: glynr0berts
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints whatsoever, regarding our stay at the rpm. The staff were incedible, with nothing being to much trouble. If you prefer a bit more lively nightlife, the other riu's are within easy walking distance. The food was superb with plenty of choices to cater for all possible tastes. Beach area was perfect, with ample loungers. The only slight problem, was that people who got to the pool area first, left theire belongings on the sunloungers, and came and went as they pleased. We even saw one couple having lunch in playa, and theire belongings were still there when they returned at 4 p.m. Ignorant in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service & Food!!”
Reviews.Author: jws057
Reviews.Content: We did not want to leave Saturday, but had to return to snowy Minnesota! Stayed January 22-29. The service was the best we have had & everyone was friendly. We have been to Cancun & Riviera Maya area before & this was the best resort we have stayed at. The food was great & large variety! The only thing we would like to of had is a restroom closer to the beach. Was nice having access to the other Riu Resorts & across the street from the club hotel. We went to The Steakhouse & Krystal restaurants & enjoyed the food. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “ALMOST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Mart/Wal
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a weeks vacation to the Riu Palace Mexico. Unfortunately our flight was delayed leaving Toronto so we didn't arrive to the hotel itself til about 2:00am in the morning. The rooms yes are dated but very spacious and nice. We ended up with a garden (back room) which really had no view to speak of but while not having a view provided us for some very private solitude and up close and personal with the pretty birds and wildlife. The food and service at this resort is really top notch so to find complaints there it is very difficult. About the only thing I could suggest that I have found at other resorts that I liked was having more snacks for lounging around the pool. The only thing available is nacho chips with the warm cheese. I might elaborate on that area and add a table with fresh salsa and guacamole and their chili and even a popcorn machine. My husband went over to the sports bar at the Riu Tequila to watch the NFL playoff games and they had some snacks in the refrigerator to help yourself and again just the boring nacho chips with the yucky cheese sauce. I was very surprised by the service on the beach, yes on the beach! The beach area is very large and as a guest of the Riu Palace you got drink service down there as well. This was a pleasant surprise and the drink service was amazing. Hard to finish a drink without them already coming back for a refill.. Overall I found this resort one of the most relaxing that I have ever gone to, in other words kinda boring for my liking. I would have enjoyed music around the pool bar area. This resort is mostly I would say for the 50 and up crowd. I managed to read almost 5 large books in one week so that will tell you what its like. I would return again in the future but would make sure that I went with another couple for entertainment purposes alone.

Reviews.Title: “Again an amazing time”
Reviews.Author: golferjeff345
Reviews.Content: We returned to RPM on 18th December for a 5 week stay. This is our 11th stay and it just gets better. This trip was our first for the festive season, and it was an absolute delight. The work that had gone into the preparation for Christmas Eve and New Years Eve was unbelievable, the whole of the restaurant had been transformed into a festive dream. The presentation, and selection of food was out of this world. The staff make this hotel a pleasure to return to, and we will keep returning for as long as we can. Even the gardeners greet you with a beaming smile and a hola. Cleanliness at this place has never been an issue, as the housekeeping staff are constantly working around the clock just to make sure there is never an issue. Location of RPM is excellent for us, as it is a 20 - 30 min walk into town or a 50 pesos cab ride, so we can either explore town or just jump on a ADO bus and go wherever we want, as we do not do all the sun bathing or just hanging around the hotel 24/7.
