This area of Mexico is beautiful, and has so much to offer and have no hesitation in recommending this place to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great service!”
Reviews.Author: vacatiomama
Reviews.Content: Went Jan. 10th-17th, Believe all the good reviews! I'll try and add some new stuff. Check-in by Aaron fast, he's wonderful, ask him for anything and you got it !Get an extra map of the property when u check in- it has everything u need to know on it (except where bathrooms are) -carry it with you till u get situated.Bathrooms, lobby,pool bar ,beach rest., have cute plaques of men n women instead of names, It rained 1 day but they had umbrellas in the room and u can get to everything except beach rest./steak house without going outside, There a water cooler at pool bar and nachos too. The cheese sauce for the nachos is the only thing I'd say is not good. Go figure! Room great, but musty smelling. I've been going to Mex for 30 years and u just have to come prepared with air fresheners. I'm 5"2" and could just barely reach the locks on the patio doors. Master switch at entry turns lights/TV all off or on(didn't realize this at first and thought I had lost power LOL!), plus a bar to prevent entry when inside. Ceiling fan switch by bed. Had rm. 0034, faced the Yucatan,( 00 rooms are ground level) large patio with large chairs that would recline and see thru iron railings, @12 feet of grass then 7 ft. hedge,fence and trees. on the other side of fence was walkway/ cart path to Yucatan beach access for the RT people. Didn'T hear any noise in room when doors were shut.. Lots of birds singing and a great place to have coffee in the am. in my bathrobe cuz no one could see me thru the hedge.Saw those funny squirrel/rabbit things- they are harmless. Couldn't do that if I faced the courtyard and had a patio with iron rails. (@ half of courtyard view rms. have see-thru iron rails. The rest are solid walls) Great shower, shower head was adjustable on a bar to go higher if needed, kinda slim tub though.2 extra pillows and 2 thick fluffy blankets in closet, they came in handy. Fridge was cold, even icy.Ltr. of water in bathroom for making coffee and brushing teeth ( Don't use tap water!) and plenty more in fridge. Air only works when patio doors are closed and floors can get slippery if u leave them open from humidity. A few mosquitoes, just keep screen doors closed.I cannot say enough @ the staff and maid service! I left $2 in fridge and $2 for maids everyday and put out "make up room" sign and it was done right after I went out! The towel animals they left put disney world one's to shame. They put roses in my room and I got a note from management the3rd day saying to call if I needed anything with a PDC shot glass! Oh ya-there is a pull out rack on patio to hang up wet suits etc...too. I only ate at the buffets and cant believe people say there is no selection. Breakfast had make ur own bloodys and mimosas, 7 smoothies, Eggs ANYWAY U WANT THEM cappuccino's etc..Just look around the place before u decide want u want.Service was always great.If u eat at the beach buffet for lunch, check out both restaurants, cuz they have burgers,dogs,ice cream on 1 side and pasta, pizza on other.The fish was best at dinner, I could go on and on! Buffet by lobby is non smoking except on patio. Beach is great and big now, always got a pool chair too. Beach service from beach bar a plus.All bar service was fast, no waiting. I don't stay up too late, but the live band in court yard was good and I did manage to stay up for the Michael Jackson show. Service was great out there too. I'm in the restaurant business and their system for getting u drinks fast is super. Some guys stay out by the tables and take ur order and pass it to drink runners. Great system RUI! I was solo and wouldn't recommend for singles or small kids. People dress up a little more here which I liked, but its more laid back. You can always go to the other RIU;S for a livelier atmosphere or may be it was the time of year. The day it rained they had one of the "twilight" movies in the theatre to keep people entertained and they showed the NFL games there on Sunday too. Inside theatre is non smoking and I don't know if the had drink service for that. I called front desk and they told me the games would be also be on at the RPM bar and at the RT bar. The front desk people were the best of any where I've ever stayed. I couldn't even try to use Spanish, cuz everyone spoke such good english, with the exception of a few grounds keepers etc and they'd try their best with hand signals. Cant beat the distance to town. easy walk. The shops in front of the RP or RPRM had some great deals if ya walk to town on the sidewalk instead of the beach I would go back in a heart beat with a companion and the only thing I'd recommend to the RPM is to carry room air fresheners in their store, cuz I ran out of incense I'd be happy to answer any question!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Well Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: poorashell
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico and as a whole we have to say that this hotel is definitely worth a return trip. The hotel itself is a beautiful property and the employees are constantly working to keep it clean. Even the simplest detail is covered. Plenty to do at the hotel and the beach is very nice & clean. We had the jr. suite which was very clean and big. We stayed at other hotels where we paid more for alot less of a room. The fridge was stocked daily and favorites in the wet bar. The buffet had plenty to choose from so can always find something tasty. Gourmet restrauants were fine for an all-inclusive hotel. Plenty of bars & drinks were always available. Even had servers on the beach.Nightly entertainment ended a bit early (11) but was fun and enjoyable. It's a 20/30 min walk into town.Hotel area is very safe it's in a residential community with security at both ends. From the hotel lobby you can set up day trips.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Suzziq
Reviews.Content: Pros:Fabulous/ huge beach, beautiful/ very clean buildings, grounds and courtyard, good pool, although the pool at the Palace Riviera Maya is more open and spacious and better view of ocean, nice amenities in the large clean rooms (bidets), very attentive friendly staff, great location(30 minute walk to PDC), good food. (Japanese resturaunt was very good) privileges at all the Riu hotels. Beds better than most in Mexican altho the pillows were fairly hard. .Pool and beach chairs available most of the time. Cons: Some of the upholstered furniture does need an update but not that noticeable. Maybe the lobby is too formal . A lot of the balcony walls off the rooms are too high to see over while sitting in your patio chairs, many rooms w/o an ocean view. Some tropical musty smell(which is at all hotels) Overall a very nice resort and quieter than the Yucatan which is overly crowded and noisy with games and children (Rui Tequila shares this resort.)

Reviews.Title: “Still great after all these years.”
Reviews.Author: Txtrav
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico, stayed 1/16-1/20/2011. We really enjoy the RPM this is our sixth return stay in the last 9 years. We stopped going to Playacar area for a couple of years due to the beach, but now the beach has been restored. I dont always feel the need to write a review however this trip was really great. The whole RIU complex was at or near full occupancy. I suggest joining RIU Class. The perks are great not only do get points for stays you also get early check-in, check-out and upgrades. We checked in at 1PM, had paid for a regular courtyard jr. suite but were upgraded to superior ocean front jr. suite without even asking. This was a considerable cost savings. We enjoyed the whole RIU complex. The service at the both the RPM and RPRM was great, from the bartenders to the waiters. I cant say the same for the RIU Yucatan, it was way too crowded. Guests of the RIU Yucatan kept attempting to get bar service from the RPM. The RPM beach bartender was polite telling them he could not serve them and they would need to return to the RIU Yucatan. The guests from the RIU Yucatan all had the same issues, slow service, beer was warm, mixed drinks and sodas had very little ice at the RIU Yucatan. I went over to try the beer later and it was warm, yuck. Before I left home the week prior I checked all the weather web sites and I was concerned as it looked like it would be cold and rainy. It was not cold at all at night, unless low 70's is considered cold. The weather was great, it never rained, highs in the upper 80's to low 90's. We didn’t get any bug bites either. I do agree with other reviews that the RPM is showing it's age but that is understandable considering the climate and the constant guest turnover. I don’t see any benefit in staying at the RPRM versus RPM as you have full access to the RPRM and the RPM is less expensive than the RPRM. The RPM is older but the pool/ beach area has more of a palm forest tropical feel to it. Yes the pool is larger at the RPRM. The food was excellent at the RPM. One night the buffet had lobster. I must have had five, umm good. The beach is great all along Playacar and you can actually enjoy swimming in the sea compared to the Cancun hotel zone. Once again our expectations were exceeded and we had another excellent stay at a RIU property. We will continue to return to RIU Resorts, RPM and this beautiful area again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: camaro81
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in early November. The room was very clean & the bed was comfortable. Didn't spend alot of time there anyway, but the view over the courtyard was very nice. The service was wonderfull, anyplace in the hotel, and they were always right there when you needed anything. The beach is HUGE and you can walk for a long way either direction. Buffett was average, but the Specialty Restaurants were all good. The shops across the street are good enough that you don't have too go into town to do you shopping. We have to give special thanks to Patricio Martinez (Bar Manager) for treating us so special and giving the extra service. We will for sue go back to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: r_simm
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic holiday staying at The Riu Palace Mexico. I just have to say the the hotel was excellent, well maintained, plush furnishings and set in beautiful grounds. The staff were so friendly and nothing was ever too much trouble, we felt like royalty. The food was of exceptional quality and the choice of food was mind blowing. We found plenty to do daily from scooters, quad bikes, snorkling and sailing or just relaxing by the pool. I must praise the management team and all the staff for a truly memorable holiday. We met couples who return year upon year to this hotel and it is easy to see why. A stay at the Riu Palace Mexico makes for holiday of happy memories and a longing to return.

Reviews.Title: “We returned to Wisconsin refreshed.”
Reviews.Author: rickwi
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Riu Palace Mexico was great. The food was very good, although I will never understand why resorts in Mexico don't serve non-dairy creamer. The mattresses were new, but not pillow top, and the maid didn't understand my request for a foam mattress topper. I'm sure the front desk would've, but I didn't ask. The room had a flat screen TV, and FOX News. Nice! I wished the room had easy chairs with ottomans instead of a soft couch and cocktail table, though. When we arrived on the 12th, the waves were HUGE, no doubt a result of the weather system affecting the East Coast of the states. By the end of the week, the weather was perfect, and the ocean was warm and fun. My only complaint is that there is no way to get away from the noise of the evening entertainment, but, thankfully, it ends about 11:00. This resort doesn't have loud entertainment at the pool during the day, which was fine with us, so we could enjoy the sound of the waves from our chairs on the beach. The front desk was helpful, and all of the staff is extremely hard-working. Tips were appreciated, but I never felt that they were expected. My only suggestions would be to bring your own Coffee Mate, and see if your cell phone can make international calls. I wanted to call Fun Jet and Air Tran, but it was impossilbe to make a long distance call to an 800 # in the states from our room. The thing that separates this resort from some in Riviera Maya is that one can walk the beach for miles in either direction. One can also walk on a safe city street (as well as along the beach) and end up in Playa del Carmen. It was fun to walk past a park near Playa del Carmen with 5 small Mayan ruins. You'll only see the park if you're on the side walk, not on the beach. It felt like we discovered the ruins, and it was FREE!

Reviews.Title: “Live from the Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: wintkat812
Reviews.Content: Posting this as I sit on what I call the "front porch" at the Riu Palace Mexico. Selected this hotel based on other reviews from Trip Advisor and very happy with my choice. Total experience is wonderful Can't say enough about the staff-without a doubt probably the best I've ever experienced at an all-inclusive food is delicious with tons of selections no matter your taste highly recommend all the fish options-tuna-dorado-grouper-and my fav red snapper can you say yummy guacamole available at all 3 meals? -25" walk into downtown Playa del Carmen -great beach for walking in either direction -first few days were cool-suggest bring along a few long sleeved options -cappucino at bars comes from a pre-made blend/sweet on arrival- ask for cafe con leche instead and get fresh ground coffee with foamed milk -we always bring a bunch of $1 USD for tips -wireless in lobby and front porch works quickly most of the time -our room door doesn't close automatically-needs to be pulled closed/don't know if this is a general problem -room safe big enough for my small laptop and all other stuff needing lock up -men need long pants for all dinner restaurants including buffet restaurant -I have not visited the 4 other Riu properties allowed with bracelet from Palace Mexico more to follow when home sharing some pix

Reviews.Title: “Service and Cleanliness is what this place is all about!”
Reviews.Author: PODS1311
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled here on our honeymoon Jan.8th-15th. The trip started out with beautiful weather till mid week, which is poured all day,but what can you do, its mother nature. Hotel reception/front desk staff was excellent and very helpful. Got us a great room overlooking the courtyards, even though we were supposed to get a basic boring view room. It had a great private balcony, where I spent many mornings in the sun waiting for my husband to wake up. Rooms-average to above average. The beds were not so bad, I was expecting much worse. The bathroom was in great shape too, loved the little separate shower area and separate toliet area. Cleaning people did a wonderful job cleaning our room everyday, giving us extra towels, extra water and beer in the fridge as well. I also asked for Pepsi Light and they brought up bottles of that as well. As far as the smell everyone talks about,yes there is a smell, but I smelled it right when you get off the plane in Cancun. Its a tropical climate, what do you expect, BUT, I must say, I did have to WASH everything when we returned, even the clothes I didn't wear, and even lysoled and aired out the suitcases because I guess you really don't notice the smell until you get home. We had a small incident with our bathroom toliet twice, smelling of sewer water and immediatley had a man upstairs fixing the issue. Room 2154 if anyone is interested. Food-I am extremly fussy when it comes to food. Here, I never had a problem of finding something to eat. Breakfast in the buffet was my favorite time of the day. Great variety of foods to pick from always, breakfast ,lunch and dinner. We only tried one specialty restaurant. El Patio Steakhouse. It was alright, middle of the road, and the best thing is, you can always go back to the buffet for more afterwards. Which we did of course haha. Beach- GORGEOUS. More than enough room for lounging, plenty of shade and sun, and beautiful waters of course. When we were there the water was very choppy, so alot of the water activities we were unable to do. Pools-I enjoyed the pool areas. They weren't huge, but I felt the perfect size and a great atmosphere. More than enough room to sit and relax, and the water wasn't as cold as people made it out to be. I jumped right in a bunch of times ( sober and drunk ) and it felt the same both times. Service-Cannot top it. The best we have ever been treated on any of our vacations. Extremely friendly, very helpful, always serving with a smile. Pool bartenders were our favs. Maybe its because they made a mean Long Island Ice Tea, but we definatley spent the most time at this bar. All of the staff in the entire resort made our trip that much more enjoyable. Cleanliness-Sparkling, always someone cleaning something. No matter what time of day or what direction you looked everything was in tip top shape. My husband and I being total neat freaks couldn't help but notice this. It was wonderful to see them keeping this resort in such good shape. We took the Ferry to Cozumel one day. Expensive if you ask me, but it is something we both wanted to check out. Here we went snorkeling, great waters to snorkel in. Enjoyed some chips and guac and watched some football at a sports bar and then took the ferry home later in the day. We also went to Tulum one day, but probably picked the worst day for that, as it poured on us pretty much the entire time. Beaches looked pretty through the rain drops, and the ruins were amazing, but after awhile, we just couldn't enjoy being in the rain, so we headed back to our resort on the collectivo. We went into downtown Playa Del Carmen one night ( we walked from our hotel ) about a half hour walk and much needed after all the eating you do at the resort. Loved the dt area. We had a great time. Met up with a friend and ate at Los Carbonitos, which was so good. Also did some betting at Tequila Barrel. I thought it was awesome how they had sports betting. Ended up at a shotty little place called the Beer Bucket, but we like that laid back, nothing fancy bar. Finally-going back to the resort, I really thought the entertainment staff did a great job. Very funny, very friendly, we couldnt stop laughing at one of the shows one night, I think it was the MR RIU contest, but it was too funny. We also shot the air riffles one day and that was neat too. All in all, I would definatley tell all my friends and family to stay here. We would even come back again ourselves. Its a beautiful, well maintained, clean property with outstanding service. Yeah the rooms are a little older, but they are clean, and thats all that matters to us. If anyone has any other questions feel free to send me a message.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean resort and excellent beach”
Reviews.Author: 10-nis
Reviews.Content: The Resort was extremely clean both the room and the grounds. A very beautiful resort. It's 11 years old but it doesn't show because it's so well maintained. The front desk was very helpful, courteous, and professional. The food was well prepared and there was a great variety to choose from. The waiters and maids were very professional. There were always lots of chez- lounges and lots of shady areas under palm trees on the beach. The ala-carte restaurants were OK but we aren't huge fan of these restaurants. We prefer the buffet restaurants. There's very little entertainment by the entertainment team on the beach. No dancing, no music, no sea-aerobics. The stretching at 10 am was very amateurish and on one day the person who was supposed to lead didn't show up. The fitness room is small but they have a variety of equipment. With these changes this resort would have been perfect for us: 1. Better tasting coffee, espresso, capuchino 2. A master of ceremony to encourage the vacationers to dance in the plaza in the evenings. Bring in a better band that is more suited to dancing. 3. Offer daily dancing lessons and dancing on the beach to taped music. 4. Move the evening kids entertainment program from the indoor theater stage to another location in the resort. The music on stage is too loud and it interferes with the guests who are sitting in the plaza cafe. It's too annoying. 5. It would be great to have a non-smoking section on the beach. Right now there's no escape and/or sanctuary for non-smokers. In sum, if you asked us if we would return to this resort, our answer would be a most definite "YES!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place... a step up from the RIU Yucatan”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledOkie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a business trip. She loved lounging around while I was stuck in meetings. The service is good and room appointments were nicer than the RIU Yucatan which we had stayed at several years prior. Food was good for an all inclusive buffet. Mostly "Premium" spirits were available but tipping and asking we found there was sometimes something even better. i.e. the vino tinto they serve is not good, but after a little flirting by the ladies in our group, a nice bottle of Chilean Red was produced. We didn't partake in the nightlife but shows were available. The beach was nice and the grove of palms to walk through to get to the water was a nice touch that gave a nice "resort" atmosphere versus just a hotel on the beach. We checked out the property for the kids and while there is a play area, other hotels are probably better suited for them with bigger play areas and a more lively atmosphere. The Palace is a relaxed atmosphere and good service is noticeable. Beds are a bit firm, but they did have foam mattress pads available which helped. All in all a good choice for couples that want to wind down, learn to SCUBA, get a spa treatment, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 5 star - more like a 4 at best, with some BAD rooms!”
Reviews.Author: SlumDog99
Reviews.Content: Decided to try this hotel based on previous reviews and tour company's 5+ star rating, selecting it over the Sensatori Azul in Cancun, which we had stayed at before. I was frankly diasappointed in the overall experience. The good stuff: the grounds are gorgeous - well maintained, quite impressive. The beach is awesome (as would be expected around Playa del Carmen), and there is an abundance of beach chairs. Booze is all premium brands, well poured. Staff are friendly enough, and quite responsive to requests. The so-so stuff: Food is only slightly better than the average all-inclusive, tending towards bland flavours that won't offend. The selection of restaurants is also quite limited and the seating capacity of each is small, so it is very hard to get a table and one must line up at 8:00 on the morning of to get a reservation. Children's club is small, with very limited facilities. Gym was also small, but functional. The bad: The rooms. Not all the the rooms, mind you, but some of them. I may be naive, but in my view a five star hotel there should be no "bad" rooms. We are paying enough that each room should be quite nice. Well, the rooms are, in terms of furnishings, nice enough - if a bit dated. The rooms locations, however, are another thing altogether. The first room we were given had a quite deluxe view - we were staring at a wall some 20 feet away and listening to evening arguments among staff at the hotel next door. We asked, nicely enough, for a different room, and they quite graciously accommodated us by giving us a room with a another great view, this time of a rooftop. Oddly enough, we asked for yet another different room. We were offered a "partial view" room, which we took. What I (and my wife) failed to realize was that the room was on top of the theatre and at the end of the plaza closest to the main lobby. We were subjected to very loud music from the theatre each night (and got to hear much of it twice, thanks to the doppler effect) until 11:30 or so. Not usually a problem, but with two small children this was a real issue. Now you might say that we brought this upon ourselves with our room switches, and that would be partially true, but it is still the case that in a supposedly five star hotel, I expect better than this. There should not be rooms that have these issues. Overall, we've stayed at dozens of all-inclusives over almost 30 years, and I would say this was, at best, an average resort - it lacked the amenities and quality of accommodation I've come to associate with a five star in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “NOT FOR A FAMILY WITH TEENAGERS”
Reviews.Author: fairandhonest
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our 13 year old daughter. The hotel manager, Maria Josee Rincon, has been manager for 1 1/2 years and has turned the hotel in a direction that does not cater to kids. This is more for adults and kids can not participate in many of the offerred activities (horseshoes, darts, volleyball). The pool is very small, only knee deep, narrow, and is cut in half by a walkway. The pool water is freezing. At most only 3 people in the pool and never any activities. The Animation staff is pretty poor. Do not let your kids get near Dideroit - he is a bad apple. This is also a pretty quiet, nothing happening hotel. Food: Quite good and can always find something. Japaneese excellent, Steak house (and we do not eat meat) very good. Main buffet very good. The recession has hit the Riu like many other hotels so you may be looking for such things as lobster without success. Rooms: Get a renovated room on the top floor and you will be happy. Location: Excellent. A 20 minute walk into Playa Del Carmen. Beach good with other hotels along to walk and see. Entertainment: Stay at Palace Mexico and you get to go to the other Palace and Rius. The Palace Mexico is very quiet at night. Shows are okay. For fun, walk accross the street to the Riu Tequilla, it is a very fun and active hotel. During the day go to the Riu Yukatan to see wild life (monkeys, and "rat - dogs", and iguanas). During the day take a walk into Playa Del Carmen. Take a 30 minute ferry over to Cozumel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great trip!”
Reviews.Author: umichmom
Reviews.Content: I need to begin by saying that I have been to this area and other all inclusives many times. While this resort is older and could use some "updating," it is extremely well maintained. The service and quality of food far outweighs some of the newer, "fancier" resorts I have stayed at! Our room was immaculate and well stocked with towels and beverages each day. Even though we were there over the Christmas holiday and the resort was full, waitstaff was constantly available to serve drinks in all areas of the hotel. The food was some of the best all inclusive food we've had...even the buffet. We ate at the Japanese restaurant and had excellent beef - unusual for Mexico! My daughter had a birthday while we were there, and although we did not mention it they put surprises in our room, decorated our dinner table and brought her a cake. Our only complaint was the pool was quite cool and there are no steps on which to gradually enter the water. There was not the strong musty and/or sewer smell that you often get in Mexico. I always take a candle for the room anyway...you're in a humid environment! The hotel is in an area of many other RIUS and you have access to them all. There is also a small shopping area down the street and it's a $5 cab ride into Playa. 24 hour room service was available and free wifi is in the lobby area. I am already planning a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Make the Difference at Riu”
Reviews.Author: Oceansidegal
Reviews.Content: We travelled as two families, a group of seven which included two 17 year old boys and one 14 year old girl. We booked our trip "a la carte" with separate air, transfers and hotel, which we found couldn't be beat as a package deal on any of my best travel websites. This was my first trip to the Mayan Riviera side of Mexico and I really enjoyed the warm ocean and moderate climate. I will itemize the different areas for quick reference: Overall Impression of Hotel: Nestled in the hotel zone, this hotel is quite spectacular from the front entrance to the resort and the Christmas lights added a nice festive touch. Upon entry into the lobby, a distinct musty odor was detected. Check in was fast and efficient. There is more of a crackdown on the underaged members of our group with regard to legal age for drinking. It's 18 in Mexico and the staff asked for passport ID before assigning wristbands. We never found this to be the case when visiting other destinations. Not that drinking is an issue for any of our teens, but they felt as young men, they were lumped in with the younger children. The location was convenient - about a half hour walk into Playa del Carmen. If you stroll the ruins along the way, maybe closer to an hour. A $5 US cab ride will also suffice. The traveller's advisory regarding US currency in Mexico shouldn't be taken too seriously. I dealt in US funds to tip at the resort and when bartering for goods and never actually touched a peso the whole trip. Canadian money is not well received. Getting back to the overall impression of the resort. Impressive in photos, but up close, a little tired and in need of some upgrades (ie lobby furniture and room furniture). Restaurants: Can't complain about this resort. Food is plentiful and fresh and nicely displayed. The buffet always had something for every taste. The hotel was at about 80% occupancy and there was never a shortage of tables or sittings at any of the a la cartes. A la cartes can be booked each morning. We ate at the steakhouse, japanese and the french restaurant. All meals were served fast and efficiently and the waiter service was always good. We tipped, but no need, as you likely won't find any difference in your level of service. The dress code is enforced, although the 17 year olds got away with shorts and shirts, the men must wear long pants (jeans are OK). Room service was ordered frequently by the teens and they reported that the food was good. Rooms: We had three junior suites among us. They placed us in close proximity with one another. Our first room had a blocked toilet, which flooded the room. Maintenance was sent up right away to fix it, but we waited a while for the flood to be tended to. The toilet flooded again the next day and I spent the better part of the day trying to get it fixed (properly) and with no success, I insisted on a new room, which I received after being told several times, there were no vacant rooms. This was my only complaint for the whole 9 days that we stayed. Toilet blocks happen, but I would have liked to have been treated like I wasn't the problem. Rooms are spacious and comfortable, although a little tired looking. Pillows were nice, beds a little hard, slight musty smell and bathrooms were humid. We couldn't reuse towels because they never dried out. Don't leave clothes in the bathroom, they'll get damp. Free safe, bar fridge stocked daily and maid service sufficient. A bit of noise early in the mornings as families headed down to breakfast, but otherwise quiet. Overall, this was a quiet hotel. Pool, Gym & Activities: The pool was on the cool side for part of the stay. I asked about this and I think it's solar heated, so the first few days were on the cool side. Once the weather warmed up, so did the pools. The hot tub wasn't (hot, that is - same temperature as the pool), so we didn't use it. Lots of lounge chairs with no need to "reserve" a spot with your towel in the morning. Swim up bar always seemed to be in the shade. Waiter service on the pool deck was good. Activity leaders like to invite guests to join in. Lots of daily activities to join in. The boys really enjoyed the volleyball and games were going on most of the day. Gym was adequate and staff on hand if you had any questions. Towels & water provided. Bars & Entertainment: Service was good at any of the bars we used, We liked the lobby bar best. The evening activies and entertainment were good, although we never found that the theater filled up. A different show every night, a casino night with auction and courtyard live bands played on several nights. You have privileges at the other Riu hotels in the area if you desire more lively evenings. Our hotel was on the quiet side, which was fine for us. Beach & Grounds: Gorgeous. Tons of lounge chairs available. Shade under palm trees was easy to find. Beach is easily swimable and snorkeling could be done right out front of the hotel. Beach vendors not too bothersome, just a few jewellery and sunglass sales people. Some hammocks available. Easy walk along the beach to the town. Watch for the cute little agoutis running around (like tailless large squirrels). Spa: Didn't use it - thought the services were too expensive compared to what you can get in the town. Tip: Don't brush your teeth with the room water. One person in our group came home with an e coli like illness and since we didn't eat off the resort, this is what could have caused it. Use the bottled water to be sure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beach, great staff, food was plentiful, fresh and high quality”
Reviews.Author: PoCotraveller
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 7 day stay at the Riu Place Mexico. Staff bent over backwards to provide excellent service. We had two 15 year olds with us whho both were able to obtain their PADI open water certificatiion, dive staff were exellent, Maxium was thier dive master and was very good with them both; they were even lucky enough to see a shark on one of their certification dives. We brought tip money and although there is no expectation to tip, we felt it is appropriate to tip for good service. Buffet was excellent; we did eat at Krystal and it was great too. We stayed a few resorts down at the Royal Hideaway in March; an amazing resort however for the value ($1600 incl. taxes CDN from Vancouver), we would recomend the Riu Palace. We did check out Riu Tequilla but it didn't come close to the atmosphere or quality of the Palace; spend the extra money; We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace still holding it's own”
Reviews.Author: Sparto
Reviews.Content: The RIU Palace Mexico is still holding it's own. This is an economy large all-inclusive resort/hotel. Do not expect this to be a gourmet hotel. We vacationed 12/10-12/17. First I will admit that, yes the hotel and rooms do have a musky smell. And the hotel is showing some age in some spot. It is was easily overcome for us by the staff's exceptional service and friendliness. The service was wonderful. Lots of smiles and "hola senoir's." The food being that this is an "all-inclusive" was delicious and plentiful. The drinks were good and beer at this hotel is only Dos Equis light or dark. The wine is just average. The bathroom's are kept clean by maid service and could use a much needed appearance makeover. Hotel guests are allowed to visit the other RIU's in the Playacar. We did venture to the RUI Tequila across the street to their friendly bars and to watch a couple of their shows. At the RIU Palace we watched bands and danced nightly outdoors. Barstaff and waiters were exceptionally friendly. Overall the for the super sale which we payed for the RUI Palace Mexico our vacation was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at Riu Palace Mexico....”
Reviews.Author: Ottawagal62
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just returned from a 7 night stay at Riu Palace Mexico. Every year around this time we take a gals vacation, just to catch up, chill out and generally recharge our batteries. I had visited the Palace several years ago, and hoped it would live up to my fond memories, as I had "talked it up" to my friend. I am glad to say that it lived up to both my fond memories and my expectations of a superior hotel. I won't rehash all the details as others have provided great, detailed reviews, but rather focus on a few key points. The Beach: The beach is lovely, long and very wide, and as most visitors know, was enlarged after the coastline suffered erosion from numerous storms and hurricanes. Although the hotel appeared to be at capacity, there really was no difficulty finding chairs, particularly if you arrived on the beach before 11:00 a.m. We didn't see a lot of beach waiter service early in the week, however, this seemed to pick up noticeably after a couple of days. It's lovely to be completely lazy, and have a waiter arrive with a large tray of drinks to choose from so I certainly took advantage of this service. Waiter service was also available poolside, and of course there is a bar on the beach and at the pool. Food: I don't understand how anyone can complain about the food. Sure there are things that I found to be more to my liking than others, but when wouldn't that be the case? On the whole the food in the buffet is excellent - very tasty, and fresh with a huge variety of items to suit all tastes. There must be more than a dozen salads to choose from on any given night, so whether you are a vegetarian or meat eater, you will find many delicious offerings. On a typical evening, for example, I found roast leg of lamb, roast chicken, steak, a pasta station, a pizza station (with a chef that you can watch making the pizzas) seafood, at least 10 vegetables dishes, breads, soups, appetizers, cheeses, cold meats, salads galore, and a dessert table. I had champagne with my dinner every evening (at no extra charge). I should add here that I have a bit of a sensitive stomach, and never once during my stay did I ever experience any stomach upset. Also, the wait staff is welcoming, professional, pleasant and efficient. General Comments/Other: As we were at the resort to decompress a bit, I admit we didn't wander to far from the resort, so I can't comment on any tours, excursions, etc., (having done several on previous trips to the area). One afternoon I opted for a massage on the beach, the hotel spa having established a small shaded hut for this service on the beach. I had a deep tissue massage to get rid of some knots in my shoulders and neck area, and the price was only $50 for 50 minutes. (a promotional price). José, my masseur was very professional, and gave me one of the best messages I have ever had. As I left the hut, he even offered to work on my neck the following day (for free) should there be any lingering stiffness. That's great service. A few words on the location of the hotel. I think it is extremely well located, being in a safe gated residential area called Playacar. You have the benefit of being in a quiet location, (surrounded by other hotels and upscale residences) but only a $5 cab ride away from the restaurants, clubs and shopping of Playa del Carmen - in my view, the best of both worlds. For my money the Riu Palace Mexico offers great value, service, and a beautiful ocation and beach, and I would heartily recommend it to family and friends. Wish I was still there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection has no limits”
Reviews.Author: Walker14
Reviews.Content: One week in December at this hotel and location was not enough, although if we would have stay any longer we would have turned into gluttons. The hotel is situated on a 30 minute walk to the town of Playa del Carmen that has a large variety of shopping, restaurants, bars and attractions for everyone. There are also some large chain stores like Mega (from Mexico), Wal-Mart and Sam’s Club. I personally like to shop and eat were the locals go. The beach and the grounds at the hotel were great. The Krystal restaurant (Fusion cuisine) and the Steak house were worth going, the Brazilian Rodizio we were not impressed although it was just ok. My best compliments are to the Mexican workers that with their hard work and disposition provide 100% results, to make our stay at the hotel and the vacation a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: michelehughes
Reviews.Content: We had a great holiday with our children - then 11 months and 2, and our friends who have no children. The food is great, the beach and pool areas very nice and the staff are very attentive. Playa del Carmen is only a short distance and a good place to visit for shopping and bars. Cozumel is worth a trip for the day as are Xel-ha and Xcaret. The only downside is that the rooms are possibly a bit tired, and also cramped if you have children. There are no family suites or interconnecting room options. In terms of value for money though you really can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Wonderful Holiday”
Reviews.Author: vix92008
Reviews.Content: This resort is excellent - do not confuse it with the Riu Palace in Las Americas which is much closer to the sirport and the town but not so secluded. Some reviews on this page are for that hotel and not this one. This resort houses 6 Riu hotels, which if you are a Palace Guest you are able to use the facilities of all 6 except for evening meal which must be taken at your own hotel. 2 of the others have sports bars, we wanted peace and quiet so were glad we stayed here. We only visited one of the other 6, the other Palace a short walk along the beach that was newer than this hotel. Laid out in a very similar way but with a larger pool that was busier than ours so again, liking the quiet life we felt we had chosen wisely. All Inclusive here means All Inclusive - towels for the beach, minibar in the room, room service, trial scuba session - in fact the only things that were chargeable were laundry, watersports and spa treatments. The hotel is situated right on the beach and there are ample bars with one on the beach serving all drinks including an extensive list of cocktails made freshly for you - it would have been rude not to work our way through the list! Beautiful beach, what else would you expect on this coastline? Ample sunloungers, no problem getting loungers at any time of day. Guests took bread from the restaurant to feed the fish who would happily swim around you in the clear waters to feed. Plenty of watersports on the beach for those looking for an active holiday. Lovely pool, all one depth, shaped like a flower, split into two sides, a lively side with activities and the swim up bar and a quiet side, with very regular waiter service for drinks to your sunlounger or in the pool. Small library by the poolside stocked with books left by fellow travellers so you can swap your holiday book for another read. Again, ample sun loungers, more comfortable by the pool than the beach as the padded cushions were super. There are 6 restaurants, you can take your evening meal in any but need to book if you want to use any of them other than the main one. Other than the main restaurant which serves all cuisines, the restaurants are themed. We tried the Steakhouse and were very disappointed, set meal, choice of starters but no matter what you ordered every couple was brought one of each and as one was seafood and one had cheese added our individual dietry requirements meant we had to pick at one. Main dish had poor quality meat and the dessert looked inedible, we walked out after the main and ate a proper meal in the main restaurant. This is the only reason the hotel has a 4 and not a 5 from us as this put us off trying the other themed restaurants and we ate solely in the main, which was excellent but became a little samey and when you choose a hotel with 6 you expect to be able to choose each evening. Otherwise, cant really find fault here. Breakfast in the main restaurant was exceptional, always at the main entrance open bottles of champagne on ice next to fresh orange, cherries and champagne flutes for you to make your own Bucks Fizz to start the day. Fresh omlettes made for you and a range of foods from around the world second to none. Again, superb at lunch and in the evening, only small downside was that they only serve wine, light beer (lager) and soft drinks so if you want a cocktail or dark beer take it in with you from the piano bar as you walk down. Rooms are excellent, clean and large (split level with a lounge and sofa) with a minibar and 4 optics containing full bottles of vodka, tequila, brandy and bacardi. Beds are huge - 8ft wide, satelitte tv with european channels. We didnt take any trips so cant comment on them, it was far too lovely here to spend days out elsewhere not enjoying the lovely surroundings. We are due to marry in the Carribean in March and saw 2 weddings whilst we were here, definately a nice wedding location so if you are looking at tying the knot abroad its worth thinking about here as a venue. This was our first Riu stay and we would definately book Riu again.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend a Riu to anybody...will go back!!”
Reviews.Author: oth8252007
Reviews.Content: We went and stayed at the Rui Palace Mexico for my friend's wedding...we stayed 5 nites in Playa then went to Cozumel for 4 days. The Palace was amazing...when we 1st stepped into the hotel we said this is not us. After the 2nd day we changed our views into this is so us! We were greeted by extremely nice employees that were truly there to make our stay perfect! We went into our room which was a junior suite with a garden view with a king size bed...the rooms were spacious and very clean! Loved how they stocked our fridge even on the opposite day(they restock every other day). We told them one day we wanted lots of beer nothing less than 12...it was completely full!! The food was great...didnt have a bad meal...we couldnt get any reservations for any dinners for the 630 seating the day we wanted...but the night of the wedding we ate at the brazillian restaurant...was nummy!! The service was exceptional...only thing I didnt like about the drinks they werent strong enough...we just would ask and they made them stronger and remembered the next time they saw you!! The beach was very nice and clean there was always empty chairs! An added bonus of the Palace we get to go to the other 5 Rius. Playacar was nice,Yucatan we hung out at beach bar and the tequilla was fun...one of their bars are open 24hrs....the only thing with the riu tequilla was there were mexican raccoons all over in the lobby area! Yuck!! They remind me of monkeys but raccoons! We will be definately be going back...and if we go on any vacays and theres a riu will be staying at the chain!!

Reviews.Title: “About what you would expect from a big all inclusive”
Reviews.Author: dallasmom2
Reviews.Content: Here is my honest to goodness review of this place: Location-It is a beautiful place with impeccably maintained grounds. It is truly paradise there. Food-we ate at all the restaurants (except for the Japanese sushi) and I have to say variety wise, Don Julian buffet is the best. The reservations were never full at the others though. The Brazilian restaurant we ate at twice, make sure you get all you want of a certain meat the first time, they do not come back around once you get a piece like they do in traditional brazilian steakhouses. The Fusion restaurant is very much noveau cuisine so if you don't like that, I wouldn't recommend that. My boys laughed at the food there and ended up ordering room service. Keep in mind, the room service menu is very limited though. A club sandwich in Mexico is not a club sandwich with turkey bacon etc. The steakhouse was ok, we ended up going into Playa and eating dinner on our last night, we were pretty sick of the food. There is enormous variety and they try and cater to all cultures. It is a very cosmopolitan group there. Things I wish I would have known: Having teenage boys-I wish someone would have mentioned the topless sunbathers. My younger son was mortified, the other one intrigued. I understand it is culturally standard in some countries, but I neve experienced it before without knowing in advance. Yes, there is a musty type smell to the property, but it is in the rainforest, what would you expect? We did go to all the other Rius in the area, (all close by walking distance) and I think this Palace is the nicest. We went to the new Palace and that was nice, just a little bit bigger pool scene. We did go and rent a car in Cozumel to explore there and that was fun. If I were you I would make sure you go to a Cenotes and snorkel, I have reviewed a specific tour and it was absolutely phenomenal, I highly recommend that without a doubt. Staff-the staff are all super friendly, helpful and kind. You need to bring small bills to tip them, they deserve it. We brought two hundred for the week and went through it all. This was truly a relaxing place and breathtakingly beautiful. Lots of cool animals around like Palm Rats, iguanas and Monkeys (Riu Yucatan). Feel free to email me if you want to know anything else specific!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great value: bad food, drinks and pool service”
Reviews.Author: Renata3
Reviews.Content: The good: 1. Architecture & rooms were nice. The area was carefully maintained. The staff was generally very nice and friendly. 2. The beach is right there. 3. It is in a gated community -- very safe. The bad & ugly: 1. Drinks were terrible. Bars closed before midnight. We ended up not drinking. 2. We saw 2 large cockroaches in the room. 3. The pool & jacuzzi closes at 6pm (even though it said 8pm on service board) 4. They never have enough beach towels. First day we had to ask for towels 6 (six!) times. They also limit exchanges to 1 per day. 5. The specialty restaurants are small -- very hard to reserve a spot. You absolutely must get there at 8am (even though it says reservations start at 8:30am). But then it's not really worth the effort -- the specialty restaurant food was not really good and choices very very limited. I much preferred the general buffet anyway. 6. They have evening shows, but they are quite poor and cheap. You will also miss half of it if you take the 8:45 pm seating.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth!”
Reviews.Author: Capth00k123
Reviews.Content: Had a great time and we where glad we stayed at the upper scale Riu Pallace which enabled us to spend time at the other Riu resorts. Friends stayed at the Riu Tequila and they where not allowed to visit our resort. Go for the court yard view!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: Richchris70
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort..We've been to several Resorts in Rivieria Maya and this one is one of the best....very clean and very well appointed. Rooms were large..beds were comfy..the only complaint with the room was the musty odor. The odor stayed on your clothes even once you were home..I needed to wash everything...but that was a minor complaint.. Food...very good..buffet was better than the specialty restaurants. We did not like the Krystal restaurant. Stick with the buffet for dinner...excellent variety and so so good. Pool...nice but nothing spectacular... very clean and plenty of chairs to go around. Beach...awesome!! The best yet...very large with plenty of chairs...great walking...so beautiful...loved it. Room...nice and clean..just musty smelling...only complaint. Beds are great. Service..excellent. Location....excellent..walk to Playa Del Carmen...40 min walk..or take a $5.00 cab ride. We took a ferry to Cozumel..very convenient too. I would recomment this resort to anyone.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, Great Service, Fantastic Beach!”
Reviews.Author: LMR050
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week. The service was great! Everyone was very friendly. We would definitely go again. A few tips we would give is one I read from someone else. Bring a insulated glass/mug. It's a bit of a walk to the beach from the hotel and ice melts quick in the warm weather. We had dinner in all of the restaurants once. The French fusion one was my favorites we ate there twice. The Brazilian stake house was very slow. We brought a lap top computer which we were able to put in the safe when we didn't use it. The upstairs bar area had free WiFi. We did one excursion after listening to a 2 hour talk at a time share hotel. We got a free breakfast out of it and an amazing tour of Cozumel with lunch and snorkeling on a reef all at no charge. The presentation was a waste of time but we did get to see another hotel and what they had to offer. Since it was our first time to the area we didn't mind. If anyone takes the trip on the ferry I would recommend if get sea sick to take medication before going. Let's just say there is a reason for all the garbage cans in the aisle ways. The only extra cash we spent was on the gifts we brought back to our kids. We did bring extra money for tips. After speaking with an American that lives down there he did recommend us tip as we go. The typical Mexican down there makes about $20.00 a day. Per recommendation of a family member we had taken some extra cash to tip a bundle of ones and fives. A nice thing about the Riu Palace hotels you can go to any of the other Riu's for drinks or lunch. All dinners have to eaten in the hotel you stay at. The beaches are awesome! I was told they just remade them in the last year. We would return here again!

Reviews.Title: “closest thing to cruise quality”
Reviews.Author: twohills71
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort. We were here from Nov. 12 -19. The service was excellent. The rooms were large, clean and nicely decorated. The beach was the best we've ever had in all the years of vacations in the Caribbean with plenty of chaises there and at the pool (no need to "reserve") Waiters often came with drinks and fruit while we were at the beach. Staff worked very hard to keep guests entertained, fed and happy. If you didnt want to see the evening show here you could go to any of he other 4 Rius next to this one. The grounds reflect the palatial name- really awesome fountains and reflecting pools and manicured landscaping. Food was excellent for a resort . We were impressed with the Japanese restaurant. We were able to email home for a small fee.All this makes it easy to see why people return to the Riu Mexico year after year.

Reviews.Title: “A return trip to Riu Palace Mexico and I cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: GeorgieBillie
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing trip to Riu Palace Aruba earlier in the year we were looking for the usual Riu standard and relaxation so decided to take a return trip to Riu Palace Mexico. It is 4 years since our initial visit for our wedding - although we did return for a day last year when we were holidaying in Cancun. The hotel and team exceeded our expectations from the moment we booked reserving us a beautiful room (with a seaview over the top of the trees). Staff welcomed us back as soon as we walked through the door and were inviting and friendly. Our luggage taken to the room (this didnt happen in Aruba) - while we were making ourselves a drink and starting to relax on our beautiful balcony. The holiday was just amazing from start to finish. The food in the buffet restaurant is superb and vast. We only ate in the steak house speciality restaurant throughout our 15 night stay as we were more than happy with the choice in the buffet (im not a great meat fan but never struggled to choose something different). Booking the speciality restaurants was easy if you chose. Lunch was always in the beach restaurant for us - again plenty of choice and a great service throughout our stay. I never had anything but a tasty cocktail and certainly didnt find them weak as some people mentioned. Cocktails tend to be made with local spirits but if you want branded just ask. The weather was fantastic all the time (I think we had 10 minutes rain 1 day...) so most days we spent relaxing on the beach - which has doubled in size since our last trip (im told a lot of money has been spent on making it larger). The sea can be quite rough on occasions and can be unlevel in places. We had lots of fun on the body boards and boats available from the hotel and free of charge. Drinks were served at the beach - waiters came down with a huge tray to select from - there is also the beach bar set back a little way in the trees should you want something different! We walked into Playacar several times which was nice for some exercise and a change of scenery. We also used the ther hotels around the resort as these tended to be more lively in the evening. We did take the ferry to Cozumel one day and hired a car. It was not great and we would have got a better deal hiring it once we arrived but of course the vendor told us it would be double on the island! The glass bottom boat trip was fantastic though and well worth the $50each as we were the only 2 on it. All in all I really cannot fault Riu Palace Mexico or Playacar. Its wonderful and cannot wait to return. We were advised to only take peso's by our travel agent - having been told that due to money laundering US dollars were only accepted in low amounts. We did also take dollars as we had some left over from a previous holiday . When we arrived everything was still in priced in $ and most places seem to prefer them (I did hear the president had changed his ruling the day after it was set??) enjoy your trip

Reviews.Title: “OFF SEASON - GREAT; Unbelievable service”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Vic
Reviews.Content: Our first time at a RIU Palace (although we have stayed at RIU Club Hotels before) and first time at Playacar. No line-ups, no crowds, no problems with specialty restaurant reservations. We were there when Hurricane Paula went past; the hotel staff were so professional in preparing for the wind & rain. For the visitors, the day progressed as normal. Weather was hot (28C), beach great & fun with the large waves. We took advantage of using the other 5 RIUs in the area to see what they were like. The Club Hotels were more active with families and younger crowds, while we could retire to the quiet of the Palace. Staff so friendly and accommodating (thank you Raul ! ! !). Food was not a disappointment; all of the specialty restaurants worth trying. We will return next year without hesitation; we have reconfirmed that going to a RIU is always worth it.

Reviews.Title: “European Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Owassodeb
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to a Riu Hotel. We recently stayed at the Riu Palace in Cabo san Lucas and decided to try this location because we had been to Playacar before and knew we could swim in the ocean safely at this location. The hotel had a very different feeling and clientele than Cabo San Lucas. It definitely caters to an European customer. The hotel was beautiful and immaculate in grounds keeping, housekeeping and service. We were placed in a wonderful room on the top floor fairly close to the beach - which meant far from the lobby and main restaurants. It would have been OK except my husband has mobility problems and the only elevator was at the far end of the hallway and he cannot do stairs. When we contacted the front desk we were immediately offered a ground room. After moving to the new room we went for dinner at the buffet and was surprised to find that unlike the Cabo buffet, the men were required to wear long pants. This did not make my husband happy! He wears shorts in the winter because he is hot natured. The buffet was nice but I think the food was of better quality and there were more choices at the Cabo buffet . The only specialty restaurant we tried was the steakhouse. The food was very good as was the service. Our favorite place was El Patio for lunch. It offered a good selection of dishes that were very tasty and the choices changed daily. I was particularly happy to see ceviche, guacamole and very spicy chili with meat and beans. Regarding drinks - it seemed as if the drinks were not as strong as in Cabo san Lucas but they were happy to add additional alcohol to your drink if you asked. One improvement I was very happy to see was the addition of a device (don't know what it's called) that kept people from slamming the doors! Now if they could somehow keep maids from moving furniture during siesta time it would be wonderful! It seemed to me that the beds here were harder than in the Cabo location. Hopefully, if the hotels go through renovations in the future they will opt for a slightly softer mattress. My only complaint is that there is only one ice machine for all floors of the hotel! Our bell captain said to just call room service and they would bring us ice. We called for ice and we would still be waiting for the ice if we were there! We enjoyed our stay and are planning on going to the Costa Rica Riu next year. All in all, I think the resorts offer a very good value for the price but I believe that the Cabo San Lucas property is the best so far! If you could safely swim in the ocean at Cabo san Lucas it truly would be paradise on earth!

Reviews.Title: “HAD A GREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: algoma
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, always right there when you needed something. are room was average were on the out side not much to see but dont spend a lot of time there. Met a lot of people from England, Germany and the U.S. in the lobby bar and pool bar. Walked the beach every day it was a lot bigger then two years ago, you can walk all the way to town. The shows were very good. The food was excellent. A lot of the Staff remembered us from two years ago, made us feel special. Will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Chidnjo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful vacation in Playa Del Carmen with friends. This hotel offers many things including a very relaxed environment, great service, cleanliness, spectacular beach and amazing food. Even if you are looking for a little more, you will have access to the neighboring Riu resorts where you'll find differences in activities, pool and night life. With the location of this hotel being only 5 minutes from Playa Del Carmen you will also be able to check out local clubs (Coco Bongos is a must) and shopping. Our group had lots to keep us busy and would not hesitate in recommending this hotel. A great time and memories to get us through the cold winter we have ahead of us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: lancslassRossendale
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico. Excellent holiday for relaxation combined with some entertainment. Don't be mislead by some of the reviews, you just can't please some people. Our room was large and very comfortable. All staff where very pleasent and helpfull and provided an excellent service.The hotels managemnet team is strong and hand's on. There was a wide range of excellent food in the Don Julian restaurant and we allso liked the fusion restaurant.We really liked the Mariachi bannd. We liked being able to viisit other Riu's in the area. The ferry from Cancun to Isla Mujeres was worth the trip. We enjoyed visiting the beaches at Acumal and Tulum. The beach at the Riu is amazing. Ignore comments about the smell in the reception you are in a foreign country with some humidity, it is not offensive.

Reviews.Title: “FAB !!!”
Reviews.Author: xxgemxx1988
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fab loved every minute travelled with my mum, dad and two brothers aged (26,14) and we all enjoyed it, the riu palace riviera maya is alot better with more going on spend most of out time there but down to service and food they are both as good as each other this one just seemed to be more couples that familys like the riu palace rivera maya would certainly recommed them both!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: MrMiggins
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Riu Palace Punta Cana and the Riu Merengue prior to that, we were really looking forward to this holiday. Knowing what to expect is half the battle I believe, and we were not disappointed. We flew out with Thomson on the 13th Sept. We upgraded to Premium as it's a long flight and we went to Riviera Maya last year (Azul Sensatori). The flight was delayed by nearly 4hrs, but we didn't let that spoil things We arrived at 10pm due to the delay and we were the only ones to get off the coach when it pulled up outside the Palace. There was no bellboy or doorman on duty, so we made our own way to reception (no big deal). We were given a welcome drink and I informed them that I'd emailed twice requesting a courtyard view, but hadn't had a reply. They apologised and gave me the keys to 2156. This room overlooks the plaza and sits right on top of the restaurant. We went up to the room and the first thing that I noticed was the A/C not working. It was like an oven! Maintenance came up and agreed with me and they moved us to 2133. This was in a better location, still overlooking the courtyard, but further down near to the pool and beach. The A/C still wasn't great but leaving the fan on made it a little better. The hotel itself is great. If you've stayed at a Palace, you'll know theyre all pretty much the same layout and similar in decor. I'm told this was the 1st Palace Riu built and some would argue it needs a makeover now. I think it just needs tidying up. As has been said, some tiles are cracked and the rooms have keys instead of cards, but that's easily rectified. One thing it does need is a Sports Bar. Most Palaces have them and they're great! You can sit there all night drinking and snacking, whilst watching TV if that's your thing. I'm told it's being refurbed next year and they are putting in a Sports Bar. We'll see. The room was great- two beds pushed together but they didn't move the whole time we were there. There's the famous Riu optics and mini bar, with branded spirits so no locally produced stuff here. Food was great but got a bit repetitive ( they love their beef!). Speciality restaurants were also good but the steakhouse didn't have a non smoking area, which is strange because during the day, it's used as a snack bar and they have a no smoking section. Likewise, at the lobby bar it's no smoking, which is good. I remember the Palace Punta Cana being a smokers paradise and it was awful. We checked out the other RIUs whilst there and took a walk down to the Palace Riviera Maya. This was a newer Palace, in keeping with all the rest, but had a Sports Bar! Strangely, the Riu Tequila had one too, and it's not a Palace? Never did find out why. At night, there's little to do. The entertainment didn't do much for us and we were back in the room most nights at about 10pm, apart from a couple of late sessions in the Lobby and a bar crawl in Cancun. We went to Coco Bongos, which I highly recommend if you've never been! We are definitely going back. Hopefully, next year if funds permit. It isn't cheap, but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: marhuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our 19 month old and other family and friends. It was an excellent price for the money. The were only a couple negatives. The beds are two double beds pushed together to what they call a king bed and the bathroom needs to be revamped. The fixtures for the sink, toilet, bidet and shower are old. The shower/tub area is very dark. They need to add a light in it. But those are all minor things for me. The resort is very beautiful and they keep it immaculate. The beach is very long and wide with lots of chairs and palm trees. The staff were amazing. They were very friendly and always made sure you had everything you need. The pool is a little smaller, but very sufficient. It has a swim up bar on one side and an identical pool on the other with no bar. The two pools are separated by a walkway to the beach. We ate at Fusion, the Japanese and Steakhouse. The Japanese was our favorite. They start off with an excellent sushi plate. We loved the tempura shrimp and veggie appetizer. For main course, the beef and shrimp dishes were the best. The tempura icecream for dessert was great. Fusion was our least favorite, but had a great steak dish. The steakhouse was also very good. The beef was VERY tender and cooked just perfect. If you order dessert, get the Baked Alaska. Very good and entertaining. The buffet always had a wide variety of food. The make your own pasta station was great! Don Julian is the main buffet and only place open for breakfast. You have a few options at lunch, but Don Julian was the best. The drinks are weak, but who wants to be hammered the whole time and if you do, just ask for more alcohol. The mini fridge had four different hard liquors, beer, water and soda. The drinks were prepared the best in the bar by the lobby. The entertainment wasn't that great. It was hit and miss. Not much to do as far as kids activities. They had a very small kids club, but never seen anyone there. Every night, they do have the kids come up on the stage to dance around 8. All the kids enjoyed that. If you like to shop, it is about a 5 min. ride to 5th Avenue for $5 or there are a few shops across the street. The resort and all the shopping is in a gated community and we felt very safe. There is free wi-fi in the lobby if you have your own laptop or you can also pay to use theirs. We love to travel to different areas, but when we come back, this will be the place!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again....”
Reviews.Author: Angelicstarlete
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riu Palace Mexico from October 2, 2010 through October 9, 2010. We were under the impression we booked Riu Palace Riviera Maya since the booking information said Riviera Maya, Mx- Riu Palace Mexico. We arrived at Riu Palace Riviera Maya and they advised we did not have a booking with them. They took a look at the voucher and advised us to go to the Riu Palace Mexico. Once we got to our hotel- we checked in smoothly, and got to our room only to find two TWIN beds pushed together to make a large sized bed. Also, we had a beautiful view of nothing, basically trees and part of the neighboring hotels tennis court peeking through. The room was stuffy and not comfortable. We tried to upgrade (and of course, pay for the upgrade) but they told us they could only accomodate us for a good reason (like a honeymoon). That's funny since we went during off-season and the hotel was basically empty. So everynight I would end up in the gap between the two beds, pretty much pushing the beds apart and falling into the gap that was made! The hotel was all in all was nice. The staff was amazing. The beach was incredible. There are a number of restaurants to eat at with reservations (which can only be made from 8 30-1030 am). If you dont have a reservation, you will be eating at a daily themed buffet for dinner. The food is edible, not great. I guess we expected to eat authentic Mexican food, and of course, there was only 1 night of mexican themed food at the buffet and we missed it. We ate out in town 90% of the time. I'm not likely to stay at this hotel again based on poor quality of food and our room. The all-inclusive was good for breakfast and drinks, however, with the money we spent eating out I probably would not opt for the all inclusive at this location in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I remember”
Reviews.Author: marsguy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a return visit to the Riu Palace Mexico. We were there almost exactly three years ago and loved it. This time, however, it didn't quite measure up. Sure, the grounds are spectacular - a more beautiful resort complex you'd be hard pressed to find. It was very well tended and extremely well manicured and shiny/squeaky clean. Great maid service and turn down service and extra towels - just like before. The food, however, was not very good. I know, people complain about the food at the all-inclusives all the time. Or they get excited about the variety at the buffets. We tend to like the restaurants and always try to get our meals there. We were at the Riu Palace Negril earlier this year and the food there was FAR superior. The restaurants this time seem to just mail it in - the steak house was not good at all. The Japanese restaurant was probably the best - and I'm not a fan of Japanese food. The "Fusion" restaurant was the worst. All in all, pretty tasteless and uninspired. That's NOT what we had the last time we were here. Plus lunch was noticeably bland no matter where you got it. The Beach: One thing we remembered the first day at the beach that we had forgotten about - the huge dropoff as you walk out into the water. There's a huge step down and after 10 yards or so, you climb back up onto a sandbar where it levels off more gradually and proceeds to deeper water. It made many people have a lot of difficulty exiting the water - lot of them had to be helped up out of the ocean because they couldn't navigate the steep step out onto the sand. Just a cautionary advisory. We loved the trees and the shady areas all throughout the beach. You can be in complete shade all day long if you want. The people are extraordinarily friendly and the atmosphere is still amazing. A great relaxing place - just don't expect really good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, but there were a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: bgarcia79
Reviews.Content: All in all this resort is great, but there were a few minor things that could be worked on. First I will start with what needs to be fixed. 1) The hotel still has regular keys that you have to take with you everywhere. It is a real pain to keep track of the key when in the pool or at the beach. I have not been to a hotel that didn't have key cards in at least 8-10 years. 2) The "king" beds are 2 beds pushed together that slide apart throughout the night 3) The pool does not have steps to walk into it. 4) If you want to go to the night club or sports bar you have to go to across the street to Riu Tequila Now on to the positive: The service was spectacular. The food was very good. The beach was pristine. If you are looking for a resort to relax at this is it. We went over to all the other Riu resorts in the area and this one was definitely the least crowded. FYI if you do go over to one of the other resorts to check out the pool or beach be sure to take your towel as we had a hard time exchanging our towel cards for towels while there. We went to all of the specialty restaurants and my husband like the brazilian the most, I prefered Krystal, we didn't really like the Japannese. We didn't have any trouble getting reservations but it didn't really seem like the resort was at capacity so maybe that helped. The buffet was smaller than other Riu palaces that we have been to but still had plenty of choices for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mskane
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant at first to stay here because there were mixed reviews of this hotel. But, family members that we were traveling with had stayed here several times in the past and loved it. So, I figured we give it a try. The hotel is beautiful with modern and old world charm. It is very clean and the service was very good. Even our four-year old daughter was kept entertained. The few things that could be improved are the pool area has no steps for easy access in and out ot the pool. They only have a ladder that is pretty steep. Also I have never stayed at an all-inclusive that did not make thier frozen drinks out fresh fruit. This hotel only uses mixes that can be bought in any supermarket. That was a litlle disappointing if you are going for the true tropical luxury. They are also very strict about men wearing long pants to dinner, even in the buffett. I can understand it for the restaurants but, the buffett seemed a little extreme since men can wear shorts even in the clubs. All in all it was a very pleasant experience and we look forward to going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate”
Reviews.Author: davali2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of our Honeymoon, very nice, the place is immaculate, We Traveled from the UK, met lots of nice people, very very hot though!!

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brocher
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 4th June check in was straight forward & fairly quick . Had a room on the Groundfloor , quite far down complex, penultimate block for the pool. The room was spacious & clean the King Size bed was actually 2 double beds pushed together . Nice space at the end with couch / table & telly , which led to a small balcony looking onto a path around the back of the complex. The bed was a bit hard & the bathroom was a bit tired looking especially the small bath with shower over, however the room was spacious , impeccably cleaned each day & minor problems with a couple of light bulbs & the toilet running were dealt with quickly when raised . The pool was bit of a disappointment as it was quite small & split in half by a main path through the complex to the beach. However the staff down there looked after you well(towel change, book exchange, bar & waiters ). We don't normally do 5 star so was a bit of shock not having to get off the sun lounger to get a drink, the waiters round the pool area are continually , serving drinks, tidying glasses & generally making sure that you are ok. The main buffet was very good , with a lot of choice a number of different show cooking stations & in addition on various nights held theme evenings. The speciality restaurants were a bit hit & miss, Grill down by the beach & Krsyal Fusion were nice & they made a great effort to look after you. The Brazilian was OK , but most of the meats you get in the buffet from the show stations & the Japanese food wasn't very nice, late letting you in, people were being rushed to leave before they finished their meal to make space for 2nd sitting & this was caused by the staff being late letting people in & their slow service. The other facilities were beautiful especially the Lounge bar , with dark wood & the large chandelier in the main atrium . The staff & reception & the bars really did their best to make people welcome & relax. I guess one of the issues were mosquitos , they were biting everyone & jungle Formula didn't appear to work (even the 50% deet high strength) , however when chatted to the rep , she advised we buy a local deterrent called "OFF" form the nearby pharmacy & that seemd to keep the little biters at bay. The only other issue we had was the wife had bit of a funny tummy for a few datys, & so did a few othe other guests we talked to, but I think this was probably down to the heat & humidity rather than anything else . The temperatures were 40+ C the humidity was in the 90s . Some people were overheating under the sun brolleys as they don't block the heat like the palm leave roofed stations in other parts of the carribean. As it was during the World cup, the hotel set asid one of the conference room with a projector screen & a couple of tellys. They also put in wine / beer / soft drinks in coolers & provided snacks so that the visitors could see the matches . In short it was lovely hotel, with great staff. We would definitely go there again but not in june with heat & humidity .

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money. Not a singles destination though.”
Reviews.Author: TMG0440
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Playa Del Carmen although I have stayed in Cancun several times. I found the Riu Palace Mexico to be a good value for the money but with a few areas that could use improvement. I think these are mainly due to the natural aging process.
