PROS: My stay was from September 11-18, 2010. Upon arrival, I was greeted by Manuel, the doorman. During the entire week of my stay, he always greeted me by name and gave me a "fist bump" greeting. He made me feel welcome. Upon check in, the front desk staff saw that it was my birthday and offered me an upgraded room, #1047. It was September, so I'm sure they had rooms to spare. But it just illustrates that the hotel's attitude is to service and please the customer. Without exception, that's how I was treated during my whole stay. The grounds of the hotel are meticulously manicured and maintained. The Beach is very nice. I liked that you walked through a shady grove of palms get there. You have the option of staying under the trees if you prefer not to cook or laying on the wide open beach. There were always plenty of lounge chairs no matter the time of day. The ocean water was a very pleasant temperature also. One day, a group of people took some bread out into the water with them and were feeding the fish. The fish that fed looked like frisbee-sized angel fish. Very cool! The food was good with lots of variety. I always found plenty of options that I liked or wanted to try. I didn't go to any specialty restaurants so I cannot comment on them. One day, I had a migraine so I booked a massage on the beach. It was raining that day so it was very peaceful and relaxing. The massage girl found that my back was full of knots and the treatment helped me tremendously. CONS: Generally, my complaints are minor. The first being that the hotel is showing it's age. There are many cracked or chipped tiles in the halls and corridors. There are areas that need some paint and touch up too. All cosmetic but they're things that I noticed. My main complaint was the air conditioning in my room. It was BARELY able to keep up. The unit's blower only put out a slight amount of air, even on the highest setting. I needed to keep the ceiling fan on at all times to keep the air moving. Without the fan, I think it would not have kept up. On the second to last day of my stay, they worked on the adjacent room's air conditioning and needed to access the A/C unit in my room too. After they were through, my A/C unit had developed a vibration noise in the blower. It sort of sounded like water-hammering in pipes, but not that loud. I have a background in maintenance so I know exactly what happened. They knocked the blower out of balance when they were messing with it. I comlplained to the desk and supposedly someone went to look at it. It wasn't fixed though. Since I'm a heavy sleeper, I just decided to live with it for one night. Speaking of maintenance, I noticed several things that wouldn't get by Q.C. in the states. The most noticeable being the florescent fixture over the sink. There were exposed wires due to the ballast being replaced and the cover not replaced correctly. I guess you have to expect things like that because of the quality and training of the maintenance staff in Mexico. Also, the shower drain was very slow. There was always a big puddle of water and soap suds around your feet while you dried off. As I said, minor complaints but worth mentioning, I feel. On a side note... I am a single traveler. Next time, I would probably stay at one of the sister properties instead of the Palace. During my whole stay, I didn't run into another single traveler at the hotel. It's definitely a couples destination. The Riu Tequila across the street was packed with a younger, more lively crowd. If I'm still single and go back to Playa, that's where I'll stay. Lot's of Europeans at the Tequila, I noticed. That would make it even more interesting to me. All in all, I would recommend the RPM if you're a couple or family. My package was through CheapCaribbean.com and very reasonably priced for the level of service I received. If you're single or young and fun. I'd stay somewhere else. The RPM is geared toward a more quiet, upscale crowd.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed for our anniversary and had a...”
Reviews.Author: Jimbert
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our anniversary and had a really wonderful time. The hotel is in a fantastic location with a stunning white fine sandy beach. The sea is perfect, warm, clear and coral free. The walk south is stunning where jungle meets beach, with rocky outcrops and bays. If you are into snorkelling there are reefs nearby and tours on offer. I recommend the free scuba lesson then a reef dive, truly amazing and easily affordable. The food at the hotel is great, plenty of choice and all to a good standard. It's the people and service that make the hotel so special, real attention to detail, highly professional and genuine. I wouldn't think twice about returning, loved it and hands down beat Barbados for this time of year. Take enough money to get out on some excursions, so much to see, and if you can tip, do so, the staff truly deserve it, without ever making you feel you have to.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations, great place”
Reviews.Author: torontoamy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled here with our 5 month old baby in May, 2010. I have to say, it exceeded our expectations, and then some. The hotel itself is beautiful, rooms spotless, beds huge and comfortable. The beach is AMAZING. The hotel staff are so friendly and make you feel comfortable. Our room fridge was always stocked with water and cervezas! The food was great too, we are both vegetarian, and lots of options for us. I was very hesitant to go on an all inclusive since i'd had a not so great experience before, but, with a young baby we didn't have much choice. I surprised myself and had an amazing, relaxing trip. I would recommend RIU Palace to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great again!”
Reviews.Author: BLHickson
Reviews.Content: New mattresses are fantastic! No more hard as a sheetrock beds. Good food, great beach, great service. The check in girl Ernesta did not know us as repeat customers 'til we mentioned it and got an upgrade in rooms, but this was the only ? to the whole trip. Still a great place to stay and play in Playa del Carmen. We'll be back. Also, the Mayan dance show was fantastic! They should have it every Sat. night.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: tjswife
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience with an all-inclusive resort and we loved it! The food was wonderful, the staff was exceptional especially at Don Julian. We also ate at the steakhouse & the Brazilian restaurant. We were there during the off season (September) so did not have the issue about waiting for reservations in the morning ~ both times we made reservations it was about a 2 minute deal. The steakhouse was great however it is outside and was a very hot humid night so that made it a little uncomfortable but we were impressed with the food and the service. We really liked the Brazilian restaurant. Lots of meat plus a salad bar and a dessert bar. Don Julian was amazing. The staff there was exceptional and the food was wonderful with tons of choices. The beach is absolutely beautiful & very clean. The water was aqua and clear. We would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a calm, relaxing, stress-free vacation or holiday. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! Loved Playa del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: roses4889
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! And the staff was very friendly, nice and helpful. We had access to all the Riu resorts in the area, which were beautiful as well. We had a wonderful time, highly recommended. The only downside was the food was mediocre .

Reviews.Title: “Overly priced hotel, beautiful beach.”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel0909
Reviews.Content: First of all let me start by saying my husband (51), me (42), daughter (20) and my mom (72) have traveled to either Playa del Carmen or Cancun twice a year for the past 4-5 years and have always stayed at All-inclusives. We payed the most for this trip at this hotel and I would not stay there again, it was not worth the money. I would recommend staying at any of the Iberostars, Sandos Playcar Riviera or others for the price. My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico for a friends wedding with a large group for one week over 4th of July. The resort grounds are beautiful and is on one of the best beaches "Playacar". Unfortunately the food at the buffet was better than any of their specialty restaurants except for the Japanese and I am not a picky eater. Service was decent at the buffet but at the specialty restaurants the staff seemed "put out". The pool area is very small for such a large fancy resort. Pool bar staff was okay. Rooms were nice size but the bathrooms were horrible. Shower area was back in the corner and very dark. Not 5 star in my opinion. Entertainment was okay, typical for "Mexico all-inclusive". Their show "Grease" was good and the Michael Jackson night was entertaining. In the week that we were there at some point or another we all got sick and a few people in our group were sick for weeks after we got back. My husband, me, daughter and mom have never gotten sick at any other resort in Mexico. I thought this was strange. Walked to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and ate lunch there and used the pool, that pool is much nicer. Resort also seemed much livelier than the Mexico. Nothing much really happened at night at our place.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a relaxing holiday.”
Reviews.Author: purrshaped
Reviews.Content: It's as good as all the reviews say it is, so just a couple of tips for you when you're there, you are entitled to go to any of the other five hotels and watch their evening shows, ask reception and they will tell you what's on at each Hotel, I recommend the Movie show, and try to watch the Michael Jackson show at the Palace Riviera Maya as the strobe lighting is very effective for this. Second floor rooms have smaller balconies, so if you want a larger balcony ask for another room if your room number is between 2000-2100 Leave the air conditioning on all the time, Mexico is very humid and if you turn it off a lot it could make the room smell damp. Bring along a batch of one dollar bills, the service is very good anyway but it gets better if you leave a dollar tip every now and then. The cleaner will probably leave you a towel animal in the room, if you leave them a dollar by the animal they will normally do a different one each day, I didn't know it was possible to make towel monkeys..... the pool away from the bar is quieter, there's a sign saying no ball games, but no-one minds if you're just throwing a ball to each other in the pool. the Jacuzzi is round this side as well, it hidden but definitely worth using. Enjoy your trip

Reviews.Title: “Great time and great beach; little nightlife at resort”
Reviews.Author: Family5Missouri
Reviews.Content: Our trip included my husband and myself who are in our early 50's and kids 30, 21 and 19. We had a great time on the trip and felt the resort was a good value. The staff for the most part was very friendly and the beach is wonderful. The rooms are older and could use updating; the key is an old time relic. The beds are crazy, why they push two together like this is beyond me. The mini refrigerator in one room did not workwell sot we just stocked up in the second room. We did not use room service, it is available but the menu is limited. We ate at the buffet most meals and it was quite good. There is a variety of food and it is well prepared, The wait staff was very attentive and friendly. We ate at the Fusion and Japanese speciality resturants. The Fusion food and staff was wonderful; they met us at the entrance with a glass of champagne! The appetizer had foam which was alright but a little different. The Japanese Resturant did not meet the service standard and was one of the disappointments of our trip. I had read great reviews but I really think they wait staff was not assigned to our table. We had to ask for beverages and menus after everyone else was served. I don't know how this happen since the dining area is small. The food was good but not great. And the way to make a reservation is not well explained. In the morning the day the guest wants a reservation the guest must go to the bar area downstairs and sit at 0800 and wait for a staff member to arrive and pass out numbers. When your number is called you go up to the staff member and put in your request. The problem is there can be a stampede to get the number. The first morning I did this I was not expecting the pushing and rush to get in line. The next morning the guest were much more civilzed and orderly. Be prepared. Dress code. The men must wear long pants in the evening to the buffet. The women can wear shorts, halter tops and flip flops. Beach: topless sunbathers. Not that I am very conservative but most of the women that were topless should not have been. Gravity over time wins. There is no nightlife at this resort . The Rui Tequila across the street has a disco and more lively evening shows. Internet access. You can pay a fee to use the lap top computers in the lobby. This was nice to check on things at home. Things to do differently Our trip was through Apple Vacations and we did arrange for a non-stop transfer from the Cancun Airport however next time I think we will cab it or look into alternatives; even though the transfer is non-stop, we sat in the van for 45 minutes before it left the airport and the representative had report to the hotel lobby 1 hour and 15 minutes prior to pick up. I didn't think this was worth the extra cash. We had a great time and would go back again without any hesitation. The drinks were good the beach access and pool were wonderful. Hope to go back in a couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend a week!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationtime79
Reviews.Content: I have spent a week in Riu Mexico with my boyfriend in April 2010. We really liked the hotel. I will try to summarize what we liked and what we didn't. Even though I will rate this hotel as a five-star resort, there are still some things to improve. Trip to and from airport: This will take you an hour but is not that bad. Rooms: Now beware: your room can smell of mold. When we first go there, they gave us a room on the 1st floor. We walked in and it smelled really really moldy. We thought maybe it is the cleaning stuff that they use for the floor, decided to stay the night and air the room. The smell of mold stayed and I am not sure how we even slept. Then we went to the reception early the next morning, complained about the moldy smell and they gave us a new room on the 2nd floor (which is better). So if you don't like your room - tell them your first hour there! They will stock your fridge every day and clean the room really well. Restaurants: There is a buffet and there are specialty restaurants. We found the buffet great. On our last night we had lobsters - and we could eat as many as we wanted. There was always a great variety. Also - perfect service. They are very attentive. Coffee is bad but you can go to the bar at 10am and order a capuccino. As for the specialty restaurants: we had to wait in the theater, take a number, then come 30 min later and make a reservation. It is kind of a hassle and you need to plan in advance and wait. Some people actully took their books to read and wait. I recommend the steakhouse. My boyfriend had his birthday there and they brought him a chocolate cake and started singing - very friendly and great service. Was not impressed with the sushi place - but then again - sushi in Mexico is kind of streching it. The Krystal place is OK. But all the inside restaurants were really cold as AC is on full blast. The food for lunch is kind of repetitive and we ate at the restaurant by the beach. You cannot eat there though in your bikini so put some clothes on! Beach: gorgeous clean beach. Lots of sand. Nice chairs. You will have a guy walking around and offering drinks about every 20 min. You can also take a walk on the beach all the way to the town and you will see lots of weddings take place. We saw about 5. There is also a pool and we took a water aerobics class which was really fun. What you also can do is take a walk to a different Riu resort. We did that and actually thought ours was the best one. Entertainment: this was kind of a weak I thought. They were trying with the shows but I was not really impressed. Overall - I would definitely go back and not just for a week!

Reviews.Title: “First time at an all-inclusive was a very pleasant one”
Reviews.Author: vix814
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked through the door of the Riu Palace Mexico, I was blown away. The service (from the bellhop to the reception desk to the housekeeping staff to the men serving drinks at the beach) was outstanding. Everyone always had a smile on their faces and went out of their way to accommodate us. The hotel was beautiful and very well kept. There were always staff members ensuring that everything on the premises was clean as well. You truly feel as if you are in a palace because of how beautiful the place is and because of how well you are treated. Food and drinks are very plentiful. The great thing about it was that there were a variety of restaurants to choose from and even at the buffet there were theme nights, so you don't really get bored of the food too easily. The minibar is always stocked well and there is never a shortage of any drink, including bottled water. The only complaints I have about the food/drinks were 1) you have to make reservations for the a la carte restaurants (which is understandable), but you can only make them the morning of between 8:30 and 10. Although, we went on 2 excursions and were not there during the reservation time, but when we came back, we went to the front desk and asked if there was anything open and they were able to accommodate us. And the buffet is good, so it's not the worst thing in the world if you can't get to the a la carte once or twice. But that was still a little annoying. 2) The mixed drinks were very weak, so if you like them strong, I would recommend asking for an extra shot or two. The beach is beautiful and right off of the hotel. There is also a BBQ on the beach and a bar, as well as men walking around very frequently serving drinks. There are also two buffets off of the beach. So if you're hungry around lunch time, you don't have to leave the beach and change for lunch. The pool was also nice, but it was a little small. The water in the pool was also a little warmer than I would expect it to be, but it wasn't a bad pool. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The housekeeping even put adorable towel animals in the room, which added a nice little touch! The balcony was also very roomy and nice to sit out on and relax with a drink in the evening. While everything in the room was very nice and well stocked, the bed was slightly hard. If you have trouble sleeping on a mattress that is not super plush, this may not be the place for you. While the mattress was a little hard, I never had a bad night's sleep. The location that the hotel is located in is very safe and is a nice little area to walk around. There is a little flea market 2 minutes away from the hotel that was nice for souvenirs as well. While it is not central to 5th Avenue and the center of Playa del Carmen, taxis are abundant and it is easy to get anywhere that you would need to (it seems that many of the tours we looked at offered transportation directly to hotels as well). Overall, I really enjoyed my stay here and would recommend it to anyone going to Playa del Carmen. There were a lot of great amenities and the service was outstanding. I don't think we could have gotten any better for the price!

Reviews.Title: “A totally stress free holiday .”
Reviews.Author: jayjaygee
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week stay at the Riu Palace. Check in was quick and we were shown to our adjacent rooms. The rooms are large with a seating area and a flat screen tv and a well stocked fridge and mini bar which are replenished daily. There is a slight musty smell which we experienced before in Mexico, but it did not worry us at all. The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained and everywhere is spotlessly clean. The beach is amazing and there is an abundance of sunloungers, no need to ever get to the beach early to get one!! The food is very good and we had no problem getting reservations in the specialiaty restaurants. The staff are all very attentive and so hardworking and nothing was too much trouble. We had no illness and ate at all the restaurants. My only complaint is that there are no Roman steps into the swimming pool which makes it very difficult for the disabled and children, but we are beach people so this did not affect us at all. We walked along to the Riu Yucatan which was heaving with people and also to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya which admittedly had a better pool with Roman steps but it was full of people drinking and eating nachos whilst in the pool and the music was very loud, we preferred the peace of the Riu Palace Mexico. We t5ook advantage of the complimentary room service several times which was much appreciated and always arrived with a smile. Overall we had a very relaxing holiday,with excellent service in lovely surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Arraminta32
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after staying at the Riu for 7 nights. On entering the hotel you are greeted by a very grand entrance where guests can use the free Wi-fi. The staff here are very friendly (always saying hello as you walk past) drinks are regularly brought around on the beach and near the pool. The beach is clean and there were always plenty of sun loungers to choose from in the shade or direct sun. We swam in the sea as it is both warm and clean also took Kayaks out a couple of times at no additional cost. The swimming pool is so warm, we sat by the quieter pool as the other pool is quite loud with volleyball and music playing so it depends on what suits your taste! We ate at the Krystal, steakhouse and Brazilian restaurants...I wouldn't recommend eating at these and thought the buffut was much better quality food, however sitting down to a 3 course meal did make the dining experience feel more varied. The Krystal restaurant served some a variety of food (with alot of foam) in one meal I had tomato and watermelon foam, mushroom foam and another that I forgot! The steakhouse was OK, nothing that great and the Brazilian was terrible. The side order of potato and veg came out a long time before any meat. The server came around with skewers of meat and cut one small piece of meat but didn't seem to know what meat they were serving, also ou get sauces to accompany the meats, but the server could not explain what these were. We ate the rest of our meals in the main buffet area, where I could not fault the food, there really was something for everyone! The rooms are good, a bit dated and the bed wasn't the comfiest but they were clean. On the whole we really enjoyed our stay at the RIU Palace Mexico, after reading the reviews on here I payed special attention to the 'smell' and can honestly say there wasn't one. At the end of the day when they are cleaning out the bar by the pool there was a slight drain smell. We visited all the other RIU hotels nearby and felt ours was the best. The other Palace hotel down the road appeared to be a newer building, but there certainly was an unpleasant smell here like vomit. The location is great, you can walk down the road to look at some small stalls or get a taxi for $5 in to Playa del Carmen where there are several shops and bars. We got a taxi from the airport to the hotel - hertz we couldn't see the 'regular taxis at the airport on arrival and had the choice of a shuttle bus taking another 3 couples to their hotel for $60 or and individual taxi for $90. On the return to the airport we got a 'regular taxi' and they have a set fee of $50, so if anyone knows where the 'regular taxis' wait at the airport on arrival that would be good to know for future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing trip & a good value”
Reviews.Author: pickoutagooddream
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Riu Palace Mexico on a last minute decision to scout out places for our destination wedding. The hotel is quiet, romantic spot, and was a bit dated for our taste. Apparently it's 12 years old and I'm guessing no updating has been completed. We are a young couple who enjoys relaxing on the beach, but also some fun nightlife. This hotel is DEAD after 10pm. The pool is great to lay out and nap by, but not the place to look for fun. The water also was warmer than the ocean. The beach, however, was perfect. We loved all of the palm trees under which we napped daily. There were plenty of loungers available. The drinks here were not strong, but the bartenders were always happy to add more liquor if requested. Service at this resort is OUTSTANDING. We Our stay was great for the price! We loved the food so much I gained 4 pounds in our 4 day trip:) We ate the buffet every night, and even ate it once and hour and a half before our scheduled dinner! I loved the breakfast buffet, especially the smoothie bar, omelette station, and Mimosa stand. They have free wi-fi in the lobby near the bar (so don't pay the $15 for 15 minutes). The only negative we noted to this resort were the rooms that were dated and dingy smelling. Our bed was somewhat laughable. It was two full-sized beds pushed together to make one big bed....but each bed was individually made. Thus, you end up sleeping in a full. And the beds move apart! I also didn't like that we had to carry around an old-school room key. Plus, the walls must be thin, since we were woken up one night by our "enthusiastic" neighbors. We did like that staying in a Riu "palace" entitled you to visit any other Rius in the Playacar area. We went to Riu Tequila one afternoon to watch the World Cup at the disco. We also spent one day at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, which we LOVED. The pool area here was HOPPING.....which was exactly what we were looking for. The Riu Palace Mexico is in great proximity to walk to any of the other Rius. Also, there's a STARBUCKS within quick walking distance!! We walked along the beach several days and loved this. Overall, we would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing, affordable vacation. However, if you're looking for a more lively crowd, we'd stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya (which looks just like the Riu Palace Mexico, only 10 years newer with a MUCH nicer pool area).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant, brilliant and brilliant!!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulCasey_91
Reviews.Content: Firstly just want to say, some of these reviews seem to be for a different hotel entirely and to put people off. Nowhere is going to be 100% perfect for everyone but this hotel is not far off. Not sure about the smell some people have commented on - we were there for two weeks and reguarly walked through the reception and didnt notice this once! However, we were welcomed with a strong smell of vomit in the other palace down the road - Riveria Maya. We also had a massage on the beach and thought it was excellent and very relaxing - there is an option to chose to have it in indoors. The only noise we heard was the birds in the trees above. The food was amazing(especially the meat) - so much choice. Compared to some of the all inclusive hotels we have visited this was top notch, people are complaining they were bored defintely need to try a be a bit more adventurous or visit one of the four speciality resturants. Every night the hot food was different, obviously the salads dont change that much, but everything you could think of to put in a salad is available all of the time. The staff at Riu palace were also very friendly and helpful. The barstaff especially, always topping up your drink, asking if you would like another one and also remembering what you liked to drink. Granted, the pool is quite small however staying at the palace gives you the choice to go to all of the other hotels and use their facilities which we did a couple of days and really enjoyed. The hotel grounds are kept very well and clean, people are looking after them 24/7. There is never any litter or bird poo (considering the amount of birds) anywhere either. The beach was amazing!!! Just like what you see in the brochures and on tele, lovely white sand and blue, warm sea!!! This is also kept amaculate. Overall we had a brilliant holiday and wanted people just to know how it really is and how much it really is worth going to!!

Reviews.Title: “Muy Buena”
Reviews.Author: PorterAirlines
Reviews.Content: We decided on the Riu Palace based on the recommendation from our travel agent and some of the reviews from TA. Our honeymoon. It was a good choice. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are comfy. One notice though and it could be this time of year but the mosquitoes were hungry at night. Bring some repellent and use it generously before you go to bed. The service was fine and if you plan on eating at the theme restaurants - get up early to get your reservation as they fill up quick. There's a sweet golf course not to far down the street as well. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Not another hotel it either becomes a part of your heart or doesn’t…”
Reviews.Author: yulkin
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Riu Palace Mexico countless times, and I keep on coming back. Many people that write negative review regarding Palace Mexico don’t take into consideration thing such as location, size of the property and relatively small amount of guests. Since I have visited Playa for so many years been there more than 10 times I know all the ins and out and abouts. Location: Take a taxi and in 4 min you are in down town Playa where you can find a public bus station that will take you all around Yucatan peninsula and even to Cancun. Busses are safe, clean and cheep ( about $2 us dollars one way) you can go explore places like Tulum, Xel-ha and many others without buying ridiculously priced packages from tour agent or a hotel. On a different day make sure to visit Cozumel (I have never seen more beautiful waters) make sure that you don’t see the cruise ships on the horizon prior to going. Rent a scooter or a car and take a ride, it is breath taking. Size of the Property: Palace Mexico in itself is large, and by far has the largest beach comparing to the most properties in Cancun. First there are no corals in the water, second the water is quieter than other places due to the fact that it is protected from the winds by Cozumel. Small number of guests: A lot of guests choose the new palace which is a bit nicer in terms of the smell situation. Otherwise it is smaller, much more crowded, far from Riu Tequila (for the night disco) and overall missing that grand feeling that Palace Mexico does. Negative: The smell is bad. Many hotels in the overall Caribbean region have an issue with smell. Royal hideaway doesn’t but it is small and boring and really really quiet with practically nonexistent beach. I usually bring incense and burn them so that the room smells a bit better. Mosquitoes are monsters and their bites hurt like hell. So, buy the mosquitoes spray that they sell in the hotels store (Mexican one). Spray yourself outside your room (it smell so bad) try not to breath and you will be safe for the night. Make sure to rinse it off before bad. Food is redundant. Personally I don’t go to a vacation to eat. I like to look good feel great and move around a lot. I love to dink, especially Champaign and screw drivers (regardless of the order). My food recommendation try Mexican McDonalds, it taste like Mc Donald’s from your childhood and looks the same as well. He he, large review, hope it helps. Side note, I am a girls who is mostly happy in Four Seasons or Ritz but this place has my heart. Feel free to ping me with questions, going again in September will upload unique pictures Cheers!!!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: ireneobyrne
Reviews.Content: A fantastic stay at this Hotel, Staff could not be more helpful. Always friendly and polite. No problemn getting a table for 6 for Lunch and dinner. Would have no hesitation recommending this Hotel.Feeling unwell on the last morning we were allowed stay in our room until pick up at 14.00.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5* and not for us”
Reviews.Author: tropicalaware
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu palace Mexico with our children for 2 weeks. The first thing you can't help but notice about this hotel is the dreadful smell as you walk in the doors at reception. Even the joss sticks they burn don't mask it, its awful. Reception service was very poor. We experienced rain whilst there and noticed that everyone had red and white stripped umbrellas and asked at reception were we could purchased some, we were told the umbrella is in the wardrobe which is clearly was not. We asked for an umbrella on 3 occasions without success, thank god the sun came out. We also asked reception to contact another riu in cancun and we were told to contact them ourselves!!. The food is so repetitive that you get sick of looking for something to eat. We tried the steak house which should be renamed grizzle fat house, dreadful and the fushion which was just as bad. The fact that you don't have to queue for a ticket for these restaurants is a good indication of how popular they are. If you are used to good quality food then its a NO. All of us had tummy trouble whilst staying at this hotel and so did most of the guest we spoke to. The beds are hard even with the famous Rui topper. On several occasions going to or from our room we saw a mattress in the corridor were they were changing the bed or bed combination maybe, I don't really know, but the stains on these mattresses were awful and I worried what I was sleeping on but could not bring myself to look under the sheets. Staff work extremely hard and hotel is very clean. The beach is fabulous now, so wide and plenty of sun loungers. You also get waiter service for all your drinks as you lounge by the pool. We would never stay at this hotel again. It is definitely not a 5* and needs refurbishment. We stayed at high season and the hotel was not full. Each day the Riu Tequila brings people over for a tour of the hotel to try and drum up customers for next year but they don't do that at the Riviera Maya which is on the same road, because they don't have to it was busy. Some people we spoke to said the hotel was fantastic but it was their first time in Mexico or to an all inclusive and I guess once they have tried some others they will change their minds. We still had a fantastic holiday and that was because is was a Palace and the all inclusive band of a Palace allows you to go in any other Riu hotel. There are 4 Riu in this area and the Riviera Maya Palace and we used them all, thats what made our holiday. The Riviera Maya is beautiful and a world apart from the Palace Mexico. The entertainment at the Riu Tequila was fab. Our two teenagers spent most of their time in the sports bar there. We also visited Riu Cancun and the Palace Las America next door which were also gorgeous, and you can have your breakfast and lunch in any of these hotels and also your drinks just not your evening meal. I suppose you could say the safety net of a Palace is if your not happy you can move around and its also your chance to see the other hotels should you decide to return.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better!”
Reviews.Author: b305miami
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three day stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. The grounds are beautiful and the hotel itself is nice and the staff very friendly. The food was just ok and what I expected. Kinda like cruise ship food. Never too good but not terrible either. We tried to get reservations to the speciality restaurants but they were always booked solid, even if you get there on time to make a reservation. The rooms are large and clean. However, there is a strong odor of mold . The beds are absolutely hard as a rock. Very uncomfortable. There is also a lot of noise. Everything echos in the hallways and you can hear everything. I dont think I slept more than a few hours each night. Overall I would not recommend this hotel to someone. there are many other options out there that are better..

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - would go back”
Reviews.Author: Essex88
Reviews.Content: We actually booked and stayed the first week of our holidays in the Riu Tequila across the road from the Riu Palace but we decided with young children it was too busy for us (had to be up at 7am to get a sunbed!) and we asked our Thomson rep if we could pay the extra and upgrade to the Riu Palace - we are so glad we did! The food is lovely - no complaints but I have to mention that apart from the kids (prob because all they ate was pizza!) my husband and I had tummy upsets. I just put this down to where we were - it wasn't dirty or not cooked properly but a lot of people we spoke to seemed to be suffering the same. Tummy cramps but no sickness just the other end. Did get me down a bit by the end of the holiday as it was with me more or less the whole time but it didn't stop me eating and I didn't feel ill. On more positive notes, the hotel is beautiful, rooms are lovely, everything is very clean, the drinks are great - no rubbish local petrol style alcohol, good cocktails, mixed very well with brand name alcohol, the beach is amazing, the local trips are great, going into town to Playa Del Carmen is so much fun, the pool drinks service is brilliant - tip them sometimes, they deserve it. Whan can I say, we would love to go back next year. We shall just remember the tummy tablets!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, but our poor stomachs :(”
Reviews.Author: TNTfr
Reviews.Content: We just got back yesterday August 3rd 2010. The resort is beautiful! Our room was spacious. I do agree with the post about their clothes smelling when they got back and unpacked the luggage. Our clothes did too. I didn't smell it when we were there though. FOOD We did not eat in any of the "special" restaurants. We ate the buffet most mornings and every lunch and dinner. Dinner is always pants for the guys. That is something to keep in mind when packing for this resort. The food was good. The second night we were there though my husband started to get sick the 3rd day he was having frequent belly aches and on the 4th day I thought I should take him to the hospital. He did not want to go and had chills, dizziness and the runs (tmi I know) and TERRIBLE belly cramps. I also kept have sporadic belly aches. We are home now and we are both still sick, better than when we were there though. We did not directly drink any water. I am thinking it was the buffet. The food was all good. The service at the buffet was excellent. Friendly, friendly staff! DRINKS I never tasted any alcohol in any of the drinks that I had. I had the Coco Rosa, the Mango Tango, Sunshine and margaritas. Oh and on a side note - they have no Crown Royal. (husbands favorite) THE BEACH We found chairs every single day that we went to the beach with no problems. The only shade comes from the palms. The sand was not powdery like you would find in Destin or Panama City Beach in Florida. It has some shells in it too. But on a whole the beach was nice. Lots of activity. Jet skis, boats, kayaks, snorkeling tours......when swimming you will smell the water crafts as they come and go. They do have an area roped off for only swimmers but there were kayakers that came in there. Not sure if they were allowed. Snorkeling gear is free at the Scuba Caribe on the beach. Kayaks were too even though we didn't use them. THE ROOM Nice room. We had a junior suite with a sunken in den that had a couch that made a bed. There is a bidet in the bathroom. I took my macbook pro...it did NOT fit in the safe so I was locking it in my suitcase every day. Ipad fit fine and small cameras and other small items. We had one really big roach that probably crawled in through the sliding glass doors. That did not bother me. Bugs can get in anywhere. MOSQUITOS are terrible about getting into your room. I swear they WAIT for you to open your door and fly in. The maids keep the doors open while they are cleaning so every day when we came back we had a bunch in our room flying around our heads. On our 2nd morning there they started renovating the room next to us. They were scraping and sanding and banging before 8am! Being" later than 8 am sleepers" they woke us up. The sounds went on ALL day. We complained (we are not complaining people) at the front desk and he did nothing then about 4:30pm. we called the front desk and the front desk girl came down and yelled at them but they still stayed until 5pm banging. The next morning (check out morning) they were back at it at 7am waking us up again. We complained again at check out and we were told that they were sorry. THE POOL HOT HOT HOT! I thought it was heated but that was just the temp! They have a towel station. When you check in they give you one towel card per person. When you go get towels you give them your card and they give you the number of towels per cards. If you don't turn your cards in during checkout they charge you 20 bucks per towel. Watch your towels while on the beach, I heard some towels came up missing. Wi-Fi Only in the lobby and bar area. Wish it could have been in our rooms. TRANSPORTATION Very easy! Transfer vans were always there. Taxis called by the bellhop are easy to find at most any time. GIFT SHOP Convenient but overpriced a bit. Nice clerks. EXCURSIONS We did the snorkeling booked through Lomas Travel (thank you Jorge)! AWESOME!!! SO MUCH FUN! Swimming with the dolphins at DOLPHINARIS. FUN!! If you can take the offer at the Cancun airport for 100 bucks per couple! WAAAY CHEAPER but you do have to sit through a 2 hour presentation at a resort. We didn't do this but wished that we had. A couple on our snorkeling trip did it and save a TON of money! I think I have covered everything :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - we would return”
Reviews.Author: rockyScotland
Reviews.Content: We are just back from two weeks holiday at the Riu Palace Mexico. We have stayed there once before and this time friends joined us for the first time. I was worried that they may not enjoy it as much as we had but I am glad to say they did. From check in everything was wonderful including they gave us the room I had requested and our friends were right next door. They main thing about the hotel is the wonderful staff, they were always so happy and could not do enough for us. It was hard work turning down all the drinks we were offered down at the pool. I think they must get great training as they are all so hard working. The management too were always about making sure everything was working as it should. We tried all the a la carte restaurants and liked them all but the buffet was excellent and we went to this most as we could all eat what we wanted and at our own pace. We went to different tables for breakfast, lunch and dinner but the staff got to know us and decorated our table with flowers which was a lovely touch. We did tip for drinks and meals but not a lot and they certainly did not look for tips and many people do not seem to tip but I know they dont earn a lot and we liked to give them something. We ate lunch a few days at the other palace and it was nice for a change, we also went out to some of the other hotels for drinks but we did like our hotel best. One last thing be sure and go in the sea, it is lovely and warm, we liked it best last in the afternoon when it was not too busy and not too hot. The only thing we did not enjoy was the wine, we tried them all but finally just stuck to champagne all the time as we all enjoyed that. Not such a hardship for us. We would certainly go back to this hotel I just wish it was not such a long flight. However when you are there it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Gross....smelly...and Gross again....”
Reviews.Author: Bella46942
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico and was very disappointed. There were a number of bugs in my room that were only addressed with a can of bug spray, no offer to move to a different room or anything, just bug spray The food is alright if you have a stomach of steel that can handle anything. Do not do the outside massage of you decide to stay there, not worth stripping down in front of strangers to then have to listen to them all on the beach while you are trying to relax. The outside massage is not in a clam relaxing setting instead its right on top of all the guest yelling out for drinks and sun block. Before booking my trip I went on Trip Advisor and read all the positive reviews and was excited about the all inclusive resort. Upon arriving at the Riu I was overcome with a stench that lingered with me throughout my short visit and then back home on all my cloths in my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at a Riu!”
Reviews.Author: ERat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 night stay at Riu Palace Mexico and it was a wonderful stay. This was our third stay at a Riu resort and it was just as good as Riu Palace Riviera Maya. I would recommend this resort to anyone wanting to stay at a very nice resort, with an outstanding staff, beautiful grounds, great food, and a wonderful beach. Here is a breakdown of our stay: - Check-in was very quick. Jonathan was polite and informative. We got our keys and were headed to our room within 10 minutes of arriving at the resort. - Room: Very good. We had a non-courtyard view which was fine with us since we weren’t in our room very much anyway. Rooms have a sitting area, flat screen TV, mini-bar, and ceiling fan. The AC worked well. The only difference I noticed between the Palace Mexico and Palace Riviera Maya were the bathrooms. The Palace Mexico’s bathroom was much smaller and didn’t have a jetted tub. - Food: I truly believe this is where Riu resorts excel. The buffet was very large and lots of options. We weren’t displeased with any of the options at the buffet whether it is breakfast, lunch, or supper. The a-la-carte restaurants were great. The Japanese restaurant and Krystal were by far our favorites. The steakhouse was nearly as good. The Brazilian was our least favorite. I didn’t mind making reservations for the a-la-carts…I actually enjoyed knowing that I was going to eat at a specific time (no waiting) and at a specific restaurant. - Drinks: Nothing to complain about here. If you want top shelf liquor just ask…If you want more/less liquor in your drink just ask…I was able to get Don Julio anywhere I went. All of the bars were great. My favorites were the beach bar and the pool bar. Johnny, at the pool bar, is outstanding…he was very busy but easily kept up with drink orders and conversation. He took the time to talk with us during a less busy time. I really enjoyed getting to know him and I look forward to seeing him next time we stay. Hector was also great. He knew what and when to bring us drinks when we were on the beach. He’d always stop by and have refills for my bubba mug. Great job guys you made our stay enjoyable and special. - Beach: Amazing! Lots of palms for shade, plenty of loungers, and a large beach with soft white sand. I will caution you to be careful when entering and exiting the ocean. There is a drop-off as you enter the water which can be a little difficult to navigate after a day of beer and margaritas. We found lots of shells on the beach and at the waterline. - Location: Perfect. As a Riu Palace guest you have access to all of the other Riu resorts. The Riu Yucatan is on the south side of the resort, the Riu Tequila is just across the street, and the Riu Playacar and Palace Riviera Maya is just a short walk away. We enjoyed visiting the Tequila which has better nightlife (shows/sports bar/disco) than the Palace Mexico. - Entertainment: Good. We enjoyed the Michael Jackson show and the Grease show. The Mexican show at the Tequila looked enjoyable also, but we arrived as it was just ending so we didn’t get to see too much of it. During the evening they had a band playing in the courtyard which was nice. - Towel Service: This was the only area that I was disappointed. Guests are given a towel card that you exchange for a towel. The problem is the towel hut closes at 6pm and you are only allowed to exchange your towel once during the day. This becomes a problem when it rains. We were on the beach when a hard/short rain began which soaked our towels. We took them back to exchange for dry towels. Then another shower came on which again soaked our towels. They weren’t going to allow us to exchange since we already changed once. I explained that the towels were unusable due to the rain. Eventually they let us exchange once more. Just words of advice…protect your towels and keep them dry. Overall we loved our stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. It’s the type of place that makes their guests feel important and special. The resort met our expectations and we will return. Extras: - Don’t miss La Quinta Avenida. It’s a one of a kind experience. Only a $50 peso cab ride from the Riu. It has a Bourbon Street feel to it, for anyone that’s been to New Orleans. - We used Cancun Transfers for our private transfers to and from the airport. Irma and Milton were great. We would recommend them to anyone needed transfers. - Playacar Plaza is a small shopping area a couple of steps from the resort. It’s a good place to go if you need something. Cheaper than the resort gift shop…wish we would have known that before we went.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure..a joy...will return again...”
Reviews.Author: Laura7818
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review on behalf of my parents who recently went to Playa Del Carmen & stayed at Riu Palace Mexico. As always I like to write about travel experiences whether or not I particularly went there. Here are a few notes/comments about Palace Mexico. 1. Food was fantastic & plentiful 2. The rooms & grounds were incredibly clean 3. The staff & service was the best they had experienced (and they are travelers like myself) 4. There was so much booze available that you didn't know what to do with it 5. Great resort organized activities & not over crowded My parents stated that they would come back to this place in a heartbeat and they had an incredible time. They fell in love with Playa Del Carmen & this RIU property. It comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing All Inclusive for the price.”
Reviews.Author: noelj07
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our 10 day trip to the Riu Palace mexico and we had an incredible time. Our room wasn't too bad ( we were in room 31) and the house-keeping did a great job every day of cleaning the room. The location of the room was pretty central to everything that the hotel had to offer; from the restaurants to the beach, we never had to walk very far. One weird thing about our room was the shower... for the first 7 of our 10 days we never had hot water, it was luke warm at best all the time with the nob all the way on hot. On the 8th day I was taking a shower when my wife tried to wash her face in the sink and all of a sudden the water in the shower went to boiling hot!!!! So apparently, you have to turn the sink on a little bit in order to have hot water for your shower. I don't know why, but it worked for us. I read another review saying that the hot water never came on during their entire trip, so I'm sure the other rooms are the same way. The food was very good all around. They had 4 or 5 different specialty restaurants that were very tasty. My favorite was probably the Brazilian steakhouse! We've been to a lot of different all inclusive's in Mexico and the buffet here was by far the best! (For a buffet). The staff was exceptional with removing plates and filling drinks... I never had an empty glass anywhere I went!!! The beach was simply amazing. I really love that there are palm tree's everywhere for shade and there was always chairs open to layout. The resort has employee's on beach bringing around drinks for you to drink all the time. There was only one afternoon in the 10 days that I was there when I didn't see somebody bringing drinks around. Not bad! The pool area is fair at best and the mixed drinks at the bar needed help. It's not that they didn't have alcohol, but that they lacked flavor. Even all of the mixed drinks at this resort and the Riu Palace Maya (the more expensive one) a couple resorts down, sucked. They just don't know how to make'em I guess. The pool has a weird design and is pretty small. They do offer free scuba diving lessons in the pool though which was pretty fun. The last thing that I really liked was that it didn't have the young party crowd. There was a handful of folks with baby's and such, but for the most part the people their were laid back and fun... not the cancun party scene! Which we really liked. All in all, an amazing resort and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for 1st time all inclusive.”
Reviews.Author: samuelb54
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, the pool is a bit small and shallow, but clean. The beaches were very nice and clean. The food started getting monotonous after about the 4th day, but was overall good. The beds were comfortable, but the room never really got cool enough. The staff was very accommodating and courteous. It was a good value for 1st time users of an all inclusive facility.

Reviews.Title: “WILL SURELY RETURN”
Reviews.Author: MrsSkeval
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Riu Palace Mexico for our honeymoon when our travel agent recommended it. I never write reviews. This is my first one and I had to review this place. IT WAS AMAZING! The service was like no other, the staff was beyond friendly and it was the cleanest place I've stayed. I never had a glass get empty, they cleared my plates within seconds of finishing my meals and the food was DELICIOUS! After going on a cruise a few years ago I was worried about the food and this place is amazing. You can go to different restaurants within the resort or to the buffet which is just as good. The room was beautiful. We have onl y2 complaints- the room service menu was not very good and we didn't sleep well in our bed. We met a couple that was back for the 4th year in a row because they loved it there so much. There is no question that this place is a paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for older crowd.”
Reviews.Author: sugarmag13
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Riu Palace, unfortunately for us we picked a week where it rained most of the time. That of course has no reflection on my hotel review. Check in was a breeze, we arrived and within 15 min. we were in our room. We stayed in room 57 which in my opinion was in a perfect spot. 1/2 way between pools and lobby. The room was clean, nicely sized, and most importantly extemely cool. The A/C was amazing. I even needed a blanket a few nights. We did eat at each specialty restaurant and my opinions are as follows.. Steak House- Very good. I had a rack of lamb that was perfect and my husband had a steak that was also cooked to perfection. Krystal- Our favorite we ate here 2 nights and loved everything we had. Japanese- We do eat Japanese often at home in NY and were pleasantly surprised by how good it was. Brazilian- Both my husband and I did not enjoy this one at all. I do not know it it was the qualtiy of meat, the seasoning, or something else. We have been to other Brazilan places and have enjoyed them, but this was out least favorite and wouldn't go back. Buffet- Was well stocked and good quality. We enjoyed the food and selection. The service was 5 star at all the places. The staff is wonderful and I can't say enough about them. Riu should be proud of their staff. The pools were nice although fairly small compared to other places. The pool bar was in one pool (the noisier ofthe 2) We preferred that quiet one. The bar service was amazing, constant service no matter where you were sitting. Both pools was clean and well maintained. The beach was HUGE! There were plenty of chairs even though the hotel was quite full. It was absolutely beautiful. Our favorite bar was in the lobby, I feel the best drinks were made there. I had a massage at the spa that was average. The crowd was older and there is really nothing for kids or people who are looking for a place to party wild. The shows at night were OK, a bit boring in my opinion. We have stayed at other Riu's and are always happy. This was no exception. Everything was wonderful(except the weather lol)and we would definitely go back and recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: rdsmith17
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my one week stay at the Riu Palace Mexico, everything was perfect. All of the staff were lovely and worked so hard to make sure that you were ok. I was very impressed that the pool bar staff came round the poolside with drinks, they all had smiles even though they were roasting hot in the sun! Jaime from the buffet restaurant deserves a special mention as he was the perfect waiter! All food was amazing-cannot fault it at all. The room was perfect and cleaned everyday. the staff came around at night asking if you would like any fresh towels which was nice. I did notice that this hotel does not have many children so I would go to one of the other Riu hotels in the resort such as the Tequilla. If you fancy a late night I would go to Coco Bongos. Cost $50 from the rep but well worth the money. It is an amazing show combining tribute acts (music and film) with acrobatics where the actors perform in the air. You also receive unlimited drinks throughout the night. I would love to return to this hotel but one week was definately not long enough!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: niclouemmScotland
Reviews.Content: This is a true review no complaints,lovely Hotel, staff very friendly ,food great & drink, rooms very spacious & very clean, all around hotel clean,reception area lovely. Shows are quite good at night time to,best we have had at a hotel actually,Michael Jackson show good & Grease show. Animation team good fun,go to Coco Bongos with Chris from animation team, great night out & he really looks after you, we had great night for our friends 50th birthday,great show & your barman keeps the drinks coming.Went on Fat Cat Catamaran trip, good day had by all. Beach is lovely & clean, sea great, we got lovely big shells & brought them home.Walks both ways along beach nice.Taxis into Playa Del Carmen only 5$, you can walk but was to hot to walk. Taxi men friendly, go to 5th Avenue for shops, lot of the same but ok.Little shopping mall 5 mins walk from hotel but cheaper at 5th Avenue.You can get a sunbed by the pool anytime of teh day,pool staff good & come round all day long to bring you drinks,bar staff at teh other bars very nice,you don't have an empty glass for very long, the waiters really look after you,restaurants good, Japanese lovely & use chop sticks, good fun & it's easy, main buffet restaurant very good, you will find something nice every night,lots of choices. We had great day fro friends 50th,champagne lunch & he got a cake & the waiters all sang, we done up teh table before hand & waiters helped, so frindly was lovely.Will def go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort...Great Food, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSlim
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very impressed with the Riu Palace Mexico. We stopped in to the Riu Palace Riveria Maya just up the street, and while that is a sililar but newer hotel...the service at this place can't be beat. One of the other reviewers said that the staff seemed to be very proud of their hotel. That sums it up best. Most everyone from the landscaping crew to the hosts and hostesses in the dining area were very accomodating and friendly. I had one bad experience in the La Bodega restaurant where I asked for a vodka and tonic to drink and the waitress gave me a dirty look because she apparently had to walk out of the restaurant to get the drink. She grudgingly got it, but it was an awkward moment in an otherwise great stay. I wish I would have gotten her name. The front desk folks were very helpful and welcoming. The doorman seemed very proud of his hotel. The food was incredible. I did not find one single piece of produce that was not fresh and perfectly ripe in the buffet restaurant. They had a nice variety, and again...the service was absoloutely outstanding. One night they had sushi. Another night, they had a Mexican theme. Their red snapper and salmon dishes were about the best I have ever had. I was eyeing up a dish when one of the chef's came up to me and said "you've got to try this...it's really good". The hotel was immaculately clean. I even saw them cleaning the railing baulsters regularly. Anybody do that at their own house? The grounds were impeccably landscaped. The room was fine and adequately sized, although not lavish. The furniture was decent. The AC worked well. The tap water was not potable. It did seem to leave a bit of a film after your shower, but we dealt with it. We had no issues with ambient noise. Everything was pretty quiet. The nightly entertainment was decent, but I didn't go there for a stage show. If you stay in one of the two "palaces" , you can do anything at the other Riu hotels in the area except eat dinner. This is a nice feature because it gives you more room to roam while not straying far from food, drink or a place to sit and relax. The hotel is in the Playacar area of Playa Del Carmen, which is a gated community with security at each end of the road running through it. We took a quick cab ride from Playacar to the town of Playa Del Carmen, and it was like going from peace and tranquility to chaos...but friendly chaos. I felt very safe throughout my stay. If I have the chance, I would definitely stay here again and recommend the place to a friend. If I do go back, I would pick a different time of year than late June/early July. The weather was hotter than hot, and very humid. We are experiencing a heatwave in the Northeastern US this week, but I laugh when people say it is hot here. I just about melted every time I left the AC. Even the pool water at the hotel was pretty darn warm. This is a great place for a family to stay. Try it, you'll like it.

Reviews.Title: “The beach is back!”
Reviews.Author: JuanCanalaga
Reviews.Content: It's been 3 years since I stayed at the Riu Palace,Mexico mainly due to the fact that, thanks to some rogue weather systems and natures force, the magnificent beach there had eroded. Now, thanks to considerable effort, and no doubt money, by the authorities, I am glad to report that the beach has been restored to its' former glory. The Hotel too has retained its splendour with a lot of the staff still there from my last visit. In fact, if anything, I would say its better than its ever been. I won't bore you with the details of all the restaurants, suffice to say that the food is still excellent, with may varied choices and willing chefs only too happy to rustle you up a plain steak if that's your desire. Take my word for it, if you want a top quality beach based Hotel the Riu Palace Mexico is hard to beat. Believe me, I've tried.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: cardinal
Reviews.Content: It took a while to write this, but here goes. Before I get to anything negative, let me start out by saying that the service at this property was EXCELLENT! This was our third trip to the Riviera Maya and our second visit to a Riu property. We stayed at the Yucatan the last time we were there and found it to be crowded. This palace was nice, but be warned that for the most part there is really nothing going on, especially at night. The main problem we had here was the pool. Besides being small, there is no easy way to get in the pool-unless you jump. There are no steps or ramps that make it easy to get in or out. The beach area is fine and that's where I spent most of my time. The hammocks that they have on the beach is a nice touch. The beach has been renovated, so now it is wide and smooth, just look out for a small drop off. The food was good, but we never ate at any of the specialty restaurants. We have found that since the same cooks are making the food there, were better off just eating in the buffet. As usual, the drinks were fine. I always ask for something premium, so there is never a problem. Be warned you Americans, they only provide Dos Equis beer. I used the gym that they had there and it was small but adequate and we visited all the other properties, just to hang out someplace different and found that theirs not much difference. We went into Playa Del Carmen a few days, again, just to do something different. Since we have been here many times it was still the same. Remember, always haggle over anything you buy! Never pay the first asking price. In conclusion, my wife and I did have stomach issues the last couple of days, but we found out that quite a few other people had the same problems. The Riu Palace is a nice place and not that much different form the other Palace. As I stated earlier, the service was excellent and we did show a lot of the staff how much we appreciated them-via tips. If you do visit, just consider the pool and nightlife, but if your going there to relax, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Great Resort!”
Reviews.Author: freddyde
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico for 1 week on June 5 and it was great. From the moment we stepped off the plane and approached our Sunquest rep who guided us to the correct bus to transfer us to the resort, the check-in process went very quickly, everything was perfect. The beach and the pool areas are top-notch. The food was very, very good especially in the steak house and the Brazilian. It really helped that the weather was perfect, 90's every day with sunshine. The rooms are very well appointed and very clean. We had a room on the 3rd floor with a huge balcony that overlooked the courtyard. We could watch the evening stage shows from our balcony. Liquor dispensers in each room with 4 different liquors and beer and soft drinks in the stocked fridge was very convenient. The hotel lobby is absolutely beautiful with very high ceilings and very nicely decorated. The staff was excellent in every aspect. The only negative thing we can come up with is the musty smell in the rooms. Comes with the territory in being in such a humid area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the over 30 crowd”
Reviews.Author: jesse_50
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at the Riu Palace. Originally, after weeks of reading reviews of the top choices in Playa we planned on the Royal. It got sold out. We then sighted in on the Riu Palace Riveira Maya and once again it sold out. We quickly reviewed the Riu Palace Mexico and pulled the trigger on a Jr. Suite Courtyard. We traveled with a couple that got the regular Jr. Suite. We got a view of the courtyard for $200 more, they got a pretty nice view of tennis courts and trees. I would not have minded it at all. I read reviews about the front desk being unhelpful. This was so far from my experience. Jonathan was very nice and helpful, getting us rooms close together and moving us to the 3rd floor. Very friendly throughout the trip. I think the key is being friendly to them and giving mutual respect. They will do anything for you if you ask with a smile. When you demand, I can imagine things can turn sour. The room was nice. It was very clean and we had plenty of room. The beds are doubles pushed together. I discovered the water in the sink and bathtub is salty which leads me to believe its filtered sea water so of course it is undrinkable. They supply you with large bottles of water so you can brush your teeth and drink good water. I would have preferred fresh water from my showers but it wasn't a deal breaker. I heard the Riviera Maya is similar. The hotel is not designed for ocean view. You will likely not get one unless you go full suite. This is the ONLY reason we will probably try another hotel next time. both rooms would get ice cold if you wanted it that way. No issues with the A/C at all. Ours was 2065. You had your choice of Brandy, Jose Cuervo Gold, Vodka and Bacardi Rum in your room bar. Room service was very good and fast! Food- We did Krystals and Myagi. They had a birthday cake waiting for me for dessert at Krystals. That was a nice touch. The food was pretty good. We all had 4 different entrees. The salmon was the best choice. The filet was okay but just okay. The appetizers were nothing to write home about and the watermelon, basil, tomato foam was awful. Myagi was a disappointment as I am a big Japanese food fan, having lived abroad for several years in the far east. Can't recommend it. The main buffet was very good with a lot of choices. We figured out that it was better than the theme resturaunts and stopped making reservations for them. The beach was phenominal. You can actually tell when you cross property lines while walking the beach because they actually sift the sand in front of the resort to remove shells. It is virtually like walking on cotton. The water was 4 shades of blue and beautiful. There was no problem finding chairs at any time of day. Talking to some people who stayed at the Riveira Mayan, and were visiting our property, ours was more relaxing, fewer college kids and plenty of room. The service at the hotel was unbelievable. Always a smile, tipping or no tipping, they treated us like royalty. My friend got sick one night. We asked about chicken soup. They didnt have any but quickly offered to make some and bring it to him in the room. They all asked about him all evening long. I recommend buying or bringing your own insulated mug as the glasses they serve drinks in at the bars are very small. They will fill whatever you give them up to the top, no problem. We figured this out on our 3rd day. Entertainment at night was lame. We watched anyway. The Michael Jackson show as probably their best show but even then, the stage was not much bigger than an elementary school auditorium stage. Not much room for the dancers to move around on. I would say they don't put a lot of effort in their entertainment, relying on the beach and other attractions to carry the weight. We did the lobster dinner cruise from the El Dorado Marona (?) and it was amazing! The first part, with the catamaran ride along the coast was okay but when we got back to the beach around sun set, they had our own private dining table, seperated from everyone by white cloth, right on the beach. They served us drinks, and a truly amazing dinner while a saxaphone player played romantic music for us. Highly recommend it. Overall, while you can find a more updated hotel, you won't find a better beach, better service, friendlier staff and a cleaner resort. We all had a great, relaxing time and though we will explore a different resort option to get ocean view, would recommend this to friends and family. By the way, the gym was usually empty, but had enough new looking equipment that you can get a decent workout if you want to.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: lock8527
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for his birthday. It was so nice and clean. Also the beach is so perfect. Very hot and humid waiter staff was the best new what we were drinking everyday when ever they saw us sitting by the pool or even in lobby would bring us our drinks. Staff was great. Food was good also we loved the buffet. Men do have to wear pants to dinner no shorts. Also we had a problem when we checked in there was water leaking from upstairs, we called with in a min. they upgraded our room free no questions asked.Very safe to walk to around town taxi cab drivers were great we went to 5th ave 5 dollar ride. Took cab to cuba pyrmid $120 the taxi cab stayed with us showed us stuff it was great. Great trip and staying at a RIU Palace you can use all the riu that are there. We can not wait to go back. Oh dont buy anything in gift shop must cheaper at the store within a 5 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: lindseykaye06
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I went to stay at the Rui Palace Mexico for 4 nights and days and had a fantastic experience. The room was rather large and very clean. The staff is so accomidating and friendly. Food was good, not great, but still very yummy! Drinks are a little on the week side, but there was a decent variety of brands. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. There were a small number of children, but mostly couples and families. I would go back during another month when it wasn't so hot. We took a 5 dollar cab ride to Playa's 5th avenue for shopping - very close! We also took an ATV tour of the jungle and went swimming in a cenote - AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not recommended for honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Lili-Mayflower
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week in this resort for our honeymoon. Overall we really enjoyed our stay in this Riu. The service was very good. The property and grounds are very clean and very well maintained. The beach is very nice too. There were no palapas, but lots of shade from the palm trees. The restaurants are very good too, even in the main buffet there was always lots of good food to eat. There was even a chocolate fountain every night. We always got a great service at all restaurants and bars. No line ups, no waiting. The rooms are kept very clean. I agree with the majority of the positive reviews here, this is a great hotel. We had several activities and excursions. We went to Chitchen Itza -it was great and worth 2.5 hours ride one way. We also went to Xplor for the whole day. It was just amazing (if you are in your 20-40), I highly recommend this place. It is very well organized, safe and very well thought out. I was impressed, very "user-friendly"! We also went to Dolphinaris [---] to swim with dolphins. This was also great! Now the negative. Overall, we had a great vacation, however I do not think I would recommend this hotel to honeymooners. The purpose of our trip was our honeymoon, we got married two weeks ago and have chosen Riu to stay at because we wanted more luxury and better service. Our travel agent requested upgrades for our honeymoon. Upon arrival I presented our marriage certificate and we were told that we are given a free upgrade, however it turned out to be a regular room with two twin beds pushed together. I went back to reception to ask them what exactly did they upgrade and was told that we have the room facing towards the courtyard and not the exterior of the hotel. The view was nice, but that was about it. And on top of that the was a very strong mould smell, like if that room was not used for a long time. This is my 10th trip to an all-inclusive South destination and I have never smelled such a strong (I mean really strong, I do not over exaggerate!) moisture odor, not even in the 3 stars hotel! There is a review here that mention the same, I did not really believed until I experienced it myself. The only other special treatment that we got was a plate of fruits in our room on our 3rd day. There was two apples, one banana and some grapes. This was it! Maybe it was just our luck, and maybe other people get more for there special occasions (I have seen a guest that was given a huge cake at the restaurant because it was his birthday), but I felt that my honeymoon was neglected and no one really cared much, we were treated like anyone else, even though a honeymoon is once in a lifetime experience, even if people do re-marry sometimes, I do not think it is as magical the second time. I feel happy for those that got VIP treatment for their special occasions, but I do warn you, it is not guarantied! Actually, we met a couple on the plane, that got married the same day as us and they went to another resort in Riviera Maya and got much more for their honeymoon than us!

Reviews.Title: “Our best Riu Hotels holiday to date.”
Reviews.Author: Ge0rgeFrederic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico for 14 nights from 11th May 2010. We would like to express our sincere thanks to Maria, the Hotel Director, to Laura, Katy and Ernesta of the reception desk staff and to all the Hotel staff for making this holiday our best Riu Hotels holiday to date. In our opinion, this hotel is a model for how a hotel should be run. Hows this for a welcome service? The scent of a huge bouquet of fresh flowers in our room greeted us when we entered after checking in, and shortly after, a waiter brought to our room a plate full of delicious strawberrys coated in chocolate specially prepared by one of the Chefs. Our Room. We were given one of the best suites in the hotel, with a beautiful view from the balcony overlooking the pool area, beach and the ocean. Everything in the room functioned perfectly from the quiet air conditioning and ceiling fan to the 32" widescreen LCD TV. The room service was impeccable. Towels changed daily, rooms cleaned promptly and thoroughly (thank you Cristobal) and even a turn down service to tidy our beds whilst we were having Dinner. Although we never availed ourselves of it, there is room service to eat in your room if you desire. Every day we returned to our room we would find intricate displays of towel art and bed decoration crafted by Cristobal. The room safe was a digital safe, very easy to operate and of a size to fit a standard Lap-Top PC. The mini bar was restocked every two days. Drinking water is made available in two sizes of bottle. Small 750cc bottles handy for taking out on trips and larger 1.5 litre bottles for keeping in the fridge. The optics in the room dispense branded liquors and not local brands, ie Smirnoff Vodka and Bacardi Rum. The hotel public areas look really "classy" with magnificent crystal chandeliers in the foyer. The grounds are truly beautiful, having an avenue of tall mature coconut palm trees flanking a series of fountain sprinkled pools leading down to the pool area. A real pleasure to walk along in the early morning sunshine on our way to the breakfast buffet. The food for all meals was very good with lots of variety in the Buffet Restaurant. The speciality resaurants also served very good food but the choice of dishes was limited to about three or four options for the main dinner course. The Krystal Restaurant is the most popular and was our favourite closely followed by the Steak House by the beach. We did not eat in the Japanese Restaurant as we do not like sea food. Again how's this for service? Carlos, the manager of the Steak House would arrange for me to have two steaks when I declined the "Surf" sea food option for my "Surf and Turf". He also sent out to one of the other restaurants for a specially made up fruit dessert dish for my wife after she declined those on offer on the menu. Booking for the speciality restaurants is simple. There is a member of staff available to take your booking in the theatre, which we did before breakfast. Dinner times are 6.30 and 8.30 pm. The popular Krystal restaurant gets fully booked very quickly. The pool area is prettily landscaped with lots of trees and bushes. The pool is in two semi circles, being split by the footpath leading to the beach.
