Sometimes we struggled to find vacant sun loungers beside a parasol as selfish people would get up at the crack of dawn and reserve them with their towels and then do the same with sun loungers on the beach. The pool is clean and the water warm (warm by UK standards) The beach has been restored and is now a beautiful wide white soft sandy beach. Please note that the sea is quite rough for swimming. Additional palm trees have been planted on the beach but they offer no shade as they have not branched out yet. There are no parasols on the beach and the shady parts under the trees soon get taken. You won't go thirsty on the beach or beside the pool as there is a waiter service to order and bring you drinks. There is a Childrens Club with a dedicated childrens play area, amusements and childrens pool. There is also a fitness suite close to the dive and watersports centre on the beach. The entertainment we found was of a higher standard than that provided at the Riu Club Hotels, the adjacent Riu's Tequila and Yucatan. We loved the dance themed shows such as the Mexican Show with the ladies in lovely coloured Mexican dresses, also the Mariachi musicians show. The musicians were first rate. Would we go back to the Riu Palace Mexico? Yes without a doubt. We intend to book a holiday for the same time next year. Would we recommend this hotel? Yes without a doubt. Our son and his fiancee are going to the Riu Palace Mexico in September 2010 on our recommendation and, having seen our photographs, our next door neighbours daughter has booked her wedding at the Riu Palace Mexico for June next year. O'h that reminds me. There is a beautiful traditional church like wedding chapel in the Foyer area if couples do not want a beach or a hotel grounds wedding. It would also be useful for a wedding on a rainy day. The town of Playa Del Carmen is only a $5.00 taxi ride away. It's too far to walk in the hot sun for we older folk. There are lots of shops and some restaurants / bars in the 5th Avenue shopping street. You can also get the ferry to Cozumel from the 5th avenue pier for a pleasant boat ride for about $25.00 return. If you want a trip into Cancun, there are frequent very cheap buses to Cancun from the 5th avenue bus station. We did this and had a day out to the Riu Palace Las Americas and the Riu Caribe where the Manager very kindly let us choose our own room for our next holiday. Shortly after this review is published we will be back in Mexico for two weeks at the Riu Caribe. We love Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “The standard of customer service in this hotel is first class”
Reviews.Author: IJDW
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel three times since it opened.Constant work to maintain the rooms/beach/restaurants etc. help keep standards high.Its air-con reception and lobby bar area is a real bonus .Book a room in the courtyard area for great views of gardens and their many fountains.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility RIU Beach W/Palm Trees Shade”
Reviews.Author: gammaprincess
Reviews.Content: May 29th - June 5th - As usual most of the resorts I've stayed at have to "grow on me" I was concerned with no Palapas. I am a "beach bum" literally as I have traveled to Cancun/Riveria Maya for over 20 + years now. I've done all the excursions long time ago, now I can relax at the resorts and enjoy the relaxation of a well deserved vacation. The beach is literally beautiful and for this is why I select Cancun. I was there in 2009 in March- Iberostar Tucan and October- Iberostar Quetzal, and will return to Iberostar Q, in September 2010 (booked already beginning of this year) The beach water no longer has the beached whales/huge black bags of sand in the ocean, this was from about five years ago from Hurricane Wilma. They renovated the beach in early January 2010, after I left in October. RIU had an awesome beach before the renovation but some of the resorts literally had no beach, with the ocean directly hitting the walls of the hotels. Like Occidental and Royal Hideaway. Today all the way into town to the Nightclub Blue Parrot has a huge beach front now, great! You can have your pick on the beach/sand of your choice under any Palm Tree at the RIU Mexico. With the exception of closer to the water the Palm Trees are very small with no shade. They were tied up (palm trees) to grow. I was there every a.m. and saw the crew cut the dried palms away, which were holding in place the new palms - and the Trees blossomed-opened up. But they still are small. Further back is where I stayed daily. The water is simply paradise deep shades of the most beautiful blue water ever. In all my years I have never seen so many sea shells. Conche shells were washing ashore every day, I never saw this. Those are the huge shells, and a lot of small shells. Since they renovated the beach, the ocean now has a lot of small rocks upon entering into it. So be careful with your feet, nothing to big, but you can hurt yourself. Use Caution. The last three days the ocean was really rough. High waves and the water will take pull you out and sideways and take your suit off. Watch for the red flags. The resort is quiet, not your resort for nightlife. I liked it for this. Along with seeing the same people was a +. The rooms are typical rooms with a sofa and thank goodness a dresser for clothes. A fridge with soda, water, and beer and the wall dispenser in all RIU's of liquor. You can not see the ocean from any single room, so no need to upgrade to any "ocean front room" at all. A + if it rains you can access the lobby through the buildings which are connected, no need to get wet, but the rooms have umbrellas. You have to make reservations (I don't like doing this everyday) to eat at the theme restaurants. 8:15am they hand out a number and @ 8:30 they begin to give out a piece of paper with a confirmation to dinner. It seemed as there was no problem arriving after the above times. They have Brazilian, Steak House, French, and Japanese. It was all good. The main bar is open from 10:00am til 7:00am which is located upon entering into the resort. Huge beautiful chandeliers. You can visit directly next door to the "Yucatan" and across the street to the "Tequila" and on the beach down a little way to the "Playacar" and the other "RIU Riveria Maya Palace" Only the palace's can visit all of the above - the other resorts guest can not come to the Palace's. The "Tequila" has a sports bar with over 155 channels to watch any sports event. I was there over three nights watching the Champions "Black Hawks" Hockey - Chicago! This place is very loud with a lot , a lot of teenagers, kids. The whole resort of "Tequila" is so over crowded with to many people and so is the "Yucatan". "Tequila" does not have a beach, they have to come across the street to the RIU Palace Mexico directly next door to sunbath. A golf cart brings them over and back. The weather is so very hot! Hot! If you go to the Ruins think twice about going. You have to take water and mosquito spray. Away from the ocean is extremely hot, no relief. The swimming pool is very nice with tiled flowers on the bottom. The water is hot, not cool at all. The coffee is no good, they have a Starbucks directly across the street. It is safe to go to Cancun, town is not far away at all, a cab ride is $5.00 each way. I had a massage in the spa. Most other resorts the massage therapist come around and try to sell, not this resort. As a matter of fact the girls at the front desk at the spa are not friendly, as I went in there three times before I booked. I even went to another resort to inquire as I didn't fell comfortable at the RIU spa. But no one was around at the other resort, so I wound up at the RIU. One last note please TIP these very very hard workers. They work very very hard, it is a very hot climate they have to wear jackets and long pants. You can see the sweat falling from their faces. This breaks my heart, I always tip them, everyone. Go to the bank and take single dollars with you to pass out. You will see a very huge smile from the employees. I did not get to know any of the employees as I usually do. It did not seem as the employees at this resort were so happy, not all but some. Not bad at all and I would go back and recommend this hotel. Take a taxi to Walmart $5.00 to buy all your souvenirs, I do every time it beats trying to get a good price from the vendors in town

Reviews.Title: “Perfection to the MAX! BEST WEEK OF MY LIFE!”
Reviews.Author: vanessathetravelgal
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister travlelled to the riu palace may8-16, i couldnt have been more satisfied! Ariving at the hotel i was overwelmed with how beutiful the lobby was. when we went to the check in desk they greeted us with a welcome cocktail! that was a great first impression!! the check in was very quick! ( For those wondering the ride from the airport to the hotel was aproximatly an hour long, and it was really easy to find our suquest bus, signs everywhere!) Our room was on the 2nd floor ( hotel has 3 floors). Entering our room it was very fresh and clean, our room was not ocean view but was garden view and we had our own private balcony to chill out after long days. On our 1st night we went to Don Julian Buffet and it was very impressive, great variety, high quality dinning. There is so much to pick from its even hard to start!! Service at the hotel was amazing, ive never seen such good costumer service and i work with costumer service soo i would definetly know!! At the buffet theyre is a outside dinning area and inside. We sat outside in the same spot everyday, our server was absolutly spectacular, his name is IGNACIO. After dinner there was entertainment, live music , Circus night, Micheal Jackson night, Movie night, Mariachi Show, Tropical show etc. All shows were GREAT! Christian a young guy in the entertainment was absolutley hilarious!!! The pool area was great aswell, awesome pool bar, many activities in the pool aswell, i really recommend the scuba diving lessons , its in the pool but its alot of fun, made me want to take the scuba diving lessons! The beach was absolutley breathtaking, amazing blue water, white sand, simply amazing!! Service at the beach was awesome too, you just lay back and relax and they bring you drinks! The hotel restaurants: Krystal was okay, im not into fine dining but i cant say it was bad, i still perfer the buffet soo i went there after! Brazilian Steak House: Meat was delicious, however its more of a place to taste diffrent meats, i also went to the buffet afterwards! I did not go to the japanise restaurant. For those of you who do not know, when you book at any palace you can go to any sister hotels. We had access to the Riu Palace riveria maya, Riu tequila, Riu Yucatan,Riu Lupita and Riu Playacar. I stopped by all of them except the riu lupita. They are all nice, i really liked the riu tequila, great night time entertainment and theres a disco there at night for those of you who like dancing. 5th avenue is a $5 cab from the hotel, a 20min walk, its nice to walk during the day, great view walking there. its a must, soo much to see there, everything is very cheap and you can bargain! Overall i was 100% satisfied. Im 19 and my sister is 22, this hotel has alot of families and older people soo if you are looking to party the other rius are more Party hotels, If your looking for a calm relaxing vacation definetly the riu palace mexico is exactly what you need.

Reviews.Title: “even better than last time”
Reviews.Author: billy1888
Reviews.Content: four years since last holiday at the palace and it is even better. since our last visit the beach has repaired itself following hurricane damage. as we have been to this hotel and playcar many times before this was 14 days of chill out on the beach.if you are looking for a 5 star hotel with great food & staff book the palace.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time and will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: debbydibdabs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from 15th to 29th May. We travelled with Thomson Holidays and were met by our travel rep at the airport. He took us straight to our air-conditioned coach and we waited for a few other people and were off on the hour transfer down to Playacar. The transfer rep had cold Corona's and soft drinks for sale on the coach, which was very refreshing and quite reasonable in price. We did hear of some people on other coaches assuming it was free because they had booked an all inclusive Holiday….. if some people had half a brain they would be dangerous!! Check in at reception was fast, efficient and easy with Guillermo. Once in our room we found it had a courtyard and side pool view. Great location, as it was closer to the beach and pool rather than reception and the lobby. The room as in most palace hotels had two double beds pushed together and looks exactly like the one in the Thomson Brochure. There was a sunken seating area with flat screen TV with satellite channels. You can't see the sea from any of the rooms due to the palm trees between the hotel and the sea. Our maid was fantastic and the beds were made with clean sheets every day. There were always plenty of drinks left in our fridge daily and any of the spirits changed should they be running low. The beach, now it has been restored again is back to pre-hurricane is amazing. Really nice blue waters and white sand. There are palm trees everywhere should you want a little shade and plenty of sun loungers. There are 2 restaurants within moments of the beach for lunch if you don’t fancy a walk to the main restaurant. Alternatively you can also use the snack bar for the beach club (RIU Tequila) or the RIU Yucatan. The beach was really clean and there is beach bar under the palm trees. It wasn't too crowded on the beach, but we were out there in lower season. There were 2 Pools. One with the swim up bar. This is where the water activities take place and the other pool, across from the seating area which was a lot quieter. This is though a Palace hotel so the activities are a lot more low key than in the Club Hotels next door. I can't say enough about how good the food was, with a great selection on offer in the buffet restaurant that varied every evening at every meal. We went to each of the themed restaurants. Krystal was our favourite again here and we least liked the La Bodega, the meats were calved table side and were rather pink without the option to have them cooked how you would want them! The evening entertainment here is probably some of the best quality we have seen in any of our stays in RIU and RIU Palaces. The dancers are amazing pulling off their sometimes complicated choreography perfectly. The service in the hotel was outstanding. All the staff were so friendly and they all spoke very good English. We never waited long for a drink or our food. Tipping is certainly not expected in the hotel, but we did tip for our waiters and our maid and mini bar man. Our maid $1 a day, the mini bar man the same and the waiters between $5&10 at the end of the 2 weeks depending on how often they had served us. We never felt that service would have been different tipping or not. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely return in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “LETTER TO THE RIU MGMT. SPAIN. & OTHERS”
Reviews.Author: baglady
Reviews.Content: I am writing this on Trip Advisor as when it comes to the reviews the RIU head office does not acknowledge or really read the reports but I KNOW THEY READ THIS SITE. First and foremost I like the Riu chain and will more than likely return. We were there for under two weeks and we stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico but have stayed at MANY other Riu’s including this resort many times. In talking with other repeat guests we have come to the conclusion that the management in Spain are more concerned about the new and grand openings of their New Babies they forgot about the other children. What about “WE” the traveller that likes the older ones why are we penalized because we don’t want to get on the band wagon following the new Riu’s Things that are going wrong with older Riu’s are, the moisture leaking through the floors and when you go to bed these beds are extremely damp and you have to put the big blue blanket down to keep the moisture from coming through to your body, so uncomfortable, ( I would compare it to sleeping in a leaky camping tent when it rains) not to mention the plastic mattress protector that causes sweating. We wanted to tear the bed apart. At this point I am extremely worried about the mould. The Riu rule is do not turn the air conditioners on till the guests are due to arrive. Therefore while the room is empty the moisture grows and so does the mould. There is no ventilation in bathrooms and in the shower you can see the white grout on the walls growing black mould. The backing of the mirror is damaged from the moisture. The sinks are chipped and marked, with the taps pitting. Around the toilets and behind are never cleaned properly all the time we were there. The mirrors are wiped down and all streaky with a soap film and you can’t even see properly, ever heard of Windex?? Another complaint from a guest was in the suite the little couch had plastic in it and the moisture from the room was absorbed by the fabric of the couch and therefore after sitting there a bit you realize the couch is wet!!!! Because the mould is so bad the clothes in the drawers and closets smell far worse than they ever have. Wouldn’t if make more sense to run the air conditioners on low continually and ventilate the bathrooms instead of having to replace tile and fixtures. Money wise I believe it is a cost saving enterprise, that is what we do in our homes. Next if you don’t want to clean /bleach the grout in the floor tiles use coloured grout then the dirt will not be noticeable. Also when putting down these floors there is a sealant that can be used over it. Doors leading to the buildings are broken and remained broken throughout our visit. The walkway tiles are chipped broken and cracked. With ice machines it like a game of wonder which one will be working today?????? Food, very disappointed in the lunch restaurant by the pool. It was the same every day. To get any meat well it just wasn’t there except for hot dogs, hamburgers, or chopped up beef or chicken to make fajitas and then it was just left of meat from the dinner before. I have never seen a Palace lunch so pathetic. You pay more to stay there but you are better off paying less eating better at the other resorts. The Yucatan’s on going sewer problem is like the oil spill in the gulf, nothing is working to fix it. The lunch restaurant reeks from the smell coming from the washrooms and septic tanks. Pools, slop job on the painting, there should be inspectors that get in the pool themselves and have a look under the edge it is black and gross. The paint is splattered on the blue tiles and they too have mould in the grout, a brush would get rid of that. My advice to the Riu people if you don’t want to lose more clients to the Iberostars start taking care of what you got properly instead of seeing how many more place you can open. Pretty soon you will tick off your faithful and they won’t even go to the new ones. Maybe it’s the new young fresh management in Spain that you are putting too much faith in what happened to old school. In closing I want to say that the management and employees at the resorts are outstanding, we could not be happier with the way they treat us. They have to listen to all the complaints and handle it with dignity and I know it must be hard for them, their hands are tied. They can’t go and repair tiles or change orders sent down by Spain. Take these executive people and secretly send some to each Riu in Mexico for a week in one room to sleep, bath, then to use all other facilities and report back. It is not the staff it IS THE FACILITIES. If you want to run a low budget resort cut your prices because your resorts are becoming budget calibre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: michelleandandy11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks in mid May and had a great time! We were apprehensive before travelling, having read a number of negative reviews on here, but throughout our stay we came to realise just how unfounded these negative reviews were. The rooms are a good size with a separate living area and balcony. In some rooms there is a slight musty smell but no worse than in other resorts by the sea in hot countries. We had a courtyard-facing room which was great, the view of the fountains was beautiful, would definately recommend one of these rooms. The beds were huge and we didn't find them hard at all. The rooms were cleaned daily and then there was a turn down and mini-bar filling service each day too. One pointer would be to put the 'do not disturb' sign on your door in the evening and keep it there until you want to get up - the cleaners have a habit of going into your room very early otherwise! The food was great, all buffets had a good choice and speciality restaurants were lovely. Our favourite was the Japanese one but others in our group preferred the Fusion and the Steak House. Drinks were unlimited wherever you went which was great - with your glass being re-filled whenever it was half empty. The beach was stunning, plenty of loungers in either shaded or sunny areas and beautiful turquoise sea. People from the bar come round all the time with a tray of iced cocktails, beer and soft drinks. They came around so often that we found we were refusing 2 or 3 drinks in a row! This was the same by the pool - which was also lovely We got married in the kiosk by the fountains at the resort and everything went very smoothly. We had a meeting with our wedding co-ordinator the day after we arrived and sorted out all details then, and everything on the day was exactly as we wanted it to be. We had a brilliant time and it was so much simpler than trying to organise something similar in the UK We went on 2 trips while we were there - to Akumel and Xcaret. Akumel was great value for money and well worth doing, a taxi costs around 300 pesos and then for 25 USD you can get a boat snorkelling trip and equipment hire. We saw 6 or 7 giant turtles which was amazing, and some rays too. Xcaret wasn't such good value for money at 69 USD, but was still well worth a visit as there is so much to see.

Reviews.Title: “just beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: laceysu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico after one fantastic week. We just loved it! It was our first time in Mexico, and our first time at an all inclusive resort. I think the resort was a perfect pick for us. We are in our early 50's, no kids. The Riu Palace lived up to all the internet descriptions and pictures.The food was great and plentiful, fresh blended fruit smoothies in the morning, all different blends, pineapple, papaya, melon, etc. An omelette station , bacon , eggs anyway you want it, beautiful fresh breads to name just a few items on the buffet. The dinner buffet was just as fabulous, and they changed the theme nightly. We also tried two speciality restraurants, and was also very pleased. They had shows at night and if we felt like a stroll, we would walk across the street to the Riu Tequilla to see what was happening. There was always something interesting going on. The pool is so pretty, the beach is soft clean white sand with gorgeous turquoise blue water.The resort is spotless, all the staff work so hard to make your experience so nice. Everyone was friendly and polite, it was great feeling so pampered. It was also nice to be able to go visit the other Riu's, Yukatan, Playacar, and Riviera Maya, they are also fantastic. I would return tomorrow if I could! You have no worries staying at the Riu palace, everything has been figured out for you. Don't hesitate to go.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LaurAnn23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort last year for vacation and we absolutely loved it. I wanted to write a review and never got around to it. But after staying at a comparably priced resort in Cancun this year that we hated, I figured I should give this awesome resort proper credit. The service is excellent, the rooms are great, the food is great with a great variety, the pool and beach are both awesome with plenty of chairs and umbrellas, and there is fun entertainment every night. The only thing that's kind of annoying is the reservation process for dinner. Loved the mimosas at breakfast too! =) Also, the location is great because you're in a gated community full of other resorts and condos, etc. We were able to walk to some other Rius along the street or along the beach and enjoy some lunch and drinks as well. I highly recommend it and we will be going back there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: StingrayzWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a one week stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. FANTASTIC!! We were able to check into our room right away after great service from the front desk. We had a gardenview room. We had two beds that were pushed together but made up as one bed. It was great! It was like being together yet having great space to sleep. The beds weren't that hard as some people have noted. I have a plush pillowtop bed at home and did not find the bed uncomfortable at all. Pillows were wonderful too! The cleaning staff are very hard working so we tipped him the day before we left. He always had our bed decorated with flower petals and was a nice touch. The beach is HUGE! Tons of loungers but not much shade on the beach. The beach is very well taken care of. There is a large area that has palm trees all over with loungers so you can enjoy the sand while having some shade. There is also an area with about 5 hammocks which is a nice place to relax too. There are two pool areas. One is the activity pool with the swim up bar and the other is a quieter area. Both with loungers and umbrellas. We never had a problem finding any spots to relax. There are no decending stairs to get into the pool, only ladders. There really isn't anywhere to sit or lay back in the pool on the quiet side. The activity pool has a ledge aroun d but I'm not sure how long it is. We never got around to the a la carte restaurants and just ate at the buffet for dinner. Many, many choices for everyone. The breakfast is always my favorite! There are three areas for lunch/snacks. The main buffet restaurant is opne from 12:30-3:30 (roughly) but we always at at the one that is close to the pools. There is a small shopping area within walking distance of the resort. It's about 3 minutes away. Every night around 8:45 there was a 10 minute Mayan show that was pretty cool to see. Be careful of pricing. Many stores in this area as well as in Playa del Carmen have the same items for sale for many different prices. Look around first and try to remember where you saw the cheapest price. I saw something in one store for $40, then $25 in another, and $11 in another!! Free wireless internet is available in the lobby and lobby bar if you bring your own laptop, otherwise you have to pay if you use theirs. All in all everything was fanastic at this resort and I cannot find anything bad with it at all. Anyone who has posted negative comments will find fault with everything they encounter in life :)

Reviews.Title: “Highlights and Lowdown of Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Lazyreader
Reviews.Content: Basis of comparison: Our stay was for 7-nights, May 2-9, 2010. My wife and I stayed in a standard room. We've been to the Riu Palace Mexico back in Nov. We've been coming to Playa del Carmen or Playacar (the gated resort section where the Riu Hotels are) for 13 years and have stayed at 6-7 other hotels. Lobby: Elegant and clean! (See photo) Check-in desk staff was efficient and helpful. Any problems (like needing more hangers, or another bottle of Rum) were taken care of promptly (one call usually took care of problem). Beach: Recently repaired: no more "beach whales" you may have heard of. Beach is wide and deep. Only about 435 rooms worth of guests share a very large beach area, compared to some other hotels 700-800 rooms' guests sharing a smaller beach area. (Makes it less crowded). Beach is raked several times a week, making the sand soft and powdery, and clean. There has been some seasonal trimming of the front four rows of palm trees, so that they don't offer much shade, but in the tropics plants grow back quickly. Grounds: Very elegant! Well manicured and beautifully maintained. The central fountains, and reflecting pond bordered by tall palm trees that runs down the center of the resort, separating the two 3-story guest room wings of the resort, are visually magnificent! (See photos.) Rooms: spacious, with a step-down sitting area with loveseat, dresser, and flat screen t.v. 10'-12' tall ceilings. Safes, ironing board, booze dispenser, fridge with beer and pop, full size umbrellas are in every room. Each room has its own a/c thermostat and ceiling fan. Bathrooms are adequate, but not oversized (with tub). Toilet and bidet are in their own small room. Food: the ala carte restaurants are attractive and the food is pretty good....... particularly for meat eaters. There is Miyagi Japanese, Krystal Fusion, La Bodega Brazillian (Meats!), and Steakhouse (El Patio during the day). The Buffet (Don Julian), we found, offered a wonderful assortment of seafood, pasta, meats, salads, soups, and desserts. We loved the variety of the buffet so much that it was our favorite place to eat (serving till 10:30). For the ala cartes there is a reservation system that starts at 8 a.m. (Ask about it when you check in.) Buffet requires no reservations, but long pants, and sleaved shirts are required at dinner (also true at ala cartes). Bars: pretty wood-paneled lobby bar serves premium liquor until the early morning hours. Nice wait staff. Pool bar (open til 6 p.m.) Beach bar (til 5 ) Pool: it's okay, but not as colorful, or as tropical as some of the other Riu resorts' pools. There is reciprocity at any of the other Riu Resorts pools, bars, or restaurants (EXCEPT not for dinner) Offered by Riu Palace only. Gym: small, but has most popular machines (2 treadmills, some free weights, stairclimber, exercise bikes.) Located next to spa near pool. Entertainment: Evening shows in the lounge, and small bands with a singer many nights in the gazebo/courtyard area outside of the lounge. Kids: Riu Palace does have programs for little kids, but I have noticed that the families that come here seem to have fewer children per family than other resorts. Guests: on our two visits here I noticed that most visitors are Europeans, Canadians, Russians, Mexicans, Latin Americans, and about 15% U.S. There are 35% 60-year-olds, 30% 40's, 25% in their 30's, & 10% 20/70's Service: excellent. Workers are friendly (for the most part) and work very hard for low wages. Small tips (a dollar or two) help them out a lot. . Town visit: worth the 5-minute $5 cab ride (each way). 5th Avenue is a pedestrian walkway lined with shops, restaurants, bars, and...salesmen (some are a bit assertive...just smile and walk past those guys). Fun visit. Hints: we take insulated 18-oz. drinking mugs (with tops) to keep our beach beer and drinks COLD. Mini-umbrellas also protect against unexpected tropical showers. We also take medical aids (immodium, bandaids,aspirin, insecticide, etc) to save the expense and hassle of a doctors visit ($120) for something minor. We hope you enjoy the photos and find that this review was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding is the only word for The Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: twalt
Reviews.Content: Mike and I had a outstanding time! Food was great and service was Outstanding! The only problem was one night when the mosquitoes attacked the Steak House. The staff did a great job in taking care of the problem. It had one of the longest beaches I have been to. The beach was great and a great place to look for conch shells. Best Day is great contact for you in getting around Mexico. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Honest -Stu WOW What a Fantastic Experience its our best hotel yet”
Reviews.Author: honest_stu
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked to celebrate our Silver Wedding Anniversary - after check in we were shown to our room with a Queen Size bed and a very large private balcony which overlooked the outside entertainment area. The hotel staff were professional in every way and nothing was too much trouble for them - including cocktail delivery service on the beach to the bed turn down service every evening. The bar staff were absolutely wonderful especially if you are brave enough to try speaking Spanish. Try the Casino night at the hotel it is great fun, and the Michael Jackson show was really good. We got good exchange rates at the hotel.The best part is that you can use all the other Riu Hotels in the area except for evening meal and breakfast. The Carribean Sea was absolutely wonderful and when we relaxed we used the beach instead of the pool area, I found that the motor sports were expensive compared with the Mediteranian 36 Pounds for Parascending behind a boat - they tell tou it is for half an hour but when timed you are lucky to get 8 minutes. We went to Chichen Itza to see the newest 7th wonder of the world and enroute I swam in a Ceynote (Mexican Sink Hole - a natural access point to an underground river 90foot diameter x 150foot deep), on another trip we visited Xhel- Ha which is a natural water park,however, we were not advised to take extra money with us if wanted to swim with Dolphins ranging from 99 Dollars to 150 Dollars. Manitees or the diving bell - these were all extra. It is a great day out - best trip we have been on so far good for children and adults - and we would certainly do it again. We used to walk into PlayaCar along the road approx 30mins and walk back along the beach, by Taxi it is 5 Dollars or 50 Peso's (Peso's is cheaper than Dollars). We were also advised to change money for Peso's (Not Dollars) If you walk into a shop the general rule of thumb is not to haggle, however, if you are invited in to the shop expect to haggle to pay roughly half of the price on the label. We took ourselves to Cozumel Island by ferry for £14 each return, however, it is much like Playacar. Would we go back - Yes The worst thing with Mexico is the extortionate departure tax £38.00 per person

Reviews.Title: “Heaven with a beach”
Reviews.Author: GMUNY55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico with friends from Apr.19th-26th. Beautiful resort with an awesome beach.Service was seond to none. Always somebody cleaning up or planting flowers. Great variety of food , especially the Don Julian Restaurante ( this was my favorite). I am not a picky eater, but found the speciality restaurants to use way too much salt in their food.( made me drink more I guess). No problem getting alcohol in our drinks( even the premium brands, all you have to do is ask for it). We all felt very safe when we visited the town square ( huge flea market there). Do not be afraid to barter with the locals.My wife got some good bargains. The weather was absolutely beautiful.2 days hit the mid 40's. At one point while in the pool, I said to my wife" this is just like being home in the bathtub ( so hot!). We booked an excursion to swim with sea turtles and were not disappointed!. Akumal Bay was beautiful. I personally do not visit the same resrt twice as their are so many to see. I think that my next stop with be the island of Jamaica, St Kitts/ St Nevis Barbados.... the list goes on and on !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would not go Back”
Reviews.Author: fsupilam
Reviews.Content: First time ever going to an all inclusive and if they are all like Riu Palace Mexico, I will not go back. My GF and are both 30 and were looking to go have a nice beach vacation mixed in with drinks and good food. While the hotel grounds and staff are very nice, the food, drinks, entertainment and bars were not what was expected. You are limited to 2 beers on property and each bar only has one of those to choose from. The Pool bar served Dos Equis, which normally i lliked, but here it tasted awful. They serve it in 6 0z glasses, and the foul odor it possesed made it difficult to drink. the mixed drinks aren't much better. Zero alcohol, and again served in 6oz glasses. The food was just down right bad. The breakfast buffet was good, but that is hard to screw. The Steakhouse, Fusion and Brazillian restaurant were all under par. Food is below the quality of applebees to give you a bench mark. The food was so bad i just gave up eating it and headed down to the City to eat. Also the room service was gross The city of Playa Del Carmen was lots of fun, and if I ever go back there, i will forgoe the all inclusive plan so i can enjoy the good food and drinks there. Maybe all inclusives are like this, i don't know. If you are a younger couple looking for drinks and fun skip the Riu Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more..”
Reviews.Author: kwarnrdc
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an amazing trip to the RIU Palace Mexico. The hotel was absolutely stunning and the staff was amazing. They all went above and beyond to make their customers happy. The staff was very professional and classy. We arrived to a smooth check in and very greeted with a refreshing fruit juice. The rooms were roomy and the sitting area was a nice touch. The only thing I would suggest is if you have small children or an early bed time, ask for a room away from the theatre and the courtyard area where the band plays. It can be a little noisy but it does end by around 11:00 or so. I spend every day by the beach and did not utilize the pool aside from one quick dip. The pool area seemed dramatically hotter than the beach. The pool was slightly chilly. But the pool was not my preference when there is such an AMAZING beach and sea within walking distance. The beach is immaculate and raked and cleaned daily. Plenty of beach chairs at any time. There was no rushing down to save your chair in the early morning like other hotels I have visited. The only thing that I can say someone may complain about is the lack of night life on site. But there are other RIU's within walking distance with more to do at night. I was not affected by this as I did not go to party and simply wanted lots of relaxation and a beautiful beach. I would also say that if you are traveling with children that this might not be the place for you. Not really anything for kids to do that I could see and there were very few kids at the hotel. Overall, I have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel and I am already trying to decide which Palace I will stay at on my next vacation!

Reviews.Title: “stunning”
Reviews.Author: parsue
Reviews.Content: Booked the Palace on a recommendation from my lovely sister who went to the area last year, she was right it was sooo special and stunning. The hotel was perfect, amazing service the waiters and staff were so sweet, attentive and professional. The hotel court yard was lovely to eat in a night and have after dinner drinks just like covent gardens London. The food.... was so much choice and all gorgeous especially the fish and chinese night.... well every night actually (put on 10 stone!!) The room.... Very nice and spacious with a lovely view of the pool and gardens, very comfortable beds and sun loungers on the balcony. Nice bathroom with loo with a separate door which was a good touch. Lots of drinks in the fridge and good choice of optics too. The beach was amazing with topaz blue sea which was a lovley picture through the palm trees. Book this hotel you wont be disappointed my sister and family are going in August and cant wait .

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing visit”
Reviews.Author: MJGso
Reviews.Content: I went there with several girlfriends for our annual "Girls Only" trip. This is something we look forward to each year. We stayed at the RIU in Negril, Jamaica 2 years ago and were very impressed with that property. We decided to try the RIU Mexico Palace in Playa del Carmen this year. What a disappointment this RIU was. After the 60 minute ride from Cancun's airport (we had to make a stop and drop another couple off at a different property), we were assured by the bellman that our luggage would be brought in to us. We were greeted by an enthusiastic front desk team. After getting to our rooms, 2 girls in our group discovered that they had someone else's luggage. It took about 90 minutes for the hotel to track their luggage and deliver it to them. The pool was another disappointment. There was a sludge of suntan oil, dead bugs and hair floating in the water. Bleech! Aside from the ladder, there were no other steps to get into the pool. Unfortunately one of our friends was still recovering from knee surgery and had a hard time getting in and out. The food was mediocre at best. Very over-salted. Breakfasts were good though. (Kinda hard to screw up breakfasts though.) I DON'T recommend the Brazilian restaurant. The service was slow. We also noticed that the wait staff didn't stop by tables more than once with the meat unless there were men at the table. There really wasn't any nightlife at the hotel. No disco. They did a kids show each evening at the martini bar that opened into the courtyard. While we had after dinner drinks, we were regaled with "Head and Shoulders, Knees and Toes" and "Simon Says" each night. After that, the RIU had a music group that sounded like a wedding band that played in the courtyard each night. There were some positives. The sleeping room and bathroom were a good size. We loved our patios (although one room's patio was quite a bit smaller than the others). We enjoyed going next door to the RIU Yuccatan. Overall, I can't wholeheartedly recommend the RIU Mexico Palace. Check out other RIUs or all-inclusives in the area before booking here.

Reviews.Title: “the best vacation to date”
Reviews.Author: sandwalkerToronto
Reviews.Content: We have just returned form Riu Palace Mexico on Friday, April 9. This was the best vacation we had to date. We enjoyed every moment of our stay, from the amazing setting of the hotel, with wonderful gardens and fountains, luxurious lobby, excellent room, to the incredible staff and level of service. We never waited for anything, and it was always enough just to ask. The room was excellent, quiet (1017, facing the back of hte left wing) and very spacious. The air conditioning was very quiet too - this has been an issue for us when travelling to other destinations - and also there was a thermostate in the room so we had control over the temperature. The room also has a terrace, a fully stocked bar with rum, vodka and whisky (we are not drinkers but we can appreciate quality - they were all very good!) and a fully stocked fridge with water, soft drinks and beer. The room cleaning staff was excellent (thank you Lorenzo for all your hard work and artistic touches! very cute towel creatures) and the room was done at least 2 times during the day - we did not even have to turn the bed for the night! The serving staff at the buffet restaurant was great - Ignacio is the best, very polite, pleasant manner and very good recommendations, and Fabiola - at breakfast - really nice. There are always special touches, and the staff is always trying to remember what we liked and provide it, be it the wine or the choice of coffee. The selection is huge, there are always at least 3 types of meat and lots of sides to choose from, some nights there are special dishes too, and overall we did not feel the need to go to any a la carte - there was plenty of variation. The quality of hte food was top notch, both my husband and I have sensitive digestion but this was very well cooked and very tasty. The rest of the hotel staff was also extremely nice, always smiling, constantly cleaning and aranging everything so it looked impecable all the time. All the positive comentaries you read here are true, we did not have one single thing that was disappointing. We did 2 trips - Xcaret and Chichen-Iza, very good both of thm, both provided by Sunquest. The guide we had for Chichen-Iza was very knowledgeable - Eduardo - and funny - we had a good couple of laughs on the trip. The Cenote - Ik-kil - was awesome, very refreshing. We also walked to Playa del Carmen one afternoon, it is very safe and the promenade is very nice, all the villas, hotels and landscaping - beautiful. The beack is excellent, visible they have restored it recently - beautiful sands and the bottom of hte sea smooth and no stones or shells. The water was warm, crytal clear and one day we had high waves, but the rest the waves were just right. Lots of shade - we are always staying in hte shade - but a big stretch under the sun too, with many beach beds available at all times. Drinks are brought around frequently, but the bars are really close too if something more sofisticated is needed. As you can tell, the enthuziasm did not wear off yet. This was the first time we did not want to come back, that is how much we enjoyed this vacation. I recommend this hotel wholeheartedly and I am looking forward to returning there (I would go tomorrow if I could :))

Reviews.Title: “10 day trip from 3/28-4/6”
Reviews.Author: markovka23
Reviews.Content: My family and I desided to go to Riu palace Mexico for the first time. Being traveling Enthusiasts we travel to different Riu's as well as other hotel franchises every year. The Hotel was very nice and comforting. The lobby had closed off air conditioning which was very nice when its very hot outside. The Front desk was helpful and if you needed any assistance or help they took care of it. The Hotel said that they had wireless interenet in their lobby but it kept breaking so if you needed to use internet you had to go to another Riu location. The Food was good in the buffet but was practically the same every day. If you have ever been to a Riu before then this hotel won't be a huge difference. The beach had alot of shade as well as alot of sunlight, which was great for our party, because we had both those who spent the day tanning and those who spent the day running away from the sun. The restuarants were good but you had to wake up early to get a reservation. The Bars were good for the most part. They knew most of the drinks and made very good margaritas. sadly they struggled to make any other drink meet expectations with most of them being either too watered down or just plain alcohol. The rooms were mini-suites and large for 2 people. the Tv had around 40 channels with about half in spanish. The service was good for the most part. The beach was very wavy during our 10 day stay and some of our party didn't even enter the water becuase of the waves. The ride from the airport took around 1 hour ( if no traffic) but it took our friends 2 hours due to construction and traffic. All in All, it was a great vacation and i would recommend this hotel to anyone who is loooking for a relaxing vacation. ( the hotel lacked entertainment for the most part) and so if your looking to hit the town or party this is not the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: carol087
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from the Riu Palace Mexico stayed from the 26th March to 9th April 2010 my Daughter and her boyfriend got married here, what can I say we had a fantastic time the best ever. The staff are excellent the place is so well organise from checking in to checking out cant fault the hotel it was the best time ever our party was varied from very small children upwards. The wedding was wonderful it was like a dream you did not want to wake up from. The beach, the food.the rooms cant fault it but the staff made this a great stay for us from the entertainments team, the bar staff and the restaurant staff have nothing to complain about this holiday. Would not have any problem recommending this Hotel to anybody would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “9 Blissfull days at the Riu Palace Mexico - minus the springbreakers”
Reviews.Author: lucia_and_daniel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great vacation at the Riu Palace. Stayed in a Suite overlooking the pool and ocean. Fluffy bathrobes, fresh flowers, spotless, Superb service - maid was excellent. Buffet staff very good, quick service - non stop refills, clean tables, polished cutlery - everything top notch. Food - A+++ very nice - never boring. The chocolate fountain is great! Beach - plenty of chairs in the shade. Pool - a bit on the small side but nice. Taken over by the spring breakers - very loud, obnoxious, annoyed everyone around. Very rude to staff and other vacationers. Their parents didn't mind. We thought going in early April wil be safe but not the case. Also took over the beach, again loud - and pretty ignorant to everyone around them. Not the resort's fault. The grounds - amazing just like the other Riu palaces we've been to. Gardeners work very hard, always raking the sand, leaves, debris, picking up anything amiss. Great hard working people - deserve a lot of praise. SPA - simple and nice. Did the daytrip to Tulum and Beyond - got to snorkel in two cenotes, lunch on a secluded private beach and pyramids in the morning - well worth the visit. Go early. Small shopping plaza 2 min walking distance from the resort - nice variety if you don't want to drive into town. Overall, wonderful trip we'll be returning to this one again, albeit at a different time of year. Highly recommend the Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but only one bed?”
Reviews.Author: rjrmk
Reviews.Content: We stayed from March 30 - April 6. My spouse and 14 Yr. old son. We arrived and there was only one large bed! My son being a teenager would not sleep in the same bed as us. I asked for another bed and they said they did not have any left. So he slept on the loveseat size sofa, that didn't pull out to a bed. There are five Riu Palaces within walking distance of each other. You cannot tell me that they couldn't find another bed at one of them. My son stayed for three nights that way, before my persistent nagging at the front desk got us another bed. Our friends stayed in another room and their sofa pulled out. Do not pay extra $90.00 for nonstop shuttle from airport. Delta Vacations talked us into it before we left and it had another couple that they dropped off at the Sandos Playacar. Our friends did not pay the $90.00 and they rode the same shuttle. Tiia the Delta representative said there was nothing she could do but give us our own shuttle on the way back. The food was great, hotel was clean, and people were overall very friendly. We stayed at Moon palace two years ago and it was alot better and priced comparible to RP Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAFF - EXCELLENT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: BAN49
Reviews.Content: We (husband and I) have recently returned (well we had when I started writing this!) from a 2 week holiday at the Riu Palace Mexico – stayed between 13th and 27th February. Check-in was very quick, with very efficient reception staff. Must say at the outset that ALL THE STAFF at the hotel are absolutely fantastic and nothing is too much trouble for them and you didn’t have to tip them to get this service (although we did at the end).The grounds are kept immaculate and everywhere was kept so clean but so many staff. This is a very well run hotel. We were allocated a standard room with view of the fountains and it was just what we had hoped for. The room was kept spotless by our maid (wish I could have brought her home with me to do my cleaning!). We had breakfast in our room one morning but unfortunately the order got misinterpreted so only ended up with breakfast for one but this was rectified very quickly when the mistake was pointed out with many apologies. So pleased that Riu have now put coffee making machines in the rooms; hope it’s the same for all of their hotels now and not just the “Palaces”. We were always left plenty of bottled water and the mini-bar and fridge were well stocked. Our bed was very comfortable and not hard as some trip advisors have stated. There was a good selection, as is usual with Riu’s, at the breakfast buffet in the Don Julian restaurant and we managed to get a table outside on the terrace every day we wanted to. The staff were very efficient in clearing away so that other guests could eat on the terrace. We also tried the later continental breakfast at La Traviata on one occasion after a jog (hope you’re all impressed!) which also had a good selection. We ate lunch mainly in the El Patio and La Traviata restaurants and once in the Don Julian restaurant. We also ate lunch in the main restaurant at the Riviera Maya twice and do feel that their main restaurant did have a better feel to it than the Mexico’s, hence one of the reasons for sitting outside on the terrace. We ate mainly in the Don Julian buffet restaurant (or should I say on the terrace) for dinner which had a very good selection with wonderful deserts. We also visited the El Patio Steak House 3 times, which was very good, La Bodega Brazilian restaurant, which was ok and the Krystal (gourmet) which we were disappointed with. We visited the Krystal restaurant when staying at the Riu Palace in Aruba and the food in the Aruban Krystal was much better than at the Mexico. We did feel that the arrangement for booking the speciality restaurants was silly; you having to get a numbered ticket at about 8ish and then the numbers were read out starting at 8.30 and with only being able to book for that day. We discovered that the Riviera Maya dealt with this differently; only queuing once and being able to book in advance. There were plenty of sunbeds around the swimming pool and beach area with a good amount of shade if needed. Unfortunately the swimming pool was cold with the sea being warmer. We did prefer the layout of Riviera Maya’s pool area, but it was very noisy and because their pool was nearer the beach you could hear the noise from the pool on the beach. As the beach at the Mexico was a short walk through the grounds it wasn’t at all noisy and was much wider. The beach itself was wonderful being able to walk all the way to Playa del Carmen. The entertainment was better than we have seen in other Rius; it could be improved on, but at least we didn’t feel we had to walk out on anything as we have done in the past. We did visit all of the Riu hotels in Playacar and feel that it is worth that bit extra to stay at the Mexico, especially if you’re a bit older with no children. Not sure if its worth paying even more to stay at the Riviera Maya even though it did have a few extras more than the Mexico. There wasn’t wall-to-wall sunshine every day and some nights it was chilly but that did not affect us. We had a fantastic holiday and felt guilty that we had done very little compared to what we usually do on holiday but we had visited the area before and had “done” a lot of the sights. As I stated above, everyone made our stay great and we would not hesitate in recommending the hotel. Hope my comments are of use to you and if you want to ask me anything; don’t hesitate to contact me

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the most amazing resort ever!”
Reviews.Author: LauraFoxMichigan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from March 22 - 29, 2010. This resort was so beautiful that I don't know if we can say enough good things about it. The grounds are immaculate and so tastefully decorated. The rooms are very nice as well, but I think that they were given a little less attention as to the decorating. Please don't take that in a negative sense, because that is not what I mean at all. They are still very nice and very clean. I just think they focused more on the outside and common areas, which is just fine with me because we were hardly ever in our rooms. The beds are a little hard and so were the pillows. But I found after leaving just a couple of bucks under the pillow for a tip that first night, the next night we had extra soft pillows. This resort is tucked into the very elegant and private community of Playacar. And it is quite secure. I never felt unsafe. The service is amazing. There is always someone there to wait on you whether at the bars, in the restaurants, room service, you name it! And very friendly as well. We developed a great friendship with one of our pool bar waiters, Hector. What an awesome young man! We plan to keep in touch and maybe someday show him around Michigan. Please say hello to Hector for us from Dan & Laura. The food was outstanding. We actually only ever ate at the buffets because we just never got around to making reservations in any of the restaurants. The choices were endless. We had absolutely no complaints at all. Not even one. And my boyfriend has been a cook for the last 35 years. He was very happy with the food. All-inclusive is the way to go. The mix drinks were a little weak, but then someone suggested that I just ask them for doubles instead. They had no problem mixing doubles for us and they tasted much better after that. There is a liquor dispenser with four types of liquor in the room, as well as a fully stocked mini fridge with beer, pop and water. Any time we asked for more, they always brought it to us. The water in the resort is purified, but not in your room. They still recommend using bottled water to brush your teeth. The beach was very beautiful and clean. There are so many lounge chairs that are both in the sun and the shade, that you never had to save a chair for yourself. There is plenty for everyone. The waiters walk around the beach offering you drinks - how nice! The pools were very nice - a little quiet at times. They do have some activities like water aerobics, but I would have liked to hear a little more music. No rowdy spring breakers here. There were all ages really, from young families to the elderly with a lot of middle age in between. But it was peaceful and fun. We met two really nice couples from Canada right before we left. The resort provides beach towels, so there is really no need to take up room in your suitcase to bring any. They have entertainment every evening. We caught some of it, but not all, as we had gone into town a couple of nights. While it's not Vegas, I'll give them an A+ for effort. When you're a guest at this particular resort, you have rights to go into all of the other Riu resorts in Playacar for entertainment, drinks and meals (excluding dinner), but the other resorts are not allowed to come to this one to drink or eat. Kind of nice in a way. It gives you the opportunity to check out the other resorts and maybe enjoy some of their entertainment, yet it leaves more open chairs for you back at this resort. I would highly recommend this resort and we plan to go back there as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great beach”
Reviews.Author: BostonSunLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico March 13-20. I had booked this hotel thinking it was the Riu Palace Riviera Maya (where we had stayed one year ago, and is almost identical, when viewed in pictures, to the Riu Mexico – thus the confusion). The RP Mexico is a few hotels down from the RP Riviera Maya and is a little older. I prefer the RP Riviera Maya. Our room – number 0001 – was ground level, and had the worst musty odor I have ever experienced in a hotel room. Maybe last year’s swine flu epidemic that kept tourists away caused this hotel to shut down some rooms, because that is what this room smelled like – like it had been closed up for a long period of time. (Note to hotel: throw away the disgusting-smelling sofa in room 0001.) We did not change rooms. Why not? We got there in the late evening and we were tired, and I also believed that the hotel was totally booked. Looking back, I should have changed rooms (if any were available). So, we kept the patio sliding doors slightly open 90% of the week. Luckily, you could safely do this due to locking mechanism. Important note: Riviera Maya is about one hour south of Cancun Airport. Lots of traffic and it's slow. Overall, this hotel (food, service) is very nice. The pool is divided into four separate sections. Access: Unless you just jump in, it is difficult to get into and out of the water. There are ladders, of course, but no graduated stairs or easy access. I saw several elderly people having difficulty getting in and out of pool. Ocean was beautiful, clean and warm. Huge beach area and no problems ever finding chaises either at the pool or beach. Lots of water activities also – kayaks, sailing, jet skis, parasailing. Drinks are indeed lacking alcohol, unless you ask for extra liquor in your drink. Any frozen drink or welcome drink was really just punch – which is strange because there is a fully-stocked bar in every room, containing bottles of Tequila, Rum, Brandy, Vodka, water, soda, etc. (all inclusive) Any outdoor eating/entertainment area is open season for smokers. I am a non-smoker, and found this particularly annoying, but recognized this is the way it is. The hotel is approx. 1.5 miles from the Cozumel ferry and 5th avenue shopping. You can walk there safely. I recommend taking the ferry and enjoying the sights on that island. Get ready for the onslaught of vendors and store owners who will drag you into their stores. If you don't want to walk to 5th ave/ferry, a taxi costs $5 one way (that was for 2 of us). On a side note re Cancun Airport: When you arrive and have gotten your luggage and made it through customs, get out of the airport. Go past all of those men/women in tan pants. They are not there to help you get transportation (although that is what they tell you). They want to sell you timeshares. Just get out of the airport. Ignore them all. They are persistent. And realize that once you are out of the airport and into the transportation area, it is pandemonium. Also, on your return to the Cancun Airport, you really do need a 2-3 hour window. Our line for Delta snaked around and took us one hour to get up to the check-in desk. American Airlines check-in area was just as bad, if not worse. Maybe because it was a Saturday, with a high volume of travel. Also, do not come hungry to the airport on your departure. Very, very expensive food items.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place shame about the thieving”
Reviews.Author: JAG387
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week break at the Riu palace Mexico in Playacar. NOW FOR A WORD OF WARNING I LEFT MY WALLET IN MY TROUSERS FOLDED UP AND AWAY AND HAD MY MONEY TAKEN FROM THE WALLET WHILST OUT OF THE ROOM. This would have meant an employee of the Riu would have to had searched through our room this was not just lying out on the side or was not too good to resist!! The hotel reception staff reaction was to say the least bad "well what do you expect its not in the safe provided so your asking for it basically "!! they reluctently filled a small form out with room number and incident and said it would take a day to hold a full investigation come back tomorrow and see how its progressing as i left i watched her put the form in an envelope wrote on the front and popped it into a tray next to the phones. Went back the next day as requested and waited to see the desk person who i had seen the day before for a while when she spotted me she did her best to keep busy to avoid me but finally said we are still carrying out our investigations The envelope was still exactly were she left it the day before!! the next 3 days the same then we left. Having been to Playacar about 12 years ago a lot has changed built up with more resorts and private condo but this does not spoil the area in the slightest. The riu palace is a large resort with all the amenaties you would expect for an all inclusive resort in this price range. In my opinion quieter lower key than the more active Riu sister resorts and with better food.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break! The best time of my life, never will forget it!”
Reviews.Author: AGalucia
Reviews.Content: Alright, this trip was hands down amazing. The service was great! I was here for my senior spring break! Highly recommended to all! It wasn't as crazy as cancun, but still had the clubs and the city of Playa close by. The taxi was easy to get, the bellhop flagged them down off the street, and we hopped right in. it was $5 each way, and had van available for larger parties. We traveled to the city of Playa 2 times. First to go to senor frogs, which I HIGHLY recommend going too! It was a blast. My friends and I got the "yard" margaritas and even took shots with our parents! Definietly a night to remember. A different night we went to Coco bongo which is a night club. We got a "deal" and spent $60 per person but we got open bar at the club next door for an hour then v,i.p access into coco bongo, so we didnt have to wait in line. Once we got in, we each recieved 2 tequila shots with a lime. The staff was very fun and pulled us up on stage! it was a blast as well! Back at the resort, I am a picky eater but still found food that was enjoyable. The drinks were available 24 hours a day, either at the 4 different bars OR your liqour dispensers that were in every room! I recommend getting a Mango Tango! it is a fruity drink that is soo good and refreshing! It is an alcoholic beverage but because the drikning age is 18, my friends and I were able to have as much as we wanted! The beach was just recently re-done and was so amazing. The water was clear and warm. The pool was great and of course the swim up bar is unforgetable. We met up with a group from Arkansas that was also there for their senior spring break. The club next door at Riu Teqiula. The club was called La Disco Pinata, it was a blast. sooo much fun, the only thing that i can say was a problem was we went two nights in a row and they played pretty much the same 25 songs both nights, and possbily in the same order. The beach bar was wonderful because you didnt have to go to the pool to get drinks ALSO waiters came arund with cervezas, margaritas, mango tangos, anything all day long. So sometimes you didn't have to move! The staff was extremely helpful and amazing. All the men joked with my friends and I. We know some spanish, so we had some conversations in espanol, though they ended up laughing WITH us, because we weren't very good. The only problem we had with the staff was a women bartender. She was at the lobby bar, and when we asked for Passion Dreams (another drink containing alochol) she didn't put any alcohol in it. She didn't ask for our bracelets or anything. So we were pretty annoyed. Even when our parents went and order the drinks for us, she still didn't put any alcohol in them. I also recommend having a "Dos Equis" it is the beer of Mexico and just puts me in a good mood thinking about it! I miss Mexico so much. It was such a blast. I do also recommend wearing a lot of sunscreen, and reapplying every few hours. I tanned before i went so i had a base, but still burned and am now pealing! I would give anything to go back for another week here at the Riu Palace! It was truly amazing and I will never forget it : )

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Mayan, Great Experience at the Riu”
Reviews.Author: ubbriacos
Reviews.Content: How Lucky can we get. Our first trip to the Mayan we had great weather. A little cool in the evening but great beach weather during the day. It was great, no rain at all the week we were there. Beautiful beach. Lots of chairs available in the shade or sun. A little music on the beach would be nice. The hotel was excellent. The buffet was fabulous and the service was great. We tried the steakhouse which was very good. Did not like the Brazilian, we found the meat dry. We left and went to the buffet. Other guests weren`t too impressed with the Krystal so we did not try it or the Japanese. The band in the evening should be a little more "hip". Even though we are in our late 50`s I found it too slow. The shows were good. Our overall experience at the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull all round!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigfella53
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Riu Palace Mexico and had to write a few lines about this great place. We had a fantastic time from arrival to leaving, great service, food and fortunatly weather too. The staff are fantastic and will bend over backwards to get you what you want at whatever the hour. Although the pool was a touch on the "arctic" side it was kept immaculate at all times and well looked after. The beach was lovely too, good size and not too crammed. The hotel all round was so clean. Food in the main resturant was fantastic and varied, always something to try and had several theme nights a week, all of which presented the tough choice of what to eat, so many great dishes to choose from. Some of the other resturants like the brazilian were very good too and great for a change of scenery if the main resturant is getting too much. Top tip with the currency exchange though, we took US dollar travellers checks and found that the exchange rate was very poor not just to get the checks in the UK but also when we changed them for the Pesos in Playa del Carmen. Best way to get cash is to use the Santander bank which is about a one min walk from the front of the hotel, I think it cost me about £1.50 to use the machine but I got a massive difference in the exchange rate which would have saved us a small fortune over the two weeks. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family, a truly lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Visit”
Reviews.Author: Zeeka
Reviews.Content: Sorry ~ this is a bit late, but things happen. Feb 17 – 21, 2010 A Riu Palace decorated nicely (I think the RPLA is more elaborate). Front desk warm greeting, Very efficient and helpful. The food is good at the buffets. Very good food selection as with just about any Riu I’ve stayed. There is some themed evenings, but there is also other food available, not just the specific themed food. Only ate at the steak ala carte. My table was decorated so nicely for my birthday. There were flower petals all on the linen along with the lovely hibiscus. They were very attentative and it was such a pleasant dinner. It wasn’t the worst steak, but I also wasn’t expecting outstanding. The room service is the typical Riu menu. Limited, yet adequate. I just love those silly little chicken toasties. They are actually like a tostada. I'll take some of them right now please. I was also told that I could go to the Japanese whenever I’d like. No reservation required. Unfortunately I never made it. Room was a standard palace room. It was located in the center of the resort and faced the trees. It was actually fine. Easy enough to get to beach/pool area or to the front of the hotel. I swear there are only about a million people staffed in housekeeping. It’s not one person per floor, it’s a LOT per floor (or section per floor). Everyone is great and very accommodating. I would not hesitate to return to this Palace. There are so many options of where to lounge. Mind you the pools are somewhat small so that area is limited a bit. There are areas on the outer of the pools. Some are nice and quiet locations too. Umbrellas all over. There are lots of lounge areas on the beach near and further from the waters edge. There is also an area with hammocks. This is a nice serene location plus they are under the palm trees which sound so nice. Bored of sitting around? Walk next door to the Yucatan (I think). Walk around, check it out. Next across the street. That’s where I finally saw the Coati creatures. They are out at the club at night. Got some funny pix of them too. Next walk north a couple hotels to the other Riu (forgot which this one is). I went up here one day and they were having a beach party (during the day). It was fun and the beach was really nice too, except not enough shade. I walked up here to get a massage as I was told by one of them that it was a little cheaper up here. So I thought, why not I’ve nothing else to do. Well worth it too! I would definately recommend this Riu. Something off topic a bit. I booked this hotel thru funjet and the transfers were with Lomas. This included round trip transfers. Problem was that I was heading to another hotel after Riu. They were kind enough to arrange my pickup at my next hotel even though they do not sell the hotel that I was staying at next. I just thought that was a great deal and pretty nice. One of my cameras broke ` so I'm hoping to get some pix up later :-)

Reviews.Title: “Relax at the Riu Palaces”
Reviews.Author: cdneng2
Reviews.Content: This is my first review of a hotel, but my second time in Playa del Carmen, 6th time in Mexico. I went with my wife just when the peak season is starting (spring break). First, an overview of the Riu's in Playa del Carmen. Riu has 6 hotels located in an area called "Playacar". Playacar houses many upscale hotels and condos as well as a golf course on the property. Playacar has security gated entrances, so everyone entering is screened. One of the things I didn't know about the Riu "Palaces" is that it is a premium hotel relative to the other Riu hotels. A "Riu Palace" guest can go to any other "Riu" hotel and resort, but a Riu hotel guest cannot visit the "Riu Palace" resorts. We understood the difference when we went to Riu Playacar hotel. Although the level of cleanliness and maintenance were the same, there was much more people at the hotel resorts. The rooms are smaller in size, as well as being closer together at the hotels. The Riu Palace is upscale and spacious. As I mentioned before about the differences between the hotels and palaces, the palaces are more quiet and relaxing. It also seems to cater to the older crowd, and this may be due to the premium pricing. The hotel is less dense which means much less noise. I would come to the Riu Palaces for relaxation and calmness and go to the other Riu's for partying. We got a junior suite on the main floor (which is the least expensive of the hotel rooms you can get). The room was spacious, but we had a view of a fire hydrant and a fenced walkway from our balcony. The open minibar was convenient. It had plenty of water, soft drinks, beer and hard liquor. The room had a safe to lock your valuables in. There is also a nighttime turn down service to restock the minibar. The hotel feels very safe. In fact, we forgot to close our room safe one night. Fortunately, nothing was missing after the room service. The Riu offers a central buffet that has a theme every other day. The Riu also has several specialty restaurants: a Brazilian Rodizio, a Steakhouse, Fusion, and a Japanese restaurant. The annoying thing is that these restaurants need to be booked during specific times. This was an inconvenience as you needed to talk to the Maitre'D if you have an all day excursion (like we did when we went to Chichen-Itza). The food was exceptionally good at the central buffet. The odd thing about the buffet is that the "Mexican" dishes are at a separate buffet at the entrance of Don Julian. It was really at the other end of the restaurant and it seemed largely ignored. It had great salsa, guac, and fajitas. We tried the other specialty restaurants out as well. The Asian restaurant Miyagi had disappointing Sushi (but the Asian themed buffet night was tepid as well). Then again, you don't come down to Mexico for the Asian food. The Rodizio, Fusion and Steakhouse were all fine. The food quality was on par with the buffet. I guess the biggest difference is if you want to be served vs. getting up and getting your own plate. The pool at the Riu Palace Mexico is the worst of the Riu's in Playa del Carmen. The pool is not heated, and a little on the cold side. The Jacuzzi is not heated either. The pool has no swim up bar, no built in benches, tables or lounge chairs unlike the other Riu's that I've seen. It does have a gorgeous rebuilt beach, and a shaded area between the pool and beach for lounging in the shade and partial sunshine. I had no problems getting pool/beach lounge chairs or drinks from service people. However, after that being said, the pool was not crowded even with the free scuba lessons going on. The Riu Palace does not have a concierge that I was aware of. All the bookings we did were based off our shuttle company Olympus that provided our transport to and from the airport. We met an Olympus representative at certain times in the lobby to discuss and arrange excursions. There were other tour operators there as well around the same time (Sunquest, Apple). I can't see why you cannot book excursions with the other tour operators if you need to. The nightlife and entertainment at the Riu Palace was OK. The shows were typical "cruise" line entertainment shows, but with even lesser budgets and production values. This seemed to satisfy many of the hotel guests. We prefer to go downtown or to another hotel (if you prefer crowds). Downtown Playa del Carmen is a half hour walk from this hotel, but all the hotels in Playacar are a $5 cab ride. Make sure you agree to the price before you get into the cab. There is free wireless internet in the hotel lobby only. The Riu Palace hotel guests seem very international. Riu is a Spanish hotel chain. We met Germans, Nordics, Swedes, Canadians, and Australians. A couple of Americans were there as well, but not as many as I would have expected. Overall, I highly recommend the Riu Palace hotels for everything it offers. I would advise a Riu Palace if you prefer rest and relaxation vs. a regular Riu hotel if you prefer a more active nightlife. I intend to stay at another Riu in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “i am desperate to visit again, just lovely”
Reviews.Author: K_Meister1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the Riu Palace Mexico with my mum in April 2008. We arrived fairly late into the evening but were still greeted with friendly staff who were more than happy to help. Our room was lovely & clean (just what you want at all times, but especially after a 10 hour flight) We went to the buffet area which still had plenty of fresh food laid out and again the area was spotless. The food was lovely and you can sit outside or in the comfortable restaurant area. Swimming pool areas are a good size and there are PLENTY of sun loungers to make use of, with staff bringing you drinks whenever you require, and always with a smile. The staff are one of the most friendly I have ever come across and will do whatever they can to help. We both thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and did not want to leave, a week was just not enough time! Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a relaxing get-away in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Beach - Can't say enough!”
Reviews.Author: NDvacationer
Reviews.Content: Arrived in early March, stayed for a week. The hotel is spotless, the food is very good, the service is great, the beach was Amazing !!! Can't think of one fault! I would reccomend this hotel to anyone. There were families, singles, middle age and older couples. It has something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “best place and best time we ever had”
Reviews.Author: packmanNorthernMn_
Reviews.Content: The riu place mexico was a great resort. the people and service were excellent. If you want to relax at a very nice resort this is the place to go.I can not say enough goods things about this place. I wish i was still there and we will certainly be traveling back there again someday in the near future. Everybody that we talked to there also enjoyed the accommendations.
