Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMEND!”
Reviews.Author: beachnut023
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Riu Palace Mexico and was very impressed.The hotel is beautiful and immaculate with outstanding service.The food is abundant and varied.The beach is huge with both shade (palm trees) and sun with lots of chairs to choose from. The rooms are large (2 double beds) with a sitting area (sofa) and balcony. The hotel is a 5 minute cab ride ($5.00 U.S.) to Playa del Carmen. There are 5 other Riu hotels within walking distance and they allow you to vsit. Entertainment is good and if you miss one show check out the schedule at the other Rius!! Special mention to the front desk Manager, Laura who was very attentive and professional!! Highly recommend this hotel and we will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Riu palace-is really a palace”
Reviews.Author: nelson1968
Reviews.Content: The service, the food , the rooms, everything was top notch. Would go back in a heart beat. Loved it. we stayed at RIU PALACE LAS AMERICAS last year, just as good. the difference was the beaches, LAS AMERICAS beach was a little more private and secluded, MEXICO was really big and busy, thats the only difference. see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good all Around Experience”
Reviews.Author: born_to_run_Canadian
Reviews.Content: This is a nice choice for an all-inclusive hotel with options to leave the grounds for nearby attractions (playa del carment is a very cheap cab ride). Food is generally good for both the buffet and specialty restaurants (avoid the lame attempt at Japanese food and anything with shrimp, which taste like they were made from frozen). Rooms are of amble size with a sitting area, good mattress, flat screen TV with sattelite channels. The beach is great for those who like the option of shade, as the part closer to the hotel is lined with trees. The sand has come back from any earlier storm damage (there were no sandbags as indicated in some earlier reviews). The disco is across the street at the cheaper Riu Tequilla, which keeps the noise away at night. The staff enthusiastically participated in sports, and was also attentive at restaurants, if a bit less so at the front desk. Drinks have low alcohol content if you order them at the beach, which works out well if you don't want everyone drunk all day. All told, a worthy choice. One tip: don't use the travel companies to go to nearby attractions (Xcaret, rio secreto, etc) as all of these are a short cab ride away, and you can book the cap to pick you up for your return. Much much cheaper unless you are a party of one.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful water, white sandy beaches, being waited on hand and foot!”
Reviews.Author: heathergot2
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to Playa del Carmen. We visited first three years ago with another couple and stayed at the Riu Playacar. This time we had 18 people total and booked the Riu Yucatan, as we like the Riu hotels. Upon arrival we were told they were over booked and upgraded our entire crew to the Riu Palace Mexico which was not only a much pricier hotel, but also allowed us to utilize all the Riu's amenities at each of the Riu resorts. The Palace was bigger, nicer, a bit older crowd. The beaches in Playa have all been redone in the past two months so they were very large, whereas when we visited three years ago, after the hurricane, they were sandbagged, small and you could not walk the beachfront from resort to resort. Now we could walk all the way into the downtown Playa area. The waiters brought drink trays to the beach just for the Palace guests and were always very attentive, one step above the other Riu's we have stayed at which were all still very nice. We ate at all the restaurants and everyone had thier favorite picks. We enjoyed fresh lobster the last night of our stay at the buffet. The rooms were large suites with living area's. If you don't put your "do not disturb" sign out, expect housekeeping to start knocking at 8am! You can walk into town or take a cab for $5. We took an ATV jungle tour and swam in a cenote for $57 - not sure it was totally worth that much, but was enjoyable none the less. We also took a ferry to Cozumel and rented scooters. We negotiated the price from "CP rentals" for $20. A tip - they are negotiable - don't let them try to be sticklers on the prices! The disco was at the Riu Tequila, which was a little inconvenient - they should all have their own. Shows were the same as at every other Riu we have stayed at - Grease, Michael Jackson, game show night. Cheesy fun. It was nice to have the gym and spa on site. We did find massages downtown at Kristines for $25 for a 50 minute massage - several in our group went back for more than one massage. Very good! Was pretty windy and waves were rocky, hard time snorkeling or enjoying water sports. The buffet was ok, along the lines of the other Riu's we have stayed at. We did enjoy the fact that we had 24 hour room service and they were always delivering within 5 minutes. That was a great perk. Another tip - you MUST wear long pants at the restaurants and the buffets. At the other Riu's this was optional - not here! Half our group was turned away at the buffet the first night for wearing khaki shorts and not long pants (shorts are ok for women though - go figure). All in all it was another great stay at the Riu!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: TracyAnne25
Reviews.Content: So beautiful every where you looked. People were nice and helpful. I would like to only stay at a RIU Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every minute of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: erinlee16
Reviews.Content: I traveled here Feb 11-18th with my boyfriend, mom, dad, brother and sister-in-law. Kids are in our 20's and parents in their 50's. We had a great time. The hotel is very nice. Grounds are absolutely beautiful. The staff is out all the time cleaning, trimming trees etc. The hotel room is very nice. Very large and spacious. The bed is huge. Firm mattress but defiantly not anything I didn’t have any good nights sleep on. The staff is out of this world. There to please and do anything for you. The food is very good. Buffett is wonderful. Being a breakfast person I loved the breakfast buffet. The four restaurants were all very nice. My family’s favorite was the Japanese restaurant. We had no problem getting reservations to any of the four. The pool area is very nice but quiet. The pool is cool but refreshing to put your feet in to cool off. Down by the ocean the beach is beautiful, lots of wonderful palm trees and plentiful seating. The beach is one of the best I've seen and this was my 3rd time to Mexico. The nights are much cooler than I had expected. Wishing I would have brought a few more sweaters for the evenings. During the day there is some periods of clouds and a few days we had some rain showers pass through. If your looking for a party night life the Riu Palace is the wrong spot. The evening is quiet around the grounds which was fine for our group. The night shows and entertainment were fine...nothing spectacular. We really enjoyed our self’s and have nothing but good things to say about our stay, the hotel and Playa Del Carmen as a whole was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - What a trip, what a hotel...1st class”
Reviews.Author: SuzyCaiger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just arrived back from a vacation to this wonderful hotel. We traveled with friends from Canada and arranged to meet up with family from the UK. We could not have asked for a better hotel. The food was great the staff are amazing, the beach was out of this world. The only thing we could not control was the weather which was good but a little cold on an evening. I have traveled all over the world, Europe and the Caribbean and this was one of the best trips. We stayed at the Princess last year which is a 5* and while we had a great time and we were not disappointed we enjoyed our stay at the RIU Palace Mexico much better. Again I cannot stress enough how great the staff are at this place…wish I was back there……don’t worry about the negative comments you hear on this site they are all petty and insignificant, just relax and let the staff take care of you. If you are a red wine drinker as for one of the wines from Chili they are much better than the house red they serve!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Visit!”
Reviews.Author: AJHula
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at the Palace twice and have loved every minute of the stay. The staff is wonderful and always very welcoming and helpful! Love the palm tree lined beach and facilities on the grounds. While the food is nothing spectacular it is always quite good....love the breakfast buffet and you've gotta try the guacamole!! Absolutely the best! The only real down side is the rather hard beds....but I am willing to make that sacrifice for the paradise that surrounds you at this location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Two Week Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rabbit123456789
Reviews.Content: Thanks very much to my16 yr old daughter for finding this place as we were nervous to stay two weeks without a good bed and good food. The Palace Mexico provided a beautiful location. The rooms were very well laid out with a step down sitting area and a flat screen TV about 24" screen so we could watch the Olympics. The best part was the beach. The Government just finished adding about 100 feet to the beach with about 2 feet of new sand. The beach was picture perfect. There were also many palm trees so you could stay in shade or sun. The green blue water was something out of a picture and swimming was excellent!!! At the Mexico you get a wrist band to visit all the other resorts (Yucatan and Playacar -both on the beach and also the Tequilla and Lupita which are not on the beach). We walked down the beach to Playa Del Carmen and also went by the street - both picture perfect walks and what a gorgeous town!!! All the souvenirs you could want. Did I mention that outside the resort and just down the street a short distance is a Starbucks and a shopping plaza.. Kids thought they had died and gone to heaven. A coffee was 55 pesos or 5 CDN dollars. The second Riu Place Mayan Riviera was located closer to town but not with the other Riu Resorts. Food wise the buffets were excellent. There were four restuarants a la carte: Brazilian, French, Japanese and Steak. All had good food. The beds were a bit hard but we asked for a mattress topper and they were so comfy. Not a true King -two doubles next to each other which was great. In the room was a liquor cabinet with four dispensing bottels of vodka; rum; brandy and tequilla. There was also a bar fridge with pop and Dos XXs beer. If you ran short they would run down and refill - how could you ask for more. The service at the pool and bar was outstanding - always someone by to take an order and clean up.The pool area was quiet, you could get a spanish lesson at the pool side bar everyday at noon; there was a reading library to which I donated some books and also salsa lessons on the beach sometimes with a little band for authenicity. There were a couple of weddings - no wonder as the grounds were impeccably kept (I mean not a leave was allowed to grow before it was snipped). The kids enjoyed the WiFi available in the lobby and if you have to you can bring your computer go to the lobby and connect. However the service was not as fast as in the Burger King in Playa where when you buy anythinng you get a code to link to the system. All in all - our expectations for food, hotel atmosphere, beach with the two teenage daughters (16 and 18) rated as 6 out of 5 were exceeded. I definitely recommend the Palace - and especically for two weeks. It was a bit pricey when you consider we also had our 17 year old son and we had three rooms but I would do it all over again in a minute. This was paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, smelly rooms, awesome beach”
Reviews.Author: tstrouble
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from 2/10-2/16/10. The staff: excellent, always friendly and seemed to love their jobs. The beach: awesome, very large beach area with plenty of chairs for the sun and shade. The ocean: ok. The ocean floor was very sharp with lots of shells. I'd recommend beach shoes in the water. The bars: 1 bartender staffed at most times and they were quite busy and the wait was long. Our rooms: had a horrible funky smell the entire time we were there. It seemed humid in the rooms to the point that my sheets and clothes felt wet but it wasn't really that hot outside. I returned one afternoon to find it hadn't been cleaned yet but the patio door and screen door was wide open. Wasn't happy about that! Used the safe and it worked great. Mini bar was stocked daily. Not sure if the floor in the room got cleaned. My socks were black on the bottom. Location: excellent! Close to 5th ave shopping. Taxi ride was 5.00 one way to shopping. The nightly entertainment at Palace Mexico was horrible! After 2 nights of boring we ventured over to Riu Tequila and their entertainment was excellent and it was packed full of people. The bartenders were great and very quick. We went to the disco at Tequila one night too. The smell in there was horrible. No ventilation at all. We stayed and fun though. Visited Riu Yucatan one evening and watched the Michael Jackson show. It was excellent. The bar was full of bartenders and they were super fun, entertaining and quick. Food: Ate at Don Julian buffet for dinner 2 nights and every morning for breakfast. Breakfast was good and dinner was ok. Highly recommend reserving the specialty restaurants!!! La Bodega: Al carte salad bar and the rest is served at your table. The wait staff comes to your table with large skewers of meat/sea food and they place a piece of each on your plate. Dessert is also served. Left very full! Krystal: Ordered the Salmon for my main entree. Very good. I believe this was another meal with appetizer, salad, main entree and dessert. Miyagi: Awesome! This meal started with sushi and it was great. I'd never had it before. The appetizer I ordered was Tempura - good. Main meal I ordered was the salmon - great and then dessert was served. By far one of my favorite places to eat. El Patio: This is the steak house. It was excellent. Started with large appetizer and salad. Followed by the main meal and dessert. Again...it was excellent. I'd probably go back to this resort. I got used to the smell of the rooms and turned my air and ceiling fan up and that helped a little.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, A little disappointed in service”
Reviews.Author: paradiseawaitsme
Reviews.Content: Went first week of October with my sister. We travel a lot, and love the Riu Resorts. The resort is gorgeous, clean and well kept. It was not busy at all so we found it to be a little understaffed, service a little slow in bars, bartenders didn't seem to know how to make drinks. Food was always excellent and service in restaurants always quick and friendly. We found that there wasn't much to do, day or night, probably because of the low occupancy. We went to the Yucatan and met some great people from Scotland (Hi George and Leslie, Barry and Melinda!) and spent most of our evenings there. The bartenders at the Lobby bar in the Yucatan are awesome! Rooms are all suites and are kept clean. Mini bar and liquor dispenser kept filled. No special towel animals or bar items whether or not you tip. I would recommend it to my friends and family only if they went during high season. I would probably try the Riu Palace Mayan Riviera next time though because it was busier and the service was better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, love the area”
Reviews.Author: trvladict
Reviews.Content: My sister and I travelled to this resort in October. It wasn’t very busy so they didn’t have all their staff on which brought the service level down a bit. We didn’t find the service staff as friendly as we usually do at the Riu’s. The Riu Yucatan next door had amazing service staff and we spent most of our time there. This one is located right next door to the Yucatan and across the street from the Tequila where the 24 hour sports bar and disco are. The Riu Mayan Riviera is about a 10 minute walk and a lot busier than RPM. There was a lot more going on around the pool area as well and they have a sports bar there that is air conditioned and was a relief from he heat. The Riu Playacar is next to the Mayan but we didn’t make it in there. The food was terrific and the drinks here were okay. The lining up for the a la cartes is a joke. Even if you are down by 8am to get a number they are already gone so you must have to be waiting at 630am or 7am. We did want to try the Fusion but then heard it wasn't that great. We ended up at the Brazilian and really enjoyed it. The Japanese was also great. The rooms were nice and clean but don’t expect the fancy towel art here (It could be because they weren't fully staffed). We did order room service a couple of times which was nice to have in the morning while getting ready. The Palace’s are usually quieter but you still have access to the other Riu’s. You can also walk into Playa Del Carmen in about 20 minutes. Love the area and had an awesome time with some great new friends. I would definitely go back but would probably stay at the Palace Mayan Riviera or the Yucatan this time for a change and to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort beautiful weather”
Reviews.Author: djkoomans36
Reviews.Content: We went there with 4 couples for a week on January 29 to February 5. We had beautiful hot weather for the week with 2 rain showers at night. The hotel is beautiful with the staff working very hard to please you in every way. It was very clean and the food was over all very good. All the staff were very friendly all the time whether you tipped or not. We were not that thrilled with the entertainment at night. We went to Riu Yucatan last year and it was much better. The hall in which it was held was too small. The drinks were plentiful with never having a reason for them to be empty. They also came around on the beach to serve you. There was enough things going on to keep you busy during the day. We met a lot of people from all over the world who seemed to get along well everyday. The drawback was the pool is not as nice or active as the Riu Hotels around there especially the Palace Mayan. The beach is now very beautiful as it is now 500 to 1000 feet deeper with beautiful white cool to the feet coral sand. It was very disappointing to find it closed for the first 2 or 3 days with bulldozers payloaders and excavators working on it day and night. We might not of gone there if we had known it ahead. However if you are going it is now open and probably the best beach around. The palace is definitely better than the other RIUS in the area (excluding Riu Palace Maya) as we checked them all out in the last 2 years. We liked the buffet restaurant the best for food and variety. The Brazilian was also very good as well as the steak restaurant. The French was all right but could have done without that one as the portions were not too big. It is a beautiful area better than Peurto Vallarta or Jamaica Rius.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Snooty”
Reviews.Author: kviveiros
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful and the staff was great but the guests were a little snooty for our taste. We've stayed here and the Riu Playacar and my husband and I prefer the Iberostar hotels. Overall the rooms and the grounds are really well maintained and the food and drink are fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: travelingwfamily
Reviews.Content: Excellent beach (nicest one in all the Riu hotels), great friendly staff who constantly are there to offer their services, extremely clean, very nice shows after dinner, delicious restaurants (all of them, including the buffet which was an excellent option even for dinner given it looked like any of the other restaurants) and 24 hour room service. If you are looking at different Rius spend a little extra on the palace ones, there IS a sizeable difference with the others (we went over there to have a look). We liked the beach and decors better on Palace Mexico but the Riu palace playacar had better pools, so you have to chose what you value the most. At walking distance from the playacar dowtown "5ta avendia" with shops and restaurants. Free snorkeling lessons at the pool, kayaks and other outdoor activities. Gorugeous stay and vacations. We are going back.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: NorthDakotaNannie
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my husband, mother and father. We have stayed at other Rius so we have something to compare. We thought we would upgrade to a "palace" this trip....Mabey we were expecting too much...First, don't get me wrong, we are not real fussy. The staff, as with the other Riu resorts are wonderful, everyone is mostly very friendly and helpful. The food is, in my opinion, very good. The food is the same at the resorts from Mexico to Jamaica with some differences according to country flair but always alot to choose from. The rooms are nice and always kept clean. Can always get what ever you need, xtra towels, blankets, pillows. Can get boxes of tomato, orange juice, even milk from the bars to take to your room if needed. There is always a musty smell in all the Rius....(its the ocean/caribbean humidity) -not a big deal for us...let's us know where we are :) All that was great Problems: At all the other Ruis when we arrive there is a bus person that grabs our luggage, a bartender gets our drink orders and we are escorted to the front desk for a quick check in. This time when we were dropped off there was no one to meet us, doors were closed, so we grabbed our luggage and went to front desk. No busperson, no bartender, so we requested a drink and were all given a grapefruit, slightly cool drink while we got checked in...ok maybe not a big deal for some, but we expected better service with a "Palace"---The beaches at the other Ruis were always kept clean, there were always people walking around just to collect trash/glasses so the beach was clean...not here....always trashy....glasses, plastic, ciggs, straws...kind of ugly. Pool area very beautiful, but no tables by chairs...???? There were 2 tables per pool and when the people using one of those two tables would leave, that table would be quickly snatched up. Now...I feel if you upgrade to a Palace and you need to dress for dinner there should be adequate tables at the pool to put your drinks/books/food ect on....You should not have to put that stuff on the ground....wet/bugs/dirt....classy???!!!! The pool, I noticed, did not have steps into the water, only ladders and with the age of most of the guests i am suprised. My parents are in the upper 60's and chose not to go in the pool because the ladder was a bit hard for them to use. We had a wonderful vacation as always and will continue to go to the Rius. We feel that they are a good value but felt that maybe the upgrade at this Riu could have been a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING: THE BEACH IS CLOSED FOR A LARGE CONSTRUCTION PROJECT”
Reviews.Author: lovethebeach53
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Riu Palace at least 6 times over the last 8 years. We loved it because they had (and still have) a beautiful, wide beach with lots of palm trees for shade. We will not return. I still can't believe neither the hotel nor Expedia told us the BEACH WAS CLOSED when we made our last minute reservation for a long weekend (4 night) get-away. The hotel manager told us they had "no idea the government" had a beach construction project planned. This is VERY difficult to believe considering the size of the project. My husband is an engineer and noted that a project of that scale requires a good deal of advance planning. The beach was full of heavy equipment and hundreds of yards of 2-3 foot wide metal pipe. The beach was CLOSED to all activity - you could not even walk down to the ocean. We were told we could carry our towels, etc. and walk to a Riu property about a half a mile down the beach. The reception clerk explicitly told us to carry our own towels; we would not be allowed to use the towels at the other Riu property because "we were NOT their guests". We had stayed at that property before and chose the Riu Palace Mexico because of the superior beach. We asked for some compensation for our spoiled vacation and were given an apology (nothing we can do for you) and a customer service email address. We were told the beach would be closed for "2 days", but it really looks like a project that will be ongoing for several weeks, at least. Resigned to the bad situation, we walked to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Along the way, we were harassed by personnel from the Viva resorts, who did not want us crossing their property. The beach at the Riu Riviera maya was open, but the water is still full of "sand whales" (huge black containers of sand the size of small whales) so swimming is not very pleasant. We feel like we were DECEIVED by the Riu and their staff, along with hundreds of other disappointed guests. Repairing the beach is a great idea, but doing it at the expense of paying customers??? We will be vacationing elsewhere from now on, and will advise our family and friends to avoid the Riu hotel chain. Check with a reliable source (not a Riu employee) about the condition of the beach before going to any of the hotels in the Playacar area!

Reviews.Title: “vacation ruined.. beach is closed!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: whfan09
Reviews.Content: Before you consider coming here, please make sure you call and check if the beach is open and try to find out if the construction is over before coming here and spending money!!!!!!!!!!! grounds are gorgeous, food is great, service is in most parts is very good, quiet resort, gorgeous warm pool, beach is broad, lots of shades, but waves were huge, and after 2 days, the tractors came and long huge pipes were placed on the sand and beach was closed without any warning or explanations, still not clear what they are trying to achieve, different versions of what happened, but the bottom line is THERE IS NO BEACH..........HORRIBLE. you stil can go to Riu Palace Riviera Maya Beach which is great with white sand and 10 min walk, but it looks like they are planning same things there too, since all other Riu Beaches closed too.....think, check before spending your money here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fun by my self”
Reviews.Author: toyterrier
Reviews.Content: i met people from all over the world but it was a little smell when you walked down the hall to my room on the ground floor. i was in room 5 with a view of one of the pools, so it was a nice view of the ocean as well. the rooms were cleaned daily i usually leave a tip for them and they made me a cute little figure out of the towels for me that was cool. if any one was there between 01-09-10 - 01-16-10. we had some cold weather that was a bummer since i came from michigan to warm up. but what happens in mexico stay's in mexico. debbie

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Ukrainka
Reviews.Content: Impressive property with Mexican tint. Friendly staff (I liked the population in general). Christmas decoration was fabulous throughout the property, inside an outside. Every night there was a live performance. Amazing long park. Very nice pools where you also can get a diving lesson. Issues: beach was washed away and rather narrow. Bathroom (namely bath in a niche) quite dark. All-in buffet is a separate story. It is 1001 night to say at least. Plenty of everything, for any taste, huge area, themes every night. Lobsters, anything - you name it! Vegetables and fruit cut in beautiful slices or even whole sculptures. Feels like it's your wedding. Delicious food so beautifully prepared. I have a whimsy stomach, but not a single problem with food there. Really great value for your money. We definitely want to get back to RIU Palace sometime again :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Beach, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Erin4MU
Reviews.Content: RIU Palace Mexico was very open and with in walking distance to 3 other RIU complexes. Which allowed you to be able to go to any of the other complexes and eat lunch or dinner which allowed for a nice change of pace. The staff over all was friendly we had not major issues and the rooms were clean. The ocean and beach were perfect one of my favorite beach locations. You are about a $20 cab ride to Cancun so you can enjoy the more laid back atmosphere of the Riveria Maya and if you want a taste of party life you can take a trip into Cancun. If you are looking for a springbreak party type local this is not it but if you are looking for a relaxing getaway you are in the right spot. I suggest taking an eco tour to explore the Maya Ruins and Rainforests. We took an eco tour where we went to Maya Runis and hiked up a temple, hiked through the Rainforest, Kayaked, went spelunking, and did a zip line. All in one day!

Reviews.Title: “nice but not overwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: beejay56
Reviews.Content: The service and the staff are absolutely fantastic. All are very friendly and helpful, no problems whatsoever. Due to low wages in Mexico, we tipped either in $1 bills or in pesos the wait staff and housekeeping. Buffet: The breakfast was wonderful and no one would have any reason to complain. There was lots of fruit, cheeses, cold cuts, cereals, eggs, bacon etc. Even cappuccino is available and the coffee is quite good. Lunch: Beware of the fried items if you have a sensitive stomach. They are tasty but if you are not used to what we assume is lard, you may need an antacid. We ate lunch at the Patio & La Traviata; you can go between the both of them and it is a great place to view the beach. The salad bar is fabulous. They have a soft ice cream machine which many enjoyed. The buffet at the hotel is standard. Dinner: Being non-steak eaters we focused on Miagi and Krystal. Miagi was excellent. We both ordered separate dinner choices in order to taste different items. Both the salmon and shrimp with tamarind sauce were excellent. Service at both was impeccable. Krystal (fusion) was also quite good. The only things we did not care for were the 'foam' portions which do not come with every dinner. The salmon comes with a scrumptious pineapple chutney with a hint of cinnamon. Desserts at both places were good. Rooms: the bottom floor rooms begin with 00, these can be quite loud and the patios face neighboring resorts or a path so privacy is almost nil. Originally we were place on this level; within the hour some young adults were already partying in the hall. We asked to be moved and were easily relocated to the second floor. These rooms begin with the number 10. There are 3 sections on each side of the center 'plaza' and gardens. The furthest sections are closest to the beach and the quieter ones as during the evening the entertainment can be easily heard from the sections off the plaza. We had no problems with water pressure, bedding, etc. Rooms are cleaned daily unless you choose to not have it done. Staff come around to restock water, bar drinks, and towels. Tap water is NOT COSUMMABLE. The balcony was very private which made for very nice sunbathing on a windy day. The balconies have a pull out wall rack to dry clothes. Beach: The beach was very nice but the water was murky. Jet skis are now allowed and due to their 2cycle engine have become polluters. When you head towards the beach steer south of the Scuba Caribe where they launch these or you'll end up with a good bit of exhaust fumes. There are very few hammocks but if you can get one this is the ultimate in relaxation under palm trees! The sand whales were not bothersome at all but it is obvious that hurricane damage is not the only reason beaches are eroding. Watercraft is also contributing. Having been to beaches in Portugal, CA., TX, and FL I was not overwhelmed with these. The beaches in Portugal, CA and FL had much clearer water. In general: this is a nice place to get away from it all and relax, there are many Europeans and it is fun listening to the various languages and guessing where people are from. We met families from Spain, Russia, and England (these three dominate) and of course the US. Gym/Spa: Gym was soso, bring running shoes and enjoy the area of Playacar instead of the treadmill. The elliptical was okay. Sauna and jacuzzi are nice on chilly days! Tips: Take antacid with you. There is a drug store in the shopping center just down from the hotel, pricey but good in a pinch. They carry amoxicillin and erythromiacin. You do not need beach towels, hotel provides them. The hotel shop is very expensive, go to the shopping center down the street. Also, late at night they take pesos only. Money exchange at the front desk is easy, exchange rates are posted. Drinks are weak, look at the bar menu and be specific about brands and you will get it. Wine is either Mexican or Portuguese and below average. Dinner attire: Men - they do require slacks/long pants; no t-shirts. My companion wore a non-collar shirt with sport jacket and had no problem. Other men wore collared shirts. Ladies wore nice dresses or slacks/nice tops. A few were in after 5 dresses; especially young couples on their honeymoon. Lunch: no shorts/sleeveless tanks in the buffet at the main hotel. at the Patio and LaTraviata everyone had nice swim coverups. They expect decency which is not asking too much. Evening entertainment: The Flamenco dancers were the best. The young people who perform the 'American themed shows' do work very hard and many work around the facility during the day. The Michael Jackson show was pretty good. Some of the shows were 'kitchy' and I felt that the corporation could have planned something more authentic to the Mexican culture. The plaza gazebo had excellent(!!!) local musicians and there is plenty of room to dance. These were our favorite. Drinks are also served in the plaza area. All in all it was interesting for my first trip to Mexico. I was not so overwhelmed that I would return and feel that I can enjoy a beach just as well in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Unbelievable!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyjenmisfit
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went visited this hotel last April and we are still talking about what an amazing time we had. The hotel was perfect in everyway. We had every need taken care of, all the food and liquor we could ever want. The mini bar in the room was perfect and the room itself was so nice. Other people talked about a musty smell, we didn't notice anything, what do you expect staying right on the ocean? We were so happy with the hotel that we planned another trip this April and will be staying at another Riu in a different location in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Grayella
Reviews.Content: Shuttle ride took about 1 hour 15 minutes to the resort. Upon arrival we were greeted with a drink. We were switched 3 times before getting the correct room we had paid for. All 3 rooms were very musty/moldy smelling, however, they were very clean (bedsheets, towels, etc. were cleaned and restocked every day, mini bar was consistently full). We did happen to see a patch of black mold in the shower on the ceiling. Staff was extremely friendly. Pool is freezing cold, but temp outside is only 20 - 25 C, so it's expected. Food was just average. Best restaurant is The Krystal and Yamir is great.. Shows were amateur but still some good entertainment. Spa is very small. I would not return to this hotel, but for the price, it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “OMG - This hotel truly is amazing”
Reviews.Author: KentPrincessSparkle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from the UK on 12th December for two weeks. I was a bit apprehensive as we have not been to Mexico before let alone for Christmas. The flight was long for us (11 hours) but when we arrived it was all worth while. From the moment we arrived the staff could not assist us more, we checked in early and were allocated a nice room overlooking the little plaza square, massive balcony which was nice. The weather was great and honestly the staff were always around in huge numbers - cleaners, waiters, managers, animation, you name it. Always saying 'Hola' and smiling. The food in the buffet was great, I always laugh when people say all inclusive is 'Samey', course its going to be if you have a bit of everything every night!! It was always plentiful, with impressive ice sculptures and fancy designs. The other bookable restaurants were excellent, although there were a few that served enormous amounts of food - like the brazilian 'La Bodega' they serve a six course of meat of skewers..... The best thing about this hotel is we can use all the others but still ours stays somewhat private as they cant come to us ( except the other Riu Palace). We loved the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, this was the exact same as ours but the more modern version. I have to say a lot more children too....!! However we adored the buzz at their pool and beach, seemed livlier, loud music. All in all this whole Playacar complex is ultra safe and really friendly to tourists which is great. On 24th Dec they celebrate their christmas and all the hotel guests get treated to a huge Gala dinner. It was amazing Santa and elves there, they even had 4 life size ice sculpted reindeers, you had to see it to believe it. The food was the best I have ever seen , they had lobster, crab, kingprawn, every kind of seafood in vast amounts.....then turkey, ham, lamb, salmon and beef it just went on and on. This place really is truly amazing, neither of us were ill which I was also worried about. Shopping and Fifth Avenue is also great to explore in Playa Carmen. We met a couple who took the 40 min ferry journey to Cozumel as well. I have to say the Spa is very good also I had a massage. So there you have it. If I had to moan it would be one small thing - the draught beer is very very poor. The bottled stuff in your room is ok, but the draught is incredibly weak. I changed to cocktails much better!!!! Honestly value for money and what this little paradise offers is very hard to beat. ENJOY 8)

Reviews.Title: “We Cant Wait to Go Back!!”
Reviews.Author: travelerNYPA
Reviews.Content: Pros & Cons Cons: 1. The room itself was well airconditioned and did not smell moldy at all. What did have a hint of mold however was the thick blanket that was in our closet which we actually needed b/c our stay there was during their coldest winter week. I imagine anyone not visiting during their winter would never need this blanket which is probably why it smells a bit musty.....B/C no one ever needs it. 2. The buffet food is very good. The food that should be cold was and the food that should be warm was. Minor complaint is that some of the food that could have been a bit hotter, but overall the food was excellent. 3. The pool was freezing every day so we never got to use it. As for all these cons you should take them in context, which is to say that our stay here was during their coldest winter week. I imagine anyone traveling here ordinarily would (1) never need the thick blanket and (2) be happy the pool was on the colder side as it would probably be refreshing from that hot sun. The Pros: Our check in was easy breezy & we received drinks from the front desk as they explained how to find our way around the hotel (btw there are 5 Riu's all next to each other which you have access to as well for EVERYTHING except that dinner must be eaten at your hotel); Even though it was their winter we had a blast on the beach, swam in the water which was super warm and inviting, had staff available to bring us drinks on the beach; We found the buffet & the restaurants more than satisfactory with an ample variety to suit anyones needs; We felt safe, well fed, and relaxed our entire stay. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good bang for their buck. We are already looking forward to booking another vacation at this Resort.

Reviews.Title: “best of everything”
Reviews.Author: kaugie
Reviews.Content: stayed at RIU Palace Mexico for 1 week decenber 7th.everything was 1st class.i have stayed in 5 diffrent parts of mexico 9 times and nothing can come close to this.the 1 review who said that the rooms were mouldy so they switched to RIU Santa Fe?? there is no such hotel in this part of mexico.it is in Cabo San Lucas.no mould in our room.housekeeping was great(maybe tip once in a while) ate at a couple ala cartes,which were good,but preferred the buffet,it changed its theme every day and the variety was unbelievable(including lobster tails) grounds were immaculate.staff were friendly.people who say that the drinks are watered down do not know what they are talking about,why would they water down the drinks,i had several shots of don julio (premium tequila) during my stay and believe me they were not watered down,besides there is a bar in your room.those bottles are full.lobby was very fancy and all staff was great.pool temp was perfect. after being in the hot sun ,you want to be refreshed,not dive into a hot tub.only draw back(if you could call it one) the hotel gets very quiet very early,so if you want to party,go to the RIU Tequila across the street,the guests at our hotel were allowed in the other 5 RIU 's in the area but only 1 other RIU was allowed in our hotel..would definitely go back again ,but doubt if i could get that good of a deal again.-Kevin ,vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly pleased”
Reviews.Author: sha58
Reviews.Content: I travelled alone with my 3 older children and we had a great time. I know people complained about getting in line for your ticket to make a dinner reservation, but if that was the only stress I had to deal with all day, I could handle it. We dined at 3 of the 4 restaurants - Krystal , their fusion one, was phenomenal ! That meal alone in a major city would have cost hundreds of dollars ! Myagi, the Japanese one, was excellent . La Bodega, the Brazillian, was okay. The service was fantastic . My daughter spoke fluent Spanish so once they knew this they preferred speaking with her. I loved the security of letting the 3 of them wander off to the other resorts on their own - we watched the college football game at Riu Tequilla. We took our own cab to Xel - Ha for snorkeling, tubing, cliff jumping and we had a delicious lunch there. I wish we could have stayed longer !

Reviews.Title: “All about Service”
Reviews.Author: NJexit4
Reviews.Content: I graded the categories like when you were in school. Overall Value = A First class flight and traveled during the busy week between Christmas and New Years I think the value was good. Room = B The room was large enough and had conveniences of stocked mini-bar, LCD tv, bidet toilet, and private balcony. Only problem was the bed was 2 separate twins next to each other (not very conducive for snuggling :) Location = B+ It took us 55 min to and from the airport. It's located in Playacar which is a secure gated community within Playa del Carmen. The hotel is adjacent to a small shopping plaza with a starbucks and a Santander bank that will convert dollars and an ATM for cash withdrawal (trans fee is 7.5 pesos and my US bank (TD) did not charge me a fee). The shopping plaza is the pickup stop for many offsite excursions. Riu Palace Mexico is also surrounded by 4 additional Riu hotels that have all-inclusive reciprocity with the palace (except for dinner meals). Cleanliness = B+ The rooms, lobby, restaurants and bathrooms were all very clean. As referenced by some other reviewers there is a faint musty smell throughout. This is due to the proximity to the ocean and the age of the hotel (something that would be hard pressed to avoid for an older charming hotel on the water). Service = A+ The service makes the hotel. The staff are very friendly, hard working and do not miss a beat. You will be brought drinks as you lay in the hammock on the beach…. Entertainment = B+ You will be surprised at how well they coordinate the entertainment. They have bands on the beach during the day and nightly shows and music in the theatre or in the courtyard. The grounds are gorgeous and make for a relaxing enjoyable evening. However, if you are looking to party like a rock star you may want to consider Cancun, no yelling, screaming and vomiting at the Riu Palace. The hotel truly caters to every age group. If you do crave a nightclub the Riu across the street has a disco. Food = B Let's not confuse service with food. The service is excellent but the food is adequate and there are many cases where the food really exceeds expectations. The buffet has a strong selection and there are variations every evening. The house wine is a choice between a decent Mexican or Portuguese red or white and your glass will never be empty. If you are looking to enhance your zagat-like diary you may want to avoid all-inclusive all together. The worst thing about the hotel is the need to arrange for the restaurants reservations. It will remind you of standing out in line for tix for your favorite rock star. Folks will bolt in like cockroaches at 8AM sharp for a number in line for reservations. Beach = A+ The beach is wonderful. The beach is structured in two tiers: first tier follows the pool and has much shade under the palm trees, hammocks and volleyball. The next tier is in the hot sun in front of the ocean. We didn't have much trouble finding chairs during the busy holiday week. You can do everything or nothing. Gym = C- The gym is not so good. The machines were old, there was one pitcher of water available and it was hot in the work-out room. If you train religiously you may want to check-out one of the other Riu gyms in the area. Spa = B + Spa massages and hair treatments are available but for an extra fee. There is an option to get a message on the beach (many folks took advantage of this). Also, the rear of the spa outside has a heated Jacuzzi. Some of the previous reviewers were not bright enough to figure this out. Activities = A+ Daily activities from rifle shooting, volleyball, dancing lessons and horseshoes and non-motor ocean water sport items are available for fun in the ocean. Other fee activities like scuba trips, Jet Ski, and parasailing are conveniently arranged on the beach. Cancun Airport = D Obviously not a fault of the hotel but worth mentioning in this review. Prepare for chaos at (CUN) airport. There is little information or notification of what is going on. There are also droves of people looking to solicit you to drive to your hotel, sell you a trip or whatever else. Arrange for transportation in advance and get a private ride. You will already be tired from a long flight and an impending 55 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “A great all-inclusive getaway”
Reviews.Author: Sh5fam
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (mom, dad, a 15 year-old and 11 year-old twins) stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from Dec 19th to Dec. 25th. We were looking for a week of fun and sun at an all-inclusive resort and this is exactly what we got. We found the hotel beautiful, the staff extremely professional, friendly and helpful and the Playacar beach area lovely. Here are a few of our observations/recommendations.... * The hotel is approximately 50 mins. (with no traffic) from the Cancun airport. Arrange for transportation to pick you up from the airport and make sure that the representative who approaches you is from the specific service you hired. It is very important that they show you your name on their manifold. Be aware, there are literally hundreds on solicitors outside the arrival gate just waiting to give you a ride while they attempt to sell you timeshares, hotel alternatives, excursions, etc. * The check-in at the hotel was quick and painless. The front desk staff is extremely well trained. * The rooms are very nice and spacious, but don't expect serious luxury. They were more than adequate for a beach vacation. * The hotel grounds are immaculate and beautifully landscaped. The pool is nice....it is actually 2 separate pools, each in a semi-circular design. We generally found the water a bit cold and like most guests, actually preferred to swim in the warmer ocean. Management should consider heaters. The jacuzzi was simply a smaller pool with water jets, but not heated...we were a bit surprised by this. Get to the pool early each day or lounge chairs won’t be available. * The beach is beautiful, but be prepared for the man-made erosion barriers that all the hotels beaches have in front of them. One could argue that they take away from the aesthetics, but many beach-goers (including us) found that they were fun to climb on. Water sports are available for an additional fee. * The gym and spa were well appointed. There were plenty of aerobic and weight equipment (part of the all-inclusive package)...spa services were extra. * Riu has many hotels in the area. The Palace hotels (Mexico and Riviera Maya) are the two "high-end" resorts and guests of either can use the amenities at all the Riu hotels in the area. All guests must eat dinner at their respective hotels. * The food is pretty much what you would expect from an all-inclusive resort....plenty of it, but not particularly noteworthy. However, it was always fresh and there was quite a variety. As for the water, we typically drank bottled, but we also had water served from a pitcher several times and no one in our family had any stomach ailments. The waiters and waitresses were excellent and always helpful and friendly. We often left a gratuity at the table. * The entertainment at night is amateurish, but still fun to watch. The one main complaint we had was the lack of activity after dinner. However, Playa Del Carmen is only a 5 minute taxi ride and is a fun way to spend the evening. In addition, we enjoyed visiting the other hotels that were in close proximity. * The one regret we had was not visiting Cozumel (approx 45 min. ferry ride). We were told it has beautiful beaches and good snorkeling. * There are a few adventure parks within a half hour taxi ride from the resort that looked like fun, although if you only have a week in Mexico it may be difficult to find the time to go. * We took a taxi to Tulum (approx one hour). There are beautiful Mayan ruins on the shore. They were truly spectacular. You can see everything you want in about one hour. * On our departure date, we were picked up from the hotel at 3:30pm for our 7:00pm flight home. The hotel gave us a one-hour extension for check-out and allowed us to store our bags with the bellhop so that we could continue to use of the resort until our departure. Overall, our family considers our recent visit to Riu Palace Mexico as one of our better trips. The area is beautiful, the hotel is lovely and the staff is extremely well trained and genuinely very friendly. If we found ourselves back in the Playacar (Playa Del Carmen) area we would definitely come back to Riu Palace Mexico or maybe even try the Riu Palace Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Food”
Reviews.Author: Ruby75Toronto
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed by this hotel. I think that you will find that this is a balanced review. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and our room was very spacious. The beach is quite nice and there is a lot of natural shade from the palm trees. However.... There are many problems with this resort: 1. I agree with the other reviews that the rooms are moldy; 2. The food was absolutely disgusting. The food was left sitting out for ages. Food that should be hot was cold. Food that should be cold was warm. The buffets were all the same. It was difficult to get reservations at the a la carte restaurants. Dinner does not start until 6:30 which is too late if you have young children. We stayed in Cuba a few years ago at a Melia resort and the food was actually better. Every time we ate we crossed our fingers that we would not get sick. We overheard a lot of complaints about the food from other people as well; 3. The drinks are watered down; 4. Don't plan on swimming in the pool --- it is freezing; 5. Some of our clothes that were sent to the laundry service disappeared. We will never stay at a Riu Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Riu”
Reviews.Author: jmcteer
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico. We stayed the week of Dec. 14th - 21st. We have stayed in all of the major resort locations in Mexico but this was our first time to the Mayan Riviera. I will tell you now that if you are looking for an honest review by a person that understand what all inclusives are about than this is the review for you. For example, a mosquito bite can't ruin my trip and I understand that the hotels don't control the weather. I go away to have a great time and enjoy myself and the Riu More than held up their end of the deal this year. I will break my review into sections for those of you who are looking for specific information. The bus ride from the airport: This is very painless and is no reason not to go to Playa The Location: This hotel was the first hotel that we have stayed at that was located in a subdivision. Outside the hotel there are lots of houses (vacation homes I assume as there is lots of golf nearby) there is a street with sidewalks that takes you in to Playa Del Carmen (5th Ave. is the place to go, $5 cab from the resort). There is also a smaller market with the usual Mexican shopping and a Starbucks if you are craving one. If you are looking for deals this is not the place to go. There are also some smaller ruins about 10 min from the resort if you walk to the right out of the entrance of the resort. This is great for people who want to see ruins while they are there but aren't willing to give up a day on the beach to see the larger ruins. The Hotel: The hotel was very clean. If you have ever been to a Riu before than you know they keep everything looking spotless at all times. The front desk staff are usually helpful and there is almost always one front desk member who speaks English very well. Our check in was fast. They brought us all a drink to have during check in as they always have done at the Riu's we have visited before. Our luggage was taken to our rooms by the staff and we were down on the beach by 2pm to enjoy the rest of the day. The Beach: The beach is great. There are large sandbags out front of most of the resorts that are there to help rebuild the beach after it was destroyed by the hurricanes. So far it is working very well and the beach is getting bigger every year. While some people claim that the sandbags are somewhat of an eye sore I will disagree strongly. Not only are they there for a purpose but they have also attracted a small amount of sea life which makes snorkeling out front of the resort much more enjoyable. If you are looking for more of a snorkeling adventure there is a boat that goes out to the reef every day for an hour tour for $29. I didn't get a chance to do it but I spoke with some people who did and they said it was well worth it. They saw lots of fish and sea turtles etc. The Pool: This is the only area that I have some criticism of the resort. The pool is not anything special. if you don't care about the pool then read on but as a pool lover I was somewhat disappointed. That being said, since you are staying at the Riu Palace you have access to all of the other surrounding Riu's and they all have very nice pools (especially the other Riu Palace just down the beach to the left). We actually spent a day at the other Palace sitting by their pool. It is the best of all. The Rooms: They are all junior suites which means there is a sunken living area with a couch (hide-a-bed) and small plasma screens (probably 24 inches or so). But then again if you going away to watch TV save yourself the money and stay home. The bathroom was spotless and the shower head was one of the best I have seen in a hotel/resort. The housekeepers always leave a new towel animal every day and remember to tip these people as they work very hard and make very little (a couple $ a day). We left our housekeeper a $20 tip at the end of the week. A big tip can really go a long way with the staff at the resort. Each room also has a minibar and in room liquor dispensers that are filled every other day but if you run out you can always call the front desk and they will bring you whatever you need. Since it is a Palace there is also 24hr room service. The Food: The food was possibly the best we had ever had. All inclusive food is just that. Don't go in expecting to eat 5 star restaurant food that would cost around $50 a plate at home because you will be terribly disappointed. The buffets are much like they would be in Canada/US. I will say that the Piazza at this resort was outstanding if you like pizza. The a la carte restaurants are a different story. We ate at all of them but the Steakhouse. The Asian restaurant was great. Don't be scared to order the beef, it is actually quite good, not your typical Mexican steak. I had the salmon which was also good. The fine dining restaurant called Fusion was our best meal of the week. Take my advice and have the ravioli, the steak and whatever desert you like. I would have been happy to pay $30 -$40 for that meal at home. However, keep in mind that all inclusive resorts are sometimes inconsistent so don't hold me to my word. La Bodega which is a Brazillian Rodizio style restaurant was also good, but if you are not a meat eater than don't bother going there. Nightlife: The nightlife at the Palace is pretty weak. All is quite by around 1130 pm but if you want to party late into the night just walk across the street to the Riu Tequila and go to the Disco. Or if you are looking for something more go Into town. We went to Coco Bongo one night ($50 all inclusive, talk to the entertainment team about tickets). It was amazing, If you have been to coco bongo or any other Cancun bar then you know what I'm talking about. If you are looking to party then this is the place to go. Again it is a $5 cab ride there and back. Summary: Our trip to the Riu Place was great, even thought the weather was the worst we had ever seen in all our trips to mexico we all had a great time and would be happy to go back. If this is the hotel you decide to go to enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Did not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: familyhohoho
Reviews.Content: Pros: - good food variety compared to other hotels nearby (we checked them out), especially the specialty restaurants - nice clean room (we stayed in 2003) - the free water activities (kayak, snorkling, catamaran, etc.) keep us occupied - very friendly hotel staff Cons: - reservation system of specialty restaurant. You have to be very early (8am) to get the seating and restaurant you want - pool a bit too cold

Reviews.Title: “Love the Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: RoninOKCOK
Reviews.Content: In October 2009, my wife and I took our 7th trip to the Riu Palace Mexico and found the magic still there. The location, the service, the staff, and the food are all excellent. This is the hotel that took such good care of us during Hurricane Wilma in 2005 and is still taking good care of us today. I have some difficulty understanding how some visitors could complain about staff members. I have seen these wonderful people respond courteously to some of the most unreasonable requests. Santoyo, Omar, Tony, Manuel, and Merisal are just a few of the wonderful staff we have become friends with over the years. The rooms at the Riu Palace Mexico are terrific, comfortable, and clean. Since we first started coming, they have gone to different, more comfortable mattresses, but even the old ones were fine, if not a little stiff. The beach is still the best in the Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “My best all around hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobbyjim_9
Reviews.Content: We went to RPM from the 13th to the 20th of December. It took us 1:50 hour to get to the hotel buy bus because it made 5 stops to different hotels before reaching our destination and upon return 4stops (usually it takes 50 min.) this was with Sunquest. Upon arrival at the hotel, they greeted us with a glass of punch and the check went smoothly and fast as we were only 4 checking in ... There are 434 rooms in the complex . Our room was situated in the middle of the complex, when facing the beach it was on the left side. We were in room 2116 on the 3rd floor. On our balcony we could see the plants and the fence close to the Whynham not a good view. We could hear the disco every night....till 1 o’clock. ROOM: The room was big with 2 double beds, a living area, a 22 inch flat TV. a stocked fridge, umbrella, iron and ironing board, hair blower, a bar with 4 bottles of hard liquor. There was enough place to put away all of our clothes and accessories .There was also a free room safe The only thing missing was a fan in the washroom.....They made the room every day and also a turn down service...You can order breakfast by leaving a card on your door before midnight every night. Also you can order food from a menu 24 hours....in the room.... BEACH: The beach is nice white sand and the water green, turquoise with not too many waves especially if you stand close to the sand dunes...There is a lot of chairs available all day in the shade or in the sun....Not a problem if you arrive late....There is a beach bar and some activities all day (volley ball, spanish lessons, stretching etc....) We saw only a few vendors on the beach. You can walk on either side but the sand is deep and is a bit hard to walk on ...The RPM has the nicest beach from all the others hotels around ....There is massages on the beach....... SWIMMING POOLS There are 2 swimming pools . The right pool is the quiet one . The one on the left is the one with all the activities ,the bar and the towels.. Lots of chairs in the sun or in the shade at anytime during the day.. COMPLEX The resort is very nice and beautiful. From the lobby with its big chandelier and marble floors to the outside trees, flowers and bushes......Well decorated and well maintained… the only hick is the ladies washroom in the lobby and near the restaurants, you can always wash your hands but the blower to dry does not work accurately when it works. The same can be said for the one at the beach.There is nightly shows and they are very good as the entertainers and the dancers are professionals form mexico .There is also a new band every night before and after the shows. Vendors are outside the theatre almost every night(prices are a bit high). There is wireless internet and internet that you can buy at $8.00an hour... SPA AND EXERCISE There is a spa and exercise room but we did not use them… Kids Club There is one but we did not use it RESTAURANTS There is one buffet and 4 a la carte restaurants.... BREAKFAST:The buffet from 7.00 to 10.30 or El Patio from 10.30 to 12.00 for continental LUNCH : there are 3 that you can go , the buffet and the 2 between the beach and the pool...El Patio or La traviata from 12.00 to 3.00 o’clock... . Dinner : The 4 a la carte restaurant that you need to reserve in the morning from 8.30 to 10.00 at the theater.... ..For that day only, this is not a good option, we should be able to reserve for at least 2 days (Steakhouse, Japanese, Fusion and Brazilian. We tried the Brazilian and the Fusion and they were good.... Buffet: From 6.30 to 10.00 pm. A new theme every night ...We went 5 nights and it was always very good. The SERVICE was the key factor in this hotel. That is why it is a 5 star. They go out of their way to make your stay very special. We went to Playa del Carmen a few times by taxi and it costs 50 pesos or $5.00 to go anywhere in Playa del Carmen.(10 minutes away).....Very safe place even if you walk, it will take you about 45 minutes to go to 5th avenue for shopping......a must …. OVERALL We did 16 trips to 4,4.5 and 5 stars hotels and this is the best overall so far..Do not hesitate to go there …..i would go back tomorow.....

Reviews.Title: “Good if you are traveling with kids... but would not go back”
Reviews.Author: LL1975
Reviews.Content: Pros First: Good service friendly staff (except for one cranky rep) great pool, especially for the kids (its big and not too deep) yummy drinks by the pool beautiful beach, white sand nice grounds buffets was great for kids (kid friendly food)...great fresh fruit and avacados unlimited drinks (if you like to drink)...even had top shelf stuff all inclusive mini bar in the room (full of soda and water - restocked every day) casual atmosphere late night entertainment (fun when there is nothing else to do at night) easy flight and airport transfer nice town for shopping and strolling - about 5 minute taxi ride Xcharet about 20 minutes away Cons: far ride from the airport - about 45 min - 1 hour room: needs renovation. old, musty smell, very hard beds, stained sheets, stained old bed cover, scratchy blanket, gross couch with stained apholstery, only 3 working outlets, tap water is not filtered, roaches!!! we killed 5 or 6 over the course of our stay. they were mainly in the closet and the bathroom. it was disgusting. gym: old treadmill, no free weights, old equipment, no towels beach: the ocean is not the perfect calm caribean blue....choppy water, high waves food: 3 star at most, silly reservation process for their 5 restaurants. reservations are taken between 12p - 3p. if you miss it you have to eat dinner at the buffet. its relatively okay for an all inclusive

Reviews.Title: “Yet again Faultless.”
Reviews.Author: golferjeff345
Reviews.Content: We stayed at RPM 29th November to 13th December, and yet again we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We have been going now for 5 years, and in total spend 5 weeks per year there. If we thought there was anything wrong with this hotel, then we would not be sitting on a plane for almost 11 hours twice a year. What we have noticed over our visits are people who are getting so rude to staff, it is at times embarrassing. Just because the hotels name has "Palace" in it, does not mean that you as a guest, have the right to treat the fantastic staff as slaves. They work so hard to keep everyone happy, and to make sure that all your requests are seen to. When we hear the food is substandard, then we wonder what on earth is wrong with lobster, shrimp, smoked salmon, crab, mussels, red snapper, the list is endless. Remember this is an all inclusive hotel, and has to cater for a lot of nationalities, not just yourself. Remember that the hotel has other guests, not just yourself. Not once have we encountered any uncleanliness, mould, bugs or any other unlikely health hazzard. The amount of reviews that state the staff are rude and unhelpful are untrue. Dont forget, that unless you speak their language proficiently, then there is a language barrier. The smallest slip of the tongue will be lost in translation, which can cause frustration on both parts. All in all, this is a fantastic hotel, with fantastic staff, ranging from the gardeners, cleaners, waiters, chefs, bars staff, reception and all the way up to all managers. We certainly have not got any complaints, and are on the 14 day count down to return.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: cam30
Reviews.Content: go to this hotel. please dont take any notice of all these negative comments , these people would rip buckingham palace to shreds, they would simply not be happy where theh were or how much they spent, any traveller will know the kind of person i am referring to. any how that out of the way,WOW what a hotel food, service, drinks rooms staff , simply cant be beaten. we paid £2800 for 2 weeks of pure luxury, there may be more expensive hotels around ,but not better.the staff could not do enough for you, thats what comes of treating them with respect,and not like something you have just stood in, even if they are very poor , but they could also teach some of the guests from america or canada a thing or 2 about good manners.This place is heaven

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Canada”
Reviews.Author: thopholm1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by our travel agent, we will not use this travel agent again! Hotel is old, smells old, looks tired and feels tired. None of the rooms offer a view except of the court yard or trees off your balcony. There is lots of food to choose from but, it is not quality food. Instant masked potatoes that were like wallpaper paste, or, fried potatoes that were soggy, your choice... You will not go hungry, but do not think of meal times as a highlight to look forward to just use them as a way of getting enought energy so you can go back and play in the ocean some more because that is truly the hightlight of this hotel. Even though the sand bags are a blight on the landscape, it is still an awesome beach, the loungers are set out amongst palm trees if you like shade or lots set out in the sun for tanning. The staff were amazing, polite, mannerly, accomodating, you name it, they all deserve a standing ovation ! Tipping is not a " must" but, tipping shows good manners and that you care just like they do !! If humidity is an issue for you, do not go this far south, our bedding was damp the whole time and that is not something the staff can fix.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: stevenkath
Reviews.Content: Just having spend 12 nights at this fantasic hotel i had to let you all know we loved it, We travelled with a 6 month old baby from the uk to this hotel. After a ten hour flight it was great to stay here, Check in was great and the room well i dont think we could have had better, it was at the end of the block looking out to sea. The service in this hotel was 5star all the way, you never sat down for more than a 3o seconds and a waiter would be over to ask if you wanted anything, each time they take your glass another one comes to you, all the soft drinks come in bottles and the beers this is real all inclusive!!!!!!! waiter service around the pool on the beach in the buffet resturant it was great...... you realise this after all all inc week in europe this last week... The only thing that i didnt think was great was the specialality resturants i though they where in fact poor. The beach was great as well...... loved it...

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: agass
Reviews.Content: Service: A+ Food: C to C+ -- somehow got a bit better as the week went on. I guess hunger contributes. Drinks: B Property: A Speacilty Restaurants: D- (you can't make sushi with Uncle Ben's rice)

Reviews.Title: “HORRIFIC EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: greengirl97
Reviews.Content: For all of you that are looking for excellent customer service and a hotel that meets your expectation "PLEASE DON'T STAY AT THE RIU PALACE". My husband and I was celebrating our 8th year wedding anniversary. We had to sleep on a hard matress, our room had the smell of mold and basement etc. We were treated like they gave the vacaction to us free of charge and as if I didn't spend my hard earned money??? Management was the worst I have ever seen. Please spend your hard earned money else where!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach, Good Service, Tired Rooms, Bad Outdoor Buffet”
Reviews.Author: DarrellsGirl
Reviews.Content: Spent the week after the US Thanksgiving holiday here for "fun in the sun." We chose this place for it's proximity to el Centro Playa del Carmen and great beach; mission accomplished. The crowd at this RIU is firmly over forty and the majority from Europe. There were kids at this resort. The more I travel the pickier I get - so I may be beginning to turn into "one of those fussy" people! You've been advised. Manuel greeted us (and everyone) with a same warm welcome - every time we ran into him. What an asset to the hotel. Our room was on the third level - one elevator in each wing of the hotel building, no problem for us, we are mobile and were grazing every few hours so needed the stairs to work some of it off. If you have mobility issues - this place may not be a good fit. The room itself was just ok - we didn't pay for or get much of a view. The balcony had a full cement railing/wall - and the space very small. If you sat in the chair you stared at cement - that's it. On one side of the hall rooms had a courtyard view and a few were facing the ocean. RIU needs new linens - towels and sheets clean but a little tattered. Lighting throughout the space was an issue. Tub area was basically dark. Good water pressure and modern appliances. Air conditioning was LAME - hard to sleep. There is also a weird matress pad that had a "moisture" (?) barrier that made it even hotter. Pillows were very firm. The two double beds put together was odd - but I knew about that from reading other reviews. There were a lot of housekeepers and our room was made up quickly each day. We didn't order room service. When we arrived around 3 pm - we were hungry and tried the outdoor buffet by the pool/beach - my first impression was really bad - it did improve with future experiences but just slightly. Messy counters, overheated food, not a lot of choice, dried-out desserts. The indoor Don Julian Buffett was very good, lots of choices and food was freshly prepared. Very good Mexican choices everywhere. And fake "nacho" cheese for us Yankees :-) I wasn't too impressed with any of the reservation-only restaurants - they were good, not great. One notable experience; a great Filet Mignon at the reservation restaurant El Patio. Don't know why everyone thinks Krystal is so great. (What is that Avocado Foam anyway?) I didn't find any Mayan coffee being prepared at any restaurant - that's one treat I look forward to when visiting Mexico. The regular coffee was strong - not in a good way. We like to drink Iced Tea and it wasn't offered. Soda pop offering; Pepsi products. The liquor selection was ok. No Grand Marnier, or 43 for apres dinner. Great beach. Lots of chaise lounge chairs at the beach and plenty of palm tree shade - no palapas (none needed). Ok bar service at the beach - mostly a tray with a few selections to choose from. Just FYI a lot of small bathing suits and lots of skin showing. One nudie hooter mama was standing closeby watching an afternoon beach wedding and managed to get noticed enough to get herself in a pic with the groom and best man - nice memory for the bride, eh?! Just my little editorial - I guess if you get married on the busy beach - that might happen! Pool area nice, a little older, offered a lot of padded loungers with umbrellas - I liked that - but spent most of my sun time at the beach. The theatre was very small compared to others - the "shows" were ok. Not a lot of nightlife at this RIU. Nice live music in the plaza courtyard each evening. Only one little convenience store on site - but you are a short walk to the little outdoor mall in this Playacar gated community. Many evening walkers and full or part time residents out in this community. A relaxing time, probably will try another hotel in the same area at some future time. Would recommend, but with caveats - not my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious! Ruined my wedding day.”
Reviews.Author: rieb16
Reviews.Content: I recently got married at the Riu Palace Mexico. During my stay there my group and I were treated very poorly and unfairly and my wedding day was basically ruined. Our wedding coordinator at the resort was very reluctant to work with me on anything from the beginning. I had trouble dealing with her even before we got to Mexico. The resort as a whole was simply unable to cater to our large group of 59 people. We were told only a few weeks before the wedding that groups of 27 or more people would have to eat dinner at the late seating which was at 8:45pm. This wouldn't have been a problem except for the fact that we were going to spend $1300 extra dollars to rent out the disco for a reception. They also told us we could spend $700 more dollars to rent out one of the restaurants, but that all 59 people in our party would have to eat the same one dish that we chose for them. In a group of 60, its just about impossible to assume everyone will be able to eat either beef, chicken or fish. We were also told that if we wanted cocktails at the reception, it would cost an extra $9 per person (even though everyone had already paid for alcohol in their all-inclusive resort package). Between all the money we were spending on the Caprice package (the most expensive wedding package), the fact that we were bringing 60 people to their resort during an off season, and knowing that it was an all-inclusive resort, we really felt like they should have been able to work with us on some of these costs. Of course, tropical storm Ida decided she wanted to join us they day of the wedding, so it needed to be moved inside. Understanding that this was in no way the resort's fault, we just tried to stay positive when we were told the ceremony would need to be held in the resort's theater. Prior to this, several people in our group had actually witnessed a wedding in the resort's lobby the day before and said it was very nice, so we were optimistic. When I asked if we could have our ceremony in the lobby instead like the other couple, we were told "Oh, those people paid a lot of extra money to have their ceremony in the lobby." REALLY? They paid more to have it in the LOBBY??? How come I didn't see that in the list of add-ons? How come that option was never even mentioned to me, I had to bring it up? And then when I did, suddenly there would be another expense? Why would it possibly cost more to have the service in the lobby versus the theater? It wasn't going to cost the resort any more. But honestly, I was just too exhausted to fight with her anymore at that point, so I just gave in, thinking the theater might be better than I was imagining. But no, the theater was atrocious. All they did was add an arch and, other than that, it was just the theater. I walked down an aisle formed out of pink velvet theater chairs!!! An aisle so thin that my father and I could barely fit down it. My dress kept hitting those horrible velvet chairs to the point where we almost fell over. My photos are hideous because I was surrounded by a sea of pink velvet chairs, lace curtains, horrible pink patterned carpet and ceiling fans!! We actually downgraded our photo package after-the-fact because there were only a handful that were actually any good. Not to mention we didn't hear a word from our coordinator or anyone else on the wedding staff the second after the ceremony started. No one checked in to see if everything went ok. No one tried to contact us to follow up and see if we were happy with the ceremony or if there was anything else they could do to help. I was simply appalled at the lack of customer service we received the entire time we were dealing with the resort. Oh, but we're not done. Outside of just the wedding issues we had, we were also unable to make reservations at any of the specialty restaurants, except for the Brazilian steakhouse. For as large as the resort is, only 2 of the 4 specialty restaurants are open every night (again, showing they are unable, or just unwilling, to cater to the large amount of people who were staying there, even in an off month). And I'd be surprised if each restaurant had more than 50 seats. And in order to try and secure one of these precious seats, you had to get up at 7am to make sure you were one of the first 50 people in line at 8am when the reservations table opened up, in hopes you could get in.
