Oh, and if it was any time after 10:30am, the reservations table was closed and there was no way to make a reservation anywhere, even at the Brazilian restaurant. Maybe this is the way all of the resorts in Playa del Carmen do things, but I've been to very nice resorts in both Cancun and Puerta Vallarta and NEVER had to deal with so many rules and limitations. And to top it all off, at least half of my guests, including myself, went home with bronchitis and sinus infections - almost positively due to the poor ventilation systems in the rooms. Several of my guests actually asked to have their rooms switched the first day they arrived because of leaks in the roofs and musty odors. For a resort that claims to be five star, you certainly could have fooled us. And, some of our guests/groomsmen also almost slipped and fell while walking down the aisle and when members of the wedding party informed the coordinator that the floor was slippery and wet she simply wiped it up with a piece of paper and proceeded to toss that trash onto a nearby table in what was supposed to be my beautiful wedding room. Appalled by this, one of the groomsmen actually had to throw the paper away or she would of just left it there. Also, while myself and my bridesmaids were getting ready for the wedding in one of our rooms, we requested a bottle of champagne that we never received and had to trudge down to the lobby bar to get drinks for all 5 girls in the wedding party plus my mother and grandmother, and when we requested help back to the room with them, so not to spill them, we were rudely told no by the wait staff so I had to get my cousin to come help us. The worst part is, I only get to have a wedding once... and my day was ruined. I just really expected the resort to take more care with such a special day. So now, I just want to make sure no other bride as to go through what I did. The Riu is NOT the place to stay in Mexico, no matter the reason you are visiting. STAY AWAY FROM RIU RESORTS!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place/Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: DesireeA
Reviews.Content: We went in September and it was extremely hot....burnt on the 1st day...Would love to go back...amazing place & amazing, friendly people...Absolutely fantastic holiday and well worth the cost of getting there...your waited on hand a foot...

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation”
Reviews.Author: melrockit
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the RIU. It exceeded our expectations. From the moment we arrived to the day we departed, the service was fantastic. If we were thirsty someone gave us a drink, if we were hungry we just had to go to one of the many great restaurants. Everything was very clean, from our rooms to the pool. We have been to several all inclusives in Cancun and this is by far the best. If you can find something to complain about at this resort you better just stay at home because you won't find a more luxurious resort. We highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely holiday .”
Reviews.Author: MarianneD2
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel . Very Clean. Everyday differend food for everyone to choose .The staff is is lovely and working hard .The rooms are nice and clean , every day clean towels .You can eat and drink as much as you like .Next time i choose the same hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Location for relaxing - see tips”
Reviews.Author: ATL-travel71
Reviews.Content: Here is our review/tips about our Nov. 15-Nov. 20, 2009 5-night visit to the Riu Palace Mexico. We have only been to Playa Del Carmen once over 10 years ago and it has changed tremendously. Lobby/Check-in: Very nice, large lobby area and they greet you quickly when you arrive. Front desk was very helpful for all our needs. You can cash traveller's checks for pesos. They can arrange travel to the airport (see note below). They can also tell you who to talk to if you want to leave the resort for an excursion one day. Grounds: Extravagant fountains in the center of the resort as seen in the pictures. The grounds were kept up nicely. Rooms: We had a standard room facing out to a garden area and the room was great. It was large with a nice flat screen TV with quite a few channels. There was a fully stocked bar and mini-fridge with water, sodas & beer. Bathroom was fine and the water pressure was good. A/C worked very well. There was a small balcony with seating. The beds were two full-size beds pushed together which was odd. They were pretty hard, but we slept on them just fine. I was more worried from other reviews. Pool: Nice pool(s) surrounding a bar (walk-up and swim-up). There was usually plenty of loungers for the pool. One side was quieter than the other, so you have a choice on preference. Overall, there were very few children at the resort. Beach: The beach was large with plenty of loungers. There were always plenty in the shade, but usually a few free in the sun as well. Water was clear and they had those sand whales, but that didn't bother us. There is no beach drink service, though they sometimes have staff bring down some random drinks to pass around. Restaurants: There is a main buffet restaurant with indoor and patio seating. It is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. You have to wear a shirt for breakfast & lunch. Men have to wear long pants for dinner. It's got quite a variety of food and we felt it was very good given our expectations. It's not gourmet by any means. There are two restaurants between the pool & beach that are open for lunch mainly. They too had decent food you would expect for that type of setting. Service was good in these restaurants and you could get any drink you wanted with any meal (even Mimosas at breakfast). Specialty Restaurants: There are four specialty restaurants and we went to three of them (Fusion, Japanese, Steakhouse, missed Brazilian). We liked all the specialty restaurants and the service at them. Men must wear pants and short/long sleeve dress shirts (pants rule is strict, you might be able to get away with anything that isn't a t-shirt). We liked the Fusion restaurant the best. All the food was quite good. It was better than the general restaurants, so we recommend them. See tips below for booking tips. Bars: There are about five or so bars and they are all open at various times. The piano bar off the lobby is nice before dinner and they probably serve the best drinks. Mixed drinks did seem watered down a bit, but you could get stronger ones by getting to know the staff and doing some tipping. Other Riu resorts: We didn't visit the other resorts even though it was allowed. We didn't see a point since you could only eat lunch there and that was probably similar to our resort's. I think there might be a dance club at one of the resorts. Spa/Gym/Tennis: We didn't use any of these, but they were available. We did play sand volleyball and pool volleyball a couple of times. They had other activities as well throughout the day. Shopping: You can walk directly across the street for a small shopping center with a Starbucks. However, I highly recommend walking (20+ mins) or taking a $5 cab ride to Playa del Carmen for at least one lunch and one dinner. We did and 5th avenue is great for shopping and eating. We ate at Carboncitas for dinner and 100% Natura for lunch. Both of those were excellent Mexican places since the resort didn't have too much Mexican (which was surprising). In Playa Del Carmen, you can always try to negotiate on price. Service: This was somewhat of a negative at first. It felt like the friendliest staff were only the ones trying to sell/upsell you something (like Scuba Caribe). After we did some tipping and got to know some of the staff, they were much friendlier. You should go out of your way to be nice and they'll warm up to you quicker. Helpful Hints: Travel from the Airport: If you don't have transporation arranged ahead of time, be careful. Someone will probably try to help you even though they are trying to sell you something (like excursions). We ended up taking a grey-line shuttle for $30 per person and it was fine. Taxi fares were quoted at $90 which seemed really high. Supposedly, there was an ADO bus that would take you directly to Playa Del Carmen, but we didn't see any signs of it. Tipping: It is not required, but we felt tips in either pesos or US dollars were greatly appreciated. The attention we recieved was higher by tipping just minimally. Money: I'd advise getting some local money (pesos) when you are there. It's absolutely not required since everyone takes US dollars or Euros even in Playa Del Carmen. However, many things are priced so you ge a better deal in pesos rather than dollars/euros. Also, when tipping it may be better to tip in pesos depeding on how much you want to tip (ie. 20 pesos instead of 2 dollars). Travel back to Airport: We booked a taxi back to the airport a couple of days ahead at the front desk for $65 which is actually a good rate. However, the desk associate set it for 2 hours before our flight. When we showed up that morning, they said we really needed to get to the airport 3-4 hours before the flight. This was quite stressful to say the least. As it turns out, it takes about an hour to travel to Cancun and the airport wasn't terribly crowded, so we didn't have any troubles at all. I'd recommend giving yourself more time than we did because I think we were very lucky. The outbound terminal from Cancun to US was very nice (Duty free, restaurants, etc...) Other Riu Resorts: Do not confuse this resort (Riu Palace Mexico) with a very similar resort (Riu Palace Riviera Maya). We did and we ended up going to the wrong one at first. So, it was a $5 taxi ride to the other one which was 10 minutes away (we would have walked, but we had our luggage). Beach: There is no beach drink service, so you might want to pack some larger drink tumblers to fill up on way to beach. It's a short walk back to the beach bar, but the cups they give are terribly small (8 oz maybe). Specialty restaurants: Booking must be done from 8:30-10:30am in the Salon bar in front of these restaurants. They hand out numbers around 8am and they call numbers at 8:30. If you want a 6:30 seating, you probably need to get there around 8am. If you are ok with an 8:45 seating, then you can be later. We at at 8:45 each night and didn't have a problem. We got our number at just before 8:30am and were done in 15-20 mins. Also, some restaurants are closed on some nights, so check the whole week ahead or you might miss one you want to try. Internet: Bring your laptop/netbook for free WIFI in lobby/bar. Otherwise, you have to play to use resort supplied laptop time. No access in rooms. Security: If you leave the resort, you should feel very safe. The resorts are in a gated community with high end housing all the way to Playa del carman. Playa del Carmen has police roaming the town, so it's very safe. The retailers will call out to you to visit thier store constantly. Most of them don't really expect you to do so. You should just be polite, smile and say no thank you if you are not interested.

Reviews.Title: “Once again....a wonderful time at the Palace.”
Reviews.Author: MicleleL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 10 nights at the Palace Mexico. We have done the RIU Palace Riviera Maya the past 2 years and decided to return to the Palace Mexico. They are both wonderful; excellent staff, delicous food, wonderful suites. I think the pools are better at the RM but the beach is better at the Mexico. The RM is closer to Playa Del Carmen but the Mexico is closer to Playacar and the other RIU Resorts....either way...you can't go wrong booking at a Palace. Palace Mexico is getting a little worn and due for an facelift but is really is still very beautiful. Say Hola to Abraham and Tony....great staff members!

Reviews.Title: “holiday”
Reviews.Author: NeringaK
Reviews.Content: Cosy hotel , from all Riu hotels i liked that one the best. Nice area, good service, food. Coctails not too good , I can rate it not 5* but 4, 4+

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: thomaso275
Reviews.Content: We were there from Oct 26 to Oct 31. Off-season - so the deal was great and hotel was not crowded. Weather perfect, service exceptional, mature crowd. Food was great - breakfast and dinner at different restaurants each nite were the highlights. Did I mention super service. Rooms very comfortable, firm beds which we like. Plety of chairs for the beach, plenty of shade if you want it. Overall, a top vacation spot. Speak some spanish if you can

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: Thejimenez
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the riu palace on October 16- october 23 2009. Its a great place to stay. The staff is incredible they are so polite and nice, the food is great , great entertaiment. We cannot complain about a single thing. Our room was very spacious clean. I recommend this place to anyone that wants to be pampered, This is the place to stay in playa del carmen. Its a true Palace. The Jimenez

Reviews.Title: “Four Nights Were Too Short”
Reviews.Author: glorya14
Reviews.Content: We spent four very pleasant nights at the Riu Palace Mexico from October 27 to the 31st. Yes, there is a musty odor that permeates the entire lobby area and inside corridors as well as our room, but I attribute this to the climate and not to upkeep. Our room was spotless as were all areas of the resort. And I must agree with other reviews that the RPM is in need of a facelift, but I would definitely go back to this resort again and would extend our time to one week at least. The beach at the RPM was one of the best in all our travels. There were plenty of chairs to choose from in either the sun or shade both at the beach and around the pools. No need to hurry in the morning to try to get a chair. They were available anytime. Staff at the front desk was extremely courteous and helpful when called upon to assist as were those working in the dining areas. Almost everyone we saw greeted us with a smile and “Hola.” If there was a downside to the dining establishments we ate at, I would have to say service and quality of food suffered in the La Bodega Restaurant, one of the speciality restaurants. The day we chose to eat at the Krystal (touted as Fusion (?) gourmet) it was closed. Reservations for the four speciality restaurants must be made between 8:30 – 10:30 for that day. I would advise getting there at least by 8:30 in order to get your choice of restaurants. There were two seatings at these restaurants, either 18:30 or 20.45. We were always satisfied with the Don Julian restaurant whose buffet menu changed nightly. There was roast pig, roast turkey, and a myriad of different entrees to chose from. In the morning there is a special station where the server purees fresh fruit into juices, which is a nice touch to your regular orange juice. You will definitely not go hungry if you eat here. We hope to go back for another relaxing vacation. Four nights were too short!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: spaceystacyDallas
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Riu with spouse and friends. This was my 14th trip to Mexico, 4th in Riviera Maya. Always a great time. The hotel is beautiful. I personally prefer an open-air lobby and restaurants but the lobby is absolutely gorgeous and the main dining room was lovely with better than average food. I did not care for the process of reserving a table in the "specialty restaurants". Waiting in line at 8:30am, no guarantee). The Japanese restaurant was average. The pool area appeared very old and dated compared to the how gorgeous the hotel is but guests are able to use other riu's so this was not a problem. Drinks were small plastic juice glasses. Most of the staff was very nice. All in all, nice place - just a tad over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Caneps
Reviews.Content: This was wonderful and the staff was great. We had 28 people and everyone was treated wonderfully. Food was great. The Fusion restaurant was my favorite. Pool and all was good.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by a bad review, its fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: rumour1975
Reviews.Content: I came home from my second trip here on monday, and miss it already! I love this hotel. I travelled with my mum to mexico for 2 weeks. The weather was fantastic, the hotel was fantastic and everything about it is fantastic. The reception staff greet you with a drink, and talk you through details of restuarants bars etc while the bellboy takes your bags to your room. During our stay we received calls from reception, checking that we had everything we needed, they sent gifts to our rooms (fruit platters, local orniments etc) and could not do enough for you. The rooms themselves are exceptionally clean, spacious and comfortable, the maids cleaned daily, and the mini bar was restocked with international brands daily also. We had various towel animals left for us during our stay, which was a very nice touch. in addition to this, we had a turn-down service every evening, and also fresh towels every day. The restuarants are brilliant. The waiting staff are extremely friendly, they remember your names, and even what drinks you like with your meals. The buffets are always being refilled with fresh food (which is not below standard by any shot) there are chefs at stations cooking fresh foods to order and always plenty of options to chose from. the speciality restuarants are harder to get in to but with it. you need to book these in the mornings, but they do go very quickly, but persevere :) The pool area is very relaxing with ample loungers, I dont think we ever needed to hunt some down as there were loads free. plenty of shade for the hotter hours of the day too. Two pools, one quieter pool area, and the other has the activities and the pool bar, which is lovely. they are spotlessly clean too. the waiting staff are constantly checking that you have all the drinks you need, and fresh fruit on some days too, which is great! the entertainment round the pool is the usual kind, volleyball, beach volley ball, ping-pong, rifle shhoting etc always in the afternoons. they also did spanish lessons and dance lessons on the beach too. a very full daily activity list if you wanted to take part. The beach is very well maintained. it is raked every night and cleaned of sea weed often (they bury it so its out of sight) they also have a bar service there too, with waiters coming round and they had a band on the beach a couple of times. They have built the beach back up, after a bad hurricaine a few years back. they have the sand "whales" to break the tide, they dont spoil your enjoyment of th beach or sea at all. lots of water sports if you want to take part. including boats, kayaks and wave riders. (some payable) In the evenings, there is usually a band playing in the plaza. very good fun as the ent.s staff have the guests dancing salsa and mumbo. the evening shows are varied, very caberet style. usually starting at 845pm. they are excellent, the entertainment staff all work so hard. (especially Mario, the cuban nutter! lol) if you want to extend your night you can go to the disco in the riu tequilla, i personally thought it was rubbish lol. the entertainment staff will take you for a night at copco bongo for $50 all in, which is open till around 6am (if youre up for it) I can not complain about this hotel, the staff, the food, or any of it. yes it is slightly dated, but i like the colonial style with the real wood and the wrought iron works. if you prefer concrete and un-interesting, then choose a different hotel. And i will definately be going back, probably more than once. thank you riu!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach front property”
Reviews.Author: nickyblack67
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this beach front Property for an Honeymoon, Anniversary etc. I love the cleaness of Hotel and the Hospitality was great as well. The speciality restaurants were good although i prefably prefer the buffet at Chillis Steak House there was more of an variety. The rooms were always restocked with Beverages such as Liquor, Soda, Water, and the room service was quick and effiecient i would definitely visit the property and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “this was paradise”
Reviews.Author: paradise76
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico. So glad we choose riu palace mexico. What a beautiful place. The resort is kept spotless, the staff go out of their way to pamper you,the beach is beautiful,white sand as far as you can see. Anice view of Cosmel across the water. The food was ok. The ice cream was very good. The night time entertainment was great,everything over by 11;00,but that was ok because after a day of sun and afew drinks we were ready to call it a day. Staying at the Palace allowed you to visit the other Riu resorts that are very close by. Went in to Playa del Carma for an afternoon of shopping,took a taxi for 5 dollars,it was agood time. We had a great ralaxing,pampered time cant wait to go back, saving money already. Thanks Riu Palace Mexico for a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip for the Price”
Reviews.Author: luvthebeach_9
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 6 previous times. We got a good deal due to the "swine flu" panic. This was our first time back in a couple of years. The hotel looked a little more run down. We think that this hotel needs to be the next Riu to be remodeled. The staff continues to be excellent. The beach has eroded from what it once was but is still one of the nicest around. We had a very enjoyable time.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered”
Reviews.Author: gbb12
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, the shows professional, the rooms and grounds spotless. Lots of activities for everyone. Although the food was not bad, the quality has declined in the last two years. Still, plenty to eat. The best ice cream! Drinks always flowing but no drunkenness observed. Guest were reserved and polite. Can use the other four Riu's nearby for pools, some meals, and beaches? The two Riu Palaces are the nicest. You must be at one of the Palaces to use the other.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best holiday hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: jeffersdc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks holiday in theis Hotel and cannot find enough praises to sing about the place, and it's staff. It has every thing a couple could ask for. The food was super, with speciality resturants (5) a beach location to die for, two pools a swim up bar, super rooms and facilites, spa etc. Nothing is to much trouble for the staff, friendly to every one. Elegance to relax in and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “What a Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: buddyShropshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the most wonderful holiday we have ever had. Words cannot express how we felt about the Riu Palace Mexico - from the sheet luxury of the hotel, the excellent service, cleanliness and friendliness of the staff - it is hard to put into words. We cannot praise them enough. Nothing was too much trouble, and we will be definitely going back there again. We met some lovely people and spent time with different couples and just generally had a fantastic time! Rosi and Mick, Shropshire U.K.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon was perfect. Our 2nd trip there.”
Reviews.Author: BLHickson
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I returned to RPM for our honeymoon almost 1 yr after our 1st visit. Everything was very good the first time, but our honeymoon was perfect because the staff remembered our names, gave us VIP treatment, and gave us extra special attention, from extra "towel art" in our upgraded room (ocean view w/ jacuzzi suite), special gifts of fruit trays, tequila and handmade art, flower petals on our dining tables (even at the buffet!), even to insisting on giving us extra entrees at the reservations-only specialty restaurants. We think the hotel is beautiful and old fashioned looking, with Spanish Colonial architecture ("mission" style is simpler and California-looking), lots of beautiful tile and black wrought iron, and, while this resort may be an older resort, they are fortunate to have a very expansive lovely beachfront where newer resorts do not. There is a musty smell to the hotel, probably due to its age and the heat and humidity, but also probably due the beautiful mahogany wood used throughout the facility. If it were built w/ concrete, there wouldn't be such a smell, but that's concrete and most of the newer resorts are primarily concrete (much cheaper material but also has the "modern" look to it). The wood adds to the beauty of the resort and the rooms. I didn't think the smell was offensive, but I've been around boats, the sea, and humid climates all my life. Even tho the resort is all-inclusive, the staff truly appreciate tips and a little goes a long way. Food on the buffet ranges from great to average depending on how long you stay, to how many guests are at the hotel, to who is working in the kitchen that day and what you choose to eat. The buffet obviously caters to European and Hispanic appetites. The guests from Belgium and Sweden we spoke to thought the buffet food was awesome. The buffet is huge and there is always something that you will like. We're American and thought the buffet was both decadent if you wanted to indulge and healthy if you did not. They always had grilled or broiled fresh grouper or snapper at lunch or dinner, which was delicious. The salad dressings left something to be desired as American tastes go, but please remember, this is Mexico, not the home of buttermilk ranch dressing. Great fresh fruit, breads, cheeses, Mexican food, plus pasta and sauces and fresh veggies and a breakfast buffet that will send you to the beach to nap until lunch time. And desserts to make you extra fat! The maitre d' hotel, Sr. Santoyo, made us feel extra special. He is one of a kind. The specialty restaurants are excellent. We tried Krystal and the steakhouse and were very pleased w/ both. We wanted to try the Japanese Fusion restaurant but it was closed the only night we could dine there. I think it may have had to do w/ the fewer number of guests than the year before. There were definately fewer guests than the same time the year before, I'm sure it's the economy. Room service for our breakfast always provided tons more food than we could eat and we hate to be wasteful. The one time we ordered room service for dinner after we'd been to Chichen Itza for the day and were dead tired (great trip tho!), it was typical foreign room service. It's not American room service and they had a hard time translating my substitutions from what's exactly on the menu. No big deal. My husband ate everything anyway! The Scuba Caribe vendor that contracts for the water sports leaves a litte to be desired, they didn't have our catamaran reservation on their list (there was only one name on the entire list), but we got one anyway and stayed out almost 2 hours without any problem. These are young guys operating this and they are obviously trying to go for the paid for scuba/snorkeling trips, but the same thing happens back home. I think sometimes tourists from very "capitalist" countries (like ours!) forget that not everyone has that "hustle" mentality. And let's face it, customer service isn't that great in America anymore either. The pool at RPM is beautiful and is cleaned every night. We think it is the best pool area at any of the Riu resorts. The drink service is great (both at poolside and on the beach or under the palm trees), swim up bar very cool and the best at any of the Riu resorts. The beach is raked every night and the chairs organized so that every inch is spotless the next morning. One afternoon we walked to the other Riu resorts to see the other pool/lobby areas and came back very happy with our choice of resorts. The Riu Palace Riviera Maya has a large pool area w/ some different features infinity pool (for the "older folks"), concrete loungers inside a pool area w/ "tables" in little alcoves to put your drinks/ashtrays on and jacuzzi alcoves, all very cool but where do all those cigarette butts go?), but it was VERY crowded and noisy w/ loud music and a crowd of twenty somethings looking for action. It just was not our cup of tea, but might have been if we were 20-something and hot for a wet meat market. The Riviera Maya has a big crowded pool area, but a VERY small beach. I should note that the bar staff were quick to notice our "gold" wristbands and treated us very well, as did staff at every other Riu resort we ventured. (If you stay at one of the 2 Riu Palace resorts, you get a gold band, and have access to all the other resorts' amenities, but not vice versa.) The Riu Palace Mexico resort is fabulous and we'll be going back the same time ("shoulder season") every year. We travel a lot, so this is a safe bet for us once a year to chill out. We like the low key (read "no children") ambiance. The band in the courtyard is entertaining after dinner and allows you to dance and drink and try out your salsa moves that you may have learned at the noon lesson. It's fun! Some folks may think the nighttime shows are too touristy, but hey! that's what we are, and the Mexicans are very proud to show off their culture. They should be. It's a wonderful place that is rich in history, culture, natural resources and native cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest vacation ever at the Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: psnyder13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 35th wedding anniversary at the Riu Palace Mexico. It was the best trip yet that we have taken. We will definitely return. The hotel, staff, environment, food, service, beach and location were absolutely fabulous. The hotel made our anniversary very special by sending to our room greetings, gifts, and food. It definitely was a paradise away from home.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: RowlandsGill-Rob
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from a wonderful holiday in the RIU Palace Mexico in Play De Carmen. I must admit that I wasn't that keen on the prospect of a beach holiday but this place is something else. The staff were so attentive and nothing was too much trouble for them. We had a go at most things from lying by the pool to jungle safaris and I would fully recommend this type of holiday to anyone. We also had a look at the other RIU hotels whilst we were there and I would say it is worth paying slightly more for a five star because the service is so much better. Each evening they put on entertainment and this finished at 11pm. The Hotel was very quite after that time but you could go down town if you wanted to party some more. The Shops on Mexican Street appear to have been the best in terms of value for money. We took a flight into the Jungle and although it was expensive it was the highlight of the holiday shortly followed by our Jungle trip to Punto Allen where we got to see dolfhines and sea turtles. Overall if you go to Mexico I guess you will have a great time where ever you stay but I would fully recommend the RIU Palace Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wedding, Great Experience, Great Food, Very Friendly Staff, and Best Vacation I have ever had!!”
Reviews.Author: kpolase
Reviews.Content: I am new to TripAdvisor, so pardon the tardiness of this review. I got married at The Riu Palace Mexico in June of 2007. We had about 80 guests come, which made this experience even better. Check-in was easy and fast. A few of us arrived about 4 days prior to the main group, and were greeted with a cocktail and a friendly smile, while given a quick rundown of where everything was located, and off we were. The wedding staff was very helpful as well. We were a bit nervous because we were told to meet the day before to go over details. From what I have seen poeple do to plan a wedding back home, it is a long stressful process. That day we sat down with the best on-site coordinator, Edith, we chose decorations, music, dinner, etc, and were done in 20 minutes!! Talk about EASY! I would highly recommend having a wedding here. We got married in the Gazebo near the hotel. Since our group was so large, we were able to reserve an entire restaurant for our reception, that was open to the beach. We all had a buffet type dinner that we got to choose, and afterwards we had a DJ for 4 hours. I spent soo much time burning cd's with songs we wanted to play, but we never even brought them out. The DJ was awesome, and had every song you could think of. He just played good songs all night, and you could request whatever you wanted as well. We requested a couple of songs for the Father-Daughter and Mother-Son dances, and we danced to those 1st. Afterwards, we danced and drank the night away. They also had bartenders staffed strictly for our reception, which was very accommodating. By far, this was probably the easiest, funnest, cheapest, and most laid back time! If you are thinking about a wedding, this is the place to tie the knot! Feel free to ask me any question! --Do not do the Riu Palace Riveria Maya, they suck! Now the hotel. The grounds were all very well maintained. There was nonstop cleaning going on all over the resort. Every evening I saw staff checking the pool chemicals and cleaning the pool. Every other day they were trimming the hedges and cutting the grass. And cleaning went on all day, every day. They work extremely hard, so be sure to tip them. One reason why I chose this resort was because of the palm trees on the beach. If you look at all of the other resorts, there are no trees. This resort had lots of shade for when you wanted to get out of the sun and relax. There are hammocks all over too. The pool was large and had a nice swim-up bar. There is a bar inside the lobby too. All the bartenders were funny and entertaining, and would pour the drinks heavily handed if requested. All over, the staff was extremely nice. Food. The food was fantastic. You have to make reservations for the restaurants (Brazilian, Steakhouse, Japanese). If you didn't, no worries because the buffet was awesome too. Trust me, I did not miss a meal. They mean it when they say "all inclusive". You have a bar in your room that gets restocked daily. One of my favorite, drunken, late-night munchy memories was room service. My first night there, at 2 in the morning, I made a call to room service and I must have ordered five dishes. I hung up the phone and looked at my wife with a tear in my eye, and she asked "what?" I replied, "they said YES, to everything!!...everything!! That was the happiest moment of my trip. Oh yeah, right behind getting married. Like the other all inclusives around the area, thay have non-motorized watersports for the guests. You can sign up for other excursions and motor sports right on the beach, or in the hotel. Since you are staying here, you have the option to go to the other Riu resorts on the street. I think there are 3 or 4 others. You can drink at their bars and do their activities. We went right across the street to the Riu Tequila. It was a neat night atmosphere over there. They have a bar outside in the middle of the resort where everyone gathers, they have a night club, and shows as well. Riu Palace Mexico has shows and music too. Towards the weekend, the hotel has a mini-market set up right on the premises. For those who choose to leave the resort at night, you must go to 5th Ave. This is where all of the bars, restaurants, and clubs are. They have a neat open concept where lounges are open to the street. Blue Parrot is fun for drinks, fire show, and dancing on the dancefloor right on the beach. A must, if you have time. This was a family friendly resort as well. DO NOT STAY AT THE OTHER RIU PALACE. I stayed at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya last year for a wedding, and the service was horrible. The staff was rude and I had money stolen from my supposedly secure locker at their spa. I reported the incident to the management, and to this day have not been followed up with. The Bride's room didn't have a functioning a/c for days. Nothing was done to fix the issue. None of the fountains were ever on, and all looked algea infested. Riu Palace RIVERIA MAYA is NO GOOD. - See my detailed review there. Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: “Our best ever vacation in 25 years. Truly!”
Reviews.Author: ChrissieLinnit
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what the 'official' rating of this hotel is... indeed, I'm so confused by all the different organisations: Travel Companies; Tourist sites; Hotel bodies and Hotel owners themselves who all rate hotels using different criteria, that I tend to ignore anything that says it's the 'official' rating and just choose my holiday based on reviews I get of a short-list of options that are generally rated 4 or 5 star. The Riu Palace Mexico was one of five hotels I'd shortlisted on the Yucatan Peninsula for our September 2009 vacation. I booked it after reading scores and scores of reviews of all of the hotels on this site and on the Virtual Traveller site. No hotel ever gets a 100% rating of 5* unless it has only a very few reviews. Once a hotel gets over (approx) 20 reviews there will naturally be a smattering of lower ratings on one or another criteria, but overall, the Riu Palace Mexico seemed to hit the right spots for us as a family. Consistently good ratings and, as a Brit, I was especially interested in Brit reviews because culturally those reviews were probably going to be closer to my own expectations and needs. But, the international reviews from American and Canadian reviewers also formed a big part of my decision making. The hotel, staff, accommodation, location, all inclusive facilities and value for money all met and in some instances exceeded our expectations. HOTEL Yes, it is one of the older hotels in the region - a little over 10 years old, I think. But it is grand visually and has an air of quality about it that makes it very attractive to adults looking for something a little special. The lobby entrance is lovely with a central chandelier that was so reminiscent of an episode of Only Fools and Horses that I got hubby, son and grandson to reenact the scene for my camera! There's a piano bar there that lends an air of relaxation and grown upness (that's not a proper word, I know, but it fits!). The rooms we had were especially good, and had been recommended by another reviewer of this hotel - on this site! - I eMailed the hotel to ask if we could have the rooms and they were able to accommodate us. we had two junior suites, sea facing, on the second floor... which was good because the palm trees have grown over the years and to get the best sea view yo do need to be on the second floor. However, I will say that it wouldn't really matter which way your room faces because the views are beautiful even facing the really well maintained gardens and pools! We tipped our maids and waiters daily (roughly the peso equivalent of £1 each day for the maid each morning and waiters at mealtimes, meaning we spent around £75 in tips in two weeks). The average non-skilled wage here is US$7.00 a day, so these people do rely on tips. The rooms are kept spotlessly clean. When we did get ants, or we couldn't work out how to work the TV, the hotel responded immediately and even made follow up calls to ensure things had been resoled to our satisfaction. The towel art was fun and we had a room war going on to see which room got best towel art over the two weeks - mine & hubby's room won! During our stay the hotel left us a small ceramic gift and some postcards are gifts... and they remembered our names even though I kept forgetting theirs! The one very small observation I will agree on with negative reviewers here is that there is a musty smell... however, after a few days you don't notice it. And, I do think it's generic to the area, being to humid and hot - not just this hotel. It only became noticeable again when we got home and I had to wash everything, even unworn clothing, to get rid of the musty odour... but it in no way detracted from our enjoyment. SERVICE All of the staff, from management to front office to waiters, maids, pool staff and gardeners were friendly and helpful. Most of the non-skilled and casual staff are Mayan descent and many still speak the Mayan language. All of them, without exception, were welcoming and clearly content. The dining areas were a treat, with food prepared and artfully displayed. Waiters and waitresses are very attentive and you never have to waive to get attention. Drinks were abundant and replenished as soon as your glass emptied. This sort of attention was evident not only inside the hotel areas but at poolside and in the palmtree hammock areas too. The all inclusive dining includes the a la carte restaurants which are all nouvelle/haute cuisine, so less is more, if you know what I mean. We only used the Krystal and Steakhouse. both were great. The buffet was large and varied enough to meet our every need at breakfast, lunch and dinner. In fact, we've all agreed that we need to lose a few pounds and get back to exercising soon! LOCATION The hotel has it's own private beach and is adjacent to several other Riu hotels, all of whose services guests of this hotel can use... the beach does have beach whales on it (large semi-submersed banks that protect the beaches from erosion) but they in no way detract from the beauty of the beach, sea or vista generally. The sea is clean and there are too many free and chageable (motorised) sea sport activities right there. The hotel is situated on a private estate called Playacar which abuts Playa del Carmen to the south. It's a good walk into Playa del Carmen and if you can handle the heat and humidity would take you around 45 minutes. However, I'm not good in heat and so we used the local taxi which cost US$5.00 plus tip. Taxi's all have fixed charging rates (check out the local website for Playa del Carmen) Playa del Carmen has a ferry that will take you to Cozumel if you want to do some serious snorkeling, but for US$28.00 you can get a taxi to Akumal beach and spend the day snorkeling for free there. It's a gloriously picturesque beach with coral, fishes galore and turtles that swim right up to you. No shade though, so take a parasol and whack on tons of sun screen! We booked two trips with YucaTreks, again as a result of reseaching trips and trip organisers on this and other sites. YukaTreks take small groups (from 4 up to 13), they are English speaking and their prices are very competitive. Also, because they aren't big coaches they get to sites quicker, before big tours get there, so you spend longer a the location and it's less crowded. We did Sea to Cenote with them - it's really Cenote to sea, but mitch, our guide explained that Sea to Cenote just sounds better (???). A cenote is an underground river/river bed/pool and snorkeling in one is an awesome experience. You also get a small jungle trek in there, learn something of the Yucatan history and wildlife, eat local food and if your lucky, as we were, meet a couple of European cave explorers who live there!! Mitch, of YukaTreks also escorted us on our visit to Chechin Itza and Valadollid. We got there before all of th coaches and had a guided tour with Jose. You MUST get a guide like him. His knowledge of Mayan and Toltec cultures and history brought the whole place to life. The site is over 30 sq km and there's no shade. Again, take parasols, hats and sunscreen. On a sunscreen note. All tours and many eco-sites will ban non-biodegradable sunscreens. I knew that and spent time searching for organic sunscreens before we went. If you're going to the Yucatan, remember that the whole region is an ecological area. Invest in good, environmentally friendly sunscreens, please! Our third and final trip, which I booked direct, was to Xel-Ha. A vast natural fresh and saltwater lagoon that's been turned into an eco water-park. We bought all inclusive tickets. You get all the food & drinks you want; free snorkeling equipment, towels and access to all areas. You pay extra for underwater sub helmet walking, dolphin swimming etc. Despite my aversion to dolphins in captivity, we did pay for our boys to swim with them. The trainers clearly have bonded with the dolphins and the dolphins all appeared very healthy and responsive. The boys loved the experience and the interactions ae very respectful of the animals. Overall the Xel-Ha experience is breathtaking. We did get bitten massively by mossies, despite all of us wearing organic mossie bands and sprays. A lot of that was to do with a big burst of rain, that I'm told brigs the blighters out BIG time. It left us itchy and sore for a few days but none o us would balk at the chance to go again. VALUE We paid 5* price for what I consider to be a 5* hotel and 5* service. Do we regret what we paid? No. Would we go back there? Well, we've always agreed that the world is too large and our time on it too short to waste going back to the same place twice. We've yet to travel to Australasia or Canada (we've travelled most everywhere else) and we've an average age of 57, hubby and I, so the clock's ticking... but, I'm sorely tempted! If the service we received here at the Riu Palace Mexico is indicative of the service we can expect from othr Riu Palace hotels, and I'm going to research that (!) then we'll be reviewing our holiday policy very soon! OVERALL If you're undecided about Mexico or the Caribbean, I can only advise that this out-of-season holiday was brilliant weather, cheaper and quieter than high season, picturesque, offered sports and entertainment if wanted and allowed quiet and relaxation if your needs were more mellow.

Reviews.Title: “amazing, saving up for a return trip”
Reviews.Author: ecoactive
Reviews.Content: staff were really welcoming and helpfull on arrival, the room was clean and spacious, the food was great, the waiters etc were really freindly and helpfull, beach was really close and was really nice, nice touches were when drinks were brought to you on the beach and also fruit, it saved you having to get up and the parting gift of a ceramic turtle from the front of house staff, first long haul flight and also first all inclusive holiday, really enjoyed and we are now saving for 2011 as we want to return and also take freinds and family with us to share this fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing ! you have to experience for yourself .....”
Reviews.Author: rhodeislandsignman
Reviews.Content: first let me say that prior to our trip we read all the reviews on tripadvisor and were nervous about our stay . Once we arrived we were greeted with a drink and quickly shown to our room . let me say it was fabulous !!! we have been to several properties in playacar and none even COMPARE to this hotel . Not even atlantis in the bahamas in my opinion compares to the palace for luxury and peace !! The food was superior at the buffet , although to be honest the specialty dining left something to be desired ..... But it is not a cruise and you should expect a little less quality . the menu changed every night and they couldn't do enough for you . The entertainment was WAY better than what we imagined . And don't buy the ac stuff . we asked for a third floor room so we could do the stairs and we needed to turn it down and use blankets to stay warm !! after a 95 degree day anything is cold ! i don't know what some people expect ! its proximity to playa del carmen is great , we walked back every evening . it was always clean , the pools didnt have a haze , the palm trees didnt smell and we only got bit by mosquitos in the jungle at coba. go and try it for yourself !! you'll have the time of your life . we just got back sunday and we already booked it for next year with funjet . it was that fun !! its quiet and romantic . im 33 and my wife is 37 it was just lively enough for us and then quiet when you wanted to sleep . besides if you want to party go to coco bongo !! also a side note , if you like atv's forget the tours !!!! go to atv extreme next to the royal on 5th . take a cab . we booked a three hour tour and got 6-1/2 plus cave diving and a private beach ! they used our cameras for the pics and went WAY OUT OF THERE WAY to make sure you had the time of your life !!!! for 50 bucks it was the best deal in the world !! thanks carlos you made our anniversery amazing !!!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star??? You have got to be kidding!”
Reviews.Author: SUPERIORSCHULTZ
Reviews.Content: The pool and beach were gorgeous but it ALL went downhil from there. The air conditioning was not working nor could they get it to work on the whole entire 2nd floor - staff couldn't have cared less. Food was horrid - room service was worse than an elementary cafeteria! Drinks @ pool served in 8oz. dirty platic cups. The employees @ spa were extremly unprofessional and did not seem to be very sanitary (coughing sneezing & doing a manicure). Three friends in group moved to other resorts after 2 nights of misery! If you are thinking about this resort-THINK TWICE!

Reviews.Title: “A truly unforgettable holiday & wedding - would return tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: clare1178
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the Riu Palace Mexico at the beginning of June 2009 with 18 of our closest friends and family for our wedding. Where to start? As you arrive at the hotel the first sight is very impressive - we stayed at the Riu Tequila last year so knew what to expect, but it was still amazing when we arrived. Check in was quick and simple, with the reception staff explaining the layout of the hotel along with how the restaurants worked etc, all with a great fruit and tequila punch - a great start to the holiday. You can either take your own bags or leave in reception for them to be delivered to your room shortly after - your choice. We elected to take them ourselves as we wanted to dump them and explore! As we were there for our wedding we were upgraded to a sea view room which was lovely - the rooms are good. Two beds which were slightly smaller than doubles - we fit both of us in 1 bed quite easily! We've stayed all inclusive on a number of times and it was a nice touch to have the options of room service (although there's so much to see and do it did seem a waste to stay in the room) and toilettries (shampoo, conditioner, moisturiser etc) in the bathrooms. Not huge things but a nice finishing touch. We never really used the optics as spent most of our time out and about, but the fridge was stocked every day with whatever you wanted (a good mix of beers and soft drinks). I've noticed from other reviews that some people were disappointed with the lack of entertainment at the Riu Palace Mexico which I can't really understand. The Palace hotels are the most expenive of the Riu's and you obviously pay for what you get - champagne/fizzy wine, live music every evening, table service in every bar, sunlounger service at the beach, a more relaxed & upmarket feel to the place. If you want something more lively, either during the day or night you can use the Riu Tequila (great pool area, sports bar & disco), Playacar (great for kids entertainment around the pool), or the Lupita. There is also the Riu Palace Riveria Maya about 10 minutes walk up the road. I must admit we stayed at the Palace Mexico for the majority - around the Plaza in the evening until midnight and then up to the air conditioned bar next to reception for more fizz! The hotel were brilliant at organising our wedding. We had a meeting with the wedding planner a couple of days before and chose the venue within the hotel, flowers, cake etc and had our paperwork checked out. A Dr was sent to our room at an allotted time for the blood tests and that was it - sorted! It really was very relaxed and organised - they really are very good at what they do and remove the stress. We ate at all 4 of the speciality restaurants and all were very good - my favourite being the Japanese restaurant - the sushi was especially nice. We were lucky when we arrived as the bookings were being taken at breakfast time at the entrance to the buffet restaurant as the hotel had only just re-opened after the flu outbreak and occupancy was down. Not sure about peoples comments about having to wait as we never had to do this. The beach was lovely - can't complain about the sand whales are they are preserving the beach and if anything actually creat nice calm areas of sea. There is plenty of shade in the trees with hammocks and sun beds, and of course the beach bar! The staff are amazing and nothing is too much trouble, and always a smile. A small tip goes a long way and the service you receive (whether you tip or not) is second to none. Would definitiely go back, and hopefully will be able to do so later this year. Please feel free to ask any questions.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars -- not so much”
Reviews.Author: acashatt
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite beautiful but not too much activities to participate in. The food was not that wonderful either. We ended up getting extremely ill from the food and were in our room for the last two days of the trip. The beach wasn't too special either. Big sand dunes in the ocean to prevent sand loss. If you are looking for peace and tranquility this is a good place. Very quiet not much night life. If you are looking for activities and fun times go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Muchos Fabulous time at the RPM”
Reviews.Author: SammyDorset
Reviews.Content: I have only just walked in the door from my fantastic holiday to the RPM. I am not going to waste time by going over everything that everyone else has commented on(especially considering I have now been up for 25 hrs and likely to fall asleep mid-way if I write too much). I just wanted to say what a fantastic time we had. We have previously been to the Riu Palace in Cancun and the Riu Cancun. We have always loved Mexico and have been extremely happy with the quality of the Riu hotels, particularly the Palaces. We had an absolute ball...we made the most of all the Riu properties in our vicinity, and felt, without a doubt that ours was the best of the lot. We did enjoy going to the RPRM and using their pool area as it was a nicer pool area than our own but we definitely had the better beach and also felt that our hotel generally was a little more chilled out and relaxing than the others. Don't get me wrong, we like to party as much as anyone but it was nice to opt in and out of a more lively atmosphere. The nightclub at the tequilla was only over the road if we fancied letting our hair down after a few glasses of champagne and then it was easy enough to walk home, knowing that we would have an undisturbed night's sleep once back in the room. Service at this hotel is absolutely excellent...we truly were treated so well. Katy was absolutely brilliant, always stopping for a chat and to find out how things were going on her regular walks around the hotel. Everyone we met were so friendly and not only will we have taken home some special memories but also special friends too...you know who you are!!!!!! We would definitely revisit this hotel. The only one complaint I would have is that one night the buffet served up my most favoured meal ever...massive juicy crab claws. They were so delicious I had them for my Starter, Main and Dessert. Unfortunately we only had them that night....oh well....the other mass selection of seafood and shellfish had to suffice...damn shame (!!!???!!!) If you're thinking about booking this place please do not hesitate...you will have a great time!!! Anyone who met us, hello to you all!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel- Absolutely Brilliant !!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leedsbarmy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. We both agree this is the best hotel we have ever stayed in. Everyone at the palace from the reception desk to the beach bar lads couldn't do enough to make you stay a pleasant one. On arrival we were given a room on the ground floor near the side of the pool area. The room was fine but the air conditioning unit was extremely noisy. I reported it to the desk and as they couldn't get it repaired straight away, they moved us to an upgraded room opposite the fountains. Every hotel will have it's problems from time to time, it's how they deal with the problems which counts & we couldn't have asked for better service. The food from the specialty restaurants to the buffet service was unbelievable. Anyone who complains about the food at this hotel must have serious dietary problems, because there was always something nice to eat at all times of the day & night. We tried all the special restaurants except the Japanese as it was closed for some of the time we were there. All were brilliant however the best out of the 3 was the Krystal, the food was great & the staff made you fell like a million dollars. The beach was a picture postcard setting, plenty of lovely white sand, loads of sun beds & more importantly shaded areas to keep you out of the baking hot sun. Night time entertainment was far better than we expected, it was varied & enjoyable. If you want a luxury holiday where you can relax & take things easy then look no further than the Palace. It is like living in a palace & you are treat just like a king & queen.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most greatest vacations ever! Felt safe and welcomed.”
Reviews.Author: bbeanerbbear
Reviews.Content: We traveled July 24-27. In Playa del Carmen it was a completely gated community where you felt safe and there were tons of hotels next to each other and alot of happy people. Try not to get confused with Riviera Maya and Mexico because that's what happened to us. Service was prompt... Literally. Our room service came in less than 5 minutes for food. Everything was so beautiful and clean and staff was very respectful. Our rooms were 2 twin beds pushed together and I knew ahead of time after reading one of these reviews. There was a fully stocked mini bar and fridge full of soda, water, and beer which was completely free! The room was very nice too... can't reallly say anything bad about it. The beach was really nice too. I didn't really see any service there at the beaches from what I've read about, but there's a booth type bar service that makes drinks, but you have to walk there. The water was a bit strong for me.. though I'm not a great swimmer. However, it was packed full of people. There are some women who I've seen gone topless and just walking freely along the beach and people getting undressing. I didn't care, but not sure if it makes those who care uncomfortable. Just an FYI. I didnt' visit the 2 pools. It looked really nice and less crowded. The only annoying part was you HAD to make a reservation for dinner between 8:30 -10:30 otherwise they fill up. It was annoying the first night we got there because they just told us that you can just stop by there to see if anything was open and all of the restaurants except 1, you MUST wear long pants. (no matter if dress or jeans). Well we didn't pack jeans at all because most of the restaurants were outside and it was just soo hot (about 95 degrees and horrible humid weather feeling like you can't breath) So we didn't pack long pants. Also the only time's to eat were ONLY at 6:30 or 8:45. So if you're just checking in around that time you're SOL unless you get room service, which is only salads, fruits, desserts, or sandwichs. So the first night we went to eat we were walking for an hour back and forth to see if anything was available and pretty much had to beg to eat. Overall, besides making reservations to have dinner, it was a great experience and didn't want to go back home at all. Oh for those who say scooters are death traps. THEY are NOT. We took a ferry to Coz and rented them for $20 (but go on their website and print out the screen and get it for $15) It was the funnest thing there. It took about 3 hours to go around and stop at places. It was an amazing view to just do what you want. I totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Definately, not the best”
Reviews.Author: clayhudgins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have gone to Mexico 3 times in the past year. The first, our honeymoon, was to El Dorado Royale. The second was to The Royal in Playa, and the third was to the Riu Palace Mexico. That's how I would also rate them. I would rate the El Dorado with a 4.5 stars. The food was excellence, rooms were spotless, the grounds, always neat, and the workers were outstanding. We went to The Royal in Playa for a wedding in November. The beach was better in Playa than at El Dorado, the food was a step down from the El Dorado, but was really beautiful. It was a perfect setting for a wedding. I would also give this one 4.5 stars. With some experience, we went to the Riu Palace Mexico, and were quite disappointed. It wasn't a real romantic trip. We went with some friends. We had a great time because of the company, but it wasn't by far the best. -Here's a true rundown. This is my first review ever. As we checked into the lobby, it was beautiful. It was very clean, but had a truly musty smell. They really don't like air condition. We arrived early and couldn't check in right away. They took good care of our bags, we checked out the grounds (which were beautiful), and headed to the beach. The beach was extremely large, clean and great. There is a little walk to get there, but it is outstanding. If you have kids (watch out for the boobies). They are everywhere! ha. The pool has a funky little odor, and doesn't appear to be too clean. Didn't spend any time there. As far as the food....Not good. Great service. The quality is just not there, in comparison to the two that we have stayed at before..... All in all, I would not go back to this one. But would on the others.... + Great Beach +Decent Drinks +Good Service +Clean Grounds - Poor Food - Poor Quality AC in rooms - Poor pool

Reviews.Title: “Not great. There are much better.”
Reviews.Author: eeeds4
Reviews.Content: I have travelled lots, and been to other AI's in Mexico (see other reviews if you want to check it out) ... here is my honest review: Positives: Beach is nice - white sand and LOTS of it. Staff is friendly Location - close to Playa Negatives: Food gets old fast! We ate in town a few times to mix it up. I am a foodie granted, but seriously, this was NOT good. Non foodies in our group were complaining by day two! Rooms are dated. Bed! It is two beds pushed together, even in upgraded suites. Upgraded suites are nothing special. Starting to show it's age. Pool is nothing great, I have seen MUCH MUCH better. Shows were not good (Micheal Jackson as the only decent one) Room Service menu was terrible! Gross! A/C did not work in some of the group's rooms. Would I go back? Definitely not. For the price, there are much, MUCH better places to stay. Personally I would not call this a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - The staff make all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: Bern_Hazel
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Riu Palace, the last was in 2006. Normally we don’t do revisits as the second time is usually never as good, this was an exception. We booked the Rio Palace Mexico as we got a great deal with Thomas Cook around the time of the flu outbreak. We got given great rooms on the top floor overlooking the pool which we did not expect and as per last time the rooms were spotlessly clean and well serviced every day with clean fresh bedding and some very nice presentations of towel animals. The fridge and bar were well stocked and filled every day. The food was fantastic especially the buffet which changed themes quite regularly. Our favourite was lunch served in the open sided restaurants by the beach with great views of the spectacular azure sea. We would sip chilled white wine whilst enjoying various fresh salads and Mexican food. We went to 3 of the 4 themed restaurants (missed out the Japanese as my wife is allergic to MSG) and we liked the Steak House, thought the Krystal was fabulous but the Brazilian somewhat ordinary and disappointing. Breakfast was good with lots of choice though after a couple of days we stuck with the fresh fruit as the heat was too much. The pool and swim up bar were clean and good as was the availability of sun beds both at the pool and by the beach with no one reserving them!!! The entertainment guys worked hard and there were lots of activities. My 15 year old daughter and her friend were never bored and made friends with quite a few other teenagers from the UK, Canada and USA. The beach is good and clean though the large sand bags used to protect the beach were buried deeper and not as obvious in 2006. Plenty of water sports for those who want to be more active. The gym was somewhat small and this disappointed me a little as it was quite crowded once 4 or more people were trying to use it. We ended up using it between midday and 2pm when it was usually empty. The hotels strongest point is its staff. Around the pool or at night around the bars you are never more than 5 minutes away of being asked if you need another drink. The service at the restaurants is incredible efficient and courteous. Everyone works with a smile and looked genuinely pleased to see you. I would definitely go again in a couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation - would go back!”
Reviews.Author: MexicanWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth year that my husband and I have stayed on the Mexican Caribbean. Our first year, we won a trip to El Dorado Royale, which is close to perfection. So we knew that coming back, it couldn't get much better. We were pleasantly surprised with the Riu Palace. The last two years we overpaid to stay in Cozumel and were very disappointed, but this year we got a great deal with Riu Palace and got great service as well! The Riu staff was extremely helpful and willing to serve you in any way. After two rather sleepless nights on a rock hard mattress, we asked the staff if they could do anything about it, and immediately they put in a request for the cleaning staff to add mattress pads. The night staff continually looks to refill drinks and get you whatever you need. I thought the entertainment was good most nights - I guess it just depends on your taste. The shows were mostly dancing which is what I like. There was live music each night and they tended to play the same songs, but I thought the band was very good! The beach is absolutely beautiful even though there are ugly wave-barriers about ten feet out. There are many Europeans that come to stay at the Riu's, so prepare to see some cleavage! Also, there are lots of mosquitos esp. at night, so bring bug spray. I loved the fact that there were so many palm trees on the beach so there are shaded and sunny areas. The food is okay - nothing compared to the El Dorado Royale restaurants which changed menus every night, but worth getting up early to make reservations for. Make sure to get the Alaskan flambe if you go to the Steakhouse - it was wonderful!!! We rented a car for two days and visited the towns of Akumal and Tulum. It is so much cheaper and worthwhile to do this rather than book the formal tours. In one day, we went to the Tulum ruins (about $4 pp), visited a local public beach called La Mariachi and drove to downtown Akumal. The next day we went back to Akumal to a free beach called Turtle Beach. There are protected waters where sea turtles frequent. You have to bring your own snorkeling gear, but when we went we saw four large turtles, a stingray and a nurse shark. You could probably do this all in one day if you planned it right. Overall, we had a wonderful trip staying at the Riu Palace and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dihrdreb
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a room with A/C for 2 days. We had 3 different service come in the first night until 12AM and they said nothing was wrong. I even had a front desk staff tell me I didn't know how to work the thermostat(he didn't understand that when you turn it up, it will turn off at the temp it is in the room- it was 80 degrees). Finally had to go to the property manager - Vince who finally moved us to a new room. New room had sliding glass door handle that was hanging by 1 screw and bathroom towell rack was literally hanging out of the wall and towells wouldn't even sit on the rack it was hanging so bad. Hotel is beautiful, but isn't being maintained. Workout facility has very dated machines that are rusting. Hotel didn't have the business center open one time during my 5 day stay. Even when questioned the front staff, they didn't know why it was locked. This hotel clearly appears to be going down in a financial crisis due to the lack of investment in up keep. This hotel needs attention to detail to which it currently doesn't. We will not stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Hotel but excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolMike
Reviews.Content: I'll give it you straight , booking the restaurants is a pain, the food is fine, did the specialist restaurants the first week and the buffet the second week, absolutely no complaints. The beer was poison for me, should have been Sol or Corona instead they Double XX because it's cheap, the shorts are international brands at all the palaces, not so at the Tequilla, Yukatan or Lupita where they taste like diesel, the safe in the room is on the floor, which makes it awkward to find your stuff and you have to drag everything out.. The pool isn't the greatest but the service around the pool is, go to 5th avenue $5 in a taxi, things are expensive, compared to going to Walmart which is also $5 in a cab. $14 takes you to Puerto Aventura which is free to get in and has Dolphins, Sea Lions and Manatees, it will cost you to swim with them if you choose to, but far cheaper than with the Thomson Rep. Brilliant holiday would go again met two fabulous couples that kept us laughing through the holiday. The entertainment is dire, but they work really hard All the staff are brilliant, But a special mention to Pedro, Carlos, Raul, Francisco, and the big fella who gives the restaurant numbers out and last but by no means least Katy the stand in Deputy Manager, who couldn't have been more helpful to us So there you have it ... a good hotel, excellent value for money, I'd certainly go back

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Pools, Ugly Beach, Insects in Room, Smells Bad”
Reviews.Author: iloveweinerdogs
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many RIU hotels in the last few years including the Riu Cancun, Riu Palace Las Americas, RIU Vallarta, RIU Ocho Rios, and RIU Montego Bay. While no hotel is perfect, I was pretty happy with my experiences at this hotel chain. I expected to have a similar experience at this hotel which is why I didn’t bother to read tripadvisor before booking this vacation. That was a big mistake. If I had read the reviews, I would have known how horrible this hotel was. Rooms: The rooms do not get cool enough. The air conditioning has always been strong when I stayed at other RIU hotels, but it does not work very well here. Maybe they turned down the a.c. to save money. Even with the ceiling fan on, the room is stuffy and uncomfortable. I booked two rooms for 4 people and both rooms had this problem. I enjoyed a Jacuzzi tub at the other RIUs, but this hotel had a regular bathtub. I expected that all Palace hotels would have a Jacuzzi tub since the Palace level is supposedly their highest level. The maids leave the doors open when they clean your room. As a result, insects get in. My sister and I both got multiple insect bites. They will spray your room with bug spray, if you request it. However, when the maid cleans your room the next day, it’s full of bugs again. The problem got so bad that when I saw a can of RAID bug spray on the maid’s cart, I took it and kept it in the room for the rest of the week so I could spray whenever I needed. The linens are also very cheap and rough on the skin and the television is very small for a split level junior suite. Pools: They have two lackluster pools, one baby pool and a Jacuzzi. The pools were very dirty. There seemed to be a thick layer of oil on the surface. During the week I was there, I never saw an employee cleaning the pools. Usually at resorts, they clean the pool at night, but it doesn’t happen here. The pools are not good for lounging. One of the pools has a ledge about 10 feet wide that you can sit on. Otherwise, you have to stand up. The pool areas have always been spacious and beautiful at the other RIU hotels. They had infinity pools, lounge chairs in the water, jacuzzi’s and tables off the swim-up bar. This is another example of how plain this hotel is compared to other RIU hotels. There is a strong odor like raw sewage that starts in the pool area and extends to the beach. It is disgusting. Activities: Staff not as animated as the other resorts. Same ten songs played from the stereo everyday while water aerobics was going on. Other than that, there was no music. There is water polo once a day, if you like that and also bingo once a day for a half hour. Spanish lessons too. But there are no games, trivia contests or dancing like their other hotels. At night, they have music in the courtyard which is very loud from approx. 9-11:30 at night. We had first floor rooms and it prevented us from falling asleep. Dining: I thought the food was better than average. It is similar to other RIU resorts. They are understaffed at the restaurants. It takes a long time to get served at the specialty restaurants because there are only 2 waiters working. Beach: Beach is full of big rocks, which I don’t particularly mind because that’s just part of nature. But the big black sandbags are really an eyesore. There is also an enormous green hose right in front of the hotel’s beach which extends to the ocean. It’s ugly; be sure not to trip over it. Again there is a strong raw sewage odor right next to the beach bar. The smell is nauseating. Animals: We spent a day at the RIU Playacar’s pool which is the next resort over. It is nicer than the Riu Palace Mexico. There was a lot of excitement in one corner of the pool area and the reason was because someone found a snake in the bushes. Another day, back at the RIU Palace Mexico, I heard a woman scream because she thought a snake fell out of a tree onto her. I found this disturbing since I’m afraid of snakes. However, if you like reptiles, you might enjoy it. I saw many weddings take place at the hotel. They hold the services right on the beach. Everyone just stands there and watches in their swimsuits. If you ask me, it’s pretty tacky. If you’re looking for a place to get married, I do not recommend this hotel at all. It’s not nice enough for something that should be so special. I was there is late June and there were hardly any Americans or Canadians there. It was mostly Europeans. There was a lot of topless sunbathing, so if you don’t want to see that, go elsewhere. I don’t know why this particular RIU hotel is so horrible. Maybe it’s older or maybe the company hasn’t spent the money to update it. At any rate, I won’t be spending anymore time or money at the RIU resorts. I learned my lesson and won’t take a chance on this chain anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!! You have to go”
Reviews.Author: GAKM2009
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased we decided to go ahead with our trip despite the flu scare, having previously stayed at the Tequila 3 years ago we knew the area and location of the palace. An honest review of the hotel... here goes: Our check in was smooth and the reception staff were most courteous and spoke excellent english, upon checking us in I happened to ask as an off the cuff remark whether or not we had been given the pool view room I had "requested" at the time of booking, (first time I have ever made a request) the young lady said she would check for us, as it happened we hadn't got a pool view (we were in the rooms that backed onto the walkway running between the tequila and the beach, seems they put most people there to start with), but she said she would do what she could to try and get us moved next morning as the hotel was full that evening. I really didn't expect anything to come of it but to her credit 15 minutes after going into our room she rang to say the bell boy would be up next morning to move our luggage as she had allocated us 2 rooms with a pool view. We were moved to a room overlooking the pool & fountains, a truly beautiful view. The hotel was not up to full capacity due to the flu scare and as such I think the variety of food was possibly not as plentiful as it would normally be, though we did see this improve as our stay continued due to more guests arriving daily, by the time we left the menu had increased quite significantly. The buffet restaurant caters for all and the food is plentiful, the waiters cannot do enough for you. The speciality restaurants are excellent we tried them all, there is a booking system which does seem a bit odd you have to go the the theatre bar and pick up a ticket (next door to the main buffet reastaurant), they start giving out tickets at 8am but you then have to sit and wait for the bookings to begin at 8:30, works okay but can't see why they just don't don't take the reservation at 8 rather than give out a ticket but as I said it works so no problem, after all you're on your holidays so there's no rush! The rooms are spotlessly clean and the maids are very thorough, They also do a turn down service at night which is quite nice. Towels and toiletries are in plentiful supply. The mini bar in the room is constantly kept well stocked as are the optics, not that we used the optics ourselves. The drinks are all branded names and they do a lovely baileys coffee in the lobby bar even though it isn't on the menu, they will do just about any drink you ask for. There are plenty of beds and umbrellas around the pools and on the beach, there is waiter service around the pool and on the beach the waiter comes round frequently with a tray of ready made drinks for you to choose from. All in all they cannot do enough for you and genuinly seem to enjoy doing so. The entertainment isn't up to much but then this seems to be the case wherever you go, the lobby bar is popular at night there is a pianist there and it is a place to have a very relaxing drink, there is the Tequila 2 minutes walk away if you fancy something a bit more lively, and of course you can go into any of the other RIU's there, we tried them all however the Lupita was closed for most of our stay only re-opening a day or so before we left therefore we didn't get to see that one. In our opinion the Palace Mexico was by far the best of the bunch even better than the Riviera Maya the new palace further down the street. As a guest of the palace hotel you are also entitled to go into the RIU's in Cancun we visited them also and again preferred ours. There is a shopping/bars area 5 minutes taxi ride away at a cost of 5 dollars, well worth a trip, we took a local bus to Cancun it is totally safe to go out on your own and though this time we didn't do any of the trips this yime we spoke to many others that had organised their own with the local tour companys and had excellent results even going on the same bus as the guests who had booked via our holiday rep and as a result paid almost half price for the same trip. What more can I say the place and staff are amazing and I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone. Feel free to message me with any questions, as there is too much to write on a review.

Reviews.Title: “Showing signs of age”
Reviews.Author: BDunDoncaster
