Reviews.Content: Long tiring ride from the airport but what a joy to see the hotel once again. This was our 5th holiday at the Palace over 8 years. The food was not quite as good, the hotel is showing signs of need for refurbishment but the staff and service is still excellent.Must mention Rafael and Mariely who were great. Will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: shoez4me73
Reviews.Content: What an amazing trip! As soon as we landed, we never touched our luggage and were loaded into a comfortable air-conditioned bus and we were served rum drinks that were out of this world! The Riu Palace was gorgeous, absolutely gorgeous. Once again greeted in the lobby with refreshing drinks, we were then shown to our room. We did not upgrade but very clean, large balcony and a very nice view. Loved the shower. The resort itself is maintained very well, very lush and beautiful. Very nice white sand, blue water beach. We opted for the massage on the beach which was incredible. We loved all the dinner shows, I never really thought I would be entertained by a “dinner show” but loved them all. I loved the vendor market. The only thing disappointing about this trip was, It didn’t last long enough. Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: mire13
Reviews.Content: wonderful place to go, great food , great hotel, very nice people i give it 2 thumbs up....lol

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lhj7
Reviews.Content: Was booked to go to playa in may but rescheduled due to the swine flu. was a little nervous about going in june but went anyways. had no problems. the resort was quieter than it would normally be when I arrived but by the time we were leaving, things had picked up a lot. For the most part other guests were friendly and very quick to talk to one another. It was just myself and my boyfriend (in our 30s) Seemed like most of the guests were older and we saw a lot of families. We went across the street to the bar at the Riu Tequila and there was a much younger, more lively crowd. The pros - The service is amazing. very attentive and friendly staff. the hotel is extremely well kept! spotless. beautiful lawn, pool, beach, etc. the waiters made great drinks especially margaritas of course! hotel is a 3 minute cab ride from downtown playa. all the water sports you could want are right on the beach. Pool bar was great. The cons - The food was just OK. the reservation restaurants such as the krystal and the Japanese one were slightly better than the buffet but nothing amazing. Room service was just ok. Very limited menu. There are a lot of people trying to sell you on tours and excursions on the beach. I get it that everyone has to make their money but it can be a bit annoying after a couple days. No wi-fi in the rooms, only in the lobby but you could use your laptop down there free of charge or rent their laptops.

Reviews.Title: “This was Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: bryleeBowlingGreenKy
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were in awe, the check in was smooth, the bellman was courtious and helpful, Our first view from our room wa unbelievable. Absolute paradise The service was spectacular. the food is above five star. I may never be hungery again. All our needs were met above and beyond our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Must go to Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: gokartgirl
Reviews.Content: We recently went to Playa del Carmen, despite the flu scare. We had an absolutely wonderful time, however, we were to stay at the Playacar but it was closed due to the flu scare. We stayed at the Yucatan. There were only 2 RIU hotels open, the Yucatan and the Palace. They had to consolidate because of such few tourists. Many other hotels were closing while we were there. I think this is such a sad event because of a media scare. I believe the flu is real but we have literally put an entire economy on hold because no one will go to Maya Riviera. I am not suggesting go to Mexico City, but at least go to outlying areas. There are now even more people out of work and just waiting for their livelihoods to open back up. People were healthier there than when we were flying back on the plane. I would highly recommend keeping your plans and travel to Maya Riviera. The merchants, employees and hotels all need our help!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull!”
Reviews.Author: PattiB_9
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Riu Palace Mexico and the facilities and staff exceeded our expectations. The desk staff were professional, courteous, always willing to help and were proficient in English. The resort was beautiful, and very clean. The buildings conveyed a sense of old world charm while providing every modern convenience. The waiters and bar staff were very friendly and made us feel right at home. We decided not to go a la carte as the buffet was sufficiently varied to keep us coming back and the food was very good. Overall we were thrilled and look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: dg2Pa
Reviews.Content: We got back from an 8 day stay at the Rui Palace Mexico on 4/23/09 and all I can say is it was one of the best vacations we've had. The hotel is beautiful, the staff outstanding and attentive, the beaches were pristine (the sand whales are not bad, several younger people used them as amusement slides). There are plenty of palm trees to put your lounger under and since we had no rain during our stay and the temp was in the mid-80's the shade was appreciated. There is no reason to save a chair, there were always plenty available. I can't say much about the pool since we spent most of our time on the beach. The beach bar was very good and we were served by waiters most of the time. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The cleaning staff comes in at least 2 x's a day. The food is good, my complaint (as is many others) is their reservation system. We only made it to the Steakhouse which was quite good. The other thing to keep in mind is men have to wear long pants in all the restaurants, including the buffet. We didn't know this ahead of time so my husbands 2 pair of pants got quite a workout. One of our favorite places was the lobby bar and the bartender, Elena. She was one of the sweetest people we've met. All the staff is very friendly - expect to day alot of Holas. Check in and check out were seamless...I could keep going but this is long enough. If you have any questions, feel free to ask. No violence seen and no swine flu.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great resort”
Reviews.Author: CaptnFlex
Reviews.Content: Hola, we spend a week there (Apr 18-25th 2009) and it is a great resort.(Adults mostly not much for teenager but they can access the RIU Tequila across the street with younger crowd/activities) Great service evrywhere way better than other 4/5 stars resorts, nice beach and many shaded area where you can rest,no shortage of chairs. Free wireless internet in the bar/lobby so bring your laptop. You can also rent laptop by the hour. Confortable bed, fridge and safe in room, very quiet. Food above average with special fancier presentation in restaurants.Buffet food is also great. Only negative point is to line up at 08:30 am to make resto reservation. Walking distance (20 min)to Playa del carmen and 5$ cab ride back, best time to go is around 17:30h and come back for diner at 20:45h There is a bank less than 5 min walk from hotel (small shopping area with about 25-30 stores) with great exchange rates/no commision (10% better than hotel)and way better than many place in Playacarmen. Always better to bargain/pay in pesos. Cambio $exchange) at airport is too expensive so change some before leaving your country or go to a bank. If you want to go back to canCUN airport or to the city ask about the ADO airconditionned super bus cost only 90 pesos ($6US)1 way and depart every hour.(compare to $70 taxi). In all we had a great time and will probabley return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: realtt
Reviews.Content: It is our first trip to Mexico and first stay in Riu hotel. It says on various websites that this hotel is 5+ star. There is no doubt that this is a very nice hotel, but if you expect a 5 star hotel, you might be a little bit disappointed. The rating for this hotel is actually 4 diamonds, not a 5+ star hotel. Diamonds and star ratings are different standard but they should be about the same level. TripAdvisor list it as a 4 star, I think this is about right. Over all, the service is great. Hotel is clean. Beach is big and beautiful. We had a great time there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect resort”
Reviews.Author: Delaware05
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with the Riu Palace Mexico. It is a beautiful resort . It is well maintained and the service is excellent. Since we cannot sit in the sun all day, we especially enjoyed liked the dozens of palm trees on the beach, which provide shade to those who want it. The only negative aspect was the limited availabity of tables in the specialty restaurants. By way of comparison, at Couples Swept Away Negril, we made all reservations when we checked in. At the Riu, it was necessary to line up at 8:15 am to get a number for the recording of reservations at 8:30. After doing that once, we decided that we preferred to enjoy a leisurely breakfast and eat dinner at the buffet restaurant. All of the food at the buffet was excellent -- much of it prepared in small batches. We are amused by the reviews complaining that the resort is too quiet. That is our idea of a relaxing vacation. However, the evening music and other entertainment were quite good. We treated ourselves to massages in a thatched enclosure on the beach -- terrific!

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE RIU HOTELS!!!”
Reviews.Author: riulover1234
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at a Riu hotel and we were extremely satisfied with our decision to stay here. We stayed at the Riu Tropical Bay in Negril, Jamaica several years ago and had an amazing experience. Because of that, we decided to choose another Riu property for our trip and we are very happy with our choice. The hotel and grounds are very beautiful and well maintained for the most part. The hotel is at least 10 years old so some parts of it feel pretty "lived" in. Hopefully there will be some renovations in the near future. The hotel is located right on the beach and has lots of beautiful palm trees to keep you cool in the shade. The water was amazing of course, but the only disappointment was the numerous sand bags that were stationed in the water to break the waves. But after awhile we got used to it and hardly noticed them at all. The service provided by the staff is absolutely fantastic and we can't praise them enough. They took very good care of us during our stay and made us feel like we were the most important guests on the resort. They couldn't do enough for us and constantly found new ways to "wow" us. They are extremely hardworking for the amount of money they are being paid, but in spite of this they always had a smile on their faces and friendly "hola" for us. They were also very knowledgeable and gave us lots of advice on how to go sightseeing without spending outrageous amounts of money via the tour operators. Overall we were totally impressed and couldn't ask for a better vacation. We can't wait to go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic will return.”
Reviews.Author: minimacca
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks 4 adults and 2 teenagers (14 and 15). Check in was easy and the rooms very clean and spacious. Maid sevice was above excellent and clean towels again at turn-down time! Food was good we did try several of the restaurants but found the buffet very satisfying. Steak house, not impressed - beware we got eaten alive!!! Brazilian was good, lots of meat, very salty, but still great. Crystal - excellent and the food well presented and a very upmarket atmosphere. If you are going with teenagers, beware there is very little for them to do in this hotel, ours spent their time in the Tequila, where they met lots of lads from Liverpool in the sports bar. The pool acitivities and amusements are well orgainsed in the Tequila, but in the Palace they are not. This is more suitable for adults. When in the Palace you are able to use the other hotels, we did venture to the others and whilst I agree with the comments about the pool in the other Palace, our food was by far superior to the other 4 on offer........you will not be disappointed here! Raul and Francesco were fab, so too was the nice young man in the piano bar - thanks to them for all the glasses of champagne!!!! One little negative comment is that in our English brochures it makes no reference to there being a dress code (Thomas Cook nor Thomsons), I even went into Southampton and Abindgdon offices and asked and they were unable to confirm what the code was. However I did take my husband a pair of long trousers - they are required for the buffet and other restuarants. So go prepared - this didn't spoil the holiday. We have been to the Merengue Riu in Dominican and although this was more expensive it was well worth the extra............we will return in a few years, without teenagers!

Reviews.Title: “If you have small kids...you should read!”
Reviews.Author: jroth1
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying Playa del Carmen is absolutely BEAUTIFUL! For anyone that is worried about violence in Mexico...there was absolutely none to speak of! I rely on TripAdvisor tremendously to guide me in picking a resort so I am loyal to providing an honest review for all of you! This Riu is beautiful...the grounds are well kept and the beach is gorgeous! Tons of shade under palm trees and tons of sunshine closer to the water - plenty of lounge chairs! (Note: the beach is topless, which I wasn't expecting and with 2 little boys I was a bit worried but, they didn't seem to notice after a while :o) The pool did not meet our expectations. The pictures I saw were deceiving. It appeared as though the pool was a complete circle and you could swim around the whole thing. this is not the case - it's actually 2 U shaped pools. It also appears much, much more grandiose than it actually is.....we were shocked! It was also a VERY boring pool...absolutely no activities going on in or around it and the view (because it was U shaped) was very boring! We spent all of our pool time at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, which has a BEAUTIFUL, more active pool (and you could see the whole pool from one chair vs. staring at a wall :o) Now...I need to clarify the word "active" pool...we went to Cancun last year and stayed at a resort that had the most entertaining pool ever! Contests, games, constant entertainment - my kids (6 and 8) had a blast...even if they couldn't participate in some of it, it was fun for them to watch! You don't get anything like that at these resorts. Outside of water aerobics in the a.m. and water volleyball, there is absolutely NOTHING going on. In addition to that, the kids club at the Riu Palace Mexico was run down, always closed and the extent of it was a Little Tykes type playground. The Riu Palace Riviera Maya was pretty much the same thing but, was open a bit more. These kids clubs are designed for children 4 and under at best. There is no activities for kids 6-12 and what they did have (ping pong, darts, horeshoes) was so unorganized and sporadic that we only caught an actual organized activitiy (soccer) at the Riviera Maya 2x. Last year, we received a list of activities for the entire week that we could keep in our room and it kept the kids sooo busy! I did leave a comment card at the Riu advising that they need to utilize their entertainment crew because for us.....we probably wouldn't go back to this resort with our children. Also - at the Riu Palace Mexico both ends of the pools had standing water.....well, let me correct myself...one end had standing water with a water fountain but, it was really gross and I think kids used it to pee in. The other end (opposite the swim-up bar) was suppose to hold the 'jacuzzi' but was filled in with rocks and not functional. It was really an eye-sore. The food was great! The beach was clean and beautiful! The maid service was outstanding! The shows at night were okay - not great (again compared to last year) but, good - with the exception of the Michael Jackson show, which was outstanding! The street that the 5 Rius is located is very quaint and safe. There is a shopping plaza and Starbucks diagnol from the Riu Palace Mexico, which was very nice with absolutely NOONE begging you to buy anything! If you stay at the Mexico or Riviera Maya you can go to all 5 resorts BUT, beware that if you stay at the other 3 you can NOT go to the Mexico or Riviera Maya and they ENFORCE it. We had friends come over to our pool from the Riu Tequila and they were actually stopped at the lunch buffet and told they couldn't eat because the food is better, the wine is better, etc. than the Tequila. It was embarassing for them so just beware not to try it! :o) We went on the Mini speed boat/ATV excursion ($250 for 4 ppl)....we were told it was 15 min. away and it was more like an hour and 15 minutes. The ATV ride was okay but, the mini-speed boats were actually small speed boats that you cruise around the ocean in. I can't drive a boat and get motion sick so this was a very long 45 minutes for me! If you like to work out...none of the gyms are great but, the Riu Yucatan had the best one. 5th Avenue is a MUST ($5 taxi ride there) but, well worth it! Lots of very nice shopping and great restaurants (Sr. Frogs, Carlos N Charlies, Los Rancheros); this is also where you can take the Ferry to Cozumel. If you are planning to work while there....the business center doesn't open til 8am so bring your laptop if you want to work earlier than that. Also - our cell phones did not work at all in our room.......sporadically on the beach but, were fine in the lobby! All in all....how can you NOT be happy when Mexico is such a serene place to be...the sun is always shining, the people are so friendly and the beach is breathtaking but, when you are spending $1000s of dollars you should be sure you get exactly what you are looking for. So........if you are looking for a beautiful beach, peaceful surroundings, breathtaking gardens, fountains and landscape.....the Riu Palaces are great! If you have young children.....you can definitely find someplace with a lot more for them to do! We heard the Iberostar Riviera Maya was great for kids but, we dropped people off at this resort on the way to our resort the day we arrived and it's about 2 miles off the main road and pretty far from actual downtown Playa Del Carmen (5th Ave)....the Rius are located right IN Playa del Carmen on the cutest little cobblestone type street! So...this is my review! Please email me with any questions! ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Good Trip”
Reviews.Author: iDanka
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice stay at the Riu - I feel like we got good value for what we paid. We ate at the buffet often and were always satisfied. We enjoyed the steakhouse and La Bodega - the Japanese was our least favourite but it was OK. The service was great - very attentive staff everywhere - chambermaids, restaurants and bars. We visited the other Riu's in the area too - the Riu Palace Riviera Maya has a much nicer pool area but the Riu Mexico beach, in our opinion, was better. Overall, we have no complaints. My main reason for posting a review was to attach some photos so here goes.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sussi13
Reviews.Content: I agree with everything good that's been said regarding this hotel!! Just a couple of points; if you do get "plastic" undersheets just ask them to change them, no problem. The wine is crap and the early evening entertainment is not very exiting but the rest is fantastic. It's a lot better value than the place we've been to in Antigua for the last 6 years!!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE”
Reviews.Author: NIGHTSIDE
Reviews.Content: I've read most of the reviews before we left, now here's my review. Pros: I would like to also add the food in the buffets were really good during breakfast, lunch & dinner. You could also eat at the restaurants you must make a reservation for. we ate at a different one each night, and i would have to highly recommend the Brazilian Restaurant, unbelievable, couldn't eat it all. I would like to clarify on the dress code at all of the buffets and restaurants. During the breakfast & lunch servings men must wear at least a tank top, women must wear a full cover over there bathing suits and all must wear at least sandels. At dinner all men must wear long pants, at least a t-shirt with sleeves. On there web-site it said women had to wear formals. I noticed in the restaurants you must make a reservation for some women wore shorts and both must wear at least sandels. On the reservations for dinner. There is a 6:30 dinner or an 8:30 dinner you must chose which one, the early dinner reservations go pretty quick. Now they tell you not to be late, there's only seating for about 50 people and the first dinner has to wrap up so they can get ready for the late dinner. After about 10-15 minutes after they let you in they lock the doors, but it never fails, couples and familys that are late are knocking on the door trying to get in when we've already started. I even heard them arguing with the door man. They were not allowed in, now for being late, there eating at the buffet. i would recommend this Riu Hotel if your going to visit Cozumel which we did, the beaches over there are awesome. If it wasn't for the visit to Cozumel I would prefer one of the Riu Hotels in Cancun. More things to do pretty much within walking distance of everything. The only paroblem we had, had nothing to do with the Riu Palace. It was with the taxi service. We decided to spend the day at the Riu Americana in Cancun. On the way the driver must have known of another way because I wasn't familiar in the direction he was going but thought he must know a different way. My wife is fluent in Spanish and so was a friend of ours wife, he explained that he was going out of his jursidiction and other companys kind of frown about it. He asked when he dropped us off that we pay him behind the van so the other hotel and taxi drivers wouldn't see. We agreed on $120.00 U.S. round trip before we started, but my partner only gave him $60.00 U.S. and told him he would receive the balance with a generous tip after he takes us back to our hotel. He dropped us off at about 9:30 and agreed to pick us up at 4:00 at the Starbucks across the street. When the day was done we ended up at the Starbucks at 3:50 for the taxi. 4:30 no taxi, 5:00 still no taxi. My wife and some friends went across the street to the Riu Cancun and asked them to call our hotel to ask what happened to our taxi. They contacted the driver and said his van broke down. The van he took us in was brand new. Now the Riu Cancun abliged us and got us another taxi to take us back to our Hotel, one way back was $100.00, what are you going to do, we paid it. On the way on the main highway that I was familiar with about half way there he had to pull over to this little office and said he had to check in. When he got back my wife asked him about the checking in. He says that all taxi cab drivers going out of there district have to check in to tell them where there taking us, show proof of insurance and take a sobriety test. On the way up to Cancun that's why our taxi cab driver took a route to by pass the check point for taxi drivers. He also told us that when we were dropped off he was supposed to go in the Riu Americana and tell them where's he coming from and how many people he dropped off, he didn't do that either. The Starbucks we were waiting at there's a parking lot for out of area taxi cabs that have to wait there until there guests are aready to go back. Your taxi driver must wait for you and your party until your done, he' not supposed to leave it doens't matter if your there for 5 minutes or 5 hours. Our driver pocketed the money. A suggestion, agree on this before you get in the taxi, if it's a round trip fair, don't pay him until he completes the trip, do not pay anything for halfway, he may not be coming back

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time but gained weight!”
Reviews.Author: JBien
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a quick getaway to relieve some work-related stress and take advantage of the travel industry's bargains due to the economy. We spent 5 days and 4 nights at the Riu Palace Mexico in Playacar. We have stayed at Riu properties before, and knew what to expect as far as the hotel concept goes. At Riu properties, everyone has access to the same pools, same alcohol brands and same restaurants. You can book the cheapest room in the place and still have access to all the same amenities as those who book the fancy rooms; there isn't a Royal Club, or an Elegance Club that you have to pay extra for. Having said that, this trip was more pricey than going someplace else in the Caribbean, like Punta Cana, or Puerto Rico. The room alone was $192 per person per night. If you book a vacation package, it might bring the rate down somewhat, but we had vouchers for airfare, so we just paid for the hotel. The hotel is decorated in British colonial style decor, though the architecture of the buildings was Spanish in style. There is a center courtyard with beautiful fountains that go all the way down toward the pool, and the promenade down toward the pool was covered with mature, tall palm trees, offering a great shady walk to the pool. The pool is a crazy shape with a bar side (that has a volleyball net and lots of kids, for some reason) and a quiet side without the bar. The pool has not only a swim-up bar, but a walk-up bar as well. There are several bar tenders at the pool bar, but wait staff that take care of those folks that are sitting around the pool. I recommend the mud slide, or the Bailey's Irish Coffee. By the way, both the bar tenders and the wait staff were fantastic. Always a smile, always attentive. And they worked their butts off. The beach itself is a gorgeous beach. There are TONS of palm trees scattered around the beach on the hotel property, and the Riu Palace Mexico has the best beach hands down. You can walk to the other Riu properties and see for yourself, but you'll notice lots of folks from the other Riu properties will end up on the beach in front of the Palace Mexico. Though, be careful if you aren't a guest of the Riu Palace Mexico - they check your wrist band, and if you are not a guest of a Riu Palace property, they won't serve you. Many folks on this website have reported that the sand is worn away on this stretch of beach. This is very true. But the Riu Palace Mexico has more sand than most hotels in the area and the beach is mostly intact. There are places where the sand whales (large sandbags the size of city buses) are buried under the beach to help keep the sand in place, but they are exposed a little bit. But that's okay - the beach area is still very nice, and its obvious that they are trying to keep the beach intact and protect it from further erosion. The large sand whales are also out in the water, creating a sort of safe place for swimming. However, the waves still pound those sand whales relentlessly and on some days, the waves were so strong, they would come over the top of the sand whales by several feet. I've attached some pictures of how rough the waves got. I wouldn't advise taking a toddler into the waves when high tide comes in. The waves are most calm in the morning hours, but pick up substantially by noon, when high tide comes in. The water was a wee bit chilly, but you got used to it really quickly. It's still that same shade of gorgeous turquoise. We were in room 2054. The room was as we expected it, after staying in other 'Palace' category Riu properties; a junior suite with a love seat, coffee table and dresser with a TV on it, and two double beds pushed together in a separate area. The TV was a Sony Bravia flat screen which was great quality. There were several channels in English to include most major cable news channels. The TV just didn't pivot (or swivel) so we couldn't watch it from the rest of the room; you couldn't see the TV unless you were directly in front of it. There was a coffee maker in the bathroom which some great coffee and Carnation-brand creamer. The bar was refilled every day (which was good, since we were drinking the 7UP the fastest) and the toiletries were replenished if we used them. They offer to replace your towels like most hotels claim to: If your towel is hanging up, they don't change it. If your towel is on the floor, they exchange it. They actually adhered to that. Few hotels I've been in actually DO what their little placard actually states. The airconditioner kept up at night, and the room was cool at night, though sometimes damp. The damp smell didn't permeate this room as it did in Punta Cana. This room was less humid as well. Our room had a tiny little balcony since our room was a little bigger, but most folks had larger balconies. I would have traded our room for a room with more of a balcony since the weather was so pleasant at night. We had little patio furniture to fit on our little patio. Unlike our balcony, the "normal" balconies had larger lounge chairs on their patios ... gee, sure would've liked to have one of those rooms ... ;) The food! OMG. I gained 4 pounds in 5 days, even though hubby and I did cardio every morning in their gym. Aack! But we ate at Don Julio's every day for breakfast and for dinner. And there was ALWAYS something fantastic to eat. I must preface this review with the fact that my fave food is Mexican, being from Texas. Fresh-made tortillas, wonderful chicken enchilada soup, tortilla soup, hot gorditas/flautas, etc. Don't get me wrong, there were other amazing dishes for dinner as well: spit-roasted whole turkey one night, outstanding paella, grilled seafood (like shrimp and lobster), asparagus soup, beef steaks (though I'm uncertain of the cut of steak), amazing prime rib that was cooked just right at the carving station, creamy and very tasty farfalle pasta in alfredo sauce. Several nights they had a guy cooking crepes while you wait. He would fill them with what ever you wanted; creme freche, bananas, home-made caramel, chocolate bits, etc. Holy smokes .... it melted in your mouth. And he always had a line. We OD'd on those one night; we couldn't quit eating them. I must admit that I didn't exactly eat much veggies or salad while I was there, which contributed to my expanded waist line, I'm sure. But with so many great aromas in that restaurant, I couldn't help myself. Dang, I'm making myself hungry just remembering the food. Breakfast was the standard fare: all kinds of different eggs, charizo/potato mixture with sauteed onions, bacon (not really sliced bacon; it was more like shaved bacon which made me go crazy with it), a variety of different toasts, lox and bagels, cheeses of all kinds, huevos rancheros, migas, cereals, yogurt (try the mango yogurt, it's great). I'm a big breakfast eater (well, let me say I'm a believer in having a good solid breakfast) and I ate myself stupid at breakfast, knowing that I don't usually eat lunch. This breakfast was great. You could have mimosas, coffee, all different kinds of juices (try their guava) at the fresh juice station, fresh milk with all the cream (which was honestly quite good!); this meal was my second fave of the day, with dinner being my first fave meal of the day. The wait staff at Don Julio's were really great. They worked their butts off running here and there to get you drinks, take away plates, make you cafe con leche, etc. We liked to sit in German's station (pronounced Herman) and Daniel's section. Both waiters were real polite, very nice, very attentive. I have to admit that we left the safe in our room open while we went to breakfast one morning, and housekeeping came. Elitsita, our housekeeper, didn't touch anything; all our passports, money, jewelry was still there. I don't think we got "lucky". I think there are still good-hearted people out there that are genuinely honest. Elitsita got a nice tip from us upon checkout, not just for that, but for also being friendly to us and being so responsive. Here's my only complaint (that I'll be sharing with the Riu in a letter) about this hotel. If you book your reservation directly with the Riu website, you get "free transfers" to and from the hotel from a 3rd party called HotelBeds Services and Attractions. You have to provide your flight details for your arriving flight and your departure flight (like, airline, flight number, arrival/departure time, etc) and the number of passengers with you when you make your reservation. You are emailed travel vouchers that you are supposed to present to the HotelBeds rep upon arrival into Cancun International Airport. You should know that this is what's called "shared van service" which means it's like a Super Shuttle. Many people share a van and the driver drops you all off in a pre-determined order based on where you're staying. We were kept waiting for an hour for other passengers due to arrive on another flight. We hadn't anticipated that we'd be waiting an hour just to get into a van. But after an hour, we started getting fussy, and refused to 'go have a seat'. Instead, we stood right by the HotelBeds podium in front of the other HotelBeds customers (and potential customers), which prompted the HotelBeds rep to put us onto a van by another tour company called Aventura Tours. I guess he didn't want surly-looking guests ruining potential business. The Aventura Driver was very nice and he had us to our hotel in an hour. While we were at theRiu, we were constantly bugged by the HotelBeds rep who said we had an "orientation" at a specific time. Heck, we came on vacation to get away from meetings, and I'm not about to sit in another meeting while we're on VACATION. So we ignored her calls. Then one day, she called at 7 AM waking us up and insisting that we come to an orientation. I debated with her on the following points: Me- I already have a voucher with a scheduled departure time, so why do I need to come see you? (knowing she wanted to waste our time by attempting to sell us excursions we didn't want) Her - So I can get your return flight information for the return transfer. Me - I already provided that information when I booked my reservation, so you should have that information. Her - No I don't have that information. I need you to come to the HotelBeds desk. Me - Then I can give you that information over the phone. Her - Well, I'll need your signature Me - For what? Her - For the transfers. See the circular argument? We get up, go to the desk (mind you, we're not happy) she sees us but is with another customer booking an excursion. She's already got a customer on the hook and doesn't care about us who are simply scheduling return transfers, so she ignores us. We wait 15 minutes, and we're both glaring at her from 5 feet away. Seeing that we might ruin her business with our presence, she asks if we are so-and-so, and we tell her yes. She asks for our return flights, at which time I hand her the voucher from HotelBeds that I received via email containing not only our return flight and time, but a scheduled van arrival time to pick us up from the Riu. She writes this information down, explains where we should wait for the van, and we leave. Wow. This was the only irritating thing out of the whole trip, and it's not the fault of the Riu, though they should know who they're doing business with because I certainly won't be using HotelBeds in the future. For anything. We later found out that a private taxi would have been $50 (negotiable) for two each way. I would highly recommend going with a taxi instead in the future. It might save you a headache and an early wake-up call. Everyone from check in (thank you to Laura at the reception desk) to check out was really friendly and really made us feel welcome while we were there. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends or family heading down to Mexico. It's not Palatial, but rather it's a cozy, beautiful hotel with outstanding service and great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “A little dated, but something for everybody!”
Reviews.Author: maribel922
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from our trip to RIU Palace Mexico, and since I spent a lot of time reading these reviews prior to our trip, I thought I'd throw my two cents in. Overall, we loved our stay at the RIU Palace Mexico. Based on past TripAdvisor review, I wrote the manager a few weeks prior to our trip and requested a fountain view room, but they never responded. Although not a fountain view, per se, we did have a view of the courtyard above the main buffet, which was a nice room (not sure if this was because of my email or what), HOWEVER thankfully we aren't the sort to go to bed prior to 11pm, as the music in the courtyard was very loud for the nightly entertainment and lasts until 11. We were impressed with the evening entertainment each night and loved having something to do after dinner on site. The property and grounds at the hotel are overall very nice, but I agree with past reviews that the hotel is showing its age a bit in the pool area. The pool is not as big or as nice as the RPRM, nor has as close proximity to the beach like RPRM. It really didn't bother me much, but if you are a "pool person" you may want to consider the RPRM or the Yucatan. We were easily able to find chairs under the palm trees close to the water every day and enjoyed looking out of the ocean. The hotel food was great. There is a buffet open all afternoon close to the water, so you can go load up on a salad or guacamole or pizza as a break from your lounging. There really is something for everyone at the morning and evening buffet in the main hotel. The quality of the food was great and lots of variety. We ate at Krystal one night and found the food and experience to be excellent. The other night we went to the Brazilian steakhouse and it was "just okay." The meat was fine, but it was a little rinky dink. Certainly no Fogo de Chao. We had no problems making reservations for the restaurants after we ate breakfast around 9, but the morning we went down around 10, all that was open was one spot in the Brazilian steakhouse, which we declined as per our first experience. We did go down to RIU Palace RM one day and the hotels are very similar in kind of a Seinfeld "Bizarro" world sort of way. The restaurants are in the same areas of the hotel, have similar names and the hotels both have a similar layout. The pool area for RM was much larger and nicer, but beyond that, the only differences we could see beyond that was in clientele. RPM had far more Europeans and Midwesterners (in our one day observation). RPRM seemed way more American overall, and especially lots of New Yorkers (maybe there was a NJ special, we don't know). :) We loved being exposed to the different cultures at RPM, but definitely saw a lot of topless sunbathing going on (and quite out in the open- an 80 year old grandma thought nothing of feeding the gulls topless- ha), so parents bringing children not accustomed to this may want to plan ahead. This was a getaway trip for my husband and I; our first trip "away" from our 10 month old. It was a lovely escape. The drinks weren't watered down, there was top shelf liquour available, if requested and overall the service was fantastic. I spent most of my trip drinking mojitos and they were divine. You didn't feel like you needed to tip, but it was generally appreciated if you did. We discussed our top 3 recommendations for the hotel one night and it would be this: 1. Update beds. I know a lot of previous reviewers said the mattresses were hard and then improved. I found our beds to be hard and covered with a plastic sheety thing and scratchy sheets. I missed my bed at home a lot. 2. Cabana servers on the beach and more of them at the pool. The last day we were there, there was a man walking around with a variety of drinks on a tray, but the other days we were there there was no cabana service at the beach. Not a big deal to go get your own drink, as there is a bar right on the beach, but it would be nicer if there was better cabana service. 3. General overhaul of the pool area, as previously noted. 4. More central bar/gathering space. The outdoor area where the nightly entertainment is located is okay, but it would be nice to create more of a central bar/gathering area like they have at the RIU Tequila across the street. Tequila is a fun place for a change of scene in nightly entertainment and they have a hopping bar. RPM has great entertainment, but people are sort of all over the place. Tequila is fun people watching for an evening cocktail and you can just walk across the street. They also have a nightclub that opens late in the evening like 11:30 or so.

Reviews.Title: “Spring break with my college sons fishing for marlin”
Reviews.Author: mlibratore
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for 5 adults one room for 3 college boys and one deluxe suite for my wife and I. The AC never worked right and they sent one after another incompetent person who could not fix it and we spent hours arguing and fighting with poor english speaking staff about it and were after two months of corresponding with the Spanish based equally incoherrent staff we stil have no adjustments or relief. Oh and yeah, they lied about the free transportation from the airport as well for stays for over 5 days. We ended up paying for our ride to the airport as well. The beach is un-swimmable and the staff is rude and arrogant, no one really cares if you are there so you might as well go to New York. Feel free to write me for details. markcasa@bellsouth.net

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay despite the surprising number of spring breakers”
Reviews.Author: jetsetbet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed at Riu Palace Mexico March 23rd for 5 nights in a garden view jr. suite. Check in was handled very quickly and even asking for a change of floor did not cause the front desk clerk any distress. Our rooms were on the 3rd floor overlooking the walkway used by the Riu Tequila guests to get to the beach. There was no noise associated with the location. Compared to many other upscale resorts I have stayed at I was slightly dissappointed with the pool area. There was very little shade so we chose to spend more time at the beach where they seemed to be more palms and intimate areas. There was never an issue with getting loungers. Plenty were always available and could be easily manouvered into the right spot. Even being quite a distance from the ocean provided us with great vistas. Plenty of hammocks were also scattered about in and amongst the palms. On most of the days we were at Riu Palace the breezes were quite strong therefore making the waves quite large. The life guards were always blowing their whistles to get people off the large black "whale" sandbags so they would not get injured. I did not see it but heard that a young teen had gotten knocked off one of them and broke his leg. I would think it could happen very easily. The beach is coming back with the help of the sand bags. It is much wider than a few years ago. As you walk south from the Riu Palace there are points of the beach where the surf has cut into the beach leaving a 2 to 3 foot drop off. With the winds beating the water onto the beach you can appreciate why this has happened. It did not seem to bother anyone who was a beach walker however. One day we walked all the way from our hotel to the border of the Occidental Grand Xcaret resort's beach. It was several miles each way and a beautiful walk. We were surprised to see an exceptional number of college aged spring breakers at this property. I own a travel agency and this is normally a property that attracts this demographic. I will say on the whole they were very well behaved. We always enjoyed watching them play volleyball at the beach court. It provided a lot of entertainment. Periodically we did see them with adults so we assumed they were not booked into the hotel on their own, but had chaperones. There was one incident that did have me wondering why they allowed younger people into this upscale hotel however. One night at about 3am on our floor a group of breakers emptied 5 or 6 of the hotels fire extinguishers all down the corridor. Our friends heard the commotion but did not feel they should open their door for security reasons. When we left our room for breakfast we seen about 1/2 an inch of a fine gray sandy powder absolutely all over everything. At the time we could not figure out what had happened. After breakfast when we went to the lobby to retrieve emails my husband went to the front desk to inquire what had happened outside our room. He was told that multiple fire extinguishers has been discharged and it would be cleaned up immediately. I must give kudos to the staff because by the time we came back from the beach around 3pm it was virtually spotless. They worked tirelessly to clean all the wrought iron railings, the wood work, and the floors to their previous condition. Because the extinguishers were no longer in their places it made you hope their was not going to be a fire. My final thought is that I would have hoped the hotel's security would have caught this before it got out of hand. In this I was dissappointed in Riu's management. I am even more dissappointed with the imature people who did it. We were for the most part happy with the food and drinks. I was quite concerned before I got to the resort about having to make reservations each morning for that evenings a la carte but it proved to be very simple. After breakfast around 820am we simply crossed the courtyard to the theatre / lounge area and got a number from one of the staff. At 830am they started calling out numbers and guests would simply go up to a table, give the name of their restaurant of choice for that evening, give their preferred time, and the number of guests, get a reservations slip, and you were on your way. We ate at the steak house, the Japanese, and the gourmet restaurants. The service at each was very good. As someone mentioned in an earlier review it did seem like many of the appetizers were pre made and therefore not as hot as they could have been. The buffet selections at breakfast and lunch were very good. and presented well. If someone couldn't find something to eat then truly they should not leave home! None of us were a big fan of the coffee. Adding hot water or lots of milk didn't seem to help so we either switched to the instant coffee they had on hand or had tea. The service at the lobby bar was exceptional. Even when I ordered my special drink concoction it was not a problem. For something different try a Mad Max. One part of Malibu rum, one part of Amaretto, and then a few spashes of orange juice in a tall glass over ice. Delicious!!!!!! In regard to the room I felt it was comfortable for the most part. I still am not a big fan of the Riu bed configuration. I have yet to figure out why they put two double beds together with one giant wood headboard? I would enjoy a true king bed more and I am sure families staying in one room would prefer two separate doubles. I also could not figure out why the safe was installed at knee level in the closet. Having to bend over to put things in and out was a pain. By the way the safe did hold a large lap top. We had no complaints about our mini bar. It was stocked with lots of everything and we loved that they had Dos Equis beer. It is one of our favorites in Mexico. The coffee maker and supplies to make coffee in the morning was also a great touch. We made coffee every morning in the room and it was much better than the restaurant stuff. The location of this property is superb. We had a car throughout our stay but even if we didn't have a vehicle it is very easy to get into Playa del Carmen. Many people walked into town. A taxi into town would be quite affordable as well. All of us, along with multiple other guests enjoyed the fact that the resort has free wi fi in the lobby and lobby bar areas. If someone did not have their own lap top there were also about 5 or 6 computers on a pay for minutes basis at the one end of the lobby bar. If you are looking for a well located resort with excellent food and service this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Worldwide707
Reviews.Content: this is a top grade hotel! wonderfull, i took my 2 teens and my husband and i was perfect. right in the heart of everything! awesome food (and a ton of it), great service, clean rooms, great pool! could be a bit cheaper but worth every penny! a little far from the airport but wonderful views. best beach on the strip! very classy and right for any age, shows at night for families and later ones for adults. everyone was very nice and friendly! We went to most everyother hotel in the area and searched for the perfect hotel for months, and this one stood out the most and was wonderful! can not say more about it! simply Great! i saw a weding while i was ther and it looked beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Breakers Puke on Our Vacation”
Reviews.Author: MindyStLouis
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel we didn't think they allowed groups of spring breakers, wrong! Hundreds of spoiled rich high school kids took over this hotel with little regard for anyone but them selves as many parents sat by and watched them puke on the beach (MICDS) and along the walks on the way into the dinning room, rip out plants and scatter dirt down the hall ways, and discharge all the fire extinguishers in our area. Scream incessantly every where they went, in the dinning rooms, at the pool and beach and late at night. There was no way for an adult to approach the pool bar. One girl was wheeled off the beach who appeared near death from alcohol poisoning (MSHS?). The hotel is worth going to but not if they allow these groups to take over. The rudeness and air of entitlement of the majority of these breakers is what no one needs when you work hard and just need to get away. If they would have had any respect for anyone but themselves nobody would have cared how drunk or how much fun they had. The hotel needs to decide what its clientel is going to consist of and make it clear to them because this mix doesn't work. Every adult I talked to was unhappy and would not come back or recommend this hotel to freinds because of the breakers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: talk2kim
Reviews.Content: At first, we were very disappointed. Originally we were to stay at RIU caribe in Cancun. We were bumped to this hotel but not by choice. The clientele is a bit older at this hotel, so not what we expected. Quiet at night time, not what we expected. However once we settled in that we were there for a reason, we had the time of our lives. The hotel was beautiful. The beach is great. The pool and swim up bar excellent. Rooms and all other areas, always clean. Weather fabulous. The staff, especially the activities coordinators were awesome! Entertainment was so-so. Food was a little bit to be desired, but it was ok overall. There were not many kids, but there were facilities for kids. Not a place I would take my kids. The shopping and nightlife in Playa Del Carmen excellent. Must go to Coco Bongos. Lots of trips, excursions and culture to experience and keep you busy if you wanted to venture out. The community where the hotel was gated and therefore felt very safe at all times. This vacation overall was 5 plus all around even though we were bumped to somewhere we did not want to be. The staff definitely helped us to enjoy our vacation immensely. We definitely look forward to going back! You know what? Only you make your vacation what it is going to be! :) And ours was great!

Reviews.Title: “Superior facility and service with great food and entertainment”
Reviews.Author: budw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the Riu Palace Mexico. Never have we seen a hotel staff work so hard to please guests. The nightly entertainment was very good and fun to be a part of. The entire facility to include rooms, restaurants, pool and beach were clean and well done. Playa del Carmen is close by and provides good shopping, bars and restaurants. However, we ate all of our meals at the hotel as it was all inclusive. The only negative, contrary to what out travel agent told us, was that there were a group of "spring breakers" who were loud and rude. One group included high school seniors and their parents; some of the parents were almost a s loud and rude as their children. The hotel staff was fairly effective in dealing with them. More than being bothered by their behavior, I was embarrassed in the presence of Canadians and Europeans who are always considerate of others. All in all, I would go back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Rui Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: tkettler1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for our second "adult" ttrip to this area. Overall the hotel was nice, but I was not impressed with the food. There is a good selection of meats it seems, but we had a hard time finding food that was warm. Went to 3 of the reservation restraunts, and the Brazilian was the best. Food was acctually hot! Was my husbands birthday, and they went all out with a special table and sang Happy Birthday to him with a cake! Beach was great, very clean, lots of chairs, good choice of sun or shade. Rooms were nice. The only problem we had was that our balcony face the walk way to the next door resort and there was not much sun light, making our room sort of dark. Very Beautiful grounds and great service. We really did enjoy our stay. It seem that most of the other guests were older. We are in our 30's and wishedd there were more people in our age group to talk with.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect winter beach getaway!”
Reviews.Author: travelalotCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the RIU Palace Mexico-- what a great place! The resort is large and roomy, it was completely full but never felt crowded like the other nearby Riu properties ( the Yucatan, Tequila, and Playacar). It is a nice option to be able to use the facilities at the other resorts, some of the other pools were larger. The bar seemed very small at the Palace, but that is because the service is outstanding, you don't need to go to the bar to get your own drink, a server came by at the pool or on the beach about every 15 minutes. The hotel rooms and the grounds are IMMACULATE, very well-kept . Other reviews mentioned the hard beds: the hotel has put mattress toppers on all the beds, so it was confortable. The rooms are nicely appointed with a wetbar stocked with Dos Equis beer, a variety of Pepsi products and bottled water, enough water for coffee and brushing teeth (we avoided Montezuma's revenge!). Also a liquor dispenser with vodka, tequila, whiskey, and brandy. We talked to another guest who asked for Kahlua to put in his coffee, they sent the whole bottle to his room. This resort has the best beach area of all the neighboring properties-- large, plenty of palm trees, alot of chairs, they even had a lunch barbeque on the beach. The other resorts have a much smaller beach area. There are large sand bags to help stop erosion, but they are not obstructive. Check-in and check-out were quick and smooth, they asked at check-in if we had any special occasions. I mentioned my husbands 50th birthday later that week. On his birthday, they decorated the room with balloons and a "cake" made out of towels, they gave him a little gift and a card, they traced which restaurant we were eating at and had a birthday cake, sang , gave us champagne, decorated the table with rose petals--it was great!! The resort is located in Playacar, a gated private community of homes, condos, and hotels---very safe. There is a small shopping area down the street, and it is an easy 2 mile walk into Playa del Carmen. If you don't want to walk, it is a $5 cab ride. The location is close to the ruins at Tulum, Xcaret park and Xel-ha snorkelling. There is always someone in the lobby to arrange these tours for you. The food is good, I don't think the specialty restaurants are necessarily worth waiting an hour to make reservations every morning, the buffet is good with a different theme each night. The "gala" night had lobster and beef Wellington. The food is very similar to a cruise ship. There are shows each night at 9:45, I'm not a big show fan, I thought they were pretty lame, but that's a personal preference. They have a nice piano bar in the lobby and a disco across the street at the Tequila. Okay, lets talk price: we got a great deal on the 'net-- 7 days, 6 nights, non-stop air from Cincinnati, and of course the resort is all-inclusive, all for $2200 including taxes, transfers, gratuities. GREAT PRICE!!!! Especially for February! I would DEFINITELY go back again, or stay at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya down the street-- it's a little newer, bigger, with a gorgeous pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the resort but didn't care for the food”
Reviews.Author: KK
Reviews.Content: My sister and law stayed at Riu Palace for 3 nights in early March. We were actually booked at the Riu Yucatan but were upgraded to the Riu Palace at check-in. The Palace had a much nicer lobby than the Yucatan- it was more elegant and air conditioned rather than open air. The room was a jr. suite- 2 double beds and a small sitting area with a couch. The room had a musty smell- but many beach resorts do. The maids always did a great job cleaning up the room. The pool was large but very quiet. Alot of people were seniors. I would suggest going next door to the Yucatan's pool if you want a more lively atmosphere. At the Palace pool, I was glad that you could get out to the pool after 12pm and still find a lawn chair. I was not very happy with the food at this resort. At least with the buffets (breakfast, lunch, & dinner), the selection was large enough that you could find something that tasted decent. For the reservation only restaurants, you have to wake up at 8:30am to try to get a table. They have 2 seatings 6:30pm and 8:45pm. It is not worth wasting your time to try to eat at one of these restaurants. We ate at Miyagi, the Japanese restaurant, one night. We thought it was terrible. The food didn't seem freshly prepared and the sauces used on the entrees were just not good. We tried the Brazilian restaurant, La Bodega, another night. It was terrible too. The meats were fatty and just didn't have decent taste. Maybe we are spoiled because we have so many outstanding restaurants in Houston, TX, but I would rate the specialty restaurants at the Palace below average. After dinner, the bar over at the Riu Tequila (across the street from the Palace) is more happening than the bar at the Palace. The disco- La Pinata- opens up at 11pm- at Riu Tequila. It's small but fun. We never checked out the other "gold" property- the Riviera Maya. We did walk through the Riu Playacar. It seemed older. They had 2 small pools that seemed to be mostly shaded by all the trees around them. I would spend a few dollars more and stay at the Yucatan over the Playacar- there was an $8/person difference when I made my reservation with my travel agent.

Reviews.Title: “liked the beach but the Front Desk wasn't friendly”
Reviews.Author: golnazmiam
Reviews.Content: The beach was awesome. The food was great. The best Rui in playa del carmen in my opinion. The only problem was funjet.com and the front desk. We didn’t get the room we wanted it. Overall good hotel to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon, didn't get the promised champagne”
Reviews.Author: kpettijo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel and defintiely agree that all future trips to Mexico will be all-inclusive. At check-in we had reserved as a honeymoon couple and did show our marriage certificate, however did not receive the promised goodies, they did send us a small fruit plate to make up for it . . . no so amazing. We only left the hotel a few times to check out the shopping in Playa and visit some favorite sites. The shopping district is within walking distance, but it's a bit of a trek. The buffet was fabulous and had great variety. I would suggest trying all of the restaraunts, King Aurthur's had the best steak I've ever had, we actually at there more than once. However, my hubby had to get up quite early to make sure we could get the reservations we wanted. The staff over all was pretty good, they do a great job at keeping your glasses full, especially your first nights there. I would make sure to fill up at the meals, room service options were not that great.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to like!”
Reviews.Author: PorkerDizz
Reviews.Content: The staff did everything to please you and it was hard to believe they could all be so nice. Every inch of the resort was spotless and beautiful. Rooms were roomy (at least perfect for 2 adults). There's even a small clothesline on the deck for your wet swimsuit. Champange every morning at breakfast, all the alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages you could drink 24/7 and in your room. Guests would go out early in the morning and put a towel on a chair around the pool so they were hard to get, we never did get one in the 7 days there but my only question was - why would you sit around the pool when the beach is right there? It was nice being able to look at the other Rui's to check out the difference between them. It was our first time in Mexico and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit & hope to return”
Reviews.Author: Viv01
Reviews.Content: We visited the Riu Palace Mexico 2/18-25 & thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I had emailed the resort in advance hoping to avoid a ground level room & requesting the north side of the resort w/a courtyard view. But, upon arrival they did have us booked in a ground level room on the south side of the resort w/a courtyard view. I kindly asked if there might be any 1st or 2nd floor rooms available & voila, we were in luck. Thank you Shannon!! (I hope you received the envelope that I left for you when we checked out.) Our 1st floor room (1133) was very nice & quite suitable for us. I also would rather have had a king size bed versus the two beds pushed together, but of course, we made due. After all, it was only for a week. I don’t think any of the rooms have a walk in shower, but that would have been preferable over the tub. There was always plenty of hot water & good pressure in the shower. The room was cleaned perfectly every day & the mini fridge was also restocked every day. We were happy to leave a daily tip because the room was so well kept each day. As previously noted on other reviews, the grounds are indeed beautiful & very well maintained. We stayed on the beach each day & didn’t really take time to experience the pool area. There were plenty of beach lounge chairs available in the sun or the shade. So, didn’t have to worry about getting out early to save chairs. There are various activities to get involved in if you are so inclined. Or, if you just want to relax & read (which I did) there are quieter spots to do that too. We are not picky eaters & loved the buffet. Special thanks to German for all his excellent service & attention. (I hope you received the envelop we left for you.) We also tried the Steak & Brazilian restaurants & found the food very good & the atmosphere just fine for us. Although, limiting the reservations to just one a day was a bit inconvenient. My husband is a scuba diver & he did go out with the dive operation there at the resort his first day of diving. But, his preference is go out with smaller groups. So, we went in to Playa to book the rest of his dives for the week with a dive operation that he used the last time we were in Playa Del Carmen, Beach Divers. My husband finds the people there to be very friendly & accommodating. This is our 8th year going to the Playa area & the fourth different all inclusive resort that we’ve visited. I would say that the Riu Palace Mexico is our new favorite!! We walked around the other nearby Riu resorts and for the most part, they looked pretty nice as well. But, I think we made a very good choice in the RPM. We very much hope to be able to return & enjoy another week in paradise!! V&M Dexter

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away By The Beach!”
Reviews.Author: lovetrout
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from Riu Palace Riviera Maya. I've stayed in Playa before (05) but liked this place better, mostly because of the beach. Food is ok, breakfast and lunch the best. But, my clothes from the week in the room all had to be laundered due to a musty smell that I couldn't ignore- even though the clothes were never worn. Staff is outstanding! Service is first and foremost to be sure. I would definitely stay again, but do something about the odor please.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely FANTASTIC place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mombi
Reviews.Content: This resort was amazing. So clean, food was great, beautiful beaches and I just can't say enough about the service. We always had a drink in our hands and never had to go looking for things. Someone was always there to help or answer a question. We called for more blankets and literally as soon as we hung up the phone, there was a knock at the door with the blankets. They have servers walking the beaches with drinks and you could also order from them and they would bring you the drink you want. They even had a BBQ on the beach on the Friday and we could eat right there and they also walked around and served us fresh fruit. The people are so friendly, I felt so safe and I highly recommend this resort to anyone wanting a fantastic holiday. There is a dance club at the RIU Tequila across the street that we could go check out. We could go into any of the RIUs and eat there or use their facilities if we wanted. It was neat. Well I just can't say more about this wonderful place!! I recommend it to anyone wanting to have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico vrs Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: garylubbes
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 day stay at Riu Palace Mexico. You are granted privileges at all of the Playacar Riu's so we went to Riu Palace Riviera Maya to compare. Both facilities are large and impressive. Excellently maintained and visually attractive. They take cleanliness to an art form. I have never been anywhere cleaner in 15+ trips to Mexico. Food at both was very good. Only a food snob would criticize the overall effort. Lots of variety. Excellent bakery goods and abundant fresh fruit and salads at all times. Beaches are the best in Playa. Both have large sandy areas between the hotel and the Caribbean planted heavily with coconut palms for shade and beauty. Pools - Riviera Maya has hands down the better pool. Many great features including an infinity pool area, loungers in the shallow water and multiple step entrances. If you are a pool person, it will be worth your while staying there just for the better pool. And yes, the pool at Mexico does have an odor. It seems to emanate from an exhaust fan on the side of the pool building where the pool chemicals are mixed and added to the water. You need to stay up wind or you will notice it all day long. Plus the pool has NO STEPS, only ladders and mostly 4 1/2 ft deep thruout. Hard to get in and out. And the design, while attractive from a distance, does not lend itself to swimming any kind of lap - very scalloped and curvy. Reservation restaurants - You can only use the dinner restaurants at your resort. We did try three of the four. Each had "sittings" - everyone arrives for either the early 6:30 sitting or the late 8:45 sitting. This forces the kitchen to prepare all meals at the same time. So they cheat, and prepare some elements of the meals ahead. They offer a limited menu and anticipate a certain number of each item and cook them in advance. Fine for soup or cold items, but not hot hors douvers (spl) or entrees. So some items will have past their prime by the time you get them. We have had better food quality at other all inclusives that offer reservations every 15 minutes or so to stager the diners. That way each meal is prepared as ordered rather than in advance. With Riu you get what you pay for. In Playacar alone, they offer the bargain Tequila to the Palace Riviera Maya. If you can afford it, go to either Palace - Riviera Maya if possible. Maya is newer and designed around the same basic plan as Mexico, but they learned from their mistakes and made the improvements at Maya. If have any questions of concerns, please feel free to e-mail me @ garylubbes@gmail.com.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: cardiodoc
Reviews.Content: This was our first venture into an all inclusive resort. Trip's goal was rest and relaxation with sun/beach. The Riu Palace Mexico did not disappoint. The rooms were clean and attractive. The staff friendly and helpful. As we are vegetarians, the buffet was challenging at times, and the chef did attempt to make some vegetarian items, but not as accomadating as say a chef on a Cruiseliner. The restaurants for dinner were hard to schedule and booked within minutes of availability at 800 am so effectively they wanted you to eat in the buffet. The beach was excellent and the wait staff, etc were superb.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and relaxing hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Tantino
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the hotel from 8th February '09 for ten days. Overall we found the hotel to be very good. The layout and design of the hotel was nice and you could tell that this was the best hotel in the area after visiting some of the others nearby including the other Riu's. The hotel was always clean and tidy with staff who seemed to be constantly working hard to achieve this. We found the food was good with plenty of choice at all meal times. We mainly used the Buffet due to having a young family however found both the Steak and Krystal Restauarants to be very good. The restaurant and bar staff in all areas of the complex including the beach were very efficient, constantly offering drinks. Our Children used the mini club on a few occassions and seemed to enjoy themselves. The pool area design was not that great and not so child friendly whilst the beach was lovely with white sand with turquoise sea as you expect. Our only area of dissapointment was our room since we were sold one room which could apparently hold two adults, two children and an infant comfortably however this was not the case and we had to change roooms upon arrival to a larger room which still didnt give is the space we would have liked. Furthermore there are no ajoining bedrooms in the hotel therefore young families are a little limited. In my opinion the hotel is best suited for couples, families or anyone looking for a quiet relaxing holiday. It will not be suited for teenagers or singles looking for a party atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday at the Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: BrianM55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from January 25 to February 1. For the first week we had our children and grandchildren with us, 12 of us in total. Every single one of us had a fabulous time. Our check in went smoothly and we were quickly shown to our rooms. All rooms were clean and well equipped. No complaints at all. Beds were comfortable and maid service was thorough every day. Rooms on the Yucatan side are definitely quieter than those on the fountain side. On the fountain side you hear the noise from the outdoor band stand and theatre every night until 11 PM. The food was great. Our son is an executive chef at a well known Vancouver, BC hotel and he was impressed with the quality of the food. Breakfasts were great with a tremendous selection. Lunch can be had at the main buffet or closer to the beach in the El Patio restaurant. Suppers were good at the main buffet. We tried two of the gourmet restaurants, the Krystal and the Japanese. Both were excellent. The Krystal was our favourite. Both the filet and the salmon at the Krystal were very good. You can't go wrong with either one. The hotel is impeccibly kept. Staff are constantly cleaning and tending to the landscaping. We never had a problem finding a lounger at either the pool or the beach. The sand at the beach is amazing; soft and clean. The water was a little cool, but very refreshing after being in the hot sun. As others have said, the "whales" are there for a reason, they stop the beach from eroding away. Staff are regularly making the rounds on the beach offering guests cool drinks. There are some vendors who walk the beach trying to sell their wares, but a simple "No, gracias" and they continue on their way. The hotel is well located in the Playacar area. Across the street is a small shopping plaza with ATM's, small shops and a Starbuck's for those who need a fix. Playa del Carmen is about a 1 mile walk away or a 50 peso cab ride. There are dozens of shops there to satisfy most shoppers. The staff at the Riu Palace Mexico are one of its greatest assets. Absolutely everyone we spoke with and dealt with were friendly and helpful. They always go out of their way to assist in any way they can. The door man at the hotel, Manuel, is a great ambassador for the hotel. He is very attentive to all guests and always has a smile on his face. Manuel is always willing to help in any way he can. Also deserving of a special mention are Kim and Alejandro at the front desk as well as Esther and Rosauro in the main buffet. These 5 individuals made our stay very enjoyable through their genuine friendliness and willingness to help us any way they could. We all know a few basic phrases in Spanish and that went a long way toward making communication easier. All in all we had a tremendous holiday. We were sad to leave at the end of our two weeks. We do not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a fabulous holiday. My wife and I are planning on returning to the Riu Palace Mexico next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTraveler_8
Reviews.Content: I dont understand any of the bad reviews other than you can't please everyone. We've been to 8 different resorts in 4 different countries and this one is the best. The resort is being cleaned costantly. It is gorgeous. It does have some wear on floor tiles and other areas, but they are repairing things all the time. The beach is huge, but does have some repairs needed since a few hurricans a couple of years ago, but they are constantly working on it by pumping sand back up behind the whales. The food is the best we've had and the variety should make any one happy. The animation team works hard to entertain everyone and they work long hours. The resort is very close to Playa and it is a 30 minute walk or a 5 minute taxi ride for 5 dollars. The staff all work hard. The front desk is very helpfull. When we asked them for anything they were very nice and polite. The wait staff in the restaurants were always at your table. The bar staff are quick. They came around about every 10 minutes or less. I would highly recommend this resort and we will be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, fun, and good food!”
Reviews.Author: buck2009
Reviews.Content: Wow! It really is a great place. The staff went out of their way to please us, whether we were on the beach or in one of their restaurants. The food was wonderful in all the restaurants, although we didn't make it to the Japanese one, but we heard it was really good. We spent the majority of our time on the beach just relaxing. If I wasn't relaxing, I was usually playing beach volleyball. One of the many bonuses of staying at RPM is that you can enjoy the other nearby Riu's. My wife and I visited the Yucatan and the Tequila. Both are fun! Not only did we meet a lot of fun people to hang out with, the workers also knew how to entertain all day long.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints what so ever”
Reviews.Author: reddy2goback
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace Mexico was great. Great food, great location, clean rooms, big beach, great service--couldn't ask for anything more except a few more days.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our third trip to RPM!!!”
Reviews.Author: fllipflop
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an amazing week's stay at the RPM from January 28 - February 5. This is our third trip to the RPM and our fifth to the Rius in Playa and everything was excellent as always. Each trip surpasses the year before and just when you think the service couldn't get any better, it somehow does. Many of the staff recognized us right away and greeted us warmly...everyone from our dear friend Maria the Director who always made time to welcome us and ask how everything was to our favourite chica and towel girl Abigail....it was lovely to be so warmly received, we truly felt like we were among family... We had private deluxe transportation from Cancun airport to RPM with Greyline transportation through Northwest. This year there was approx. a fifteen minute wait for our SUV while last year we found them to be much more prompt. There was also a bit of confusion and delay upon leaving the resort at the end of our trip which held at the gates of Playacar for 50 minutes - but that was no fault of Greyline, just an overzealous taxi driver that caused some confusion - but that's another story... Upon entering the airconditioned lobby, we were greeted by Manuel, usually the first person you see when entering the RPM, with a cool drink, hug and a "welcome home". We went to the front desk and were welcomed back by the wonderful Luis - and found he had the room we had requested ready and waiting. Our room was beautifully decorated with flowers each day with as well as occassional gifts of food, art, etc. from management. The front desk was outgoing and wonderful, especially Luis who was so helpful, and at times, comical, and even offered to come say goodbye on his day off...this front desk is the best the RPM has ever had... The grounds were just as beautiful as in years past with improvements constantly being made. We don't spend much time in the pool area but found it a bit livelier than in years past with music which was nice to see. There is a wonderful restaurant near the beach which offers lunch as well as a great view of the beach. The more formal buffet also offers lunch as an option. Room service was always prompt - delivered within a few minutes - and always beautifully presented. Raphael, head waiter, made our stay as special as he has every other year...and as did Gebrail, the other head waiter. We were constantly asked how everything was and if we needed anything. They made sure everything was perfect and had our table set aside with flowers during our stay which was very sweet... Breakfast buffet was our favourite with so many options from fresh breads, bacon, eggs, cheeses, fruits, waffles, etc. to choose from. We have always loved the evening buffet (especially the mexican area somewhat hidden in a seperate section) and loved the incredible variety there. It was just as wonderful as in years past with many hot cooking and carving stations, ice sculptures, etc..
