We did try the specialty restaurant Krystal which was absolutely amazing in both service and flavour. I wish we had taken the time to try more of the specialty restaurants. We enjoyed sitting in the lobby in the evenings and listening to the piano before dinner. Emil was waiter extaordinaire who always had a smile and your drink ready before you were even finished your last. Our glasses were never empty. anywhere at RPM..We enjoyed coffee in the courtyard which was beautifully light after dinner. We never did watch the evening shows as they were nice to see, but somewhat the same as in years past. We found the beach much larger than last year, with some of the necessary remaining sandwhales still showing. There was so much room on the beach this year, either shaded with palm trees or not...near the water or quieter back in the hammocks...so many options to choose from...it was never crowded. The RPM truly has the best beach of all the Rius in Playa. We loved to walk past the Riu Yucatan and the remaining hotels to the undeveloped beach area about five to ten minutes away, it is quite lovely and untouched. We also loved our walks to Playa which usually took about twenty minutes there and a $5 cab ride back. There were nice updates to the safes (using keypads instead of actual keys), new LCD screen TVs and new beds which were very comfortable to sleep in, not hard at all as in years past. Unfortunately, the beds are still two doubles pushed together as oppossed to a true King bed. Housekeeping service was outstanding this year, very clean, very efficiient. The only problem I had was if I threw out a bottle of lotion not completely empty, the housekeeper, thinking it was a mistake, would pull it out of the trash, and place it on the counter. There was constant flowers, towel and curtain art in our room each day. We did have lunch at RPRM a couple of times - it is a beautiful resort. It did seem to have a lot more activity and was a bit louder than what we were looking for during our stay. It just seems that at the RPM there is always someplace to escape to for quiet, be it the beach, the pool, lobby, etc. The hotel was pretty quiet the first part of our stay and reached full capactiy the last few days, but there was always plenty of room everywhere. We definately were happy with our choice of Rius. The grounds were gorgeous, the food wonderful, the atmosphere peaceful - but it is the amazing service and staff that make it so unique and it will always definately be our 'home' in Mexico. We can't wait for our fourth trip!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico review”
Reviews.Author: MichiganWaves
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at Riu Palace Mexico and would like to share our experience. Note we have stayed at Royal Solaris and Barcelo Maya in Mexico and Couples, Sandels, Breezes and Grand Lido Braco in Jamaica. If you have never stayed at an all inclusive you will really enjoy Riu Palace. I am always looking for a deal and out of Detroit it cost us $3,000 for the week which I consider a very good price. The up side to the resort is the sandy beach, the beautiful complex and their employees which are the nicest of any resort I have visited. The meals overall are good with the Krystal restaurant being the best and I would guess that dinner would cost $150 plus in the mid-west . The location is excellent and my wife felt safe leaving the complex and walking daily to town and back. I enjoyed running into town with no problems. Now the down side to our visit. I enjoy wine and the Chilean wine they offered was good if you could get it. The wines from Mexico were not very drinkable but the champagne was ok. I ended up going to Wal-mart to buy my own white wine. There is a wine shop right across the street from Wal-mart if you don't like their selection. The Steak House dinner which required reservations was a big disappointment. I would guess my steak was 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick so I wouldn't recommend this restaurant. The Brazilian restaurant was a joke. They come around with meat on long skewers and actually placed the meat on our plate cutting meat off that had just sat on someone else's plate. We had to pass on the meat an go to the main restaurant. Finally on our last night we were asleep in our room when we hear someone trying to open our door. We heard the male tell house keeping staff it was his and didn't have his key and would they let him in and sure enough they opened the door for him. I had the latch pulled so they could open the door but not get in. I contacted the front desk and was told the male trying to get in was drunk and the cleaning staff could not speak english so no problem. I will let your imagination review the different scenarios that could have taken place and I plan on following up with the director of the complex as this is an easy one to fix. If the price is right I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “hospitality plus at Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: jcy100
Reviews.Content: We selected Riu Palace Mexico first due to the beach location and abundance of shade trees, and second due to the perceived cost/value ratio. We were very satisfied that Riu delivered on these expectations. The town of Playa del Carmen was a comfortable walking distance, about one mile. Shopping (price-wise) was much better in town than in the small shopping mall in Playacar (which was conveniently located across the street from the hotel). The ride from/to the airport can take a while in a shuttle van due to other resort stops. It seemed like we drove forever... well, it's further than it looks on the map. We were impressed with the facilities, the buildings, the rooms, and the grounds. The hotel had perhaps the most attentive and friendly staff we have ever encountered. Everyone seemed willing to help and do whatever they could to make us comfortable. I would definitely recommend this resort. We did not venture to the other Riu properties that were nearby. (I understand the "nightlife" extended into the early morning at the other properties, but we were often too tired to stay up.) The food in the buffet and specialty restaurants was very good. In some ways, it felt like we were on a cruise ship. Maybe this was because of the cash-less, all-inclusive nature of the resort. The entertainment at the hotel was less than first rate, and kind of hokey at times, but enthusiastic and we still enjoyed it. Most of the live bands were pretty good. I have to say I was a bit apprehensive about going to Mexico, mostly because of the water situation. But bottled water was available throughout the resort (and other places), everyone seemed to use purified ice, and we were careful. If I can make any suggestion of improvement, it would be regarding RIU restaurant reservations. You can only make same-day reservations. It was hard to make reservations for the restaurants (especially the most popular Krystal) unless you woke up very early (7:30am) and waited in line; you first got a line number, then you could sit and relax until they took reservations. Sometimes the line got very long before the reservation desk opened (between 8 and 8:30am). The allocation of reservations seemed to get exhausted very quickly after the reservation desk opened. They only had two seating times for dinner. Each night we went to a restaurant (3 out of 5 nights), there were empty seats. I'm not sure if this was due to cancellation or clerical problems, or even low demand. If possible, it would be good to have a standby list that could be utilized when the restaurant opened. This would allow more guests to use the restaurants and become satisfied. I don't know why they wouldn't fill the seats even at the last minute. With empty seats, they still turned people away (without reservations) at the door at each seating. Go to the Xcaret eco-park for one day; we had a great time there on Saturday. It is less crowded FRI-thru-MON than TUE-thru-THU, probably due to vacationers penchant to travel on weekends and take 1-2 days to get their bearings. The Xcaret evening show was truly "espectacular"!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Hospitality!!”
Reviews.Author: NanaPapop
Reviews.Content: Playa Car, Mexico - Riu Palace Mexico: "Impeccable Hospitality" January 30, 2009 NanaPapop, Vermont, USA This was our second time visiting the Riu Palace Mexico. The first visit took our breath away that is why we went back. This time was even more special. There were people (staff) and I hate referring to them as that because they were more like family welcoming us home! They remembered us from our first visit and I will give some of their names that stand out; Laura our Receiving Manager, Santoyo our Head Waiter, Francesco our Waiter, Pedros, Carlos, Abigail, Mary our maid and Manuel our Concierge and so many others. They all treat you so special. If there ever is a place for healing and soothing this is the one that will do it for you! We have traveled many places and all of them were just as beautiful as the next but as the name states, it truley is "The Palace of Mexico! It has a feeling that embraces you with such warmth and charm that will last forever.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: madwelshwoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Place Mexico for 2 wks end of January. We found it a beautiful resort and had a fabulous time. Truly cannot understand some of the negative reviews. Staff excellent, very friendly and helpful, we never wanted for anything. Most went that step further to make your stay more enjoyable. We had a couple of instances with our room maid, our room wasn’t serviced on the first day and three times the first week we had to chase housekeeping for toilet paper as she hadn’t left a spare roll, but hey, nowhere is 100% perfect. The buffet restaurant was very good, plenty of choice, I gained 8 pounds in 2weeks! Breakfast was amazing never seen such a choice in any other hotel before. There was something for everyone, whatever your nationality. We didn’t try any of the speciality restaurants as the sittings were either too early or too late plus didn’t fancy getting up that early on holiday to make the reservations!! Anyway we were quite happy with the buffet. Rooms were lovely and spacious, no musty smell. The new mattresses were firm but comfortable. E-mailed hotel 2 wks prior to going, requesting room on the Yucatan side (as after reading reviews had learnt it was the quieter side) but hinted a fountain view room would be very nice if possible. Upon arriving we found we had been upgraded to fountain/courtyard view for no extra charge!! The beach was lovely, didn’t find the whales a problem, you just have to accept they’ve got to be there. Plenty of loungers available any time of day with numerous quiet sections under the palm trees. Pool area was good, also plenty of loungers available. Water a bit cold though! It had a quiet side and a noisy side depending what you preferred. Slight musty smell sometimes in lobby and one end of restaurant but only if the temperature dropped or if it had been raining so obviously due to the tropical atmosphere. Ladies, if you’re thinking of bringing your own hairdryer, there is a power point under the mirror in the bedroom. It was one of my petty concerns before going as I hate drying my hair in a steamed up bathroom !! So to sum it all up, the Place Mexico is a beautiful hotel, though not recommended for families and teenagers. We chose the hotel for this reason as we have done the “family holidays thing” and now we leave the kids behind! I think there were only about 6 children staying whilst we were there. Bliss! We went for a drink to the other Ruis and if budget doesn’t stretch to one of the Palaces then the Yucatan would be our second choice. Would we recommend the Place Mexico? Definitely, without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Oounce
Reviews.Content: We did not enjoy our stay at the Rui Palace Mexico. We did not get the rooms we were told were reserved for us. Upon arrivial at the resort it took over 45 minutes to get checked in, although our travel agent had already made our arrangements. we found our room to be substandard at best. Our veiw was of the back of the kitchen facilities. We had rodents and spiders in our rooms and had two double beds pushed together. We were unable to book any of the a la cart resturaunts because of excursions we had booked, we were unable to line up every morning to place a reservation. It took twelve hours for the front desk to send someone to fix our plugged toilet. the food was usually cold and breakfast consisted of leftovers from the night before. The pool is very small and cold. The beach itself was always crowded because the other Rui Resorts shared the same beach. The only thing we did enjoy was how close the resort was to town, and most of the staff was friendly. We would not choose to re-visit this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at RIU Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: highnoonPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: Like many people I scoured the Tripadvisor reviews of the RIU Palace Riviera Maya before deciding to commit hard earned vacation dollars. I don't believe you'll be disappointed with the hotel or its amenities should it be your choice. Is it for everyone? Perhaps not. If you're a young single looking for a go-go atmosphere this resort might not be your first choice. However, for those looking for a quality resort in a great location with well above average "all inclusive" food, beverage and entertainment The RIU Palace Riviera Maya presents an excellent choice. The hotel is very pleasing both visually and in its quality of service and amenities. The people working at this resort are pleasant, courteous and truly seem to care about the hotel's guests. The hotel's location in Playacar is excellent. Playacar is a gated community just south of Playa del Carmen. It contains a number of resorts, condominiums, single homes and commercial areas. There is a shopping plaza several blocks south of the hotel. The town of Playa del Carmen is about one and a half miles north of the hotel and is a relatively easy walk. Along the way are several Mayan architectural sites. For those who would rather ride into town the fare from the hotel is 50 pesos or $ 5.00 USD. Playa del Carmen itself is certainly worth going into. There are multitudes of shops, restaurants and boutique hotels. Fifth Avenue is a pedestrian only street and is worth strolling. In the evening many restaurants and bars have mariachi bands, folk singers and rock bands many of which may be enjoyed from the street. Playa del Carmen also has several large department style stores including a Wal*Mart. The standard junior suites at RIU Palace Riviera Maya are designed in split level fashion. Upon entry into the room are the bathroom, sleeping and closet areas. Several steps down from the entry level is a sitting area and balcony. The sitting area has a sofa, cocktail table and clothes storage bureau. The room's television is located on the bureau in the sitting area. It can be difficult to watch the television from bed as it does not swivel toward the sleeping area. The bathroom in the room is quite large and has double sinks and a Jacuzzi tub with shower. One caveat in the bathroom. Because the Jacuzzi tub is quite deep there is about a 26 inch rise to step over in order to access the tub/shower. There are assist bars in several places to aid entry and exit. Food is always important at an all-inclusive resort. The food, service and dining venues at the Palace Riviera Maya range from good to excellent. Breakfast which is available from 7:30 AM to 10:30 AM is at the Don Manuel buffet which features a wide variety of choices to suit both North American and European appetites. This restaurant which also serves buffet lunch and dinner selections has both indoor and outdoor seating areas. The outdoor seating area overlooks the hotel's central plaza, gardens and fountains. Specialty restaurant options include a steak house, japanese, mexican, brazilian and fusion venues. With the exception of the steak house all of the specialty restaurants are relatively small in size and are very nicely decorated to match each specialty theme. The steak house is transformed in the evening from a poolside buffet. This buffet serves lunch from noon to about 4:00 PM. and has both hot and cold selections. To summarize this review; if you're looking for a well designed, well run resort with above average amenities, food and services the RIU Palace Riviera Maya warrants your attention.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: bobdonna
Reviews.Content: We have been reading up on the hotel for the last month and there was a lot of negative comments. We just got back from the Riu Palace and did not have any problems. The staff were great, no theft, no hard pillow, no hard bed, our room was very clean and did not smell at all. It was a lovely place to walk around, beach fantastic. We rented a car from the hotel for the week and drove around everywhere, thus not have to take the tours. No trouble with police etc. Loved Fifth Avenue, great bars and food. My only comment is the pool is small and no steps into it. I saw a lot of people that could have used stairs or a walk in to the pool. They only had ladders. Went to a lot of the other Riu's for lunch etc. They are all lovely resorts. Hats off to all the staff at the Riu for working so hard to let everyone have a great vacation. We will be back. B & D, Toronto

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: NorwoodDave
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay at Playacar but they were overbooked, so we got upgraded. The Palace is awesome. We had a blast. The only downside to the whole place is it isn't for singles. The entertainment I thought was geared to an older croud. It would be absolutly amazing for a honeymoon or a couple going to relax. The food was excellant, and the staff couldn't be any friendlier. Great people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: CGCMaine
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! This was our second year at the Riu Palace Mexico and we were not disappointed. Last year our only complaint was the hardness of the beds. This year the issue was corrected thus making our stay perfect. The staff was like family. The food was what would be expected from buffet style dining. It was good, there was variety and there was plenty of it. The speciaIty restaurants were excellent. I was amazed by the amount of beach front which had been restored since Jan 2008. The only disapponting aspect was the way some of the arrogant guests would treat the hard working staff employees. There is absolutely nothing which would stop me from returning to the Riu Palace Mexico in 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: mypferd
Reviews.Content: When first driving up to the RIU I was impressed with the entrance , the lobby, the staff, in the first few minutes everything was top notch. Nothing really changed the rest of the trip. The service was great, the food was great, and all the employees were pleasant and helpful. The buffet was so good we only ate at one other restaurant the whole vacation. The Japanese restaurant was good but it really did not have Sushi. It was one of the best all-inclusive experiences I have had and at half the price of some others. I will be going to a RIU again. Peter G par-travel

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the sun”
Reviews.Author: canadiancook
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Riu and had a great time with a group of friends. The resort wasn't the most spectacular place I've stayed in the Cancun area but it was perfect for a few days to relax and have fun with friends. PROS: 1. When you stay here you can use any of the Riu resorts in the area - I think there were 5-6 within walking distance. We were happy that there was a night club across the street at the Riu Tequila, so we could go for a little while and not have to worry about cabbing it back to the resort late at night. We also enjoyed the pool at one of the other Riu Palaces and the bartender brought us shots to help us celebrate our friend's birthday without us even asking - thanks Gerardo!!! 2. The minibar and alcohol provided in the rooms is fully stocked - lots of bottled water - both regular sized and large bottles which were perfect for taking in our beach bags to the beach! We also ran into the gentleman who filled up the minibar everyday and he would always let us take extra water and asked if there was any type of alcohol or pop we would like more of in our room. 3. The hotel is beautiful looking and the grounds are very nice, with lots of chairs at both the beach and pools. 4. The food was okay - we only went to the Japanese restaurant and the buffet and always found things we liked at every meal. Great guacamole and chips!!! Some of the options we steered clear of but for the most part we weren't expecting a gourmet dining experience, so we were fine with what was offered. 5. The staff was very friendly and helpful - we saw a lot of the bartenders on multiple days and they asked if we wanted our regular drinks. Make sure to ask for premium alcohol when you order drinks! A big thank you Elena at the lobby bar!! CONS: 1. There was the odd spot where there would be a strong sewage smell but it is Mexico, so you almost have to just accept it! 2. The coffee was very strong and not very tasty but there is a Starbucks right across the street, so for us it wasn't a big deal to spend a few bucks each day there rather than miss our morning cup of joe. The staff at the Starbucks were super friendly too and pretty much knew our orders by the time we left! 3. We had some issues with communication when calling room service or the front desk but the staff that came to our door bringing food or other requests were always very helpful and friendly so it made up for it! Enjoy your stay - we did!!!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ricste
Reviews.Content: Went to the palace 7yrs ago for my honeymoon -- loved it! Clean, friendly staff, great food, entertainment, and great security. My husband and I thought it would be a great place to return with our two small children after a terrible Canadian winter. It was a mistake...the standards have dropped considerably. Our room was not clean, not to mention the little cockroach friends we made in our room during our stay . We complained to the front desk several times but they didn't bother to offer a solution other then having our room "sprayed". Our room was ground level facing the hot tub...not a good view. We left our swimsuits to dry on the balcony, and long and behold they were stolen including our sons' swim shoes. Again, the staff didn't have to much to say about it - no apology, nothing. The food was a joke, and the mixed drinks tasted as if they were watered down. If you do go, and have small children, watch them like hawks...I felt very unsafe. The staff was not as friendly as they used to be either. Other then meeting some wonderful people from the States, we were very disappointed and will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Kept Locking Sliding Doors”
Reviews.Author: tripper58
Reviews.Content: DO NOT bring any valuables that will not fit into the safe. This is really the only complaint we have. There are warnings already written about the theft problems here. The hotel is very out spoken & WARNS you with a written note on the coffee table in the room. The food here is excellent for an all-inclusive. We had no problems getting the restaurants and seating times we wanted. The staff is extremely friendly. I would only be concerned about the housekeeping staff "team working" with whoever is going into the room where the sliding doors are purposely left unlocked every day (5 in row for us).

Reviews.Title: “impeccable service at the Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: spottedcallie
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week January 7 -14, 2009 at the Riu palace Mexico. We are new to the all inclusive concept but wanted a nice place to enjoy with our kids ages 20 and 23. We generally vacation in nice hotels but we were very impresses with the quality of the Palace. The suite is large, bed comfortable, LCD TV's, in-room bar but the service was impeccable. Room service (free) witch we seemed to use nightly during midnight card games was immediate and I was constantly asked if I wanted a drink at the pool, beach, dinner or wherever I was. The grounds are georgeous, the pool wonderful and the beach was great. The whales (sandbags) did not take away from the view. The food in the Krystan and Steakhouse was on par with fine restaurant. We had no issue issue repeating dinners at the restaurants. and the buffet was plentiful especially for breakfast and lunch. I have to admit that while we only ate at the buffet 3 nights that was enough as we got tired of the buffet food quickly. The only negative is that the Riu Palace nightlife is sleepy and caters to an older crowd. There were hardly any single young adults and by 11:00, after the show, the resort is empty. However there are 6 RIU hotels within walking distance and the disco take about 3 minutes to walk to. You can also see the shows at any of the 6 resorts or use the pool and facilities of any of the 6 resorts. Playa del Carmen is a $5USD cab ride or a 1.8m walk and a whole lot of fun. We had a great time at Senior Frogs! A travel agent of mine was really pushing the Iberostar Maya over the Palace but we met several people that have stayed at both but liked the Palace food and room better. We did walk to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and it seemed identical to the Palace Mexico except for the infinity pool.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyoneMaryland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 day stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. The best vacation ever! The rooms were spacious and very clean. Unlike other places, this room and bathroom did not have an odor. There were small mosquitoes that flew around (one or two a night) but they do not bother you. We did not have any issues with "lost or stolen" items as other reviewers mentioned. We always locked our valuables in the safe. Our room was on the first floor and facing the hotel next door. We even brought our camera to the pool and beach but never had anything stolen. The service at this hotel is outstanding - you are waited on hand and foot. You can eat at either the buffet or the specialty restaurants each evening. The reservation system for the specialty restaurants leaves a little bit to be desired. You must wait at the lounge between 8 and 8:30am for someone to distribute numbers and then you are called to make your selection. We did not have difficulty getting into any restaurant. Our favorite was the Krystal which we sent to twice. Men must wear long slacks to all restaurants. The pool area is quiet, although there is a major issue with the reserving of chairs with towels. We always had a place but I would see towels on chairs not occupied until 12 noon -- a bit unfair to those who actually want to relax before then. It is nice to lounge at the pool -- the side opposite the pool bar is nice and quiet. The drink service is prompt and frequent - always someone around to serve you. We walked to several of the other Riu hotels nearby which are certainly a more casual atmosphere than this hotel. It all depends on what you are looking for. We especially enjoyed sitting on the terrace in the evening and listening to the band and watching others dance while we were waited on hand and foot -- a true, relaxing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Weren't impressed”
Reviews.Author: JK315
Reviews.Content: We got an upgrade from Riu Tequila to stay here for 3 days. We were told this was their best property so figured we'd take the upgrade. The lobby was nice, however it had a horrible musty/stale cigarette odor that never went away. After checking in they instructed us to the elevator and said our bags would arrive to our room shorty thereafter. When we got in the elevator I commented on how hot it was in there. All the sudden the elevator got stuck! We tried pressing the buttons to open and NOTHING! I panicked because litterally we were sweltering of heat! My husband had to pry the doors open and thank god it was on a floor. We notified the front desk and didn't use the elevator again til we checked out. As we waited for it to come down, there were 4 people stuck in it! So we hauled our luggage up the stairs and wouldn't use it! The grounds were very nice and well maintained. The pool was smaller than the other resorts. Much smaller. Oddly it didn't have shallow ends! At the other resorts everytime you ran into an employee they always said "hola" and had a welcoming smile. NOT HERE! The atmosphere was very unwelcoming. The food selection wasn't nearly as big nor as good as Tequila. Our room was 00030 on the bottom level. Warning: if you have a room on the bottom level this side you have a view of a fence where the walk way is to the beach from the other resorts. So basically if you were in your room you had to keep the curtains shut or everyone could see directly in your room! The only thing we liked about this resort was we actually got towel art in our room and the beach was beautiful. However when we were at Tequila, we had access to Riu Yucatan and Riu Playacar that was on the beach. The sand bags in the ocean were unsightly but they did block the big waves so you could swim! Overall, if we had paid to stay here I would have been upset! I really wish we didn't take the upgrade and spent our last few days at Tequila. It was much more fun there. I read a review on here from one woman that stated they would have had more fun at a funeral parlor then staying here, she was right! Save your money and book Riu Tequila! Such a wonderful resort and very friendly staff! They go out of their way to make you feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; horrible management; questionable security”
Reviews.Author: MouthpieceNYC
Reviews.Content: A recent Christmas trip to Playa del Carmen, a lovely spot on the Riviera Maya, was ruined by inept and inhospitable management at the RIU Palace Mexico. As a direct result of a hotel air conditioning repairman failing to latch a first-floor patio door, my son's room was broken into. Probably due to being frightened while going through his backpack (which was dumped unceremoniously on the bed), the thief left with only the backpack and what he thought was a wallet. When we discovered the theft, my son's driver's license, which was the only thing in the wallet, was on the patio floor. We contacted hotel security and then went to the front desk to make our report. The General Manager of the hotel, a woman who's name I have but I need not share here, informed us that there was nothing she could do, as RIU policy prevented her from making good on the theft. I suggested that all she need do was credit my bill with the cost of the empty backpack (US$200) and, if it was found later, merely reverse the credit (the vacation, for 7 of us, had already cost US$20,000 with airfare and transfers.) She refused and said that all I could do was file a police report. She would do nothing. Her attitude was the classic "You'll be gone in a day or two and I could care less what happens to you, your backpack or your family." She then informed me that the wallet had been found, ,empty (it was empty when it started, except for the license) in an area surrounded by three used condoms. Used condoms! How lady-like! Did she mean for me to believe that my son had left his backpack somewhere on her grounds after a rather robust night of sexual activity? That would have been impossible, as he slept in our room that night. He forgot his room key and the night staff at the front desk, without ever asking to see any identification, had given him the room key to someone else's room! He couldn't have slept in his own room that night if he wanted to. His room key was on the night table right where he left it the next morning when we discovered the theft. The "condom" line had been done solely to embarass my son in my eyes. It did not. I then contacted the Mexican State Police and waited three hours until they responded. When the General Manager saw the police at the curb, she promptly sent a messenger to the lobby to offer me, perhaps, a one-room upgrade (we had three for the family.) I told her no, I didn't want her single room upgrade, especially after killing a morning of my vacation. So this General Manager of a major chain allowed two uniformed Mexican State Police motorcycle cops with submachine guns strapped across their chests to interview me in her own main lobby! Then, when it became apparent that I was serious, a Captain of the State Police arrived in an armored vehicle with an anti-aircraft gun on the back, drove to the front door of the hotel, parked it there and came into the lobby to invite me to make my complaint with the Bilingual Minister of Justice of the Mexican Federal Police in Playa del Carmen. I did make this report, where I discovered that the logbook showed that the RIU chain in Playa del Carmen (though not this hotel unit) had its fair share of criminal complaints. Wonder of wonders, the backpack showed up the next day, having been "found" at the pool. The General Manager, who had turned her front lobby into an armed camp, never had the courtesy to present it to me herself, but had a lackey do it. My e-mails to RIU's Vice President in Los Cabos went unanswered and my copy to RIU's Customer Service produced the classic "we're investigating" response. The moral of the story is that there is something to be said for hotels bearing an American hotel chain name. We teach hospitality in our colleges and that principle is based on our belief that the smallest mistake is an opportunity to make a guest for life. Obviously, the huge RIU chain, which is heavily used by Europeans, gets away with having its luxury hotel units run by minor functionaries who do not have the autonomy to solve the sort of problems handled by American motel managers everyday. Perhaps, in this failing economy, we should get smarter with our vacation dollars. The world is learning a valuable lesson right now. Without America, there is no global economy. My experience at the RIU Palace Mexico suggests that not everyone has learned that lesson as yet. By the way, the hotel is very lovely and the food (all inclusive) about at the level of a mid-level cruise line. The beach is the reason to go as it is far superior to any other RIU in the area.

Reviews.Title: “qualified okay place....”
Reviews.Author: timetrvl
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through a tour operator. We stayed at a sister Riu last year (playa del carmen). Riu is the equivalent of Starbucks of the hotels in the Cancun area. They have about 8 "palaces". Last year's experience was good, so we tried a different PALACE. It is identical in many ways to the bigger (and better) Palace (playa del carmen). Check-in service was relatively quick and the rooms were spacious and clean. You do need a flashlight in the shower tub as the Riu infamously keeps you in the dark in the shower area. Amenities of the property overall were good. The beach is very nice and clean with abundant chairs. Unfortunately those gigantic sand bags to stop beach erosion are quite unsightly, but necessary. The palm trees give the natural shade for those who prefer it without seeing the ugly colors of cheap and faded umbrellas. Beach bars were close and you could get service while lounging. The Pool was very disappointing. I was expecting to see the signature "palace pool" but the layout cuts the pool in half or quarters, and the look of concrete was inconsistent with the nice center fountains and landscape that dots the way to the beach and pool area. The pool looked like it was 4 small pools with no rhyme or reason. There was the obligatory swim up bar and an awkwardly placed volleyball net in the middle near the swim up bar! If you are planning to go to the gym to work out, forget it. It is by far the most disappointing amenity. It is a room of about 15x15 with no view and a multitude of third rate and broken pieces of equipment. When I walked in, two 8-year old boys completely wet from the pool and with no shoes were using the equipment while their mom was non-chalantly using the only operational treadmill and completely oblivious to the kids endangering themselves. There were no towels, no cups, and an empty water cooler. There was sand on the floor. Food is okay if you are a big fan of "sumptuous buffets". After a day of that, you're ready for change. Breakfast is definitely the best part. Employees in general had a good attitude and worked very hard. They were accommodating and courteous. Making dinner reservations for the small restaurants was difficult and you could see that they preferred that you go to the buffet as you have to make reservations between 8-1030AM. One day I was there at 9AM only to learn that the Japanese restaurant was "fully booked". I peaked in to see that the late seating still had open tables, but they refused to seat us because we did not have reservations!!! As in the other Riu, this hotel is acoustically challenged. There was not one quiet spot in the whole resort. The walls are thin, and the cleaning crew carry real loud conversations in the hallways at 7AM! The tile is ribbed, so anything that rolls on it makes a lot of noise. If you escape to the pool for peace and quiet, you will be greeted with screaming kids, volleyball games, or even bingo. At the beach, your peace and quiet on the hammock is immediately ruined by beach volleyball, horseshoe contests or vendors hawking their ware. This resort is not for everybody. If you go with low expectations, you will be happy. If you are a discriminating traveler with a keen eye, you will be annoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: rainsbow
Reviews.Content: Stay: December 9-16, 2008 Transfer: American Express transfer service was very efficient and on time. Check in: Efficient and friendly. Grounds: Fabulous, beach wide and beautiful. Plenty of hammocks and loungers available all day pool and beachside. Beach is filled with palms. Good shade available for those who need it. Food: Great selection at the buffets for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Specialty themes each evening. Krystal fusion restaurant ala carte was a wonderful experience. Staff: Without exception, friendly, helpful and courteous. One of the main reasons we vow to return to Riu resorts. Pools: Pools were clean and clear with plenty of palms and umbrellas. Renova Spa: I used the hair salon to have braids done. Excellent service and price. Laundry: We had our travel clothes washed and ironed. Excellent turnaround time and care in handling our clothes. Bravo! Room: Excellent view of the lovely fountains. Our room attendant was fantastic, towel art, fresh flowers and attention to detail every day and night. Amimacion: The team endeavors to get folks involved in a variety of activities, but they are never pushy. Kids club: We observed the children and their caretakers each day, the children looked like they were enjoying a variety of activities. Beverages: In-room fridge restocked every day. Bar service excellent with good selection of liquors as well as Corona and Negra Modelo beer available. Entertainment: Music each night in the courtyard plaza, the evening shows were very good. We especially enjoy the Mariachi and Mayan show. Other Riu resorts: We had occasion to visit the three Riu's in Cancun: Riu Caribe, Riu Cancun and Riu Palace Las Americas as well as the 5 other Playa del Carmen Riu's--Yucatan, Tequila, Lupita, Playacar, and the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We were able to enjoy beverages and breakfast and/or lunch at those restaurants inclusive to our stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. Without fail we found the service and grounds to be excellent. Each has its own charm, and I can see why there are folks who return to each.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: finakyes
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two weeks at the Riu Palace Mexico. We booked about 6 weeks ago with Thomson holidays in the UK and got an excellent price for a fortnight all inlcusive. The location of the hotel is perfect, directly on a lovely stretch of beach, close to a number of other Riu hotels (all of which you are able to use) and a 20 minute or 50 peso cab ride into PDC. The public areas of the hotel and the gardens, are very good, although as some of the other reviewers have mentioned there is an unpleasant musty odour in places. We had a standard room on the top floor facing the garden (rather than the courtyard). Our room got no sun all day so was rather dark and a bit dinghy as a result. On the positive side the rooms are large and have all the amenities you could reasonably expect - including a free and constantly refilled mini bar. The furnishings in the room and the bathroom were a little tired and could do with updating but certainly adequate. There were two smallish doubles rather than one big king bed which was not great, beds were also very hard - didnt bother us too much but some might find them uncomfortable. We also found the room to have a constant musty odour - again this is reported in a number of other reviews and i'm not sure why the hotel cant do something about it. They put it down to the humidity and temperature but other places with similar climates dont seem to suffer in the same way? The variety of food available was excellent, I can't imagine anyone would ever find themselves going hungry. However, I couldnt really understand the previous rave reviews for the food. It was adequate but certainly not gourmet! We tried 3 of the speciality restuarants. The steak house was ok, we didnt like the brazilian at all and the fusion restuarant Kystral was the best but nothing to write home about and certainly not worth getting up at the crack of dawn to secure a table! 'The buffet had lots and lots of variety but the food was really only like good quality 'canteen' food rather than what you would consider a nice meal out. Another issue we had with the food from the buffets (both at lunch and in the evening) was that it was often not particularly hot. I dont want to give the impression that the food was poor because it wasnt but if you are a foodie or if you like eating out at good quality restuarants then you will be disappointed in what is served. Drinks service was excellent and we were never kept waiting for longer than a couple of minutes for service whether in any of the bars, round the pool or even on the beach. The staff at the hotel were all exceptionally friendly and enthusiastic - and it didnt seem to make a difference whether you were tipping or not. I think the hotel staff are a definite strong point. All in all we thought the hotel represented excellent value for money, enjoyed our stay and wouldnt hesitate to go there again. However if you are expecting luxury you might be disappointed. The 'five star' rating given in some brochures is misleading. This is not a hotel of five star quality, maybe more like a good european 3 or average 4 star - but to be fair the price you are paying should tell you what you are getting. Some of the true 5 stars in PDC cost over £600 per night - we paid less than twice this for 14 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Poolside theft - BE VERY CAUTIOUS”
Reviews.Author: nedjpd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 1 week stay. Staff gave attentive feeling upon arrival. Room and lobby had musty odor which increased through the week. When brought room smell to their attention they did spray, check a/c and then finally placed an ozinator in the room which helped some. (yes I realize it's the humid area but neighbors room next door was not nearly as bad) Food OK, Nice to be able to visit other RIU hotels (in walking distance) Here's the bad part - at the RIU Yucatan brought wallet to poolside to tip with - had several drinks at swim up bar - had shots the barmaid prepared (we didn't request them) -bags within view - and yes you can guess the rest - wallet gone. Yes we were stupid to bring wallet but we truly feel we were set up by staff. Within 2 hours credit card was used at local stores for close to $3000 US When I discussed it with the Apple vacation director he acknowledged it does happen there (both Yucatan and Palace Mexico) and inferred not to tip at all - to leave all funds,credit cards etc in safe. Staff at hotel desk synpathetic but thats all. So as much as you may want to tip - FORGET IT. Also when leaving ANY area double and triple check that you have everything. Left a camera beachside late at night (few people if any around the area), went back for it and no surprise - gone . Three staff members were in area raking sand, questioned if they saw it but claim they didn 't. Next AM checked at main desk hoping guest may have turned it in.Hotel maintains rudimentary lost and found list. I found it surprising that in a 400 room hotel they only had 3 "found" items in a 48 hr period. The low number of items indicates to me that anything left unattended anywhere in the hotel is fair game to staff. Management must look the other way or staff would turn more in. If you go here keep your guard up at ALL times.

Reviews.Title: “RPM lives up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: tropicalozzie
Reviews.Content: My lady and I spent the first week of December at the Riu Palace Mexico. It was her first time in Playa del Carmen, my seventh trip to the area, fourth at an all-inclusive resort. This was by far the best. We used Trip Advisor extensively to research our trip before we booked in October, all the reviews were great. Checked just before we left and found some not so good reviews that had us kind of nervous about our choice. Don't know what resort those folks stayed at but it couldn't have been the Riu Palace Mexico. Check-in was a breeze. The cool drink was a nice touch. Room was very clean and did not smell! Didn't really care for the pushed together beds, but managed to get around that minor inconvenience. Our room did not have a view of the courtyard which, at first, was a disappointment. But when we figured out that the bands might keep us awake and that we had much better privacy on our balcony, that didn't seem like such a big deal. When I research a resort the two things that matter most to me are the beach and the food. At RPM both were very good. The buffet was varied and good quality. The specialty restaurants were inconsistent. Didn't try the Brazilian on the advice of other vacationers. The steakhouse was OK, not a whole lot better than the buffet. The Japanese and Fusion restaurants were excellent. You need to get in line early to get reservations for them, both are small and fill up fast. Had a very nice massage on the beach. Did an excursion to Chichen Itza. Did the shopping day in Playa del Carmen and mainly chilled on the beach. Rooms were serviced at least twice a day. Everyone was very friendly and couldn't be more helpful. The only negative was we ate way too much!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was back there”
Reviews.Author: Johnboyholidaykid
Reviews.Content: its called a palace and it is a palace. The layout of the hotel is very nice, and the rooms are great, with nice size bathroom, bedroom and sitting room part with sofa. (this was a standard room). There are 2 beds, each which are slighly smaller than a regular double and pushed together. They would be better off with one King size one, but it wasn't a problem for us, even if they are a little harder than i'm used to. Our balcony area was huge, probably about 15 to 20 feet long overlooking the courtyard. With a minibar in the room (restocked daily) this was bliss. The food, particulary in the main buffet was fantastic and we are now several pounds heavier after 2 weeks of it !! The only drawback was with the bookable a la carte resturants where you had to be an early riser in order to book the Krystal. There is a queuing system that starts at 8.30 but some people were queuing we heard at 6.30. They have to be nuts! After all we were there for a holiday and rest and we could'nt be bothered to get up that early. The others were generally still available at 9.30 (Brazillian one is not very good). Clearly the system needs to be changed. The service from all the staff was just impeccable. Drinks are served at all times, and I never waited more than about 90 seconds after taking a seat, in any of the dining areas, or theatre area before being offered a drink. service around the pool is also good and frequent. In the theatre areas the shows most days are actually quite good considering they are free. The pool area is great, towels are provided, and its a short walk from there to the beach , which has some great hammocks in the shade. The beach area has black sand bags to prevent the beach from the tide and to prevent you being pulled away by the rip tides when the tide is strong. The pelicans frequently dive amongst the bathers for fish, which is quite a sight. The staff are also all very friendly and I received 2 or 3 check up calls to check that everything was Ok with my room and that i was enjoying my stay. They clearly have a great service culture. We have been to around 13 or 14 all inclusives all 4* or 5* and this is certainly the best of the lot. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganSunshine365
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico this past weekend 12/3-12/6 (was supposed to stay until the 7th but we requested to be transferred to another hotel) and we had items stolen out of our room 2 times during our stay. We were on the ground level with a grassy backyard before a hedge and fence. The front desk staff was not helpful whatsoever until my friend (who was celebrating her 30th birthday) and I had to spend over 2 hours in the lobby arguing with the front desk staff and even a manager!!! There was also another couple at the front desk who had stuff stolen out of their room while they were at dinner. I was not allowed to have a copy of any of the 3 security reports I had filed and was told if I wanted a report I had to go into town and file one at the police station. The staff was rude and uncaring, we had only been out of our room for an hour and a half by the pool on Sat. morning only to return to our room (beds made) and a $600+ camera missing, earlier in the week my purse, IPod and a phone had also been taken. Its a shame that this had to happen on what was supposed to be such a celebratory weekend for my friend's birthday and another friends wedding,at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya, which was were we were transferred to and treated much better.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Silvus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weeklong stay at Riu Palace Mexico - end Nov - beg Dec. We travel extensively and stay in all sorts of resorts, from budget to high end. We must say that this resort is near the top of our list. We don't quite understand the negative reviews posted previously. The resort, grounds, staff, food, beach, all are exceptional. Perhaps the unattractive sand bags scattered along the beach could go, which they will once the beach is brought back. More detailed feedback is below: Resort and grounds- very colonial and paladian. The nicest architechture of all 5 Rius in the area (including Riu Palace Riviera Maya). The grounds are beautiful and the gardens well kept. There are people working round the clock perfecting the resort. Rooms-all rooms face the gardens so no oceanviews, unless you book one of the suites on the top floors facing the pool (they perhaps offer some partial oceanviews). The rooms are kept clean at all times. Inviting furnishing and decoration in the room. Flat screet TVs. Stocked fridge replenished daily. The mattress seemed to be brand new and on the harder side. Beach area-very tropical with tons of palm trees. Very wide. Best beach area out of all 5 Rius or other resort (we checked them all). Plenty of empty chairs in the shade or sun. Beach bar someone small but we never really used it. The beach service was great. They come to you with the tray full of drinks or you can order and they'll bring you what you want. The area in front of this Riu is best for swimming in the area and you are close to the underdeveloped part with no hotels or sand bags in the water (to the right of the resort, past Sandos Playacar). You can do your daily walks here and can walk for 1/2 hour or so until you reach the "end" where you can do some good snorkling. Food and restaurants-the best buffet restaurant is Don Julian for all three meals. The other two by the beach are OK for a quick snack, but do not offer as good of a choice as Don Julian. Be aware, lunch is served only inside of Don Julian. The reservations for a la carte restaurants are taken from 8:30 AM not in the afternoon as the previous poster mentioned (this is perhaps the reason why he never got the reservation). We lined up three times and got what we wanted. Be there at 8:20-8:30, grab the number and wait. It takes no longer than 10 minutes. We ate twice at Krystal, the fusion restaurant, which we highly recommend. We heard the Steakhouse was great and it seemed to fill in fast (we did not eat there). We tried the Brasilien which was OK. Overall, food was great and plentiful. Entertainment-just OK. Some nights were better than the others. Live bands, dancing, all your regular stuff you get at any all inclusive resort. This resort seemed to be a bit quiter that the other Rius so this is a plus if this is what you want. You can always go to any of the other Rius for louder atmosphere. Guests-mostly older, some young families with very small kids and some couples. Guests from Germany, Italy, US and Canada. We would stay here again. Do not hesitate and go!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: bryflys
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico in Playa Del Carmen. The room was very nice and the only negative comment I can make is that the beds are not king size, but rather 2 smaller beds pushed together. Not really a problem over all. I did not find the bed hard as other reviewers noted. The Service is great - staff is very attentive and always ask if you want another drink when you're at the evening shows. The band was good at night and the shows were entertaining as well. The beach and palm trees are great for relaxing, sunbathing, and swimming in the ocean. The food was good and there were many different choices. Overall this was a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but beware on some things”
Reviews.Author: sbpearl
Reviews.Content: We went there with our older children. The first night was horrible, as they put us in a three jr suites that were next to the service closet which made it very loud. They did move us after two days when I complained. This is a nice hotel and service is overall very good. A great place for families with small children. One negative is you have to make reservations for all the restaurants, but can only make reservations between the hours of 12-3. We arrive on a Wednesday and tried to make reservations, but it was all booked up. We were stuck with buffet dinner. This is not the place to come if you are single and don't want to be around children. If you make reservations ask for the master suites which are room facing the inside with a view or you get stuck in not a great area of the hotel. The bartender Esias was GREAT!! Have fun

Reviews.Title: “Superb, don't hesitate”
Reviews.Author: soonerthedog
Reviews.Content: OK I feel that I have to say I don't understand all the negative feedback this hotel has received. We stayed at the Palace Mexico for 2 weeks starting the end of October. As far as we are concerned it was fantastic, rooms, grounds, beach, sea, buffet etc, etc. The staff were very helpfull and only ever wanted to help you. If you are considering a holiday here then go for it.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace Mexico Review”
Reviews.Author: dickandjackie
Reviews.Content: We booked thru Apple vacations and stayed October 29th to November 5th. It has been our experience in the past that some of the best prices occur the end of October -early November. We have stayed at two RIU's previously ( Negril and Cabo San Lucas). This hotel had very good ratings on trip advisor. I should mention that there are 4 other RIU's within walking distance of this RIU. We enjoyed walking to the other RIU's to have a drink or lunch. Pros- Great beach- It was the best swimming beach due to the artificial coral reefs . The whole beach was very sandy and we never felt any coral underneath. The beach area is hugh with lots of shade , real Palm trees and the most lounge chairs I have ever seen in one location. Rooms were in good shape and everything worked. There are no ocean view or ocean side rooms. You only get to look at the Garden or trees along the fence . Location - was great - Playacar is only 1 1/2 miles from Playa del Carmen. Staff - All the staff was very friendly and helpful. It does help to tip the staff especially the maids. Con's Food - was mediocre. Buffet was better then average but 3 of the 4 dinner places were mediocre at best. Breakfast and lunch were very good but only the Gourmet restaurant was excellent. Room upgrade- This was the first time we were not able to upgrade our room to a more favorable view. Even though the Palace Mexico was only 1/4 full and no one was staying in those rooms - the management would not budge. In the past we would give a good tip to the front desk and they would take care of our room. We were able to get a room with a different balcony but still facing the fence side. Turns out they want you to apply for a RIU card and the more times you stay the better chance you have to upgrade. Sounds like a Comfort Inn to me. We noticed a strange odor in the main lobby, bar area and protected hallways. Most lobby's are open and this one is enclosed- even the newer RIU Rivera Maya had the same odor due to being enclosed. The hall ways must have some type of mold causing the unpleasant odor. We were the only ones that seemed to be aware of this- it was the first resort we've stayed in that was not open. There were a lot more people staying at the other RIU"s- if you like no crowds this was the place to stay. It was very quiet and somewhat boring at times so we went to the other's for fun. Overall we enjoyed our stay but would probably not return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Nina0127
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico for three nights. The grounds are beauiful and well maintained. The beach was nice. We did not go in the pool at all as the water was freezing. We decided to do the buffet for all meals as it appeared to have a better variety. The food was good and plenty to choose from. The staff was polite and attentive. We used room service for our morning coffee and it was exceptionally quick. The bar tenders were quick filling drinks however they were watered down. The room was clean. The room had two full sized beds put together to make it a king so there was a gap in between. The televison set was very small and only the local channels had good reception. The bathroom needed some attention. The caulking was old and kind of looked grimy. The door in between the toilet and sink area did not slide to close. The hotel itself needs some general maintenance maintenance. I noticed many cracked tiles in the hallways with small pieces missing. The chairs in the lobby had a terrible appearace once someone sat on them. The round seating was showing signs of wear and the buttons from the tucking were missing. Next vacation we will try another hotel, not that this was terrible but for the money, expected it to be a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: jonchris08
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here after being recomended as a good 5 star hotel what a let down.I will start with the good things the grounds are well kept and clean and the beach area and sea are good.The rooms are ok but the bathroom/shower is tiny and the towels are old and ragged. But the worst aspect was the food and bevarages and the dismall service given by most(but not all staff)The breakfast buffet was the worst I have ever experienced with to much cooked in advance little choice day by day and when I tried to get a simple fresh fried egg was ignored by chef in favour of spanish speaking guests.We were told there were 4 a la carte resteraunts but two were shut every night so most meals were in the buffet, again very little changed night to night and the carvery meats often run out by 0900pm.Drinks in the bars were watered down and you would always be given cheep local spirits unless you went to the bar and insisted on branded drinks these were also watered down.On returning from holiday I emailed riu with my concerns and 10 days later still have not had the curtecy of a reply.I would rate this as a 3 star hotel at best and food and service at 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “It's for first time travelers”
Reviews.Author: Otis41
Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else. Somewhere newer. If you have ever traveled to nice places, pick another spot. The people are very, very nice. I agree with that. The rooms smell horrible. There are two separate beds pushed together to form a king. The shower area is dark and cramped. The air barely works. Little bugs flying around the room. You won't sleep well. The drinks are in old cafeteria cups. Everything, and I mean everything on the room service menu was unedible. We were so bummed when we saw the other newer resorts on the way back to the airport. European smokers everywhere. Great location. 5th avenue is amazing. Go there to eat. My advice, stay at a different place and pay for your own meals. You won't eat the food after day 2 anyway. Anyone who says that the food is good has obviously never been anywhere nice. Just because you can shovel massive amounts of food in your pie-hole, doesn't mean its any good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall, but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: wjack
Reviews.Content: We booked this vacation through Funjet at the recommendation of my travel agent. You select the hotel rating and Funjet selects the hotel. You don't learn about which hotel until about a week ahead of time. Kind of a surprise. We picked a "5 star" property and ended up at Riu Mexico. The property is beautiful. Our travel agent mistakenly beleived we were staying at the Riu Riviera Maya which is only 5 properties away. We looked at both and the Riu Mexico has a more ambience. The architecture is more interesting and the beach is significantly larger. The pool area; however, is showing it's age (about 10 years old) and needs to be updated, especially the bar area where much of the cabinetry was visably rotted from all the moisture. Nonetheless, the bar was clean. I saw them disenfect the bar and equiptment regularly. They also disinfected the pool ladders and and showers, a nice idea. The Good: The food was overall quite good. I would compare it to good quality cruise ship food, maybe a litte better, but certainly not gourmet. There was a lot of variety for each meal and the main restaurant has a nice outdoor seating area, but it's hard to get a table outside unless you get there real early. The grounds and property are immacuately maintained and quite lush and beautiful. We were very impressed. The rooms are large and very clean. The bathrooms are large, but could use updating. This place has a large white sand beach with an even larger area that is covered with by palm trees, nice for relaxing in the shade. There is a beach bar. We found bar service on the beach to be almost nonexistant, but the service by the pool was great. As I mentioned earlier, the pool could use updating, but it is still very nice. There are plenty of chairs both at the pool and at the beach. We didn't find a problem with people saving chairs as there was no need. The Not So Good: As others have mentioned on this website, the beds are very hard and uncomfortable. I emailed the hotel ahead of time and request foam mattress pads. I received a reply indicated that this would be taken care of-it was NOT. I complained 4 times and each time except the last I was told it would be rectified. The last time I went personally to the front desk where I was told "the mattresses are all new and we no longer have any mattress pads" When I mentioned the email and told him I had personally seen maids bring the pads to other rooms he became quite rude. At that point I gave up on the pads. The other big problem is the "upscale" restaurant reservation system. There are 4 non-buffet restaurants on site which are open only for dinner. In order to get a reservation you have to go the theatre at about 8 am. An employee comes in and hands out numbers which requires you to hold up your hand like school child and indicate the order in which you arrived. You then get to meet with the restaurant represenative and get your reservation slip. Interestingly, I never saw more than 25 people show up at the theatre, yet all the restaurants are full for the both the 6:30 pm and 8:45 pm seatings. Clearly, there is an alternate "reservation" system. I found this process degrading and it needs to be changed. Overall, I would recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel would definately recomend”
Reviews.Author: donnajameson2
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, with lovely people, who could not do enough to help. If you want a relaxing, luxury holiday this is the one for you. The food in all the restaurants was excellent. Though my husband would recomend Sir Edward Chocolate Muffin for dessert. If you go ask for Abraham in the main buffet, he is the most charming, helpful person you could want to meet and nothing was any trouble. The booking for the speciality restaurants was a bit long winded, but I can understand why it was done that way. The beach and pool area was, as in the photographs It is more a couples hotel than a family, though they make everyone welcome and there are activities for kids The staff were one of their best assets, and all were smiling and helpful. The rooms cleaned all the time and always everything you needed If we get the opportunity again, we would certainly go back Thank you to everyone that made our holiday special

Reviews.Title: “A lovely holiday, no complaints 'at all'”
Reviews.Author: Lorna D
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely holiday here, the hotel was 1st class, the staff were excellent and very friendly, they could not do enough for you. We took our 3 boys 9, 13 & 16 they loved it too, there were lots of activities for them to take part in during the day. We loved the ease of use of the other nearby RIU hotels, which made a nice stroll in the evenings. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a relaxing and value for money holiday (you get what you pay for). We will certainly be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sunloving
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this area. Last time was 5 yrs ago at the Riu Tequila. The palace is built to impress and it certainly does this. I agree with the positive reviews. It definitely has the best beach and a large sitting area between the pool and beach. Yes, the sand bags are ugly, but they had no choice. Unfortunately, the best beach is located to the right of the Sandos resort. Thats what the beach in front of the Palace used to look like. Still were able to enjoy the waves, water was warm. Service was excellent as was the food. Very varied to please all. Internet was available at the piano bar for 3 us for 15 minutes. If you sign up for the Riu class card at front desk, they double the minutes. At the Riu Playacar close by, they gave 40 minutes with the card. Internet was pretty fast. We enjoyed the location to the town and a small shopping plaza almost across from the hotel. You could buy a calling card for 10 dollars and get over 50 minutes to call Canada from one of the phones in the plaza. We walked to 5th avenue and enjoyed walking the street at night. Very safe and looked beautiful all lit up. Many fast food restaurants to be found. Also went to WalMart. Only a couple of blocks from 5th going up 10 th avenue. They have the best prices on liquor and chocolates. Better then duty free. Only problem is they would need to be put in checked luggage, possible weight issue with luggage at airport. Checked out RPRM. Also very impressive. Found the beach restaurant had more variety and was larger. The pool area was also very modern. The resort seemed more compact while the RPM was spread out more. Which to chooose? A beach person would love the RPM, while a pool person would like RPRM. We chose RPM since we able to get it for 1000 taxes in for the week of Oct 26- Nov2. This week was mainly sun. Best view would be a chair around the pool at the Riu Yucatan. Since it it buit up on higher ground, you look down to the beach and ocean. Will definitely go back if a deal like this comes back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.....but make sure they know the occassion!”
Reviews.Author: Bristow1559
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to the RIU PALACE MEXICO on an all inclusive basis for our honeymoon. We researched this to excrutiating lengths as you'd expect but somewhere along the line somebody somewhere forgot to tell the hotel it was our honeymoon!! Which detracted slightly from what is a fabulous hotel. It took us a few days to sort out the "honeymoon" issue, but between Emma (Thompson Rep) and the customer services manager it was all resolved. Ok......the hotel; ROOM We were upgraded to a garden view room which had a great aspect. The room itself was on two levels; the top level contained the two enourmous double beds and the lower level was the sitting room area (all open plan). In the room was plenty of storage, safety deposit box (included), 4 optics with branded spirits (all inclusive) and a minifridge restocked daily filled with mineral water (large and small), Corona and branded soft drinks. Make sure you keep the mozzy net doors closed because we got bitten quite a lot!! WEATHER We went between 28th Aug and 11th Sept. It was generally hot (90 +) and very humid. We found that the breeze from the beach was a welcome break every now and then from the sweaty, sticky heat of the pool. Whilst there hurricane Gustav, Hannah and Ike all hit Cuba and even though (thankfully) none hit or area we found that 2 days after hitting Cuba we had a day of bad weather ranging from all day cloud to 2 or 3 torrential downpours a day. It may be pertinent to note that my brother stayed at the same hotel in the first 2 weeks of August and the weather was fantastic throughout. The locals will tell you they are "not safe" until November arrives but if you don't mind the odd day off from the sun it should be fine. HOTEL The hotel has a buffet style main restaurant and 4 themed restaurants (Steakhouse, Argentinian. Japenese and the Fusion). The buffet was more than adequate and we went to all but the Fusion (which I was told on the last day was probably the best). We found that the buffet themed nights encompassed most of the food from the A la Carte restaurants and can say that the choice every exceeded my expectations. There are four other RIU hotels within walking distance where your A.I wristband is also welcome. We had a nose around and can honestly say that pound for pound the PALCE MEXICO was the best. In a nutshell, you'd be hard pressed to find a better hotel with more friendly or dedicated staff in this area for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Kenny&Diane
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from the Riu Palace Mexico. Was there from 10/24 thru 10/31. This place is amazing, romantic and beautiful! We don't usually stay at 5 star resorts but decided to splurge this year. The grounds are perfect, the beach is wonderful, and the food is fantastic. The only room for improvement is the pool area. It's rather small compared to other resorts and also a bit dated. The paint and concrete are showing it's age. Other than that, this place is well worth the price. Had dinner at the steakhouse and the japanese. Both were excellent. Men have to wear long pants at the evening buffet. Glad I brought one pair. Some people had to purchase pants in Playa. Overall a great resort. Hello Tony, waiter at Los Mariachis Bar. He's a great guy. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “Got Married at the Riu Palace Mexico and Honeymooned at Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: Elisa08
Reviews.Content: As the title says , myself , husband , and 50 guests stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from October 5th until the 9th , he and I then moved the the Riu Palace Riviera Maya until the 2oth . If you need info in The RPRM , please see my review . this review will only pertain to RPM. Check -in was a breeze and a drink is handed to you right on the spot . Our room was a upgraded room , the Honeymoon Suite I believe. It was outstanding !! Very spacious and with a gorgeous Ocean view . Our Balcony was HUGE !! We had nice big white fluffy terry cloth robes . Every night for turn down service our maid left us chocolates ....( we left tips of $1 or $2 every day ) Some of my guests complained of the musty smell in their room , but I always bring a travel candle with me , and plus anyone who has travelled enough KNOWS that when you stay at a BEACH front property , there is bound to be some type of " Musty smell " ..it 100 degrees every day and night , what do you expect . Go with an open mind and if smells bother you that much then bring a travel candle and be sure to use it . Food , well I will sum it up to this ....my parents arrived a few days before my husband to be and I . I asked her if she had booked any of her a'la cartes , because the restaurants are always a fun treat . Her reply to me was as follows " Sweetie, if you can't find what you are looking for at the nightly buffet , then just stay home " ....she was right . The buffets always had something for everyone . The breakfasts were outstanding and the dinners were a different theme each night , including a Sushi station !! YOU will def. not starve . But if you can book your alacartes , do so . All of them are great , especially the Brazillian and the Gourmet one . Pool- has a swim up bar and a quiet side , but we spent most of our time at the beach . If you don't like the beach and are more of a pool person then just wander to any one of the other Riu's ...specifically the Riu Palace Riviera Maya , has an outstanding pool ! Complete with beds, tables and jacuzzis , ALL inside the pool . Beach - awesome , lots of room , lots of chairs , and full drink and waiter service , they will come directly to you and offer to take your order . It was bliss ! There is sandwhales , but you have to understand their need to prevent any further beach erosion . Plus the sandwhales make it easier for children to play in the water safely and cuts down the waves quite a bit . Don't worry you can wander in either direction of the beach should big waves be what you seek . There is numerous activites , beach volleyball, water polo , water volley ball , surfing , parasialing , boogie boarding , name it and you can do it at the Riu Palace. Grounds, landscaping and general maintenance was outstanding . I mean these people really work hard and yet always with a smile on their face and a friendly ' Hola ' ... Make sure you venture into town . Playa del Carmen is 5 minutes away , literally hop in a cab and ask him to bring you to 5th ave. and you will be in the heart of all the shopping you could ever dream of , including some neat little restaurants and of course further down the strip is where all the night life takes place . A great bar to check out is The Blue Parrot , we went there twice it was so much fun and the cab ride is only $5 , so treat yourself to some time off the resort . There is great excursions, I recommend the Xel ha park and of course if you have never been to Mexico , you just have to go to Chtizen Itza , its a long drive away , like 2 hours or more , but so so worth it . if You can't make it to Chtizen itza then at least go see the ruins at Tulum , and bring your bathing suit , as the beach at Tulum is gorgeous . We also visted some cenotes while there , simply magical ...and also worth swimming in ; ) All all in was a wonderful trip and an amazing wedding . The wedding co-ordinators work their butts off to make you happy and they really are a great team. All of my guests had a wonderful time, they ate , they drank, they laughed , they rested ...memories were made . Feel free to contact me if you have any questions or need any advice . I am always happy to help out my fellow trip advisor members !! Pack your sunscreen , bug repellent and your smile ...you will indeed have a good time . ** Side note ** I travel quite often and ALWAYS use my in room safe , well this time around I never did , not once. I left my good necklace and diamond earrings on the bathroom counter , and they were right there when I got back to my room . My husband left his suitcase wide open ( men ! ) and inside he had cash , his Ipod and his brand new white gold bracelet , nothing happened . I also found out from my mother that my father left his entire wallet AND his passport , foolishly , on the bed ( men ! ) ..anyway , not even a single dollar was taken . They are very hardworking and very trustworthy employees ( maids ) . I was very impressed by this **

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but smelly”
Reviews.Author: T-bunkie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful, it wasn't crowded and it is very clean. The staff is amazing and the food is generally awesome. We also had issues with the reservation system. It's hard when you go on an excursion (Tulum Extreme was fun). We stayed 5 nights and could only get to specialties 2 nights (and "the Bodega" got a terrible review form the rest of our party). The beach was great! There are plenty of chairs and you can walk across all the properties and enjoy the beach. The week we were there I NEVER saw a body in the pool. It's pretty but freezing cold. The shopping in Playa del Carmen is fun there is quite a variety of shops and bars on 5th avenue, from tourista type to MAC and an amazing shop with incredible Opals and Obsidian Most had a great time at Senor Frogs where we celebrated a birthday. Our complaint is the bed felt like cardboard and was 2 full beds pushed together. Our room was beautiful and I loved the air system(no on & off all night) but smelled awfull. I am still trying to get the odor out of our clothing and things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluebird14
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a 2 week holiday at the Riu Palace.The hotel is incredible,only one negative aspect about this hotel was a group of americans that arrived during our first week for a wedding,they were noisy, unruly and the behaviour of one in particular was totally unacceptable,but the hotel was not to blame for this.Accomodation was immaculate,service was unbelievable,never been to a place where they bring you another drink so quick without asking. The food caters for everybody and i have never seen such a high quality, varied and enormous selection every day,can't praise it enough. The various restaurants you need to book are equally as good as the main restaurant and well worth booking.
