The pool and swim up bar was brill and we spent a lot of time propped up on a seat here, on one occasion in particular the pool was extremely dirty ( flies and like a skum on top and i refused to go in however this problem was addressed and rectified fairly quickly. The beach is lovely, plenty of sunbeds,though not the most comfortable, however i feel the sea is not the safest of places for children, you could be paddling one minute and up to your neck with one small step, on one occasion a local man was in the sea and he literally dived to pull a child to safety , i think a lot of the problem are the black whale bags they have introduced to save the sand from being washed away and these cause currents disrupting the sea bed when the sea goes in and out.The sea is great fun, warm, clear and refreshing and we had a great time here,but take care. We visited the other Riu hotels while we were there and i am glad we chose this one as first impressions go a long way and the palace seemed far superior to the others. I have travelled extensively over 20 years to borneo,cook islands and been on safari staying in the same camp as BBC while they filmed Big Cat Diaries, to name just a few and i would highly recomend this hotel for a fab and memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, don’t go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Cassandragk
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our holiday at the Riu Palace Mexico and loved it so much we extended the stay by 2 days. The place is as grandiose in person as it appears in the photos. The best part of staying at the Riu is that you have all inclusive access to each of the 5 Riu hotels in the Playacar area (a 20 min walk or 5 min taxi to downtown). The food buffets were amazing, offering huge quantities, variety and quality of both the food and wine. At dinner, waiters come around the tables offering drinks and wine, also all included. The bars are open all day and night with a wide variety of liquors and mixed drinks. An additional benefit is that there is a swim up bar at each pool. The swimming pools at each hotel are amazing and unique. The service at the pool and the restaurants is top notch. Each night there is a show with live bands and professional dancers. We danced each night! The hotel ambiance, décor and art have a colonial theme. You really feel like you’re in a palace. The sleeping rooms are clean with modern bathrooms. The only downside is that the beds are not very comfortable. We resolved this issue by asking for mattress padding provided by the hotel. Americans prefer the other Riu Palace hotel, called Playacar. This one is more modern and larger.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aubwel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Palace, and what a great choice. Great staff, great food. To be served drinks right down near the beach, sheer luxury!!! Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PEOPLE STAY HERE A MONTH AT A TIME! THAT SAYS IT ALL!”
Reviews.Author: LOVECANCUN/RM
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were treated with warm smiles! I arrived with lots of yummy candy for the front desk and they loved it! Maria the manager was absolutely wonderful! I gave her chocolates as well. Juan and Christian were a warm welcome to the front desk team. If you have any questions or concerns they a wonderful! This was my second visit to this wonderful hotel. Let me tell you I hated to leave. I found people often stay here twice a year for a month at a time. They were treated very well they said. I would like to do that next time. They have live music each night under the stars. They have a really nice patio set up for dancing too. They always come by to take your drink orders so you never have to get up for a crazy drink line. Alex Peralta was the best waiter! He serves in the sushi restaurant and the main buffet for breakfast. He is a hard working friendly server so tip him well! By the way great sushi! Christian is the best water aerobics instructor (11:00am everyday) and salsa instructor, so don't miss his enthusiastic classes. He was hilarious. You won't leave his class without a huge smile!! Worth every minute. The beach is in the best area for swimming. I've been to riviera maya 8 times and this is the best swimming beach around! If you need a taxi for the day call Ruben Medina 984-87-6-97-59 Tell him Lisa sent you. We sang him happy birthday if he forgets who I am. He took us to Merida. Great driver. You can rent him for the whole day. Tell the front desk to call him for you. Food was great! my favorite was the sushi and steak house. Have fun! Take the front desk treats and they will treat you great!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico is OK”
Reviews.Author: ldubb007
Reviews.Content: I just spent my 4 year anniversary at the Riu Palace. The Lobby was impressive with a large chandalier and dark wood. We were greeted with a cocktail. The elevator was out so we had to take the stairs. The Room was big and it was neat. The bathroom was ok. The beds were hard but I think you can ask for the foam topper to make it more manageable. I slept fine every night. The private terrace was nice and spacious. The bar is stocked with alcohol and mixers. Nothing top shelf. The maid service was good. I didn't have the exceptional staff service that others mentioned. I didn't feel like royalty but they were nice enough. The beach was nice with plenty of shade and lounge chairs. The water was beautiful and their beach was clean (except for the occasional cigarette butt). The drinks at the beach were watered down but you can ask for extra shots. Someone walks around with drinks on the beach so you don't have to go up to the bar. Bring plenty of bug spray because we were eaten alive on the beach by mosquitos. We had spray but didn't reapply after coming out of the ocean. The breakfast buffet was the only time we ate at the hotel. The food was ok too. I did enjoy the mimosas though! This is the first All Inclusive we've tried and I don't think we'll do it again. It's good for the drinks and the breakfast but for dinner I think we like to have more variety and more of a high end experience when we are on vacation. Overall it was a nice getaway but nothing earthshattering in a good or bad way. There was also a couple of days when the phones were out. I had to walk to the front desk to ask a question. That was a bit inconvenient. If you just want to take a quick beach vacation this is the place but it definitely doesn't have the entire package of a luxury resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeighNewcastle
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the staff were excellent. We had a suite which was described as "a suite for up to 4 adults" and it was really no more than a larger double so wasn't really worth the extra money. The Brazillian restaurant was never fully booked and I don't understand why as it was the best food we had on the holiday. The hotel is very clean and well kept. It's much smaller than the other Riu Hotels in the immediate area but much nicer (we visited the two either side of us). The only thing I would fault is the hotel allow people to smoke at the swim up bar meaning the pool area around the bar had ash in it!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: elkstravel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7 day stay at the Mexico Riu--9/13-9/20. This hotel is rated a 5 but would suggest it should probably be a 4--only because of the pool facilities--showing its age. The food was very good--main buffet had many selections each day. For those people who said the food was inedible--you probably don't even know what a skillet looks like! As you have probably read, you must make your reservations from 8:30 to 10:30 each day--you should probably be there by 8:00 to get your number. They move them along rapidly once it becomes 8:30. We did Sir Edwards one evening--it was very good and the service was outstanding. There are only two times a person may eat at the speciality restaurants--6:30 and 8:30. We do this when cruising but prefer to select our own time to eat when at an all-inclusive; therefore, the buffet was our main evening dining location. The first evening the service was poor, we needed to ask for water, coffee, etc. However, every other night we had one waiter and bus boy who serviced one particular section of the restaurant, so we had good service. Men--you MUST wear long pants at ALL evening meals--EVEN THE BUFFET. We saw a man turned away due to shorts-they do enforce it. The women wear whatever. The pool is small and starting to show its age. The drinks were fine. If you wanted top shelf at the pool, all you needed to do is ask. Also, a few bucks each day helps you receive what you want and also helps their workers. Remember that you are at a resort--not your local bar--and act accordingly. The lounge chairs become very hot in the afternoon and the towels don't reach from the top to the bottom. Take along an old t-shirt (xlarge) and fit it on the bottom of the lounge pad. It saves your legs from being scorched and then just leave the shirt when your vacation is over. About the pool, if you enjoy sitting around the pool, just go to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for the day or days. Since you are at a Riu Princess you have access to all the Riu's in the area. The Riviera Maya pool(s) are much nicer, and if you like to be entertained, their staff is always having activities during the day at the pool. It is about a 10 - 15 minute walk or a $5 cab ride one way. The beach at the Mexico is very nice. Lots of chairs--many in the sun and lots in the shade. The one thing--there is no sidewalk going to the beach so it is hard to get there if you have trouble walking. We have been to some resorts that have sidewalks above the sand which makes it easier to navigate. If a person has trouble with stairs (I'm starting to encounter knee problems) you may wish to consider another resort besides the Riu. There is an elevator but we could not get it to work--besides it was at the front of the resort. To get from the lobby to the main area of the resort, you must climb stairs--this also true at the Riviera Maya. Our room was clean, the air worked, and the fan certainly circulated the air. I found that when I wanted some particular soda in the refrig I'd leave the note on top of the refrig but left a dollar or two in the refrigerator. Then the maid did not take that as her tip besides the one I left for her. Overall, we had a great time. However, we certainly would not say that we would only go back to a RIU. There are many that we have been to that are comparable to this one. However, if you have booked this hotel--don't worry, you'll have a great time if you don't sit around and nit pick all the little things. You're on vacation, enjoy!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Riu is all good”
Reviews.Author: cinnamon21
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just got back from a 9 day stay at the Riu. This is a really nice place. The hotel & the grounds are beautiful. Nice swimup bar that is maybe bigger than a lot of them. There was a lot of area that you could sit out on the beach under the trees or you could go closer to the ocean & sit out in the sun. They have plenty of loungers to lay in on the beach as well as at the pool. The rooms are really nice with plenty of room, and the bathroom has a bidet. Maid service was execellent and our mini-bar/fridge was filled daily. Food was great - they have 4 speciality restraunts & the buffet. Our favorite was the Sir Edwards which I thought was the nicer one but all were great. The Japanese even had sake. To make sure you get a reservation for the fine dining you really need to get with the lady that does the reservations about 8 a.m. & get a number & then at 8:30 she will start signing up in the numerical order. I thought the drinks were good & plenty strong but if you wanted more alcohol in them all you had to do was ask. There is a little shopping area that is just a 5 min. walk from the resort. It has all kinds of souvenirs & a couple of pharmacies & mini-marts. There are 5 Riu hotels all within walking distance of each other. If you are a guest at one then you can visit them all, which we did for a day but we really liked ours the best. We met lots of great people & just had a blast. A quick shout out to Coroline & Ian from England, you guys were great. And that is about it - Everyone that worked there was just awesome & made you feel right at home. I just cant think of anything negative to say about the place. So Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: jennifervirginia
Reviews.Content: I am an avid reader of TripAdvisor but felt compelled to post my first review because this place is that good. The service is outstanding and the people that work there are very, very nice and hard working. The beach is beautiful and the whales that some people complained about were a highlight for us. Climbing up onto them was a workout in itself that made us feel better about eating so much. Take the time to walk into town and see the shops. Stop by Walmart on your way back to the hotel for lots of cheap tequila (there are cabs waiting outside so you don’t have to walk back into town to find one). If you want more excitement at the pool, go next door for some funny entertainment. And, if the Brazilian dance troop happens to be there during your stay – don’t miss it. I would have to agree that, for dinner, the buffet isn’t that great. You will fill up and find good things to eat but it isn’t restaurant quality in my opinion. The restaurants are worth the (very modest) effort of getting a reservation in the morning – and have much better wine. Maybe during high season it is more competitive, but we had no problem. We ate at the steak house, fusion, and Japanese restaurants and the Japanese one was the surprising winner. The breakfast buffet is outstanding – don’t miss the smoothie bar.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ramdav2001
Reviews.Content: We went to Playa del Carmen over the long Labor Day weekend and had a great time. Considering there were 8 of us, we NEVER had to wait for anything. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. The hotel grounds were immaculate. My husband and I went to the other hotels and they were equally beautiful. The bartenders were always happy and very generous. There was plenty to eat and even more to drink. We were impressed the bartenders knew how to make every drink we asked for, and we asked for ALOT! We recommend this chain to all-it was first class service all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples but not for singles...”
Reviews.Author: eamiranda44
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing for couples but NOT for singles... I looked at review after review about the food being so so and the rooms not facing the ocean... let's be real.... if your going to complain about the food at this hotel...... you must of been born with a silver spoon or just plain cpmplain about everything going on in your life,, how can you say a bad thing about it????... all the food was great!! The hotel grounds are amazing the pool bar area is awesome... only thing missing was the singles... my friends and I were there for a bachelor party and all we saw was couples over and over so if that's what your shooting for bring your wife and leave the guys back home...oh yeah don't loose your towel key or you will be charged 20 bucks per key and your room AC will not keep you comfortable... the ac system just plain sucks plan for mosquito bites and nasty humid climate all day... but hey it comes with the area your in so have fun and let the hotel take care of the rest...one thing for sure... you get spoiled here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning in every way!”
Reviews.Author: gmac9461
Reviews.Content: WoW! I can not believe some of the reviews people leave on this place. We stayed at the Riu Palce Mexico from August 15th-21st. This place is amazing... The service is unbelievable, the grounds are immaculate, the food is very good... always something for everyone unless you are totally spoiled or something. We arrived to cold drinks and a beautiful room with a balcony that faced the beach area. Fresh clean linens on the bed, room was spotless, and I am a complete clean freak.. I literally was making myself sick over my decision before we arrived based on some of these reviews... There are very few (what I consider to be) downsides.. This is not an opened air hotel. It is closed, but it was very hot in the lobby area and in the bathrooms and the resturants. Now we went down the block to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and the lobby there was nice and cold. So I must assume that the air conditioning in the Palace Mexico was not working that well, but our room was always nice and cold.. The liquor was watered down. Just ask for doubles and you will be ok. Or just drink the beer.. It is a 5 minute, 5$ cab ride to downtown Playa. Must see 5th Ave and that area. Just stunning.. Go snorkling in Akumal Bay. BEAUTIFUL... If I had to compare the Palace Mexico to the Palace Riviera Maya, I would say that the Palace Mexico's beach was much better than the newer Palace Riviera Maya. But the pool at the Riviera Maya was hands down better then the Palace Mexico.. Great beach service at both... We chose the Riu Palace Mexico over all of the Riu's in the area as it is on the quiter side, but loved that if we wanted to have a wild evening, we could utilize the other Riu's services.. All in all, please do not worry at all about this hotel. It is visually stunning, the service is hands down wonderful, food is great.. Literally, I think that some people can not be please in the slightest bit..

Reviews.Title: “Stay here-you won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: alvinemery
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace Mexico is amazing! I felt like royalty while I was there. My husband and I had a wonderful honeymoon-our best vacation ever. We left yesterday, after 10 days, and miss it already. Can't wait to go back next year! The staff was very friendly and helpful. I was never without a drink for more than a couple of minutes. The food was amazing! (food 24/7 and free room service) The room was large and air conditioned. This hotel is also in the perfect location. We were able to do everything we wanted to do without traveling far. However, if you do stay at the hotel the whole time, there is plenty to do. You will never be bored. We had a lot of fun playing volleyball and bocci. And perhaps best of all-a perfect price for a perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “just loved this place”
Reviews.Author: summerlove_8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel with my husband and two girls (20 and 16). Booked this holiday in February and checked on this site every few days for new reviews. Got quite concerned with a few bad ones and began to wonder if I had made the right choice. Sooo glad I stuck with my original choice, cant beleive I even considered changing. It was wonderful. There were some specific concerns so I thought I would address those as that may be helpful to others trying to decide. Beach - we thought it was lovely. never had a problem getting a bed although more choice of beds with shade the earlier you go. this was definately the nicest part of the beach from what we saw when we walked along the beach and the water is the most gorgeous turquoise. Whales did not really detract and were great fun to jump off. Pool - this was a really good size and never seemed crowded. we stayed over the opposite side from the pool bar as this was quieter. never had a problem getting a bed no matter what time we arrived at the pool Food - could not fault it, so much choice. We were there 14 days and never found it repetative, I dont knwo how you could. It changed every day. Breakfast was my favourite but I just couldnt decide what to have! Tried 3 speciality restaurants and like the sir Edward best but my children liked the buffet best so we stuck with that mostly Rooms - really nice and clean, there was a musty smell when you first walked in but not terrible and after a couple of days we did not notice it. We moved rooms after the first night as we were on the side where there is entertainment going loud and late from the next door hotel and we could really hear it. No problems moving and the smell was in all the rooms so I think just part of this area. Reception - could not be more helpful they were great. Any queries or info we wanted were dealt with straight away and they went out of their way to help. Language no problem, they all spoke pretty good English and actually a couple of the girls on reception were English so always someone who could advise. Service - have holidayed mostly in Europe and so service like this was a revelation to us. The staff here work to hard to make sure you are kept happy and we most definatley were. I dont think we waited more that 20 minutes by the pool for someone to ask what we wanted to drink - then they would just bring round cocktails or sangria, this happened even more on the beach. hope this helps but if you are thinking of going here GO, I do not see how you could be disappointed. Only negative if I have to find one is that the pool bar gets so noisy that it became impossible to drink there - mainly americans who constantly shouted out that they were on vacation and it was time to party/have fun - this actually meant they just turned up the volume to deafening - just avoid the pool bar and this is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!!!”
Reviews.Author: kottaca
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week-long stay. The rooms are very dated. The beds are not very appealing - sort of look like boxes with blanket thrown over them. No problems with the maid service, bartender or waitresses. The problem was with the front desk. These folks would not bend a finger to help you in any way at all. I have never experienced this problem with any other hotel in Mexico. This is such a huge resort - you are just a number - no personal service whatsoever. Food was average - i hated the whole "reservation" thing. Guys - be sure to take long pants - you MUST have long pants on to eat dinner here! What a pain!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: swgf
Reviews.Content: Honeymooned at the Riu Palace. Couldn't have asked for more. Rooms large and very air-conditioned! Pool was great, beach was very impressive. Food was OK. All in all, a great place to relax after a hectic few months!

Reviews.Title: “Go to RIU Palace to Relax and Reconnect in a Great Environment”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelors
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from a superb stay at the RIU PALACE MEXICO last week. Not only were the rooms, grounds and the food spectacular, the service was absolutely incredible. For example, this past Saturday before taking a late afternoon flight home, we stopped by for lunch at El Patio, one of the two restaurants by the beach. When I noticed that the guacamole was not in the usual spot, I asked one of the waiters if they had moved it. He told me that unfortunately it was not on the day’s menu. A short while later the waiter came out of the kitchen holding a plate of guacamole that they had especially prepared for my wife and me. Finally before we left the restaurant, one of the waitresses gave my wife a beautiful red rose. I could go on with other similar stories of excellent service or talk about any of the other great features of this venue, such as the picturesque beach where we spent most of our days, the shady and cozy palm trees, the proximity or the town and its myriad of shops, the high-quality drinks, the great shows every evening or the live outdoor music and dancing. Suffice to say that if you are looking for a place to relax and reconnect where you are made to feel that you are a welcome guest, I highly recommend the RIU PALACE MEXICO. We definitely plan to go back in 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Gals Vaca!”
Reviews.Author: Eff3
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night-6 day stay at Riu Palace Mexico in Playa Del Carmen with 3 of my girlfriends. We had an excellent stay and can't wait to go back. Rooms: We had a ground level room, please be sure to ask for a higher room so that you do not get eaten alive by mosquitos as I did, although they barely attacked the other girls. The room has a misty feel to it and you can easily slip on tiled floors; this is due to humidity in air. The ac worked very well and we even turned it completely off at night because we were too cold believe it or not. We had two beds piushed together, it was fine, all we did was sleep and shower in the room. Bathroom was fine and turndown service was a great extra treat. Beach: Beautiful! The hotel has placed huge black sand bags in the ocean and shoreline to help prevent the beach from any further erosion. These bags are black and look like whales. They were soooo much fun to climb on top of and jump off into the water. Great fun for all ages. We always found loungers no matter what time of day. Mixed alcohol and virgin drinks came around very frequently. Food: If you want to eat at a restaurant u must be online by 8am everyday to reserve which restaurant you would prefeer to eat at. There are 2 seatings...630 and 845. This procedure sucked and was extremely inconvenient. However, the buffet was open late evey night and we thoroughly enjoyed the variety of choices to pick from. The buffet even had themed nights such as asian, italian, etc. We made it to the Brazilian restaurant once, I recommend skipping it. Breakfast was grreat, you can have your choice of french toast, omlettes to order, sausages, muffins, fruit, etc. Very yummy and well worth waking up early for! Service: Exceptional! This resort was truly all-inclusive. Tips were not expected, though we threw dollars down for those the workers who truly went out of their way for us. A mention goes out to "Tony" serving drinks at night and "Alex" a waiter. Guests: We met great people from on this trip. Even though we were 4 girls at a family/couple resort, we had a great time. It is the company you hold that defines the kind of time you will have. Shopping: For 5 dollars (50pesos) you can take a cab into town and go shopping. Lots of jewelry shops, food and even beach bars, etc. Well worth going to. Excursions: Lots to do. We went ziplining through the jungle.Uhm, if you are afraid of heights do not try to attempt getting over your fear here. LOL. I was very scared but other girls enjoyed it very much. Bring lots of bug spray, our rep forgot to mention that to us and 60 bites later, I was not so happy! Overall: Food, service, beach, people were all great. Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Loved everything!”
Reviews.Author: doodle100
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned at the Riu Palace and had an awesome time! We couldn't find a single thing to complain about! The atmosphere is wonderful, and the scenery beautiful. We walked over to the other Riu hotels across the street, and were not as impressed walking around as we were strolling in ours. The staff was very helpful and friendly. My husband and I both thought that the food was great! Even in the standard buffet, we were impressed with the quality of the food. On our way to excursions, all of the other couples from other hotels complained about how horrible their food was, and we just sat back and smiled knowing that we did not have the same experience. Reservations did have to be made early in the morning in person, but were not difficult to get. Over all, I have absolutely no complaints about this place. It is so beautiful and everything was wonderful!! I would highly recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place!!”
Reviews.Author: kat222Calgary
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this all-inclusive resort to anyone out there!! There is nothing bad that I could say about this resort. The rooms are extremely clean, staff and service is probably the best we have ever experienced in our lives (no joke!!), food quality and variety is phenomenal (Even for the most picky of eaters!), and more activities than you can fit into one week for sure! My fiance and I were extremely impressed with all aspects of this hotel. Also, the location of it was great as it was close to the town of Playa Del Carmen ($5 cab ride) and many other attractions in the area. STAY HERE!! - YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico is "the place to stay"!”
Reviews.Author: pwc1110
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I am a 32 yr old male and pretty well traveled, so I have quite a bit to compare it to. Our stay at the Riu was nothing less than perfect from the time we met the bell hop at the front door. I will start with hotel itself. It is VERY clean at all times. From the room, the halls, the common areas and out doors. The staff is constantly cleaning, painting, mowing, ect...Our room was cleaned 3 times a day and our wet bar was always fully stocked and fresh towels after every use. The hotel is very grand and has a very elegant and opulent feel. It has a spanish style decor and a grand lobby with a very old world luxurious feel. The main plaza has beautiful fountains and landscaping leading you down to the beach and the pools. The pool has a swim up bar and a very tranquil feel which is then proceeded by the beach. You walk down through a forest of palm trees covering lounge chairs and hammocks hung from the palm trees and then you come down to the beach and the beautiful aqua blue ocean. On the beach you will find two massage cabanas and a full service bar. That was key! Compared to other hotels, the bar is always up at the pool or the hotel. I also highly recommend a massage on the beach. We found most people were at the beach during the day and retired to the pool for the afternoon. As for the service, we found the staff very polite, helpful and attentive. They always greet you with a smile and seemed so happy to help you. I have never had such wonderful and sincere service anywhere else. When ever we were finished eating, our plates were removed promtly and our drinks were always full. You never sat there looking or waiting for service. The food was also very good and you never seemed to be bored of eating the same thing at the buffet like you do on a cruise. The variety was amazing especialy at breakfast and dinner. I would recommend you try all the fresh juices they make at breakfast, they are delicious! As everyone else has mentioned, you do have to get up early to go down and make dinner reservations in the lounge. We ate in the Brazilian and the steak house restaurants and they were excellent. Because my life is one big schedule, my vacations are not. Therefore, I like to eat when I am ready and not have to leave the beach or pool to get ready for dinner or get up early to make reservations. I found the buffet to be very good and Mexican night was awsome! The buffet offers a fine dining atmosphere with white linens and stem ware and of course excellent service. Now the only two bad things about the whole trip and this is no lie, is the coffee and the ketchup. We seriously said this several times over the vacation. We could not find anything else wrong with this trip. While you are there, make sure you go down to 5th Ave which is all shopping, dining, and drinking. Very cool and must go see at least on night. Oh, you can also get Starbucks down there too! We also went to Chitz and Itza Mayan Ruins. Absolutly amazing and educational. It's an all day trip for a $100 through the Apple Vacation guy in the main lobby. Trip includes beer, soda and full sit down lunch. As far as entertainment, It is ok, If you are looking for high energy, your not going to find it here. You will have to go to the Riu across the street which caters to a much younger crowd, I almost felt like I was back in Cancun on spring break. We kind of think because this is such an upscale hotel, the high energy will not appeal to this clientele. In conclusion, the Riu Palace Mexico is every thing they claim to be and you will not be disappointed unless you are used to staying in hotels that are $10,000 a night. As far as some of these other reviews such as a broken ironing board or because your not greeted with a drink, do you really think that is going to ruin your vacation? Believe me you won't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Appearence, not 5 star Service or Quality!”
Reviews.Author: bionca22
Reviews.Content: I want to be very fair with this reveiw. First, this place by far is one of the most appealing places I have seen. Scenery for days. Everything you see on their website as far their photos is just the same in person. But the SERVICE and FOOD is not 5 star quality! I read all the great reviews before I went . I was eager to see what the hype was all about. We got to our room, gorgeous. In the closet the was DIRT on the floor and our ironing board was broken. We advised the front desk, but they could not bring a new one until the next day. The dirt in the closet was not cleaned until 3 days after our stay. Second, the food here SUCKS! I have stayed in CANCUN and the food was way better. The reservation policy is basically first come, first serve. Which no one tells you until you get there. The best tasting food in the the resort is SIR LAWRENCE. But it is the size of my master bedroom, so the resevation goes fast. We ate there twice during our stay, once we had to pay one of the waiters 20 bucks to get us in. (that was the rumor going around how to get in!) Second time we had to get up at 7am and wait in line until 9:30am for the reservation. You have to just sit there and then they give you a number, I felt like I was on a welfare line! People were getting into arguements on who got there first. I paid all that money to stay at a 5 star resort, so I could sit for 2 hours just so I can eat good food? Never heard of this policy. If you do not wait online you will not eat at any of the restaurants that is mentioned on their website. And to make it worse the food at the buffet sucked! This place was a pretty penny, but not a 5 star resort! You will be blown away from the scenery and it all ENDS there!

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Round - Pure Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Batch21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace five years ago for our honeymoon. Nothing could have made that vacation any better. We have carried the fondest memories ever since and have been looking to return since that day. Once we knew that we would be returning to Mexico there was only ever one place we would stay. People say that you shouldn't go back to somewhere because it can never live up to your expectations but we didn't find that to be true. As many people have said before, the property, grounds and pools are wonderful. There is a refined elegance to the courtyard area, with its fountains and manicured grounds and a tranquillity to the pool that we have yet to find anywhere else we have stayed. Every member of staff we encountered were excellent. Friendly, attentive and always willing to go the extra mile. I have never felt as relaxed as I do when reading a book by the pool at the Riu Palace (especially with the highly efficient drinks service). Food was again, very good and we enjoyed every meal. We ate at the Steakhouse and Brazilian restaurants and thoroughly enjoyed the experiences. Everyone is different but I had no problem what-so-ever with getting a reservation at the speciality restaurants (despite not generally being a morning person) I would go to the theatre at 8.30, get a number, buy a newspaper, drink a coffee and within 15 minutes, get the reservation I wanted at a time I wanted. On the days I couldn't be bothered to get up early, we ate at the buffet restaurant or went out for a meal at the ever impressive Playa Del Carmen. On our last visit, we didn't catch a single show (too much tequila and sun probably) but this time we stayed up every night and despite me initial scepticism I was very impressed. The singers and bands in the Courtyard were also brilliant. A special mention for the waiting staff at night. I have never seen service like it. We found that there was definitely a wider variety of guests on this visit. Five years ago it was predominantly European couples. This time there were more families (all of the children we saw were wonderfully well behaved) and the entertainment team seemed to be doing an excellent job. There were also more large parties - usually American and they seemed to encompass a wide age range i.e. extended families, not college kids etc. This gave a slightly livelier feel to the evenings than on the previous visit, although nothing like Cancun. My view on some of the complaints I have read here are: there will be some mosquitoes and bugs, what with it being the jungle, but there are considerably less than in some of the other resorts and hotels we've visited in Mexico because the courtyard and grounds are not full of jungle plants - it looks like a palace after all. Due to our experiences and those of people we have met on our trips to Mexico, I find it hard to believe that people are treated rudely or are not provided with a good service. We have never met a staff member who didn't greet as warmly and help in any way they possibly could. Unfortunately, the same could not always be said for the way in which a minority of guests talked to the staff so I wonder if the problem does not lay a little closer to home. (My apologies to any polite guests who have had bad experiences). I was also impressed with the efficiency of the maintenance staff. I noticed two cracked floor tiles in the hallway near our room and the next day the area was being re-laid. My wife and I noticed that the building / room by the pool where you collect and return towels was looking a little tired and two days later it was being painted and improved. At various other times the pools had staff in them scrubbing the tiles whilst others were maintaining the lawns, shrubs and painting the main building. In conclusion, we have had two perfect holidays at the Riu Palace Mexico. We would go back in a flash, and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “50 th Wedding family vacation”
Reviews.Author: DaleLaurel
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Riu Palace Mexico and we took 24 of our family and friends for our 50 th wedding anniversary. It was excellent, in check in, room service, pools, beaches, restaurants, every part of our trip was excellent. Transfer from airport and everything went extremely well. They could not do enough for our group. The bars and servers were all great. Apple vacations did an excellent job since we switched to this resort the day before we left for Cancun. We intend to go again in less than a year. Awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “Riu rules!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl1217
Reviews.Content: Riu palace was absolutely amazing! We went for my grandparent's 50th wedding anniversary. There were 24 of us and we all loved it. The food was decent. The buffet (don julian) was the best by far, but it's worth trying the other restaurants. Room service is nice, but typical not the best food. The beach and pool were lovely. The staff was amazingly friendly and provided excellent service! There really isn't much to complain about. Everyone was helpful. We booked through Apple Tours and they rock too! Also scuba diving and the massages are fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Awesome Time”
Reviews.Author: Joe B
Reviews.Content: I have to be honest, I was skeptical about vacationing in Mexico, let alone an all inclusive resort vacation (all inclusive makes me think of young students on spring break). The crowd was not all young or all older but a good mix of all ages. I was impressed with the grounds and aesthetics of the hotel. I was also impressed with how polite, helpful and descriptive the front desk was at check-in. I also like the special welcome drink you receive. The hotel hallway to our room was very humid, which made me think it would be hot in our room, but I was wrong. We walked into a cooled and clean room. The room was spacious with a separate seating area, tile floors and balcony. We did not have a view, which we didn’t mind because we were hardly in our rooms. The bathroom was also spacious and clean. The hotel grounds were very neat and clean. The beach and pool areas were also very clean with many activities to do in the vicinity. The evening restaurants were excellent, I didn’t have anything but a great meal. The lunch and breakfast were also very good. The bar staff was very friendly and drinks were excellent (**Try the Batida De Cocoa**). We did venture to a couple other Riu hotels in the vicinity which you as a Palace guest have access to, but always seemed to make our way back to the palace Mexico. The Riu Palace made my trip to Mexico a lot of fun and very relaxing at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort - 26 / Married with 9 Month Old”
Reviews.Author: bryansimon
Reviews.Content: Our family was celebrating our Grandparents 50th Anniversary. They were taking us all on vacation. We were all so excited...until two days before we were supposed to leave we got a call from the travel agent saying that they had a group in the hotel we were supposed to stay at (Grand Princess Sunset) and they were very unhappy and wanted to switch hotels. YIKES!! So they recommended this resort to us and I am so very glad they did. Here's a brief summary of the resort: Appearance Of Overall Resort: This place is absolutely beautiful. The grounds are well maintained, everything is kept nice and clean. Every day the landscaping folks were out trimming shrubs or cleaning. Everything about the courtyard / entertainment area was very nice...top notch. The only slight downside of the whole place is the ceramic tile everywhere. It can become very slippery. Our grandmother actually slipped on it as soon as we got there. Got a pretty nasty bruise. But if you walk with caution after the rain, it shouldn't be a problem. Rooms: The rooms are very nice. You can see pictures from the reviews of other people on here. You walk into the room and enter a small hallway. There is a bathroom directly to your right. It's got a nice shower and sink area, and the toilet has a door that closes so you can do your business without disturbing others. Through the hallway you enter the sleeping area, basically a big bed (2 doubles with a big headboard). The mattress is kind of uncomfortable but you can request a mattress pad which makes it a lot better! Further past the dining room there is a small living area with a couch and TV. There is also a small sitting area outside but we never sat out there cause it was really hot during the day and at night there were a few mosquitos, but not many. The air conditioning worked great in the room. The mini-bar was always stocked up with sodas and water and a few beers. Pools: The pools were OK. In all reality there could have been more, or it could have been bigger, but we never really had any problems finding a place to sit. I totally was consumed with playing pool volleyball. There is a net setup and the staff always comes around at about 11:00am trying to get people together to play. They'd play for 1/2 hour and then leave to go do other events, but we'd play pool volleyball all day long. In between matches, we'd take a break to visit the pool bar or find some shade to sit in around the pool. Plenty of palms and umbrellas provide the shade. The pool is about 4 feet all the way around...they had a kiddy pool but we never checked it out. Beach: The beach was lovely. Sand whales (big mounds of sand with a black vinyl-type sheet over it to prevent beach erosion) were everywhere but who cares you go to the beach to soak up the sun or hang out in the ocean. There are topless women everywhere...some whom you didn't mind seeing and some whom you wished would put their tops back on!! Plenty of lounge chairs. There were hammocks under the palm trees which looked like a nice way to relax! Nice water, very clear, very clean. Food: Ahh the most important subject!! First off, women can wear whatever they want to restaurants, and basically men can do the same thing except at dinner, men have to wear anything but a tank top / sleeveless shirt, and they have to wear long pants. No shorts. No big deal. For breakfast, they have a sweet buffet at the Don Julian. We ate there alot. Pancakes, french toast, waffles, eggs, meats, bagels, etc. For lunch, we would normally eat at one of the two buffets down by the pool since we were closer there. They had killer pizza (had cream cheese in crust, yummm), burgers, hot dogs, chicken wings, and other stuff. For dinner, if you wanted to eat at the Steakhouse or Japanese, or any other "non-buffet" restaurant, you had to schedule a reservation early in the morning (8:30am). We mainly ate at Don Julian because it was just awesome. They had a different menu every night. Good deserts. The people there were very nice and the food was very good so we didn't waste time making reservations and just ate there. The Staff: I have a new opinion of the mexican people after this trip. Everyone at the resort was just so nice. All the staff at the desk were helpful when we needed a crib sent to the room. The room service was very friendly. The people who cleaned our rooms did such a great job and even went as far as organizing the baby's toys in her crib. The restaurant staff was so very kind. They sung happy birthday to our Grandmother on her birthday. The mariachi band sung for our table. They always made sure our glasses were filled. The drink waiters around the pool always made sure we had enough to drink. We knew we didn't have to tip but we were compelled to because these people were just so nice to us. Because of their attitude alone, we'd return to this resort in a heartbeat. In conclusion, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone I knew. If you are on the fence about where to stay, just pick this one and be happy!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm a Riu man”
Reviews.Author: RiuMan
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace Mexico is a solid 4 star resort. Great service, food, and location are it's strong points. The room was comfortable, but the beds are too firm; and the bathroom was small. As a family of 3 with a college bound son, we loved this place, and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get married here/stay here!”
Reviews.Author: coachlong
Reviews.Content: I would like to express my sincere disappointment in our overall vacation experience including the level of service, accommodations, and general staff issues. We arrived (myself and one other person) to the resort on Monday evening, June 23rd. We chose this resort because our friends were getting married on June 26th at the RIU Palace Mexico, and we were told the wedding party had to stay at the same resort. The bride and groom arrived the day before (having already provided a list of guest names, provided another list to specify that she wanted all guest rooms to be near each other). Of course, we understand that we won't be right next to each other, however we found ourselves across the hotel in a far corner, nowhere near the bride. We also found ourselves in a room full of mosquitoes. It is June, and there are mosquitoes in Mexico, but we must have killed a dozen mosquitoes in the first hour we were in our room. When we went to the front desk, along with the bride, we asked that we be moved not only for because of the mosquitoes, but also because the bride had previously requested we be in a room much closer to her. We were told that there was nothing that could be done about our room for that night because the resort was full. While I have no proof otherwise, it seems odd that at 5 O'clock on a Monday night during hurricane season that the entire resort was not only full, but that all other guests had checked in making it impossible to switch us from one room to another. We were also told that there are lots of mosquitoes in Mexico, so we should expect mosquitoes. I understand this, but found that I was the only one complaining of killing dozens of mosquitoes including four of them in a matter of a minute on Tuesday morning. We were accommodated that day, having our room switched to a location somewhat closer to the bride with no more mosquitoes. Also, I did get several (around 15 bites not of the mosquito variety all on my ankles while in the first room, which was unpleasant since I don't know what bit me). Unfortunately, our new hotel room, along with all rooms on that side, backed up to the Wyndham Viva that likes to party with club style dance music until around 1:30 in the morning making sleeping a bit difficult to say the least. Obviously, one can't control what another hotel does, but it is something to note regarding staying at this particular hotel on the particular side we were on. Regarding the food, we were disappointed with the rules and restrictions involved in eating, both at our own resort, and at one of the other 5 RIU resorts in the area. First, the all-you-can-eat buffet requires that pants be worn by men (as opposed to shorts) for all dinners. This would be helpful to note before arriving because this is not a requirement at all all-inclusive resorts. Basically if you want to eat anything except room service (all five dinner options) for dinner, you have to wear pants if you are man. One expects to have to dress up to eat at one of the specialty restaurants, if only one could get into ANY of those restaurants. Note: Even though you can go to the other five resorts for other activities, you MUST eat dinner at your own resort. Regarding reservations for the specialty restaurants, we were told when we checked in to go to a certain location between 8:30 and 10am in order to get reservations for each night (note: you have to do this everyday because you can only make reservations for that night). The bride, however, went to the specified location on Monday morning at 9:30 only to find that all specialty restaurants had already been booked. When the bride inquired about why she was told to go between 8:30 and 10am if everything was going to be booked right away, she was then told that you have to get in line at 7:30am, to get a number, that MAY get you to a reservation. What a vacation, stay up late having a good time, but then have to get up at 7:30am if you want to eat at a restaurant besides the all-you- can-eat buffet. AND remember you have to do it everyday! The food itself, once we did get into a specialty restaurant, was lackluster, and was average overall throughout our stay. The rooms were ok, nothing to speak of, except that everyone's TVs seem to work differently. The bride and groom had a TV that turned on without warning in the middle of the night, quite odd I must say, and we all didn't have the same channels, or at least not the same clear channels -- some were fuzzy, or didn't come in well enough to watch. Room service sometimes took 5 minutes, and sometimes took 25 minutes, so there was no consistency there. The floors in the areas around the hotel were always slippery because they were always being cleaned, except for the ones in our rooms which were so dirty that we all put towels down in front of our beds so we could wipe our feet off before we got into bed. The pool was smaller than the other RIU resorts that we visited, but we assumed that it was because this RIU was along the ocean, so you could swim there as well. The pool bar held odd hours, so that you couldn't get certain kinds of drinks unless you got out of the pool and went to a different bar, even though the pool was still open two more hours. The bartender had the ability to walk up a flight of stairs and get us the drinks we asked for, but instead told us that he could only offer us beer, and cocktails had to be obtained elsewhere. As far as the wedding, I would NOT recommend getting married here. There were a lot of rules and restrictions related to the reception such as having to be out of the reception area by your designated time or else they charge you $600 for the extra hour. This was actually written into the contract! Having said that, the people at the reception dinner (the staff) made no effort to keep the dinner moving along so we could meet our deadline, and we found ourselves having to call for the head waiter to get our main course, and to remind him that the cake still needed to be served. There was a birthday taking place at the same time in another part of restaurant, and that took precedence over the wedding party. Now to the fun part of our vacation. We lost power on Wednesday evening between 6pm and 7pm. We dealt with it for a few hours, and it did come back on briefly for some people in some areas of the resort. Other members of the bridal party, however, did not get power back in their rooms until 7:30am the next day. In the meantime, people who found themselves in a similar situation were not given even a candle to light up their rooms until around 1am in the morning, and then it was just a candle, in a drinking glass (very unsafe). When the other members of the bridal party complained, they were told that there was no management on site that was high enough ranking to make a decision, so basically there was NO CONTINGENCY plan, and everyone had to sit in 90 degree heat, with 90% humidity and wait to regain power. Some of us had power off and on thru the night, but not everyone did, and would you believe (because this is what people were told) that of all the other FIVE RIU resorts in the area, there wasn't ONE room available to move guests to until power was regained. Once again, this was not the busy season, and I find it hard to believe that all guest rooms in all 6 RIU resorts were completely full. To summarize, I will not be staying at a RIU resort again, and recommend that other's not stay here as well, and to certainly not get married here.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the bad reviews. It's Very good!”
Reviews.Author: PortoLiberty
Reviews.Content: We, a family of 4 (2 adults and 13 and 11 years old kids) stayed at this spectacular hotel from 22 to 29 june. We booked 2 rooms, all rooms are junior suites, side by side, and ask for a quiet zone in a top floor, and all of it was there when we arrived! Very nice room, clean, always fresh with AC, and the maid leave at the bed, everyday, lovely figures made with towels, and it was so kind!! Room service was free of charge, but we didn't need it. All the restaurants had plenty of wonderfull food, and we particulary liked the mexican food, very good! No problem booking the non buffet restaurants, at the Mariachi bar (we booked Sir Eduards, La Bodega and Steak house) The staff was allways friendly. The pool smaller than we expected, but still ok. The bad things, if we can say so, were the bugs (mosquitos) atacking you even with repelent on the skin and the sand whales on the beach (but we understand they are trying to recover it) Finaly, we recomend this hotel and really don't understand the bad reviews

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace is great”
Reviews.Author: Cherr1024
Reviews.Content: We (husband, 14 yr old son and I) stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from 6/15/08-6/21/08 - Everything went smoothly - arrived at the resort around 12:30 pm and were in our room by 12:45 pm - Everything we asked for (rollaway bed for our son, mattress topper, extra pillows) was delivered within a 1/2 hour after we asked. I know some reviewers have bashed the front desk but every time we called them they were very accommodating, courteous and pleasant. The reservation system for restaurants, which we had heard so much negativity about, actually went smoothly. I don't sleep late on vacations generally so I didn't have a problem grabbing a mimosa from the buffet and sitting for 15 minutes to make the reservation..Met some really nice people there as well Never had a problem with chairs on beach or by pool...Cabs were abundant...even at 6:15 am when we left for a fishing trip out of Puerto Aventuras...And the drinks were great..just Ask...if they have the liquor you want, they will give it to you..Coronas on tap and in the minibars in the room were a plus.. the room was kept up nicely and was made up by 11 each morning with turndown service occurring around 7:30 or so...again great All of the staff were friendly..while some spoke very little english, a smile and a thank you goes a long way.. We saw about five weddings the week we were there...the one in the center courtyard was exceptionally breath taking... In conclusion, take the negative reviews with a grain of salt...this is a beautiful resort with charming employees and we'll be looking to go again next June Cheers Cheryl

Reviews.Title: “Married at the RIU Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Extras678
Reviews.Content: My now husband and I decided to do a Destination Wedding last year. I read a number of reviews and decided to go with the RIU Palace Mexico in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico. I am not a fussy person by any means, but I do enjoy my luxuries, and the hotel was nothing short of excellent. Our wedding coordinators were fabulous! Everything was so easy and so fun. Our food was excellent, the staff was so nice and accomodating. We are going back next year for vacation without a doubt. We had 41 guests at our wedding, and every single person said what a fabulous time it was and how much they enjoyed everything. We did come away with a couple of tips 1) the mattresses are a little hard, ask for a mattress pad 2) eat at the Miyagi restaurant at the hotel, its sushi and a nice change of pace 3) defin go to Cozumel, beautiful island and worth spending a full day there 4)the walk to town is actually a half hour, not fifteen minutes I would recommend this resort to any of my friends, its so wonderful. Any brides planning to get married, email me if you have questions.

Reviews.Title: “Deplorable RIU Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: amwys4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 6 Apple (Apple Vacations) Square Deal for Riviera Maya. We were assigned to the RIU Palace Mexico from 7 to 14 June 2008. We had stayed at RIU's previously and know them to be a decent hotel but nowhere near a 6 Apple (HIghest category Apple Vacations assigns). This particular RIU was worse than anything I have ever experienced in a hotel. Giving it a 3 Apple rating would be generous! The staff was in no way up to par. I can only recall running into two employees that made us feel we were on vacation. The room situation was simply ridiculous. Upon check in we asked for an ocean view and were told they did not have ocean views. We were told we could get either a pool or courtyard view if we waited for an hour or so. We waited and returned to receive our room key. We got to the room (1125) to find we were facing the trees at the back of the resort and the back of the neighboring resort. We also found a well lived in room. When I called the front desk to ask for the room we were told we'd get I was told that rooms with view were $40 extra per person, per night. When I informed the young lady we were told we would get a room with a view if we waited the additional money was reiterated. After going back and forth a while I was told we could get a room with a view in two days, but I had to come to the front desk by 10 am on the day of the move to let them know we wanted to move. I still don't understand that, but we agreed. Later we find we have a colony of ants parading up a bed side dresser and a ledge where my husband had clothes. We had to track down a housekeeper in the halls to come combat the bugs. We had to stick it out in this room until we could move. The next surprise was the realization that the neighboring hotel's night club was right on the other side of the fence we faced. It was a long and loud night. Our next morning, Sunday, we found out we had to go to a designated location between 8:30 and 10:30 each morning to make a dinner reservation. This was horrible, what an unwelcome daily vacation activity. When I went to the front desk to complaint to a supervisor, I waited for about 15 minutes to talk to a woman who told me no one had ever complained about their system and, at least 4 times told me I could make the reservation anytime within the 2 hour window. This trip was off to a bad start! The second day, Monday, I went to the desk early to confirm we want to take the room with a view. I asked more than once that they have some one check the new room for bugs before we moved. It seemed as though I was bother in the young lady, but she finally said she would. We returned to the desk later and receive the new key. We entered the new room (1063) to find another well lived in room. I headed to the window and opened the darkening drapes to find bugs crawling up the drapes. I immediately called the desk to ask for help. It took 20 minutes or so before someone arrived. The man killed the bugs I pointed out plus some that he found in another place. He cleaned up and left us with the can of Raid. That was certainly not a comforting thing. I began looking around the room and here is a list of what was found: - BUGS - A rusty safe - Corroding handle on toilet - Crude/mold at base of toilet lid - Rusting wall connection/water cut off for toilet - Broken bar for the handheld shower head - Crude/mold around and above the shower curtain bar - Crude abound the tub - Crude in the bottom of the tub - Broken bath gel dispenser and bath get sitting to the side - Silver finish coming off of the assistance bar for the tub. - Ill fitting cover for the Kleenex receptacle in the sink - Green crude around facet handles of the sink and bidet - Stained bed sheets - Stained pillow cases - Cushions that were too small for the love seat - Chipped soap dish on the sink - Corroding magnifying mirror - Dirty vent and surround - Dirty/molding room service menu - Stains on the walls - Paint chipping off of the handles to the patio When the front desk was notified of the problems, I got no assistance. Having book an Apple Vacation, I decided to see our representative when he returned the next morning. We went out to enjoy the grounds and have dinner. The maid had come while we were out. She left the light on and the bugs were having a great time flying around in the lighted room. I spent the next while chasing bugs with Raid bug spray. I was a basket case. Once I was finally able to wind down, the chase was on again. After not seeing anything move for a while I finally laid down. It was a horrible night of feeling like things were crawling all over us. The next morning I got up to go see Luis, but first I saw bugs crawling on the 2nd bed and then a couple in the bed we were in. I felt sick! I saw the Apple Rep, Luis, and told him of the unacceptable conditions in the room and the poor service around the hotel. He just gave me a blank look. I told him how we had bugs in the 1st room and even after asking the desk staff to check the second room we had bugs in it also. Luis told me that maybe this was just a "general" problem like that would make it okay. I explained that for what we paid and for what Apple said we were going to get, this was unacceptable. I had taken pictures with my cell phone and showed them to Luis. This did not cause Luis to be any more helpful. Luis asked what I wanted him to do about it and I told him to move us to an actual top rated hotel. He acted as if I did not say anything to him. I told him that no one from the hotel management, nor he, had ever even asked to come see the room that housed these horrid conditions. Again there was no response. I was furious and frustrated. I asked to speak to his supervisor. After a while he got a supervisor on the phone. He spoke with her and then gave the phone to me so I could repeat my plight. She apologized, saying she'd contact the hotel. Luis came back to say we could move back to the first room (1125) we were in. I explained to him that that was not an option, because that room had bugs. Why would we go back to that room? Luis left and came back again to say he and a housekeeping supervisor would come see the room. Luis and I went to room 1063 and I showed him the laundry list of problems. Minutes later the housekeeping supervisor came. It was the same many who had sprayed the day before. Luis showed him the problems, during which two men appeared with industrial fumigation canisters. Apple was not going to move us to a decent, top of the line hotel. Our offer was to move to our first bug infested room or let them work on the on new room. Having no recourse, we got things together exited the room and let them work on the room. We returned hours later to find a few things fixed and there were no bugs in plain sight. I tried to tell Luis but he was not around. He did call later. After we returned from dinner that night, Tuesday, we did not see bugs. You do not know how relieved I was. I wish all of the problems had disappeared. Even so, we still could not enjoy the room and I was tense for the whole vacation. I never got rid of the felling that things were crawling on me. I still shutter when I think of it. We feel like we were robbed. We paid too much to end up in a place that does not value it's customers and takes no pride in there service or their accommodations. We have yet to hear a response from Apple Vacations or the RIU Hotels. We were thoroughly disgusted! No one helped us. RIU Hotels and Apple Vacations really pulled one over on us!! Note: Sorry, had more pix, but couldn't upload them

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Dinner Madness”
Reviews.Author: Vacation-Loca
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace Mexico June 10-17, 2008 We booked this trip as a 6 Apple Square Deal. Price was $999 per person plus tax and trip insurance. Have stayed at 4 Apple, 5 Apple, and 6 Apple resorts. This is a solid 5 Apple Resort. CHECK IN: I am a Riu Class Club member. They took a copy of my card at check in. I had my Trip Advisor hat in my carryon, but did not pull it out and got good service from the front desk (I did mention it was our 6th Riu resort visit). It was 10 a.m. and our room was ready. ROOMS: We were given a ground floor room (#0052) facing the fountains. Very clean with lovely towel art. Fridge was stocked with water, Corona, Pepsi, Pepsi lite, orange and lemon/lime sodas. Liquor dispenser had Rum, Vodka, Tequila and Brandy. Bed linens were clean and fresh, but beds were very firm and pillows were flat. The one in the closet was a little fluffier. Towels were fluffy and absorbent. There were 2 bath towels, 2 hand towels, 2 bidet towels, and 2 smaller towels on the vanity. They sprayed for bugs a couple nights when they did turndown service. Did not have bugs in the room. Air conditioner worked very well. Remote stopped working and was replaced right away. FOOD: There is a breakfast buffet below the lobby. There are 2 buffets available throughout the day for lunch, one is just off the beach but you must wear shoes and a cover-up (no beach snack bar where you can grab a bite in your swimsuit). You must make dinner reservations in person at the Theatre below the lobby near the restaurants between 8:30 and 10:00 a.m. You may only reserve for that night. What a pain and waste of time to have to get up and stand in line to get a reservation for dinner. We ate at the Brazilian and Sir Edwards (Krystal menu) which were good. We never got reservations for the Steakhouse or the Japanese. The dinner buffet had many choices. Even picky eaters should find something to eat. Food was better than most All Inclusives (unless you have allergies). We went into PDC for dinner and drinks one night and spent way more than we thought we would. Things have gotten a bit pricey in PDC! BARS: There is a bar on the beach, and they bring trays of drinks around for you to choose from (water, Pepsi, pina colada, something strawberry, beer). There is a pool bar and waiter service around the pool area. The lobby bar had a piano with live music in the evening and a nice Martini menu. It is open until 7 a.m. for the insomniacs. They offered Beefeaters and Gordons, Absolut and Smirnoff, Bacardi and Havana Club, Modelo, Don Julio, J & B, Jim Beam, Johnny Walker Red, and much more. There is NO Coke at this resort. Rum & Pepsi??? Service was good at all bars. Especially Elena in the lobby bar. BEACH: There are many large “sand bags” set up to help stop the beach erosion. They pumped sand every day but it will be a very slow recovery. The water is still nice, rough first 2 days then very calm. Just depends on the weather. The constant pounding of Jet Skis and smell of the fuel were irritating, but I guess you get used to it. POOLS: Plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas. Cushions are covered in plastic and get very hot in the sun, but fine if you put your towel down. Pool was clean the first 2 days (it rained a couple hours late in the day). By the 4th day it was looking a little cloudy. The Jacuzzi water was warmer than the pool, but not heated. INTERNET/PHONE: Internet runs VERY slow. I had problems with my cell phone and went online to my account to find out what to do and as soon as I got to the page where the info was I was booted off. I ended up buying a phone card to call home. Make sure you activate your International cell service before you leave the US. I did so in September before our trip to RM, then went to Punta Cana in December with no problem, but this trip was not able to use my cell (AT&T). PROBLEMS: #1 They do not cater to any special needs. If you have a food allergy be careful. Ala carte restaurants are usually best for food cooked to order, but they would not assist with reservations. The Buffet Manager gave some assistance, but we corrected him on a few items, so it was really “eat at your own risk.” #2 There are only 2 elevators, both in the lobby area. There are long corridors and pathways from the lobby to the beach/pool. If you have difficulty walking distances and climbing stairs this may not be a good choice for you. APPLE VACATIONS: This was our 25th trip using Apple. We have done the Square Apple Deal in the past with no problems at all. When we checked in at the airport we were supposed to get our hotel information in plenty of time to call home. Our Apple Rep didn’t show up until we were on the plane. We were given the hotel info and phone number but had no way to contact our family at this point. Our Apple Orientation was at 4:30 that day. We knew we didn’t want to go on any excursions so we gave the Apple Rep our return transfer card after waiting for him to book several people on excursions. It seems they are more interested in selling tours than taking care of your needs once you arrive. We had asked the front desk staff about reservations in the restaurants regarding dietary needs. They do not bend at all. The answer is “NO!” They were no help at all. We didn’t expect special treatment and would take any restaurant at any hour (at other 5* resorts we’ve had no problem and this is a 6*). We went to our Apple Rep the next day. He could not help us and told me to choose 3 other resorts and made some calls and told us to come back later. We were told it would be an additional $1000 - $2500 for our last 5 nights. Not sure if we would have any better luck at those resorts we decided to stay and enjoy the rest of our vacation. The day before departure we still had not been notified of our pickup time for our transfer to the airport. There is usually a book with all the flights and pickup info (after 25 trips I know this) but the page was missing. The front desk clerk told me the Rep would be back at 3:00. I left a message for the Rep at the front desk asking to be contacted with the pick up time. At 5:00 I hopped in the shower and realized we never got a message. I called and of course, she never received my note from the front desk. She was leaving at 6:00 and I needed to pick up my transfer voucher by then or miss my transfer, which was scheduled for 6:10 a.m. I was still wrapped in my towel, and told her I would rush. About 10 minutes later she knocked on my door and handed me the voucher. (We ended up waiting in the airport for almost 4 hours and our flight was on time!) We were VERY disappointed in Apple Vacations this trip. I will be happy to answer any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: BeachLover0025
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wedding at the Riu Palace Mexico. My fiance and I stayed for nine days (June 4-12th) and had an amazing time. The food is good, not always gourmet, but there is plenty to choose from. The buffet had such a good selection I never got sick of the food. We only made dinner reservations for three of the nights, went to town twice for dinner, and ate the buffet the rest of the time. The rooms are beautiful, and cleaned every day. The workers are constantly cleaning the walkways and maintaining the grounds. Be careful because the tile can be slippery (especially after it rains). We did check out the Riu Tequila and shot pool at the Sport's Bar. We also went to Riu Playacar to find the guys that massaged us on the beach. (They rotate hotels) They were excellent! Definitely worth the money. We had it done twice and enjoyed every minute of it. We walked down to the Riu Mayan Riviera, which was a nice change. The staff was extremely friendly and always had a smile on their faces. I will definitely be back again for my own wedding next May. Don't mind the sand whales....the water is still gorgeous and they are preventing further erosion. WELL WORTH THE MONEY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It! Terrible Service!! :(”
Reviews.Author: ril_00
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a week trip there for our friend's wedding. Unfortunately, we were very dissatisfied with the Riu Palace. The A/C was down for more than half of the time we were there so the hotel was burning hot. The room service served all their food cold including nachos and their response was that's how nachos are supposed to be served--cold. Who's ever heard of that? Anyway, the power went out a few times which made me wonder how they kept the food they served fresh. And the list goes on and on. When we complained about the A/C, their response was "how do you think we feel?" It was just terrible, terrible service and never again will we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Hotel Assignment a Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: muleahcar
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our glorious 7 night stay from 5/31/08 to 6/7/08 at the Riu Palace Mexico. A few of our fellow TA's booked a fantastic deal through FunJet's Fun for Less 5 star program, which allows Funjet to pick the hotel for you a week before you depart. I had no problems with the booking process through Funjet or the included Lomas airport transfers. I did buy the cancellation insurance in case of a tropical storm (we were there at the start of hurricane season). I do have to say that when booking the Fun for Less package, make sure you are completely flexible in terms of where you stay, as if there is any reason you want to move, like if you have already stayed at a particular property or want to keep your large group together you may be out of luck. With that said, I would do this deal again for the right price! Overall: While Funjet categorizes this hotel as 5 stars, I wouldn't agree that the RPM is a 5 star property. It is a very solid 4 star property with stellar service, immaculate grounds and good food. I apologize that I'm repeating previous reviews, but I think it's helpful to read a complete opinion. The Room: In terms of design, I think the rooms are the biggest disappointment of the RPM, which is the main reason why I give it 4 stars instead of 5. They are dated, think decor of an older Courtyard Marriott. The bed is actually 2 full sized beds pushed together with one enormous headboard. The beds are even made separately. If you are a snuggler with your bedmate, this can be awkward as someone will be wedged in the crack. The beds themselves are very very hard with a plastic crinkle sound. I assume this is to protect the mattresses from humidity, but it was similar to the noise a pad cover you might give to your potty-training toddler makes. There is one very genius design in the rooms that I can't believe all hotels don't have - a double door design in the room, so there is the main door, then a hallway with the bathroom, then another door that leads to the bedroom. Not only does this help with hallway noise insulation, but in an unfamiliar bedroom suite it makes it a lot easier in the middle of the night to shut that door then turn on the bathroom light and not have to worry about bothering your partner. Also there is a "master" light switch, so when you come in and out you can turn the lights off and on with one switch, and you don't have to run to each of the lights. The much publicized minibar is a convenient way to get water and grab a cocktail while getting ready for dinner. It would be nice if they had some sort of mixers for the Tequila, Vodka and Rum (there's also Brandy). We made use of the room safe to keep our passports and money while we were in the resort, however, be warned that they are small so a 15" laptop won't fit in them. They are keyed, with a little lock that they give you at the front desk, along with your room key (another real key as opposed to key card). The bathrooms are unremarkable, but get the job done. I did like the water closet design, with a sliding door for the toilet and bidet. Make sure to ask for extra towels if you use more than one per person in 24 hours. They provide tiny bottles of lotion and the gel dispenser in the shower is a shampoo/body wash combo so bring your own if you're at all particular. There is a step down to a small living area with a mini couch, coffee table, dresser (where the breakfast room service door tags and hotel stationary are) and a tiny tiny TV with a good number of channels, both in Spanish and English. Our room and balcony overlooked the Riu next door but we didn't mind this as we spent so little time in the room. I heard it's more to upgrade to a room overlooking the interior courtyard, but if you go to sleep early I would avoid these as the nightly entertainment echoes down the center of the property. Our room was very very quiet, never did we get jarred from sleep with noisy people, I thank the hydrolic doors and double door arrangement. We did not experience any musty smells as previous reviewers did, but we were on the 2nd floor. All in all I think a minor room decorating redo would help this property immensely. Corridors and Overall Hotel Layout: I understand the Riu Palaces try to mimic a real palace with interior courtyards and rooms surrounding them, but this does not take advantage of the property's greatest asset - proximity to the sea! I think 4 rooms in the entire resort have an ocean view. The pathways are all tiled, so if it rains (it did a few days while we were there) they turn into a skating rink. Ladies if you wear heels to dinner make sure to grab your escort's arm! There are only 2 elevators at the property, so if you are at all physically challenged or just plain klutzy, try to get a room on the first floor as the stairs are tiled too! Restaurants, Bars and A la Carte Process: We didn't find the reservation process to be a big deal. Get down to the Mariachi bar (where the nighly entertainment is) by 8:30 and you'll get a number card (no waiting in line) and we never had a problem getting the restaurants we wanted.
