We did not have a chance to eat at the Steakhouse (El Patio by day) as there were wedding parties there the nights we tried to go. But La Bodega, the Brazilian, was the highlight of the a la cartes in our opinion. Try the chimichurri sauce with your meat, it's fantastic. Sir Edward, the Gourmet, was the biggest disapointment. Everything had some type of foam on it, but foam does not make a gourmet meal. The highlight there was the chocolate cake sundae. Miyagi, the Japanese, was ok. The sushi had the wrong rice and all the rolls oddly had (goat?) cheese in them. The tempura was good, as was the miso soup. The entrees were better than the sushi. Don Julian, the buffet was amazing (men - don't forget your pants!). There are theme nights, international, chinese, etc., but we always went for the Mexican food that they have every night (we're in Mexico, right?). The guacamole (both varieties) was incredible, as was the pico de gallo and red and green salsas. I thought the house wines were sufficient, but we are not too particular. Breakfast buffets were outstanding, with a full range of standard American breakfast items, made to order omelet bars, smoothie stations, mimosas and bloody marys, pastries, fresh fruit, cereal, anything you could want. We ate lunch mostly at El Patio, where we could go from the beach in our coverups and sandals (do remember your coverups and sandals as you will be turned away without them). The room service is dismal, don't bother as restaurant dining is almost always available from 7am to 10:30 pm. The lobby bar has sandwiches until 7am when they close for 3 hrs until 10am. The bar in the pool is small, so stake out your spot early if you want a seat in the water. Pool and Beach: The pool is the second biggest reason the RPM gets 4 stars. It is small with two separate sections. We spent most of our time on the beach - the grounds there are incredible. They have split many of the loungers in the area between the pool and the water's edge into twos. There are ten hammocks or so in this area, most big enough for 2. We spent most of our days there. The beach bar is small and lines do form. Once in awhile, attendants would make the rounds with drinks on trays. There is an annoying towel card system, where you only get 1 towel and if you lose your card or the towel it's $20 so keep tabs on them! I can't say I enjoyed the sand whales, but I am glad the beach has improved to a gradual slope into the water, unlike at the Riu or the Wyndham next door that is more sandy cliffs. The European women sunbathe topless, which certainly didn't bother us. The pool was more interesting at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, which we have guest access to, but we didn't bother staying there long as we preferred the sandy beach, which was much nicer at the RPM. Service: Outstanding and friendly! Learn some basic Spanish if you can (iTunes has great podcasts), it helps with some of the waitstaff. Plus you are in Mexico after all! They really appreciate the tips. Location: Across the street there are touristy shops and the property is less than a 5 minute drive ($5 USD cab ride) from Playa del Carmen. We did stay mostly on the property as everything was paid for. If you would like to change some USD to Pesos, there is an ATM across the street at Santander Bank. I use Bank of America, and I had no fee to use the ATM and a better exchange rate than exchange houses. Entertainment: Corny, but they put 100% into the shows. There is a nice outdoor seating area to enjoy music and drinks. Some of the bands were good, highlight being the mariachis. There is free wifi internet access in the lobby for those of those who want (or need) to be connected with your own notebooks, otherwise they have laptops to rent in the lobby by 15 min, hour, day, or 3 day increments. My Verizon cell worked at the property, at the obscene rate of $0.99/min. Luckily I knew this ahead of time, but beware if you want to chat or text. They will also need to activate international calling features so make sure to set this up in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: tony838
Reviews.Content: At the RPM service is the name of the game, best service I have ever had. Air conditioned lobby bar, great! As well as air conditioned buffet. Shade on beach as well as sun, and sunbeds are abundant. Maintenance & cleanliness can't be beat. All common restrooms spotless all the time. Mini bar in room with liquor, beer, soda, water. One important comment on the quality of guests; Booze is available everywhere and the waiter service to your chair or table is non-stop yet I did not see one sloppy drunk the whole week I was there. All liquor is top shelf and no drink is to fancy especially in the lobby bar. Our room was kept spotless, and the air conditioning kicked. All the food in the ala cartes or buffets were as good as you could ask for. In summary the RPM is a shining star and if you go there is much to appreciate.

Reviews.Title: “Just Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: shethinks
Reviews.Content: Impossible to be disappointed. I've been to Riu Palace Mexico last April and to be honest, I can't understand the ratings given by some people: either I am a very easy person to please or others are impossibly pleased, no matter where they stay. I've stayed at other Rius and the Palace makes all the difference: -enormous rooms - iron and ironing board - daily stocked mini bar - impeccable cleaning We had a junior suite on the 2nd floor facing the entire garden and lakes. Large balcony, great views. The hotel is amazingly decorated and the restaurants are absolutely great. Lots of variety and ABUNDANCE is the key word here. Everyone is very friendly and they make sure that nothing misses on your vacation, either it is food, drinks, amusement. The beach is what you see. The "whales " are there, but there is still A BEACH and a great one. (see pictures) We walked to both ends of it, and to the right, Iberostar's beach was absolutely terrible and to the left, to Viva Wyndham, there was a beach but a terrible sewage smell. I also visited all other Riu's and none seemed better than this one. Classy but relaxed. If you like walking or jogging, there is a big "avenue" leading to a Plaza where you can go to, outside the hotel. Felt perfectly safe and the walking was quite good to digest all those wonderful meals. Objective facts about the hotel Rooms: - all junior suites, 2 gigantic beds pushed together, big balcony, mini-bar, big bathroom, Tv, iron and ironing board inside the closet. Restaurants: - Don julian (fuffet) - Rodizio (brazilian) - Italian restaurant - Gourmet restaurant (fantastic, yummy) Thematic dinners: Asian, Mexican (everyday), International, Seafood Bars: - one by the reception, one near Don JUlian, one by the pool and one at the beach (opened from 10 amto 17pm) Pools: - 2 pools plus a children's pool and a jacuzzi one on the right side of the hotel. Available: - yellow towels that you have to pick up in the morning;books if you forgot to take some with you. Animation team: - they are non stop and very nice (and funny). If I return to Mexico (not right away because I'll be leaving to Jamaica in a month and a half) I will certainly chose Riu Palace Mexico again, no doubt whatsoever. Any questions, I'm glad to answer them.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: jtie55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Riu Palace Mexico May 24-29th and had a wonderful time. We have traveled to all inclusives in St. Lucia, Jamaica, and Dominican Republic. This resort probably ties for our favorite. I'd say the service was by far the best we have ever had. Check in was quick and easy. No issues with the room at all. The beds in our room had matress pads on them so we did not find them uncomfortable. That musty smell people complain about is the smell of the Carribean. Every place we've ever stayed at in the Carribean had a musty smell. Doesn't bother us since we just crank up the A/C which seems to do the trick. Maid service was outstanding. We always had plenty of fresh towels and linens. We really spent most of our time at the beach and a little time each day at the pool. Plenty of loungers anytime of the day whether beach or pool! We have had issues at other resorts where people reserved loungers before 7am. We really didn't see any of that here so it was a relief! The location of this hotel was really great. We walked to Playa Del Carmen about everyday. It was about a 25 minute leisurely walk. We ended up taking cabs back at $5 per ride. Not bad at all. One evening we took the ferry from Playa to Cozumel. After several drinks in Cozumel we got seasick on the ferry back to Playa. LOL. In all fairness the water was very choppy and weren't the only people getting seasick. Food was okay. We felt the buffet was like a good college cafeteria. Plenty of options for sure. Only ate at one specialty resturant which was the Brazilian place. It was okay. We weren't able to get down early enough in the morning to reserve the other specialty places. We ended up eating dinner in Playa Del Carmen and Cozumel a couple nights just to do something different. I will say that everywhere we ate we had amazing service which really goes a long way. Drinks and service were great at all of the bars. We especially liked the bar in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to the Riu Palace Mexico May 2008”
Reviews.Author: ksinkc
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at the Riu Palace Mexico at Playa Del Carmen in May 2008. This was our 4th trip to this hotel and the first time since the hurricane of a couple of years ago. As usual, we had a great time and really enjoyed our stay. The staff was great, the food was excellent and the hotel and grounds were in wonderful shape. The beach had definitely seen some changes from the last time we were there. There have been some very large black sandbags placed along the waters edge to help prevent further beach erosion. There were plenty of lounge chairs available along the beach in the sun and also back in the palm trees where it is better shaded. The beach sand was fine & the swimming in the ocean was fine. The only problem was the sandbags placed along the shoreline. If a pristine shoreline is of extreme importance to you I would say you might want to think hard about this hotel but any of the hotels along this stretch will have the same problem as the Riu Palace Mexico with the exception of maybe the Gala (Sandos Playacar) which is the last hotel in the line going south. I don't know anything about their hotel but their beach looked to be in great shape. The Riu Palace Mexico hotel did however have the best beach of any of the other waterfront Riu hotels in this area-The Riu Palace Riviera Maya, Riu Yucatan or the Riu Playacar. We ate at one of the specialty restaurants almost every night during our stay and the food and dining experience was always excellent. I can't say enough about the staff as they were always there for you when needed. Of all the times we have stayed at this hotel, I believe the grounds and landscaping was as nice as I have ever seen. We loved the bands and dancing that they provided almost every evening before and after dinner. We would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a nice quiet vacation that is reasonably priced and a great value. I agree with some of the other reviewers on this website that you should take any negative reviews with a grain of salt as we have always found this hotel to be everything we expected and more. I will try to upload a couple of pictures of the beach if I can.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: DebbieOwingsMillMD
Reviews.Content: The Rui Mexicao was an upscaled very elegant hotel. We had a wonderful time. Six apple rating is accurate for this hotel. I am going to be as honest as I can in my description. Food: Very good. They have to also include food that Europeans enjoy too so you see a lot of sliced meats and some odd food that we aren't used to. They had pretty much something for everyone. The only negative was the getting the reservations to the speciality restaurants. They gave out numbers starting at 8 am and started the process of booking times at 8:30 every morning . It wasn't a problem for us because we were up early, but could be a problem for those who like to sleep late. If you missed out on the restaurants the buffet was extremely good. A nice lady working the omlette station even went out of her way to go and get spinach for my omlette which I thought was great service. So much food you will not go hungry. Men do have to wear long pants for dinner, even in the buffet. Speciality restaurants good, we enjoyed all four of them. Hotel and Grounds: Beautiful. The hotel was extremely clean and lovely. You always seen people cleaning and working on the upkeep. Very upscaled and classy. Room: Wonderful. Large room with a self serving bar in the closet with a fridge in a closet. The best thing was the air pressure gauge on all the doors. It kept the doors from slamming when the guest came in late or up early. This was a real plus in my book after staying at other hotels and being awakening all hours of the night. The only negative was there were a few days when the staff were talking louder in the halls early in the monring. The room cleaning staff were great. Pool: Fair. Very relaxing and I enjoyed it, but I liked the pool at the Rui Palace Playa much more. I didn't like the design, it broke up into two sections. A plus was that they had plenty of staff waiting on you around the pool. Lots of chairs and shade. Another negative thing was they didn't have any activites around the pool except volleyball. Other hotels I stayed made being at the pool so much fun. At the Rui Mexico it was just relaxing. Beach: Good. Plenty of chairs and you could always find a chair in the shade or sun whichever you preferred. All the hotels in Playa Del Carmen have these larged sand filled bags in the water that takes away from some of the beauty. I'm guessing that after the last hurricane they had to protect the beach. Shows: This is the only reason that I did not give this hotel the top rating of excellent. I have stayed at several hotels in Playa Del Carmen and Cancun so I had something to compare it to. I was not impressed with the shows, they were disappointing to me. I only enjoyed one show "Michael Jackson" which was very entertaining and I would recommend not to miss it. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for 20s or 30s if they are out for a good time. It is really laid back and relaxing--not too much action for people who want to party. But if you was to relax in paradise this is the place for you. We enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “It started out rough but got better!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSheryl
Reviews.Content: For those of you going to the Riu in Playa Del Carmen, be sure that you know exactly which one you're going to.....we ended up at the Riu Palace instead of the Riu Palace Mexico (which wasn't clear on the confirmation page that we printed out). When the staff figured out that we were at the wrong one, there was no offer to take us to the correct location (about 1/4 mile down the road) - instead they offered to get us a cab. A little annoying considering that this must happen quite frequently. Once we got to the right spot, the check in went well. But when we got to the room, we were overcome by the smell of mildew.....we went back to the front desk and asked for a different room. They gave us the keys to a different room but when we checked that out it also smelled. They then offered to have an aromatist (I didn't know there was such a thing) come to our room to fix the smell.....awhile later, a cleaning woman came and sprayed air freshener of some sort in the room. It masked the smell for awhile but the mildew smell was pretty bad. We complained again and a couple of hours later we were given a different room. We could tell that it had recently been "aromatized" but it was better than the original room we were given. So, we decided to switch rooms and see how the smell went......it was much better but still smelled like mildew. We got used it to and decided to stick out the 3 days that we were there in that room. Once we got past the smell and the very uncomfortable beds (which by the way are two double beds pushed together), the rest of the trip was actually great. We were very happy with the service and the food was very good! The beach is incredible with lots of chairs - we never had a problem getting one (even in the shade - which is needed - it gets very hot). We would recommend that you head into Playa del Carmen for the shopping (late afternoon is best because it's shady and cooler)....it's very quaint and there are good watering holes along the shopping street to stop for a beer or a snack. So, all in all we had a good trip......but definitely would recommend to the Riu that they update their rooms and do something about the smell!

Reviews.Title: “Third Trip to the Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: krijowri
Reviews.Content: This was my third trip to the Riu Palace Mexico. I and everyone I went with absolutely loved the resort and Playa del Carmen, as usual. No complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: ChristySullivan
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing honeymoon location! The whole resort was absolutely beautiful, the food was amazing and the service was perfect. There isn't anything negative that I could say about my stay here. FIVE STARS! I stayed from May 19th 2008 until May 26th 2008. We did not want to leave. The people who might have something negative to say about this place are probably the kind of people who just look for something negative to say about anything.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: PlanoTripper
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Riu Palace Mexico, after an enjoyable stay. From checkin to checkout, every staff member was very pleasant. The grounds are spectacular and the lobby has a certain charm. The rooms, as others have mentioned, are a bit dated in décor but very spacious and clean. Yes, it is certainly hot and humid on the Yucatan peninsula, but I'm not sure what others expected. The food was adequate, though hardly spectacular. Indeed, the steakhouse was worse than the buffet. The only exceptional dining experience was Sir Edward. Pool could have used a bit more maintenance - surface residue always visible and the floor and swim-up stools were disturbingly slippery (all presumably from sunscreen, etc), so a good scrub wouldn't go amiss. The beach area was very spacious with plenty of chairs. Service was extremely attentive. Drinks were a bit watered down, most evident when a martini was ordered. All in all, a good time with only minor reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: phree82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful! All of the staff are very attentive and hard working. They were extremely friendly and defintely made you feel welcome. The food is delicious! The only thing I thought was a little lacking was the entertainment and nightlife at the resort, but I guess it is geared to an older crowd because that is what a large portion of the guest population appeared to be. I have stayed at a RIU in Jamaica and this one blew it away. I would definitely recommend it if you are looking for a wonderful relaxing getaway. By the way, I am an American, so I guess you can't really stereotype an entire population of people.

Reviews.Title: “Total Luxury... AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: itsjojo
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived back from Rui Palace and have had the holiday of my life! Please ignore the American reviews, they just love to complain... The same goes to the American guests, even the locals don't like them! If anything they put a dampner on my holiday as they just love to moan and bitch at the amazingly helpful and pleasant staff who will do anything for you. Lighten up folks! On arrival to the hotel you are greeted with the most beautiful grand lobby complete with the biggest chandalier I have seen. The staff are so friendly and give you complementary drinks while they check you in. Then your bags are delivered to your room... and the rooms are great! Not the brightest rooms but everything you could want...2 double beds pushed together, a mini bar and optics which is restocked daily and a great bathroom with shower and bath. The room is tidied a couple of times a day and the even come in to check your air con and close your curtains. They even sorted out my makeup and would hang up my clothes for me! I put a few things in my safety box but I felt that I could leave anything out and it would be safe... and it was! The food is fantastic with so many restaurants to choose from. Most days I just went to the buffet as I could get more than I could ask for there. They even get 2 ice sculptures in there every dinner time and thats just the general eaterie. Again, staff are always smiling and would bend over backwards for you! Other restaurants are brilliant and the steak house does great burgers and hotdogs at lunch of you don't want to venture too far from the beach or pool. The lobby bar is open 24hrs a day and is very comfortable with a pianist playing most nights. Look out for Tom Cruise as he makes great cocktails. The forcourt has great entertainment every night, you will love the mexican and mayan nights! The staff are amazing to watch running around with full trays of drinks and never spilling a drop. They always know where you are sitting even though the tables have no numbers and you get a variety of waiters serving you. The maitre's are fantastic and always look immaculate in their tuxedo's. Raul will make you a very special cocktail if you ask nicely, he's an amazing guy who is full of brilliant tips. The pool and beach are stunning with regular drinks brought to you while you sunbathe and they even warn you if you look like you are burning. The pool with the swim up bars has great activities daily and the staff are fantastic. During the day you will find Raul at the swim up bar and Fernando all day there. Great guys who make your stay top notch! The pool is clean and has more than enough loungers to go around. There are even a couple of guys who come around with various animals and will take pics of you with them. The beach is amazing with loads of activities such as jet ski's and paragliding. This is an amazing holiday and is excellent value for money. Can't fault it so GO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jill0489
Reviews.Content: As a single woman in her 40s, who travels all the time. I would not recommend this resort to any age. The rooms smell of mold and never seems to dry. The beds? Sleep on the floor you will get better rest. I highly enjoyed waking up to being bitten many places on my body by what Im not sure. But I will say it itched and the welts were enjoyable too. Oh did I say I traveled alone. So singles lock everything up because their in your room way to many times in the day. Put your do not disturb sign out at all times when you are not in your room. Also put your safety lock on because one time I had my sign out and I was in the room and they still tried to get in. Food poor. All around! A least I did not gain any weight. Thats the best review I can give this place. Pool not so clean. Drinks poor. If you drink bottled water well you have to chase the staff down to get it. For the price Ive stayed much better places for less. This was not my first stay at RIU Resorts. Just this resort to me should only get 3 stars. Never Again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: eakNYC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back yesterday, May 18th, from five days at Riu Palace Mexico. We booked the 6 Apple Square Deat about one month ago. It was very nice: good service, nice rooms, pretty grounds, lovely beach (despite "sand whales"). We arrived with the intention of requesting and, if necessary, paying for an upgraded room. This resort has no ocean view rooms, however, and our reception agent really discouraged us from paying more for a courtyard (view of beautiful fountains) room over a garden (view of the next resort). We hemmed and hawed and he eventually gave us a courtyard room, which actually faced the pool and was as close to the beach as you could get, for no additional cost. We were very pleased with the location of our room. The beds were very hard as other reviewers have mentioned, but not worth fussing about. The room was spotless and a small leak from the a/c unit was fixed immediately. Housekeeping also responded immediately to our request for more towels. The food was very good in the buffet restaurant. Having been to "a la carte" restaurants at other AI's we opted to fore go the experience this time around. One nice touch was that regardless of the cuisine of the day, they always offered several delicious, authentic Mexican dishes, as well. One negative was the quality of the drinks. It was virtually impossible to get a proper cocktail. Even when you ordered liquor straight up, it didn't seem quite right. Wine and beer with meals were fine, and this certainly wouldn't cause me NOT to recommend the place, however if you're a connoisseur, this shortcoming might matter to you. Overall, we had a great time. The beach was really lovely and the numerous palm trees provided adequate shade throughout the day. One point about the beach however: so many people smoke there that rather than sea air wafting about, much of the time it just smelled like cigarettes. If you're sensitive to this, plan to isolate yourselves, which is entirely possible on the spacious beach area. I'm not sure I detected significant difference between this "6 Apple" resort and the "5 Apple" Iberostar we stayed at last fall. But overall, we had a lovely vacation. One last note: the "sand whales" are fine . They're no hindrance to beach enjoyment, in fact they're fun to climb on and sit and enjoy the slashing waves

Reviews.Title: “The Riu Palace Mexico was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: PipeyMorden
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 2 weeks at the Riu Palace Mexico. Our holiday didn't get off to a good start with a 2 hr delay at Gatwick due to ' a delay in preparing the paperwork resulting from the merger of TUI and First Choice'. However checking in at the Hotel was smooth and our luggage appeared in our room within 5 minutes. Due to the delay we were tired and didn't fancy changing for dinner, so we called room service. Within 15 mins 2 nice rounds of sandwiches and nachos arrived. The room was comfortable and spacious, with a small balcony. The view wasn't great-just the side of the next hotel. However, it was nioce to sit there with a drink from the well stocked fridge or mini-bar. The only criticsm of the room was the bath, if you are disabled you might find it difficult to get in or out of the bath/shower. We didn't use the speciality restaurants because my partner did'nt fancy the vegetarian options, but Don Julians more than made up for this with its varied menu, and the fantastic ice scupltures at dinner. We spoke to the Head Chef on our last night and he told us they have 87 chefs! The resturant staff were very good, a drink was usually on your table within 3 minutes of sitting down. Again the choice of drinks was good (beer, wine oe soft drinks) We tended to stay by the pool, largely because the beach area had little shade, which always had sun loungers available. Within 5 minutes of laying down a waiter would be around asking if you wanted a drink. Experienced swimmers might find the pool a little small. We didn't join in the day time activities, although they seemed well attended. In the evening we would have a drink outside and watch the entertainment for an hour. It was OK, but we always ended up in the PIano Bar which was quieter. Must mention the Reception Staff, there was always 2 or 3 staff on reception which meant little delay if you had a query. On arrival we didn't have any cold water, Katy (an English girl) on reception took our problem and had it dealt with immediately. She rang the next day to see if everything was OK-nice touch. If you are considering a trip to Chichen Itza be warned it's a 3hr drive and you arrive around mid-day. The site is well worth seeing, but there is little shade for the hottest part of the day. We had a great holiday at the Riu Palace Mexico and would highly recommend it. Probably wouldn't go back to Mexico having been to Vallarta last year. But will certainly be looking for a holiday elsewhere at a Riu

Reviews.Title: “Loved the RIU Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: earthangeluk
Reviews.Content: This is the RIU resort to stay at if you are coming to Playa del Carmen. Gorgeous, immaculate resort grounds, friendly helpful staff, nice cosy beach areas, and the restaurants were really above average for an all-inclusive resort. The resort is located inside an upscale gated community with golf course, resorts and condos. "Downtown" Playa del Carmen is just a short walk or 5 minute taxi away and there is just so much to see and do in the area! I highly recommend going over to XCaret park as well. Great watersports, snorkeling and diving too. Overall, RIU Palace Mexico (and the Riviera Maya) exceeded our expectations. My fiance and I are avid travelers and I believe we have high standards for resorts. I would give this resort 4.5 Stars only because the rooms and decor could be improved a bit. Although the rooms are clean and pleasant (with a very nice liquor bar included!), the beds and linens are a bit hard and uncomfortable. That being said however, I would still definitely recommend RIU Palace Mexico. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Service - a winning combination!”
Reviews.Author: stripey2000
Reviews.Content: Hola everyone! My wife and I have just returned from a 7 night stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. Just to give this review some context, we are from England and would call ourselves seasoned travellers - both in our mid 30’s, we have travelled extensively as a couple all over the world. First impressions as we pulled up outside the hotel were excellent. As you walk through the automatic doors and enter the grand palatial air-conditioned reception/lobby, we were blown away. You could almost see your face in the highly polished floor! Sure we’d seen photos on here but the place in real life was just spectacular. With chandeliers a plenty it certainly felt very regal, elegant and grand, just as we’d hoped! The front desk reception staff were very welcoming, helpful and always happy and cheerful. Check in was easy, professional and quick. Our luggage was delivered to our second floor room within 5 minutes. The room was outstanding. Very large and cleaned to a very high standard - those Mexican cleaners sure know how to clean well! I was chuffed to bits at the size of the room, just so much space. It was split level with a lower seating area towards the end where the balcony doors were. The balcony looked out over the beautifully landscaped courtyard, fountains and gardens which run through the centre of the grounds. There was so much storage space too, drawers and cupboards all over, much more than anyone could possibly use. The fitted wardrobe was large and contained an iron and ironing board and a free to use safe. We were welcomed by a fruit platter and a bottle of tequila in the room which was a nice touch. The refrigerator was full with bottles of Corona, carbonated soft drinks, and mineral water. The in room optics contained a good selection of premium branded tequila, brandy, vodka, and white rum. Very handy for a drink on the balcony before going out for the evening! The bathroom is the first door to your right (or left depending on layout) as you enter the room. It comprised of one sink (with giant mirror), slightly sunken bath with shower, and a toilet area which had a sliding door for privacy. No issues with the bathroom, it was absolutely fine and all functioned perfectly. The beds were very large and extremely comfortable with firm mattresses. Personally I much prefer a firm mattress – I find it much more comfortable and a lot better for your back. Surely nobody wants a “back problem creating” soft mattress with a big dip in the middle? As previous reports on here suggest, it was actually two double beds pushed together to form one monster size bed, but that was absolutely fine. I really can’t understand these people who moan about the beds – just unbelievable. We had no problems with the room service menu – it featured around 10 food/snack items and unlimited drinks of any kind available 24hrs. You can also order ice for your ice bucket via this route. Ok, the room service food choice wasn’t massive but there was other food readily available throughout the hotel from 7am till 1am anyway. The speciality restaurant dinner reservation system was very easy – just a quick and simple visit to the theatre area between 8.30am and 10.30am where one of the guest services staff were taking bookings for that evening. Check of the menu, pick a restaurant, and book a table sitting - Easy, no trouble at all. We booked 2 restaurants on separate occasions and the reservation took no longer than a few minutes. The food overall was superb. Normally I’m quite fussy with food but I ate like a king for the week. I ate much more than I normally would and tried so many new things. The buffet (Don Julian) was really good – I mean tens of real tasty and well prepared dishes, with all the attention to detail in presentation and layout that you would expect from a hotel of this standard. Each night there was a theme at the buffet, but always had the Mexican selection area open in addition to the theme (Oriental night was our favourite). The speciality restaurants were just ok, but too much seafood on the set menus for our liking. Much preferred the buffet. Drinks at the bars were plentiful and I was overjoyed to see that all premium branded liquor/spirits were included and available. Some brands were not on display at the bars (one or two were kept hidden in a cupboard) but were printed on the drinks menus and were readily available should you ask for one. The ice in all drinks is purified water and none of the drinks that I had seemed watered down at all. I tried several of the liquors/spirits in shooter style just to be sure and each tasted every bit as strong as back home. Have I mentioned the service yet? Wow, the service was something else. Excellent in every way – from the bar staff at the bars to the waiters in the restaurants. Your drink was always being topped up and they just couldn’t do enough for you – always with a smile too! Just brilliant! The beach was beautiful, with plenty of room. I was glad to see that after the storms wrecked it some time ago, a lot of the beach has now returned and is deep enough to provide room for at least 3 rows of loungers in the sunshine and then several back in the shade under the palms. We never had a problem getting one at any time of the day. White powder soft sand is in abundance and the sea is a beautiful turquoise colour – it was like getting into a warm bath. There were no rocks or anything sharp on the ocean floor close to the beach, just soft sand underfoot in the sea. On 2 days out of 7 there were a couple of choppy sea days that were great fun. Bobbing in the waves and swimming with the larger ones as they crashed towards the beach was terrific! The large black sand whales installed to help restore the beach right along the coastline in both directions are very obvious, but to be honest after a few days you really get used to them. They just look like rocks! Thankfully they were installed with beach users in mind - there are large gaps periodically so that you can enter and exit the sea directly from the beach without having to climb over them. The pool was ok, a little small for the size of the place I thought but then I’m a pool person and I like big Caribbean style lagoon pools! It was an odd shape, like a large star split into two divided by the pool bar/terrace bar, toilets, and towel exchange. One side seemed to be the quiet relaxing part, while the other side was where the swim up bar was located and where the daily pool activities took place. There were plenty of sun loungers available all day long on both sides - I don’t remember seeing one time when all loungers were occupied. As you are able to use the Facilities at all the other Riu hotels in the area, we visisted each hotel on a different day and night to check out the vibe and see if they would be worth staying at in the future. I can safely say that we thought we were staying at the best one overall (although the pool at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya was better than ours!) The Riu Tequila opposite was good fun however the service and abundance of drinks were somewhat limited. It had a nice square shaped outside terrace bar, and a disco (La Pinata) which was open from 11pm till 2am. This was quite small (could only have about 60 people in it at any one time) but the music was pretty good and good for a change of scenery. The pool at the Riu Playacar next door was worth a dip too, a bit more Caribbean like than the other hotels pools. We also had a good night out in Playa Del Carmen. We took a taxi there and back to avoid the approx 2 mile walk (wife couldn’t manage the trek in “strappy sandals” as she put it!). Some of the eating places in town looked lovely and it’s a shame we didn’t eat out. Will do next time though at least once. Anyway, we had a good night, enjoyed several beers at the local watering holes and ended our session at The Tequila Barrel – a good party bar! Overall, we had a terrific stay at the Riu Palace Mexico and would return in a heartbeat. We would recommend it to anybody looking for a bit of class, some good fun and spectacular service in all areas. Hasta luego!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday - The Clarks - London”
Reviews.Author: bernadette11
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico and had an Excellent time. We cannot believe all the negative statements that have been written about this hotel. We stayed for 14 nights and arrived home on the 5th May. Below you will find our experience. Hotel - Fantastic, clean, light, plenty of room. Staff - More than helpful, happy and wanting to do anything they can for you.This includes all the staff, ie, reception,Bar staff, restaurant staff, entertainment team, pool and beach staff, doorman, the list goes on. Tip them if you can, they work so hard. Entertainment - Mexican shows, and more, Brilliant Food - Out of this world, Excellent, so much choice,ie, lobster, crab, prawns, mussells, pork, chicken, turkey, beef, special evenings, the list goes on. We had all this in the buffet and did not bother going elsewhere. Breakfast and dinner Fantastic! Lunch we ate at the beach restaurants which had a good selection of food. Maids - Kept our room lovely and left us fresh flowers and towel arts throughtout our stay. Beach - Lovely, sea warm, lots of sunbeds, cocktails were brought around by the waiters. Out and about - We got a cab from the hotel which took us to 5th Avenue. This costs $5 each way. Here you will find lots of shops, bars, places to eat and a beach. Try Senor Frogs, it is a really funning place to have a drink and they have swings at the bar. It is on the beach and is a really nutty, place. Anybody that is going to this hotel shortly, dont worry about a thing, just go and ENJOY !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lovin50
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends spent 6 nights at the Riu Palace. Overall, we had a wonderful time. We thought the hotel was beautiful and the rooms were very comfortable and clean. We requested a roll-away and an extra chair for our patio and they arrived very promptly. Even with the roll-away, we did not feel cramped in the room at all.The double beds were firm, but comfortable and my friend who slept on the roll-away had no complaints either. The grounds are very well maintained and gorgeous. The beach is the best of the neighboring hotels and yes, there are sand whales, but they are only there as a result of an act of mother nature. The hotel is trying to preserve the beach from any more damage, can you blame them for that?. The blue water is awesome! The food was great. We did make a reservation for the steak house and had a real nice evening! The buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner never got old. We ate lunch a couple of times at Riu Tequila and and it was also very good (although very similar to the fare at the Palace). The drinks were plentiful and the service was superb at whatever bar you were drinking at. In the courtyard, Pedro and Armondo took very good good care of us- our glasses wrer NEVER empty! We did use room service one evening (just too tired to eat at a restaurant). The menu is very limited. The food arrived fairly quickly, but it was just so-so. The ONLY complaint that I have, is that the pool at the Palace does not have entry/exit steps. It posed a problem for me, as I have arthritic knees. (I witnessed older folks also having a challenging time exiting the water). The only exit available is a ladder, I spent most of my pool time across the street at Riu Tequila. The pool there, had an entrance ramp as well as entry stairs. I would have been very disappointed with the pool situation, but the exchange privileges allowed for an enjoyable pool experience at Tequila.(The pool bar there was also very nice). I also noticed that there were only 2 elevators- both located at the same end of the property. If you get an upper level room, be prepared to do stairs. If you have any disability, make sure you request a ground floor room! Overall, the Riu Palace was a great place to spend a week and well worth the money. I would definately try another Riu property in the future and would recommend the Palace to anyone considering booking there.

Reviews.Title: “Go elsewhere for the MONEY”
Reviews.Author: traveler200837
Reviews.Content: I have just arrived form Riu Palace Mexico, and I can wait to share my experience with others. I would like to begin by telling you about their horrible service. On the night of our arrival, our sheets were not changed form the previous occupants of our room. The next day, I called to complaint about spoiled sheets. On our third night, the linens were once again absolutely filthy. I called the front desk, and their response was that housekeeping was gone for the day. I asked for at least different sheets, and the ones that they brought to our room were once again dirty and damped. So note to self, in future bring you own linens if you are planning to stay in Riu. The food was not good. DO NOT MAKE RESERVATIONS IN ANY OFF THEIR RESTURANTS, BECASE THEY ARE HORRIBLE!! Go to the buffet ONLY. Upon arrival, I was told that there is food on the property 24/7. Well one night, 25 of us skipped our dinner hoping that we will be able to have a snack at the bar. At 1 o'clock in the morning we came up to the front desk to find out where can we get something to eat, and to our surprise we were told that there is no food left on the property of our hotel. We were actually told to go to a neighboring hotel, which also had no food left. The beach is also, so-so. There are no umbrellas or any type of shade at the beach. The only shade that you could get was from the palm trees. And believe me then I say, you can get really burned. There are huge black barriers, preventing sand from washing away from the shore. So imagine, looking at the sea and seeing whale like structures everywhere. So in the conclusion, if you do go be prepared for horrible service, awful food, and shade-less beach. Go at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise Ship Hotel X 2”
Reviews.Author: worldventures
Reviews.Content: This was a very beautiful huge hotel with several restaurants to choose from (if you get up early enough to get in line for a reservation). A good way to describe this hotel is it's like having 2 cruise ships parked on the beach side by side. There were so many people! If you enjoy European people, Speedos and topless older women then this is the place for you! Our favorite restaurant was the Japanese (the sushi was good) we also enjoyed Sir Edwards. The morning buffet was not much to get excited about. The beach is blocked with HUGE, BLACK sand bags that resemble beached whales, which took away from the beautiful ocean view. The shopping town of Playa Del Carmen was like a circus with all the vendors yelling somewhat rude remarks to tourists that did not come into their shops. That is not what Mexico is like. We have been many, many times to Mexico and never seen anything like it. The tourists can keep it. We left 5 days early, rented a car and headed south on our own adventure-with no reservations! We stayed at several different places and found the farther south we went the shopping, food and prices were much more reasonable. We have nothing bad to say about the hotel or services (the staff was very pleasant and everyone treated us with first class service). We just had no idea how crowded it would be! We were looking for a romantic getaway. It reminded us of being on a cruise. It was all worthwhile because we made great friends that we wouldn't have met otherwise!

Reviews.Title: “The best week, wedding, honeymoon (weddingmoon) anybody could expect”
Reviews.Author: TurkeylLover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from a magical week at Riu Palace Mexico. We had our wedding there and 40 of our family/friends attended. The communication with the wedding coordinators' manager was very difficult prior to getting there and I was getting really nervous. My most ordinary requests, despite the fact that I was willing to pay for it to some extent, were being refused. For example, I wanted to have sound system for the wedding reception and dancing. They first said that I couldn't, that I had to bring my own speakers! and finally when they said that they'd provide me with speakers, I was supposed to wrap everything up and send everybody home by 10 PM!! Having said this, once we got there, they were more than accommodating and they provided us with a better wedding than we could have imagined. They also let us have the speakers till 11:30 which was adequate. We ended up getting a private dinner. We had the wedding at the Gazebo. The beach is very crowded with tourists and they haven't partitioned any portions of it for the wedding party. The Gazebo was fantastic though. Everybody had so much fun at our wedding, including my husband, myself and our families. If I had to do it all over again, I wouldn't wish for anything different. The Hotel is gorgeous. The beach is fantastic. The rooms are comfortable and despite what everybody says, both my husband and I found the beds very comfortable. The food is extra-ordinary and the hotel is very well-situated well within walking distance or a cheap cab ride to Playa del Carmen. The service is fantastic, and it's too bad that tipping is not mandatory, like it is on cruise ships. The staff always goes out of its way to please you; they are grateful if your tip them but they are still as courteous and polite if you don't. In summary, I cannot recommend this resort highly enough. Everybody in our group, old, young, with or without children, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “There are much better choices for Hotels in Playa”
Reviews.Author: sherriAllen_TX
Reviews.Content: This was our 3 trip to Playa in the last year. Our other 2 experiences at another hotel chain were absolutely perfect. We found the Riu to be a total disappointment. Other than the restaurant staff, we found the whole experience anything but a pleasure: very unhelpful front desk, watered down drinks, over an hour wait for dinner reservations, hard beds, no beach, no in-room coffee service, limited room service and on & on. The restaurants they discribe in their marketing is very misleading. The reason they do not make advance reservations is they are trying to make it as difficult as possible to eat anywhere other than their buffet. The restaurants are all very small and not even worth the effort. Be warned! I would never recommend the Riu Palace. There are other hotels that are actually customer service oriented and are trying to win your loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our trip”
Reviews.Author: jmp12562
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to the Riu Palace for the first time and we loved it! We loved the service, food, rooms, the pool, and the beach. I agree with the lack of nightlife. I would recommend more entertainment so we would not have to go to the other hotel for dancing. Other than that, I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu...!”
Reviews.Author: westcottevans
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at the Riu. I was a little dubious not having been to an all inclusive resort before but repetitive this is not. 8 out of the 10 nights that we were there we booked into the a la carte restaurants with absolutely no problems and they were all fantastic. The food in the buffet is pretty much the same every day but there is so much choice you could never get bored. The service is fantastic and the presentation of the food is superb. Every effort really has been made to cater for all possible tastes. Everday for breakfast after visiting the gym (get there early as the equipment is in high demand) we had freshly made juices where you can choose exactly what you want in it, fruit of your choice freshly prepared , omlettes made to order etc etc everything you could possibly want to eat just never enough room for it all. In the evening, sitting around the court yard, the service is exemplary, all staff are so friendly and helpful. It is a very relaxed hotel which is exactly what we were looking for however other guests recommended the Riu Tequila for more lively evenings which is just across the road. We just enjoyed getting quitely inebriated on cocktails whilst enjoying the live music from the bandstand. One night we stayed to watch the show and it was brilliant, they did a mix of shows from Chicago to Grease and it really was so funny and a joy to watch. My partner joined in playing all the activities on offer from Beach Volleyball to shooting and bowls and I enjoyed the Spanish classes on offer. There really is something for everyone. Alternatively you can relax in your hammock under the coconut trees and do nothing at all!!! There is also free use of Kayaks, Pedalos, boats etc etc. The beach does have enormous sandbags but once you get in the sea it is like a bath and so these really don't matter that much plus several people seemed to be really enjoying surfing along them and crashing into the water with shrieks of laughter...! We didn't struggle to find loungers on the beach or by the pool but it was relatively quiet when we were there, however I don't know if this does become a problem in peak season. The only thing I would mention which has nothing to do with the hotel is the taxes at the airport on the return flight. We had to pay $100 in tax and then a further $150 for excess baggage (which was exaclty the same weight as we entered the country with) which really annoyed us and put a dampner on the end of the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Riu”
Reviews.Author: lns56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 6 days at the Riu with 2 other couples. Overall, we had a great time but I agree with some of the negative comments posted, especially regarding restaurant reservations. I don't understand why you have to stand in line for 1/2 an hour to make a dinner reservation. We only did that one night because our experience in the Bodega restaurant wan't good--I definitely DO NOT recommend it. The buffet food certainly isn't gourmet fare but it would be pretty difficult to go hungry; there are tons of choices with a different theme every night (Italian, Mediterranean, etc.) There was chicken, fish and beef every night with a nice salad bar and several veggies/side dishes to choose from. The breakfast and lunch buffets were really good, although all 6 of us thought it was odd that so much of the fruit (cantaloupe, watermelon, honeydew) was tasteless. We were also disappointed in the beach as our travel agent hadn't warned us about the beach erosion and sand whales. We actually spend more time at the pool then the beach because the beach just wasn't appealing. We didn't have any trouble getting chairs at either the beach or the pool though we had to do a little rearranging to get 6 chairs together. The hotel itself was beautiful, clean and nicely landscaped; the courtyard is gorgeous. It was much quieter than we expected though. There's not much going on at night ( the bars close at midnight) and even during the day, it's pretty subdued. There was live dinner music every night near the buffet--mostly covers of older American musicians like Elvis Presley, the Beatles,etc. We would have preferred more native music-we didn't go to Mexico to listen to Elvis! There was a show most nights-they were just OK-nothing to get too excited about. Our last day we walked over to the Riu Tequila pool area which is adjacent to Riu Palace Mexico. It's a much more casual, fun place. That pool is great--you can sit around the pool and look out at the beautiful turquoise ocean. There was more activity there. We had checked out the disco in the Riu Tequila one night earlier in the week but it was empty and there was a very strong, disgusting smell that some other reviews had mentioned, so we left after a very few minutes. The fridge in the rooms were stocked every day-we had no complaints there. All 6 of us agreed with other reviews posted--the beds are rock hard. Definitely ask Housekeeping for the egg crates as they make a big difference. All of the staff we met were very pleasant and accomodating. The head waiter knew after the first day that we were a group of 6 and went out of his way to get us seated quickly; there aren't a lot of table for groups of more than 4 people. I also agree with the comments about tipping. A few dollars go a long way and from what I saw, the hotel staff work very hard for long hours. The language barrier can be a bit tricky, but the staff really tries to make you happy. The Riu Palace Mexico is a nice hotel if you want a QUIET, relaxing vacation. If you're looking for a little more activity, you will probably be disappointed. One final note--both my husband and I are experiencing "Montezuma's Revenge" right now; the other couples are fine though.

Reviews.Title: “Good times”
Reviews.Author: kmtruffe
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace April 10-13. I was in my friends wedding party and was accomponied by a dozen friends, most of them being my best friends from high school. Needless to say, we had a blast. Three night wasn't enough, but it was long enough to make some observations. The good: - the food and drink service was great. there was never a problem getting a drink (accept when they cut us off completely from getting a particular vodka lemon shooter after ordering dozens of rounds the first night. we could get any other shooter, just not the vodka lemon one we ordered that first night. weird). - the buffet restaurant had plenty of choices and the food was good. It had all the basics and a little more. don't expect "fine food" and you won't be dissappointed. I didn't go to any of the a la carte restaurants but some of my friends said the japanese restaurant was good. if i stayed a week, i'd book at least 3 nights in one of the a la carte restaurants. - the room was nice. the fridge stocked with beer and pop was nice. Although i didn't use it, the 4 bottles of booze and the liquor dispenser was a nice touch too. Improvements Needed: - the front desk seems to need improvement. one night my roomate plugged the toilet and when i called the front desk (about midnight) the phone rang, and rang, and rang, and when someone finally picked up it was a guy completely out of breath who could hardly speak and he told me to come to the front desk myself and get a plunger because he's having a "crazy night". Again, weird. not expected in whats supposed to me a 5 star resort. - there is no bar/disco that plays music. this is just plain crazy. the most fun offered at night was to sit in a quiet courtyard. the Riu Tequila across the street had a disco but (i) it was full of drunk, obnoxious kids (a fight almost broke out after 5 minutes of arriving) and (ii) you shouldn't have to walk across the street to hear some music. - I expected more food options throughout the night. i think the restaurant opened until 10:30 but every night from midnight on we hunted for food with no luck. anyway, we had a blast and i hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The $$$$$”
Reviews.Author: KLB01
Reviews.Content: OK I thought this was a 5 star Hotel??? Boy was I wrong... The Room: Very Small. Bring some slippers or something because you dont want to walk on the floor with bare feet,(YUCK) it is very slippery and I almost fell many times. (I think they use dirty water). I found some mold on the couch! It is a very damp place, nothing dries quickly like you would think in that heat. Dont hang anything out on the terrace it WILL get stolen! The Front Desk Staff: VERY UN HELPFUL. We lost our camera while we were there (TAXI). We reported it to the front desk and asked them if we could call the taxi service to report it to them. They wanted to charge us $1 per minute on their phone. They acted like we were bothering them. We went back to them may times to check, and each time we got the same response. The Servers: AWESOME. No matter who passed your table, if you needed anything they got it for you. They always gave 100%. The Beach: OK so there is not much beach there but they dont have control of it. Its mother nature. Local people there say it has been gone for 2 years. But from my thoughts it did "grow" while I was there. The sand bags work. Yes they are an eyesore but there is nothing you can do. The Entertainment: The entertainment was OK.. The staff was good, they try to get everyone to join in. The shows at night are OK.. If they have the Myan show. GO TO IT.. It is AWESOME. 1 big tip. -- DO NOT DRINK THE WATER. It is NOT POTABLE. Overall I was disappointed with this hotel. We paid ALOT of money and it didnt compare to our last stay at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our family enjoyed the Riu”
Reviews.Author: alissa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from April 5-12 with my husband and our 6 month old daughter. I was a little nervous after reading some of the negative reviews that have been posted on here recently. All I can say is that these people must have been searching for things to complain about. We typically stay at 4-5 star non-AI resorts or couples only AIs but we wanted to stay somewhere family friendly this year. While the rooms, meals and pools aren’t as extravagant as say a JW Marriott, you are also not paying those prices so you shouldn’t expect that! We did go to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya one day. It is newer and the pool is much larger, but it is also a lot busier. We liked the laid back feel of the Riu Palace Mexico. FOOD – While it is true that the food on the buffet was primarily the same each day, it included pretty much anything you could imagine so unless you ate everything every day I don’t see how you could sick of it. We were skeptical of the reservation restaurants but were pleasantly surprised. I do think the reservation system is odd but we never had to wait longer than 10 minutes to get a spot. BEACH & POOL – The beach is eroded but there were some good stretches without sand bags. The Riu Palace Mexico had one of the better beaches in the area and they are trying to get it back to normal. There were plenty of chairs in the beach area. I did notice a lot of chair saving at the swim up bar pool, even though there were signs saying it was not allowed. Since we were at the other pool we never had a problem finding a good spot. SERVICE – This is really what set the resort apart for me. Everyone was so friendly to us, especially to my daughter. The waiters at the pool were constantly checking to see if we needed anything. The front desk staff spoke English and were very helpful. One night our daughter was sick and they let my husband get take-out at the buffet (the room service menu is very limited) and they brought it back to our room. It seemed everyone went out of their way to be helpful and polite. It was disappointing to see how few guests left tips. Even if it says this is included, a dollar here and there really means a lot to these people and they work so hard! I really felt bad for the omelet lady, standing in front of a hot stove in a white coat making omelets all morning. ROOMS – The rooms are nothing elaborate but were nice and roomy. The beds were strange – two full beds pushed together. So if you like to sleep next to your spouse you either have to pick a bed or sleep in the crack. The mini bar was stocked daily. Overall this is a very nice resort and we had a great time. I really find it funny when people complain about things like the musty smell – it is a tropical country and the buildings are open air, I don’t think a resort can control the climate! If you are going on vacation expecting everything to be perfect, you will be disappointed no matter where you go. You’ll probably have a bad experience with a person or meal, just like you would at home. With an AI, they are making food for hundreds of people, so you shouldn’t expect the quality you would at a gourmet restaurant. I figure I don’t have to make it, clean up, or figure out where to go so I just try to enjoy it. If you have the same attitude you will really enjoy the Riu.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico is great !”
Reviews.Author: Cuervoman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really like the Riu Palace Mexico. I think you have to put things in perspective when you book an all-inclusive in Mexico. We paid about $2700 for the two of us, $1050 being for airfare. That breaks down to $1650 for five nights of accomodations, entertainment, and all you can eat and drink. In my book that is an incredible value. The color of the water alone is worth that. We have no problem overlooking minor inconveniences like the stupid method of reserving at the specialty restauraunts. I find that small tips go a long way in boosting the level of your service. I enjoy doing this because I really appreciate the effort the staff is putting forth. Let's face it; we Americans can be hard to impress. Once I was staying at another resort up in Cancun. At breakfast, some jerk flipped out because the grill man broke the yoke of his egg. The poor man was working his butt off and could not understand why the man was irate. The jerk actually went and brought the cook's boss into it. Moments like that cause me to be embarrassed to be noticed as an American. I tipped the cook $5 for doing an excellent job on my omelette. Enough about us being hard to please. Go to Riu Palace Mexico, tip the bartenders, start drinking Don Julio tequila, and make some friends very quickly. The rest will take care of itself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: dmh72
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at the Riu Palace in Cancun and had very high expectations. I would say that this wasn't as nice as the Palace in Cancun, but still an excellent resort and much more relaxing than Cancun was. THE GOOD The room was nice (yes the beds are a little hard - ask for the mattress pads they helped a lot), but everything else about them is nice. The food was good (breakfast and lunch were our favorites). We only tried one specialty resturant. The Mexican resturant at the beach was the best for lunch! The booking process for dinner reservations is horrible. We weren't willing to give up beach time to stand in line for 1/2 hour to an hour. The staff is excellent. Very helpful, very attentive, very friendly - I could go on and on. I was a little disappointed to see plates in the hall from room service that weren't picked up for quite some time. The pools were very nice - liked the pool bar, but we spent most of our time on the beach and in the ocean - I can sit in the pool at home! The sand whales on the beach were a little disappointing, but we knew that they would be there. The Palace has one of the nicer beaches and are working on restoring it. There was still plenty of room to sit in the sun or the shade and we never had a problem getting chair. We booked massages on the beach for our last morning - they were wonderful and only $65 for an hour. I would recommend to book early as it was more enjoyable when it was a little cooler, plus not nearly as many people on the beach so it was quieter. We did the Tulum Extreme excursion (Visit Tulum, then rappel, swim in cenote, and zip line). This was lots of fun. Tulum is a beautiful setting on the coast - take your suit, the beach in wonderful and the zip line was fantastic!!!! THE BAD We relying on a 5 star hotel to keep their promise of trying to keep out spring breakers. We had a group of 12-16 teens (with parents) in our wing of the hotel. They were loud and rude until all hours of the night (not sure where their parents were at 3AM, but they didn't seem to be bothered by the yelling and slamming doors). Three nights we had to call security, they did come and take care of the matter, but this certainly was not what we expected. I guess that we expected the parents to be parents. All in all - it was a great trip and I would definitely go back, just not until mid April when the spring breaks were over.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlLI
Reviews.Content: After reading StLouisGirls review I laughed, in complete agreement with many of her issues. Check in for us was fine- no issues there. The resort itself and its grounds were clean and well kept. We didnt happen to notice any, may have just been our luck though. Our main issue was the food and restaurants. Having to wake up early, 830 the latest to be waiting in the bar to make reservations was the worst system I have ever seen. And still arriving at 8:30, we were number 50, not getting the restaurant choices we wanted. Meanwhile, when walking by the restaurant during dinner they were empty. While at the specialty restaurants beverage choices were very limited. Only beer, wine and soda or water were offered. And the wines are NOT reccomended. No bar service at the restaurants was quite annoying. THe buffet was disgusting- food looked like it was sitting there all day! There were never towels available when we needed them. We would either have to wait, or return to the towel hut later in the day. Lounge chairs on the beach and by the pool are very very limited. If you are not there early, forget about it- you will be searching for a while. Many of the staff members did not speak English- understanding we are in Mexico, but we would have at least expected them to understand us when we asked for towels. There is a horrible smell throughout the resort.... THe Mariachi Bar, the hallways and all the bathrooms... On the other hand... the room we had with a view of the courtyard was beautiful. The breakfasts were also the best part of our day. We also took advantage of the spa and booked two massages, one on the beach and one in the spa- both were wonderful. We also visited the Club across the street at the Riu Tequila- my suggestion- dont bother! We also visited teh Riu Palace Riviera Maya- We wished we booked there instead. The pools were nicer and the resort looked more kept up. The lounge chairs were more available and at the restaurant the food looked more fresh. The staff was also much much more attentive. After visiting many other all inclusives in the Caribbean, the Riu Mexico Palace was at thh bottom of my list. I would return there, however, I would consider the Riu Riviera Maya instead.

Reviews.Title: “"Deer in the Headlights"”
Reviews.Author: Travelsalot8
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico. Front desk help is poor. When asked to address any slight problems, we received the "Deer in the headlights" look as if to say, "it's not my problem" They offer no real solutions for any problems. I called a week ahead of our arrival to make sure that there would be wireless internet access at the hotel so that I would be able to keep in contact with work. The resort assured me that they had it. It worked about 10% of the time and always had problems until you had the option to pay the $15.00 per day charge, then it miraculously worked.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: stlgirl39
Reviews.Content: I just returned today from the spring break trip from hell. After reading other reviews I was expecting a luxury resort but was disappointed. I traveled with a large group and we arrived at the hotel around 11 am. After a brief orientation from the manager we were told our rooms would be ready around 3 and we were shown to a hospitality suite where we could change and go to the pool or beach, so far so good. At 3 we returned to the front desk and were told our rooms would not be ready until 4 and finally at 4:30 we got our rooms. The rooms were disgusting. I stayed in a ground floor room with a view of the neighboring resort. It was a decent size but was poorly lit. The couch smelled awful and had some mildew stains and the beds were hard, had stained sheets and reeked of mold. The bathrooms were even worse. However I found out that I was lucky compared to my friends who had cockroaches in their shower and sink. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and I had no problems except for the occasional confusion due to the language barrier. Anytime I needed extra towels or sheets they were delievered to my room within minutes and with a smile. The food was not so great. I had never stayed at an all-inclusive before and I never plan on doing so again. Breakfast was far and away the best meal. There were so many choices and they included freshly made smoothies, fresh fruit, pancakes and mexican specialities. Lunch was so-so and dinner was disgusting. After the first night, I went out to restaurants in Playa del Carmen. Some of my friends who braved the brazillian specialty restaurant and found the food unfit for human consumption. The meat was rubbery and when someone found several dead bugs in the salad bar she was told by the staff to just eat them because they were "good for her." The green beans were apparently still frozen. The drinks were weak and the liquor was diluted. Overall...after 5 days I was ready to come home and was the envy of other members of my group who had booked longer stays. There is no chance I will ever stay at a Riu again.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive enjoyable resort”
Reviews.Author: Steven1146
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, my wife and I and two daughters, 16 and 25, spent 5 nights at Palace Mexico from March 18 until this past Sunday and it was perfect for us. We spent some time walking around the other RIUs, including Tequila, Yucatan, and Palace Riveria. The guests at the Palaces are a little older-more couples or couples with teens than the others and quieter. For example, Tequila had fun , loud music going on in pool side contests most of the day while the loudest noise at Palace Mexico's pool were the volleyball players. The towel game starts early-towels start popping up at 6:30 and chairs are gone by 9. Even at the beach, the chairs were taken by 10;30. The beach is small but we enjoyed staying up in the partial shade of the palm trees. There is a lot of room up in that area. The beach activities were great -free kayaking and pay per trip parasailing and jet skiing. All of the staff were helpful and friendly-the grounds are perfect-even browned palm tree fronds come down quickly. Pruning shrubs and cleaning takes place early, leaving the courtyard beautiful all day. The food was very good for as many people as they serve. The large buffet had a wide variety of hot and cold foods-6 kinds of smoothies at every meal, including a spinach smoothy. Trays of scrambled eggs as well as custom made fried eggs and omelets every morning, lots of fresh salalds good breads and pastries-I was suprised at the wide variety of foods at each meal. You can make a huge salad of exotic fixings or settle for a hot dog and full plate of french fries-as we watched one teen enjoy one night. The 2 lunch buffets near the beach offer different foods and salads, are close to the beach and worth a visit.The specialty restaurants are average-avoid the steak house-only one third full they night we were there-I can get a better cut of meat at a supermarket. The Japanese restaurant had good saki and wine choices. The gym serves its purpose and they have massage huts along the beach-a special price of $65 each day we were there. The rooms are large, a door then an entry way then another heavy door but even that couldn't muffle the occasional group of drunks returning at 4 a.m. Not many spring breakers but senior trippers-spring breakers with parents along-including one polite group from Colorado who started their trip with Long Island Ice Teas and tequila shots and weren't seen again until late the next day.Overall, a well run, pleasant, enjoyable stay, which leaves you smiling and wishing you had booked for a few more days.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: butterflybirds
Reviews.Content: We found the resort beautiful and lots of fun. The staff was professional, polite and accommodating. The food at the buffets was good, but if you’re looking for something different, try the specialty restaurants. Our plane was late arriving and we missed making reservations for dinner. We went to the Japanese restaurant and asked them if they could fit us in. They scrambled, switched some things around, and served us a wonderful meal. I told our waiter I wasn’t familiar with some of the items on the menu but wanted to try new things. He said not to worry he would take care of us. He explained the different foods and brought us what he thought we would enjoy. I thought that this was especially nice. A little hint---ask your waiter what he thinks is the best on the menu and he’ll bring you the best. We had fried parmesan cheese at Oliver’s. I made a fuss over it and was surprise when the waiter brought me a bowl of it. The staff works so hard whether you leave a tip or not. But we found that even if it’s only a few dollars, they are very appreciative. We visited the other Rui’s and the Palace Riv. Maya is the best. There is a tiny chapel in the Rui Mexico. It feels like you are stepping back in time. We had plans to do excursions but the Palace had enough activities to keep us there. Don’t miss the Michael Jackson show. The beach was great. We talked to a couple who had been here in October and they said that the beach had been built up since then. I’ll try to enclose pictures but I’ve never done that before and am not sure I’ll succeed. If you have any questions please feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “A most wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: c711beachgirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a most wonderful week at the Riu Palace ,Mexico. From the moment we were greeted by Manuel, at the door with the greeting of "Welcome Home" to our moment of checking out we were pampered, entertained and felt like we were truly in paradise! The hotel itself is immaculate. The grounds and fountains are beautiful. Our room was well appointed and quiet. The food was delicious, especially breakfast! We had lunch every day in the Mexican restaurant by the beach and we thoroughly enjoyed our waitress , Elia who served us everyday. Our friend celebrated her birthday at the Sir Edward restaurant. The table was sprinkled with fresh flowers and everyone serving us made her evening so special. We spent our days on the gorgeous beach, swam in the crystal turquoise water and lounged by the pool every day. In short, nothing could have been better. The very best thing about the Rui Palace, however,are the people that work there. They are the nicest, most pleasant staff I have ever encountered. Every person we met was warm and genuine! They actually seemed to enjoy their job and it showed and in turn we enjoyed them. Would we stay at the Rui Palace Mexico again? In a heartbeat! We thank everyone there for your exceptional hospitality and allowing us to have the most relaxing, enjoyable vacation we've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful place and palace in the world !!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyluv
Reviews.Content: I'm an usual reader of the trip advisor's review and if you are lucky to go to this awesome hotel, I want to tell you that it will be the most fantastic trip of your life. There is some highlights: HOTEL: The hotel location is great. Near us, we had a little shopping center call Playacar Place. It is very beautiful and luxurious. Also, you have to know that the palace is not really old. There are many big and great fountains all around the place. The hotel is amazing ! SERVICE: You have to know that one of the most impressive thing of this hotel is the quality of the service. When you sit at a table at night, there are always a waiter who ask you if you want something. If you have a problem in your room, call the reception and the service is really fast. Also, the staff of the hotel is very nice. They are always smiling and are doing the best as they can to satisfate you. BEACH: The beach is what it is. The water is incredible, the most beautiful I have ever seen ! The color is clearer than the water of the pool ! Plus, it is really hot. The sand is white and soft. There are some rocks but just in an area, not everywhere. In the water, you can swim without problems : there's no rocks or seaweed. Some people complain about the sandwhale but i found them really funny. You can slide on it and many people here jump and have fun on it. If you walk 3 minutes down right, after the hotels Iberostar and Sandos, the beach is wonderful, without sandwhale. But, there's no chairs down there. At the Riu Palace Mexico, you can always have a chair where you want. The other Riu hotels around can't take our chair. The waiters on the beach are very nice and efficient. You don't wait one hours for a drink ! FOOD: The food, oh my god, the food, i can't say anything about it, WOW ! It's so great that you can compare it to the cruise ship food ! The a la carte restaurants are all amazing. Some people complain about the Bresilian restaurant but i think it was amazing. To the starter to the dessert, all are excellent. The buffet restaurant is really good and there's a lot of choices of meet, fish, dessert, fruits, etc. I can talk about it for hours. ROOM: When i came in my room for the first time, i just say WOW !!! It is really big and beautiful. The bathroom is huge and awesome. If you read a review of this hotel who say : the room is ugly, go right now to the next review. It is very clean. The air conditionner works really well. There's a lot of place to store your clothes. It is amazing ! POOL: The beach is so wonderful, we didn't use the pool often but it's really great and... hot ! It's huge and there's a lot of chairs. Sometimes, we went to the pool before to go to the room, after the beach at 4 pm and there was still free chairs. Again, the staff around the pool is very efficient.
