You can wait one minute that there's a waiter who want to serve you. My advise: go to the beach, it's so wonderful ! SOME ADVISE: If you want to go to Tulum, don't go with a tour, you'll pay twice as much ! If you want a good way and cheap way to get there, you should use the collectivo. It's like the public bus but don't worry, it's safe ! The ride to Xel-Ha, Xcaret, Tulum or all the interisting thing there, it cost 3 dollars per person. The price to come in the site of Tulum, it's 5 dollars per person. So, if you take a tour, it will cost you 99 dollars per person ! Please, don't waist your money. Xel-Ha is really wonderful. The site is huge and there's a lot of nice activities to do there. I recommand you to go there because it's an all-inclusive (food and drinks) and it's very beautiful. You can swim with dolphins but... it's very very expensive ! Just to stay one day, without dolphins, it's really nice. You can do snorkeling in a natural and huge lagoon. Once again, the snorkeling equipements are include. I prefer Xel-Ha than Xcaret. The ferry to go to Cozumel is... expensive ! We didn't go to the island because it was too expensive !!! But the snorkeling place is really awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: reno91187
Reviews.Content: We were in Playa del Carmen March 5-12; started out at the Yucatan then were asked on the 7th if we would like to upgrade to the Palace--well, of course! Had an excursion on the 8th so couldn't move until the 9th.. Mar 9-got moved over to the Palace, room was great, Jr suite, large sitting area, large balcony. The weather was overcast, rainy so we didn't do too much that day, the food was excellent at the buffet, staff very attentive. Mar 10-went to the pool---didn't see the "towel game" being played, that was a nice change, plenty of chairs to choose from. Service at pool was great. Went to 5th ave later in the day, some of those guys are pushy--my 1st time in Mexico so it kind of bugged me for a little bit until I got used to it. March 11-Started out at the beach, the weather was perfect, swam in the ocean quite a bit, drink service on the beach was very good also. Stayed the afternoon at the pool, beautiful day. Early to bed for an early flight. March 12-I used Worry Free vacations for this trip which included transportation back & forth to the airport--well when we transferred to the Palace from the Yucatan--the transfer didn;t. After some searching by the Palace's front desk staff the problem was fixed--they called someone (Worry Free??) for us, and 1/2 hour later we were on our way to the airport. Front desk was great. next time I vacation in PDC I will most likely book my stay at the Palace...it is spotless, clean, staff is very accomodating and gracious. It is not crowded, and the obnoxiousness I saw at the yucatan was not seen at the Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel. Only there to delight you! Excellent in every way.”
Reviews.Author: TessaFW
Reviews.Content: Delicious food. Clean, beautiful rooms. Staff all only want to make you happy. Lovely, large beach area, with plenty of chairs. Best beach in the area. Will definitely return. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation Destination”
Reviews.Author: toomuchsnow-9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the Riu Palace Mexico! It was our first time traveling to Mexico and staying in an all inclusive. I used this site to help determine our hotel and found it to be helpful and mostly true(except for the negitive comments). I really don't know how anyone could have a bad experience here. The main complaint of some are the beds, when we arrived the egg crate topper was on our bed and I found it to be very comfortable. It was very clean and the hotel is beautiful. The beach area is by far the best of all the properties in the area. It was nice to have the palm tree area up off the beach to relax out of the sun. The pool area was fun and upbeat. I can not say enough about the staff and service. I fell in love with the staff! They are kind and always greeting you with a smile with a "Hola"! My drink was never empty, (sometimes not a good thing! I had a couple of rough mornings!) The entertainment group always was working hard to make sure everyone was enjoying themselves! The food was very good, the buffet during the day did get a little old, but you can go to the other hotels for lunch. The Sir Edward was amazing! The buffet morning and night are very good. Service again outstanding! I loved the breakfast in the morning the most because you can sit outside in the warm morning sun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, restful time at Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: weluvacation
Reviews.Content: Were at the Riu for six days (March 2 to the 6). This was our sixth trip to the Caribbean/Mexico region. Our last 2 trips were to Sandals (St. Lucia and Jamaica). We go to moderately priced restaurants weekly and high priced for special occasions. We love to cook and are pretty good at it. Here is our review. The hotel: Location very good. 20 minute walk from town and 5 minutes/$5 cab ride. Small shopping plaza 2 minutes walk-nice and smaller scale of town. The hotel itself is beautiful and clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. Few helpful hints: if you don't like the noise from the stage and fountains, ask for rooms that don't face the inner courtyard. Our room was 3rd floor and very quiet. Bring your cash in $1s and $5s for cabs, tips (not necessary but appreciated) and shopping. Room was large, comfortable and clean. To restock the in-room bar you need to catch the drink guy. We agree with all of the reviews that the beds are very hard. You can ask at reception for a soft topper for the bed. Food: We found the buffet to be of good quality, variety and quantity. There is something for everyone. Don't miss the Mexican section at every eveing meal. There was a regional theme nightly. If you have good Japanese restaurants at home, skip Miyagi. At Sir Edward the food and service was excellent. We did not try the other sit down restaurants. The variety of the buffet was excellent. For breakfast and lunch, you can eat at any of the other 5 Riu hotels in Playacar. Dinners must be eaten at your hotel. the restaurants have 2 sittings; 6:30pm and 8:45pm. You must book daily between 7:30 and 10:30am. We preferred the freedom of the buffet. Pool: Beautiful setting. Very clean. there are 2 sections. The north section has all of the activitiy and the swim-up bar with music. Can be loud. The south section is quiet and relaxing. don't miss the large jaccuzzi on that side. It's hidden behind some bushes. Beach: unfortunately, Mother Nature in the form of hurricanes last fall eroded the beach. It is not as nice and smooth as you would expect . You can still go in the water, sit on the beach and sit under the palm trees. If you want lots of sand and beautiful beach, walk south beyond the next 3 resorts and you will find it. In summary, the hotel is beautiful with great variety and quality of food. It's a great place for a quiet, restful vacation. if you are looking for great shows and bar scene, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful wedding at the Palace”
Reviews.Author: loco24
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I just returned from our wedding and honeymoon at the Riu Palace in Playa and could not have had a more wonderful experience and beautiful wedding anywhere!! We have been to Cancun and Playa six times and this was by far the best time we have ever had! The resort was beautiful and made for the best wedding photos one could ask for! The rooms were beautiful and perfect! Yes, the beds are a little hard but we have found that at most of the resorts in Mexico! The service was definately 5 star all the way! After the second day most of the bartenders knew us by name and treated us like royalty! Tony,Raul and Roy were exceptional and always asked us how we were doing and made sure we always had a drink! We had 35 guest's stay at the resort for the wedding and everyone said the had a great time and told us we could not have picked a better resort to have the wedding! As for the wedding day we could not have had anything go any better as even the weather was perfect! Rebecca the wedding co-ordinator did a perfect job making sure that all the arrangements were exactly as we asked for! We had a cocktail reception at the Mariachi bar wich went perfect, as we hired the mexican trio to play and everyone danced and had a great time. The food at the reception dinner at El Patio was perfect and some of the guest's said they had one of the best steaks that they ever had! Julio, the wedding photographer, hired by the Riu could not have been any better, as the wedding photos turned out beautiful! If you are planning a beach wedding in Mexico we would definately recommend the Riu Palace! From the service, food, rooms and resort everyhting was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel with a big heart”
Reviews.Author: manwest
Reviews.Content: This was our 9th trip to Mexico and our first time to a RIU property. We love this area of Mexico do to it's close proximity to Playa and the short drive from the airport. Our summary of the trip would be as follows; Rooms: The beds are "firm", but we found them acceptable. More of a problem, and it is a problem, was the musty smell. When we entered the room it was overwhelming. We improvised by turning off the air conditioning and leaving the screen door open to our patio. This worked OK for us due to the mild temps we had all week, but will be a problem when the weather turns hotter. The bathroom is tired and I would recommend using bottled water to brush your teeth and bring shampoo and conditioner, since it was not provided. Service Excellent, and the best I have ever received. We never waited for a cocktail or to have our table cleaned while we ate. Check in was a breeze and were constantly asked if you needed anything. Food The breakfast was 1st rate. Lunch was OK, but would get old over a 7 day stay. The dinner buffet was similar to lunch, and we had trouble getting a reservation. By my estimate, they only allow 25% of the guests the ability to get a reservation, and we usually got there late so book right at 8:00 am. We did eat at the Brazilian and it was very good. Overall, the food was very good. Beach All of the beach's took a hit, but this resort seemed to have the best of what was left. We walked down to the Iberostar and were stunned by the loss of beach from 2 years ago. The Palm tree area getting to the beach was very nice to sit in for a break from the sun. Pool OK. A little problem getting a front row chair, so get down early. The pool bar service was again excellent, but the quality of the drinks was poor. Summary This was a grand old property with a great heart. The service was excellent but the rooms HVAC needs to be updated. For those seeking a 5 star resort, you will not be happy. We have stayed at the Excellence, and this property does not compare. I think it is a little overpriced when compared to other options in this area and had a great time, but would not go back simply due to the musty smell.

Reviews.Title: “Above average, but nothing to write home about....”
Reviews.Author: beechmi
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace Mexico is one of a few large resort hotels in Playa del Carmen and Cancun. It is basically an above average cruise ship on land. The lobby and grounds of the property are impressive and extremely well maintained. The hotel is very clean with friendly resort staff everywhere. The rooms are a nice size with a decent sized bathroom. Rooms facing the central plaza (with balconies) are available for (currently) an extra US$30 per person per night. As with all hotels I have stayed at in Mexico the beds are hard, and not very comfortable. But this is something I have found throughout Mexico (Mexico City, Puerto Vallarta, Cancun, etc.). We had to switch rooms a few times because of a very strong musty 'sewage' odor, and problems with the air conditioning. I discovered that the air conditioning in the rooms on the south wing does not work very well and is very weak. I would avoid this section of the hotel if at all possible. Also, the resort's theater is located near the central 'plaza' and plays loud music until after 11:00 pm. Because all the floors of the resort are tile (with few if any rugs) the noise travels and may keep you up at night. We opted for a room that face away from the theater which seemed to help. The gym is small (and hot!) but functional. The spa is average as are the restaurants with lots of free liquor (although it was hard to find the top notch liquor - Absolut, Tanqueray, etc.). The beach and pool area are clean and we never had trouble locating a chair or spot on the beach even though the resort was full. There isn't much of a beach though, but what is available is nice. One thing I found interesting was that the hotel does not purify their water so it is not potable. How can this property have a 4 star rating from AAA and not have potable water? Its the first property in Mexico I have stayed that did not purify their water. Overall there was nothing major to complain about with this resort but I would not spend a lot of money to stay there. Most of the guests were from Europe and were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay better than the first”
Reviews.Author: DebNac
Reviews.Content: This is our second President's week vacation at this same hotel and my teenager is asking me to book again for next year. The entire hotel complex is beautiful. We were upgraded to two rooms overlooking the fountains in the central plaza. The entire staff is friendly and hard-working. Everything was always spotless. You can always get a lounge by the beach or the pool. As a matter of fact, I thought it was less populated than last year. (The economy?) I had cappacino two or three times a day, so I don't know what the other reviewer is talking about, and we swam in the ocean every day. One day it was windy and a little rough, but surely you can't blame the hotel for that. Yes, it can be a little tiring eating the buffet food every day, so try the restaurants. The Brazilian was excellent and the Japanese was very good. I was less impressed with the steakhouse, though some people raved about it. Breakfasts were outstanding--anything and everything you could eat from oatmeal, vegetarian platters, to bacon and eggs, pancakes, etc. Mimosas and bloddy mary's every day. You can use all the facilities at any of the Riu hotels, so you can bike ride or go to the sports bar or disco etc at another hotel or even sit at another beach or pool. Last year we walked the whole length of the Playa beachfront and went into every hotel and definately like the Palace de Mexico the best, except for the Iberostar, which is also lovely. We spent a day at Xcaret and loved it--only minutes from the hotel. Beautiful setting, fun to swim in the underground river, and the show was spectacular (a little long). Even our lunch on the beach was delicious--not the usual bad hamburger/hot dog you'd expect, but a really good Mexican lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Overly Spolied!!!”
Reviews.Author: jefmlrn4
Reviews.Content: I Read all the reviews before leaving and you people must just be complainers!! You had us worried but, as my friend and I always say we could could have a good time on a beach blanket in a parking lot. Of course we live in central IL, USA so leaving snow and ice for 82 and sunny was a treat all its own. The grounds were beautiful. The rooms were spacious and very clean. yes the beds were hard but, who cares we were so tired at the end of the day it didn't matter. I asked our room attendant for extra towels and water and it was given. The wait staff couldn't do enough they were always there asking if you needed anything and we laughed that they constantly were replacing our coasters under our drinks, and wiping off the tables. We had no problems with bugs of any sort!! And if there is a biting bug around it would find me first, we didn't leave our doors open alot maybe that was the problem for some, but we also don't spend much time in our rooms. we took repel and never used it once. The beach is what it is, they can't help the sand whales being there they were not enough of a distraction that i would turn down another trip to the same resort. We loved the sun, sand and the whales made nice loungers in the water. We spendt late afternoons in the pool playing volleyball, met alot of cool people from many places. There were 8 of us all traveling together, 4 couples. 4 of us had been to Mexico before and the other 4 were newbees. The food is not like home but, if it was you wouldn't be in Mexico. We had plenty to eat and our boys are big ones and they like mainly Steak. The steaks are not like the US at all but we raise our own and never expect other meat to be as good. We mainly ate at the buffet nothing to complain about there and like I said our guys are eaters. We ate at Sir Edwards you should go for the experience the food was fun, the salmon was great. The steak there was better than most the men said.Our waitress was so sweet and put up with our men being strange without question. Meaning this was out of their comfort zone, and it was the funniest thing ever. We Took 3 excursions. The Pirate Ship Cruise. Not exactly terrible the lobster was Great, the trip to and from the resorts was long and very tiring. It turned out to be a 71/2 hour trip. wouldn't do it again. One of our ladies went on the Horse riding trip, she said it made her whole vacation, the pictures were beautiful. One couple went on the dolphin trip they loved it.... Expensive for the pictures though because you can't use your own camera, but they said they would do it again. The whole group did the 4x4 jeep trip in cozumel. DO NOT GO!!! this wasted our entire day, you were not allowed to leave the group as we were told and it took up way too much time waiting on others, the end of the trip is the snorkling for like 15 minutes huge huge waste....The ferry ride was nice into cozumel. to do it over we would just take the ferry and do our own thing for the day. We have been to other resorts in Mexico and the Dom. Republic. We have stayed at 2 other resorts in this same area all very similar to compare, Some people must just look for things to complain about. All in all our trip was great the resort is well worth the trip and the money. We would gladly return to the RIU but, our goal is to get different stamps in our passports!!! Our pictures aren't much different than everyone elses but if you'd like to see them we have them on a web site.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: fruitpuff
Reviews.Content: I always check Trip Advisor before booking any hotel and was browsing the site and thought I'd look up the Riu Palace Mexico where we spent our honeymoon. Having read some of the negative reviews I felt I must comment. We absolutely loved this hotel and only have praise for it: staff - excellent: very attentive location - fantastic: beach a minute walk away food - best we have had; fantastic selection, beautifully cooked poolside - not crowded at all. This is the hotel we judge all our holidays on - and none have matched up.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Fuzer
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience. Only time we were happy was when we were away from the hotel. Got stuck in ground floor room with a view of pedestrian and cart traffic from hotel next door. Room smelled like sewage. Shower head was old and cheap. Mattress was cheap and rock hard. They DO NOT have king-size beds only two doubles placed next to each other. Request for egg foam padding for the bed took 3 attempts. We had to remove the plastic mattress covering because it did not breathe well and we awoke to dampness beneath us. Blow dryer wall mount was cheap and fell off the wall. AC did not dehumidify the room. Clothing, towels and bed linens consistently damp. Took us two days to change rooms after misinformation from reception staff. Certainly felt like we were getting the runaround. New room was on second floor with better view. AC still did not dehumidify the room. Room still smelled like sewage. Shower head was newer, but still cheap and did not match its wall mount. It constantly fell off. Didn't bother requesting the egg foam padding because we just gave up at that point. Lobby always smelled like smoke because of the lobby bar and poor ventilation. Incoming calls from the US were not transferred to our room by reception. Heavy beach erosion required large black sandbars to be installed on the shore and they blocked beach access. Overall the hotel gives the illusion of luxury, but no attention to detail. Also, don't book excursions through Expedia when traveling to Mexico because we had a difficult time redeeming the vouchers.

Reviews.Title: “No Beach, Mosquitos in Room”
Reviews.Author: Alex98NewYork
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a nice beach, go elsewhere. We went recently and this beach is almost non-existent. Not able to stroll on the beach. Also, they can't seem to keep the mosquitos out many rooms. If you still wind up booking, ask for the quiet side if you get a garden view, because an adjacent hotel plays loud, bass heavy music until 2am.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable, relaxing stay at the Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: vancouvertraveler50
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a very enjoyable stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. We agree with the positive posts - the hotel is beautiful, the grounds with lovely fountains are spectacular and the service was first class. The animation staff were always lively running all the various events throughout the day. A few cautions: If you go to bed early or don't like loud music, ask for a room away from the plaza where the evening show is held until 11 PM or later. We were disturbed and the hotel quickly moved us to a lovely room on the far end of the hotel over looking the pools. As noted by others, the beach has washed away quite a bit and the sand whales are somewhat unsightly but we weren't greatly bothered. It may be a concern for families with small children because there are drop offs and the swimming area isn't the most gentle. If you are a serious gourmet which means you probably shouldn't be going to an all inclusive hotel to start with, you may be disappointed in the food. There was a huge variety and we found it all very tasty but it is not the equivalent of a first class restaurant. During the period of our stay at least the average age of the clientele was 50-70 with a heavy proportion of Europeans which suited us perfectly but might not be right for younger people. If you are aware of these cautions and they don't concern you, then this is a wonderful place to spend a sunny week resting and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “over rated for the price”
Reviews.Author: bettercold
Reviews.Content: this resort is not a 5 star. we have been to this area 3 other times. The food is poor to average. Plenty of food but the hot foods were very dry and tasteless. Both of us got sick on the 3rd and 5th day of our stay. We are still trying to figure out what could have caused it. I would reccomend immodium. the rooms were spacious but 2 double beds put together. we were told they had king size beds. the rooms looked clean but the floors were always damp. I walked with white socks and they were very dirty by the 3 day. (in the room) Bathrooms had a bad odor from the drains. Beach was ok for what they have had. Water was very rough most of the time we were there. Plenty of chairs. Grounds were kept up very nice. Would we go back? No. Entertainment was average. If you want to go where the people are friendly and want to have fun this is not the place. For us it was more for the sophisticated.

Reviews.Title: “Hated Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: scottybeammeup
Reviews.Content: I would like to preface this review by saying that my wife and I take about five to six vacations per year. We have stayed at many of the resorts in this general vecinity and have been realitively pleased with most of them and very impressed with one. Needless to say, it was not Riu Palace. The resort itself is immaculate. The grounds are maintained exceptionally well. This, however does not make up for the atrocious service that we received from the general manager, Maria Jose Rincon. We approached her with the simplest request and instead of helping to meet our needs, she insulted us and treated us in a manner that was absolutely appauling. We contacted our travel agent the following morning and promptly made arrangements to move to another resort. I would not recommend this resort to anyone who expects a level of service that one deserves while vactioning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lon weekend...”
Reviews.Author: cbus77
Reviews.Content: We are not huge fans of all inclusive resorts, but for a long weekend (4 nights) it was a fun, easy get away. The beach was nice and the hotel staff was great. The resort was very clean and well kept. The guacomole was to die for! No problems with anything, except the beds were pretty hard and they were two beds pushed together. Beautiful blue waters and would recommend tresort o friends.

Reviews.Title: “trip from hell”
Reviews.Author: islandgirlCanada
Reviews.Content: Out of all my travels by far this was the worst experience that I had. We arrived at the hotel at 12pm and did not get a room till 4:30pm, we were traveling with two young kids considering that the kids have been up since 3am for the flight you would think that the hotel could have been more accommodating. The reception staffs were extremely rood, the hotel definitely needs to replace the staff at the front desk. We had paid extra for junior suit and were told that they did not have the documentation. Our video camera got stolen from the room, and the staff at the hotel told us that they couldn’t do anything about it. I would have never thought that at a 5 star hotel my camera would have gotten stolen. The food was not the greatest. Every day they would say the cappuccino machine is broken, you would think that if you are paying fro a 5 star hotel they would have at least one machine working. The beach was horrible, there was such a strong current that you could drown of you did not know how to swim. Overall the only thing that was good about this hotel was the cleanliness and the decoration.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely magnificent vacation”
Reviews.Author: snowbunnii
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Riu Palace and had a great time. The grounds are spacious , and perfectly manicured. The room was very clean and large, bed was comfortable. There is a small fridge that is stocked daily with various beverages. I do have to agree however; with previous posts about a musky smell, in the room. Food at the buffet was excellent, lots of variety, the cheesecakes were delicious. The service was awesome! Servers were very attentive and friendly, always making sure our glasses were never empty. We spent most of our time by the pool. Although there is a large beach area with lots of shade if needed, right by the water there were some rocks and sand bags due to the erosion. Found that walking to the right past 3 other resorts there was a beautiful secluded beach area. I would recommend this hotel to friends. We had a great, relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “This place feels like a palace.”
Reviews.Author: vwgirl
Reviews.Content: This place really looks and feels like a palace. You won't be disappointed. I agree with all other positive posts, so I want to write about something different. This hotel is within Playacar which is an exclusive community in Playa del Carmen. Playacar is a guarded neighborhood with a few hotels, many beautiful luxury villas, some condos, a few stores, a golf course and an aviary. The property is huge and the hotel is in a center of it, about 30 minute walk from the downtown. Taxi ride is $5. We were there just before Xmas and we found the beach in front of the hotel was always crowded. I'm from New Jersey and our beaches are often crowded, so that's nothing new. One day we decided to go for a walk on the beach to the right of the hotel. We passed 3 hotel properties and found a beach that has nobody there, only occasional beach walkers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: KubaBound
Reviews.Content: I visited the Riu Palace in January 07, and also once before in March 05. The resort has gotten nothing but better. Service is unbelieveable, ambiance is incredible. Food was good, a bit repetitive but it always is. Drinks were great! The resort is located on a strip of others, and staying at the palace means you can use any other Riu Resort around you! This is benefitial at night time, when the Riu Tequila boasts wonderful shows and a larger crowd. Playa Del Carmen is a beautiful city as well. Cheap shops (always ALWAYS barder for at least 50% less then what they ask first). Bars are great, this is my 5th time in general to Playacar and i always find the Blue Parrot to be the best place to party! All in all great vacataion!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely done...”
Reviews.Author: lrg∈charge
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Jan.20-27th/08 My wife and I were quite pleased with the overall level of service, entertainment, grounds, rooms, cleanliness, food, drink. The French restaurant and Asian restaurant could be rated perhaps a 3 for food prep and delivery, based on our experience anyway (however a 5 for effort though, lol). Besides, what the heck am I doing eating French and Asian food in Mexico anyways...geesh ;) The beach is beat up as everyone knows but that didn't matter to me, still a beautiful resort. Go there, tip the bartenders, and enjoy the Don Julio!!!!! Cheers

Reviews.Title: “absolutely awesome experience a real palace”
Reviews.Author: MeandCec
Reviews.Content: The nicest beach of all adjacent resorts. The beach recovery progress is amazing. The "breakwalls" are nearly completely covered by beach sand - the progress in one week was amazing and you hardly know what is happening. LOTS OF GREAT BEACH NOW!!!Great area of Palm shade and sand for sunning or shading, with beach bar AND beach service. Activities are loads of fun. This was not a relaxing vacation because we playing volleyball on the beach, volleyball in the water. A 40 minute walk to Palya but not necessary because the most reasonable shopping centre for all souvenirs and jewelery of all expenses is right there. Food outstanding - and I have travelled to South America, Melaysia, Turkey, I'm going back to Riu Palace. The staff service was absolutely remarkable - My glass was NEVER EMPTY - Grounds are immaculate, Did I say the food and variety of Food was outstanding - Gourmet all the way - We'll be back AND I will send photos. Excellant golf courses just a block away - 4 married couples - and we are going back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations!”
Reviews.Author: NewAdventures6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace for my honeymoon and had an incredible time! I honestly don't understand some of the negative reviews - the staff went above and beyond and were incredibly attentive. The grounds were beautiful and the rooms very spacious and clean. As for the food - I would highly recommend the breakfast buffet, dinner buffet and Japanese restaurant. The Brazillian was okay - a little too much meat for my liking - but the experience is fun. The resort has a quieter and more elgant atmosphere than some of the other resorts in the area. I really enjoyed the elegant tone to the resort...if you wanted to change it up you also have access to the other Riu resorts which are in walking distance. There also seemed to have been a lot of European and South American travellers (or as one Amercain quoted "a lot of foreigners here...???...ummm aren't you also a foreigner?). There were primarily honeymooners and couples of all ages when we were there which I really liked. If you have a chance I would recommend taking a tay trip to Xel-Ha for some great snorkelling (or at least great for beginners)! My husband and I also took a day trip to Cozumel. It's a cheap and fast ferry ride to the island. We rented a scooter for the day and had a fabulous time driving around the island. Overall I would highly recommend this resort! It was a great location for a romantic honeymoon with lots of options for activities or just plain old relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel - disregard the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: socgrl15
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to write a review after reading how far off the mark the extremely negative review that I just read was. I visited the Riu Palace Mexico in December 2007. I'd heard about the problems with beach erosion and was nervous about it because I love the beach... but I had a great time when I got there! Here's a breakdown: 1. THE BEACH: while it is true that the Riu's beach has eroded, THERE IS A BEACH AREA at the Riu in the direct sun where you can lounge all day, and I never had a problem getting a chair. It's not a huge area, but it's there and I was on it for each of the seven days I was there. There is also a grove of palm trees (and sand) -- I thought of it as the "palm tree grove" directly behind the beach proper if you prefer indirect light -- that's where the beach bar is, and it (the palm tree grove) is huge. If you prefer the deserted beach feel, there is no need to drive to another beach... just walk toward the ocean, turn right, and walk six or seven minutes down the beach at the hotel. The resort area ends and there is a big, beautiful beach there -- occupied only by the beachcombers walking back and forth from the resort area. At the hotel, there are also inflatable reefs in the ocean. They are part of the effort to restore the beach, but they were actually fun to play on and to sunbathe on -- it like having docks. The status of the beach should not be a reason for not staying at the Riu: (1) you can still sunbathe and swim at the hotel beach (2) there is a huge beach a short walk away (3) the other things at the hotel are absolutely fantastic and the experience is not worth missing. 2. THE STAFF: The staff at the Riu was great -- and certain members were outstanding -- they knew our names by the third day. I didn't want for anything the entire week I was there. The rooms were exceptionally clean, and they were always cleaning the hall areas. I think the pictures say it all -- there is no way this hotel, or its rooms, could be construed as dirty! 3. FOOD: This was my first all-inclusive and I was nervous -- I'd always heard that the food at all inclusives was terrible. I loved the buffet. It was huge, and each night it had a special feature (along with the enormous amounts of everything else). There is a fresh juice bar at breakfast that has everything: mango juice, papaya juice, etc. I ate at the buffet restaurant by the beach for lunch every day -- a huge variety, and awesome guacamole! I think the specialty restaurants were overrated -- I ate at the Sir Edward (gourmet), and the Brazilian restaurant. They are fun to try, but I don't know how many I would go back to if I went again -- I preferred the buffet. 4. OTHER THINGS: Overall, the Riu is a beautiful hotel -- the pictures really say it all. It's not the place to go if you're looking to do serious partying on vacation or if you're single and looking to meet someone. However, if that's the case, you can cross the street to the Riu's sister hotel, the "Riu Tequila" (the food and drink privileges carry over) at night. There's a disco and there appeared to be more singles. The Palace was mostly older couples, and was pretty quiet at night. I consider myself an objective person, and I thought that that the Riu was outstanding. I've attached some of my pictures -- it looks even better when you're there. I highly recommend it and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, no beach, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: sjopjm
Reviews.Content: Although the structures are fairly new the hotel does not offer any of characters Mexico is famous for. The property and its management fails to inform guests ahead of time that there is currently no beach. The beach was taken out by a tropical depression sometimes in October 2007. It is a major disappointment flying in for a family vacation just to find out that the beach is washed out. The pool was too cold for kids. After bringing this to the managements attention we were told "to leave" and "that they are not interested in complaining guests". We had to rent a car and drive over 1 hour (one way) each day to Tulum to find a great beach. Service and food is mediocre, property is overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & Relaxing, Cannot wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Sarzyn
Reviews.Content: Wow...what a place, elegant, well kept, beatiful. My wife and I were not disappointed, during our stay at the Riu Palace. Check in was smooth and without problems, and we were escorted to our room. As I had contacted the hotel a weel or so before or departure date...our room was filled with beatiful exotic flower arrangements. My wife and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary. The hotel itself is large but not overwhelming. Each piece of art or area of landscaping is thoughtfully placed to provide visual surprises around each turn of the hallway or garden path. yes, it gets slippery when it rains...but hey, you are in the tropics in what is essentially a jungle...its gonna rain. The floors are not so slippery that they present a hazard to guest. The pool area is quiet and relaxing. The hotel animation team seems to focus onthe beach area during the day. We recommend the hidden ten person hot tub just between the pool and the south side of the main building. There is nothing like drinking mojitos and relaxing in warm bubbling water, or lying on the fine sandy beach. Food was not an issue...all was good quality or better. This is not the same style or ingredients used at home...so be adventurous and try something new. The buffet was excellent, for breakfast and dinner. We did not each lunch often as we were busy doing absolutely nothing on the beach at that time of the day. The staff were genuinely friendly and went out of their way to provide guest satisfaction. Don't be rude if a hotel employee does not understand you, they will usually find an employee who can help. The animation team was funny, entertaining and friendly...but they were never pushy as we have found at other all inclusive resorts. Rooms were meticulously cleaned every day. Yes its humid if the doors are left open, yes you may encounter an occassional harmelss insect...but the way I see it, thats what will happen when you pace a resort hotel in the jungle. It didnt ruin our trip, or affect us one bit. Housekeeping kept our mini bar stocked and our firdge full every day. A simple cash tip of one or two dollars per day to the housekeeping staff will ensure you will be treated like royalty. So why be cheap, tip the staff. We are planning t o return to playa del carmen in June...and we will seek to stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. Dont let the negative reviews dissuade you from coming...after all how bad can it be to lie in the sand with your toes in the warm carribean water. A bad day here is till probably far better than a good day at the office. Loosen up and enjoy yourself!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only for quiet people”
Reviews.Author: sproutess
Reviews.Content: We were originally staying at Playacar and got a letter about upgrading. We walked over to the Palace to have a look first and the first impression was beautiful. So we switched in the middle of our vacation. The hotel is beautiful to look at but that is all. Half of the staff that we dealt with acted like the guests were bothering them. ( I get that kind of service in the states!!) We are used to the staff being overly friendly at other Riu hotels. The food was so-so. And the other visitors at this hotel were by for not friendly to each other as in other resorts. We did not like the fact that the king beds were seperate mattresses put together. My husband actually fell between the cracks. We also would have thought that such a nice resort would fix any problems with the rooms but we had no extra lock on our door as others did and our shower head sprayed all over the place because it was cracked. This hotel is okay if you go on vacation to have quiet and to be by yourselves. If you go on vacation and want a little fun and nice service this resort is not the place to go. We wished we would have not so-called "upgrade" from the Playacar to the Palace.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ahenry
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Riu Palace and had a great time. The service was really great. Everyone from Silvana at the front desk to Enrique on the Animacion team, and all the waiters and waitresses and housekeepers. They all work very hard every day and they manage to always keep smiles on their faces. The resort itself is immaculately clean and well maintained. It's very beautiful. The rooms are very nice as well. The beach is a bit eroded, but it was still nice. We mainly stayed by the pool. This resort is in a great location and very close to 5th Avenue. We enjoyed going to town on one of the very cloudy days. The food is good as well. The breakfast buffet was delicious! The steakhouse at El Patio was very good and Sir Edward's gourmet restaurant was our favorite. The lamb chops were great there. We were really impressed with the Animacion team at the resort. We noticed how many hours they put in every day doing different activities with the guests during the day as well as providing great entertainment at night. It was really nice to not have to leave the resort if you didn't feel like it and still have a great time watching the shows and just hanging out. All in all, it was a great trip and we hope to come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its finest”
Reviews.Author: Deloresedina
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Riu Palace Riviera Mexico Feb. 9-16th. Service was absolutely wonderful. We ate at several of the specialty restaurants at the hotel including the Mexican, Brazilian, Steak House, French. They were all great. The buffet restaurant had multiple, varied choices. We were more than pleased. Maid service was good. She would come around in the evening to see if we needed more towels. The rooms were spacious. Lots of closet space & a jacuzzi in every room. We didn't have a good view. We looked at a building next door and were disappointed that we couldn't see the ocean. Also, we found there was a lot of walking because the property is huge & the main grounds are covered with tiles that are slippery when wet which they usually were. My husband has a heart condition and cannot walk distances in hot, humid weather so that was the one of the things we didn't like. Overall, you couldn't stay at a better place if you don't mind lots of walking.

Reviews.Title: “the beach sucks!”
Reviews.Author: pumaeyes4u
Reviews.Content: everything about this place was beautiful except the weather and teh beach...and these two are the reason why I go away! I was very disappointed in the beach and weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: ziggytt
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Riu Palace. The people who work there where very polite and helpful. Our Rep gave us plenty of information on tours and prices. The room size and view were great. I can go on and on about this destination. I also had the time to play a round of golf directly across the street. The service at the course was great also. One of the best things about Playa del Carmen is that it has a great town if you like to go out. We where able to go to clubs, shopping, and other thing off the ground of the resort. While we where in town we felt very safe. And if you want true Mexican food, you can get it in town.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Doug_Heffernan
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Riu Palace Mexico on January 10th. It was great from the food to the huge room. The service was top notch!! Another great option because you stay a the Palace you can use the other Riu hotels. We went to the Tequilla across the street and realize we booked a very nice hotel compare to that one...it was like college spring break over there!! The beach is lousy but you can walk a minute and be at the other Riu beach where the sand is unreal and beautiful. The buffett was great and they change the menu every day. We highly recommend this and will be back next year

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice but Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Tink3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from 12/27/07 through 1/2/08 and had a wonderful time but must say, as someone who has traveled to many places, I do not feel this is up to the 5 star rating. Food: The food was very good and our favorite was the Japanese restaurant. Although, we were a bit disappointed that it was not like the usual Japanese restaurants where they cook in front of you it was still very good. The buffet, we felt, was better then the specialty restaurants even though you have to serve yourself. Each night the buffet would have a different theme and the Chinese theme night was excellent. The duck was very moist and out of this world. The breakfast had many options and definitely something for everyone! Our favorite lunch was at the beach restaurant but the problem was trying to find a table to eat. This was always crowded and it was much easier to walk up to the Main buffet for seating but the lunch was more formal then what we wanted. Service: The service in the restaurants and buffet was very good. Always attentive and had our glasses filled as soon as they got low. The service from the front desk was bad. This hotel which is rated 5 stars had only one ice machine and that was located on the first floor. Why they have mini bars in the room and no ice machines on each floor is beyond me. Anyway, the ice machine on the first floor broke after our first day. We then had to call every day around 4:00 pm for ice to be brought to the room from the front desk so we could have a drink on the balcony. We would then wait one hour and have to call back or, after one hour, get a call from the front desk asking if our ice was delivered ok. When we would reply “no” we did not receive ice they would apologize and say “coming right up”. Just when were ready to leave for dinner around 6:00 the ice would show up! This went on day after day so it was not just an isolated incident. We did get a laugh from this because one day they took our ice bucket and not only did we not get ice but we never received our ice bucket back. Another annoying incident I must complain about was when the cushion from our seat was taken out from under us. We sat on the patio for drinks after the show and were asked for the cushion from under us so they could clean up. Now, if this was a cloth cushion I may think ok but this was a waterproof vinyl cushion which they take in at 12:00 pm and put back out at 8:00 am. Do not think 4 cushions left out would have hurt anything. I don’t want to sound like a complainer but I must also add this. My husband and I wanted a bottle of wine for our room and were told it was not possible. When Daisy came around to our Buffet table and asked if we needed anything we explained to her that we wanted a bottle of wine being our anniversary on the 29th. She said she could arrange it and what time did we want the wine delivered and we said around 4:00 pm. She also said she would also get us dinner reservations for 2 at Sir Edwards to celebrate because it was a special occasion we did not need to wake up at 8:00 am to make them. We never heard back about the dinner reservation and received no confirmation or bottle of wine in the room. My husband had to walk to the Yucatan next door and purchase a bottle for 20.00. Now, the challenge of getting someone to come up with a wine opener was the next task. Room: We had a Jacuzzi suite and our boys had a regular room. Our room had a beautiful layout with a walk in closet that had built in shelves and plenty of hangers. The beds were hard but we had no problem sleeping on them. The Jacuzzi was up on a separate floor of the suite and took at least 45 minutes to fill because if you put on just hot water it comes out very slow. We enjoyed it anyway while sipping our hot drinks (back to the ice machine problem). The tile floor in the rooms did constantly have moisture on them which made it very slippery. I would suggest packing shoes with rubber soles or it could become very slippery. I must say that I am not a fan of the dark wood used in the rooms. When in a tropical place I would prefer to have a light and airy feel and the dark wood made the rooms seem a bit drab and depressing. However, that may just be my thoughts I understand everyone has different taste. The rooms were always very clean and our beds turned down each night which was very nice. Beach: Considering all they lost during the hurricane it was much better then I expected. Yucatan was in bad shape and I would clearly be upset if I was staying there. They had a huge 8 foot drop off. Riu Palace did a great job restoring their beach and had about 4 rows of loungers on the beach on two sides. The sand walkway to the beach under the palm trees also had many loungers. We had no problem getting a lounger even during Christmas week but we did claim them at 8:30 am before breakfast so that could be why. My kids loved the whales (sandbags) in the water so they were not a problem. I think they created quite a fun thing for the teens, adults and kids to play, sit and jump off! I did notice when we arrived on the 27th we had drink service on the beach by the 30th the service stopped. I think it got so crowded with people coming in for the New Year they did not have spare help to walk around with drinks but it was quite nice while it lasted. In closing, we had a wonderful time and found this hotel clean but a bit outdated in places. The food was good especially in the buffet and the beach was still wonderful considering what they went through. Even though we experienced a few problems I always try to keep in mind that with so many different people it is hard to please everyone and small things are bound to happen at every hotel. My family had a fantastic vacation at the Riu Palace and even enjoyed spending time with a warm and friendly family we met through Trip Advisor

Reviews.Title: “Needs some "Fixing"”
Reviews.Author: AddictedToTravel01
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace Mexico is a beautiful resort with old world charm. It does however need some updating. We didn't start off great - we were left stranded at the Airport by Cancun Limo (not cancun valet) Rooms: a bit tired looking. bathrooms need updating. bring slippers as other reviews have said floors are sticky. We left tips for maids every day and found they just did the minimum.. At the paradisus the maids would scrub the room daily. Bring your own hairdryer - ours was rusted and barely worked. Beds were comfortable but two doubles pushed together. I assumed if you asked for a king they would make it up as one bed. This is not the case. If I was on my honeymoon I would be disappointed. They need to update the room key and safe key to credit card and code system for better security. Food: Our biggest complaint, the food is much better at royal hideaway and iberostar. We avoided AI because of buffets. When they started having specialty restraunts we got on board. Japenese was good but they don't cook in front of you as at other resorts. Others are not very good at all. Buffet is good but I don't like getting up between each course to get my food. The reservation times are 6:30 too early and 9:00 too late. The resort also does not have a wine list. they two kinds to choose from. Lunch at Don Julian is better than the buffet at the beach and you don't have to fight for a table. Bars: Our teenagers enjoyed the disco across the street. we enjoyed sitting outside at the Riu Courtyard Bar. We were actually having a glass of wine with wonderful couple we meet on TripAdvisor. It was about 12:10 the bar closes at 12 and the waiter came over to ask us for our seat cushions. As first we didn't understand what he was saying then he pointed. We were shocked to have the cushions at an outdoor bar taking from underneath us at closing time. Grounds: Beautiful - tile gets very slippery be careful Beach - we all know mother nature took it away, you are on top of eachother, there is room under the palm trees but it not as close to the water. The whales are fun to play on in the water. bring bug spray for night even if you don't see bugs they are around All in all I feel we overpaid for this resort. It cost us more than the Royal Service Plan we got at the Paradisus last year. Its in need of renovations and better food.

Reviews.Title: “Average resort”
Reviews.Author: Savvy_NYer52
Reviews.Content: I love Mexico and keep going back almost every other year to various parts of the country. This was my third time in this area. I went with my family from Dec 22-29, 2007 hoping to spend an unusual Holiday season. Here are my quick assesments: Service: 9/10 (very efficient friendly people) Food: 5/10 (plentiful but very average material and cooking) Drinks: 4/10 (very few top shelf liquor; most of the others are watered down which was ok with me because my 19 year old was guzzling them down!!) Accomodation: 5/10 (very small bathrooms with ineffective central exhaust; terrible mattresses; frayed towels; whole hotel smells musty and smokey) Decor: 5/10 (yellow rooms with vivid coral pink highlights is not exactly visually soothing; the other newer Rui Palace next door seemed better at least externally) Beach: 3/10 (not their fault; the whole area is destoyed by hurricane/ erosion and very little of the natuarl beach is left) Value: 5/10 (maybe possible to get a better place with the same money though I may have paid higher rates because of the holidays). Town: 5th ave was nice especially for teenagers and twenty somethings; there were some nice bars; food at Casa De Agua was expensive but very good. Other actvities: Sailing and lunch on CataMaya, the catamarran, was very nice. Will I go back? Probably not to this hotel or even to Playa Carmen until they can reclaim the beach. I heard the Mayakoba area nearby will have some high end hotels and resort in 2008.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FifiGlasgow_Scotland
Reviews.Content: We went to Rui Palace for our honeymoon. The first week at the hotel was lovely, weather was beautiful and the food was great-good chioce even for fussy people! Then I ended up with an upset stomach-three times!! Although I do like salads and was warned off them, I didnt learn! The staff were all very friendly, especially the tall manager woman. We booked and paid for a trip, via Thomson, and they advised us we had to make our own way there. When we arrived nobody seemed to know where we were going and the taxi driver brought us back-communication was poor. The rooms are of a 3 star standard, certainly not 5 star. We had to move bacuse of cockroaches. We complained and were advised that they were common in the Carribean, however I wouldn't have thought this on the 3rd floor? The hotel was also very tired and the rooms smelled of dampness on occasion. We also got hit by hurricane Dean. The hotel turned from being beautiful to being all boarded up, which ruined our honeymoon, although the hotel were very good at questions etc. I wouldn't return to this hotel as I feel the money you spend is not what you pay for. It is good for all people and the beach was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: jck76
Reviews.Content: RIU Palace is a nice all-inclusive hotel, but far from the best I've stayed at. The food is just okay as is the entertainment. The beach is nice, but crowded and you will do some walking to get around the property. Overall, the rooms are clean and quiet and it is a $5 cab ride into the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: darwin1905
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner from 28th November through to 12th December. I have travelled to many hotels in the world and I must say that this was the best overall hotel I have stayed in. The food is really fantastic - there is such a great range of food and it is all of superb quality - it's really difficult to know what to choose. We didn't go into the specialty restaaurants as they operate a rather daft booking system which means that you have to queue at 8.30am to book your place. As we went diving at 8.00am every morning, we were unable to do this, so that was a bit unfortunate. The staff are all extremely helpful, and friendly and there is always someone around to help whatever you need. The service in the restaurants and bars is fantastic and consistently so. The room was kept very clean, although I do agree there was generally a slight musty smell - however, you must remember that the room is air conditioned and that this part of the world is generally very humid, so it's something that is difficult to avoid. I was not particularly keen that in the general reception and lobby area, this was not a smoke free zone and did come as a bit of a shock, bearing in mind the recent change to smoking laws in the UK, but of course this is a different country so you can't expect the same laws to apply. However, it was never THAT smokey. The grounds are beatifully maintained and there are always people working hard. I didn't feel that you were expected to provide tips, but we did where we found that exceptional service had been given (which was most of the time!) and these were always greatly appreciated. I know that some guests were quite generous in providing tips in the restaurant and staff gave special attention to these people by reserving tables and decorating them with flowers etc. Us Brits don't like to be made a fuss of, in fact I could think of nothing worse than being made a spectacle of in the restaurant, so if you don't want a big fuss, then be warned. I have noticed comments by other members on this page to say that drinks were watered down with inferior brands. I can honestly say that we did not experience this - the optics in the rooms were big brands names such as Smirnoff and Bacardi - can you seriously believe that they would bother putting other brands in the bottle? They were about £5.00 at the airport duty free and I am sure that the hotel would secure bulk buys at much less than this. The beds are quite hard - I suffer from back pain, but I must say that I did not have a particular problem with the bed, despite this. On a more negative note, the erosion of the beach is quite extensive, whilst this is not the fault of the hotel, you should think twice about booking this hotel if you like a pleasant dip in the sea. The dregding activities to restore the beach involve huge sandbags around the beach together with lots of pipes and cables, which quite frankly could be quite dangerous. However, all in all, a superb hotel with fantastic food and helpful staff. I would not hesitate to reccomend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: RajWaterloo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Palace 1st week of Dec/07. Really enjoyed it. Travelled with 2 couples, 35-40 yrs of age. Beautiful grounds, excellent service, nice rooms. Food was AMAZING. The buffet was so good, you dont need to book the specialty restaurants (although they were good too). The beach took a bit of a beating from the hurricanes, but still very beautiful, and enough room to enjoy, no worries. My only complaint would be the night life. We were looking for a little more entertainment, it was ok, but kind of mellow for our taste. Alot of older people there. Still, we made our own fun. The Riu Tequilla is right across the street with a disco thats pretty good. The Riu next door was a little more lively, so we went there too. Lots of options. Go ahead and book this one, you wont be dissappointed. We've travelled to many islands over the years and this one is definately great. Enjoy, but watch out for the tequilla!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: vacationguyOmaha
Reviews.Content: My wife and I go to Mexico every April and always stay at RIU properties. This hotel was very clean, and the staff was helpful and courteous the entire time. The beach was fantastic, which is very important to us. We were a little concerned about the Cancun/Playa area because of the hurricanes, but this resort and other RIU properties were as good as new. The food was good, but a little mundane after a few days. My only complaint, or what I found a little strange, was the fact that in a couple of the restaurants, men must wear long pants instaed of shorts. I didn't take any long pants, so we just didn't eat at either of those on-site restaurants. I guess next time, I'll stick a pair in the suitcase. In fact, we're going back to the same resort this year. Overall....very nice.

Reviews.Title: “riu is good”
Reviews.Author: pjdToronto
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are the best of the best..They actually remember your name after the first meeting..The hotel is a class act in all areas..We had a wonderful 2 weeks..

Reviews.Title: “RIU does it again!”
Reviews.Author: Missriupalace
Reviews.Content: My 6th year in a row celebrating Thanksgiving at the Riu Palace Mexico and after reading the past few reviews, I absolutely could not take it any longer - For those of you that are complaining about the beach erosion - that is what would be called "Mother Natrure" - there was nothing that anyone could have done about it - apparantly it doesn't happen in your seaside communities wherever you have come from. The hotel was not responsible for it and they are trying deal with - I have been to this hotel the last 6 years in a row and unfortunately "Mother Nature" took her vacation there as well..............so as a frequent guest of the hotel by all means those of you that promise not to come back to this hotel......I Thank you from the bottom of my heart! As for the Riu staff - again, the best in the business. The food just keeps getting better year after year. Cleaning staff, undeniably the best, the place is spotless! Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back”
Reviews.Author: tlb1492
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Riu Palace Mexico over the American Thanksgiving Holiday (Nov. 18-24). We loved it the first time (2004) and were a little anxious to know if it would live up to our wonderful memories and IT DID! The ride from the airport was routine and went very smoothly. Our room was great, although we only received one towel "animal" our entire stay, and that was after leaving a tip. We asked for a mattress pad upon check in and that made a huge difference. The room did smell a bit musty, but if you travel in the tropics, that is something that isn't unexpected. The grounds were immaculately manicured and beautiful, especially knowing that all of the trees in the main courtyard had lost their tops in Hurricane Wilma just 2 years ago. We only went to the pool once; it's a little too cold for us. We spent nearly every day on the sand under a palm tree, it was amazing. Yes, the beach is eroded significantly, but neither the Riu or any other resort is responsible, it's called Mother Nature. We watched the Riu employees work to fill very large sandbags every day and hope that those measures will help. If you want a flat beach to walk along, the beach just south of the Riu, by maybe 4 resorts, begins to flatten out and wasn't crowded at all. We also had a massage on the beach, we highly recommend that, very relaxing. The food was fantastic, which we thought was surprising for a buffet. We dined at Don Julian all but one night, when we went to Sir Edwards. We were disappointed with the service at Sir Edwards; it was very slow, however the food was good. I think our favorite meal was breakfast; we would sit and chat for 2-3 hours, enjoying mimosas and cappuccinos. The drinks were great unless your objective was to be drunk by lunchtime every day, which we had no interest in. The service was fantastic! Everyone was very friendly, except for maybe the poor fella raking the sand at 5:45am everyday, but he was the exception. We would recommend the Riu Palace Mexico to everyone we know.

Reviews.Title: “dangerous beach”
Reviews.Author: captainr0n
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the palace from nov 26 to dec 3. the rooms are great ,good food , outstanding service . the problem is the beach . some reviews said the beach was eroded but no one mentionned the incredible number of sharp rocks sticking out in the water. we had a party of 8 adults. the first day 3 of us got some pretty serious scratches on our legs and knees . the second day we tried real hard to find a decent place to get into the ocean without these sharp rocks. we even tried the beach on the riu playacar side with the same result. so we ended up staying at the pool for the rest of the week. this was my third and last stay at this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “5 stars? Well Riu, do your homework!”
Reviews.Author: tingado
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed from Nov. 25 through Dec. 4. The transport from the airport with Olympus was ok. The check in was quick and very professional. Our room was o.k., though not clean, hairs from the last guests everywhere. The floor was so dirty that I kept my flip flops on all the time. The bed was not very comfortable but ok, still I would expect better from a 5 star hotel. Fresh towels were provided every day, many with ugly spots and most times some towels were missing. The mini bar was not restocked every day (we only had the water and soda, though there was plenty of beer and liquor), only after talking to the assistant director (very nice and helpful), this was resolved. There was always a slightly musty smell in the room (courtyard, 2nd floor) and when we unpacked our suitcases back home, everything smelled really musty. The service in the restaurant, at the lobby bar and at the pool was impeccable and very friendly. Santoyo is great, he is responsible for the service at the terrace section in the buffet restaurant. We only tried the Sir Edwards of all the specialty restaurants and the service there also was very good. The service at lunch time was horrible, especially at the beach restaurants and so was the food. The waiters there were slow and uninterested. Overall we were not so happy with the food. After 3 days we had seen it all and it was just a repetition of minor quality meat (once undercooked chicken!), some vegetables, boring pasta and a boring starter buffet. The calamari and shrimps on the other hand were excellent. There was a Mexican buffet in a corner of the restaurant, but it was the same food every day too. The dinner in the Sir Edwards was of mediocre quality, but it was nice to have it served. The breakfast on the other hand was very good. The drinks and wine were somehow ok. The drinks were watered down and mixed with minor quality liquor, we had to ask to get branded spirits. The juices for the drinks were only some kind of reconstituted stuff. The wine list showed wines (Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot from Chile eg.) that were not offered (“sorry, we don´t have them”), only cheap Portuguese and Spanish wine. Astonishingly the Cab and the Merlot (ok. quality) were offered at the Riviera Maya at the bar – we could not find out if they offer it in the restaurant too since the Riu policy only allows you to go to the other Riu hotel bars and discos, not the restaurants). We always gave plenty of tip, we liked the service in general and some people did an outstanding job. We would have appreciated the maid not only accepting the tip but doing a better cleaning job. Be careful, the walk ways are very slippery. The beach was almost non existent. They are working on it, but how long will it take? We saw no progress during our stay. We stayed at the pool which was ok and there were enough umbrellas. Internet access was only offered in the lobby and the charge was 8 Dollars/hour or 15 for 24, even when you have your own laptop and just want to use the wireless service. The bandwidth was not great and on top not even stable. One sad thing in the end: our friends left a couple of days earlier than we did and they called us right after finding out that they had left a cell phone in the night stand. After many fruitless conversations with the reception staff and the assistant director the hotel staff was not able to retrieve the phone. We will definitely not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOved the Riu”
Reviews.Author: girlstime
Reviews.Content: Everything went like clockwork even though my daughter broke her foot the day before we left. As we got off the plane, we were given a wheelchair for her and told just to leave it at the front door of the airport. We booked our shuttle with Cancun Valet which picked us up promptly. They were reasonably priced and we had our own van. We also had booked a return trip to the airport and they were there on time to pick us up also. The staff at the Riu Palace Mexico was so pleasant, helpful and accomodating. They even had a wheelchair for my daughter to use while she was there. I can't imagine what our vacation would have been like without it. The rooms were clean and welcoming. The beds were comfortable. The food was marvelous and we never had a problem getting a dinner reservation. It was great having entertainment right there and the acts were terrific. The activity directors were friendly and energetic. There was so much to do we didn't get to do it all. 5th Avenue (downtown) was a cheap $5.00 cab ride away but there was also a nice little shopping area within a few blocks of the hotel. I would definately return to the Rui Palace Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort, Fantistic Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Marrc6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Riu Palace Mexico from 11/15/to 11/22/07. I have been to four other all inclusive resorts and I have to say this one is by far the best. Upon arrival, I asked if it would be possible to have a courtyard view room. After a minute of checking the deskman, Ron said it was our lucky day. He gave us an awesome room with a great view of the pool area, the fountains and Cozumel’s lights at night. This would have been an extra $25 a day through my travel agent, so I’m glad I waited and asked for it when I got there. The room itself was very large. It had 10 foot ceilings, a sunken living area, separate bath area, and a nice balcony. The beds were firm, but we both slept great every night. The mini bar was great too, always stocked each day. I thought the food was great. The buffet was the best I’ve seen. Each night was a different theme, but always a good assortment of different food. I never have eaten as much seafood in one week. Shrimp, mussels, calamari, lobster, fish and clams were my favorites. The even serve wine and bottled beer at your dinner table. The buffet was so good; we only tried one of the other specialty restaurants, Sir Edward. We both enjoyed it as well. The service was impeccable, there was always someone asking if everything was OK and if you needed anything. I tipped well every time; I brought lots of ones and fives just for that purpose I know it’s an all inclusive, and many people (especially Europeans) feel it is not necessary to leave ANY tip, but these people work very hard to please the guests and they are very poor compared to the people that stay there. Several times I saw groups of six, eight or ten get up and not leave anything, it irked me. The beach was badly eroded, but you can’t blame the resort for that. I was told a plan was in place to try to restore it. If you want the best beach at a Riu down there Riu Playacar still has a more sloping beach. It’s a great place, so don’t hesitate to go.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but NO beach...”
Reviews.Author: Fairviews
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Nov3-7. The location is nice and the resort is pretty but there is No beach left at all from the errosion. This upset us since we like to walk on the beach and could not due to the cliff... We also were not aware there are no ocean view rooms here, just courtyard. The food was good, but not great. The service was exceptional all the time. The night life was for the 50 something year old crowd. The played music in the courtyard which I thought was for an older crowd. We are in our mid 30's. We have been to Riu Cancun, Riu Palace Macao in Punta Cana and Riu Ocho Rios. This was our least favorite. We loved Jamaica the best. I hope somehow they are able to rebuild the beach, but we will not return to this Riu.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: sunlover00
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend (in our early 30's) spend 1 week at Riu Palace Mexico from Nov 5- Nov 12, 2007. I love to travel and this has been my 3rd time in Mexico, I have also been to Cuba, Dominican Republic, Hawaii, Spain, Greece, Italy, France, Czech, Croatia...….. Rating: Truly 5* 1. TRANSPORTATION: from the airport to the Riu Palace Mexico (about 1hr) booked through Entertainment-plus.net with Brant- the cost was $95 return Excellent service, no credit card necessary. Highly recommended 2. CHECK IN: smooth, very helpful and professional staff 3. ROOMS: 2 double beds, mini-bar stocked with beer, water, soft drinks, alcohol dispenser in the room, TV with US channels, balcony, large bathroom - Very nice Housekeeping: Excellent 4. SERVICE: TOP NOTCH! 5* Service. The waiters are working very hard to keep everyone happy. Front desk is very helpful so is everyone else working in the resort!!!! Bring a lot of $1 bills because they deserve to be tipped!!!! 5. FOOD: Excellent even for my picky boyfriend who is an amazing cook. He really enjoyed the lamb in Sir Edward Steak house. The Buffet: breakfast, lunch and dinner - all amazing, lot of choices, great cheese selection, and beef cooked to perfection. Different theme every night e.g.: Italian, Japanese, Mediterranean, Chefs special.. Specialty restaurants: Japanese, Steak House, French and Brazilian Steak house - need to make reservation at 8:30 am - amazing food, excellent service Room service: every day until 11pm 6. DRINKS: brand name drinks: Bacardi, Smirnoff, Absolute, Bailey's, Canadian Club Ray and many more - excellent Mixed drinks: Martinis, Pina colada, Miami vice and many others - Very good 7. GROUNDS: Beautiful!!!! 8. BEACH: I am a beach lover. I’ve been to amazing beaches in Cuba, Dominican Republic, Spain… The beach is beautiful until you get to the actual shoreline. The shoreline has been washed away. There is a plan to have it fixed early next year. If you are a beach lover unfortunately this is not a place for you. The water is warm and beautiful. If you are looking to get pampered this is where you should be… I would highly recommend this resort for mature, sophisticated couples and honeymooners.. You will fall in love with this place from the minute you walk out of the cab. IT'S ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! AND THE SERVICE IS TOP NOTCH! My boyfriend is very picky guy when it comes to food, service and vacations. He would definitely return to Riu Palace Mexico any time!

Reviews.Title: “For those traveling with babies and those booking through Sunquest....”
Reviews.Author: meeOntario
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Riu Palace from Nov.9-16, 2007. We booked our trip through itravel2000 and it was a Sunquest package. Sunquest now offers travelers the option to pay for private transportation to and and from the hotel. We thought this was a great option since we would be traveling with a one year old and could go straight to our hotel rather than riding on the bus/shuttle and stopping at several hotels to drop people off on the way to ours. We were supposed to have a suburban but instead were driven in a Chevy Malibu. It was a tight fit for 2 adults and a car seat in the back seat plus fitting in our bags and stroller. However, not such a big deal. It was a big deal though when the car overheated on the highway outside of Playa del Carmen and the driver told us we had to get out. He didn't speak English very well but told us that we'd have to get out and his buddy would pick us up. We were beside ourselves. It was late, very dark and we had a baby with us! Fortunately, his friend pulled up as he was unloading our suitcases from his car and we were driven straight to our hotel. We had the same original driver in the Malibu to go back to the airport and we had no problems. Be aware though that you will most likely be driven in a small car and not what is written on your voucher unless you are traveling with a large group. The hotel was beautiful - I can't say enough. The rooms are large with a sunken living room and a deck. Our deck faced the courtyard and we were close to the pool so we didn't hear the noise from the theatre and terrace at night. We never actually got to go to any shows because we were back in our room at 7:30 every night to put our daughter to bed. We also didn't get to eat at any of the restaurants because our daughter couldn't make the late sittings (early sitting is at 6:30 but meals end around 8:00/8:30) and the buffet at 6:30 was already pushing it. The hotel has a really nice terrace and the bar there serves drinks in the evening. Riu has a new drink menu with martinis and all types of cocktails and the drinks were really good....best margarita I have ever tasted! The piano bar in the lobby is open until 6am and then it re-opens a few hours later. It has a slightly smoky, musty smell and I much preferred the piano bar at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya as it was much larger and has huge windows overlooking the courtyard/pool/ocean. The beach at the Riu Palace Mexico is better than at the Palace Riviera. At the Palace Riviera you are landlocked in front of the hotel because the beach has eroded on both sides. At the Riu Palace Mexico, you can still walk in the direction away from town. I couldn't believe the condition of the beaches - completely changed from our last trip in 2004. The erosion is so bad and Riu doesn' t seem to be doing much at any of its properties. Other hotels have sand-bagged piers but Riu Palace Mexico just had a few sand bags but no piers. When the tide is high, you can't access the beach at all. I've uploaded pictures of the beach in front of Riu Palace Mexico. They are actually losing palm trees as the beach erodes and I think they lost the massage hut at the Yucatan next door. We didn't spend much time on the beach though as our daughter preferred the pool. We also never had any trouble finding an umbrella for shade at the pool - unlike other all-inclusives where you have to stake your territory by 7am. We were able to get an umbrella at any time of day. For those traveling with kids I have to comment on the cribs. I will be writing a letter to Riu to complain. Our crib was falling apart and it had springs which are illegal in Canada as baby's head can get caught between them. The mattress didn't even fit the crib so the springs were exposed on the sides. When the crib was brought to our room, there was a big blanket under the mattress and on top of the mattress.
