Our daughter refused to sleep in it because it was way too soft but after I pulled out the blankets my husband refused to put her in the crib because it was such a safety hazard. The Sunquest rep brushed it off and told us Mexico's standards were different but it was not acceptable. i would have brought our Pack n Play had I known. I absolutely loved this hotel but I had to rate it 4/5 because the crib totally changed our trip. We weren't able to put our daughter to bed and sit on the deck because we worried about her rolling off the bed (yes, she slept with us all week!) The anxiety of her sleeping with us in our bed changed the tone of the vacation but we still had a great time. I plan on bringing our Pack n Play next time so hopefully Sunquest doesn't nickel dime us and charge us for extra luggage! Aside from our issues with the crib, I highly recommend this hotel - nicest all-inclusive we've ever been too.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: world_traveler035
Reviews.Content: The resort itself was beautiful and clean. The customer service by far was one of the best I have encountered. I think the resort is a little over rated, maybe 3-4 star. I was immediately turned off by the smell of my room. We went with 43 other people. Request a room other than ground floor if you go, this seemed to be the area that smelled the worst. But who is always in their room I asked myself? So I got over it . The food was excellent as Sir Edwards and at the Buffet. I didnt care for the Brazillian steakhouse, we left in the middle of dinner and went to the buffet, which was always great. If you starve to death or die of deydration at this place, its your own fault. There is always someone asking if you need anything. If you want to make reservations at the specialty restaurants, you better be in the theater by 8:00am that morning, or they fill up. I was seriously disappointed by the fact that there is no beach..it is a cliff due to erosion. I enjoy walks along the beach in the morning and at night. Not worth the effort unless you like climbing hills until you get about four resorts down. I am definitly a pool person. The pool was beautiful but we were only able to stay in it one day because it was so cold, and I mean cold. The aerobics staff couldnt even get people in it to do them. I did not understant that at all it was 86 and hot every day. It was almost like they iced it down. We ordered room service a couple of times, the lunch menue is great, everything was good, not much of a dinner menue though..but there is always, again, a great buffet..he entertainment was good, nothing spectacular but enjoyable. Again I cannot emphasize enough on how great the service was, but unfortunately, that would not bring me back. The shopping on 5th avenue is near the resort, 5 minutes and 5 dollars in a cab. Go at night, there is a lot going on in the nightlife. We went deep see fishing while were there, it was great. Also ask about the Dinner sunset cruise (surf and turf) This was the best spent money ever, for about 80.00 a person. Its beatiful and you'll feel like Kings and Queens on one of the top ten beaches in the world. We left at 3:30 and was back by around 10:00. I only would not go back for the reasons of the beach and the pool, and the smell and the fact that there are too many places in the world to go to the same place twice...I think we are going to the Riu in Jamaica next. Looks gorgeous... Lea Cheatham

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rui Mexico”
Reviews.Author: wyzzer
Reviews.Content: Went to the Riu Mexico for 5 days in early November and had a great time. Seven girlfriends from grade school got together for the week to celebrate our 50th birthdays. The hotel was great. Rooms very spacious and comfortable. Staff was excellent. Very polite and helpful. Never had to wait for anything. Property is absolutely beautiful. Food was very good. Loved trying Japanese for the first time. Activities were so much fun. Water aerobics, beach party, and so many others if you wanted to do them. QuiQui and Christian were awesome. They really look like they enjoy their jobs. They are so friendly and energetic. Also, find Jose for a body massage on the beachfront. Unbelievably professional and excellent at his job. The beach was a bit washed out in front of our area, but that didn't stop us from walking down a little bit to a larger area. It was not a problem for us. We went into town to eat and celebrate at AJUA. A must for fun and great food. Also went to Rolandi's for Italian. Awesome pizza and pasta. We owe that fun to Omar, our travel representative. Only thing I wouldn't recommend is the snorkel trip with "Paradise". It wasn't what I'm used to. Water was way too rough and I couldn't enjoy it. I wish I had been told about another option for snorkeling in calmer waters. All in all, it was a wonderful trip and I would recommend it to anyone. Only have one recommendation for the resort. Maybe move the beach chairs away from the Massage huts. Too much conversation nearby might interfere with the peacefulness of the massage. All in all, great place to vacation. My first experience with an all-inclusive and it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: HoopsSurrey
Reviews.Content: My girlfiend and I stayed from October 22nd for 2 weeks and after a long and labourious research time on this website, choosing the hotel, I can honestly say it was worth the time spent doing it. Pro's It is the best hotel in playacar (which I found out is where all the hotels are in the Playa del carmen area, 5 min cab from playa del carmen). The food is excellent (which was a priority when looking for hotels, as was the beach). Buffet or choice of 4 restuarants (you have to book for 8.30-10.30am but never fully booked) or buffet (hot and cold) which is just as good and food differs every day and night. Loads of seafood, steaks of all meat varieties, mexican food. Breakfasts were also amazing, eggs to order etc. The quality was spot on, as I have been to all inclusives before where the food is sub standard. The beach was great despite the warnings you get of the small size because of the storm damage (removing a a lot of the sand, thus reducing the size). All of Playa del carmen/Playcar has been effected and the Riu Palace is the best beach front hotel. By the time you read this they will be repairing the beaches anyway. Always enough sun loungers and a beach bar just behind you, where you can go and chill on a hammock if you want to get out of the sun. Service. Unbelievable. The mexicans are very kind people and here they are no exception. As you finish your drink, they are there to give another one. Facilities. All the other Riu hotels are around you or next door and you can use all their facilities. There always activities going on in the day that the staff try and get you to do (air rifle shooting, volleyball, bingo!?, pool aerobics etc). If you fancy a 'club' type atmosphere you can go across to the Riu Tequila that has a 'disco' open until the very early hours. Entertainment Amazing dancers and there is a Micahel Jackson lookalike, who I have to say is impressive (moves not voice, he mimes). They do make an effort and I was pleasantly suprised, as this type of enteratainment is usually poor. Cons There aren't any really. I'm sure the drink is slightly watered down but I think this is to stop the Americans getting too drunk! Besides, its not like you have to pay for drinks is it? Summary Not the hotel for teeangers or singles or anyone below 25 (unless you've been married a while and have calmed down!). It is positioned for nearer middled aged couples/married demographic. I'm 33 and it was fine for my girlfriend and me, as if you wanted a livelier atmos just go to the tequila or into play del carmen!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: Micoco
Reviews.Content: Hi fellow readers! I´ve been reading the reviews of this hotel for 4 months before going. A friend of mine had recommended it, so I trusted him in the decision. When I finally arrived, after seeing so many pics, it was as if I knew it by heart. No surprises.... All in all, we had a great time. I know, after reading and reading, why people like or don´t like the hotel. Opinions are very personal and subjective, and the factors that matter to some people, aren´t the same that matter to others. The hotel itself is impressive. It might be older than the RPRV, but I didn´t mind that. Also the pool is quite smaller, but again, I spent all the time on the beach, so the pool size wasn´t also a big deal. If you only care about the pool, this is definetly not the Riu for you. You have 4 others to choose from. The beach was perfect then, but that shouldn´t be a decision factor, cause one day it´s fine, the next day is totally eroded. That happens to all the hotels, so keep in mind that it can happen to anyone. The rooms are very spacious. I didn´t like the double beds put together, I prefer a simple king, but I guess is their style....Of course we used one queen at a time. Never used both. When we arrived, we were given a garden view room (what we had paid of course) but my husband asked the bellboy if there was a chance for an upgrade. After a simple phone call to Erwin (the bellboy boss I think), we had to wait till 3 PM, but we got a great room, very close to the beach, looking onto the courtyard. I didn´t mind the garden view room, specially because it was on the second floor, and we had all the privacy we could get because the only thing that could watch us were trees. But my husband liked the new room on the ground level better, where we had to watch out from walking naked inside cause it was on the people's way to the beach. So again, it depends on what you prefer..... I also think the airconditioner was not working well, cause it was too cold, but there is a chance I didn´t know how to regulate it, so we didn´t turn it on and that´s it. About the towel animals, only got 2 in the 7 days... Don´t know if it was because they didn´t like us, or because we woke up later than most of the guests, and it was too late... We will never know.... The food was fine, always plenty to choose from. Everything tasted great. We only tried 3 of the especiality restaurants. The Brazilian, the Stakehouse and the Gourmet. Ate great the 3 times. I know people had problems with the booking, but I don´t know how that can be improved. The restaurants aren´t that big. It´s impossible to fit all the hotel guests inside. So I guess it is the fairest way to everyone to make the booking early in the morning. I particularly been there 2 or 3 times too late, but I didn´t complain, the buffet is just as good. The desserts kind of dissapointed me, I expected more of a 5 star hotel. But the ice-creams or the chocolate fountain saved me from my sweet desires. The drinks were THE BEST. Amazing. Between Hiram, David, Miguel and Mariely (our favourite 4 bartenders) I never had my hand empty. The Banana Mamas & the Piñas Coladas were heaven. The only complain in the matter is that the hotel uses a cheaper kind of Baylies....not the real one, but´s it is OK, cause we went for the tropical drinks instead..... And last, but not least, the animation. I don´t know if it is because we are very easy-going people, but we had a great time, all the time. If we weren´t playing darts, it was bingo, or bochiball, or riffle shooting. Since we were almost the same in each activity, we made lots of friends. And became a big group hanging out together all the time. I want to thank the animation team that made all this possible, in particular Ale, Quique, Cris & Aida. The night shows, weren´t Las Vegas, but enough entertaining. My favourite was the Mr. Riu contest, but that maybe because my husband won the title.... :) Thanks RIU for the unforgettable time we spent over there!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palace”
Reviews.Author: NJLynn
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace October 29th to Nov. 7th We had a great time at the Palace. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is fantastic. We had no problems at all. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. They could not do enough for you and, in fact, Daisy, the hostess at the restaurant, stopped by our table several times to ask if there was anything we needed in our room or anything at all they could do to make our stay more pleasant! We couldn’t think of a thing! Guests were about 20 t0 25% American, I'd estimate. The rest Europeans, South Americans and a few Canadians. Met lots of nice people, particularly Brits. More children than I expected but it was never a problem. Rooms were great, nice sitting area, lots of drawer space. Maids kept room very clean, turn down service at night. Beds were hard but we slept really well there. Food was great. We preferred the buffet to the ala cartes, never felt that way at any other all-inclusive. You did have to make reservations in the morning but never had more than 8 or 10 people in line and it moved quickly. Five minutes in line tops (at 8:30). I think many ate at the buffet instead. Presentation was lovely, waiters were constantly filling your glass and removing plates. Entertainment was as good as any and better than at some resorts we’ve been to, although we don’t care for the audience participations shows which were about twice a week. The animation team always stopped to say hi. The bands in the gazebo were very good, as was the piano player in the lobby bar. Pool is very nice, never crowded, lots of loungers. Pool wait service was very good. The beach unfortunately washed away before our eyes. I would say 10 feet of beach disappeared while we there and a huge 4 foot drop off appeared, making access to the beach in front of the hotel difficult, we walked to the Yucatan where the drop was a little less. They brought trays of drinks, alcoholic and non-alcoholic to you. Checked out the other Rius but kept coming back to the palace. The Yucatan was nice and had a nice pool. There was quite a bit of topless on the beach if that concerns you (didn’t bother us). We had no problem carrying keys to the room or safe, always have some little bag with us or you can put them in your pocket. We have stayed at the Iberostars (Tucan and Del Mar) , Palladium Grand and Occidental Xcaret and while each hotel has it's own strengths, I must say we found the service, food and rooms here the best we've seen so far. I am posting pictures of the beach, darn that Mother Nature!

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional resort”
Reviews.Author: DavidKToronto
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from October 20 to November 3rd. Three of us stayed for one week and three stayed for two. We were there to celebrate a significant birthday and we were not disappointed. This is an all around good resort. The service is fantastic. From check-in to check out the staff make every effort to make sure you are well taken care of. In the lobby bar you finish one drink and the floor manager is there to take your order for the next. You pull out a cigarette and a waiter suddenly appears out of no where to light it for you. The service in all of the restaurants is great. Speaking of the restaurants, you can hardly believe this is an all inclusive. The food is great by any standard. Sir Edwards is the best restaurant in all of our opinions, but the Japanese is also very good as is the steakhouse. Le Bodega (brazilian) is ok, but you have to be true carnivore with little regard for potatoes and greens. The buffet is also very good, so if you get up too late to reserve your ala carte for the evening, don't despair you will still have a good meal. Keep in mind that men must wear long pants for dinner, even in the buffet. Also, if you have a special occasion they will decorate your table for you in advance. We had our breakfast buffet table done up for the birthday, and also our table at Sir Edwards. The drinks are fabulous. A great selection of top shelf liquor. They have a great martini menu. There are liquor dispensors in your room and the bottles are replaced immediately when getting low. You get four beer per day in the mini bar, but leave a note and a little tip and you will get more. The rooms themselves are very nice. We had a junior suite. It was well appointed and was a good size. The beach was beautiful when we got there. It was big, but it sort of washed away on the last day. There was still plenty of beach to lay on, but it was half its previous size. I think it's a cyclical thing. We did have a couple of mild complaints. The pool is not the best. The layout cuts it into two smaller pools and the pool bar scene wasn't very exciting. However, 5 of us were beach people so it didn't bother us much. If you are looking for a fabulous pool book Riu Palace Mayan Riviera. It appears to have the quality of Palace Mexico with a much nicer pool. Another complaint was the lack of night life. After dinner there was a Mexican band playing in the court yard, but it was basically elevator music. Very boring. Fortunately staying at the palace allows you access to Riu Tequila where we went for some evening entertainment. AS far as tours are concerned, pass on the Apple Chit Chin Etsa (?) tour. The tour itself was ok, but for lunch they pack you into an over crowed barely air conditioned restaurant shoulder to shoulder with people you don't know. This is after walking in 40 degree heat. The bus ride takes most of the day. Do go on the CATAMAYA catamaran. It's four hours of fun and snorkeling. Overall, this was an excellent holiday. It was more expensive than your standard 4 or 5 star, but it was well worth it. We would go back and we certainly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service!!”
Reviews.Author: reenie56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RPM October 6 through October 10th. This was my first trip to Playa. I loved this resort from the minute I stepped out of the cab. The service here is excellent. The staff can't do enough to keep you happy. I would hardly finish one drink before the bartender was giving me another! The wait staff , the room attendants and the front desk staff were all helpful and friendly. The room was lovely and spacious. The maid was in twice a day and kept it spotless and kept our refrigerator filled with water and soda. The weather was just okay when I was there...it rained like crazy a couple of days....but the food was fantastic and the drinks were plentiful and there was nothing to complain about. We ate at the steak house one night, very good...a huge steak that I could not finish and endless champagne...yum! We also ate at the Japanese restaurant one night and it was very good... excellent sushi and tempura and chicken yakatori. I wish I was back there now. The beach is probably the best part. Nice soft sand. Lots of loungers. Warm water. A massage on the beach. I'd go back in a minute!!!

Reviews.Title: “Non-smokers beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beechluver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the RIU Palace Mexico and had mixed feelings about it. We had emailed the resort twice before arriving requesting a room facing the fountains close to the pool. Our travel agent also emailed the resort. When we arrived we were given a room facing a brick wall on the back of the resort. When we walked into the room it smelled so strongly of cigar smoke and anticeptic/ammonia that it literally brought tears to your eyes! Horrible smell! Then the fan didn't work and the door latch was broken. I immediately went back to the front desk and asked politely if we could have a different room and the lady at the front desk who was less than friendly about it and told me to come back tomorrow. I went back the next morning and they did switch us to a courtyard view room but it was right across from the theater and very noisy in the evenings until 11:00 - which is fine except when you are sick and trying to sleep. Here are the pros and cons of the RIU Palace (IMHO): Rooms - average View - Below average (we looked out at another brick wall all week) Food - Good (except I got so sick on Friday from the food - not alcohol & sun because it started Friday morning and I wasn't drinking the night before - that I had to call the resort doctor by Sat. and get a shot and Cipro). Also - you can only make reservations for the ala carte restaurants for that night and you have to be in line by 8:15 AM which was a pain. Also - they only seat at 6:30 or 9:00 (??). This wasn't convenient at all and so we only ate in the specialty restaurants one time. Beach - great! Best part about the RPM. Very wide and plenty of lounge chairs and shade. Pool - small - the pool is better at the RIU Tequila and Yucatan. Lobby - Beautiful, air conditioned but consistently stinks like a dirty ashtray! Awful smell first thing in the morning - reeks like stale cigar smoke when you walk through on your way to the buffet. Makes a good point for open air lobbys like the Yucatan and Tequila. If you are in any way allergic to cigarette or cigar smoke, do NOT stay here!!!! It seems like everyone everywhere was smoking either cigars or cigarettes. Both of our rooms smelled like stale cigarette smoke even though we requested non-smoking. Bottom line - last year we stayed at the Iberostar Del Mar for about half of what it cost for the RPM. My advice - go to the Iberostar - better service, better rooms, half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: rm0894
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel was good. We have stayed at other Riu hotels and have always had a good experience. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was always willing to help with whatever you needed. The hotel had a musty smell in the stairwells and the lobby, other than that, the rooms were very clean. The food was very good, there was a huge variety and many different specialty restaurants. I was impressed with the beach area, it was the largest by far than any of the other hotels down the strip. I didn't like the fact that the "outside" bar closed at 6 p.m., you had to go across the street to the Riu Tequilla for an outside bar that was open later, which was okay because they also had a disco you could go to. It was a nice vacation and it was nice that you could go to the other Riu properties for entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: OKTravelers83
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace Mexico is Great. This was our second trip there, and it was even better than the first trip. The food is fantastic, enormous variety, spectacular presentation and incredible taste. All the restaurants are good, and the service is better than you get at most American restaurants. I preferred the à la carte restaurants and my husband preferred the Don Julian restaurant for dinner, but like I said they are all good. Our room was very nice, I would rather have one king sized bed instead of two queen sized beds pushed together. But really for the warm weather two beds probably are more comfortable. The bath room is also very nice, it does need more light in the tub/shower, but that is nit picking. The house keeping service is really good as well, they kept the room clean, always had clean towels, the mini bar was kept stocked and even had turn down service. The hotel and grounds are picture perfect, see included pictures. The pool and pool area are spacious there were plenty of chairs and umbrellas. And for us the best part of all, the beach. They have a huge beach area; I believe it is the largest in the area. They have a large area with palm trees and chaise lounges, then a nice sized open beach. The whole Playa Del Carmen area has had some beach erosion, but it is returning. If want to relax under trees you can, you want to layout in full sun you can, a combination of the two you can. It has areas that are kind of isolated you can be seen but you’ll probably be unnoticed. The Beach bar is convenient, and they did bring drinks to us on a couple of occasions. But plan on going to the beach bar to get you own drinks. While you’re at it plan on frequent trips as the glasses are very small. The shows at night are nice, they are not Vegas quality, but they are entertaining. We did not take advantage of all the activities they had there, we didn’t need to. There are two changes I would make to the Riu Palace Mexico, one is switch to King Sized beds and the other is to make it adults only. The four or five kids there did not cause any real problems just lessened our enjoyment on a couple of occasions. Over all it was Great and we will definitely go back. This is not an American resort in America, so don’t expect it. Do not be upset when things are different from home. If you are going to travel internationally, then enjoy and try the international experiences. For example topless sun bathing, just try it and do it the first day don’t wait until the last day. The point is, go with flow and have fun. While shopping in Playa Del Carmen you will have shop keepers trying to get you in to there shop, if you are not interested the easiest way to get them to stop is to say “no thank you”.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money...”
Reviews.Author: pkwilly
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Mexico Palace for 4 nights with my wife this October. We were truly disappointed. It seemed the management at the resort was trying to make everything very inconvenient. Let me explain: 1) No advance dinner reservations. You have to get in line between 8:30-10am and stand in line to make reservations. Then, all the restaurants might not be open that night. And to make it worse, they only offer 6:30 or 9 oclock seating. I thought I was at a resort, not on a cruise ship. 2) Would be sitting at the pool bar, along with 50 other peole in the pool, and they would close the bar at 5. That is the middle of the day. 3) No wait staff on the beach. You would have to get up and walk 200 yards to get a drink that was served in 6 ounce glasses. By the time you got back to your lounger, it was gone The food was C- at best. Only thing I really enjoyed was the breakfast. It is in the buffet restaurant and they would make made to order omelets, french toast, ect. But besides that, bad. If you need a snack in the afternoon, only palce to get it was the buffet. No beach grill cooking up burgers and fries like most all-inclusive resorts. The staff was just not helpful or friendly. I know that when you book one of these packages that they say all tips included. But I always go with a pocket of 5's and 10's to tip. Only one bartender got a tip. He actually look like he enjoyed his job. The positives of the resort are that they keep the grounds perfect. The beach is also very nice, but quite a long walk from hotel. Overall, this resort is average at best. We have been to over 10 all inclusives, and this ranks at the bottom, mainly because of food, service, and be so inconvenienced on our vacition that was as expensive as any 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!! Great People!!! Not the best room for honeymooners.”
Reviews.Author: winona05
Reviews.Content: We were not upgraded at the hotel. We showed the front desk clerk, Rosa (who is also the PR coordinator at the resort) and she claimed that it was not necessary. When we got to our room we knew why--she was not upgrading us. Other couples got balloons, flowers, a complimentary upgrade, and more. We got nothing. The food service people, gardeners, bartenders, and housekeepers were WONDERFUL!!!! I cannot say enough good things about them! The bartender, Angelica at the RIU Playacar stole a full pack of cigarettes from the pool side (we saw her do it) and when we asked her about them she claimed they were hers. That is the ONLY time the entire trip I can say we had any problem with anything being taken. I felt very secure with our belongings in our room. There was an $8 phone call charge on our room when we were checking out and we only called other rooms and the front desk, when I asked to see the number they said they would just waive the charge. Our air conditioner was not working the first two days of our stay. The man who came to fix it was so nice!! I was worried about his ladder that was falling apart, but he was fine. The people working at these resorts are so kind!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon at the Rui”
Reviews.Author: BellIndiana
Reviews.Content: We were at the Riu Palace from Oct 7th to Oct 11, on our honeymoon and we did not want to leave. This was my first true vactaion and it was wonderful. I am now spoiled. The beach was beautiful and there was hardly anyone there. it was not crowded at all, which was really nice. The water was beautiful. I have never seen a more beautiful blue. From the moment we arrived, the staff was absolutely wonderful. You could not ask for a nicer or more attentive staff. The grounds are immaculate and the rooms are great too. I read alot of reviews before our trip and i was worried about the hard beds but as soon as we got there we requested a matress pad ( one of those foam egg carton things) and it wasn't near as bad as I thought it would be. I actually slept pretty well. Now on to the food. It was also wonderful. They had a huge selection! The only down fall to the food was the desserts. If you are a chocolate fan...stick to the ice cream. The desserts look wonderful but don't have alot of flavor..but I did discover a coconut ice cream that is to die for. I would highly recomend the Riu Palace to anyone especially in October if your trying to avoid the crowds. We will definetly be back. If you have any questions please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina203
Reviews.Content: found that this place was great for the price! It was our honeymoon and they made us feel like royalty! Not only were they constantly cleaning, pulling out our chairs, asking us if we needed anything, but the beach was beautiful the food was good and the atmosphere was gorgeous! We chose this place because of its good reviews and are so glad we did. It was very relaxing. Yes, the moldy-kinda smell I did notice, but didn't after a couple days. It's a different climate so it must be near to impossible not to get that! Yes, the beds were SOOOOO hard and it was two full beds pushed together instead of one king-size, and the room service menu wasn't very good and was small for those in between meal times when we were showering from the pool and didnt grab lunch. But that was pretty much all I really could complain about! We were boring and only ate at Don Julien's but it didn't seem boring because they had theme nights almost every night at the buffet! They had stuff for people who don't eat different foods but for my husband and I, we enjoyed sushi, fish, chicken, fruits, it was great! Bottled waters, sodas, beer, and liquor in the rooms. We had a blast and were just so excited by how they kept cleaning everything the entire time we were there. Very friendly! Would go back or would recommend to others :-) I took some pictures of the bathroom so I hope they help :-)

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: abf1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our week stay at the RPM, where we also got married. Before I go on, let me just say that it rained EVERY day, which I'm sure is part of why our stay was not perfect. I'll just do this like everyone else! Resort/Service: This resort is beautiful! It is VERY clean with excellent service. The wait and cleaning staff are very attentive and really want to please you. They were always stopping in to clean the room or re-stock the fridge. I would, however, ask for more alcohol if you see that you're about to be out of something because they don't seem to check the mini-bar. Another thing is to be sure to bring shoes that are easy to walk in because the tile (which is everywhere inside and out) is VERY slippery. We were clinging to each other everywhere we went! It would be wise to get mattress covers also! Beach: The beach was so pretty and spacious. There were more than enough lounge chairs and servers come around often with frozen drinks. If you want something else, there is a beach bar very close. There didn't seem to be a great deal of erosion to the beach, but there are more rocky spots in the water than I expected which can be a little annoying. Overall, very nice! Wedding: We really enjoyed getting married at the RPM. The wedding coordinators were super nice and helpful. It was just the two of us, so it was a very short wedding. We were originally going to have the ceremony on the beach, but there really was no privacy because of the nosy people so we chose the gazebo location. I would definitely recommend our photographer, Juan, who works for the resort. Our pictures were great! Food: And here's the bad part, people. First of all, I'm a dietitian, so it's not like my husband and I are spoiled on delicious food. The food in Mexico was what I was looking forward to most! But unfortunately, it was pretty disappointing. The buffet was very large and had many choices so I could always find something I wanted, but it just didn't taste very good. I have to say that breakfast was the best because you can have omelets made (oh, and the scrambled eggs are good). Even the fruit and cheese tasted funny to me! When we did make reservations to eat at one of the specialty restaurants, we could eat very little and end up getting nachos at the buffet later. I don't know...I was hoping for more. Drinks were good, though. Overall, it was a pretty good week. We both agreed that it would be fun with a large group of friends, and a little more money to eat out every night! We'll probably try out another resort next time. Hope this is helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The RIU”
Reviews.Author: blues30
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon at the RIU and it was wonderful! It was our first time at an all inclusive and we will certainly come back again.The food was great and the service we received from the staff was top notch. The weather was not the best as it did rain a lot but we were told that that was very unusual. The beach was fine for us but it is washing away due to all the storms that that sent big waves crashing into the beach. If you are a beach snob that this isn't the place for you. The drinks are very well made for the most part and a $1 tip goes a long way. You can bring your own container for them to fill up with alcohol which I would recommend doing since the glasses they use are so small, The room we stayed was the jacuzzi room and it was wonderful as the jacuzzi is on a second floor which you access via a spiral staircase. The rooms were very clean and we tipped them $5/day. You must eat at Sir Edwards resteraunt, it is gourmet and one of the best meals we have ever had. We also ate at the Brazilian and Japanese resteraunts but they were not very good at all even though others did like it. This place is great for couples and honeymooners but not for kids. We did not go on any of the excursions for we thought they were overpriced but we talked to others who went and they seemed to enjoy them. I recommend you go into town and do some shopping since you can get some pretty good deals but the shop keepers will nag you to death to stop in and buy something. Their is a shopping complex on the resort site but you get more for your money if you go into town. The shopping district is a 20 minute walk from the resort or a $5 cab ride each way. Because of the humidity and the chance for rain everyday I would recommend taking the cab, it is well worth it. We booked the trip through AAA/Apple Vacations and the Apple reps were very available, very friendly and very helpful and answered all our questions and take care of all of our concerns. My only complaint about the hotel is that none of the ice machines worked which was very frustrating since we had to go to the bar to get ice. I also got a bad ear infection from swimming in the ocean and a doctor visit is $90 for the visit plus treatment and medicine. The Dr. is only available 1 1/2 hours in the morning and 1/12 hours in the afternoon. Overall our experience was fantastic and I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: linzi_cute_cookie000
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Riu Palace Mexico on 09/10/2007 and absolutely loved it. This had to be one of my best holidays ever. As soon as i waled into the lobby i was like WOW. It was so beautiful. The chandaliers were amazing. The attention to detail not just in the lobby but in the whole hotel is fantastic including the room which are kept immaculately clean by the maid and also left us a different towel animal most days and i thought the turn down service at night was a nice touch. The rooms also had a seperate seating area which was very handy for having the breakfast roomservice in the morning (which i did a lot) or for the roomservice during the day from 11am-11pm. The service in the bars/restraunts was great. Everyone was genuinely happy to help you and always had a smile on their face the people are lovely. Another great thing i noticed when i was there is that you do not need to be up early to reserve a sun lounger. There is always lots available at either the beach or the pool. Another nice touch here is that you get waiter service at the pool and at the beach which i have to admit made me very lazy but i was on holiday so who cares. I know that some people are still worried about beach erosion but i will let you know now there is nothing to worry about, the beach is beautiful. I stayed at the riu yucatan last year and the year before and admitedly the beach was slightly bigger then but its not lost much and its still lovely and the water is great. For anybody who is trying to decide between the Riu Palace Mexico and the Riu Palace Riviera Maya please go to the Riu Palace Mexico. I did compare them and the Riu Palace Riviera Maya does not have much of a beach also the water is not to good in that area and the Riu Palace Riviera Maya looks cheap and it is further away to the other riu resorts that you can use in playacar. The Riu Palace Mexico looks a lot more classy compared to the Riviera Maya. I would recommend the Riu Palace Mexico to couples, honeymooners and civilized groups of friends (this does not include the young and wild). I would not really recommend it for children or teenagers i didnt see many there although i do no that the did have a mini disco available if there were any childern there. The last thing im going to say is please tip hotel staff (inculding the gardening staff). They do a fantastic job. They work so hard to please you and they do not get paid much. I tipped 5 dollars here and there and they were alwys so pleased they always said than you but it is me who should have been thanking them. All i can say is that this was a fabulous holiday and i will definitely be returning to the Riu Palace Mexico. I will try to add some photos later. Feel free to contact me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “We have fallen in love with the RIU Palace Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: goodjobjoe
Reviews.Content: There were 8 of us traveling and we have all decided that we would definitely be back again next year! From the fantastic buffet and wonderful selection of foods to the warm and friendly staff we have fallen in love with this resort. At 6:40 in the morning on our way to see the sunrise on the beach there were many many workers already out pruning, mowing, raking the beach, just doing everything they could to keep the resort in top shape. The worst part of the whole trip was that we had to leave and go home and it will probably be another year before we get back again. A first class resort with a fantastic beach, food, rooms, and service!

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel and resort in Playacar”
Reviews.Author: sophie_in_london
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most beautiful places I have ever stayed in my life. I have travelled quite well for my young age but I would recommend this hotel and resort to anyone. I would go back in a hearbeat! It was the first time I had been to Mexico and I really didn't know what to expect. Lets just say that I was amazed and overwhelmed. Not only is the hotel stunning, but the staff can't do enough to help you. We found the other guests to be lovely too. My boyfriend had a great time as everyone was always asking him to join in with their games. The area of Playacar and Playa del Carmen is great too. There is lots to do and see. The town of Playa del Carmen offers many nice restaurants and bars which are definitely worth trying out. And easy and cheap to get too. The only thing which we found to be a little bit disappointing was the Hotel entertainment, but even so it is better than most places. Also we went into Cancun one night and I can safely say that we are soooo glad we stayed in Playacar. Cancun is a really awful place, so if you want a peaceful holiday-don't go there!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding was the best”
Reviews.Author: Jk3366
Reviews.Content: We went ahead and booked a wedding last November. Going there, we were a little worried. We had 50 guests and there wasnt that great of communication between the wedding planner and ourselves (maybe a slight language barrier). Also, the wedding coordinator is a service of RIU in the area- not for the particular hotel- so there was sometimes a disconnect between the two parties. So we were a little questionable going in that the ceremony would not meat our expectations. But the results were absolutely unbelieveable. We hired two bands, had a large cake, a videographer, etc. this was all for a fraction of what would have been spent in the states. And they really came through. A year later, we are still so impressed with the courtesy and attention the staff paid not to mention the grounds/ location were unreal. We are not typically "All inclusive" travelers so we were delighted that the experience was far from cookie cutter. The ONLY complaint we have is that the beds are hard and not very comfortable. Our guests ranged from 15 to 80, and they all had a great time. Let us know if you are interested in photos, as Id be happy to share.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: formertravelagent
Reviews.Content: The resort and grounds were absolutely beautiful. Everything was kept very clean and the staff were very helpful and courteous. We did get sick by about the 3rd day but as long as there was a bathroom nearby we did not let that ruin our holiday. We did not eat very much as we were not sure what had made us sick but what we did have was good. The drinks were excellent and all the serving staff were very friendly. The beach - WOW! Lots of loungers and long stretches of beautiful white sand. Did not spend a lot of time at the pool (why would you when the beach is so great!?) but it was kept very clean and the bar was nice. Walking distance to Playa del Carmen where you could ferry to Cozumel if you wanted, snorkelling tours available (extra $$) and you had resort privileges at the sister properties which were right next door (from what I could tell, I would probably stay there too) Fantastic - would go back again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: aarika
Reviews.Content: Well we were taken to the resort via shuttle bus from the airport and our bus had people on it who were going to many different resorts along the way. It felt so good to find out that we were staying at one of the nicest resorts along the route. When we saw where some of the others were being dropped off we began to worry but our place was BEAUITFUL especially at night. Our room was larger than we had anticipated with a lowered seating area facing a TV (only a handful of English channels but why watch TV there anyway?). Because you are staying in one of the "Palace" Rius you are able to visit any other Riu resort in the area which was nice. It made it seem like we had lots of variety to choose from for meals and drinks (but you had to stay at your own resort for dinner). The buffet style food was a bit tiring by the end of our week stay and I wouldn't give high marks for food (especially fruit; highly disappointing considering you're in the Caribbean) but I have heard of much worse. I was 2 months pregnant at the time but the Mexican bartenders didn't understand what "virgin" meant for drinks so I had to say "no alcohol please" for them to understand. I would pay the extra to stay in a "palace" hotel again. I would have felt a bit jealous on my wonderful vacation if every time I walked out of my resort, there was another resort twice as beautiful and elegant as mine (as the case is) across the street. Just pay the extra and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Vacation, Awful for Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Mashylya27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riu Palace Mexico at the end of August for my wedding. We got there right after the hurricane and nothing was damaged. We loved the hotel it is simply gorgeous. I will concentrate more on the wedding part for all the brides that consider this place for their wedding.. Wedding Expereince: Where do I begin… I considered this wedding package to be an above average price in comparison to other hotels in Mexico. The day after we got there we had a brief meeting with wedding coordinator. I do not consider myself to be a picky person and was very disappointed with service we received. They totally lied about the fact that we could choose our restaurant for the wedding reception when I booked the wedding, we could only have Le Bodega which is absolutely horrible. The menu at Le Bodega is a joke , they have a salad bar which is self-service and 6 different type of meat which you can’t even order since all they do is go around each person and cut a piece. After much negotiation wedding planner did us a “favor” and allowed us to have wedding dinner at Buffet restaurant "Don Julian". For the wedding dinner they do not give you an exception of timeframe allowable for the dinner which is only and hour and a half. They do not provide any rehearsal direction what so ever, on the wedding day none of the guest knew where each is suppose to be and who goes where. As for me they told me that my maid of honor should walk me down the isle?which of course did not happen. My flowers started to fall apart not even half way through the day. I have paid extra to have a cocktail party with appetizers at the Cuban bar, well when our party arrived nothing was set up. No one around from staff knew anything about the wedding. The wedding coordinator was never there to make sure that everything was ready. After my sister numerous times tried to find out what happed with our appetizers they brought them. No one was serving our party, to get the drinks we had to go downstairs and order it! Some appetizers were missing and when we asked the manager, she replied that I never paid for it! I was speechless and did not want to argue on my wedding day so my hubby took over. After some time she came back apologizing and saying that their supplier had some problems with fulfilling the order. The dinner table decoration consisted ONLY of rose petals, no candles or decorative natural seashells. The cake was very small one tier, since we had a party less than 30 they simply wouldn’t accommodate us for the two tier small cake which I was more than willing to pay extra! Not even once anyone came and asked from wedding staff if everything was fine. Rooms: We got the upgraded room for our wedding package, it was big and beautiful, and the view right on the fountains, but the smell of the room was not very pleasant. We had no problems with bed being too hard. Restaurants: Sir Edward is the best choice; don’t bother with Le Bodega or Miyaki. Entrainment: We enjoyed different shows each night, as well as sports activities tournaments during day time. Customer service: The hotel staff is very friendly and for the most part will do anything to make you happy (besides wedding area) I loved the hotel and would recommend it as a regular vacation spot but not as wedding destination.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: LoveSouth
Reviews.Content: We visited the Riu P. Mexico on the week of Aug 26-Sep 02 for our honeymoon. Upon arrival we were welcomed with a drink and our rooms were allocated to us right away, however they were facing a concrete slab. We had previously made requests for an oceanview upgrade which was not honored until the front desk individual tried negotiating minimal tip which still got us a courtyard room, we weren't extremely pleased but carried on with our day. The hotel is fairly huge and has a good spread of resteruants and the premises are very clean and staff otherwise is very helpful. Below are some of the salient points about the hotel: Rooms: OK, but our room was infested with small ant like creatures, however the hotel staff addressed that right away and took care of it for us. All rooms are equipped with a mini bar and a liquor dispenser which is a nice touch. The beds are rock hard and it took me a few days getting used to. Resteraunts: We found the Buffet resteruant "Don Julian" to be the best of all, however for those eager to wake up early and make reservations, I highly recommend "Sir Edward" as that was somewhat similiar to fine dining. Other resteraunt such as Miyaki and Le Bodega were simply a waste of an appetite as the food was far from authentic and dry. Don Julian often changes thier menu at night times which is a good trade. Lunch times at El Patio were OK which is typical to fast food althought i must say i had some of the best hamburgers ever, really tender. Drinks: Watered down, typical to most mexican resorts although i would have expected RIU to be at par with it's standards and not have them that way. The best drinks are made at the Piano Bar, as everywhere else you would have to request doubles of everything. One thing i would like to compliment is that the hotel has a good selection of wines, which to me and my wife were plentiful. Pool: Not good at all, I have stayed in plenty of resorts throghout mexico's pacific and Atlantic regions and have found Riu;s pool to be really small and wierdly shaped. One side of the pool faces a swim up bar where you can witness most of the traffic and is fairly small, the other side of the pool is completely dead, we didn't find a lot of people in the pools regardless, i guess of the same reason. I like to swim in the pools, rather than lounge and i found this pool to be rather shallow. Although, we visited the nearby Riu's as well and i can say that our pool was the cleanest. Every night the pools are cleaned at our property. Beach: Good, there is a minimal damage but was caused by the hurricane 2 years ago and not the recent Dean Hurricane. The water was gorgeous and plenty of sun loungers. The only drawback is that the hotel is not entirely beachfront as there is a 50 yard walk to the ocean from the pools. I did not understand the concept of a topless beach since it is a family resort with kids around. I would highly recommend Riu to look into that or post signage for that. We don't mind that except i would not recommend bringing kids around unless the Resort does something about it. Entertainment: It was pretty decent with mexican themed shows every night and we loved the entertainment guy; Al who had so much energy and always smiling throught our stay. Since it is a family resort, there isn't much to do there after 6 PM, so i would check out the town of Pl.Del Carmen. Overall Assessment: After a few hicups at the check in, we were well taken care of by the managers at the property especially Rose and Roberto. Our room was decorated nicely with flowers and a bottle of champagne towards the later part of our stay. The staff is very friendly and we kepy tipping although we didn't see many people do that. All in all, i would check out other resorts next time in the vicinty but will not entirely rule out the Riu Palace Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach but greatly prefer Los Cabos Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: Jimbon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at the Riu Palace Mexico, Aug. 24-29, ’07. There was no damage from the hurricane. If you want a hotel on a lovely beach where you can play in the water, this may be a good choice for you; however, we MUCH preferred our stay last August (2006) at the Los Cabos Riu Palace. It is an exquisite resort with excellent service, all the rooms have a beautiful view of the water and beach from the balcony, and it is less hot and humid than the Yucatan, even in August. We would love to return to the Los Cabos Palace, but would not consider returning to the Riu Palace Mexico. We found it depressing that we rarely saw another guest who looked happy or was smiling. In the outdoor restaurant between the beach and swimming pool, they required you to have on shoes, shorts and a top to enter the restaurant area. They need to relax their dress codes and remember that folks are on vacation and don’t want a bunch of rigid rules. It was very much the opposite atmosphere that we found at the Los Cabos Riu Palace where everyone seemed thrilled to be there, including the staff. The main dining room was almost empty every evening for dinner but they still said men could not wear shorts. Seemed that we were forever being told not to sit there or not to sit here when we entered a restaurant ~ left a very uncomfortable feeling. We booked both trips with Funjet and highly recommend them. Their transfers and on-site service is excellent. They had by far the lowest prices we could find for a hotel only package. They also have hotel/air packages. Be sure when you make reservations that you get the transfers included or it will cost you a bundle when you arrive at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: austinwinters
Reviews.Content: This was the first RIU I had visited in the Carribean, and I couldn't possibly be disappointed if I have gone to 4 others in the past years! The Riu Palace Mexico is a gorgeous resort which is heavy on service and whatever your little heart desires! From the towel zoo I had collected near the end of the week to the seats at the pool and beach which I had occupied for a cool week! There were a few problems with the resort however, mainly rooms. Unfortunately, I had recieved a room which had a view of a cement wall with leaves growing out the other side. Not the nicest place to lookout at when on vacation. The beach was eroded so badly that it is atleast half a story from where the dry sand is until the sea hits the beach. It's a good jump down and climb up down the entire resort and continuing onwards to the left and right. The bars and restraunts are to die for! Any drink you could possibly imagine, but if you have ever been to a Riu, you know they give you the 'Welcome Drink' when you first arrive. Watch out, if you ask for it anywhere during your stay, they look at you like you are from the stone age. Otherwise, the ride from the airport drags on for a while, but heh, what about $1.00 Coronas to make the ride a little easier! Overall great resort and one which you should check out to ease yourself into RIU Palaces!

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: goingbeachy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Palace Mexico June 26 - July 3, 2007. After reading all the horrible reviews about the beach situation, we were really worried about our stay. We were with a large group, 18 altogether, coming from quite a few states, and everyone really loves the beach. Upon our arrival, the first thing we checked was the beach and were very relieved to find a beautiful beach! We could tell it is not what it was last year, but still a great beach and plenty of space/lounge chairs to be comfortable. We were also worried about the "rock hard" beds we had read so much about. We had requested a courtyard room, which we did not pay for, and were granted our request along with mattress pads already being placed on our beds. This was a great surprise and we were in a beautiful location in the courtyard. The rooms were very nicely made and no one in our group had anything to complain about. They even paid special attention to the various anniversary and birthdays among our group and left wonderful "treats" for us on those days! Most of the staff we dealt with was very pleasant and accommodating. The only staff problem we had was in a few of the bars, there are not enough waitstaff and some nights we had to wait quite a while for our drinks. The two downfalls of this upscale resort are; the towel card situation, and the fact that there are no beach waiters. When you pay this amount of money, you should not have to worry about a towel! They should provide plush towels each day by the beach/pool. Which plenty of other resorts are able to do. Also, they should have waiters down on the beach to bring cocktails while you are relaxing. After all, isn't that what this place is supposed to be about? Relaxing? All in all, this is a beautiful resort, very well kept and we enjoyed our stay! We have stayed in quite a few all-inclusive resorts, and this ranks right up at the top. So, don't listen to the whining people who will never be pleased! PS If you only see one show, go to the Michael Jackson show!

Reviews.Title: “Pick this one for the beach”
Reviews.Author: Tara19
Reviews.Content: Since there are so many resorts to choose from (even among the Riu options) we took a recommendation from a friend. One of the most important things for us was the beach area. As we walked along the shore line to the different resorts in this area, we clearly had the best beach. Although crowded, we were always able to find chairs in a great spot. Overall, we really enjoyed our time at this resort. The dining facilities were nice, but we thought the food was average. My husband ending up getting sick from the food. Upon our return home, he was still feeling the effects of the food and had to take an antibiotic. Little did we know, this medicine could have been purchased over the counter only minutes from the hotel! I'm a rather picky eater and ate mostly bread and fruit throughout our stay. The rooms were nice, but a little outdated. The king size bed was two double beds pushed together. It wasn't a huge deal, but not what we wanted. Many people mention the musty smell and it was very strong upon our arrival. However, we didn't notice it after a couple days. We did notice it once we got home. Everything- including our suitcases smelled really bad. The workout facility is very small. Only two treadmills and a few other machines. We gave up using the facility after two attempts because it was so crowded and kids were messing around in there. Downtown Playa Del Carmen is only a $5 cab ride away. There are tons of shops and restaurants. We would definitely return to this resort, but would take advantage of downtown Playa a lot more and eat less at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to tell but...”
Reviews.Author: TravelgalMankato
Reviews.Content: I went to the RIU Palace on an agent fam for 3 days right smack dab in the middle of hurricane Dean! It's very hard to make a fair assesment of this hotel since most everything was shut down and boarded up. All the restraunts-except for the buffet were closed and boarded up. By law, there was to be no liquor served, but fortunately we still had our liqour and beer in our room! The staff kept us well stocked with bottled water, soda and beer. The hotel staff were very well prepared, and kept us informed of everything that was going on with the weather-and what we should be prepared for. Our rooms were prepared by putting towels under the patio door and a dresser pushed in front of the door. The patio furniture was put in the bathroom, the tv unplugged and turned around. We were given food to put in our room in the event that we would be unable to get out in the morning for breakfast or lunch. There were sandbags at all the entrances to the hallways, and whatever windows weren't boarded up, were taped. I felt very safe at this hotel. If anyone has had a "normal" experience at this hotel-I would love to hear from you, as It's not likely I'll get back to the Palace anytime soon! On our last night there was finally a little normalcy! Entertainment that included a Las Vegas type show. Here's a shout out to Eddy-one of the entertainment coordinators. Thanks for making a couple middle-aged women feel special!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Again!!”
Reviews.Author: TGS-DALLAS
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip (First August 2003) to Riu Palace Mexico, and I have to say I was even more impressed this time. Hotel - Just as last time, the hotel itself is immaculate. We had reserved a Garden view suite, and we were give one on the top floor almost all the way to the beach. From there you can see the lights of Cozumel. Food - The food is very good. I do not want to say "Great" like some reviews, but very good. I truly can't understand those who say it is horrible. Pool - I have to admit, in both my stays here I have not once stepped in the pools. I don't understand going to the beach to hang out at the pool unless you have kids. Beach - The beach is definitely significantly smaller than it was in 2003. That said, this is clearly a problem for all of Playa. I would say that the beach at the Riu Palace Mexico is as big or bigger than all other hotels in Playacar that I could tell from walking. The hotel has also done an excellent job of creating more open beach space in between the palm trees all the way up to the hotel. Not once did we have to worry about finding open chairs in the sun or shade at any time of the day. Overall - Excellent stay. The staff is excellent and all very helpful. For the most part they want to engage you in conversations and want to try to learn to speak english by talking to you. I hope to go back again and don't plan to look at any other places to stay. For me it is definitely Riu Palace Mexico when I go to Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: jaimeGL
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Food reasonable. Gourmet restaurant worth a visit but others no better than the buffet. Excellent fresh salads. Best nachos I have ever eaten! Great coffee that usually comes with hot milk. If you prefer cold, you need to ask. Best to sit by the salad bars as service tended to be better. Breakfast OK but omelettes terrible. Gentlemen need to remember to pack long pants as shorts not allowed for dinner. The staff are wonderful: friendly and always smiling. Very attentive and almost too eager to whip plates away. Drinks always available. Boy, do those mojitos just slip down! Rooms are very nice but smell a little musty. Had to call for fresh towels a couple of times but other than that no complaints, The beds are hard....not firm but hard. Walk in showers will flood bathroom as drain fitted flat into floor with almost no step down Drains are slow. You need to either run the shower at low stream or turn it off every now and then to let water drain away. Beach is glorious...sand soft....water warm and activities available free of charge. Snorkling, jetskiing and parasailing available at a charge. Lots of loungers and shade but best shady spots go quickly so it's best to get down there early. Drinks are brought around which is nice touch. Things to know: very few teens around during summer time. We had two 17 year olds with us and they were a little bored. We sent them to Xel-Ha for the day and we also went out on ATVs which was great fun and the outfit we used very professional and helpful. When it rains outside walking surfaces are very slippery. Most of the place is tiled and caution is needed. Walking on grass is safer. Take a trip in to Playa del Carmen....nice little seaside town. Cab fare should be no more than $5 each way. If paid in dollars, no tip needed as you pay a little more anyway. Pool is nice but a little on the small side and closed after 8:30 PM. Evening entertainment was fun and the hotel staff appearing in and running the activities program were delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Just an all around great place!”
Reviews.Author: dwninit71
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RIU with my girlfriend from 7/28 to 8/3 of 2007. Just a forwarning...I would highly recommend booking an Apple or Funjet bus to transfer from Cancun to Playa Del Carmen. There is only one taxi stand there with their own cabs (Gray Cabs). We paid 80 bucks for a cab to Playa Del Carmen, but only 50 bucks back so take this into consideration. Now on to the good stuff....We arrived around 5pm on a Saturday to be greeted at the front desk with a nice drink and a lot of informatoin on how the hotel was laid out and when things were opened and closed. The front desk did a great job throughout the trip and always had a smile on their face. The rooms are very nice and spacious. Yes the bed is somewhat hard, but we still slept well. The room is stacked with liqour so you can definitely drink in the room. We barely used the room alcohol because what is the point of staying in the room when you have bars, beaches, and pools to enjoy! The pool is a tad small, but nonetheless we never had a problem getting beach chairs and was very easy to get drinks from the pool bar or by waitstaff taking your drink order. You can ask for a "double" if you want more alcohol in your drinks and be sure to request the top shelf stuff or you will just get well. Also...very important...tip the bartenders and waitstaff...these people are running around in 100+ degree heat for you so it is the right thing to do. 5 bucks here or there will bring a huge smile on someone's face and will make their day. The beach was another pleasant surprise. I heard a lot of negative thing about the beach, but it seemed to be in good shape when we were there. Yes there is a bit of erosion, but the beach area is quite deep at this hotel. When you get to the water there is a little drop off, but nothing to even think about. I have attached some pics so be sure to take a look! The water was crystal blue and very warm. The sand was great..pretty fine with no rocks so you don't have to wear anything on your feet when on the sand or in the water. On to the food...my girlfriend and I love the buffets. I mean there was so much variety if there was something you didn't like I am sure you could find something you will. We are from San Francisco so we eat at some super highend restaurants so we know our food. The food is definitely more than adequate and you will enjoy it. The breakfasts usually had waffles, pancakes, eggs (scrambled and fried), bacon, sausage, fruit, etc. The lunch usually switched their main food but usually had some fish, beef, lunch meat, salad, fruit, pizza, pasta, etc. For dinner we usually ate at one of the 4 restaurants on the premises. At 8:30am you need ot be in a small queue of people to get your reservation for that night. No what...I enjoyed getting up that early so I could start get the most out of it. The line only took about 5 minutes max and that was it. The restaurants each had a theme: Sir Edward: Got a really nice steak here with a cheese dressing on top. Very tasty with a bottle of red they provided. Miyagi: Asian/Sushi place. The food was good, but don't expect a full blow sushi spread. The sake is average grade so be sure to drink it hot. We blew through around 4 large sakes so they are not afraid to give you as much as you want. El Patio: This place has some really nice steaks! Be aware it is outside by the pool/beach so there were mosquitos buzzing around a bit. Brazilian: Can't remember the name but if you have a big appetite this is the place for you. Please note that men do need to wear long pants at these dinners and in the buffet at night so bring one or two pair. I think I saw people wearing jeans so they aren't too picky, but I just brough a pair of khakis which was more than enough. The bars have a wide selection of drinks from martinis, mojitos, cuba libres, etc. The only beer on the premises is Corona, but that is what I would normally drink in a tropical environment anyways. In all if you want a place that with beautiful grounds, beautiful rooms, super nice people and friendly service, then this is a place I would definitely recommend. We will definitely be back since we never left the premises the whole week! Need to do a bit more exploring next time!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Mexicanfans
Reviews.Content: What can we say. We have just returned from a truly amazing holiday. From the moment we stepped inside the hotel to the moment we checked out we were treated superbly. Everything about the hotel is fiirst class. Truly recommend this hotel, you cannot be disappointed. Thank you to everyone at the Palace for making this a perfect holiday!!!!

Reviews.Title: “riu is truly excellento”
Reviews.Author: DaleLeeds_England
Reviews.Content: Dale from Leeds,England. we booked our holiday originally to stop at the iberostar tucan, but found out a week before travelling we had been moved to the riu palace what a blessing this turned out.From the moment you walked through the front door you couldnt fail to be impressed the reception always immaculate,the lobby bar a classy joint with excellent service.Rooms were clean and very spacious cant even complain about the beds been hard never noticed but us english are easily pleased. Our 12 year old son really enjoyed himself and made plenty of friends and the animation team made the kids feel really welcome with always something going on for them to do or watch. The shows were a bit so-so but it passed a bit of time on inbetween drinks infact i found the mexican waiters more entertaining running around keeping people happy and their glasses full. We only stuck to the buffet and el patio because of the lad but there was always a large selection of meats to be had and we were never stuck for choice the food delicious, the wife in particular taking a liking to the desserts. The beach and sea are picture postcard stuff,beds are easy to get and plentiful.If thats not your thing then there is always the pool where beds are in abundance also,but do use the swim up bar and call on roberto for a drink,this man is truly amazing he wastes no movement whatsoever serving 6 people at a time with cocktails within a minute. The riu palace is an incredible place where dreams come true and ours certainley did we would return in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Holiday”
Reviews.Author: holiday_fun_seeker
Reviews.Content: I and 8 other family members (including kids ranging from 12-17 yrs), have just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico after a wonderful 2 week holiday. After reading some of the reviews prior to departing I was a little worried, as our travel agent had changed our hotel from the Iberostar Tucan at the last moment. We needent of been worried, even though it was peak season, the service was absolutely 1st class, with everyone trying, and succeeding to cater to our every wish. All 4 of our rooms were excerllent with the requested courtyard view being granted on 3 out of the 4. (The occupents of the 4th room prefered the "garden view" so we didnt request a change, although we felt that if we did we would of been moved.) The food in the buffet resturant was good and didnt suffer from too much repeating. We also tried the Al-A- Cart resturants which were of very good quality. (You must be prepared to get up and book early though, especially if you want the later sitting. Most places are gone by 9.30 AM). The pool was livley enough during the day, with the Ammination team doing their best to get people involved in volleyball, aerobics, rifle shooting, dance lessons etc etc. They were not pushy if you just wanted to be a "watcher" though. The beach was fab, plenty of sunloungers, with no need to resereve early. The water sports team was very good, we used the sailing and windsurfers on many ocasions with the guys being very helpful. A special thanks to "Tony" who always made us laugh as he took our continuing orders in the bar each night, (thanks Chicken!!!!), and to Emanual the head bell boy who, it seems was always on duty with a "welcome home" when we came back through the door. Overall a fantastic hotel with exceptional service and a great location, dont hesitate to book it.

Reviews.Title: “Fun while it lasted”
Reviews.Author: thetio
Reviews.Content: I'm still trying to figure out how I got traveler's diarrhea there. Started to get sick the 2nd day I was there. Be careful; I would suggest maybe reading up on government suggestions on what to eat in Mexico. Stick to bottled beverages. Great staff and lots of fun the small amount of time I was able to leave my hotel bed and toilet. :(

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place, service is unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: rblebaron
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace is a first class All-inclusive resort. We went with a group of 52 who really tested the service for a week. The meals were incredible and we ate in each of their 5 restaurants. They have a beach to die for with plenty of activities and shade, nice rooms, and the best little bartender in Mexico. The staff was always helpful and they really go out of their way to accomadate. Plenty to do around Playa Del Carmen, Scuba, snorkeling, waterparks, ruins, etc. but these trips are extra.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it was once”
Reviews.Author: Dougie_and_Jeanette
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to the hotel. We went last year in May and had such a great time we booked again as soon as we returned. home We knew that they would have to give the place a lick of paint as it was looking a little tired last year, and they appear to have done this recently. I know I'm being picky now but it's a little slap dash and not very neat, this really makes the place look a little messy. For example, they've painted the restaurant near the beach, and paint has dripped onto the floor and over the blinds. It wouldn't have taken long to just do a neat job and make it look special. The pool area is now looking very tired, with broken tiles, faulty umbrellas and tatty towels. The popcorn machine (that was there last year) has broken and they didn't replace it. We emailed the hotel several times in advance of our arrival asking for a courtyard room, and upon arrival nobody knew anything of our request. I was disappointed as a repeat customer they didn't acknowledge our request. After a while, they managed to find a court yard view room and we were very happy with the room. The bathroom could have done with a bit of a scrub, there's lots of mould around the bath / shower and the paint-work wasn't very good (sorry to be picky again). The lock on the door was broken. The fridge was stocked with all the usual favourites and the optics were topped up. Beds were hard. Very hard. A quick call to reception solved this problem with the mattress covers and sleep was once again possible. The chairs on the balcony were broken, but again a quick call to reception fixed this. Our first week was wonderful. The food is fabulous, the staff are wonderful and we ate in the buffet each night. Each night has a different theme and there's a massive selection of food. I was happy to eat at the buffet each night, but we tried a couple of the restaurants too. They were also very good. We were worried about the beach erosion, but it appears the hotel has done something as you can walk down to the water. There's plenty of sun beds available, some under the palm trees and some on the beach. The pool area also has ample sun beds. The second week wasn't so good though. I think it was the start of school holidays as the hotel was transformed from a quiet relaxing place with all the guests feeling 'special' to a hotel pushed to the limits with staff working at full capacity. In the first week, a guest in the buffet area dropped a plate. Within seconds the staff were cleaning up the mess. In the second week, it took over 5 minutes for someone to sort out a broken glass in the middle of the buffet area. The guest had to push the broken plate to one side to avoid other guests being injured. Finding a clean table was a problem. On our last night we were given a dirty table with dirty napkins. Not something you'd expect from what should be one of RIU's flagship hotels. Finding a clean table at breakfast was also a problem in the second week. They have a strict dress code in the buffet during the evening, I presume this is to keep standards and ensure it remains a quality buffet and not a free-for-all cafeteria. Nobody was enforcing the rules during the second week, so instead of going for a nice meal it was a case of grabbing the cleanest table you can find, getting your food and getting out. Not ideal when you consider the cost of staying here. Overall I'd consider our holiday experience good, but standards have slipped since our last visit. We took a walk to the newer Palace just down the road, and naturally it's more impressive because it's new, perhaps we would consider staying there next time. Would we go again? Probably not. It's looking tired now, and they've proved how they struggle to cope with numbers. If they do a complete overhaul in a couple of year, I would go back, but I can't help but feel guests are treated to a sample of what was once a truly magnificent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, clean and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: legallyblondeleo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay for many reasons: -great food, even at the buffet if you couldn't get a reservation at a side restaurant -so close to the beach, which really did have tons of chairs and hammocks open at almost all times of day -bars everywhere you went, even by the pool which also had nachos -rooms were gorgeous and made up twice a day -PLENTY of activities to do within the resort and nearby -fun clubs nearby contradictions of reviews I read before we went: - food was NOT bad.. really it was stunning, even in buffet.. people must be really picky about food because there were a few different things to try but if you go on vacation to a different country like we did, we expected it. They also had "regular" food in case some things were too "weird". -beach was amazing. Nothing dirty about it. -room was far from moldy, ours was great. In fact they have tiled floors (not carpets) so I don't know where the mold would even exist -pools were for relaxing and wading.. if you are looking to swim laps, try your American local gym all in all, a fantastic mix between relaxing and fun. You make what you want to make out of it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Palace (June 30-July 7)”
Reviews.Author: RobynW
Reviews.Content: I've just read the other reviews from people who stayed at the RIU during the time we were there, and it's funny how people can have such totally different experiences. We've stayed at a lot of all-inclusives and this was the 2nd best one (ist was the Grand Lido Sans Souci, Jamaica) we've encountered. Grounds-flawless and beautiful Beach-THERE IS A BEACH. I'm puzzled by the reviews who say there isn't one. Yes, it's smaller than in the brochure pictures, but there's lots of white sand, palm trees, and loungers. We went parasailing and could see all the resorts' beaches and the Riu Palace had the best, by far. Dining-lots of variety at the buffet. The Steakhouse does not have a/c (it's outdoors) so it can be a little warm. The dress code in the buffet is a bit silly---men have to wear long pants but ratty jeans will suffice and the women can wear tanks and skimpy shorts.
