My hubby didn't think it was fair but it wasn't a major concern. We actually had some fun laughing at how poorly dressed some of the diners were, despite their long pants. Rooms-we were disappointed we didn't have a room overlooking the courtyard, but otherwise it was fine. The beds were hard but didn't bother me and we never asked for a mattress pad. Fridge was stocked everyday and the cleaning was amazing. They even move the beds (every time they clean) and the nightly turndown service was a nice extra. Excursions-we parasailed (available right on the beach) and it was awesome. My husband did the free scuba lesson in the pool then booked the extended lesson and 2 45 minute dives on a coral reef, which he loved. We did a full day at XEL HA, which is very cool. It's a long day to be snorkeling though, so bring a book and relax in one of the many hammocks, beach chairs or loungers. I'm pretty sure I picked upa little food poisoning from the burger I had there which might be keeping me fom raving about the place as much as a I should. Tulum was interesting and the swimming there was a blast. Staff-incredibly friendly, especially the gentleman at the front entrance The only complaint we really had was that we thought the RIU Palace was more of an adults (although not adult only) resort. The stroller brigade was there, perhaps not in full force, but enough that it was disappointing. That is the only reason I did not award 5/5 stars. As an Adult's Only Resort this place would REALLY Rock! This is a lovely resort where you will be treated very well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service Shines at RIU Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: quicksilvergt
Reviews.Content: As I have recently stayed in Mexico twice this review should be pretty objective. I also dont do my reviews after the initial "high" of returning from my trip, I wait a bit to review them honestly. Hopefully you'll find my Riu review helpful. Please also see my review for the CATALONIA RIVERIA MAYA, in Puerto Adventuras. As this was a great experience too. I went with two groups of families. The Riu Palace Mexico is a great all inclusive resort. It has a solid location just 5 minutes south of Downtown Playa Del Carmen. The following is the breakdown. First Impressions: Getting to the resort is easy if you have transportation set up. We did through our travel agent, otherwise set it up ahead of time, as personal taxis can be very hard to get and you will wait for a while. The resort is in a chain of RIU resorts being RIU Tequila, Yucatan, etc. Although the Riu Palace Mexico has what I felt the best location and greens/enviroment. There is a big driveway and there is a friendly gentleman to greet you and open the door for you. The staff was very accomidating and spoke very good english at the front desk. If you stay at One RIU you get access to all of them so that is nice if you want to walk around. There is shopping at little shops across the street and Playa del Carmen is only a $5, 5 Min Cab ride into the city. (Warning: some of the cabbies are crazy drivers, be ready for different traffic rules) The resort overall: This resort is manicured like a quality golf course. The greenspace and center pools are immaculate. Every day sand is brushed from the tile walkways and trees maintainted. The beach area is kept very clean and the pools are also. Inside the main hallway is a pretty grand chandlier (spelling?) and walkway. Overall it's appearance is beautiful. Every night in the center plaza there is music or a show of some sort. Whih is nice. There are events earlier in the evening for young children, and shows and music later on geared more towards family and adults. The bar staff services the plaza and getting drinks is no problem.Thier entertainment team is at the resort all day, much like the Catalonia, and they do a good job keeping things fun and the shows entertaining. Beach / Pools: OK the beach is (or was) eroding. If expect Virgin Islands like mile long, hundred feet wide white sand they dont have it. There was a good 3-4 foot drop off along the tree line leading to the water. The water area itself is great, not rocky at all and crystal blue clear when it not that wavy. That being said the resort actually has a great beach area to lay down! Slightly back from the shoreline there are Lots of large palms and hammocks to chill in and just read a book and jam some music w/ the iPod. You can get plenty of sun or shade just pick your spot, of which there are plenty of chairs and spots. Despite the beach drop off, i never felt that inconvienced. POOLS: are great. The staff checks the chemicals several times a day and the waters refreshing. The swim up bars have good service and the volleyball net is always active with fun people or staff. Staff aerobics in the morning, kids activities poolside, and scuba inscruction are the norm, but they still dont feel too busy. Bars/Food: This resort has several restraunts and buffets. Each restraunt has very good food by most American/European standards. Even the Asian place has decent food (although it's not Hibachi). We never got sick and always left satisfied. Make your reservations early though, as they do fill up in the morning. The bars are pretty good. Decent selection of semi-preimum boozes like Smirnoff, Beefeater, Bacardi, etc. The drinks get watered down a bit who really cares when thier free. The bar in our room is not a mini, it's a full size liqor cabinet with 4 bottles and a fridge filled with bottled water, soda, and Corona! This was sooooo nice to have, especially the water. The morning buffet has hot and cold breakfast with a wide selection of smoothie flavors and blended drinks. NOTE! Men need to wear long pants to dinner. For some strange reason women do not have a dress code (no swimwear perhaps) but the men do. SO bring some jeans or slacks men. The Disco over at RIU Tequila was pretty crazy, filled with young teens and honelstly I expected more. The disco at Catalonia was soo awesome that i guess this just wasn't the same. Still, we spent some time there and it was ok. Rooms: The rooms are junior suites with 2 beds and a coutch (some w/ sleepers). They are clean with enough space for stuff, although the beds are hard (welcome to mexico, as this is typical). We left a small tip of 10 pesos ($1 US) and we were stocked with towles. Although one day my girlfriend accidently left 150 pesos in the tip envelope on Easter and we were welcomed later by a towel art zoo of elephants, bunnies, and swans. Room service is very good. Staff: The service here really is first class and I think this resorts best feature. Everyone you encounter has a smile and is there to serve you. The waiters speedwalk to fetch your orders and never keep you waiting. If you are a beach person, they have a beach bar and usually one or two people serving on the beach, although most of the time you have to go to the bar. I never had a problem w/ this. The entertainment team is pretty good, doing activities during the day and shows at night. BIG THANKS TO BAR MANAGER TONY. One night I lift my $$$ digital camera at the bar and I thought for sure it was stolen. Tony had reported it to the front desk and I claimed it the next day. This was really a nice thing to do. Also although not necissarily part of the resort i think, LEWIS from Scuba Caribe teaching the scuba class in the pool was Awesome! If you want great service, this is a good resort to go to. Final Thoughts and Comparison: This resort is a classy place that shines on service. It's a larger resort with lots of choices and is close to playa del carmen. Compared to the CATALONIA the RIU PALACE MEXICO is not necissarily better but different. I would say the RIU has better service overall and more bars/restraunts but has a "Big resort" feel and look to it. It is a great place for families or groups. The Catalonia is a bit more romantic, has a better beach and oceanfront, and the entertainment team is outstanding. THe RIU costs a little more but I can see where the money goes as it is kept up so nice and they have great service staff. It has a decent value for what you get. Overall this resort is a great place I would recommend for people who want to be pampered and chill at a resort for a week or two or for families. For someone who is looking for a party atmosphere look at RIU Tequila or the Cancun hotel zone. For a more romantic and smaller resort experince in sand n sun try the Catalonia Riveria Maya further south. I cant wait to go back, Iberostar next? Hope this helps and wasn't too long!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Mediocre otherwise”
Reviews.Author: cocobaby
Reviews.Content: Literally just got back and decided to do the favor that most people have given me by writing my own... Positives first: Great people and service personnel at the restaurants and bars good buffet overall Negatives: The room service was not that great. Even though we left 3-5 dollars a day in tip, got great towel sculptures but not enough towels and they did not restock the fridge (bottled water was our main concern) regularly The room was moldy and mildewy, granted, we had the junior suite, but gross... \ we tried the japanese food -Miyagi and it was the WORST ever! - I live in Ohio and granted, the fish here is not the freshest, but it was nasty... On the other hand, the buffet seafood actually was very good. After that, we were too disgusted to book with any other restaurants, but I heard from other people that Sir Edwards was good. Advice Bring lots of suntan lotion because they charge you like 20-30 dollars a bottle Bring a hat if you don't want the leathery look Agree with bringing fifty singles to tip here and there I don't agree with the six golden apple rating that apple placed - maybe five... due to mediocre room service and bad specialty restaurant experience...

Reviews.Title: “Staff and Hotel are Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Escondida4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort from June 30th to July 7th. The hotel and the staff are great. The staff never stop working and will go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and welcome. This place is gorgeous and you can find what you need at pretty much any time that you want. There is always food and beverages available. You have a beach and a pool at your wish. You are also close enough to shopping and a night life if you want one. This place is set up to meet whatever needs that you are looking to satisfy while you are on vacation. If you are looking for a party at all time I would suggest going to Cancun. If you are looking for a romantic and grown vacation spot with options to party if you want than this is the place for you. Everyone that I talked with at the resort had a good time and could find no fault with the facilities or the staff. We would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Everything is Average.......except the beds, they're terrible”
Reviews.Author: planning_in_tulsa
Reviews.Content: June 18 to 21, honeymoon, garden view jr suite Although we did enjoy most of our trip to the Riu, we found it be be average on most accounts. The food was good, as others have claimed, but not outstanding. The beach is gone....but, it is 100% sand, no rocks, so it is a great place to run right out into the water without having to wear shoes or carefully watch wear you step. The rooms are spacious, well air conditioned and very clean, but the beds are terrible. Not just bad, and NO the mattress bad does not make it OK, they are just terrible. The shows are mildly entertaining and provide something to do at night. The people there were very nice and the service was great. Please email with any specific questions, bigt1832@yahoo.com. We will not be back, and I will not recommend this resort to you, unless you are getting a spectacular deal. Happy Travels to all.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico, is the place to go”
Reviews.Author: JOESFIANCE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, just returned from our 2 weeks honeymoon at the Riu Palace Mexico, and let me tell you, you are treated better than King and Queen, It was beautiful, more than what we expected, the food is soooo good, Sir Edward really good, Japanesse and the steak house really Good, Buffe Don Julian was really Good different type of food everynight, Waiter at the Don Julian, (German) best waiter ever and on the last night we were there, he decorated our table with all sorts of flowers he is really the best. The pool bar not one day didnt we drink, the beach was nice but too many people from the other hotel Riu Palace Riviera Maya, which is a nice hotel but the worst beach i have ever seen. so if you have to consider one of the Riu's you should really go to the Riu Palace Mexico. To the animators Mickey, Aida, Jessica, Kikin, Ronaldo and the rest Thank you for all the good times. Mary & Joe

Reviews.Title: “Mobility challenged”
Reviews.Author: Marty1hbg
Reviews.Content: This is a month after we were at the Riu and felt I needed to write to add to what others were saying about the resort. The Resort itself is very beautiful and immaculate. Food was very enjoyable and rooms were comfortable. We especially enjoyed sitting in the courtyard and enjoying music and shows in the evening when weather permitted and enjoyed the piano bar upstairs when the weather did not cooperate. I have to address the beach which according to most reviews here was described as beautiful. The beach under the palm trees is in fact very nice, however the week that we were there the erosion was especially bad. My husband and I were standing at the edge of at least a six foot high embankement which ran the entire length of the Palace's resort. We were commenting on the loss of beach when the palm tree next to us fell over into the water. No one was swimming in this area when we were there and there was no access on this particular property that week. Yes, there was access from next door, where the guests of the Riu Playacar and Riu Tequila also shared the space. I have mobility issues due to some nerve damage in my ankles and have interstitial lung disease. The extra walking in the heavy sand and going up and down the embankments was very difficult for me. What I looked forward to as a relaxing vacation became a more difficult workout than I had planned. I do understand that nature is responsible for the erosion but the pictures displayed on the Riu website are certainly outdated. We took our concerns to Riu who gave us a response that this was normal seasonal conditions which is a bunch of rubbish. I have stayed at Playacar before and unfortunately due to what I refer to as severe erosion, we will not be back. As for Riu I was very disappointed in their response to my concerns. I paid for a beach in front of my resort. Riu Playacar and Riu Tequila were both cheaper and I find it interesting that Riu has offered guests of the Tequila opportunities to stay at the Riu Playacar Mexico for no additional costs. For the person able and fit, this is a lovely resort. For people with disabilities (walking or breathing) this may not be the best resort area for you and thought I should share my thoughts with you.

Reviews.Title: “The Palace is Beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: stavos
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful resort. It was beautiful to the eyes and my fiencee and I were upgraded to one of the suites that faced the ocean. The best room I have ever stayed at. Now here are some key points. Rooms. Very nice but get the pillow tops as you will need them. Beach. We loved the beach and the ocean. A little eroded in some spots but still plenty of open sand to lay out in and palm trees for shade. Entertainment. It was pretty good. shows each night and very entertaining. Food. Buffet is ok, food is good but I was disappointed to see the same food for 2 nights in a row. Need better mixture Sir Edwards was outstanding and higly recommend. Staff - This was way way better then I could ever imagine. WOW. they were great, the servers are the best , very nice and speedy. Please tip as they really deserve it. We usually go to Jamaica, the Mexicans blow them away. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: sophiec74
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Riu Tequila, then transferred to the Riu Palace (Cancun), as there was a promotion going on. Transfers cost us nothing. A fantastic hotel to stay in, we were in a room at the top of the hotel and the views were fantastic (although I dont like heights, just dont look downwards) People really friendly. Nightclubs and bars just a few minutes walk away. You can use the Riu hotel next door, which we did at night, started off having a few drinks there then went to the bars outside. I would love to go back to Mexico at some point, but it would have to be to the Palace. This was the best holiday (honeymoon) I have ever been on, and am always saying to my husband that I would love to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Tequila, LOVED the Palace!”
Reviews.Author: photoameteur
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 8 day stay in Playa Del Carmen. Originally booked the Tequila for all 8 days, but while we were there the hotel offered us our last 2 days to be spent at the RIU Palace Mexico. Not sure why they did this, there was no "catch" to it. The Palace was absolutely wonderful and so picture perfect...as I am a photo nut! If we had it to do over, we would have stayed at the Palace and paid the extra money. My husband and I traveled with our two sons 17 & 10 yrs old. The room: Wonderful, nice extra living room area that we didn't have at the Tequila The surroundings at the resort...if you want absolutely stunning surroundings go to the palace. It was easy to get a shaded umbrella spot there even early in the afternoon. The beach..beautiful...beautiful. I would feel a bit more comfortable with the older ones going to the beach alone from the palace since it is very close, rather than the tequila....that way you can easily check on them. The beach in front of the palace is nice and sandy. If you stay at the palace waiters come around the beach with drinks for you and you can use the hammocks on the beach also. The shows...only one we saw was Michael Jackson and it was good. we were so wiped out by 9:30 we went to bed early every day and couldn't stay up late enough to watch the shows. The Food....VERY good at both resorts! Palace has a bit more elegance about it, but couldn't complain about either. The buffet has a nice variety and we didn't bother going to any other specialty restaurants at either resort. None of us got diarhhea or sick at all. The kids loved the ice cream at lunch and dinner and I loved the chocolate dipped marshmallows (yum) If you come back without gaining weight....you are certainly better than we are :o) Excursions....we did the snorkeling adventure at Maroma beach through apple vacations/lomas travel and it was very nice although it was too windy to do the spinnaker so we didn't get that part. We went to Xel-ha and the kids really liked it...especially the jumping off the cliff which they did like 50 times. We also went parasailing at the beach which was awsome...I thought it would be scary but it wasn't at all. My youngest son was afraid to go but came back with a huge smile and was fine going with my older son....they loved it. One other thing....we noted that there were more travelers from USA at the Palace (seemed to be the majority) where at the Tequila we were more in the minority it seemed. Any questions, let me know.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing week”
Reviews.Author: drlawdo
Reviews.Content: Our trip to RPM was from a Tuesday to Sunday, earlier this month. We had a wonderful time for the most part and I would like to provide you with some information from our trip. FOOD-Overall pretty good. If you are looking for gourmet, big-city dining than you will not find it here. The food is good, but not what I would consider gourmet, so if you are very snobby about your food this may be a problem. If all you need is some good quality hot food then you will have no problems. One thing we found is that a lot of the food is deep fried, which is a problem for a lot of people. We felt breakfast was the best meal consistently. Also, we ate at the japanese restaurant once and the steakhouse twice. Not a huge fan of the japanese place but the steakhouse was very good. The buffet dining room was also pretty good with theme nights every night. DRINKS-You can have them as weak or as strong as you like, you just have to ask. If you do not ask then you will receive the standard weak one shot drink. The bartenders are very friendly and will accomodate your any request. Drinks are brought to you on the beach as well as the pool. SERVICE-Outstanding. Twice daily maid service. Everyone is very accomodating. Waiters, bartenders, etc. very, very nice. ROOM-We had a regular room with no view of anything other than the roof of the theater, but not a problem. The beds are two doubles pushed together and they are HARD, no messing around. We slept allright but they are HARD. A limited number of mattress pads are available, but we were unable to get any. Otherwise the room was clean as was the bathroom. BEACH-The beach is eroded away in comparison to previous pictures I saw, but overall it isnt that bad. You have access to the ocean and many beach chairs are available on the beach and even near the water. Some hotels north of ours had practically no usable beach. The water seemed clean and very warm. MISC-Lots of daily activities throughout the resort. Some nightly entertainment, but it ends at 11pm. If you are into clubs and dancing late into the night you will have to go to another resort or into Playa, because it isnt here. Check in and check out were pain free. We had no real problems to speak of. We are very easy to please people. Booze, beach, and books is just fine for us, but if you are very picky about things then you will find things to pick at here. We had a very nice time and enjoyed ourselves. This resort was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort (!!) -- a detailed review”
Reviews.Author: KYtrekker
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 wonderful nights (June 10-16) at this beautiful resort and had a marvelous experience! I had done exhaustive Internet research, including reading countless TripAdvisor reviews, before booking the resort. I’m happy to report that it met all my expectations – and then some. In selecting a resort, we wanted an all-inclusive that met this criteria: classy accommodations with excellent service; good food served in an air conditioned environment; a beautiful beach on clear, turquoise water; a location near Playa del Carmen, but not right in town and a resort with an adult atmosphere, rather than one which catered to kids and teens. The RPM satisfied all of the above criteria, including a lovely beach (described below) despite the erosion at this resort and in much of the Playacar properties. We did like Playacar very much, because of it being a gated resort community with restricted access, so guests are not harassed by beach vendors at these resorts. It is also very pretty, with tree-lined sidewalks and a shopping center in an upscale atmosphere. At the Palace, you are treated like honored guests and you want for nothing. The service is exceptional, and the staff, from waiters to housekeepers, greet you with a warm smile and a gentle “hola” wherever you go. They truly go the extra mile to serve their guests and to keep the entire resort spotless and perfectly manicured CHECK-IN: We arrived around 1:00 p.m. and were greeted at the door by the gregarious Manuel, who extended a warm welcome, before whisking away our luggage. The welcoming continued at the front desk, where we were given refreshing drinks and useful information. Our room was ready and our luggage was transported immediately. ROOM: Our room was a courtyard suite (which I recommend), with a balcony overlooking the fountains. It was clean, spacious and attractively furnished. I did not notice a musty smell, but I did note some signs of mold around the bathroom tiles. It is, after all, an extremely humid climate. The rooms contain a mini-bar with 4 premium liquors cased in dispensers. A fridge is stocked with bottled water, soft drinks, beer and mixers. All are replenished daily. The room also is equipped with an iron, blow drier, shower/bath combination and bidet. The A/C worked well, and each room has its own thermostat. GROUNDS: The grounds are beautifully adorned with fountains, reflecting pools, palms, shrubs and flowers. One word of caution: Throughout the resort, both inside and out, there are tile walkways that can be very slick when wet or even damp, which is most of the time. BEDS: The beds are two doubles pushed together (but made up separately) to make a king. The mattresses are hard, as reported. However, we asked for mattress pads shortly after arrival and by the time we returned from the beach to our rooms, our beds had been remade with the pads. They made a great difference and we slept well all week. BEACH: The beach, in my opinion, was lovely, even with the erosion. The upper beach is very deep with rows and rows of beautiful palms. We found loungers under the palms at all times of the day, so shade is abundant. The lower beach leading into the water (below the drop off) is wide enough in places to accommodate a couple of rows of loungers, which are all in the sun. There is a sloped area from upper to lower beach for easy access to the ocean. The whole setting was just beautiful and the Caribbean waters are a resplendent aqua in front of this and neighboring resorts. You can walk along the beach going south for a great distance. POOL: The pool is pretty, but not spectacular. It encircles the bar and has a quite side and a more active side. One side of the bar is a swim-up, the other side a walk-up. There are plenty of loungers available at any hour of the day. FOOD: The food is certainly plentiful and the quality is mediocre to good. Breakfasts, which we ate every day on the beautiful outdoor terrace, are outstanding. We ate at the specialty restaurants for dinner 3 times – twice at the “gourmet” restaurant, Sir Edward’s, and once at the Brazilian restaurant. Sir Edwards was the better of the two. Reservations must be made in the morning for that evening, and seating times are 6:30 pm and 9:00 pm. We really didn’t find the reservation system cumbersome at all. We simply appeared downstairs at the theater at 8:30 am on our way to breakfast, got in a short line and within minutes had our dinner reservation. Reservations may be made anytime from 8:30 am to 10:30 am, but your chances of getting the time you want are better if you go early. No reservations are necessary for the buffet (Don Julian’s). DRESS CODE FOR DINNER: Men must wear long pants, shirts with collars and closed toed shoes at the specialty restaurants and Don Julian’s for dinner. This doesn’t mean that guests need to “dress up” for dinner, however. A pair of khaki pants, a knit shirt and penny loafers, for example, will suffice. Women may wear slacks or dresses, and can wear any kind of shoes they want. DRINKS: What can I say – your glass is bottomless! All the bars at the hotel and on the beach provide excellent service. Premium liquor is available, but you have to request it. The drinks can be a bit weak, but you can also request that they be made stronger. All the staff is very accommodating. TIPS: Tipping isn’t required and is supposedly included (at a rate of 15%), but we tipped for most everything – from the doorman to the housekeepers to the waiters and bartenders. After all, service was not just average but exceptional, and at home we would certainly tip more than 15% for outstanding service. SHOWS: There was live music provided by local and regional bands every night in the courtyard patio. We enjoyed sitting outside and having drinks before dinner and then coming back after dinner to listen to the music and have more drinks. The theater had a show every night that was a Broadway-type dance revue with lip-sync. The dancers were quite good and the Michael Jackson (impersonator) show was especially fun. Everything shuts down at 11:00 pm and the resort becomes very quiet. Those wanting more action may go across the street to the RIU Tequila, which has a disco bar. The only negative all week was the cigarette smoke we encountered in the bars and outdoor terrace. Thankfully, smoking isn’t permitted in the restaurants (except, perhaps, the open air one at the beach). I feel certain this is not unique to this resort, but it did keep us from using the lobby bar or spending much time in the theater. All in all, this is an incredible resort and an excellent value. We loved it and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: beachbum7405
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the RIU Palace Mexico was excellent! The hotel is an all inclusive and it lived up to our expectations. Restaurants were great and even though you had to make a reservation each day between 8:30am-10:30am, we always ate when and where we wanted. Of the speciality resturants we thought all were good except the Brazilian. I am a seafood lover and the Brazilian was rotiserie style, a meat and potatoes kind of meal. The hotel grounds are beautiful and the nightly entertainment was much better than we thought it would be. We especially liked the outdoor courtyard at night(lots of servers ready to get you another drink). The water and sand on the beach were beautiful, but crowded. The hotel is in the Playacar area where the hotels are one after the other, pretty close and the beach still has erosion from a hurricane a couple of years ago. We booked with our travel agent through Vacation Express. Royal Tours (aka Vacation Express in that area) were outstanding. We had no problem with hotel transfers on either end. We also took a tour through them that we just loved, it was a combo tour of the Mayan Ruins in Tulum and snorkling in two places. One of the snorkling places was an underground river in a cave, just beautiful! Overall our trip was fantasic and I would highly recommed the RIU Palace Mexico and Vacation Express.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sl2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple just returned from a week at the Riu Palace Mexico, June 11 - 16. We didn't really find anything negative to report. So here goes... If you traveling with adults only I would suggest staying here. Very few kids b/c there’s nothing for them to do. The food was excellent and the hotel was very nice. The only downfall is that they don’t have king beds. They push two full size beds together to make one big one. It didn’t bother us though we still had a good time. The beds are very hard so I ordered a mattress pad and it made all the difference. There is a separate sitting area with a coffee table and couch so you don’t have to hang out on the bed to watch TV or eat your food. The mini bar is stocked with 4 different kinds of liquor, beer, soda, and bottled water. When you’re at the restaurants you can order ice water and not worry about getting sick. It’s all filtered. I even brushed my teeth with the bathroom facet water. I didn’t drink the bathroom facet water b/c we had bottled water in the room so I would encourage you to drink out of the bottle. The resort itself is very laid back and quiet. There is no music on the beach so very peaceful to read your book or take a nap under the Palm Trees. The pools aren’t that big b/c there aren’t many kids that vacation there. They do have a decent size swim up bar and water volleyball for all to enjoy. Besides the water activities they have beach volleyball, ping pong, dance lessons, and several other activities offered everyday. It’s not a pushy resort so they don’t hassle you do partake in any of the activities, which is very nice. They have the traditional buffet for breakfast everyday with an omelet bar and everything else you could imagine. They even had a smoothie bar at breakfast!!! Lunch was also served buffet style and was probably my favorite meal of the day. I had fajitas everyday for lunch and I never got tired of them!!!!! You have several choices for dinner. There is the traditional buffet (no complaints) with a different theme each night or you can choose from 4 different restaurants which included a Brazilian steakhouse (very good), Japanese (also very good), French (we didn’t try), and a traditional steakhouse (which we couldn’t get reservations). Oh, did I forget to mention that room service is included in your package????? I ordered room service at some point every day. I just tipped the delivery boy a couple of dollars each time and I never had to wait more than 10 minutes for my food. Very Nice!!!! We took a $5 taxi into town to do some shopping. I highly recommend going into town at least once while you’re there. It’s a very safe area so you always feel safe. The shopping towards the south end of 5th Avenue is better than the north end. The south end merchants are willing to negotiate they’re prices. I bought a gift for everyone in my family and never spent more than $10 per person!!! While you’re on 5th Avenue you should also eat at one of the restaurants. You won’t be sorry!!! My shrimp was out of this world and only cost $20. Plus we negotiated a free top shelf drink with our dinner. You really can’t beat that! If you have any questions about Playa or any of the other resorts just shoot me an email and I’ll be more than happy to answer.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best.”
Reviews.Author: Bermudez
Reviews.Content: I just recently came back from a 5-day vacation at the Riu Palace Mexico. There were some setbacks that you have to be aware of before you pick this hotel. When I arrived, the staff at the front desk were very friendly. They offered us drinks and gave us a quick 'tour' of the hotel on a map. Although our trip encountered some bumps in the road, i have to be honest and say the staff is very helpful. But please request for a room on the second floor, courtyard view or not. The one on the lower floors have alot of humidity and high balcony walls, not offering such a good view. One of the bed legs were broken, and the matress slid sideways. On our second day, the showerhead broke and wet everything in the bathroom. And on the same day, the mini-fridge broke as well as the TV. So you could say constantly calling the front desk didn't add much joy to our summer vacation. The pools are very small -- not much room for swimming laps, unless you wanna bump into a few people on the way. But i guess that's ok. The beach was ok, but half was obstructed by a mass of rocks. [The beds, this added as a sudden thought, are very firm and hard.] I enjoyed dining at Don Julian but make sure to make reservations every morning. It can get a little boring (despite having different themes every night, it feels as if it's the same thing as the night before). Please, please be sure to put every one of your electronics and valuable belongings into the safebox in the closet. On my 4th day, I arrived at my room after a blissful day at the beach and found my bags teared apart -- not like how I left them. My daughter's was ripped open and her mp3 player wasen't in it's depths anymore. I didn't want to jump to conclusions but I did, of course -- the house-keeping at the hotel is very poor. I've seen the televisions on when I pass by and they spend more then 15 minutes in each room. So just be warned; take any of your valuables with you in a bag, but of course just lock it in the safe box. Overall, our experience was..mediocre. This review was to inform you then there's more then meets the eye. The Riu Hotels in Playa Car are very beautiful and you should check them out before you choose this palace that isn't quite as relaxing as i thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Long Review of Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Julie21037
Reviews.Content: I and six of my girlfriends went on a girls' trip for the week of June 2nd through June 9th. We were a little apprehensive at first, as we had booked our vacation through Apple Vacations and they were slightly unresponsive. Our concerns were this: We were due to arrive on a direct flight from BWI to CUN to arrive at 8:30 a.m. Cancun time. Check in at the hotel is 3:00. Who would keep our bags? Would we still be able to use the facilities? On top of this, about a week prior to our departure, we contacted our travel agent to ask him where our tickets were. He advised us that we were flagged for document pick up at the airport. Huh? We were told that they would be delivered to us 10 days prior to our departure. We asked him for something tangible to travel with, he obliged by sending us an email we could print out and present to the check-in rep at the airport. As it turns out, our concerns regarding lack of documentation were unwarranted. Apple Vacation bought USA3000 a few years back, and when you show up at the airport, you hand them your identification and they hand you your plane ticket, travel vouchers, and shuttle confirmation in a neat little packet for you to carry with. One word to the wise, USA3000 has a strict 50 lbs. per bag limit. If your bag is over 50 lbs., they charge you $50.00 more. So, pack a duffel bag just in case, that way you can separate your stuff at the check-in counter and save yourself some money. The scale is right there... there's no squeeking by. I used the duffel. No biggie. Cancun airport isn't confusing - it's relatively simple, you walk until you find who you're looking for. With Apple Vacations, their people have a Hawaaiian shirt on and are located outside of the terminal. Close to the doors of the terminal where you walk outside, there are probably about 50 people who will try to get your attention to take you on a tour of a local resort/condo facility. Ignore them and keep walking...unless you're into that sort of thing. We loaded a big ol' bus and waited for the rest of the bus to fill up. My husband and I cruise quite frequently, and have up until now avoided the cattle car experience. When booking through Apple, you are cattle. You are expected to wait for the rest of your party - which can be on another flight, arriving at another time. They're not leaving until their busses are full. We sat for a good hour before heading to Playa del Carmen. Just outside of Playa del Carmen (to the south of it) is a resort area which houses about 10 or 15 hotels...this is where the Riu Palace Mexico is located. It's in the middle of the chain of hotels on the waterfront, so by walking north or south along the beach line, you can access other Riu facilities. Playacar is about an hour South of Cancun. It's a straight shot on a highway, and not an unpleasant ride at all. We tipped the bus driver, the luggage handler, and the tour guide from apple. $10 for all three on the way down, per person. The checkin process was painless. You get a towel card, safe key, and a room key. Our rooms were ready when we got there at about 10:30 or so. We were pleased. The rooms are clean and big enough to not knock into eachother. We were on the ground floor, in rooms 34, 36 & 37. Although we had requested adjoining rooms, we were given rooms very close to eachother, but not adjoining. I'm not sure if they have adjoining rooms at this resort...Our rooms faced the outside of the U the hotel makes. To see the inside of the rooms, there are pictures posted everywhere on the internet - surf around. I will warn you that this place is HUMID. You are in a tropical environment. Any wet item that you place on the drying rack located on your balcony will stay wet, first of all, and be covered in mosquitos in the morning. This is not the resort's fault. It's just the way it is! The buffets and restaurants were all acceptable. I won't say superb, I've had better, but I've had worse. I tipped everywhere I went. I read somewhere that the average income for this area of Mexico is approx $360 per month USD. With this in mind, I kept my purse with me most times and tipped a dollar or two with each meal. Finding Mexican food in this resort is a challenge. If you want tacos, take a cab into town and eat at any of the places there. They have cool bars/clubs/restaurants all over Playa del Carmen and for a $5.00 cab ride, you can find pretty much anything you like for the taking. Italian, Steakhouses, Mexican restaurants, etc. About 1/2 way through the week, we'd realized that nothing we'd worn had dried. Usually, you can wear a tshirt once in the morning, and once in the afternoon. This is not the case in a 100 degree climate. By half way through the week, we'd investigated using the laundry services at the resort. They were very expensive. So, we hooked a cab into town, found a laundromat with a Mexican woman to wash our clothes for us. They charge per kilo. It's inexpensive. If you do regular service, it's ready the next day. If you expedite, it's ready within about 6 hours. It's up to you. We expedited and a full load was about 10 dollars, US, folded and dry. What more could we ask? We would have paid the same for about 3 tee shirts at the resort. The excursions we booked through Apple were a toss up. One was great, the other just ridiculous. Our agent at the resort was unavailable after the initial payment was made. The first excursion we took was the Mayan Adventure experience. We snorkeled in 3 different places, a cenote, an ocean inlet, and an underwater cave. The guide was knowledgeable and friendly, and it was money well spent. The lunch they provided tasty. Again, we tipped. About $20 for the day. The second excursion we booked through Apple was cancelled and we were never informed. We waited for over an hour at our designated pick up spot, and returned to the hotel, where our Apple Rep was off for the day. One of the desk staff bent over backwards to help us. We wanted to catamaran, so we remembered the name of Fat Cat, a catamaran that operates locally. We asked him to call them directly, so he did. He went out of his way to make sure that we were booked for the next day, and even arranged payment and pickup for us. The next day, I understand that he was given a hard time by Apple Vacations for overstepping his boundaries. I had to write a letter to be given to the hotel management, Apple Vacations, as well as Fat Cat, to explain that we had asked him to help us directly. Sounds like a little politics, right? I have a bad taste in my mouth when it comes to Apple after this vacation. The way that I see it, he went out of his way to help us. In hindsight, he did what he could to ensure that the hotel's clientele was cared for. Apparently, Apple doesn't support that theory. I will never book through Apple again. Onto the beaches and pools: The beaches of Playacar are wasting away. There is a 5 foot drop off at the edge of the palm trees to get down to the water at this resort. The neighboring hotels either have something similar or no beach at all. Still, we made the best of it and walked up and down the shoreline looking for the ultimate beach experience. You can use any Riu facility when you stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. We used a couple of the other Rius while we were there. Different resorts have different classes of alchohol, by the way. When you ask for premium liquors at some of the neighboring resorts, they'll laugh at you and tell you to go back to your luxury resort. Hee hee. I took it all with a grain of salt. You're on vacation. If a better class of alcohol will make or break your day, then stay in the upper eschalon of the Riu hotels, such as the Riu Palace Mexico or the Riu Palace Rivera Maya. Stay away from the hotels that cater to the party crowd...Riu Tequila or Yucatan. You'll get water aerobics there with a wigged bunch that tells jokes, not premium liquors. As for the return, you're on the cattle car again...You wait in the lobby for your bus to arrive and then get driven all over the place on the way to the airport. It's up to you whether you get bent out of shape about it...I have already stated that I will never do an Apple vacation again. I prefer direct and preferential treatment, something you are not afforded with a group attitude travel company. Lesson learned. So, in summary: Riu Resort Facilities: B+ Riu Staff: A+ Apple Vacations Travel Agent: C- Apple Representative at the resort: F Riu Food: C Playacar Beaches: D Playa del Carmen City: A If you need more tips, please contact me and enjoy this lovely place. It's truly a beautiful experience if you can get past the little annoyances that might happen...

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: STL1
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my second trip to Riu Palace Mexico! Once again, it exceeded all expectations! I loved the resort so much that I had my wedding there. The wedding coordinators aren't the greatest (nor is the spa!), but aside from that the day went perfectly and was everything I could have imagined!!! I definitely recommend hiring the harpist and getting married on the beach! There is some beach erosion, but it actually worked out well for the wedding. We were basically right on the beach and there were no sunbathers in any of our photos! Best of all...our guests were able to sit in the shade of palm trees. In all we had 17 guests. The resort did a great job of always putting seats together, decorating the tables, and giving our group extra attention! No one had reason to complain! My uncle celebrated a birthday while he was there. No one in our party informed the hotel yet they somehow knew and decorated his room with towel animals, balloons and flowers. At dinner the table was decorated, they sang happy birthday and even presented him with a large birthday cake. The resort truly is gorgeous! Even the "lowest grade" rooms are impressive. Every room is a suite and has its own mini bar. My husband and I even got upgraded to a suite facing the ocean at no additional charge. (the beds are kind of hard and are two full size beds pushed together....bet somehow I had amazing sleep on the trip!) Note of warning: This isn't a place for kids. This may bother some people, but is exactly why I chose the resort. I saw perhaps 3 children the entire time! It was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “For the price, it was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: livehappy8
Reviews.Content: 6 or so of us went and all stayed. Truly all inclusive, full size bottles of tequila, vodka, whiskey, and rum? in the rooms as well as a mini bar. Food was OK...not amazing, but for an all inclusive it was very good. Breakfast in the main dining room was fantastic. It's not a place where a 5 star celeb chef is going to be, but again, it's all inclusive. Drinks at the bar were a tad watered down, even for a beach bar. The beach was beautiful, lots of chairs, plenty of shade if wanted. Tons to do on the beach. The spa was truly great. My massage appt was pushed back 15 minutes, so they gave me some cool mint/lime water and access to the private jecuzzi. The pool was ok. Easy to get a cab and 5 dollars anywhere in town. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “15th visit back home”
Reviews.Author: cecooper
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 15th visit to the Riu Palace Mexico. It felt lke a family reunion. From the moment we stepped off our Van to Manuel's warm and loving greeting, I knew we were home. The food , the service, the grounds, the room , the entertainment, nothing compares. Maria Jose, the manager is top notch. She makes you feel like a member of her family rather than a visitor to the resort. I cain't imagine vacationing anywhere else, My husband and I highly recommend this resort. Once you visit you will never go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it what a wonderful place !!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaz07
Reviews.Content: We are a group of 4 ( 2 couples) who have just had our first experience of a Riu Palace hotel and what can I say ........ it was brilliant. Check in The check in was great and Katie on reception was extremely efficient in getting everyone who arrived at the same time booked in and informed about the hotel in a short time. One of our party was ill whilst we were there and again Katie came to the rescue she was great. Rooms The rooms looked a little dark at first as we overlooked the side of the hotel and a walkway to the beach next door but it was a quiet location which was great. The cleanliness of the rooms and the maid service was excellent and the towel sculptures kept us smiling ...the mermaid was particularly good. I was impressed by the reception and guest services who did ring and check a couple of times if everything was ok and we were enjoying our stay. Pool The pool was lovely we stayed on the quiter side and it was never crowded and sunbeds were available most of the day. The pool cleanliness was the best I have seen. Restaurants We visited 3 of the 4 speciality restaurants ( not the brazilian) our favourites were the steakhouse and Japanese which we went to twice, the buffet restaurant was also great I cannot understand anyone who is negative regarding the food as there was always fresh food arriving at all times even as the buffet was due to close Beach Well what can I say it is a real shame that the beach is not as it appears in the brochure photos and hopefully this can be remedied as soon as possible however it didn't spoil our stay Staff I cannot praise the staff enough NOTHING is too much trouble the restaurant staff were great especially Juan and Brigado. The bar staff made our holiday and were very attentive we just had to smile and another glass of champagne was at hand. Roy, Raul, Armando Jr, Oniver, Lopez, Manuel, Carmen, Lupita , David and of course Toni ( Antonio Banderas..... ) and I am sorry if I missed anyone they work so hard but remain cheerful and enjoyed the banter with us, we even taught them how to speak like a northerner instead of 'lovely jubbly' . All in all our stay was fantastic and we would love to go back again and again but there are so many places in the caribbean to still visit so it may not be for a few years, however, we are looking at Riu hotels for next years holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: bliss24
Reviews.Content: We went on our honeymoon to the Riu Palace Mexico on the week of May 21st and had an incredible time! The hotel grounds are stunning, everything is immaculate and absolutely gorgeous. We loved the food, and were treated so nicely by all the staff....when they heard we were on our honeymoon they sent us a fruitbasket, a bottle of tequila, and a cute little handpainted souvenir to take home. I loved the fact that room service was included too....mmm breakfast in bed everyday! The one downside is the beach....it kept eroding while we were there, right before our eyes....it's not so bad though because there are still areas to get inside the water, and once you're in, the water is absolutely beautiful. Don't forget to go snorkeling too! The hotel offers tours for about $30...definitely worth it. Overall it's a great hotel and I'd go back there in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heartbeat!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tapifer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple went there for our wedding anniversaries and enjoyed every minute of it. We have NEVER been to an all inclusive resort so we have nothing to compare this too...but it was TRULY amazing!!!! We have been reading all the comments from previous people that have wrote about the resort so we went in knowing about the beach, hard beds and what not. HOWEVER...I don't agree completly with everything I have read. Here is a REAL QUICK review of what I thought about everything.... BEACH: wonderful....YES, it's not all there...but by no means does this take away from the resort. Yes there are hard sand stones around the entrance of the beach...I feel and scraped my knee...but it was no big deal, the beach was beautiful and had many places to play in the waves or boogee board or swim. As for laying out, it's mostly palmtress around...so you mostly in the shade laying out on the beach. But again, this didn't bother us one bit!! I have read some that alot of people come up to you while you are laying on the beach to try to sell you stuff...I was under the impression that there was TONS of ppl. that would come and bother you....thats NOT the case at ALL!!! We hardly saw anyone walking around...and if they do come up to you, all you have to do is say no thanks and they leave you alone. RESORT GROUNDS: BEAUTIFUL!!!!! AMAZING!!!!! I feel in love with this place and hated that our vacation had to end...I loved everything about the grounds and the emloyees do EVERYTHING to ensure that they are manitained. EMPLOYEES: They do everything possible to make sure you are happy and make sure you need everything you need. RESORT ROOMS: We read to request a courtyard view apon arrival, we did and our friends got one...but we didn't, I was VERY disapointed at first because ALL I read was how all the other rooms suck and whatnot and that was NOT the case again....our room was perfect...we had our own little personal balcony that was very nice and peaceful. The beds were hard...but not TOO hard, but we requested a matress pad which made them almost as comfy as our beds at home. You don't have to tip the made but we did about 3-5 dollars a day and we got nice towel animals everynight, except the last. My husband asked the maid for flowers on the bed since it was our anniversary and when we came back from the beach that evening there were beautiful swans in a heart like shape with flowers everywhere...it was beautiful!!!!!!!! ENTERTAINMENT: Everynight they have a show...we saw Las Vegas, Grease and Michael Jackson...they were very entertaining. I loved them all.. ..I saw nothing to complain about them...they of course are not professionals...but it was worth the time to see them!!!!! FOOD: Was GREAT!!!! Buffett was wonderful.....something for everyone there...the only other side dinners we tried was La Bodega (Spelling???)...which was WONDERFUL...but it took FOREVER, so if you have anything planned that night don't plan on eating here...but I do recomend trying it one night....and the other one was Sir Edwards....it was GREAT too!!! Other than taht we stuck with the buffett...it was the BEST! As far as making reservations....its not as bad as ppl. made it out to be....we were already up that early.. ..we just walked in, NEVER had to wait in line, asked what they had open....and that was it....it NEVER took longer than 5 minutes!!!! EXTRAS: My husband, I and our 2 friends parasailed (VERY awesome and I suggest thius to everyone) we also swam with the dolphins at dolphin discovery and we did a jungle tour in Cancun where we snorkeled. It was worth the extra money spent. NEEDLESS to say we had a blast, I would recommend this resort to anyone...I wish our vacation wasn't over. As far as all the negitive you hear about this place....these ppl. must be really picky or something because everything was WONDERFUL!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our honeymoon at the Riu”
Reviews.Author: jennss990
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu for 1 week, for our honeymoon. Our wedding was at the Gran Bahia Prinicpe the week before, but we decided to try somewhere new for our vacation as newlyweds. The Riu is beautiful as a hotel and for it's landscape. Food is always such a personal matter. We really enjoyed it - the buffet and the a la carte restuarants. As for the beds, yes, they are hard. When checking in you may as well as ask for a mattress cover right away. It makes such a difference. Our room was in the back of the hotel. We had read about the 2 beds pushed together but gave it a try. It is pretty unromantic, but you make due... At first we asked to move rooms (for the view) and they gave us some run around about how we couldn't change rooms untilt he next day so we just stayed. As it turns out, the room was great - having a private balcony facing the back courtyard was perfect! We took full advantage of having a private "sunbathing" area, which we wouldn't have had in any other room. We were not crazy about the beach. It's very squishy and it takes about 2 minutes to walk from one end to the other. We would go down to jump in the waves (you cannot swim or snorkel here) , but lie by the pool to relax. The waves in the ocean are quite large. I stumbled a few times and got a nasty scratch on my leg. Also, regarding injuries, be careful entering the shower/tub. I slipped three times and bruised the same spot on my leg from the tub. It did not look good in honeymoon photos! One further note regarding safety - do not touch the seaweed. My husband got a terrible rash from it under his arms that burned something awful. We don't know what it was, but we know it was fromt he seaweed. If you are sensative to cigarette smoke, DO NOT GO HERE. We are not smokers and there were times we could not bear to walk through the lobby, bar, or in the theatre. The stench stays on your cloths and in your suitcase. Also, there is a nasty rotting garbage smell near the theatre/restaurants which becomes quite unbearable. I would not visit here again just based on the smells! We did like the Riu for it's location. We probably spent more time off the resort grounds. We rented a car, which is really the way to go. We went to the Cristal cenotes, which were amazing, We actually had the entire cenote to ourselves! It is past Tulum and pretty sketchy, but well worth it and only $4/pp! Akumal beach (more than once) for FREE access to a non touristy beach and the best snorkling, Yakul ja (also for snorkling), Tulum, Cozumel (the biggest waste of a day and money!) and into Playa Del Carmen. We've been a few times to this area so if you have any questions about what to see/do please feel free to ask. Overall, we love the area but will not stay at the Riu again. It is good for first time all inclusive vacationers to get an idea of the area. Very safe too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: rob10
Reviews.Content: We like to stay in nice hotels and pay that little bit more for the nice things, so my expectations are fairly high - this hotel met them easily, it was great. My wife and I spent 2 weeks in the Riu Palace in May 07. The hotel is well laid out. All the rooms are large with a sofa / seating area and balcony/terrace. The layout of the hotel is like a giant "C", with square sides. This means 50% of the rooms face inwards to a beautiful fountain area (in all the brochures) and 50% face outwards to neighbouring properties. If you can, get a fountain facing room - they are the premium rooms, but as we were not in peak season we did not pay extra, though it was arranged at time of booking. The trip was our first all inclusive holiday. Given this, we knew to expect buffet style and if you don't expect a michelin-starred restaurant, you won't be disappointed. The main evening buffet was great - themed nights and always a big selection of different items, to cater for most tastes. As well as the main restaurant, there are 4 other restaurants, all requiring booking and they operate on a sitting system, so there is less flexibility in them. The Japanese and Gourmet (French) are worth a visit. Booking system is a bit of a pain, but not overly-so. We spent most of our time by the pool - lots of sunbeds to choose from, no need to hog with towels. Loads on the beach too. There is an issue with the beach in the hotel and along the peninsula - it is being eroded away by the sea. If you want to spend a few days by the sea as part of your holiday, fine. If you want to spend your entire holiday on the beach, check the status of it before you book. It is changing on an almost weekly basis. As "palace" guests, you can use the facilities of all Riu hotels in the area (there are 5). The nearest one is literally next door - 2 mins along the beach. We used that. The staff deserve mention - extremely friendly and could not do enough for you. Bar and Restaurant service is excellent - waiters always ordering new drinks for you and keeping you topped up We would thoroughly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “***Our Best Holiday Yet!***”
Reviews.Author: yr1980
Reviews.Content: I was one of a group of ten who have just returned from Playacar after spending a fabulous fortnight at the Riu Palace Mexico in May 2007. It was our third visit to the hotel in the last 4yrs and it definetly wont be our last! After speaking to other guests we are not the only ones to return year after year! The staff are all friendly and polite and nothing is too much trouble for them. Many of them remembered us by name when we returned this year! The food is gorgeous & they have a very wide selection. Breakfast is served from 7am - 12pm and they have everything you could think of including cereal, full english, pancakes, fresh fruit and smoothies. Lunch is between 12.30pm - 3pm in three restaurants everyday and again there is a very wide selection. Dinner is serverd between 6pm - 10pm. The main buffet restaurant has a different theme each night including Mexican, Oriental, Italian and Caribean. The hotel also has four restaurants they are Brazilian, French, Japanese and a Steakhouse. I would recommend all of them. To eat in any of these you have to book between 8.30am - 10am on the day you want to eat there. The French and Japenese have two sittings per night, 6.30pm and 9pm. You can more or less pick any time you want for the other two restaurants. We never had any trouble booking a table for the 10 of us in any of these restaurants. The evening entertainment has improved a lot since our first visit, there is a live band and a show everynight and excellent waiter service so you dont have to move from your seat! If you just fancy a quiet night the Cubano bar is the place to go. There are two pools, both have waiter service. A quiet one to just chill out and the other one has a swim up bar and lots of seating, you can also play volleyball and do water areobics in this one! There are plenty of sun loungers to choose from as well so you dont have to save them with a towel every morning! The pool and the beach more or less run into each other and there are also loads of sun loungers on the beach as well as some hammocks and they are so comfy! Dont let what other people have said about the beach put you off. It has eroded a bit but you can get access to the sea from the Riu Yucatan next door. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, they all have a hairdryer and full size ironing board and iron. The mini bar is well stocked with spirits and Corona and soft drinks and gets filled up daily. The beds are really comfortable as well. There are six Riu hotels in Playacar, the furthest is a five minute walk away, as a guest at the Riu Palace you can use all of their facilities but they cant use the Palace. You can eat in any of these hotels for breakfast and lunch but not for dinner. There are nightclubs in the Riu Playacar (next door) and the Riu Tequila (opposite). The Tequila is probably the best for evening entertainment and has a sports bar to watch all the big games! Playacar has quite a few shops to pick up some souveniers and is only over the road from the hotel. Playa del carmen is much more built up and worth a $5 taxi ride. Xel-ha is also worth a visit if you enjoy snorkelling. There are no hidden extras at the Riu Palace it really is all inclusive! Overall i gave this holiday 10/10. I hope this review has helped you decide where to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Calling_In_Sick
Reviews.Content: If I were just rating the hotel on its own I would definately give it 6 stars if I could. Unfortunately, the beach is terribly eroded. We had to walk to the hotel next door, Riu Yucatan to get to a safe drop off to the beach. The beach area is very crowded due to the vast erosion. Everything else in the hotel was immaculate. Beautiful grounds, delicious food for an all-inclusive, and plentiful drinks. Our favorite restaurant was Sir Edward, try the lamb, delicious!! The hotel had a nice mix of American and European guests, mostly couples. I would not recommend this hotel for singles.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed at the RIU”
Reviews.Author: Maryland1
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on this resort before and since I booked back in Feburary, I figure maybe I could help someone with their decision since it did with mine. So here goes. We arrived late, like 11 p.m but the check in went very smooth. Even at that time at night the staff had smiling faces and were were eager to answer any questions. We arrived in our room which was nice and cool. It was a suite, which all the rooms are. The bed that is to be a king are two doubles pushes together, they are all like that. Yes, the beds are hard but we slept very well beacause the beach, pool and drinks wear you out. From the bed area you step down in the living area which has a sofa and television. From there you walk out onto the patio.The bathroom was very clean (a clean bathroom is a telling sign to me) and up to date.There is one sink a bath/shower tub combo and then a toilet in another space with a seperate door. The pools are are very clean and refreshing. The waiters come around and serve you drinks. There is a swim up pool bar. If you want a snack they have chips and melted nacho cheese at any time. The beaches are very clean and have soft sand to step on. Yes, there is a beach erosion problem but once you get a glimse of the water who cares!! You have about a two foot drop and in front of the hotel it is roped off. You walk just a few steps to the right and you arrive at the RIU Yucatan, there is access to the beach. Reaslly it is not a big issue!! The people staying at the RIU Playacar and RIU Palace Riveria Maya have no beach. There is plenty of food and a wide variety! If you can not find something to eat between the room service, buffets and specialty restaurants there is something wrong! The only complaint I have is there is not a lot of Mexican food and men must wear long pants to every dinner , buffet or not. We only went on one tour, the Mayan Adventure that takes you to three diffrent sites to snorkel. The first was a reef out in the ocean. We saw sting rays, baracudas and beautiful tropical fish. The next was a cave, the water was so clear but cold! The third was a cenote (sinkhole) where you can jump about twenty feet off a cliff into the water, you can also use the steps. We saw an eel, turtles and more fish. Our guide was Marisol, he was so friendly and just a pleasure to spend the day with!! The resort is layed back and geared toward families and couples. If you want more action with music and games that will make you laugh walk over to the RIU Yucatan. The crowd is younger. All in all it is a wonderful resort with friendly workers and I really wish I were back sitting on the beach with a drink in my hand! I would definetly stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go back or go to another RIU”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseySunLover31
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and went to the Riu Palace for 5 night over Memorial Day Weekend in 2007/ We had heard good feedback about the RIU in the Dominican Republic from two separate couples and read the reviews online and also went to the RIU's site. Let me say this.. the hotel is gorgeous! The staff is very helpful and pleasant! For those two reason we had an OK time. The food is horrible, and the beach is eroded and the beds feel like you are sleeping on a rock with sandpaper covering you. The beds are also two full size beds, pushed together to make a King. So if you plan on sleeping next to your partner.... one of you will be sleeping he crack (we asked other couples we met there and all the rooms are like this). The beach is a cliff of sand and then drops 15 feet to the water. You can go to the RIU that is next to the RIU Palace and use their beach, but so does everyone else so it is crowded. Also, there is no waitress/waiter service on the beach, so if you want to drink and relax, you will have to go get you're own drinks at the Tiki Hut or Pool Bar which isn't that close to the beach. Back to the food, if you read the RIU site and brochure they claim to have culinary chefs... I"m not sure what chefs they are using but I can cook better than them. The buffet is the same food options every day for breakfast/lunch and dinner. To go to the resturants you must make reservations by 10am (which isn't bad), but the late seating (8:45-9pm) fills up early, so you may get stuck with the early seating with this 6-6:45pm. We didn't like the fact that we had to make reservation every night, it caused us to be on their schedule, not our own, while on OUR vacation. We'd be sitting at the pool, asking what time it was b/c if we missed our dinner reservation, when we'd be eating at the buffet - AGAIN. The other thing is... the first day you get there, you can't make reservations at any of the resturants unless you get there before 10am, so this forces you to eat at the buffet. The wine selection... well there really isn't one, it's one white and one red to pick from. We had the red one night and it taste like grape juice. Overall the drinks are lite, ask for double or triple shots in your drinks and they will taste like a normal drink here in the states. We went to Xel-Ha for snorkeling, which is awesome. The only thing is... it is all day. You leave the hotel at 8am and don't get back until 6pm. Which again means you can't make reservations to eat at a resturant. If you go to Xel-Ha, only go for a 1/2 day. We found out after we bought the excursion and were on the bus that we could of done a 1/2 day at Xel-Ha and 1/2 day at the Tulum Ruins, which is only 10 minutes from Xel-Ha. It was our tour companies fault for not giving us all the options (Olympus Tours). By 1pm or so, you are tired of Xel-Ha and snorkeling, we sat at the bar for the rest of the day. Also, I would suggest taking a cab to and from the airport to the hotel. The Tour Companies drop off at several hotels and it makes the trip over an hour when it should be 30-40 mintues to the hotel. Overall.... I wouldn't go to another RIU and this RIU wasn't worth the money we paid for our trip, which was over 3400.00 with airfare for 5 nights. I've stayed at other hotels that are all inclusive like DREAMS in Puerta Vallarta that was much better as far as food, drinks and beach. It may of not had the grand entrance way with marble floors, etc... but it was a much better experience. GO AT YOUR OWN RISK. Keep in mind also, my boyfriend and I live in a Metropolitian Area, close to NYC and frequent resturants. We met other people from the midwest and west coast that didn't complain about the food as much, but still weren't happy with it. Most of the people there were couples, some families, not a lot of kids. Mostly couples our age in there mid to late 30's and a few couples in there 40's and 50's.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: SoJersey
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Riu Palace - we loved it! The grounds were beautiful, the food delicious and the waitstaff very polite. We (my wife & I), would highly recommend this hotel. We went with two other couples and had a fabulous time. Our weather was picture perfect for five days. A previous "trip advisor" suggested bringing 30 - 50 one dollar bills, how true! The airport and hotel service people (even though the tips are "included") definitely appreciate being tipped. One negative, the beach has eroded from a recent "high tide", thus there was no beach, but we still enjoyed ourselves! Future Riu guests at this hotel enjoy, we sure did.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace Mexico Great but beach is a disaster”
Reviews.Author: gerrydehaas
Reviews.Content: We had our second stay at the RIU Palace Mexico from May 5 until May 19, 2007 and experienced the luxury of this hotel with its nice grounds and beautiful rooms with nice view on the courtyard. Service was top class as ever and the food was well served as ever. BUT: On the first day of our arrival we went to what we thought was the beach as we left it two years ago. We experienced the biggest disappointment of our holidays as we arrived at the end of the palm trees and saw only water of the sea. The only place you could spend at the beach was under the palm trees and we had to step one meter down without stairs to be directly in the sea. When we left two years ago we had a beach of about 60 to 70 meters wide giving as much privacy as we wished to spend our holidays. Now we had to place our beds side by side with other people which gave no privacy at all. After a few days the beach got somehow wider however after a week it eroded again to the palm trees and even old trees and rocks appeared from underwater so we had to put our beds in the direction of the Yucatan hotel beach which was even more crowded than we experienced during the days before. Moreover getting into the water got more and more dangerous as we regularly stepped on hooked rocks which were under water and caused injuries to myself and my wife. This was all very disappointing to us and upon reporting this to the hotel's management we only received a confirmation of the problem but no foreseen action plan to improve the situation for the customers. This has made us decide not to return to RIU Palace Mexico before all of this has been taken care of. One last bad thing was the annoying behaviour of some people during the night during 7 days of our stay passing the corridors of the hotel shouting and kicking doors with the only meaning to awaken other customers. Sad to learn no action was taken by the hotel security to prevent this.

Reviews.Title: “Move up the beach to Riu Palace Riveria Maya”
Reviews.Author: KMP410
Reviews.Content: In the interest of full disclosure, I should note that this hotel was not our (my wife and I's) first choice. We had spent most of the time prior to our trip preparing to stay at the Grand Velas Resort and Spa in Nuevo Vallarta. However, because of some last minute changes to our travel schedule, we ended up here - not the end of the world, but certainly not comparable to the Grand Velas. Secondly, this was our third trip to Mexico, in previous years we had stayed at the Royal Hideaway and Secrets Excellence Riviera Cancun (while it was still SERC before it was sold and became ERC). Since we were not venturing to the west coast, as originally planned, we decided that we wanted to go back to Playacar. We decided not to go back to RH and try someplace new instead, thus, we ended up at the Riu Palace Mexico. We took a standard transfer from the airport and when we arrived at the hotel's front entrance, despite there being no one around waiting for a transfer, taxi, etc., and no one else arriving at the time, there was no one to be found to welcome us to the hotel and/or help with our luggage. Now, we are certainly capable of managing our own luggage (and in fact, normally do) however, it would have been nice to see a smiling face welcoming us to the resort and directing us to the front desk (not being totally devoid of a sense of direction, however, we managed to find it on our own ... though not before passing three bellman standing around having a conversation with each other). We checked in and got keys to our room and elected to carry our own bags to our room (mainly because no one at the front desk offered the help of bell services). When we walked into the room, we were both disappointed. The room was dingy, the floor was sticky (like it hadn't been mopped in weeks), there was a painting/wall hanging missing from the wall (the hooks and outline of the picture were still there), and there were several half empty beer bottles in the mini-bar fridge and tucked away behind the mini-bar glasses. We decided to sit down on the bed and collect ourselves for a minute before venturing out onto the grounds, and found that the beds were like cement and the pillows like rocks (now we're used to the hard beds in Mexico, but these were exceptionally hard). We decided to check out the rest of the hotel and wandered outside down towards the pool and beach to grab a little lunch. We walked around both sides of the buffet, and nothing looked remotely appetizing - we managed to find a few things that did not look like they had been sitting under heat lamps for hours, but even after a few bites, we settled on salad and bread. After lunch we took a walk down the street to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya ... it was like night and day. The building was impeccable, we got a peek at the rooms which were beautiful (and clean!) and the food at the buffet looked (and tasted) much better than what we had not more than an hour before at the Riu Palace Mexico. We returned to the Riu Palace Mexico and spoke with the manager, we explained that we wanted to switch to the Riu Palace Riveria Maya and he agreed to call their booking office the next day (as it was a Sunday and they were currently closed) and see if there was availability and we could switch. That night we ate at the dinner buffet (we couldn't get into a specialty restaurant .... see below for more on that). The best of the dinner was sitting outside on the patio of the restaurant enjoying the warm Mexican night and ocean breeze (the food was nothing spectacular). The next morning we were able to make the switch, and the rest of our week was fantastic at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya... It's still not on the same level as RH or ERC (however, you also pay considerably less here, and for the money you spend, it's an amazing value). Also, the poolside service was just as good as the poolside service at the RH and probably better than that at ERC. The rooms are nicely appointed and kept very clean. The food is very good - breakfast and lunch buffets offer moderate variety (however, still much of the same everyday, which can become a little boring by the end of the week). The specialty restaurants are very good - enjoyed the Oriental restaurant the most (went back twice). A word on the reservation system at both Riu Palaces... if you take nothing else that I said above to heart, then at least consider this when making your choice. Reservations at the Riu Palace Mexico must be made the morning of the day you want to eat. You have to go to the theater and get a number, and then at 8:30a or 9:00a they start taking reservations. You have to do this every morning. Reservations at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya can be made each day between 1p and 4p in the lobby bar, and you can make two reservations a day (so, essentially you can make all the reservations by the middle of your trip, if you make two each day). Also, you can be put on a wait list at the Riviera Maya in case there are cancellations (we had to do this to get a second night at the Oriental restaurant) and the staff actually does their best to get you into the restaurant if you're on the waitlist. It's entirely worth it to pay the extra $100/$150 per person for a week to stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya instead of the Riu Palace Mexico... don't find that out for yourself when it's too late, trust us on this one!!

Reviews.Title: “My Impression of the RIU Palace - Mexico”
Reviews.Author: kimrochelles
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Riu Palace - Mexico. I have found the reviews through Trip Advisor helpful so I thought I'd post one on this resort. I have visited the Riviera Maya south of Cancun 3 different times so I do have something to compare with from the area.
