I have read a lot of the previous reviews and will try to comment on things I have read. The Positives first because I believe the positives outweigh any negatives experienced: The resort itself is immaculate and beautiful and all the staff I came into contact during my recent stay May 13-May 20th, 2007 were EXCELLENT. The entire RIU Staff is quite impressive, They are hardworking, friendly, helpful and in my opinion enjoy their jobs. The daily entertainment staff is BY FAR the best I have experienced in the area. They are always polite, professional, fun to be around and do not try to push guests into games and activities. They do try to encourage guests to participate in the daily activities but do not get annoying. The entire entertainment staff was great but especially Kike, Jessica, Mickey, and Edourato helped me have a lot of fun and gave me lots of memories to take home with me! The shows at night were done by different individuals who were exceptionally talented so go to the nightly shows if possible. The titles and themes of the shows don't always make sense but the dancing is very impressive. The front desk staff was awesome too. They greeted us with a smile, remembered who we were and were always as helpful as they could be. The food was great. I would however recommend the Don Julian Restaurant over the Terrace/Patio restaurant by the beach. The food selection was better. Unfortunately I can't comment on any of the restaurants requiring reservations at this resort because I never tried them. I just didn't want to have to be tied down to a certain time for dinner on vacation. A lot of the guests did rave about the different restaurants here though that required reservations. The Negatives. I was VERY concerned about possible beach erosion at this resort before I left as I had just seen reviews pop up about it a few weeks before I left. Unfortunately I found this to be true. There actually is no beach per se at the RIU Palce Mexico that one can walk into and swim in. One has to go up about 25 yards to the RIU Yucatan to really enjoy a swim in the ocean. I would also HIGHLY recommend not trying to climb the rocks and get into the ocean at the RIU palace. I even heard some people had injuries from the rocks to their feet.My understanding is the erosion started about 4 months ago with a storm and continues to get worse daily. When I mean daily I really mean it. It is amazing to see conditions deteriorate just over a period of 7 days. The view of the ocean from the RIU Palace is splendid though looking down or out over the Caribbean. I was also told that the RIU Palace is trying to figure a way to get the beach back but that will no doubt take time. I was told that as of about 6 months ago there was a VERY large beautiful beach and now it is virtually non-existent so I am positive the resolution won't occur overnight. I think in general the Playacar Playa Del Carmen area really has experienced major beach erosion. The resort next to the RIU Palace Mexico called Windham Viva Maya has even worse beach problems and it appears they are at risk of losing a dive shop from erosion. I saw a person digging sand moving it up toward the structure during the day. They also had big black items designed to keep sand from washing away all over the beach. Their guests literally had to crawl over these to go into ocean water. I am not sure what is occurring with the ocean conditions but even walking up further there's apparently beach erosion occurring although not so obvious. There's big dropoffs walking out to the ocean, and the water routinely appeared murky and muddy in places where I think dirt and sand were being forced up doing erosion. I love the Riviera Maya. Until the beach erosion issues are resolved I will probably stay further south of Playa Del Carmen where there evidently isn't as much erosion. The good news is that there is a beach available to Ru Palace Mexico guests that isn't too bad nearby about 25-50 yards. The rooms were very nice but there was one thing I did not like. There's really not room for two double beds so they put them together so it is like one big King bed. Be aware of this if sharing a room. Who you share a room with will be your sleeping partner for the duration whether you want to or not! Guests are given towel cards for only one towell for use at beach and ocean. This was irritating to me. We really need two towells one to lay on, one to dryoff with. My family and friends and I took to taking a room towell with us. I previously seen reviews talking about loud music from other resorts bothering them. I think what is being referred to here is that the next door Windham Viva Maya has an outdoor show starting around 10:30PM lasting til about 1AM. It is pretty loud I admit. When I closed the patio doors though I wasn't much bothered by the noise though. Comparing to the other resorts I stayed at there's more beach vending going on on these beaches and that was a little annoying to me. It seems like every 1/2 hour someone was trying to sell me bracelets. I don't think the RIU approves of this. In fact we actually saw several times people being run off or were even told by RIU staff not to buy what these guys were selling because they items were fake. They were not pushy though. WIth a no they wouldn't bother you again at least that day. I'd recommend that guests request a upper floor room too. The bottom floors are must more accessible tand I didn't feel safe on a bottom floor room. The RIU staff readily switched us though and that was much appreciated. In Summary: I loved the RIU Palace Mexico. The resort was beautiful ,staff was fantastic. The beach or lack of one was somewhat of an issue. I am glad I stayed at the RIU because I had a wonderful time in paradise but I will probably not stay there again until the beach problem is resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the RIU!”
Reviews.Author: fer1Usa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeklong stay at Riu Palace Mexico. After reading tripadvisor obsessively in the months before our trip, I feel it is my duty to post a review. First, the food. It is incredible, really. Even picky eaters should have no problem finding something to eat. The reservation process for a la carte dinners was a little annoying, but my husband managed to get us our first choice in a matter of 15 minutes each time (we ate at 3 of the 4) so no big deal. My favorite was Sir Edward. My husband loved the brazilian place. They were all good. The dinner buffett is amazing as well. The rooms were clean and pretty. Housekeeping did a great job of coming in promptly to clean our rooms. We never experienced any theft; and we got a little careless with leaving things out on a few occasions (not smart, but after a few pina coladas, what can you do?) We were upgraded to a courtyard view at no charge because the music from the hotel next door (Viva Wyndham Maya) kept us up late on the 1st night. The pool was smaller than some of the other resorts I've been to, but it was never super crowded and the swim up bar was fun. We went next door another Riu and the pool was way overcrowded, so were were pleased with ours. The beach is beautiful. The water is a picturesque tourqoise and there are always plenty of chairs. There is a slight dropoff from the area with the chairs to the water, but this is to be expected in this part of Mexico. It did seem to increase over the week we were there, but it did not detract from our enjoyment of the beach. Drinks were yummy and plentiful. You can always ask for premium liquor and doubles if you mind that sort of thing. They only have a couple types of wine for dinner, none of which I was crazy about, but they were drinkable. The ONLY negative thing I have to say was about the beds. I read the reviews about the hard beds and thought maybe some were being a little whiny and particular but I soon found out for myself. First, there are 2 full beds pushed together. They even have seperate bedding! Not so romantic! They are soooo hard and they sink in the middle. Our backs were killing us by the end of the week (and no, we aren't old fogeys!) It was hard to get a good night's sleep and I really never woke up feeling rested. I hate to say it, but I probably won't stay there again unless they fix the beds. Unfortunate, because everything else is so great! Overall, though beautiful property and a good value. I just wish they'd get new beds!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been any better”
Reviews.Author: KansasCouple
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Riu Palace Mexico, we were there from May 2nd - 9th. It was even better than our first stay. The staff was great, service excellent, the grounds beautiful. I was going to write a long review telling about our stay, how boring is it to read about someone else's stay. All anyone needs to know the place is great, we are returning for our third stay in late September 2007. That should say how we feel about the RPM.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found”
Reviews.Author: MJ58
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fantastic 2 week holiday in the RIU Palace Mexico and felt obliged to add a rewiew as this hotel deserves praise. I was a little surprised and confused to read previous negative reviews of this hotel however they are individual opinions and in reply I can only assume those people were unlucky. My Fiancee and I arrived at the hotel at 5 pm on 29 May, we were greeted by the ever polite and friendly doorman Manuel with a cold welcoming drink. We asked for a nice room at check in (remembering Trip Advisor reviews read pre holiday about rooms with courtyard views), we received the jovial reply " all our rooms are nice". This brought a laugh and we learned upon entering our room that the receptionist's confidence was correct. Our room was indeed nice and overlooked the main square and bandstand. I understand that it is not always possible to get a room that overlooks the courtyard and it is advisable to request one if possible. We found that everything was possible at the RIU Palace Mexico and you only had to request it. For example we didn't like 2 out of the 4 choices available from the liquor dispenser in our room, we asked for replacements which were changed within 10 minutes. On the day of my Fiancee's Birthday I asked at the reception if they could help in anyway. We returned to our room from spending the day by the pool to discover the maid had decorated the room with animals made from towels and had hung balloons and ribbons from the walls. A card and gift were also left from the staff at RIU. We requested extra towel cards (only one issued on arrival per person) as the bottom of the sun loungers were getting quite hot with the sun beaming down on them. The reception staff kindly obilged, no more burnt feet. I'll try and reduce this review or I could be here all day. Reception - Grand Pools (2) - Quiet pool for relaxing. Livelier pool with swim up bar and where daily activities took place. Grounds/Gardens - Immaculate Beach - Sadly eroded back to line of Palm trees due to Mother Nature but still sufficient space and beds to relax if you prefer the beach to the pool. Gym/Spa - No Comment as didn't visit. Bars: (all waiter/ess service except swim up bar) Pool bar - nice place to sit and relax Swim up bar - busier in the afternoons Lounge bar - where evening entertainment is held Piano bar - quaint and next to reception Entertainment - Daily activites. Nightly shows and music in the lounge. Restaurants: (all require reservations daily and have two sittings at 6.30 and 9 pm except buffet where you can eat at anytime) Sir Edward - Gourmet The food and service here is exceptional. Set menu with different choices of 3 course meal. Miyagi - Japanese Do try this, the Sushi is particularly good. Sushi to start followed again by set menu with a choice of 3 course meal. La Bodega - Brazillian 7 types of meat served one after the other with veg. Salad/soup to start finished by a selection of desserts. Only went once as choice of food is the same once visited. Meat is nice though. El Patio - Steakhouse Had Tuna and B-B-Q ribs which were very good. Set menu again with different choices. Salad/soup to start with selection of desserts. Lunch is also available here (reservation not required) where Burgers and Hotdogs are on offer. Next door at La Traviata Italian dishes such as Pizza and Pasta can be found. Mexican dishes are also served and the usual salad/soup/desserts are readily available. Don Julian - Buffet There is so much variety here and no reservation is required. There are theme nights so you can imagine the choices on show each evening. This is where you eat breakfast, if you like smoked Salmon then you'll be happy as it was available most mornings. This is in addition to your usual English fry up, American pancakes, waffles, smoothies, fruit galore, omelettes cooked while you wait,etc. Lunch is also available here where more than fast food is served. Do walk back from the pool rather than taking the easy option at El Patio near the pools as it was often quieter and you had more choice. The food choice was endless and I still laugh at an American comment I overheard that the food was average. It is certainly not average! The staff worked tirelessly to make your stay enjoyable and were so polite and friendly. I have to mention Lopez, Raul, Roy, Miguel who ran the pool bar by day and managed the drink situation at the main square in the evening. Believe me you never had an empty glass with these guys about. Yamir one of the head waiters in the buffet also deserves a mention, he was a star. Our stay really was amazing from entering the hotel entrance to waving a sad goodbye to Manuel on the door. Do try this hotel, we stayed at the RIU Cancun previously which is good but this is better. Tips: Request a courtyard view upon check in if possible. If you require a 6.30 sitting at a restaurant you may need to be towards the front of the queue as this time seemed more popular than the 9 pm sitting. Don't miss the Michael Jackson tribute night, it is only on once every fortnight and this guy can dance! We saw him in Cancun and were really happy that he was on again at this hotel this time. Don't act like the Americans and do say please and thank you as the staff fully deserve it and I think appreciated the manners shown. Won't continue as could go on and on. This hotel is brilliant, try it for yourself and hope you have as good a time as we did. Sad to be home but have wonderful memories for life.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: mommapotty
Reviews.Content: We were at the Riu Palace Mexico from 4/19-4/26. It was outstanding. The resort was beautiful, the people were wonderful, the room was clean, the food was great... We cannot say enough good about it. The beach was beautiful, before it started erroding. The staff has worked very hard to keep it an inviting and pleasant place to be. We took two tours through Apple. The first was to Chichen Itza and the other was all day snorkeling with Jesus. Both tours were great. We enjoyed them very much and we felt like the tour guides did their absolute best to take care of us and provide us with great experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous”
Reviews.Author: travelfooldc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the RIU Royal Place Mexicana. Stayed 4 days for my brother's wedding. I agree with other reviewers that the beds were hard, but other than that, it was relaxing and pleasant ... and very hot and humid ;-) The staff goes above and beyond the call of duty. The food was very good. I highly recommend making reservations at El Bodega. The entire resort is unbelieveably clean. Note that men must wear long pants for dinner in all restaurants. Tank tops for men are also not allowed at dinner time. We liked it so much that we just booked a June getaway at an RIU resort in the Dominican Republic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Wedding and Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JWRod
Reviews.Content: We just came back from having our wedding at the RIU Palace Mexico and I can't say enough positive things about the resort and our experience. We had 41 friends and family members, all whom travel often and everyone felt that this resort was one of the most beautiful places with wonderful service, and an all around great time. The food was wonderful, the beaches relaxing and the pool, nightime dancing/entertainment truly enjoyable. Edith, our wedding coordinator put together the most unforgettable wedding that we could have imagined. EVERYONE raved about the wedding and the time spent together in such a gorgeous setting. The photos do not do it justice. We are off to our honeymoon in St. Barth's, and I had to check-in here to let others know what a truly fabulous experience it was for everyone. I just read the last 2 reviews and couldn't disagree more. We had guests stop by other resorts just to have a look around and all agreed that this was the nicest in Playa Del Carmen. Enjoy your vacation here!

Reviews.Title: “NOT A FIVE STAR PALACE DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Louise77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace April 22nd for 1 week, that was enough! On arriving everything looked ok. Quick check in, shown to our Rooms:- We was not over impressed on first glance. We did request 2 rooms over looking the Courtyard. Instead we got 2 rooms at the back of the hotel, over looking the noisy hotel next door. We unpacked our cases and tried to shower, but the shower head was broken, we reported it to Reception which fell on deaf ears. Next day the sink was not running away, again reported it to the maid, nothing was ever done. The beds was the most hardest disgusting beds I have ever slept in with massive rips in them, they need replacing, they have seen better days. The view from our balcony was a brick wall, not what what you expect from a 5 Star Palace. Beach:- We went to find the beach, but the beach was gone the erosion of the beach is terrible and the beach is very dangerous, with massive drops into the sea. The chairs are all in a line, with no room to even turn them around. They palm trees are falling into the sea and are all roped together, its a mess. This hotel needs to knock the coconuts off the trees at the beach, or someone is going to get seriously hurt if one falls off. Weddings:- There are 2 weddings a day at this hotel, which takes priority over everything, there needs to be a reserved area for weddings to take place. If you are on the so called beach beware, you will have a wedding set up around you in minutes while you are sitting on a sun lounger. They set the wedding arch up and then out come the speakers and music, they drape dangerous wires all over you and try to apologise for the inconvience and tell you it will be for 5 minutes only. This becomes a very awkward situation when you are trying to relax on your vacation, and also very unpleasant for the wedding party. Food:- The ala cartes are good, the evening buffet was mainly fish, if you dont like fish, salad is the other option. The lunch time buffets at the pool was horrible, no selection, other than pizza, hot dogs or hamburgers, the salad looked stale and there was no selection of food to go with a salad. Overall:- The grounds of this hotel are immaculate, the rooms need to be stripped out and refurbished, the staff are very over worked, I would not say the happiest of people, they try there best. The hotel management are constantly asking you are you enjoying the Palace and will you return, I think they know that this hotel is hitting on massive problems, and are very unsure what customers are thinking. Unfortunately this hotel is more like a 3 star hotel, with 5 star prices. We will return to Mexico but definately not the Palace, its certainly not how it is sold.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: TamaraMc
Reviews.Content: I just discovered tripadvisor.com or I would have written this review almost 2 years ago. Our experience was so horrible that I still get upset thinking about it. My husband and I had contemplated booking at the Riu Tequila; however we thought we would spend the extra money as it was our honeymoon and why not pamper ourselves. Upon check-in at the Riu Palace there was not enough space in the immediate vicinity for us to sit for the welcome briefing. I had to approach the front desk for information such as booking reservations at the restaurants and the in room safe keys as we couldn’t hear a word. Our mornings started off the same everyday, being woken from our sleep at 7:00am as our room was in a back hallway that was used by hotel employees to transport items such as the towel cart. There was also construction at the property adjacent our building which also ensured we were up by seven. We requested to be moved several times and were ignored. When we were choosing hotels we noticed in the advertisement that honeymooners would receive a special gift from the hotel. After speaking with out Sunquest Rep and the Front Desk Manager several times and being promised it would be in our room by the end of the day (3 days in a row) we gave up. On more then one occasion our drink orders with meals were either lost or forgotten. The food was OK but definitely not fantastic. The only compliment I can pay this resort is that the young lady at the towel booth was delightful. I have been on many all inclusive vacations in the past and spent a lot less and been a lot happier with the service, the resort and the vacation in general.

Reviews.Title: “25th Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: kevinandvi
Reviews.Content: We just got home from a great experience at the Riu Palace Mexico. We spent 7 nights and have little to complain about. I note a reocurring mention that the beds are very hard , and we agree. Other than that, the food, service and experience were wonderful. We have never been treated like royalty before this. All of the employees were genuinly friendly and made this an unforgetable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: YucatanGroom
Reviews.Content: I'll try to keep this review brief allthough I feel i could write a novel praising this hotel. The hotel. On our very first impression the hotel was beautiful, the lobby area was very impressive and our first encounter with a member of staff (Luis at the front desk) left us feeling instantly impressed with the quality of service. The grounds, gardens and all public areas are immaculate, the staff seem to be working around the clock to keep the hotel and grounds looking truly stunning. Our room was extremely clean and tidy, if you try to find a fault no doubt you will see the odd cracked tile but overall these little things arent noticable. The hotel is 10 years old afterall. The pool area is very nice and well maintained. But no deep end of the pool left me wanting more The beach was very nice and on some days breathtaking. There were also far more loungers than ever needed. The beach has suffered from some of the erosion problems but it doesnt effect your enjoyment of it. The service. Absolutely unbelievable!! I have read a few reviews in the past that have complained of waiting around for waiter service etc and all i can say is that these people probably should get off their lazy backsides and get there own drinks. The staff work very very hard and always seem to do so with a smile on their faces delivering what i can only call a great level of service. At the poolside waiters come round every hour or so taking drinks orders and then returning shortly later with your drinks. In the lobby bar they are so efficient that when they see your drink is NEARLY finished they will ask "same again?" and be back before your drink is finished. One night whilst watching the entertainment I got very drunk beacause i had no idea how many drinks i had due to me not needing to leave my seat. I would also like to point out that although I do tip a bit I very rarely tip waiters so was not recieving any special level of service. The service from every single member of staff was always top notch but it is easier to find examples from the waiters. Also I was very surprised by just how much english the staff spoke, when i am on holiday i enjoy "trying" to speak their native tongue but found this wasn't a bit necesary most of the time The Food. The food was the only thing that to me occasionally let me down this was primarily due to some foods not being kept warm enough (in the buffet). Other than that one complaint I found the food to be well varied and prepared to a very high standard. We ate in two of the speciality resteraunts, Myagi (japenese, duh) and La Bodega (Brazilian). Both were excellent and again the service was superb. From 11am to 11pm you can order room service which will always be delivered within 10 minutes or so. This was a great service that we took advantage of from time to time. The wedding day. Well I know that i am going to be a bit biased but it was perfect, we got married at 2pm in the Gazebo, It was a boiling hot, clear day. We had hired a harpist to play at the ceremony and we found that to be one of our better decisions. The wedding coordinators were very good and helped to ensure everything went smoothly, The flowers were beautiful, the ceremony was pleasant and the reception dinner was very nice (La Bodega) All of our guests enjoyed every part of the day but most importantly so did my wife and I. The photos(taken by Juan Carlos Magallon) and DVD (edited by Monica Lciano) that we purchased as extras are outstanding and also very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico has thieves working there”
Reviews.Author: fyerfytr
Reviews.Content: We arrived April 12th, 2007 at the Riu Palace Mexico and went to check in, we asked if we could get a room somewhere down at the far end close to the pool. The front desk girl went to ask mgt. and she said there was nothing available - I asked again and she said she would double check to see if there was anything available, all of a sudden there was a room available. Come to find out the room is on the outside not courtyard view but we thought oh well we wont be in it much, later that night we went to bed at like 10:30 then the music started playing at the Wyndham next door... it sounded like they were on the patio! This went on till 2am EVERY night. Third day there we went to the beach in the morning to chill on the beach, at about 1pm I went back to the room to take the camera back, to my surprise there were two male maids in the room. I didn't think too much of it but thought it was kinda weird. Before I went to the beach that morning I took some pain meds for my back (vicodin)that was likely flaired up from the rock hard beds. After getting back to the room at like 4pm I went to take another and noticed that half my pain meds were missing from the bottle. I had only taken one from that bottle and there were only 3 left. The bag of about ten bottles of different meds were in a zip lock bag in the nitestand next to the bed. After talking to mgt. about the problem they said they would talk to the guys who did our room, Imagine this... they had no idea what we were talking about! I have been at two other resorts in the PDC area and never had a problem. If you go there make sure you lock up all your stuff in the safe. The meds didn't just disappear and they were the only ones in the room besides us. Beware of this resort, I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bean06
Reviews.Content: 2nd stay at this hotel. 1st stay the service was incredible, this time it left a lot to be desired. The beach and pool area are amazing. The water and grounds are incredible but the service not good. There were 6 of traveling. Check in was at 3p. 2 arrived at 1 the day before were let immediately into their room. When the rest arrived the next day at 1p they were told that there were no exceptions to early check in, even though our friends checked in with no problems. When asked for a hospitality room to change in and store our luggage we were directed to what turned out to be a bathroom to change in and had no option other than to leave our luggage in the lobby. When returning 5 hours later our luggage, thankfully, was still there, but no bellman had bothered to take it our rooms. I guess they were upset with us asking for a early check in and clean private place to change. Actual Check in - 6 ladies traveling together, placed on the ground floor which most travelers know is not advisable for women. When we requested a room change we were told by the manager that there were absolutely no rooms available until the next day. Ironically, one of the girls returned to her room later to find a picture had fallen off the wall and there was glass everywhere - the manager did find her a new room. The next day - only 1 room was available but when we walked around the adjoining rooms had no guests and it was well after 3p - the rooms were open as the maids were still cleaning up. Dinner had to be reserved day of for any of the restaurants and only between the hours of 830-10a. If you were not in line by at least 8a you always ended up with the last seating which was 9p. Very inconvenient. Maid service - one of the gals had her cigarettes stolen not once but twice - the 1st time she thought it may had been a mistake but the 2nd time clearly not and when she questioned the maids about it they denied it, however, my friend found her cigarettes on their cart! Another gal had her tweezers and faux diamond earrlngs come up missing. Many complaints to the manager fell on a deaf ear. They could care less. Kudos to the gal named Kate at the front desk, she was the only one who seemed to care and really try to get things fixed, however it was her manager who never actually came through. Very disappointing service for what was suppose to be a special celebration for a 40th birthday with great friends. Would definately not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace Mexico Report”
Reviews.Author: PhilliePhanatic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are back from a quick vacation to the RIU Palace Mexico. I’m hoping that writing this trip report will give valuable guidance for future travelers. I hope this is not too long or too boring. It was a different type of vacation for us, in the sense that it was at a resort and the main purpose of our trip was to attend a wedding. Both of us had never been to this country before. How it was booked – Usually I book our vacations ourselves to save us money. This time I decided to go through a travel agency – Liberty Travel. I shopped around for the best deal, though. If we would have gone through the bride’s travel agent, the exact same package would have cost 300 dollars more. The trip that was bought included round trip airfare to Cancun from Philadelphia, 4 nights and 5 days at the Riu Palace Mexico in Playacar on an all-inclusive basis and transfers from airport to hotel. It was great to have our transport, stay and even our food taken care of. I had travel insurance added in, in the event of a storm, since it was hurricane season also. Luckily, this was a quiet year as far as hurricanes go so this was never an issue. I have only one complaint about this process and that was the travel agent’s knowledge of the ever-changing passport rules. I have a passport, but it is in my maiden name. I asked her if I could use it in conjunction with a marriage certificate and have plane ticket in married and she said OK. But then when we got to the airport, the tickets were changed to reflect my maiden name. I am a proud married woman – I don’t like to travel in my maiden name. Looking back I would have requested a new passport instead of dealing with the hassle. Where we stayed – The Riu Palace Mexico in Playacar was good. This was a change of pace for us since we usually stay in simple accommodations. We had room 145 and our veranda looked out on the manicured lawns. The resort has a wild feel to it – on our first day we spotted a capybara on the grass. The workers take care of this resort very well. In addition I liked not having to do research on food like I do on other trips. I had mixed feelings about the resort – while the resort was great, it didn’t give us a true taste of Mexico and we were very sheltered. We decided to take a few side trips to accomplish this. The frustrating thing at the resort is that there was never a concrete list of what was included. For example, I could borrow a windsurf for free but in order to learn how to use it, we needed to pay. When we were checking out, we were charged for making calls to Dolphin Discovery for a shuttle. We thought that it would be included since it was a local call. So be careful about any phone calls you need to make – local and otherwise. How we got there – Our package included RT air from Useless Air (AKA US Air). This was my first trip with this airline. I did not care for the constant credit card shilling on board. Perhaps I am spoiled by the no-frills attitude from Southwest Air. Otherwise the flights were good. Healthy in Mexico? – I had read the stories about getting sick in Mexico due to the water. I was nervous due to the fact I suffer from IBS and I need to very careful with what I consume and drink. I think I went a little overboard – we brought jugs of Philly water with us. In the end, however, I did get sick on the last day but this was probably due to drinking soda of all things. My illness was short-lived, though. Here are the details: Day 1 – Oct 4 – Vamos a Mexico! Our trip did not get out to the best of starts. The flight was to be at 10 a.m. so I wanted us to be at the airport at 7 a.m. We usually get a lift from my mother-in-law, which we are very grateful for. Unfortunately, my husband gave her the wrong dates and we found ourselves rushing to the airport. Luckily there was no one at the US Air Intl Terminal by the time we got there and checked in time. Our flight took off and landed without incident –yes! As it was not a fully booked flight, we had plenty of comfort aboard. Perhaps it’s a wise idea to leave mid-week. Upon arrival we went through immigration and customs smoothly. I was so happy to see our luggage even though the one suitcase got broken somewhere along. The next step was finding our transfer, which was with Olympus Tours. I had received many warnings that we would be approached with time-share hawkers and boy, are they out there! Be careful! Despite the fact I warned my husband, we still almost got sucked in. We eventually found the transfer and we were on our way south to Playacar. Our room in the Riu Palace was not ready when we arrived so we took some time to take in our surroundings. We were instantly greeted with juice as a welcome. We were very happy with this since we were starved- apparently US Air does not give much food on their flights. This was a low-key first day since it was arrival day. We checked in with the bride and the groom, chilled out at the resort and called Dolphin Discovery to get a van transfer for the following day. We spent the night watching the baseball playoffs in Spanish. Our first time at the buffet happened to be Mexican night. I wanted to try cuisine that was close to traditional Mexican so I tried the chicken with mole sauce. Other foods were available, too. The first meal at the resort was a foreshadow of the all-inclusive plan, BTW. My husband asked for a wine and the waiter proceeded to put an entire bottle on the table. Day 2 – Oct 5 – They Call Her Izamal…Izamal! This day’s activities combined local sight-seeing and some family obligations. At the start of every day, we had a big breakfast at the buffet. Usually I had banana juice with a crunchy fried donut type of thing. I was never able to find out what this was but I believed that it was a native Mexican breakfast dish. Anybody know what this is? The hubby tried too many things I can’t even remember. I had read that in the Mexican Riviera you could swim with dolphins. Prior to us leaving, I booked a Dolphin Encounter for us at Dolphin Discovery at nearby Puerto Adventuras. Cost of this for two was about $160. The transfer picked us up and proceeded to take us there after picking up several other passengers. The website for the place claimed it cost money to take the shuttle but we were never charged. During the transfer, it was obvious that the proprietors have taken US commercialism to an art form. They were advertising the DVD and photo sales before we even got there. Although the time was relatively short, we had great time interacting with our dolphin Izamal. This may be our only chance to engage such intelligent creatures in real life. We found the Encounter to be the best bet for those on a budget. In the other programs you seemed to pay a lot more for only an additional 15 minutes. I don’t like places where you can’t take pictures (they want to sell you the pictures and DVD of course) but we wound up buying two and two frames for about $40 US. There were other creatures to see, however. They had four manatees, stingrays, three toed sloths and macaws also. We took the shuttle back to the resort and proceeded to eat lunch. After lunch, we took some time to lounge at the beach. The water was extremely warm and this is coming from someone who’s traveled all over. Then a small rain storm came in. It rained every day we were there but it didn’t ruin the trip. That night, my husband and I attended the rehearsal dinner for my cousin-in-law’s wedding the next day. This was the night that we started our experimentation with cocktails – after all, they were free! Over the course of the trip, my husband tried out a blue lagoon, a pina colada, gin and tonic, margarita and Kahlua and cream. One of our favorite memories was sitting in the hot tub with a drink in hand. I found a new favorite drink while down there – Kahlua and cream! Day 3 – Oct 6 Here Comes the Bride (and Here Comes the Rain) Today was wedding day so we decided to stay at the resort. After our usual breakfast, we headed out for some shopping at the mall that was a short walk away. I am careful about spending money for souvenirs but once I saw the carved elephants, I surrendered. Since we are big tea drinkers, my husband picked up a couple mugs. We had no problems using our Visa card from home and used American $ as currency. After shopping, we discovered the maid had left a towel elephant for us in our room. As I love elephants (see above), I was very excited. I was disappointed I couldn’t take the towel animal with me. A total of 3 towel animals were left: a swan, the elephant and a peacock. We then spent time at the beach, the pool and the hot tub while having lunch in between. I had wanted to try windsurfing, but we found out that lessons for beginners would cost 85 American $. We decided to spend this money instead on visiting ruins the next day instead We got changed for the outdoor afternoon wedding in the gazebo. I feel we dressed appropriately thanks to the guidance on this site. I wore a skirt and sandals and he wore a golf shirt and long khaki pants. The wedding was lovely although rain caused a brief delay. The workers organizing the wedding seemed to have a lot of patience regarding the rain. A few select family and friends made it down for the bride and groom. In reality, there were more attendees at the wedding because resort guests got to watch the wedding, too. My cousin-in-law, the bride, wore the traditional white dress and cried throughout. The bridesmaids wore short dresses from Ann Taylor and the groomsmen wore slacks and casual white shirts with no ties. After the wedding, dinner was held at the restaurant Sir Edward. The choice was between steak and red snapper. I remembered the desserts the most – traditional cake was served along with various fruits in a glaze. Good fun was had by all. It was great spending time with this side of the family we usually don’t see. Day 4 – Oct 7 – Hi Ho It’s Off to Tulum We Go! First things first: We had breakfast and made dinner reservations at the Japanese restaurant. This was, alas, our last full day. We chose this day to be another exploration of the outside area. This was a fun because we felt we saw more of the “real” Mexico. We chose to visit the Mayan ruins at Tulum. There were many ways to get there. Colectivo, taxi, tour or renting a car were options. Ultimately, we decided to take a taxi. We liked this because we got to interact with a local and he knew where he was going. We were excited because the driver knew of my favorite baseball team –the Phillies- back home and its home run hitter Ryan Howard. The taxi cost us 80 American $ round-trip though we paid him in pesos. The taxi option was good because we could come and go as we pleased. When we got there, they had shuttles to the ruins site for a few pesos each. We took this shuttle only to discover that we could have walked the distance for free and with little effort. Admission to the ruins was about 8 American $ for the two of us. It was extremely hot at the ruins. I would strongly recommend that you bring plenty of water and sunscreen/hat. In retrospect I would have brought our swimsuits since the ruins face the sea and we could have gone swimming right there! The ruins themselves, though, were spectacular and were one of the highlights of our trip. Although I had seen pictures of these ruins before I left, my husband had not and was blown away the first time he saw them. My husband and I are fascinated by history and took great time reading every card. The ruins were also full of wildlife – the local residents here are iguanas! The taxi brought us back to the resort. Unfortunately, this was around the time that I got sick. It didn’t damper our trip as much because all of our major activities were out of the way. So all we did the rest of this day was lounge around. Problems arose when I was looking forward to having Japanese cuisine for the first time and I was too sick to really enjoy it! Later, I missed out on going to the disco with my husband. I spent the night packing and watching the Formula One Japanese Grand Prix auto race in Spanish. Day 5 – Oct 8 – It’s Time to Go Home and Watch Some Football Our flight home was scheduled at 9:30 in the morning. I scheduled it this way so we could be back in time for a football game. With the flight leaving this early, we needed to leave the resort by 6 a.m. It was hard to get up but we did it. Thank goodness I had packed the night before. My husband had smuggled in some pizza from the buffet the night before and we had this as our breakfast. The bartender gave us some orange juice also. Our transfer company -Olympus Tours brought us to Cancun airport in time – in pouring rain. There was some effort trying to find the Useless Air check-in but once we found it we were good to go. We bought two big bottles of Kahlua at duty-free along with a few last minute souvenirs. Our flight took and off and landed without incident – thank God. The baggage made it to us in Philly as well – hoorah! Getting through immigration and customs was smooth. After a pick-up from my beloved mother-in-law, we were home watching the Eagles beat the Cowboys in no time.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a splendid week!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelVirginia
Reviews.Content: Our family has just returned from a week at Riu Mexico for a week of spring break. Overall, it was a wonderful week! This is a gorgeous, impeccably maintained property whose employees strive to please everyone. It was 100% booked for our week, but the level of service was not compromised in any way. Months of tripadvisor reviews filled my head prior to arrival, and this is what we experienced first hand: PROPERTY- beautiful, one of the cleanest I've stayed at, nicely laid out & very elegant. BEACH- gorgeous sand & palm tree area, but they most definitely have some serious beach erosion issues going on. We came out one morning and approx 12 ft of beachfront was gone. You had to use a rope to climb down the 6ft embankment. Entering the ocean was rocky and risky. By the next morning, the rocks were covered with sand again & the workers had sloped the embankment so you could safely climb down to the water. The water is gorgeous, but they are losing beachfront rather quickly from what we observed. FOOD- our 1st time at an AI, and I was much more impressed than I expected. The buffet offers huge selections, with different themes nightly. We also tried Miyagi (great) and Bodega(okay). Sir Edwards got great reviews but we were never able to get a reservation despite standing in line for 20-30min on 2 different mornings. Don't forget that men must wear pants in the evening. -no exceptions, from what we experienced. POOL- yes, a little dated and not as big as the Riu Maya Riviera pool. The beach area of hammocks, sand & palm trees was so gorgeuos that it was not a big deal to us. Hopping with activity our week, but never rowdy. SERVICE- could not have been better. Very quick responses to our requests for egg crates (which do help the hard bed tremendously), water/beverage refills, room service, etc. They also made every effort to get us courtyard rooms, but we got so settled in our 2nd floor rooms in the south buildings we decided to stay put. LOCATION-couldn't be better. We walked into town (20min- straight shot & safe) or a 5min/$5 cab. Wonderful Playacar Day Spa about 10 minutes toward town. Spa at RIU- I would not recommend. SUMMARY: for our first AI experience, it was wonderful. So hassle free for kids to eat as often as they wish & have enough activities to choose from, yet not crazy. Very relaxing for the parents too! We would return.

Reviews.Title: “extremely relaxing”
Reviews.Author: sunworshiperohio
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and I went to riu palace mexico for a girls week of sun and relaxation and had an incredibly easy and relaxing trip. We can't say enough about how clean and neat everything was. The service and accomidations were excellent and we enjoyed ourselves immensely. We were looking for quiet beaches, good drinks and good eats... and we were happily satisfied. Our rooms was great and we found playa del carmen to be fun and really exciting at night. Whatever we wanted to do, we found it easily and with a smile. I would recommend mexico and any of the rui's in playa del carmen. Next time we are taking our husbands!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible property!”
Reviews.Author: evilstepmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace from April 1 - 8th, 2007. The property is beautiful and especially breathtaking at night with the lit up grand staircase and fountains. The beach is one of the better ones in the area, as many are still non-existant. Our kids loved the swim up and beach bar for "kids Pina Coladas" and being able to tip the staff. Being Easter break our only complaints focus on the crowds, rude fellow guests (carefulof injury at the buffet table! MANY people deem it acceptable to push you out of the way if there is something they want!! Quite amusing really). We had some rowdy drunk cursing teenagers next door for a few days, but when we complained the security staff was there in about 5 minutes threatening to remove them from the hotel. (We never heard from them again). Because of our small children we stuck to the buffet only, but most times it was excellent. We expecially loved the Gala and the beef wellington. Johan was one of the best waiters we have ever had anywhere in the world. We were disappointed when we could not be seated outside (on the veranda of the main buffet) with him. For tours we did the Xel-ha and the Tulum, but would only return to Tulum. It was too crowded on the holiday weekend to enjoy. I want to go back to Tulum when the beach and water is less crowded. It is the most beautiful sand and water I have ever seen. We stayed at the Grand Sirenis in December and had heard that Tulum's beach was incredible - just don't go there on a Mexican holiday! Playa Del Carmen is a horrible little commercial town (reminds me of Waikiki's International Marketplace) - we have now tried to go there twice in the past year and have been so harassed by the rude shop keepers that we were much happier doing all of our shopping at the Plaza down the street from the resort. In the past 12 months of travel we have been to Hawaii twice and Mexico (Mayan side) and were so impressed witht he Palace and the staff we have joined the Riu Class club and are planning 2 weeks in Jamaica at the Riu Ochos Rio in the next few months, but will definately be back to the Palace soon as well.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon over the Holiday”
Reviews.Author: prkinney
Reviews.Content: My husband and parents spent the Christmas Holiday at the Riu Palace Mexico. On a previous trip I stayed at the Riu Playacar which is one of the resorts that you have access too while staying at the Palace. We were there for seven days and had a great time although we did experience some issues. My mom had a small Christmas pin stolen. She didn't think to put it in the safe because it was no more than $5. I had one diamond (it was a CZ so not a huge deal) stolen. I understand that the safe is there for a reason, however you just don't expect to have to put EVERYTHING in it. Be aware. We had a hard time getting towels. Many times we would call and call and never receive the towels. We figured out that taking a stack of towels off the maid carts in the hall was the best bet. We did have to hide them in the drawers or they would take them back. Many times our rooms weren't cleaned until after 4 pm. Flip a coin on the turn down service. My parents room was turned down each night, ours wasn't. The pools are small, but the bonus was that we didn't have any issues finding a spot at the pool. This was a major problem at the other properties primarly b/c the Riu Tequila is not on the beach so many people would come to the Playacar. Although you can visit the other resorts..those staying at those same resorts are not allowed in the Palace. We did walk up to the other Palace resort, it took us about 15 minutes. It had a much bigger,nicer pool area but it was totally packed with kids. It was a bit more quiet at the RPM. The food was typical all inclusive food. Some things were just plain bad and I am not picky. I have been to many,many all inclusives and I was just disappointed. Another issue was the fact that MEN MUST WEAR PANTS TO ALL DINNER MEALS. This was fine with us but it was not consistent at all. On the first night, my husband was told that he could not come in with shorts on. I just assumed that we could slip by due to experiences at nicer resorts. It wasn't a huge deal but later that night and throughout the week we noticed that other men were allowed in with shorts. We also experienced rude waiters. One let us know what time the buffet would be closing and stated that we only had 10 minutes to eat when the buffet didn't close for another 30 minutes. We had a very nice, relaxing time. However, this was a fairly expensive trip due to the time of the year (December 06), so we did have certain expectations that just weren't met. I did let the front desk know about the problems we experienced. They had nothing to say.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jen983
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. I loved the location and the resort itself was beautiful. The staff are very friendly and I enjoyed talking to them. The restaurants were all great, I loved the fact that you had choices, the specialty restaurants were great but the buffett was just as great. I had a massage on the beach and fell asleep on the table. It was such a relaxing place. I would recommend this to anyone who wants to enjoy mexico and relax. It is not a party hotel, if you want that go across the street to the Club Riu Tequilla. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Life”
Reviews.Author: CindyKWarrington
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a four night stay at the Riu Mexico. My husband and I took our 18 year old daughter and found everything absolutely wonderful! Some of the reviews that I read made me a little apprehensive, but we really could not find fault with anything. Our room was immaculate- I had asked the travel agent for a quiet room and it was. The breakfasts were unbelievable-something for everyone- yogurt, fruit, smoothees, omelets, french toast, donuts, etc... My daughter and I enjoyed their tortilla chips and guacamole for lunch each day. We ate at Sir Edward one night- it was nice, but preferred the buffet as it really had something for everyone plus we enjoyed eating outside. I was wary of the beds, but we all found them to be firm and we slept very well on them. The service of the staff was impeccable. We did tip, but I found the service to be good whether you tipped or not. I checked out the other Rius while we were there and liked ours the best. We took an excursion to Tulum to see the ruins and then to Xel-Ha- a natural park where we snorkeled. Tulum was interesting and added some history- not for little ones though- too hot and lots of walking. The park was more for little ones- we liked it enough but it was crowded and it was nice to get back to the Riu. My daughter and I went shopping in Playa del Carmen early one evening and it was just okay. ( ten minute cab ride $5) - did have Starbucks there. We really liked the shopping plaza right down from the hotel better and we could walk there in five minutes and use the internet cheaper than at the hotel as well as a pay phone with no fees for the $20 calling card we bought at the hotel. I think this is a nice hotel for families as well as couples or teens. The beach was crowded so we sat around the pool and walked to the beach for a dip. Put your towel on chairs early in the day or you won't get one. It seems rude, but it is the way it is done there. I did water aerobics one day and it was not for old ladies- there were situps on the edge and it was a good workout. I would highly recommend this all-inclusive as it was a wonderful life for four days!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: rken148
Reviews.Content: I was with a group of 10 40 somethings. We arrived to the resort early all but one room was ready. The desk was more than kind and friendly towards us. I did notice the smell as you walk in but nothing that would ruin a trip. It reminded me of dead cigarette smoke. Our room was on the first level with a view of the left yard of the resort, we aksed for a better room but were told none was availble, with 5 rooms needed that would have been difficult. We were not planning on being in room that much anyway. Over all we thought all the food was great our only complaint was the reservation method. We ate at the steack house and Rodizio both with a 9ish reservation we were like the only ones there. Enjoyed them both very much. We went to beach and pool bar everyday. The beach was having problems due to mother nature palm tress fell as we were there. Everyday the beach became smaller. We would have loved for the pool bar and area to stay open longer. 5 for swim up bar and 6 for pool we thought that was very early. We did walk one night across the street to disco all there wee very young 16 if that. We are a fun group who would of like alittle more excitement in the evening. We toook taxi to Play adn ferry to Cozumel that was very nice. We did do one excursion which I believe we could have gotten alot cheaper out of resort. The excursion was ro Xe-Ha (spelling). I thought was a waste of time! Over all the vacation was great can't really say amything bad about it we all had GREAT time

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: LynnieLondon
Reviews.Content: We returned from the Riu Palace on 25th March after 2 fantastic weeks. I had spent weeks watching these reviews and was worried that I would be disappointed as my expectations were quite high. After a very long 11 hour flight from Gatwick, we were exhausted when we reached the hotel. But check-in was so easy, we were given drink whilst they allocated out rooms. I had emailed to request courtyard view rooms and to let them know we were celebrating my friends 50th Birthday. But unfortunately although I had had several replies from them they did not know anything when we got there. Nevertheless we were given excellent rooms (2045 facing the fountains near the pool end and 2049 top floor sea view!). Being at the far end of the hotel meant we had very little noise from other guests. The hotel is exactly as sold and I don’t need to repeat all the previous wonderful reviews. Our rooms were big and pleasantly cool at all times. The bed was 2 doubles pushed together and very comfortable (even without pads), the bathroom was clean and shower hot (but dark!). I would take my own hairdryer next time as having one in the bathroom meant it got really hot and damp (and played havoc with the hairstyle girls!). We spent most days on the beach, grabbing beds early (7.30am some days) and staying there until we became surrounded by the spring breakers who seemed to be able to squeeze a bed in every single spot until you were surrounded. We then up-rooted and went further back into the quieter area amongst the palm trees and stayed until the sun went down (6pm). We would get cocktails and Corona from the Beach bar (or occasionally a waiter came along with a large tray of drinks). 2nd week, when the teenagers left, we went around the pool more and it was great cooling off standing in the pool bar. The pool has two side’s one is quieter and deeper for swimming and relaxing; the other has the water polo net and the swim-up Bar and is more for socialising. Food was excellent, we had no problems booking all the different speciality Restaurants (if you went down late you just asked where they had spaces). We easily booked Sir Edwards (gourmet) for the Birthday Celebrations and they made a real fuss, decorating the table and doing a cake etc. (Thank you Brittany!). They also delivered flowers and champagne to my friend’s room on the morning of her birthday and filled it with ballons! Entertainment was ok! (Not great!), but it was lovely to sit in the courtyard and listen to the band later on after the ‘show’. The Piano Bar was very ‘civilised’ and we enjoyed sitting there, except when the Spring breakers took over just before they went out clubbing…..and even worse when they got back! We went into Playa Del Carmen a few times and had drinks at Blue Parrot (worth a visit!). Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone from England, as the standard is way higher than we are used to in the majority of European resorts. Hope to be back some day, but there is a big world out there………….

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: M&MGrandma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with another couple stayed here March 10-17, 2007. My husband did a lot of research on what resort to stay at and this one was chosen partly due to what he read on Trip Advisor. I will start with the positive. Let me say first that the hotel is very nice; grounds are beautiful and well kept. The rooms are 2 double beds pushed together but we knew that when making our reservations. The beds are hard but didn’t keep us from sleeping. We did ask for mattress pads but the resort was fully booked that week so there were no mattresses available. The rooms had a musty smell after a few days but that is expected being on the water. We had a scented candle which helped. The staff was very nice and accommodating. Whether at the pool, on the patio, or in the lobby bar, there was always a waiter/waitress there to fill your glass. We never had any trouble with weak drinks. We had thermal mugs and used those for water or drinks. They don’t mind at all making drinks in your mugs. The beach was great and really never had any trouble getting chairs. The pool was a little harder getting chairs but it always seemed to work out for us. The pools are on the small side but the pool opposite the bar was almost always empty and quiet. Food on the most part was good. There is a lot to choose from on the buffet. Entertainment was fine. There was a band every night in the courtyard and it was enjoyable sitting outside having a drink listening to music. Down side were definitely the spring breakers. I would never go again in March. These kids were out of control. They were with their parents but they might as well not have been as the parents didn’t really care what they did. They took over the pool bar every day and the lobby bar in the evening. If you went to the lobby bar before dinner you were ok but after nine it was hard to get a table. For a hotel that advertises no spring breakers we were very surprised. We were always woken up between 3-4AM with the kids coming down the hall screaming, yelling, throwing things on the walls and doors. Very annoying. The specialty restaurants were good except the steak house if you are eating steak, which was very chewy. The tuna I understand was great. The process of making reservations is a hassle and after 2 days we just slept in and took our chances. We were able to try all 4 of them so it worked out. I would go back but definitely not in March.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: KESt.Louis
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and 2 of our friends vacationed March 10-17. The hotel, beach, restaurants, message on the beach all get an A from the 4 of us. The hotel was very nice, beds were hard but we knew that from the beginning (they were booked so there were no mattress pads available), the beach was absolutely beautiful, we all enjoyed the diverse choice of restaurants to eat at (like others have written the way to make reservations for these restaurants is a bit ridiculous and I think a better process could be found), staff was nice but at times there were some real language barriers. Our friends did a ton of research to pick this hotel - the main winning point to choosing this hotel was that they "did not" cater to spring breakers, so we felt the money spent would be well worth it. We found out way to early that this was not a correct statement. They cater highly to spring breakers (high school & college age) that travel with their parents. These kids were out of control and seemed to overtake the entire facility from the beach, to the pool bar, to the main bar there was no where the 4 of us could go to escape them. They were loud, drunk and disrespecful especially at 3:00 in morning - really didn't matter that their parents were with them because they weren't supervising them at all. We will never stay at this resort again in March which is a shame because that is the month we enjoy to travel.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Gl0beTr0tter05
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that my husband and I are in our early 30s and have traveled quite a bit over the past 5 years. We have been to several all-inclusives, including Sandals in Jamaica and Occidental Grand in Aruba. We have also been to luxury non-all inclusive resorts, such as the Westin in Maui and the Grand Hyatt in Kaua'i. Based on our travel experience, I believe that we're in a good position to give an unbiased review of this all-inclusive resort. We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from March 17 - 24. As many people have previously noted on tripadvisor, the grounds are immaculate. (see pictures) The courtyard is filled with fountains, flowers and manicured shrubs. The hotel itself is beautiful - yellow with black wrought iron balconies and terracotta roof tops. It truly feels like you're staying in a palace. Our room, 1125, was very nice. We didn't have any issues with mold. Our bathtub was perfectly clean as well. The daily cleaning service was adequate, with only one exception - the floors always felt sitcky. We had to walk around the room in flip-flops. The only other problem was that the Wyndham Viva Maya had a disco playing loud music very close to our window until 2 am. We didn't have a problem because we were out pretty late ourselves on most night. By the time we returned to the room, we were so tired that the music didn't keep us up. But for those that prefer quiet, stay away from this side of the hotel. Stay on the side that borders Riu Yucutan. Also, as others have mentioned, the hotel door lets in a lot of noise. So if you want to sleep in, I would definitely consider some ear plugs. The service at the Riu Palace was great. The waitstaff was super-friendly. Roy, Oniver, Raul and Abel are very fun and friendly waiters. We threw a few bucks their way, and they greatly appreciated it. They make $25/day, so even a buck or two is significant for them. The food was very good. To address the complaint that other people have posted on tripadvisor regarding lack of food choices, I completely disagree. I really don't know what else they could have incorporated into their buffets and restaurants in order to ensure that people would not bored with the food choices. I think the people that have said this simply chose not to try different things. It is difficult to describe the amount of food they offered, but I will try. Every breakfast lunch and dinner they had one whole buffet table of deli cuts and cheeses as well as a salad bar with several dressings. For breakfast, they offered an omlette station, a waffle and pancake station, a smoothie station, and a doughnut station. They also had hard-boiled eggs, hash browns, flambe, bacon, sausage, 10 - 15 different cereals, a fruit bar, a table with 10+ different freshly baked breads and a table dedicated to pastries. For lunch, they had three different restaurants open offering everything you could possibly want, including fajitas, hamburgers, pizza, french fries, rice, chicken, fried calmari, soup, freshly baked tortilla chips with gucamole and pico di galo. At dinner, if you didn't chose one of 4 a la carte restaurants, they had even more food at the buffet than was offered for the breakfast and lunch. Honestly, I don't know how anyone could even begin to complain about the food! The a la carte restaurants were all really good. If you can manage to get up early enough to make a reservation, I suggest that you try them. La Bodega had really good food, but there was way too much of it. Miyagi, the Japanese restaurant was decent. The dessert was fabulous at Miyagi. Try the ice cream tempura and the deep fried banana egg roll. The steak house was no Ruths Chris, but it was decent. We asked for a medium-rare steak and this is exactly what we got. Unfortunately, we didn't get a chance to eat at Sir Edward's, the gourmet restaurant. We ended up eating at the Glass Bar in Playa Del Carmen instead, which was fantastic! If you feel like leaving the resort for dinner one night, I highly recommend this place. Ask to sit outside and you can people watch as you're served your phenomenal yet resonably priced meal. The bar was premium, for the most part. They had several choices for vodka, gin, rum and tequila. We found that it's best to specify which one you want. If you don't specify, they may use a generic brand. Also, having a bar in your room is a definite plus. You can pour yourself a cocktail and enjoy the view on your balcony. The nightly entertainment was very decent also. Nevertheless, we got a little bored staying at the resort. After the 9:45 show, many people headed for their rooms. The band would play for another 15 minutes or so before calling it a night. The only place that's open after 10:00 pm is the bar in the lobby. (see picture) There is also a disco across the street at the Riu Tequila, but it was filled with high school kids, so we felt really out of place. We went out to Playa Del Carmen on a few of the nights. It's only a $5 cab ride away, and is very beautiful. We were blown away by the restaurants, bars and shops. The cobble stone streets, that have only pedestrian traffic offer a great atmosphere. The pool was decent and we found ourselves there in the afternoon, after the wind would pick up on the beach. The water was cold for the first couple of days, but became warmer towards the latter part of the week. It wasn't too loud by the pool. Music was only played by the pool during water aerobics. The beach was by far our biggest disappointment. On the first day, there was about a 1 foot drop down to the water. (see picture) But by the third day, the beach had eroded and had a drop of around 4 - 5 feet. (see picture). The beaches to the left of the hotel were in even worse shape. So places like the Royal Hideaway, Riu Playacar, Wyndham Viva Maya, Riu Riviera Maya, and Occidental had virtually no beach. They're currently trying to fix those beaches, so there are a bunch of sand bags and hoses on the beach, which look horrible. Not to mention it's very difficult to enter the water with those obstacles in the way. We spoke to some people who mentioned that this beach has eroded 60 meters in the past two years! Since we love the beach, we wouldn't come back unless this problem was corrected. As one of the more recent posters mentioned, we also found that there were too many spring breakers at the resort during our stay. Many people were disappointed with this. Some of the kids were okay, while others were rude and discrespectful. Some of the guests we spoke to heard them running down corridors in the middle of the night and banging on doors. We felt that they had no business staying at this resort. They should have stayed across the street at the Riu Tequila, where the hotel promotes a party atmosphere. If we did come back to this resort, it wouldn't be in March or April, when colleges and high schools are off for spring break.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: activebeachlover
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weeklong stay at the Riu Palace Mexico and had an incredible vacation. The grounds were beautiful, and impeccably cared for. The hotel was incredibly clean. It was especially breath-taking at night when the fountains were all lit up. Our room did not face the courtyard and I would request a room that does because the resort is so pretty and those rooms offer a much better view. The staff was very helpful and the few times we ordered anything to the room someone was there in minutes. The day we got there we had some mosquitoes in our room and they quickly brought bug spray and we didn't have a problem for the rest of the week. Our room was spacious and clean, the shower was awesome, but the beds were definitely hard and they had run out of mattress pads so we had to deal without them. We never had a problem getting chairs at the pool or beach, though we preferred the pool because there are drink waiters there that come around frequently and at the beach you have to go to the bar. The food was fine. Being from NYC and somewhat of a food snob it was nothing to write home about but it was never bad and there was TONS of variety. Breakfast was especially good and they always had fresh salad ingredients and a wide assortment of cheese, to my delight. The entertainment at night was light and amusing, and every night there was a band in the piazza that provided a great background for cocktails. We had drinks out there every night of our trip, and a waiter was ALWAYS right there asking if we needed another. The only time we did not have perfect service was at El Patio and in the main buffet area where we sometimes had to get our own silver-ware and repeatedly ask for drinks, but it was quite crowded when we were there due to school spring break and I think the waiters were overwhelmed. There were tons of high schoolers the week we were there but they never caused any problems for us or kept us up at night. As a couple in our mid-twenties, we were basically the only two in our age group at the resort; lots of families, chaperoned high school trips, and elderly couples, but we didn't care. The hotel had the best atmosphere, it was so relaxed, and the staff was so pleasant that we just hung out and opted not to party late at night, though plenty of people did. The Riu Tequila right across the street had a night club and sportsbar that were open late if you like to go out. The Riu Palace had the biggest beach of any of the other hotels we saw. We also really liked that there were 5 other resorts we could go to for drinks and walk around, it was nice to be able to explore and not feel stuck in one place. I would highly recommend both our hotel and the area in general. Playa del Carmen was a charming town and fun to walk around, and a nice 20 minute walk from our hotel. We ate at a delicious restaurant called Casa del Agua for my boyfriend's birthday, at the hotel's recommendation, and it was perfect. We did two excursions, one to Xel-Ha and then an ATV jungle tour, and both were SO fun and easily booked through the hotel. Playa is a great vacation destination and our experience at the Riu Palace was amazing! I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: SmileyToronto
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Riu palace mexico from March 17th to the 24th, 2007. We had an amazing time!!! The good: Upon arriving at the palace you were immediately impressed by the beauty and elegance of the place. The staff that greeted us at the hotel were very friendly. Our room was more than comfortable and we ended up with a garden view room instead of a courtyard and this worked out to our advantage because it was quieter. The bar was fully stocked, so you had access to bottled water, beer and pop whenever you needed some. The food was GREAT. We've been to other resorts in Cuba and the Dominican and to be honest of course there are some repeats but the RIU palace mexico staff made an effort to keep things as creative as they could. Each night at the buffet was themed and so you could get a variety of foods that way. We didn't bother with the specialty restaurants because we preferred to have more variety of choice for our meals. Finally, the beach.... it was beautiful and because it's so long and wide you could always find shade and a lounger. The only concern is that in the 7 days we were there the shoreline went from flat to a drop off mini-cliff (a meter or two), poor palm trees were falling down :( That doesn't mean there isn't a good beach - you can walk to the right of the hotel and there is tons of beach but it's something to note. THE BAD: There are only 2 complaints that my husband and I had regarding this hotel. 1) NOISE, the way the hotel is built there is a lot of echo from the halls. The cleaning staff start early and they are talking rather loudly which is magnified by the structural design of the hallways. It's not the end of the world, but my hubby and I used earplugs and they helped. We were there when the spring breakers were as well and they were obnoxious and drunk most of the time, luckily they are not a staple of the hotel. 2) ON the day of arrival we had an early start from Toronto and by the time we got to the hotel with our delayed flight and waiting at the airport for an hour (another passenger got lost), we were tired. We had to wait a while for our room, we got there at around 11:30am and waited until ~2:30pm. If possible it would have been nice to get a room earlier, rest and settle in. Overall, we had a BLAST. We would totally recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to relax on the beach, take back a few drinks and just do nothing. The entertainment was ok.... but we were just happy to be away and enjoyed the music and our drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Great food, Great hotel, But too many spring breakers”
Reviews.Author: a&e-solamante
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from the RIU Palace Mexico. It was very nice, had very good food, and the service was excellent!!! The giant beach was beautiful and had lots of palm trees. There were many activities for the busy bodies and one day there was a band on the beach. The pools were beautiful and refreshing. The grounds are very well groomed and kept clean. The entertainment is very enjoyable. There is a live band outside and a show in the theater each night. The wait staff will keep your drinks filled and your table clean at the patio bar by the theater, they're awesome!! That’s the good news, now for the bad. If you like high school & college kids getting drunk and making so much noise that you can't sleep, you'll like this hotel. The beds are hard, but not bad. What is bad is that they are 2 doubles pushed together, so good luck sleeping in the same bed with your significant other. Drinks are served very weak and in small servings. Bring your own container if you plan to relax on the beach with a cool drink. The bartenders will rinse and fill your thermal cup with whatever you'd like so you don't have to run to the bar every 10 minutes. Also there are no food or drink servers on the beach. If you want bottled water or soda, take it with you from your mini fridge. If you'd like room service, make sure you find your order form that is hidden in the drawer and decide what you want before you go to bed. If you decide when you wake up, that you want breakfast brought to you, good luck. At 9am we were that we could order lunch...too late for breakfast. The room service menu is limited and you'll need to brush up on your Spanish if you call in your order. The towels are in poor shape, and the couch in the room had mildew stains on it. The specialty restaurants were ok, the servers were wonderful and very nice, but not worth the hassle of waiting in line at 8:30 in the morning to make a 9pm dinner reservation. I was ok wearing long pants to dinner, and my wife looked very stunning dressed up as well, but beware, the table next to you may have girls wearing short shorts that say "Pink" or "Juicy" on them with a tank top. Very trashy, and couldn't understand why they didn't enforce the way girls dressed at dinner. Again, beach, food, service, hotel, courtyard, very nice...drunk kids all over the place, not so nice. If you’re going to advertise "NO SPRING BREAKERS", then stand behind it. When you're spending thousands of dollars on vacation, you should be able to enjoy it. P.S. When my wife tried to let mgmt. know about the complaint we had about the spring breakers, they told us to write it on trip advisor, so here we are. We hope this helps you in choosing your next vacation. ***A suggestion for the hotel that allows the young spring breakers: since these kids want everyone to know how much fun they are having, put them in a designated section of the hotel so the other people can enjoy their vacation too.

Reviews.Title: “Our Report Card On the Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: campinptown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned our vacation over the past few months and decided on Mexico. We used TripAdvisor to make our decision like we had in the past. After much debate we decided on the Riu Palace Mexico for the week of 3.10.07-3.17.07 and here is our report card. Location: "A" The hotel was located in the gated area known as Playacar which was within walking distance to downtown Playa Del Carmen haivng a small shopping area and we felt very safe. Hotel: "C" Upon arrival we were graciously welcomed by Manuel the doorman who was so nice to us during our stay making us feel at home. He makes the hotel and we would give him an A for effort! Front desk "C" during check in very helpful but during our stay we called a few times for minor things such as a mattress pad taking almost 2 days after 3 calls.
