(8) Based on advice from this site, I asked for and received a room on the Riu Yucatan side of the hotel, which are quiet as long as there aren't any noisy kids in the hallway. (9) I didn't have any difficulty making specialty restaurant reservations. Even if you came in at 8:30, you would get a number near 40, meaning you could pick almost any time or restaurant. The only tough reservation was Sir Edwards for the 6:30 seating. Negatives: (1) Maintenance and front desk staff were problematic. Our first room had a leaky toilet, nonfunctioning bidet, and poorly running A/C with temperature bottoming out at 76F (24.5C). The next day we reported the problem to the front desk, where it was written in a log in front of me, and we received a phone call about it later to confirm. Over 24 hours later, not a single one of these three issues had been addressed. I went to the front desk and the clerk said he'd call me in my room in 5 minutes. 40 minutes later, nothing had been done, and we asked to be moved to a new room. The temperature when we first came in was 74F (23C) which was OK, but when it got up to 75F the next day, we asked that our A/C be fixed. The issue was not even looked at during the rest of our entire stay, and we got a "Manana" response each time we asked. Since there were overhead fans, we could use them to sleep, but when I pay $371/night, I expect more than a "manana" blow-off response when I have a concern. (2) I went to the gym early during the stay. There isn't a huge number of pieces of equipment, and it got pretty heavy use around sunset (5:15). Again, the A/C was completely non-functional in the gym, although the day I worked out there was a strong breeze which made the workout tolerable. Two of the aerobic pieces of equipment didn't work, which I reported to the staff. I checked the place out several days later, and, to no surprise, neither the A/C nor the equipment had been fixed. (3) We were disappointed by the food at the specialty restaurants, especially Sir Edwards. In addition, the limited times at most of them (6:30 PM or 9 PM) meant you either had to enjoy an early dinner and short day, or miss the evening entertainment if you went to the later seating. I was commenting about this to my favorite bartender, and she said that most of the long-standing guests opted for the buffet most nights. (4) With the exception of Sir Edwards, the choice of alcoholic drinks at the restaurants was either lousy wine or Corona Extra beer (one did get one Caipirinha at the Brazilian Rodizio). This got to be quite tiring. By the end of the week, my partner commented that he didn't think he'd ever want another Corona. (5) There was no seating by the pool for most of the afternoon. Although the hotel has a sign advising guests not to save lounges they weren't using, this wasn't enforced. It would also be difficult to enforce, given the policy of $50 fine if you misplace your beach towel or beach towel card. With that policy, it's not as if they could just take the towels off the beach chairs which people weren't using, like they do at some places. I don't quite understand the hotel's excessive preoccupation over these $2 towels at the rates they charge. A guest would have to steal a suitcaseful per day's stay for them to feel a financial pinch over towel thefts. (6) Perhaps a minor annoyance, but I kept noticing people slipping all over the place (sometimes with resulting broken glass in the hallways). I also found the hallways annoyingly slippery much of the time, even in my flat walking shoes. (7) As others have pointed out, the mattresses are quite cheap. Not only are they hard, but they make these twang-y sounds when you roll around in them. When it comes to mattress firmness, for me it's usually the firmer the better, but these almost left you bruised. In summary, I feel as if this hotel has a lot of good things going for it, including its architecture, its staff (except the front desk and maintenance staff), and its beach. Nevertheless, for the reasons I mentioned above, I don't feel I got my money's worth, and wouldn't return for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED it!!”
Reviews.Author: sheraprincessofpowa
Reviews.Content: I consider myself to be somewhat of a seasoned expert of All Inclusives, having been to 6 in the past year. I'm also very familiar with Playa del Carmen and the Playacar RIU's, having visited 3 of them. My sister and I were looking for a 'sista' vacation with a bit more luxury, so we decided to try out the RIU Palace Mexico. I had such a wonderful time, it far exceeded my expections. CHECK-IN: I emailed the resort one week before we arrived, asking for a courtyard view, even though we booked a garden view. When we arrived, I asked again and after spending a matter of minutes at check-in, and were upgraded to a courtyard view. We were in Suite 0135, ground floor overlooking one of the fountains in the courtyard. ROOMS: Room 0135 was a GREAT room in a perfect location! It was only a few rooms from the pool and far enough away from the terrace and main buildings/restaurants that we did not hear the music/shows at night so we got a decent nights' sleep. Plus no stairs to maneuver after a long day in the sun. There was no ocean view, but the view of the fountain was soothing. The air conditioning seemed to be a bit weak, not sure if I'd want to stay in that room during the summer months. The beds were hard, but we called reception and asked for mattress pads and within minutes we had someone re-make our bed with cushy pads. The bathroom has a bathtub with shower, and a separate toilet with bidet. Shower pressure was not that strong - thank god! I had a sunburn and was thankful for the soft water. THE BUILDING/GROUNDS: Although I had seen pictures, I don't think they did it justice. The buildings themselves were very beautiful and the grounds were immaculately maintained. There was a large fountain pool that stretched from the main building down the entire length of the resort, with 3 strategically placed fountains. There always seemed to be one person actively maintaining the grounds. I really liked the layout of the resort...nothing seemed very far away. FOOD: Was more than pleasantly surprised. The buffet was just outstanding - probably the best All Inclusive buffet I've ever experienced. The breakfasts were wonderful, with such a huge selection. Probably the best french toast I've ever tried. Juice bar, bread bar. Lunch was available at two restaurants - the main buffet Don Julian and the beach restaurants that have two separate sides. The food was different at each side, and since I don't eat red meat I was assured that one side would have at least one chicken and fish dish. The salad bars were amazing, the Italian vinagrette salad dressing was like no similarly named dressing I've had in the US or Canada. The Dinner...oh the dinner! I must admit that each night there was something for everyone and each night it was very good. The best of any AI I've ever experienced. The standout of the dinner was the chocolate fountain. Every night there was a chocolate fountain where you could dip the various spread of fruits and marshmellows. It was delicious. Another good part about dinner was the choices of different wines and champagne. We had champagne with dessert...heaven! Never made it to the specialty restaurants so I cannot comment but heard from fellow travelers that they were very good. THE BEACH: When we arrived, Playa Del Carmen had just experienced a period of harsh weather - strong winds and tides that took all the sand away...even some palm trees fell into the ocean and the resort took some proactive measures to keep it from completely disintegrating. A day or two later the weather changed and the beach was back to normal. Enough palm trees to provide sufficient shade and enough beach front to maximize your sun exposure. One of my favorite things about this area is the beach. Absolutely beautiful. THE POOL: Plus: waiter service to deliver drinks. Not so good: the situation of it was a bit odd. It seemed like you really had to maneuver your chair to get proper sun since the generic layout didn't provide the best logistical setup. Plus, there were no palapas at the pool, just umbrellas. It was hard to get sufficient shade at the pool because of the set-up. SERVICE: Now, this is where the RIU palace really SHINED! It was like they couldn't do enough for us. I had stayed at another RIU across the street awhile back and just loved this chicken dish they made. One night I asked the manager if they were planning on having it on their menu and told me to hang on while he brought the Food and Beverage Manager to speak to me. He greeted me with a 'Welcome Home Again' handshake and listened to my story and happily obliged to make the dish especially for me the next night. We arrived the next night and they greeted us enthusiastically and led us to our table - decorated with Hibiscus flowers and sparkles. They poured champagne and gave us a delicious sushi appetizer sampler plate. Then came the main course. It was this amazing Mustard Chicken dish...just delish. We tipped both the head waiter and our waiter and lo and behold, the next night we had another decorated table. Santoyo (the head waiter) and Johan (our waiter) were so professional, so accommodating and so friendly. True 5 star service. Every time I turned around there were staff members bending over backwards to make sure we were not in need of anything, this truly was the best service I've ever experienced. GENERAL: I don't think this is a resort for older children. Saw quite a few babies and some toddlers, all seemed to be having a good time. I would think that older children would be bit bored here, but singles, couples and groups would find this place a great escape. BARS: There was a beach bar within close proximity of the beach, the lobby bar had a piano player there in the evenings and there were computers so you could use the internet. There was one bar - where the evening shows were. It was inside with floor to ceiling windows that opened but still, I found it too hot to sit in. After dinner we would sit in the lobby bar and meet people from all over, it was a great vibe, people were very friendly. All in all, this is by far the best All Inclusive I've ever been to, it will be hard to match!

Reviews.Title: “an objective appraisal of the Palace”
Reviews.Author: FRNS
Reviews.Content: I write this as we contemplate our 3rd visit to RIU Palace. That in itself must say something. We stayed there in March 05 as well as March 06 --- my wife and I as well as 3 kids ages 14, 11, and 9. We all loved it. Aside from one excursion during the week, we enjoy staying put at the resort. We were always on up early and stayed by the pool or beach for the entire day. Service was always good. Going back the second time was an advantage -- we knew the resort, including all the little "ins and outs". A few specific comments: 1) not musty. This is a seaside resort --- there is bound to be more humidity and saltiness in the air. "It ain't the same air as Nebraska or Saskatchewan, folks." 2) It is indeed "kid-friendly" --- my kids loved every moment of the stay. Aside from the obvious sun, sand , and surf, we played tons of Ping Pong, did crafts, para-sailing, scuba lessons in the pool, volleyball, Bingo, and so on. Just because there isn't a guy dressed up as Mickey Mouse does not mean it is not kid-friendly. 3) Meals were fine. Interestingly, their "theme nights" were exactly the same from one year to the next. 4) Generally, the evening entertainment was "weak all week", but I was too tired in the evening to really care. After dinner, I enjoyed strolling around the resort in the comfortable evening air. 5) Fitness Centre. Small, but I liked it. Opened at 8 am and I believe it closed at 8 pm. "It is important to me to maintain my well-sculpted physique". ("ahem") 6) Beds --- a matter of personal preference. I liked the firmness of the beds. 7) Beer is good. Bar off lobby area is the best for mixed drinks, but very smokey.(Now that is an area where all-inclusives are not cost efficient to take kids. I bet my 8 year-old only drank 3 beer all week !! (just kidding). He loved the non-alcholic pina coladas. 8) Lots of Americans, a few Europeans, Brits, and Canucks. A good cross-section of ages --- for the most part, everybody polite and respectful. 9) Staff polite and accomodating. However, the evening dining experience can be frustrating. I noted on a couple of occassions that because our party included children (well-behaved, I might add), we were always escorted to a remote location in restaurant. After it occurred once, I did not let it happen again. Be firm when you make your reservations .... as well as use of a $5-spot. I did tip regularly because, since this was our exclusive 1-week family vacation, I wanted nothing left to chance. Over the course of the week, my cumulative tips were probably $40-$50. It was worth it. 10) To the guy from Colorado who won the Ping Pong Championship, "I'm coming back. Be there." 11) Beach is good -- well groomed. No problem finding a spot to sit. Water is lovely and refreshing. 12) criticism: too many people peddling their wares on the beach !! Far worse than the previous year. We bought some jewellry one day, and went parasailing one day. That was all I wanted. I am not exaggerating when I say that, over the course of the week, I said "NO" over 100 times. It made it difficult to relax and enjoy. 13) criticism: On both stays (05 and 06), there were 3 days when a large group of American graduating high school students and their parents stayed at resort (from Texas one year and from Kansas the other year). They basically were the most ignorant and disrespectful people at the resort. The students overtook the pool bar, yelling and screaming, pouring beer in the pool (as others tried to swim). The parents (whom I blame) were off by themselves enjoying the beach. Security was called and all were ejected from the pool, and some ejected from the resort entirely. The message: if such a thing happens, complain immediately! The resort will act. I have covered a few points of interest. This is a good resort. Enjoy, and don't sweat the small stuff. The newer RIU next door also looks nice. -- A Nova Scotia, Canada Perspective

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: ncsanchez
Reviews.Content: This is a Great Place! My wife and I were there from Jan 14 to Jan 18. We have been to Cancun about six times and have stayed about 15 different All Inclusive Resorts throughout the Carribean. We would have to say this is one of the best we have stayed at. The staff was always friendly and smiling every time we saw them, not matter if they were serving us or making up our room. The drinks were always just right, not too much liqour or too less. If you wanted more just ask they will put as much as you want. While at the pool the waiter came around fruqently enough that we had a drink all the time. I read some of the other reviews and some people did not like the bed because it was too hard, it was hard, but all you have to do is ask for a pad for your bed and they will bring one and put it on for you, it make all the difference. The beach was not all that great and I asked how come the beach was so small and narrow. The person at the hotel told me that it has to do with the tide, he said in the late summer the beach gets wider because the tide comes in. One thing we loved about the resort was during lunch you could not bring your plate out to the pool, you had to eat at the resturaunt. The food was excellent all the time. There is a wide variety of food, too much to list. The one problem we did not like was the procedure on how they made reservations for the resturants, it was crazy. But if you can not get reservations don't worry the bufret is just as good. We really liked the Mexican night at the buffet it was excellent. Just a reminder, during dinner men have to wear pants even to the buffet, they will ask you to leave or not allow you in, I learned the hard way. We went downtown to Fifth Avenue that is where all the bars are at, they were not that busy we came back to the hotel early that night. We would go back as a matter of fact we will probably go back with our daughter in July. Hope this helps have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Never Take Your Kids!”
Reviews.Author: OhioPenelope
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, but not enough direction on complicated "dinner reservations".......we actually got asked to leave one sitting because we weren't there at designated time! (NOBODY told us we needed to make reservations in even the main dining hall!!) We had a 2 year old with us, and received the "cold shoulder" and discriminitory looks from staff and others.......as if we missed the blinking neon sign at the entrance that said: "Children NOT Welcome Here"! We got looks of sympathy from the 3 other couples who had children there as well. Would probably be ok for honeymooning couple, but then again...maybe not..... The "King size" beds are actually 2 rock hard doubles pushed together........but not made up together....! The one day my husband asked to para-sail, he was informed by a rude staff member "no para-sailing today" though there were obviously others para-sailing! Massage tent was great!!! ..which was good because I needed something to help me wind down after all the stress of "the dinner dilemmas" with child. We came back from this vacation needing another one. Would NEVER take a child there! Dont expect absolutely delicious food either. Main dining hall was a little like a large cafeteria........ Never got a chance to make reservations for the specialty restaurants. They were booked by the time we learned how to get in to them. Child would definetely not have been welcomed in one of these.!!

Reviews.Title: “Travelled from Kamloops, BC AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Gypsy060
Reviews.Content: We went to the Riu Palace Mexico for 2 weeks, Nov 17 - Dec 1, 2006. I have read the reviews of late and I cannot believe what I am reading. It was an incredible place to go. My only and I mean only complaint was that the beds were pretty darn hard. The beach was incredible, crowded but that isn't the fault of the hotel, if you want privacy stay at a private island. There was a little bit of confusion with our rooms with our travelling companions but was quickly sorted out. The food was absolutely incredible and although we ate at the Steakhouse and Sir Edwards, we didn't think that they were anything more special then the buffet. Save yourself the time and effort and eat at the buffet, always variety and always good. We met a lot of great people there who have been coming back to this resort year after year. My husbands shirt got ruined from one of the chairs that had been freshly painted and the resort reimbursed us full price to replace the shirt. They offered to try and fix the problem but we were leaving in the morning and time did not permit. The staff was incredible. Just wish that darn beach bar was slightly closer to the main beach area and maybe if they had waiters come around at the beach it would have made it even more enhoyable than it already was. We give this resort an above average rating as we have no other resorts to compare it to. We will be coming back for sure. We loved the locarion, close to all the great things we wanted to do. We walked south down the beach a couple of miles and went snorkelling around some great reefs. My only recommendation is that they make the swim up bar side of the pool adults only. Check this place out, there was atleast 2 weddings a day while we were there. AWESOME is all I can say

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing Vacation Without The Kids”
Reviews.Author: livefast
Reviews.Content: This was our first AL so keep that in mind but we did get other travelers opions and they seem to think the same as we did. This is a great place to stay if you want a relaxing vacation in our case one without the kids, thirtyish to enjoy eachothers company. We stayed from Jan 4-8th and really enjoyed the alone time and what I have expierenced as the best service ever. * This is not a great hotel for kids and it is not designed to be so if that is what you want don't go here! I personally booked here because I wanted a peaceful vacation without kids. ROOMS- The rooms were wonderful mini bar always stocked with tequilla,rum,brandy, corona botteled water and soft drinks. The beds were hard but we found them comfortable depends on your sleep preference. The couryard room upgrade is very nice. Your views are limited everywhere in this hotel but we were not in them that much so we didn't mind. SERVICE- OUTSTANDING!!!! bartenders willing to make you any drink you desire. Yes they do have premium liquior (for mexico) you do have to ask but they don't care at all. When you sit in the courtyard after dinner it seems your waiter is there before you even sit to see what you would like. They serve drinks at the beach but only every so often. The beach bar is only steps away so it's okay. In the pool area the service again is awesome. Just lay back and relax they will bring the drinks to you. FOOD- Great-good- Depends what you like and expect. The buffet was great more than enough to choose from. Some Special items each night one night (thursday),we had lobster,but otherwise the same things daily. You might get sick of it after five six days but every thing was good. We really enjoyed the chips,salsa and guacamole. Simple but good. Really enjoyed the coffee & cappachino I drink coffee but not that much but the coffee was the best I ever had really!! We ate at the specialty resteraunt once Sir Edward it was good but we actually really enjoyed the buffert so it wasn't a big deal. BEACH- was nice plenty of chairs in the sun and shade no need to get there early. Just north of us the beaches were horrible do to the erosion but we walked to the south and they were all good . (if you were there before the hurricane the beaches are different so we heard ) All in all were would definatly recommend this hotel to a couple who just wants to get away (from the kids, work , daily life). This is an excellent place to relax and be waited on all the time. Please remember to tip when appropriate and be friendly it goes a long way, and these people deserve it they work very hard. I would not recommend this place to families or spring breakers. Hope this help in your vacation travels!! ps sorry about the spelling

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at the Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Corvalis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from October 7-14, 2006. This was our second time in the Playa Del Carmen area, the last time being 1996. Here is an unbiased review of the property. Upon arrival at the resort you are greeted by the doorman Manuel. This is the perfect job for him, since he is super friendly and makes you feel very welcome upon arrival. Rooms: Good sized, although the bathroom is bit small with only one sink. Also, the bathroom is just a bit dated and is due for an upgrade, particularly the tub and shower. We had no problem with the water pressure in shower. There is a toilet and bidet in bathroom. There are 4 types of liquor in the room. Tequila, Vodka, Brandy and Rum. No top shelf but adequate. The Mini fridge is stocked with mixers but not ice. The ice machine in our building did not work, although that was not really an issue since they recommend that you not drink the tap water. Bottled water is also available in the room. WARNING: Do not drink the tap water as it is not purified. I did brush my teeth with it buy rinsed my mouth with Scope after doing so. Our room had a balcony overlooking the fountains in the courtyard. There are no oceanview or oceanfront rooms at this resort. They initially will say it is a $30.00 extra charge per night for a courtyard room view, however, if you keep calling the front desk they will eventually upgrade you at no charge, which they did for us. We ended up on the top floor room with a large balcony overlooking the fountains in the courtyard. Very nice! The Beach: Nice but not extremely wide since there has been some erosion from the waves. Lots of cigarette butts on the sand deposited by chain smoking Euros. Otherwise fine beach, with mostly clear blue water and minimal seaweed. Jetskis operate on the North end of the Riu beach but are four stroke Yamaha models and fairly quiet. Still get some fuel smell from the jetskis though. Yes there are vendors on the beach but they are far from aggressive. Actually quite tame by Mexico standards. Quite a few topless women on the beach, much more than the last time we visited 10 years ago. Not that anyone minds of course! Restaurants: Steakhouse is outdoors at the El Patio Restaurant. Try the Tuna Steak which is excellent and huge. I would forego the portabellos. I got a bit of Montezuma’s revenge from eating them. Sir Edward French Restaurant: Good food with outstanding service. We did not try the Brazilian or the Japanese Restaurant. Lobby bar: Good selection of liquors. Super friendly staff. Never really crowded. A nice place to cool down and relax with a drink. Housekeeping service: Best I have encountered anywhere, period. Really on top of things I think they really appreciated the $2.00 per day tip we left them. Be sure to ask for the mattress pads at check in. They make a world of difference. If you called for a mini bar restock there were there in minutes. Same goes for asking for extra towels. They are always on top of it. Super! Public areas: Very nice and extremely well kept and clean. Top notch! Pool: Small but nice. Swim up bar was nice. Only thing is the depth of the pool which is too shallow in spots. Nightly entertainment: Grease was good. Michael Jackson is a don’t miss show. Excellent! Breakfast buffet: Some tables are reserved in the morning for the breakfast buffet on the outside patio. We were told it was for guests who are staying 4 weeks or longer at the resort. Otherwise no problem with seating for breakfast. I would not want to be at this resort during the high season (December – March). It is just not large enough to accommodate that many guests. I don’t think it would be much fun since it would be too crowded since the resort is not that large. Also, I would not recommend this resort if you have children. Not much to do for them since it is mostly adults staying at the resort. Hotel was very quiet, no noise problems. A/C worked well 95 percent of the time. Only occasionally did it get a bit warm in the room. Make sure you set the thermostat to low. Asides: Went to the Riu Tequila across the street to watch an NFL football game at the Sports Bar. Not real great with the only food being hot dogs hamburgers and pizza, all pre-prepared and placed in a refrigerator where you could select what you wanted and then heat it in a microwave. Also went to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Not real impressed with that property either. Pool was not much bigger than the one at the Riu Palace Mexico and the public areas were definitely not as nice as those in the Riu Palace Mexico. It looks like Riu ran out of money when they built the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. The fountains at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya are just a piece of PVC pipe with a sprinkler head on them and the design of the building itself cannot put a patch on the design of the Riu Palace Mexico. I guess the cost of construction had gone up quite a bit since the Riu Palace Mexico was built (1999) and it shows in the construction of the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, which is only a year or two old. It simply is not as nice aesthetically as the Riu Palace Mexico IMHO. Staff was absolutely fantastic at the Riu Palace Mexico. Best anywhere that I have stayed. Riu really must have did there homework during the hiring process of this staff. Truly exceptional people working at the Riu Palace Mexico. They all seem to love what they are doing. Food was better than expected from reading the previous posts. Actually very good with a wide variety for an all inclusive property. My only complaint would be that the only beer available is Corona, on draft and in bottles in the room mini bar. We did have a glitch with our private transfer returning to the Cancun airport. Gerardo the Apple Tours rep told us to come back on a Friday to make final arrangements for our return transfer with Apple to the Cancun airport for our flight early on Saturday. He basically started talking over me when I asked him to confirm that Friday was the day we should come back to confirm our transfer. So, early Friday we came back to see him and it was his day off. He is too busy trying to sell tours and does not even know what his scheduled day off is! We had to call Apple ourselves to make our own arrangements for the return trip to the Cancun Airport. Gerardo needs to become a more effective listener and stop focusing so much on the tour selling! Town of Playa: 5th Avenue has some decent shops, but mostly lots of junk stores. One crazy thing is that colorful quotes are directed at touristos from the locals as you walk through the town. A sampling of quotes from the locals… Hey alcoholic, come and look at my junk. Come and look at my stuff, amigo, I promise I will shut up now. Funny stuff indeed! Check out Karen’s in town. Great nachos and beer special. Good place to people watch too. All in all I would highly recommend this property for a relaxing stay in the Riviera Maya. Feel free to email me with any questions that you may have at big7ben@gmail.com.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and fun”
Reviews.Author: cornet1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great Christmas and New Year. Didn't find reserving places at the speciality restaurants a problem even when we didn't make it down to the reservation table until after 10am, we still managed to get our choice of restaurant and time slot. Food was excellent and plenty of choice for all tastes. Staff were extremely helpful and service was good. they were attentive and courteous at all times. Unlike other guests didn't find early morning noise a problem but perhaps I'm just a heavy sleeper. Only problem with pool area was inconsiderate guests who would reserve sunbeds early and then disappear all morning not returning until well after lunch. Snorkelling in the area not good but went to Xelha which was great for this activity. Our 6 year old daughter had a great time and enjoyed every minute of the holiday and made a few friends. We ordered room service and must say I was impressed with the speed in which it arrived. Christmas and New Year gala buffets were excellent pity there were so many 't shirts' on show. Only downside was some of the 'rudeness' of some of the guests to some members of staff. We will certainly be returning at some time in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & Quiet at night”
Reviews.Author: emkww
Reviews.Content: Stay RPM 12/21/06 - 12/28/06. Found Riu Palace Mexico to be very luxurious & quiet. Early morning 7:00 am noisy in the halls. By 11:00 pm the entire resort seems to shut down. This place is great for early risers. The other Riu across the street (Which you have access to) is where the late fun is. Maid service is excellent & twice a day. Mini bar always restocked. Buffet had all you could want & variety. Wine & drinks very good. Staff always around & helpfull. NEGITIVE - Reservations for the Specialty Restaurants. Their SYSTEM of signing up at 8:30 am every morning for either 6:30 pm or 9:00 pm does not work. Never could get 6:30 pm dining no matter if I showed up at 8:00 am. MUST Hear that the reservation system HAS BEEN CHANGED for me to return & recommend this resort. EMKWW

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: alperlma
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Riu Palace Mexico. Many aspects of the hotel were lovely, and some were only adequate. Yes, the mattresses are hard and a king bed is two full-sized beds pushed together (but not made up together). The food at the buffet is fine but the noise and the size of the dining room made it feel like a fancy camp dining hall. (There was a alot of variety and the food was generally decent enough.) The specialty restaurants varied: Sir Edward (the "gourmet" restaurant) was pretty and pleasant, La Bodega (the Brazilian restaurant) was tasty, El Patio (Mediterranean and steak house, I think) was fine, and Miyago (the Japanese restaurant) was awful. The thing to keep in mind is that the food at an all-inclusive resort is not going to be as good as at individual fancy restaurants. The process for getting reservations for dinner was a bit chaotic. People start drifting in as early as 7 or 7:30 AM to get a number to determine in what order they'll start taking reservations. The numbers were handed out between 7:30 and 8 AM, but you never know exactly when. They start the actual reservations at 8:30 AM. The seatings are at 6:30 or at 9:00 PM at the specialty restaurants, not in between (except at El Patio for some reason). We always wanted the early dinner since my husband is an early riser. Except for the day we got there when we had missed the reservations process and ate in the buffet, we always got something. (Christmas Eve dinner was buffet only but it was an incredible spread. Also pretty chaotic.) It is a LONG walk from one end of the hotel to the other; one day I walked down to the beach to tell my husband that the rest of us were eating at the main buffet (instead of the smaller buffet that was closer to the beach). It took me 15 minutes roundtrip, including a while to find him on the beach, which was very full. If I forgot something in the room, I really didn't want to bother to go back to get it. Our room was close to the lobby so our walk was the longest. We've only stayed at one other all-inclusive (Intercontinental El Presidente in Cabo which we liked better but our teenage daughters liked this one better). Any all-inclusive has its pluses and minuses. Basically, if you're used to something like a JW Marriott, this is going to feel like a step down. If you're used to a Ritz Carlton, this is going to feel like a BIG step down. But if you're looking for a nice all-inclusive, it's probably as good as any other. Just don't think that 4 1/2 stars is the same as 4 1/2 stars for a stand-alone hotel, and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation - Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: fromToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Riu Palace Mexico from Dec 07 to Dec 21, 2006. We had a wonderful time and we rate the hotel as a 5-star. To summerize, the hotel is clean, the rooms are speacious and clean, our room was cleaned 3 times a day. The food is above average (except the Brazilian retsaurant which is exceptionally great!). Brand name drinks are served. The mini-bar is refreshed every day. The staff are friiendly. We didn't have any problem communicating with the staff. The beach was nice. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: olechka00
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 7 days Christmas vacation at Riu Palace Mexico in Riviera Maya. Overall, we absolutely loved it. SUMMARY: Positive: Quality of food Layout of the hotel grounds Pools and beach Bar Staff and service Just ok: Process for signing up for specialty restaurants Noise in the halls Snorkeling/Scubadiving DETAILS: FOOD: Buffet was excellent, so many selections, everything seemed very fresh. Specialty restaurants: Brazilian and Steakhouse and Sir Edwards - great food, great service Japanese - terrible, don't waste your time. Sushi is not really sushi (no raw fish), main dishes just ok. Now the process for booking speciality restaurants is ridiculous, people would wake up at 7am to get a number to then get in line to make a reservation. There must be a better way to do this, like i've seen at other resorts, book all restaurants when you arrive. STAFF: Everyone is very friendly and professional. Cleaning staff, wait staff, bartenders, great service from everyone. GENERAL: Gorgeous hotel grounds, everything is so clean, beautifully decorated, great set-up, a pleasure to spend time there. Room was huge, the only negative was a tiny-tiny TV, which wasn't a big deal. Another very strange thing was old fashioned keys instead of keycards, that we had to drag around along with the old fashioned safe key. No big deal though again. Our only major complaint was the noise in the hallways, as early as 7:30am you can hear staff walking around with walkie-talkies, carts being pushed as well as people running around and yelling. We are not early risers and didnt appreciate being up that early every morning. SCUBA/SNORKELING: My husband is certified scubadiver, he had fun, although his experience was ok, it could've been better. The instructors were not as good as encountered at other resorts, also, on Chirstmas morning a dive was scheduled at 8am and when he showed up ready to go, was informed that staff will not be available. Also, another disappointing thing is that there was no snorkeling available at the resort itself, unlike other resorts we stayed at. We didn't do a special snorkeling excurision that was offered, so I can't comment on that. Overall, we had a great experience and highly recommend it to everyone. We would definitely go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Well-worth the trip!”
Reviews.Author: JulieStCharles
Reviews.Content: We (4 couples in all) stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico Oct. 25-Nov. 1, 2006 and had a wonderful time! The resort was clean, beautiful, well-maintained. The rooms are large and always clean. The mini-bars in the rooms even had bottled liqour, which we've never had at other resorts. The food at the buffet restaurant was really good, at the sit-down restaurants the food was pretty good. Several of us did get a touch of tummy-trouble, not sure if it was from the resort or our day at Cozumel. The staff was friendly but we really weren't impressed with the evening entertainment. The sports bar over at the Riu Tequila was too kid-oriented so we ended up watching the Cardinals win the World Series in our room. Many of the staff were Cards fans! My husband and I had a wonderful massage on the beach one afternoon, well worth the price! And the beach was great!! We were disappointed in the scuba dive we did at the resort's dive shop. We felt a little rushed, and my husband's regulator was not working as well as it should have. On the boat, our dive master seemed frantic trying to find him a regulator that worked. My husband ended up quitting the dive after 5 minutes, which has never happened before to him. The current had switched so our drift dive was a 'swim as hard as you can' dive that seemed to go on forever. I was glad when my tank started running low so I could join my husband on the boat. As disappointed as we were, the dive shop didn't offer us any sort of compensation. That dive was a waste of money. The only other negative was our room faced the next resort and I guess we were very near their disco. And they liked their music loud and we got to listen to it well-into the night. They usually didn't quit until 2am.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Rui Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: jenniferSanDiego
Reviews.Content: My husband and I selected this hotel based on the reveiws, food being one of the most important factors and beach shade being another. Being that we are mostly vegetarian, eat a little fish, I must say the food was excellent. I could not believe how fresh everything was and how many options there were for us. I ate more fresh fruit and salads than I would have imagined. As for the beach, we could always find shade which was exactly what I needed. The service was excellent. They really go out of their way to ensure you have a wonderful stay. The hotel is a pleasant walk to town (about 20 minutes), but don't expect to find any bargains there.....the prices are not much different than they are here in San Diego. We did check out a couple of the other Rui's. My husband is much more about the action, if he were to go back he probably would stay at the one next door.....it's a bit wild and full of action. My preference is the Rui Mexico.....calm, quiet, relaxing, and not crowded. I absolutely loved it. It was the relaxing vacation I needed. Oh, great cappuccino's too!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace-Just got back”
Reviews.Author: chicagogal
Reviews.Content: Just got back from RIU Palace Mexico 12/15-12/22 Weather- Was perfect considering the forecast was for rain and storms everyday. It did rain 4 of 7 days but it was usually at night or in the morning. We had plenty of beach time and came back with perfect tans. Resort/Staff- The resort is very pretty and grounds are kept clean and neat. The interior is not a very Mexican feel-more like Bermuda or something but it was still nice. We enjoyed the outdoor terrace at night for drinks and music. 2 nights they had vendors that would sell jewelry (they will bargain). Really didn't watch any shows as they seemed to just make them up as they went along. The staff at all the restraunts-bars-maids and front desk are top notch. We would tip but they don't seem to expect it. Beach/Pool- We chhose this hotel because of the beach and proximity to Playa del Carmen. The beach is wonderful. One of the best I've been to. No problem getting a lounger everyday for a group of 7 people and a 1 year old. There would be plenty of sun and shade areas. The water is warm and there are very few rocks in the water. We found there seemed to be less rocks toward the Yucatan side rather than the Westin side of the beach. The staff would bring premixed drinks-water and beer for anyone on the beach who was thirsty. We really didnt use the pool that much. The hot tub is the same or colder than the pool. The pool has a nice bar area but other than that it was just ok. Food- well considering several of us were sick I would say the food was not that great. I know this can happen anywhere in Mexico but it still put a damper on the trip. We did try all specialty restaurants except the Japanese. They were all just average. The buffet was decent you can go there anytime even though they say seating is at 6:30-that's just when it opens. If you really want to eat a t a certain place (especially at 6:30) i would get in line by 8 am to make your reservation. This was one thing we did not like was the reservation system. Rooms-all junior suites. We upgraded at arrival and paid around $400.00 extra for the week to have a courtyard view. I thought it was worth it. We were also close to my family. Mini bar was stocked everyday and rooms cleaned twice a day. Kids- Not too many. My sister had her one year old with her and it was fine. The staff is very baby friendly. Not too many 7-16 year olds. Not too much for them to do unless all they want to do is go to the beach. Let me know if you have questions- Oh yeah we walked to RIU Palace Riviera Maya. I would not stay there if you want to go to the beach at all. It is completely gone. A tide came in and took away most of the beach between that resort and the Royal Hideaway. Overall we had a nice time but I would try other resorts before going back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday...”
Reviews.Author: Deirdra
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from an amazing holiday to the Riu Mexico Palace. This is our second visit and we will definitely be returning next year. We have travelled all over the world, but the GENUINE hospitality of the staff at the Riu Palace was second to none...If you want a fab vacation, are getting married or anything else for that matter, this hotel comes highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “From a Fan of Riu Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Peacheypc_123
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks at the Riu Palace Mexico and it certainly lived up to its expectations. Just one tip: Rooms overlooking the courtyard are good but make sure you get one with a proper balcony - some of the balconies are very narrow with no overhead roof therefore when it rains you would not be able to sit on the balcony. The waiters were excellent and really look after you - we ate outside every day as we thought the dining room did look rather dark. We would definitely go back. We have also stayed at the Riu Yucatan and the Riu Monica at Nerja, Spain which are both excellent hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Gabriele
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip through Apple and had a great experience with the flight and transfer from the airport. Once we got to the hotel however, we requested our room in a certain area--a large area--we weren't limiting the hotel to a small number of roooms. Samuel, the man behind the desk told us it would be an additioinal $600 to have a room on that side of the hotel. So we declined. Then he said, well maybe on Wednesday you can move there. We ended up in room 0016, a very smelly, moldy and noisy room. It was often not made up until we requested it at 8:00 p.m. Then there was a problem with the beach towels. They only gave us one with the towel card which we used to cover the beach chairs that had bird poop on them. It would have been nice to have a second towel. That evening we did speak to management about this and they said "is the second towel for you", like we were going to give it to someone else. Hard to understand this mentality. But we were already upset with the bad room and being hit up for extra money. Then midway in the week they invited us to move to another hotel, the new Riu Hotel. Having lost all trust, we walked over there first to see what kind of a room they were going to stick us in. They refused to show us one. Suspecting that we could end up even worse than we were now, we opted to stay put. The food was good in the French restaurant, horrible in the Japanese restaurant, good in the Brazilian restaurant and decent in the buffets. The help was not very friendly or helpful. There are many problems with this hotel. You would be better off to spend less money at another hotel. It is hard to understand the ratings this place gets. This past summer we went on a trip and stayed in Fairmont Hotels and they truly deserve the fine ratings they get which (I can't believe this) are similar to this fleabag. How can this be! I got the feeling at this hotel that once they had my money they didn't care how comfortable I was. Our December break last year at the Bahia Principe was a much better experience. We thought we were moving up to a better place, but it sure wasn't. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: hayzgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RPM Nov.29-Dec4/06 and loved every minute we were there. The staff, food and rooms were extremely impressive and to beach was amazing. My only advice would be to make sure you bring a ton of single bills. ( If you purchase anything you only get pesos back). We also did the Mayan encounter day trip which was awesome. If you like adventure and a little bit of culture.... this tour is for you. We had a blast. The night life at the RPM was short lived ( It was totally quiet by 10:00pm) so we made our way across the street to the Riu Tequila every night to party. The Shows and the Disco were awesome at the RT. We would dance until it closed then stroll across the street back to our hotel. Overall we had an amazing trip and we can't wait to go back!!! B&B Hayes Amherstburg, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: allgat
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to mexico with the family and had a great experience. The staff was very accomodating, the grounds where spotless and food was good. Just small enough to feel comfortable with young kids (9&10) running around. Lot's to do on the beach including using the other RiU properties. We went on the ATV/Speed boats (average) and fishing. Lot's of fish caught by other boats but our boat had sub par equipment, captain and crew. If you are looking to catch a bill fish, it's not hard to do. The grounds are only a few miles off shore, so not alot of cruising. I made the mistake of being the coordinator for booking the excursions for several families. If you take on this responsibility, my advice is to decide on day one what you want to do, on what days and book early. If you wait until the last minuite, you may not get the day or time you would like. We will be staying at the new RIU property in Porta Vallarta. I look forward to reading any reviews. I believe it just opened.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Babb
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a fantastic 2 week break in the Riu Palace Mexico, Expectations of "All Inclusive" after our last experience 5 years ago were limited. However. all apsects of the Holiday were beyond our expectations. The Room was perfect, Clean and spacious, The Food was excellent, and the location of the Hotel perfect, The Staff were always friendly, and helpful. The 2 ladies who look after the main bar were fantastic. On our return, Both My wife and Myself commented that for the first time in 30 years of holidays, This is the first time we have came back without a complaint, of any sort. Well Done to everyone at the Palace for making our Holiday Special....We shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Palace”
Reviews.Author: batgraham
Reviews.Content: What a great time, the people couldn't have been nicer and the service was the best. This is the second time my family has been their and we will go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, disappointing food”
Reviews.Author: erpatches
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Palace Mexico from October 30th to November 6th. The hotel and grounds are truly impressive and the service is excellent. Our room was clean and comfortable. The beach was nice and shade was not a major problem. The beach bar is a distance from the beach area. Drink service is offered, but they only came around twice a day and not everyday. We enjoyed the pools, and the bar service was great. There was never a problem finding loungers at the beach or pools anytime of the day. The entertainment was excellent. Bands performed in the courtyard before the shows in the theater. The piano bar is off the lobby and has a casual atmosphere. The Internet service is located in a corner of the piano bar smoking section, with laptops on four small tables. Surely they could find a better location for this service. The major disappointment of our trip was the food. Having stayed at other five star resorts in the Caribbean, we found the food at this RIU to be four star at best. The main buffet restaurant (Don Julian) hot food dishes were only warm, some cold. The food is very repetitive for both lunch and dinner. We went to three specialty restaurants, Sir Edward (Gourmet), La Bodega (Brazil) and the Steakhouse. We found them to not be very special at all. The steaks at the Steakhouse were so greasy that some people sent them back. Although our vacation was good, we will probably not return to this resort. When you pay for a five star hotel, you expect food not to be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Short but Sweet Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LFD95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico 11/10-11/14/06. When we originally booked the trip, it was a long weekend designed to fit into two full-time work schedules and two full-time school schedules. What we found as we were sadly packing our bags to go home was that we should have found a way to stay longer. We had a very nice time at this hotel. One reviewer commented on Olympus tours and we completely agree. It was a gorgeous day when we arrived at 11:30AM and we waited for 45 minutes, watching other people get in their vans and leave to enjoy the sun. When the group leader led us to our van and then led us back to the curb, he explained the delay by telling us that the van didn't have enough gas to get us to the Riu. My husband took the high road, saying a slow start to vacation beats the fastest day at work anytime. We were happy with our room, very clean, animals made out of towels, mini-bar re-stocked everyday with our requests, very attentive staff. We didn't have a problem with the mattress, as we have a hard mattress at home. Our view wasn't the greatest, faced another resort, but it was quiet and bug-free, and it never dawned on us to request another room. We stayed to the quieter side of the two pools, when we were at the pool (just the first day). We dove 3 out of the 5 five days we were there with ScubaCaribe. They were wonderful, accomodating to all experience levels, and completely professional, very fun to have as Divemasters. The rest of the time we lounged on the beach, breath-taking!! The vendors seemed to be more prolific in the mornings (maybe because there weren't as many people around in the mornings?) A no, thank-you was enough. We thought the food was very good. We had room service two days because of our dive schedule and ate at the buffet the other days. The buffet was extensive and fresh. I thought the scrambled eggs were great and the fruit was awesome. We never had lunch or an afternoon snack. We ate at the buffet twice for dinner and it was great both times, a wide variety for many different preferences. We ate at the Japanese restaurant one night and the gourmet restaurant the other. We thought both were outstanding. As many other people have said, the service at the Riu Palace Mexico is outstanding. We would absolutely stay here again, only if we could stay longer and truly get a feel for this resort. We met a couple who were on their fifth trip to the Riu Palace Mexico and they come from British Columbia (that;'s devotion!)

Reviews.Title: “Another great experience!”
Reviews.Author: mpd68
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our 3rd trip to the Riu Palace Mexico in Playa Del Carmen. It was another fabulous experience! The staff was great! Upon arriving in Cancun, I found that dealing with Customs was very easy. They have made some significant improvements over the years. After being processed into Mexico by Customs, we retrieved our luggage, and made our way to the x-ray machines nearby. For some, this was probably the most confusing part of the trip because nobody directed anyone on where to go after retrieving their luggage. I watched as many tried to find an exit, not realizing they needed to get in line and have their luggage x-rayed. Once through Customs, we were confronted by many who wanted to take our luggage for us. I have always taken them up on their offer, and was brought directly to our ground transportation service. I have read that many oppose this, but I don't want to be bothered with my luggage, and feel they are trying to make a living...It's appropriate to TIP him/her a few bucks (I gave our guy $10.00). Unfortunately, we experienced some minor delays with Olympous Tours. We sat in our van for about 1/2 hour without a driver. I watched as many travellers were ushered promptly into their awaiting van and then taken away, so I guess we just had some bad luck here. I really wasn't bothereed by this wait, but one group in the van seemed quite annoyed. It seemed that it was the driver's fault, not Olympous Tours. I watched as he stood around talking, while our luggage sat outside the van. I am not sure I would fault Olympous Tours, so no need to worry. I think we just got a "lazy" driver...no big deal to me. When we arrived at the resort, we were greeted as we exited the van, and then watched as our luggage was quickly gathered by one member of the staff. He escorted us to the front desk where we were handed a "welcome" drink. Check-in went very smooth. It took about 5-minutes, as Luis explained a few things about the resort to us. When we arrived at our room, I wasn't very pleased with the view. We were overlooking another resort and a pathway leading to the beach from the Riu Tequilla. In our previous trips to the Palace we had a courtyard view, so it was a bit disappointing. The room was very nice, but my expectations were set on a courtyard view. I went back to the front desk and asked (very nicely) if we could be moved, and offered to pay $$$$ for an upgrade. Unfortunately, they did not have any rooms to move us to, but we were told to check back the following day. The following morning we got up, and checked in with the front desk. They advised us that they did have a new room available, and moved us within a few hours. (Of course, I gave a very generous TIP, but only after I was given the NEW room key). This room was very clean. The "musty" odor some complain of is very common is high humidity areas. Occasionally, we could smell it, but it didn't bother us. The beach was exceptional! We have travelled to many resorts and found that the beaches in this area are some of the nicest. The water is a turqoise blue, and the beaches have a soft white sand. There were plenty of chairs for everyone, in both the sun and shade. There's a beach bar too. Massage huts were also situated on the beach...for an additional fee of course. While on the beach, we weren't hassled too often by people selling merchandise. The few times that we were approached, we said we weren't interested and they left without any hassle. There was some topless sunbathing on the beach, so if that bothers you....this might not be the resort for you. I also saw it at the pool too, although it was not as frequent. The pool here is nice, but it's a bit small in comparison to some other resorts we have stayed at. There are two sides to the pool. The side with the "pool bar" is quite noisy. We spent most of our time at the pool "opposite" the pool bar and found it was very relaxing. There are plenty of chairs around the pool, but if you are "picky" about where you sit...I would suggest you get to the pool early. They do provide drink service around the pool. The staff providing this service is extremely effecient. I made a point to tip them frequently and found it to be well worth the $$$$. We would finish a drink and they would be right there to ask if we wanted another one. Overall, our meals were very good. There is plenty of variety to go around, so nobody should complain. Breakfast was very good, the lunches were OK, and the buffet dinner was very good. This is the first trip here where we did not try a "specialty" restaurant because there was enough variety on the buffet. The specialty restaurants consisted of a Japanese Restuarant, and Steakhouse Resturant, and one other I am not sure of. The service for breakfast and lunch was good, but we had exceptional service for dinner. I would suggest you find a server you like, and then make a point to go to him/her every night. There's no assigned seating, so you need to get there early if you want to pick your server, or find one you like and give him a very generous TIP and then ask him to keep the table for you. It worked for us, as we had our table decorated with flowers and drinks waiting for us. We did not do many activities outside the resort becaue we had done many of the excursions during previous visits. The one excursion we did do was the Jungle Jim's ATV Tour. This was a blast. It's about 40 minutes from the resort. You can either ride together for $65.00 each, or seperate for $89.00 each. I rode with my wife and we had so much fun. We started out driving 4-wheelers down some dirt paths, through some rather large puddles and along some side streets. We stopped and walked around a nature park that had many wildlife animals. We toured and underground cenote that was absolutely spectacular, and then hopped back on the ATV's and taken to a fresh water cenote where we could swim. This excursion is relatively cheap, and is worth every $. If you are contemplating staying at this resort, or the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, I can offer my opinion. We have not stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, but did tour it during this trip. The beach at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya is very rocky and doesn't compare to this resort's beach. I did like their pool better, but the overall landscaping at the Riviera Maya needs some major improvements. The water fountains have very small spouts, many palm trees were dead, and the shrubs were overgrown. In comparing the two resorts in appearance, the Riu Palace Mexico is much nicer. I can't speak for the service because we have not stayed at the Riviera Maya. Overall, this was another great vacation. We did have a few kids running around the resort unsupervised, and very obnoxious, but no fault of the resort....just their parents. Usually, this tends to be a resort for an older crowd, and is relatively quiet. If your looking for some "party" nightlife, find another resort...because you will not get that here. The shows are marginal...but good. The entertainment bands they have playing are good, but they shut it down at 11:00pm. In my opinion...It's a great place to get some rest and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Value with ellegance”
Reviews.Author: Gordonwhitehead
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this Hotel for food ,value for money,staff and amenities. I have stayed in many Riu Hotels over the yeras but this has the edge on all.The rooms are very adiquate the restaurants all serve good food and the pool service is first class . My only reservation is that we were there for my Daughters wedding and I do not think their idears of detail arec the same as mime.There is no rehersal time and for the guests no shade throughout the Ceremony.We did choose a very hot day!!! Apart from that the wedding breakfast which was allowed in private was very good and if you like champagne this is heaven.Its on tap 24/7. I would recomend this hotel unless you have a problem with over bareing Americans who do lke the sound of their own voices.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent's review of the RIU”
Reviews.Author: tequila2000
Reviews.Content: We (my fiance and I and another couple) booked the RIU Palace Mexico for Oct 21-28 after much research and reading reviews. Check in was great. I had requested an early check in, a room with a balcony and to be as close to the pool and beach as possible - all of our requests were met. The view from our balcony of some bushes and buildings was not the most appealing but we were aware in advance that the courtyard/fountain view rooms cost extra. I would definately reccommend paying the extra $60 or so to upgrade to a fountain view room. It may seem like a trivial thing, but it really makes your vacation feel just a little more special. Starting with our one and only issue. We were initially dissipointed when we checked into our room eager to unpack, unwind and make use of our liquer dispensor by having a "cuba libre." While the rooms provide a stocked mini bar, liquer and and ice bucket there were no ice machines in the entire resort that were actually working. I ended up speaking to management on this issue because as a travel agent I wouldn't feel confident sending people to a resort that did not fully provide the services that people would excpect from a 5 1/2 star resort. The front desk was unaware of the problem and apologized, upgraded us and our friends (who hadn't arrived yet) to a courtyard room, and made our a la carte reservations for the rest of the week for us. The next day there were maintenece workers working on the ice machines. I don't think they all got fixed that week, but we just got the bartenders to fill up our buckets. The rest of the week... The Resort: The resort itself was gorgeous, the grounds beautiful and well manicured. We had chosen the Palace Mexico over the Palace Riviera because the reviews of the beach were much better and it was closer to the other RIU's. My only concern was the pool bar which was shallow, but that turned out to be a non issue at all. There was a quiet pool that hardly ever had anyone in it and a hidden jacuzzi that we found on our last night! The spa centre had 2 outside hotubs which were very relaxing. There is a nice courtyard patio where you can have a drink before dinner or the shows. The lobby bar was a little smokey and dark, but a nice break if you had had enough of the sun. Rooms: A room is a room, it was clean spacious, yes the beds were a little hard and were 2 queens pushed together. We didn't spend much time in ours. Beach: The beach was definately the best of all the RIU hotels, there was a beach bar and bartenders would come down to the beach with trays of tropical drinks and bottles of rum and vodka. You could walk for miles in one direction on the beach, but the tides were stonger so I wouldn't advise swimming in a secluded area. We never had any problems at all getting 4 lounge chairs on the beach or around the pool. The hammocks were a nice touch as well for relaxing. Massage huts were on the beach too. Food. No complaints here at all! Breakfast had everything you could possibly imagine eating and all was very frresh. It was also one of the few resorts that I have been to that had my personal favorite - peanut butter! The "healthy juice" which was green is way better than it looks, and makes you feel less guilty for indulging in everything else! Lunch - we had lunch at a different RIU everyday, all had similar choices but our favorite was the beach restaurant at the Riviera Palace. If you have to wake up early to make dinner reservations for the a la carte restaurants, believe me it is well worth it. They were all amazing! If you are vegetarian don't go to the Bodega Brazillian restaurant. I am not much of a meateater, but I turned into one at this restaurant. You sample all different kinds of meat and poultry, and they were the most succulent tasty pieces of meat I have ever had! Sir Edwards Gourmet was the best, the food was truly gourmet and the atmosphere really nice and fancy. Miyagi Japanese had fresh and delicious sushi, and the fried ice cream, oh my...mmmmmm! Best fajitas that I have ever had at the Steak house! Other RIU's We felt that we made the best choice at the Palace Mexico based on the location and because we were there for the BEACH, but we loved being able to check out all the other resorts. The Palace Riviera was alot of fun if you like to party at the pool bar - good music, and awesome pools and swim up bar (with tables in the water and sun beds). The Yucatan recently built another pool and now has 2 swim up bars, loungers in the pool and 2 pool-side bars. There are also a couple of monkeys that live on the grounds (it is very lush). The Tequila had the best nightlife, good shows and bar atmosphere. The disco was stuffy, smokey and crowded (everyone from all the RIU's go there). The pool was beautiful and had the biggest swim up bar. Staff: They were fantastic and deserve to be tipped for their hard work. Maid service would clean our rooms during breakfast and also do a nightly turn down service. Our friends arrived later than us and were celebrating their engagement. We arranged for the staff to do something special for them and they decorated their bed with rose petals, a card from us, a bottle of champagne, fruit basket, picture and a bottle of tequila. It was a really nice touch! Last words: In speaking with guest relations at the hotel I found out that what happens a lot of the time is that people come to resorts and never mention their complaints to the front desk. They come home and vent their displeasement on review sites and to their travel agents and leave with a bitter taste in their mouth. The people at these resorts will (in most cases) go above and beyond to make their guests happy, but they cannot fix problems if they are not made aware of them. The only way these resorts can continue to offer and improve their services is by being informed by guests of how to make things better. In my opinion alot of bad reviews on resorts come from people who either go about making their "displeasure" known in a rude and argumentative way, or they don't bother to even see if there can be anything done to fix whatever problems there may be. I would probably give this resort a 5* rating if I didn't have so many other Caribbean All-Inclusive resorts to compare to, but I would definately not hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Lendach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace Sept/Oct for 2 weeks and we are already planning to go back next year. This hotel was excellent in all ways from the moment you stepped through the door. Every single member of staff made you feel welcome and went out of their way to make your holiday the best! We picked this hotel by reading reviews on trip advisor, and it seemed the best, but far exceeded our expectations. The rooms are very spacious and we were lucky enough to get a room facing the swimming pool, with a fantastic view of the ocean. The beach was great, and we would make one small suggestion that there are some parasols or cabanas for shade on the beach. All the restaurants were excellent, and the staff both in the restaurants and the bars were extremely friendly. Anyone considering this hotel for a holiday won't be disappointed, and we cannot wait for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: karingkare
Reviews.Content: My husaband and I stayed at the RIU with ou very good friends in April 2005 - it was fabulous. We've been travelling to Playa for years and have stayed in several all-inclusives. The Riu Palace Mexico beats them all - hands down. Our friends had never been to Mexico and were celebrating their 20 year wedding anniversary. They were considering a cruise, but decided that this would be a funner option. We were ALL so impressed with all the staff and the service is incredible. Initially we were in the back rooms overlooking the forested area - we immediately asked to transfer to rooms which looked out onto the patio/fountains. They couldn't accomodate us on day one, however, the next day moved us (at no additional $$) to rooms overlooking the fountains.. Great. Food - Awesome, funny how some people just can't be happy - there is something for everyone. Food presentation is fabulous. My husband and I said, when we go back, why would we stay anywhere else?? We are headed back Nov 17th-Nov 25th with my in-laws who are celebrating their 50th wedding anniversary. They have never been to Mexico - we are so excited to share this beautiful region with them , and I think they will be especially pleased with the hotel we chose to stay at.. If you are considering an alternative hotel - don't, you'll love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Gene and Carol from Texas”
Reviews.Author: cgreen1902
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I booked 7 days and extended the stay 3 nites more- Sept 21-Oct. 1 2006. This is the second RIU we have visited... Beaches were fabulous, water in the pool was just right. Room was super with a great view of the ocean. The swim up bartenders were just too good. Met the most wonderful folks from Canada..If you have'nt booked this trip--what are you waiting for...

Reviews.Title: “simply the best!!”
Reviews.Author: lissawoc
Reviews.Content: my family and i have just returned from the riu palace and it was above and beyond our expectations. i would highly recommend this hotel and there is not one thing that i can say i was disappointed with or would change. we went for a 2 week holiday to just relax, and that is what we did, the staff were fantastic, all of them, and the hotel was imaculate, nothing out of place. i have read reviews about the beds being hard, but for all of us, this was not the case for us we found them to be very comfortable. i honestly can say this is the best holiday ive had and wouldnt hesitate to go back again, i didnt want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel in Playa Del Carmen!!!”
Reviews.Author: LexPost
Reviews.Content: Great resort, perfect in every way! I am super picky about food and was in heaven!!! We went to the Iberostar the following year an their food was substandard and walkways too slippery- i fell 5 times!!!

Reviews.Title: “A+ from beginning to end!”
Reviews.Author: rlog67
Reviews.Content: The beach was beautiful! The room was spacious and nice and cool. NO MOLD on the couch!!!! The food was great and there was plenty to choose from. The steakhouse had super food. The APPLE rep helped us in the lobby with any extra tours or excursions we wanted to do. XCARET was great but you need 2 days to see and do it all! The hotel staff go above and beyond..especially Eleazar (lead waiter~bar tend) and Miguel. 2 very great guys! My 12 year old son had the time of his life!!! He had a boogie board everyday and loved it in the ocean. Sunscreen should be your best friend as we all got burned even with spf30 on. Reapply often!! The photos the hotel staff take for you to purchase are awesome!!! Great memories to take home! The pool is beautiful and refreshing! The weather is great but so humid!! So, so, so humid! The towel animals left on your bed are adorable. The night time entertainment is wonderful from the bands on the patio to the shows in the theatre. The sunrise is beautiful, you can not see the sunset from the beach but the sun rise is just as good. We would go back in a heartbeat. Can not say enough about this hotel and the staff!

Reviews.Title: “relaxing riu”
Reviews.Author: dmdmd
Reviews.Content: Just got back from riu palace mexico, 10/7-10/13. Fantastic. The service is outstanding ... everyone was incredibly friendly, and attentive without being obtrusive. The only other all-inclusive experience we've had was at iberostar bavaro in punta cana, and this was clearly better, at least in terms of service. The building itself is beautiful, as are the grounds, beach, and water. There is a minibar in our room, which was stocked every day, the maids are in at least twice a day, once during breakfast for cleaning and towels, and once during dinner to turn down the bed. The waitstaff were all great, and we found it much easier to get the attention of bartenders here than in punta cana. They also had two guys carrying a tray of drinks along the beach in case you wanted something, both with and without alcohol. Breakfast and lunch were great, but we did find the dinner choices not so appealing...we were expecting a little more in the way of seafood/fish. The a la carte restaurants (we ate at sir edwards "gourmet" and Miyagi japanese) were edible, and again, service was good, but the food itself was only ok. We used olympus tours for our transfers, and they were great. They also arranged any excursions for us...we did the "Mayan Adventure"...a trip to blue cenote, cave snorkel, and lagoon snorkel. It was fantastic, for the great guide (Jesus) and for the sites. I would recommend bringing your own snorkeling gear, if you have it...they have snorkels w/out valves (hard to clear) and one size masks (leaky/painful). Even so it was awesome, and would definitely recommend it. Our only complaint is that there is evening entertainment in the hotel courtyard from 8pm until 11pm and if you have a room that looks into the courtyard (which we did) it is quite loud. However, after 11pm, quiet time is respected.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DebraO
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place! The Mexican hotel employees were the best! I would definitely visit this hotel again and highly recommend it to everyone. When you read reviews, you see a few people that have a bad experience somehow and want to write about it, so that others will be warned. I read mostly good reviews, but a few not-so-pleasant reviews on this place. Even my AAA representative had been there and LOVED it. But I have to say I could not see anything negative about the place. The sweet people working there were always pleasant and helpful. Sure, it's an all-inclusive, so the food at times can be so-so. But everyone was so nice and it made our family's trip one of the best. My "family" was my two college student kids (male and female, ages 19 and 21), my son's friend ( 19 also), my daughter who is 23 and lives in another state now, my husband and myself. The boys had the BEST time of all of us, because they met two cute German girls and their families and two other teens from England and Canada. How much fun is that for two single college boys? With a disco in the complex to dance in, and a town within a cab's ride away (about 5 minutes), and a beach with tons of activies you can't go wrong. We rarely saw them and never worried about them. The spa was great. Henna tattoos were awesome! Playa del Carmen town offered great places to eat and shop at when we wanted something new. Did I mention the beach? Beautiful and full of people from all over the world. (Some even topless, if you are in to that.) Never bothered anyone that wasn't. In conclusion, try it. Never felt "compelled" to tip, but did it anyway. Never felt compelled to speak Spanish, but wanted to because it was fun and non-threatening. They smiled and helped us to learn more.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kamtjm
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that what you get out of the trip is what you put into it. My husband and I have been to several all inclusive places from Mexico to the Dominican Republic and been on cruises too. We both had very high standards after staying and being married at the Secrets Excellence Resort in Punta Cana three years ago. (which I have heard that it is being sold and below average now) We upgraded to the Riu Palace Mexico a week before we left on the 30th of Sept. And I am so happy we did. Our trip was booked through Expedia and not one problem occurred. We arrived with the same great hospitality that others have mentioned. We asked for the upgrade that expedia had mentioned and received a beautiful room 2073 that overlooked the main fountain and gazebo area. Our tv didn't work properly and the shampoo/soap dispenser was leaking when we arrived. We walked down to tell the main desk and they both were fixed before we ever got back to our room (15 minutes at the most)! I have to say I am not sure what people are complaining about on the food. Everything was really good considering that you are at an all-inclusive resort. Of course the beds were hard but I have not stayed at an AI resort in Mexico that hasn't been. And the drinks were a bit watered down buth then again we were staying at an all inclusive resort. We were at the Iberostar Quetzal last year two days before the hurricane hit and I have to say the RPM was two steps above the IB. Granted the RPM did not have the "jungle" feel or the exotic animals running around but it was very upscale and beautiful. The pool is not as large/nice as I prefer but luckily the RPM was not crowded the week we were there. Now one thing that was quite humerous to the husband and I, is the nightly show of Grease. I am not sure if the performers had ever performed it in front of anyone. It was pretty bad. The other shows were decent. Again, very comparable to other All Inclusives we have been too. We did do an excursion to Cozumel through ScubaCaribe which is the dive shop at RPM. Cozumel was great for snorkeling that I did and also wonderful diving for my husband. Although he did say that he liked the dive shop better at IB Quetzal it was not a bad excursion at all. I had a couple of spa treatments that were great. Including a very romantic ocean harmony massage at sun down with my husband. Right there on the beach where the waves were splashing. Very nice! Anyway...I have to say we will return to the RPM and will most likely try out other RIUs.
