There are people selling necklaces and stuff on the beach. Unfortunately he caught us before we had done any shopping so the prices seemed ok, but later looking back it was steep. Plus one of them with a shark tooth on it broke, it was just super-glued on. All in all, the people were very nice although not always helpful. It was an experience and I can say I did it but next time I think I will spend my money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon...Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Aims77
Reviews.Content: First off, we arrived to the RIU on July 2, both of us were exhausted after a long day of flying, driving and having just been married the night before. When we arrived our bags were carried in for us, we went to the front desk and were greated with two wonderful bevarages. We were then handed our room key and headed down the long hallway to our room. I took note of the many reviews I had read on trip advisor, so I was able to compare my experience to others. I DID NOT notice a bit of mold anywhere in my room, I thoroughly inspected the couches because of the other reviews i had read, and saw NO MOLD!!! We had a junior suite and the balcony to just our room overlooked the fountain, and was HUGE!! After we settled in our room we headed down to the buffet, my one and only complaint is that my husband and I were not aware of the dress code and my husband was asked to change from shorts to pants JUST FOR DINNER which was a bit embarrassing, but after reading over the brochures we realized this was information we should have already known. The beach is beautiful, Never crowded, the pool was nice...never crowded we enjoyed the food at the mexican and italian restaurants during lunch. The beach was always empty after about 3:00 pm im not sure why, but we were virtually guarenteed an empty beach at around that time, which was so nice. We never got to partake in any of the restauraunts during the evening because we were gone on tours during the time of reservations, or just did not get up early enough, but we were okay with that. There was plenty of variety with each dinner and the the food was good, but you could always find something that was great. Each night was themed, they had seafood night, american night, mexican food night, italian food night, and Im sure there were others. The buffets were huge, always something to choose from, even at breakfast. Breakfast buffet was my favorite, so make sure you get up early to enjoy that. We enjoyed the bands each night, there was american and mexican music, some songs we even knew! I do recomend taking a cab to 5th street to do any shopping, that is where you can haggle and get a bargain. The staff is very friendly, and our room was always clean and we were always given fresh towels. We never got any towel art even after leaving the maid a $5 tip, so that was the last time we tipped the maid. All in all it was a wonderful resort and I do believe it is one of the best in the area. Remember you are in Mexico, so don't expect the ritz new york, but riu palace is better than I expected. It is absolutly beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “8th time - going on 9th!”
Reviews.Author: Machiavelli4
Reviews.Content: Says it all really. My wife and I have recently returned from our 8th visit to the Palace. We are a middle aged couple who have been fortunate enough to be able to see and stay in hotels all over the world, yet we always return to the Palace. The food is superb and we sometimes wonder where people who criticise it,eat. Whilst we are not gourmands we have high standards which the Palace always achieves. The service at all levels cannot be faulted; the staff are happy and hard working - they are one of the main factors for our return. There are plenty of sunbeds round the pool and beach - none of this getting up early to reserve them. The pool never seems crowded. There is room service for breakfast if you're feeling lazy! It really is the perfect place for a massive unwind - thats why we're off there in October .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort for Couples”
Reviews.Author: Deblen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from June 23 to July 7, 2006. It was two weeks of being pampered. The hotel is very well managed and it shows in how fantastic ALL the staff are at the resort. There are so many wonderful staff at the resort it would be hard to mention them all to say thanks. I would not recommend this hotel for singles or people with children of almost any age. There is not a children's program to speak of and the resort is just not set up for children. It is definitely set up for adults and couples. The clientele is more on the reserved side. If you want a more "happening" place I would suggest the Riu Yucatan which is next door to the Palace and also right on the beach. We have also stayed at the Riu Yucatan and it is a wonderful resort with more action and a fantastic children's program. They have a really good pool area with a few bars and an atmosphere that is just more enjoyable for people that are more active. When we were there a few years ago children and teenagers alike seemed to really be enjoying themselves. There are discos at the Yucatan and Tequila also. The reason why I say this is that many people are disappointed in this not being a happening type place. We loved it but we are a bit older and do not come with any children. There are six Riu hotels in the area and you can visit all of them. There is the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, Riu Palace Mexico, Riu Yucatan, Riu Playacar, Riu Tequila, and Riu Lupita. The Riu Palace Mexico sits beside the Riu Yucatan with the Riu Tequila across the interlocking brick road. Even though the Tequila is not on the beach it has great access to the beach and if you don't want to take the short walk across the street you can catch the cart that will take you across and drop you off at the beach. The Riu Playacar is just a very short walk (toward Playa del Carmen) away from the Riu Palace Mexico (one hotel is between them). Then you need to walk past about four more hotels from the Playacar to get to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. The Yucatan is on the opposite side of the Palace. You can also access (Yucatan, Palace Mexico, Playacar & Palace Riviera Maya) all the hotels from the beach or along the sidewalk . The Riu Lupita is a very long walk away (we walked it!) but it is not worth the effort. It is inland a fair bit and quite boring in my opinion. Playa del Carmen is about a 25 minute walk but you can always stop in at the Palace Riviera Maya for a bit of cool air and a drink and then continue along your way or you can take a taxi for $US5.00 each way. The food was very good. The buffet has a lot of variety. The ala carte restaurants are very good and not hard to book. If one wasn't available we just went to another. Remember...you are on vacation, don't sweat the little things and just enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: TripadviserUser
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace between 30th May and 13th June for our 25th wedding anniversary. As mentioned in other reviews found the rooms a little musty to start but didn't notice after that, definitely no mould. Rooms were spacious,clean and comfortable - even the beds which we found fine, although would prefer king size to 2 doubles pushed together. Felt service throughout the hotel was excellent from all staff we met, they were all friendly and polite. Enjoyed food at buffet very much and always loads to choose from, went to Brazilian, French and Steak House and found these very good also, good steak at French and steakhouse. Buffet was good as you could go when you wanted not having to be on a set mealtime. This is not a hotel to visit if you want entertainment as very low key in evenings although we picked for this reason. Very few children around, some babies and older teens but again it made for peaceful time around and in pool which suited us, as we were looking for a peaceful holiday together. Excellent service in Cubano bar and staff very friendly. Nice and cool too as very hot at outdoor bar even at night. Liked the fact that there is a small shopping area couple of hundred yards from hotel - nice to be able to walk out at night after dinner, unlike some other carribean places visited. Playa Del Carmen worth a visit with good shops, spent far too much on pressies to take home. Found we were in minority during 1st week being British (Welsh actually) and there were some very loud young Americans around but they had a short stay so bearable. We did meet some very nice people - american, canadian and british and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. All in all would love to come back to the Palace - looked at the other RIU hotels in Playacar and felt we had choosen the best of the bunch. Beach is beautiful and water is great, hotel very welcoming, attentive staff and great food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel2day
Reviews.Content: Anybody staying at the Riu Palace Mexico will not be disappointed! The resort is beautiful and the staff was extremely accommodating. We stayed in a junior suite that was very spacious and always kept clean. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. We were there for a wedding and I have never had more fun!! We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “If you have kids choose another RIU”
Reviews.Author: Yap'z
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds are very nice. We felt mislead thinking that they will be kids programs in the Riu Mexico hotel itself. It turns out that we have to go to other Riu's kids program. Although not far the heat made any 10 min walk feels like 1/2 hour. Plus you had to bring your own towel to the other RIU's. We couldn't even make the walk to Playa Del Carmen. (Guess we just aren't sun worshippers) So save your energy and just take a cab to town. Prices for things aren't cheaper in town either. Infact my daughter bought a beaded purse that was $2 cheaper at the Plaza Del Carmen (across fr RIu Playacar) That was after haggling the price fr 12 USD to 8 USD. At Plaza Del Carmen only 6 USD to begin with. Food - well .. you can only eat so much. It was jaw dropping the first time when you walk into the restaurant. Overall we found the main meals very salty. The desserts selection seems better at lunch than dinner and didn't quite meet my expectations in selections and quality. My older daughter cut her leg going up the steps fr the pool bar to the deeper water. The cut was deep so we asked for a first aid attendant only to find out there isn't one at all! So we had to order a doctor to visit u at our room. It cost 90USD for consultation. He told us she needed at least 2 or 3 stitches but he couldn't perform it at the room since it wasn't a sterile environment. So we asked to go to his office which he mentioned was at RIU Yucatan and he said it wasn't sterile there either and that we had to go to the hospital to get it done. Thank God it was our last day there so we opt not to stitch and saw our our family doctor first thing Mon morning. So buy your travel insurance especially when you have children. The hotel isn't build with child safety in mind. As nice as it was to have a sunken living room in the suite itself - my younger daughter fell down the steps onto to hard tile floor. I was sure she twisted her ankle but luckily she was fine. Oh yes if you are a non smoker be prepare to second hand smoke. The one week stay there we second hand smoke equivalent to 2 years worth. You smell cigarette smoke the minute you step into the lobby to register. Coming from Vancouver it was hard for us. We couldn't even sit down to enjoy any of the nite shows. Some patrons smoke their Cuban cigars without a care in the world right inside the theater. So all in all we did have some memorable moments especially with the picturesque beach and palm trees. Would I go back to RIU Mexico ? NO. Maybe another beach another hotel. We'll see. "I am still de-compressing"

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing, relaxing and fun vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: Turk196
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent the first week of June at the Riu Palace Mexico. First off, I will start by saying that if you don't have a great time at the Riu Palace, it is your own fault. This hotel was beautiful, the staff was amazing and we had the best, most relaxing and fun vacation ever. ROOMS: The rooms were very, very nice. You get what you pay for. We knew we weren't going to spend much time in the room, so we did not upgrade to an ocean view. We didn;t need it as we spent so much time at the beach. The rooms were spacious and clean, the bathroom was immaculate, the minibar was nice, and the staff always replenished the mini fridge every day with beer, water and soda. The only complaint I have is the bed situation. They put 2 queen beds together to make it a king bed. FOOD: The buffets were excellent, especially the breakfast buffet. You could eat for hours there. They had everything you could ever want for breakfast, and champagne too. The lunch buffets were standard lunch fare, and that was fine. The dinner buffets were great, and the food never ended. The specialty restaurants were pretty good. We went to the Japanese restaurant, which was nice, but we did not get enough food there. And it wasn't the best Japanese food. The Brazilian Steakhouse was top notch, I walked out very full. The only complaint I had was the reservation system, but we never had a problem getting a reservation and I couldn't think of a better, fairer way to handle the reservations. Just make sure you get on the reservation line by 8:15 if you want the Japanese restaurant. ENTERTAINMENT: The Animacion team was really great. Yes, some of the shows were cheesy, and actually, out of the 5 shows we saw, we only disliked one. There was usually a band playing at around 7:30pm , then the shows would start around 9:30. We saw a Michael Jackson show at the Yucatan and it was hilarious, and pretty good. POOL: I can't understand why I read so many negative reviews about the pool. The pool was beautiful, and clean and the pool bars were great, especially the swim up bar. If you want an olympic size swimming pool with diving boards, this is not the pool for you. If you want to cool off, relax, play water volleyball, have a drink and enjoy yourself, you'll love the pool. And never a problem getting a chair with shade either. Umbrellas are plentiful. STAFF: This was the best hotel staff ever. They went out of their way every minute we were there. The maids were great, the bartenders always topped off the drinks with an extra shot if you asked, the animacion team always tried to get people involved in events and games during the day. The beach party was a lot of fun. I never heard a no, or attitude. These people make peanuts but always had smiles on their faces and always made you feel like you were the only guests there. Tip them! BEACH: Saved the best for last. This beach was so beautiful, the sand was so nice, the palm trees were awesome. Never had trouble finding a chair, and we would move our chairs accordingly when the sun moved. We spent most of our days there, just relaxing and enjoying the water. The beach bar was great. They had a lot of beach sports, some included, some not. If you want to kayak or windsurf, you have to take a lesson, so don;t wait until the last day to do it like I did. Massages on the beach were a nice touch, and very reasonable. The only 2 times we spent money on this trip were the beach massages and parasailing. And tipping of course! You will have a great time at this hotel. The great thing is that you can use the other three Riu properties which surround the Palace (and they can't use the Palace). The Palace is very upscale, quiet and relaxing. If you want a more upbeat time, go to the Riu Yucatan next door, they were a lot of fun there and they also had a great pool. The Riu Tequila was good too, they had the nightclub for dancing and a sports bar, with pool tables and darts.They also had a fridge with snacks and sandwiches (free of charge) and is open 24 hours if you get that midnight craving. The lobby bar at the Palace also had snacks at night. You can have the best of both worlds in these hotels, depending on your mood. A vacation is what you make of it. Remember, you are not in the United States, so things are different, but you will have the best vacation ever here. We will be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Cancun - Not What was Expected.”
Reviews.Author: CRAustin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my b/f 26/7/06-30/7/06. I have stayed at the RIU Cancun before also. I expected after my stay at the previous RIU to love this place, especially since it was a "Palace" and supposed to be superior to the others. 1. Food was good/great in buffet's no complaints, was a pain as always with their musical buffet, sorry it's 10:30 go to breakfast by the beach Don Julian is closed. Never got a chance to try gourmet resturants as we got held up doing other things, even though we made the reservation twice for Sir Edwards. No problem making these reservations, no one in line went at 8:30 once and once at 9:30. 2. Resort itself clean and beautiful, except for rooms will get to that at the end. 3. Pool adequate, good service at pool bar, is pool at Tequila, Yucatan and the RIU Palace RM nicer - yes - but this was good enough and we spent one afternoon at the other Palace and it was much more happening with music and fun bartenders etc. 4. Beach was beautiful, beach bar was great, make it the way you want, also had drink service with pre-made drinks. Did Catamaran with a guide, They want you to take 4 lessons for 90 dollars total to take it out on your own for 1 hr a day. It cost us $30 to go with the guide and we were out there for about 1.5 hrs was worth it. They say Non-motorized is free, but believe me they try to get you to buy something, go on snorkeling excursion instead of beach. Also lots of people selling stuff on beach, prices ok, haggeled and bought a couple of bracelets. 5. Disco over at Tequila - great just like RIU Cancun and the bartenders work so hard! 6. Shows, too boring for me, but some might like it. Bands were good to sit and listen too. 7. Staff - not what I expected, as I mentioned went to RIU Cancun in Dec (just opened after Hurricane) and the staff was outstanding and so happy to see us and serve us. Some staff here was great, others should be fired(Joel you know who you are). Maids - great, Dining Staff-great, Front Desk-negative, Bartenders-varied. 8. Free transfers with holtel: only ones on bus up to resort, 3 families on way back - handled very well. 9. Other RIU resorts spent time at Tequila, Yucatan and RPRM, all seemed good and different. 10. Pharmacy at Yucatan is about 40% higher than the one across the street from the Palace in the Plaza and they have more selection over there. 11. Now for the BIG negative, and I rarely complain about anything and was expecting great things from this resort. THEY HAVE A SERIOUS MOLD PROBLEM! I am quite aware this is the jungle and it's humid etc, etc. 1st room terrible mold moved and tipped an extra $20 to get a 2nd room with a BIGGER problem. The mold was so bad, the pillows were black with it, in the closet, in the shower, on the curtains in the room. Air conditioner broke and thought after this was fixed it would go away it did not - it got worse. The smell was unbearable by the last night and I was sick (visit to the pharmacy for a Z-pack). I know this mold made me sick, kept me up for 2 nights. It was so bad when I opened my suit case after getting home - everything smelled from being in that room - had to wash it all. I went and showed them the pillow and covers at the front desk (since I had came down earlier to try and talk about it and they didn't care) and Joel was extremely rude to me, as I stood there with my fever and bronchitis - shooed me away telling me Senioria go home, you are free to go. I don't know where he came from, but he should take a lesson from the majority of his hispanic co-workers on customer service. He then accused me of making phone calls that were never made and trying to charge me for them. I tried to explain the room change, but again he wouldn't listen to a word I was saying and kept rudely telling me to leave. Unreal - I will never stay here again due to the mold and the rude staff. I guess he didn't appreciate me bringing the problem to him in the Lobby.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful but a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: steelers77
Reviews.Content: My mother and two sisters and I stayed at the hotel at the end of July. I agree with a lot of what other people have said, rooms were great (bed is firm), maid service was just o.k. She would forget to bring wash cloths and left dirty sheets one time. The food was pretty good (no comparison to food you receive on cruises). We enjoyed Sir Edward and the Buffet. The Brazillian was good, but the waiter served six types of meat, too much meat for our liking, so we sampled. Making reservations was an inconvenience. We tried to do this before breakfast. The waiter/ress service was fantastic. They were extremly hardworking and friendly. The drinks were watered down. Unless you got them from the pol bar (some of them were even too strong). They only have Corona, which I didn't think it would matter, but it did after the third day. Bringing a thermos were a geat tip! After dinner we would sit outside in the open patio and listen to a band. It was practically the same music each night. The shows were cheesy, but it was entertainment. After the band stopped playing (around 11:00), everyone seemed to go in. We would hang out at the Cubana bar near the lobby. Quiet atmosphere, but there was nothing else to do. As other people have stated, go to another hotel if this is a priority. Pool was great, it is sectioned off so that you can go to a quieter side. It was unfortunate that kids hung out near the pool bar since that seemed to be where their parents were. No problem finding chairs. The beach is one of the largest at a resort. No umbrellas, didn't see any waiters. However, there is a bar that is opened (until about 5:00-6:00ish). Someone mentioned that they were unable to change their money back into American money. They have a bank in the Plaza Playcar (which is across the street). You are able to get pesos from the ATM and exchange money at the bank. Shopping: Be aware that the items they have at the hotel in the evening are COMPLETELY overpriced!!! I saw a wall hanging (of The Last Supper) for about $40-$50. I saw it at the Cancun Airport for $12.99! Shopping at 5th Ave was fun, again, watch the jewlery stores. Bring a small umbrella with you, one minute it is beautiful, the next it is could be pouring. Speaking of shopping, if you want to buy cheap alcohol, wait till you get to the airport. Their duty free shop near the gates were much cheaper than they were in town. In case you need medicine, there is a pharmacy in the plaza (and at the RIU Tucan). I would bring Immodium! Concerning excursions: Be prepared that you have to pick up and drop off people at other hotels. We went on three excursions, and it took about an hour from picking us up to getting us to our destination. I don't know if there is a way you can pay for the excursion and not the transportation, and just get a cab...but it would be worth it!!! Major disappointments of the hotel: Our tiolet overflowed around 9:30 pm. We called the front desk. No one showed up until midnight (and after a few more calls)!!! No maid service showed up to clean the floor that evening. In the morning, we woke up to a running tiolet. The entire bathroom was flooded and ran into the hallway. I went to the front desk. They could not change our rooms since none were available. Within 10 min it was fixed. We had to wait about a half an hour to get into the bathroom for the bathroom to be sanitized. Second disappointment: When we were about to check out, we had to pay a doctors bill. We wanted to pay by cedit card. The man at the front desk said that their lines were down and the machine was not working. He told us that we had to pay cash. My mother used all of the rest of her cash that she had in her pocket. After she paid the bill, we asked what would he have done if she didn't have the cash. He stated that he would have given her a voucher. Then he changed his story and said that he didn't have any vouchers when my mother wanted a voucher instead of her not having any cash on the way home. This was unethical. A lot of the places down there prefer you to pay cash...but this was uncalled for. Riu Palac Mexico was the classiest RIU hotel. We enjoyed our stay and had a wonderful trip. But we will not be going back on count of the insincerity of their service on what really matters.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but please NO SURVEYS at dinner...”
Reviews.Author: teddyz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at RIU Palace Mexico for 4 nights. RIU was a nice resort with beautiful grounds. Staff were very helpful; Leonardo at the front desk was so kind!! Food was mediocre. Do not recommend any of the restaurants, stick to the nightly buffet. On the last night of our stay, guests were handed a survey at dinner,asked to complete and slip into a box afterwards. We made the mistake of completing the survey during dinner and around staff. Unbeknownst to us, service staff were watching our every mark and comments on the survey. We were rudely and inappropriately confronted by staff members asking about our marks, i.e. why we marked a "good" box and not the "excellent" box. We were appalled at their boldness and presuming attitidues. RIU needs to change the practice of asking patrons to complete surveys during dinner and in the plain site of staff - highly suggest to move to an online survey system- and RIU needs to further discuss with staff the inappropriateness of confronting patrons, during dinner, to question their surveys. Management issued an apology which lessened the pain of the event but it still left us with a "bad taste in our mouth" ..or maybe that was the food. Other than that, the stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Go!! Your hings Will Get Stolen!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovemymisu
Reviews.Content: I am writing in regard to my stay at the Riu Palace Mexico from May 6, 2006 to May 9, 2006. My husband and I stayed in an adequate room; but unfortunately, on May 7th a Nikon 5600 Coolpix digital camera and two braceletts were stolen from our room. My husband and I had unpacked on the 6th of May, and the camera was in our carry-on bag. The camera is valued with the case, battery charger, and our extended warranty at $500. This unfortunately is not covered under our renter's insurance, so this is quite a loss for us. It also had pictures from our honeymoon, and other sentimental pictures, which is very upsetting. The camera was setting above the mini fridge in our room, and we noticed it was missing when we wanted to take it to Playa del Carmen the evening of May 7th, 2006. The braceletts were a secondary loss, however, I was so distracted by the camera being missing, that I did not notice the braceletts were missing until May 8th. I suppose they could have been missing on the 7th as well. The braceletts were left by the sink in the bathroom. My husband made a report at the front desk, however, the person he spoke to said that he would check with the maids to see if they knew anything. That to me was an unacceptable response, since they or whoever turned down the beds at night were the likely culprits. Although the items stolen was a misfortune, I felt the way Riu Palace Mexico handled it very poorly. I emailed them on 5/10, 5/15, 5/16, 5/21, 5/22, 6/30 and 7/26 all of 2006. The person who was supposed to respond to me never did. In late July, I did receive a blanket email, stating that I never made a report at the hotel, which is a lie (I did file a complaint), and they also said they were not responsible. So, basically no compensation! I want to make those who may be traveling to Mexico aware, PLEASE do not go to Riu Palace Mexico in Playa del Carmen. Although the hotel itself is okay, many of the workers have sticky fingers!!! And, after they steal from you, and the resort has your money, no one will help you after that :( Christy

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace-Awesome Vacation, highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Aristah23
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Riu Palace Mexico. I can't say enough about this resort. The service was superior (this is coming from a finicky traveler). The grounds were immaculate and the resort was quite clean. The food was good (not excellent). I highly recommend La Bodega (Brazilian rodizio). The food was great there. The Japanese restaurant wasn't so great (not worth going to). Don Julian (buffet) was awesome! The breakfast buffet was the best! I didn't have a chance to get to the the Italian restaurant or the steakhouse (both restaurants were outdoors)--too hot! The drinks at the pool and beach weren't very strong while the lobby bar drinks were super strong. The staff was very attentive at the all the bars. The rooms were spacious and clean and we even had towel animals on our beds (see pic). There were only a few things that I really didn't like about the resort: First and foremost, the BEDS! Unless you like a super firm mattress, you aren't going to get much sleep. Also, you are given an actual room key for your room (no cards) and the room # in on the keychain. Um..hello? If someone found your room key, they would know exactly where to go to clean you out! Speaking of keys, you are given your room safe lock and key upon check-in. You actually put the lock into the safe door in your room (kinda out of date?). Finally, restaurant reservations...you need to get in line at 8am to get a reservation at all the restaurants (except the buffet). The line stretched throughout the room to make a reservation! Not only that, you need to make a reservation every day! You can't make all your reservations for the week at the same time. I am sure there is a better system to do this! Overall, I highly recommend this resort. I've been to many all-inclusive resorts, and I have to say that the Riu definitely ranks at the top. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility, but service needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: S7
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week in Riu Palace Mexico a week ago. We had a very good time overall. Here is my review of the Riu Palace Mexico. Resort - Excellent, well maintained. Rooms - Good air cond. clean, maintained 2 times a day. TV was a bit small, but who watch TV anyway. Food - Buffet was excellent, qaulity was certainly above the average. Too bad we just came back from Vegas a few weeks ago and was spoiled from the great food in Vegas. But comparing to other resorts in the area, I think it is very good. Only complaint may be too much similiarity between days. The speciality restaurants were very poor. A friend that we met at the resort got sick after having dinner in one of these restaurants. Drinks - Excellent! name branded drinks. Beer and pops in bottles. I especially enjoyed the coffee with Baileys after dinner. Entertainment - I hated it. They keep having Mr. Riu and Mrs Riu contest all the time. I was hoping to get entertained, not to entertain others. Pool - Small, but you can always walk over to the other Riu resorts. Beach - Beautiful. Service - Poor. Besides the general lack of smiles, I did encounter the following small issues: 1. Everyday, just before 8AM, the cleaning staff were having a party to talk about their life time stories in the hallway outside of my room. 2. For 2 days, there was nobody at the front door to call a taxi for us. No big deal, but this is not what I expected from a 5+ star resort. 3. One morning, I only get my first cup of coffee after ordering it 3 times. Overall, I would still give RIU in other locations a try, as we found Riu Palace in Cancun was very nice. Steve

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: kail2
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I stayed at the Rui Palace for our honeymoon last week. I am cynical by nature, but I was exceptionally impressed with our stay. Everyone keeps talking about how well kept the hotel is and they are completely correct, my hats off to the management and staff. We eat at two of the restaraunts( Sir Edwards and El Patio) both were very good. The Hotel is gorgious at night and dinners were very good either w/ the restaraunts or the buffet. We were a little surprised by how may kids and teens were there, but they were not loud or crazy- they were fine. The shows were not terrific, but the theatre is very small. We actually went to some of the shows next door that were a little nicer. Rooms were very nice- I little bit dated, but not bad at all. Everyone is correct, very hard beds. I like a firm mattress, but even with a mattress pad- very hard. Overall the hotel is beautiful. Any and all tours that you may want to do is available every morning in the lobby (we did too many to recommend). Playa del Carmen is nice, a bit touristy for my tastes. An absolute MUST DO in playa is have dinner, or at least drinks, at ALUX- beyond exceptional (If you enjoy having a great candlelite dinner inside an amazing cave with live music)! Anyway I would recommend this hotel to anyone in a heartbeat. We had a wonderful time. You would have to be a VERY uptight person to not like this resort. I hope that this review has helped. Feel free to see the pictures that we posted.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace Mexico Delivers!”
Reviews.Author: ShaneAndLisa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned last Saturday, July 15 from a six-night, seven-day stay at the RIU Palace Mexico - a trip booked through Apple Vacations with about four weeks notice. We had an EXCELLENT time! This was our first all-inclusive experience after visiting Playa del Carmen three times previous in the past five years, and it was an outstanding experience. The goal of this trip was total relaxation, lots of great beach and sun, and a little pampering. The RIU Palace delivered on all counts. Let me see if I can address the kinds of things people reading Trip Advisor for this hotel likely are looking for. At minimum, here are the things I was looking for when I was reading these same posts...hopefully they'll be helpful to you as well. My guess is that either you're considering booking here, or you already have and now you're reading as much as you can to prepare and get excited, and to set your mind at ease about the decision you've recently made. WEATHER: Excellent. Seven days there, it only rained one day for half the day, beginning at 8 a.m. and lasting until about 3 p.m. For us, it was a blessing, as we'd had two full days of sun at that point and were a little lobstery anyway. Rest of the time, sun sun sun and temps hovering in the upper 80s (F) to lower 90s. BEACH: The RIU Palace Mexico may have one of the best sections of beach in the entire Playa area. Not only is the water excellent this time of season, but the beach itself is wide, clean, free of rocks and seaweed, and crystal clear blue. Like a post card, only better, because you're in it. You want sun...great! Use the many deck chairs on the front section of beach that are completely exposed. Want sun and shade interchangably, stay 75 meters or so back from the water's edge on one of the many beach chairs set amidst the many palm trees that offer plenty of shade. Drinks - alcoholic and non - are avaible at a little beach bar, and occasionally, staff will bring out trays of drinks for you to enjoy. CLEANLINESS OF HOTEL: Beyond being eco-friendly by using products like vinegar to clean floors, the place is impeccably clean. The staff seem to work non-stop to keep the place clean. We walked by an open room door one morning to see one of the cleaning crew on her hands and knees hand-scrubbing the floor of a guest's room! Towels are brought to you in the evening as well as being replenished in the morning when the room is cleaned. Our room was top floor, and had no musty smell or mildew. Common areas of the hotel are immaculate. STAFF: Friendly, attentive, not in your face and seemingly excited to serve you! Unless you are one of those brash, loud, mouthy American-types (I'm American, I know who you are and so do you) who is spoiled rotten and just can't be quiet and enjoy some time in serenity, you're going to be treated wonderfully. WHO'S STAYING HERE? / MIX OF CULTURES: Less Europeans in general and more Americans in general than other places we've stayed...my guess is that it has something to do with the all-inclusive nature. That said, this was not some loud, overbearing Cancun experience AT ALL. People in general here were a bit more sophisticated than the average traveler in all the right ways. There are definitely families here, though not predominantly. And the kids and young adults staying at this place, at least while we were there, have learned their manners and know how to have fun without being a slow, simmering psychological drain on their neighbors. ENTERTAINMENT: This is not Vegas or Broadway...you've been warned. We saw a slightly creepy "Michael Jackson" show that was complete with dancers and coreograhpy and a guy that was a dead ringer for the King of Pop. Billy Jean is not my lover, indeed. For an even creepier time, try the other RIU Palace floor show, which one evening featured kids from the resort singing a song that translated English words into Spanish words, and was led by a guy dressed from the set of Grease the muscial, a cowboy, a guy in very stereotyped authentic Mexican wear, a clown and a guy in a Batman costume. This ensemble, if you can call it that, takes us deeply into a relm most of us seldom wish to willingly travel, and they do it without the benefit of context. The fact that it didn't make any sense whatsoever was such an all-encompassing focal point for my brain as I watched it unfold that I was left paralyzed in my seat and unable to escape its pull. Perhaps it's Mexican culture's obsession with the variety show that refracted this particular Tour de Force...whatever it was, it left both of us scarred. HOW'S THE FOOD? Outstanding for a largely buffet-driven experience. There is no way to possibly experience all that is to offer, and attempting to do so could easily result is some less-than-intelligent food pairing decisions you'll pay for later on. No matter how much your eyes tell you the mango yogurt with granola will be fine to eat along side three different types of Danishes, a stack of pancackes, two different sausage varieties, a brick of bleu cheese and a green drink, PACE YOURSELF. You have several days...no need to do it all each day. We only ate once not at the evening buffet, and it was the Brazilian place. While good, it simply doesn't compare to the convenience of the buffet and it's overall quality. You also should venture into town one night...don't forget...Playa's got some GREAT restaurants. OVERALL: Outstanding. We will do it again, next time with a baby that is well-mannered :)

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home !”
Reviews.Author: dtss
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at the Riu Palace Mexico ( we stayed there twice in 2003). The hotel hasn't changed a bit since it opened. The property itself is still well kept, neatly manicured and exquisitely maintained. Most of the staff hasn't changed too much and we recognized many of our favorite people from our last visit. We also had the pleasure of meeting the hotel director and the PR managers during our stay. Our only concern was the reservation system. You had to line up most mornings before 8:30 a.m. in order to get reservations for the following day to the a la carte restaurants. On most days there were at least 100 people in line. We don't like to waste precious beach time in lines. The rooms were the same as we remembered. We had a courtyard and partial sea view room in the first building. The chambermaid was great and worked so hard each day to make sure the room was kept spotless. We made sure not to overlook the staff's hard work and made certain to tip the waiters, bartenders and room cleaning staff frequently. All in all a wonderful trip to a wonderful hotel. We did pay a visit to the new Riu Palace Riviera Maya just 10 minutes away from our hotel. It is a beautiful new property situated a bit closer to the town of Playa Del Carmen's shopping district. The hotel seemed larger but we did not care for the beach area. There is a breakwall at the edge of the hotel and a very narrow beach. Our hotel has one of the nicest beaches in the area so if you are a beach person you may want to check this out before booking the other Riu. The only thing that made me a bit jealous was their gym facility. The Riu Palace Mexico has there original gym ( the hotel opened in 1999). The wear and tear on the equipment has resulted in one barely working treadmill and two stationary bikes. There are free weights and other weight equipment but it needs a complete overhaul. The gym at the new Riu Palace Riviera Maya is gorgeous. Their equipment is state-of-the-art and the gym itself is beautifully designed. When I spoke to the Hotel Director she explained that within the next year they should be doing a renovation and getting some new equipment for the gym. It is simply too small and out of date to handle the capacity of the hotel. If you are looking for a first class holiday experience you can't go wrong with the Palace. We intend to go back for the 4th time within the next year or two.

Reviews.Title: “Rest/Romance at Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned from our stay at the Riu Palace Mexico yesterday. We stayed for 5 nights. It was just wonderful. Upon check-in, we were greeted with great hospitality. I told the gentleman that my husband and I were here to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary and he upgraded our room from a Jr. Suite to a Suite. We immediately asked for a matress pad, yes the beds are very hard without them, and that made the bed much more comfortable. I have never seen such hard working staff before! There was no time we had to ask for a thing. They were all very friendly, attentive, and were always striving to please everyone. I was very impressed with how well eveyone communicated with all of the guest. The food was great. There was such a variety of different foods that everyone should be very satisfied. The beach was beatiful. We did not have any problem finding a lounge chair at any time. The pool was quiet sufficient. I guess if you were a big swimming pool fan you might have a problem but we were there more for the beach anyway. We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: skinny74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned yesterday from a quick 4 day trip to the Riu Palace Mexico. We had a great time with exceptional weather with only a few sprinkles of rain one morning. It did not feel as hot as I expected it to but it could be due to the wonderful breeze from the ocean. The resort is really beautiful and the food is very good. We had a room on the first floor facing the resort next door. Since we weren't in the room that much, the view really didn't matter. I had a birthday while there and my husband asked for a few special things in the room. I found ballons, towel art which included a cake and swans with real flowers, fruit, and a small bottle of tequila, a very nice touch I thought. The staff was very friendly and always busy cleaning and keeping things neat. We had turn down service two of the three night with fresh towels twice a day. The beach was beautiful, I could sit there for hours and just watch all of the activities going on around me. I have to agree with other reviews that the pool is nothing spectacular but we still enjoyed the time we were using it. We ate at Sir Edwards and the Steak House for dinner and thought both were pretty good. We did the buffet at breakfast, lunch and one night at dinner and we thought it was also very good. Since we arrived at the resort at noon it was too late to make reservations for an a la carte for dinner so that is the night we ate in the buffet. My husband had a nice shirt and shorts on and was asked to change into pants which I thought would not be required for dinner at the buffet but I was wrong. No big deal, however, we did see several men at the Steakhouse in shorts one evening which I thought was odd but it could be due to that restaurant being on the beach and not air conditioned. We had a great time and would recommend staying at this resort. Please e-mail me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “great riu palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the riu palace mexico food was great, beach very nice (nicest on the strip), service impecable. The food was very good and although a bit repetetive still was very tasty. Highly reccomend this resort it has great value for the buck. Beds are hard but ask for a mattress cover it will feel much better. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace - awesome”
Reviews.Author: wardog
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that I have been to Mexico many times as well as the Bahamas and Punta Cana!! Have stayed at Iberostars, Oasis, Premier and now RIU. This place is wonderful. I see so many people not tipping and it is disgusting- I am not saying that you have to tip, but when someone goes way above the norm then a tip is good - well everyone at the RIU does just that. Armando, Montejo and many more. I would definately return here (I have never stayed at same place twice!) The food was good, beach was great, I was so tired that we often went to bed before entertainment, but we would get up at 4 am and walk around, bar was open, have drink walk on the beach, eat at 7 am sunbathe and it was the most relaxing trip that I have ever been on!! We used to go to Vegas 3 or 4 times a year- no more because you don't get refreshed- when I returned home from the RIU, I felt like a new person - that is what vacations are supposed to be for right? Anyway, no disappointments here. Oh yeah the only thing is that I am a non-smoker, so go figure, it seemed like a lot of smokers - I would like to get rid of them, but what can you do?

Reviews.Title: “Money Changing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Changing £Sterling into $Pesos was no problem at all but at the end of the holiday (which was brilliant, I should add) there was NO facility at the hotel for changing $Pesos back into £Sterling - they just DID NOT WANT TO KNOW !!!! We were told to change it at the airport - and these are rip-off joints anyway ! Black mark for the Riu Palace Mexico in this respect but full marks in everything else....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 wonderful days at the RIU Palace Mexico. Unfortunately, our vacation started at the Grand Coco Bay Resort (which was a complete disaster) and after asking to be moved, we found ourselves at the RIU Palace. It was absolutely perfect. Every staff member that we came across was friendly and helpful in every way that they could be. The buffet food was great, and we also had dinner at the Japanese restaurant and also the French restaurant. Both were terrific. The pool was always clean, and the beach was very well kept. I would definately recommend this resort to anyone who will be traveling to Playa del Carmen. We will definately be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: jdcross81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from June 19th - 26th for our honeymoon. Never been to Mexico before, we heavily relied on Tripadvisor when planning this trip. We were not disappointed in the slightest! As pretty much all the reviews state, the grounds are absolutely georgeous, the staff is excellent, and the beach is the best. The food is also excellent. We ate at 2 a la carte restaurants - the steakhouse "El Patio", and the gourmet restaurant "Sir Edward". The steakhouse was really good, but Sir Edward is at the top of my list! However, with that said, we were completely satisfied with the buffet. More food on it than you could ever ask for; even for extremely picky eaters. Did not find the pool small. If you are looking for a more relaxed swim, stay away from the bar side. Its a little crazier over there. The volleyball net is also on that side of the pool, so it can get crowded fast. Cannot wait to visit the Playacar area again real soon. As much as we loved the Riu Palace Mexico, and would recommend it to everyone we know, we probably won't stay there for our next trip, as we would like to go somewhere we have never been before. If you are considering staying here, don't hesistate! You won't be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful! The people there are so nice! Everyone from the door man to the waiters. Everyone has a smile on their face and are always helpful. We stayed for 5 days and I enjoyed every minute of it. The rooms are very nice. It has a big bathroom, step down into the living area with couch and tv, two large beds. Balconies with beautiful views. Has swim up bar, banana mama sin alcohol was my favorite. They have free activities everyday that you can do, such as volleyball, the volleyball instructer was amazing, Miguel is the best. There are several water sports to do. This is a great vacation for the young and old. I loved it and I can't wait to return. The hotel, food, people are excellent!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It was so Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We vacationed at many resorts, but this is now our favorite one yet! We decided on this hotel when picking our honeymoon. There is not one bad thing I can say about this hotel. To tell you all the positives, the customer service was excellent, everyone working the hotel always had a smile on their faces. Beach was beautiful, so many chairs, there were more than enough chairs. The bartenders were all so genorous with the alcohol, never at any point did I have a weak drink. Moy was such a sweetie, he was our bartender at the poolbar everyday. Hello Moy! Maid service our room was always clean with towel animals to greet us when we came back from the beach. Ever meal there was always something of your liking. I am a picky eater trust me, my new husband who I absolutely adore will tell you how picky I am, I had no problem in finding something I like. I will have to say Sir Edwards has the best steak, both my husband and I loved it. It was so tender. But the buffets were also good. They have a theme everynight. Presentation of the food was like as if you were eating at a five star restaurant. Servers at all the restaurants and buffet they were always on the ball. When you had a half full drink they were bringing you another one. Entertainment at night was good. One night that we were there they put on a Grease show it was really good and another night they had this competition, they picked four men from the audience and my husband was one of the picks, they had to compete to become MR.RIU and my husband was MR.RIU for the week and there were servers and audience members that remember him throughout the week and would greet him as MR.RIU which is kinda funny. So as you can tell my husband and I had a wonderful honeymoon. Can not wait to return, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon & The RIU”
Reviews.Author: stunnin
Reviews.Content: Summary : We choose this resort for our honeymoon. We are a active younger couple in our mid-late twenties. We were looking for an upscale location that wasn't adults only, yet had minimal children. Overall, the resort was very nice & up to our expectations. The atmosphere was very elegant & more upscale than other hotels. The landscaping, the grounds, the lobby, the courtyard, the fountains, etc - was always being tended to by staff members who would great you with "hola" or Buenos Dias". The hotel is 1 of 4 ( 5 total - one 10 mins down the road. ) RIU properties right next door to each other which made it easy for side / day trips to the other RIU resorts. Airport: No issues to speak of, in & out of customs in 15 mins or less. I would definitely recommend flying on MON-THU as the airports were a breeze. We heard several complaints about some people waiting 1 - 3 + hours for check in / customs on the weekends. Front Desk: We were greeted with a drink and welcomed with courtesy & professionalism. This was our honeymoon & I was a little surprised that the front desk made no mention of the occasion after reading over our package / itinerary. Rooms: Good & adequate, nothing to fancy but nice. . The room we were originally given was 1014 & no welcome / honeymoon package was there upon my wife & I's entrance. She was a little disappointed as was I. The view was facing the walkway of the RIU next-door & although OK, not appealing. We grabbed a couple beers out of the cooler, turned up the AC & headed down to the pool, beach & to explore. We returned a couple hours later to find the room still warm, the AC didn’t work… I returned to the front desk, explained the situation & they stated no rooms were available, to come back tomorrow. I also advised that this was our honeymoon & there was no welcome/honeymoon package. I tipped the man a $20.00 and said I would be back tomorrow afternoon & would appreciate any assistance. I returned the following day, the gentleman I was working with was gone but did make mention to the shift manager who transferred us to a courtyard facing room, #3260 & I tipped the manager a $20 as well. No honeymoon package in this room either, and none ever showed up. MiniBar: Not all its cracked up to be. The fridge filled with cold coronas, water & sodas gets an A in my book, but the 4 bottles which people seem to rave about is not all it's cracked up to be. Ice is a commodity in Mexico & there were no working Ice Machines - a 90 degree rum & coke or hot shot of tequila doesn't work so well. It would have been great if you could make a cold mixed drink in the room, but we would just head down to the bar. Maid Service: Was very good, almost too good. There were times people would check on the room 4 or 5 times during the day, even as late as 8 in the evening - knocking & opening. HINT : use the do not disturb sign - LOL ;) . We tipped the made 1/2 a day & she made several towel animals during our stay. Pool: The entire place was beautiful & the pool was nice but it just didn't compare with the grand scale of the resort. Although not massive in size, there were ALWAYS chairs available, no matter what time of the AM or PM. The pool served it's purpose but just didn't appear on the same level as the upscale resort. Beach: Amazing, just like all the others say, it is huge & again you never ever had an issue getting a chair / lounger. The beach on the other hand was very nice and impressive. The soft sand, azul waters and slight summer breeze is something we will never forget and reminiss about today. Very Impressive overall. Food: We tried all the restaurants including specialty / reservation ones. At first I would wake up early every AM, wait in line with about a 100 others & even with a long line first thing in the AM we were usually out in 10 mins. Near the end of the trip I just strolled in casually at 9:30 or close to 10 & never had an issue getting a table. . Our favorite was Myagi's for the setting & food. The ice carvings, the melon carvings, the selection was expansive. The food was good, not great but the selection was definitely there. I never thought I would get tired of the food, the quality was good, service great but by the 7th day it did get a bit repetitive. The service was impeccable however, on the spot, some of the best I've had. We tipped 5.00 at the specialty restaurants. Drinks: As others suggested we brought mugs, a MUST. It is warm / humid so nothing is super cold or stays cold for to long. The bartenders were all friendly and very laidback. If you wanted more alcohol, simply ask. I would also recommend calling out your liquors ( absolute, Smirnoff, etc ) if you want them or they use the house brand. We brought plenty of ones & would tip most of the day. Atmosphere: Again elegant, overall a beautiful resort with an adult feel. Lots of different cultures & people from all over the globe, Asian, Canadian, American, with a large percentage of European's. There was little to no language barrier with staff & guests alike, everyone was in an upbeat mood which made it very pleasant. Nights could be spent in the courtyard listening to music or relaxing. IT was a very quiet place at night, not a lot to do, but you were only a 5.00 cab ride to downtown or a walk across the street to the disco ( hit n miss but FUN ). Downtown: Was very cool, lots of shops, vendors, etc… Much busier on Fri / Sat / Sun nights at the dance club / hot spots like Blue Parrot & Senor Frogs. We had a blast & the Swing bars & met some very cool bartenders, locals & others on vacation just like us. The RIU Palace Mexico is a very elegant / upscale hotel & a very nice place to stay on a honeymoon or vacation. Overall it was a great place and we would definitely stay here again. Will we ONLY stay here again, no. Although we were thoroughly impressed with the hotel I am still eager to see what else Playa & other RIU locations have to offer. The RIU chain did impress us & we will be looking at staying with them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Yup, It's Great (And That's From a Cynical New Yorker!)”
Reviews.Author: NYDJGuy
Reviews.Content: To put it quite simply, this one was of the best hotels we've stayed at (my girlfriend agrees) any price level (were talking Motel 6 up through the Four Seasons). The service was just about perfect - immediately when we sat down at dinner, the pool, the beach, the nighttime shows, we were offered drinks. The grounds were immaculate; I've never seen grass cut that perfectly (the grounds were always being attended to and we never even heard them working on it). The attitude of the staff at the Riu Palace is: "What can I do for you?" which is how it should be when you go on vacation. They even didn't try to rip you off for Internet acceess! But of course, nobody or thing is completely perfect, and being fussy New Yorkers, we did notice a few things that could make this hotel even better: 1) Room Keys - Not only are they actual keys (not computer key cards), they have the room numbers printed right on them. Now you maybe saying, "quit your complaining!" but this is a pretty serious security issue. The key is basically saying: "Hi, if you've found me, my guests are at the beach, so feel free to come rob us!" I haven't seen keys like this since the Reagan Era, so they should be updated, or at least take the room numbers off! 2) The Food - The Don Julian (main buffet) had an excellent selection and the food quality was good. Yes, we were paranoid about eating the fruits and vegetables at first, but we gave in and we were okay. The Riu claims to wash this stuff in purified water, and here we are 2 weeks later, alive and well. As for the Speciality restaurants, they were fair at best (I know, I know, the New York foodie-wannabes maybe a little critical). But the Steakhouse steak quality was barely Applebee's, and the "fancy" place -- I think it was "Gourmet" was "eh." Again, these comments are just for the food, the service was excelllent at both places. We didn't try the Japanese (there was no way we thought the sushi would cut it) or the Brazilian. And again, I'm not comparing these restaurants to Peter Luger's or Le Bernadin, etc. I'm comparing them to the Don Julian buffet, and they were not as good. 3) Nighttime Entertainment - One nice touch at the Riu: you can hop on over to any other Riu property in the area. So after the night shows (kinda cheesy -- yes, one night they had couples popping balloons on each other ---but you can't expect Broadway), you could go over to the Riu Tequila (right across the street), where there's a sports bar and a club complete with 90's dance favorites. I know the Riu Palace is supposed to be more upscale, and not as "partyish," but it would be nice to have something to do after the show. They had some good bands playing, but they were doing so as the show was going on, which made no sense. So you would come out of the show say about 10:45pm, the band would play 2 sounds, and then pack it in. Huh?!?! Start the band AFTER the show ends, and play 'til about 12am. 4) Beach and "Umbrella, umbrella!" - Yes, the beach is a little crowded and not too wide, but it was very well maintained, despite seeing lots of cups, and papers left at the end of the day (what's wrong with people?). There were no issues getting a lounge chair, but I think they should have umbrellas for pasty types (like myself) who like to sit in the sun for one day, and then hide because he is burned, even while wearing 45! Sorry, I digress. So yea, beach umbrellas (like they have at the pool) would be nice. And that's really it for the nitpicks. Great place, great service at a very reasonable price. I asked the staff if this Riu was just exceptional because it was a higher end Riu, and they assured me that all the Rius have this level of service. If that's the case, we'll definitely consider others!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace was above expectations!”
Reviews.Author: pinkpurplejohn
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here from 11-23 June and had an amazing vacation. I also studied this website before we departed, but words cannot describe just how beautiful and well kept the grounds of the Riu Palace are kept. FOOD-Great choice, nice feature each night at the buffet. What you could actually have for breakfast was amazing, fruit, vegetables, meat, beans, champagne! OK well it's not actually champagne but the sparkling wine is not bad. As for the evening meals, the speciality restaurants are a great touch, and yes you do have to book in advance in the morning, but generally if you're there for around 9-9:30 you'll get a reservation, unless of course you have a party of 8 which you may have to que when bookings start at 8:30. What's the harm in that? You're in beautiful mexico, who want's to stay in their rooms and sleep?!? ROOM-Good not great decor, spacious, clean, the maids came twice a day and our minibar was filled daily. Always supplied with clean towells when needed. Beds were really not too hard, def not that you would have noticed if you had not read all the reviews that stated that. Upon arrival I requested a room on the 2nd floor, and we had 2056, which had a great view of the ocean, pool and also could see the court yard but essentially overlooked the fountains - perfect! Def no mould to be found, must have been some unlucky people but I couldn't find a single dot! SERVICE-Fantastic I found the Mexican staff couldn't help me enough, so warm and welcoming which is strange to begin with as you get the feeling this is for tips, but soon learn that this is their nature, we saved tipping until the end of our stay which was greatly appreciated! The service here was better than i have ever received, and one of the hotels trademarks, keeping the palace at the top of its game! ENTERTAINMENT-Again better than expected, pretty much slammed by previous reviews, but I found it to be enjoyable, varied and really got the crowd going. If you dont like it here then visit one of the other Riu hotels on the complex where their will be something to suit everyone from live music, dance shows, disco, or fun and games on stage with the hotel guests. The 'nightclub' disco at the Riu Tequila was a great place to go if you still wanted to dance after hours, although it does have a strange smell and I'd stick to drinks from the hotel bars as this was the only place I found them to be watered down...even the shots! The Sports bar at the Tequilia was definately another high point of our holiday what with the world cup and NBA finals on, it was quite full most of the time, but the service here is amazing, you can also grab snacks and they have internet connection (and the best air con) Ok now the rest.....The beach was beautiful, there is shade, not alot no, but who goes to the beach to hide away in the shade! There are always hammocks available and some days activities run on the beach which was another nice touch watching the salsa dancers! Pool was fine, didnt think it was small at all. You have the loud side (pool bar and volley ball) and the quiet side which was nice to cool down go for a little swim. Overall I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone going to mexico, I will def plan to return some day, so anyone reading this and who is visiting soon I am very jealous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmiranda
Reviews.Content: I can't understant how anyone can say bad things about this hotel! The staff was excellent Manuel the door man never forgot our names he made a point to say hi when ever he saw us. Miriam the night bartender always had a smile on her face and made a point to talk to all the people around her. All the staff always had smiles on there faces. They all work hard so don't forget to leave a tip for them they deserve it!!! The food was pretty good I'm a picky eater and never had a problem finding something that i liked!! The beds yes they are hard but your so tired by the end of the night you don't even notice. The maids always had our room clean real nice always left 3 or 4 dollars a day they always made towel animals and the the refrigerator was always fool. The pool the kids alway had lots of fun and fun at the beach. The beach is really nice it can use some umbrellas it does get pretty hot out there. I will come back to this hotel and tell lots a people to check it out!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had our wedding at Riu Palace June 19th...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My now husband, family and close friends just returned from a 7 night stay at the Riu Palce Mexico. I must say that, in agreement with previous reviewers, the groundsof the Riu Palace are beautiful and are truely kept spotless. We chose to have our wedding at the Riu Palace and it was absolutely beautiful, our wedding coordinator Cynthia was FABULOUS! But it was very difficult trying to get in touch with her proir to our arrival. Nevertheless , she really knew what she was doing, and our wedding turned out wonderful. That being said, I was very disappointed with several aspects of our stay. First, with our wedding, we were to recieve a complimentary room upgrade. Now, when we booked our stay we had already reserved an upgraded suite. Upon check in they tried to tell us that they did not have any jacuzzi suites available for 3 days, and even then we may not get the upgrade! I was livid! However after talking with the hotel manager, they miraculosly had an available suite, oceanview, with a jacuzzi. Amazing! Another, surprising thing I found was that all of the table linnens were dirty!! Gross!! they didn't change them when people spilled food and drinks all over them, they just wiped them off and sat acted as if it was ok! At a hotel that is rated 5 star, I expect clean table linens!! Same with the ou room, the window treatments were dirty and the bedspread had cigarette burns in it. My parent's and our friend's rooms were fine. One of our guests traveling alone was pu t in a room that had all of the appliances and air conditioning turned off and unplugged. When she finally was assigned to a different room, she was asked to transport her luggage herself, also not ok at a 5 star hotel. I tipped the maid $10 a day and we only recieved towel animals the first day we arrived and the day after our wedding. We never recieved a fruit basket or a gift that was supposed to be delivered as part of our wedding, and we never recieved our breakfast in bed the morning following our wedding. As for the pool, the restaurants, the beach, all were excellent. I agree that the palace has the nicest beach in the area, and I too have been all over the Carribean and Hawaii. The beach is great for adults and children, but yes there are topless sunbathers. All in all, it was a great vavcation, but I think if you are going expecting the best of the best you may be disappointed. I was addicted to this site before we left and I went expecting absolute luxury, it was close, but not top notch. P.S. If you have an early departure flight, beware, they have no bellman before 7am! We almost missed our bus! we called to have a bellman sent and the front desk said they would send one in 5 minutes, then called back and said they would send one at 7! Our bus left at 7:10 and We were in the very, very last room of the hotel (were traveling for a wedding, do you have nay idea how long it would have taken us to get all of our luggage to the front!!) The bar was open at 7am, but they don't have bellman ?!?! This was the Riu Palace Mexico not the Riu Palace Party! Also, the bed are really hard, everyone was right! Ask for mattress pads...it does really make a difference!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed June 7-June 14. It was outstanding. This was our delayed honeymoon from when Hurricane Emily came through last year. SERVICE: More than anyone could ask for. I honestly don't know why anyone could complain about that. ROOM: We stayed in a fountain view jr. suite 0062. It had a living area with a sofa, a coffee table, tv and a small patio. The room was a great location. Right across from the fountain so it drowned out the activities in the courtyard. Great central location from the main area and the pool/beach. Room was clean and AC controlled. so if it was too hot you could adjust it yourself. Yes, the bed and pillows were hard but we were too tired every night to care! AND who watches TV anyway. FOOD: Excellent. There is something for everyone. Even the pickiest eater can find something. The restaraunts for dinner were wonderful. Service again here, FABULOUS! you need to get up to make reservation at 8:30 - 10:00. Not a big deal for an early riser. the line was quick. Then after, i got my coffee and walked to the beach or went to the gym. GYM: For fitness people, it was a little dated but really, are you there to relax or workout. IT served its purpose! BEACH: Excellent! There were plenty of chairs. The palm trees are slowly making there recovery but there was shade to find. Not much in the way of chair to chair drink service bu there is a beach bar a few steps away. DRINKS: Very yummy. If you ask for more liqour, they'll give it too you. No problemo! I took a cooly cup. Well worth it. POOL: Didn't spend a lot of time there. This is definately a beach resort! but the pool was nice. Again plenty of chairs and umbrellas when we went. ACTIVITIES: The activities people are a hoot. It was fun to break up the day with volleyball or a stretching class. Don't be shy.... you meet alot of fun people. I'd recommend to do something at least once. The shows at night are little cheesey but this isn't broadway gang! Have a sense of humor and enjoy a night out under the stars with your loved one or family! TOWN: A cab will take you there for $5. Don't walk.... HOT!!! We went during the day and at night. Alot to see. I recommend going to 5th avenue... very pretty! Have a beer at Senor Frogs and relax. Overall, we had a great honeymoon. We enjoyed Playa and each other. Made some great friends and had alot of fun. In essence, don't sweat the small stuff, your on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT stay at the Riu”
Reviews.Author: GLC
Reviews.Content: Riu was terrific - this is our 3rd time there. The guys at the front desk are SO nice - better than last year too! The palm trees on the beach are filling out from last year's hurricane - there's plenty of shade if you want - we are definitely beach people. The food has always been way above average - we had a ribeye the last nite and it was delicious. It was our first time to eat at the Japanese restaurant Miyagi and it was really good. Rooms are always spotless and they leave flowers, chocolates and towel animals on your bed daily. If I were to change anything about it, I actually don't know what it'd be! Any questions feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the RIU PM from May 27 through June 3. I can't say more about this place than many of the reviewers have already said. The service was excellent, I want to single out Santoyo at the Don Julian restaurant and Emanuel at the door for there great attention. The pool "wait staff" was great as well as the Cubano and the courtyard service. The food, rooms, grounds, beach, location, entertainment and most of all the friendliness of the help was super. If you cannot enjoy yourself at RIU PM, than you are a little too picky and should move on to another resort. As for me and my wife we will be there next year! *Oh, and a note to some reviewers. Please keep your comments to the Hotel, your flight, airport, cab ride and rude treatment by people outside of the Hotel experiences have nothing to do with RIU PM.

Reviews.Title: “wedding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the Riu Palace, as a Travel Agent based in the Uk I have to say that the hotel is magnificant and I would not hesistate in recommending this to any of our customers, We stayed there between 22/05/06 - 05/06/06 and got marrried out there on 29/05/06, the hotel is the best hotel we have ever stayed in, service was fantastic the staff were great nothing was too much trouble, when we checked in we were allocated a room overlooking next doors hotel, as we were on our honeymoon/wedding we did ask to be moved to a courtyard facing room and was allocated one the next day no problem, Anyone who complains about the food in my opnion are just plain picky, food was fab there was something for everyone, we did eat at the Sir Edward and I would have to say that for the time it took to get the meal it was not that great and people were walking out half way through the courses as it was taking so long for the meals to come out so i would avoid that one, but the steakhouse was delious and the Rib Eye Steak was very tasty, as for making reservations it is a pain but you are in the que no longer than a 10 minute wait. Rooms were adequate for the amount of time you are in them, Beach is the best I have ever seen and there were plenty of sun loungers, pool was ok childrens pool was average but beware if you sit round there the waiters do tend to just walk past and you have to shout them which is a pain, Wedding was fantastic no problems at all, co-ordinators were ok nothing to shout about but everything went off without a hitch and the photos were really nice we were married in the gazebo which I felt was the nicest location out of the three, the wedding meal was in the el patio and again that was very nice, we did check out the other Riu hotels and the palace is the best by far, so anyone who is thinking about booking this hotel you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days here from June 7 - June 11 with my wife and 11 year old daughter. Arrived a little early at 10:00 a.m, they said our room would be ready at noon and it was. We had drinks in the lobby bar during the wait, they were excellent, I liked the Carribean Orange. Room: The room was very nice and smelled fresh and clean. We were on the South side looking towards the Riu Yucatan next door not too far from the lobby which was convenient. The air conditioner worked great and with the ceiling fan going it got a little cold in the morning and we added blankets to the bed. Other reviews are correct about the beds being hard, we asked for matress covers and they were a lot softer. Fully stock bar with tequila, vodka, Rum, and bourbon. Refrigerator was stocked with water, soft drinks, wine coolers. Bathroom was roomy and very clean. Water in the shower and sink was very chlorinated, don't drink it. There's also a room safe for your valuables in the room. Beach: Beautiful! a lot of palm trees that were growing back from the hurricanes, you had to keep positioning your beach chair during the day to stay in the shade. There were massage tents on the beach. My daughter and I rented jet skis a couple times for $55 for 30 minutes, she loved it. The 2nd day there it was overcast the entire day and rained a little, that was the best day because the sun wasn't bearing down on you and we walked the beach and stayed in the water most of the day. There's nothing really to see if you snorkel off the beach, it's all sand, all you'll see are some fish. Food: I'm not a very picky eater. We ate at the buffet the entire time and loved it. Different themes every night. Our waiter for the drinks was excellent, I tipped him $5 the first night and he offered a special bottle of wine to us the next night and took great care of us. The coffee was good, if you get decaf it'll be instant. The organge juice in the morning was some of the best I've ever had. Hotel: Beautiful hotel and all the staff was courteous and attentive. Don't shop in the hotel store or you'll pay double. There's a shopping area about a block down the street on the other side if you need anything, go there. Beautiful landscaping. This is a quiet hotel, not much noise, you don't hear the "boom boom" of music all day long we've heard at other hotels we've stayed at. Everything is reserved, no major partying going on here. The fitness center was small but they had nice exercise equipment, I never saw anyone in there. The pool is small compared to others I've seen but we stayed at the beach most of the time. All around great time here, I'd return again.

Reviews.Title: “Riu is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to the Riu palace from June 8th-11th. A group of 12 couples went ranging from 30's to 40's. We all had an excellent time. A group of us have been traveling to Cancun and Playa for the past 8 yrs. looking for the perfect location and I think we finally found it! Check-in: Easy and fast. I do have to say that last year the resort was overbooked, so they sent our group to the Moon Palace in Cancun which was not nice. They provided us with vouchers to come back this year to stay complimentary. We made sure to confirm our reservations this year! Rooms: The size of the resort is really nice. It is smaller and easier to get around. The rooms are comfortable and clean. We had a room on the second floor and it was cold always stocked with fresh towels and drinks. The beds are hard, but we always slept great in the cold dark room. Beach: Best we have ever been to. There is a large sandy area with a bar, volleyball court, chairs and hammocks that is wonderful. There are plenty of chairs and the beach and water are beautiful. You don't have to get up early to get a chair by the beach or pool. It is also not as crowded as some because it is a smaller resort. Pool: The pool is very nice, but not a typical huge winding pool.
