Not many activities or noise at the pool, but it's nice to not get bugged constantly to participate in water aerobics etc. Our group would relax out on the beach all day, then come in about 4:00 to play water volleyball and hang out at the pool bar. It would be nice if the pool bar stayed open later, but I think most resort pools close at 6:00. Drinks and food: The drinks are really good. If they are not strong enough for you just get a topper of alcohol or just request how you want a drink made. It would be nice to have an insulated mug because the beer can get warm in the heat. The bar lobby made really good drinks, or maybe they just tasted better in a glass instead of a platic cup! The food was excellent. There were plenty of choices at the buffet and wonderful fresh cheeses, fruits, and vegetables. There were several meat choices beef, shrimp, pasta bar etc. If you can't find something to like at this buffet you would have to almost be unable to please. The Myagi Japanese restaurant was wonderful. The sushi was actually really good and fresh. The Steak restaurant was great also. Half of our friends ate at the French and said it was really good. I think the least favorite was the Brazilian, but still good. You do have to wake up early to make dinner reservations. We had early risers, so they booked our reservations for the people who wanted to sleep in. The restaurant by the beach was great for lunch. The guacamole and pico are wonderful on anything. The grilled fish and fajitas were always good. Overall the food is fresh, replenished quickly and a large variety is always offered. Entertainment: We never watched the shows, so I can't comment on that. The lobby bar was fun to relax and have drinks after dinnner. We went to the disco at the Riu Tequila across the street and it was fun, but extremely hot. If you want a lively, rocking place this might not be a good choice for you. I would have to say that at least the four days that we were there it would be placed in the lively category! It can be as quiet or as fun and crazy as you want it to be. I would reccomend this resort to couples, but not really a family resort. We are going back next month with our kids ages 7 and 9 and staying at the Iberostar Quetzal/Tucan which is perfect for families located a couple of resorts down from the Riu Palace.

Reviews.Title: “It was Okay”
Reviews.Author: bwakus23
Reviews.Content: Well we stayed at the RIU Palace for four and a half days, and it was definitely a good time, but I thought the service and overall experience could have been much better. Some annoyances: 1) no working ice machines and being told I had to get ice from the front desk 2) no available food or bar after 10 pm (except for the small lobby bar and some sandwiches) 3) no beach wait staff It was Okay, but I don't think I would stay there again. I hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding & wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned from a week at the Riu Palace Mexico where our wedding was taking place. There were 50 of us staying at the hotel and we believe we are talking on everybody's behalf with the below review: The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. None of our guests ever felt neglected. The rooms are large with a sitting area. They are cleaned neatly everyday and the hotel staff is always polite and lovely. The buffet restaurant for breakfast and dinner is amazing with a variety of choices. There are a few different specialty restaurants as well but the buffet was so impressive that most of our guests would rather eat there. The pool is clean and nice and quiet. The beach is unbelievable, all sand with see-through water. The beach is so great that everybody spent most time at the beach than at the swimming pools. We also spent a lot of time at the bar close to the reception and trust us: serving 30 over excited people at a time is not an easy task but the waiters and bar tenders did an amazing job everyday. Service is prompt and excellent and the cocktails are to die for. Now for the wedding part: We would like to extend our tremendous thanks to Edith and Cynthia, the wedding coordinators at the Riu Palace Mexico!! We were just so impressed. We contacted them about 3 months before the wedding and they were always very prompt in getting back to us with the required information. They were extremely patient given some of the questions we kept asking and always kept us informed. Once we arrived at the hotel, they sat down with us to finalize the details and tried to accommodate our needs to the best of their ability. They were both always so friendly and helpful reassuring us that they would take good care of us. The wedding was set to take place on the beach on a Thursday. Although it rained during our week stay in Mexico, it would always rain for about ½ hour and then the sun would be back but it seemed that on our wedding day, it had decided to pour the whole afternoon and evening. We were so nervous as things were not going as planned! But again Edith and Cynthia impressed us with their professionalism and organizations skills. They managed and directed our 56 guests to the hotel chapel and made our day a very special one. Most of our guests have traveled extensively around the world and they all agreed that this hotel was amazing and that the service was excellent. They all had a fantastic time and would return there if given the opportunity. As for us, we would definitely like to go back. The week went by too fast! Our wedding was everything we had imagined in a dream setting. We are so impressed with the wedding services of the hotel and are grateful to Edith and Cynthia for all their support and hard work. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning on going to the Mayan Riviera.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Mexico is the best !!”
Reviews.Author: elvisp
Reviews.Content: My wife(age 45) and I (age 55) stayed at the RIU Palace Mexico for one week from May 27th to June 3rd ,2006. We had stayed there 3 years ago at about the same time of year.We loved this resort equaly both times.The beach is simply the best in the entire Riviera Maya , and one of the best in the world , in our opinion , and we are experienced world travelers , having been on 30 cruises ,and to many different countries around the world. The food at the resort is very good , and the buffets are varied enough to satisfy most everyones tastes. Living in a very cosmopolitan area like Washington ,D.C. , we didn't eat at the theme restaurants , because we have very good Brazilian , French , Japanese , and Steak restaurants in our area.The rooms were spotlessly clean , with no odor of must at all , and we were on the 1st floor. The maid service was great , and twice we came back to find "towel animals" on our bed. The theme shows at thehotel are very funny and entertaining. The piano bar features a pianist named David Carilla who is excellent , and he plays from 6P.M. til 9P.M. The Disco at the RIU Tequila across the street is lively and opens at 11 P.M. One of the strengths of the resort is it's staff. It is hard to single just a few out , but we'll try. Bartenders Moy and Jesus and Armando at the swim-up bar , Head doorman Manuel (a legend!!) ,Bar waitress Lupita at the piano bar, and Bartender Miriam at the piano bar , and front desk Manager Jose are just some of the excellent staff. We met a lot of nice folks of all age ranges , and from all over the world also. There are not a lot of children at this resort , though the few that we saw there seemed to be having a great time. I still think that if I were traveling with kids I would stay at one of the other RIU hotels that cater more to them. All things said , we wiil be back at this Palace again !!

Reviews.Title: “Great AI for the Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Riu Palace Mexico for the first 4 nights of our honeymoon after religiously reviewing Trip Advisor for the best resorts. We went to the Royal Hideaway for the final 6 nights. Check In – We arrived and were quickly processed and given our room key. We did not have to wait for our room to be ready. Check in took us 10 minutes. We booked through the Riu Call Center (not a travel group – which seemed to take quite a bit longer to get their customers checked in). Room – We were in room 2009. It was centrally located and on the top floor. We overlooked the Riu next door (aka – not much of a view) but our room was quiet. The room was large but could use an upgrade. Our shower did have some mold and the room just needed a face lift. (I heard that the Riu Palace Riviera Maya has more modern rooms as it is a newer hotel). Housekeeping – Excellent. Our rooms were always put together. They decorated the room with heart balloons for our honeymoon and every day we got a little gift (ceramic bud vase, print of the Mayan Rivera). They put heart balloons all over our room the second day to help us celebrate. Resort – Everything you read below is correct – the resort is in perfect condition. Very clean and well kept…it is quite beautiful. Pool – We are pool people, and we had some ups and downs about the pool. It is small (especially after we saw the new Riu Palace Riviera Maya’s pool) but there are always pool chairs available at any time (this is huge as we had to get up at 5am to reserve pool chairs at the Royal Hideaway). Servers would come around every 10 minutes for drink requests. Beach – No doubt, this resort has the best beach in the entire area. It is huge, with tons of shade and there are shady areas if you move back from the water a bit. There is no comparison between this beach and any other – this is simply the best beach on the coast. Food – For an all inclusive, the food was good. On par with food we have had on cruises and much better than the food we had at other AI’s. The buffets were all wonderful and they were so big, that there is something for everyone. Breakfast was especially great, but the coffee was not good at all. We ate at the Japanese Restaurant, the Steakhouse and the Gourmet Restaurants. The sushi at the Japanese was so-so, but we are from California and have excellent, fresh sushi, so we have high expectations. Guests – Although there were a few honeymooners and couples, there was an equal number of groups (graduation group, wedding group, etc) at the resort. There were only a few children and it was a mellow crew. When we went to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya we immediately notice that the group was much more lively and rowdy. A bit more Cancun-ish. The Riu Tequila had a TON of children – it is much more family oriented. We were happy with our decision to stay at the more mellow resort. Activities – Honestly, they were pretty lame (except for water aerobics which always had a big group of people having fun). For example, Pool Bingo was this strange version of bingo and if you won you had to get up and do an embarrassing cheer. However, when you have a beautiful resort at your disposal, you don’t need activities. Spa – We had the 80min massage and it was good. Not one of the best treatments I have had, but I left satisfied and feeling great. The spa facility is tiny and not a place you would go before or after for relaxation but the massage itself was great. Entertainment – They had a nightly show and we never stayed longer than an hour. They were pretty cheesy – but the dancers work very hard putting on a great show. I think it would be better if they had a show every other night and then did more live bands on the off nights. Usually, the live band plays for a bit and then stops way too early for the show. My husband LOVED the cigar bar at the Riu. The owner is quite helpful and hand rolls the cigars himself in front of you. If we could do it over again, we would have stayed at the Royal Hideaway all 10 nights - there is no comparison between the two (and it is quite unfair to compare them) – but this was a great, cost-effective alternative. We will probably return to the Riviera Maya but most likely to the RH, however we have already recommended this resort for friends looking for a good AI. If you book a trip here, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel, but a few hiccups”
Reviews.Author: gavelrapper
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 6 days at the Riu Palace Mexico, flew Aeromexico. I. Aeromexico Incompetent, slow, inattentive and rude attendants, AC was bad. Try to fly Continental or really any other airline that will get you to CUN. II. Check in at RIU Palace Mexico Picture perfect. We had an early flight, got to the hotel at 11 AM, were given our wristbands and checked right in. While this was definitely a function of their capacity more than anything, it was certainly welcome and saved basically an entire day of wandering around in town while we waited to check in. III. Room at RIU Kind of a drag to not have an ocean view. I'm told that only 6 rooms or so do. Still, very clean and comfortable, although a little hot for my tastes (temp was probably around 80 F in the room). Only two English speaking channels on the little TV (CNN and local ABC out of NY). Bathroom roomy and shower great. Had a bodet. Nice minibar with everything you would would want in it for what you paid. Corona is the hotel beer. IV. Beach at RIU The best looking water in the world. Not much shade as Hurricane Wilma stripped many leaves off the palm trees. No palapas or other rentable shade. We saw innovative people cramming umbrellas into the beach chairs and decided to buy some in town ("dos sombrinos" -- $20 total). The sombrinos wound up being a little flimsy and were constantly turned inside out by the wind. More innovative and economical were the beachgoers who inverted beach loungers (free and ubiquitous) and placed them on top of the loungers they were sitting in. That method really did provide some MUCH NEEDED relief from the very powerful sun. Otherwise, there were many cigarette butts on the beach. V. Drink service on beach Basically nonexistent. I was there for a week and wasn't offered a single drink. Anticipating this, I brought along a shoulder cooler which I filled with the drinks from my mini bar. This was a great plan, except that NONE (AS IN NOT ON ONE SINGLE FLOOR) of the hallway ice machines worked. Thus, I had to fill my cooler, walk to one the of bars for ice, and then make the LONG walk to the beach (with my sombrino). This is a good place to mention this: THERE IS A TON A WALKING WHEN YOU STAY AT THIS PLACE. Oh yes, BRING ONE OR TWO OF THE HUGE BOTTLES OF WATER IN YOUR ROOM WITH YOU. VI. Pool and all its actvities The pool looked nice, but the W and I are are total beach people; we didn't enter the pool once. It appeared that they had lots of organized activities during the day (spanish lessons, volleyball, riflery [presumably off campus for that]). Again, we stayed away from the pool, so if that part is important to you, you might want to check other reviews. V. Food Breakfast I love breakfast, and this was some of the best I've had. Great selection in the buffet. Fantastice fresh fruits. Lunch Pretty good. It always seemed like a little bit of a pain to hike back to the hotel and eat once we finally got situated on the beach. Still, service was good and food was above average. We usually ate at La Traviatta, closet the the beach (and oh so hot during the afternoon). Dinner MEN MUST WEAR LONG PANTS TO BE ADMITTED TO ANY OF THE DINNERS. Also, if you shun the buffet in favor of one the the four "theme restaurants," you better get up at the crack of dawn to make your reservations. Unless you're just dying to be served what amounts to buffet food in a ala carte setting, I recommend having dinner at of the the two buffets. There is a huge selection of good, though not great, food, and you don't have to sit around all night while some waiter turns truly basic food into a 5-7 course meal. VI. Entertainment at night at the hotel Inside A great piano player near the main bar around dinner time. Also an internet cafe that operates near the bar at dinner time for $3 / 15 minutes. Can't tell you how many times I forked over that three bucks while my wife blew dry every strand of hair on her head in the room. Outside Very, very cheesy. "Grease" productions and the like that made me wanted to blow my head off. My advice: get a double from the bar and just go down to the beach, which should be cool and quiet at that point. VII Miscellaneous A. Snorkeling from the beach Forget it. While the water is calmer than Cancun, it's still not calm enough to do any decent snorkeling. Go to Cozumel, or -- if you have a sea sick wife like mine, go to XEL - HA where you can snorkel without getting on a boat.. We went to XEL HA, and it was the best money I've spent in years -- so natural, clean, such magical snorkeling. B. Fishing from the beach. Forget it. Don't lug your rod around like I did, not unless you're planning on going to Puerto Juarez or some place where you can fish in the surf. P.S. Great surf fishing from the RIU Caribe in Cancun (don't tell anybody!). C. The screwing of the exchange rate If you are coming from America, take the cash you plan to spend, go to town and convert itr into pesos ON YOUR FIRST NIGHT. The Mexicans ignore the exchange rate and always divide by 10 when changing you, even though the rate is closer to 11. On big purchases and dinner bills, this can definitely make a huge difference, and they know it. D. Best restaurant in Playa La Parilla -- hands down. Fairly priced, good food at a streetside table on avenida quintanida, won't screw you on the exchange rate.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace Mexico--The place to go!!”
Reviews.Author: thewayitis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned today June 2nd, from the Riu Palace-Mexico. This was our second time and we still love it. The resort is 100 percent recovered from the hurricane last year and the palm trees are full of leaves. Best of all the beach is beautiful--literally it is the best beach in the Riviera Maya-Playa del Carmen vicinity. We walked to other beaches such as the Royal Hideaway which is a lot more expensive, and the Riu Palace Mexico is much better. Also if you are debating on whether to stay at the Riu Palace-Mexico, Riu-Yucatan, Riu-Tequila, or the newest Riu-Riviera Maya, our advice would be to stay at the Riu Palace-Mexico. The New Riu-Riviera Maya is beautiful, but they don't have their stuff together like the staff at the Riu-Mexico, and the beach is not even comparable to the Riu-Mexico. When you stay at the Riu-Mexico you have access to all the other Riu's that I mentioned and they are all in walking distance. It is fun to go to the Riu-Tequila in the evening for drinks, but if you choose to stay at the Mexico for the evening, they will treat you like royalty. The best restaurants to dine in at the Riu Palace Mexico is Sir Edward--trust me, the duck and red snapper were my favorite dishes there. The next best is Miyagi, a japanese bistro. I am picky about my sushi and Miyagi surprised me....it was excellent!! Your room at the RiuPalace-Mexico is stocked with corona, water bottles, orange soda, 7-up, pepsi, and diet pepsi. The bar in your room is stocked with Jose Cuervo tequila, Bacardi Rum, Smirnoff Vodka, and Presidents Brandy. The rooms are spotless and cleaned daily. You can get all kinds of drinks made to order at the othe 4 bars like daquari's martini's what ever you can think of. Bring your own Margarita mix for your room. Also be sure to bring plenty of sunscreen because if you buy it there you will pay. I ran out and it cost me 25.00 for a bottle, and I looked all over for the best price. Just to let you know do not worry about what the weather forcast says. We thought it was going to rain everyday the whole week we were there based on what weather.com was forcasting. We never saw a drop and the sun was out all week. Bring some soft toilet paper. Go jet skiing--55 dollars for a half hour but worth it. I'd say 30 percent of the women lay out topless at the beach. The water is unbeleivable and really is as blue as you see in the pictures. Trust me the Riu palace-Mexico is the best place to stay if you are going to Playa del Carmen for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Stupendous Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: New-to-Travel-Scene
Reviews.Content: Don't hesitate to book your stay here. We stayed here May 16-23rd while on vacation with our best friends and we all agreed that it was great! The hotel is beautiful, the beach is marvelous, the drinks delicious and the service impeccable. My only tiny, miniscule complaint was that the hot tub was luke warm. There was one day during our stay that it rained and was overcast and we wanted to jump in the hot tub and were slightly dissapointed. But had it not been raining we wouldn't have even known there was a hot tub as we wanted to spend every minute at the beach. Here is a helpful tip: learn some speanish! We learned just the most petty basic phrases and it made a huge difference! We need to remember that we are visitors in their country. Plus, we thought it was fun to try and make toddler conversation with everyone there. Anyway, we felt we recieved more attention and better service when we showed some respect for their language and country. Everyone MUST book the Mayan Encounter tour with Alltournative. It was AMAZING and probably the highlight of our trip. Try and get Heidi as your tourguide, She was great and she speaks English, Spanish, German and French. We were glad we didn't rent a car. The cabs are very accessible and cheap. Back to the hotel. We had zero mold and were on the middle level. Our room was cleaned very well. We tipped $15 on the first day and got plenty of towel animals. At first I was afraid to leave my luggage unlocked in the room but I got over that by day 2. The beds were not too hard for us and we didn't mind the 2 beds pushed together either. The food is pretty good. By day 7 it all tastes the same though. Breakfast is the best meal of the day and we all loved the italian restaurant down by the beach for lunch. We ate at the steakhouse (pretty good) and the brazilian (pretty great). We didn't get up early enough to ever get into the other 2 restaurants. We got massages on the beach and they were WONDERFUL! We did see about 7-10 topless women on the beach for those of you who care about that. It didn't bother us at all. We went dancing at the Blue Parrott in downtown Playa and had a blast. Well worth it. The nightly entertainment at the hotel is great! Our favorite was the "Miss Riu Palace Contest" it was hilarious. The entertainment is just that: entertaining and mostly hilarious. Everyone try the Passion Dreams drink from Miriam at the lobby bar. She makes them the best and they are yyyuuuuuummmmy. I think that is it. Sorry my review is not organized at all but I think I got my point across: we had a terrific time! Basically, the people who pick this place apart must pick everything apart because this place was glorious. I hope this helps! Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our 6 day vacation at the Riu Palace Mexico was wonderful. This was our first time in Mexico. We were picked up at the Cancun Airport by representatives of Apple Vacations. It was a wam humid day. You can get safe bottled water right outside the airport. Upon arrival at the Hotel, we were warmly greeted. We were given a map of the area and were taken to our rooms. We ended up on the ground floor and wished to go to the top floor. As soon as a room was available we were moved. We noticed that the beds were very firm. I asked to make it softer and when we retired for the eveing, I noticed that a quilted mattress pad had been put on my bed. The rooms are spacious and pleasant. There is a refrigerator in each room stocked with soft drinks and water. All the employees of this resort are very friendly. The grounds are immaculate. The pool is very nice and the beach is fabulous. I spent most of the day in the ocean. We had no problem at all getting a spot at the beach or the pool. I would recommend eating at the buffet. There is so much food and a wide variety . If you are health conscience, there are plenty of choices. I would go back to this resort in a heart beat. We were treated like kings and queens. There is entertainment nightly. Take a short walk down the street to the shopping area. It is very safe to walk around because you are in the resort area. We took a trip to the Coba Ruins. Our tour guide was the greatest. On a scale of 1 - 10, I give Riu Palace Mexico a 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - You'll love it!”
Reviews.Author: ut_bandelero
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at Riu Palace Mexico (May 17-20) and thought is was a fabulous resort. The service was impeccable and our every request (we never heard the word no) was taken care of promptly and courteously. The food was excellent and we thought the drinks were good, too. In fact, whenever we thought the drinks weren't strong enough, we simply asked for more alcohol and received more every time. We hit the beach every day and never had a problem finding a shady spot. We usually got there around 11am so it wasn't like we had to get up at 6am to find shade. And as others have said, this is the best beach you will ever see. Clear blue water, lots of sand, plenty of space. Simply perfect. Here are some tips to consider- they worked great for us: 1) If you feel the mattresses are too hard, request a mattress pad. We did and slept better b/c of it. 2) Bring an insulated mug. We brought 24oz mugs and they worked perfect. The bartenders will fill them without saying a word. 3) We ate at 2 of the restaurants (Brazilian and Steakhouse). Food was good, atmosphere was nice. And both times we made our reservations at 10am. So no need to get up early and wait in line. Maybe we got lucky but I doubt luck struck twice. 4) Get a room on either the 1st or 2nd floor. Our initial room was on the bottom (room 83) and it was very musty. We requested a change and got a 2nd floor room (2112) and it was 100x better. No smell, cooler temps, better views. We didn't watch any of the shows (too busy at the bar) or spend more than 15 minutes at the pool (we are beach people) so I can't comment on either. But it appeared as though the pool had ample room. We never saw more than 10 people in it at a time anyway. Hope this helps - if you stay here you won't be disappointed. Have a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS GREAT !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Vacationed there May 18-22, 2006. This place is a real value for your money. It is clean,safe and the beach is excellent. My only problem was the taste of the coffee. The food is excellent, try the patio for lunch and pig out on fish and beef soft shell tacos with good pico de gallo. Dinner buffet is great with lots of choices. Rooms are big and very clean. ALL the staff are very polite and quite helpful. The beach is excellent and is cleaned every morning. This time of the year is an excellent time to go since it is about 1/3 full. This means no fighting for chairs at beach or pool. Overall the Palace Mexico is an excellent vacation spot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jds915
Reviews.Content: This has been the 5th time to the Cancun area. However, since the hotel that my family and I have stayed at the past was closed due to renovations (Cancun Palace), we decided to try this hotel in Playa del Carmen. We definitely made a great choice. Here are some great points about the hotel: 1. Hotel - it was absolutely beautiful. The decor, lobby, beach, and pool were spetacular. The beach was the best in the area and that is why I go to Cancun area (Caribbean). The beach was spacious unlike some of the other hotels in the area. I walked the beach and it looked like some of the resorts' beaches, people were laying right next to each other. The palm trees' leaves are growing back, so the shade is increasing. The only thing about the hotel and beach in general is if you have trouble walking, it is sort of a hike to go to the beach as well as walking around the hotel. 2. Location - it is very convenient to go to Playa del Carmen - a 5 minute, $5.00 cab ride. In the town, you can catch a Ferry to Cozumel which my family and I did and it was well worth it. 3. Food - I must have put on a few pounds because the food was delicious. Those individuals who didn't like the food at this resort must be picky eaters. If you cannot find anything at this resort that you like to eat, it is your fault. There is a buffet daily as well as the specialty restaurants. The Japanese restaurant was my favorite because of the food selection and being different (I have never tried sushi). We found out from the hotel manager that one of the nights at the buffet is chef's night and they cook elaborate food. For example, there are animal carvings on the salad bars made out of melons as well as ice sculptures. In addition, I really enjoyed waking up in the morning to freshly blended juices such as mango, banana, watermelon and etc. 4. Service - the service was excellent. The staff at the hotel were always trying to please as well as no sooner you finished a drink, you had another one in your hand. Hey, if they aren't as strong as you might like your drinks, just drink more! All of the staff were very friendly and personable. This is my only somewhat negative point about the hotel. The Front Desk staff needs improvement in regards to customer service. They really didn'y understand English too well and it took me 15 minutes to check into my room and I was the only person at the counter. In addition, I wished that the hotel had a concierge that could provide local tourist information. For example, we had to ask a few individuals about the night club hours in Playa del Carmen. We went to Senior Frogs one night and it was totally dead. The next night, we went to the Blue Parrot and it was much busier and a nicer club too. This is information that the Front Desk should know, but didn't. One last feature that I liked in the hotel was the stocked mini-refrigerator. There is alcohol and nonalcoholic beverages stocked. It was definitely a convenience to take a large cold bottle of water to the beach every day. This refrigerator was replenished on a daily basis. 5. Entertainment - the entertainment was really enjoyable at the hotel. The dancers were great. Also, you can rent free of charge on the beach - boogie boards, canoes and etc. Jetskis and fishing charters are available for a fee. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. The area called Playacar is a gaited community, so you are totally safe to walk around the area. I did tour a few of the other hotels in the Riu chain, but I feel that this hotel was the best. However, the pool was the best at the Riu Palace Mayan Riviera. Although, the beach was better at the Palace Mexico. Comparing Cancun to Playa del Carmen, it all depends upon your taste. If you like to party, then go to Cancun. However, if you would like to relax, but have some fun during the day and go to a more relaxed night club, then Playa del Carmen is your choice. Feel free to contact me if you would like more info about Cancun or this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! What a great resort!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoSun
Reviews.Content: After doing a ton of research since this would be our first trip to mexico, we decided on the RIU Palace Mexico in playa del carmen! I am SO HAPPY WE WENT HERE! the service is excellent and the resort itself is amazing. I would recommend booking here to anyone! absolutely the most friendly and helpful staff that will make sure you are having a great vacation. Rooms were very clean, food was good and the never ending drinks were a nice touch too! can't wait to go back! I also suggest booking your airport transports through cancun valet [""]. the service with them is awesome too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 days at the RIU Palace. We really enjoyed our stay and were impressed by the cleanliness of the resort. The staff was professional and friendly and staff management checked daily, sometimes twice to see if your stay was going good. ROOMS: Very clean. Beds and pillows very firm. Mini bar stocked daily. We had a room facing courtyard fountains, nice views. FOOD: Very good. Variety and service at the buffet was great. Although the service at the two restaurants was great, we were not as impressed with the food (but it was good as well). DRINKS: Seemed to be a little watered down at the beach and pool areas. But in the outdoor courtyard bar and the bar Cubanos off the lobby, the drinks and service was great. POOL: Pool area was nice. Never had any problems getting chairs or umbrellas. We thought the pool at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya was incredilbe if you are more into the pool area than the beach. But we are mostly beach fans. BEACH: This was the best beach in the whole area. Color of the water was awesome. We normally like more secluded beaches, but the beach area was large enough that you could find your own private palm tree. The only draw back and I still can't understand how people can disturb a piece of paradise like this, but there were cigarette butts everywhere. I guess you will have those people everywhere. Not sure if the resort could attend to this more. Overall we had a wonderful stay. The friendliness of the staff was awesome and we were impressed by how hard the staff worked to maintain the place. These people I'm sure worked long shifts because we saw many of the staff morning, noon and night. Not sure how you could be dissappointed by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Who can complain here?”
Reviews.Author: Dougle
Reviews.Content: People complain about the dumbest stuff , One complained about the airport what on earth does this have to do with the hotel? I was there in March and had the best time ever the shows all week were great and the staff was above all in there service wonderful, Yes and the beach awesome, the poolbar was a great shady place at the hottest part of the dayto relax. I shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was back!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Palace April 16th thru April 23rd. The beach in front of the Palace is the best beach in Riviera Maya. The sand is white and soft and the water is the bluest I've ever seen, and crystal clear. We had a large number of friends with us and we did not have any problem getting lounge chairs together. You do not have to get up extra early to reserve a chair. We spent most of our day on the beach and then moved to the pool around 3:00 for happy hour. The pool is a little on the small side, or should I say the swim up bar side is a little small. We had at least 30 people with us at happy hour and I must say that the size of the pool did not spoil our fun! The bar tenders at the pool bar were great! They never slowed down and the drinks were great. Corona is the beer you will find at the Palace. I thought the Margaritas were very good too. For breakfast, Lunch and Dinner we spent most of our time at the buffet. My family and I thought that the buffet was very good. There were many different items to choose from. For breakfast there was everything you could think of, pancakes, french toast, omlets, cereal, fruit. pastry, etc. For lunch there were so many things to have from burgers, pizza, nachos, salads. and the list goes on! The dinner buffet was usually a different theme each night. Mexican, Italian, Chef's Gala. There were always carving stations, pasta stations, tuns of breads and pastries. A chocolate fountain. The wine red and white, espcially white was very good. The Champagin was the best. The staff did everything to accomadate our large party. At our request they would have a table set up ahead of time for as many as we wanted. I can't say enough good things about Maria, Karima, and Tamara.( These 3 girls work so hard to make everyone happy) We saw so much of them. They were always available for anything we needed. We did eat at the Barzilian rest. one night, but didn't think it was good. With 2 young kids it didn't make since to eat in a resturant at a certain time, especially when there really isn't anything on the menu for children, and they loved the buffet. By the way... you do need long pants for dinner... no matter what others say! The property at the Palace is spotless and beautiful. The staff works so hard and late at night and in the early morning to make sure of it. Checking in at the front desk was painless. Barbara was very friendly. We did have to wait for our rooms, but it was worth the wait, and the Hotel was very full during this week. The rooms in the hotel were a nice size and very nice and clean. We are a family of 4 with 2 kids so we had plenty of room. My kids took turns sleeping on the sofa. By the way I did not see any mold in any form or fashion. And the first thing I did was inspect the sofa. Everything was spotless. I did speak to management about this issue and they explained that after the hurricane, they only had a room capacity of about 100. Many of the rooms remained closed for at least a month, and with the humidity it's almost impossible to avoid the musty smell. Everything has been cleaned, painted, and replaced. At night there are shows for the kids, then adults. I never really watched the shows for the adults, but heard from friends that the Michael Jackson show was the best. There was always music in the courtyard. If you wanted more action, Playa was only a 5min. cab ride, and there was a club across the street at the other hotel. Shopping in town was good. I did not miss the big city of Cancun. There is also shopping across the street is nice to have so close. Shopping on the beach is even better!! I would definately recomend staying at the Riu Palace Mexico for your next vacation you will have a great time. When you look around the palace and see what you see, I don't know how anyone could complain about this resort. Have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected At All”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: OK the airport was horrible. We were taken by bus to the main airport from our plane. We were shoved on a bus like sardines. We then were taken to customs where we waited online for an hour because the women in charge of our line kept walking away and coming back. We took so long at customs that when we got to the luggage carousel our stuff was already thrown to the side. The security agents were very rude and nasty and were to busy talking then to pay attention to whats going on. We then went outside to wait for Olympus tours to take us to our hotel long wait but the people were very nice from Olympus. Took about an hour and 15 mins to get to our hotel between a little traffic and all the stops at the other hotels to drop people off. We finally got to our hotel and the front desk girl was very nice but she talked to us like we were stupid and took forever to complete check in. There were also no keys for the safe's and we had to come the next morning to get one. They didnt have a key for every safe in the hotel so i had to carry my airline tickets and birth certificate everywhere because I was scared to leave it in the room. Pool: SO SMALL! nice design but way too small. And as for Dirty by like 5:00 yea it had some sand on it but after people were on the beach they would jump in the pool and sand at the bottom of the pool is just expected. And everynight the pool was vaccummed and cleaned. Beach: the beach was great. it was clean and the waves were a lot of fun. No topless women unless they were over 40+ and they were european. Food: I only like breakfast at the buffet. My boyfriend liked everything. Ate at the Brazilian Restaurant "La Bodega" one nite it was HORRIBLEEEEEE my table and a few other tables actually got up an walked out. I pretty much survived on the french fries and salad for 6 days. We went shopping at a market place right by the hotel What a rip off in prices compared to the 5th ave shopping down town (a $5.00 cab ride) I picked up a few souveniors and I felt taken advantage of with the translations from us dollars to peso's. Cabs were very easy to get and usually only cost $5.00. We went to Dolphin Encounters which was a lot of fun. We also went to Xel-ha which is a natural aquarium. Basically it was a lagoon with fish and they give u a snorkel and u pay like $45 a person to go . Absolutely not worth it . THere were huge rocks where u can easily cut ur leg and the water was cloudy. and everything was really long walks or u can use one of their crummy bikes to get around because the man in charge of the train ride was sleeping. I was really unhappy with my whole trip the hotel was very outdated, spotless but old looking and gloomy no mexican bright colors or anything like that. The service was superior however to any other hotel i have ever been to. Everyone is so friendly and goes out of their way to help you. The second they saw your drink was almost empty they came through with a new one. The nights were very boring especially for two people in their 20's. The bars were boring and dark and most of the shows were cheesie. I think after this experience in Mexico I will definetely not return to Mexico at all. What a rip off the whole week was.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach and Great Food.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back last night, and we already miss it. We love the beach and swimming in the sea, and the beach at the Riu Palace Mexico is the best I've been to. Better than Aruba, better than Punta Cana, and better than other places I've stayed on the Mayan Riveria. You can see your toes in shoulder deep water clearly. The waves were just enough to do some light body surfing, but not enough to beat you up. For my taste, nearly the perfect beach. The food was awesome. I bet I gained 10 pounds while I was there. Usually I avoid the buffets at AI resorts, but if you avoid the buffets here, you would be missing out big time. I've stayed at places where the "gourmet" restaurants weren't nearly as good as the food on the buffet at the RIU Palace Mexico. We did eat at a couple of the specialty restaurants, Sir Edwards and the Japanese place, and while they were both excellent, the buffet was just as good. Also, by eating at the buffet, you eat when you want to instead of committing to a time, and you don't have to go through the hassle of making reservations. Like what you expect from a resort in Mexico, the service was outstanding. I loved this place, and I plan to go back. However, there are a couple of areas that could be improved upon: The beds. I had read that the beds were very firm, but that did not prepare me for just how firm they were. I would say a better word would be hard. Beach bar. Because the beach is so wide, if you like having you lounger right up by the water, it's a bit of a hike to the beach bar. I saw other people take large mugs. One guy had a mug the size of a pitcher, and the bartenders would gladly fill it up. I recommend you take something like that. The pool was only average, but I never understood why people even use the pool area at resorts that have such an awesome beach. So if you're a pool person, maybe this isn't the resort for you. However, if you like a spectacular beach, great food, gorgeous views everywhere you look, and being treated like royalty, then you would have a hard time finding a better place to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: ny1478
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Riu Palace Mexico over the Easter holiday weekend. The weather was fantastic and the ocean water was glorious. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Riu Palace with only a few minor complaints! Rooms: We had three courtyard view groundfloor rooms. Beautiful, clean and no mold to speak of whatsoever! Food: Fantastic. The pancakes at the breakfast buffet were my personal favorite. Skip the Brazilian resturant, but try the French. The meat at the Brazilian resturant was NOT good. Beach: Amazing crystal clear blue water with plenty of waves. One sour note however, the Riu Palace has something against beach umbrellas and palapas. You CANNOT sit on the beach if you need shade. The plam trees DO NOT provide any protection against the brutal Yucatan sun. Make sure to bring your floppy beach hat and SPF 55!!! Pool/Pool Bar: Very boring small pool for such a beautiful resort. It really needs a makeover and the bar could use a livlier soundtrack. Try the Yucatan's pool for a party atmosphere. That said try the Miami Vice...what a great drink. You also must reserve chairs by 8:30ish to get a good spot. Grounds: Immaculate, you could literally eat off the ground. Service: Terrific. Everyone was friendly and service oriented. Entertainment: Boring and cheesy. The bands were good, but seemed to enjoy playing tacky wedding music! One other note, we visited the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. While they do have a much nicer pool, the Riu Palace Mexico is by far the nicer resort. The new palace looks as if it was mass-manufactured. Too large, tiny beach and insufficient landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “To help you decide to do RIU or not.............”
Reviews.Author: sunswimsand
Reviews.Content: We wanted to post an accurate accounting of RIU Palace Mexico; we think this is pretty accurate, and we’ve made comparisons to our other trip experiences to illustrate for anyone trying to make a decision. We took a Sunquest charter tour Easter Week 4/15 - 4/22: Airport: to our pleasant surprise, we were bussed to the opposite side of Cancun airport, and waited in line for just 15 minutes to push the button. They have new customs area and it moved quickly, and this was day before Easter. Luggage did not move quite as fast. Arrived at 9:20 am, - made it to Playacar by 11:30 am. Check-in: we were disappointed to be taken to the piano bar area and found there were no rooms until after 3:00. There was no front desk welcome, no package with our name waiting for us. First time ever in all our travels we checked in like this – and told to come back later. We walked around in our jeans until 3:30 – with a small baby this was not ideal. Take your bathing suits or shorts in your carry-on, we saw this happened every day all week long, if you came in with a tour like Apple, Sunquest, etc. The regular room reservations, no tours – got a room immediately upon check-in. Lobby: Yes its ornate, but we were disappointed with the dark dreary nature of the wood, the mint green walls in the dark piano/lobby bar were all depressing, and we knew right away no one would congregate here in the evenings because its “upstairs” from the main eating levels. This was our important first impression and we were a little disheartened after being greeted at the front door of the Katenah Palladium last year and handed a welcome package and personal greeting to the whole tour. The RIU Palace décor feeling is not Mexico like Iberostars and Palladiums, its more rather depressing 1800’s New Orleans Creole fancy with red velvet circular banquettes we haven't seen since the PeeWee Herman show was cancelled. The chandeliers were beautiful - but again maybe in Rome, not Mexico. And we absolutely hated the very mid-evil feel to the buffet dinner eating quarters. These awful 4 foot flame lantern lights attached to the columns made it look like the days of Shakespere and MacBeth. Grounds: were beautiful. The landscaping is gorgeous and well maintained. The fountains are gorgeous in the courtyard. Breathtaking. One note too here - there are two elevators from the lobby to the upper rooms (3 floors here) - and to the lower level for pool / eating. But once you got to your floor - you walked through dark narrow hallways to get to your room. It's not open and a jungle atmosphere like at Iberostars or Palladiums or even RIU Tequila. This wore on mommy as she had to walk these hallways with baby for naps several times a day. Rooms: we pre-emailed and asked for a rollaway bed and a room on 2nd floor overlooking fountains. We got a courtyard fountain room on the 3rd floor (2060's) and no rollaway bed. Son #1 had to sleep on the small couch first night. Not good. The beds were very hard. Two doubles pushed together. Room was spacious, bright – NO ODOR – no mold. Balcony was iron gate and we could sit and see the stage bandstand (this would be trouble later), the wedding processionals, the fountains and see the action. Room had iron/board, extra blankets and pillows, hair dryer, old fashioned metal lock/key safe, mini bar closet with 4 bottles of liquor in dispense mode, beer, pepsi in plastic, 7-up, orange drink and selzer water and plenty of bottled water in two sizes. Mini bar was filled 2 additional times over 7 days. No coffee maker. The bedding is somewhat dated and threadbare, and the curtains were very formal. Shower is a tub, with removable wand shower head (good for rinsing baby) and vinyl shower curtain. On 2nd day after 3 calls about a bed, we visited the front desk, pleaded for the 14 year old and got a bed by noon. They moved the coffee table and placed a solid wood double bed looking out the french doors. The rooms were brighter than Iberostars due to the colors and sunlight coming in all day. Air conditioning was adequate if french doors stayed closed. One single ceiling fan also. Pool: all we can say as a family... unanimously thumbs down! The pool is a circle cut in half. It’s too small, dirty and the side where the pool bar is – is really questionable in terms of cleanliness. We saw things floating in the corners, muck on the surface. No floatees. Small pool volleyball area. Big big letdown if you are used to the Iberostar free form pools – or Palladium. Mom went in all of 2 times all week. So disappointing. We suppose for the smaller crowd this hotel gets – its adequate at best. One girl server at the pool all day killed herself to get drinks all week long – we tipped her daily. The one bathroom too by the pool in the pool bar area smelled so bad everyday (a chemical like smell) I gagged every time I went in, gagged like I was going to be sick) I refused to use it and would walk to the lunch area entrance. Not sure what the chemical smell was but it was bad. Popcorn machine and nachos by pool bar daily. There is no music, games, activities, exercise - nothing at the pools - not even plesant background music. Just white noise. Beach: unbelievable. Best beach we have ever been at. No rocks, plenty of room. Awesome waves. Plenty of beach access, chairs, and even a drink guy coming by. He carried the mixers and actual bottles of liquor and mixed right there on beach. The views are lovely, and there are miles to walk in each direction. However - there is no difference in the beach at RIU Palace, RIU Yukatan or Iberostar Tucan - they are all right next to each other and run into each other. The only difference is the chair color, and the nice palapas at Iberostar Tucan/Quezel. Jockey for chairs/shade: yes they do it here too; however not as early. We found great chair selection at 9:00 am each day. We would put our towels down, and walk the beach. By 11:30 the pool chairs were filled. You could not find 2 together. Here’s one big problem we noticed: NO Palapas anywhere. If you need shade at some point – the only coverage is ivory canvas beach umbrellas. There is no escape from the sun at RIU Palace MX. The beach umbrellas are ok – but have to be moved around in big heavy weight peds – there are no grass palapas anywhere on this property whatsoever. We needed that for the baby. The beach umbrellas give this place a very European feel or better the Beverly Hills Beach and Tennis Club - not the beautiful palapas of Mexico. We walked over to the Iberostar Tucan and saw the difference in shade around the pool – it was almost dark compared to RIU Palace. They have the cushioned bed palapas too, and coverage on the beach as well. We've stayed there and their pool, grotto and waterfalls beat RIU hands down. So Iberostar Tucan/Quezel wins here for shade / and pool size. And it was the Canadian and American moms at RIU Palace who were making scenes over chairs, missing goggles, “you stole our towels” etc. Not the Europeans, who were very relaxed and pleasant. Lunch: served in the pool area El Patio and La Traviata (I think) – one side hamburgers and fajitas daily, the other side was flat pizza and Italian pasta, soup, etc. Salad bars on both sides. The hamburgers were excellent. The pizza very good. Soft ice cream machines here daily. Salad bars on both sides with iceberg lettuce and romaine lettuce daily. We ate veg’s daily and no issues with stomachs. Husband ate the grilled fish everyday in taco shells and said it was excellent. Fried chicken legs one day were very tasty too. Guacamole was outstanding every day. Dinner: we did buffet first night. Excellent. We cannot say enough about the food and selection. It slightly beats Iberostar’s and does circles around Palladium and Bahia. The slow roasted meats each night are excellent (ham, duck, roast beef) the pasta station and sauces were very good – best Alfredo sauce I’ve had on vacation. And love that Guacamole. Stuffed dungeonese crabs one night. Each night is themed (Italian, Mexican, etc.). Asia Pacific night was superb with stir-fry, sushi that was excellent, smoked salmon, soy sauces, duck, etc. We could never get coffee with dinner ever. Red wine they poured at dinner was just so/so. Some of the wait staff did not take kindly to the mess the baby would make, especially chocolate ice cream on the napkins. So we found one waiter who was great to us and sat in his section nightly. And desserts were tasteless cakes and cookies and pies - no taste at all. Steakhouse: unlike Iberostar and Palladiums, you make one reservation per day for that night in line in the theatre area. You must stand in line daily from 9-9:30 and pick from 4 (maybe 5) restaurants – Brazil, Mexican, Italian, Steakhouse, and maybe Med – I can’t remember. We waited in line one day just 10 minutes, picked the steakhouse (from 2 sitting times) – which was the lunch area dressed up by beach. Salad is a la carte, and the ribeye steaks were really bad. My husband selected the tuna, and he was served swordfish. It took forever, service was slow, each table’s meal was prepared together, one group at a time. Not worth it – the buffet was so much better. We skipped eating at restaurants after this night. We heard the Brazilian was outstanding with several meats on skewers served at your table. Breakfast: usual faire. The handmade donuts are to die for. Thumbs up on having make-your-own mimosas daily. And BEST part of breakfast: they would come and serve you your first cup of coffee, and leave the whole pot. You never had to wait for coffee again for breakfast. Just drank and poured, drank and poured. Loved that!!!! Entertainment: was our biggest issue. We heard on all the boards this place was quiet “dead, stuffy” etc. Well it's not. There is a house band that starts playing at 8:00 on the bandstand in the courtyard right outside the rooms, and dinner / theatre area. They stop at 8:30 pm for “mini disco” when all the kids go up on stage and dance in the theatre. (Other than this mini disco I saw no activities for the kids outside of a few sports contests). We knew there was no kids club here. Then the band would start playing again at 9:00 pm until 9:45 when the theatre nightly show would start. The theatre is nice seating – soft pink velour seats. After the theatre show ends at 10:30 pm – the band would resume and play outside until 11:15 or 11:30 pm every night. So two problems: if you have kids – 9:45 pm is way too late to wait for a show, and if you have kids, and a courtyard room, the music blasts you out of bed until 11:30. My husband was irate every night – he could not fall asleep listening to bad renditions of “feelings” and “Sweet home Alabama” sung by really bad Mexican singers. We didn’t complain officially, however learned on the plane that other couples with small children did complain. Room location didn’t matter, if you faced the courtyard, you got the music. And similar schedule was in place at RIU Tequila across the street too. Loud music until 11:30 pm every night. Bars: really really disappointing in all directions. The pool bar was a busy place everyday with great service; however as in all RIUs they skimp on the alcohol. They cannot make a margarita to save their lives, tried 3 times and each tasted terrible. The Palladium Ketenah and Iberostar Paraiso made them sensationally - frozen and regular. The strawberry drinks at RIU were bad too. So we stuck to weak Pina Coladas and banana dac’s since they could not harm these too much. Beer was also always somewhat flat, not really crisp or cold. It’s Corona on tap at most of the bars. Although they did have something in a bottle - you must have to ask because we were never offered bottled beer. The little bar/hut on the beach was just an outlet for water for us. One server was very rude to the Mommy when she asked for Pinapple juice for the baby - he said "you didn't even say good morning". Not acceptable; and the only sign of bad service all week. They closed that up everyday at 5. The pool bar was closed by 6. The bar in the courtyard was never used. So we got the feeling they wanted everyone up away from the pools everyday and shut the bars to do it. The little bar in the back of theatre area didn’t open until 7 or so. So at 6:00 when most hotels have a big central lobby bar meeting place and music – this had none. You had to go upstairs to the 2nd floor lobby area, to sit in the depressing moldy smelling mint green julep piano lobby bar – where the piano bar music was so depressing. Get the picture. We noticed the seniors like to hang here nightly. That’s about it. The servers do work very hard. Overall: the place is very compact and feels intimate. However, there just was not enough in the way of entertaining bars, shade from the sun, beautiful pools, decent music, and quiet evenings to make us want to come back. We had a wonderful time, thought overall the complex was very pretty on the outside, but it just was not our cup of tea. It has a turn of the century European nature/feel to it – much more intimate than the rowdy family crowds at Iberostar. We liked the smaller feel only for no lines for food, etc. We missed walks around a large complex like Palladium, through the jungle plants and seeing all sorts of wildlife like pink flamingos at Palladium and tree monkeys at Iberostar. There was none at RIU to show our baby. We met lovely German couples, one who waved and blew kisses to our son every day. There were people from Germany, Czech Republic, France, Scandanavia, Canada and Latin America as well. Only a few times did a family of Latin Americans walk right in front of us - cutting us off at dinner. And yes there is smoke at times - most notable at breakfast in close quarters. Comparison: we did go to the new RIU Palace Mexican Riviera down the street. It was exactly the same on the inside – same layout, same location of theatre, courtyard, restaurants - same Euro feel inside / stuffy bar feel. The pool was much nicer, but the beach was smaller. And some of the rooms that overlooked the street really had a lousy view because the hotel seems so much closer to the street. Across the street: we walked through the RIU Tequila also. The pool was much nicer (remember they have no beach) and the lobby bar was so much more like an Iberostar or Palladium. Lively bar, large lobby with soft seating, fun, families everywhere. We did hear they had the late night music also here. If it were not for being across the street and such a long walk to beach, we would consider RIU Tequila next time. We did not get to RIU Yucatan next door, but could see from the outside their pool was much nicer and family oriented also. Our recommendation: we spent more to go here and wished we would have spent less and stayed with the Iberostar chain. Tip: take bug spray, and wear no perfume. We were eaten alive the last night by mosquitoes we think. We have welts at home from multiple bites. One buzzer must have infiltrated our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and fabulous beach, minor problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We, a portuguese couple in our early forties, and our two children, aged 13 and 9, just came back from a week at the Riu Palace Mexico. I agree with most of the previous reviewers, so I will try not be repetitive. The hotel and beach are really good and having checked the neighbouring hotels, the Riu Palace beach is undoubtedly the best and largest. I have to agree that there is a lack of shade problem and I do not know how long the palm trees will take to regrow again. We stayed in the Riu Palace Macao in Punta Cana once, has the same beach/palm trees layout and it was much more agreeable (and easy) to be in the shade there. In Riu Palace Mexico you have to constantly move your lounger around for shade, and you only can do that if the beach is not full of people. In the Easter week-end it was... Riviera Maya seemed a bit windy to us and the beach water temperature was 26º to 28º Celsius (afternoon) and I missed the 30ºC water from the Seychelles and NorthEast Brazil. My wife and children took the parasailing 10 min. tour and they liked it. The swimming pool was average and I do not like the concept of a swim-up bar. People tend to drink and become loud there... And it seems very easy to spill the drinks on the water, which did not look crystal clear... We had a room facing north, to the neighbouring Riu Playacar Hotel. In short, no views (see photo) but, at least, you will not hear the entertainment music coming from the center "patio" if you like to go to bed early (european jet-lag). Our room did not smell musty and it was on ground floor. We ate mainly in the buffet, which was good, and accepted the one time invitation to dine at the steak house, nice. We did not bother reserving "a la carte" restaurants. Service was friendly although in the beach restaurants (lunch) sometimes it seemed a bit understaffed, the hotel was full. The reception people were great and the Euro exchange rate seemed very acceptable at the hotel. There were daily newspapers available at the reception shop, El Pais from Spain or the Miami Herald from Cancun. There was broadband internet available at the lobby, costing 80 pesos for one hour or 30 pesos for 15 minutes. My wife loved the Playa del Carmen village (mainly shopping...). One afternoon we took a taxi to Xcaret (12 US$) and bought the "after 3 pm" ticket and the optional dinner for the night show. On the whole, it all seemed a bit too expensive (admissionand totalling around 210 euros for our family of four) but the entrance to the night show is really spectacular with all those Mayan characters dressed up very impressively (see photos). Overall I would very much recommend the Riu Palace Mexico hotel and beach, but, if you need beach shade, you should wait for the palm trees to recover from Wilma.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: SamgNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Riu Palace from a week-long vacation with my wife and two children (princess age 9 and boy age 14). I travel extensively on business -- both domestic US and international -- but have never stayed at a Riu Property. I also take vacations too infrequently. In other words, a week at the Palace needed to be perfect. And it was, by all measurable standards. Other reviews have commented on the food (I can confirm that Don Julian's is an exceptional buffet), the gorgeous beachfront (white sand that feels almost powdery and never hot), etc. so let me offer a number of other observations: This resort is PERFECT for families. My two children had the time of their lives. They were always made to feel like royalty in all areas of the property (from the pool to the restaurants to the internet cafe in the lobby). I can emphatically state that this is a kid friendly resort -- conversely under no circumstances was anyone's enjoyment inhibited by the presence of children. As mentioned, PERFECT for families of all sizes and ages. The resort's facilities are spotless and kept in outstanding condition. I had a room on the first floor and it was a quick and easy walk to the beach and the pool. The room was spacious, clean, and without hyperbole, the best I have ever stayed at. We had two cots brought into the room and it fit the family of four very very comfortably. I was prewarned about the "aroma" of the tropics but there was no smell of moisture, humidity, etc. Believe me, my honker would have detected anything amiss. The business model of the Riu is clearly one that promotes customer loyalty and retention. That is evident from how the staff interacts with the guests. From the moment I stepped out of the taxi and Manuel at the entrance greeted me to "his palace," I got the sense that all employees feel like they have a stake in the success of the resort. Manuel learned our names quickly and never stopped greeting us like we were long lost friends. Sylvia made sure that my princess and son knew how to use the computers. A special word of commendation goes to the client-facing staff of the Riu Palace. Two staff members in particular, Tamara van der Borgh and Sandra Guerrero Varela, were extraordinary in their service to the guests. Any question at all about the resort, activities, life in Playa del Carmen, they were ready to answer. Again, I am not sure how the Riu is able to attract and retain such exceptional staff -- but kudos to the management for having the foresight to have Tamara and Sandra on staff. They are gems and I miss them already. I arrived with very high expectations. They were met on all occassions. The Riu has clearly merited a return trip from my family -- and as long as Manuel still greets visitors at the door, and Tamara and Sandra work to ensure that the guests are treated as special as they are -- the Riu Palace will have my loyalty. I hope that this review will encourage others to visit. I am already planning a return visit for my family and friends. Viva Riu Palace!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great wedding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding at the RIU palace Mexico on the beach on April 1 and it was wonderful-this site helped me so much so I am paying it forward for future brides. For those considering a destination wedding-do it if you can go with the flow-it was an absolute blast and I was swimming on the beach the day of the wedding. Although some items went wrong it wasnt enough to ruin my day. My suggestion-just because it seems easier than a wedding at home still do your homework and be super organized. (From this site I concluded that the wedding coordinators only do so much) Yes, the wedding coordinators are not as organized as they could be. So make sure that you ask alot of questions and give tasks-my expectation was that they would handle things the way they handle weddings here in the states. Nope. They did forget that at our toast we ordered margaritas and champagne-had champagne only with no one to open or serve. They delivered the cakes to the bar area where we were having the toast-but no big deal-I just asked the waiter to take them to el Patio, which they did. The wedding coordinators were no where in site after the ceremony ended-literally, so they werent there to help when I needed it-for example a server to pour the champagne. The food (El Patio) was fantastic and the service excellent. I had prime rib for my wedding dinner. The cake tasted AWFUL, but not my priority anyway-dont order extra it is a waste-the one that comes with the wedding package is pretty enough for pics and symbolic to cut. The most confusion came from the day passes my outside guests had to buy. Make sure to negotiate a rate for day passes. They said 45 then 65 then 90 for a day pass, then tried to charge my guests 95 each the day of. Luckily I told them the price and they negotiated them for the entire day. The wedding coordinators tried to charge them extra-they know the prices so it didnt make me happy-I just thought they were trying to rip them off. Just so you know people can attend the 'ceremony only' for free if they are not staying at the hotel. Or they is a way to get to the beach right beside the hotel without passing through the lobby-guests could just enter there. I brought extra decorations for the tables and ceremony and the wedding coordinators did an excellent job on decorating to my specifications and they also played all my songs correctly during the ceremony-I teach drama so I made a cue sheet for them. I think that may have helped. We married on the beach, and yes everyone gathered around, which bothered me at first -but when it came time for me to walk down the beach I didnt see anyone except my fiance. It was neat to have people give us congrats the next day-everyone was very respectful and quiet during our ceremony-I was afraid of the topless beach thing and the pictures. Ha. The pictures are phenomenal. They are totally worth it. The wedding coordinators didnt direct my guests away from us during the photos so many guests jumped in the middle of our session-the sun was setting so we had to hurry. It was hard to be bride and coordinator but be aware you may need to assign a friend to shuffle people around the hotel after the ceremony. The pastor Kiko Flores was great! They excepted the changes I made to the ceremony and his reflection and support was great. Flowers were beautiful! We rented the ballroom at the Yucatan and that was fun-the DJ was good-I brought my own music just in case I wanted something specific. The person who did my hair at the spa did an excellent job too-I did my own makeup. The rooms, food and service are top notch along with the grounds. yes, bed are hard. No smell in our rooms. We were moved to a Jacuzzi suite and they are very sweet indeed. Jacuzzi on the second story patio with a big patio area. I could have just had my reception up there-it will hold about 30 people. Other suggestions for a wedding-the El Dorado Seaside Suites would be very romantic and the Iberostar seems way more organized than the RIU. Yes, there were mistakes (mistakes are made at home too) but all in all is was incredibly beautiful. Email if you have any questions about getting married at RIU!

Reviews.Title: “really loved the riu palace mexico!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i had my wedding at the riu palace mexico on 3/27/2006 ~ it was everything i had hoped for and then some!!! the location on the beach was just breathtaking & fabulous!!! my bouquet was gorgeous. the gals in the spa did a great job on my hair, & my make-up (considering i was peeling from being sun burnt so bad) they hid my peeling really really well!!! hahaha. food was exceptional, my cake was delicious!!! my family really really had a great time!!! one of the best resorts we have stayed at in a long time. great place to have a wedding!!! i am so glad i choose the Riu Palace Mexico!!! would i go back - YES YES YES!!! as a matter of fact we plan on going back on our 1 year anniversary!!! then 5yr- then 10yr!!! to all you brides out there - if you have any questions i can be emailed at: marym9939@earthlink.net the beach at this resort is absolutely gorgeous - have no desire to return to cancun - i love playa del carmen, the city is so quaint!!! LOVE IT~~~~

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace not my palace”
Reviews.Author: Paula010
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort in February 2006. The Riu Palace has beautiful grounds which are emaculately groomed. The rooms are also emaculate. The food and entertainment are good, not excellent, but good. There are several restraunts. However, you have to make reservations each morning before 10:30 for the restaurant of your choice for that evening. You cannot make reservations in advance, they must be made each morning. They have two sittings, I believe they are 6:30 and 9:30. If you are not at the desk early in the morning to make your reservation, you will be scheduled for the late sitting. Also, you may not be able to make a reservation at the restraunt of your choice. If you do not make it to the desk in time to make your reservation, you may be out of luck and your options will be to eat at the buffet restaurant or try your luck with the restaurant that you wanted to make reservations for and ask if they have any cancellations. You can't make reservations at a restaurant your first night unless you get to the resort very early in the morning. Our first night, we ate at the buffet. We forgot to make dinner reservations for one night, and we were turned away from the restaurant which we attemtpted to dine in, even though they had empty tables available. Bar service around the pool area was also very poor. It wasn't because the help that they had wasn't trying, it's just that they didn't have enough help to cover the area. You could easily wait more than 30 minutes before help would come around. The swim up bar was not always manned. The service not what you would expect at a resort with such a high rating. Our room was very clean. We were on the second floor and it was very noisy. We were woke up every morning around 6:00 by the people upstairs and the small children in the room next to us. The walls are very thin and you can hear the conversations in the room next to you. Also, our air conditioning unit did not work very well. Each night it felt like our bed linens were damp and we would stick to the blankets. The humidity in the room made it difficult to sleep. We attemped to upgrade or even just change our room with the front desk. They were not very helpful. As a matter of fact, the first question that they asked was who did we book through. When we replied "Apple Vacations", they indicated they had no other room to move us to. However, we met a couple who arrived after our arrival date. They were not satisfied with their room and requested to be moved. They were moved to another room. We have traveled quite a bit. We love beach vacations. However, this resort is situated so that there are no ocean views. We really missed the ocean view and the sounds from the ocean. The beach is very clean and it is nice for walking. Also, it is very nice to be able to stop at the other Riu resorts and be able to swim in their pools, or have a drink at their bars or even enjoy lunch in their restraunts. This resort is rated a 6 golden apple by Apple Vacations. Therefore, our expectations were high. I would not rate this a 6 golden. This may be a 6 golden for the area of Play Del Carmen, but it really wasn't as nice as other resorts we have visited that were rated less. We decided that the accomodations were not going to ruin our vacation. We had a great time. We just know that we will not go back to this resort and we wanted other people who are considering this resort to be aware of the problems we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: farmer72
Reviews.Content: We arrived home last night from the Riu and didn't want to leave. The service was excellent as were the grounds and atmosphere. I was really worried after reading some of the negative reveiws but we had no mold in our room and yes there was a smell but I would call it a tropical smell not a musty smell. The food was excellent, there was something for everyone even my picky eater. The pool and beach were great, very clean and well kept. There was always someone cleaning, do everything was spotless. We are already planning a trip for next year to the Riu.

Reviews.Title: “Super wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is superb. The quality of the hotel, location, food and staff are truly wonderful. We were there from march 11th-18th 2006. The staff is so polite and very courteous. The beach is gorgeous, the pool is great and the food is good. The way to make reservations for the dinner restaurants is a bit hard, when people book parties of 12 and 16. and there is really no easy way to do it and too big of a room, where people can cut in line ahead of you. However, the hotel rooms are wonderful, very spacious, the maid service is great and the in room bar is just to die for.... The gift shop is great for small unique items and very close to all shopping. Just a walk away, or a taxi cab for a further trip and more markets. to the plaza. We truly did nothing on our trip. We just relaxed on the beach and drank pina coladas. The weather was perfect. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again in a heart beat. There are other properties across the street and one door down each way, where you can have access as well.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time at Rui!”
Reviews.Author: kara8779
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Rui Palace Mexico and had a wonderful time. We were there for 7 nights. The grounds of the hotel are very nice and compact. We went to the Iberostar Parisio Maya last year and it was just to big. To get anywhere it seemed that you had to walk 1/2 mile. So this year we wanted a smaller resort. The food was fine, but we got sick of so we went and ate in town a couple of times. We have two young children 1 and 3 and they loved it to. They have a nice size kiddie pool and small palyground (very small). We also were able to get a babysitter from the front desk who helped us out durning the day chasing the kids. We had her everyday from 9-3. She was wonderful (Barbara). This resort had everything that we were looking and would definitly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to the Riu once in May for our honeymoon and now with 14 people. Was a little leary about hurricane damage but its very obvious that Cancun was hit the hardest. There were some resorts in Playya that did not have a beach so make sure you read the reviews carefully and look at photos before you book. Unless of course your a pool person. Rooms: After being there a 2nd time I realized that there is not much room in the bathrooms. Not a five star thats for sure. Other than that rooms are good enough and yes beds are hard. Bring your own pillow and you will be fine. Food: The Japanese was still our favorite and everyone else liked it to. Even the ones that were hesitant. The buffets for breakfeast lunch and dinner were still awesome. No one got sick at all even from food downtown. They keep things pretty clean in Playya Beach:The Riu has the best beach by far!! Be prepared to walk. The sand was so soft in the ocean no rocks or seashells. Just perfect!! Pool: Very clean not allot of room in there when there are what seemed like thousands of kids splashing. The Pool bar is great by the end of the week they know what you want and have it ready for you when you walk up. Town: I was really disapointed in town this time the prices seem very high. They were charging what it costs at home for there items. Why shop and have to lug around then? People were really rude this time did not even care if you were in there store or spent any money. I think Playya is not used to all these people and now that cancun is down, there all over the place. Lots of springbreakers!!!
