Oh and dont let them fool you they will allow in our hotel but the good part about it was they woke up when we were going to bed. HA HA Overall I love the Riu and am looking into again in Cabo. It truly is a beautiful place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico and had a wonderful week there. The Riu Palace had been highly recommended to us by friends, and all positive reports turned out to be perfectly accurate. The staff at the Riu Palace are wonderful. Everyone was friendly and extremely helpful. The PR folks walk around constantly chatting with guests to make sure that all is well. The room was great. Large and well-equipped. Excellent sound-proofing -- we couldn't hear TVs or any other noise from other rooms. The veranda was very nice as well. The food was great too, and there was a lot of it. Let's just say we availed ourselves of the buffets at Don Julian. Will hit the gym tomorrow as a consequence. Drinks were fun and plentiful. Other guests were pleasant, although why people think it's okay to smoke cigars in the presence of others is beyond me. There weren't too many cigar smokers there, but one cigar is too many in my book. Not many kids, and the only teenagers/young twenty-somethings were there with their parents. If you're looking to avoid spring breakers, the Riu Palace is a good place to go. The beach is awesome and much better than the other beach property we saw in the area (and we visited several other resorts, just out of curiosity). Always plenty of room, and lots of trees. The water is gorgeous. We didn't spend any time in the pool area (except to grab a drink at the bar), but it was very pretty. Location was great. Very nice to have Playa del Carmen so nearby (a nice 30 minute walk). We took a bus to Cancun and spent the day there. Ugh. If you like being surrounded by lots of people and noise, Cancun may suit you. We, on the other hand, were looking to escape the city, and Riu Palace Mexico was perfect for that. We ate lunch at the Riu Cancun while we were in Cancun, and the hotel was much more rambunctious and loud (and the guests were much younger) than at the Palace. It certainly appears that if you do your homework, you can pick a Riu which suits your personality. Chichen Itza was great, despite picking a rainy and rather cold day to go. We took the bus, rather than a tour, and thus were able to see it at our own pace. In summary, we highly recommend the Riu Palace Mexico. We had a great time, and would certainly go back again the next time we're looking for a week of relaxation in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise!!!!”
Reviews.Author: thomlin
Reviews.Content: We just got back last night from a stay a the Riu Palace Mexico. We were there from 3/19 to 3/26 & it wasn't long enough! I tend to be a harsh critic, but I could not find one thing to complain about. I am very mold sensitive & I was concerned after reading some of the previous postings before we left, but I saw no evidence of mold anywhere in our room or anywhere else on the property. We were on the second floor facing the Wyndham & we never heard any noise from that resort at all & we are usually asleep by midnight. I was amazed at how clean the resort was kept--from our room which was cleaned twice a day to the pool area restrooms which were always being checked/restocked & cleaned. All of the people that worked at the resort were extremely helpful & friendly & would go out of their way to make you feel welcome--they seemed genuinely happy to assist you (a rare occurrance nowadays!). The food at the resort was fantastic--such a variety of choices! We ate at all of the reservation restaurants & liked the gourmet (Sir Edward) the best--the filet mignon was great & the lambchops suberb! For atmosphere, the beach steakhouse was very nice, although my husbands steak wasn't the greatest. I had the tuna steak which was excellent--I would recommend that instead of the steak. The Japanese restaurant had very good food & atmosphere also but we had a late lunch in town & I think we were still too full to fully enjoy it. The Brazilian restaurant was good but not our favorite--too much meat for us. As for the drinks, we usually drink wine or beer but we did try some of the frozen drinks & they were very good (maybe not super strong alcohol wise but you are drinking all day--probably better off this way!) Also, I would think if you requested an extra shot of alcohol in your drink the staff would happily comply. The beer that is served is Corona on tap & the wines were better than I expected. We did not like the Villamor wine (Portugese or Spanish I think) but we liked the Calafia (Mexican)alot (both red & white were good) & we had a rose' from Spain with dinner one night & it was also good. They also had a Chilean Cabernet that was very good. For dinner they will bring you a bottle of wine & put it on a stand next to your table which was a nice touch. They have nightly shows at 9:45pm either in the courtyard or on the stage (check with someone to find out where the show will be to get a good seat). They did a rendition of Grease that was very cute and had a traditonal Mayan ritual in full costume in the courtyard that was very interesting to see. We found the pool area very nice & although it would get crowded chairs were readily available all day long. The swim up pool bar is nice & if you bring an insulated mug from home they will fill it & your drinks stay cold. The beach is also very nice, again alot of available chairs & not as crowded most days as the pool. If it seems too hot by the pool, the beach gets the ocean breeze & will be a little cooler. We did decide to walk into PDC one day & my only advice is not to do this mid-day when it's 90 degrees & sunny. It was further than we thought & actually on that day we didn't make it into the center of town (which is the nicest part) because we were too hot & knew we still had to walk all the way back. There are alot of discount souvenir stands in town, so I would recommend buying souvenirs there rather than in the complex (t-shirts were $3 at one store in town & were the same as $12-$15 dollar ones at the little shops near the resort). Another thing, I don't think I would recommend this walk late at night unless you are in a large group. It isn't well lit at all. On our second walk there, we came back just after dark & there were still alot of other people walking around so it was fine. The only bad thing that happened during the entire trip was on the first or second day I got bit by something (mosquitos??)all over my leg. It was extremely itchy & we had to buy some cream to put on it from a pharmacy. I believe I got bitten on our room balcony because it faced the back of the complex & that area probably doesn't get sprayed for insects as much. My advice is if you are the type to get bitten by mosquitos at home (my husband is not -- not one bite ever!!) bring insect repellent & wear it after sunset. I brought some but never saw any mosquitos so I didn't think I needed it. After my episode I would wear it every night & never got any more bites. We did walk through all of the other Riu complexes & definately thought the Riu Palace Mexico was much nicer than all of the others. We met many nice people from England, Germany, Norway & of course all over the U.S. It seems that this resort does have alot more Europeans than the others & we enjoyed meeting & talking with them. To sum up a long review, I would just say that we thought that the Riu Palace exceeded our expectations on all accounts --the complex was beautiful/staff wonderful/rooms very large & clean/food was out of this world/the wine & other drinks very good/beach & pool exceptional--and would definately recommend it if you are looking for a nice relaxing vacation. We will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to chill out”
Reviews.Author: changesinlattitudes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico and absolutely loved it! Hotel grounds: Amazing, clean, and beautiful The beach: Pleantly of chairs and shade could always be found, sometimes you had to get a little creative with the positioning of your chair. After walking up and down the beach looking at the other resorts near by, I am convinced that our beach was the nicest because there was pleantly of room between the chairs The pool: Again pleanty of chairs and shade. I had read reviews about the water being cool, but we found the water to be a great temperature, as did many others who were swimming. The rooms: I was a little nervous about reading the reviews about the mold on the couch. So the first thing we did was to inspect the couch. We saw no evidence of mold, but we were also on the second level. My only complaint was that the safe was rather small and was not electronic, but that is just small potatoes. The room did have an interesting smell, but to me it is the smell that all tropical places have and I did not notice it after the first day. The food: The food was good. The guacamole was amazing!! Breakfast was my favorite. I consider myself a very picky eater and will not eat any seafood. I always found enough to eat. We stayed at the buffet for most nights. We tried the steakhouse "El Patio" and it was good as well. They served steak, chicken, fish, ribs, and a vegatable entree so at that everyone could find something to eat there. We did not get sick at all, but we did had ciprofloxacin on hand just incase. The drinks: Not very strong. But by having weak drinks you can sample more cocktails from the menu. I recommend the "Passion Dreams". The staff and service: The staff was very polite and helpful. The service was outstanding, the best we have had at an all inclusive. We did bring along $1 bills to tip with. I don't think it improved our service, but the staff was very appreciative and we would have felt bad not tipping. The one place where it might have made a difference was with the maid-we got towel animals! Other: Make sure to bring lots of sunscreen because it is very expensive to purchase at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from March 9th through March 16th. Our room was great, the food was great, the pool was great, the beach was the best that we've been to in Mexico. The drinks were plenty strong enough for us, and we enjoyed the entertainment. Jose Luis and the staff at the front desk were helpful, Raul, Nancy, Miriam, and Ibrahim at the piano bar were great, and the kid at the beach bar made great Miami Vice drinks! We plan to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have done a lot of traveling around the Carribean and Mexico, including some all-inclusives. Here is my version of the short story concerning this hotel. We are from Texas, USA. -Hotel, grounds, beach, staff - primo, posh euro style. Beach is huge, palm trees had leaves torn off by hurricane, so not as much shade as there used to be as reported by return guests. -Rooms The Bad - Unbearable Bad Mildew - tried to switch, but it was more problem than it was worth. They gave us the run around, and I just wanted to get on with my honeymoon. Just dealth with it. My wife is very sensitive to molds, and it made her a little sick during the stay. Noisy on perimeter of hotel due to adjacent hotels. If you don't go to bed until 1:00, or pass out at night, not a problem. Didn't really bother me. -Rooms The Good - Very nice decor and water pressure. Nice bar in room -Food - Very good buffets. Also available is specialty restaraunts that require reservations, but very hard to get reservations. Must get up at 8:30AM the day of reservation, and then you might get a 9:00PM reservation if you are lucky. They schedule 6:30, and 9:00, that is all. -Drinks - OK. We all seem to think liquor is watered down by staff. By we all - I mean everyone we met during our stay - people from other countries, etc. Also, they do not carry premimum liquors, or at least what we consider permium liquors in Texas. -Age of Guests - ranged from 5-80. As a 41 year old that is 29 years old at heart, I felt there were a lot of old people there. However, I happen to like old people, so that was fine. Its better than putting up with punks who have just had their 1st beer ever. Just don't plan on coming down here looking to pick up young chicks at this hotel, you won't find many. Now on the other hand, if you are a woman that wants to do a little gold digging, this might be the place for you. A few "stuffy" ones in the crowd as well. I just didn't let them get to me. A few topless Grannies, didn't really need to see that...... a few topless hunees - that was nice - they were from other hotels, walkng down our beach. -Guests were from international locations all over the world. This was a cool. I enjoy meeting people from other countries. I've been to hotels in MX that everyone was from Houston. That is great, just attempting to explain this is not one of those places. -SCUBA - Got one 45' dive in, then too windy to get boat out after that. 45' dive was bad. reefs covered in sand. They owe me a refund, but I'll probably never see the money. One thing I've learned in Mexico is to pay as you go. Scuba crew was decent, but I've had better. They do not have a boat dock, but they do pull the boat in near the beach and you wade over to it with your equipment. You only bring yourself and your equipment. Leave sunglasses, towels, sunscreen etc behind. -Nightlife - Nice shows, I'm not much of a show guy. Nice dance club across the street, same hotel chain. Opens at 11:00PM and gets a little punkish after 12:45. -Gym - Weights are old, but functional for the most part. I've seen better in other resorts. Nice setting though, near the beach, with lots of open windows. They need to put more effort into maintaining it, because it has lots of potential. -Pool - Nice, but cold -Hot Tubs - COLD. -Bar - Very posh, european style. -Trip from airport - about 45 minutes to 1.5 hours depending on circumstances. they will return you to airport about 3 hours early if you let them. Wife got sick last night. She is adament about not drinking water, ate same thing everyone else ate except for the mussels, which she indicated did not taste right so she quit eating them immediately. Will I go back??? Probably not. There are better locations and there is a lot of competition down there.

Reviews.Title: “We had a terrific time at the Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family returned last night from the Riu Palace Mexico. We had a terrific time, and were very pleased with the food, the amenities and the atmosphere. I also liked that you could walk to downtown Playa del Carmen easily from the hotel (25-30 minutes, one way), and you could also take a good hour-long walk on the beach, sometimes passing other resorts but also on empty beach. I did not like the moldy smell, which I detected in the main dining room one night and in our room often. I did not see any mold, but thought the smell was that of heavy upholstery and drapes that have been in humid weather. Our room -- and the hotel -- were very clean. I was impressed that the hotel had small maintenance projects going on daily --- freshly painted trash cans, newly washed windows, etc. The entertainment was lame, but we were there to relax as a family, so we were happy there were lots of nice places to sit and have a drink so that we could talk. We took a trip to Chichen Itza one day -- it was a 12-hour day and, while we enjoyed it, would not have done it if we knew the bus would stop at a touristy souvenir shop for 30 minutes and that we would have to change buses on the side of the highway! Tip: while the marketplace at the hotel is very convenient (it is set up by local vendors in the hotel's courtyard a couple of times a week), the prices are downright gouging. If you can shop elsewhere during your trip, do.

Reviews.Title: “You want to be pampered stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fabolous time we had there. Relaxing, unbelievable service. The food was excellent but most important the staff were the best. The resort was first class. You want to be pampered, relax, enjoy great food, drinks and great service I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 4 couples went to the Riu Palace instead of the Riu Playacar this year. The Palace is much larger and more beutiful by far. ---Beach Best around- crowded but there are plenty of chairs. ---Pool The pool is nice (big pool bar). I was surprised that it was not as "stuffy" as I thought it would be. I thought it would be full of snooty people for some reason. The pool (like all others) has towels on the chairs at 6:00 am from jerks that reserve them for several hours. If you want a big party , you can walk next door to the Yucaton (best pool around). -----Rooms: Nice- DO NOT get a room on the north side overlooking the Windham unless you like listening to loud music and parties until 2:00 am. ---Food THe food is good. We tried all the restaraunts and they are ok. THe buffet always has something good. Breakfast buffet is great. ---Service: As good as any. ---Price: High. We are used to going for $1000 (usd) less. Overall ir was worth trying the nicest of the 4 Riu Hotels. The new Palace (by the way)has a breakwall for a beach. The Palace Mexico is better!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the mold in this hotel it is not a joke”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaRuthie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Riu Palace Mexico, we took our 11 years old daughter and her three friends age 11,12 and 13. We arrived on March 10th the moment we entered the lobby we could smell the mold. The grounds are beautiful, the workers are constantly pruning and grooming the property, the grounds are spectacular, but this resort puts nothing into the rooms. The moment that I entered the room I knew I was in trouble. The smell of the mold just totally overwhelms you. The sofa in my room and my childrens room was covered in mold, there was a cigarette burn hole in the comforter in my room, it was old and ragggedy. The final straw for me was when I found lipstick on the pillow in the childrens room and they do not wear lipstick. We travelled through Apple vacations, the next morning I went to see the Apple rep at the resort. I expressed my dis-approval and requested to be moved to the new Riu property which is the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. The rep. was very helpful and they moved us right away. The Riu Palace Riviera Maya was fantastic. It is new, very clean and most important no mold. We did the buffet every night because of the children and it was good, nothing special, but there is something for everyone. If you are looking for night life this is not the place for you, it is a ghost town after 10:30pm. I would recommend this new property Riu Palace Riviera Maya resort to everyone, but stay away from the Riu Palace Mexico, if you don't have a problem with a moldy sofa and raggedy dirty sheets then this is the place for you, but this is no joke, I am not a picky person but I like cleanliness and that is not a lot to ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the RIU Palace, Mexico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the RIU Palace, Mexico and loved every moment from the time we arrived to the day we left. Hotel Grounds - the grounds to the hotel are beautiful and very well kept. Every day the hotel staff were working so hard to keep the hotel grounds clean and well groomed. They worked so hard and did a fabulous job. They always greeted us with a smile on their face when we would pass by. The floor tiles shined, the chandeliers sparkled and the hotel was very very clean. The hotel rooms are big and beautiful and the service in the hotel rooms was fabulous. We would walk into animals made of towels, a rose on the bed and a thank you card for staying at the RIU. After our first night, the front desk called our room to see if there was anything that we needed and how we were enjoying our stay....great service. We received hotel room service every morning and every night. They would make our beds in the morning and get our room ready for night time. Food - There was a lot of variety in food and it was all delicious. We went to the specialty restaurants and really enjoyed the Japanese and loved the French restaurant. We also went to the Brazilian restaurant, but didn't enjoy that as much. The buffets were good and everything seemed so fresh. Lots of variety to meet all tastes. Service - The service was outstanding. There was always someone to offer a helping hand when we had a question. There was always someone to make sure our glasses were full whether it be at the dinner table or bar. All of the staff were always so pleasant after working such long hours. I really praise the staff as they really worked hard. There was always a smile on their faces. Entertainment - The hotel entertainment kept us busy with their daily activities and their nightly shows. The dancers worked really hard in the evening and did a great job. It was nice to have access to the other RIU hotels so that we could enjoy their facilities as well. The new hotel that just opened has an amazing pool. Beach - The beach was absolutely beautiful. It was long and wide and we never had any trouble getting a lounger. The ocean is a beautiful green/blue colour and was so very warm. There are lots of activities to do on the beach, such as parasailing, wave runners, scuba diving, snorkeling, etc. A lot of people were walking around selling silver, cigars and sunglasses. Not pushy at all and they were selling things at good prices. After taking a walk on the beach, I think our hotel had one of the best parts of the beach. Out of all the RIU hotels we had access too, we definitely liked the RIU Palace Mexico best and would stay there again. It was nice to have access to the disco across the street and it seemed real lively there, but as much fun as that was, it was nice to go back to a hotel that was quite. The Riu Palace, Riviera was beautiful, but it almost seemed too much. We loved everything about the RIU Palace Mexico and can't wait to go again. We met a lot of wonderful people during our stay there and everyone was in agreement about the hotel and service. This was definitely a five star hotel for us and the best hotel we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Riu Palace Mexico with my husband and 2 college aged children. It was our first time visiting Mexico. I pretty much knew what to expect after reading all of the reviews. The Palace met most all of my expectations. Lobby and Grounds: Spotless and beautiful. Pool: Some of the previous reviews mentioned that the pool was small, but it looked plenty big to me. We never actually used the pool. Beach: Incredible! Beautiful soft white sand, aqua blue warm water, plenty of loungers and shady spots. Bar is a short walk away. We loved the "Costa Caribe" frozen drinks! There were a few topless women on the beach, but it wasn't really noticible if you weren't looking for it. We absolutely LOVED the beach. Food: Pretty good. I'm not a big fan of buffets, but there was so much food that it would be difficult not to find something that you liked to eat. The fruit bar at dinner was amazing and the coconut ice cream was the best I've ever had. We all drank the water at lunch and dinner and ate plenty of fruit, salad and veggies and nobody got sick or had any stomach issues. Room: Stayed in room 1120. Looked pretty much like the pictures. Good sized room with a small sitting area and balcony. We had a garden view on the Viva Maya side. I kind of wish that I hadn't seen the posted picture of the moldy couch because even though our couch was not moldy, it still kind of gave me the creeps. I actually never sat on it. One morning I looked outside and noticed three couches out in the grass. I guess they may have a problem with those couches getting moldy and were trying to dry them in the sun. Our room did not have any moldy smell at all and was very clean. The bathroom was fine - decent size. Only issue was the lack of light in the shower, but it was really not a big deal. One thing... if you are looking for a quiet room, I would ask for one on the Riu Yucatan side. Every night between 10 and 11 the entertainment would start at the Viva Maya and it was LOUD! We could hear it CLEARLY, even with the sliding door closed as our room was directly across from the entertainment area. The music ranged from a Nora Jones type singer to a Santana cover band, which actually started at 11pm. We didn't really mind it most nights, but the Santana night nearly sent me over the edge. We were exhausted from a long day at Chichen Itza and had difficulty getting to sleep until it was over. Hey, we dealt with it. Not worth getting stressed about, but if you go to bed early and like things quiet, ask for a room on the other side! I was looking forward to seeing the towel art after all of the hype, but never did. We did tip daily, but never got towel art. We did get some beautiful flowers in the bath one day though! Staff: Great service. Incredibly warm and friendly people. I LOVED Manuel the doorman and Eduardo at the dinner buffet. One thing I also wanted to mention... We booked a day trip to Chichen Itza through Olympus Tours in the lobby. They ended up calling our room at 11pm to tell us that they would have to move our trip to the following day as they were overbooked. I wasn't crazy about taking a bus tour to begin with and was a bit nervous about renting a car, so I suggested to my husband that we ask if it was possible to hire a driver to take us there. For an additional $24.00 per person, we were able to get a private van and driver to take us! It was WONDERFUL! The driver gave us a tour of the city and explained all of the architecture and history. Once we arrived at C.I., there was a private guide waiting who gave us a tour through the ruins. Both the driver and guide were so passionate about the history of their country and were so wonderful. We felt spoiled having our own guides and wouldn't have gotten half as much out of the experience without them. Definitely worth the extra $24.00 per person (plus tips). I will say that the 3 hour drive was a bit long and about 30-40 minutes of it was over a VERY bumpy road. The tour bus may have been more comfortable, but we were so happy to have our own private van and be able to call our own shots, that it was a small price to pay. All in all it was a great trip. We will definitely return to the Riu Palace Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “we loved the riu palace mexico”
Reviews.Author: pepv
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and mine first time to the Riu. Actually it was our first experience in Mexico. We had a wonderful time. The Riu Palace was beautiful. The food was good. The staff were very happy all of the time and were there for all our needs. We plan on going back next year around the same time. We loved that we could have the quiet relaxing atmoshere at the Palace and then go across the street or down the beach to another Riu and have the night life. There were no problems getting a lounge chair at the beach or the pool. I've read in many reviews that the walk to the beach is long. It was, but we didn't mind. The walk really wasn't that bad. And the setting was beautiful. The Ocean was so blue and the sand so white and not hot!! Our room was on the second floor. We had a balcony that over looked a court yard. We loved the fact that the balcony had a high wall. This gives you a little more privacy, if you know what I mean. We had a decent view when standing, no view at all when sitting. The room was cleaned 2 times a day. The only complaint that I had was when we went into Playa del Carmen one evening. My husband was approached to buy some drugs. Again, this was not at the resort. Never did we experience this there. Everything was perfect at the resort. Actually there was everything that we needed there. We didn't have to leave it at all! As far as the food goes, we were very satisfied with it. There was plenty of it. Food seemed to be available every hour of the day somewhere in the resort. Being this was our first trip to Mexico I have nothing to compare it too. Neither one of us seemed to be starving by no means!! Actually, food was an afterthought. There were to many other things to do!!! We can't wait to go back next year. Hopefully we'll see a lot of the same staff. It is paradise. Just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaribTraveler71
Reviews.Content: The RIU Palace Mexico is a beautiful, clean and well maintained hotel with a great location and fabulous beach. You will definitely enjoy your stay here. Here are some specific comments: Rooms: We had a room on the 3rd floor with a beautiful view of the fountains and courtyard. The room was immaculately clean and spacious with no musty smell. When we checked in, there were rose petals sprinkled on the beds and bathroom and towel art in the shape of two swans made into a heart - very nice touch. The only con was the 2 double beds instead of a king size bed. Otherwise, the room was perfect. Beach: Amazing beach - tons of room, no problem getting a loungechair, very clean beach, crystal clear blue water. It's only a short walk to the beachbar to get a drink and staff does bring drinks to the beach periodically. Food: The food was good, but not great. There was a good variety to choose from at the breakfast buffet and lunch at the El Patio and La Travieta was good too with a good variety to choose from. We also ate ate at La Bodega and Sir Edward which we enjoyed very much. We did not care for the Japanese restaurant at all - the food did not taste fresh. People make too much regarding the dinner reservations - really it's no big deal at all. We never waited in line more than 5 minutes to get a reservation. Entertainment: During the daytime, there are many activities to choose from such as pool volleyball, beach volleyball, darts, scuba, snorkeling, jetskiing, parasailing - something for everyone. The nightime entertainment was nice too. There was always a band in the courtyard playing live music until 11pm and a 9:45pm show in the showlounge. The shows were by no means broadway performances, but were humorously entertaining. Staff: Very friendly staff always sincere and willing to serve you with a smile. Never a problem to get waited on in any of the restaurants or bars. We did not meet one rude staff member. They were all genuinely polite and happy to accomodate the guests. Overall, it was a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: 1sttimerinCancun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RUI Playacar Sunday 2/26 to Thursday 3/2. 1st time in Mexico and 1st time at an all-inclusive. We thought it was very nice. By far the RIU Playacar has the largest beach in Playacar. The rooms are very nice and kept clean. We didn't find stained sheets or anything like that like I have seen on previous posts. My husband thought he died and went to Heaven with the Corona on tap. I just loved trying all sorts of different drinks too!! Food was OK - the breakfast buffet was excellent, lunch was good too. The dinners were fair. The steak in at the steakhouse was excellent. The Mediterrean dinner was lousy. We ended up walking out and hitting the buffet. The dinner buffet was OK - not what I expected. I thought there would be a lot of seafood and it would be very good. Except for the shrimp - the seafood all tasted very fishy. Each night they had a different main meat - prime rib (just OK), ham, pork, etc. Then the potatoes, veggies, etc. There was also a pasta bar at both the lunch and dinner buffet which was very good. Fresh fruit all to die for! We talked to alot of people down there who go all the time and they said the food is the same at all the all-inclusives (except for maybe the really expensive ones?). Pool area very nice - although we are beach people and were happy on the beach. Waves were nice, water was beautiful. Activities all day long - there is large chart in the main lobby that tells you what is going on each day. My husband played beach volleyball every day and there was plenty of room at our beach. Some of other resorts had the volleyball but it was all squeezed in with the chaises, etc. Their beaches were just not as large or as nice as ours. My only concern in the future would be - they are building a new place right next door. Their beach is really tiny. I would think that some of the people would use Playacars beach? Overall, nice anniversary trip. Would go back to Playacar and RIU.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: travelbeth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got home last night and I couldn't wait to write this review! We have an 18 month old and one on the way, so we wanted to get away just the 2 of us on a relaxing vacation for 5 days. The Riu Palace Mexico was the perfect place for just that. If I repeat what a lot of the reviews say I apologize. Flight-USAirways. No problems at all either way. The Cancun airport was a madhouse when we were on our way home but the lines went quickly and it was organized. Transfers-Olympus Tours. Very happy with them overall. Friendly, helpful, available at the hotel during the day for questions regarding the resort and excursions they offered. Resort-Spotless. Hard working employees cleaning constantly and maintaining the beautiful grounds. Beautiful fountains, green grass, lovely flowers and palm trees around. CAUTION-Be careful if it rains, the ground is very slippery however there are signs warning of this. I've never seen so much detail in the archetecture anywhere-marble and tiled floors and walls, arched roofs, spiral staircases, huge chandeliers in the lobby, high ceilings, mosaics and intricate woodwork throughout. Check out the chapel in the lobby if you can, it's beautiful. TIP-If you are physically unable to climb steps it's a good idea to get a room on the ground floor. There's only one elevator and it's in the lobby. Pool-I agree with other reviews that it is small and cold as well as the jacuzzi being cold. I liked the mosaic flowers at the bottom of the pool as a decoration though. Plenty of chairs at the pool available most of the days we were there. Plenty of umbrellas and small tables if you need them. Tons of hammocks between the pool area and beach to chill out on. My husband got a spa treatment and enjoyed it. Beach-Amazing. Clean. White sand that doesn't stick much to you. Water-Crystal clear and the bluest I've ever seen. Great waves. Only thing I wasn't too thrilled about were the people walking around trying to sell shells, jewerly and the motorized watersports. They weren't pushy but it was still a tad irritating. Employees-I found them to be extremely friendly yet they weren't overbearing as some can be at other resorts. They know that this particular Riu is one where most people go to relax and not need to be involved in a bunch of loud activities. I loved it. However there were activities every hour if intersted. Room-Fantastic. We were on the top floor with a terrace. Wasn't too flipped on that but it wasn't a huge deal. There are balconies in other rooms where you can see out, just ask for it. Room was sparkling clean and the water pressure in the shower was the best!!! Booze was available (unfortunately I couldn't drink it being preggo) in the room as well as a stocked fridge of water and soda. Don't drink the tap water in the room. The bed was firm but I didn't think it was as awful as some of the reviews said. Definitly a personal preference. Room was made up twice a day. Wonderful wonderful wonderful!!! OH-I did notice a little bit of mold on the top of the couch but if I didn't read the previous review about it, I wouldn't have even noticed! Food-I rate it between very good and fantastic. We didn't like the specialty restaurant (Sir Edwards) b/c the service was slow and our fish was dry. The buffet was awesome, so was the steakhouse (nice-it's on the beach), the Japanese restaurant was good and we didn't try the Brazilian one. Please--it's ok to drink the water they provide to you as well as eat the fruit and vegetables. We did not get sick at all. TIP-if you arrive in the afternoon and want to eat in one of the restaurants that night, go to the restaurant at 6:45 and ask if there's any cancellations. We were able to get a seat at the steakhouse without a problem. We had no problems getting a rez the other nights, we waited no longer than 2 minutes to sign up. It's not a hassle at all. Excursion-We rented a car and drove to Cancun then down to Tulum. Tulum was awesome especially being on the beach. CAUTION-Don't drive like you do at home. The roads are paved well but get extremely slippery when it rains. We saw 2 accidents that day! Just be careful, drive slower than usual and you'll be fine! And go into town (Playa del Carmen) onto 5th Avenue. It's an open street where you can walk down and check out shops, restaurants and bars. The Blue Parrot was fun and it's on the beach. Overall-This IS a 5 star resort for what we paid (good deal) and the experience we had. If you compare it to a Ritz-Carlton or one of the 5 star resorts in America, I would rank it up there, but wouldn't pay the ridiculous amount of money for a Ritz just b/c of the name. I know this was long-winded but hope it was helpful. Have a GREAT time!! No worries!!

Reviews.Title: “Still Beautiful...”
Reviews.Author: Blase' Jose'
Reviews.Content: We returned to the RIU Palace on February 25th after our 1st experience there in March of 2005. We originally planned to return in 2007 but had such a wonderful time in 2005 that we decided to return again this year. This year, we were a group of 6 and were very pleased to see that (almost) all evidence of the hurricanes at the hotel was gone. Except for the "cropped" palm trees, everything was as we remembered it...extremely clean rooms, extremely friendly service. It was fun to see many of the same faces working there from last year. We did notice more children there this year. We were disappointed that each night, there was an activity for the children in the lounge at around 8:45 which cut into the evening entertainment in the courtyard. We also thought we'd see some different entertainment than last year but the shows were pretty much the same. I personally would like to see a better variety of beer (only Corona and Negro Medelo) but that is not a complaint. We did Parasail this year which was beautiful. I recommend you do that mid-week as Friday, Saturday and Sunday were very busy. My wife and I also had massages in the Spa (not on the beach) which did not disappoint. The beach remains one of the very best we've ever been to. It was harder to find shade this time because of the beating the palm trees took during the hurricane but the palm branches are sprouting and will soon be regrown. (Since it was -14 degrees when we left Wisconsin, looking for shade was a nice problem to have). Our only bad experience came in Play del Carmen when we met our wives in town (after they spent the day shopping) to have a drink and dinner at one of the local restaurants. We met at a bar called "La Pinata" right on the beach near the pier where the shuttles to Cozumel embark. (La Pinata is NOT the little thatch covered bar right next to the shuttle pier but the next Thatch bar further down the beach). Our first clue should have been when the Mariachi Band demanded $10 after they did a song for us. But the real shock was the $110 bill we got for the 6 beers and 6 margarita's we drank! DON'T GO TO THIS PLACE unless you like $11 margarita's or you feel like getting ripped off. There are plenty of other bars in town where the people are grateful for your business (such as the Tequilla Barrel, or the one we called "The Swing Bar" which has rope swings around the bar). We were so put off after our experience at La Pinata that we decided to return to the Riu Palace for dinner. My advice is to visit Playa del Carmen for some fun shopping or to sample the Mexican beers and return to the RIU Palace to enjoy the wonderful amenities and great service that they provide. You won't be disappointed here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Riu Palace Mexico...was a good trip overall. Pros: *Good food; not gourmet but good; would say the buffet is the best deal for dinner *spic n span *Staff was friendly but not overtly so *Good sized rooms *Wonderful ice cream & guac *Beautiful, deep beach *Quiet relaxing vacation; not many kids..the kids that were there looked bored *Lots of chairs on the beach Cons: *Lots of smoking-this chain caters to Europeans so lots of smokers *Reservations for restaurants a pain in the butt *Desserts were kinda lame *Walk from hotel to beach-hard; they need to build in some steps or something *Trees still recovering from hurricane; should offer umbrellas/palapas *Warm beer *Chair saving hogs-hate when people put towels on chairs and never return..especially bad at the pool! *Don't get a massage..they did a poor job

Reviews.Title: “An acceptable well-managed resort but not 5-star”
Reviews.Author: surfermom
Reviews.Content: The rooms - 3-stars. Bathroom was small and very dark. Beds were hard (if only every hotel bed be a Westin Heavenly Bed!). Maid service was very good. Balconies have tall solid concrete railings and are almost worthless. Room service is available for continental breakfast and is included. La playa - 3-stars, but only if you don't mind the jet ski noise and fumes. They run all day long. Staff keeps beach very clean. Plenty of lounge chairs available, but it made the beach feel crowded. Very little shade available on the beach. Long beach walks to the West take you to undeveloped coastline. Bring some cash and get a massage at the tents set up near the beach. The bars - 5-stars. Good service, good liquors and mixers. Fresh fruit used in many drinks. Wines are all local - stick to the whites. Servers will occassionally bring trays of drinks to the beach. Bottled water is available in the mini bar and is included. The food - 4-stars for the hot food, 5-stars for cold. The salad bar was great. Wonderful guacomole, ceviche, artichokes, hearts of palm. Always fresh fruit. The prepared hot food was very good, seemed to be prepared from fresh ingredients. Breakfast was always good with plenty of variety. Skip the theme restaurants. Making reservations is stressful, the food was not as good as the buffet, and the service was below average. The entertainment - 1 star. was good only for a laugh. Entertain yourself with a cognac and a walk on the beach instead (bring a jacket). Entertainment across the street at the Riu Tequila was a little livelier. Unfortunately, if you want to go to bed before midnight and your room is near the courtyard (most are) then you will have to listen to a mexican band playing Frank Sinatra as you drift off. The scene - 5 stars. A nice mix of european, mexican, and american tourists, couples, seniors, and families. Many wedding parties. No young singles. No spring breakers. Some topless sunbathing.

Reviews.Title: “Food does not s--- at the Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: BurntOrange58
Reviews.Content: Felt compelled to write another review after reading about the couple stating it was sooooooo bad and the food s----!!!! The food was amazing when we were there, even at the buffet the choice was outstanding, something for everyone and different every day. I am travelling to mexico again this year but to a different resort so I have been keeping an eye on the reviews. To my British counterparts I would like to say, keep a very open mind when reading these reviews, Americans are very harsh critics at times and this can be misleading, what they consider unacceptable, to Europeans is more than adequate. At the Riu Palace the food was excellent, rooms amazing, service was impeccable, staff very friendly. You will not be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: roro79
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from Feb 3-10. So here i go..... First of all, we reserved a private van (Alltournative travel) to take us from the airport to the hotel. It cost us 110.00 round trip. THey were there waiting for us when we got out of the airport. They were also on time picking us up to take us back to the airport. THe van was very clean and the driver was very nice. When we got in the van he asked us if we wanted to stop and get beer or something to drink, which we didn't. We couldn't wait to get to the hotel. Once we arrived at the hotel, we couldn't believe our eyes, the entrance was beautiful and VERY clean. We checked in and were given a drink. THe staff at the front desk was very helpful and nice. We arrived at our room and couldn't believe how big it was even the bathroom. Very clean! We had a stocked refrigerator which was also included and an alcohol dispenser which also was included. The room did smell musty but i think they all do in Mexico. The beds were kind of hard so we requested a pad for it and they came right away. We did not have a room facing the courtyard which would of been beautiful. Our balcony was very big. They have two lawn chairs and you could actually layout there. The pool area was very clean and you do not need to get up extra early to get a chair. The pool water was very cold. THere were servers constantly walking around the pool asking if you needed a drink. THe beach was very nice but the water was also cold. THe one thing we didn't like about the beach is that it was a tiresome walk from the beach up to the pool area. You have to walk up a hill. THere were no servers on the beach you had to walk to a nearby bar. The only thing we really hated was you had to get up early to make reservations to the resturants. You have to get out of bed between 8:30-10:30 and go down and make reservations. They really need to change that. We really liked Miyagi and The Patio. Those were the only two we ate at, besides Don Julian (buffet). We thought the food was good at all of the above. We had no complaints. Although my husband and i are very simple eaters. The staff at all the resturants were very friendly and catered to your needs. The breakfast buffet was also very good with a lot to choose from. The lunch buffet at La Traviata and Il Patio were both very good. They do try to change up the food daily, they never had the same thing twice in a row. But don't expected to not see the same foods changed up in the buffet. But all of it was good. THe cleaning people were very nice and catered to your every need. Anything you needed you would call the front desk and they would have someone up to your room within 10 minutes. NO SIGNS OF THE HURRICANES!!! THe evening shows were very good so don't miss them. My husband loved the pool activities and did them every day. The activity staff is very friendly. All in all, we had a great trip and highly recommend this hotel to couples. There were not a lot of kids there so i don't know if you would want to bring your kids. This is a very relaxed hotel no partying. So if that is what your looking for, this hotel is not for you. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: marian01
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from the Riu Palace Mexico and it was fantastic. Everything was top notch. There were four of us, 2 adults,16 year old and 11 year old. Our room was more than big enough for us. We received a room with a couch that folds out into a bed and with 2 doubles pushed together it was fine. The maid service was excellent and they would turn down our beds in the evening while we were out and leave chocolates. Also would bring fresh towels around 7:30 pm. They left decorative towel art on the beds more than once and even decorated the room with balloons and ribbon on Valentines day. We ate a 3 of the restaurants only waiting 5 minutes to make reservations.We would grab a delicious cup of coffee and enjoy it while we stood in the line. The food at the restaurants was very good. The service was awesome. We always had someone bringing us drinks no matter where we sat except the beach but there is a bar which is about a one minute walk away. The pool was chilly but on a hot day it was very refreshing and my son spent hours in it. The beach was huge with lots of loungers. There was always a place for us to sit around the pool and we had no trouble with umbrellas. We had 4 towel cards and had no trouble getting by with 4 towels. The evening entertainment was good. We always enjoyed it. We weren't rounded up during the day to participate in special activities but they had all the activities and their times posted by the towel hut and you could sign up on your own. If you want a more party atmosphere just head over to the Yucatan as you can use all of the other Riu's facilites if you are staying at the Palace and it is only a few short steps away. Happy vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “just got back today”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: So here's the deal...my husband and I just got back this afternoon and are soooooooooo happy to be home. We booked our trip to Mexico to celebrate our one year marriage anniversary. We went to Cancun for our honeymoon and liked Mexico a lot, so we wanted to go to familiar grounds, but try something new. Ok so here we go...we booked the six apple deal, where you don't know which six apple hotel you are staying at, but you know it is "six apples/stars". We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the Riu. We were both taken back by the larger than life architecture and cleanliness. Getting there was a hassel...we paid for private transfers but we found out our travel agent never told apple about them. We quickly forgot about the trip to the hotel as we were handed a cold drink and treated like royalty. As most people do when they arrive, they walk around to check everything out and we were more impressed with every step we took and every where we looked. And then the real vacation started... the FOOD was absolutely horrible. Each day we would look forward to our meals and were always let down. What was served HOT for breakfast was usually served COLD for lunch and then STIRFRYED for dinner. and it all SUCKED!!! The same goes for the breads, salads and desserts. I lived on tortilla chips and fries for a week. the SERVICE was constantly working, but they never seemed to wait on my husband and I. At the buffet you were lucky to get someone's attention to get you a disgusting cup of what they called American coffee. the ACTIVITIES were lame. there was no one trying to get the shy people involved. it's always entertaining to see the people who are normally reserved act crazy on vacation. there definately missing that charismatic soul in their entertainment staff. i hate to be that person who complains about non English speaking people in a different country, but let's keep it real...you are catering to mostly Americans (who speak English) We could rarely find someone whom we could ask a question without pointing to the object or attempting to use my few words of Italian to find some similar words. Besides the other couples we met there and the abundance of lounge chairs around the pool I would not have to many good things to say about the Riu. Oh and by the way the APPLE REPRESENTATIVE at the hotel was soooooooooo rude. As we arrived we attempted to explain our whole private transfer debacle to her and she seemed bothered by the fact that we had interruppted her while she was tending to her personal credit card statement. She bascially told as that we were lucky to have been booked at the Riu considering our six apple deal, so we really shouldn't bother with concerning ourselves with out loss of money from the private transfers. No sooner did she pick up her personal cell phone while we were trying to resolve our issue, so we left her and started our "vacation" Thank the Lord for beautiful weather, because my only memories are my tanned skin which will soon fade along with the desire to ever return to Mexico. remember the food is horrible, so if you do go...pack some protein bars or mac and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “The Way to Go”
Reviews.Author: Vance22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a week in this hotel and really enjoyed it. The staff was very friendly and always put their guests first. The hotel and grounds were immaculate and showed no signs of Emily and Wilma. There were some recently planted trees but who noticed? The buffet at Don Julian's for all meals was very good and the special retaurants such as Myagi, La Bodega, Sir Edward's, and La Mediteraneo were good but not great, But, you have to consider when you come here you are not dining at the best restaurants in your area. The activities and entertainment provided were varied and helped to fill the time between the pool or beach and dining and drinking. My wife and I plan to return here next February for ten days rather than seven. I especially liked that the waiters put the wine bottles next to our table or in a bucket beside our table. A caveat, if your thinking about Riviera Maya and choose RIU, pick the Palace. It's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “After Wilma”
Reviews.Author: Donna A
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent so I do get to go to this area of Mexico quite a bit (4 times a year) to review and revisit resorts to make sure they are being kept up. I must say, the Riu's in Playacar Mexico hardly had any damage due to Wilma last November. The Riu that got hit the worst believe it or not was the Riu Tequila, which is across the street from the beach! But it is back up and running. They did add another pool to the Riu Yucatan to help alleviate the people coming from the Tequila to use their facility since they are on the beach. The beaches are actually bigger (and they were quite big before). They are now opening the new Riu Palace Riviera Maya about 6 doors away from the Riu Palace Mexico. The biggest difference I can see is the tubs have jacuzzi's and instead of the seam in the middle of the KING BEDS, it is an actual King Size Bed. Plus, it is brand new! It is a little closer to Playa del Carmen, so walking there is a little easier, but heck a $5.00 Cab there is well worth it. I had lunch in Cancun at the Riu Las Americas which if you have to go to Cancun, then this or the Riu Cancun would be the only place I would stay. They didn't seem to get the worst of the Wilma damage as much as the rest of Cancun. Although the beaches in front of these Riu's were kind of small to begin with, it is actually bigger since Wilma, can't say the same for the rest of Cancun. Email if you need a quote or more information.

Reviews.Title: “suprised this is rated #3 on reviews”
Reviews.Author: bobolito
Reviews.Content: feb 2-9 2006 riu palace i will highlight my info and not go into a story. i have been traveling to playa for 23 years alot...this is what I experienced this time at this hotel: i never will go on an apple group bus, its easier and quicker to cab it. you lose several hours. the rooms were extremely damp and musky...no air purifier helped. watch out for slipping on tile. the hotel is not 5 star... but it is enjoyable. the liquor is low quality. i hate drinking out of plastic on a beach and around pools especially if it is 5 star. the food was just ok not top notch. it is hard to get in the restaurants you want when you want. the wait staff does not come around very often by pool and on beach you pretty much have to go get drinks by your self. crowded beach and extremely loud spin music at pool. no relaxing here. great buffet for breakfast. tons of things to choose from...i like ala carte personally. nice patio in front of room. housekeeping came around 4 or 5 every day...a little late in my opinion. room service does not understand orders to well even with specifics. treatments/ massage on beach was super relaxing and well done. treatment inside spa was ok. the therapist did not listen to my preference in pressure. room was relaxing. salon was small and dirty. people were very nice though. cuban bar was charming and fun. did not like sectioned off beach water area. felt confined and crowded. if you like to drink there are bottles galore in mini bar..again not great liquor. liked large bottles of cold water in frig evey day. liked the extra urnal/ beday in toilet room. beautiful grounds in middle of complex especially at night. very hard bed which i like. pilling sheets, felt like polyester. ughh! again not 5 star or even 4. we had fun with friends!!

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace Mexico is moldy...see our photos”
Reviews.Author: sunbeachbeauty
Reviews.Content: Who traveled: My husband and I. Ages: 33 and 34 Length of stay: 10 days Number of previous visits to Mexico: approximately 10 This was not my husband and I's first all-inclusive vacation to Mexico so going into this 10 day vacation I was confident in our hotel choice because I was reading reviews daily and checking multiple sites to ensure good food (10 days is a long time if the food isn't good) and a non-party atmosphere (parties in Mexico go 'til the wee hours). Rest was the key to this long awaited vacation. Iberostar Tucan was rated #1 at the time but because we stayed at Iberstar Paraiso del Mar with our family the last time, we decided to try a new brand and make it our own experience, a second honeymoon of sorts. LOBBY AND GROUNDS: RIU Palace Mexico is a nice resort. When you walk into the lobby it is grand. Looks like something you would see in Europe and smells like India (Nag Champa incense is burning through out the day). Although beautiful, it was a bit much with the giant crystal chandeliers. The grounds are well kept and the fountains are beautiful. At times I felt I was in a Piazza in Italy as you can see in a photo. POOL: The pool is small and inconvenient. There are not steps into the pool, only ladders. The water was cold. Most guests were complaining of the temperature of the pool. The swim up bar is in the shade to top it off. You are only allowed one towel per towel card and they do not cover the lounger. When it was 90 degrees, the chair pads got VERY hot and burned our feet. The next day I tipped the towel associate and signed I would return all 4 towels in order to get them. Not a 5 star experience to say the least. BEACH: The beach is beautiful. Crystal clear and warm. Much warmer than the pool. Tons of lounge chairs and water sports available (when it's not windy which was 3 out of 10 days). Occasionally they would come through with trays of fruity drinks for refreshment which was a nice touch. The beach itself is crowded. RIU Tequila is across the street so they are on "our" beach too. The trade off is they have the disco that we can use. Resorts are on top of each other in Playacar so all you see is people. There are topless sun bathers which was great. Go for it ladies...you only live once! FOOD: The food was great. Sure you can eat french fries and fried jalapenos if you want but we were thrilled with the selection of meats and veggies. The salad bar is outstanding. There is a full Mexican food station, a carving station, pasta station (including shrimp and chicken), show cooking, fresh baked breads and desserts. The "snack dinner" from 10pm 'til 6am is a joke. Ham sandwiches and fruit...that's it. Nothing sweet after dinner closes. Kinda silly I think. Don't be fooled by room service...it is for continental breakfast only. TIPS: At Iberostar tips are DISCOURAGED during the stay and you tip at the end of the visit which really is nice. Tips are expected at RIU. Part of why we chose an all-inclusive is to not have to worry about carrying around money and change, etc. It would be easier to stay at a non-inclusive and charge the room for services rather than the hassle of tips. SERVICE: The service is outstanding in every area. We had to change our room and they were as accomodating as possible. ROOM: The musty smell that others spoke of in the postings are not to be taken lightly. I, unfortunately, did not listen. Because we live on the beach I assumed it was the damp smell that most are not used to. I was very wrong. RIU Palace Mexico has a serious mold problem and there are photos you can see with our own eyes. As soon as we opened the door we could smell mold. We opened the doors and hoped it would go away. It was evening time so we ran off to dinner. The next morning it was so bad we bagan smelling around to find the source of the problem. The couch was covered in mold. The dresser stunk of it and the shower was moldy too. Aside from the mold, the bathroom was small and certainly not 5 stars. I give it 1. RESORT IS FOR: Over 50 years and older. The kids area is a joke and the entertainment is for over 50. In all, we had a nice time but would not return to this resort. Besides the mold, it did not "feel" like we were in Mexico. The horrible 80's love songs like "Wind beneath my wings" and overdone decor is not what Mexico means to us. We prefer Mexican music and authentic decor when we visit Mexico. Can you imagine listening to Mariachi music in Venice, Italy? I didn't think so. Certainly not a 5 star resort. SIDE NOTE: We did visit the new RIU Palace Riviera Maya which has an amazing pool. It too is a beautiful resort. We spoke to a couple that was staying there and we asked how the rooms are. They said the rooms were comfortable but over all it didn't feel like they were in Mexico. Took the words right out of our mouthes. Feel free to email me any questions.

Reviews.Title: “So happy we changed our destination!”
Reviews.Author: FoxyRoxy32502
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned a few days ago from our, much needed, solar recharge! Initially we were to stay in Cancun but changed to Playa a few months ago. We are so happy we did. Never having been to this area, we were a little nervous. The Riu Palace is a beautiful hotel. The front desk staff was very professional and pleasant. We had a plumbing problem with our 1st room which was addressed/corrected within 20min. Received a follow up call too! We moved rooms day2 as our 1st had a view of the neighbor hotel. Efficiently we were moved to 0129 with a view of the beach and pool! It was fabulous! The rooms are clean, roomy, but a bit noisy during the day. (our siesta time!) Mini bar was restocked dailly. At night, the place is very quiet, especially if you are at the end of the hotel away from the "action areas". Our room was cleaned early every day, got turn down service once. The only draw backs to the room were the hard beds (can live with it) and the small bathroom (what's up with the bidet..do people still use these??!!) You can't use the tap water to brush your teeth. They'll give you extra bottles of water for this. I can't say enough about how beautiful the beach was. The best I've been to since visiting the USVI. The food was good. We ate at 1 specialty rest. ..the steak house. It was ok. There didn't seem to be the lines that I heard about when making reservations. We ate at the buffet, it had a nice selection. Service was good and fast at the many bars. Wasn't sure if the chips and popcorn would constitute as unlimited snacks..no salsa for chips :(. The dress code was enforced at the restaurant doors guys!! Men are to wear pants and ladies dress ranged from dresses to capris and a cute shirt. I think pants at a buffet is a bit much, as long as you're clean, nice shorts, what's the big deal?? The guests seem to be a quieter, more mature croud which we loved! Not much for kids to do, so there were not many little ones. The staff was friendly, professional, efficient. We tipped, but I didn't notice the staff not giving good service if you didn't tip. We greated staff with a good morining, hello, etc, and they would return the gesture! We found a little smile and trying to communicate in Spanish goes a long way. We saw some guests that were down right rude and obnoxious! The Playacar area is a gated community. If you're out walking or shopping, you will not be bothered by timeshares, etc. This hotel is within walking distance to the Playa del Carmen area. Would I return to this hotel..oh, you bet!!!! If you have any questions don't hesitate to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip”
Reviews.Author: MAN615
Reviews.Content: Another late review, went to resort in June. Went in 2004, was so wonderful returned with famiily in 2005 to show then what an amazing place this is, and was not disappointed. Everything was as the year before, with the addition of a Japanese restaurant, which we did not try. Third floor rooms closer to beach than lobby made for long walks to exit resort and dining and lobby, prefer to be closer to lobby since there ar no rooms with ocean view anyways. Rooms spotless again, with refrig stocked daily with whatever you ask for, and liquor dispenser that has, vodka, brandy, tequila and rum. Prettiest and most spacious beach in the area, with plenty of room and palm trees for shade. Buffet is amazing, food delicious, and the choices change every night in the buffet(huge salad bar). Not tavern on the Green, but for all-inclusives, it is top notch. Grounds immaculate, and the area surrounding the resort is safe and controlled. Playa the town is a short cab ride away of you desire authentic Mexican surroundings and shopping. I would be happy to answer any questions you have, considering I could write a book about this resort, but don't have the time right now. ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “it really was a palace”
Reviews.Author: Roelof
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site and an equal review site in the Netherlands i was so pleased to actual be in the Palace.It was just great.I cannot find any item which was not good.The food (the buffet was exceptional good),the service,the room (we were so lucky to have the room with a seperate jacuzzi). All personal were so friendly and just taking care of you having a good time.Forget the fact that perhaps you have to wait for 15 minutes(!)to reserve your restaurant of choice.You are on holiday.I have seen people who were mad because they had to wait for more than 10 minutes to reserve a restaurant, i have seen people who were so demanding and unfriendly to waiters etc. I find this unbelievable. Whether you give a tip or not, everybody is so helpfull.So, if you are thinking about going there,just go for it,it is really a palce in a small piece of paradise.For us, it was worth more than 11 hours of flight.If you want more information,don't hesitate to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente!”
Reviews.Author: mrsjosh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Jan. 19-26, 2006. We were booked at the Riu Yucatan, but were upgraded for our entire trip. We have previously stayed at the Riu Tequila. We had such a wonderful time at this hotel and we can't wait to return. The beach is large and there were always plenty of loungers. We were always able to find shade in the afternoon. The staff, especially the Entertainment team, made this trip really great. We participated in 1 or 2 activites every day. The Entertainment team knew our names within days and were always friendly. They really make an effort to connect with the guests. Other service was very good. As for the drink service on the beach, while nice, you may only get one drink the whole morning if you wait for them. For service at the pool, if you tip, the waitress will remember you and come by more often. We also noticed that the inner circle of loungers got served more often than the outer circle. Pool and whirlpools are not heated. The food was acceptable, but not memorable. The buffet offers many, many options. Vegetarians will have enough to eat. We ate at La Bodega twice becaused we enjoyed the different meats. We also ate at Sir Edwards which was also good, but mostly because it was different than the buffet. Service at these restaurants was excellent. We did not get sick at all while there. For the dress code, my husband got by with 2 pairs of pants and 2 polo shirts, which he only used for dinner and then changed into shorts. I panicked because I had expected to wear shorts to dinner (we were supposed to be at the Yucatan!) and only had 1 dress outfit and a pair of jeans. I opted to wear the jeans and a nice top at the buffet because I saw other people doing the same thing. The grounds are clean and well-kept. Our room was also very clean. We were in 0004, which was not the best room because the staff used that hallway in the mornings and the evening which created a lot of noise. Our room had a musty smell, but we figured it had flooded at least somewhat during the hurricane. Maybe the higher rooms wouldn't be so bad. The front desk had the worst service overall. During check-in and check-out, we had to stand in front of the desk until someone took the time to notice us. We had a light bulb burn out in our room and when we reported the problem the person explained that there are two light switches and we were using the wrong one. When we said, no, we are using the right one, he said ok, ok, I'll have someone fix it. It felt like we were tolerated, not welcomed. We brought mugs to use for our drinks. At any time I could have looked around and seen someone else with a mug; they were common. We only used ours a few times and tipped when we did. Other than that and tipping for service by the pool, we did not tip. Blended drinks are not strong. There are also drinks without alcohol. Mixed drinks had the right amount of alcohol. Then, there are also shots. All alcohol was brand-name: Jim Beam, Southern Comfort, Chivas, Beefeaters, Bacardi, Havanna Club etc. Beer selection included Corona and Modelo Negra. There are not very many kids at this hotel, which was nice. The kids that were there were very well behaved. There is no kids program, but there was a kids disco every night before the show. There's something for everyone here. The average age of a guest at this hotel is higher than at the surrounding Rius, but there is a great mix of people and nationalities. The mood of this hotel is more subdued than that of the other Rius, but there's always fun to be found. Young (like us, mid-twenties) or old, you will find what you are looking for here. Overall, this hotel is excellent and I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but not for non-smokers”
Reviews.Author: PamK91
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to the Riu Palace. I had been to Playa Del Carmen several times, most recently to the Iberostar Quetzal/Tucan. I was excited to try the Palace because I had heard so many good things. First of all, the hotel is beautiful. Grounds are well-kept and gorgeous. Rooms are spacious and well-appointed. Beds were just fine with the mattress pads (ordered them when I arrived). It is a very quiet hotel, which was nice. I especially liked the door you could close between the room door and the bed--helped keep the room quiet. I liked the convenience to the small shopping area across the street and enjoyed the mile walk to town for shopping. The buffets were a bit "off" in quality and redundant--breakfasts were best. I went to 2 specialty restaurants: Steak house and Japanese. The Japanese restaurant wasn't good; the steak house was better. The smoking everywhere was REALLY irritating--very hard to escape. I'm happy the smokers could have a resort to love; I'm just hoping the smoke comes out of all my stuff! Yuck! Although the bartenders/waiters/waitresses are very nice, service was spotty. They have a goofy rule where a "head waiter" takes your drink order, hands it to a waiter/waitress, and then that person brings you your drink. Sometimes you got it right away; sometimes you never got it. It was bizarre that you couldn't have bar drinks in the restaurants--only wine, water, beer, and pop. That was a pain if you wanted to stick to one type of liquor all night. Made no sense to me. I really missed the great touches at the Quetzal/Tucan like daily papers, popcorn in the bars, real barbeques on the beach, pop machines throughout the resort, and casual dress at the buffets. One friend commented how funny it was to see women in evening gowns at the "Old Country Buffet". Most of the guests seemed to be quiet, smoking, older Europeans. Most of the young couples I met were pretty bored. I missed meeting Canadians who always seem to enjoy Mexico better than anyone! I think the hotel is best for older people over 60 and smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our vacation”
Reviews.Author: cpp90278
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu in Jan 2006. No sight of the hurricane - palm trees a little shortened. The beach was excellent and the resort was nice. Much nicer than the other Riu hotels in the area. The food was also surprising good - we are vegetarian and we still found a good selection. The drinks and wait-staff were great. Drawbacks - lukewarm hot tub next to the pool and at the spa; making dinner reservations at the specialty restaurants was a little painful as the staff was not flexible; the bed was not a real king-size bed (mattress cover helped); rooms near the lobby are musty; pool closes at 7pm. Overall, we had a great time at this all-inclusive resort.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband were in Mexico from Jan 8th-15th We stayed at the RIU Cancun until Jan 13th- that is when the RIU upgraded us –for free- to the RIU Palace Mexico in Playa del Carmen until Jan 15th. We thought, why not? This is pretty much my comparison between the Palace and the RIU Cancun. The RIU Palace Mexico in Playa del Carmen was beautiful. The staff was not overly friendly (however, some were) The whole feel of the place was a bit stuffy. After being in Cancun first- I did not feel as relaxed at the Palace. I understand the Palace is a different hotel class than the RIU Cancun, however, I didn’t feel the staff was as “outgoing” as the Cancun staff, but just as accommodating, which was great. The food was very good and the chocolate fountain at dessert was yummy- (get the coconut macaroons and dip them in the chocolate!) I really loved being able to have champagne all the time- the RIU Cancun did not offer it at their bars. Men have to wear pants for dinner- even at the buffet. I thought my husband looked much nicer in his dress shorts and button up shirt than some of the guys who had on jeans- just to accommodate the “pants at dinner” rule. The lobby bar was quite small and quite. We had a ground floor room facing the courtyard and the fountains. It was beautiful. The bathroom showerhead was kind of strange though- you had to take it off the holder or else it would spray right over your head—that was annoying. The balcony was a really nice size, with chairs that can turn into loungers. What was great about the Palace is, they had room service which the RIU Cancun did not (for breakfast only) we enjoyed sitting on the balcony and having our morning coffee and croissants. The pool area was large enough where there were empty loungers. No one was saving chairs (there is a sign that this is not allowed anyway) Drink orders were taken at the pool. The pool was not heated- the pool bar was in the shade- it was a bit chilly and no one was hanging out at the pool bar. It was very quite. Complaints:the beach seemed really far. No staff on the beach for drink orders- you had to walk quite a ways to get a drink. There were too many jet skis in the water- you can smell the oil on the beach and I thought the noise was a bit annoying- try and get a beach chair closer to the RIU Yucatan, you can’t smell the oil down there. I am not a “partier”, or prefer the party atmosphere and I don’t even drink that much but I must be a Cancun kind of girl at heart. I loved the RIU Cancun, however, if I chose to go back to Playa del Carmen- I would probably stay here again, but might want to try another hotel first to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time is a Charm!”
Reviews.Author: BostonTia
Reviews.Content: I Just returned Saturday from a week long stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. It was a superb trip. I have been there three times now, and I think this visit was the best as far as the resort and beach aspects. I was given a gift and invited to a special dinner for being a return guest. A big thanks to the folks who decided to go elsewhere because of the hurricane. I was able to get a better price on the resort, a better room, and less crowding at the beach. I hate to say it, but the hurricane was good to us. The entertainment was very good. David is still magnificent at the piano bar and the evenings in the courtyard had a good variety of entertainers. The weather was a little cool to start off with, but the temperature increased as the week progressed. We did have one full day of rain, and then it rained sporadically throughout the week. It didn’t wreck our trip and it provided a little relief from the sun. All of our friends who work at the resort were still there. Manny the doorman is still excellent. Roy at the beach bar entertained all of us and all the waiters delivered superb service throughout the week. We tipped heavily, often, and to as many employees that we could. We even tipped a waiter that never waited on us. We met him on previous trips and felt bad that we didn’t eat at his restaurant. He works at the Miyagi. That was the only restaurant than not everyone wanted to go to. There were six in our group. The beach was better than ever. It is so much bigger now after the hurricane. There were a few pebbles we encountered getting into the water, but nothing major. My husband did stub his toe pretty bad on a rock in the water. We never had this trouble before. I do believe the storm brought in some coral and rocks, but please don’t be alarmed, as it is nothing to be concerned about. The men in our group did do a lot of water sports and loved every minute of it. A big favorite for one of them was walking down to the private beach after the Gala Resort. We also visisted the monkeys that roam between the Iberostar complex and the Riu Yucatan. There are about 15 that live in the trees. We gave them bananas, which they took right out of our hand. We later learned that you really shouldn’t be feeding them so we stopped. I didn’t go in the pools. It being January and all, I don’t usually bother. I brought my Riu class card and received 15% off a massage. We took two quick trips into town. There were a lot of people in town and a lot of purchases being made, especially at the Playa Mart where the prices are really reasonable. Our group, which consisted of 3 couples had the best vacation ever and are planning on going back very soon. There were no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Georgous and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: cubstwinkies
Reviews.Content: The RIU Palace is a beautiful place to stay. My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and felt it was well worth the money we paid. The RIU Palace is more of a quiet resort and not the party goer type, as others have mentioned. It is definitely a resort for one who likes to relax and enjoy the beautiful ocean and beach.
