We both feel this resort and its beach are the better of the resorts in the area. The RIU's biggest assets are the beach and tremendous staff! They do go out of their way to make sure your stay is perfect. The resort is immaculate and always clean. I can not say enough about how hard they work to keep the resort and grounds clean for all their guests. The courtyard area and view of the ocean are priceless! As for the rooms, I don't really think you can get rid of the musty smell when in a tropical area with humidity. And we agree with others on the food, they could use some work. However, as Americans, we are probably just used to our old ways! I would truly recommed this resort to anyone and everyone. I can not say enough about how enjoyable of a stay we had. It was a wonderful place for my husband and I spend our honeymoon. I also recommend doing the snorkeling excursion. I read on here from someone else that had done it. It was amazing! Neither of us had snorkeled before and we had so much fun! Definitely worth the price! If the RIU seems like a good fit for you, try it out!! How can you go wrong with a little pampering, drinks in hand whenever you want, and the sound of waves coming in?!!! I am sure you will love it!! WE DID!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expected too much”
Reviews.Author: snowmobilekid
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Palace Dec 17-24. It was a very nice resort. I think the problem was I read so many wonderful reviews I expected way too much. We've been to Mexico once a year for over 10 years and while this was one of the nicest resorts, it wasn't the best value. 2 main complaints were the food and the noise of the rooms next door. The food was too greasy for my taste. Spent the 4th day of my trip in the bathroom all night and bed all day. Not fun. Our neighbors next door were simply rude. I had to call on them everynight. Their TV was so loud I could hear it word for word. The staff was very good about fixing the problem. Even went into the room one night when the people were so out of it they didn't hear the phone ring a million times or the banging on the door. Please be considerate of your neighbors. It really can make or break a trip. The drinks were very good. Esp at the lobby bar! I think her name was Miriam (like I said they were good) She really knows how to make a good everything! I did request one of the mattress covers and that did make a world of difference. I was a bit disappointed in the fact that it is not a real king bed. We ate at all of the specialty resturants and wished we hadn't wasted our time. The Sir Edwards was nice and we would go there again, but the buffet does have a better selection than the others and I think it tasted better than the other specialties. The beach was really crowded when we were there, but that could have been the week we were there. The staff was very helpful and friendly. All in all I guess my trip was OK. Actually at the last minute I found it cheaper on sale and because I was paying $1000 less than I originally booked for I was happy. If I had paid the original price I would be complaining alot more. It was a good trip, but I don't think I will ever go back there. As a reference, last year we went to Paradisus Rivera, and it was more "palace like" to me. I think I will go there again. It's kind of like when you hear a movie is awesome by everyone and you go and it was just OK. I guess that's kind of how I feel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: kljohn10
Reviews.Content: I was reading some of the reviews and felt that I needed to comment. My boyfriend and I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico in October of 2005 during Hurricane Wilma. We arrived the weekend before the hurricane hit and the hotel and grounds were beautiful and clean. The hotel suffered minimal visible damage (in comparison to Cancun), mostly water damage. However, there was a lot of work to be done in order to have the hotel up and running normally. The staff worked day and night to restore the hotel to normal. I have never witnessed such hard work and dedication in my life. They went out of their way to try to maintain some sort of normalcy during our vacation. I imagine some of the musty smells may still be a result of the flooded rooms - as well as just the nature of tropical weather. The buffets weren't spectacular, but you are definitely able to get a good meal. I can not say enough about the customer service offered at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sure to be pleased”
Reviews.Author: Jesser78
Reviews.Content: As I relied so much on the comments and ratings from others when selecting Riu, I thought it only right that I post my own opinion of this Resort. I myself have traveled enough times to the Caribbean to have set a pretty high standard when it comes to resorts. It was difficult to find a low cost, high quality honeymoon vacation. After extensive research, we selected the Riu and don't regret our decision at all. We did, however, have a few bumps. A couple weeks before our trip, Hurricane Wilma decided to make land and for over a week after it passed, we were unsure if we were going to get our honeymoon in Mexico. Not knowing what the condition was of the Riu, we decided to go ahead and continue our plans to come here. Thankfully our travel agent was able to send us pictures of the aftermath, and that eased our minds. Not being a regular to Palm trees, I honestly wouldn't have noticed the damage once we stepped onto the resort grounds. As all others have stated, the grounds are immaculate - there's simply no other word for it. Walking out onto the courtyard almost took my breath away (and made me wish we had a room facing it). The check in was quick and they gave us those yummy punch drinks. Just as we were about to go to our room and crash for the day, our travel group stopped us and told us we needed to come back later that night to arrange our pickup to go back to the airport later that week. We told him we were exhausted and asked if we could do it in the morning. We ended up checking out our room and then going out for a short walk around the resort to get a bite to eat. I think we had timed it just right so that there weren't a lot of options for us to eat, but we managed. We stopped back through and talked with our travel guy, gave him our flight info and he noted to touch back with them the day before we were to leave (more on this later). Having read a lot of comments from other people, we had some expectations that I'm glad we were prepared for. Making reservations for dinner being one. The resort must change how they do these because when we were there, we had to go to Don Julian between 10 and noon and we could make reservations for that evening and the next evening. We ate at Sir Edward and La Bodega. We really really like La Bodega. Sir Edward seemed kinda stuffy to us and it was rather empty. Don Julian was very good. We enjoyed getting up early enough in the morning before the big crowd showed, eating breakfast, then going down to the beach. We slept in later one morning and couldn't believe how many people we saw at breakfast. So we really like getting up early when it was quiet. The desserts were lacking I thought, but I've found that to be true all around Mexico. The chocolate fountain was a bit of a disappointment, but that is the way of the area. I was surprised to see that the last few days Don Julian ran out of pineapple which I love and had at every meal. The nacho cheese was awful and the butter had a funny taste - but that could be the American in me. One tip we will NEVER forget is to bring your own insulated mugs. People were so jealous to see us on the beach with these and we were SO glad we brought them. The glasses the resort provides on the beach are so small and get hot so quickly. I had a soda with ice in mine for nearly 3 hours and it never got hot. In previous travels, the bartendars are usually very outgoing, but I didn't see that here. If we ordered drinks, it seemed like a different person brought them to us each time. So we couldn't really personalize with any one of them. They didn't speak to you much anyways. Another tip was about the smell of the room. I assumed there wasn't anything the resort could do about the smell, but I'm a huge smell person so I brought my own air freshener. It didn't really do a whole lot since the rooms are pretty big, simply opening the patio door was suffice to rid of the musty scent. I was disappointed after leaving a couple dollars every day for our maid, we never got any fun towel art or anything until the day before we were to leave. Maybe they needed a bigger tip? :) Our room was located on the side facing the hotel being renovated. You could count on them beginning work no later than 7 a.m. Fortunately we were usually up by then, but for those that want to sleep in, this could have been an issue. Also, we had to be careful about walking around unexposed as workers could plainly see into our room and they were not that far away. Overall though, we weren't picky about it so we didn't request a new room at all. We did do a trip to Chichen Itza which was really neat. I've had several opportunities to go, but never did until now. It was about a 3 hour trip on a bus, on a gravel road with speed bumps! Made us feel like we were in the back country. Our tour guide was excellent - it was difficult to stay with him though as he had to repeat everything in two languages. I highly recommend this excursion to anyone. And plan on spending the whole day there and not much else. We were exhausted when we got back. Overall, this was a fantastic place. I was surely impressed by it. The value for the money is very good. You can't even compare the beauty of any of the resorts nearby to this one - and the price is only a tiny bit higher. The food was decent and the rooms were as expected. I would love to come back someday but my husband is one that likes to change things up. One thing is for certain, Riu Palace has set a VERY high bar for the others we end up visiting in the future. Our biggest complaint was on the return back to the airport which is by no means the fault of the Riu. The day before we were to leave, we got a call from the travel group asking why we hadn't come to talk to them about our return. I informed the gentleman that the man we talked to upon our arrival took all our information and asked us to stop back the day before our departure sometime. He asked who it was I talked to and I honestly couldn't remember. He asked for a description - well, dark hair, dark skin...that doesn't tell them much :). The gentleman on the phone seemed very worried about it, but I just told him we'd be down to talk with them in a little bit. So we went down to the lobby and there were several men waiting to talk to us. None of which were who we recognized from earlier that week. They kept asking us to describe who we talked to like that person was a criminal or something. All we cared about was getting our transportation arranged. They asked us to fill out a customer complaint form detailing the incident, describing the person we talked to earlier in the week, etc. They indicated this was to help them better organize so as not to happen again. Fine - great - we'll see you tomorrow when we need a ride to the airport. The next morning, we came down to check out and were waiting in the lobby to leave. My husband went over to the same people we had talked to the day before and they didn't know who he was and they didn't see a reservation for us to get a ride back. WHAT?! After everything we'd gone through the day before, filling out that form so that "it didn't happen again" - and here it does happen again. There was another group waiting in the lobby to leave and they apparently had an earlier flight then us, except that there were two men who showed up unexpectedly and I'm thinking they took our spots. For whatever reason, they didn't leave for 45 minutes, as we're continuing to wait for a ride. We found out that the large group's plane reservation had changed and had a later flight than ours. We checked in again with the travel group and they said they had a guy coming to get us but he was stuck in traffic in Playa. Finally he arrive (nearly an hour after we were supposed to have left). I think the drive normally takes about 45 minutes but we got there in under 30. The speedometer on the car was broken, otherwise I could tell you how fast he must have going! We made it to the airport in time and we were on our way back.

Reviews.Title: “great time had by all”
Reviews.Author: cobrawillys
Reviews.Content: I was extremely reluctant to vacation in mexico given the potential danger from banditos and poor water. However, my wife and I , along with our 2 college age kids stayed at the Palace between xmas and new years. We had a wonderful time. The hotel, the grounds, and the beach are spotless and beautiful. You do not have to run to the beach at dawn to secure lounge chairs as there are plenty for all. The only "negatives" would be the following: beds- they are very hard but if you request they will put pads on the mattress which help a great deal rooms- the rooms all smell musty. We kept the screen open which helped but the a/c goes off when the glass door is open. food- if you love the food on a cruise ship you will love the food at the Palace. The buffet has something for everyone and is adaquate but certainly not great. The speciality restraunts were a little better. If food is important to you you will be disappointed. All things considered, this is a great resort. Nearby Playa Del Carmen is a hip town with great bars and restaurants. Its only a short cab ride away, safe, and lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go to Riu!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent trip overall. Our rep (Marco from Worry Free) met us at the airport and directed us to our bus. We stopped at a couple of resorts prior to Riu Palace. At one stop five of our bags were inadvertently left off the bus. When we arrived at the Riu and let Marco know he immediately set about getting our bags back for us. We had them within 15 minutes. The check-in at the Riu was quick and easy, and the welcome drink was fabulous. Manuel is the main doorkeeper and is really fabulous. Our favorite employee by far was Regalio. He is the bar manager and couldn't be nicer. If you go, please give Regalio a "hello" from his mamasita from Minnesota. The Riu beach is lovely, and the rooms are great. We had no problem with using the water in the room to brush teeth, etc. The patios are beautiful. Our room was pretty quiet and cleaned well every day. There is turn-down service every night. The Riu is also an easy walk to a small, lovely shopping area as well as the bus that takes one on tours. I would definetly recommend the snorkeling. I don't think it's worth a trip to downtown Playa for shopping, but it's kind of fun to walk around. We had seven in our party, ranging in age from 15 to 86, and everyone had an equally good time. My teenage son was never bored and reluctant to go home after 7 days. The Cancun airport is pretty hectic, at least on Saturday morning. If you have a flight between 9 am and 2 pm, be sure to arrive at least 2 hours early. The lines get really long, and it gets really hot in the airport by 10 am. People who work in the airport are pretty friendly. I would defintely return to Playa and to the Riu. There's very little hurricane damage in Palaya, but Cancun is still a mess.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best!”
Reviews.Author: dignplant
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our second stay at the Riu Palace Mexico, Dec 24 - 30, 2005, and I can say that this is where we will stay again the next time in Playa! Only visible Wilma damage is the tops of the palm trees on the beach and lining the beautiful reflecting pool. There won't be much shade available on the beach until the palm leaves grow back, but there are now a couple of "ocean-view" rooms. The Riu Palace is still among the cleanest and best maintained resorts we've visited. They have a great staff, we recognized several from our stay 1 1/2 yrs ago. We were even remembered at check in by one of the front desk staff. The staffers here are very friendly. We ate every meal at the buffet. It was much more than acceptable, even for some of the more "picky" in our 5-person family. Bar service was excellent, you want something stronger, just ask. One bartender at the pool bar didn't seem to be enjoying himself, but it didn't affect his service. They have an excellent watersports group. The on site dive operator, Scuba Caribe, was excellent. We went out on schedule even on the day there were only two divers! Saw several sharks, tons of turtles, moray eels and other fish as well as some very colorful coral. We especially like the open courtyard full of tables and a stage. We would sit there every evening after dinner enjoying a nightcap, listening to the live bands on stage, people-watching and waiting for the indoor entertainment to begin. At many resorts you don't know what to do with yourself between dinner and your choice of night-time entertainment. The patio at the Riu is absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Excperience & Adventure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time at the Riu Palace in the winter of 2003. The service & hospitality was outstanding. We had no idea it is a six star. There isn't the proper words to describe this adventure at a resort where you can relax & enjoy the veiw, ocean & entertainment. It is a place i would diffenently go again. The food & service was terrific. There isn't pictures or words to describe our enjoyed & fun we had. This is a must place for you & your family.

Reviews.Title: “if your going to playacar, you must go to the palace!”
Reviews.Author: sparko
Reviews.Content: having seen alot of the hotels in playa on my walks along the beach i can honestly say we made the right choice in going to the palace. we visited the other riu`s next to the palace and we were not that impressed. it realy is worth paying that little bit extra for the more peaceful adult atmosphere and extra quality. lastly i just can not understand the negative comments on this hotel, but every one has their opinion. all i can say is go and see for your self, you won`t be dissapionted. thanks to everyone at the palace for making our two weeks the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the RIU Palace and so did our children”
Reviews.Author: nokidsholiday
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Palace for nine nights and would definately go back again. Marcela from the activity group was soooo great with our kids. She would come and get them for all the activities she knew they enjoyed (Beach volleyball, water volleyball, rifle shooting, bingo etc.). Food was just fine for us. We didn't eat at the specialty restaraunts as we have two somewhat picky eaters that did just fine at Don Julian. Breakfasts were definately the best. Edwardo in the restaraunt at dinner time was the best. He always had a table ready for us with our drinks and he always took good care of us. The cleaning staff left a different towel creature every day. I don't know if they do this for everyone or if it is just for the guests with children. The towel arrangements were a lot of fun. Lots of drinks, never a moment when someone wasn't asking if you would like a drink. We enjoyed going over to the yucatan pools (bigger and more kids there than at the palace), however, very nice to come back to our quieter resort. We would definately stay at a RIU again, however, we've now been to Playa and it will be time to try somewhere new next time. I will be posting some pictures on trip advisor soon. Go and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Resort very beautiful but food and service had a lot to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: springlane
Reviews.Content: Everything at this resort was very clean and well maintained. Our room was nice. My husband and I loved the beach. What we didn't love was that some of the staff,especially at the reception desk, acted like they were doing us a huge favor for even the smallest of requests, for example, a late check out. This was the 5th all-inclusive resort that we have sayed at and it had by far had the worst food. Every thing from the nacho cheese to the chocolate fondue was completely watered down and had little to no flavor. If you wanted to make reservations at the specialty restaurants you are supposed to go a specific location from 8:00 to 10:00am. In truth the staff got there at about 8:20am or later so I guess their time was more important than ours. I don't know why you couldn't just phone in a reservation like at other all-inclusives we have stayed at??? We ended up eating in Playa Del Carmen a couple of nights and had some really good food. Over all it was great to be in a safe, beautiful environment but because of the food and the service I don't think we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Resort”
Reviews.Author: MoonBound
Reviews.Content: First I feel obligated to mention that this was the second leg of our honeymoon. We stayed for 7 nights (and got married) at the Aventura Spa Palace prior to our 3 night stay at the RIU Palace Mexico. Had we stayed at the RIU for the entire trip, it's very possible that I would have rated it Excellent rather than the Above Average that I actually did rate it. That said, here is a breakdown of the trip: CHECK IN: The first thing that we noticed was the beautiful lobby as we entered. It was enormous and was decorated for Christmas. The Check In process was very simple. We were greeted with a glass of punch as soon as we entered (very good stuff) and went directly to check in. The reception desk folks were very polite and courteous and we were assigned our room within a matter of minutes. The gentleman provided us with a map of the resort as well as explained the times that we would need to make reservations at the ala carte restaurants. The only issue we had at check in was minor, but worth mentioning. We arrived at the RIU at about 12:30pm. We were told that we could not make reservations for the evening for ANY of the restaurants because they were already all booked, we would need to eat that evening at the buffet and that we could make reservations the next morning for dinner that evening. Reservations for dinner are taken ONLY between 8:30 and 10:30am each morning in front of the restaurants. It makes in inconvenient to arrive for a 3 night stay and not be able to eat at one of the ala carte restaurants the evening of your arrival. This left only two evenings to eat at the 4 ala carte restaurants. I'm not sure how the situation could have been avoided, but it seemed that maybe the hotel should hold several reservations aside in case guests that are checking in later in the day wished to eat something other than the buffet that evening. More on this later. Besides this minor issue, the check in process went very smoothly. B+ (only due to the reservation issue) ROOMS: The room we were assigned was in the courtyard area closest to the pool. We were in room 1049 which is actually a second floor room. The rooms were pretty large and contained a separate sitting area with a couch, coffee table and television. The rooms were also decorated nicely and each had it's own balcony or terrace. The bathroom sink area was large, but the toilet and bidet area were quite cramped. The bathtub was pretty standard with a shower head and was the same size that you have at home. This was one big difference between this and other resorts in Mexico that we've stayed before. The bath and shower areas at the RIU were MUCH smaller than those of other resorts that we've stayed. Not too big of a deal, just worth noting. We had three concerns with the room. The first night we were there, our TV would function properly, then the sound would go out for 20 or 30 minutes. It would come back on for a minute or two, then go out again. We called reception and they said they would send someone right up to check on it. Over an hour later, I called reception again and they advised me that the technician was nearby. He showed up just a few minutes later. When he came into the room, of course the TV was working properly. I explained to him what it was doing, but he spoke no English. He had to call to the front desk so that I could tell them what the situation was and they relayed the information to him. He handed me back the phone after speaking with reception and they told me that he was going to take care of another guest and return in 10 minutes to check on it. 10 minutes turned into another hour and I called reception again and asked them if we could just have another TV brought up. To their credit, within about 20 minutes, the same gentleman was there with another TV that had OK written on it in magic marker. Evidently this was not the first issue that they had with the TV's. He put the new one in and took the old one with him and he was on his way. Total time wasted waiting on the TV issue to be resolved: About 2 1/2 hours. Again not a huge deal, could have happened to anybody, certainly worth noting though. The other issue was with the air in our room. The terrace doors are designed with sensors to detect when they are open thus cutting off the air in the room. I totally agree with this. Why waste power when the doors are open? The problem was that evidently our sensors only worked part of the time. We had the door closed for several hours and it was still way over 80 in the room. We called reception and they sent a technician up to check. He was able to resolve the issue in just a few minutes. The sensors were not meeting correctly and I guess he fiddled with them enough to where it was able to work properly. We were very appreciative. The last concern that we had was the unavailability of an ironing board and iron in the room. We called reception to find out if we simply overlooked it somewhere and they advised that they would deliver one to us for a maximum of 30 minutes before they would come back to retrieve it. I don't know that I've ever stayed in a hotel room that didn't have an ironing board and an iron in it before. When it was delivered, I was amazed. The board was one of those 2 foot long travel boards with two hinges on the bottom to sit on a table top. The iron looked like it was several years old. It worked well enough but it was inconvenient to have to wait on it to be brought up and then only have 30 minutes of use. Other than those minor issues, the rooms were OK. C+ GROUNDS: I can't say enough about the grounds on the resort. AWESOME. It was a beautiful, beautiful resort. The grounds were immaculate. This is probably the best looking resort that we have ever stayed before. The courtyard with the fountains was very nice as were the pool areas. This was definitely top notch. A+ BEACH: Again, AWESOME. This was the biggest beach at a Mexican resort that I've ever seen. It was very nice, always had chairs to lay out on, had plenty of trees to offer shade and generally was pretty packed with people. A+ FOOD: Overall, the food was above average for an all inclusive resort. We at the buffet (Don Julian) for breakfast and it was pretty good. It had a pretty decent selection of food including a cold cereal bar and a fresh juice station. The lunch buffets were OK. The beef is not USDA, but was not too bad. Everything generally is overcooked, but I guess that's better then the alternative. We ate at two of the ala carte restaurants. La Bodega is a Brazilian restaurant that was pretty good. You must make reservations for this restaurant. On the subject of reservations, the night we ate here, there were about 15 of the 20 tables unoccupied. The restaurant is pretty small, but I couldn't understand why we were told when we checked in that we couldn't get a reservation at any of the restaurants. I suppose we should have gone down and checked at the restaurant ourselves on the first night, but we decided to just go into Playa and have dinner at La Parilla. The food is bought out Brazilian gaucho style on a large skewer and you advise the waiter how much you want. You have choices between chicken wings, pork tenderloin, sausages, skirt steak, sirloin steak (more like roast beef) and one other that I've forgotten. You have an unlimited salad bar and the service was very good. The second evening we ate at the Sir Edward gourmet restaurant. It was excellent. The steak was great, the shrimp and scallops were awesome and the service was good. This is also a small restaurant but there were many empty tables here as well which made us wonder if the restaurants were really booked up when we arrived. Overall the food was pretty decent. B+ ROOM SERVICE: None available. D+ (only because RIU advertised 24 hour snacks and beverages. We can get the beverages in the room, but what about the snacks? I also now notice that the 24 hour all inclusive icon for this property on the RIU website has been changed to just all inclusive and dropped the 24 hour part.) MAID and MINI BAR SERVICE: The maid did an excellent job with our room. It was always clean upon our return and we only came up once while she was in there and we only had to wait for her to leave for just a minute or so. The mini bar was stocked when we arrived with soft drinks, water and Corona beer. The service was to be restocked every other day and as necessary. We had it stocked each of the days we were there. The in room liquor dispenser was pretty standard. Bacardi Rum, Jose Cuervo Gold Tequila, Presidente Scotch and some type of Scotch Whiskey. We used very little and drank mostly at the Lobby Bar and the Pool Bar. A POOL: The pool area is very nice and relaxing. There were always plenty of chairs and the swim up bar was always nice to hang out at. Raul was excellent and not only worked at the Pool Bar but in the Lobby Bar as well. Some of the other bartenders were not nearly as cordial and engaging as Raul, but were OK overall. A BARS and DRINKS: The bars were all very nice. The Lobby Bar especially was great. There was a section that had a piano bar in it as well as an Internet cafe. It was very laid back and relaxing there, yet had kind of a formal feeling to it. I wouldn't hang out in the Lobby Bar in just shorts and a t-shirt. The Bartenders at each of the bars did an adequate job and attempted to accommodate most every request. The selection of liquors were great!. There was a wide variety of Bourbons and Whiskeys as well as Rum, Tequila and Vodka. There was also a great selection of cordials as well. Mostly premium stuff. A+ OVERALL EXPERIENCE: As I said in the beginning of the review, had we stayed here for the entire trip, we probably would have rated it even higher. We were spoiled by the Aventura Spa Palace. The RIU has almost a stuffy kind of atmosphere. There was a noise policy after 11 pm. No noise at all to be heard. Everything was basically shut down at that point. There is a disco at the RIU Tequila next door (we didn't go) and it was pumping throughout the night (we should have gone). The employees at the resort that we came into contact with would only speak when they were spoken to or if we acknowledged them first with a nod or something. It didn't seem like they went out of their way to be personable to the guests. I'm definitely not saying the service was bad, but it was not what I expected. The RIU Palace is a beautiful resort with a beautiful beach, decent food and OK service. If this property could provide the same level of customer service as some other resorts, it would be extremely highly rated. I would definitely recommended staying at this resort if you are interested in a great looking resort with a great beach. We would definitely return to a different RIU property, but probably not this one. B

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Allen_W
Reviews.Content: First time at a RIU, our second in Mexico (last time it was the Azteca). Simply no comparison with any others in our opinion. This is a first class all inclusive resort. Check-in was hectic but once we settled into our first floor room facing the courtyard fountain, we were pleased. Clean, beautiful grounds (some lingering damage to the palm trees), spacious beach (forget about having to reserve beach chairs), courteous staff, imported liquors, very good food with a variety of meats and vegetables (no one got sick). Long pants are required for men for dinner AND the buffet (silly). There are four a la carte restaurants. We ate at the King Edward. It was very good. People like to dress up in the evenings so be prepared. Service was exceptional, except when lots of families with children showed up toward the end of our week, then service suffered a bit. A word of caution about the flight. We used Aero Mexico. Our departure was delayed for 65 minutes leaving Boston and 3 hours and 15 minutes leaving Cancun with no explanation in either case. Also, Cancun airport is not a world class international airport. It actually borders on controlled chaos in our opinion. Priority check-in is meaningless here. This has nothing to do with storm damage. So, be prepared to use up a full day for travel, even if your flight time is in the 4-6 hour range. Visiting the RIU Palace makes you forget all that. This is the only place we'd go back to in Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: 4cliffs
Reviews.Content: I spent Thanksgiving at the Riu Palace with 12 other family members and we all had a wonderful time. The Riu Palace is beatiful, the food and beverages are top-shelf and the staff is amazing. We did have some young children in our group and although the resort isn't geared for young children, they had a wonderful time as well. We initially checked into the Riu Tequila, but weren't thrilled with the rooms and not being right on the beach- so we moved over the the Palace and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday”
Reviews.Author: shadyladyuk
Reviews.Content: best holiday my family have been on we loved it. The people there are so friendly the service is excellent i would definetly go there again, we met a few coupels there who also loved it and were thinking of goin back there in the future. The beach is lovly and the waters clear, the weather was fab.....10/10 for the riu and its staff

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: CancunES
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palace Mexico from Dec 1-4, 2005. This is the best Riu we have stayed at. Customer service was awesome, from receptionist to housekeeping. I'm a picky eater and was very impressed with the quality and variety of food compared to other all-inclusive hotels. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious. One of the best things about staying at the Palace Mexico is that you can visit the other Riu properties in the Playacar complex. We had a lot of fun at the Piñata disco in Riu Tequila and also at the beach bar in Riu Yucatan (thank you Roger for introducing us to the Tequila Boom Boom shots). The drinks are much better at the Palace (premiun liquor, even in the in-room minibar), but people of our age group (early 30's) are mostly found in the other Riu properties. The shows at night were very good. The beach is nice and ample with no rocks and plenty of lounge chairs. After staying at Riu Palace Mexico we won't be able to go to any other Riu that is not a Palace. Thank you Laura, Raul, Roger, Miriam, Roberto, Julio and others who made our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace- the Best! Great staff escpecially Elazar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say the RIU palace was fabulous. I had just stayed at the Riu Tequila (with about 10 other friends) about 2 months prior and it was great too! I have to say that the staff at both places were wonderful. The person who stands out in my mind is Elazar who worked the bar- He was working at the Tequila earlier in the summer and now was at the Palace. I was happy to see him becuase he made our stay even better- He remembered my favorite drink and provovided excellent, friendly service and even recommended some great places to go in town. The front desk staff Joel and Antony were great too. I would definately come back to this place. The food was great, rooms large, and the facilities were kept spotless, and you gotta love that the lobby had air conditioning. The Riu properties are the way to go!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Riu Palace. We were there with another couple from 11/11/05 -011/14/05. The resort is awesome. The grounds are spectaculiar...Hurricane Wilma did damage some of the Palm Trees, leaves were gone and so on but they have worked very hard at the resort to restore the landscaping. The courtyard is beautiful! We actually witnessed a few weddings...the staff placed an enormus amount of time and effort into these weddings to ensure their beauty. The food is very good with different choices everyday. The Japanese and Meditranian Restaurants were wonderful...you need to make reservations early in the morning. Plenty of beach chairs. Drinks were very good. The service all the way around was wonderful...very friendly staff and is eager to please! The rooms are very nice and cleaned daily. Shopping across the street was nice. Going into Playa del Carmen is a 5 minute taxi ride and there are many different shops and restaurants. We all will be returning to the Riu. This was our 8th trip to Mexico our first stay in Playa del carmen and at the Riu Palace. Go and enjoy it was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Is OK But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My male friend and I were to stay 10/15 - 10/22, however, our trip was extended to the 10/25 due to Wilma. The lobby is beautiful and service is exceptional. Especially Stephanie and a petit small blond who wore a CSI T-shirt after the Hurricane hit. The staff was extremely polite. I found the room perfect, yes the mattress was hard but corrected with the mattress pad. Loved the bathroom. The room did smell a little musty, but hey once you open the patio doors it clears in a few minutes. Please remember, you are staying close to the ocean. I was a little disappointed that they did not offer room service (for food). On days we had full day excursions, we did not feel like dressing in the required casual attire for dinner. I do suggest a limited menu, i.e. sandwiches, fruit platter etc. The view from our room was spectacular, we stayed facing the fountains and the beach was everything I wanted and more. Now for the OK part of the trip, if you wanted to try the other restaurants you had to make reservations which was fine. However, it was only done at a specific time and it was handled by only one person, needless to say the line was very, very long; so I did not have the opportunity. The Apple Vacations representative was very patient during the difficult days post Wilma, some people were verbally aggressive and demanded immediate answers. We were at first told we would not be able to leave until the 26th or 27th but my prayers were answered and we were able to leave on the 25th. I could not believe she came looking for us personally to deliver the news. Now that is service! Now for another only OK part, we had to double up with another couple in preparation for the Hurricane, the first room we went to the individual was rude and refused to let us in. He slammed the door in my face. When I informed the staff, we were changed immediately. Also travel representatives from Belgium met us in the lobby and apologized profusely. They assured us his behavior was not indicative of their country. So I can honestly say the hotel does care about your confort level. We ended up sharing a night with a wonderful French Canadian couple. I did meet two other couples from England who were extremely pleasant. I just thought a smile was a uniform way to communicate. If nothing else to warrant a nod of acknowledgment. While most of the other Americans would reciprocate, I found the Europeans would not. At times while at the Buffet, some would rush in front, grab the serving utensil and act as if you weren't there. During one of the Hurricane meals two young women were ahead of me and they literally removed all but two tea sandwiches from the recently refreshed platter. While using the phone in the small shopping plaza across the street, the connection was lost after a minute. I put the receiver back on the hook and the individual behind me reached over my shoulder and picked up the receiver. She did not wait to see if I was going to try again or let me move two inches. Since she did not speak english, I gave her a look that obviously revealed my displeasure, she put the phone back. I am an African American, so this sort of behavior was especially disheartening as we could tell it had to do with our ethnicity. But overall we did not allow a few bad apples to spoil our fun. The hotel cannot be liable for guest behavior. There is no shortage of idiots. The final OK part is the hotel was charging individuals who stayed after their scheduled departure dates, despite the fact the airport was closed and even if it were open the road was impassable. This I could not understand, as from 10/20 to 10/21 I roomed with another couple. When they returned to their previous room I cleaned, removed the trash, swept the floor, obtained disinfectant and cleaned the bathroom. We had no phone service and the lights were out from Thursday night until Sunday evening. And you know, I would not have cared as others at different hotels did not fair as well but an additional $$$ burden did annoy my sense of reason. There were a lot of unhappy guests at checkout time. Who knows the charge has not been processed on my account, so maybe they have had a change of heart.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent's perspective”
Reviews.Author: TripGuy
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent who visits about 10 resorts/year, I truely can appreciate the beauty of this resort, even after Wilma. Here is a breakdown of our review of the resort: Location - Great location. About a 30 minute stroll into Playa del Carmen or a 5 minute taxi. Easily accessible to the tourist areas of Tulum, Xcaret, Xel-ha, etc. Structure - Riu Palace's are probably the best designed resorts in Mexico. Elegant lobby, great "piazza" feel with live music in the evenings, wonderful fountains, nice pools, and everything is very clean. Keep in mind, that my visit was the week after Wilma and I felt this way....it will only get better. (As an FYI, the Riu Palace Riviera Maya being built about 5 blocks north is looking even nicer although it wasn't finished when we walked around...incredible looking) Beach - The beach at Riu Palace Mexico is nice for the area. Plenty of large palms to provide shade, umbrellas on the beach if you need them. Didn't look like much damage from Wilma. If you haven't been to the Riviera Maya, please be aware that the water off the beach is not crystal clear like other areas of the Caribbean. Also, it it is not as calm. Food - The food at the resort was above average for an all-inclusive in Mexico but did not meet my 5-star expectations. The buffet was above average for breakfast and lunch, but after a couple of times there, it got boring quick as the variety did not change enough. Plenty of options however and some very good meals were had....just not 5 star, more 4 store in total. Entertainment - Live music in the Piazza was great and we saw a couple of shows after the resort started to fill up again. Average in total, especially since little was available after about 11 pm each night. Service - 4 star service. Some really great employees including the gentleman who checked us in. Others were not interested in going out of their way to provide exceptional service. Rooms - we had rooms 245 and 246, oceanview. Due to the location of the resort, being farther away from the beach, I do not believe that oceanview is worth the extra money. Fountain view rooms on the side, would be my top choice for they are closer to the main lobby and restaurants, especially since there is no room service at the resort. Other items of note (nit-picky) - 1) Towel cards, key & wristbands - I hate the fact that this resort forces people to carry towel cards and wristbands around. They are truely awful and are not appropriate for a resort that wishes to be 5-star. Also, they need to get electronic door locks, since carrying around their key is also a pain. Other 5 star resorts like Secrets have gone away from both and use your name and room number as ID at the restaurants. 2) Internet access - in the age of cheap internet, this resort has yet understood. Only available for rental and not cheap at that. Yes, I know some people want to get away from it all....I believe they can choose not to use it, but people who need affordable internet access have to walk into PDC to get it. 3) Bar service at the buffet - difficult getting bar drinks at more busy times...are people less likely to want a drink just because it is a buffet meal? 4) Bar service at the beach - not available during our stay Please feel free if you want some of the pics we took during our stay or if you have any questions about this or the other resorts we have been to. We stayed at Secrets Capri after the Riu and I will be posting a review there also.

Reviews.Title: “RUI Palace The Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were vacationing in the Riveria when Hurricane Wilma hit. The RUI Palace and its staff took excellent care of us and all their guest. They made sure we were safe and had plenty of food and water. Not once was I worried about the Hurricane while we were in our rooms waiting it out. The hotel was safe and secure. The staff during the stay was unbelievable. Our next trip will be to the Riveria Maya and we will be staying at the RUI Palace. THank You RIU

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful People Took Care of Us”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeJaime
Reviews.Content: When you go through a situation as stressful as a hurricane you need assurance and assistance. The staff at the Palace were reassuring, attentive, and were the hardest working people I've seen in my 58 years. Reviews can describe many things and rate by stars. There are not enough stars to rate these people. Miriam, Tony, Carlos, and Irimar at the bar, David at the piano, Manuel who was everywhere, the wonderful Stephanie who kept a smile the whole time, Rosalia at the desk, and most of all Jimmie who was DJ, dancer, bar instructor, landscaper, and cook all in one person. Every employee at the Palace--GREAT JOB! My wife and I will be back to this place to see all our friends and enjoy the nicest resort we,ve ever been too. It just won't be in hurricane season.

Reviews.Title: “The Riu pulled everyone through Wilma”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last week we were stuck at the Riu Palace due to Hurricane Wilma. We both can not say enough to thank the staff for the amazing treatment we received during this ordeal. Stephanie, the PR Director for the Hotel, was incredible. Never did a smile leave her face. We know she was working with a full hotel and little staff. The staff (Stephanie included) actually came around to deliver sandwiches to the guests during the worst part of the storm. And when Wilma started to subside, they actually re-opened the buffet. As the week progressed the tourists still in Playa Del Carmen were frantically making phone calls every day trying to figure out how we would get home. And every night, the only thing that relaxed us was watching the entertainment team put on their shows. DJ Jimmy, Chi Chi, and the rest of the staff were always great faces to see after stress filled days. During the day the entertainment team was working around the hotel trying to clean up after the storm, so for them to go and smile and put on a show for us, when it had been a long day for them was truly remarkable. The wait staff and the bartenders at the hotel were wonderful as well. We could really go on and on about how positive our experience was at the RIU Palace. We have had our fill of Mexico for a few years now, but trust us, we will return and we will stay at a RIU resort. In fact where ever we travel, we will always look for a RIU.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners Hurricane Wilma Survivors”
Reviews.Author: KidKaos
Reviews.Content: I wanted to be able to get in a review of the Riu Palace in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico, in the aftermath of Hurricane Wilma, and share with you how wonderful the staff at the Riu was during and after Hurricane Wilma. My new wife and I decided to go back to the Riu Palace a second time to spend our honeymoon (at least our honeymoon will be extremely memorable). As always, the level of service provided by the Riu's staff was amazing. Our hearts go out to all the Mexican people and their families, many of whom still have homes under water. Yet, the staff at the Riu Palace worked round the clock to ensure our safety. The Riu Palace is a fortress. From what I have been told, it was 1 of 5 hotels out of 500 that fully withstood the magnitude of a Category 4 hurricane for 36 hours. We were very fortunate to be in a place that was fully prepared. We did lose electricity for almost 3 days, and the phones never came back, but the Riu Palace was a home away from home. They provided us with food and water and shelter, and still maintained as high a level of service as was possible, given the circumstances. If we ever visit Mexico again, the Riu Palace will be the only resort at which we will consider staying.

Reviews.Title: “All 42 people, ages 17 through 84, loved this resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were among a group of forty-two people, ranging in age from 17 to 84 years old, who attended an all-inclusive, four-day vacation stay during a wedding which took place at the RIU Palace in Playa del Carmen, Mexico. All five of the resort's restaurants offered us extensive and varied daily menus which included delicious, chef-prepared, beautifully presented food choices. The ambiance and attentive wait staff added to our enjoyable dining experiences. Throughout the hotel resort the staff members were wonderful -- from concierges to wait staff to housekeepers. All were warm, helpful, accommodating, and they wished to please. The guest rooms and suites were regularly stocked and thoroughly cleaned each day, and the entire hotel resort was elegantly furnished and decorated. For nightly entertainment, we could sit in the spacious outdoor atrium watching and listening to a Latin band as it performed a wide range of Latin songs and American pop favorites. If we felt like dancing, we could join other resort guests from all over the world who were loosening up in the paved dance area in front of the band's pavilion stage. A short distance away, we could sit in comfortable theater-style chairs in the roofed theater and watch a lively production of "Grease," Mexican-style. Individual musicians/vocalists provided dining and cocktail lounge guests a pleasant yet unintrusive accompaniment for their gastronomic experiences and intimate conversations. The beach's sugar-white sand and azure water were stunning, and the beach resort area included all the amenities we could ask for. Best of all, we didn't have to figure tips, visit ATMs, or check bank accounts online because everything was included in the prepayment arrangements. We all agreed that this was the perfect trip at the perfect resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice @ RIU Palace Playcar!”
Reviews.Author: hiltinuts2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were here Oct 1-7th 2005. After reading many reviews about the Rui Palace, we were not surprised by the musty rooms and hard beds. Now that I got that out of the way... ... The Rui Palace was very nice. The PALACE is in Playacar which is a five minute cab ride to Playa Del Carmen's 5th avenue for all of you shoppers out there. More on that later. The Rui Palace is surrounded by 3 other RUI Resorts all of which are in walking distance. The Palace IS INDEED THE FINEST of them all. Thought I should mention this just in case you get overbooked and they want to put you at another Rui location... Don't. Insist on the Palace. The Palace features probably one of the nicest beaches I've ever seen in Mexico... many other people will tell you the same. The atmostphere is more adult-laidback even though kids are welcome, the clientelle seems to be more upscale here than the other RUIs (which could be good or bad depending on what you're after). The service\waitstaff is top-notch. I cannot say enough on how friendly these people are. The only negative thing I could bring up would be the whole dinner reservations thing. The RIU sports 4 different resturants, however, 3 require reservations for dinner. Man, I'm on vacation, I've left my organizer at home, WTF, reservations?!? Oh well, no biggie... just make sure that you are at the reservations desk (yep, I said DESK) before 10am if you want to try any of the 3 resturants. If you're going through Apple Vacations, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND the snorkling excursion. Make sure it's through Mayan Adventures! Seriously, this excursion rawked. We spent 3/4 day snorkling at 3 different places and ended-up swimming with a seaturtle, which made my wife's whole vacation. Lastly... Playa Del Carmen. The wife likes to shop so we try to get down to 5th Avenue and find deals. Before this vacation, it had been two years since being in Playa. Soooo much has changed in downtown Playa. Before, Playa was REALLY rough which kinda had an element of danger. However, present day, Playa has cleaned-up a TON! More street lights, they finished the main road downtown, we actually saw policemen patrolling, and it was really fun hanging out at Carlos and Charlies. I don't normally give anywhere 5 stars but the Riu Palace was pretty darn close (if our room hadn't have been musty). Hope this review helps... Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “The Trizzo was Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the RIU! The resort is very clean and the staff makes you feel at home. The food is terrific and most importantly, the beach is 100% awesome! I love to sunbathe and after just one afternoon, I had a great base!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed there for our honeymoon back in May. It was very warm weather and maybe rained twice usually around 6pm when your in room getting ready for dinner. The place was beautiful!!! I fully recomend it and in fact we are planning another trip there in February. The food was excellenct! ( I left 10lbs heavier) availble at all times of the day and night. We never ordered room service but did not need to for what they gave us throughout the day. One thing that is tough if your not a morning person is that you must make a reservation (no exceptions) unless you want buffet everynight which is not bad either. What we did was take turns waking up early to get there in time. Our room was right near the area to make reservations so we lucked out. The beach was incredible!!! Sand was HOT HOT HOT but that was because we were there in May. You NEED to rinse your suit off when you get out at that time of year due to some alge bug "which I caught" called sea lice. Sounds worse than it is. Its not lice but that is the name of it. In all areas of bikini I had oversized mesquito bite type bumps that itched like hell but if you show the girls in the pharmacy they know right what to do.(only use cream. Dont take pills becuase they put you right to sleep!!) It has happened to me before just watch during April-July. I have to say that I could not have been happier there and would go time and time again. So if your ready to get up early eat lots of food and just bake in the sun. This is the place for you!!!!!! Highly recommended!!!! Have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at Riu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just returned from honeymooning at the Riu Palace (10/3/05-10/10/05) and would definitely recommend it. I doubt we would go back because I'm one to try other resorts instead of the same one but all in all it was good experience. Service - this was outstanding. They are on top of things and everyone is very friendly and accomodating. The only problem I had was the morning I ordered room service (coffee only), they brought me a cold pot of coffee. When I called to ask for another one, it never arrived so I finally went down and got my own. Rooms - the rooms are nice but ours did have a musty smell to it. The beds are a bit hard and although we didn't get a mattress pad, I highly suggest it. You can't really cuddle because of the crack in between the beds. The TV's are definitely small and only a few selections of English speaking channels. I also didn't like that they do not have coffee pots in the room. I am the kind of person that doesn't like getting dressed to get a cup of coffee. Pool - we spent a lot of time at the pool and found it to be very clean by the pool bar. The other side wasn't so great - the water was filthy most of the time. They play great music during the day, too. Beach - Absolutely gorgeous. I would suggest getting there early if you like to sit up front right by the ocean. Otherwise, they have plenty of chairs and lots of palm trees for those who like the shade. Restaurants - the main buffett was decent. They had a huge spread of food but most of it was things that I have never even heard of nor had any interest in trying. Some of the American food they did have was a bit bland. My favorite was breakfast because you can't go wrong with sausage, bacon & french toast! We at twice at Sir Edward. We loved the appetizers and dessert. I had the filet mignon for the main course and it wasn't that great. My husband had the red snapper and that was much better. We also ate at El Patio and this is very similar to the main restaurant, Don Julian - buffet style, same desserts, salad bar, etc. We weren't really impressed with that one.

Reviews.Title: “Happily Married in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Wedding at the RIU Palace Mexico and it was absolutely amazing! The staff was all extremely friendly and helpful. Our ceremony was beautiful. Our pictures and DVD are incredible, and they got it to me in less than 24 hours! My 27 guests said it was the best wedding they've ever attended. As for the resort, the rooms are nice and clean, but they are starting to look a little dated - but not worn. I too recommend asking for the matress pad. The beach was spectacular! I ate at all of the specialty restaurants as well as the buffet and never left hungry. I would say that there were some things that were really good and other items that I was not impressed with. Overall, I would say the food was good. All in all, we had a wonderful time. I went into the experience hopeful, and the RIU Palace exceeded my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Riu Palace for our honeymoon. We had a fabulous time and would go back in a heartbeat. This was our first all-inclusive, but we spoke with a lot of people at the resort who had been to others and they all felt this was one of the best. The service at this resort is top of the line. The waitstaff anticipates your needs before you do and takes care of them immediately. The moment you are clearly done w/your plate, it is removed and your water glass is never allowed to be emptied. The rooms were very nice. Only issue we had was the beds are 2 doubles pushed together, so each person has to be on either side of the crack. We did not get a mattress pad, which may have solved this problem. Even though the beds are harder than we are used to, we were very comfortable sleeping on them. The rooms have the mini bar stocked w/soda, water & Corona, as well as a few bottles of liquor. The pool and beach areas were great. The grounds were absolutely beautiful - again much nicer than the other 2 Riu's we visited next door & across the street. We walked up & down the beach and the Riu Palace had the nicest beach by far. If the pool area gets filled, which it did a couple of afternoons, there is always plenty of room at the beach or take a short walk next door to the Riu Yucatan and hang out at their pool. Great thing about exchange privileges! The food was fantastic at most of the places we went for dinner. Our only complaint was you can only sign up for the restaurants needing reservations up to a day ahead of time starting at 10 am. The line forms well before 10 and by the time we made it up to our turn (We got in line at 10:10), there was only 1 place left for dinner that night & 1 for the next night. We did several tours which left before 10 am so a few nights, we had no choice but to eat at Don Julian, where you don't need reservation. All the restaurants require men to wear pants. We were not told this by our travel agent, so my husband wore the same pair of jeans every night for a week. They do not budge on this rule AT ALL (we tried!). Only dinner we felt was ok was at El Patio. I had the steak, which I like rare. It was beyond medium and really thin. The salad bar, soup & dessert were good there and my husband enjoyed the ribs. Don Julian was actually our favorite and the selection there for breakfast, lunch and dinner is amazing! You name it, they have it, no matter what part of the world you are from. Although we did not eat there, we heard Miyagi and Sir Edward were great. This resort is definitely good for a more laid back vacation. The crowd is older and more mellow. Only a handful of kids running around. We enjoyed this being that it was our honeymoon. We did go across to the Riu Tequila one night and that was definitely more a party atmosphere! Again, great having exchange privileges but you can always go back to the easygoing place! We did watch a couple of the shows - the Michael Jackson one being the best! All in all, would highly recommend the Riu Palace and I am sure we will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tedman007
Reviews.Content: Hi There, The Palace was a very nice resort. I recommend it. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food was very good. The room was very comfortable. However, the T.V. is very small. (19") Hard to see from the bed. The beach was Awesome and the use of Kayaks and Catamarans was included in the All-inclusive. The resort also lets you use the other sister facilities. The Riu Tequila, Riu Playacar and Riu Yucutan. The Riu Palace uses premium brand liquors, whereas the others use the cheaper well brands. The resorts tend to market mostly to Europeans. We meet a lot of people from the U.K. Very nice and friendly. However, some of the eastern Euro's were not. The Mexican people were all very friendly. This is a very nice resort and we enjoyed it very much. It was a little bit pricey for us so next time we will most likely stay at the Tequila which is usually about 30% less expensive. Enjoy yourself and good luck. P.S. Ask for a room on the fountain side or Southern face if you sleep late. Because on the north face construction begins about 8:00 am on the hurricane damaged Viva Mayan Hotel. Was not too bad for us, cause we woke up about that time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Riu Palace!”
Reviews.Author: sunland
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at Riu Palace Mexico September 1 - 7, 2005. I found the reviews I had been reading here for months prior to this trip to be very accurate - no surprises. The resort lobby, grounds, etc. were beautiful and extremely clean. The rooms were extremely nice and spacious as well. From the reviews I knew to order a matress pad upon arrival, which I did - and then the bed was fine. The customer service provided by the staff was SUPERIOR and way better than the service we have received at all-inclusive places we have been to before. The food at the restaurants was superior as well. We went to Sir Edward's and Miyagi's and loved them both - very formal settings and service. You need to pay attention to the dress code when making reservations at these places, you will feel uncomfortable if you don't! We liked the Don Julian's buffet as much as we liked the a la carte restaurants. There were many, many different choices and several different cooking stations to prepare your dish just the way you liked it. The beach - this was the BEST part of the trip as we are "beach" people as opposed to "pool" people (we can do the pool at home). The Riu Palace had the best beach by far of any of the resorts up and down that area. The beach was very wide and deep, with lots of palm trees for shade. We had no problem at all finding lounge chairs in the sun or shade. Plenty of space for everyone! White sand, blue water - we were very impressed! It is true that the Riu Palace catered more to the older crowd (30ies plus) and was laid back at night. You could tell the Riu next door had a younger, more adventurous crowd. We were just fine with the laid back atmosphere of Riu Palace (we are mid-thirties) as our goal was to relax on this trip. The nightly entertainment was OK - the best shows were the "Grease" and "Michael Jackson" productions - the rest were so-so. Overall this was a great place to vacation and we plan on returning to Riu Palace Mexico again!

Reviews.Title: “Third Time Is Enough!!!”
Reviews.Author: Legaleagle73
Reviews.Content: My husband, two kids (6 year old and one whose 11 months), my parents and his parents and his sister (9 people total) went to Riu from August 27-September 3rd. My husband and I have been here twice before and our families it was a first for them. As soon as we arrived at the Palace we were given our rooms within 10 minutes, we had requested courtyard view, but unfortuneately our request was not made. Not a big deal! My mom who requires a wheelchair which was given and also a handicapped room. The staff is terrific and they met all our needs. The one bad thing for my mom was that there where no steps in the pool area only ladders, which is difficult for her. Also, there should be a walkway made for wheelchair accessibility to and from the beach (Somewhere on the side) that would be very convenient for people who require wheel chairs. My mom could not walk to and from the beach, thus she mostly stayed at the pool area, again which was fine with her. As usual the rooms did have a musty smell and when I got home I did do laundry to get rid of the musty oder, again which is not a big deal. It's an outdoor area in Mexico with temperatures in the 90's and it does tend to get humid and thus causing the smell in the rooms. The beds were perfect for us and they provided a crib for the baby. This time around there were a lot of people with kids and they did provide entertainment for the little ones prior to their shows every night at around 8:30. The shows were alright and we did enjoy the ones especially when they did the Mr. and Ms. Riu Palace contests which were a lot of fun. Food was good. The buffet is the best place for breakfest and dinner, it has a wide variety of foods for I think every pallet. For kids they served pizza, burgers, french fries, hot dogs, lots of ice cream choices, my daughter was in heaven. We did go to the Japanese restaurant one night and it was alright, nothing special and we did prefer to eat at the buffet rather than all the other restaurants. The reservations did need to be made between the hours of 10-12 for the speciality restaurants. For lunch El Patio and La Traviata (buffet style) were pretty good. My husband and I enjoyed the moonlight massage on the beach, while parents babysat, (which I highly recommend, it's so relaxing and romantic, also enjoy the jacuzzi)! The grounds are so clean, however the pool area was a little dirty. We did play volleyball and I enjoyed water areobics. We meet a lot of couples from the U.S., and especially a little girl from Utah whom my daugther had a blast with. All in all this was a great trip! The hotel, service, staff and food were wonderful. However three times is enough!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Rui Palace with 31 family members and it was a perfect vacation. The staff went above and beyond. The food and drinks were great. If you are travelling with kids make sure you ask for adjoining rooms and book your activities ahead as they tend to sell out (you then just have to go downtown and you can find any activity you want.) This place was beautiful and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Riu Palace. Everything was exceptional, the restaurants were great, the service everywhere fantastic, the place was spotless and beach was amazing, one of the best beaches anywhere. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you choose to stay at RIU Mexico, you will have a wonderful experience!From the time we got there, every thing was great. The hotel is spotless. You will see people cleaning, washing windows, sweeping or whatever else they can think of, all day and night. They are very quite also. The rooms are very nice, clean, and plenty of room. It is a very nice hotel to spend time in. The Apple reps are very helpful. Just make sure you ask lots of questions. The food was great! Try to be outside of Don Julian's at 6:30pm, you will get a very nice suprise!! This resturant has a wide variety of food. All of it is good. If you can't get reservations in a resturant, this is your only other choice. Be sure to get in line early, they go quick! The beach is clean, plenty of chairs, just watch for people trying to sell stuff. I found this to happen often. They are not pushy, very friendly. If you choose to do a day trip, go to Don Julian's, talk to the manager, he might be able to get you a reservation for the next day, since you will not be there to make a one. A couple extra $$ goes a long way!! Everyone is so nice and friendly! I can't wait to go back. I fell in love! Enjoy your trip! It is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico from Aug 14-20. We are both in our late 20's and this trip was our summer vacation while we had time off from professional school. I had read many reviews before our trip so I will comment on previous comments i agree with and disagree with. The hotel is spotless and is always being cleaned. The beach is to die for! The pool is not THAT impressive, but nice. The gym is so-so, but you probably wont spend too much time there anyway. Entertainment was just ok, the shows are kinda cheesy. I guess my idea of entertainment is not watching a half-assed michael jackson impersonator. We went out to Playa del Carmen for entertainment, we liked the Blue Parrot. Good music, fire dancers right on the beach at 11pm, $5 entery gets you 2 beers or 1 mixed drink. There are also many up-scale bars and lounges, very west hollywood style for those people from Los Angeles. Speaking of entertainment, there were no adult channels on the television, but thats ok because we could hear the couple next door having sex!! :)~ I had read a review that commented about noises in the rooms. This was very true in our case. From about 9-10 am to 7pm there was constant noise in our room from the outside. We heard the "furniture being dragged" from upstairs and it was very annoying on the days we had partied late the night before and wanted slept in past 9. I had read about the "amazing service" in the reviews before, so I was expecting a lot. While the service is good I have a few complaints. I had to call 4-5 times for a mattress pad. When it was finally delivered, we found it is was just a bed cover placed underneath the sheets. Also, when you request the beds be joined there are still two seperate sets of sheets on the bed. This makes it very hard to snuggle since you cant really share the sheets and the two sets dont stay together. I had tipped the maids the first two nights and really wasnt satisfied with how the room was cleaned(no towel art may I add), so tipping the maids stopped after the second night. I am also a little suspicious about who else has the key to the safe box. The service in the buffet was really dependant on the server. There are no assigned seats or times anymore, so sometimes we would get a great server (I'd tip $2-5 depending on the service) and sometimes my glass would stay empty for 10 minutes before somebody would come to fill it (wouldnt leave a tip for that waiter). But I must say I thought the food was pretty darn good for a buffet! Loved the breakfast, loved the seafood pastas at dinner. We tried two ala carte resturants, miyagi's (japanese) and el patio (steakhouse). I thought the steakhouse was pretty good, we both had the ribeye, although the dessert and salad was still buffet. style The set-up of the japanese was excellent, but i thought the food was average/below average compared to the sushi bars in the los angeles area. The fried ice cream was awesome! My fiance got sick after the sushi night, but that might have been from the 5-6 bottles of sake we were downing with the food. she thinks it was from the shrimp since she ate it all. btw, corona really doesnt go with sushi imo, wish they had some japanese beer. oh well. Dont expect to get drunk on mixed drinks. They are pretty weak and asking for a double doesnt change much. I couldnt really tell if there was alcohol in them at all. I didnt use the alcohol dispensor in the room, but i suppose i could have gotten drunk if i really wanted by taking shots in the room. Smirnoff and Cuervo..yuk. There was Absolute at the main bar, but i usually just headed to PDC. I had read in a review that food couldn't be taken to the room from the buffet. Not true! at 10am we went and brought a bunch of plates of breakfast to the room. I dont know why a previous poster had to "smuggle" anything. kinda funny in retrospect. Oh, beware of the mosquitos! My fiance spent an hour the first day killing mosquitos in our room. We still got biten up. In regards to the bathroom, it was a little dark in the shower when the curtain was closed, but not a big deal. The towels are pretty nasty (partly why I was dismayed with the maid service). They were thin and old with stains. This was also true for the towel service at the pool. Let me just close by saying again that the beach was AWESOME. Plenty of lounge chairs at all times. The beach makes this resort. One more thing, if you decide on going scuba diving be warned about your ears!! nobody tells you this, but you will likely have some major ear pains for 12 hours afterwards, so save it for the end of your trip. Oh yeah, Xcaret, thumbs down. Dont waste your day and visit the zoo when you get home. And about Cozumel, plan on renting a car to explore the island or else you will be walking around the tourist shops. I probably wouldn't go back to this resort, only because there are other nice places to visit around that area i would like to try. But if you havent been there before, go and enjoy. Disclaimer: I really did enjoy my vacation, this review may come off negitive because if I were to highlight all the positives it would be very long.

Reviews.Title: “a dreamed honeymoon at the Riu Palace!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Riu Palace for our honeymoon on may 22-29. We chose the Palace based on Trip Advisor reviews. It was like a dream!!! The people, the service, the location, the grounds, the beach, the rooms, and of course, the value was far more than what we expected. AIRPORT TRANSFER - we booked through Apple Vacations. Arrival into the Cancun airport was very smooth. Representatives were waiting for us outside the baggage claim area very well identified. 45 minutes ride to the Riu. In the way to the hotel the shuttle showed us a video of excursions with Apple in the Riviera Maya. But you will save a lot of $$ and time by renting your own car and buying tickets at the sites. (instead of paying $160 for 2 adults to Tulum you can do that plus Cancun with less than $100) CHECK IN - very smooth, they welcomed us by sitting us on a table, gave us a cold drink and explained to us about the hotel. We arrived at 2PM and the rooms were not ready. We were told to come back at 4pm, so we spent about 2 hours eating and exploring the hotel and the beach, exactly what we wanted. Remember to ask for towel cards, they forgot to give them to us at check in and we had to walk from the pool back to the front desk. ROOMS- we were on room 0015 (first floor facing south to the trees). A lot of privacy, specially if you want to be on the balcony. Very spacious rooms, almost 1/2 bigger that the standard US rooms. Based on previous reviews we requested a matress pad by e-mail which turned out to be a great help. Bathroom is very spacious, we had plenty of light in the shower, so definitely wasn't dark as we have read on some reviews. Mini bar with drinks including Coronas at no charge. FOOD- excellent!!! loved Don Julian and La Bodega. No reservation needed for El Patio and La Traviata. But for dinner need to reserve Don Julian, La Bodega (our favorite), and Sir Edwards (specially the last two b/c they are smaller and fill up quickly-reserve them by 8am, although 10am is the latest you can reserve) . Need to reserve Don Julian by 10am as well, but if you don't, chances are that there will be seating available for the 9pm turn. POOL -very spacious and beautiful. The pool bar closes at 5pm. You have until 6pm to return the towels, otherwise will need to take them to your room and return them the next day by the pool. We loved the jacuzzis at the spa, there are two, one is warmer than the other and it closes at 7pm. BEACH - I have been in cancun, cabo san lucas, and puerto vallarta and this is by far the most beautiful beach I have been in Mx. Soft sand, crystal clear water, warm temperature, no rocks. Somedays it was calm, other days with some wave action, not enough to be dangerous but great to have a lot of fun. Great for romantic long walks. They bring you drinks to your beach chair. Never had a problem finding chairs even when we got there at 11am. SERVICE - we were always joking and asking ourselves, what pill do they get in order to have a smile in their faces at all times?? No words will never describe how impressed we were with the service at the Riu Palace...the best ever!!!!! TULUM AND CANCUN - rented a car for $60 including insurance (from 10am to 10am). The front desk arranged it for us. In the morning we went to Tulum (about 45 minute drive to the south) and in the evening to Cancun (45 minutes to the north). The roads are very well identified, and never felt even confused nor lost. PLAYA DEL CARMEN - about 25 minute walking from the Riu, felt very safe walking since the hotel is on the Playacar gated complex. Once you get out of the complex you are in downtown PDC.
