Everyone we met was friendly and accommodating. The servers at the bars and restaurants are just lovely people who seem to really enjoy working at this resort. I would love to know the staff to guest ratio because I would guess that it is quite high. We ate at all of the restaurants except for Miyagi’s and they were all very good. Sir Edward’s was our favorite meal. The atmosphere and service there was impeccable. Don’t forget to try the coconut ice cream at Don Julian’s…its amazing! Don Julian’s is really wonderful for every meal…we could always find something that we liked and the staff was always so helpful. They do a very nice job setting it up every night with fruit carvings and displays and specialty stations. The beach at the Riu Palace is probably one of the nicest of the surrounding resorts. Just up the beach a bit was the Royal Hideaway and there was, literally, no beach. They have to walk down steps to get to the water. The beach at the Palace was very large and very well maintained. If there is an erosion problem there, I didn’t notice it. A few comments about frequent complaints: 1. I was armed with my Glade Plug-In because I had read there was a musty smell in the rooms. Not true at all! 2. The lighting in the bathroom: There are two lights in the bathroom; One in the main area and one in the toilet/bidet. We never had trouble seeing in the bathroom. I don’t know what all the fuss was about there. They use energy saving bulbs and they do get brighter after a minute or so. 3. The beds: They were firm but not at all unbearable. The hotel will be happy to put a mattress pad on the bed for you if you just ask. So, instead of complaining about it…ask! 4. Beach Chairs: We never had a problem finding a chair on the beach. And we are not early risers. I always saw empty lounge chairs for the taking. 5: The Food: We found the food to be very good. We enjoyed Don Julian’s (the main dining room) the most because there was always something new to try. There’s a theme there each evening so before making your reservations at a specialty restaurant find out what it is. 6. Reservations: We never once had a problem getting a reservation at the restaurant of our choice and we never got down to the reservation desk before 9:30 am. The first morning of our trip I was worried about it so we went down at 7:15 and got a reservation for the early seating. Well, the early seating was really crowded so from then on we ate at the later seating and had a snack at La Traviata in the afternoon if we were hungry. 7. The walk to the beach bar: 100 feet depending on where you’re sitting. We brought our insulated mugs and they were always happy to fill them but really, not a long trek. I did like having the mugs though because it kept the drinks cooler, longer. Overall, this was a dream vacation for us. It’s a quiet and relaxing resort. We are in our mid-twenties but we’re not party animals. We’re already talking about our next trip to Playa del Carmen and can’t imagine staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “As awesome as we remembered...”
Reviews.Author: SommerinTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our second trip to the Riu Palace Mexico (April 23 - 29). We had been three years ago for our honeymoon, and this trip was for our third anniversary. The Palace was exactly how we remembered it to be...wonderful! 1. Grounds - The grounds of the resort are absolutely perfect. Every time we left our room, someone was mopping the hallway, shaping the bushes, painting the edge of the pool, etc. These people work so hard to keep the Palace beautiful. 2. Beach - If you are worried about beach erosion, fear no more. The beach is fabulous, and we couldn't even tell a difference. The water is the most amazing tuquoise color, and the sand is so light and fluffy...not packed down. 3. Rooms - Although nice, the rooms would probably be my only complaint. For a Palace hotel, the bedding was definitely not up to par. The bedspreads are getting really old (same ones from three years ago), and the sheets are stiff and rough. I think this is one way the Palace could improve. Besides that, the room stayed cool, and there was no musty smell. The maids did an excellent job of keeping the room clean and changing out towels. We even got a towel swan one day. * Hint - If you want to avoid a lot of noise, ask for a room beginning in "2." These rooms are on the top floor. If possible, get one facing the courtyard. It's nice to sit on your balcony and overlook the grounds, instead of overlooking another hotel or the beach pathway to the Tequilla. 4. Food - It's an all-inclusive, so the food's not fabulous, but it's good. We ate at Sir Edward's (gourmet) one night, and the other five nights, we went to the main buffet, Don Julian. Don Julian usually has a theme each night, like Oriental, French, Mexican, Italian, etc. You can always find something you like because there's so much variety. Breakfast was my favorite meal. Their homemade donuts (donas) are sinful but delish! * Hint - The reviews we read about the coffee are true. It is very salty. To avoid this, ask for a cappucino instead. They are wonderful! You can order them at breakfast and dinner. Other advice: To avoid getting sick, make sure you don't put your toothbrush under the water in the bathroom sink. Use the bottled water provided in your mini-fridge instead (also has Corona, Pepsi, Pepsi Light, 7-Up, and orange soda!). Also, try not to let the shower water hit you directly in the face. We also watched out for fresh produce that may have been washed in the non-potable water before it came to the hotel (lettuce and fruits without a shell). So far, we're both still healthy! :) If you're looking for a fun day trip to do on your own, you can go into town to 5th Avenue, take the ferry to Cozumel and rent mopeds to ride around the island (gorgeous!), or take a ferry down to the cute marina town of Puerto Aventuras (about 20 minutes). We did the Swim with Dolphins at the Dolphin Discovery in P.A., and it was the most fun we had all week! I hope you all enjoy your trip! :)

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace was absolutely Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: GoBigBlueWilcats
Reviews.Content: We returned from the RIU Palca in Playa de Carmen last week. Where do I start? I was going expecting paradise, and it blew my expectations out of the salt water! From the minute we arrived, we were treated like royalty. Now I know what it must feel like to be a rock star! Definitely a 5 star resort. The room was great, plenty of room and very clean, wood trim and tile galore. NO musty smell!!! The beds were 2 doubles pushed together, but I don't like to share my covers, so it worked well for us. The beds were hard, but when your in heaven, why sleep all day? Every day when returning from the beach, we were excited to see what towel creature the maid had left. We had a swan, a rabbit, a duck etc. and one day returned to a huge boquet of flowers! The room had a mini fridge that they kept stocked, and a liqour dispensor with 4 different liqours. I used the fridge a lot, but if we wanted a cocktail, we went to one of the many bars on site. By the third day, Carlos and Herberto knew what drinks we liked and were quick and friendly. We took $50 in ones for tips. I thought this would last, but I wasn't ready for the amazing level of service we were receiving, and it didn't last long. Make sure that you bring smaller bills because the resort will not make change for US dollars (only pesos). So, the rest of the week I tipped in pesos. I would rate the food a 9 out of 10. Everything you could imagine to eat was at Don Julians. I would rate Sir Edwards as the best, follwed by Don Julians, followed by Miyakoes. The only restaurant we were not inpressed with was the grill (steak restaurant). Yes, it was annoying having to make reservations in the morning to the a-la-carte dinners, but you always had a seat at the buffet restaurant. The beach was very beutifull, the water was a bit choppy, but very clear. We went parasailing which was fun, but I don't think the people who run that are employed by RIU, becuase they were rude. Maybe I was just used to being treated so nicely by the Palace staff, that I gotten spoiled. We went to the nightclub at the RIU Tequila across the street. They needed a bouncer. Drinking age is 18 in Mexico, so you had to put up with some kids that didn't know how to handle their liquor and were acting like idiots in there. It may sound like I am complaining a lot, but I could write a novel on how nice the place was, and how great the staff was. I would definetly recomend the RIU Palace for someone who wants to relax. If I were single, I would go somewehere in Cancun, but for us we will definitely return. If you plan on any excursions, I would definitely recomend Xel-Ha. The snorkeling was awesome. If you do this, get the all-inclusive there, it will save you money in the long run. We also went to Tulum. If you go there make SURE you by some bug spray! The ruins were nice, but the small nat like bugs were everywhere, and made the ruins hard to enjoy. We also went to Isle Mujures. I would not recomend this, it was a wasted day. The snorkeling was terrible, and there was not much else to do. We basically paid for a bus ride to Cancun and a boat ride to the island.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Delsue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace April 10 – 17. It exceeded our expectations. We’ve traveled a fair bit through the Caribbean, and this was our first time in Mexico. The Palace had come recommended to us by a friend who had stayed last year. I can’t thank her enough for her recommendation. Check in was very quick and painless. We had sent an e-mail in advance requesting a courtside room on the top floor of the north side. We received courtside, top floor on the south side which worked out well. The room had a huge balcony which we really enjoyed. Shortly after we arrived at the room, we called the front desk to request mattress pads. This was our sole source of frustration during the trip. It took 4 phone calls (each time speaking with a different person) and 24 hours until the pads finally arrived – thank you to Borja at the front desk who finally made it happen. Food was excellent. We’re accustomed to eating well and managed to do so at every meal (much to the detriment of our waistlines). We are both vegetarians but we do eat fish and seafood, and we never had any problem finding a variety of delicious dishes. We ate all dinners except one at Don Julien’s. The one a la carte we ate at was Miyagi, which unfortunately was disappointing. We are big sushi fans, and the sushi at Miyagi catered to a very unsophisticated palate. For lunch La Traviata was terrific. Excellent pizza, pasta, fish, vegetables and salad bar. Service was stellar. Santoyo at Don Julien’s, Carlos at La Traviata and Jose Luis at the pool did an outstanding job. As did all the staff at the Palace. We brought our own air mattresses for the pool. There is a sign posted that they’re not allowed. As long as they’re used with discretion and don’t disturb the other guests enjoying the pool, there is no problem. The pool water temperature was perfect, however the Jacuzzi (notice we aren’t saying hot tub) was frigid. Plus it is in a shaded area, which does not help. We took an excursion arranged through playa.info called Tulum and Beyond and had a fantastic time. If you go to Tulum hire a guide or you’ll get nothing out of the experience. The joy of Tulum was not just seeing it but also learning about it. Truly a fascinating place. After Tulum we visited the breathtaking Gran Cenote for snorkeling. Then off to a private beach for lunch and a swim in the ocean. We were very impressed by lunch. Expecting sandwiches and a bag of chips, we were amazed at the spread that was laid out. Chicken, fish (only if you request it in advance), rice, potato salad, avocado, fresh tortillas, salsa, beer, soda, juice, fruit. What a feast. After leaving the beach it was off to another smaller cenote for more spectacular swimming and snorkeling. Great job Mitch! To sum it up, we highly recommend the Riu Palace for people looking for an elegant and relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palace!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyHHHHH
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children, ages 9 & 6, stayed at the Riu Palace in early April this year. We loved it. The food was EXCELLENT, and my husband and I are very picky and used to dining at top-rated restaurants. We loved the buffet; it was easy with our children, who could always find something they liked, but the adults loved it as well. The presentation and selection were simply amazing. Our compliments to the chefs. We tipped our dinner waiter well every night and he took EXCELLENT care of us. He also deserved it! The staff works extremely hard. Every staff member we encountered was extremely helpful and always positive. The pool was beautiful and well-kept. Pool temperature was perfect. The beach was beautiful, the best within walking distance in the Playacar area. Unfortunately, we had one annoyance, which was not the fault of the resort, but of other guests. We stayed at the same time as a LARGE group of American teenagers (60 high school seniors) who were there with some parents (although we never could figure out who or where the parents were). The kids were spoiled and oblivious to the other guests. It was somewhat embarassing to us as fellow Americans to watch these teenagers give American tourists a bad name. I think the resort would do well to try to prevent such "spring breakers" from tarnishing the reputation of the resort. We would love to return to the Riu Palace, but are somewhat hesitant to return at the traditional spring break period because of the experience with some rude high schoolers (and negligent parents) this year.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot complain about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nodnyl
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Palace in 2002 we rebooked for this year having stayed at various 4 / 5* hotels around the world but noted & were concerned by some of the comments made by other visitors. Do not take any notice of the negative criticism. Although the beds are firm we enjoyed complete rest & relation but if a firm bed is not to your liking request a soft mattress topper when checking in. Reports of a musty atmosphere were probably caused by the wooden furniture draws not being used. This soon disappeared once the draws & cupboards were opened and a full blast of air cleared the room by opening the patio doors. The bathroom, washing area and toilet were certainly well lit and it was good to see the Palace using energy saving lightbulbs. Our room contained animals made out of towels which made a nice touch & the twice daily maid service ensured we never needed a new towel or anything else. Staff were attentive , curteous & obliging & were certainly efficient in clearing tables & serving you with the next drink. Besides the minibar and optics in the room you are well served in the Piano bar for pre & after dinner drinks as well as in the courtyard & at the beach bar whilst the daily specialty cocktails served on the beach by the immaculately dressed waiters was supberb. The presentation of the whole resort was excellent & the nightly drinks display welcoming guest to Dinner was abolutely awesome and the Palace should feature photos of the displays in their brochures. The dining experience at the Palace is as good as or better than at many restaraunts we have eaten in around the world. Don Julian: Buffett self service with a choice of foods to accomodate all tastes but better suited to children. ( Breakfast / Lunch & Dinner ) Myagi: Japanese sushi specialty in a minamilist fashion. ( Dinner ) Sir Edwards : Gourmet French Cuisine with impeccable waiter service ( Dinner ) La Bodega: Argentinian Meats in a relaxed setting once again with full waiter service ( Dinner ) La Traviatta: Beach side Italian Restaraunt ( Lunch only ) El Patio: Beach side fast food during the day / Specialty waiter service for set menu dinner. Whilst you can attend the Don Julian every night once allocated your first table you do need to make reservations for Dinner in the more formal Dining rooms. Although you need to do this before 10 am it's well worth the effort to make the reservations that you want as the dining experience certainly enhanced our visit & we only ate in the Don Julian for breakfast & one lunch preferring the hands on full waiter service at the other restaraunts. Preferring the beach to the pool it was interesting to note that there is a lot of erosion occurring nearby but the beach right outside the hotel was idyllic with shade from the palm trees keeping you cool whilst a dip in the azure blue sea certainly refreshed the skin . One half of the pool was secluded and suited the honeymooners but the other side with the swim up bar was more lively & entertaining. The Spa & Gym were sufficient for the little time you are away from home but the nightly entertainment in the Courtyard & theatre was old fashioned to say the least & could be improved although you could also use the facilities of the other nearby Riu Hotels. With the manager making regular visits all around the resort and continually seeking guests opinions the Riu Palace team certainly strive to make your stay with them as memorable as possible. This is not a resort for " Party People " who are well looked after in the Cancun area but is highly recommended for the perfect holiday

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: RMC2007
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed a the Riu Palace for our honeymoon from April 10-17. We were really impressed by the beauty of the place. The lobby, rooms, pool, grounds...all were clean & breathtaking. The staff was excellent & we never felt anything other than pampered. We spent most of the week lying at the pool & beach, and of course at the pool bar. Drinks were very good & they offered most top shelf liquor. The only downfall for us was they didn't have Coke products...only Pepsi (which tasted a little different to us than what we are used to here). This did not stop us from drinking! The food was good with a lot of variety...especially at the Don Julian (buffet). We ate at the buffet most nights, however we did go to the Steakhouse & Sir Edwards (both were okay). You never have to worry about going hungry at the Riu! We were looking for a little more to do at the resort than what they offered. Part of it was our fault b/c we didin't do many excursions, but all in all it was great. We enjoyed relaxing at the beach drinking cocktails. I recommend the Riu Palace to anyone that wants a very high-class, laid back vacation. If you are looking for a "party" atmosphere it is not for you. However, the Riu Tequila across the street has the Discoteca that was a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Everyone Loved it”
Reviews.Author: calvin123
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 with two aged 17 and 22 went from March 25 thru April 3 2005. We hated to leave. Some advice: --Keep requesting a courtyard view room even if rejected on arrival. Rooms open up and on the second night, we were moved and it was well worth it. There is no extra cost and no tip was needed. --The buffet became everyone's favorite although you may as well reach the same conclusion the hard way. --Bring the insulated mugs and even an inflatable neck cushion for the lounge chairs that do not recline or stay upright to angles that you are used to at other resorts. --Taxi from airport regulated at $62. I did not see a chance to negotiate a better rate. Return is less and about $40. Both are before tips. --Went through $100 of tips and US currency can be changed to smaller US bills at the front desk without a charge. This is available most of the time depending on what they have available. --Pool water temperature was fine. --Modelo in bottles at the piano bar --Do not buy anything at the shopping area across the street from the Palace if you can. Prices much, much better in town. --Wife and daughters felt very safe and secure in town. and walking at night down the street between the Riu's. --No issue encountered as far as sickness. Suggest you avoid eating in town if you can help it as then you up your odds of an incident. --Punchline is my wife liked Playa Del carmen and the Riu Palace better than Aruba and Hawaii ( Oahu and Maui) which we have been to 3 times ( Palm Beach area). I would rate it a tie with the sand/beach whiter and nightlife better in Aruba, the water color better in Mexico and the rooms better in the Palace. --Service was very, very good. Our only blip was check-in with a German girl who had been there only 3 months a bit cold and matter-of-factly in attitude. --The abundance of shade trees makes it a better experience than Cancun where we stayed at the Ritz which was nice but starkly open on the beach. Glad we went. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Dramatically Better!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelArlington
Reviews.Content: We returned to find the RIU Palace Mexico had improved dramatically since our last visit about a year and a half ago. Employees who were snooty were no longer there. Food was very, very good - really. No hassle getting a table at an al a carte restaurant at 09:00. The beach is the best in the Playacar area, with significant erosion affecting most other resorts north of the RIU palace. The pool was nice and not too cool. Our room was near the front of the hotel, and was kept very clean and tidy with no problems. Note: the beds are very firm, if you do not like this call and ask for mattress pads to be put on - it makes the bed much more comfortable. The new manager at this place has got it on the ball! You can see him all day long visiting with guests and inspecting the property. The morale of the employees is so much better now - they are all very nice, and seem to be happy to be there. Kudos to RIU for turning this place around. We will be back next year for sure! We can hardly wait for the newest RIU Palace Mayan to open in December. My only wimpy negative comment is that the coffee at the buffet restaurant at breakfast is not so great - it is kind of salty and of poor quality - but I drank it anyway. If you are a young person hipster type you may want to go somewhere more active. This resort is calm and quiet with many 40+ people and honeymooners/newlyweds/weddings. There is no disco on site. A mostly european mix of guests - about 20% American. Overall, an excellent stay of 4 nights. A solid "9"! A good value for the $ too!

Reviews.Title: “A Wedding in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: married_in_PDC
Reviews.Content: My now-husband and I stayed at the RIU Palace from March 26 - April 6 and were married there on March 30. Prior to the trip, we spent a lot of time reading reviews and looking for an all-inclusive resort with the dream wedding setting away from the spring break crowd. We found this to be true and so much more. The wedding planning went very smoothly with most planning done via email with the wedding coordinators Jessica and Edith. Our ceremony was in the sand just off the beach near one of the massage huts. Our dinner that evening was at El Patio. The staff sectioned off a corner of the outdoor restaurant near the fountain so that we could have privacy. It was wonderful. For anyone considering a destination wedding, I would highly recommend the RIU Palace. The stress is taken away, and you can completely enjoy the day. A few pictures are attached so that anyone who is thinking of planning a wedding at the RIU Palace will have a better idea of what to expect. I think it would have helped settle our nerves and reassure us of our decision if we had the chance to see someone else's pictures or had the chance to email questions to a couple whose wedding was at the Palace. Hopefully this will help someone who is planning his/her special day. We are so thankful we chose such a wonderful location for our wedding. On a daily basis since returning home we comment on how perfect everything was. We can't wait to return. It really is paradise!

Reviews.Title: “What you may want to know”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I, there were six of us total, went the first weekk of April. To call this a five star hotel is absurd. Two out of the three rooms we had smelled like mildew. Dinner is at scheduled seating times and in order to get them get up early and be prepared to stand in line. One night we had reservations at sir edwards and they were very, very slow (and that we didnt mind to much) but it was when we asked for coffee after dinner they told us they ran out and we needed to go beacause the next seating was about to arrive. Not to mention only beer and wine for dinner no cocktails. I felt there were too many time restrictions and or windows in which you had to eat. You didnt eat when you wanted but when they wanted. The place was very clean, the staff was very nice and it was beautiful. Would I go back? NO! My girlfriends and I are all in our early thirties with 16 children between us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our week in paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: KGinCA
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in early March at the RIU. We traveled with another couple and all left our kids at home. We love our children (ages 3-11) but were so glad that we didn't attempt to bring them along to this resort which is definitely adult-oriented. The RIU is the perfect location for luxury and relaxation. We range in age from 38-42 and weren't in search of a "party" vacation. We had rooms 1121 and 1123, good beach proximity and both lovely but we did hear the music from the disco at the neighboring property at night. We read MANY reviews prior to our trip and agree, the beds are hard! Two nights prior to our return home, we saw some fluffy mattress toppers by a housekeeping cart and figured that if you request them, they will add them to the top of the beds. Ask for it on night #1, you'll sleep better! We thought the beach and the water were truly wonderful!!! Nice soft sand, great fun to jump the waves too! We hit the beach by 8 to reserve primo lounge chairs at the ocean's edge, left our towels, etc. there, then went for breakfast. As the week got busier (likely families on Spring Break), it was necessary to stake out a chair or it was quite a hunt! Loved the reviews that advised to take insulated tumblers along. We used ours every day! The wonderful beach bar staff filled them with their yummy frozen margaritas. Then, while we lounged on the beach, they stayed cold and delicious. Scuba Caribe (on the property) worked well for two afternoon scuba dives, one to a reef and one with giant sea turtles. One of their excellent Dutch staff did a thorough refresher course with us prior to our first dive too. We were tickled to be able to buy a DVD of our dive with the turtles to bring home and show our children! The weather was perfect during our week, high temperatures in the upper seventies. It was a bit cool in the evenings, upper sixties, a light jacket is a must. We took $100 in one dollar bills and used them throughout our week for tipping. The staff is so pleasant and we wanted to tip even though it's not expected. The food at the Palace was good, but not great. (I've been on 5 cruises and would say that the ship's food is superior.) RIU definitely caters to the European palate. There was delicious fresh fruit, salad fixings, soups and fresh-squeezed juices. The desserts were fair. The theme nights that we felt were great were the Italian night, the chef special night and the Mexican night. One delicious after-dinner coffee drink from the bar that we enjoyed every night was the Cafe Palace, gotta try it!! We ate at the Japanese and the steak house specialty restaurants. In our view, the effort of making a reservation for them (at 7 AM) was not worth it. Both meals were good but not outstanding enough to warrant waking up early to make a reservation for! All four of us stayed well during our trip but we did use bottled water even for brushing our teeth. OUTINGS: We went to the downtown area by cab twice and greatly enjoyed shopping and strolling. We spent 9-10 hours one day at Xcaret (the eco park) and all loved the place! It was well worth the time and money and floating down the underground river was fabulous!!! Wish I'd have had a disposable underwater camera with a flash! Though we hated to be gone from the Palace for a whole day, we all agreed that it was a day well spent. This is a long review, but this was a special vacation, greatly researched by myself and my mother (a travel agent who also loved the Riu Palace & spent a week there in Feb.) and I wanted to share my positive thoughts about this beautiful part of Mexico and this wonderful resort. If you plan to go there, you will love your time in paradise too!

Reviews.Title: “Sunshine Everyday”
Reviews.Author: VerasGA
Reviews.Content: Review of RIU Palace, near Playa Del Carmen, stayed a week in March 2005. Members of our budget-conscious group of have been fortunate over the years to have stayed at beach resorts in Mexico before (Ixtapa, Cancun, Manzanillo, Cabo, Cozumel, etc.) as well as numerous Caribbean islands and Europe. We do not go to all-inclusives to eat and drink ourselves into a stupor. Overall, we were pleased with the RIU Palace and it is run much better than the standard Mexican beach resort, we’d stay again At the resort, the RIU staff gatekeeper for the guest internet-access computers was typing away all day, everyday, and we began to wonder if she is posting bogus reports on travel boards like this one. Who knows? I can promise you this review is a legitimate review from a legitimate guest. Here are a few miscellaneous notes: Pool and Beach: Pool was never crowded and temperature fine. Ocean is great for swimming, body-surfing, etc., the Beach is long but has narrowed and has visibly eroded somewhat since the storms in fall 2004. Just north 100 yards up the beach from the RIU Palace a crew was cutting out the stumps of palm trees that had been covered at high tide and securing other trees with ropes so they would not topple into the ocean. Walking south from the Palace about 300 yards the beach widens considerably to almost 50-75 yards of exposed beach. The RIU Palace has plenty of beach (50-75 yards deep), mostly covered with palm trees as all but about 10 yards of exposed, unshaded beach has been washed away. This was not a big deal to us as we lounged by the pool but walked down to the beach to walk and swim. Rooms: the suites are spacious, high ceilings. Furniture, tiles, etc. were all in great shape. The A/C would not turn on in our first room so they moved us quickly to another room where A/C worked great. No musty odors at all. Water pressure in showers was great though temperature sometimes got lukewarm at peak demand times like before dinner. The beds are very firm as reported. If you are 30 yrs old you can deal with it for a week, but when you are 60 it can make sleep difficult if you are not used to a really firm bed. The other Mexican and European hotels we’ve stayed at never had such firm beds. We tipped the maid $20 on the first day for the whole week and we got towels folded to look like swans and rabbits as well as fresh flowers three times during our stay. Dining: A surprisingly rewarding experience. Anyone who complains about the quality or choice of foods here is too picky (you know someone like this, we all do). The quality of the food at the Don Julian main dining buffet was excellent, but if you are accustomed to dining at 5-star restaurants in NYC, Chicago, etc., and expect the same at RIU Palace resort, you will be disappointed. It has loads of fresh fruits, juices, etc. At least 40-50 different types of cold selections at the salad bar areas. 5 or more meats, from grilled to fried. 10 or more vegetables, from steamed to sautéed. 8 or more dessert selections including 6 ice cream flavors. We also ate at the Brazilian and the Japanese restaurants which were very good quality but in hindsight we would have been happy at the Don Julian every night. Other Notes: Estimate 60% of the guests were European which is not surprising given the RIU chain is based out of Spain and the value of the Euro right now. The Palace has a low-key adult atmosphere, quiet as a mouse after 11pm. No partying college spring breakers at all. Also, the RIU Palace is not a resort designed for unsupervised young children. There are no activities for kids at the Palace. So parents, do us all a favor and leave the kids at home or stay at a different resort. We brought many $1 bills with us and tipped $100 over the week. The staff never asked for nor expected tips, though they were very appreciative, and we noticed sometimes the liquor quality from the bar was better with a tip. There is a guy on staff who sells cigars that you can watch him hand-roll from tobacco leaves. It is a $6 taxi ride to Playa Del Carmen and the ferry there to Cozumel ($16 RT) takes 45 minutes and we went scuba diving in Cozumel with Blue Sea XT diving there (the diving in Cozumel is world-class and so close don’t miss that opportunity if you staying at the Palace.) The resort’s most noteworthy attribute is service and positive attitudes of the staff. In our experience the Mexican staff at other Mexican resorts were generally friendly, but the RIU Palace staff from top to bottom was exceptionally hospitable. Checkout was simple at the Palace, unlike at every other Mexican resort we’ve every stayed at where there were always strange charges to dispute. Keep your expectations realistic--if you select the “5-star” RIU Palace expecting the Ritz Carlton you will be disappointed; if you expect a high-quality Mexican resort, as we did, then you will be very happy with RIU Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Paradise! You will love it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You will absolutely love the Riu Palace! My husband and I just got back from the Riu March 19-23,2005 and frankly we wish we would have stayed longer! This hotel is a true palace! It's soo clean. The workers were up real early in the morning cleaning the resort from the statues to the pool to the beach. This place was gorgeous! Not one person working at the resort was nasty! They all smiled and went the extra mile to make sure you were happy! Not like it is here in America. They all seemed to love their jobs, you could not tell if they were having a bad day. The food was wonderful! There was something for everyone! Yes, you do have to get up early and reserve a table for dinner, but I don't think it was that big of a deal. If you are on vacation, then sleep in and when you get up make a reservation when you go down for breakfast. You might not be able to eat until 8:45 p.m., but then again you are on vacation and time isn't a issue. The beach for beatiful! I don't know what people are talking about when they say it was a tiny strip of beach? The beach had more than enough room for people. They also had palm trees off of the beach, so when you got hot or too much sun you could just move back towards the palm trees, but still be on the beach. Please wear your sunscreen. I saw soo many people with really bad sunburns. They did not look like they were having a good time, because they were in soo much pain from their sunburns. My husband and I have olive color skin and tan real easily, but we still wore sunscreen SPF 30. And we got a little burnt but not bad. The resort is basically right across the street from Playa Car shopping. Good shopping, but if you want deals wait and take a cab to Playa del Carmen. It costs $4 for a cab ride. You can really do some serious dealing in Playa del Carmen. Great food, great entertainment and very relaxing. If you are interested in a party resort, this is not the place for you. This resort was super relaxing. We are already planning our next trip down to Mexico, and we are going to stay at the Riu Palace again!

Reviews.Title: “Another day in Paridise!”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth67
Reviews.Content: Everyday I woke up and said to my husband, "Another day in paradise." This hotel is just incredible; I have never stayed at a nicer hotel, in my entire life. There is a piano bar with some one playing every day around 5 pm, 4 bottles of hard-liquor in your room, champaign for breakfast, someone who turned down your bed (if you wanted it) every night, nightly entertainment, it was all just incredible. Here is the run down: Bedroom: A full bedroom and then you take 2 steps down and it takes you to the mini living room. There is a large closet in the bedroom, with plenty of hangers. Yes, the bed was hard, but I slept great every night. The bed was 2 double beds pushed together. There is a locked safe in the room. There are 4 hard liquor bottles in the room (rum, tequila, bourbon, and one other type of hard liquor). All the beer, soda, water, etc. you could want, and they restock daily, or at your request. Bathroom: A beautiful large bathroom with a bidét. The marble was beautiful. The shower was large. Yes, that is correct, the shower was not lit, but with the other light in the room and the light shower curtains, this was not a problem. Mini living room: The mini living room had a nice couch that seated two people, a small TV with remote, coffee table, and cabinet. Off the living room was the patio. The patio is not huge, but it has 2 chairs on it. It has a nice close drying rack. I've stayed in many hotels in the south, Mexico, and by the beach, and no matter how nice the hotel, there is always that musty smell at the hotel; well not at this hotel. There was no musty smell. I believe it is because the workers scrub the hall ways, rooms, and everything, from 8am-6pm. Food: Every meal was wonderful, you had your choice of Don Julians, which is the main dining area and always a buffet, La Bodega (Brazilian), Sir Edwards (French), and Miyages (Japanese), and you must make reservations at the specialized restaurants. They made homemade omelets while you waited, pasta, anything you wanted. There was plenty of European food if you like European food (I love it!). Also more informal restaurants out by the beach and pool were La Traviata and El Patio. Beach and Pool: Huge beach and pool area. They have activities every hour on the hour (free), free scuba lessons, water aerobics, kitchen tour, volleyball, Spanish lessons. Etc. Other: The employees are all very nice and speak English. They all work like dogs.....6 days a week, 12 hours, so please don't forget to tip them; plus you'll get better service. They are thrilled with just $1.00. However, if you want a wild and crazy place this place is not for you. There is no music playing at the pool or beach, it is very peaceful. There is no one partying until 2 in the morning, it is for 30 years old and older. I would go back to Riu Palance in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Expeted more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beach is absolutely amazing. Staff is very friendly. It took two times to change the room until we get the "right" one. First one looked at the patio, where air conditioners from the main restaurant roared as motors of the airplanes 24/7, second one smelled terribly damp, third one was just perfect. Food and drinks were OK. It was our first experience with "all-inclusive" resort. It appeared to us to be very much like HMO. Everything is prepaid, so level of care is OK. Finally, it is a great place for people who like eat and drink a lot, not paying much of attention to the quality of food or drinks.

Reviews.Title: “The wedding of my dreams!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding at the Riu Palace February 19, 2004 and it was the wedding of our dreams! 68 guests attended the wedding and stayed at the hotel with us and everyone had the time of their lives. The staff were amazing, the food was exceptional, the grounds were gorgeous, the rooms beautiful and the wedding was perfect!! The hotel staff went out of their way to make our stay unforgetable. Ana was our wedding planner through the Riu Palace and she did an exceptional job - there wasn't anything more I could have asked for - everything went according to plan and turned out just as we had hoped. Our wedding exceeded all of our expectiations and those of all the guests as well. Everyone said it was the most fabulous wedding they had ever been to. I should also mention that the photographer (Hulio) and videographer were outstanding. Our pictures turned out beautifully. If you are looking to have your wedding at the Riu Palace do not hesitate....you will not be disappointed. Your dreams will come true. My husband and I have traveled extensively around the world and this hotel was definitley first class.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: indenver
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Riu Palace Mexico in March and were very satisfied. The service was wonderful, we never got tired of the food, our room was large and comfortable and the other guests were well-mannered. It was relaxing and we felt pampered. Some minor issues: I hated wearing the plastic bracelet for 4 days; getting up before 7 a.m. on vacation to make dinner reservations was a pain; the sand on the beach was a very narrow strip and quickly got crowded if you wanted a spot in the sun; expect the beach to be windy; I wish they had a real king bed instead of two pushed together. But I would go back and I would recommend this place as long as you don't have kids and don't want a party atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort but dirty sheets”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the Riu Palace. We have stayed at many nice hotels and resorts around the world and this one is certainly near the top in most respects. Our only complaint is the beds. As many have said, the beds are two beds pushed together and are hard. This could be improved upon quite a bit but was not such a big deal for us. The big problems was the sheets. When you looked at the bedsheets and pillow cases they had marks on them of various colors. I am sure that they were washed but a certain point, they should throw the sheets out and used new ones, especially at a higher priced resort like this. One night at about 10pm we called housekeeping and asked them to put on different sheets. The replacement sheets were also just as dirty. My wife is very picky and usually is not pleased unless we are at a five diamond resort. She loved this resort and wants to go back but said that next time we will bring our own sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Can it be better??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A delayed review, as me and my wife(40 somethings) stayed here at the Palace July of 2004. We chose this resort solely on the reviews that were posted with Trip Advisor, since I had expected to book Secrets. But Secrets was getting spotty reviews, so I looked for something more sure, and we wound up choosing the Palace, solely based on reviews, and then were even more assured when we found the price to be much cheaper than other 5 star resorts in the area. Airport was crowded, but quick to get thru. After Customs, go straight to bagage. There will be many uniformed people trying to help you, but they are timeshare salespeople, and you do not need anyones help to get to your transfer. 45 minute ride to the Palace. When we arrived at the front door, a white uniformed doorman welcomed us by saying "welcome to your home for the next week". He knew what was in store for us, a week in paradise. Check in fine, beautiful combination lobby and main bar area. We got second floor room, about 10 rooms from lobby hallway entrance with a view of rear gardens. I have seen people complaining that they asked for a fountains view room due to a special occasion and were denied. Of Course, those rooms cost more, and if that is important, pay the extra for it!! Room has dark wood decor, large closet, 4 liquor bar(tequila, rum, vodka and brandy), fridge with water, mixers and beer. Sunken living room with outdoor patio, bathroom with toilet and bidet, and, yes, the dimly lit shower. Beds are hard, but you can request a softer cover when arriving. The food is on a whole, excellent!! Don Miguels, the main buffet restaurant is undoubtedly, the best buffet style restaurant I have ever been to. Huge, amazing salad bar, different foods every night, always fresh, most main meats and entrees are cooked right in front of you, and if anything looks like its been sitting a while, it gets changed immediately(roving head chef). You will get assigned a table the first day, and you will use the same table each night at the sitting of your choice 6:30 or 8:45 I believe. We eat out just about every week at home, and the food was in the top 10% of all restaurants I go to. If you pay over 150 bucks for dinner all the time, you might be dissapointed, but the common man will eat like a king. Ate at La Bodega one night(ala carte), more formal, but the food is basically the same quality, just less choices. Activities during the day are the usual, lots of pool stuff, shooting, volleyball, dance lessons, spanish lessons, Etc... Beach is beautiful, lots of sun area, lots of shade area, kept clean and saleman free, good security. Bar between pool and beach, can be quite a walk on hot sand, so bring the large cup everyone is talking about. Did tandem parasailing(70 bucks), was amazing, and waverunner(which is not endorsed by the hotel)(50 bucks). both worth it. Had some little catamarans which if you took a lesson(40 bucks) you could use free all week, will do that next time. Took cab to Playa downtown(4 bucks) nice safe waking area for shopping, and some nice bars and restaurants if that interests you. Great liquor prices for bringing home. Did 2 excursions. Lobster and steak dinner cruise in Cancun bay, was nice, little crowded, but LObster was great, and had romantic music playing with a live saxophonist, nice night out. Went to a 4 wheeler excursion, which was dangerous and fun. Not recommended for the rookie quad driver, unless daring. They had courses in the sand beach, and used them fully at full speed, a definate rush!! All our excursions were arranged by our Apple representative. This is an upscale resort, one of 4 Rius in the enclosed area of Playacar., but it is the best of them. You will be allowed to use the other 3, but they cannot enter the Palace. All 3 are within walking distance easily. The most important is the Riu Tequila across the street, because it is the party place, and has a very above average dance club. Great music every night, which is not common in resorts, they usually are pretty lame. Important things to know. Long pants are required at dinner for the men, so bring plenty. It is very hot and humid in the daytime, comfy at night. People dress very well at this resort, which made it all the more impressive. The bars have alot of top shelf liquors, not everything, but much better selection than I have experienced at most all inclusives. All employees of the resort are ultra friendly and will go out of their way to please you, especially the bartenders and waiters. I don't know what else to say except that I have been to about 6 all inclusives in the last 8 years, and this is by far the best one I have stayed at, and the price is amazing compared to the others in the area and in other carribean places. We felt like royalty the whole time there. Please don't hesitate to ask any questions you would like answered, as I know this site can be ultra helpfull. My email is listed with this review.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: MMH
Reviews.Content: We just arrived from a week at the Riu Palace. This is a wonderful resort with excellent service. The main structure and entrance are architecturally handsome and capture the feel of a Mexican estate or villa. The entrance area has a small chapel that creates a sense of Mexican culture. The terra cotta tiled central walkway from the main building to the pool is beautiful with a central fountain the entire length of this area. The rooms are nicely decorated, very clean, and a good size, including the bathroom. The pool is nice but nondescript. The beach is the best we've experienced. It's deep with plentiful palm trees for shade. It has several hammocks, a bar, and a massage center. We were pleasantly surprised to have a staff member provide lounges for us on a busy beach morning. You can also get a henna tatoo or paint clay sculptures on the beach. There are activites planned throughout th day on the beach such as volleyball, exercise, and salsa lessons. Various non motorized activites are also available. The ocean bottom is sandy and it takes a good walk out before it gets deep. The clientel is mixed. We noted a large contingent of Germans during our stay and also came across French, Canadians, Brits, and Spaniards as well as many Americans. I've read many reviews on this board and others and feel the need to dispel a couple comments that keep reappearing. Several reviewers in the past have said that the rooms are musty. We were in two rooms (changed for a better view) and neither room smelled musty. However, our first room was a smoking room and I did pick up a slight smell of previous smoking. For this reason alone we would have had to move since I have a strong reaction to smoke and by the evening was already sneezing in this room. I made a mental note to remind my travel agent to remember to always book a nonsmoking room in the future. We have stayed at three other all inclusive resorts in the past, one in Punta Cana and two in Playa and all three of those resorts had musty smelling rooms..not this one. The other ongoing comment is the hardness of the beds. Again, this was not an issue in either room. However, we don't like soft mattresses so we may not have been sensitive to any hardness since we are used to a firm bed. I also read comments about being "packed like sardines" on the beach. This too was hard to fathom after seeing the beach area. It is large and has plenty of areas to find your own place. We have been to beaches where you are literally lined up in rows..not this one. However, the resort needs to make a greater attempt at keeping the beach area reserved for Palace residents only. We saw many vacationers with wristbands from the neighboring Rius using the Palace beach. This is an inconvenience for Palace customers and somewhat frustrating. The food was generally better then the food at our previous resorts. We stayed at the Paradisius in Punta Cana and in Mexico we stayed at the Iberostar and Xpu Ha. We have yet to find a resort that has a buffett like the Paradisus in Punta Cana although we have heard that the Paradisus Riveria is like the one in Punta Cana. Generally, the main buffet in the Don Julian for breakfast, lunch, and dinner was quite good. However, I felt that other on the Chef's Gala night, the cold and hot choices were not varied enough. There seemed to be a bit too much pork and not enough fish selections. Fish was always served but it was simply sauteed and not labeled. We would have preferred more salmon and seafood in general. I enjoy calamari but it became a staple after several days. I also think the appetizers could have been more interesting. The buffet at the beach for lunch was also good but tedious after several days. Cabbage and pork seemed a prevalent theme and I wondered if this was to please the German contingent. This said, the food at the buffets was better then your all inclusives but then again this is the Riu Palace and quality and variety are to be expected. We only ate at one ala carte, Sir Edwards. We felt the food was good but the buffet was better. We also felt that it was an imposition on the "vacationers" to have to stress being up early every morning to make a reservation on a daily basis for the ala cartes. One more issue regarding food, we felt it would have been a nice touch to provide a cheese table or appetizers at the bars prior to dinner but that's still not the same as an appetizer with your cocktail. For those of us with 8:45 dinner seatings, it was a long time from lunch to dinner unless you wanted a late snack at the beach restaurant. One more slight negative is the smell of smoke in the main bar since it's not an open air bar. It would be nice if somehow, the Palace could find a way to airate this area for those of us who have a difficult time around smoke. Overall, even with the few negatives which are mainly regarding the variety of the food, we had a terrific stay and would definitely return. The new manager, Ernesto is amazing and is always willing to listen to your comments and to do whatever he can to make your stay a happy one. He takes a personal interest in his clientel and pride in the Riu Palace. This resort offers a tranquil and relaxing setting with excellent service. It's beautiful, clean, and well appointed. This truly is an amazing resort and you will leave with wonderful memories!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We married in June of 2004 at the Riu Palace. It was more than we could have hoped for. All of our family and friends attended and were thrilled with the resort and accomodations. The grounds and beach are unbelievably maintained. Perfect! We have been to cancun several times but loved playa del carmen so much more. We definitley look forward to returning this summer. Dont hesitate. It is heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not entertaining...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Riu Palace a year ago the week after Thanksgiving. EVERYTHING about the hotel was absolutely awesome, we enjoyed ourselves very much. We were greeted with a warm smile and a cold drink. Check in was flawless, the lobby is breathtaking! The grounds are spotless, every morning the maids would be scrubbing the tile in the garden! The food was great, plenty of variety. OK, so here is what we didn't like...not necessarily bad, just would have made our stay that much more memorable: 1. It's a LONG walk to the beach. 2. No music at the pool. 3. Entertainment was rather dull in the evening, and nonexistant at the pool. 4. Beach bar could have been a little closer to the beach...did I mention it was a long walk? 5. Older crowd, not a party atmosphere at all. 6. No big waves here...not that they can help that. Beach was very clean though (not for young teenagers though...lots of bare skin). Playa is a quaint, neat little town. It's an easy walk into town and taxi's are plentiful and cheap. I recommend taking a day and ferrying to Cozumel! We had a blast in the huge waves. We would go back to Playa again, just would choose a more upbeat hotel. Rui Palace is great for those who are looking for rest and relaxation. The beds were hard, but comfortable. Rooms were great, very big and clean. We had a room with a large patio that overlooked the garden. At night it was almost as if the band "serinaded" us. The restaurants were more formal than we expected, but it was a fun experience...I didn't know what to do with half of the silverware they gave us. Plus it was fun to "dress up" after spending a day in my swim suit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Palace in the Mayan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were at the Riu Palace in Mayan in September for my friend Rose and Rich's wedding. My boyfriend and myself have been to Mexico before but we loved it there. The staff were very helpufl and courteous with the wedding plans. The wedding was beautiful and the grounds at the Riu Palace are incredible. I would go back to the same resort anytime with my boyfriend. Anyone who is looking to get married should look into this resort. The food was great and the beach is beautiful. Loved the hotel, location and surroundings.. we were very close to Playa Del Carman as well. A very enjoyable experience in the Mayan Riviera and what beautiful memories for my girlfriend and her husband. Thanks, Eve Fischer and Tony Paulo Toronto, Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not a great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've ever written a review, but I love this website and found many of the reviews helpful. This was the first trip my husband and I have taken in 3 years (since our children were born). The weather was wonderful and we enjoyed reconnecting and relaxing. Here's the quick of it: 1. Beautiful grounds, very clean common areas and beach well maintained. 2. Room was spacious and we had a great balcony room looking over the courtyard fountains. But we had to give $$ to the front desk person to get that room. The first room they tried to give us faced the cart path and a wall. I know things are done like this in Mexico, but honestly those rooms that face the cart path are aweful! 3. Friendly staff. However, asking for things like a bottle of wine to be brought up to our room was difficult. They acted like they had never heard of such a thing. It's all-inclusive, that means snacks and beverages should be able to be consumed outside of the eating areas. 4. The reservation policy is weird. Who wants to wake up and make reservations at the a la cart restaurants at 7:30am. 5. The food was not great. This was my first time doing all-inclusive and I don't think I'll do it again. The food was plentiful and looked amazing, but most of it tasted bland. It was almost like eating a picture. It looked good, but with no flavor. The coffee was awful as well. It was the concentrate stuff, not the real thing. The guac and chips were good. So were many of the breakfast items. 6. The alcohal was totally watered down. We went to Playa most nights to have some good drinks. The only thing that was good was the house wine (difficult to mess that up). 7. La Bodega was worth the reservation. There was too much meat for my taste, but it was all good. But you could tell that most of the food was the same from location to location. 8. I liked that the hotel was mostly Europeans and Canadians. It is fun to meet people from around the world. That was part of the reason we didn't go to Cancun. We wanted to feel like we were traveling somewhere, not just an extension of the USA. Also my husband and I are in our low 30's and we felt pretty young at this resort. That was great because we needed a quite place to relax away from toddlers. But if you are looking for excitement, this is not your hotel. Most people staying there were 50+. Again Playa is a good bet for some evening activities. Overall for the $$ I was a little under impressed. I've stayed at a lot of resorts in the US for that kind of money and were much nicer. I know Mexico is a little different, but I think in the future I would stay somewhere else either going all out for the Royal Hideaway or just someplace 3 or 4 star. There wouldn't be that much difference.

Reviews.Title: “Whats wrong with some of these people”
Reviews.Author: daley7264
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 10 days at the Riu Palace and went on tripadvisor to write this review and was surprised to read some bad reviews. Well, I do not know where they stayed , But the Riu Palce that I stayed at was COMPLETELY AWESOME. I think some people are either spoiled millionaires on vacation or just extremely picky and petty. I looked at alot of reviews on this and other resorts and will give a brief review, if you have more questions feel free to E-mail me. The whole resort is beautiful and clean,the staff is always working to keep it perfect. The beach was unbelievable, big and clean with areas of full sun and shade, finding a chair was never a problem even after 900 or 930am. There is also a dive shop right on the property where you can book snorkle trips and parasailing. We did both and were pleased with them and the price was reasonable. The Staff has to be some of the best in Mexico, always friendly and helpful. They seem to anticipate everything and do not wait for you to ask, they just bring what you need, if your glass is empty for more than a minute at a time it's an accident. The food was excellent and the buffet at Don Julien was the best way to go, plenty of variety and the food was always fresh and hot. They had different theme nights, as well as some standard regular items. Salad bar was hugh as well as the Dessert bar. Breakfast and lunch were both well done as well. The rooms were big, clean and beautiful. They did not smell musty at all and the AC worked just fine. The room was not cold , it was cool. Some people forget that they went to a tropical climate and that is how it smells its not musty, its tropical, you are in mexico. The room bar is as advertised, self serve beer, booze and soda and it is refilled every day. I did not find the mattresses to be rock hard, but they were firm and they were comfortable. The Housekeeping staff was excellent, as was the front desk. They answered all my question about the area and hotel and were very professional. This is a quiet resort without a lot of activities and no children programs, they have nice music in the evening and some shows that were nice, if you are looking for a loud, busy, active vacation this is not your place or you can leave the Palace and go find the night life but, if you want a beautiful, High class resort with an amazing beach and wonderful food that caters to your every need, then this is the place you want. A couple of other things ,The drinks were strong and top shelf was there, just ask. They do use plastic cups around the pool, thats because glass and bare feet and pools do not go together very well, Duh. If that hurts the Quality of the resort I think you just don't get it. Bring Insulated mugs for the beach, get the biggest you can find and they will fill it up. Its not that far of a walk to the beach bar, but no sense making extra trips if you don't have to. Do not listen to the negative, picky people. Some people are never Happy. This place is AWESOME and the price was excellent for a hotel of this Quality. We will, without a doubt be back. P.S. Make sure you get to 5th Ave at least once, its a great time and we never felt unsafe. Go early in the week because you'll want to go again. Last thing, don't forget to tip the staff at the resort, the work very hard and I'm sure don't make much. The tips are not required but they really earn them, so don't be cheap. That dollar or two means alot to the them.

Reviews.Title: “Met most expectations.....”
Reviews.Author: Warzy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the RIU Palace 2/5 - 2/12. I wanted to give a review right away while it is all still fresh in my memory. Having been to resorts all over the world including Japan, Brazil and several in EU I think I have a fairly good idea of what makes a resort sucessful. To begin--- PALACE LOBBY Positives - Elegant, well maintained, cool and comfortable. Negatives - Musty from all the smoke in the bar. Very dark. I would have preffered an "open air" atmosphere to give a more exotic touch (like the RIU Tequila has)...however I am sure it's a bonus to have an A/C lobby in the summertime. PALACE ROOMS Positives - Very spacious. Clean. Has additional door to keep out hallway noise. Ceiling fan and A/C. Great water pressure in shower. Mini bar stocked with Corona, Pepsi, Pepsi-light, water, tonic, etc. Also has a liquor dispensor that holds four bottles of various booze including Bacardi and Jose Cuervo. Negatives - Small balcony (where we were, although some rooms have quite large balconies), Two beds pushed together instead of one Queen or King. Hard bed (which I prefer but most people seem to dislike so I consider it a negative) PALACE PIANO BAR Postivies - Quick drink service Negatives - Atmosphere is weak. Your basically sitting in the lobby of a hotel, not a bar. It is outfitted with outdated wicker furniture. Definately some room for improvement here. SERVICE - Only positives here (EXCEPT THE EMPLOYEES IN THE GIFT SHOP WHICH I WILL MENTION BELOW). The employees who work at the Palace are top notch. I have never run across such polite hard working individuals in my life. Because of this wonderful service I tipped a lot. They don't earn a great living but they work for every dime of it. PALACE FOOD Overall I would say the food was slightly above average. The breakfast and lunches basically offered the same thing everyday which became tiresome. The dinner buffett was OK at best. We only at there twice during the week. I heard other people rave about it but I just didn't see it. As for the Ala Cartes- Miyagi (new Japanese restaurant) - waste of space. This was the worst of the three we ate at. We are reqular sushi eaters and would have expected decent, not great sushi here. The sushi we were served at this place was brown, not kidding. It was terrible. Do not waste your time with this place. La Bodega - OK, not phenomenal by any means. Problem is I have been to steak places in Rio so my expectations were somewhat high. I had a hard time enjoying this but my wife commented on how she thought it was good. Sir Edward - Very good I thought. The steak was tender and prepared well. My wife had the shrimp and red snapper which was quite tasty too. Highly recommended in my opinion. The rest of the nights we ate in Playa to break up the AI monotony. For the external part of the resort............. PALACE GROUNDS Perfect in every respect. Clean as can be and perfectly groomed. Very picturesque. PALACE POOL Positives - Clean, bar service, quiet (depending which side you are on) Comfortable loungers, lots of foliage. Negatives - All seats were taken by 7:00 AM...Get out there with your towels early if you can. Water is freezing! Not enjoyable even on the hottest days we were there. Swim up bar in the shade, don't bother, too cold. PALACE BEACH Positives - Clean. Spacious. Loungers available almost all day. Hammocks. Beach bar. Negatives - Beach very crowded. Shoreline has significantly eroded. The volleyball court and a lot of the sunny areas of the beach has almost being washed away. People are packed in like sardines and it is a bit noisy for my liking. (As a side note...if you are considering staying at the Royal Hideaway... there is NO BEACH, NOTHING AT ALL. IT HAS COMPLETELY ERODED AWAY) There is one last touchy subject I feel the need to address to all you "Ugly American's" out there. Being an American I was completely ashamed on how fellow Americans acted during the entire trip. At one point, late in the afternoon one day there was a group of Midwesteners carrying on like true idiots. They were hooting and screaming and actiing like complete jerks. Everyone at the pool stopped and stared at this group of about 7-8 that was disrupting the entire place. I have never seen such obnoxious people in my life. Ever heard of having class? Being the resort has a large EU population there were some choice words being said about us. It is true, we are the loudest of them all. In the bars, restaurants, at the pool, beach wherever. You could always here us Americans yelling at one another. Why is it we feel the need to scream at eachother in a group setting? Oh well, please have respect for the countless other guests who go there to relax and have a quiet time. If you want to scream Senior Frogs is a $4 cab ride from the Palace. In summary the Palace is a wonderful place and has many great attributes to it. Seems a lot of the little problems the resort has can be easily fixed but putting a little money into them..(like hot water in the jacuzzi and a respectable weightroom) I wouldn't say the Palace is a five-star....more like a solid 4. I hope this helps...I would be happy to answer any questions via e-mail.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but...”
Reviews.Author: tros2112
Reviews.Content: We went to my nephew's wedding at the Riu Palace in June (I'm a little late in posting this. Sorry.) I really only have two complaints about the place. One is the cost. If we weren't going for the wedding, we wouldn't have stayed there. I'm a little spoiled because my first two times to the Yucatan Penninula were free. Once was a thank you trip from the radio station the company I work for advertises on, the other I won. After that, we fell in love with Cancun and have returned a few times, but never paying more than $600.00/each including food and drinks, and we've stayed at nice places. This trip was $1000.00 each. At least I saved some money on shopping, since Playa del Carmen has fewer stores than Cancun (grin). My other complaint is several in our party, including my wife and I got stomach cramping and a touch of you-know-who's revenge. Not fun. She got is first. I got it later in the trip. Since we had all of our meals and drinks there, you know we got it from them. Otherwise, do not listen to any other complaints. The grounds are gorgeous, well maintained (immaculate), food was good, the buffets weren't perfect, but it's still the best buffet I've had. Beach is perfect, a few topless European ladies, no complaints from me. Staff was accomodating. Again, for $1000.00 I would expect no buffets, but oh, well, the all-you-can-drink booze in the room makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Dissapointing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked an all-inclusive vacation at the Riu Palace which was also a belated honeymoon. The hotel was rated as a 5 and 1/2 star in the travel brochures so we were expecting something special. When we arrived at the hotel we were impressed by the lobby and reception. However, we checked into our room and were immediately dissapointed. The problems were: 1. the a/c wasnt working 2. the fan squeaked all night 3. the room smelt like damp mold 4. the beds were hard as a rock 5. further there were 2 double beds pushed together to try to make a king (not quite the same) 6. the pillows were lumpy 7. the bathroom was dingy 8.the bathtub was about 2 feet wide so you could barely wedge yourself into it 9. the room on a whole was dark and dank We complained after our first night but all they did was fix the A/C. We have stayed at other resorts in the cancun/playacar area, and the Riu did not meet our expectations of what a 5 Star should be. The food was fine, the service was excellent. Howver, you had to get up early to book for the the non-buffet restaurants which was a pain. The beach is beautfiul, however there is no waiter service on the beach, you have to walk up to the bar everytime you want a drink. The pool was nothing special. When we got home and unpacked, everything had to be washed as it smelt moldy. I would not recommend Riu Palace if you are looking for something special.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my wife and i celebrated our 25th anniversary at the riu palace. The hotel was beautiful, the weather was beautiful, the staff works their butts off. It was very enjoyable. we met people from the states and europe and all were very friendly. Would recommend the palace to middle age and older couples, 40's and up. not alot of nightlife for 20 year olds. that was ok with us. just had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “a great holiday”
Reviews.Author: lincolnshirelass
Reviews.Content: just discount the negitive reviews...this is the place for a relaxing hoilday with good day trips to mayan cultural site....the food is A1..the drinks are great...the staff so friendly....this is a great place....just dont belive the moaning-minnies out there....the beds are FIRM not hard..have a massage on the beach, go parasailing in tandam, swim with dolphins..drink champagne all day..........just go!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Shadow78
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel is a terrific ALL-IN and it means you can eat wathever, how many and whenever you like...food and beverages from all different types. You name it, they got it! Second, the fantastic location is a real plus for this hotel! Xelha and Xcaret are nearby and Tulum is about 1 hour drive....the excursion Chitchen-Itza is about 2 1/2 hours drive, but it's worth it...you will be pleased to see it! Marvelous! Our stay was last summer (september '04) and we spend 15 fantastic days in this SUPERB hotel! Our travelagent almost congratulated us with our fine taste and added that he also visited this hotel and wanted to go back himselve, just because it's all there: the luxery, the great food and drinks (the real brands, Smirnoff, Bacardi, Johnny Walker, J&B....you name it), so not the ordinnay brands they all like to mix in your cocktal instead of the well-known stuff. The rooms are spacious and we were pleased by the double beds, plenty of room and a bathroom filled with marmer, to make it all complete. The staff was one of the greatest I've ever met! They're SOO helpfull and guide you to your table, putt the seat ready for you and will get anything you wish for....and if you know a cocktail that they (amazingly) don't know...tell them how it's done andyou'll have it within 5 minutes! Also animation to keep you busy for a night...plenty to do and many, many sports to do during the day! (tip: play the beachvolleyball!!) The beach is right to the hotel and it's a white, soft and well-kept beach without peaces of paper flying around and empty cups lying in your way...it's all taken care of....beauty!! Well, this is the end of my review....for those who are still here..it's a GREAT hotel and my wife (yep, we spend our honeymoon there) and I would go back in a heartbeat!! Hope to be of any assistance....if there's something you like to know about this place, don't hesitate to mail me! Jurgen.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded most Expectations”
Reviews.Author: MamaEmily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Riu Palace. It was a trip we had planned and looked forward to for a long time - our first break from two small children. I will try not to repeat previous reviews but just highlight a few thoughts. GENERAL The resort is immaculate. Everyday we commented on how shiny the tile floors were, even outside, as though no one had been walking on them all day. Our room was very nice although the "king bed" was pretty funny. We did know what to expect with the two double beds pushed together, but we still got a laugh each night as we crawled under our own covers. It was nice having the stocked bar with liquor, beer, soda and water in the room. We tried asking for more water, even in Spanish, but it never happened, we still got the standard four bottles everyday. The staff is the friendliest we have encountered in our travels. We had the moonlight couples massage on the beach. Only complaint there was mother nature, the strong breeze made it a little chilly to be laying on a table with only a towel on! Something to think about if the nights are cool when you travel. BEACH/POOL The beach was VERY crowded, we were not at all prepared for how crowded it would be. This is the reason for only 4/5 stars. We did go down to the beach to save chairs around 8:30, on our way to breakfast. By the time we returned an hour later, the chairs near the water and in the sun were taken. We were truly suprised at how crowed the beach was. We were packed in like sardines. True, we could have moved back under the palms, but we are sun people and the breeze made the shade too chilly for me. With the beach erosion going on now, there wasn't much room for walking. You couldn't go north pass the Royal Hideaway due to all of the sandbags in the way. Heading south, you had to walk in the water due to the small cliff at the edge of the sand. We didn't hang out by the pool. We did try going in one time and almost turned to ice. It is amazing that the water can stay so cold when it is so warm outside. Also, there is a reason it is called the jacuzzi and NOT the HOT tub. It is just as cold. FOOD Excellent and we never ate a la carte. The buffet was so good that we didn't want to chance ordering from a menu and not liking it. The food was different each night and always superb. We did eat in town one night for a change of scenery. NIGHTLIFE As parents of small children, nightlife doesn't exist for us at home. So, we were looking for a place where we could get out, maybe dance a little, stay out late, etc... Playa is the perfect place for that. Not necessarily the resort but defintely in town. We picked the Riu Palace for the luxury, classiness, and quiet, knowing that we could always head into town for fun without having to deal with the noise and rowdiness at the resort when we didn't want to. We went over to the disco at the Riu Tequila one night and had a blast. Great crowd and good dancing music, for our age anyways (late 30's). Another night we went to the Blue Parrot. Amazing location. The dance floor is 10 feet from the breaking waves. The other place we went was called Mambo Cafe. It was fun, although a little too much. The kind of place where they get you to take a shot on the way in and then walk around with a whistle and bottle of tequila to pour down your throat. Too much of why we didn't go to Cancun. Another night we just shopped and ate at a restaurant in town. It was nice to eat outside the resort and we loved the food - Las Parillas ( or something close to that). One final thought, hopefully not to offend anyone. For those of you who are non-smokers as we are, we wanted to let you know that we were really suprised by the number of smokers. As you are packed on the beach like sardines, know that half of the other sardines will probably be smoking. Same is true for bars and outside seating areas of the resort. Some people are not bothered by this, but for those that are, just thought I would let you know.

Reviews.Title: “Got upgraded from Tequila to Paradise at Palace.”
Reviews.Author: Brimnerclan
Reviews.Content: We arrived at RIU Tequila on January 28th. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived...so we had lunch, then checked in. Our room was 604, and was ideally located - close to lobby and restaurants, and to the pool. It is a ground floor room, and simple. There was a slight musty smell, but I brought room deodorizer, so that was a non-issue. On our very first day we received a message that the Tequila was over-booked, and we were offered an upgrade to the Palace. We thought it over for about a mili-second...and quickly agreed to move. In the meantime, we enjoyed the pools, the restaurants and the bars at the Tequila. The food was great! Lots of selection at the buffet. The Meditteranean Restaurant at the Yucatan was very nice. The employees of the hotel are phenomenal. They would do anything you asked, and better than you could imagine. The property looked like park land. Tequila is definately the nicest of the Playacar, and Yucatan group. Many more families, thus more children...but it didn't bother us at all. Monday the 31st of January was moving day to the Palace. This is where my report turns into a dream. Please know that if we returned to PDC, we would definately stay at the Tequila....however, our time at the Palace was amazing. We were given suite #16. Gorgeous room with separate sunken living area. Bathroom had marble counters, water closet with toilet and bdaie, a large deep bath tub. It was a lovely room....with slightly nicer beds than the Tequila. Premium liquor stocked daily.
