This trip, we had a different waiter / waitress every night and it seemed like they were serving a lot more tables. We often had to flag the waiters down to get a drink refill. Not a real big deal but it just seemed like a little less attention to detail. We again spent virtually all of each day at the beach. It was as beautiful as before, though the waves were a lot bigger this trip. We’d get to the beach around 9 am and never had a problem getting lounge chairs under the palm tree of our choice. Beware, even in November, the sun is still strong! It seemed like more of the crowd at the Palace was from the USA this trip as opposed to May ’03 when there seemed to be more Europeans. Unfortunately, the really loud obnoxious folks on the beach were Americans. Not sure why that was, nor why some folks thought they needed to be so loud, nor why they seemed to always find us. We walked south down the beach past the last resort. It is amazing how much that stretch of beach had changed in a year and a half. Enormous amounts of sand have washed in, creating additional beach. On our last trip, my wife took a picture of me on a big rock I had swum out to. After the picture, I dove off into 5-6 feet of water and swam back to shore. This trip, that rock (and the one a few feet from it) were ON the beach. We often hear of beach erosion. That stretch of Mexico has experienced beach expansion! We were looking forward to hearing David play the piano again in the bar off the main lobby. I’d traded a couple emails with him because on our first trip after he had asked me to send the words to a song. After confirming our reservation a few months ago, I sent David a note and asked if he could learn to play “Remember When” by Alan Jackson. When we were there Friday night, I went and re-introduced myself. When he returned from his break, he played the song (which is my wife’s favorite). It was a surprise for her, and nearly brought a tear to her eyes. David plays Mon-Fri nights until 9pm. He is excellent! If you’re at the Palace, you owe it to yourself to spend an hour or so listening to him play. With a couple teens still at home, I’m not sure when we’ll be able to schedule more time away, but we will definitely return the Palace again. We have fallen in love with the place!!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tarheel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were at the Riu Palace from 10/24 thru 10/28. It's a very attractive property, both inside and out. We had room #1149 which was a second floor room overlooking the fountain/courtyard. Room was nicely appointed, very clean and well maintained with no musty smell at all. Bed was on the hard side but we slept well. We tried both La Bodiga and Sir Edwards which are the restaurants that require reservations. We preferred Sir Edwards. The buffet restaurant, Don Julians, was very good and offered an amazing selection of food. We had great weather everyday with only one 15 minute shower the entire stay. This was our first visit to Playa and first visit to a Riu resort. While we did not go to any of the other Riu properties, we were very satisfied with the Palace. Riu does an exceptional job of maintaining this property- the hotel looks as though it was just built when it's actually several years old. The fountains and grounds are immaculate with no trash to be found anywhere. My wife and I have traveled extensively in the Caribbean and I think you get more bang for your buck here than just about anywhere. We have been to other all inclusives, including Sandals and Grand Lido and the Palace is about half the price and much, much nicer and the staff is exceptional. If your thinking about going to the RIU Palace Mexico, go ahead and book it and have a good time. You won't be disappointed. One other mention. We took the Riviera bus ($7 per person) from the Cancun airport to Playa. It was exceptionally clean and comfortable. The trip took about an hour to the bus station in downtown Playa Del Carmen. When you get off the bus, you will see taxi's parked across the street. They will take you to the Palace for $4 so total cost for 2 was $18. We had an early morning flight when we left so we had to take a taxi which costs $40. Departure tax is about $40 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality Central”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Honeymoon...and I was blown away. What an incredible deal for the level of perfection. From check in to check out, cleaning service to gourmet food. Everything was exquisite. It has to be the best resort in Riviera Maya. If you want to be pampered and gorge on indulgence...this is the place for you! I will stay at any Riu if this is their level of commitment to the vacation service industry.

Reviews.Title: “Again....truly paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW! Another great vacation at the RIU Palace from Oct. 16-23, 2004.. This was our second time and definitely won't be our last. As a matter of fact, I do no think we can stay anywhere else in Playa Del Carmen. The RIU staff is exceptional, going out of their way to ensure you have a wonderful, relaxing vacation. The grounds are amazing, the food outstanding, and the rooms well appointed. I read a previous review about inadequate air conditioning and I am not quite sure if the person wanted it to be below the freezing point or what. We found our a.c. worked really, really well - we actually had to turn it down! If you are considering another RIU in the area, consider upgrading, you will be really glad you did! Have a great trip to PDC and maybe we will see you there!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise - no matter how many times you visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Riu Palace twice now and hope to return in 2006. It really is a great place and all the staff work really hard to ensure you have a good time. In case anyone is wondering, the guinea pig type creatures roaming around the grounds are Agouti. They really appreciate a few bits of dried fruit, grapes and nuts from the breakfast buffet. We asked George who looks after the main restaurant what the Mexicans call them and he said something sounding like "Sericos" and added that they taste like chicken !!

Reviews.Title: “I was a princess for 8 days ! !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow...Eight Days in Paradise...Is the only way to describe our stay at the Riu Palace in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico. I could never stay anywhere else after the daily royal treatment....It was truly a week I will never forget ! !

Reviews.Title: “The absolute best to Hotel in PlayaCar, just TIP EVERYONE !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the absolute best place to stay in PlayaCar. First , let's begin with the beach. It was neat and best well-kept beach in the world. The waiters bring coconut and pineapple filled concoctions right to your lawn chair. The waiters were absolutely fabulous. We tipped the waiter one dollar for every drink he got us and the service got better and better every time. Most Europeans did not tip at all and their service was inferior. I, recommend that you tip one dollar for every drink and that will insure you will get great service. Now the restaurants; The buffet was absolutely the best. The theme restaurants are not worth waking up at six A. M. for. Stay in bed and enjoy your sleep and get the bartender to reserve it for you. For a tip he will reserve a seating for you. Noe, the night bartender, will get to what you want when you want and I mean, he will get you anything you want, anything. We went to check out the bars in the Sister hotels , and they are not worth the walk. Stay at the Palace , you will not regret it. But check for yourself you will realize that spending the extra money was well worth it. There are areas that were were inferior and do need some upgrading, but not crucial and no need to mention. People don't realize that you can use the sauna, Jacuzzi and athletic equipment in the gym at no additional cost. So don't forget to work out while you're eating all that wonderful buffet food. Topless women; the women at this beach were absolutely gorgeous and topless was the icing on the cake. My head was hurting after staring at these women for prolonged period of time as my wife was whacking me on the side of the head. Mind you , I am 39 years old and my wife is 29. But the women were worth the wacks. By reading this board , we were able to be better prepared of what to bring with us to the Palace. Take plenty of sunscreen , a hat, second skin shoes for snorkeling, and lots of T-shirts, if you're sensitive to the sun. The rooms; they are spacious well conditioned with hard beds. We had the view of grass and trees , and that was nice because it was very quiet. The safe was very useful to keep your valuables stored. The only obnoxious thing about this entire trip were my comrades, the Americans. They were mostly pompous arrogant and uncaring. I noticed that the Germans did not like the French. The French did not like English , and so on. But Americans were able to get along with all Europeans but not each other. The Iraq war was the biggest topic. Mind you , we were there and mid September and lots of other American GI's were getting killed. 5th Ave.; you have to visit this great street. Just to get it out of your system , but it is not that great. Other then it is a street that you can see and be seen , if you're young and like to party. This hotel housed , mainly couples and the single life would be very boring. If you can bring a significant other, do it. Just not your neighbors wife. Snorkeling; the best snorkeling is in Cozumel. Rent a moped for about $20 for the entire day and drive it along the island and find snorkeling places on your own. There are plenty of them. Taking the ferry to Cozumel was $35 and renting a moped was $20. Dinner was about $30 and drinks were about another $30. So it is safe to say that for about $100. You can have a pretty nice time in Cozumel. Everyone talked about bringing in a insulated cup. Don't bring an insulated cop , it is a waste of space and time, just tip the waiter and he will bring cold drinks every single time. My tipping budget was $20 per day. So we brought $200 in one dollar bills. We didn't use them all up for tipping. So we gave a lot of them away at the airport. Dress code; this is a pretty stupid code , as it is very hot and humid there. So men, bring lots of Hawaiian shirts They are airy and comfortable. Whatever you do is wear long pants to dinner. Otherwise you will not be eating. Stay away from parasailing , a woman was gravely injured while we were there. She must've suffered brain damage and felt very bad about that situation. Oh yes, I am a physician, orthopedist, but was not able to help this lady. Other then try and comfort her. Snorkeling and scuba diving at the Palace was affordable and enjoyable. The prices were very reasonable , and not worth going elsewhere to find it cheaper. I'm falling asleep trying to write this review. So there will be lots of typographical errors as my secretary is not here to correct them. I hope you enjoyed my review , and if you have any questions please feel free to e-mail me. By the way, if you get a chance look at the properties for sale. They are very expensive , but well worth their money. DO'T FORGET TO TIP EVERYONE, it will make you feel good too.

Reviews.Title: “Guarantee yourself a great vacation...”
Reviews.Author: GlobalEyes
Reviews.Content: There are so many reviews here, so I'll try to keep it fairly short. It's a phenomenal hotel, so the question isn't if it's worth the stay (because it definitely is). The question is, what details should I remember to make it an even better stay at the Riu Palace. Stay in the 2100 block of rooms (3rd floor). It's definitely more quiet up top. Some might complain about having to climb a few flights of stairs, but hey, you'll be pigging out on the great food and should be working a bit of it off anyway. Tip because you want to tip, not because you want better service. The service at the Riu Palace will be great no matter what you do. Don't book any excursions/day trips at the hotel (or any hotel for that matter). Take the 3 minute walk to Plaza Playacar down the road and book your stuff at the travel agency there. You'll save at least US $20 per person per trip. I highly, highly recommend the cenotes at Hidden Worlds (about US$80). If you go, do yourself a big favour and buy an underwater camera with flash in advance. Try to avoid paying for things in US$. Convert to pesos and you'll save quite a bit of money throughout your vacation (e.g. most places go by the US$1 for 10 pesos conversion when it should really be 11 pesos - hey, believe me, it'll add up by the end of the trip). Sorry, I'm kind of tired and don't want to type anymore. Hope my suggestions help...

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation !!”
Reviews.Author: lena123
Reviews.Content: The resort, service and food were excellent. Definatelly tip your waitors and the cleaning service our room was made up 2x a day and they left little towel animals on our bed. Tons of things to do we did ATVs and Speed Boats and loved both. However, ATVs are extremelly muddy so wear something that you would not mind discarding afterwards. The nightly shows can be improved especially the kids show. Go to this resort if you just want to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service at Rui Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home today from vacation, 7 days at Rui Palace, Playa Del Carmen. When checking into the hotel requested a garden view room. none available. not satisified with room given to us because of the view and they moved us the next day to a garden view, it was great. One of the best trips we have been on. Recommend the ATV trip and the Tulum trip if you are interested in history, the trip to Xpu-Ha is a good trip also they have like a outdoor zoo and a great place to snorkel. Things to take: bug spray for the Xpu-Ha trip and on the ATV trip you will get muddy. Insulated mugs are needed for the beach, this is the hottest place I've every been and the bar tenders will put your drinks in the mugs you bring. The service is the best we've ever had and I'm afraid to say after arriving home I gained 7 pounds in 7 days so I don't need to tell you how good the food is. If I can help anyone please email and I will try to respond. Hope your trip is as good as ours was Paula

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: HAMMRR2
Reviews.Content: Sept.18-25 Excellent property & great service! Would highly recommend it to anyone. We checked out all the Rui's around & there is no comparison. It' worth the money. We had room 2153 with a huge balcony. The food was great & the lobby bar always has a good crowd at night for meeting people or just to hang out. It stays open til 7:00am although my wife & I could only manage 5:00 am one night or morning. If anyone has any questions please feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Suprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for us to stay at the RIU TEQULIA from may 16-22, when we got there they were overbooked and took us to Riu Palace, this was incredible! The hotel is SOOOOOOO nice and everyone is very respectful. We got a room on the bottom floor and yes there is a smell but that is the way Mexico smells. I mean you are right by the ocean. I did not like the buffet, I found nothing on it appetizing in any way besides bread and butter. The drinks were great and the bartenders and waitresses are fantastic! We ate at the steak house 3 nights in a row, very good steak and salmon. It gets VERY quiet after the last show, we are pretty young so we wondered to the other hotels. Riu tequlia was hoppin every night, Riu Playacar was not nearly as nice as the others, has a terrible western decor. I LOVED our room, it was kinda hot but we stood on the bed and made the ceiling fan go higher. I paid for tequlia and got the palace, I can't complain!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Worry, Be Happy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Because I exhaustively read reviews before leaving for the RIU Palace, I felt obliged to add my two cents! First, I want to say, stop worrying, reading reviews, etc., you are going to have a great time. Yes, the showpiece of this beautiful, spotless resort is the beach! If you ladies are stressing over does your bathing suit make you look fat or can I really wear a two-piece, just go for it! It is amazing to see how people seem so comfortable no matter what shape their in. I think I only saw a couple one piece suits on the whole beach. Thanks to everyone who said bring an insulated mug, a must! Also throw an inflatable float in your bag, you'll want to have one and they charge 18 us dollars in the gift shop. I would caution against signing up for tours. We did Tulum/Xel Ha. Glad we did but we could have probably taken a cab to XEL-HA and been on our schedule. The bus is a drag. Luckily we were able to cancel our 2nd tour. The beach and pool were just too great to leave for a whole day! Personally we thought Sir Edwards, La Traviata and La Bodega (a lot of meat) were okay. They do break up buffet eating. The food is good, fresh, with an incredible selection. It may get a little tiresome by the end of the week, but you will not go hungry. This is such a beautiful resort, I hate to be negative but I did not love the room. It smelt very musty, so an airfreshner is a must. The towels never felt really fresh and clean. But they do a very good job cleaning it, it'll be fine. Might be a good idea to upgrade your room, if possible. Mostly I want to say tip the staff! Bring us dollars and pass them on freely. These people work unbelievably hard and are paid a very low wage. They are so appreciative of any generosity that it is almost embarassing. Have a great time, wish I were just going too!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon! Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Cath75
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my honeymoon at the Riu Palace Mexico in Playa Del Carmen, and it was absolutely fabulous! We travelled with Apple Vacations and everything went smoothly from start to finish! The hotel is elegant but the service is what makes it such a great place to stay! One thing to note, Playa del Carmen is full of very nice, all-inclusive tropical resorts. Just a prelude for those who might expect the high rise resorts of Cancun. I had a room on the second floor over looking the courtyard. It was nicely appointed. We DID request a matress pad and received one immediately. The grounds, the rooms, the restaurants were all exceptionally clean! The staff was so service oriented, I really felt like a queen for the week. My glass was never empty before a waiter stopped to refill. The restaurants were great! Sir Edwards and La Bodega were the best of the specialty resturants, but main dining room/buffet was delicious! Lots of options! The quality was relatively high for all inclusive. Gratuities were included but we tipped a little here and there when the service was above and beyond. It certainly was not expected or the norm. There were a lot of European's staying at this hotel. I would say 50-60%? I thought this was great because we met alot of different people. I don't know what else to say except that i would not hesistate to stay here again. It met and exceeded my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having now returned back to the UK, I must say that the RIU Palace is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. Not only is the setting fantastic but the staff are perfect - you will find that they cannot do enough for you, if you have the oppurtunity I recommend trying the other restaurants as a change to the normal buffet restaurant - which also by the way is excellent. I cannot praise the hotel and their staff enough. We were there to celebrate our honeymoon and we could not have wished for anything better, Both my wife & I are now trying to save up enough money to go back nest year. Do try and see some of the shows as you will find these are fun to watch - however the main air conditioned bar is fantastic for chilling out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palace!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After much discussion and review reading on here, my husband and I stayed at the RIU Palace for our honeymoon July 26- Aug. 2 2004. I am sooo glad we picked this resort! After reading everyone else’s reviews of this resort I had to offer our comments regarding the Palace. Cancun Airport: While our arrival was not as bad as anticipated, our departure was a nightmare. They have non-random screening at the ticket counter where they only pull the first 3 people in line for their return tickets aside and hand search every item. Unfortunately, this turned out to be my husband and I and we ended up being the last people to check in and didn't get seats even near each other! Front Desk: Check in was a breeze although we arrived at 8pm. We were offered a drink as soon as we got into the hotel. Our room was exactly what we had requested through our travel agent and our bags were delivered to our room very shortly after we got into it. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful when we had questions. Room: We stayed in one of the 8 jacuzzi suites that overlooked the ocean. Beautiful room with a nice marble bathroom with two sinks, a sitting area with couch and chair, and even a full walk in closet area with shelves. We had 2 patios, one that you could walk out onto from the room with a few chairs, and the other was above the room with a private spiral staircase to it. The Jacuzzi was on this patio that had a breathtaking view of the pool and ocean. This resort only offers two beds pushed together instead of a single queen or king. We were expecting the beds to be hard, and they were, but we didn't find this a problem at all since we were so exhausted each night. Mattress pads could be requested from the front desk. Grounds: As everyone else has mentioned, the grounds were immaculately kept. There seemed to be an army of people out early every morning attending to it. I would caution that the floors become VERY slippery if at all damp/wet so make sure you are careful. Beach: I can’t say that I have been to a nicer beach in my travels. The sand was pure white and so soft. There was not a hint of garbage or seaweed anywhere. I believe the beach is combed every day or so to keep it clean from debris. When you walked into the ocean, you could feel nothing but sand and see right down to your toes. We even had a few fun days where the water was a bit choppy and had a blast riding the large waves! We also never had a single problem finding a lounge chair at any time during our stay. Plenty of room and shade or sun! Pool: We spent a great deal of time at the pool. It was nice and large so you weren’t bumping into others. It also had seating around the edge to just relax and sit in the pool. The pool also had a swim up bar with water cascading down from the top. While the service was a bit slow (and yes, we tipped generously) I can’t complain about being able to drink while being submerged in the cool waters. Directly outside the pool was another nice pool bar that served snacks and had shaded seating. The towel exchange is also located around here for you to get clean pool towels. Service: I really can’t complain about the service. I won’t say it’s the best service I’ve ever received, but these people do work extremely hard to make the guests happy. Drinks were always offered while at any of the bars or dinning areas. The ashtrays never sat dirty for more than a few minutes, and the staff was very friendly. The only area that I would suggest was a bit uncomfortable was at Don Julians. According to the “rules” at your first dinner you were to be seated in your permanent spot for your entire stay. Unfortunately, we were told every single time we ate there that we were in someone else’s seat. We would have to move tables in the middle of our meal every time that we ate there. Not a huge deal, but was a little inconvenient for us. Overall: We really had a wonderful trip here and would come back in a heartbeat. This was one of the few vacations that I’ve taken where I was sad to go home. I hardly ever felt the need to leave this resort because I had everything I wanted right there. This resort is a very low key at night so please stay elsewhere if you are looking for an all night party. I also probably wouldn’t recommend this resort if you have young children. While they do have a kids program every night, this resort tends to be more for adults who are looking for rest and relaxation. One thing I didn’t discuss in this review was the food. I felt it wasn’t necessary to go into that since everyone has different tastes and there have been plenty of others who have commented on it. I would be happy to help anyone who has questions about this resort, feel free to email me!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just a brief note to say how much my wife and I enjoyed our honeymoon stay at this hotel. I cannot find any fault with it what so ever. The room, food (wonderful and very varied), staff (always smiling and saying hello), beach and hotel were superb. Only the entertainment would get a lower mark for being a bit cheesy! All in all, it was the perfect honeymoon. Go there if you are thinking of visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Riu Palace Mexico in Playa de Carmen August 28th-Sept. 4th. It was PARADISE in every way, exceptional! The hotel is absolutely beautiful and so clean. The food was excellent. Sir Edwards and the buffet were are favorites. I'm not much of a buffet person, but the food was so fresh and offered so many wonderful dishes. Dining at Sir Edwards was like dining at the finest restaurants back home. The restaurant is very elegant and the crab bisque, pork and duck was so delicious which are foods I normally would not order. La Bodego was good and the restaurant is romantic but not to repeat because the buffet offers so much more and is again, soooo good. The staff is so friendly and attentive. The service could not have been any better. Our room was well kept but we did leave a $1 tip daily. The maid turned down our beds in the evening but I don't know if everyone had that or if our $1 gave us a little extra attention. The tropical drinks were very good and quite lovely presented. However, the drinks by pool side and beach were not that good. I recommend you take a cup with you that keeps your drink cool and just take it up to the Cuban Bar and have them pour your drink in it. That way your drink stays cooler as you are outside and you have a bigger cup so it will last you longer. Gorgeous beach. The water is so clear you can see your toes. The sand is super soft and lots of it. However, I didn't realize that Playa de Carmen had so many resorts built on it and they are so close together. However, our hotel nor beach felt busy or crowded and we didn't have any problems with service or getting our dining reservations. All in all, we had the best vacation ever. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “All-inclusive review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since I used Trip Advisor to plan my trip, I thought it only nice to report back to it how my experience was. This was the first time I was ever out of the country so I will give you all the things I learned so those also making the venture for the first time will be prepared. For those wanting a quick summary of the tips, I have made them at the end. We went with Apple Vacations mostly because my company uses them frequently, but in retrospect we are glad we did. Their service was great. Getting There: The flight in was relatively uneventful. We were flying from Philadelphia so the trip was only 3 hours. From the US you can go to Mexico with 2 different forms of ID, Passport or Birth certificate with Photo ID. We were going to go with our birth certificates at first, but at the last minute decided that it would be better to get passports. From my observation, people with passports had an easier time and it also took less time for them at the custom windows. Two people were denied (before we left Philadelphia) boarding. One was a woman whom had a birth certificate with her maiden name and ID with her married name. All those honeymooners beware. Make sure you have like ID. The other was a family with an adopted child. Not sure exactly what the problem was, but if you are going with an adopted child, make sure you double check. On the plane we were given two forms to fill out (make sure you have a pen). These are standard forms of who, what, where, and why. When you land at Cancun airport you will be bussed to the terminal and enter the customs area. This can take a while depending on how many people there are. Luckily we were close to the front of the line (about 20th) and it only took us about 15-20 minutes to make it through the first window. Continue to the baggage claim and get your bags. After you have everything you go through the last checkpoint for customs. The stoplight. It’s easy. You push the button, green you go, and red you are stopped and checked. They say it’s random, but I doubt it. As you are walking out of the airport, there are kiosks of people for rental cars and god knows what else. They will try to hound you. If you already have transportation set up or with Apple (or any other vacations) just look straight ahead and keep walking. When you finally get outside, again there will be people trying to take your bags to transportation. It’s very confusing and scary if it’s your first time. I practically had to intimidate a guy who had my bag in his hand to let go. Just make sure you see ID of the person who is supposed to pick you up because there are a lot of people who try to look like your tour/travel company. If you are going Apple, the Apple busses are down a little bit to the left. They will have your name on the bus manifest so you can make sure it’s for you. There: The bus ride there was pretty uneventful. We were the only ones going to the RIU Palace and we were the last stop of about 5 stops. It took altogether about an hour. The bus guide was trying to entertain the busload of weary travelers and did have some of us laughing. He went round robin and asked each of us where we were staying. When we said the RIU Palace, he gave us this weird look and said, “They have good coffee there”. At this point we were a little nervous that our hotel invoked such a reaction. One of the things we noticed was that there were numerous police checkpoints on the route. After everyone, besides us, left the bus, the bus guide came over to us and sat down. He asked us what made us pick the RIU Palace. I told him I researched it on the web, mainly trip advisor and it seemed like the best place to go. He nodded to me. I asked him if there was something wrong with the place. He told us that he had been working in the industry 10 years and that this is the only hotel that has left him speechless. He told us it was the best resort out of all of them including the surrounding towns. He explained that he couldn’t tell me that earlier with everyone on the bus because he was suppose to stay professionally neutral. When we pulled up to the resort he actually went in with us to see it again. The Hotel: We walked into the lobby and it was really nice. Our check in, although early, was really smooth. We each got welcome drinks while checking in. We went to our room (#19). It was spacious. The view wasn’t the greatest off the back patio, but we didn’t care. It was a little musty from the humidity, but not that bad. We began to test everything in the room. The fridge was filled with numerous sodas and beer. Above that was a runner with Tequila, Rum, Vodka and Brandy. The closet space was nice and so was the bathroom. The beds were firm, but since I like firm beds I found no problem with them. The only two “problems” I found with the room was that the lights did not get bright enough and the a/c didn’t get cold enough. It was manageable, but in a perfect world they would be the only things I would change with the room. We decided the first thing we would do is to look around the whole place briefly just to get our surroundings. We went out into the courtyard and we almost fell to our knees. The beauty of the center courtyard was something we never saw before. Fountains, nicely landscaped… just breathtaking. We walked through the courtyard to the pool area, again stunning, then to the beach. The water was a beautiful turquoise, the beach was not too crowded and there were many people sailing, wind surfing, and swimming in the water. The skyline of Cozumel could be seen off in the distance. It was the first day and we were already in love with the resort. Where do you eat? The most confusing part of our trip was figuring out where the heck to eat. The map of the hotel they give you is not right and mostly in Spanish. We had a hard time figuring out where to go. So you won’t waste time figuring it out, here is how it works. You need reservations for every restaurant for dinner. The first night you arrive you do not need reservations at their main buffet Don Julian for dinner. While you are eating, the maitre D will come to you and reserve Don Julian every night for the rest of your time there. So if all else fails, you can eat there for dinner. They have a dress code at all of the places to eat for dinner. Don’t go grabbing your Sunday best though. I was fine with black jeans, a nice shirt, and sneakers. The only place you don’t have a dress code is La Triviata for lunch. You can come in your swimsuit if you want. The food is good. Don Julian is a buffet with many different choices. The specialty restaurants are Sir Edward, La Bodega, and La Triviata. Sir Edward is a fancier a-la cart place. They have soup, salad, appetizer, main course, and dessert. They have things like chicken, duck, fish, lamb, and beef on the menu done in different ways. La Bodega is the Brazilian style place. You start off with a salad bar, and then they bring out a skillet of roasted vegetables. Then every 5 minutes or so, they come out with a different meats and give you a piece. It was very good. La Triviata was a Steakhouse/ Mediterranean grill. It wasn’t too bad. We had steak and salmon. The steak was tasty, but not like steak in the states. You may be a little disappointed. As for recommendations, they were all good for dinner. La Triviata was my favorite for lunch. Not only is it open later, but also I enjoyed the food there more. Not too mention being able to be nice and casual. Water: The pool was nice. It is in 2 big wavy half circles. The deepest it gets is about 4 feet. One of the half circles has a swim up bar in it. Where the bar is though is only about 2 feet deep. The swim up bar was nice. In the center of the 2 half circles is another patio bar with some snacks. Early in the day, it is pretty easy to get a chair close to the pool. One trick that a British couple we met there did was bringing their own towels from home and keep them on their chairs they liked. They do have waiter service to the pool chairs, but it is often slower then just walking the 10 feet to the bar. My only 2 complaints about the pool are that there were no deep areas, nor any stretches of straight pool to actually swim laps. Again, a very minor complaint. The beach was nice. I recommend going early. Though getting a chair was never a problem, the beach can get a little crowded. The water was cool and the beach was beautiful. Nothing in the water. No seaweed, no jellyfishes, not many shells, nice and clean. There are topless bathers and the bar is a little distance from the beach. Bringing your own big insulated mugs (as suggested here) was definitely a plus. There is enough open beach for those that want to tan to do so, however there is a large shaded area of the beach too for those that don’t want as much sun. There were a few vendors around, but nothing annoying. I was there 7 days and only got asked twice to buy something. Town: We decided that we shouldn’t just stay on the resort the whole time, but that we should experience the town of Playa Del Carmen. We caught a taxi (no shuttle) to the town and it was about $4USD. We began to walk 5th avenue (the town’s hot spot) and were immediately hawked by the various vendors. We did this about 5 blocks and did go into 2 stores that no one hawked us into but decided it just wasn’t worth it to stay. We caught the next taxi back and stayed at the resort the rest of the time. We went in the late morning. The British couple went into town in the evening and said it wasn’t as bad as we had it. Perhaps it depends on what time you go. If you don’t need to buy anything and aren’t interested in the touristy “Senior Frogs” I would advise skipping the town. Money: As most of you know, Mexico uses the Peso but the US dollar is king there. Things are cheaper if you use the dollar. You will see sales like “20% off but 40% if using USD”. The tricky thing is, that you need to bring all the USD you want to use because there is nowhere to get USD once you are down there. There is no ATM in the resort. There is a little mall-like plaza about a 5-minute walk from the hotel, but it only dispenses pesos. Pretty much everywhere takes Visa/MC but it may give you some stress. Was that 200 pesos they just charged to your card or 200 dollars? When you find out, it will be too late. We brought cash, a MasterCard and an American express traveler check card. I would advise against the traveler check card. Sure it’s secured in case it gets stolen, but hardly any place takes American Express. Also we had a situation where the card was charged with something then it was cancelled. It took a week (well after we were home) for that money to be re-posted on the card. Summary: The trip and hotel was superb. The staff was attentive and pretty much everyone knew English. Out of all the resorts I saw down there… this was most definitely the nicest. I would go back here in a heartbeat. Put all your worries aside, if you vacation here you will live in the lap of luxury, even if it is only for a week. Tips: Some tips that you may want to have if you stay here. 1.Bring an insulated mug. It saves the trips back and forth to the bar. 2.Bring a lot of sunscreen. It is very expensive down there and the sun is really strong. 3.Drink water. I know it sounds common sense, but I don’t mean a bottle a day. Especially if you are drinking. We saw many people pass out. A method we used was drink water with meals then alcohol at the other times. Dehydration is rough. 4.Get the later dining time. We like to eat earlier but we ending up skipping lunch almost every day because we wouldn’t be hungry for dinner. 5.Bring some Pepto, Advil, etc. Medicine, though you can get prescription over the counter there, is very expensive. It’s better to pay $2 here then $15 there. 6.The drinking water on the resort is A-OK! Elsewhere, beware! 7.Since the sun is so hot, try to live like the Mexicans do. Try to keep all your outdoor activities in the morning and early evening on. Between noon and 4 gets really hot there, take it easy. 8.Bring USD. 9.They have no diet non-carbonated drinks other then water. If you want something else, bring a little ice tea mix or lemonade. 10.The water in the bathrooms is NOT filtered. Brush your teeth with the bottled water and when taking a shower, keep your mouth closed. 11.The TV there is pretty crappy. Not that you will be watching much, but you may want to bring a game or some cards. 12.This is not a good kids resort. There weren’t many kids there, but this place is definitely skewed for adults.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace is the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bamafun
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great week at the Riu Palace! The hotel is as beautiful as everyone says. The hotel staff was extremely friendly. The beautiful beach was definitely the highlight of the trip. We arrived at the Cancun Airport on Saturday at 10 am. Had no hassles going through customs, got our baggage, and headed outside. Ignore all of the people who will try to call you over as you leave the airport. We booked with Apple, and headed outside the airport and found the Apple rep in a flowered shirt. We boarded a 12-passenger, airconditioned van and headed for the Riu. We were the first passengers dropped off, and arrived at the hotel at noon. Our room was ready (on the 2nd floor near the pool), we unpacked, had lunch and hit the beach. The beach is beautiful white sand, plenty of shade under palm trees, and the water was the most beautiful blue I've ever seen. We brought insulated mugs, which kept our drinks cold all afternoon. During the week we took 2 tours - one to Chichen Itza and one was a Mayan Adventure snorkeling tour. Chichen Itza is worth doing once in your life, but it's a long bus ride. Be careful climbing the pyramid. We saw someone fall, and suffered multiple injuries. The snorkel tour was fun for beginners. Next time, we'll book with Scuba Caribe rather than Apple for the snorkel tour. Scuba Caribe is right on the beach in front of the Riu Palace. The weather was sunny and hot every day. It rained on our last day as we were waiting to leave. The buffet restaurant was good - be sure to go there for the Chef's Gala night. We also enjoyed La Bodega and Sir Edwards. The El Cubano lobby bar is a great place to relax prior to dinner. We never stayed up for the shows, which started every night at 10 pm -- too exhausted from the sun and surf! We will definitely be returning to the Riu Palace and PDC. Be sure to go to the town of PDC to shop. However, we found the prices at the small shopping area in Playacar were better than in PDC. This was the most relaxing 7 days I've ever spent!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance Meets Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the RIU Palace from 8/26/04 – 9/2/04. As stated in the previous reviews, the resort is breathtaking. We have stayed in several other 5* resorts in the Playa del Carmen / Puerto Morelos area & the RIU Palace far surpassed the others. We were looking for a nice stress free relaxing vacation & since we used this web site extensively to do our research, I thought I would provide our experiences as well. Positives: The beach: Unbelivable! All the outstanding reviews regarding the beach were one of the main reasons why I selected the Riu Palace. We are beach lovers & this beach did not disappoint! The water was crystal blue & very warm with fine white sand on the ocean floor as well as on the beach. This is one of the best beaches I have ever been to. The fact that there was no pressure to scramble to the beach early in the morning to “reserve” a lounge chair was a big plus. You could get there ANY time of the day & have a great location either in the shade under all the swaying palm trees or in the sun. Very nice! Service: Outstanding! Again, as all the other reviews stated, the service is top notch. The employees are always there with a friendly Hola! & a smile. If you sit back while enjoying a show, watch the employees. You will see them actually running back & forth to get the guests their drinks. It was amazing how hard they actually work. You will see the same employees working at 7am & still serving guests at 11pm. They work VERY hard. Room: The room was very nice & well maintained. There was a very slight musty odor when we first entered the room but you are in the Tropics & it is to be expected. The balcony had a view of the neighboring RIU resort & a 5 foot cement wall so you could not sit down & enjoy any view since all you could see was this wall. When we first saw this upon entering the room, we asked if we could have a room with a nicer view with a wrought iron rail so we could actually utilize the balcony. We were told by the desk if we wanted to spend an additional $50 a day we could change rooms. I did not understand this because the resort did not seem to be full? The beds are firm, but after a day on the beach & a couple cocktails, we had no problem sleeping at all! Food: Very good! We ate at all 3 reservation restaurants, the main buffet Don Julians, as well as the lunch buffet (El Patio) & never experienced a bad meal. This is another area were the Palace distinguishes itself from the other all inclusives we have stayed at. The buffet was delicious & changed nightly depending on the theme so it never got repetitive. The buffet offered a wide variety of foods not to mention roasted duck, beef Wellington, & other upscale selections you usually do not find on a buffet. The reservation restaurants were all very good as well. I highly recommend them all just for the service & the experience. The only restaurant that was difficult to get reservations for was Sir Edwards. We were up early Sunday morning to go into town for Church so we were able to get in. It is first class all the way & worth getting up a little earlier one morning to get in. Weather: The weather was gorgeous the whole week. Not a drop of rain fell. We learned the first time down not to stress over the weather reports. They are seldom correct! Small Disappointments: These negatives are very slight & really did not cause any major issues but thought they would be good to include. Room: The shower did not work the first night so we had to bath & wash our hair under the faucet. We told the desk on the way to dinner & it was repaired by the time we returned from the show. The bed had no bedding on it 2 nights out of our stay? I am not sure what was going on but we had to call the desk one night because we had no bedding & we had to make our own bed one night because the bedding was there but piled on the closet floor? We also tipped the maid daily & never received any towel animals or bed turndown service? No big deal but when you read all the reviews & are expecting these little touches it is a little disappointing when you do not get them. Desk Service: We requested the front desk to give us a wake up call so we could get to 8am mass downtown but never received any call. Strong Pungent Odor: There were several areas at the resort that had a very strong stomach turning smell. I do not know what it was but was very strong. It smelled like someone had been sick, but since it was there the entire week of our stay I do not think that was the cause. As you can see the positives well outweigh the negatives & we would not hesitate to return to the Palace. We were looking for a very relaxing stress free vacation & found it. The Palace is an outstanding resort & was worth every penny! I highly recommend the Palace & guarantee you will not be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emaryandgene
Reviews.Content: My wife and I vacationed at the Riu Palace this summer for the third time. It never ceases to amaze us to read negative views. This was our 51st trip to the Caribbean, and we return to the Riu Palace as we find it an incredible property. It is obvious to us that many people do not research before they travel. The Palace does offer activities for children, but the other Riu hotels have a more extensive program for them and advertise that fact.. Not wanting to be rude--some people do not enjoy the flurry of activity of hundreds of children, that is why some hotels offer activities for them, and others are more limited. As far as the food at the Palace--I cannot imagine anyone going hungry at this hotel. Every imaginable type of meat is served EACH night, along with a variety of fish and seafood dishes, as well as an entire Mexican section in the buffet restaurant. On top of this, individual cooking stations were in constant motion. Yes, the 3 other restaurants require reservations due to smaller size. Just like anywhere in the world, restaurants fill up, and you must try again. In our two weeks at the hotel, we did not get a reservation only once, and some nights, the restaurants were not full. People not preferring the buffet restaurant can have lunch in the open air Italian and Mexican restaurants, both serving a multitude of dishes. The hotel is even more beautiful than when it was first built, and it is kept impeccably clean. The ground are among the most manicured we have ever seen. Regardless of what some reviews state, there is entertainment EVERY night, and frequently, as well as these shows, music is played in the courtyard outside of the restaurants where you can sit and have drinks before the show. Many people take advantage of the dance floor as well. The staff, from bartenders to cleaners to the dive shop and the front desk personnel are very accommodating. Perhaps people who do experience problems are being rude and obnoxious--trust me we have seen some extremely rude people at resorts over the years !!! We certainly have no reservations in recommending this hotel, and have booked a winter trip to the Rui Cabo San Lucas opening in December. We have stayed at Westins Hotels in the Virgin Islands, Sandals in St. Lucia, and Lido resorts in Jamaica and find the Riu resort much better, and a bit cheaper as well. Check out their website: riu.com for detailed info and actual pictures. We hope you try it out, and love it like we do.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond our expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where to start.... I was a bit apprehensive about going to Mexico (water/food & after being spoiled at 5 star all-inclusive resorts all over the world.) I was pleasantly surprised by what the Palace and Playa del Carmen had to offer. Reviews/ Info The food was very good in all the restaurants but not incredible. The desert was so-so. The entertainment was amusing at best. Go to town (5th street it's a great time) Get an egg crate for your bed to make it softer and it'll be fine. The rrom is large and sunny. Use bottled water to brush your teeth. The pool was small but enough. The pool and beach bar close at 6pm. the pool closes at 8pm, and you can't swim in the ocean at night. If you do early morning tours or rise before 9am you will have NO problem getting reservations to any of the restaurants. The service was the best I ever experienced, they clean constantly (they even painted part of our room while we were out). The beach was perfect w/ soft clean sand and crystal blue water (you can use snorkel equiptment, boogie boards, kayaks, wave runners, etc....) If you plan to spend alot of time at the beach then definitely bring thermoses for your drinks. They have a pottery painting (extra $) by the beach, they come out great but to paint them takes more time then you think...make something small. Tours: You can't wear bug spray or non-biodegradable sunscreen on these tours. And at the Mayan ruins it is VERY hot, prepare to sweat a lot!!! 1. The best tour was called Altournatives. You got to really see the Mayan people and culture in the jungle. It's the only tour allowed in so close. You visit and climb the ruins, eat a traditional Mayan lunch, go rappling and zipping threw the jungle, swim in a canote... It was an all day tour from about 7am -6pm. 2. Tulum and Xel-Ha: We saw the only ruins near the water, and then went to a natural aquarium. we snorkeled and saw soo many huge and small fish, they were everywhere! We also did a Sea Trek where we wore weighted helmet and walked on the bottom of the water and got real close and personal w/ the sting rays and fish. You can also cliff dive and relax on tubes down a river. 3. Swim w/ the dolphins at wet and wild in cancun. We got kisses, danced, pet them and got launched in the air by them. It was great! You can buy pictures and a video. Playa del Carmen: Its a great place to shop, eat, and go to bars. We went several times and still couldn't get enough. Great bars= The Moon, OHM Cancun: We rented a car for $65 for 24hours and drove to cancun. 45 minutes- 1 hour. Its only one straight road, but has no lights at night. Great bars, especially senior frogs!!! I recommentd the restaurant in the Hyatt Hotel for dinner and dessert. (Flamming coffee and crepes were the best!!!) If you have any quest. feel free to email. You'll have a great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but their public relations needs some work”
Reviews.Author: OakParkTraveller
Reviews.Content: I read so many helpful reviews when I was planning my trip. I hope that my experience can enlighten some future guests of the Riu Palace. My family stayed here for 10 days in early August 2004. We are two women, ages 43 and 45, and two teenage boys, ages 17 and 18. I booked this vacation about 9 or 10 months in advance, so I expected all of our ducks to be in a row by the time August rolled around. We reserved two of their "Jacuzzi Suites", of which there are only eight in the whole resort. Even on the day of our arrival, our travel agent was told that there were no changes and those suites would be our accomodations. Thus we were quite surprised to complete the entire check-in process and then be told "By the way, you are only getting one Jacuzzi Suite". How could that be? We reserved and paid for two of them months and months ago?? No real explanation was given; they just blamed it on "overbooking". This was both lame and insulting to us. Speaking with management and our travel agent got us nowhere. The two boys ended up in a junior suite THAT WAS NOT EVEN ON OUR SAME FLOOR. That was the real kicker. And, here we are a month later, and they have still not issued us a refund for the price difference on the rooms. The Jacuzzi Suite turned out to be not such a big deal. It is on a beautiful seperate patio that is accessible by spiral wrought-iron staircase on the balcony, but it is only a bathtub type of thing (with jets...). No biggie. We used it once in 10 days. Just let this be a warning to future guests. They will bait and switch you without batting an eye... That being said, the Palace is clean and beautiful. Beach and ocean are gorgeous. Tons of palm trees and always plenty of beach chairs. We enjoyed the food, and found the nightly buffet to be easier than the restaurants that require reservations. We went to the steak house one night and it was way too hot to sit outside, no matter what time of the evening... One tip, mainly for adults. If you want to find a much more secluded and quiet beach spot, walk out to the Riu beach, and turn right. Walk ten minutes or so and all of the resorts end. There is a wonderful stretch of sand to lay on, and beautiful trees up further away from the water (because there are no buildings there). No chairs, but all you need is a towel and a book, and you get peace and quiet away from the crowds. We did this a number of times. Perfect also for swimming or floating in the incredible Caribbean Sea... The staff works very hard, so please bring money for tips. They are not paid enough for their labor. I brought $200 u.s. dollars in singles and it was not enough. We tipped maids, bartenders, bus boys etc. It means a lot to them and they deserve it. The teenagers found the Riu Tequila to be the right place to spend their evenings. Much more for them to do over there, and they met friends immediately. We all had a great time, and would recommend this resort. Have fun !

Reviews.Title: “TIME WELL SPENT AT THE PALACE”
Reviews.Author: KSH1965
Reviews.Content: It is hard to put into words the awesome time we had at the Palace. The food was fabulous, our room was excellent, the staff was fabulous and the resort was spotless. We had a blast with Manuel, Carlos, Juan and the rest of them. How can I forget about Brigado, our waiter in the evening. We went for dance lessons, snorkeling, volleyball on the beach, bars in the pool and ventured into each of the other Riu Resorts. Our weather was great and I can't say enough about the shows at night. They were great. Pay the little extra and stay first class...you won't be disappointed. Thanks for such a great time. I will be back, hopefully with more friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation Yet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 8 days at Riu Palace (8/21-28/2004). It was our best vacation to date. We visited Mexico 5 years ago at another resort, and this far surpassed that visit in every respect. The resort was more than I expected. It is beautiful and kept spotless. The staff is incredibly friendly and respectful, and it is sometimes amazing how many languages they can speak. The food is gourmet and delicious -- we mainly ate in the main dining room, although we did visit Sir Edward restaurant once. I was very pleased with every single meal, including all lunches in the main dining area. The beach is superb and the water warm and electric blue. We are not big drinkers, but we did enjoy some of the fruity specialty drinks and some of the champagne that was abundant throughout the resort. From the greeting from the doorman as we walked into the resort to our checking out, we were very welcomed and catered to. We have been to several other all-inclusive resorts in Mexico and Punta Cana, but this was by far the best. I do not have one negative thing to say about the resort, the staff, the food or the beach. I had always been of the opinion that I would never return to a resort twice since there is so much to see in the world. However, both my husband and I agreed that we are visiting Riu Palace again next year. I highly recommend it to anyone and have been talking to our families about an extended family vacation there next year. If you ever wanted a vacation to put you in a different frame of mind, this is the place. I did not want to leave. Karen & Rob

Reviews.Title: “UNFORGETTABLE HONEYMOON for the JONES' !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the RIU Palace for our honeymoon 8/19/4-8/26/4. We were very pleased with our choice. I enjoy traveling and have been to a number of different resorts in Mexico and the Caribbean and this one is defiantly on the top of the list. The resort is beautiful. Clean beyond belief! We had a room on the second floor near the pool area which gave us a very nice view of the beach and you could see Cosumel in the distance. The staff is very, very friendly and helpful. My husband tipped a couple of the key personnel on day two and we were treated like celebrities for the entire stay. We were made reservations at any of the restaurants without going on a list! My husband met some very interesting people there and was advised of the top shelf tequila- Don Julio, which you must ask for by name. Also we enjoyed the Mango Margaritas very much which were a suggestion from one of the waiters Tino. We both gained weight from eating way to much food. Very good variety. The only food we did not enjoy was the Ostrich meat in La Bodega....but everything else was good. It was incredibly HOT during the week we were there, so next time we will come in Feb or March. But we managed to time our outdoor activities accordingly and made use of the bars, pool, and room to cool off! My husband and I enjoyed a couples massage which was very nice. We also went on the ATV Jungle tour which was FUN. Just be prepared for the rough ride and the dirt that will cover you from head to toe! We went on the Bar Hopping Tour and that was also fun. We took a ferry ride over to Cozumel for shopping and the ferry was surprisingly nice as well. Air conditioned inside with comfy seats. And yes, they do sell beer and soft drinks on board! We will definitely come back to this resort, but we will NOT book with Apple Vacations again. We checked in with our rep the day before our departure to make sure everything was in order, but on the following morning when were to be picked up at 6:30AM, there was no transportation for us. We were scheduled for a 9:30am flight on USA3000. Called the rep around 6:45 and was told that we were not scheduled for pick up and to take a taxi to Cancun airport! Long story short.... Apple had changed our flight time and airline to Pace at 2:40pm and did not tell us. The flight ended up being canceled and we did not leave the airport until 6pm. We demanded repayment of the taxi fee and we were reimbursed at the airport after much run around. Needless to say.....we were livid! Almost 12 hours in the airport that we could have spent at the RIU! But all in all....even with the problem with APPLE, we had a very relaxing and enjoyable honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “PURE PARADISE!!”
Reviews.Author: happyjester
Reviews.Content: I visited the riu palace playacar from the 9/8/04-23/8/04 along with my fiance his family my brother and a friend, we had a wonderful time! as soon as you arrive you are treated like royalty, the first impression when you walk through the door is amazing! the chandaliers, the marble floor, the amazingly comfy seating, just blows you away. The front desk were helpful and all the staff gave a very high level of service throughout our stay and were genuinely friendly our check in was very prompt and we were taken straight to our accommodation, within 5 minutes of being in the room we recieved a phone call to ask if the room was to our satisfaction! Throughout the two week stay at the palace i think i actually went to the bar and ordered myself twice! the service really is that prompt and the waiters keep coming up to you to check if you need anything else tony and lupita in particular in the bar cubano (lobby bar)were exceptional. The main buffet restaurant don julians was excellent ,there was always a choice of everything you can think of, vegetable dishes, meat dishes, cold cuts, fruit, cooking stations the choices were endless and they have theme nights such as chinese, italian, carribean which are all very good and just add to the variety. Sir edwards gourmet restaurant is also excellent. The only bad about the food was la bodega the brazillian steakhouse, in england we like our meat well done generally but in here its virtually running around the plate! this is a warning to any english travellers to stay away! i appreciate we are a minority and many other countries serve their meat in this manner but as i say i have written this not as a insult but just to warn the brits!! Overall the hotel is however impeccable and everyday you can see the hotel staff tending to the grounds either painting or gardening i have never been anywhere where such attention to detail has been even close to the level in this hotel. I will also say about the beach wow! huge sandy white sand with turquoise waters that seem to stretch on forever, simply stunning. There are many things to do if you want to do more than just relax we did a number of trips through our rep we did horse riding, the mayan adventure which was absolutely excellent! where you visit a mayan village and see how the poorer side live and visit little looked at ruins in ek belem ,visit a shopping place where obsidian carvings of mayan gods are hand carved, and you get to repel into cenotes, ride mountain bikes and swim in a cenote at the end of the day to cool off, amazing!well worth 89$ we also went to xel ha again i would reccomend thisyou see some awsome fish, we saw a snapper about 4 and a half feet! a real monster! we also went to cancun for the day very different to playa del carmen and playacar. Another highly reccomended trip is the catamaran cruise you go for half a day on the boat get to snorkel, sunbathe,and eat lunch and drink from the free bar (after you snorkel!)very enjoyable.The only thing i found monotonous about the palace was lack of evening entertainment, after the show fineshes at about 11o' clock there is only the bar cubano which is like a piano type bar very nice but only for a very quiet drink,we went to the disco at the riu tequilla across the street several times but this we found to be very rowdy and rather like a cattle market!! it was ok but a bar that played louder non piano music would have been better! I would reccomend the riu palace in a instant it is a true 5 * resort and we do hope to return here in the future again it was a lovely relaxing very memorable holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: melvins138
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our honeymoon at the Riu Palace Mexico in late May 2004. We overall really enjoyed the place. General Info: Our trip was May 23-30, 2004. The Riu Palace Mexico is located about 45 minutes south of Cancun, in Playa del Carmen, which is the port town for Cozumel. Playa del Carmen is a small town, and most of the tourist areas are very full of shops and sellers. Arrival: The resort was beautiful, very well maintained. The check in staff was very courteous and friendly. There was no wait, and getting into the room took only minutes. The floors were marble, with chandeliers and plush couches all around. Well dressed and mannered staff greet you and take your bags to your room The Room: The room was large, neat and clean, divided up into bathroom, bed area, and lounge area. There was a stocked mini bar containing Corona, Pepsi, Pepsi lite (diet), 7•Up, orange soda, mineral water, bottle water, rum, vodka, brandy and tequila. The beds were two full size beds bolted together, and made up like two separate beds. This was kinda odd. They were a little on the hard side, which is not a complaint, but be aware if this is not your preference. There was a 19" tv, with satellite, with about 7 English speaking channels. The tv was located in the lounge area in the room. The bathroom was large enough for two people to be in at once, with the toilet and bidet being in a separate closed off area. The shower was adequate for one, but showering together required some maneuvering. Our room was close to the beach and on the first floor, which was nice. We never heard any of our neighbors, but the cleaning staff was loud during the days. The Food: The food was very nice in every restaurant in the resort. The review is divided up this way; breakfast, lunch and dinner. Breakfast: Breakfast was held in the main dining hall, "Don Julian." It's a typical American buffet breakfast. You had your choice of eggs, made to order omelets., bacon, sausage, toast, bagels, cereal, fruit. We saw a wide variety of Fruit juices, orange, apple, pinapple, watermelon, etc. Also available were a selection of coffees, teas, and mimosa. Lunch: Lunch was offered at "Don Julian," "El Patio," and "La Traviata." El Patio and La Traviata are outside open air eateries. Lunch was good, nothing special. We preferred Don Julians only because it was indoors and air conditioned. The standard food fair was available pizza, hamburgers, pastas, salads, deli meats, mexican food. It was good, but nothing great. Dinner: There were several rules regarding dinner that you must know before going to the resort. First, when you arrive, you are given a choice in times to eat, either 6:30-8:30 pm or 9-11 pm. When you choose you are given a nightly reservation to Don Julians at that time. The rest of the restaurants are by reservation only. You must also dress according to the dress code. I personally had no problem with this, but some might. Men must wear long pants, and a collared shirt. Ladies wear nice dresses. There are a higher percentage of Europeans there, and most of them dress up beyond the basic requirement. Reservations are made in the morning for that day. Reservations start to be taken at 7 am, and fill up quickly leaving you to eat at Don Julian. Restaurants: Don Julian is the main buffet. The food changes every day, and the menu is posted outside. Each night is a different theme ranging from Mexican, Italian, Japanese, American. The food is always good. I never had a bad meal there. Sir Edwards is the nicest of the restaurants. It is a seven course meal that is very upscale. The food there was excellent. I hear th food there is the same every night, but menu has several options for each course, so you can each differently each visit. This is not a buffet, the food is ordered, and served to you. The attmosphere is upscale, yet cozy. It never felt stuffy. Reservation go very quick for this place, I got our the second day we were there by getting up at 6:45 and being first in line. La Bodega is the Mediterranean restaurant. We loved this place! The menu is the same every night, so we only went there once, but regretted it later. You start out with a serve yourself salad and soup bar, and then the rest of the meal is served to you. The servers bring a skillet of vegetables to each person, and then serve you various meats. Each meat is served on a sword, that is cut off onto your plate. I think there were six or seven different meats to choose from; veal, steak, roast beef, turkey, lamb, chicken, pork. I loved this place. El Patio is the steak restaurant. We ate there at the end of the week, there was a wedding party happening, and it ruined our experience. The party was loud, playing music and dancing. It was also our last night, so we were sad. The food was very good, no A-1 Steak Sauce, but not very memorable. The Rest of the Resort: The resort overall was very well maintained. The grounds were were always well groomed and trash-free. I had read reviews of stange odors, but never experienced it at the Riu. There was a resort up the street, when wee walked by, had a pungent smell. The pool was very clean, and the swim up bar was rarely over crowded. The Beach was also well groomed, and never too crowded. I think only once did my wife and I have a hard time finding seats together. The water was trash and seaweed free, and never crowded. There was a bar on the beach, which would make anything you want. There was a piano bar in the main lobby that was top of the line. The bartender there, Faustino, was very friendly. I tipped him on the first day, which you don't have to do to get good service, and he had my favorite drink ready the next time I came to the bar. Conclusion: Overall it was very relaxing. If you are looking for a party resort, this is not it. It is very quiet and laid-back. It's upscale without being stuffy. We visited the other Riu properties located nearby, and very happy to have chosen the Palace. The other Riu resorts were very nice, and the the staff treaded us very well, but the Palace was just top of the line. My wife and I are in our late 20's and we were young for the resort. We met a couple our age there, which made the experience more memorable. Most other guests were older, and European. We would consider returning maybe for our 5th or 10th anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Palace!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our 10-year old daughter stayed at this resort Aug 15-21. We booked thru Apple Vacations. Below is our review: TRANSFER TO RESORT: The van ride to the resort took about one hour due to stops at 4 other resorts. No big deal - it seemed to go fast. CHECK IN: Fast and friendly. We had drinks in our hand within a minute of walking in the door. ROOM: Our room was on the second floor near the front of the resort close to the buffet restaurant, Don Julian's. Our balcony faced the tennis courts and was very private. I don't think the ocean is visible from any of the rooms at this resort. The room was spotless and the A/C worked very well. The mini-fridge was stocked with water, soda, and beer. The liquor dispenser held a bottle each of tequilla, rum, vodka and brandy. We didn't drink the alcohol, but the water and soda we drank was restocked daily. Two complaints about the room - the lack of hot water (If you shower after 6:00 pm, it will be in cold water) and the hard beds (like sleeping on concrete). Our daughter loved the towel animals that the maid left each day. You will have TV, but it is in Spanish. BEACH: Beautiful and blue, with powdery white sand. There was a little bit of seaweed, but it didn't bother us. Always plenty of lounge chairs and bare-breasted sunbathers. You can stay in the sun or under the shade of the palm trees. Take the time to walk up the beach about a mile - there are some rocks on the shore and a small reef. It is very secluded and a great picture spot. There is also a place on the beach to paint pottery, which our daughter did twice. My only complaint about the beach was the constant smell of gasoline fumes and noice from the jet skis and boats. POOLS: Didn't spend much time here, but they were nice. FOOD/DRINKS: The food got better as the week went on. We mainly ate at Don Julian's, which is the buffet restaurant. There is a different theme every night and always something for everyone. We ate at Sir Edward's one night and it was excellent. We had no problems getting dinner reservations. You can get a snack at this resort 24/7. It may only be a hamburger and fries, but something is always available. My daughter ate more ice cream cones than I can count. We are not big drinkers, but if you are, you can definitely get your money's worth here. There is a bar at the beach, at the pool, and you can get drinks at any of the restaurants. The few drinks we did get were weak, but if you ask, they will add more liquor. SPA: I got a massage at the spa (you can also have one on the beach), which was excellent. My daughter had her hair braided on the beach and we were pleased with that as well. Ladies - make sure you check out Roberto at the spa - YUMMY! SHOPPING: There is a small shopping plaza down the street from this resort, but prices were lower in town on 5th Avenue. EXCURSIONS: We booked two excursions with the Apple rep at our resort. We went to Xel-Ha for a full day. It was fun, and our daughter had a great time feeding the iguanas lettuce from the restaurants. We also booked the Snorkeling Adventure tour, but our bus didn't show up, so we got our money back. We also went out on the banana boat, not realizing that they flip you over a couple of times. It was fun, but a little scarey. We also went to the Xa-Man aviary. It was nice, but make sure you take your mosquito repellent. ENTERTAINMENT: The shows each night were not Vegas quality, but funny and entertaining. SERVICE: Service from the staff at this resort was excellent. We were treated like royalty. OVERALL: Very, very nice and very, very clean - this place is truly a palace. We saw no bugs, and we did not get sick at all (and we did drink the water). We give this resort a 4 instead of a 5 only because the food was not excellent. If we ever return to Mexico, it will be to this resort. Feel free to contact us if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent (Again!)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from two fabulous weeks at the Riu Palace Mexico. Since we relied on bulletin boards such as this in preparing for our trip (albeit our second trip to the Palace), we thought we would provide a little bit of information for those who have booked or are considering booking at this resort. We first visited the Palace 2 years ago (August, 2002). We booked here a second time because we thought that any other resort would pale in comparison. We were not disappointed. ROOM We were assigned room 2146 (located on the 3rd floor, facing the courtyard). As those of you who have read Jobob's messages know, there are no real ocean view rooms. This room was the next best thing. Views of the hotel's beautifully manicured courtyard, fountains, etc. Fantastic room. Only downside - try climbing 2 flights of stairs in 37C heat. There is an elevator, but it is back in the lobby and is a long trek from the pool. Notiwthstanding, WHEN WE GO BACK (and we will), I would love to have the same room again. We did e-mail the hotel twice before our arrival and requested a courtyard room. On one occasion, they informed us that they would do what they could but there were no guarantees. We are not sure if our emails played any part in our room desingations, but it certainly did not hurt. We heard that the beds were hard. We had no problem in 2002 and did not find the beds too firm this time either (although we do sleep on an extra-firm mattress at home). FOOD Loved the buffet (Don Julian). I am a vegetarian/fish eater, so was not fond of the a la carte restaurants that appear geared to meat eaters. This was not, however, a let down. The buffet provides ample choice and even after 14 days, we were not bored of the selection. The soups are particularly excellent. Those of you who have been to luxury resorts should set your expectations at a reasonable level. This is not 5-star a la carte dining a la Four Seasons Resort, but it is also not costing you $200 for dinner every night. By all-inclusive standards, the food is 5-star. There are 2 seatings for dinner (6:45 and 9:00 pm). We went to the late seating. DRINKS The drinks are great. There is top shelf liquor on request and no additional fees. Favourite drink - Cafe Palace (ask for it in the Lobby Bar). It is not in the menu but is known by all the staff. There was live music in the lobby bar on 6 of 7 days (piano on 5 nights and trumpet on one night). Also, the bar tenders will make any drink you want. You may have to provide some instruction, but they always oblige with a smile and will keep trying until they get it right! SERVICE We have been to hotels like the Four Seasons and Fairmont -- admittedly a different experience, but the service at the Riu Palace is comparable. We were amazed when a waiter who had been at the hotel 2 years earlier remembered us from our first visit. Wow! POOL In August -- very warm. Like getting into a bath. There are 2 pools. The one with activities and swim up bar is quite busy. The other pool is much more laid back (and is a mirror image of the first pool). The pools were great. The pool bar -- Las Conchas -- has popcorn and nachos as well as a shaded area where people gather to play cards, bingo, etc. We sat there for about an hour everyday to get out of the heat and played backgammon. BEACH Piece de resistance. We took a walk along the stretch of Playacar where the hotel is located. There is no question that the Riu Palace has the nicest beach (this includes the Royal Hideaway which is the nicest and most expensive hotel on the strip). The Palace's beach is breathtaking. It is extremely lush and the palm trees provide ample shade. We would suggest bringing bottled watter from the room to the beach. While there is a beach bar, it is set far back and the heat makes the walk feel long and difficult. The water is warm and generally calm although it was a little rough for a couple of days due to Hurricane Charley out at sea. The Riu Hotels outsource watersports to Scuba Caribe. They offer scuba diving (there are some nice dive sites in the area), parasailing, jet-skiing, etc. at additional cost. Great view while parasailing. As you know by now, there are many Europeans at this resort, some of whom sun bathe topless. Be forewarned. ADDITIONAL NOTES - A la carte restaurants (in particular, Sir Edwards) require same day reservations. Sir Edwards typically fills up before 8 am. - No light in the shower. - People do dress up for dinner. You can feel comfortable dressing casually or in fancier attire.
