Remember no shorts for men at dinner (strictly enforced). - There are shows from 10:00pm until 11:00pm every night, followed by live music outdoors. - The Riu Palace IS a top notch, elegant, sophisticated, low key place to relax and enjoy. It is NOT a spring breaker, clubbing, fast paced resort. That said, anyone staying at the Palace has access to the three other RIU's in the area which provide some of the above (including two discos). SUMMARY Our past two weeks at the RIU PALACE were fantastic. We have stayed at the Barcelo Maya Beach Resort. While it too, is lovely, the Palace was, in our view, in a class above. We will return to the Mayan Riviera and we have every intention of returning to the Riu Palace. The service, the beach, the grounds and the general attention to detail make this the ideal all inclusive!

Reviews.Title: “CONTINUOUSLY STUNNING!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have returned to the RIU Palace three years in a row now, and each time is more Amazing, relaxing, lively and Outsanding than before. I have stayed in the RIU Yucatan, and the RIU Tequila, and neither match up to the Palace. Although, I believe this is done on purpose,for the highest ratings and the name "Palace" were given to this particular establishment. Short But sweet it is well worth the price, hands down. . .Stay at the Palace

Reviews.Title: “Called a Palace for a reason”
Reviews.Author: bill9thrill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Riu Palace from August 9-15 for our honeymoon. Here is my opinion: The Riu Palace is the most beautiful hotel either of us had seen. From the moment you pull into the driveway, you are amazed at the beauty. You enter the lobby and your draw drops. At one point my wife told me to close my mouth because I could not believe it. Check-in was hassle free and the staff was overly friendly in explaining what we needed to do to get dinner that evening (we arrived late on a Monday). We went to our room and were very impressed. We had an outside room, but who cares. It's 100 degrees and we never sat on our balcony anyways. We sort of enjoyed the privacy. There was a genourously stocked fridge and liquor dispenser in our room that cam in handy all week. The grounds are immaculate. We took picture after picture because we could not get over the beauty of the place. There are constantly staff cleaning and they are super friendly. The food was decent, not great. There was plenty though so we didnt have a problem finding something we liked to eat. As far as making reservations, we were worried after reading other reviews that we would have trouble getting into the speciality restaurants unless we got up early. Well, we usually went to breakfast between 7-8 and never had a problem. We ate at Sir Edward's twice and the steakhouse once. Both very good My biggest complaint is finding something to eat late at night. We chose the early dinner every day, and after a night out of drinking and going to shows, we were dying for some food. Well, there is nothing to be had. They do set up hot dogs and hamburgers, but a late night buffet like you find on cruises would have been nice. We actually ordered Dominoe's one night because we were so hungry! The staff throughout are great. Bartenders are the best. I drank Mango Daquari's mostly, and my wife drank wine. If you're by the pool, order a dirty monkey from Faustino, or as we called them by week's end, dirty Faustino's. Very tasty. We went horseback riding one day and parasailing another. Other than that, we lounged by either the ocean or pool. The weather was perfect, 98 and sunny every single day. Overall, I would recommend the Palace to anyone looking for a laid back time at a fabulous resort. If you are a spring breaker looking to drink til you puke, try Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palace!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Palace from July 19-25 for our Honeymoon. We had an exceptional stay and would greatly recommend the Palace to anyone especially honeymooners. We stayed in an oceanfront jacuzzi suite. It was absolutely unbelieveable! The room was two stories with the upper story being open to the air with the jacuzzi overlooking the ocean! Absolutely worth the extra money. The beach was spectacular and the ocean was perfect. No seaweed at all and plenty of loungers to lay on. The food was very good and the reservation system was not at all a problem - just make them when you go down for breakfast. The service is unbelieveable - we have never been treated so well in our lives. Very top notch and even better if you are willing to tip a little. The night life is a little dull - but we didn't need it - we were more than happy to sit in the open air bar sip frozen drinks and smoke some Cuban cigars. This is a great resort and I would highly recommend it!! 100% the best trip of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found!”
Reviews.Author: czikovitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace from August 2 – 9, 2004. I visited this website regularly before my trip and actually drove my husband nuts and so I felt obligated to leave my own review and to thank everyone else who left there’s, it really helped make our trip better. I find it hard to believe that people would have had a bad time at the Palace. We did our research before going and knew all about the dress code, the range in age of the clientele and the fact that the place isn’t hopping until the wee hours of the morning, that is what the other three RIU resorts are for. If you want to party, simply walk to either the Tequila or the Yucatan resort for dancing and additional entertainment. We visited the other three RIU resorts and they were all great. We also walked to the little plaza down the street for some shopping. It is best to do your shopping in Playa del Carmen. We took a taxi for 40 pesos and found the prices to be much better. They advised us not to shop on Tuesdays and Thursdays because that was cruise ship day and the merchants tended to raise their prices a bit because of the cruise ship tourists. You can exchange your money in Playa or at the Hotel but the money exchange places in Playa give you a bit more pesos for your money. Room/Resort: The resort is gorgeous, small enough to walk to everything and big enough that you don’t feel cramped. The resort was almost to capacity when we were there and we never felt crowded. The check-in at the desk was painless and we just took whatever room they gave us. We got the second floor facing the RIU Yucatan. I was a bit disappointed with the view at first but I quickly got over it. We hardly spent any time in our rooms at all. Other than the view, all the rooms are pretty much the same. I am very picky and didn’t find anything to complain about. Fresh towels each morning, all supplies replenished when needed, including the mini-bar and fridge. Bed turn down service at night was a nice touch. They also took away any dirty towels and left a light on for you so your room wouldn’t be dark when you got back from the show…nice. Two double beds pushed together is a bit out of the ordinary but we didn’t mind. Most importantly for me, NO BUGS!!!! Food: The Don Julian buffet had lots to choose from, no one should go hungry. We had two choices for the dinner seating: 6:45pm – 8:30pm or the second seating from 9:00pm – 10:30pm. We chose the first one and they assigned us a table for the week. I ended up not liking the table they gave us because there was too much traffic coming by from the buffet so I simply asked if it wouldn’t be too much trouble to get a different table and they accommodated us immediately. The specialty restaurants were great, I loved the Sir Edward but my husband was partial to La Bodega because they serve you 7 different types of meat during your meal. We had NO TROUBLE getting reservations at the restaurants. We went to breakfast at about 9am and they still had spaces at the restaurants for the first seating, so I wouldn’t worry about that. Beach: What a sight! The beach was beautiful. The water was wonderful. The first few days were a bit rough because of the wind but the rest were great. No plants or other interesting vegetation floating in the water and the bottom was soft sand and when there aren’t any waves, you could see right down to your feet in the water. We never had any trouble finding shade; there are enough palm trees and chairs for all! Thank you to whoever recommended that we bring insulated mugs…what a saviour! The bartenders happily made all my drinks in the cups and they stayed cold for at least 2 hours. I think the key to having a good time, is going with an open mind and a good attitude. Things are not the same there was they are in North America and we have to be flexible and remember that we are there to relax and have a good time and the resort really does try their best to help you accomplish that. If anyone has any questions, please feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: goohiostate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon at the Riu Palace and had to submit our review due to wonderful experience we had: Room: Great! We had a superior room, but did not like the initial room we were given since it was not overlooking the courtyard as we had hoped -- the resort changed our room with no questions asked. The air conditioning was wonderful and the bed, although a little hard, was no problem at all -- in fact, we slept incredibly well. The only "negative" I can mention would be the "scraping noise" that we heard in our 1st floor room when the rooms directly above us were being cleaned (noise from benches being moved across the tiled floor) -- this was so minor, however, but I will probably ask for a 3rd floor room when we return. Food/Drinks: We liked the mix of "sit down" restaurants and buffet restaurants. La Bodega was our favorite (serves 7 different kinds of meat at your table -- great for those on low carb diets) since you typically don't see this type of restaurant in the USA. The only negatives would be that the steak at "The Steakhouse" wasn't the best and the deserts were not that good either, but, all in all, we were definitely pleased. The fruit was incredible. For those making 9:00 reservations, however, please make sure to eat a late lunch since there really is no "snacks" and the 9:00 time is later than you think -- for the most part, however, we chose not to eat earlier b/c we wanted to enjoy the beach/pool as long as we could. The drinks were "weak", but since we don't drink too much alcohol, we enjoyed these -- they will make them stronger upon request. Staff Service: Excellent!!! The staff at the Palace was incredible -- always working, always pleasant, and always expeditious with requests. Resort: Beautiful and so well-maintained -- the staff was always working on the landscaping and the grounds in general -- very impressive! This place is cleaner than any place we have ever stayed here in the US (the staff is ALWAYS cleaning). You will appreciate the resort even more if you walk through other resorts near the Palace -- no comparison! Beach: Can not ask for a better beach or better water -- absolutely stunning -- would have been worth the trip just for the beach!! Tour: We went to Chichen Itza and definitely recommend it -- although the tour took the majority of the day, you will enjoy learning about and ultimately witnessing the history of the site. All in all, this trip exceeded our expectations even after the word-of-mouth reviews of 4 friends who had stayed here in the past and all of the reviews on this site. No need to look elsewhere -- stay at the Riu Palace!!!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace - Wow!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned at the RIU Palace on Feb 16th 2004. The facilities were fabulos. The rooms were roomy and very clean. The beds were (as everyone else mentioned) two hard double beds pushed together. You never went thirsty. It was a great idea to bring a insulated mug to save the walk from the bar to the beach. If you are looking to book day trips, visit the little travel agency in the small mall down teh street. Same tours that the groups are pushing just $20US per person cheaper. We paid $65 per person (through our agency) for a Tulum Ruins half day(great trip), and a half day large catamaran ride. People sitting next to us on the bus for the same tour paid $45 per person. Great entertainment. Night life in Playa city a bit scary. Stick to the resort. Over all great trip. We will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Palace July 28 - August 2, 2004. This is the most beautiful hotel I've ever seen (i'm a former travel agent). I am very pleased to rate this hotel as an excellent place to relax & feel like you are the queen. My family, my husband, daughter (age 18), & son (age 12) all loved this resort. The food was wonderful.........we loved the buffet (so many choices) and the drinks (virgin) drinks were just as wonderful as the real deal. The employees at this hotel were remarkable. They were always cleaning, smiling, and assisting guests. If you need something, just ask. The beach at this property is so picturesque, palm trees lining the beach along with a good supply of lounge chairs and shade. Lot's of non-motorized toys to use and the softest sand I've ever walked on. Be sure to walk to your right (facing the ocean), explore to the end of the hotel zone.... you will find a deserted beach with beautiful places to take pictures and swim by yourself (this was so gorgeious). The water is the prettiest color of blue and great to swim in (very warm this time of year). I wish we were still there. We definitely will return to this property. Now, the only negative to mention ... I would recommend folks who prefer to turn in early (before midnight).... to request a room closer to the pool away from the entertainment. We were in room #0101 very close to the main building... very noisy at night. The beds were not very comfortable, we did ask for the pads and they did help but it was nice to sleep in our own beds when we returned home. All in all, I would highly recommend this property to anyone that prefers high class with a beautiful setting ..........you cannot find a better property than the Hotel Riu Palace in Playa del Carman. By the way I checked out the other Riu properties close to the Palace and the Palace is definitely the best! Hope you enjoy!!! Donna Johnston

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the RIU Palace 8/1 - 8/8 with the family - 2 parents - 46 & 44; 2 children 13 & 10. Pluses:The hotel common area's are awesome and immuclate. The beach is the best that I have ever seen. The hotel staff are very friendly and go out of their way to accomadate you. Lots of variety for buffet dining. Minsus: Yes, bring a plug in with you, even with the plug in our room still smelled very musty. (I am now washing our laudrey and airing out the suitcases to get rid of the smell) Thoughts: This is a great hotel to stay at, we would not hesitate to recommend it friends and family. I would not however recommend it for families with young children that need alot of activies to keep them happy as it really is geared toward honeymooners, adults and families with older children.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All The Way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to Mexico, first one to Playa del Carmen and the RIU Palace. After our trip, we decided that Playa del Carmen topped Cancun hands down and that it would be next to impossible for someone to top the RIU Palace. Listed just a couple of thoughts from our trip below. TRANSPORTATION: We were on a Apple Vacation tour package so transfers to/from the airport were included. With that said, going forward we will get our own transportation. Having to wait for them to fill the shuttle up at the airport and then wait for the bus (we were told was 45 minutes late, we did not wait to find out) when you leave is a drag. We were told it was $62US for a cab from the airport to the hotel, but after a quick negotiation, we had them down to $35.00 US and on the return we paid $40US (non-negotiated) Fast, air conditioned and door to door service, no waiting for stops at other hotels. THE APPLE REPS WERE USELESS! CHECK IN : After reading previous review, was prepared for something horrible. However, it was pleasant and smooth. Arrived around 10:30 am and they had a room ready for us. Many thanks to Hugo. ROOM: Bring a Glade plug in to help with the smell of the room. It is just a result of the weather and being so humid, not much you can do about it. But the Glade plug in helped a bunch. Huge room and sitting area. Always had hot water in the shower. Drink all the bottle water in the fridge, that way they replace each day. DRINKS: The person that suggested the insulated mugs is a genius. Made all the difference in the world. Bartenders had no problem making the drinks in our own cups. Couple of times the drinks were a little soft, but when we asked for more booze they simply grabbed the bottle and turned it upside down until we said enough. Great service. POOL: Never had a problem getting chair near the pool and there was no need to go down and reserve a chair. If you want something to float on in the pool, bring it down yourself. BEACH BAR: The beach bar is not that far from the beach The problem is they serve the drinks in 8-10 oz. glasses. Again, the insulated mugs did the trick. SPA: Wife spent much time in the spa and raved about all the treatments ( massage, facials, body wraps) GYM: is not large, but has a Universal machine that will allow for a good workout. Small set of dumbells ( 10lb-30lb) and some free weights. Couple of bikes and treadmills, but they looked to be on their last leg. Most people in our party ran the loop in Playacar for cardio. BEACH: INCREDIBLE. Water was crystal clear, even at night. Suggest taking a midnight swim TIPPING: Service at the hotel is fantastic and I don't believe that tipping will get you better service than the next guest. Thebartenders/waiters/housekeeping work extremely hard and giving good service seemed to be priority number one. With that said, we tipped sometimes to show our appreciation for the effort and it was graciously accepted. (Never noticed a decline in service when we didn't tip) BARS: The Cubano Bar and The Lounge were great for drinks before/after dinner. MIX OF PEOPLE: Did not see it like other reviewers. There was a great mix of people. Plenty of kids running around. Lively atmosphere around all of the hotel facilities. FOOD: We ate at every restaurant. Never had problem getting reservation. Got reservations anywhere from 7:30 - 10 am. After eating at all of them, decided was not worth worrying about getting reservation. Eating at Don Julians was actually a good experience seeing the different people and cultures. Would suggest either eating at Don Julian's or heading into PDC for dinner. There are great restaurants in PDC. OTHER RIU HOTELS: Went to all of the hotels. The Tequila had alot more children and activities, but just seemed dirty. The Playacar and Yucatan were nice, but nothing compared to the Palace. COZUMEL :Unless you are a snorkler, scuba diver or looking for a different beach to get drunk on, there is no reason to go over to Cozumel. They are selling the same things as they do in PDC, just at higher prices. Can't say enough about how great of a trip we had to the Palace, already making plans for return trip next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: maxanddrew
Reviews.Content: We recently got back from our 8 day honeymoon at the RIU Palace (June 28-July 5). My husband and I are both in our mid-late twenties and had never been to Mexico before. We read every single tripadvisor--- review of this hotel, and wanted to contribute our impressions and feedback. Cancun Airport: Not as bad as we anticipated it to be! Our plane was the only one landing at the time, so getting through customs/immigration was a breeze. The timeshare/taxi people in the actual airport were stuck behind a counter, so unless you approached them yourself, it was easy to avoid them. Once outside the doors of the airport there were lots of people eager to take your luggage for a few dollars, a polite but firm no gracias works just fine if you don't want them to help. Check-in: We were early (about 11:00), so with check-in at 3:00 we had some time to kill. After traveling all morning, taking a brief tour and grabbing lunch, we became extremely tired and really wanted our room for a nap (it was about 1:30). We checked with the desk and they were able to get us a room early, however it wasn't on the 3rd floor like we requested, so we decided to tough it out. But it was nice that they offered! Room: We liked the split level floor plan. It added sophistication and made the room feel more like a suite. Our room was on the 3rd floor and our balcony overlooked the tennis court area and the RIU next door. We had seriously considered getting a whirlpool suite or courtyard view, but at the end of our stay, we realized that with the weather being so hot and with our entire days being spent outside the room, we never really even went out on the patio. Plus there were always people in the courtyard, so we liked the quiet exterior room. The mini-fridge was always stocked with water, sodas (loved the orange soda!), and beer – we never had a problem with running out of an item. Beds: The beds were very firm. I was fine with it for the first couple of days, but then I quickly joined my husband’s opinion in wanting a bit more softness after spending all day in the sun. We put the two extra blankets on one side of the bed for cushioning and that did help. I would have liked to have known that mattress pads were available at the desk (I just read that!). Also, the two full beds pushed together became tiresome. We would have paid extra for just a single king. Plus, it seemed like a lot of work for the housekeeping staff to move the beds apart and back together again for both making and turn down. There were a lot of pillows on the bed, so while there were flat, once stacked they felt okay. Staff: This is where the RIU Palace truly shines. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Nearly everyone greeted us with a friendly Hola and warm, genuine smile. Everyone on staff works very hard and very long days just to make our stay the best possible. We didn’t have problems with the front desk staff, like others have expressed. There were a few wait staff at El Patio/La Traviata that weren’t very efficient or friendly during our lunches, but their surliness was probably wasn’t that bad – it just stuck out compared to everyone else’s superior service. We took lots of $1 bills for tips. We gave the housekeeper a couple every day (such hard work), and we tipped our wait staff and bartenders nearly every meal -- they really appreciate it. Patrick at Don Julian’s was great, and Angel was really friendly as he took our drink orders every night on the courtyard plaza after dinner. Food: The great thing about buffet is that it’s hard to not to find something you like to eat. Breakfast and lunch was pretty had pretty much the same offerings from day to day, but wide variety. Dinner at Don Julian’s had a different theme every night (Italian, International, etc.), but Mexican selections were always available, as well as the pasta bar, salad bar, cheese bar and pizza. We were particularly impressed with the soups – so very good! We ate at Sir Edwards once, and while good, we noticed that everything came from the same kitchen, so it was just like eating the buffet food except served! The cuisine did lean toward the European palette, but we enjoyed the change of pace. One thing that we found helpful was taking the soup bowls from LaTraviata and filling them with soft serve ice cream, instead of using the tiny, drippy cones they offer. It was a really refreshing treat in the middle of the day. Bars/Drinks: We drank our body weight in pina coladas! The staff always made sure your glass was full and they seemed downright disappointed if they couldn’t get you anything else! The lobby/Cubano bar was a nice place to relax and cool off. Our after dinner cocktails on the plaza area were a part of the best time of our days. We brought large thermal mugs for the beach bar, but ended up not using them as we didn’t drink much while laying out. Our one complaint lays with the swim-up bar: the bar was always busy and they only had one bartender, leaving the poor man swamped with orders. Also, people were very possessive of their seat making it difficult to place your order without getting pushed around. In fact, there always seemed to be a large group at the swim-up bar for hours at a time, very noisy, very obnoxious – and many of them were smoking in the middle of the pool! Eww. It was honestly the one unclassy area of the whole resort. We also noticed that unless you specifically asked for it, they didn’t put alcohol in the daquiri/colada drinks at the pool bar and beach bar, just the mix and ice. Beach: We spent hours upon hours at the fabulous beach. There was never a problem in getting a lounge chair and we were completely comfortable leaving our beach bag and possessions while we got drinks, ate lunch, or went in the sea. The beach was always clean and quiet – so relaxing! I highly recommend a walk on the beach every night. Kids: There were a few families with young children there during our stay, which honestly was a bit disappointing. There isn't a lot of child-based activities to do! Most of the youngsters were primarily well behaved, but the children's show on the courtyard after dinner everynight was extremely annoying. After a nice dinner at Don Julians we would sit in the courtyard playing cards, having an after dinner drink, enjoying the cool evening, only to have the relaxing experience interrupted by a noisy, cheesy kid-participation show. Even the entertainment staff seemed tired of having to pander to these kids. Excursions: We had every intention of seeing the Mayan ruins and such, but we ended up being better beach bums that we thought! We did do a 1⁄2 day snorkeling trip through the Original Snorkeling Adventure. It was worthwhile -- but I wouldn't recommend doing a full day snorkeling trip. After our 4 hour snorkel we were satisfied, but really, really worn out. Plus we wanted to get back to the fabulous RIU Palace! We also made a taxi trip downtown and made a few select purchases. Some helpful advice for downtown is to have a firm idea of what you're shopping for, as many vendors will push you around if you come off as wishy-washy. They were re-doing the sidewalks/streets of Playa while we were there -- so while it was dusty, I'm sure future visitors will be impressed by the upgrade. Also, we had a great time painting pottery on the beach. It took some time, but it was a fun activity and we have cute keepsakes to help remind us of our fabulous vacation. Weather: It was hot, but between the A/C'd rooms and the shaded coconut trees on the beach, we felt comfortable nearly the whole time. It rained for exactly 3 minutes the afternoon before we left. A sprinkling of fat raindrops is all it was! Packing: I only brought one skirt, and I would have liked to have brought along at least one more, as I wore it nearly every night for dinner. Yes, men are required to wear pants at dinner, but my husband didn't have a problem with wearing them at that time of day, as the weather cools considerably. We brought two bottles of spray sunscreen and one bottle of regular SPF 45 and we're glad we did. We went through nearly all of it. A deck of cards, a few books, and our electronic Scrabble provided some fun both on the beach and on the plane. We had such a great time at the Palace, we're afraid that we've been too spoiled! It's a great getaway!

Reviews.Title: “The Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First, a thanks to all of you who wrote reviews about this resort and the Riviera Maya. It was very useful information and made our vacation a success. We stayed at the Palace from July 26-31. AIRPORT: The Cancun Airport was CHAOS. Our flight arrived with two other flights. It is evident that the arrival area is not set up for any more than one flight. After you get your luggage, make your way toward Customs as quickly as you can. There is no rhyme or reason to the way you get there (no roped-off lanes, arrows, etc.). Grab your bags and go. We had about five independent lines trying to get to the two Customs inspectors. After you clear customs do not stop moving until you locate your transportation provider outside and keep repeating "No Gracias" to the timeshare sharks. ARRIVAL/CHECK-IN/ROOM CRITIQUE: It was about an hour ride to the Palace. You know immediately upon arrival at the Palace that you hit a homerun when you chose this resort. The place is magnificent. We were quickly attended to by the staff and as we entered the lobby the beauty of the Palace left us speechless. The front desk staff was great. We had a "welcome" drink in our hands in under two minutes. They took the time to explain the map of the property, seating times, activities, etc. and we were on our way. We arrived at our room a few minutes later (2100 block) and our bags were waiting for us. The room was outstanding. Spacious, COOL (AC worked fine), comfortable, mini-bar and refrigerator well stocked. The balcony was fabulous. It was surrounded by eight foot high walls on both sides (maximum privacy), overlooked the courtyard, and had dimensions of 15 X 25 ! The beds are very hard, but I like a hard mattress. Just request a mattress pad and you will be fine. Requests for items were acted on immediately. We requested a clothes iron and ironing board and it arrived at our door in about five minutes. THE BEACH: Simply the most beautiful stretch of sand and water I have ever seen. We had no trouble locating chairs or a nice place to relax (either in the sun or under the palm trees). There are quite a few women who go topless so be mindful of that if you are bringing children. THE BARS: We drank at Los Mariachis, Las Conchas, and Bar Cubano. At each of them the service was fast and the drinks were NOT watered down. Our favorite bar was Bar Cubano. Go to the second floor balcony overlooking the lobby, take a seat, and enjoy your drink. A very private spot. ENTERTAINMENT/ACTIVITIES: There is a different stage show every night that begins at 10:00 and lasts about 45 minutes. Try to get there by 9:30 for a good seat. The performers we saw were very good (singing, dancing, magician, etc.) After the show there is usually a band set up in the courtyard that plays until 11:30. By Midnight EVERYTHING is shut down. If you are a party animal stay somewhere else. STAFF: All I can say is there was not one request for a service or product that was not acted upon IMMEDIATELY. These people really work their butts off to keep the place SPOTLESS and try to keep you happy. TIPPING: I know it is an "all-inclusive" resort and you don't have to, but give these people a buck or two. It means alot to them and it won't break you. We did and we were rewarded ten-fold. OFF-PROPERTY ACTIVITIES: We went to Xcaret for a day and did the whole nature park thing including swimming with the dolphins. AWESOME! A very worthwhile trip. We went into Playa Del Carmen for a day and went on a shopping spree. The jewelry business here is really overwhelming and its easy to overdose on "deals" on silver. If you are looking for items other than jewelry, the prices get better the farther you go away from 5th (main tourist street). Just as in the airport, keep moving and repeating "No Gracias" or you will be mauled by timeshare sharks and other unsavory characters selling everything from "Cuban" cigars to donkeys. Don't worry about your safety here. I have never seen as many policemen in one place at one time in my life. Check out the officers wearing black from head to toe and carrying sub-machineguns. Believe me, no one would dare try anything here. TRANSPORTATION: Take a taxi wherever you go. Do not get stuck on some tour bus where it will take you forever to get to anywhere. From the Palace to Xcaret was $10 US (20 minute ride) and to Palya Del Carmen was $5 US (10 minute ride). Money well spent. FOOD: This is the ONLY thing I was not thrilled with at the Palace. Let me explain. We ate at Don Julian (buffet) for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The preparation of food is very good. The selection/quality of the food is good, NOT GREAT. It is standard "buffet" food and I must admit I was disappointed. The only exception to this was for dinner on "Chef's Night". They served better quality items that night such as Beef Wellington and Spicy Steamed Shrimp. If they would have selections such as these EVERY night it would be a much better dining experience. Every night before dinner, Manuel (bellman) welcomes everyone. He says the word "welcome" in 60+ languages! We ate lunch at El Patio and again, the food was good but not great. We ate dinner at La Triviata (their Italian restaurant that at night is turned into a "steakhouse"). The steak was tasty but tough. We ate dinner at Sir Edward's (their a la carte restaurant) and I think this was the best meal we had. It seemed like they served a better quality meal here much like "Chef's Night" at Don Julian. Let me make one thing clear, the service at each of these restaurants was excellent. It was the food that was mediocre. We had no problems getting reservations for any restaurant and there were no long lines like I have read about in other reviews. We did NOT experience any sickness or discomfort whatsoever from anything we ate or drank. One odd thing is if you are looking for Mexican food you will have to travel to town because they really don't have a selection at the Palace. I recommend "El Almendro" in Playa Del Carmen. If you are looking for a mexican restaurant with "atmosphere" go somewhere else. If you are looking for authentic, fabulous food go here. OTHER GUESTS: You will see people from all over the world. You will see people of every size and shape. You will see people of every age from infant to elderly (I am 38). We got along just fine with all of them. FINAL NOTE: Overall, this was the best vacation we ever had. We will be returning to the Palace. We only wish it was TOMORROW!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Mark1960
Reviews.Content: We spent the wk of July 5-12 at the palace and from the moment we pulled into the property we were treated like royality. The bellman (Manuel) was the perfect gentleman and he always had a smile on his face, the front desk (Claudia) was as nice a person as i think i have ever met, and she remained that way thru the entire wk. Our room was awsome (#2129) with a view of the pool and ocean and cozumel in the distance. We requested the egg mattress when we got to the room and it was put onto both beds, we never had a problem with hard beds. Food was as good as you can get and the workers would go out of their way to make sure everything was to your liking. We never had a problem making a reservation to any of the restaurants and never had to stand in any lines to make the reservation. The girl who handled the reservations (cant remember her name) was overly friendly and was there all the time, morning and evening. At don julians the buffet was always good and the workers (elsy, christian and patrick from austria) were the best. At la traviata the steak was fine and the waiter (Carlos) was excellent. La bodega was a nice place with very nice workers (louis and Hernandez), and sir edwards was the most formal and Santos was an excellent worker. At the cuban bar (off of the lobby) angel was a very nice waiter who always had a smile on his face and was a joy to be around. And finally, the pool bar...Javier was simply the best, he was always in a good mood even though the bar was full and it was super hot, always made the perfect drink. We have been on 4 cruises and this was our 5th all inclusive and this was THE BEST. Be sure to take care of the workers (tip) and they will take care of you even more. apple vacations did a great job and it was made better by the fact that we arrived early (before noon) on the 5th and did not leave the hotel until 330 on the 12th.

Reviews.Title: “Internet access, shopping”
Reviews.Author: MarrG
Reviews.Content: We (group of thirtysomethings) had a good time at the Riu Palace. I'll just add some practical info I haven't seen written below. The food is fine but we went into town for a nice dinner on our final night. The restaurant was recommended by the front desk team. Prices were about the same as in the US. Just in case you need it, Internet access is available in the lobby for $4/15 minutes. It's much cheaper at the Internet cafe in the shopping center down the road (5 minutes walk). This shopping center has crafts and prices comparable to Playa del Carmen, so if you need a last-minute gift, be sure to check it out. Bikes ($4/hour) and scooters are available for rent across the street at the Riu Tequila. Be sure to bring exact change. It's very hot there and air conditioning is scarce, so dress cool and plan to take a lot of showers! If you go into town, be sure to walk all the way to the end of 5th Avenue. The shops and restaurants are cuter the farther you go. It's probably not as authentic, but of course if you want authentic you wouldn't be staying at the Riu Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Very Luxurious Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Janellbelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Riu Palace for our honeymoon. There was a really great package that we purchased from Apple Vacations. But the Riu Palace was reccommended to us by our good friends, so we decided to give it a shot! And boy, are we glad we did. It exceeded our expectations beauty wise, people were always working to keep it up meticulously. Our room was kept perfect the entire time with a fully stocked fridge and bar! It was such a great all inclusive deal. The food was great, but just keep on top of your dinner plans, make reservations in advance or it will get filled up and you won't get the most sought after restaurants. But overall, everything you need to do or want to do is at the resort. We went in town and I wasn't impressed. But one great thing about the Palace is that once you are checked in, you are allowed to go to any of the other Riu's and enjoy THEIR amentities too...not that you would want to because the palace is the PLACE to be. The only thing I was shocked by is the things I saw on the way to get there from the airpot (extreme poverty), that we didn't find someone who spoke English as their main language until the 2nd day and that no bikini tops on the beach were commonplace. But I think those were more of a culture shock than anything. I would reccommmend this place to anyone and we will go back ourselves! Very relaxing, very classy!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace - Again for the 5th Consecutive Year!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned from our "annual" visit to Playa Del Carmen in Mexico and stayed for the 5th consecutive year at the Riu Palace. Needless, to say, our vacation was great, very relaxing and exactly what we expect year after year. The service, the food, the staff, and the meticulous environment of the hotel and the grounds delivered the quality that we have come to expect at the Riu Palace. We go to the Palace for the utter relaxation we experience. Vacationing in Playa Del Carmen is safe, affordable (all inclusive-no other way), and convenient. Far away from the crowds in Cancun, it offers hospitality to people from all over the world with friendly, courteous staff who are eager to please. We consider it our home away from home and look forward to returning. Since we know exactly what we are getting for our money, we feel comfortable knowing that our vacation will be pleasurable and rewarding.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned at the Riu Palace from June 1st to the 8th and the palace is incredible and worth every penny. The room, grounds, food, drinks, pool and beach were all perfect. We had a few minor problems the first day, the safe lock wouldn't work and the shower was broken. I called the front desk both times and someone was there in less than 1 minute (I'm not exagerating) each time and fixed both immediately. Every employee was helpful and friendly, especially the ones at the front desk. They even took the time to teach us some spanish. While we were there the ages varied from teenagers on up. It seemed like the families with young kids stayed at the Tequila, the kids were riding skateboards in the lobby there! When we left on the bus the people from other resorts were commenting on how nice the palace was, it is definately the classiest place on the stretch of beach we walked. The best part about the palace were the employees. We were asked at least 5 times a day if everything was satisfactory. Even the management would stop to pick up a piece of paper from the floor. I saw a few complaints about the air conditioning, our room got so cold we used the blankets at night. We are definately going back......

Reviews.Title: “A Great Getaway Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cardoza
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Riu Palace and wanted to add some of the information I did not see in other reviews. First of all, let me say that the Riu exceeded my expectations for beauty, beach, location and overall AI resort. By way of general information, beware of the Cancun airport if you have not travelled there before. There are gentlemen who appear to be very official and will pull you aside when you arrive to give you a time share pitch. They are quite skilled, and will delay you for 30 minutes before you realized you're being marketed! By the way, there were no time share salespersons @ the Riu. Everything you have read about the beauty of the resort is true. More importantly, the Riu had the most spectacular beach of all of the Playacar resorts. For those of you who are not aware, Playacar is a specific resort area of Playa del Carmen, about 45 miles south of Cancun. It is very resort oriented and doesn't really cater to the spring break crowd. The beaches at some of the other AI resorts nearby (Gala, Royal Hideaway, Wyndham, Iberostar etc) were more crowded and not as deep or did not have the advantage of shady areas. From the Riu beach, it is a very easy beach walk into town (you end up at Senor Frog's). There is no reason to take a taxi or walk the hot streets when its a simple stroll down white sand. My husband is very wary of leaving the resort and going into town. However, he was perfectly comfortable in Playa del Carmen and had no problem leaving the resort and walking around. The area is very clean and safe. The downtown is full of tourists and non-intimidating. Everyone at the RIU went out of his or her way to improve our stay. The room was perfect and always cleaned and stocked. The bartenders were on top of our every drink order. We have also stayed at Sandals in Negril, and the RIU is not quite as social. I think this is because of the age variance and the fact that people come from all over Europe and North and South America, so there are some language barriers. However, if you're looking for social interaction, there are always plenty of people around the pool bar in the late afternoon looking for a game of pool volleyball or just conversation. With that said, there is also a side to the pool which is very quiet for those who prefer not to be bothered. If you like a disco with strobe lights and loud music, just walk across the street to the Tequila. It's a totally different atmosphere there with a fun disco, but no beach and lots of children and teens. Also, if you get a chance, take a day trip to Xel-Ha and swim with the dolphins! It's expensive, but worth every penny if you love snorkeling and swimming. (I would avoid the snorkel trip offered at the resort for $30.00, its just not that great.) Oh, and don't sit under the coconuts on the beach or you might be really sorry. As for the food, it's as good as AI food can be. Huge variety, some great things, and some okay things. If you can't find something you like, look inward. Bottom line, if your looking for a great beach, a quality resort without hassle, a safe and touristy downtown and some social interaction, then the RIU is for you. If you want to party everynight at a different nightclub, enjoy the dating scene, or eat at a gourmet restaurant every night, then pick a different destination.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort far exceeded our expectations. We visited the first week of May for our honeymoon. I had done tons of research to find a great resort, and because of such great reviews, I picked Riu Palace. My husband was amazed and so was I! From the minute you arrive, you feel like pure royalty. Everyone is so happy and willing to help you. The service was absolutely amazing, as was the food, scenery, beach and atmosphere. We had champagne with every meal and never tired of it! We barely left the resort, but we did spend a day at Xel-ha. I highly recommend this park, and you need a day to do everything. We spent about six hours there and still managed to miss some things. Definitely a must-do. We really hope to return to the Palace someday - I'd be nervous to try anywhere else in Playa after our great experience there!

Reviews.Title: “The Palace has Spoiled Us! Can't Wait to go Back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Palace from June 14th to June 28th for our Honeymoon. We were amazed with the Palace. Photos simply do not do this place justice! There is such grandeur, such detail in every corner that it was depressing to even leave the resort for a few hours. We were so impressed with the service by the chamber maids (cleaned room twice a day, always dropped off extra towels, called for bar re-stocking, etc.) and from the entire waiting staff. The food was excellent at all restaurants. We enjoyed the main buffet, Don Julian's, by far the best. Breakfast had excellent omelettes, sausages, bacon, hash browns, fruits, fruit drinks, cheese platters, cereal. Lunch was excellent, with dinner-like items such as stir-fry, fish fillets, beef steaks, fajitas, cooked veggies, italian food, mexican food, carpaccio, prociutto and other cured deli meats, sanwiches, etc. Dinner was always exceptional. Every other night they would have a theme dinner. One night, the Gala dinner had everything from sauteed jumbo shrimps, to frog legs, to paella. Some nights had more traditonal things like turkey, roast beef, beef wellington, whole roast pig. Oriental night was also excellent because the stir frys contained some authentic Chinese ingredients that these resorts usually overlook. Great service again. Some decent wines, nice coffees. Good sweet table. The other restaurants, La Bodega and Sir Edwards, were super as well. La Bodega is a meat lovers heaven; a true Brazilian grilling outfit, that barbeques 7 different meats, such as filet mignon, bull, ostrich, and brings them out on skewers, ready to give you any amount you wish. Very tasty. Sir Edwards is an upscale place that had nicely prepared itams such as seafood pasta, grilled snapper, even Oriental-style duck breast. I thought the selection of drinks were superb. Chivas scotch, top notch tequilas, liqeurs such as Campari, Pernod and Frangelico. They have 2 local beers on tap, one a lager, the other, a dark beer, almost an ale. Very nice. We mostly drank cocktails. Try our favorites: Banana Mama and Dirty Monkey. Sooo good! In the room, there was a fridge full of bottled Coronas, pop, water; plus a liquor dispenser with Brandy, Vodka, Tequila and Rum. We are beach lovers and we thought this beach was fantasic. Warmish water, large flat white sand beach. Plenty of chairs with tables. Our only disappointment was that the water was slightly turned up (not dirty, the waves just brike a certain way). People that stayed there previously said it's the worst they had seen it. One day we had very little waves, and the water was just incredibly clear. Hopefully this is what people will enjoy the majority of time. What was cool was using bread from the buffets to feed schools of silver angel fish, 10 feet from shore. Amazing! They would just peck the bread right out of your hands, like a pet dog! Unfortunately, there were no offshore reefs to snorkel, you have to go on the expeditions they offer. We found all of these extra curricular activities quite expensive, as in most resorts. We managed to use the Jet Ski for $50USD for 45 minutes. Everyone should go to the Captain Hook Pirate Show in Cancun. For us it worked out to little over $100CANpp. but we thought it was great. You go onto 1 of 2 pirate ships that sail out and around Cancun, while the crew put on comedy shows, contests, etc. It included a steak and lobster dinner plus open bar. Before nights end, the 2 boats come together for a staged pirate-style battle. Afterwards, It becomes a floating dance club. Great for family and party-goers. Another excursion we did was Xel-Ha. This is only good for people who love to snorkel. We saw giant grouper, pompanos, barracudas. However, be warned that it is a poorly organized place, and the line-ups are ridiculous. Be sure to ask your rep which days are not typically crowded to avoid this. We were roped one day into listening to a Time Share presentation. Of course, we didn't buy into it, but we got a free trip to Cozumel out of it. We snorkelled for 3 hours on a glass-bottom boat, and were given a scooter to rent for the rest of the day. So we drove around the south side of the island. Very pretty. Very romantic. We made some good friends and enjoyed some nights at La Pinata disco across the street at RIU Tequila. This was the most happening of the 2 discos, with lots of good music and drinks (try the Tequila poppers). There are no other local discos, but Playa del Carmen town is only a $4 cab ride away, and they have a number of good night clubs to enjoy. Again, we enjoyed everything about the RIU Palace; they made us feel like royalty, especially being honeymooners. The staff was warm, curtious and seemed genuine. And we loved the feeling that when you were outside, you felt like you were in the Caribbean, and when you were inside you felt like you were in a different world, like some place in Europe. We loved the great lounge upstairs, with it's grand piano, huge dark wood columns, crystal chandeliers, and a rich cigar-aroma. We loved the giant piazza in the evening, where people would gather, around the gazebo and fountain, before or after dinner, to enjoy the evening, and entertainment. We loved to admire the superb fountains and landscaping. We loved the Los Mariachis Entertainment lounge, with its plush red velvet setting, and live shows at night. We cannot say enough, just that it was beautiful, a perfect honeymoon, and it is our new vacation spot! Please enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great sun Not much fun but very Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: llagavia1
Reviews.Content: Traveled from July 2, 2004 to July 9, 2004. We had a very relaxing trip. We were originally suppose to stay at the Yucatan. We arrived at the Yucatan and were told we will be staying at the Palace. We had very nice rooms and house keeping was great. I had asked for rooms next to each other since we had brought our teenage boys with us. I was looking forward to having a fun time and my only complaint is that the palace seemed somewhat stuffy. Not much fun, no really great activities. I had talked to people who stayed at the Yucatan and had beach parties and alot more activites geared towards a family. So I would recommend the Palace to anyone who is looking for a quiet time away from it all. If you are looking for a fun filled tirp with kids try another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the RIU Palace I want to go back already”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to the RIU Palace in Playacar and were there from May 22 - May 29. We really enjoyed the hotel. We have stayed in all classes of hotels and we loved the hotel, I would give it 4 out of 5 stars. The dining was all very good. The main restaurant with the big buffet is what we liked best. We tried the Brazilian place but were not really impressed, all though most people in the place thought it was good. The rooms were very nice and very clean. The beds were very uncomfortable. When you first arrive have them place mattress pads on your bed or you will not be sleeping by the end of the trip, Dial '0' since there are no hotel style buttons on the phone which connect you automatically. You have to go through the operator for everything. There is beer and soda in the fridge that was always stocked, and they stocked it with more of what you drank after you have been there a couple days. Booze dispensers on the wall - Rum, Brandy, Tequila and Vodka. The property is awesome. Very clean, the lobby is beautiful. Everyone we talked to from other hotels all wanted to come to the RIU Palace because they had heard how nice it was. It was not to full, but there were weddings everyday which was kind of inconvenient because they closed one of the restaurants at lunch for the wedding. The beach is beautiful. I have been all over the world and this was one of the nicest beaches I have been to. They have a bar close to the beach so drinks are never to far away (although bringing a big insulated cup only helps). They have a ton of beach chairs and there were always plenty of seats available, whether you wanted to sit closer to the water, or further back in the trees. There were a lot of topless women on the beach, at times maybe 50% of the women in the front row of chairs were topless. It was very casual and laid back. The pool was nice, small for a resort pool, but with a beach that nice who needs a pool. We did not see much tipping going on. We tipped only because we know all the people are paid very low wages. Make sure to tip Manuel at the front door so he will take good care of you. When you are in Playa definately go to their 5th Ave and walk around (Its 50 pesos ($5.00) to get into town). We would go to the Tequila Barrel at night to watch the Laker game and had a great time. Also do the Parasail thing and go to Xcaret for the day. Next time we go we are going to go back to Xcaret and go to the ruins in Tulum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: cyci
Reviews.Content: hWe just returned from a 5 day family vacation and I found the trip advisor reviews very helpful so this is the reason I'm writing this review. The resort is beautiful and from the moment we checked in the staff was very friendly and helpful. The day of our arrival was our son's 11th birthday we asked if they could do something special and they put balloons and streamers in the room and also called Don Julian (the buffet restaurant) and they sang to him plus gave him a cake. ROOMS -We found the room to be very clean, cool and the fridge constantly stocked. We did tip housecleaing everyday because of the nice job she did for us everyday plus turndown service in the evening. FOOD/DRINKS - we tried all the restaurants except Sir George and we thought Don Julian had the best food and best selection. The only meal we were disappointed with was breakfast so we actually just skipped that a few times. The drinks are all good my personal downfall is no light beer was offered. I was really craving a Michelob Ultra. BEACH - we never had a problem getting a chair or finding sun/shade. I would caution mothers/fathers that there is a lot of topless sunbathing so prepare your children. I would also recommend bringing a large bottle of water because the glasses you are served drinks in are very tiny. The beach water was beautiful and warm. My husband and son did every activity except parasailing because they felt it looked boring. POOL - we enjoyed the pool especially the swimup bar where everyone is having a great time including kids. It does close early but we were ok with that because of the other entertainment offered. ENTERTAINMENT - every night beginning at 8:30 they offer a "mini-disco" for the kids which is dancing and a game. All the kids loved this portion. In fact my son made friends from Chicago and Canada and the would play together throught the day and night. After the mini-disco is adult entertainment and we thought it was pretty good. One night was Grease, another night a live band, the third night tropical dancers and the last night Mariachi's. My son enjoyed 3 of the 4 adult entertainment. SIDE TRIPS - we did the jungle tour on an AtV and you can book this at the hotel. It is really worth the trip and the cab ride is about 5 minutes from the hotel. We also rented bikes from Riu Tequila to ride into town but you can also rent scooters. I think this covered everything. All in all we totally enjoyed our trip, the staff, the food and the room. One more reminder and that is to take mosquito spray. Our legs are chewed up and bruised from scratching.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from an 8 night stay at the Riu Palace Mexico. We are both in our early thirties and I did not feel like the crowd was older as other reports have stated. We were constantly meeting couples our age, younger and sometimes older. I have been to one other all inclusive resort, Sandals Negril in Jamaica. I thought the overall quality of the palace was better than Sandals. The grounds are beautiful and very well kept. The food was great, I always enjoyed the buffet and never got tired of the selection. The specialty restaurants are very good also if you wake up early to make a reservation. The bars are always staffed well and serve high quality booze on request. I never felt any pressure to tip anyone at the resort although I handed out a few singles throughout my stay to those that put forward extra effort. Most everyone works very hard to make you feel comfortable, my cigarette was lit for me before I could get my lighter out of my pocket alot of times. Rooms are very nice and housekeeping does a great job. Our sheets were turned down each night while we were out to dinner and our fridge was always kept stocked with Corona, pepsi, 7-up and bottled water. The mini bar contained Bacardi, Jose, Smirnoff and a mexican brandy. The beach is wonderful, never had a problem getting a chair or a little table to go with it. Their is plenty of shade available from a sea of coconut trees between the beach and the pool area. My wife thought the beds were hard, we found out toward the end of our stay that you could request a foam pad for the beds. The disco at the Riu Tequilla was fun, good dance music and the bartenders were incredible. They functioned as a team better than any bar in the US I have ever been to, no one ever waited more that a minute for drinks. The Tequilla Bam shots they serve are fun too. I agree that the resort is not focused on entertaining children but I saw many kids enjoying themselves with the beach activities and pool. The entire Playacar area where the resort is located is beautiful, we walked into Playa del Carmen in about 25 minutes or cabs are everywhere for a $4 US ride to town. Shopping on 5th street in Playa was fun but watch out, some of the vendors start their prices rediculously high, like 4 or 5 times what they should be, so shop around. In summary the staff is top notch, the property is awesome, the entire atmosphere is perfect for a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for early risers. Eating is a hassel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace three years ago and was surprised by the poor experience occured during our second visit the later part of June 2004. The hotel is still beautiful and clean with gorgeous landscaping. The hotel caters to the type of person that wants a quiet, uneventful vacation in Mexico. Plan to end the day early due to the boring and lack of nightly activities and the necessity to rise by 6:45 a.m. to stand in line with the old men in their boxers to make dinner reservations for that night. If reservations are not made, your options are the dinner buffet (which is just okay) or grabbing an early burger on the patio (make sure the meat is cooked). The speciality restaurants and buffet are only offered by reservation at 6:00 p.m. or 9:00 p.m. so you either need to end the afternoon early to clean up or eat a late dinner. Men must wear pants to dinner however women can show up in a swimsuit top and cut offs. Take advantage of the great breakfeast buffet because the lunch buffet is not so great, especially if your stuck eating the same buffet for dinner. Besides a daily 30 minute game of bingo, there is no music or pool side activities. The beach and pool bar close at 5:00 p.m. without an option for nonalcoholic drinks and the areas basically become a ghost town soon after. There were always plenty of chairs and shaded areas available for those needing a break from the sun. The rooms are clean and cool and we enjoyed the separate seating area. The beds are rock hard and the walls are thin. The sounds of housekeeping moving furniture to clean the rooms start about 8:00 a.m. and continue throughout the day. Even though we were given four room numbers together when we checked in at noon, one couple's room ended up being on the other side of the hotel when we were allowed to actually move to our rooms after 3:00. Despite the complaint, the front desk would not budge to work out a solution nor would discuss the situation with us. We were also not given an option to request a fountain view room even though stating we were former guest that returned with six other people. The option for night-life is a 5 minute cab ride to town so in a way it was nice to stay at a quiet hotel without a bunch of drunks. It's a great hotel for the older couple or the couple with younger kids that are not expecting children activities. There were several topless women on the beach each day which could be somewhat uncomfortable for the kids and some adults (especially for those having a wedding ceremony near the beach). I made the mistake of purchasing souvenirs at the hotel and paid doubled the price for the same items that can be purchased across the street. We got passed the mix up with the rooms and two waiters that were extremely rude to us but overall, the staff was nice and displayed good customer service. We will not return to the hotel due to the hassle with dinner reservations and the lack of concern regarding our complaints shown by the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: PlainsTraveler
Reviews.Content: For a relaxing beach vacation, the turquoise blue water and white sand beaches of the Mexican Riviera Maya can’t be beat. And one of the most relaxing and beautiful places to stay in Playa del Carmen is the Riu Palace. We spent four nights there in June 2004. Located within the Playacar Resort complex, the Riu Palace is a five-star beachfront resort. With 434 guest rooms, the hotel features five restaurants, five bars, three swimming pools, along with meticulously manicured grounds and a beautiful stretch of beach. All-inclusive rates run from $601 to $933 per person for four nights based on double occupancy. We had one of eight Jacuzzi suites (Room 2150) featuring a walk-in closet, balcony, and private second floor terrace with an ocean view. All rooms are air conditioned and have a ceiling fan, satellite TV, personal safe, minibar with liquor dispenser, along with a double vanity bathroom including a bidet. The minibar is re-stocked daily with Corona, Pepsi, Diet Pepsi, 7-Up, and bottled water while the in-room liquor dispenser features Jose Quervo tequila, Bacardi rum, Smirnoff vodka, and Presidente brandy. The food at the Riu is exceptional. Don Julian is the main restaurant serving international specialties buffet style with cooking stations for cooked to order requests. La Bodega and Sir Edward require reservations and provide service at the table. As with any five-star hotel, formal dining requires men to wear long pants at dinner, so don’t forget to pack a pair of jeans or trousers. El Patio and La Traviata are beach front restaurants serving some of the same great specialties but with a relaxed dress code. We enjoyed fresh fruits, salads, and drinks with ice and had no digestive problems. While the food and beverage service is all-inclusive, the sunbathing is European plan - tops optional. There was no problem finding a beach chair and the beach includes several rows of palm trees providing shade for those who wish to stay out of the sun but still enjoy the beauty of the coast and the gentle ocean breeze. The Riu Palace is the kind of place you really don’t want to leave to do anything else. However, if you start feeling guilty for relaxing too much and not being a tourist, there are plenty of things to see and do. For souvenir shopping, there is a shopping center one block from the hotel featuring a pharmacy, convenience store, souvenir shops, t-shirts, and talivera pottery. There are several tour operators in the lobby of the hotel who can also arrange excursions to nearby attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing for kids.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: RIU Palace is absolutely beautiful. It is a true 5* resort. However, I don;t think it's the best for a family vacation. It catered much more to adults and my family (kids 16, 14, 12) and the family we went with (kids 17, 13, 11) were often bored. Our parents made us scavenger hunts and tried to keep us entertained, especially the youngest ones between the resorts in the complex, but there really wasn't much to do. We have stayed at two other resorts in Mexico and found the 4* Barcelo Maya Beach Resort worlds better for activities and entertainment to amuse young people. They might as well make this RIU adults only. Kids really don't seem to belong here.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Riu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous stay at the Riu Palace. Travelling were my family (2 adults, 2 children: 7&9, 2 grandparents, 2 sisters (30's). So a party of 8. We had such a terrific time. I'll start with the few negatives we had, the front desk clerks were not very friendly. We had two girls checking all of us in and when my sister asked if we had our 3 rooms near each other, she said, "didn't you hear her, she said we are completely full and have done our best". We still didn't know, until we saw our rooms how close or far apart they were. Two were 3 rooms apart, and the 3rd was 10 rooms apart. It worked out fine, but we certaintly would have preferred to be closer. But it was the way the front desk clerk spoke that was frustrating. The only other negative was you couldn't keep the iron and ironing board for longer than a day in your room. This wasn't a problem for anyone but my sister who likes to iron every day. But..enough of the bad. Let's go to the good! The staff was so unbelievably friendly that we felt so special. Everyone (except the front desk and front store) were always ready with an Hola, even if they were pushing a bin of towels or pruning the trees, everyone was so, so nice. Particularly the maitre d' George, Gustovo, Guadalupe. They went out of their way to make sure everything was terrific with our dining, which it was! Then our housekeeper Ruby, who was awesome. My daughter celebrated her 8th birthday while we were there and we came back to the room and found it decorated with balloons and streamers and a beautiful towel decoration. It was wonderful. We never had any trouble getting chairs at the pool or the beach. The only caution was the tiles are slippery when wet, everywhere. Sneakers didn't seem to work well, some of our sandals worked better. We loved the food, particularly the offering of breakfast room service made it very special. Again, we loved it and would love to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful..but beware of the wedding coordinator”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Riu Palace Mexico from May 4-18, 2004. We wanted a very simple wedding on a beautiful beach. There were about twenty friends and family who came as well. The hotel was goergoues and the staff, we loved. It was the best service I have ever had in my life. I too picked this place from reading these same reviews. At any rate, the wedding coodinator was a nightmare from the beginning. They had a couple different coodinators there, but the one I got was named Michah. She didn't inform me that my witnesses needed to come to Mexico early so she was breathing down my neck until they finally arrived the day before the wedding. She miscommunicated just about every detail of the wedding. My wedding was very simple so I didn't understand how she could screw things up so bad. Just a few examples: She forgot to bring me flowers for my hair, bouquet was pink instead of red, had a table at the wedding set up instead of an arch, showed up late and in a tshirt at the wedding, and she was yelling at me in front of my guests right before the ceremony about not meeting her at a certain time. Well I was already very emotional and burst into tears. When I stopped crying, my wedding was over. Needless to say the pictures aren't very nice. She never said another word to me and I was at the hotel for 10 more days. She didn't say "Hi" to me before the wedding either so I guess that wasn't too surprising. I watched as her and the other coodinators run around the resort and argue right in front of anyone and everyone. Their desk is in the lobby so they are hard to miss. Overall they were completley unprofessional and do not represent this hotel in the manner that they should. I don't want this to discourage anyone from going to the hotel because it was wonderful..but if you want to get married...I would think twice. Email me should you want any further details. Just a few suggestions: -Tip, a little goes a long way and they deserve it. -Do take blankets out of closet to make the bed softer -Bring thermos cup for beach -Get a safe key at check in -Take a taxi when doing excursions, the shuttles are horrible -If you get sick, get Lomotil..it works fast -don't get married here

Reviews.Title: “The most fantastic Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: glenalk8
Reviews.Content: First of all a bit about myself and my husband. We are in our early fifties have travelled extensively to the caribbean, Euroe and beyond, We have been reading reviews on here for over a year, so our expetations were high.We Stayed at the Riu Palace from the 5th May through to the 19th May, and the place just exceeded all of our expectations, in fact if we sat here forever we would not be able to think of one negative thing about the place, everything is just first class, and the cleaning has to be seen to be believed, everything is just spotless and shiny, it's a 24hr operation and you will see them cleaning and polishing at all times during the day and night, The food in all the restaurants is absolutely fantastic and yummy and so plentiful, and is always displayed beautifully, I am an extremely fussy eater, but never could I have complained. The staff were the most hard working and cheerful people we have ever encountered on any of our vacations, they go completely out of their way to make everything wonderful for your holiday, and the speed in which they serve and bring your drinks etc has to be seen to be believed, and ALWAYS with a great big smile on their faces. Rooms are always kept spotless and are a lovely size with plenty of hanging space, far more than usual. The mini bar is always kept full of beer, pepsi, pepsi light, lemonade, orange and water. A few negatives that I have read in the past I will go through. Beds being hard, well we never thought so in fact we found them very comfortable and other Brits that we met and spoke to were surprised when I told them that it mentioned them being hard by several people, perhaps we Brits have firmer mattresses than in the USA or Canada, i don't know but as I say we found them fine. Air conditioning not being very good, once again we found our air conditioning to work really fine and in fact during the night we usually switched it off as we got rather chilly with it on. Musty smell in rooms, maybe we were lucky but our room had no smell whatsoever, and usually in the caribbean you get at least a faint smell, but no ours was completely odourless and once again all who we spoke to said the same. Food being monotonous, this simply is the most unbelievable of all the negatives I have read, anybody that does not like the food here and the large amount of choice each evening, then all I can say is what do you eat at home? All in all this is the most fantastic hotel we have had the pleasure to stay in, everything from the staff, service , cleanliness, food, drinks, grounds and sunbathing areas are top class. You certainly will not be disappointed with this place and from the moment you walk into the most beautiful lobby, you will be in awe of this place. Well we have always said we would never return to a place however wonderful we found it, because there is such a lot of world out there to visit so would we return to the Palace, yep we have already booked to return in Apr 2005 so I guess that sums it all up. I would be happy to recommend this hotel to absolutely anyone and of course already have. Anyone who will be visiting for the first time soon, you are very lucky and believe me you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week at the best hotel we have ever stayed at, the Riu Palace near Playa del Carmen. Despite the long flight, 9 hours plus from Glasgow to Cancun and the fact that, sadly for us, we had torrential rain for over 3 days solid during the week, we thoroughly enjoyed our holiday, solely due to the excellence of the hotel. The public areas and the grounds were nothing short of palatial, our bedroom was large and luxurious, and the entire staff, from the receptionists, bar staff, dining room waiters and waitresses, boys and girls who cleaned the rooms, to the cleaners who kept the public areas spotless, were so friendly one would have thought they had known us for years instead of this being our first visit. The array of food on offer for each meal was mind-boggling and everything we tried was excellent and there was a non-stop programme of entertainment every day. The whole package was so good that I feel if we live to be 100 we'll never find a better hotel. If anyone stays there and doesn't enjoy it I would suggest they stay at home in future!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Reccommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My (new!) husband and I had our honeymoon at the Riu Place last week (4th-11th June) and I wanted to write a review to let everyone know how fantastic it all was!! I have nothing at all to complain about, as every aspect was fantastic from the room to the food to the staff. Having read other reviews I have to say that I personally found the claims of some previous reviewers unfounded (but then again, if all you can find to complain about is that the beds are a bit hard then it's gotta be a good thing!!!). The only slight downside was that you did have to make dinner reservations early, but we did eat at 2 of the other places and found them not to be particularly out of class from the main restraunt which was consistantly brilliant. The selection and quality was overwhelming, I could eat there for a month and not get bored!! The hotel is very quiet but if you are looking for a more lively evening then head over the road to the Tequila where it is definately more social. (The clientel is very different there, and having looked around in the day as well, it makes you glad you booked the Palace!!!) There was one group of teenagers staying in the Palace that I thought would have been much better off at the Tequila, as theyn were definately on some sort of team tour with no adult intervention and found that they were allowed to drink a bit of a novelty to say the least.............! Overall, the Riu Palace is a little piece of heaven and I would say to anyone who is thinking of going there to definately book it, you will not be dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went on our honeymoon to this hotel (aged 35 and 33) in May 2004. We were not disappointed - it was just fantastic. The hotel itself was immaculate; the food was outstanding - so much variety and so fresh. (I have come back home about 1/2 stone heavier!!). The grounds were beautiful, the sea and pool were not overly busy (you could always get a lounger), and the service received from all the staff was excellent. We did nothing for two whole weeks but sunbathe and eat!! But that was our choice - there were lots of things you could have done but we just loved lazying around in the beautiful surroundings. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “marriage in paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the Palace last year.It was wonderful the memories of the resort will stay with us forever the staff are so courteuos you feel like royalty!I really do plan to go back it was worth every penny.Ive even got two friends who are booking to go because it is definatley a place which is special.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back NOW”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace May 23-30. To say the least, pictures do not do it justice. When our van from the airport droped us off the driver told us we were staying at the VIP resort. I have never come across more friendly, helpful and hardworking people working in a resort before. Everything was great. We are early risers (we can sleep at home why sleep away our vacation) so we had no problem getting reservations at any of the resturants. In fact we only ate at Don Julians once. The food was good and an eating experiance so try all the resturants. The rooms were beautiful and large. The beds were not uncomfortabe to us. The pillows are your standard hotel pieces of cloth. Just like you get in any hotel (this is the ONLY thing we could find wrong in a week). Water pressure in shower good. The beach is beautiful!!! Lots of lounge chairs so no problem getting one. If you need to get some together just move them around. All under the swaying palms. Bliss!!! No problem getting lounges by the pool either. The pool and beach bars did not serve the best drinks. If you wanted something fancy wait till you went to the "real" bars to get them. Stick to basic drinks (rum & coke,wiskey&coke etc.) on the beach and at the pool. Do try a Mojito (in the "real" bar YUMMY!!!) (only pepsi products) We enjoyed the theater every night.
