Walked over to Riu Tequilla one night but came back. It is quite humid at night watching the shows so be prepared to sweat, your in the tropics. We went diving 7 times during the week with Scuba Caribe (located on the beach). Excellent! We had pre booked our dives on the internet and gotten several free dives. We took our own equipment and they kept it at the dive shop for us so I can't comment on the rental gear. I hurt my knee on the last dive and the staff contacted the resort Doctor. He was there in less than 10 minutes. He suggested I have x-rays so the dive staff carried me up the beach to a wheelchair and the doctor transported us to the hospital. He also stayed and translated for us. We then got a cab back to the Palace ($6). The hospital doesn't accept insurance so make sure you have cash or major credit card to pay the bill. I had x-rays and saw an orthopedic doctor it ended up costing $440. I didn't end up spending hours at the hospital in and out no waiting. The resort let us keep a wheelchair for the rest of our stay (glad it was at the end of our week). We used Apple Vacations and talked to the representive at the resort. They arranged special seating on bus back to airport and wheelchairs at the airport in Cancun and Atlanta. I could go on and on about this great resort. We will be going back. I just wish it were tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: jamierenn
Reviews.Content: When choosing our honeymoon destination, I relied heavily on the reviews on this site, so I want to repay the favor. This will be long, but hopefully it will be helpful. My husband and I spent 10 wonderful days at the Riu Palace (May 24 – June 2) for our honeymoon. We had a wonderful time and did not want to leave. I recommend this resort highly. ---The Resort--- The resort was truly breathtaking. The architecture is stunning and has a very European, Mediterranean feel. The name Riu “Palace” is very descriptive. It truly feels like a Palace. The open-air courtyard is magnificent. And the stairwell off of the main lobby leading to the courtyard is probably one of the most beautiful areas I’ve ever seen. Pictures do not do justice to the beauty of this resort. We are in our mid-twenties, and we did not feel the least bit out of place. There were tons of other honeymooners there. Probably about one third of the guests were Americans – there were a lot of British and German guests as well. One of my main worries was that we’d feel too young, but that thought never entered into our heads. ---The Service--- We have never been asked so many times if everything was okay. And we always told them, yes, everything was wonderful! The staff was very friendly and seemed to enjoy working there. Their English was remarkably good – much better than my Spanish! The waiters were great, the bartenders were great, the housekeeper was great, the front desk staff was great, etc. We felt very pampered the whole time. ---The Beach--- The beach was outstanding. It was nice and big, and there are plenty of chairs – we never had a problem finding two chairs, no matter what time of day, and the resort was full. Plenty of shade and plenty of sun – your choice. The water was a stunning shade of turquoise. We went to Cancun last year, and the water there is clearer, but the water here is a prettier color, and the bottom was just as smooth. Worst I can say about the beach is that it was crowded. Not bump-into-your-neighbor crowded, but there wasn’t a lot of space to yourself. Didn’t infringe on our enjoyment, but the beach in Cancun was definitely emptier than the beach here. ---The Pool--- We didn’t use the pool too much, with the amazing beach right next to it, but we did enjoy a drink and a swim most afternoons. We were happily surprised that the waiters will bring you drinks while you are in the pool (not just at the pool bar). The pool water was very warm – definitely warmer than the ocean. There are beautiful tile mosaics on the bottom of the pools that add a real touch of elegance to the pool area. ---The Food--- The food here was good. Not outstanding, but very good. We both got very sick in Cancun, and we didn’t experience that here. We both felt a little off during the last two days, but we think it was from dehydration, and not from the food. We were able to eat and drink without giving any thought to safety, which we highly appreciated. We skipped breakfast most days, but the breakfast buffet was plentiful and good. We enjoyed eating lunch in the main dining room because of the air conditioning. We ate in the main dining room for dinner most nights, but we did try each of the specialty restaurants once. The buffet was our favorite because of the choices. The salad bar was really good, and the soups were excellent. There were always lots of options – pasta, veggies, seafood, carving stations, Mexican food, etc. Desserts were okay, but their ice cream was outstanding – probably the best ice cream I’ve ever had. You scoop it yourself, and I had a bowl after every meal. La Bodega was okay – the meats were a bit tough, but it was a good meal. The Patio (steakhouse) was also okay – food was good but not great. Sir Edwards was a fun experience. It was much fancier and upscale than we are used to, and it was cool to experience that. The food there was very good – we enjoyed all the courses very much. It was a nice change to the buffet. Overall, the food on the cruises we’ve been on was better, but this food was good and safe. ---Our Room--- We were in room 13 – quite an omen for your honeymoon… :) It was on the first floor with a view of the greenery and the Riu Yucatan. I thought I wanted a Courtyard view, but I enjoyed the privacy of our patio more, and the view was lovely. The room was very spacious and well decorated. There is a fully stocked bar and minibar in each room, which amazed my husband to no end. The beds are two full beds pushed together. Not the most romantic set-up, but it was nice and big. There has been a lot written about the beds being too hard. The beds were indeed very firm, but they caused us no discomfort, and we slept just fine. There was a good deal of noise in the mornings – we like to sleep in, and we were awakened most mornings when we heard the furniture of the surrounding rooms being moved across the floor. ---Excursions--- We did the Apple Vacations tour to Chichen Itza. We enjoyed it very much and were glad we did it. It’s about a 2.5 hour bus ride, then a guided tour of the ruins. We stopped at a nice and safe restaurant for lunch, and the food was surprisingly good. We also got to jump off a 12 or so foot high cliff into a natural hidden well, which was really fun. Then we went back to the ruins for some free time when we got a chance to climb the main pyramid and explore on our own. It was about $70 a person. We also did the Apple Vacations tour to Xcaret. This one was not our favorite. If we were to go again, we would NOT take the tour – we’d just take a taxi over and pay the admission fee on our own. It was $10 each way for a taxi, and $50 for the admission fee. We paid $70 a person for the tour. My husband enjoyed swimming in the underground river – I did not enjoy it but I did survive it… And it was cool to see the giant sea turtles. But, overall, we would have enjoyed the day more if we’d just stayed at the resort. We did not take the Apple Vacations snorkeling tour, but we heard it was not very good, and that the snorkeling tour offered through Scuba Caribe at the resort was much better and much cheaper. ---The Bottom Line--- We loved this resort, and I’d recommend it highly. However, this is not a good place to go with small children – there were no activities for kids, and the kids that were at the resort looked very bored. But for adults, this place is heaven. Stunning resort, beautiful beach, good and safe food, and wonderful service. All at a bargain price. We paid $2850 for 10 days including airfare and transfers. It was truly the perfect honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: steve53chicago
Reviews.Content: I read this website almost daily before our trip so I felt the need to write. All the wonderful things you have read about this resort is true so I will try to write things you may not know. This resort is located on a stretch of coastline called Playacar that is a gated community. You travel on a beautiful cobblestone road with sidewalks, and the resorts, condominiums, golf course and villas are on the sides. This is a definite advantage to staying here because you can comfortably walk to the other resorts as well as downtown Play del Carman. Other resorts we have stayed at there is nothing to do after dinner until the shows but here we walked to the Mexican Street Shopping and had drinks at the other Riu Resorts. As far as the other resorts, let me just say that when the van picked us up for our excursions the people from the other resorts went WOW. We had lunch at the Riu Tequila and I didn't like that they didn't require the men to wear shirts while eating like the Palace did. It was a very different atmosphere. Other things that may be helpful is bring a travel clock but leave your flotation mats at home because they are not allowed in the pool. This was really disappointing to us because they didn't have a area with lounge chairs in the water either and when it is that hot we would rather be in the pool than lying around it. The swim up bar was great and served top shelf liquor but it was located in a shallow area of the pool so all the kids played there. The buffet reminded me of a cruise with the ice sculptures and fruit carvings for decorations. The breakfast buffet even served champagne. Don't go to La Bodega but El Patio was great. Get the reservations when you can because they have a lot of weddings and there are nights it is closed. We stayed at the Moon Palace two years ago and there you didn't need reservations for dinner, the pool was fantastic, and every room had a ocean view. The Riu Palace has a beautiful beach with lots of shade, you don't need a golf cart to get around, and they don't cater to conventions and timeshares so everyone gets great service. Please don't let any negative things I have said stop you from staying at the Riu Palace. We had a wonderful stay and would recomend it to anyone who wants to stay at a resort that can only be described as WOW. Feel free to email me any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 7-night stay and we had a wonderful time. As most reviews have mentioned, the service was very polite and courteous. The food was pretty good at the buffet, but after seven days of it we were in need of a little more variety. The rooms were large and very nice and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. But the nicest feature of the hotel is the beach. The tiny pictures that you find online do not nearly do it justice. The water is warm and clear, the beach is huge and never crowded, and there is the perfect amount of both sun and shade (from the countless palm trees). We walked to at least ten other resorts and the RIU Palace had by far the best beach. So why did I only give it four stars? For being a six-apple hotel (the highest according to Apple Vacations) and costing more than most other hotels, we expected a little more for our money. We had to ask five times in our seven days for our mini-bar to be restocked. One should not have to twist an arm to get a bottle of water at an all-inclusive, especially when they tell you not to use the faucet water. And as previous reviews have mentioned, the beds are beyond rock hard. Also, pray that the person in the room above you does not wear high-heels. The sound they make on the tile floors in the middle of the night is not conducive to sleeping. Also, watch your towel carefully on the beach. If you "lose" your towel they charge you $20, and someone stole ours one day. Finally, and maybe I'm just being picky, the pool is rather small for such a nice hotel. All in all it is a wonderful hotel with stunning architecture, immaculate grounds, friendly staff, and an awesome beach. I would say it is probably in the top 10% of hotels in Mexico, but for its reputation I expected a little more. But definitely worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “A great time at the Palace!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 5/24-6/1 at the Palace for our honeymoon. Overall, a fantastic trip and there were many people our age despite many reviews saying the average age here was 55. I will start with the only downsides. I know that everyone has already said how hard the beds were, but they were so hard it was a joke. Also, we were on the bottom floor (despite requesting a top floor room several times) and it was sooo noisy. I seriously was woken up about 12 times a night just from people walking in the hallways outside- I was often scared because it sounded like they were right there in the room! My husband also had his cologne go missing- not that it was too expensive or anything, but we were just surprised that it happened. Otherwise, the staff and service were great. The resort is immaculate and everyone is very helpful and friendly. We never made it to any of the speciality restaurants, but the main buffet was good and offered a lot of variety. The breakfast buffet got very old after the first few days, but I guess there is not much you can do about that. The pool is just okay but the beach definitely makes up for it!! Even though they stated that the resort was full we never had a problem finding a lounge chair at the pool or beach no matter what time of day it was. We went to XCARET which was well worth it. I would recommend going on your own instead of the bus that picks up all the other hotels on the way. We took a taxi which is $10 from the hotel and loved the fact that we could come and go when we wanted. One warning though- the only time I got sick the entire trip was after my lunch at the mexican restaurant in XCARET. We also took a day trip to Cozumel. If you do not care about the shopping on Cozumel I HIGHLY recommend going over there on a Sunday- this is when some of the shops are closed so there are NO cruise ships. It makes all the difference in the world. We went snorkeling in the national park and it was almost deserted. Perfect. Overall, enjoyed the area and the hotel, don't really like all-inclusives so much, but this one you should try without reservations!! have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and peaceful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from a weeklong stay with my family and friends which included 4 children. Believe me when I say we are an extremely critical bunch of professionals looking for the best vacation. My goodness, where to begin!!!!!! We loved the spacious rooms and the impeccable service. The restaurants all provided a wide variety of excellent food which was great for our picky kids. The pools were full of activities for adults and the beach was just amazing!!!!! This resort is much more stunning in person then any picture on the internet. The hotel staff were all friendly, helpful, and went beyond the call of duty. We will definitely return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a week long stay at the Palace and we had a wonderful time. The hotel is beautiful and vaery clean. We were treated like a King and Queen from everyone!!! The staff always very freindly and helpful and always smiling. The rooms were very spacious and nice. The pool was always fun with things going on all the time. The beach was amazing. The food was great with all the different restaurants to choose from, however you need to get up early every morning to reserve a table at each restaurant. It was nice to be ablt to use all other three RIU hotels around us to eat, drink and dance at the disco. Overall we had a fabulous vacation and we would recomend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Time at a lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Palace and I really miss it. True, the beds were hard but after all those hours in the sun , who couldn't sleep? The pool was exceptional, the pool bar staff was great, catering to your special drink requests and always with a smile. The food at the buffet is good but is about the same everyday. The breakfast is good but they really cater to the Europeans. Lunch is great too, a mix of Italian, American, Mexican and 'healthnut'. Dinner buffet at Don Julian is a mix of various cultures and the desserts are great. The other resteranunts like the Bodega, Sir Edward and the Steakhouse are a good experience but they need to learn how to cook the seafood, it's all way overcooked. The Bodega needs to learn how to cook turkey it's all way too dry. The beach is always crowded, well maintained and Angel and Javier at the beach bar are amazing to watch, very quick and accurate with your drink request and always with a smile. A true experience is the evening patio drink service, the staff works so hard on getting your order to you fast and accurate. It was worth the money, and remember to tip the staff, you'll get great service whether you tip them or not, I just felt they deserved it.

Reviews.Title: “Our Vacation was a Success”
Reviews.Author: off2ctab
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful week at the Riu. We traveled with another couple and had a blast. The hotel is beautiful and clean. The staff is scrubbing every moring by 6 but you would never know unless you were up. We had no trouble getting reservation and we did not leave the room before 730 on any day. We did have to take a later seating (9pm) at Sir Edwards but we were offered an earlier seating at the Patio if we wanted it. The beds are hard but I had no trouble sleeping I followed the advice of someone and doubled the extra blanket as extra padding. My best acknowlegement goes to the Entertainment Staff. They were very friendly and we were on a first name basis with them before we left. They were a lot of fun and we won free visors at bingo and darts. I took a water aerobics class with Sandra and Tim and it was fun. We toured Tulum and visited Xel-Ha, they are both worth the extra money. A word of advice if you choose to book a tour do not book through Scuba Caribe. They are on the beach and when we were picked up (late) they took us into town where we were shuttled into a store and made to wait at least 30 minutes for the next bus. This cuts into your tour time. The tour also cost us more than the girl on the beach said because we used a credit card. Had we know we would have brought the cash from the resort. Overall we had an wonderful experience. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with a few 'BUT's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was out first time at a Riu hotel. We were supposed to stay at Riu Tequila, but were upgraded to Riu Palace due to overbooking. Considering the difference in price, we definitely got a great deal! The place is beautiful, meticulously maintained, very impressive, staff is very helpful, sometimes too much. We had 2 kids ages 9 and 12 and there was a great selection of food for all of us. From our standpoint, the biggest drawback was - NOTHING to do for the kids. One stone ping-pong table, no basketball,a little bit of rifle shooting one hour every day, tennis court is not under any cover, right under the scorching sun, so not much playing either. We did not do water sports. The kids spent most of the time in the pool or on the beach, which may become tiring. This place has an older crowd, who relocate to the cigar/piano bar in the afternoon. The entertainment was predictable but pretty good quality for these places.. Also, it starts at 10 pm, so children did not always last that long. Other Rius seem to have kid's clubs, but this one does not - at least we did not see anything. Someone here mentioned that the room clock always reset to blinking 12:00. We complained and they put batteries into the clock to last it through the periodic blackouts. As far as the reservation for the restaurants - this is the most ridiculous thing, to make people line up at 6:30!!! We did not use it, partly because of the kids, partly because we did not want to strain ourselves, and the main restaurant was just fine. We have been to other all-inclusives - this is the first place I have seen this lame arrangement. Cheap toiletries, bring your own soap and shampoo (I take my own shampoo always, anyway). Beds are tougher than in the US but are just fine. Whoever cannot sleep, probably has a pile of feathers at home. We like more pillows, theirs were very flat, so we asked for more, got as many as we wanted ( I think, at least 3 per person) If you go to Xcaret, take the cab - it's $10 flat and it's a 5-7 min ride. You can actually spend another $20 to go for lunch back to the hotel and return. You'll pay more and get less for your money if you eat at the park. We stayed for the evening show, and left 10 min before it ended to avoid the crowds. Got the cab right away, and were in the hotel at 9:10. If you do the hair braids, go to the town. For the same pretty long hair they wanted $70 at the beach, $35 at the plaza across the street, $50 at the Tequila and we did it for $15 in Playa. Overall - great place, but probably I won't be back. There are so many other nice places.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace - Beautiful, but needs front desk training...”
Reviews.Author: pbjandthou
Reviews.Content: We would recommend the RIU Palace to anyone travelling to Playa del Carmen (as long as you don't require above average front desk service). The resort was tastefully decorated, spacious, and immaculately clean. We enjoyed the buffet most every night (loved the servers!) and went into Playa 2 evenings for dinner. Our spacious standard room (that included a sitting area with tv and sofa) overlooked the fountains located in the massive courtyard. From our balcony, if we looked to the right and over the palms, we could see the unbelievably blue Gulf waters. Pictures of the resort do not do it justice.The entertainment did leave something to be desired, but as long as you relaxed and maintained your sense of humor it was, to say the least "amusing".If you are going for the pool and not the beach, this resort might not be for you. The pool was unexceptional, but the beach was wonderful. The palm trees provide enough shade from the strong sun so that you don't "fry", but you still manage to get tanned (there is a large beach without palms closer to the water).Our only real complaint about the RIU Palace concerns the front desk employees and Concierge. For a resort of this caliber, one would expect friendly, courteous, attentive service. Our check in was hurried and unwelcoming and at other times the employees at the desk were downright rude. I don't think they realize how important one's experience at the front desk effects his or her decision to return to a hotel. We can only hope that they improve this service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip (4/25-5/2/04) celebrating our wedding anniversary, and I must say we were really impressed with the service, the food, the room and the beautiful grounds. They were always on top of keeping the courtyard well manicured, and very clean. The staff was very friendly and very willing to make things right, for any slight incoveniences along the way. One example was when we asked if we could be seated elsewhere due to a smoker lighting up nearby. Although all the set tables were reserved, he set up another table across the restaurant to accomodate us. He said the only drawback was that we had to wait for the setup. (a mere 15 min.) When our table was ready, we found a lovely table with flowers, and a chilled bottle of champagne waiting for us!! Such special treatment for what amounted to a small wait. A few bumps or things we would like to see change; the dinner reservation process. (By the way, long pants required for men; women can dress any way they like) Prepare to wake up early (6:30 am) to reserve the popular restaurant (Sir Edward). By 7:10, the best times were filled. Also, something to bring with you is a small portable clock--(to help wake you to reserve your place for dinner)--our room didn't have a clock. We asked for one and got it, but it was rather useless. Everytime our room was made up, one of the light switches that controls most everything in the room, was always turned off or on, shutting our power, We always entered the room finding a blinking 12:00 on the clock, so we got tired of setting it. Staff coming around pool side to take our drink order was not very often, almost non-existent a couple of days. Although we noticed it did improve towards the end of the week. Those that recommend bringing your own insulated cup is a great idea. Lastly, their gym. Prepare to sweat profusely before you even begin your work-out, the room is not air-conditioned and the windows do not open. Best to go to the Yukatan gym. As far as the bed goes, it's not the best, but it certainly is not the worst. Definitely livable, esp. with all the other wonderful things they have to to offer. We would definitely go back. A final comment, don't be stingy; reward their HARD work and leave a buck or 2 at the tables. It really goes a long way for them, and it certainly won't break you. Saw very little tipping, sad to say.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A stunning resort, friendly and helpful staff. We just returned from a 14 night stay. There were no major negatives for us. We are a family 4 - children are 10 and 12. I read many, many reviews before our departure, some were very helpful, ie: bring your own soaps,shampoos and the like. Yes, the rooms have an odd odor but with such high humidity and the AC on all the time this is to be expected. We requested a quiet room and knew this would cost us a view. It was worth it, we were hardly in our room and when we were it was nice and peaceful. Yes, the beds are hard and the pillows flat so what we did was request blankets and extra pillows. Made our own 'feather beds' out of blankets and piled the pillows to our satisfaction. The 2 double beds pushed together was really a non issue, we joked about who was going to sleep in the 'crack'! There are 3 different times a day that the staff enter your room, 1 to clean, 1 to stock refreshments and 1 to turn your bed down and replentish towels (new towels twice a day). A young man cleaned our room everyday and we left $2.00 each morning. We tipped others as we saw fit. The security at the Palace is tight, there was no way to get in unless you were supossed to be there. All rooms have a safe. We rented a car and took our own day trips, I think we saved quite a bit. Tulum is a must, don't miss it! We spent $46.00US to get in and that included a private guide. We sailed to Cozumel and took a cab to a public beach and did some great snorkelling. The beach is fabulous! The pool was good too, great place to meet other people. My only regret was not bringing stronger hair spray, I had a lot of "bad hair nights", the humidity just flattened me right out! We definately will go back to the Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort & a perfect vacation!”
Reviews.Author: wmariaw
Reviews.Content: We had a great vacation at this wonderful resort! We are definitely going to return. The Riu Palace is such a beautiful property! It looks and feels very upscale without being stuffy or cold. The service is perfect. It seemed like our every desire was anticipated by the hotel staff. With so many guests, they still remembered our names right away, and the waiters at the restaurants remembered what we prefer to drink. After the first couple of days, we didn't even have to ask for our drinks. They recognized us, and brought us what we always order. Every employee we dealt with seemed genuinely pleasant and eager to help. We had a chance to chat with some of them, and they told us that they love working for the Riu chain, and that, apparently, this chain is considered the best by the hotel workers. They get paid well (for Mexico), and they love their jobs. It definitely shows!This vacation was simply wonderful. The only complaint we had (a very minor one) was that the beds are a bit too hard (but it's the same at any hotel in that part of Mexico). Some people complained about having the two double beds pushed together. We didn't have a problem with that. You don't even notice it, once you are in bed.Food ranged from good to very good to great. There are many choices for all meals. Breakfast and dinner were my favorite meals (Mimosas for breakfast, omlettes and eggs made to order, etc., fresh juices, and a huge selection of stuff for dinner, from meats to seafood to vegetarian).Anyway, I highly recommend you try this resort. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Destination”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week long trip to the Riu Palace (April 2004) and had a spectacular time. The resort was impeccable, the service was second to none, and the grounds are beautiful. The pictures on the website do not do it justice. Everyday the crew are out there cleaning the floors, painting the railways, and making the landscaping perfect. I guarantee that you will be amazed with the beauty of the resort. The pool area is nice with plenty of lounge chairs and a great swim up bar. Just following the pool area is the entrance to the beach. This part is a tropical paradise with palm trees, hammocks, and crystal blue water. If you can afford to spend a little more, the suites are well worth the money. There are only eight on the premises and each includes a second floor private balcony with its own jacuzzi. It is incredible. The only dissapointment with this great suite was the fact that they had two double beds pushed together and made separately. That was a little odd. Another recommendation would be to stay away from the bus tours. They tell you that the stops are minimal, but after six stops to different hotels and two hours later for a thirty minute drive, we were not amuzed. I would recommend either staying at the resort or renting your own car or taxi. If you have an adventure side to you, the ATV Jungle tour is great. You ride out for about 30 minutes and then swim in an open cave and then ride back. It is well worth it. Also, if you want to make your wife happy and yourself, sign up for the couples moonlight massage on the beach at the resort. It is worth every penny. My only criticisms of the resort include 1. having to make daily reservations for the restaurants 2. no king size beds and 3. the lounge chairs around the pool get too hot. You can see that I had to get picky in order to criticise. I have traveled a lot and I would have to say this is one of the best resorts that I have ever been to. You will be treated great, eat wonderful food, be amazed by the beach, and have a great time. I will definitely recommend the Riu Palace to my friends and family and will probably return myself.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! Oh my, This is amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: DDCRABB
Reviews.Content: Those were my first words when I walked through the front doors. My wife and I stayed at the Palace from April 10-17. We are 35-40 and had an absolutely wonderful time. The rooms: very roomy, basicly a suite with a stocked wet bar. In the wet bar we had Coronas, Pepsi, Water, Pepsi light (Diet), 7up and Orange soda. They restocked it everyday. Also, you had four alcohol dispensers on the wall-Vodka, Rum, Tequila and I think Gin. And all top shelf. The beds were firm, but not hard we slept very well every night. We do like a firm bed, but nothing like what some were saying that it was like sleeping on a rock, it was very comfortable. Also, the pillows were fine don't bring your own. Suggestion--Buy the Superior room to get the courtyard view, we did and arrived early and got one of the rooms in front, we were 15 steps from the pool. Gorgeous!! Pool: very nice, plenty of chairs, it was always fun by the pool bar. The water was very nice, not to cold very refreshing and great way to cool off. The pool bar was great, it was beautiful to just there and sip a drink and look at the resort. Beach: This is the third pool!! So blue, it was unbelievable. Plenty of chairs, never had to search for a spot. The water is so warm, when someone from the Pacific Northwest approaches the ocean it is usually with a wet suit and a certain amount of preparation that it is going to be very cold and I did indeed approach with the same mental preparation, but to my surprise it was warm, like bath water. Suggestion--Bring an insulated mug for the beach. The beach bar is not really that far away but who wants to get up when you are so comfortable in the sun. They will gladly fill it up. Food: All the food was very good. Don Julian was excellent, so much variety, never had a bad meal. La Bodega-one of the reservation places, steak house-excellent, you will love the way they serve it to you. I am a meat lover so I was in heaven. Didn't eat at the other reservation place, Sir Edwards- I heard it was also excellent. La Triviata and the El Patio down by the beach also very good, we ate lunch there. Like I said, We never had a bad meal, it was excellent. Say hi to Eduardo and Gustavo our waiters in the Don Julian, great guys, treat them well. Entertainment: A little boring, but since you stay at the palace you can go to any of the other three Rius in the area. Suggestion--walk across the street to the Riu Tequila, excellent shows and also where the La Pinata is located. This is the disco. Young, Old and Middle age in their, it was a lot fun. The music was from the 70's, 80's, 90's and today. A fun mix for everyone. Excursions: We went to Chichen Itza through the Cancun line which was organized through Olympus Tours. They took us to a Mayan village and in one their homes, very interesting. Not all tours do this. It was a very long day 12 hours, but very interesting and fun. Suggestion--Eat breakfast before you go. Went to Playa del Carmen-fun shopping down 5th ave. a lot of shops. Suggestion--Make sure you bring money because they don't all accept American Express, Visa or Mastercard. Also, we could only find two bank machines in the area. We went to Cozumel to go snorkeling, again bring cash, ferry only takes cash and Chankanuub only takes cash. Snorkeling was amazing, great pictures. Overall, it was the best trip we have ever taken and can't wait to go back. If you have any questions please feel free to e-mail me.

Reviews.Title: “Older crowd”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The riu Palace is a beautiful resort...We visited the Riu palace for our honeymoon in November. When we arrived we were not very impressed with our room. It faced onto a little garden and we were told we were to have an ocean view. There tends to be an older crowd who enjoy talking about all the money they make...The food was great...the drinks were awesome....if your a young couple wanting to have a good time this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Palace!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a wonderful vacation at the Riu Palace. We, my husband and I , and our 3 children (ages 15, 14, 12), plus our friends and their 2 children (ages 13 and 17) loved the Riu! It was clean, the rooms were beautiful, though the beds a little hard and pillows flat. They would come into the room twice a day, once to clean and the second to tear-down the beds and bring extra towels. They even made the cutest animals out of the towels! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The food was plentiful and very good, even for our kids standards. All they ate was the pizza and pasta, even though there was all kinds of food! I felt there was food for every palate. The grounds were beautiful, and even though the hotel was to capacity, you would never know it because there was so much room! Especially by the pool area and the beach. You never felt cramped and you never had to wake up early to save a chair by the pool. There were hammocks under palm trees, there were beach chairs and there was a bar right at the beach! We looked for a hotel that would entertain our teenage kids and there was plenty there. Water sports and motorized water sports were right there on the beach. Bring money because they are independently owned. They are not through the hotel. The kids even parasailed and thought it was great! We took a few tours through Apple Tours and they were very accomodating. They were right there in the hotel lobby and took care of everything for you. All we did was show up at the specified times! The only problem that we saw was with their gym. It was very small and hot, though we made due! This was really the only thing we had a complaint bout. We would definitely choose the Riu Palace again to vacation! We had a ball!

Reviews.Title: “Riu palace ' muy excellante !!!'”
Reviews.Author: tfs5815
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 day's at the Riu Palace 3/20/04 - 3/27/04 for our 20th annversary. I was reluctant to go as we come from an ocean city in the northeast, but I am glad we did. If what you expect from a vacation is good food, clean and spacious rooms, and a wonderful white sandy beach than this is the place. plusses: The staff was very frendly and cordial. They made you feel at home and also treated you like you were at a palace. We came in late on Saturday night so our choice room was not available but Monday we were upgraded to another room facing the courtroom. The in room bars were stocked daily although we were not in the room long enough to use the liquor portion. The beer and waters were consumed on a daily basis. The food at Don Julians buffet at breakfast and dinner was plentiful and delicious. The was also a large variety. I don't know how people can complain that the food variety gets old after a few days. If you want to eat healthy you can but there is also plenty to indulge on the guilty side. Sir Edwards was the best dining experience for us as they pampered us with a 3 course meal. (Try the Duck). The patio restaurant had a nice atmosphere but the food was average. we didn't make to La Bodega. The beach was spectacular. The sand does not get hot like back home and it is kept inpecably clean. They rake every morning and align all the chairs every day. We never had to reserve a beach chair and there are plenty of shady areas if you want to get out of the sun. The red flags were flying most of the week so we didn't get to use a lot of the water crafts but the body surfing was great. it was fun watching the midwestern americans trying to do it. There was a good mix of people from all over the world. I was surprised to see as many older teens as we did but they did not detract from the vacation at all. At night they would go across the street to the Tequilla Disco and not be hanging at the palace courtyard. The only negative was getting up at 6:30am to reserve the dinner seatings. If your there by 6:45 you will have a hard time getting a seat. Hints: bring insulated coolers to keep your drinks cold at the beach and pool. Tip your chambermaids with coloring books with crayons and I guarantee you will see the towel animals. Don't try to see Xel-ha and the Tullum ruins in one day. Take a whole day for Xel-ha. Taxis are 4 us dollars to downtown playa del carmen. You may want to use them for excursions also as the packages you get from your reps stop at numerous hotels so a 1/2 hour ride to and from becomes 3 hours instead. Tip the workers they work very hard and deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Generally Good, Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at the Riu Palace with my wife, 3 kids and Au Pair. The facilities were spotless and the service was generally excellent. I would say the food was very good. Even my kids, ages 3-7(Picky!) found something to like. In addition the staff was helpful with some special requests. My suggestion regarding kids is that you should pick another place if you are thinking of ages 4 or younger. At the peak of the spring break season there were maybe a half a dozen in the entire resort in this age category. I actively sought out the hotel manager to try to get a late check out for one of my rooms so that my youngest could have a nap prior to our late travel home. They refused to address the request until the night before departure and when I finally found the manager after being misled by the manager in training for 3 days...they could not have cared less. I also don't believe it is woth the premium for the younger kids. Regarding "5 star" this hotel will not satisfy the 5 star consumer. The bathroom soap, shampoo etc are more in the motel 6 quality. The alcahol options are not top shelf. The choices are mid range and the wine options are sub-par. The towels for the beach and pool were filthy. The Gym had no air conditioning. It was so hot you could not use it. While there were short comings we did have a good time. I would reccommend it but moderate your expectations regarding the areas described above.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On December 8, 2003 My husband and I arrived at Riu Palace. The hotel was magnificant, the atmonsphere was great and the people that worked their were very nice. The food & entertainment was enjoyable!!! We are hoping to go back for our one year wedding anniversary!!! My husband and I were very pleased with the whole experience. This was our honeymon and we were very pleased how remarkable it turned out to be... We also walked around the other hotels and down the street for some shopping, the shops were very nice and the streets were calm and clean.. The other hotels seem to be very nice, but I think the Riu Palace was still the nicest. Marrying the man of my dreams and spending a week in a enchanted castle I felt like a I was in a fairytale.....

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon, Palace style!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Mayan Riviera in Sept of 2002 for our honeymoon, and to say the least we had a fantastic time. Unfortunately the first couple of days we got the aftermath of Hurrican Izidor but this didn't dampen our spirits at all, seeing as we had never been to Mexico so just being there was a pleasure. The service was fantastic, the food was incredible and the guests were just wonderful!!! Not having alot of experience with travel, we were both a little nervous to see where our travel agent was booking for us (we had gone to her a couple of days AFTER our wedding as we were just thinking of taking a week and driving to the states but she let us know that Riu was having a great sale and to take advantage of it so we did). When we got there we were just in awe of the whole resort. Although we haven't been to other resorts we knew that this place was definitely a great destination. At dinner we ended up befriending a couple who were there celebrating their 10th anniversary and they even let us know it was their second time at RIU Palace as they were just in love with it. Both of them work in the travel industry so they had they fair share of experiences and to that day they said RIU Palace impressed them the most!!! If you are looking to relax by the sea and just soak in the rays this is the place to be. Oh and the nightly entertainment was quite enjoyable. Some nights was a bit boring but others were GREAT!! I highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a lil' R&R. My husband and I are still talking about it!!!

Reviews.Title: “the best.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace Dec 6 2003.We have been all over the world and me being in the travel industry,this was the best all inclusive we have ever stayed at.The hotel was immaculate,the rooms are wonderful,and the food was just amazing...I truly felt like I was staying in a palace for 1 week.I did venture alone to Cancun by bus and returned back to Playa del Carmen at night and felt totally safe..Never once did I feel like I had to look over my shoulder.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and it is well worth the money.Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace was fantastic. The staff was wonderful. Their only goal was to make our stay enjoyable. The facilities were truly beautiful. The All-Inclusive was great. They were very generous with the drinks and made sure that everyone had enough of everything. I would return in a heartbeat. The beach was the best. Much better than the beaches of the surrounding resorts. Having access to the other Riu resorts right next door and across the street gave us a 2 block area at our disposal. My wife and 2 sons in their 20's had a wonderful vacation. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “The Palace has it's name for a reason”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the RIU Palace for our Honeymoon July 7th, 2003. We stayed for 12 days and it was wonderful! We had been to Mexico the following year to Cancun, and found Playa del Carmen to be simply perfect - calming and relaxing, romantic and exciting! The perfect retreat after a year of planning and to celebrate our marriage. The resport was immacutate and interesting and VERY classy! The rooms were beautiful. The resturants were unique and had lovely dishes to choose from. And the entertainment was a perfect way to end a perfect day in Mexico. I would highyl recommend the Palace to ANYONE - it is far superior to the other sister RIU's in Playa del Carmen... it is worth the extra cash!

Reviews.Title: “Happy at Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: JMCMaine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned March 1st after a week at the Riu Palace. We spent the same week last year at the Palace, and it is our fourth time to the area. We enjoyed ourselves this year more than last, and we loved our trip last year. Arriving into Cancun is much easier earlier in the day. We walked through customs at 10:30 am, while others waited an hour or more in the afternoon. The trip to Playa del Carmen is a mere forty minutes, and the improvements on the landscaoing to the town are great. After arriving at the hotel, we are still awed by the beauty of the Hotel itself, let alone the landscaping. Check in is a breeze, and we were in our nicely apppointed room within minutes, even though we were early arrivals. The service is my favorite aspect of the resort. We recognized over a quarter of the staff from the year before, they may not remeber you, but seeing the way they have moved up in promotions is very pleasant, especially since they work so hard. Tipping is not necesarry, but greatly appreciated. The food at the resort is above average, better than any chain you would eat in in the US. The lunch buffets get repetitive, but dinner is always great. The ala carte retaurants are very good, Sir Edwards was my favorite over a very good La Bodega. The beach is large and beautiful, pool bar is fun for a break from the sun. We are already planning a trip back next spring. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Palace all in the mind of the beholder”
Reviews.Author: sanbin
Reviews.Content: Prior to going to the Riu Palace I came to this site frequently to get an idea of what I was in store for as well as to hopefully justify the expense of the trip. It seems that the people who have gone to the Riu fall into two groups: those who went there hoping for a terrific vacation and those who expected to stay at a resort and be pampered. I think those who have stayed at AI's rate this higher than those who have limited AI experience. The Riu is much better than most AI's but is certainly not a 5 star resort whose clientele expect individualized service. The Riu's clientele is international and, as a result, has to cater to a variety of tastes. I think it satisfies all but doesn't distinguish itself to any one specific group. My review: we stayed there 13 days and you do expect to see repetition on the buffet after a while. However, I like to try enough different entres so I didn't get bored at all. Having duck twice was a treat. I didn't think Sir Edward was that much better than Don Julian's although it was nice to be served for a change. The Steakhouse again was nice to be served, but other than the steak, the salad bar and dessert table was the same as all other meal. I think they could have added some specialty items there to make you think you were at a whole different venue. One criticism we did have is that even though you had to get to the desk early to make reservations, there were so many weddings going on that the Steakhouse and Bordega were often closed for functions. This happened four days in a row with us and they would not tell you that until the morning you came for reservations. I assume they knew in advance but would not tell you even if you asked about the availability the next day. I found the front desk lacking in being forthcoming with any information and not helpful at all. Although they do try to assign you inside, we had no problem getting our table changed the first night and enjoyed sitting outside. I don't know if people were eating in Playa or on tours, but many nights the tables were only half full. Beach: not much to say about a white beach that is great to swim in, miles to walk along and terrific sand bottom. The Riu has the most natural shade of any of the resorts so you could choose to either bake or move back after a while to cool off. No beach service was a minor inconvenience but I find the service takes so long anyways it is easier to take care of it myself. The best hint I got on the forum was to bring an insulated mug. Those drinks they give you are half gone by the time you get back to your lounger. Mugs hold more and keep the drink cold longer. Rooms: we didnt mind the beds. We both slept great on the hard mattress. I do agree with no amenities in the bathroom except for some body/shampoo combo in the shower that is so K-Mart (sorry martha stewart). We ended up buying our own. Wish we had known in advance. The soap they have is the mini piece that disappears after one use. This is the first AI we have been to with no bath items and found it strange. We tipped daily and got little animals some days and some not. A sexist comment: most of the cleaning staff where we were , were guys. Maybe they are not into the animal thing. The room had a slight musty smell when we arrived but we had read about this and brought a room deoderizer to plug in. I dont know if it worked or the room cleared itself but it was a non- issue . For a couple dollars it was worth it. We did notice when we got home that some items that had hung in the closet and not worn, did smell musty, so i think the deoderizer might be a good idea. considering how much you pay for the vacation, a minor price . We had a room facing the courtyard. I sent an email two weeks in advance requesting it and another a week in advance. They responded that they could not guarantee rooms, but I think the squeaky wheel philosophy works with hotels. It is worth trying. We had a 3rd floor end room so no one above or on one side. the room numbers are strange with the first floor beginning with 0 , 2nd floor 1000, and so forth. If i were to recommend a room, try 2044-2060. Doesn't hurt to ask. These are away from the noise and facing in. Grounds: similar to the beach. Who could complain about manicured areas, clean pools and fountains, walkways scoured every morning. The number of staff assigned to keeping the grounds immaculate is phenomenal. It reminded me of disney world where you never saw any pieces of paper on the ground. It is something you dont realize unless you look around. We had no major complaints and the only major recommendation we would make to the Riu is that for a resort charging what they do, they should have a concierge. The front desk staff made you feel like you were interrupting them unless you were checking in or out. They were not rude but neither were they inviting. First impressions linger and ours was not that good at the front desk. To those who have not been to an AI, this is one of the best. You definately won't be disappointed. The vacation is what you make of it. Enjoy. Email if any other questions

Reviews.Title: “Not for Everybody”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In planning our vacation, my wife and I used this forum, so I figured we should offer up our opinion. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, which was our 1st "All-Inclusive" experience. My overall interpretation of the RIU Palace is that it is nice, but they cut some obvious corners. Specifically, what resort that calls themselves a "Luxury" resort on the beach does not offer skin care products in their bathroom? That is an obvious corner being cut by the resort. In addition, they do not offer room service? This was extremely annoying. Also, the wristbands are a bit much, feels like you are at a youth sports camp. The lack of king size beds is perplexing. If you are traveling with your wife and want a single bed, they push two double beds together, each of which is made up seperately. What were they thinking? Are they too cheap to have one dimensional rooms (i.e. kings and doubles) or is there some cultural difference i am missing? Also, the beds are hard as a rock. The "luxury" resorts i have stayed at spare little expense on mattresses, but apparently mattresses were of little concern to RIU. Positives at the RIU Palace were service, the beach, and just the overall location. All in all, we enjoyed our stay because the weather was amazing, the water was spectacular, and the beach was great. We didn't like the food, the lack of comparable "luxury" amenities, etc., but the location makes up for everything. Also, the only other option that is rated as highly is the Royal Hideaway, which from the outside looked very similar, but not as nice of a beach. Therefore, based on the options in the area, i would recommend the RIU Palace. But, if you have stayed at actual luxury resorts, don't expect the same thing here. Luxury in my mind is about the little extras, which aside from excellent service, the RIU Palace does not offer. THe following headings touch on several items. FOOD - Overall, the food was OK. However, if you are a daring person in terms of cuisine, you may enjoy some of the options. The basics, such as meats, were OK at best. The "Steakhouse" steak was not good at all and the other meats were simply OK. The buffet gets very old, very quick. My biggest complaints about the food are as follows; 1) No room service (except breakfast), 2) Same general food options. Even if you eat at the a la carte restaurants, their menus don't change. 3) When you arrive, you need to select a dining time for the main buffet restaurant. Being bound by a certain dining time is very annoying. I basically ate a bagel for breakfast, chips and guacamole for lunch. BEACH - The beach is the best aspect of this resort. The beach specific to RIU Palace is very wide offering both open and shaded areas. The sand is wonderful, the water is a brilliant turquoise, and the surf was never too rough. In the water, the bottom is all sand, which makes swimming enjoyable. Snorkeling is not very good in front of the resort. Overall, the Beach was great, however there is no beach drink service. POOL - I did not spend much time at the pool, but i suppose it is OK. It is not designed for swimming laps and it is divided into two smaller areas. Overall, the pool is relatively small, but is sufficient as there are not many rooms at the resort. ROOMS - The rooms are very clean, good maid service, and average in terms of finish quality. THere is an adequate bathroom, two beds, and a small sitting area. The beds are very hard, but i was still able to sleep OK. But, i think they were just to cheap to spend the extra $ on quality mattresses. SERVICE - The service is very good. There are workers everywhere, all of which are willing to help you out. THe service was a real plus to the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Another thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: Philsteph
Reviews.Content: We spent the first week of March at the Riu Palace and loved it! I've been to several all-inclusive resorts and this by far has been the best! The food was really very good, not mediocre dorm food that you find in most other all-inclusives. The resort was so much nicer than any other resort on the Playacar strip. I would have been disappointed if I had chosen anywhere else. I've noticed several comments about this hotel attracting an older crowd. I think that is an unfair opinion. What I think this hotel attracts are people who care about staying in a very nice place. There were people of all ages at the hotel, lots of couples 30's and 40's and quite a few families (I would have chosen somewhere else to bring my 2 small children though). There were older people but it in no way seemed like a retirement village. Just a classy place that attracts people who appreciate quality. There are a few things that bothered me about the trip, I would still rate the resort as excellent because I was able to get over some of this stuff but just to be forthright with information: 1. If you want a room that faces the fountain/courtyard area then don't book with Apple Vacations. I don't know about the other groups like Fun Jet but we were told at check-in that they will not place an Apple Vacation guest in the nice facing rooms unless no other room was available. If we wanted to pay an additional $60 per day they would upgrade us but as a rule they don't book the nice rooms to Apple. Had I known that I would have done some better price comparisons with other carriers. 2. We never got the towels shaped like animals in our rooms or the chocolate on our pillows. Nothing nice in our rooms at all as lots of other reviewers here describe. We tipped $5 the first day but didn't feel we had any better or cleaner room even with leaving a tip. Our friends had a room on the other side of the hotel and they never got any of the special things in their room either. Not a big deal but after the whole Apple Vacations deal above this didn't sit well with me. 3. At dinner, its difficult to sit at the outdoor terrace at the main buffet resteraunt. They will want to seat you inside so you must request outside seating but even if you request it you still feel like they are really doing you a favor to seat you on the terrace. This irked me a few nights when we were sat inside (even after asking to sit outside) and I noticed that some of the outside tables (like 8-10) sat empty for the entire seating. I hope these issues above don't discourage you from this hotel because this was a great vacation and I am sure it was the nicest hotel in this area. We tryed the ATV's excursion one day. This was really a lot of fun!! They take you to a ranch located on a deserted area of a nice beach and they let you drive these 4 wheeler vehicles on trails right on the beach! We left at 8am and were there and back to the hotel by 1pm in time for lunch and a nice afternoon on the beach. One of the things that I don't like about lots of these excursions is that they consume ALL day by the time you travel to all the other hotels to pick up other guests and travel time and Mexican time and all that. We loved the hotel so much that we didn't want to burn a whole day on some excursion so this ATV excursion was really nice because we were back to enjoy most of the day at the resort. The ATV adventure really was fun and definately something I would normally never do! My husband and my friends husband golfed one day. They loved the golf course - both are good golfers and found the course challenging and pretty. They said they saw several native creatures on the golf course and that made it really fun. On the negative side, golf cost $160 per person and that is with my husband bringing his own clubs! Very expensive and no other golf course anywhere nearby (besides a par 3). Even though the golf was really expensive, my husband loved it so much he would do it again. Definately worth the extra money. Enjoy your stay! We will be back next year! Please feel free to e mail me with questions at: phil_steph@HOTMAIL.COM

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from eight day stay at the Palace. We loved it! Hotel is grand, rooms large and comfortable, grounds incredibly well maintained, beach spectacular, food and service quite good. What was unusually special about our stay was our many trips to the town of Playa del Carmen, especially at night. Yes, it's crowded and touristy. But so alive with international fun seekers. Be sure to hit the Blue Parrot for $1.25 "Happy Hour" beers. Take your camera for great beach and fishing boat picts. Our favorite restaurant (among many) was "Apasionado". Second floor seating assures you a great vantage point for viewing the passing throngs of happy and tanned visitors. Guacamole with chips was best ever. Food terrific as was contemporary Spanish jazz CDs.A personal highlight of my Riu Palace stay was booking an adventure tour through "Alltournatives" to a Maya village. There we canoed on jungle fresh water lakes, jumped from a seventy foot cliff while pulley and harnessed to a steel cable and zipped some 100 meters over a lake, and finished up by rapelling down a well-like opening into a large, beautiful underground lake. After a well prepared native Maya buffet, we were driven to the Coba ruins where we hiked to the top of the tallest pyramid on the Yucatan peninsula. The trip is an all day affair, costs about eighty dollars and will be remembered the rest of your life. Try to get Adrian and Mario as guides; they're young, enthused, and eager to please. I could go on and on about our best vacation ever but I'll end here. But, one last thing; try a "caballito" or two of Don Julio tequila in the Palace's Cubano bar.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic is the only way to describe this hotel, we spent 2 wonderful weeks here on our honeymoon in July 2002. Could not fault anything! and its a bonus that you can use the facilities of the other Riu's too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the RIU Palace and had a wonderful time. The resort is magnificent, clean, hard-working personnel and alot of fun. We've been to many Sandals resorts and thought this was superior with better food and classier surroundings. The beds were hard and only doubles, as almost everyone has stated and the reservations for dinner were different with everyone you asked, but that's really my only complaints. We tried every restaurant and were very happy and satisfied with the food and the wine and especially the service. Everyone who worked there was happy, helpful and kind and they work very hard. We took two tours, to Xel-Ha and an All-tournative tour to Coba/Pac-Chen. Xel-Ha is incredible and would go again, we took a taxi to get there when it opened to avoid lthe long van rides that stop at many hotels. This was one of the complaints we had about the Coba tour. It took 3 hours to get there and we chose that tour because it was only an hour away. We will definitely come back to this area, but would like to bring the kids next time, so we will choose another resort with more options for them, but would highly recommend this resort for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Palace. Didn't have the greatest weather but the resort more than made up for it. The food was very good and the grounds are well kept. The room we stayed in was outstanding (even though we didn't really have a view). The maid service kept the complimentary liquor and beer stocked and the room picked up. Who ever trained the resort staff deserves a raise - OUTSTANDING SERVICE. Only complaint I heard all week was that the beds are two hard even after a full day of drinking on the white sand beach. I would highly recommend this resort. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace- worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned from the Riu Palace on the Feb 16,2004. We really had a nice time. The Palace was definitely the nicest and classiest of the local hotels- as we often heard from the locals. The beach is definitely the most beautiful part, with warm sandy water. The pool was busy, but we prefer the beach- We never reserved a chair- no problem. We went on Aquatic adventures by Emillio and this was a beautiful and fun snorkel adventure- easy as nice as Xelha. Great for experienced and beginning snorkelers. We enjoyed all our meals. There was great variety at the buffet Don Julians, and it was delicious- great service, and especially nice on the terrace. We had one meal at Sir Edwards, and it was very good-we both had the beef- but we missed our table and waiter! Try the almond pancakes for breakfast! As other reviewers have mentioned - there are a few down points- The beds really are hard- The shows don't start til 10- and there is not much to do after dinner. We went to Tequila one night but found it to be very crowded and noisy. The Palace is definitely a place to go to be spoiled with service and taste.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the palace!”
Reviews.Author: Amycrops2
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful relaxing week at the Palace from Feb. 8-15 celebrating our 30th anniversary. Our travel agent recommended the Palace as soon as we called him and after doing extensive research we agreed it sounded like just what we wanted. I spent part of each day for months reading any review I could find and found Trip Advisor super helpful. I don't understand why people seem surprised to find things like the beds being hard, having to make reservations at 7 a.m., etc. Do the research ahead of time and be sure it is a good fit for you and you?ll have a great vacation!FLIGHT - We flew USA 3000 out of BWI and it was fairly uneventful - there was a bit of a problem with luggage when we were about to take off, but even with a 30 min. delay we arrived in Cancun at our arrival time. Getting thru the airport was no problem even with loads of people arriving. I had brought our marriage certificate because of some things I had read about maiden names but I never had to pull it out ? it seemed like they hardly even looked at our birth certificates! As soon as we walked outside we located our flowered shirt Apple rep and he got us onto our bus and on our way. It took about 45 min. or less even with two other resort stops to let people off.CHECK IN - Even with all the pictures I had seen of the Riu Palace lobby it was very impressive! The bellman wouldn't hear of us carrying any of our own luggage to our room on the top floor. As soon as we got into our room I hurried to open our balcony curtain and there was nothing to look at but a rooftop! I had emailed ahead and asked to please be in a room with a nice view this being a very special trip for us and had gotten a standard email back that they would do what they could based on availability. I was very upset and spent the first few minutes crying before my husband went back down to the lobby and came back with a key to the room across the hall. This one overlooked a small garden area and the tennis courts. Later I did find out that Apple doesn't get the fountain courtyard views, but after looking around there really aren't that many to begin with. Overall you really aren't in your room all that much and I was happy in the one we were moved to.RESORT - Walking around the property we were very, very, impressed with the attention to detail in architecture, decoration, landscaping, and service. It felt like we were staying at someone's grand hacienda and they were very happy we were there! Everyone goes out of their way to smile and say Hola and ask if you need anything. We had fun walking around the other RIU?s in the area though we never used any of their services. The only other one we would probably consider staying at was the Tequila, which was very airy and had a cool pool area. At night it was definitely more hopping than the Palace. Being in the gated community of Playacar was very pleasant. Every night we walked around the streets and felt very safe.BEDS - The hard beds were no problem for us - I actually think I slept better than at home! I had read about this plenty and maybe it was because I was prepared for it.FOOD - My husband owns a catering company so food quality is important to us. While Don Julian's buffet was not ultra gourmet food it certainly was above average. We weren't all that impressed with the close to the beach buffet restaurants so usually ate all our meals at Don Julian. The service was perfect at each meal - napkins placed in our laps and drinks refilled as soon as they got close to empty. Our plates were always cleared right away. We both liked the fact that we could reserve our dinner table for the whole week as we were assured of eating out on the terrace, which we loved. It also was a definite plus having the same waiterers/waitresses. It didn't take long to get used to having champagne poured for us each night!Knowing ahead of time about the early need for reservations at the specialty restaurants we decided ahead of time not to do so. No way was I getting up so early on vacation! It was a bit irritating and I think they could work that out a different way but again - something we knew when we booked to stay at the Palace.BEACH & POOL - It was also no surprise that it was a bit crowded on the beach - understandable since we were there during a very high demand time. We always found a spot no matter the time though most days we did have to drag chairs around to get two next to each other in a good spot. The walk to the beach was not long and we enjoyed having the big wide sandy area to walk thru and seeing the turquoise water thru the palm trees. We never got a chance to swing in the hammocks but it looked like a very peaceful place to rest. The beach bar is in this initial area before you get to the actual beach. I have no idea why people complain about this - it really isn't much of a distance at all! On two occasions waiters were bringing trays of drinks and serving them to you on the beach. We usually spent mornings there and then moved to the pool area in the afternoon. It was a bit trickier finding lounge chairs there but we always managed to find something. We've been to resorts with fancier pools but it was still a good size and beautifully landscaped.KIDS ? We love kids and have four of our own and have been foster parents but for our anniversary wanted something romantic and peaceful. We weren?t able to spend the extra money to stay at Royal Hideway or another adults only resort and I was a bit apprehensive about the kids issue. They were definitely there but overall well behaved and only occasionally did we hear them running down our hall way or babies crying.SIDE TRIPS ? We had preplanned a trip to Tulum and to snorkle in some cenotes with a woman named Anna, who does more personalized tours. She is on the Playa Del Carmen board. This was a very enjoyable day! The Tulum ruins with the white sand and beautiful water background was gorgeous and my husband loved diving off a cliff into the centote. I snorkled for the first time so was pretty excited about that. We really wanted to get to one of the water parks but it was hard to leave the resort! We definitely want to do that next time as well as see some of the larger ruins.MONEY/ SHOPPING ? There is a nice shopping area just a few resorts up from the Palace which we visited several times. We also walked into Playa Del Carmen which wasn?t too bad a walk ? about 30 minutes. After walking all over gift buying we did take a taxi back to the resort though. ($4.total) We never exchanged our money. It?s true that most of the time you will get change in pesos though. We did bargain on pricing and overall felt we got very good prices on all the items we brought back. I thought it was much more laid back than some of the other places we?ve been where the shop people harass you to buy their products.PEOPLE - We thought there was a good mix of people from other countries and age groups. We sat next to a couple one night who were on their honeymoon and also spoke with a couple celebrating a 40th anniversary. It was amazing to see how many languages the lobby and head waiters must have to know! We never had any problem with us only knowing English.PHONES/INTERNET - Our Verizon phone didn't work even with updating the roaming capabilities. We ended up using our Walmart AT&T phone card and though the Palace did charge $1. per connection to the AT&T 800 operator this was easiest for us. Each day we checked our email at the internet cafe located at the shopping center at the RIU Yucatan - about a one block walk. I'm not sure what the cost effectivness was but again for us this was the easiest place for us to go.On Tuesday night a letter was slipped under our door asking if we would like to transfer to the new RIU Palace Las Americas in downtown Cancun for Friday and Saturday nights. We had already been planning to spend one day in Cancun and as much as we loved where we were decided to take them up on it. This hotel was magnificent! We were on the 6th Floor and overlooked the pool and ocean ? just incredible! As we walked around though we didn?t have the same feeling of graciousness that we had felt at the other Palace and were wishing we were back there. We also thought the buffet here was not as good. For Valentine?s Day my husband did go down early and get us a reservation at their gourmet restaurant which was excellent and a nice change from buffet food. When we found out this hotel had only been open two weeks it was more understandable that as nice as it was it just didn?t have the same ambiance that the other Palace had. We did have privilages at the RIU Cancun next door which was very nice.We would go back to the RIU Palace in a second! My only negative comment would be the early reservation situation for the restaurants and that they need perhaps one more to choose from.Feel free to email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Riu”
Reviews.Author: Kristine72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night/5 day stay at the Riu. We went through Apple Vacations, so at check in we were told to sit in the bar area while the front desk worker gave us each keys to our room. The first room we had 0045, was not what we asked for which was a view of the fountains. The next room 2063 smelled like mildew and smoke and the air conditioner did not work. They were not too pleasant when we asked for other rooms telling us they were booked, but then amazingly would give us a key to another room and ask us to check it out. By the time we got to the last room - 1049, my husband was ready to leave! For the money we paid, I guess we expected plusher rooms. Please note... they have no "no smoking" rooms also, they do NOT have king sized beds - they are two double beds put together side by side. The beds are hard - the other reviewers are not joking!!!! I give the rating above average because the beach was beautiful and the service was the best I've ever had. Also, the rooms were large. The hotel is IMMACULATELY clean. There are always housekeepers cleaning around the clock. We tipped the maid 2-5 dollars a day because our room was always well attended to. The beach was crowded, but not bad at all. We always got beach chairs and never had to reserve them. We ate at two of the three ala carte restaurants, they were both good. The buffet is good also, breakfast was our favorite. All in all, our vacation was great and relaxing. I guess I am just very picky. However I had never been on an all inclusive vacation before and did not know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but too crowded for us!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoMomof2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (both in our mid-30's) just returned from a 3 night stay at the Riu Palace. It is a beautiful hotel with a beautiful beach. Unfortunately (for us), the hotel was completely booked and very crowded. This was a bit overwhelming for us, as we looked forward to a short, but peaceful get-away. As mentioned in other reviews, the walls are paper thin. You can hear when your neighbor is watching TV or blow drying their hair. We stayed on the top floor, so I can't imagine how loud it would have been having someone above us! The food was pretty good, but not fabulous. Plus, who wants to stand in line on their vacation at 7am to make a reservation?! Yes, the beds are hard, but it didn't bother us at all. Overall the place was nice, but with three weddings going on and the hotel filled to the max, it was hard to find a place by the pool or on the beach (near the water) to relax without over hearing others. Also, if you're not into dressing-up while on vacation, you may want to try one of the other Riu hotels. The Palace has a dress code for dinner (no shorts). This was not for us. My husband was extremely warm trying to sit outside and couldn't relax. Overall, the stay was good, but not great. Next time, well probably stay at a smaller place with a casual atmosphere

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelChicks
Reviews.Content: Just got back, visited the week of Feb. 7-14, '04. I've been to at least 6 all-inclusive resorts and this is one of the nicest. The two of us (both female, late 30s) had a fabulous time. The guests were from around the world---not even half were from the U.S. The crowd was definitely classier than most all-inclusive resorts, due to the premium cost. There were some families with kids, but it was mostly a "couples" crowd. The grounds are absolutely beautiful, and the entire resort is immaculately clean. The hotel is organized in an angular "U" shape, with the lobby at the base and the rooms in two rows with a courtyard in the middle. The courtyard is filled with fountains, palm trees, wrought iron benches and lanterns. Definitely get a room with a courtyard view. None of the rooms have an ocean view. There are also some suites on the third floor that have spiral stairs up to a private roof deck jacuzzi. No idea how much these cost---they were not advertised anywhere I saw. All rooms have mahogany built-ins, including a hidden full bar and mini fridge. The bath has a great shower with excellent water pressure, and a private toilet/bidet area separate from the sink area. The Riu Palace is located in a grouping of three Riu hotels, the Palace being the most elegant. You can walk across the street to the Riu Tequila, or next door to the Riu Yucatan. Downtown is a five minute cab drive, but the town is seedy and people constantly harass you to buy stuff. Instead, walk a half block down the street to the small shopping area.
