There you will find a much nicer, higher-quality selection without the hassels. Nightlife at the Palace ends at 11:00---the bars stay open longer but there's no entertainment. We went across the street to the Tequila where there is a disco that plays 80's music until 2 am. Other comments: Cold pool? Who wants a hot pool? It was SO hot outside most days you needed to cool off. Hard beds? Yup, but I slept fine. Dinner reservations? A bit of a hassle---we never managed to get into the Sir Edward (fancy restaurant) because you had to physically make a reservation at 7 am. The food at the main buffet was great, but did get a bit monotonous by the end of the week. Noisy rooms? Yeah. If you are a light sleeper, ask for a room on the third floor so you don't have people above you and as much hall traffic.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice but definitely not a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (age 34 & 36) and another couple (age 43 & 48) stayed @ the Riu Palace 2/7-2/11. It was nice but definitely not a 5 star hotel. 1. Food was okay. I would not recommend the 2 restaurants that you had to stand in line @ 7:00 a.m. to make dinner reservations for. Don Julio (Buffet) was the best restaurant there. 2. Room was nice, but the walls are very thin so you can pretty much hear everything around you (ask to stay on the top floor). 3. Service was great. We tip $2/day for maid & $2/each time we dine. 4. Pool was very pretty, but did not have ledge in pool for loungers (where you can lay in the pool when it's hot). 5. Beach was BEAUTIFUL!!!! But it was very crowded!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation In Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four night/five day stay at the RIU Palace. We relied heavily on TripAdvisor for our hotel choice so I wanted to post a review once we returned. Let me just say that if you want a relaxing beach vacation, RIU Palace is the place for you. Each day that we walked down to reserve our chairs on the beach, our breath was taken away by the beauty of the water and beach. It is truly paradise! We were blessed with five days of sun and I am sure that is a big reason why our stay was so perfect. We are beach lovers so we would reserve our chairs on the beach at 8:00 am, go to breakfast, and then lay out the rest of the day. The RIU definitely attracts an international clientele, so while we sat on the beach, we could hear the conversations in Spanish, French, Dutch and Italian. There were American and Canadians as well but most days we were surrounded by foreign speaking people. We loved that!!! Due to the international clientele, quite a few women went topless. Our beach probably had the most topless sunbathers while some of the family resorts further down the beach had none. A very good reason to return, as far a my husband is concerned! The service at the RIU is wonderful. All the servers spoke English and were almost instantly at our table taking our drink or food orders. Definitely the best service we have ever had compared to our previous stays in Mexico. We had read TripAdvisor reviews that recommended we should bring $1 bills to tip the staff. We chose not to do this and I don't think we were given any less service than others that might have tipped (though I never actually saw anyone tip). In hindsite, I wish I had brought some $1 bills to say thank you to all those that were so wonderful to us. I'll definitely do it next time! The only complaints about the RIU would be the food (we ate mostly buffet meals except for one night which we ate at the steakhouse) and the beds. The buffet at Don Julian was good (not great) food which we ate at for breakfast and dinner. For lunch we at at the buffet restaurant closest to the pool and beach (can't remember the name). Both restaurants offered many choices to diners and offered quantity but not a ton of quality. Just for the record, we did not get sick during our stay and made it a point to stay away from the salad bar and water that we didn't drink directly from a bottle. On a previous trip, we got very sick so we wanted to avoid that at all costs! The presentation of the food was beautiful and it was obvious that a lot of work was put into every meal. I asure you, we didn't go hungry and might have even put on some excess pounds during our short stay!!! My only other complaint is that the beds were hard. We had read that comment in some reviews prior to our trip and would agree with those opinions. One reviewer suggested putting blankets under the sheets to alleviate that hardness. We didn't do this but it might have helped a bit. Even though the beds were hard, the rest of the room was lovely. The in-room bar was the best that I have seen and it was always stocked generously with water, pop and beer. There was a hard liquor bar above the fridge that had full sized bottles (not the mini ones you usually see in the other hotels) including good quality rum, vodka and tequila. Our room was overlooking the tennis courts and a grassy area and we thought our view was lovely. No noise other than an occasional tennisball being hit. If we didn't want to listen to that, we just closed patio doors and didn't hear a thing. Our room was very clean and the housekeeping staff usually left a "towel animal" on our bed after making up our room. The last day it was an armadillo (how the heck did they do that?)!!! Just another neat touch from a lovely hotel. In conclusion, if you was a perfect, relaxing stay on a beach out of paradise, the RIU is a great choice. We will definitely be going back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort”
Reviews.Author: AZ2323
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Palace Jan 24-30. We are in our late 30's. The resort was as beautiful as advertised. The staff were incredible. From the bartenders to the waiters to the hosteses. Everyone was very polite and eager to help you in any way. I am usually more of a pool person than a beach bum but ended up at the beach almost every day. The pool was a little cool and usually in the shade. The beach is awesome and the water was very comfortable. We went to Xel-Ha for the day but wasn't overly impressed. It was nice but not as incredible as I had anticipated. I would definitely go back to the Palace if I were to return to Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on our delayed honeymoon to the Riu Palace Jan 15-22. We loved it from the moment we arrived. The hotel/are was recommended by a friend of ours who has been there 4 times. The room was great and we couldn't believe other reviewers had complained about the "long" walk to the beach! Unfortunately, the 2nd day we were there we took a ferry to Cozumel to meet some friends that were docked there on a cruise, missed our 7 o'clock ferry so we decided to go to the Hard Rock to wait for the next one. WARNING: if you forget after you walk in there, that there are steps leading up to the door, when you leave you'll miss them and sprain you ankle (yes that was me)!!! We got back to the Riu and from then on out every one of the workers treated me even better than before!! We would go to Las Conchas (BINGO,BINGO, BINGO- if you go you'll know!) and we would show up, have beers brought to us, and an ice bag for my ankle! The water was gorgeous, the food was great, and the service exceptional. Even before my ankle sprain we decided we were going back. I strongly advise a thermos or big, insulated jug for the beach- they laughed like we were kidding! We weren't able to swim in the cenotes, because of my ankle, but plan to on our next trip. We met a great couple from Denver that we spent time with, and another couple from Chicago that were fun as well. When I saw kids there they were always well behaved and there wasn't tons of them (we don't have any so that could have been an issue!). Being in our 30's we liked how it was pretty quiet at night but would sit out on our patio and have another drink before bed. As I stated before, even before I hurt my ankle we had decided on going back- the place was amazing, they had crutches at the front desk that we were loaned but the grounds were so clean I almost slipped once so I decided to just limp around!! I could go on and on but I just wanted to lend a review!

Reviews.Title: “Best trip yet: Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: Getawayfans
Reviews.Content: We loved our week at the Riu Palace January 27- February 3. The experience there made us feel very special. The staff really worked hard to please its guests. Naturally, everything is never perfect--there was no light in the shower, the soaps were tiny--the beds were not set up for couples--they were rock hard and it was two double beds pushed together so you slept far apart from your spouse-- and unless you were on the top floor, there were scraping and walking sounds along the floor above. There were no toiletries--lotion, mouthwash, shampoo. The pool was beautiful but freezing. The food was great and there was always something to eat. There were bars near the beach and conveniently in the hotel. There was plenty of liquor in the room. The drinks seemed very weak. They decided to repaint wrought iron outside our room so we move because of the grinding noise and mess, then they started it again in front of that room a few days later. The sit down restaurant was nothing special, and I didn't like the waitress stacking and scraping off the dirty plates of half eaten food into stacks for removal to the kitchen right in front of us in the dining area. They have this weird reservation -for -dinner requirement--it was confusing--some reservations were made at the restaurant itself at strictly 7:00 AM, and some were made at the front desk of the hotel but only on the day of the desired reservation--not the day before. All this aside, it was a great trip--a very friendly and relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesoome!!”
Reviews.Author: 123forme
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time and brought our 4-year old daughter with us. It was great to have such a nice getaway. DH is a doctor and I have two bachelor degrees. Everthing was right there at the hotel - no need to go into town for anything.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Yucatan as well as our first 'all-inclusive' and both my husband and I loved it. We were thrilled with the hotel because of the cleanliness, the service and the wonderful location. Staying at the Riu Palace allows you to visit 3 surrounding Rui hotels (Yucatan, Playacar and Tequila), each with it's own 'flavor', so it's a nice change of scene. On our first night we were put in a room with no view (unless you consider the roof a view) and you could hear the bar below. We spoke to our Apple Vacations representative the next day and they took care of having us moved closer to a room away from the bar with a much better view from our balcony. Other than that, the rooms are clean and roomy and our cleaning person (Eugenia) did an outstanding job. We did hear of some small theft from another couple but we kept our valuables locked in the safe with no incidence. The restuarants are all outstanding and we loved our wait staff. The drink menu was excellent, and service was fast, and they have soft-serve ice cream during the day that really helps cool you off! We used the Hobie Cats and though fun, they've rigged them so they are slower and you can't get up on one hull. The beach is beautiful, with plenty of lounge chairs, hammocks, palm trees, and magnificant water. The salon is great and my 80-minute massage was outstanding and reasonably priced. The sand at the beach is kept very clean from cigerette butt's and used drink cups. The pool is nice, but in Jan. the water was a little on the cold side. Overall, this hotel had excellent service, excellent food and drink, and a wonderful location. We will go back to the Rui Palace. Recommended side trips: Chichen Itza and 'cenote' (long bus ride but worth it); 'Snorkling Adventure'; Tulum and Xcaret, and Xel-Ha. Also, spend some time walking around the city of Playa Del Carman--it's very charming with kind people.

Reviews.Title: “Palace truly is a Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (mid 30's) recently returned (Jan 16-23, 2004) from a trip to Playa del Carmen and the RIU Palace. I used this site extensively to make my trip selection so I thought it only fair to post my thoughts and opinions. We traveled with Sunquest Holidays from Toronto.We LOVED the RIU Palace ! The best beach holiday we have ever had. It was definitely a beautiful hotel. The grounds were immaculate and everything inside gleamed. Staff were constantly cleaning the paths, gardens, and interior of the hotel. The staff in the restaurants were very friendly and helpful. The food was great! I am a picky eater and I had no problem finding plenty of food to eat. We ate breakfast and dinner at the buffet restaurant Don Julian. One night we were able to get a reservation for the a la carte Sir Edwards. We really enjoyed our meal at Sir Edwards but not any more than our dinners at Don Julian. In my opinion the meal options at Sir Edwards in most cases were items that could be found at the buffet that evening. If you are not in line before 7:00am to make a reservation for Sir Edwards...chances are you will not get a reservation for the first seating at 6:30pm (second seating is at 9:00pm). We counted the number of tables at Sir Edwards and there were 15. Not many spots considering the size of the hotel. El Patio/La Traviata by the beach had a large selection of food for lunch. Everything from pizza and burgers to salmon, pasta, salads, and soup.Rooms were cleaned twice daily. Once in the morning and a second time during dinner. We tipped the maids a dollar US each day by leaving the money under the pillow. We were told to do this by our Sunquest rep at the hotel as if you leave the money out, supervisors or maintenance staff often come into the room and they will take the money if they see it lying out. You do not have to tip the staff but we tipped our waiters, maids, and bartenders. We brought down a handful of US dollar bills and handed them out daily. We noticed that most staff at the hotel worked 13 hour shifts, 6 days a week. We asked what the ave. monthly salary was and were told approx. $120-140 US a month. These people work hard so we felt they deserved the tips.The hotel was very quiet. The majority of the guests were European (German primarily) and generally older. If you are looking for a party place......this is not it. However, you could go across the street to the RIU Tequila nightclub if you were looking for nightlife. After the nightly shows from 10:00pm - 11:00pm the courtyard/bar area cleared out and the hotel went dead.We also really liked the location of the RIU Palace. It is in a gated community called Playacar. Playacar is at the south end of the town of Playa del Carmen. Playacar is a beautifully maintained area of approximately 8 or 9 hotels, the Playacar golf course, and private villas. On our bus transfer from the airport we dropped people off at other hotels and I was not too impressed with their locations. The new Reef Club Coco Beach for example.....looked like it was built in a rough area of Playa del Carmen. Some really seedy looking homes were around it. We had no fear walking around Playacar at night and often went for evening walks along the pathways. Other hotels were off the highway just north or south of Playa del Carmen and in some cases a distance from town. You could walk into the 5th Ave. shopping area of Playa del Carmen in 20-25 minutes or it was a quick $4 cab ride. We walked down the beach one afternoon into town.In my opinion the RIU Palace had the best beach in the area. It was much wider than others and it was lined with palm trees. You could find a spot in the shade or the sun and beach chairs were always available. The hotel frowns on people reserving chairs with towels early in the morning....it is not necessary. We never had a problem finding a spot and the hotel was filled to capacity when we were there. We walked a couple doors down to the Royal Hideway to see if it was nicer than the Palace. My husband and I did not think it was any better than the RIU Palace and not worth the extra expense. Their beach area was completely open.......no trees for shade and narrower than the Palace.The only negative thing I have to say about the RIU Palace is that the beds are terrible. They are rock hard ! I did as some others suggested on this site and put blankets under me but it did not help. By mid-week my back was in agony. It hurt so bad I had to make an appointment with a massage therapist as soon as I got home. I am 30 something physically active woman so, it was unusual for my back to bother me so much. We definitely plan to return to the RIU Palace again but next time I will be bringing my self-inflating camping mattress !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice with a few complaints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my honeymoon at the RIU Palace 1/18/04-1/25/04 and had to write a review. I used tripadvisor and all the glowing reviews to finally pick the RIU Palace and wanted to put my two cents in. First off, the resort is beautiful. It is always very clean and compaired to the other resorts we visited within Playacar, it is by far the nicest. BEACH/POOL: One of the things I loved (even though others don't agree) was the fact that the pool area was well separated from the beach area. All of the other resorts had a small beach area right beside the pools, but the RIU Palace's beach was huge. There were always tons of chairs and the walk from the pool to the beach was not that far. The beach was by far the best part of the resort. The pool was average and the water was freezing. Only a handful of people even got in the pool. The ocean was cold too, but once you were in it was okay. After the 3rd day however, the water went from crystal clear to murky. I think there may have been a storm out to sea though. One important thing I have to say - if you smoke (which I do), please don't throw your cigarettes in the sand. The beach was littered with them every night and it really looks awful. There are trashcans all over the place so use them. ROOMS: The rooms were nice, but the beds were horrible. The hardness was not as bad as the fact that the sheets, pillows, and comforter were cheap and uncomfortable. Also, they had plastic on the matresses which made you feel like you were sleeping in a crib. There wasn't enough lighting in the rooms either. The walls were paper thin so you could hear everything - people talking, kids screaming, construction work, etc., all by 7:00 AM every morning. Very disappointing! Also - we were on the second floor so everytime the people above us moved we could hear them - loudly. I'm sure the people below us could hear us too. FOOD: I'll be honest - this is where I was most disappointed. The food the first night was really good at Don Julian, after that it was down hill. They constantly served the same salads, mexican dishes, over-cooked fish, chicken, and beef. Breakfast was not that great - lunch meat, eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. and lunch was always the same - salad, cold cuts, over cooked meat. I understand that its hard to come up with new menus on a buffet, but the food just wasn't that good anyway. If it had been good I could have handled eating the same things for a week. Sir Edwards was disgusting. We almost left, but didn't want to offend the waiter. The fish I had was over done and tastless. La Bodega was okay, but meats in Mexico are not that good so after I had a few bites I really couldn't eat much more. Overall, I would only give this resort an average rating for food although if you are compairing it to only other all-inclusive resorts it was a little better than average. BARS/DRINKS: The drinks at this resort were great. If you are particular about the quality of alcohol you drink, you will be happy with this resort. Although they weren't serving top shelf, the vodka was smirinoff and absolut - not too bad. They had Bacardi rum, and Jack Daniels Whiskey. All of the speciality drinks were good, but be sure to specify what brand of liquor you want or else you will get the cheap stuff. My husband and I really enjoy wine and they offered some decent ones. The champagne/sparkling wine was not bad as well. WEATHER: Kind of a let down. Most people said that January was the best time of year to visit this area of Mexico - those people must not like to swim. The water was cold. If you could put your body through the shock of getting in, it did get better, but we hardly swam even though that is what we wanted to do most. It was only about 80-82 degrees during the day and by 4:00 pm it would get chilly. It was in the 60's at night so take a shaw or sweater if you are wearing summer dresses. SHOWS: Go over to the Tequila for their show. It was fun. They get the audience involved and really make you laugh. The Palace shows were all dancing and singing and really were boring althought the performers really did try. STAFF: Excellent - can't say much more except you should tip them if you think they are doing a good job. They are there all day long doing their best to make you have a good time. DRESS CODE: I have to mention the dress code. Men are to wear long pants. A lot of men took that to mean that jeans were acceptable. I thought it was kind of tacky. I also so many men in shorts and they were never turned away. My husband and I really like to dress up for dinner so I brought a lot of nice dresses and he brought nice slacks and dress shirts. We constantly got stared at and talked about most of the week. Most people, including the women were not dressed very nice so if you dress up you will get looked at. To end this long review I would say that the resort is above average in most areas, but a little boring. For our honeymoon we were looking for relaxation and got it, but if that is not what you are looking for you will be bored. I would go back, but probably for only a long weekend. If you have any questions feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Tanandhappy
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was extremely happy with the RIU Palace. My husband and I (in our mid 30s) left our two small children at home and wanted a week of relaxation and quiet. We found it. We have stayed at other all inclusives before and this one is by far the best that we have experienced. ROOMS: The rooms are exactly as they appear in the pictures. Very spacious. The beds are a bit hard, but not unbearable. After reading that the pillows were too soft, we brought our own pillows from home and were glad we did. The water pressure in the showers is horrible! The mini bar was always fully stocked and everything was cold. FOOD: Overall, the food was very good. The buffet at Don Julians was always fresh and the food tasty. There is a huge variety of food at every meal. Yes, it did get a bit old after a full week, but what wouldn't? Every morning they had someone making fresh fruit "smoothies." These were a wonderful way to start the day. They also had made to order eggs that were very good. We ate in the other three dining rooms and were never disappointed. El Patio was pretty good (we both had steak and thought it was tasty -- nothing special, but good). Sir Edwards is good, but they were small portions and the pace for dinner was quite slow. La Bodega was VERY good. We really enjoyed the variety of meats and the different presentation. These places do require reservations, but if you get there by 7 AM, it is not a problem. It does not take very long to make the reservation, so I would run down and make the reservation and then go back to bed. Not a big deal. We also enjoyed dressing for dinner. While pants are required -- that is about all that is required. A lot of people wore jeans (way too casual in my opinion) and others simply wore dockers. You are required to reserve a time for dinner when you arrive (6:30 or 8:45). It seemed odd at first, but we really did not mind it. (When you make your reservation for the other dining rooms, you can pick a different time) DRINKS: Always very good. We never had any problems receiving the premium liquor we requested. We read someone's review in which it was suggested to bring an insulated cup. We did and it was a wonderful tip. Many other guests commented that they wished they had done the same. There is a bar on the beach, but it is set back quite a ways -- so having the cup reduced the number of trips necessary. The bartenders were more than happy to fill our cups. THE BEACH: This is probably my only complaint. While the beach is very large, it is also very far from the pool area. You cannot see the water from the pool. Having said that, it really did not matter. There were plenty of chairs available both at the pool and on the beach. There are also hammocks on the beach. This was a wonderful way to end the day. SERVICE: The service was very good. We did have a couple of times where we thought it could have been better -- but they were isolated incidents. My tip is that if you have an issue with anything, go to the front desk. The people there speak english very well and are more than willing to help. THE AIRPORT: This is important! After you clear customs, you need to go OUTSIDE OF THE AIRPORT to find the tour operators that are to take you to the hotel. Do not go with any of the people inside the airport. We really enjoyed our stay and would definitely return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Palace fit for a King”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace 1-18 to 1-25. The service was exceptional, and the hotel was cleaner than any place in the states. The water is purified, so there is no need to worry about the water. They use bottled water as well. Food was out of this world. Only two negatives-the walls are thin, so you hear everyone and everything, whether 7 am or 7 pm. Also, the water pressure in the showers is not that good. But, we wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace from January 4-11. My husband and I are in our mid twenties and this place was perfect for our honeymoon. We cannot say enough good things about the Riu Palace. We got a pretty good deal through Worry Free Vacations and we feel that we got a lot for our money. The Riu Palace is absolutely beautiful! The hotel is immaculate. I never saw one piece of trash on the entire property. The beds are a little hard but we got used to them after the first night. We thought the food was really good. We ate dinner at Don Julian almost eveynight and we never got sick of the food. If you don't like your table that they assign you to you can ask for a different table with no problems. We found that if you eat later at 8:45 you can get really good tables outside with more privacy. We would eat an afternoon snack at El Patio to hold us over until dinner. The service is excellent! I have been to many nice places and this is the absolute best service I have ever witnessed. Our room had a view of the neighboring hotel but we liked it because it was really quiet. Our sink was clogged when we first arrived so I let the front desk know and it was fixed within 30 minutes. Our light bulb was flickering in our bathroom one morning and when we returned from breakfast the light bulb was replaced without us having to say anyting. We walked along the beach and looked at the other hotels and we both agreed that the Riu Palace is the nicest place to stay. We would get out to the beach by 10 am and we never had a problem finding a spot. We only left the hotel twice, once to go snorkelling and once to go to town! This place is paradise. We will definitly return soon. If you are trying to decide where to stay in Playa Del Carmen, stay at the Riu Palace. Trust me!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our wedding in Playa Del Carmen and it was perfect! We stayed at the Riu Palace with a group of 30 family members and friends and we had a blast. The hotel and beach were beautiful and the food was great (a big concern of mine). We held a rehearsal dinner at La Bogeta and our wedding dinner at El Patio. Our wedding was at a Private Beach Hacieda coordinated By Maria Castillo of Cancun Bridal (weddings@cancunbridal.com) they handled everything. We took a bus to a private beach which was great because we had the whole beach and bar area to ourselves and a little privacy for toasts, pictures, etc. It was beautiful and perfect and I cannot wait to go back. A few travel tips for for more selective drinkers- the beer seemed to be fairly diluted- towards the end of the trip we found you could purchase beer just down the street (better than the hotel corona for some reason) also request premium liquor in mixed drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: About us: 31, married, one child (stayed at home with Nana). We are both have bachelor degrees and some work on masters. Husband in institutional pharmaceutical sales, wife at home mommy (ex- buyer). We used to go out a lot but with a baby a party is now a DVD rental or a few friends a card game and a cocktail (or two!). We eat at places from local spots to five star steak houses to fast food. We like to travel and have been through most of US and a lot of Mexico. We're easy going & laid back, we like interesting people, great food, cocktails and good times. At Palace from January 11-15th 2004. Grounds: immaculate and beautiful, very, very clean Food: Good (in a lot of cases great). Yes reservations are required for dinner but never had a problem getting them. However, we didn't try to get in Sir Edwards (who wants to get up that early just to think about food for dinner?). It only seats 40 per sitting so reservations fill up fast. Didn't feel like we missed it. All dining experience was great. Never ate off the property all week! Bars: Cubano bar open until 7am. Crazy huh? We were never ignored when we asked for top shelf booze and we always got what we asked for. Service: Usually when you are nice and treat people with respect you receive great service in return. We found this to be true at the Riu. We always witnessed guests receiving good service usually above at beyond what was necessary. For managers reading this review... kudos to Miriam, Johnnie, Antonio, and Gabriel in Cubano and showroom bars, Manuel at the pool bar, Roberto in check in, Freddy in cleaning services, and the main doorman. We will return because of the service we received! Pool and Spa: Lots of fun at pool area... great people watching. Had massages that were awesome and cheap! Beach: Beautiful. Crowded but always a chair available. We ignored the thermos advice but ended up buying some in the gift shop. Sure made trips to bar less frequent whether for vodka or diet pepsi!!!!! Other guests: Ages were generally from 30 - 65, but we met and had great conversation with people in their 20's, 30's, 40's, and even 80's!!!! Lots of fun, interesting people at the Palace! Downtown: Keep walking when taxi drops you off. Best stuff is at end of 5th. Try to have a beer at the Tequilla Barrel. Best people watching spot in all of Playa! Overall: Will definitely go back and recommend to all we know. If you go with a great attitude, you'll have a great time. Found that we didn't spend much money since the Palace offered so much. Felt like the extra $$$ were worth it since we didn't have to leave properties to eat and drink. Happy vacationing!

Reviews.Title: “A Review From frequent all-inclusive travelers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are frequent all-inclusive travelers. We have stayed at several Sandals properties as well as Couples Ocho Rios. We were seeking an alternative to these well-established resorts and chose Riu Palace. With all of the very positive reviews, we felt it important to share our own thoughts on various aspects of the resort. Overall, it was a very nice place and gave us the relaxation and peace we were seeking. But, there are some cautionary notes. Here are some thoughts: 1. Room (4/5)--We requested an upgrade to a fountain-view room. We got it! It was a very nice room and gave us a great view of the fountain and courtyard. The room was clean and well-serviced. Different than some of the Sandals properties, don't expect in-room movies or much English-speaking television. Bring good books and enjoy the in-room bar. We tipped the housekeeper but found it added little to the quality of service. 2. Resort (5/5)--Marvellously clean and well-managed. It is in excellent shape and is startling beautiful to look at. It is truly palacial. 3. Food (2/5)--We found this aspect the most disappointing. The main buffet, Don Julian, is great for one or two meals, but grows very routine and tiresome after a while. The food, we thought, is prepared for a European palate. Some of the breakfast foods, in particular, were rather odd (quesadillas? hot dogs and beans?). Eggs were preared as were pancakes, but they were nothing extraordinary. Lunches at Don Julian were, again, fairly ordinary. Dinners were better, though we would have preferred more variety and quality. If you are looking for good desserts, you have come to the wrong place. They are below average in quality and variety. We stuck to the ice cream for the most part. You will enjoy Sir Edwards, though the service is slow and the portions very small. La Bodega is interesting in that they serve various meats as different courses. Here, you help yourself to the salad bar. Then, you are served a plate of vegetables and different meats for each course (steak, chicken, veal, turkey). The meats are excellent, but you are given only one a small piece for each course. We would have preferred an entire meal that we could eat at our own pace. The odd-pace of the courses was frustrating. The Patio and La Traviata are also buffet-oriented. They offer little different than at Don Julian. You will eat here only b/c of their proximity to the beach and pool. 4. Beach (4.5/5)--gorgeous! We found it crowded at times, but it was gorgeous. Vendors are allowed on the beach, selling necklaces and bracelets. Caribe Sun vendors also try to sell you parasailing or snorkeling excursions. It gets very tiresome, particularly if you already know what excursions you intend on purchasing or plan on not going on any at all. 5. Pool (3/5)--nice but not exceptional. The pool bar is fun, but in the shade. If you go in the next two months, you will probably get too cold sitting at the pool bar. We agree with others who've recommended that they move it in the sun. 6. Bars (4/5)--Very nice! The Cubano bar is great and well-serviced. Excellent for pre-dinner drinks. Las Conchas is a good place as well. We enjoyed this place quite a bit. 7. Service (5/5)--Wow! From the restaurants to the bars, excellent, excellent! You will not be disappointed! The service at the Riu Palace is comparable to any top-of-the-line hotel, even in the U.S. Special thanks to Vidal who really made our trip enjoyable. Tip him if you see him. He'll treat you right all week (we gave him $20 for the week). 8. Other guests--lots of Europeans. Not a bad thing, just different from what we're used to. Lots of speedos. Get ready. 9. Transportation--We were pleasantly surprised at how quickly we got to and from the RP. 40 minutes tops and it was a smooth ride. Thanks to Apple! 10. Entertainment (3/5)--The shows at night seemed lively and fun, but we did not attend many. We enjoyed listening to the music from our balcony, though we can understand some who think it to be too loud. The daily entertainment is minimal. The entertainers are good, but struggle to get anyone to join the activities....little enthusiasm for volleyball or other activities. You'll enjoy this place, no doubt, but, for the money, we might choose differently next time. Enjoy! -TC

Reviews.Title: “First Time's a Charm!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've traveled quite a bit, and a few times in Mexico, along with a career in the hotel industry and my experience with this area and this resort was outstanding. I won't go into 3 paragraphs about it but will say some key words that will not only make me return to this specific resort, but I will feel confident in recommending it to anyone...even the most "finicky". For the property: clean, fantastic architecture, beautiful beach, fabulous pool, plentiful activities and outlets, staffed very well. For the guest rooms: very large, twice daily maid service, balconies, bathrooms (my favorite) were large and had granite countertops and bathing area, beds were large (and not as hard as most hotels in Mexico), television stations were great (for those sunburned days!), bar was stocked often (sodas, waters, and premium liquor). Food: variety, quality, convenient, pleasantly surprised. You gotta try the ice cream machines with the mini-cones...they were my favorite part of the meal! You have some restaurants that were stricktly buffet but then there were the ala carte restaurants that were a nice change...and everything I had in every restaurant was excellent. And the most important thing? Service. This makes the customer return. You could have the Taj Majal as the hotel and if the staff doesn't treat you as importantly as the Riu Palace did, you simply wouldn't return. They could have Wolfgang Puck making tableside dishes personally for you and if the service was rude, you wouldn't return. So in other words, this is the main reason I will return. Knowing your name, asking if you'd like a beverage before you have to ask, every staff member greeting you, responsiveness and a sense of urgency for your requests, never having to ask twice (and sometimes never having to ask once!).I will return. And everyone I met the week I was at the Riu Palace said the same thing. They will be back....soon. There's no reason to go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we were just SO happy that everything was as fantastic as they promise on the website that we have to give the RIU PALACE, PLAYA DEL CARMEN all the stars! it's even much BIGGER than it seems in the photos and when we made a request for a room with a plaza view we were given it the very next day. try the MOJITOES!

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous Family Christmas Week”
Reviews.Author: jnorman
Reviews.Content: My husband, 25 year old 2nd year law student son and myself returned from the Riu Palace after spending a wonderful Christmas holiday week (our 2nd year in a row ). I recommend it highly. The staff as always is friendly helpful and most professional. There is plenty to do and eat (we all thought the food showed improvement from last year). Having exchange privleges with the other Riu properties allowed our son to "party" into the wee hours with a younger clientele without venturing a great distance. We cannot wait to plan our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe an off week at the RIU?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very excited about our honeymoon at the RIU, I read almost every review available on the internet before we left! We are 25 year old honeymooners. Food- wonderful, large variety at Don Julians, although we didn't enjoy Sir Edwards. Our room upon check in had the view of a large blue wall and the sounds of the kitchen, but we thought the rest of the place is so incredible how much time will we be spending in our room? So, after day three of the overwhelming smell of food and dishes breaking we requested a room change and were offered another room with a slightly better view of the hotel across the way. The beach was georgeous, by far the best looking and largest among the beaches on the strip. The grounds were amazing kept. The pool bar and lobby bar had great atmospheres. The nightly entertainment was awful, although we did miss the Michael Jackson show because my husband was ill that night and I heard that was an entertaining show. Overall, I was not impressed with the service- at all- and it is actally disappointing for me to have to say that because we were so excited to go after reading the rave reviews. The crowd when we were there were much older, I'd say average age of 55-60. My husband looks young and I felt that we were treated differently because of our age, I could not imagine what else it could have been, we always dressed nice for dinner, khaki's polos, I wore nice sun dresses every evening. We met a wonderful couple from Toronto who we joked with about the service, I don't think they believed that we weren't getting the service they did; until we got a table in the theatre one evening and only then did they realize what we had been experiencing the whole trip. They tried to order drinks and either the drink order was wrong or totally forgotten- note: by this time we found it amusing and weren't about to let it ruin our honeymoon. Our friends even tipped the head waiter $20 later in the week to give us a bottle of chanpagne and a fruit basket in our room, and we received the champagne, but no basket. We tipped our housekeeping $2/ twice a day and received one animal one day (naturally our friends came to breakfast every morning joking with us about their new creature) We also brought $100 in one dollar bills and tipped everyone all day a dollar or two. We really loved the beach and Don Julians was great; but I wish we had the service everybody else experienced...

Reviews.Title: “best experience at an all inclusive”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a heavenly two weeks at the Riu Palace Playa del Carmen. I refer to it as our "luxury land cruise" From the moment you arrive you understand that the staff at this hotel has been trained by experts in the field of pampering. Our room was wonderful. We were facing the courtyard a must for any visitor. The food was always plentiful and displayd with perfection. We tried all the restaurants on site but still preferred the buffet,Don Jillian. The beach was breath taking ,although we never sat at the pool it was very clean. We would return again. You will not be dissappointed at the Palace.Carol

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Rui Palace is paradise found! The service is incredible...everyone we passed would smile and say "hola"...waiters took drink orders quickly and would hustle to bring the drinks. The food was very good...and we never even made it to the fancy restaurants...just Don Julians. The beach had so many palm trees and everything was very well maintained. Drinks were very strong in the bar. We wandered through the other Rui's (Tequila, Playacar and Yukatan) and found them to be fine...but less elegant...and I heard from other guests that the service was acceptable in the other Rui's but not great. So, I plan to return to the Rui where they made me feel like a princess!

Reviews.Title: “if your 18 or older read mine!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am writing to everyone that hasn't been to the Playa del Carmen Rui and letting you know that it is a memory that will stay with me for a long time. I got there with my best friend and her family, all together there was eight of us. We were waiting for our room keys when they served us a wonderful drink. I was so excited to be there and was excited for the next 7 days. There was so much to do for my friend and I, both being 18. What more could you ask for, the rui tequila and rui yucatan both in the same vacinity as the rui palace have discos with a bar inside of them. There a shows at all of these hotels every nite which are actually pretty funny. My friend and I actually participated in "Miss Rui Palace" which I have to say was quite embaressing. The bar inside the rui palace is open till 7 a.m. Downtown Playa del Carmen is outrageous! It was so much fun going there and seeing all the different shops. There is also a small mall across the street from the rui playacar which is next to rui palace. My friend and I walked everywhere that week and we even went to an internet cafe in the mall and talked with our friends. We loved walking right onto the beach in the morning after the wonderful breakfast buffet. Let me tell you the morning I got on the plane I was soo upset to go home. I was virtually obsessed with the palace and all of the hotels around it. My friend and I rented a mini car and drove it around all of the hotels. As a family we went snorkeling, boating, 4 wheeling and ate meals together. The service was amazing. When I got home, I let my mom know how awesome it was and my best friend and I planned to go back again in July for our graduation present. I was more than excited. We stayed in the rui playacar this time which I have to admitt wasn't as nice as the rui palace. If you have a choice stay in the palace then please do so, becuase it is really heaven on earth inside there. When we got back we visited all our old friends that worked in the hotels and danced all nite in the disco and drank till we passed out..haha...I recommend going it is a memory that will stick with you forever

Reviews.Title: “You should be proud riu”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my wife ,two close friends, and i have just returned from riu palace. cannot say enough about the service we all recieved, from the front desk ,to the many waiters and waitresses that made our stay memorable.you can have the most beautiful hotel (which they do ) but the people make the place (e.g.dio,tino mariam,edurodo,angel ,ivan,gustavo,the list can go, on great staff). riu you should be proud of all your staff. The palace is apptly named ,after walking through all the resorts in playacar (including ROYAL HIDEAWAY) we clearly chose wisely, you will feel proud to return after your nite out. Food was great ,stuffed avacodos with crab,beef wellington, duck,were my favorites. Drinks were awesome ,lots of champagne,and chivas regal. The pool was my only problem with this place ,why is the swim up bar on the wrong side of pool?,after 3pm it gets cold in the shade,plus it would be nice look out of the pool and see the ocean,that said it was nice to walk through the palms every morning and see that gorgeous ocean. This is a most impressive place well worth the extra few hundreds. Thanks again to all the staff ,and to the tripadvisor for recommending such an amazing place . ps DIO the jaguars say hi..

Reviews.Title: “Opps - A young family perspective”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed for a week at the RIU Palace as part of a two-week holiday in Mexico. We have a family of four one 6-year-old boy and a 22-month-old girl. In our opinion, RIU Palace is a great hotel with above average food and excellent service. The hotel looked like it was about 60% to 70% of capacity. Readers should be aware that service is typically affected in the peak travel periods such as Christmas or Spring Break.The types of guests by our approximation were 50% older couples, 25% family and 25% elderly. Almost 40% to 50% of the guests were Europeans. Canadians were well represented.RIU palace is more formal than a lot of all-inclusive resorts. Men are required to wear pants to dinner. So, if you are into that, than you will feel right at home. Unfortunately, we were not used to this system, which is similar to a cruise ship with their dinner sittings.We have the standard room, which has a living room with a pullout sofa bed. Like a lot of resort in the Mayan Riviera, the rooms do not have good ocean views. Even the rooms facing the beach do not have a good view of the beach because the beach is so far away and the hundred of coconut trees giving shade to the beach goers stand in the way.While the view of the room was not the centerpiece of the hotel experience like RIU Cancun, the furnishing and excellent condition of the room and property gave us a lot of living comfort such as very clean floor to walk on. The maid service was great as they clean our room around 10 AM. With two young kids, we needed a clean room when we got back from the beach after lunch. So, we really appreciate the early maid service. They also do turn down, which is a nice touch as they also replenish the bathroom towels.The hardness of the bed has been well documented by past contributions. Indeed, the bed was hard. While we can deal with that, we were not prepared by the extremely soft pillows. We were sleeping on two pillows for support and we are still supporting a stiff neck a week later. On the bright side, it took no more than 15 minutes for the extra pillows to be delivered that is a good time.RIU Palace s breakfast is fairly standard. The benchmark here is Barceló Maya, where you can have any omelette you want with a wider variety of cereal, fresh fruits and baked pastries. In general, all the all-inclusive tend to offer the same items. There really is not that much room for innovation and improvement and they (Beaches, Barceló, and Melia to name a few in the same class) are all fairly comparable in selection and quality. One thing is for sure, it is great to roll out of bed to a broad selection of break fast food.Lunch is offered in at least a couple of restaurant at RIU Palace. We liked the beach grill El Patio for its great hamburgers and hot dogs for lunch. Beside it is an Italian restaurant with pasta for the adults. The ambiance here was much nicer as these restaurants are right next to the beach than Don Julian, the more formal main restaurant. The quality at RIU Palace is slightly above the other resort. There is a large enough selection that everyone should be able to find something acceptable.On dinner, we had to get use to a new system of sitting. It was very similar to a cruise ship. You had to pick a sitting and a table is reserved for you. This is true for all the restaurants. Until now, all the resort we have been to, and we have been to many, have the main restaurant available at any time during dinner. This gave us the flexibility to do what we want. It just took a bit of getting use to. There were more restaurants at RIU Palace than we were able to try.Using Beaches Turks and Caicos as the benchmark of 10 for all-inclusives, where they have grilled chicken breast that would compete with the best restaurants, RIU Palace would rate a close second. Than again, food is a personal and subjective opinion.After getting use to the system, we faithfully reported for dinner. It worked really well. We were always guaranteed our table, which is close to the food a strategic position for parents with young kids. The food was freshly cooked and varied day to day. If you like seafood, large shrimps with mussels dishes were served almost every night. There is a special Mexican section where you can put together great fajitas. The orange juice was always fresh squeezed. The ice creams were great. And finally for the men, bring a couple of pairs of pants for dinner.Moving on to the beach, RIU Palace shares a stretch of beach with 3 other RIU resorts. RIU Tequila is the only resort without its own beachfront. Guests at RIU Tequila are provided a trolley service between the hotel and the beach. And, yes, the beach is packed. The rows and rows of blue and green beach chairs cover the entire stretch of beach. Interestingly, from talking to a few hotel guests who were there a few years ago, the beach use to be a lot wider as it went out a lot further. Now, the guests are all packed closely together. Put your suntan oil on, walkman to your ears, lye back close your eyes and they all disappear. That s the trick. Things are really not as bad as it sounds.We hung around the hammocks as they were shaded areas. Our 2 year old daughter entertained herself with the water tap and some tea pots and cups for hours on end. Our son joined the mini-kids club a couple of times but chose to spent time with us instead. We did only try the RIU Yucatan kids program. The RIU Yucatan kids club was well shaded unlike the more popular RIU Tequila kids club. In any case, it is quite a walk from RIU Palace. We found Beaches and Barceló to have better day kids programs and location of the kids club. Of course, these resorts specifically target young families.The pool is clean because not many people swim in it. It is very cool to the point it is almost cold. Even the divers with their wet suits commend on the water temperature. In general, warmer pools have a lot of swimmers and the pools get cloudy by mid day, which makes it also very uninviting. The RIU pool is not large by comparison to other resorts. A note worthy point is that the temperature in December when we were there was not hot and on some days in was actually cool with the wind. The ocean, however, was perfect. On the cooler days, the ocean was warmer than the air with the wind chill factor.The hotel provides a number of recreational water crafts such as paddle boats, kayaks, and sail boats. Before you go get one, you have to go to the dive shop to sign a waiver. Take a dive or a resort dive if you have the time. The dive shop staff is excellent. The boogie boards are especially fun when the waves are in.If you like to shop, it s only a 5 minute walk to a little mall outside the hotel. The prices at the mall are outrageous compared to Playa Del Carmen, a small sea side town 3 kilometres away, or a half hour leisurely walk. The taxi ride is 40 pesos or US$4. There is a lot Mayan craft work available and bargaining is recommended.The Mayan Riviera is located centrally to a broad range of interesting day trips. Our favourite is Xel Ha, the world largest natural aquarium where visitors can swim in. Visitors can take large rubber tubes and float down the river. Natural hot spring vents flow through the river warming the snorkellers. There are cliffs to jump off and rope bridges to cross rivers. If you do go, get there when it opens before the bus loads of tour groups get there. Tulum is also close by. As this entire area has been targeted for development, there is a lot of fun activities to choose from.In conclusion, RIU Palace is a great resort. The service is excellent unlike Beaches Negril, which is almost 2X RIU Palace's cost, was poor. With a young family, we really missed Barceló Maya. We came back to the Mayan Riviera because we had such a great time at Barceló Maya in February. The beach at Barceló Maya is as long as the beach stretching from RIU Playcar to RIU Yucatan with RIU Palace and another hotel in between. The kids club at Barceló Maya was right on the beach and close to the swimming pool. The swimming pool at Barceló was slightly warmer and much larger with a free form shape. If you have a young family, consider Barceló Maya as an option to RIU Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but far from perfect.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is great. Everyone is friendly and eager to make you feel at home. The hotel has an amazing architecture, its interior design is perfect, and in the public rooms you really feel like in a palace. I have to say, anyways that there is no investment at all in technology in this hotel. The room keys are still the usual ones, not the electronic cards, and the safe is operated also with a normal key, instead of a safe with a digital code lock; this seems unimportant, but you have to have the keys with you all the time. There is no room service also. Finally, the room area was not constructed correctly, so you hear everything on the rooms beside and above you. One night, I cound not sleep because of the snoring of the person on the room beside us. Also, I went there in low season, and the beach was crowded (and I mean really crowded). Sorry I do not agree with everyone here, but I,ve been in better hotels in the Playa del Carmen area.

Reviews.Title: “Been there, done that? Not if you haven't been to the Palace!”
Reviews.Author: Can_we_go
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Playa Del Carmen this year. We stayed at the Occidental Allegro in April and liked it very much. We went to the Copacabana in June and had rain for all 5 days, so it's hard to know if we liked the place or not. But the Riu Palace......is perfect. I had reviewed all the websites and looked at the pictures. I thought it looked pretty, but actually being there is so much different. The peacefulness is something that can't be seen in pictures. We were welcomed with "welcome drinks" upon checkin. Before we arrived at our room (immediately upon arriving at 10:45 am), a third bed had been set up for our 18 year old daughter (without being asked to do so). We had a view of the fountain area which proved to be most pleasant. Each morning we would open our sliding doors to the patio and listen to the breeze and fountains. The resort is quiet so you didn't have alot of yelling or other distractions from the guests. Food was good. The Thursday night "gala" was the best buffet night but all of the food, morning, noon and night was good. I liked the fact that all food was served on real glass dishes with nice glassware and silverware. No plastic stuff except on the beach for obvious safety reasons. We enjoyed much of the staff. Very personable and truly interested in our family. Rooms nicer than expected from pictures. There were three of us, and I didn't feel crowded at all. Turn down service each evening was nice. I could go on and on, but the bottom line is, if you've been to other resorts in Playa, you haven't been to the best. I can't imagine ever going anywhere else. Another RIU Palace in another city - yes. If you're wondering if it's worth the extra money going to the RIU Palace vs. the RIU Tequila - absolutely! Their grounds were nice, but I felt crowded; lots more people in smaller space at the Tequila. While we really liked the Allegro and several other places in Cozumel, this will be our #1 choice from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Set the Bar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Riu in late Aug of 03. I have been to a couple other all inclusive places and a highly rated cruise. The Palace smoked them all. When arriving at the airport, keep your luggage until you find your coordinator (even then keep an eye on it). When we landed, the airport was undergoing reconstruction and had 50 cent Coronas as compensation for the mess. I had 5 not realizing that we had an hour or so to the hotel, luckily there are bathrooms on the bus. The checkin is incredibly smooth and you will not need to change rooms. I think we got one of the worst views, ours overlooked the neighboring resort, all we could see was the seperating tree line. Not only did this not bother us, it came in handy. The grounds are impecible. You could quite literally eat off the tile walkways without worrying about getting sick (I didn't actually try this). They are washed twice a day, the shrubbery and lawn is also detailed pretty much on a daily basis. You will not find chipped or yellowing paint. If the paint is supposed to be white, it is a glimmering white. This place is surrounded by other Riu's. You can visit those anytime you like - one of them has a night club that is fun, but don't bother with the restraunts. The Palace has a nightly show - we had an Ode to Michael Jackson that was awesome. Since the Palace is rated higher than the others, those guests cannot use anything at the Palace. Their grounds are much different, more of a tiki theme. Still incredibly nice but no where near the class of the Palace. The rooms are fantastic. You will have a mini bar that includes 4 bottles (tequilla - duh, rum, vodka and something else) they are replaced as needed. Your mini fridge is stocked daily or as often as you call, with Corona, water, soda, etc. Beds are a little harder (ok, a lot) than we were used to, we just put a couple blankets down under the sheets though and that solved it. Oh, they only offer two twin beds pushed together or seperate. There is a little sitting area and a tv. We hardly used the sitting area and never turned on the tv. We didn't spend a whole lot of time in our rooms. Restraunts: If you went to a similar restraunt in Boston (similar to any of the 4 or 5 offered) expect to pay well over $100 for two people. Every dinner was fantastic. Huge selection, different every night at the main restraunt. The other restraunts are more themed and should not be missed. You need to plan to go early that day by making reservations (to the themed restraunts- it is very simple), we were never declined - always got a table. We had a bottle of wine or two every night, I reccommend the Calafel. Unfortunately, I can't find it in the states. An entire entry should be made on the staff alone. You will probably never experience anything of this caliber again (unless you come back). Your waiter will know your names and drink preferences within a few minutes and have everything ready for you by the time you get to your table (if you eat in the main dining room - they'll explain it when you get there). The cleaning staff are some of the nicest people around. I went looking for an ice machine and I never made it. My bucket was taken from me, I was sent back to my room and they brought the ice to me. I never did find the ice machine. I could only make it about 4 doors away before someone would spot me. Basically, you will absolutely not have a bad experience with anyone that works at the Palace. You do not have to tip in order to get better service - in fact they can not be seen taking tips. I would do it discreetly anyway, you will not find anything close to their customer ethics in the states. Drinks: If you want top shelf, just ask. They make your drink to order. The swim up bar is the most enjoyable, I don't think I need to explain why. If you want something other than mixed drinks you can get bottles of wine, champagne (both delivered to your room via room service if you want) or beer. The only beer they have is Corona, which I was estatic about. Beach: The beach is a bit of a walk from the hotel (by bit I mean at most a few hundred yards). You will walk through a grove of palm trees that have several hammocks strung between them and eventually hit the lounging area. There is a beach bar but no one brings you drinks - but with all the food you will be eating, you will be grateful for the little bit of execise. You can sign out all kinds of water stuff while at the beach - hobies, boogie boards, etc. We discovered that if you want to use something longer than the allotted hour (very loosely enforced) you should bring a few Coronas with you from your room. Beer has amazing bargaining power. If you decided to go para-sailing, definately bring a few with you, either that or another 10 bucks or so. The ride is normally 5-8 minutes for somewhere around $50. I threw in a six pack and we went for almost 30 minutes (you actually have to bring it to the boat though, don't believe the guys you bought the excursion through). Got a cruise of the entire shore all the way to the town and back. Lounging on the beach is great. Don't bother bringing a snorkel down because there is nothing to see and the water is cloudy (its a beach, not a cove), the water however, is incredibly warm. It rained (actually a huricane hit) one day while we were there. Unfortunately, if the harbor closes, the resorts are required to close their beaches as well. All this means is that you can't take out equipment. This was the only bad thing I can think of for the entire trip - there were finally waves and we couldn't use boogie boards. So, we spent several hours learning how to body surf. Excursions: we did several - Diving - made a couple of dives off Cozumel. I expected a little more after all I've read about it but one of our dives definately met my expectations. When getting teamed up with a leader, look for the one that appears a little crazy. If your dive master isn't quite right in the head you will probably have a much better dive. We went down a little over 80 feet and found a tunnel about 6 feet in diameter that ran several hundred yards through the coral. And it was packed with life, rather hard to swim through without touching anything, but if you are careful, it can be done. We quite literally ran into a fish that was bigger than we were who refused to yield so we had to turn around and take another off shoot. The other dives couldn't really follow that and so I was kind of bored. Bring along something to eat - you will be provided lunch but you will probably want something more. DIVE THE SENOTES!!!!!!!!!! This really has to be experienced as words will not do it justice. Kind of like swimming in a sponge, more or less a cave dive. On this dive I wouldn't reccommend a crazy guide. We went to a couple of Mayan ruins - Tulum was cool - also got to go to a park of sorts (still all inclusive if you spring the extra 20 bucks - do it). We also went to another ruin, can't recall the name (shouldn't have waited so long to write a review) but its the biggest one around. Has thousands of ruins and the largest pyramid unearthed. Also has the ball court. You will have the option of walking the mile to the ruins, renting a bike or renting a bike with a guy to peddle if for you. Walking is free, renting your own bike is two or three bucks, and getting the rickshaw is 4 bucks a person. We got the rickshaw and it was worth it. The guy spoke English pretty well and kept us well entertained with a lot of the local history. I would also read a little bit about Mayan prophecies and technology before you go as well - incredibly interesting. If you go on this you also get to go through the rain forest and do a zip line, feed crocs, rappell into a senote (much different than what you would dive) and float around on inner tubes, canoe and learn a whole bunch about the area. I would do this one instead of Tulum. A group of indigenous people will make you lunch, while your guide won't get sick you probably will. (I did, but thankfully it didn't kick in until we were back home so my trip was unaffected) Montezumah is not a friendly fellow and if you can politely figure out a way to decline the dinner, I would. Remember to bring something to eat though because its an all day trip. I would reccommend not doing as many excursions as we did and save a lot of time to sit around and relax. We exhausted ourselves (in a good way) because we wanted to see as much as we could. I will definately go back to the Palace. I have been trying to find another Carribbean vacation for this year but I can't find another all inclusive resort that even comes close to this one. The Palace is definately worth the extra money - which by the way, really wasn't that much - we paid about 3G total (airfare, excursions, hotel, meal and drinks, etc). Oh, I almost forgot - at night you can get a massage on the beach. I think there are 1/2 hour and hour long sessions. You have the option of being under a very very thin tent of sorts (almost lace) or under the stars. They post a whole bunch of tiki torches around as well - if I remember correctly, it was about 70 bucks a person for the hour and you'll probably throw in another 10 for a tip. The torches are the only lights around that affect your sight so you will see more stars than you ever thought possible. We did this on our last night and it was the perfect ending. feel free to email me questions if you are considering going to playcar or want to know more about the Palace - jessman409@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time there. [To start, if you do not want to hear a sales pitch, AVOID the government workers that approach you near the luggage. If you want to spend 4 hours the next day and plan to return to the area every year and want some free trips, talk to them. They do work for the government, but are not there to help you clear customs or anything official.] We went to Chichen Itza (11 hour day), Tulum (much closer) and Cozumel (so-so). I did the basic SCUBA package (1 hour in pool, 2 35-40 minute ocean dives, no certification). Ferry to Cozumel is about 45 minutes and can be very rough (many people get woozy). Beach was great and not overcrowded. Food was great. We ate at Don Julian, Sir Edwards and La Bodega for dinner and the 2 patio restaurants for lunch. I liked La Bodega best (meat lover). Sir Edwards was OK. Don Julian has enough selection and the the food is fine. Service is good throughout the property. I would recommend bringing a stack of about $50-60 in singles to tip extras. Services charges are included in the package, but the extras go a long way. $2 per day for the maid will be worth it. Property is VERY clean. Drink plenty of bottled water, there is always 4 bottles in your room fridge. We brought immodium, but did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cmo1976
Reviews.Content: ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE!!! Those are the two words that I have to describe the Riu Palace! My husband and I (27, 30) stayed at the Riu Palace September 1-15 for our honeymoon. I would highly recommend spending 2 weeks at this resort as one week would have not been enough for us! Before booking at the Riu Palace, we had looked into almost every resort along this area. At first, I will admit that I was not 100% sure after making our reservations, but our travel agent assured us that we would love the Riu Palace. The grounds are immaculate and spotless! The workers work very hard to keep all of the grounds and doors spotless. One morning we were up at 7AM, and they were all in the courtyard scrubbing the floors with soap and water...Unbelievable! The rooms are very spacious and the beds are not as bad as soom reviews have said they were. We managed to get one of the few rooms that are facing the ocean (partial views). Some words of warning would be "DO NOT USE THE HOTEL TELEPHONES TO CALL HOME...BUY A PREPAID PHONE CARD". The telephone company will charge you $21/3 minutes and $2 every minute after that! Complete rip off! I learned the hard way with a $500 phone bill, so if I can stop others from having this happen to them, it will be well worth the experience! Another thing to watch out for is the DJ at the Riu Tequila. Do not request any songs because he will not play them and he has an anger problem and belongs in an Anger Management course.Those were the only 2 negative factors of the resort. It's not worth checking out the other Riu's as the Riu Palace is the best one! You could go check out the other Riu's - it'll reinforce what a great decision you've made to stay at the Riu Palace.Each night there was entertainment at 10PM. We really enjoyed the shows and we also really enjoyed sitting in the courtyard and ordering drinks throughout the evening. My favourite drink was the Miami Vice and the Batilda De Cocoa...YUMMY!!!!The Beach was BEAUTIFUL! Clear turquois water and soft white sand. There were lots of lounge chairs so no real need to get out early to "save your chair". There are also lounge chairs in the shaded areas under the trees as well. The only thing I didn't like was the Jet Ski's..the gas smell was obnoxious and so was the noise!!!!!! I really hope that one day they ban the Jet Ski's so that they don't come so close to the Beach area!The Staff at the Riu Palace will treat you like Royalty! When you're there, say hi to Dio and Jimmy(Entertainers, Aqua Aerobics. Salvatore, Eduardo and Omar are AMAZING! We really got to know the staff really well. Tell them that Connie and Jason from Canada say "hello". The Food at the resort is AMAZING! We tried all of the restaurants...the only thing is that I don't think they change their menu at the Specialty restaurants (El Patio,Sir Edward,La Bodega). If you are a meat lover, you definetly have to try La Bodega! We've never experienced anything like it!We ate at Don Julian often, and never got bored or sick of the food there! There is always a wide variety and it's not your typical buffet where everything tastes the same. Don Julian will host "Specialty Nights" and it's well worth dining during those nights! Keep in mind to pack some nice outfits as there is a dress code for dinner. Breakfast is Amazing! There is a fresh juicebar with different types of Juices (Banana Milk, Pineapple Banana..etc..), fresh fruit, croissants..smoked salmon..everything and ANYTHING!!!!We will definetly go back in a heartbeat! there is so much more to write about...if you have any questions, please feel free to send me an email at msconnienguyen@hotmail.com. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First- thanks to all for the reviews- I relied heavily on these and they all turned out to be true. Hope I don't ramble but here's the lowdown: We visited last week 12/2 thru Sat 12/6. thru Apple Vacations. Let me just say for first time travellers to Cancun's airport- after deboarding the plane, head downstairs straight to the baggage carousel- do not pass go, do not collect money! The official looking people with light blue shirts and laminated badges @ their necks are looking for starry eyed first timers like you. They will distract you to their counters in order to lure you into a tour or time share. Second, the people outside the airport waiting to "handle" your luggage are worse- they practically tried to take my luggage out of my hands. The airport should be disgraced. Luckily I was able to spot our red flowery shirted Apple rep & he saved us. OK the good part- after that- no worries mon. Rained the first day- after that sunny with a breeze and mid to low 80's- perfect. Kudos to those recommending bringing a thermos. I brought a 1/2 galloon jug. No need to tell you what happens to the human body after pouring in a 1/2 gallon of Pina Coladas in 3 hours. Needless to say I got pretty sick- not the hotels fault though. We tipped the maid @ $2 everyday- got a towel turtle & the beds turned down every night. When appropriate I tipped the waiters/ waitresses @ $2-$3 at a time- they are the hardest working bunch of people you will meet. We got to know the head waiter Carlos- truly a very good person. I didn't want to leave the beach at all, but we did book a snorkelling tour which was pretty much off the beaten path thru the Apple rep who was in the lobby every day. Worth every penny (The Mayan Adventure tour I think) This is a resort which caters to adults & probably serves @ 50% European clientel. There are lots of other reorts who cater more to kids and if we come back with our young ones we'll pick a different place. In the meantime, it was nice having Mommy & Daddy get a little dressed up for dinner for a change. We're in our 30's and amongst the youngest couples there. I'd say the main age group was in their late 40's to early 50's. I sure didn't mind this as it cut down on the rowdy boorish behavior. If you don't like smoke, keep an eye out for who is sitting next to you at dinner or at a show- they light them up anywhere. We ate at La Traviata, El Patio, La Bodega & Don Julian (didn't get to Sir Edward). Honestly, I wouldn't have minded eating the nightly buffets @ Don Julian every night. Plenty of selection between Mexican, Mediterranean & European. I will say that no matter where you eat, all the beef dishes pretty much have the same seasoning- pretty good though. If you are a tea drinker be warned- I couldn't find any! No Coke products. Soft drinks are pretty much Pepsi, Diet Pepsi, 7-Up, & and an orange soda like Fanta called Mirinda (sp?) Didn't get to the other Riu's, but when you're in the Palace- really who cares? Took a trip down to 5th Ave in Playa Del Carme (@ a $4-$5 taxi ride) and bought some trinkets. You'll find better deals here rather than at the hotel or in the very convenient market/ strip center @ 200 yards north across the street. Basically this is paradise. I've been in hotels & resorts from Anchorage, Alaska to West Palm Beach, Florida & considering the food, drink, accomodations, service & of course, cost- this one wins hands down. Hope we can make it back next year. (FYI-they say March is the best season.)

Reviews.Title: “Just Returned from the RIU Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned last night (Dec. 6, 2003) from a trip to Playa del Carmen and stayed at the RIU Palace there. This hotel is just beautiful. We have traveled alot and this hotel is one of the best we have stayed in. The hotel staff is very friendly and everyone does an efficient job. The food was very good (did not get sick and no one else we spoke with did either). Out of the restaurants to make a reservation at I felt that Sir Edwards was the best. We did enjoy Don Julian, which is the buffet and ate there a couple of nights. The bars do a good job with drinks and they do service a more top shelf liquor than most all inclusives. The pool and swim up bar was nice but they do need to have more music playing down there. The rooms were very nice and kept clean by the staff. If you go to the RIU Palace I do not think you would be disappointed. If we go back to that area we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Playa-- The Riu Palace!”
Reviews.Author: missamiann
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon at the Riu Palace and it was FABULOUS! If you are wavering back and forth on which hotel to choose, this is it! We travel often, and hands-down, this was the best room, location, and value. We were NOT disappointed! The location is EXCELLENT! You are in Playacar-- which is a small community within Playa del Carmen of hotels, golf courses, and upperscale homes. There is a shopping area (Playacar Plaza) that we used often. This area is immacuately landscaped and the most beautiful part of Playa del Carmen that we saw. We would stay nowhere else! You can also walk to downtown Playa del Carmen from here, or take a taxi for $4 USD. The beach is MASSIVE! The only advice I have is to go early to get a lounge chair. Although there are tons of chairs, everyone hangs at the beach so you have to go early or watch for people leaving. Otherwise, there are always chairs available at the pool (but why go to the pool when you've got the Carribean??). About food. We're not really picky about our food, but found all of our dinners to be great. There is a wide variety of selections at Don Julian's (the main buffet), and there are four other restaurants that require reservations. You can make your reservations by phone, but make them early. We only ate at the Steakhouse, which was also good. One of the best things about the Riu Palace is that it is surrounded by the other Rius. You have access to all other Riu hotels, beaches, and restaurants in the area. We visited each Riu and would stay at any one. We just don't think you can go wrong. However, the Riu Palace is truly the "grandest" of them all, and if you want to treat yourself to luxury, then it is where you want to be. Also, we were amazed at how the hotel was so "European".
