There was a mix of cultures from everywhere, and we found it to be quite "swank" and fun to be amongst so many different people! Last, you must go on two tours. The ATV jungle tour (by Chilly Willy's) where you will swim in a cenote, see small ruins, and have fun on ATVs. This is the best small tour we took (only 2 hours). The other, and my favorite, is the Coba-Pac Chen tour by Alltournative. Check out their tours at Alltournative. com. You visit a Mayan village, rapell into a cenote, fly across a lake on a zip-line, kayak, and visit the largest Mayan ruins. It is a MUST-DO! Enjoy your trip, and your stay at the Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful Resort without the service to match”
Reviews.Author: pmorty
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent six days at the Palace (7/6-7/12) and had a wonderful time. I should relay a little information about us in order to add perspective to this review. We are both 30 years old and have two children (whom we left with grandparents). We spend most of our vacations on the various ski slopes of North America but have spent a few days in warm-weather sites in the US and Caribbean. I travel quite a bit on business and so I get to sample hotels all over the US and occasionally in Europe. This was our first trip to the Yucatan and our first experience at an all-inclusive resort. We were looking for a relaxing, laid-back vacation and the Palace delivered. The resort facilities are first-class. The reception area, bars, dining rooms, and other common areas are well appointed and air-conditioned. The pool was wonderfulperfectly cleanwith plenty of loungers for relaxation. We had a first floor standard room near the pool facing the courtyard. The rooms are well furnished with standard hotel-class furniture and are larger than standard hotel rooms in the US (think junior suite) with separate sleeping and sitting areas. The beds are indeed a little on the firm side of hard but that didnt seem to affect how we slept and actually proved to be an asset for other activities. The mini-bar was always well stocked and service was responsive to requests. Service also did a great job of keeping the room immaculately clean despite our best efforts to spread sand around the room. I was a little disappointed with how thin the walls werethe people above us spent several early mornings arguing over what to do that day and the people to our right threw a couple parties during the week to which we did not receive and invitebut to be fair we did have the outside door open most of the time and the sound may have originated from there. The beach was spectacular. The sand was white and clean and the water was clear and warm. The palm grove between the building and the beach is a nice touch. We spent several hours during the day and at night after dinner lounging in the hammocks. We werent overly impressed with the on-site water recreation shop that is independently owned and operated. We did find it inconvenient that we could not charge activities to our room (they only accept cash) and we found the prices a little on the steep side. We tried a catamaran one afternoon which was a lot of fun despite our being noviceswe didnt tip over and we made it back to the beach so we classified it as a success. We also went on one of the snorkeling excursions but would not recommend it to others. If you want to snorkel you can go into town and find excursions that are less expensive and take you to more placesa fact we didnt discover until later that day. We also took the SCUBA certification classes and the first two divesthe last dive being cancelled because of a passing hurricane. You can find cheaper SCUBA classes and dives in town but we found it more convenient to utilize the on-site service. We found the food at the Palace to be only above average. The resort caters more to the European palette of which my spouse and I are not particularly fond, however, due to the incredible selection we were always able to find something we did like. We did find La Bodega to be the best restaurant of the group. We had a bad experience at El Patio, the steakhouse, due to a guest who insisted on going through a couple Monte Cristos during dinner and a manager who refused to reseat us. We liked the dress code for dinner and thought it really helped make dinner an event. We came prepared with Dockers and polos for myself and some slinky evening dresses for my spouse (note to guys: figure in the cost of some new evening wear into the overall cost of your vacation as the investment yields excellent returns). We didnt like the assigned seating and meal times because changing either of the two proved to be something of a hassle. We did not stick around for any of the evening entertainment so I cannot comment on it. The reason I do not give the Palace the highest rating is I feel the service is not comparable to other hotels at which Ive stayed. On a service level the Palace cannot compare to the likes of a Four Seasons, St. Regis, Hotel Jerome, or Waldorf Astoriaor even some of the nicer Marriott hotels and resorts. The above-mentioned incident at El Patio was just one of several that took place during the week. We would not recommend taking younger children to the Palace (our 4 and 6 year-olds would have been miserable) as there are not any programs for them. Overall, we found the Palace to be a wonderful place to spend a laid-back, relaxing vacation and would recommend to anyone looking for an all-inclusive vacation in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Beauty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I arrived back from a 5 day stay at the Riu Palace on Oct 27th. We had the absolute time of our lives. Yes, we have stayed at your Hilton's and Marriots, but the Palace in Playa Del Carmen has any of them beat! The service was phenomenal; way better than any resort in Cancun (we most definately enjoyed Playa better than Cancun!) The food was amazing, especially the restaurant called La Bodaga. This restaurant is Brazialian themed and the food was wonderful! Everything was more than we could of asked for. The nightly entertainment is a most, make sure that you plan on attending all of the shows, bc they are put together really well. The only complaint that I would give for the RIU Palace is that they do not have an iron in your room and the drinks at the disco at RIU Teguila are extremely weak. However, enjoy your time at the RIU Palace, bc you will have the best service, food and most of all FUN!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner, two best friends and I spend a perfect week at the Riu Palace. I can't begin to say enough about the level of service, the food, the eminities, the staff, the facility, etc., etc. Our room was perfect (although the mattress was a little hard) and our cleaning staff kept it in pristine condition. The food was outstanding. I think I had some of the best soups in the world! The pool is very nice. Overall, if you are looking for a perfect, relaxing getaway the Riu Palace is for you. One more word on service: We clearly had some guests who, shall we say, were not at the right resort. They were loud and obnoxious. We only needed to complain once and the management saw to it that they were no longer an issue for us. They truly took care of us and the other guests to make sure we had truly unforgettable trip. Thank Riu Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Keep the beach Jetski free”
Reviews.Author: frelisken
Reviews.Content: Thanks to your useful comments, we enjoyed very much the two last weeks of september at the Riu Palace. It is really a paradise. All the floortiles in the courtyard, corridors inside and outside are thoroughly scoured with soap every morning. The friendly personal cares for every detail asked for. We respect very much the effort of the management team to keep an high standard, giving an example of dressy clothing, having always a ready ear for suggestions, trying to keep a balance for a free atmosphere respecting basic hotel rules. The restaurants offer an extended choice of foods, comprising some vegetarian dishes and saltfree butter. We suggested to provide a special breakfast corner for diabetics, as in many Riu hotels, comprising some homemade sugarfree jam, yogurt and cake without sugar. The beach is amazing beautiful with palmtrees for shade, fine sand, clear warm water. As on many beaches the jetskis are polluting with noise and fuel smoke, the SE wind brings it right under your nose, by speed junkies, mostly to show of, driving in circles. Jurisdiction have already banned jetskis from several beaches from California to Florida. We feel sure the hotel management will find a solution with the jetski exploiters to diminish the disturbance, keeping further distance from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Far exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: todddster
Reviews.Content: This resort far exceeded our expectatations. We've been to an all-inclusive before, but nothing of the Riu Palace's class. Transition from airport to resort was smooth and check-in was a breeze. We weren't happy with our room, and they more than accomodated us with a room with an exquisite view. We booked our trip with Suntrips and the Suntrips liasion at the Palace (Brigitte) was exceptional. She answered all our questions and honestly gave her input on what to do and what to watch out for. Food was wonderful and plentiful. Service was excellente'. The waiters/waitresses become somewhat upset with you if you get things for yourself. They want to assist you in everyway possible. Beach was great and activities were fun. The bars were a kick in the pants and the drinks were, well, let's just say you can drink as much as you like and 24 hours a day. Good selection of top shelf liquor. The cleanliness of the resort was superb. They were always cleaning and maintaining the property. And, We had no problems with drinking frozen drinks or using ice. We ate and drank (seems like everything) and had no problems with any "bugs." A few things to consider: Bring your beachwear, but pack some nice clothes for dinner/evenings (High end resort), tipping is not expected, but appreciated. It went a long way with bartenders, waiters, and maid staff. They will remember you and the extra attention you receive is well worth the extra couple of bucks. SERVICE=SUPERB, FOOD=EXCELLENT, CLEANLINESS=SPOTLESS...well worth the trip and we'll definitely return within the next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!!”
Reviews.Author: alegriafury
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon at the Riu Palace (9/17--9/24). We booked our trip thru Worry-Free Vacations and they lived up to their name. Our transfers to and from the airport were great--air-conditioned vans that are there on time and deliver you to the hotel door/airline check-in counter. The Worry-Free Vacations tour representative was pleasant, easy to deal with, and understanding when we had to cancel part of our tour--he refunded part of our money. The tours themselves were great! We went to Chichen Itza, Tulum/Xel-ha, and Discover Scuba at Cozumel. If you go, try to get Cancun Line for your tours. Their tour guides were very knowledgeable and the tours themselves were comfortable and fun.The Riu Palace is fantastic! They give you a drink when you are checking in and will not let you carry bags anywhere inside the hotel. They take them for you. We were put in a terrible room at first--view of the roof with the air conditioner compressor making noise constantly. Plus, it smelled very musty. We called and asked to be moved. They were very understanding, and moved us as soon as they could (the next day). Everyone in the hotel is courteous and polite, and they all want to do their best for you! Our housekeeper even made an armadillo out of towels and washcloths for us, even made eyes and a mouth and stuck them on! It was so cute!The food is good at Don Julian, but I recommend making reservations at any of the other restaurants (La Bodega, Sir Edward or El Patio) for dinner. The food in the other restaurants is top-notch and served wonderfully, while the food in Don Julian is only passable, especially when compared to the other three. Lunch is good anywhere. The nice thing is you can get food 24-7 somewhere, so if you have the munchies in the middle of the night, no problem.The evening shows were entertaining, and it is so nice to sit outside and be served non-stop drinks while enjoying the warm night breeze.We were not really interested in night-life, so if you are looking for night-life you may want to look somewhere else. However, you can go to any of the other three Riu hotels that are right next door. They all have discos that thumped almost all night long. We never visited them but they sounded like fun!The beach at the Riu Palace is amazing! Powder-soft sand everywhere, plenty of comfortable beach chairs and tables, and trees so if you want to be in the shade it's no problem. However, we liked the beach best at night. We relaxed, watched the stars (tons of shooting ones) and the lights from Cozumel. The bar is not too far away from the beach and the bartender there has an amazing memory--he remembered who I was all week! The pools are also nice and the swim-up bar is great!Quite possibly the best-kept secret here is the new spa. Maricruz and Evelinda (not quite her name but can't remember it exactly) are spectacularly talented. We each had two massages and I wanted to take them home with us. The treatments are priced very reasonably and were two highlights of our trip.Bring plenty of $1 bills to tip with--it's not required but the service everywhere is so good you will want to. If we ever return to the Mayan Riveria, we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic vacation! Beautiful location, beautiful facility. The staff was outstanding in every aspect - friendly, efficient, courteous, and unbeliveably prompt. We will definitely return and bring friends.

Reviews.Title: “Thought we died and went to heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 1 week at this fabulous resort. Everything I read about it was true. The water was awesome, the weather was perfect, and the resort itself was A+. All the workers were so eager to please and always had a smile on their faces. The food was great, the drinks were plenty. Yes the beds are hard, but not unsleepable. We took trip advisors advise and brought our thermos bottles. It was the envy of the beach. We will be back and we will stay at the Palace. We will miss Antonio at the beach bar and Santoyo at Don Julians. Sir Edwards is worth the wait in line. Thank-you Don Miller at Apple for picking this wonderful place for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place AAA+”
Reviews.Author: CRaymond
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several resorts in the Playacar Village and would say that this is the best thus far. You will feel the grandness of the resort when your tour bus drops you off at the front door. As you enter the grand lobby you are taken back by the architecture and design of the building. Each staff member is delightful and extremely professional. Rooms are wonderful. The standard room has king/double beds and a sitting area with patio. Each room has a small mini liquor service as well as refrigerator with beers/sodas/water. The rooms were adequately cool with ceiling fans and a/c and kept very clean without a hint of ants or lizzards (yes lizzards). The grounds are meticulously groomed and offer a grand water fountain that is three buildings long. The food was good and somewhat different every night. Definitely try the nicer restaurants, well worth dressing up for. The beach area at first appeared to big or wide because it took you 10 minutes at least to get from the beach steps to the ocean because the beach is so wide. This at first was a pain but after awhile it was nice because it offered many secluded areas for privacy due to the abundant palm trees. I will offer yo a suggestion. This resort is alot more classier than the typical playacar resort. Bring you best clothes, best swimwear, and be prepared to look your best when walking around the grounds or the lobby. People look good at this resort. We were not warned, but thankfully we fit in. This would appear to be a stuffy place, but quite the opposite. People of all nationalities are very cordial and polite. A definite place to stay in Playa Del Carmen !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: SusieDublin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the most incredible 3 week stay at the Riu Palace in Nov 02-It really was paradise.The staff treat you like a king and queen-they are always smiling,friendlyand sincere- They really look after you.The beach is beautiful, the food is divine!This is truly a hotel for a romantic holiday.We will return(PleaseGod!!!) and will always have such beautiful memories of The Riu Palace .Susie and Paul-Dublin Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and me just got back from Riu Palace on 09/10/03 and that was my 2nd time there. I was impressed with the resort the first time, but the second time around, it really did exceeded my expectations. The place has changed and it changed for the best.CHECK-IN: Once we arrived at the airport, we were already outside of the airport in 10 minutes. The luggage came out right away and soon we were picked up by a van from Apple Vacations. The ride to the resort was about 45 minutes, but it was nice and smooth ride in an air-conditioned van. When we got to the hotel, went to the reception desk and we were assigned a room. The whole check-in process took no more than 3 minutes and we were given a nice refreshing drink at the counter. We were assigned a room number 0037. Thats on the first floor on the right looking out the outside of the hotel. That was the room that I requested, but when we got to the room, my wife didnt like the location. I liked it, but she didnt. I called the reception and asked them to change the room in the same building on the first floor looking out on the courtyard. Without any hesitation they gave us another room 0061. Once we got to the room, the bellboy was already waiting for us there. Of course he got a tip from me. The check-in was very fast, courteous and did I say fast?SERVICE: The service was absolutely brilliant. Riu Palace has a lot of staff on hand and everyone is there to help you. Whatever your request is, they will fulfill it. They will always greet you with a smile and theyll know your name after the first time you tell them. They dont forget. The best part about it is that they dont expect to get a tip from you. Theyre just nice by nature. Its in their job to be nice and courteous. For example, we were sitting outside on the plaza and drinking cocktails. Before I was finished with my Kalhua and Cream, one of the waiters brought out another one without me asking for it. It felt great and it wasnt a rare occurrence. It was happening all the time on the plaza, in the restaurant, dinner, the pool, etc. The staff is very friendly and they will meet your any demand. I was tipping waiters all the time and it was all worth it. I spent about $40 in tips and for that kind of money, you can not buy a better service.ROOM: The room was great. It was overlooking the courtyard in front of the fountains. The bed was made 2 times a day. First time after you wake up and the second time before you go to bed. I dont get that at home. In any case, the room was always clean and the cleaning people left all these cute animals in the room. They made a big swan on our bed the first day. They made a heart out of 2 little swans in the bathroom. They also made an elephant, a doll and an opossum on our bed. I took pictures of them and I wish I could share them with you, because you had to see it to believe it. It was beautiful. Always plenty of towels, soap and shampoo. The remote control from our TV didnt work the first day, I called the reception and we had a working remote control within 5 minutes. Our air conditioner wasnt blowing cold air and it was fixed within 10 minutes. If you find anything wrong during your stay, call the reception and it will be fixed within minutes. Its their job to provide an exceptional service to their guests. Thats why 40% of their guests come back there over and over again and Im one of them.FOOD: Oh my god. There was so much food and everything was so delicious. They concentrate on European guests more than on Americans, but they had something for everybody. Im originally from Russia, but live in the states for the past 15 years and I was able to just about anything. A lot of vegetables, fruits, meats, seafood, etc.. For breakfast they had 5 and 10 minute boiled eggs, fried eggs any style, omelets, bacon, sausages, fried bananas, breakfast quesidillas, fried potatoes, donuts, pancakes, French toast, any kind of bread you can imagine, deli meats, butter, cream cheese, 10 different kinds of cheeses, smoked salmon (my favorite), 20 different types of cereal, juice bar and a fruit and sweets station. Is that enough for breakfast? I think so. If you cant find something to eat there, youre just very picky and no other place will please you. For lunch we were going to either La Traviata or El Patio. It was good in both places. They had burgers, hot dogs, chicken, beef, Buffalo wings, fries, pasta, pizza, veggies, cold sandwiches and so much other stuff. For dinner we were going to Don Julian. The food was great there. Im not going to describe everything that they were serving, but Ill just mention the best parts. During the Caribbean Night they were serving lobster, jumbo shrimp, mussels, clams and it were all simmered in some sort of yummy sauce. It was soooo good. Other food that I really enjoyed were pork cordon bleu, seafood kabobs, a salad with crab and pine apples, pasta with seafood, turkey at the carving station, lasagna and so much more. Once we went to Sir Edward and the food was very good there. My wife had roasted duck and I had pork chops. For the appetizer we both had lobster bisque. The food was excellent everywhere and there was always something for everybody.POOL: Pool was always very clean and never crowded. At the swim up bar there were always at least 2 bartenders there, so you never had to wait for a drink. The side with a swim up bar had more people than the other side, but it makes sense, people will go where free drinks are. Also at the bar and in the room they upgraded their liquor since the last time I was there. They now serve Smirnoff vodka instead of some cheap Mexican vodka. They also upgraded their Gin, Baccardi, Tequilas and beer (Coronas now). Always plenty of sun and shade at the pool and always plenty of available lounge chairs. I was playing bingo and volleyball in the pool almost every day. One day they had a fashion show by the pool and it was a lot of fun.BEACH: The beach was the best part. Just imagine, youre walking on a white sandy beach, youre surrounded by palm trees and the sounds of calm turquoise water. Intrigued yet? You will not find a single rock or a shell in the send or in the water. The beach at Riu Palace is considered to be the 2nd best beach in Mexico. Always lots of lounge chairs in the sun or in the shade. Never crowded. There was a little bar at the beach, so you could always get a cold drink there. Plenty of activities like volleyball, snorkeling, sailing, parasailing, scuba diving and even massages. My wife got a massage at the new spa that they built. It was $60 for 50 minutes for a full body massage, but they also had a Moonlight massage. This massage is for couples. At night you go to the beach and both of you are lying there on the massage tables on the sand near the water. Candles are lit around you and youre getting a massage together. Very romantic and peaceful. I think it was $170 for both. One night we went to the beach and there was a couple getting that massage around 10 oclock at night and under a moon lit sky. That night I went swimming in the water and it was great.DEPARTURE: Departure was the worst part of our trip. Nothing went wrong and the check out was very fast, but knowing that you have to leave this absolute beauty and perfection and have to go home to work, made me realize how great Riu Palace is. It was my 2nd time there and Im sure that I will be back there again. Ive been to a lot of places in Caribbean and I try to stay at top of the line resorts, but nothing can match the beauty, service, perfection and everything that Riu has to offer. Came back home at 11 oclock at night last night and Im already sitting at work and writing this report. How sad, but I know that I will be back there again, unless there is another resort that can offer what Riu Palace can. I dont think there is another one like that now, but may be some day there will be one.In conclusion, the difference between a good resort and an excellent one is only a couple of hundred dollars. I think its well worth paying that extra money for such an unforgettable week of pure perfection.Im sure that Im forgetting something, but you get my point. Three thumbs up from a seasoned traveler.Thanks

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: great place, great service....clean clean clean...need i say anymore

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place 5 star all the way”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 9 of us have just returned from 14 nights at the RIU Palace and what a fantastic time we had. The hotel is spotless with the most fantastic beach with lots of sunbeds any time of the day. The food and drinks were all very nice apart from the wine which was not the best. Are rooms were very nice with a fully stocked mini bar and very good airconditioning. The staff were all so friendly and could not do enough for you. I would defiantly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed ourselves”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our honeymoon at the Palace the second week of July 2003. We had booked our stay at the Riu Playacar. Apon arrival at the Playacar we were informed it was our lucky day and that an over booking was forcing us to be upgraded to the Palace. Our lucky day it was! If anyone is trying to decide if the extra money to stay at the Palace is worth it...it is!!! The resort is beautiful. We had a room closer to the pool on the outside facing another resort (the Maya I think). If you are a light sleeper you may want to change sides. Those folks LOVE DISCO over there and they love it till the wee hours at that! We had no problems ourselves but others might. The beds were firm but comfortable by our standards. We enjoyed the food always finding something that was nice. We especially liked breakfast. The smoothy bar was an excellent touch. The line to sign up for reservations at the other restaraunts intimidated our laziness so we didn't make it to any of them. Oh well. We heard from other guests that they were nice. The beach was splendid. The sand was like powder. We were originally concerned by reviews we had read that implied that it would be ALL older couples. Not so. There were many younger people during the time of our stay. Many Americans as well. The service was excellent. We tipped our servers and bartenders and they appreciated it. They say the tip is included but seeing as these people work twelve hour days, six days a week it was our pleasure to provide the extra gratuity. Their pleasant and friendly attitude was a treat. Making sure to take a lot of one dollar bills is a good idea. We highly recommend taking a thermal cup with a lid on your vacation. The bars by the pool and beach serve small plastic cups. The drinks get hot quickly and full of sand if you aren't careful. We took our thermoses and only needed them filled once before heading to the beach. Handy!!! The entertainment staff worked very hard again with a very upbeat and positive attitude. It wasn't all our cup of tea but appreciated nonetheless. If you go to Playa Del Carmen to shop we recommend buying your jewely from the smaller outside vendors. The larger, enclosed and airconditioned shops will charge you more and their sales people can be very aggresive. We took two tours during our stay. One was to Chichen Itza. It was the highlight of our trip. It is a very long day so be prepared. We had a fantastic guide who offered a lot of insight into the history and current condition of the Maya people. Very eye opening. The other trip we took was also through Lomas but we recommend against it. We went on a trimarand to snorkle. The boat and the crew were terrific. It seemed like we had way too many people until we saw other boats with even more people packed on to them. The reef was very, very sad. It has been destroyed. Even though the guide admonished the snorkelers to not touch or kick the reef, people were standing on and kicking the coral constantly. Dead coral, few fish and an overly packed boat. Next time we will go to Cozumel as we heard it was better. Long review but I could go on and on. It was fantastic and we look forward to going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like "ROYALTY" at the RIU Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the RIU Palace in April of 2002 and had such a wonderful time that we brought 15 other family members back in August of the SAME year! I've read some of the negative reviews regarding the RIU Palace Spa?... unless they added a spa in the past 11 months the remarks confuse me. They do have a work-out area (Gym Equipment) and massages on the beach but there was no spa. I will say that it is not a resort that caters to small children, but teenagers (we had 5 with us in August) love it. The only bad thing about staying at the Palace is that you have to leave :o)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rogerandvirginia
Reviews.Content: The best of the best! My Husband and I were married on the beach at the RIU Palace. We had a group of 20. The whole experience was smooth as silk. The service, staff, food and drinks can't be beat. All premium quality. I personally have been to Mexico 30 times and have tried just about every all inclusive and this takes the cake. Men if you are into topless woman, this is the hotel for you. Relax, enjoy yourself, and mingle. There are people from all over the world here. My only complaint is, the food was so good, we ate to much!!!!! Not bad! Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're not too spoiled”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort is fabulous for first-time travelers. If you're expecting world-class, and used to getting it, there are a few problem areas. The spa is one, do not trust anything they tell you, ONLY agree to get services listed in a brochure. And WATCH OUT for the spa's blonde receptionist. She hid the specials from me (I found out about them from another guest, and told her I knew about them, so she had to show me). I made my appointments, and there was something I wanted in the display case (sunless tanning - I'm very fair) pointed it to her and asked her how much, and she said 700 pesos. I agreed, then halfway through the service, the lady perfomring the service told me to put on my bathing suit, I asked for what, and found out the I had been exfoliated for the wrong service! I went out to the glass case, and the product had been removed from the case, and they told me they could only do regular tanning. (How ridiculous is that?) I asked her why did she say 700 pesos earlier when I pointed to the product, and she said 700 pesos was for regualr tanning. I told her that was not what I wanted, that I had pointed to what I wanted, and she said since they had already started I had to pay. It was terrible! I had her call the front desk, I complained to multiple staff, all of whom pretended not to understand. They kept saying the same thing over and over "Was a service performed?" And I kept trying to tell them yes, but not the one I agreed to. I finally got frustrated, didn't finish the service, and paid, since we had another 10 days left I didn't want to ruin the vacation, so I paid with a credit card with fraud protection, and wrote "miscommunication - to be fixed" on the receipt. I'll just dispute it, then explain the situation to someone who understands English! Enough about that, generally the hotel, the food, the staff and the rooms are great. If you're used to world-class, you'll get it most of the time, but be prepared - it looks world class, but it's not. The inability to solve a simple and obvious problem is inexcusable. Next time, if we go back (and that'a big if), I'll stay far, far away from the spa. Everything else is generally pretty great.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star, location and property”
Reviews.Author: emasonry1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 8 days at the RIU Pallace. It is by far nicer than the other near by RIU resorts and worth the extra money ( and not that much more ). The property and beach are fantastic. Food is better than other Cancun resorts I have stayed at. If I had to complain about somthing it would be seating times for dinner. That was kind of a pain. Sometimes you are up and ready to go but you must wait for your seating. With that said I would not hesitate to plan a return trip to the RIU Palace. We have been to the Moon Palace 2 times. If the Moon Palace had a beach area like the Play del Carmen area it would be the best resort anywhere. I love the Playa del Carmen area and the convienance to the ferry for a day at Cozamel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I enjoyed the most beautiful, amazing, and relaxing vacation in June 2003. The beach is absolutely beautiful. The beach/water was incredible. We couldn't believe our eyes when we seen it for the 1st time. The resort is definately a 6 star. Pictures does not do it justice. The grounds, lobby, restaurants, room, pool area were spectacular. As everyone mentions, the service really is wonderful. They treat you like royalty. Our room service was excellent too. Yes the beds are very hard but you get use to them. We are in our mid 20's and it is definately not all "older" people. The ages ranged from mostly 20's to 60's. We enjoyed every minute of our vacation and would recommend this beautiful and outstanding place to anyone. We are DEFINATELY going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time-Advice for those taking toddlers”
Reviews.Author: Confused
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace was wonderful! I never experienced such wonderful service in my life. The staff were unbelievably kind and friendly. I did take my own drink containers, but did not find it to be necessary. The rooms were very spacious and moderately clean. I think it really depends on who your maid is because my room wasn't that clean, but my parents, who also went with us, had really clean rooms every day. I went to the Riu with my twins, who are 2 years old. They also had a great time on the beach and at the pool. For those planning on going to this resort (or any other resort) with toddlers, here is a suggestion that I found very helpful. At the resort meals are served only at designated meal times. This can be difficult for those families travelling with toddlers, because toddlers eat when THEY feel like eating. I took some disposable tupperware and tooke some food at the meal times so that my girls could have some food when they felt like eating. This worked out really well because I didn't feel stressed to feed my girls only at the meal times and it didn't turn out to be a wrestling match. We all ate at the meal time, and if the girls wouldn't eat, I just stored some food in my tupperware and fed them later.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but almost too relaxing”
Reviews.Author: motheroftwo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at Riu Palace at the end of June. The resort was beautiful and definitely a 6 star hotel, but it was almost too relaxing for us. Tropical depression Bill gave us rain the first day and a half so we had to find something to do in the hotel. Luckily, we brought some books to read, but we had to buy some playing cards as well. (The hotel doesn't have any umbrellas either, not that we would have gone out in the down pours, but it would have been useful on a few other days that it rained for a short period of time.) FOOD: we tried all of the restaurants so this gave us a variety throughout our stay which we would recommend otherwise the buffets could get old after awhile. Definitely go up early to make reservations or call the desk. ROOM: as other reviewers have said, the beds are VERY hard so be prepared. We did ask for extra blankets that helped. It was a very nice room and the service was excellent. GROUNDS: The grounds were spectacular and kept very neat. The staff was always cleaning things while we were there. POOL: There was always empty lounge chairs by the pool for us so you didn't have to worry about saving any. You can leave your key at the desk so you won't lose it. BEACH: Again, there were plenty of lounge chairs and there weren't any beggars or saelspeople walking around. It was very quiet and peaceful. We did go on the catamaran one day, but I got sea sick about 15 minutes into it. OTHER: We enjoyed ourselves and would recommend this hotel to anyone, but it was toooo relaxing of an environment for us. We are in our late 20's and early 30's and enjoyed the other people there. It is not a hotel for young kids since we were probably the youngest ones there which was fine with us. Majority of the guests are from Europe. There are not a lot of activities to do in the hotel especially for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: wonderful beach, wonderful people, and wonderful food.

Reviews.Title: “Amazed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 8 day trip to the Riu Palace and were amazed at just how beautiful the resort is! The resort itself is immaculate, the food was outstanding and the staff was very professional and friendly. We have been to many Carribean resorts and always like to stay at a 5 star resort, but the Riu Palace was by far the nicest place we have ever been. We are planning on returning next year, but we will extend our vacation to at least 10 days!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks at the Palace in June 2003. We were unsure as to whether it would be worth the extra money over the other RIU's in Playa del Carmen but were very glad that we spent the extra as it was so much nicer than the neighbouring hotels. The service and attention to detail are amazing. The staff can not do enough to help you and are always very cheerful despite the very long hours that they work. The buffet has a good mix of food and will have something to suit everyone but there are three other restaurants you can use in the evening so we tried to vary where we went. By far the most popular of these is the 'Sir Edward' which is an excellent a la carte restaurant. The bookings for this are taken at 12 o'clock but in the 2 weeks we were there you had to be in line by 11.15am to have a choice of sitting as there are not many tables. It is well worth the effort as the food is amazing. The evening entertainment is quite low key with the hotel band playing from 8.30 to 9.30 and then a show at 10pm. This suited us fine as we wanted a relaxing quite holiday but won't suit those looking for any night life. The beach is amazing and the sea is really clear although a little rough. Sun beds are available on the beach and around the pool at any time of the day so there is no need to reserve them. We went on a couple of excursions to Chitzen Itza, Tulam, Xel-ha and swimming with dolphins. By far the best of these was Xel-ha. I am not a great swimmer but still spent three hours snorkelling in the lagoon which is packed with fish. I would recommend going for the full day rather than the half day which most of the tours offer. Overall this is the best hotel I have ever stayed at and I will definitely go back in a few years time.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth time to Playa”
Reviews.Author: vallelde
Reviews.Content: April vacation 2003. This was our fourth trip to Playa del Carmen but our first at the Riu Palace. I had always wanted to stay here but didn't make it...it was worth the wait. Traveled with two children ages 15 and 12 and they loved the Riu the best too. Clean, spacious (we had a suite!), food and service were impeccable. Truly the best aspect were the people. They are warm, wonderful and accomodating. In the years we have been coming to Mexico I cannot say enough about the people. Any hotel in the playa area is lovely and you will have a great time but the RIU IS THE ULTIMATE! Deborah

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After this hotel was recommended by a travel agent and reading all the wonderful reviews on the internet we decided to honeymoon at Riu Palace in March. The hotel lives up to its rave reviews. The hotel and beach were beautiful! The food was great and plentiful! The staff was very friendly. We would definitely go back for a future anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “pure relaxations and enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the palace on the 2nd July, 2003. after 2 glorious weeks!!!! We had a fantastic holiday. We can honestly say that the service was 100% - the staff could not be more helpful. Some of the waiters English is a little pure, but if you try a little spanish they enjoy the interaction! The food was excellent - yes the booking system can be a bit tedius, but you can work round that to suit yourselves without any hassle. The entertainment was about average for any all-inclusive hotel. but it was still fun. the lobby bar was very relaxed with a resident piano player. i recommend anyone staying to ask for a top floor room facing the courtyard as some of the other rooms face other hotels. please do not hesitate to contact us if you require any further info on this hotel. we are not people who return to the same destinations but in all honesty the riu palace was that good that we would definitely return. barb. and cam.

Reviews.Title: “Super - service, food, atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace is an all-inclusive resort. The Palace is immaculately kept, friendly and has a great selection of food and drinks. Sits on the Caribbean, with lots of things to do. Also has a great pool area. Close day trips include Mayan ruins, very nice snorkeling, and shopping in the local town. A great place to unwind for a week. Beautiful resort with people from America and many European countries staying there.

HotelInfo.Name: Riu Palace Mexico
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida Xaman-Ha Manzana 3 Lote 4 | Playacar, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
